begynneth first volum sir johan froyssart cronycles englande fraunce spayne portyngale scotlande bretayne flau ders place adioynynge traslated frenche maternall englysshe tonge johan bourchier knight lorde berners comaundement oure moost highe redouted souerayne lorde kyng henry viii kyng englande fraunce highe defender christen faythe c hec rosa virtutis de celo missa sereno eternum flores regia sceptra feret royal tudor blazon p preface johan bourchier knyght lorde berners translatour present cronycle condygne grace thankes ought men gyue writer historyes great labour haue done moche profyte humayne lyfe shewe open manifest declare reder example olde antyquite shulde enquere desyre folowe also shulde eschewe auoyde vtterly flye whan beynge vnexpert chauces se beholde rede auncyent actes gestes dedes home labour daugers paryls gested done right greatly admonest ensigne teche v howe maye lede forthe lyues farther hath perfyte knowledge others ioye welthe higher prosperite also trouble sorowe great aduersyte hath xpert doctryne parylles albeit mortall folke marueylously separated bothe lande water right woderously sytuate yet actes done aduenture space thousande yere copact togyder thistographier dedes one selfe cyte one mane lyfe wherfore say historie may well called diuyne prouydence celestyall bodyes aboue complecte euery tyme vniuersall worlde creature therin coteyned dedes semblably dothe history nat right noble thynge v fautes errours amede erect lyfe better shuld nat seke acquyre dyd thyng best laudable worthely done shulde putte eye folowe nat sage counsayles two thre olde father cyte towne cou tre long age hath made wyse dyscrete prudent farre praysed lauded derely loued yongemenne howe moche ought story comended praysed loued encluded many sage counsayls great reason hygh wisedoms innumerable son sondry nacyons euery age long space four fyue hundred yere profytable thyng worlde instytucion humayne lyfe hystorie due contynuall redyng therof maketh yonge men equall prudence olde men olde father stryken age mynystreth experyence thynges yeldeth priuate person worthy dignyte rule gouernaunce compelleth themperours hygh ruler gouernours noble ded thende may optayne immortall glory exciteth moueth stereth strong hardy warriours great laude haue ben deed promptly go hande great harde parels defence countre prohibyteth reprouable person mischeuous dedes feare infamy shame thus monumentes writynge whiche testymony vnto vertue many men haue ben moued byldecytes deuyse establisshe lawes tight profitable necessarie behouefull humayne lyfe fynde newe artes craftes science requisyte vse makynde aboue thynges wherby man welthe ryseth speciall laude cause ought gyuen historie keper suche thinges haue ben vertuously done wytnesse yuell dedes benefite hystorie noble highe vertuous actes immortall moued strong ferse hercules enterprise lyfe many great inco perable labour pyls certaynly noughtels meryt immortalyte mought gyuen hym folke seblable wyse dyd imytator noble duke u many innumerable worthy price famouse men whose vertues ben redemed sro oblyuion shyne historie monumentes processe tyme varyable chaunces confused lost vertue history dyffused spredde throughe vuyuersall worlde hathe custos kepat say tyme whiche cosumeth writynges albeit menne right worthy great laude prayse writynges shewe lede v waye vertue yet neuerthelesse poem lawes artes foude deuysed writ ben mixed domage sotyme trueth ensigne man lye onelye hystorie truely wordes representyng actes gestes dedes done complecteth profyte moueth stereth compelleth honestie detesteth erketh aborteth vice extolleth enhaunceth lyfteth vp suche ben noble vertuous depresseth poystereth thrusteth downe ben wicked yuell reprouable knowlege shulde haue auncyent thynges past historie nat whiche testymony therof lyght trouthe maystres lyfe humayne presydent remembrauce messanger antiquyte moued stered phaleryus kynge ptholome oft dilygently rede bokes forsothe none cause thynges founde writen bokes fredes dare nat shewe price moche wolde fayne write incomparable profyte hystorie feare shulde sore tourment reder preface also doute nat great vtilyte therof better knowen coulde declare wherfore shall breuely come apoynt thus whan aduertysed remembred many folde comodyties hystorie howe benefyciall mortall folke eke howe laudable merytoryous dede write hystories fixed mynde thyng therin euer wha ymaginacyon came volued tourned redde many volume bokes conteyning famouse history amonge redde dilygently four volume bokes sir johan froyssart countrey heynaulte written frenche tonge whiche iudged comodyous necessarie profytable hadde englysshe sithe treat fomous actes done party say englande frauce spaygne portyngale scotlade bretayne flau ders place adioyning specially redounde honoure englysshemen pleasure shall noble ge tylmen englande se beholde rede highe enterprise famous actes glorious dedes done atchyued valyant au ceytours forsothe god hath moued highe comaundement moost redouted souerayne lorde kynge henry viii kyng englande fraunce highe defender christen faythe c gracyous supportacyon deuoyre translate frenche maternall englysshe tonge sayd volume sir johan froyssart whiche cronycle begynneth raygne moost noble valyant kynge edwarde thyrde yere lorde thousande thre hundred sixtene contynucth begynning reigne king henry fourth yere lorde god thousande foure hundred space twene threscore fourtene yeres requyrynge reders herers therof take rude translacion gre haue nat folowed myne authour worde worde yet trust haue ensewed true reporte sentence mater true namyng maner personage countreis cyties townes ryuers teldes coude nat name properly aptely englysshe haue written acordynge founde frenche thoughe haue nat gyuen euery lorde knyght squyer true addycion yet trust haue natswarued fro true sentece mater haue named dystaunce bytwene place myles leages must vnderstande acordyng custome coutreis named place lengar englande leage myle well knowen frauce leage two myles place thre coutreis lesse euery nacion hath sondrie customes faute rude translacyon remyt correctyon therof discretely shall fynde reasonable deraute doynge shall pray god sende blysse heuen amen thus endeth preface sir john bourchier knight lorde berners tra slatour present cronycle herafter foloweth table chapiter stande boke order one four hudred fyftie one whiche nombre c c c c li chapiter p foloweth table present volume first auctours loge ca p moost valyant knightes made mencion boke cap ii p ye prevecessours kyng edwarde englande cap iii p prrentes good kyng edwarde thyrbe cap iiii p first occasyon ye warre bytwene kynges englande frauce cap v p howe therle thomas lancastre xxii great lordes knyghtes englande werebeheeded cap vi p howe quene englande went co playned kyng frauce brother sir hewe spensar cap vii p howe sir hewe spensar purchased quene isabell englande putte fraunce cap viii p howe quene isabell deted fraunce entred empyre cap ix p howe quene isabell areyued englande sir john heynalt copany ca x p howe quene englande besieged kynge edwarde seconde housbande towne bristowe cap xi p howe sir hewe spesar thelder therle arundell iudged bethe cap xii p howe sir hewe spensar putte iudgement cap xiii p coronacyon kynge edwarde thirde cap xiiii p howe kyng robert de breur scotlade defyed kyng edwarde englande cap xv p discecion sell bytwene tharchers englande heynalt cap xvi p maner scottes howe make warre cap xvii p howe kyng englande made first iourney agaynst scottes cap xviii p howe kynge edwarde maryed lady philyppe heynalt cap xix p howe kyng robert scotlade dyed ca xx p howe philyppe ualloyes crowned kynge fraunce cap xxi batayle cassell fladers ca xxii p howe therle kent therle mortymer englande put dethe cap xxiii p homage kyng edwarde englande made frenche kyng duchy guyen cap xxiiii p howe sir roberte arthoyse chased realme fraunce cap xxv p howe kynge edwarde tooke towne berwyke agaynst scottes cap xxvi p howe king philyp fraunce dyuers kynges toke crosey holy lande cap xxvii p howe kynge edwarde englande counsayled make warre agaynst frenche kynge cap xxviii p howe jaques dartuell gouerned ye countie flaunders cap xxix p howe certayne noble flauders kept yle cagat agaynst theglysshmen cap xxx p batayle cagant twene englysshmen flemynges cap xxxi p howe kynge edwarde englande made great alyaunces thempyre cap xxxii p howe kyng dauyd scotlande made alyauce kyng philyp frace ca xxxiii p howe kyng edwarde made vycar generall thepyre almayne cap xxxiiii p howe kynge edwarde alyes dede defy frenche kyng cap xxxv p howe sir gaultier manny defyaunces declared made first iourney fraunce cap xxxvi p howe defyaunces frenchemen entred englande cap xxxvii p howe kyng edwarde besieged cytie cambrey cap xxxviii p howe kynge edwarde made sir henry flaunders knight cap xxxix p howe kyng englande freche kynge toke day fight cap xl p howe two kynges ordayned batayls uyronfosse cap xli p howe sayd two kynges departed without batayle cap xlii p howe king edwarde englande toke beare armes fraunce called kyng therof cap xliii p howe frenchman brent lanbes sir johan heynalt cap xliiii p howe therle heynalt toke distroyed aubenton thyerache cap xlv p howe tourney made iourney flaunders cap xlvi p iourney duke john norma dy made heynalt cap xlvii p howe doway made iourney ostrenant howe erle heynalt englande cap xlviii p howe duke normandy layd siege thyne bysshoppe cap xlix p batayle see srluse flaunders bytwene kynge englande frenchman cap l p howe kynge robert cycile dyde might pacify kynges englande fraunce cap li p cousayle kyng england alyes helde ye towne uyllenort ca lii p howe kyng englande layde siege cytie iourney cap liii p howe erle heynalt distroyed townes seclyn dorchies cap liiii p howe scottes wan agayne great te scotlande whyle siege tourney cap lv p great assemble frenche kyng made reyse siege turney ca lvi p howe garyson bouhayne distrussed certayne soudyers mortaygne towne conde cap lvii p iourney sir wylliam baylleule sir walflart de la croyse made bridge cresyn cap lviii p howe erle heynault assayled fortreile mortayne picardy dyuers maners cap lix p howe erle heynalte toke towne saynt amande duryng siege tourney cap lr p takyng sir charles momorency dyuers frenchman brige cresyn cap lxi p howe flemynges saynt omers duryng siege turney cap lxii p howe siege turney broken vp reason truse cap lxiii p warres bretaygne howe duke ther dyed without heyre wherby discencyon fell cap lxiiii p howe erle mountfort toke towne castell brest cap lxv p howe erle mountfort toke cyte reynes cap lxvi p howe erle mountfort toke towne castell hanybout cap lxvii p howe therle moutfort dyde homage king englad ye duchy breten ca lxviii p howe therle moutfort somoned lyament parys request lorde charles bloyes cap lxix p howe duchy bretaygne iudged sir charles bloyes cap lxx p lordes frauce yt entred bretayne sir charles bloyes cap lxxi p howe therle moutfort taken nau te howe dyed cap lxxii p howe kyng englade thirde tyme made warre scottes cap lxxiii p howe king dauyd scotlande cae great host newcastell vpotyne ca lxxiiii p howe scottes distroyed cyte dyrham cap lxxv p howe scottes besieged castell therle salysburies cap lxxvi p howe kyng englade amour countesse salisbury cap lxxvii p howe therle salisbury therle moret delyuered prison cap lxxviii p howe sir charles bloyes dyuers lordes fraunce toke cytie reynes bretayne cap lxxix p howe sir charles bloyes besieged coutesse mountfort hanybout ca lxxx p howe sir gaultier manny brought englysshmen bretayne cap lxxxi p howe tastell conquest wonne two tymes cap lxxxii p howe sir loyes spaygne toke townes dynant gerande cap lxxxiii p howe sir gaultier manny discofyted sir loyes spayne cap lxxxiiii p howe sir gaultier manny tooke castell gony forest cap lxxxv p howe sir charles bloies toke towne carahes cap lxxxvi p howe sir john butler sir hubert fresnoy rescued fro dethe cap lxxxvii p howe sir charles bloys toke towne jugon castell cap lxxxviii p feest iustes kyng englande made london loue cou tesse salisbury cap lxxxix p howe kyng england sent sir robert artoyse bretayue cap lxxxx p batayle gernsay twenesir robert arthois sir loyes spaygne see cap lxxxxi p howe sir robert arthois toke cite uannes bretayne cap lxxxxii p howe sir robert arthoise dyed buryed cap lxxxxiii p howe kyng englande cae bretayne make warre cap lxxxxiiii p howe lorde clisson sir henry leon taken prisoner uanes ca lxxxxv p howe kyng englande toke ye towne dynant cap lxxxxvi p lordes frauce duke norman brought bretayne kyng englande cap lxxxxvii p howe kynge englande duke normandy hoost agaynst hoost loged uannes cap lxxxxviii p howe frenche kynge beheeded lorde clysson dyuers lordes bretayne normandy cap lxxxxix p order saynt george king edwarde stablysshed castell wyndsore cap c p howe kyng englande delyuered prison sir henry leon cap c p howe kyng englande sent erle derby make warre gascoyne cap c ii p howe erle derby conquered forteresse bergerath cap c iii p howe erle derby conquered dyuers townes forteresses hye gascoyne cap c iiii p howe therle quenfort taken gascoyne delyuered agayne exchaunge cap c v p howe erle layle lieutenant ye frenche kyng gascoyne layde siege auberoche cap c vi p howe erle derby toke auberoche erle layle dyuers erles vycountes nombre ix ca c vii p townes therle derby wan gascoyne goynge towarde ryoll cap c viii p howe therle derby layde siege ye ryoll howe towne yelded hym cap c ix p howe sir gaultier manny founde ryoll father sepulture cap c x p howe erle derby wanne castell ryoll cap c xi p howe erle derby tooke towne mauleon towne franche gascoyne cap c xii p howe erle derby wanne cytie angolesme cap c xiii p howe sir godfrey harcourt banysshed fraunce cap c xiiii p dethe jaques dartuell gaunt cap c xv p dethe willm erle heynalt dyed frise many cap c xvi p howe sir johan heynault became frenche cap c xvii p great hoost duke norma dy brought gascoyne agaynst erle derby cap c xviii p howe john norwich scaped fro angolem whan towne yelden freche cap c xix p howe duke normandy layd siege aguyllon hundred men cap c xx p howe kyng englande went ouer see agayne rescue aguyllon cap c xxi p howe kyng englade rode thre batayls thorowe normandy cap c xxii p great assemble frenche king made resyst kynge englande cap c xxiii p batayle cane howe englysshmen toke towne cap c xxiiii p howe sir godfray harcort fought ampens parys cap c xxv p howe frenche kyng folowed kyng englande beauuonoyse cap c xxvi p howe bataile blanche take foughten bytwene kyng englande sir godmar du fay cap c xxvii p order englysshmen cressey howe made thre batayls fote cap c xxviii p thorder frechmen cressey howe regarded maner englysshmen cap c xxix p bataile cressey bytwene king englande freche kyng cap c xxx p howe next day batayle englysshmen disconfyted agayne dyuers frenchman cap c xxxi p howe batayle cressey deed men nombred englysshmen cap c xxxii p howe kyng englande layde siege calys howe poore people put towne cap c xxxiii p howe duke normandy brake vp siege aguyllon cap c xxxiiii p howe sir galtier manny rode thorowe fraunce saue conducte calays cap c xxxv p howe therle derby season toke doictou dyuers townes castels also cytie poicters cap c xxxvi p howe kyng scottes duryng siege calys cae englande great hoost cap c xxxvii pof batayle newe castell vpon tyne swette quene englande kyng scottes cap c xxxviii p howe johan coplande toke kynge scottes prisoner profyt gate therby cap c xxxix p howe younge erle flaunders ensured kynges doughter englande cap c xl p howe ser robert namure dyd homage kyng englade calys cap c xlt p howe englysshmen wan roche daryen howe sir charles bloys layde siege therto cap c xlii p batayle roche daryen howe sir charles bloys taken ye englysshmen cap c xliii p howe frenche kynge assembled great hoost reyse ye kyng englande fro siege calys cap c xliiii p howe kyng englande made passage boute caleys well kept frenche kynge shulde nat proche reyse siege cap c xlv p howe towne calys yelded vp kyng englande cap c xlvi p howe kyng englande repeopled towne calys englisshmen ca c xlvii p dealynge brigant languedoc called bacon cap c xlviii p another page called crocart cap c xlix p howe sir amery pauy lombarde solde towne calys wherof capitayne lorde geffrey charney frace cap c l p batayle calys bytwene kyng englande vnder baner sir gaultyer manny sir geffray cherney frenchemen cap c li p chaplet perles kyng englande gaue sir eustace rybamont cap c lii p dethe kyng philyp frauce coronacyon son johan cap c liii p howe kyng nauer made sir charles spayne constable fraunce slayne cap c liiii p imposicyon gabell ordeyned fraunce thre estate feates warre cap c lv p howe frenche kyng toke ye kyng nauer beheeded erle harcourt roan cap c lvi p assemble frenche kyng made fyght prince wale rode brode berry cap c lvii p howe prince wale toke castell remorentyn cap c lviii p ye great hoost yt french kyng brought batayle poicters cap c lix p ordre frenchman batayle poicters cap c lx p howe cardynall piergourt treated haue made gremen bytwene french kyng prince batayle poycters cap c lxi p batayle poicters bytwene ye price wale frenche kyng cap c lxii p two frenchman fled fro batayle poicters two englysshmen folowed cap c lxiii p howe kyng johan fraunce taken prisoner batayle poiters cap c lxiiii p gyft prince gaue lorde audley batayle poiters ca c lxv p howe englysshmen wan greatly batayle poycters cap c xlvi p howe lord james audeley gaue foure squiers fyue c marke reuenewes prince gyuen hym ca c lxvii p howe prince made supper french kyng day ye batayle cap c lxviii p howe prince returned burdeaux batayle poicters cap c lxix p howe thre estate fraunce assembled gyder parys batayle poycters cap c lxx p howe thre estate sent men warre agaynst lorde godfrey harcourt cap c lxxi p batayle constance bytwene lorde godfrey hercourt lorde loys rauenall cap c lxxii p howe prince conueyed frenche kyng fro burdeaux englande cap c lxxiii p howe ye kyng scottes delyuered prison cap c lxxiiii p howe duke lancastre leyde siege reynes cap c lxxv p howe knyght coutie eureux called sir willyam granuyle wan cyte castell eureux whiche frenche kyng fro kyng nauer cap c lxxvi p companyons wherof archeprest chiefe howe honoured auignon cap c lxxvii p nother sorte copanyons wherof ruffyn walsheman chiefe capitayne cap c lxxviii p howe prouost marchantes parys slewe thre knyghtes regentes chambre cap c lxxix p howe kynge nauer came prisone cap c lxxx p howe kynge nauer preched solepnelye parys cap c lxxxi p begynning cysing commens called jaquery beauosyn cap c lxxxii p howe prouost marchantes parys caused walles made cyte parys cap c lxxxiii p batayleat meaulx bry wher companyons jaquery disconfyted erle foyz captall beufz cap c lxxxiiii p howe parys besieged duke normandy regent fraunce cap c lxxxv p parisyens slayne saynt clude englysshmen ben soudyers parys cap c lxxxvi p dethe prouost marchantes parys cap c lxxxvii p howe cytie naueroyse great famyne realme fraunce cap c lrxxx p naueroise beseged saynt ualery pycardes howe realme frauce full naueroyse cap c lxxxxi p naueroyse chanone robersart disconfyted beauoyse nere towne craule cap c lxxxxii p naueroyse yelded vp saynt ualerys frenchman ben long besieged cap c lxxxxiii p howe sir philyp nauer reysed vp thre thousande naueroyse haue reysed siege saynt ualerys cap c lxxxxiiii p naueroyse sir peter audeley brought night haue takenne cytie chalons cap c lxxxxv p howe erle roucy taken prisoner seconde tyme cap c lxxxxvi p thre quenes naueryse besieged duke normady melune cap c lxxxx ii p howe lorde broquart fenestrages frenchemen ordayned bataylles agaynst lorde eustace dambreticourt englysshmen chapayne cap c lxxxxviii p batayle nogent bytwene lorde broquart fenestrages nacyon lorayne freche partie sir eustace dabretycourt nacyon heynalt englysshe partie cap c lxxxxix p howe robber pyllers kept fortress fraunce began declyne myracle cap cc p howe frenchemen refused peace kyng made englande cap cc p howe sir eustace dabretycourt delyuered prison great raunsome cap cc ii p howe sir broquart fenestrages made hymselfe payed wage duke normandy regent fraunce cap cc iii p iourney sir robrt canoll made berry auuergne lordes gentylmen countre pursewed hym cap cc iiii p almayns abode kyng englande calys ryde hym realme fraunce kyng johan beyng styll prisoner englande cap cc v p great host kyng englade brought frauce make warr kynge johan beyng prisoner englande order englysshe hoost cap cc viii p howe kynge englande departed fro calys order hoost ridynge thorowe picardy cytie reynes cap cc vii p howe kynge englande besieged cytie reynes castell charigny taken englysshemen warre began agayne bytwene duke normandy kyng nauer cap cc viii p howe lorde roy disconfyted lorde gomegynes howe castell comercy taken englysshmen cap cc ix p howe kynge englande wente wasted distroyed countrey howe came aguyllon taryed great prouisyon came hoost cap cc x p howe kyng englande put realme fraunce great trybulacion prophecyes frere auygnon p howe sir robert canoll sir johan chandos departed fro dome without wynnyng w toke gauaches rochemador dyuers townes tourned frenche cap cc lviii p howe erle cambridge erle penbroke toke great aduyse gaiyson bourdell cap cc lix p howe sir robert canoll sir johan chandos sir thomas phelton ordered people retourned prince ca cc lx p howe englysshe companyons tooke castell bell perche therin duke burbons mother also toke stronge castell saynt seuere berry cap cc lxi p howe castell roche sur yone yelden vp englisshmen howe capyteyne therof beheeded commaundement duke aniou cap cc lxii p howe duke burgoyne deted fro cyye roen thentent fight duke lancastre howe lodged eche agaynst tournehen cap cc lxiii p howe sir john chandos brought countre aniou great trybulacion howe wasted distroyed landes vycout roch choart except fortress ca cc lxiiii p howe sir loys sanxere came therle penbroke slewe dyuers men besieged erle howse cap ii c lxv p howe sir john chandos cae socoure rescue therle penbroke cap cc lxvi p howe quene philyppe englande passed mortall lyfe ye thre requestes desyred kyng husband departed cap cc lxvii p howe duke burgoyne deted fro duke lancastre without batayle howe duke lacastre went calys ca cc lviii p howe ye countrey uermandoyse coutie saynt poule wasted sir hugh chastellone taken cap cc lxix p howe sir johan chandos slayne batayle finally frenchman discomfyted batayle cap cc lxx p howe lorde coucy lorde pomyers wolde nat entre warre nother one parte howe lorde maleuale lorde marnayle tourned frenche cap cc lxxi p copy letter sent fro kynge england acquitayne howe chastelerant taken bell perche besieged frenchman cap cc lxxii p howe erle cambridge erle penbroke ledde way fro garyson bell perche duke burbons mother tho within cap cc lxxiii p howe duke burbon gaue leaue men departe knewe ye lady mother ledde way cap cc lxxiiii p howe duke aniou came fro tholouse parys howe kynge charles sent hym duke berry brother aquitayne agaynst ye englisshmen cap cc lxxv p howe sir bertram clesquy deted spayne wet tholous duke aniou receyued hym ioyously ca cc lxxvi p howe monsac moutpellyer yelded duke aniowe duke berry layde siege cytie lymoges cap cc lxxvii p howe trewse made bytwene england scotlande howe sir robert canoll brent eryled countrey picardy uermandoyse cap cc lxxviii p howe noyon toke englysshmen set fyre bysshops bridge howe frenche kyng sent sir bertram clesquy cap cc lxxix p howe lymoges yelded duke berrey howe brake vp army cap cc lxxx p howe sir robert canoll entred realme frauce great nombre men armes came nere cytie parys cap cc lxxxi p howe sir bertram clesquy made great warre countie lymoges howe toke castell saynt yriell cap iic lxxxii p howe prince walles toke cytie lymoges howe foure companyons dyd marueyls armes cap cc lxxxiii p howe cytie lymoges brent distroyed bysshop deliuered fro dethe howe sir bertram clesquy made constable fraunce cap cc lxxxiiii p howe sir bertram clesquy lorde clysson discosyted bridge bolayne certayne sir robert canols company cap cc lxxxv p howe pope urbane dyed howe gregory chosen howe sir raymon marnell taken theglysshmen ca cc lxxxvi p howe prince lefte duchy acquitayne kepynge duke lancaster howe four breton knightes toke castell mount paon cap cc lxxxvii p howe sayd foure knyghtes breton defended selfe valiauntly agaynst duke lancastre howe fynally duke toke four rausome cap cc lxxxviii p howe duke lacastre gaue lycence people dete returned hym selfe burdeux howe therle pons turned frenche howe ye seneshall poytou asse bled togyder company cap cc lxxxix p howe seneshall poictou toke moutcontour howe ser bertram clesquy toke dyuers townes castels rouuergue howe besieged cite duse cap cc xc p howe duse yelded vp sir bertram howe sir robert canoll kyng englandes displeasure howe request lordes peace made agayne cap cc lxxxxi p howe therle herforde dyuers englysshmen discomfyted bretayne ye see dyuers slemynges ye assayled ca ii c lxxxxii p kyng englad sent great nauy see agaynst slemynges howe peace made bytwene cap cc lxxxxiii p howe ye kyng mayllorgues displeasure kyng henry spayne went made warre kyng arragon cap ii c lxxxxiiii p howe duke lancastre wedded eldest doughter kyng dampeter spayne howe confederacions made bytwene french kyng kyng spayne cap ii c lxxxxv p howe duke lancastre ordayned gouernours guyen ledde wyfe hym englade howe kyng englande ordayned erle penbroke gouernour poictou cap cc lxxxxvi p howe erle penbroke departed englande go poyctou howe spaynierdes fought hym hauen rochell cap cc lxxxxvii p howe rochell towne wolde nat rescue therle penbroke howe seneshall rochell lorde tanyboton came socour erle cap cc lxxxxviii p howe therle penbroke taken prisoner spanierdes howe departed fro ye hauen rochell withall prisoner day captall beufz came rochell cap cc lxxxxix p howe sir yuan wale discofyted englysshmen yle gerusay howe frenche kynge sent spaygne men warre ley siege rochell cap ccc p howe kynge englande sore displeased takyng erle penbroke howe sir bertram clesquy toke castell mountmorillan cap ccc p howe costable frauce besieged mout counter howe departed then go duke berrey lymosyn besiege saynt seuere cap ccc ii p howe saynt seuere endurynge great assaut yelded theym vp sir bertram howe cyte potter tourned frenche cap ccc iii p howe frenche men tooke captall beufz subyse batayle howe rochell tourned frenche cap ccc iiii p howe sir bertram clesquy constable frauce toke dyuers castels rochell howe kynge englande toke see come reyse siege thouars cap ccc v p howe sir bertram clesquy leyde siege castell syreth howe thenglysshemen disconfyted howe countreis poictou xaynton rochell clene delyuered englysshmens handes cap ccc vi p siege bercerell dethe kyng scottes peace bytwene frenche kyng kynge nauer howe duke bretayne sledde englande howe constable fraunce conquered duchy cap ccc vii p howe ther certayne ordayned englande kepe countre howe therle salisbury sir wyllm neuell philyppe courtney dyuers men armes entred see landed bretaygne howe constable frauce went thyder duke bretaygne wente englande cap ccc viii p howe frenche men lay siege foure sondrie place atones howe rochesur yone yelded selfe became frenche howe englysshmen came brest cap ccc ix p howe dyuers englisshmen slayne disconfyted lorde subyse rybamot howe garysons soissonois disconfyted thenglysshmen cap ccc x p howe hostage layd dyriuall beheeded howe sir robert canoll beheeded agayne suche prisoner also duke lancaster iourney cap ccc xi p howe lorde brime chyldren taken englysshmen company howe garyson peron chased towne hastely cap ccc lxii p howe englisshmen brint wasted countre champayne countrynges way prisoner toke cap ccc lxiii p howe englisshmen came croyes bastydes duke burgoyne made without troyes resyst englysshe men cap ccc lxiiii p howe englysshmen de pylled countrey gastenoyse beause howe frenche squier right valyant requyred englysshe squier iust cap ccc lxv p justes bytwene gawen mychaell fraucoys joachyn cathore angloys wordes kynge charles fraunce sayd dethe bedde cap ccc lxvi p lorde mauuoysen taken prisoner englisshmen lorde hangest scaped dethe kyng charles fraunce fifte name cap ccc lxvii p howe englysshmen arryued breten howe ye duke excused himselfe longe taryenge fro cap ccc lxviii p howe duke bretayne englysshmen besieged nauntes coronacyon kyng charles ye sixt name sery st done nauntes ca ccc lxix p lettes duke bretayne yt might nat come sege nautes scrimysshe made cap ccc lxx p scrumysshe barroys barres almery clysson made christmas cuyu agaynst thenglisshmen beyng nauntes cap ccc lxxi p howe englysshmen departed fro ye siege nauntes fayre excuse duke bretayne made erle buckyngham cap ccc lxxii p dedes armes done therle buckyngham bytwene englysshmen frenchman auswere made heraudes saueconductes cap ccc lxxiii p howe duke bretayne made peace frenche kyng howe englysshmen returned countreys dede armes bytwene frenche squier englysshe cap ccc lxxiiii p howe warre began agayne bytwene erle flauders flemynges howe ipre discomfyted abusshemet cap ccc lxxv p howe ipre courtrey turned erle flauders parte howe towne gaunt besieged cap ccc lxxvt p howe erle flaunders reysed vp siege fro towne gaut batayle bytwene gauntoyse cap ccc lxxvii p howe gauntoyse brent churche nieule howe white hodes slewe dyuers noble men erle flauders parte cap ccc lxxviii p howe whyte hodes capitayne slayne howe philyp dartuell chosen capitayne gaunt cap ccc lxxix p ordynaunce gaunt warre spayne portyngale cap ccc lxxx p howe erle cambridge departed englande go portyngale comons englande rebelled agaynst noble men cap ccc lxxxi p yuell dedes comons englande dyd kynges offycers howe sent knyght speke kyng cap ccc lxxxii p howe comons englande entred london great yuell dyd dethe bysshop caunterbury dyuers cap ccc lxxxiii p howe noble englade great parell haue bene distroyed howe rebel punysshed sent home owne house cap ccc lxxxiiii p howe duke lancastre kept hymselfe styll scotlande feare rebellyon howe ye kyng punysshed treatours chiefe maysters cap ccc lxxxv p yuell wyll duke lancastre conceyued courage refuse yt made berwyke howe cambridge arryued portyngale ca ccc lxxxvi p howe two valyat men gaut lxxxviii p howe thenglysshmen rode without co maundement kyng porsyngale howe ye castel sigheyre portingale taken cap ccc lxxxix p howe chanoyne robersarde company returned garyson maryage kyng stryken howe chanoyne robersarde company toke dyuers castels spayne cap ccc xcii p great pyllage proies done chanoyue robersart company agaynst kyng castyle discencyon amonge cap ccc xciii p howe kynges castyle portingale assembled puyssaun e howe peace made bstwene agaynst wyll englysshmen cap ccc xciiii p howe kyng spaygne maryed agayne kynge portyngales doughter cap ccc xch p great necessyte vitaylles gaunt endured howe socoured liege cap ccc xcvi p harde answere erle flaunders made gaunt nombre men armes parys fraunce cap ccc xchii p howe fyue thousande gautoyse yssued gaunt fyght erle bruges answere phylyppe dartuell hadde shewed cap ccc xcviii p order gauntoyse howe disconfyted erle bruges meanes cap ccc xcix p howe towne bruges taken gauntoyse howe erle flauders saued hym selfe apoore woman howse towne bruges cap cccc p howe gaunt spared marchauntestraungers howe erle departed fro bruges wente lysse howe receyued ioyoussy cap cccc p great rychesse gauntoyse foude tymes howe ran lysse countre aboute realme fraunce cap cccc iiii p request duke burgoyne made frenche kynge kynge toke hym beare fleyng hart cap cccc v p dreme fortuned kynge season whyle lay lysse occasyon whiche dreme ordayned deuyse styeng hart cap cccc vi p messangers philyppe dartuell sent englande also frauce dethe sir perducas dalbreth cap cccc vii p howe kynge englandes counsayle mocked kynge departed fro mount ipre howe philyppe dartuell flemynges apparelled th selfe fight cap cccc xviii p marueyle came flemynges night howe ordayned batayle one copany cap cccc xix p howe constable admyrall frau ce bastarde langres wente se flemynges howe fortifyed themselfe cap cccc xx p maner batayle rosebeque howe flemynges discomfyted threfore sayde knyghtes auewed behauyng cap cccc xxi p howe flemynges discofyted batayle rosebeque cap cccc xxii p howe body philyppe dartuell brought kyng fo haged vp howe towne courtrey brent cap cccc xxiii p howe bruges yelded themselfe vnder obeysaunce frenche kynge howe gaunt recoforted peter de boyse cap cccc xxiiii p howe treatie alyauce bytwene englyssh men flemynges broken howe frenche kyng departed flaunders cap cccc xxv p howe frenche kynge came parys howe caused putte downe chenesse harnesse towne howe parisyens aunsomed pleasure cap cccc xxvi p howe dyuers notable men parys beheeded maister john marettes parys dyuers bloyse men came arras howe kynges vowarde toke cassell cap cccc xxxvii p howe englisshmen ye siege ipre withdrawen towne bergues howe departed then went burboucke whan sawe kynges puyssauce cap cccc xxxviii p howe ye french kyng hoost came burbourke ordre englisshemen within towne howe fraunces freman wan ndewarpe cap cccc xxxix p howe andwarpe put towne none abode gauntoyse howe amergot marcell blanke cap cccc xli p myracles done ye towne burburke howe sir thomas tryuet sir wyll helman englisshmen put prisone domage fraunce cap cccc xlii p howe lordes englande fraunce assembled togyder make peace whiche coude nat done howe loyes erle flaunders dyed ob quy cap cccc xliii p howe therle northuberlande erle notyngham theglysshmen made iourney scotlade ambassadours fraunce sent scotlande notifye truse taken bytwene englande fraunce cap cccc xliiii p howe baron knightes scotlande frauce made apoyntment entre realme englade without knowledge kyng scottes edenborowe cap cccc xlv p howe trewse taken bytwene englande frauce publysshed englande scotlande cap cccc xlvi p howe lorde destoruay made assemble wynne againe andwarpe howe policy wanne cap cccc xlvii p howe duke aniou dyed xlix p howe french kyng lordes frau ce heynault made prouysion cambray message duke lancastre sent erle heynalt maryage chyldren heynalt burgoyne cap cccc l p howe ye duke berry ensured doughter sonne erle bloys howe erle marche duke burbone made somons entre lymosyn cap cccc li p finis phere begymeth prologe syr john froissart cronicles fra ce inglande place abioynynge phe first chaptre thentent honorable noble au tures offeatis armes done achyued warres fra ce ingland shuld notably inregisterd put perpetuall memory wherby prewe hardy may haue ensample courage theyr well doyng syr john froissart wyll treat recorde hystory great louage preyse begyn require sauyour worlde nothyng created al thynges wyll gyue suche grace vnderstandyng may co tinue euer suche wyse proces redeth hereth may take pastauce pleasure ensample sayd trouth al buyldynges masoned wroughte dyuerse stone great tyuers gurged assembled diuers surge sprynges water lyke wyse science extraught copiled diuerse clerkes one wryteth another parauenture ignorant famous wrytyng auncient auctours thyngis ben knowen one place attaygne mater haue entreprised wyll begyn fyrst grace god blessed virgyn ourlady saynt mary comfort consolation procedeth wyll take foundation ye true cronicles somtyme copyled right reuerend discrete sage maister john la bele somtyme chanon saint labartis liege good herte due diligence dyd true deuoure wrytyng noble cronicle dyd contynue lyf dayes folowyng trouth nere myght great charge coste sekyng haue perfight knowledge therof also lyf dayes welbeloued secret counsayle lorde sir john haynaulte often remembred reason requyreth boke many fayre noble auentures chief causer whose meanes ye sayd ser john la bele myght well knowe many dyuers noble dedes whiche shalbe declared trouth haue entreprised boke ordeyne pleasure pastaunce whiche alwayes haue ben inclyned intent haue folowed frequented company dyuerse noble great lordes well fraunce juglande scotland diuerse country haue knowledge alwayes power iustly haue inquired trouth dedis warre auentures haue fallen specially syth great batell poyters noble kynge john france takyn prisoner tyme yonge age vnderstandyng ho toke assoone came scole wryte recite sayd boke bare ye compyled ingland presented volume therof lady philypp heynaulte noble quene ingland right amyably receyued great profite auaucemet may boke nat yet eramyned corrected iustely suche case requyreth featis armes derely bought achyued honour therof ought gyuen truly deuided promes hard trauayle haue deserued therfore acquyte bihalf folowyng trouth nere john froissart haue entreprysed hystory ye forsaid ordynauce true fundacion instauce request dere lord myn ser robert namure knyght lord bewfort entierly owe loue obeysyunce god graunt thyng may pleasure amen phere spekethe auctour suche valiant knyghtis made mencion boke pap ii noble hertis encorage shewe ensample mater honour ser john froissart begynne speke true report relation master john la bele somtyme chanon saynt lambertis liege af ermyng thus howe many noble son haue oft tymes spoke warres france ingland auenture knewe nat iuslely trouth therof true occasion fyrst mouyngis suche warres howe warre length contynued trust ye shall reported true foudation cause thentent wyll nat forget myuysshe abrydge ye hystory thyng defaute lagage rather wyll multiply encrease ner folowynge trouth poynt poynt spekyng wyng auetures sith natiuite noble kyng edward ye iii reigned kyng england achyued many perilous auentures dyuers great batelles addressed featis armes great prowes syth yere oure lorde god ccc xxvi noble kyng crowned ingland generally suche hym batels happy fortunate auentures peple absence ought ryght well takyn reputed valiant worthy renowne though great plenty sondrye parsonage ought praysed reputed soueraignes yet among pryncipally ought renowmed noble propre sone ye forsaid gentyll kyng also prynce walys son duke lancastre ser reignold lorde cobham syr gualtier manny heynaulte knyght syr john chandos syr fulque harle dyuers made mencion hereafter present boke bicause theyr valyant prowes batels comonly euer renowne land se accordyng trouth theyr dedis valyant ought reputed soueraignes chyualry yet suche theyr companye ought nat ye lesse value lesse set also frauce tyme foude many good knyghtis stronge well expert featis armes realme fraunce nat discomfited alwayes ther people sufficient fyght withall kyng philyppe uaioyes ryght hardy valiant knyght also kyng john sone charles ye kyng behaigne erle alason erle foyz syr sa tre syr arnold dangle lordes beamon father sonne dyuerse ye whiche ca nat theyr name hereafter ryght well shall made mencion tyme place couenient say trouth maynteigne suche cruel batels haue ben seen abydyng discomfeture sufficiently doyng theyr deuour may wel reputed valyant hardy soeuer theyr aduenture p mater speketh predecessours kyng edwarde ingland cap iii first better entre mater honorable pleasaut hystory noble edward kyng ingland crowued londo yere lorde god ccc xxvi christmas day lyuyg kyng father quene mother certayne opinyon inglisshmen comonly often tymes seen ingland tyme kyng thure howe betwene two valyant kynges ingland ther comoly one bitwene lesse sufficiauncy wytte prowes ryght well aparant ye kyng edward thyrde graundfather called good kyng edward fyrste ryght valyant sage wyse hardy auenturous fortunate al featis warre moche agaynst scottis conquered iii iiii tymes scott coude neuer haue victory idure agaynst hym dissease sone first wyfe father sayd good kyng edward thyrde crowned kyng called edward ii resembled nothyng father wyt prowes gouerned kept realme ryght wyldly ruled hym selfe synyster counsell certayne parson wherby length profytte norlaude ye shall anone crowned robert bruse kyng scotlande often gyuen moche sayd good kyng edward fyrst conquered agayne scotland brent wasted great parte realme england iiii v dayes iourney within realme two tymes discomfyted kyng baron ingland place scotland called estaruelyn batel arengyd day saynt john baptyst vii yere ye reigne kyng edward yere lorde ccc xiiii chase discofeture endured ii dayes two nyghtys kyng ingland wet wt small company london mydlentsonday yere lorde ccc xvi scottis wan agayne cite berwyk treason bicause part mater wyll leue spekyng therof p myn auctour maketh mencion parent good kyng edward iii cap iiii kyng edward ii father noble kyng edward iii ii brethern one called marshall ryght wyld diuers condicions called sir aymon erle cane right wyse miable getle welbeloued alpeople kyng edward ii maried isabell doughter philyp la beaw kyng frauce one feyrest ladyes ye worlde kyng ii sone ii doughters fyrste son noble hardy kyng edward iii hystory begon ii named john dyed yong first ye doughters called isabel maried yog kyng dauid scotlad son kyng robert de bruse maried teder yongth thaccord realmes ingland scotland make fight pear doughter maried erle reynold called duke guerles ii sone reynold edward reygned great puissauce herafter begynneth occasio wher warr moued bitwene kyngis frauce ingland cap v sheweth hystory philyp la beaw kyng frauce iii sone feyre doughter named isabel maried ingland kyng edward ii iii sone theldest named lewes kyng nauerr father day called kyng lewys hotin ii name philyp great long ye iii called charles iii kyngis frauce theyr father discease ryght succession eche aff without hauyng issue male theyr body laufully begoten deth charlis last kyng iii xii pier baros frauce wold nat gyue realme isabell suster quene inglad cause sayd maynteyned yet realme frauce noble ought nat go woma co sequetly isabel kyng inglande eldest sonne determyned sonne woma haue ryght succession mother syn declared ye mother haue ryght reason xii pier baros frauce theyr comon acord dyd gyue realme frauce lord philyp ualois nephew somtyme philyp la beawe kyng frauce put quene ingland sonne next heire male sone suster charles last kyng fraunce thus went realme fraunce ye ryght lynage semed many folk wherby great warres hath moued fallen great distructios people coutres realme frauce place ye may right foudation hystory recount great entreprises great featis armes haue fortuned fallen syth tyme good charlemaigne kyng fraunce ther neuer fell great aduentures p erle thomas lancastre xxii great lordis knyghtis inglande beheeddyd cap vi forsaid kyng edward ii father ye noble kyng edward ye iii mater fouded sayd kyng gouerned right diuersly realme ye exortacio ser hewe specer ben norisshed hym syth begynnyng yongth whiche ser hewe enticed kyng father ye greattest maisters realme enuy thought surmout baron ingland wherby great discofeture scott made estermelyn great murmoryng ther arose ingland bitwene noble baros ye kyng cousell namely ageynst ser hewe spe cer put hym counsell discomfeted fauorable kyng scott poynt haros diuers tymes comunicatio gether aduised myght wherof thomas erle la vncle ye kyng chief anon whan ser hewe spencer espied purueyd remedy great kyng nere hym beloued kyng world day came ye kyng sayd sir certayn lordes realme haue made aliaunce gether agaynst without ye take hede therto tymes purpose put realme malicio meanes caused kyng made sayd lordes takyn theyr heedis strike without delay without knowlege answere cause fyrst ser thomas erle lancastre noble wyse holy knyght hath done syth many fayre myracles page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate pomfret wher beheedded ye whiche dede sayd sir hewe spencer achyued great hate realme specially quene erle cane brother ye kyng whan parceyued dyspleasure quene subtile wytte set great discorde bitwene kyng quene ye kyng wold nat se quene come company whiche discord endured long space shewed quene secretly erle cane withoute toke good hede selfe lykely distroyed sir hewe specer purchace moch trouble theym quene secretly dyd puruey go frauce toke way pylgrymage saynt thomas canturbury wynchelsey nyght went shyp redy yong sone edward erle cane sir roger mortymer nother ship put theyr purueyauce wynde wyll next mornyng arryued hauyn bolayn p howe quene ingland went complayned kyng fraunce brother syr hewe spencer cap vii whan quene isabell arryued bolayn sonne erle cane capytayns abbot ye towne came agaynst ioyously receued company abbey ther aboode ii dayes departed de long iourneys arryued paris tha kyng charles brother enfourmed comyng sent mete dyuers greattest lordes realme lorde syr robert de artoys lorde crucy lorde sully lorde roy dyuers honorably dyd receue brought cite paris kyng brother whan kyng sawe suster nat sene long shuld haue entred chambre mette toke armes kyst sayd ye welcome feyre suster feyre nephewe sonne toke handis led forth quene great ioy harte nere kyng brother wold haue kneled downe ii iii tymes foot kyng kyng wold nat suffre held styl right hande demaunding right swetely astate besynesse answered hym ryght sagely lamentably recounted hym felonyes iniuries done syr hewe spencer requyred hym ayde cofort whan noble kyng charles frau ce harde susters lamentation wepyngly shewed hym nede besynesse sayd fayre suster appease selfe faith owe god saynt denyce shall right well puruey remedy quene kneled downed whether kyng wold nat sayd ryght dere lord fayre brother pray god reward kyng toke armes led chambre whiche apparayled yong edwarde sone departed fro caused costis chargis thyng delyuered behouefull sone nat long occasion charles kyng fraunce assembled together many great lordes baron realme fraunce haue theyr cousell good aduise howe shuld ordeyne nede besynes suster quene ingland cousailed kyng shuld let quene suster purchas selfe frendis wold realme fraunce place hym selfe fayne nat knowen therof sayd moue warre kyng ingland bryng owne realme hatred nothyng apertenaunt profitable hym realme cocluded conueniently mgiht ayde golde syluer metall wherby loue attaygned getylemen pore souldiours counsell aduyce accorded kynge caused shewed quene priuely sir robert dartoys one greatteste lordis fraunce p howe syr hewe spencer purchased quene isabell banysshed fraunce cap viii nowe let v speke somewhat sir hewe spencer whan sawe hadde drawen kyng inglad moche wyll coud desire nothyng hym graunted caused many noble men put deth without iustice lawe bicause held suspect ageynst hym pride dyd many marueylles barous left alyue land coude nat beare su e lenger besought requyred eche among selfe peasable accorde caused secretly knowen quene theyr lady hadde ben parys space iii yere certifiyng wryttyng coulde fynd meanes haue companye men armes nombre bryng son heyre inglande wolde drawe abeye sonne edward bounde duety letter thus sent secretly ingland shewed kyng charles brother answered sayde fayre suster god ayde besyuesse shall auayle moche better take men subiectis nombre frendes haue wrytten consent wel voyage shall cause delyuered vnto golde syluer moche shall susfyce mater quene done moche prayer gyftes promysses many great lordis yong knyght accorde bryng great strength agayne inglande quene secretly coulde ordeyned voyage made puruey aunce coude nat secretly sir hewe spencer knowledge therof thought wynne withdrawe kyng fraunce fro great gyftes sent secret messangers fraunce great plentye golde syluer ryche jewelles specially kyng priue counsell dyd moche shorte space kyng frauce pryue counselle colde helpe quene voyage great desyre dohit kynge brake voyage defended euery parsone realme payne banysshyng none shuld hardy go quene brynge agayne ingland yet sayd ser hew spencer aduysed hym malyce bethought hym howe myght gette agayne quene inglande vnder kyngis daunger caused kyng wrytte holy father pope effectuously desyryng hym wolde sende wrytte kyng fraunce shulde sende quene wyfe agayne inglande wyll acquyte hymselfe god worlde nat faute departed fro hym wolde nothyng loue good faith suche ought holde mariage also ther lyke letter wrytten cardynals dyuysed many subtile wayes whiche maye nat wrytten also sent golde syluer great plenty dyuerse cardynalles prelate suche moost nereste secrettest pope ryght sage able ambassadours sente message ladde pope suche wyse theyr gyftes subtyle wayes wrote kynge fraunce peyne cursyng shulde sende suster isabell ingland kyng housbande letter brought kyng fra ce busshopp ainctes pope sent legation whan kyng redde letter caused shewed quene suster nat seen long space commaundyng hastely auoyde realme orels wolde cause auoyde shame p howe quene isabell departed fro fraunce entred empyre cap ix whan quene hard thys tidyngis knewe nat say aduyce take baron realme frauce withdrawen fro comaundement kyng frau ce comfort succoure onely dere cosyn ser robert de artoys secretly dyd counsaile comfort moche myght wyse durst nat kyng hadde defended hym knew well quene chased ingland also fraunce euyll wyll enuy whiche greued hym greatly thus syr robert de artoyes quenes commaun dement durste nat speke knowen therof hard kyng say swere euer spake hym quene suster shulde leese landis banysshed realme knewe secretly howe ye kyng mynde make suster taken edward sonne erle cane syr roger mortymer put theym handis kyng syr newe spencer wherfore came nyght declared quene aduysed parell ye quene greatly abasshed required hym pyng good counsaile sayd madame counsaile ye depart go empire ther many great lordes may ryght well ayde specially erle guillyam heynault syr john heynaulte brother two great lordes wise men true drad redoubted ennemies quene caused made redy purueyaunce payd euery thyng secretly myght sonne erle cane company departed paris rode warde heynaulte long rode came cambresys whan knewe empyre better assured passed cambresys entred ostrenaunt heynaulte lodged ambreticourt knight house called syr dambrycourte receyued ryght ioyously best maner power moche afterwarde quene inglande sonne hadde ingland euer knyght wyfe child auaunced dyuers maners comyng thus quene inglade sonne heyre cou trey heynaulte anon well knowen howse ye good erle heynault ualenciennes syr john heynault certified tyme whan quene arryued place syr dambrecourte whiche syr john brother sayde erle guillam yong lusty desiryng honoure mounted horse departed small company fro ualeciennes came nyght ambreticourt dyd quene honour reuerence coulde deuyse quene ryght sorowfull beganne declare complaynyng hym ryght pyteously dolour wherof sayd syr john great pitie water dashte yen sayd certaynly fayre lady beholde owne knyght shall nat fayle dye quarell shall ye best power conducte lorde sonne helpe brynge astatis inglande grace god helpe frendis party suche desyre shall put lyues goodes adueture sake shall gette men warre sufficient god pleased without dauger kyng fra ce brother quene wold haue kneled downe great ioye ye good wyll offred noble knyght toke vppe quyckly armes sayde grace god noble quene inglad shall nat knele dame recomforte yourselfe company shall kepe faithfull promyse ye shall go se erle brother countesse wyfe theyr fayre chyldren shall receyue great ioye harde theym reporte wold quenesayd syr fynde loue comforte worlde ye say affirme thake thousande tymes yf ye wyll ye haue promised courtesy honoure sonne shall euer bounde wyll put realme inglad abandon right shuld wordes whan accorded syr john heynaulte toke leue quene uyght went douaing laye abbeye mornynge masse lepte horse came agayn quene receyued hym great joye tyme dynedde redy mounte horse departe hym quene departed castell dambrety courte toke leue knyght lady thanked theyr good hadde made sayd trusted oones se tyme sonne shulde well remembre theyr courtesye thus departed quene company ye sayd syr john lorde beamont ryght ioyously dyd conducte ualencyenues agaynst came many burgess towne receyued right humbly thus brought erle guyllaume heynaulte receyued great ioye lyke wyse dyd coutesse wyfe feasted ryght nobly erle hadde foure layre doughters margaret philypp jane isabell amonge whome yong edwarde sette mo hi loue company phylypp also yong lady al honour conuers nt hym susters thus quene isabell abode ualencyennes ye space viii day good erle coutesse jane ualoys meane tyme quene aparailed needis besynesse said syr john wrote letter ryght effectuously vnto knyghtis suche companyans trusted best heynaulte brabant behaigne prayed amyties bitwene theym wolde god hym entreprise inglande great plentye one countrey content go hym loue sayd syr john heynaulte greatly reproued counsailed contrarye bothe erle brother chief counsaile countrey bycause semed theym entreprise ryght hygh parillouse seynge great discordis great hate bytwene barones inglande amonge selfe also consyderyng hemen commonly haue euer great enuy straungers therfore doubted sayd syr john heynaulte company shulde nat retourne agayne honour howeso euer blamed cousailed hym getle knyght wolde neuer chaunge purpose layd hadde one dethe dye whiche wyll god also sayd knyght ought ayd theyr power ladyes da mozels chased theyr owne countreys beyng without counsaile comfort phowe quene isabell arryued inglande syr john heynaulte company cap x thys syr john heynaulte moued courage made assembly prayed ye redy hale bredas hollander uchryghte daye lymytted quene juglande tooke leue erle heynault coutesse thanked theym greatly honour sea good chere hadde made kyssynge theym departynge thus lady departed hersonne company syr john heynaulte great peyne gatte leue brother sayng hym lorde brother yong thynke god hath pourueyed entrepryse myn aduancemet beleue thynke verely wrogfully synfully lady hath chased inglande also sone hit almes glory god worlde comforte helpe comfort specyally hyghe noble lady doughter kyng desceudyd royall kyng bloodde oures hadde rather renounce forsake haue go serue god ouer see neuer retourne countrey rather good lady shulde haue departed v withowte comforte helpe therfore dere brother suffre go yor good wyll wherin ye shall nobly shall hu bly thanke therof better therby shall accomplysshe voyage whan good erle heynaulte hadde harde brother parceued great desyre hadde entrepryse sawe hy myght tourne hym heyres great honoure sayd hym fayre brother god forbyd good purpose shulde broken lerte therfore name god gyue leue kyste hym ynge hym hande insygne great loue thus departed roode nyghte mounce heynnaulte quene inglande shulde make long processe dyd moche theyre journey came durdryght holande wher theyr specyall assembly made purueyed shyppys great small suche coulde get shypped horse harneys purueyaunce com ded selfe kepyng god toke theyr passage see copany knyghtis lordis fyrst syr john heynaulte lord beamond syr henry da g syr michell de ligne lorde gomeg syr parceualde semeries ser robert de syr saures de boussoit lorde ye lord pocelles ye lord uillers ye lord heyn lorde sars lorde boy lorde dabretycourte lorde syr oulpharte gustelle diuers knyghtis squyers great desyre serue theyr maister whan departed fro hauyn durdryght fayre flete quantite well ordred season fayre clere ryght temperate theyr departynge fyrsteflodde came dignes holande next day drewe vppe theyr sayles toke theyr waye costynge zelande theyr ententis haue taken land dongport coulde nat tempeste toke see put farre theyr course wist nat two dayes wher wer whiche god dyd great grace takyn lande porte thought ben loste fallen hand theyre ennemyes knew well theyr commyng aboode haue putte theym dethe hit ende two dayes tempest seased maryners parceyued lande inglande drewe parte right ioyously toke lande sandes withoute ryght hauyn orporte harwiche inglysshe cronicle sayth xxiiii daye septembre yere lorde ccc xxvi aboode sandes thre dayes lytle puruey aunce vitaylle vnshypped theyr horse harneys wist nat parte inglande power theyr frendis power theyr ennemies iiii day toke forth theyr way aduenture god saynt george suche people hadde suffred great disease colde nyght hunger great feare whereof nat clene ryd rode forth hylles dale ye done syde tyll laste founde vyllages great abbeye blacke monkes whiche called saint hamo wher iii dayes refresshed themselfe p howe quene inglande beseged kyng husbande towne bristo cap xi tidyng spred ye realme moche ye last came knowledge ye lordes quene called agayn ingland apparailed hast come edward herson wold haue theyr soueraigne lorde fyrste came gaue moost comforte henry erle lancastre wrye necke called torte colle brother thomas erle lancastre beheeddyd ye haue harde good knyght greatly recomended ye shall hystorye thys erle henry came quene great companye men warre hym came one parte erles barones knyghtys squiers moche people thought clene parelles alwayes encreased theyr power went forewarde toke counsell among shulde ryde streyght towne brystowe kyng hym spencer whiche good towne stronge well closed standyng good port see stronge castell see bettyng rounde therin kyng ser hewe spencer elder xc age syr hewe spencer sonne chieffe gouernour kyng counsayled hym euyll dedis also erle arundell wedded doughter syr hewe specer diuerse knyghtis squiers repayryng kyng courte quene companye lordes heynaulte erles baron inglisshemen toke right way ye said towne bristowe euery towne entred receyued great feast honour alwayes theyr people encreased longe rodeby theyr iourneys arryued brystowe besygedde towne rounde nere myght kyng syr hewe spencer yonger helde theym castelle olde syre hewe spencer erle arundell helde towne whan people towne sawe greate power quene moost inglande accorde parceued parell daunger euydentely toke counsell amonge theymselfe determyned wolde yelde vppe towne quene theyre lyues gooddys myghte sauyd soo sende treate quene counsell mattyer quene counselle wolde nat agree therto without myght wt syr hewe spencer erle arundell pleased whan people towne sawe coulde haue peace otherwise saue towne theyr gooddes theyr lyues distresse accorded quene opened gate quene ser john heynaulte barous knyghtis squyers entred towne toke theyr lodgyngys within many myght reside without sir hewe spencer erle rundel taken brought quene pleasure brought quene owne chyldren john hersonne two doughters whiche foud ther ye kepyng ye sayd syr hewe spencer wherof quene great ioye nat seue theym longe kyng myght haue great sorowe sir hewe spencer yonger fast inclosed stronge castell moost part realme turned quenes parte edward eldest sonne p howe yt syr hewe specer erle arundell iudged dethe cap xii whan quene baron company lodged theyr ease beseged castell nere myght quene caused syr hewe spe cer elder therle arudell brought forth edward sonne baron present sayde howe sonne shulbe take ryght lawe accordyng theyr desertis syr hewe spencer sayd dame god good iudge gyue good iudgement nat haue world praye god maye haue hit another stepte forth syr thomas wage good knyght marshall hoste ther openly recou ted dedis wrytynge tourned hym another auncient knyght entent shuld bryng hym case fanty declare shuld done suche parsones judgement shulde haue suche cause sayd knyght counsailed baron knyghtis reported theyr opynions whiche well deserued deth dyuers horryble dedis whiche haue commysed trespas rehersed iustifie trouth wherfore haue deserued dyuersyties theyr trespaces haue iudgement iii dyuers maners fyrst drawen heedded hanged jebet lyke wyse iubged done executed castell brystowe syght kyng syr hewe spencer yonger iudgement doone yere lorde ccc xxvi saynt denys day october execution kyng yong spe cer seyng theym selfe thus beseged myschief knewe comfort myght come mornyng betymes two smalle company entred lytle vessell behynde castell thynkyng haue fledde countrey walys xi dayes shyppe enforced saile moche myghte euer dydde wynde euery daye contrary wyll god euery daye oones twyse euer brought agayn within quartter myle castell last fortuned syr henry beamond son vicount beamond ingland entred barge certayne company hym spyed vessell rowed hym long shyp wherin kyng coulde nat flee fast fynally ouer takyn brought agayn towne bristow delyuered quene son prisoner thus befel high hardy entrepryse syr john heynault companye whan departed entred theyr shyppes durdright iii c armes thus theyr help lordes inglande quene isabell conquered agayne astate dignyte put vnto execucion ennemyes wher moost parte realme right joyouse withoute fewe parsones suche fauourable syr hewe spencer parte whan kyng sir hew spencer mere brought bristowe said sir henry beamond kyng sent cousell baron knyghtis strong castell barkeley put vnder good kepyng honest ther ordeined people astate aboute hym suche knewe ryght well ought doo straytly commaunded shulde wyse suffre hym passe ye castell ser hewe spe cer deliuerd ser thomas wage marshall host yt quene departed al host ward london whiche chief cite ingland ryd forth theyr iourneis ser thomas wage caused ser hewe specer fast boud ye best leuiest hors al ye host caused hym tabarte suche traytours theues wont thus led scorue quenes rout townes passed trumpes canayres hym greatter dispyte tyll laste came cite herford wher quene honorably receyued great solempnyte copany ther kept feast sayntis wt great royalte loue son straugers yt ther p howe syr hewe spencer put iudgement cap xiii whan feast done syr hewe spencer nothyng beloued brought forth quene lordes knyght ther hym wrytyng rehersed dedis ageynst whiche wold gyue maner answere iudged playn sentence fyrst drawen hyrdell trumpes trumpettis cite herford brought market place people assembled tyed hygh vpon ladder euery myght se hym place ther made great fier ther pryuy membres cut hym bycause reputed hym herety demed brent fyre face hart drawen body cast fyre bycause false traytour hart yt hys traytours cousell extorcio yt kyng shamed realme brought great myschief caused behedded greattest lordes realme realme ought haue ben susteyned defended enduced kyng wolde nat se quene wyfe edwarde eldest son caused hym chare realme fere theyr lyues heed stryken sent lodon accordyng iudgement executed quene lordes toke theyr way toward london dyd moche theyr iourneys arryued cite london cite great company mette dyd quene sonne great reuerence al theyr company thought best bestowed whan ben thus receyued feasted space xv dayes knyghtis straugers namely syr john heynaulte great desyre retourne agayn theyr owne countres thought well done theyr deuour achyued greathonour toke theyr leue quene lordes realme quene lordes requyred tary longer lytle space se shuld done kyng pryson straungers great desyre retourne theyr owne countreys praye theym contrarye auayled nat whan quene cousell saw yet desyred syr john heynaulte tary tyll past christmas retaygne hym suche company pleased hym best gentle knyght wold nat leue parfourme seruice courtesly graunted quene tary long pleased caused tary suche company coud get fewe remnaunt wold wyse tary wherof displeased whan quene counsell sawe wold nat abyde prayer made great chere feastis quene made gyuen plenty golde syluer theyr costis seruicis dyd gyue great jewelles eche accordyng theyr degree helde selfe ryght well content ouer syluer theyr horse suche wolde leue behynde theym theyre owne estymation without grudgyng thus syr john heynaulte aboode styll smalle company among englisshemen always dydde hym moche honoure coude ymagyn company lyke wyse dyd ladyes damozelles countre great plentye countess great ladyes gentle pucels come thither acompany quene semed well knyght ser john heynaulte well deserued chere feast made hym p coronacion kyng edwarth thyrde cap xiiii part company heynault departed ser john heynaulte lorde beamond taryed quene gaue leue people parte sauynge certayne noble knyghtis whiche kept styl sone counsell commaunded departed london next christmas determyned kepe open court promysed whan christmas come helde great court thyther came duke erles harous knyghtis noble realme prelate burgess good townes assemble abuysed ye realme coud nat long endure without h chief lord put wrytynge dediss kyng prison hadde done euyll counsell vsagess euyll behauyngis euyll gouerned realme whiche wa edd openly playn audience thentent noble sagis realme might take therof good aduyce fall acorde realme shuld gouerned thensforth whan case dedis kyng done cosented behauyng vsagis red wel vndest harone knyghtis al cousels realme drew aparte cou sell part accorded namely great lordes noble burgess good townes accordyng hard say knew selfe parte dedis wherfore cocluded suche man nat worthy kyng bere crowne roy haue name kyng accorded edward eldeste son ther present ryghful heyre shuld crowned kyng stede father wold take good counsell sage true hym realme thensforth myght better gouerned olde kyng father shuld well honestly kept long lyued accordyng astate thus agreed noble accomplysshed crowned crowne roy palaice westm beside london yong kyng edward iii bayes rightfortunate happy armes coronacion wa yere lorde ccc xxvi christymas day yong kyng age xvi held fest tyl couercion sayut paule folo wyng mean tyme greatly fested sir john heynaulte princis noble cou tre gyuen hym company many ryche jewel company great feast solas lordis ladyes taried tyll xii day ser john heynault hard tydyngis kyng bayghan erle heynault brother great plenty lordis frauce ordeyned conde great feast turney cryed wold sir john heynaulte longer abyde prayer great desire said tourney se erle brother lordis hys countrey specially ryght noble kyng large gentyll charles kyng bayghan wha ye yong kyng edward quene mother baros saw yt wold longer tary theyr request coude nat auaile gaue hym leue sore agaynst theyr wyls kyng cousell quene mother dyd gyue hym cccc markis ste lyng heritable hold hym fee payed euery yere towne bruges also dyd gyue philyp chastaulre chief esquyer soueraigne counsellour c marke rent yerely payed sayd place also delyuered hym moche money pay therwith costis hym company tyl come owne countre caused hym conducted many noble knyghtis douer ther delyuered hym passage free ladyes come ingland quene namely countesse garrenes suster erle hare dyuerse ladyes damozel ther gyuen many feyre ryche iewels theyr departyng whan ser john heynaulte departed fro ye yong kyng edward company wer come douer entred encontynet theyr shippes passe see entent come tymes sayd tourney ther wet hym xv yong lusty knyght ingland go tourney hym acqueynt straunge lordis knyght shuld ther great honour company turneyd tyme conde p howe kyng robert de breux scotland defyed kyng edward cap xv syr john heynault departed fro kyng edward quene mother gouerned realme counselle erle kent vncle kyng counsell syr roger mortymer great lades ingland sume vu c li rent yerely anisshed chased inglad quene ye haue hard also vsed moche ye cousell ser thomas wage aduyse reputed sagest realme ther hadd enuy therat whiche neuer dyed ingland also reigneth wyl reigne dyuers countres thus passed orth wynter lent season tyll easter kyng quene realme good peace season fortuned kyng robert scotland ben rygh hardy suffered moche trauaile agaynst inglisshmen ofte tymes ben chased discom eted tyme kyng edward fyrst graudfather yong kyng edward iii become olde auncient sicke sayd great euyll malady whan knewe thadu tures fallen ingland howe olde kyng edwarde ii taken deposed downe fro regalley crowne certayne cousellours behedded put distruction ye haue hard bethought hy yt wolde defye yonge kyng edward iii bicause yong baron realme nat one accorde said therfore better spede purpose conquere part ingland easter yere lorde ccc xxvii sent defyauce yong kyng edward iii realme sendyng worde howe wolde entre realme ingland brenne hym done tyme suche seson discomfeture castell estermelin inglisshmen receyued great damage whan kyng ingland counsell perceyued defyed caused knowe ouer realme commauded noble shuld redy appareled euery estate shulde ascen day next towne yorke standyng northward kyng sent moche people kepe fronters agaynst scotland sent great ambassade sir john heynault praying hym right effectuously wold helpe socour kepe company hym voiage agaynst scottis wold hym ascecion day nexte yorke suche company myght gette men warre party whan ser john heynaulte lorde beamonde hard kyngis desyre sent streyght letter messenger euery place thought recouer attaigne haue company men warre inflaunders heynaulte brabant place desyryng yt theyr best apparell warre wolde mete hym wysant go ouer see hym ingland suche sent vnto came hym glad chere dyuerse hard therof trust attaigne moche honour hym ingland voiage tyme sayd lorde beamond come wysant ther redy shyppes hym company brought ingland toke shyppyng passed ouer see arryued douer seased nat ryde tyll came within iii dayes penthecoste towne yorke wher kyng quene mother lordis great host taryeng comynge ofsir john heynaulte sent many theyr men armes archer comen people good townes villag people resorted caused loged ii iii leges alabout countre day thyther came sir john heynaulte company ryght welcome well receyued kyng quene mother baros delyuered sub barbes cite lodge sir john heynaulte delyuered abbey whyte monkes hym howsold ther came hym heynaulte ye lorde angiew called syr gualtier sir henry lorde dantoing lord saignoles sit fastres de rae sir robert de batlleul sir guilliam de bailleul brother lorde hauereth chasteleyne mon ser allard de brysnell ser mychell de ligne ser john de tigni yonger brother sir sawse de boussat lorde gomegines syr percyual de seuernes lorde byaurien lorde floien also countre flauders ther ser hector uilais sir de rodes ser umslart de guistell lorde trace sir guyssuyn de la muele dyuerse came thither countrey brahant lorde dufle syr tyrry uaucourt syr rasse de gres syr john de cassebegne syr john pylestre syr guyllaum de courterelless iii bretherne de harlebeque syr gualtier de hault bergue dyuers behaignons ther syr john de libeaur sir henry brother sir henry de la chapell syr hewe de hay syr john de limies syr lambert de dres sir guilbert de ca bresis artoys ther come certayn knyght theyr owne good wylles auauce theyr bodyes sir john heynaulte well company v c men armes well apparailed richely mounted feast penthecost came thyther syr guyllaume de juliers duke juliers dissease father sir henry tyrry branberque erle los ryghtfayre row kepe companye gentle knyght sir john heynaulte lorde beamont p discencion bitwene archer inglande themof heynaulte cap xvi gentle kyng inglad better fest strauge lordes company helde great courte trynite sonday ye frier wher queue mother lodged kepynge theyr house eche apart feast kyng hadde well v c knyghtis xv newe made quene well courte lx ladyes damozelles redy make feast chere sir john heynaulte companye myght haue seen great noble plety maner strauge vitaile ladyes damozelless fre shly apparayled redy haue daunced myght haue leue incontynent dyuer began great fraye bitwene gromes page straugers archer inglande lodged among said subbarbis anon archer assebled gether bowes droue straungers home theyr lodgyng part knyghtis maisters kyng courte soone harde tydyng fray eche drewe theyr owne lodgyng great hast suche myght entre suche coulde nat get great parell archer nombre iii shotte faste theyr arowes nat sparyng maisters varlettis thought supposed sraye begonne frendis spencer erle arundels put deth de counsell sir john heynaulte ye haue harde parauenture thought som reueged set discorde hoost inglysshemen hostes strau gers shoot fast doores wyndowes wolde nat suffre theym entre theyr lodgyngis howbeit gate backe syde quickly armed durst nat issue strete feare arowes straugers brake backe side brake downe pale hedge garden drewe certeyne playne place aboode company tyll last c aboue men armes many vnharnest suche coulde nat get theyr lodgyug whan assebled gether hasted go succoure theyr compaignyons defended theyr lodgyngis great strete went forth passed ye lodgyng lorde denghyen wher great gatis behynd openyng great strete archer ingland shot fersly howse ther many henaus hurte good knyght austre de rue syr john parceuall de meries syr sanse de boussac iii coulde nat entre theyr lodgyngis arme dyd valiantly though ben armed great leuers handis whiche founde carpenter yarde whiche gaue suche strokis men burst nat aproche iii bette downe day suche company mo lx great myghty knyght fynally archer fraye discomfetted put chase deed place well nombre ccc said busshopprike lyncoln itrowe god dyd neuer gyue grace fortune people dyd gentle knyght syr john heynaulte companye inghsshe archer intended none thyng murder robbe come serue kyng besynesse straugers neuer great parell season lay northey page missing euery man takyn place lodge ther al nyght lordes drewe aparte take counsaile howe myght fyght scottis consideryng countrey farre coulde vnderstande scottis went euer foreward burnyng wastyng countrey parceyued well howe coulde nat wyse feyght among mountaignes without great parell daunger sawe well also coulde nat ouertake thought scottis must n dis passe agayne riuer tyne home warde therfore determined great aduyce counsaile oste shulde remoue mydnyght make haste mornyng entent stoppe passage ryuer scottis wherby shulde aduysed force eyther fyght orels abyde styll inglande theyr great daunger losse conclusion oste accorded supped lodged well myght nyght euery man warned redy fyrst soundyng trumpette secunde blaste euery man arme hym without delaye iii euery man quyckely moute theyr horse drawe vnder owne sta dard baner euery man take hym one loste breede truste behynde hym horse also determined shulde leaue behynde theym theyr loose harneys maner cariagis purueyaunces thought surely feyght scottis next daye euer daunger thynkyng ieo de eyther wyn leese thus ordeyned accoplysshed mydnyght euery man redy apparailed fewe slepte lytle yet sore traualed daye great haste made well raunged batell day began appere auauced forward al hast moutaignes valeys rokkes many euyll passage without playn countrey hyest hylles playn valeys meruaylouse great marsh daungerous passage great meruaile moche people hadde nat ben lost roode euer styll forward neuer taried one another euer fel marsh moche peyne could gette ayde helpe theym agayne dyuerse place many lost specially horse cariag often tymes day cryed alarum said euer formost company oste wer fyghtyng ennemies hynder went ben true wherfore hasted theym ouer rokkis stone mountaygnes helme sheld redy apparailed fyght spere swerde redy hand wt tariyng father brother companyon whan thus ron forth often tymes day space halfe myle gyther towarde crye wenyng theyr ennemyes deceyued crye euer arose reysyng hartis hyndis sauage beastis seen forewarde whiche beastis made suche showtyng criyng came went ben fyghtyng theyr ennemies thus rode forth daye yonge kyng inglande moutaignes destis without fyndyng hygh way towne village wha ageynst nyght came ryuer tyne place scottis hadde passed ouer inglande wenyng muste nedis repasse agayne waye kyng inglande oste passed ouer riuer suche gydis moche peyne trauaile passage full great stone whan ouer lodged theym nyght ryuer syde tyme son goon reste fewe among axe hoke instrument cutte downe woodde make lodgyng withall many loste owne company wist nat footeme farre behynde wyst nat well way take suche knewe beste countrey sayd playnly hadde rydden daye xxiiii englysshe myles roode faste might without rest suche passage coulde nat chese nyght laye ryuer syde styll theyr harneys holdynge theyr horse theyr raynes theyr handts wyst nat wherunto tye thus theyr horse dyd eate meate nyght day nother ootes forage people oste sustenauce day nyght euery man loffe hadde caryed hynde hym whiche sore wette swette horse dranke none drynke water ryuer withowte lordis caryed botels wt fyer lyght nothyng make lyght withall without lordes torch brought great trouble dauger passed nyght armour still backis horse redy sadled whan day began appere whiche greatly de sired hole oste trusted synd redresse selfe horse orels fyght theyr ennemies whiche greatly desyred thentene deliuered great trauaile peyne endured day rayned faste ryuer passage waxen great rysen high noone ther myght none passe passage agayn wherfore could nat sede know haue forage lytter theyr horse brede drynke owne sustinaucis nyght fayne fast theyr horse nothyng leues tree herbes cut downe bowes tree wt theyr swerd tye withall horse make themselfe lodge noone poore folk countrey founde said howe xiiii myle newcastell vpon tyne xi myle fro carlyle towne nerer wheri might fynde thyng theym ease withall whan shewed kyng lord cousell incontinent sent thither horse sompters fetche then p ueyace crye kyngis name made towne newcastell euer wolde bryng brede wyne vitaile shulde payd therfore incontinent good price shulde conducted oste saue garde publisshed openly kyng oste wolde nat departe place tyll tydyng ennemies become next day noone suche bensent vitaile returned agayne oste suche purueyaucis coulde gette nat ouer moche came folkis coutrey lytle nagges charged brede euyll bakyn panyers smalle pere wyne barels vitaile sel oste wherby great part oste well refresshed eased thus cotinued day day space viii dayes abidyng eueryday retournyng agayn scott knew englissh ostelay tha knewe wer eche ignorat thus iii dayes iii nyghtis maner withowte brede wyne candel lyght oder forage maner purueyauce othe horse space iiii dayes lotte brede solde vi whiche worthe gallon wyne vi grootis worth vi yet suche rage famin eche toke vitailes others handis wherby rose diuers batels stryffes bitwene sondry companyos yet beside mischieffis neuer seased rayne hoole weeke wherby theyre saddels pannels countresyngles rottyn broke part horse hurt back nat wherwith shoo vnshodde nothyng couer selfe withall fro rayne colde grene busshes armour thyng make fyre withal grene bowes whiche wolde nat burne bicauof rayne great mischief weeke without heryng worde scottis vpon trust shuld repasse agayn theyr owne countreis way uere ther wherby great noyse murmour began ryse oste said layd others charge theyr counsaile kyng brought dau ger done betraye kyng ooste wherfore ordeyned kyng counsaile nexte mornyng shulde remoue ooste repasse agayne ryuer vii myle then wher myght passe ease cried oste euery shulde redy apparailed remoue nexte day tymes also crye made euer coulde bryng kyng certayne knowledge scott brought fyrst tydyng therof shuld haue labour c li lande hym heires euer made knyght kyngis hande whan crye made oste diuers englisshe knyghtis squiers nombre xv xvi couetyse wynnyng promyse passed ryuer great parell rode forth throughe mountaignes departed eche one takyng adue ture next mornyng oste dislodged rode fayre easely daye euyll apparailed dyd moche yt repassed agayn ryuer moche payn trauaile water depe bicause rayn fallen wherfore many dyd swym drowned whan alouer lodged oste ther founde forage medowes feldis lytle village whiche scott bret wh page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate past way nerte daye departed frothens paste ouer hyls dale day tyll noone founde village brent scottis champyon countrey corne medowes nyght ost lodged ther agayn iii day rode forth parte oste wist nat whiche way knewe nat countrey coulde tydyng scottis agayn day rode forth ilyke maner tyl houre iii came squyer fast tydyng toward kyng said like grace haue brought parfit tydyng scott ennemies surely within iii myle lodged great moutaine abidyng ther ther haue ben viii dayes knewe tidyngis ye dyd ser shew trouth aproched nere takyn prisoner brought lordes oste shewed tydyngis ye seke ent haue batell lordis dyd quyt rausom prison whan shewed howe grace promised c li sterlyng rent hym brought fyrst tydyng made promise yt shuld nat rest tyll shewed thys tydyngys sayde great desyre fyght ye theym ther shall ye fynde without faulte soone kyng harde tidynges assembled ooste fayre medowe pasture theyr horse besidis ther lytle abbey whiche brent called dayes kyng arthur le blanche land ther kyng confessed hym euery man made hym redy kyng caused many mass song howsell suche deuotion therto incontyuent assigned c li sterlyng rent squier brought hym tidyng scottis accordyng pmyse made hym knyght owne handis oste whan well rested takyn repaste
