compet sounded horse euery man mou ted baners stander folowed thys new made knyght euery batell itselfe good order moutaignes dale raynged well myght euer redy apparailed fyght roode made suche hast noone nere scottys eche theym myghte clerely se soone scottis sawe theym issued owte theyre lodge foote ordeyned iii great batelles auaylynge hyll foote thys mountaygne ranne great ryuer full great rockes stone none myght passe ouer withowte greate daunger ieopardye though englisshmen hadde passed ouer ryuer yet place rowme bytwene hylle ryuer sette batayle good order scottis hadde stablysshed two fyrste batelles two corner mountaigne ioynyng rockes none myght well mounte vpon hyll assayle theym scottis euer redy beate stone assaylantis passed ryuer whan lordes inglande sawe behauyng maner scottis made people lyght foote put theyr spurris araynged iii great batelles hadde done made many newe knyghtis whan theyr batelles sette good order lordes inglande brought theyr yong kyng horse backe batelles oste entent gyue therby courage people whiche kyng full goodly maner prayed requyred theym ryght graciously euery man wolde peyne theym theyr beste saue honour common weale realme comauded vpo peyne deth none shulde go marshas baners breke theyr arraye without commaunded kyng comaunded shulde aduaunce towarde ennemyes fayre easely dyd euery batell went forth good array order great space groude discendyng mountaygne scottis englisshe oste dyd thentent se ennemies wolde breke felde nat se wolde could nat parceyue remoue wise wer nere guyther myght knowe eche others armes oste stode styll take counsell oste mounted good horse rode forth skrymysshe theym beholde passage ryuer se countynaunce theyre ennemyes nerer harauldis armes sent scottis gyuyng knowledge wolde come passe ryuer fight playn felde wolde drawe backe fro ryuer gyue theym sufficient place araynge theyr batelles eyther day orels next wold chose selfe orels lette lyke wyse wolde come ouer whan scottis harde toke counsell among theymselfe anon answerd harauld mold nother ouenor sayd syrs yor kyng lordisse well realme haue br nt wasted countrey haue passed displeased ther lette amend whan wyll wyll abyde long shall please v soone kyng ingland hard answere hit incontynent cryed oste shuld lodge nyght without reculyug backe oste lodged nyght moche peyne hard ground stone alwayes styll armed stak roddis tye withall horse forage husshe make withall tyre whan thus lodged scottis caused theyre people kepe styll felde ordeyned batelles remnant went lodgyng made suche fyers merueile beholde bitwene day nyght made amerueilus great brute wt blowyng horne one semed proprely deuelles hell ben thus two ostis lodged nyght whiche saynte peter nyght begynnyng auguste yere oure lorde ccc xxvii nexte mornynge lordes inglande harde masse rayngen agayne theyre batelles hadde done daye scottis lyke myse ordred ther batelles thus ottis stoode styll batell tyll noone scottis made neuer semblaunt come englysshe oste fyght theym lyke wyse englisshe men coulde nat aproche g ther withowte great dammage dyuerse compaignyons horse backe passed ryuer foote skrymyss e scottis like wyse scott brake oute skrymysshed dyuerse bothe partyes slayne wounded takyn prysoners noone paste lordes juglande commaunded euery man drawe theyr lodgyng sawe well scottis wolde nat fyght theym like maner thus dyd iii dayes gyther scottis lyke case kepte styll theyr mountaygnes howe skrymysshynge bothe partyes dyuerse slayne prysoners takyn euery nyght scottis made great fyres great brute showttyng blowyng horne entencion englylshe men holde scottis mauer beseged coulde nat fyghte theym thynkyng haue famysshed theym englysshe men knewe well suche prysoners hadde takyn scottis hadde nother bredde wyne norsalte purueyaunce saue beastis great plentye whyche hadde takyn countrey myght eate pleasure without bredde whiche euyll dyette lacked oten meale make cake withall sayde whyche dyet englisshe men vsed whan haddenede specially borderer whan make rodes scotlande mornyng iiii day englyssh men loked moutaigne wher scottis coulde se creature scottis depted mydnyght sent men horse backe afoote ouer ryuer knowe become noone founde theym lodged another mountaigne stronger ryuer syde great wodde one syde goo come secretly whan lyst incontynent englysshe oste dislodged brewe parte batelled good order lo ed theym another hyll ageynst scottis raynged theyr batelles made semblant haue come scottis issued lodge set theyr batels along ryuersyde ageynst wold neuer come toward englisshe oste englisshmen could nat go wout wold haue ben slayn take auautage thus lodged eche cust space xviii day often tymes kyng inglad sent harauldis armes offeryng yt wolde fyght hym wolde gyue place sufficient playn groude pytche theyr felde elles lette theym gyue hym rowme place assured theym wolde come ouer ryuer fyght wt theym scottis wolde neuer agree thus oostis suffered moche payne trauayle space laye nere gyther fyrst nyght englisshe thus lodged secund moutaigne lorde willyam duglas toke hym aboute cc men armes past ryuer farre fro oste nat parceyued sode ly brake englysshe ooste mydnyght criyng duglas duglas ye shall dpe theues juglande slewe sea ccc men beddis skant redy strake horse spurres came kyngis owne tent alwayes criyng duglas strake sundre ii iii cordis kyng tent departed retret lost men returned agayn scott done euery nyght englisshe oste made good sure watche doubted makyng skryes euer part oste laye harneys euery day ther skrymysshes made men slayne party conclusion last daye xxiiii ther scottisshe knyght taky ageynst wyll shewed lordes ingland state condition scott sore examyned feare lyfe shewed howe lordes scotlad accorded among selfe nyght euery man shuld redy armed folowe baners lorde wyllyam duglas euery kepe hym secrete knyght could nat shewe entended lordis ingland drewe cou saile ther thought amog scottis myght nyght tyme come assaile oste sydes aduenture themselfe lyue dye coulde endure longer famyne among theym englysshe lordes ordeyned iii batels stode iii party without lodgyngis made great fyers therby se better caused page kepe theyr lodgyngis horse thus stode styll yt nyght armed euery man vnder owne sta dard baner brekyng daye ii trompettis scotland mette englisshe scout watche toke trompettis brought kyng ingland consaile said openly sir ye watche ye lese tyme ieopardye heedis scottis gone departed mydnyght lest tyme iii iiii myle theyr way left v ii behynd thentent shulde shewe englisshe lordes said foly folowe scottis sawe well coulde nat ouer take theym yet doubte disceyuyng kept styll two trompettis pryuely caused batailes stande styll araynged tyll nere prime p whan sawe trouth scottis departed euery man leaue retraye lodgyng lordes toke counsaile determyn shulde best meane tyme dyuerse inglisshe oste mounted horse passed ouer ryuer came mountaigne scottis ben ther founde mo v c great bestis redy slayne bicause scottis coulde nat dryue theyr ooste bicause englisshe men shulde haue small profit also ther found ccc caudrons made best skynnes heare styll strayned stake ouer fyre full water full offlesshe sodden mo spytt full flesshe rosted mo x olde shoos made rawe lether heare styll whiche scottis left behynd also founde v poore englysshemen prisoner bounde faste certayne tree legges broken tha losed let go returned agayn tyme al oste dislodged ordeyned kyng aduyce counsaile hole oste shulde folowe marshal baners drawe homeward ingland dyd last came fayre medow foud forage sufficient horse cariagis wherof great nede nigh feble shulde haue ben great peyne haue goon forther englisshe cronicle sayth scottis ben fought syr roger mortymer lorde inglande nat betraied kyng toke mede money scottis thentent myght departe pryuely nyght vnfoughte hit maye seen playnely englisshe cronycle diuers mater whiche passe ouer tyme folowe myn auctour nexte day oste dislodged agayne went forth abowte noone came great abbey two myle fro cite durham kyng lodged oste feldis founde forage sufficient theym selfe theyr horse nexte day oste lay styll kyng went cite durham se churche offered cite euery man founde owne cariagis whyche hadde lefte xxxii dayes wodde mydnyght whan folowed scottis syrst hath benshewed burgess people durham founde broughte theym theyr towne theyre owne costis chargis cariag sette voyde grange barnes saue garde euery mannes cariage owne cognisauce armes wherby euery myght knowe owne lordes genty lme gladde whan thus founde cariages thus abonde two dayes cite durham oste rounde coulde nat lodge within cite theyr horse newe shoode toke theyr way cite yorke iii dayes came thither ther kyng foude quene mother receyued hym great ioye dyd ladyes damozelles burgess c mon citie kyng gaue lycence maner people euery man drawe home arde theyr owne countreys kyng thanked greatly erles barones knyght theyr good cou saile done hym hys io ney retayned styll hym ser john heynaulte company greatly feasted quene ladyes knyghtis straugers hys company made byll horse suche stuffe lost iourney delyuered kyngis counsaile euery man itselfe truste kyngis promyse ser john heynaulte lorde beamont boude hymselfe company shulde content euery thyng coprised theyr owne bils within shortspace kyng counsaile coulde nar soone recouer golde syluer content desyres delyuered sufficient reason pay small charge bryng home withal theyr owne countreis anon within yere payd euery thyng could desyre heynnaulte bought lytle agges ryde theyr case theyr lackett pagis harneys baggage water ii shippes deliuered whiche shyppes theyr arryued sluce flaundders syr john heynnaulte companye toke theyr leue kyng olde quene erle kent erle lancastre barones greatly dyd honour theym kyng caused xii knightis cc men armes copany doubt archer inglad whome nat well assured muste needis passe busshopryke lincoln thus departed si john heynaulte rowte conduct knyghtis rode long theyr iourney came douer ther entred see ishippis vessel founde redy ther apparayled adlist knyghtis veparted fro then retourned owne house henous arriued wysant ther soiourned ii bayes makyng redy theyr horse harneys mean tyme ser john heynault company rode pylgrimage lady bollayn returned heynaulte depted eche fro owne howses countres ser john heynaulte rode therle brother ualenciennes receyued hym ioyously greatly loued hym recounted tydyng ye haue hard p howe kyng edward maryed lady philyp heynaulte cap xix hit nat long kyng quene mother therle kent vncle therle lancastre sir roger mortymer barones inglande aduyce kyngis counsaile sent busshop ii knyghtis banerettis ii notable clerk ser john heynault pray enghym mean theyr lord yong kyng ingland myght haue mariage one eric boughts heynault brother named phylyp kyng noble realme rather haue lady loue hym ser john heynault lord beamont feasted honored greatly ambassadours brough ualencienes therle brother honorably receued made suche chere yt ouer long reherse whan shewed content theyr message therle said sir thake greatly kyng prince quene mother lordes ingland syth haue sent suche sufficient sonages ye suche honor treat mariage whiche request well agreed holy father pope wyll cosent therto whiche answer ambassadours right well cotet tha sent ii knyght ii clerk incotinent pope auygnon purchase dispesation mariage without pope licere might nat marie ye linage frace nere kyn iii degree ii mother cosyn jermayns issued ii brethern whan ambasadors coe pope request consideratios well hard holy father pope hole colledge consentyd mariage feasted departed came agayne ualenciennes buls mariage concluded affirmed bothe party deuysed purueied theyr apparaile thyng honorable belonged suche lady shuld quene inglande princesse maryed sufficient procuration brought fro kyng inglande al feast triumphes done thys yonge quene entred see wysant arryued copany douer john heynaulte lorde beamont vncle dyd co duct cite london made great feast many noble ingland quene crowned also great iustes tourney daunsyng carolyng great feastis euery day whiche enduced space iii weekis englisshe cronicle saith mariage coronation quene done yorke moche honour sunday euyn couersion saynt paule ye yere lorde ccc xxvii whiche cronicle shewyd many thynges rulynge realme deth kyng edwarde carnaruan dyuerse debate within realme cronicle playnly hit appereth whiche auctor boke speketh worde b cause auenture knew nat hard strager knowe thyngis accordyng wrytyng yong quene philyp aboode styll inglande company sone owne cou tre sauyng one named wandelet manny aboode styll quene karuer dyd many great prowess dyuerse place harde make mencion p howe kyng robert scotland dyed cap xx whan scottis departed nyght mountaigne kyng ingland hadde beseged theym ye haue harde went xxii myle throughe sauage countrey without restyng passed riuer yne right nere carlyle ye next day went theyr owne lande departed euery man owne mansion within space af peace purchased bitwene kyngis ingland scotland englysshe cronicle sayth done speciall counsell olde quene ser roger mortymer theyr meanes plyament holden north hampton ye whiche kyng within age grauted scottis release feaulties homage ought haue done crowne inglande charter en aled also delyuered scottis endenture whiche called ragmon wherin co teyned homage feaulties kyng scottis prelatis erles barones scotlande ought haue done crowne inglande sealed sealis rightis sondry barones knyghtis ought haue hadde realme scotlan also delyuered agayn blacke crosse scotland whiche good kyng edwarde conquered brought abbey scoue whiche precious relique rightis enteresses euery baron scotlande clene forgyuen many thyngis done parlyament great hurt preiudice realme ingland maner ageynst wyls noble realme saue onely isabell olde quene busshop ely lord mortymer ruled realme suche wyse euery man myscontent yt erle henry lancastre syr thomas brotherton erle marshall syr edmund wodstocke kyng vncles dyuerse lordes comons agreed gether amende faultes myght meane tyme quene isabell syr roger mortym caused nother parliament holden salysbury whiche parliament roger mortymer made erle marche ageynst ye baros wyls inglad preiudice ye kyng realme sir john eltham ye kyngis brother made erle cornewal whiche liamet henry lacastre wold come wherfore kynge broughte beleue wold haue distroyed parson whiche assembled great hoste went ward bedforde erle henry companye erle marshall therle kent kyngis brother made peace bitwene kyng ye erle lacastre whose part henry lorde beamont syr fowke fitzwayn thomas rocellin ser willia trussell syr thomas wyther abowte c knyghtis exyled inglande counsaile quene isabell erle mortym couetous yt thought haue part landis owne handis playnly shewen ye inglisshe cronicle whiche passe ouer folowe myn auctour forsaid peace whiche purchased bitwene ingland scotlad endure iii yere meane tyme fortuned kyng robert scotland right sore aged feble greatly charged great sickenes ther way hym deth whan felte ende drew nere sent suche barones lordis realme trusted best shewed remedy hym must nedis leue transetory lyfe comau dyng faith trouth yt owed hym truly kepe realme ayde ye yong prince dauid sonne whan wer age shulde obey hym crowne hym kyng mary hym suche place couenient astate called hym gentle knyght sir william duglas sayde lordes sir william dere fred ye knowe well haue moche dayes vphold susteyne ryght realme wha made solemne vow whiche yet haue nat accomplysshed wherof right sory whiche myght acheue make ende al warres myght one haue brought realme rest peace promysed mynd haue gone warred christis ennemies aduersaries holy christen faith purpose myn hart hath euer eate ded lorde wolde nat co sent therto haue muche dayes nowe last entreprise haue takyn suche malady nat escape syth yt body nat go acheue yt hart desireth wyll sende hart instede body accomplyhssmyn auowe bycause knowe nat realme knyght valyaunt ye body well furnysshed accoplysshemyn avowe stede selfe therfore qui myn owne dere aspeciall frede ye wyll take voiage loue acquite soule agaynst lord god trust moche noblenes trouth ye wyll take doubte nat ye shall achyue shall dye ease quiete done suche maner shall declare vnto woll yt soone trepassed worlde ye take harte owte body enbawme take treasoure ye shall thynke sufficient entreprise yor selfe suche company ye wyll take present hart holy pulchre lorde laye seyng body nat come take suche company purueyaunce shalbe aparteyuyng astate euer ye come let knowen howe ye cary harte kyng robert scotland instauce desire psented holy sepulchre tha lordes harde wordes wept pitie whan knyght syr william duglas myght speke wepyng sayd gentle noble kyng c tymes thanke grace great honour ye sith noble great treasure ye gyue charge syr shall glad harte ye haue comauded best true power howe nat worthy sufficient achyue suche noble entreprise kyng sayd getle knyght thake ye wyl promyse syr sayd knyght shall vndoubtedly faythe owe god ordre knyghthodde thanke sayd kyng nowe shall dy ease mynde sith knowe yt worthy sufficient knyght realme shall achyue whiche coulde neuer atteyne vnto thus soone thys noble robert de bruse kyng scotland passed vncertayne worlde hys hart taken body enbaumed honorably entred abbey donfremlyn yere lord god ccc xxvii vii day moneth nouembre whan spryngyng tyme began ser william duglas purueied hym whiche aparteyned entreprise toke ship port morais scotlande sailed flanders shluce tydyng knowe noble man coutrey wolde go jerusalem thetent haue copany lay styll sluce ye space xii day departed wold neuer come alande kept styll shyp kept alwaies port behauour great tryumphe trumpettis clarion though ben kyng scott hym selfe companye knyght baneret vii knyghtis realme scotland xxvi yong squiers gentylme er ue hym vessell golde siluer pott basons ewer dysshes flagon barels cuppes thyngis suche wolde come se hym well serued two maner wynes dyuerse maner spice maner people accordyng degres whan thus taryed space xii dayes hard reported yt alphons kyng spaigne made warre ageynst sarazyn kyng granade tha thought draw partie thynkyng suerely could nat bestowe tyme nobly tha warre ayenst goddis ennemies entreprise done tha thought go forth jerusale acheue charged departed toke se ward spaigne arryued ye port ualen great streight kyng spaigne helde hoste ageynst kyng granade sarazyn nere gether fronters lande within knyght syr willia duglas come ye kyng spaigne day kyng issued felde aproche nere ennemies ye kyng granade issued like wyse part eche kyng myght se wt al baners displayed arenged batels eche ageynst william duglas drewe one syde company entent shewe prowes better whan saw batels thus ranged party sawe ye bataile ye kyng spaigne began somewhat aduaunce towarde ennemies thought verelye shulde soone asseble gether fyght hande stroke thought rather formest hyndemoost strake horse spurres al company also dashte batelle kyng granade criynge duglas duglas wenyng hym kyng spaigne host folowed dyd nat wherfore disceyued spaignyss host stode styll gentle knyght enclosed company sarazyns dyd meruelles armes fynally coulde nat endure company slayne whiche great damage ye spaynyardis wolde nat rescue p also season certayn lordes treated peace bitwene inglad scotlande last mariage made solempnised bitwene yong kyng scotland dame johan towre suster kyng edward ingland berwyke inglisshe cronicle saith mary maud ly day yere lord iii c xxviii agaynst assente many noble realme quene isabell kyng mother erle mortymer made mariage ye whiche myn auctor saith great feast made bothe party p howe phylypp ualoys crowned kyng fraunce cap xxi kyng charles fraunce sone fayre kyng phylyp iii tymes maried yet dyed without issue male first wyues one fayrest ladyes world doughter erle artoys howe kept euyll sacramet matrimony brake wedloke wherfore kept long space pryson castell gaylarde husband made kyng whan realme fra ce fallen hym crowned assent xii dowsepiers fraunce tha bicause wold nat realme frace shulde belong without heyre male aduysed counsell kyng shulde remaryed agayne doughter emperour henry lucenbourg suster gentle kyng bayhaigne wherby first mariage kyng fordoone bytwene hym wyfe prison licece declaracyon ye pope ii wyfe ryght humble noble wyse lady kyng sone dyed yong age quene also issodnii berrey dyed suspeciously wherfore dyuers parsones put blame priuely kyng charles maried agayn iii tyme doughter vncle ye lorde loyes erle dewreux suster kyng nauerre named quene johan tyme space lady childe meane tyme kyng charles husband fell sycke lay downe dethe bedde whan sawe waye hym deth deuised fortuned quene delyuered sonne wolde lorde phylyp ualoys shulde gouernour regent hys realme tyll sonne come suche age myght crowned kyng fortune ye quene haue doughter wold xii pier fraunce shulde take aduyse counsell forther ordering realme shuld gyue realme regally hym moost ryght therto within whyle ye kynge charles dyed ester yere lorde ccc xxviii within short space quene delyuerd doughter peres fraunce asse bled counsell togyder parys shortly might conueniently gaue ye realme comen acorde sir phylippe ualoys put clene quene isabell englande kynge edwarde sonne suster germayne king charles last deed opynion noble fraunce sayed maynteyned realme fraunce great noble ought nat successyon fall woman hande thus crowned kyng france philypp ualoys raygnes trinyte sonday next anone somoned barownes men war went withall power towne cassell layd eg therto makyng war agaynst emmynges rebelledde agaynst owne lorde namely bruges ippre franke wolde nat obey therle flau ders chased hym owne countrey might nat abyde partie therof onely gaunt scantly ther flemynges xvi thousande capytayne called colen anequyn hardy man couragious made grayson cassell wage dyuerse townes flaunders thentent kepe fronters ye shall howe flemmynges dysconfeted owne outrage p batell cassell flau ders cap xxii day garyson cassell departed thentent haue dysconfyted ye kyng hoost came priuely without noyse thre batels well ordred wherof first batayle toke way kynges tentes fayre grace kynge natben taken souper company thought nothyng batayle toke streyght way tentes kynge behaygne maner founde hym lyke case thirde batayle went tentes therle heynault likrwyse nere take hym hoostes cae peasably tentes moch payne thoost coude arme wherby lordes people ben slayne grace god nat ben maner myracle god lordes dysconfyted iii batayls eche batayle selfe one hour wyse vi thousande flemmynges ther ascaped neuer person captayns slayne kyng lordes frace knewe nat one hadde done tyll finyss edd atchyued lay thre sondrie party one fro flemynges nat one left lyue lay deed hepes one vpon sayed thre sondrie place done saynt bartylmewes day yere lorde ccc xxviii french men entred towne cassell set vp baners frauce towne yelded kyng also towne pyepigne ipre castlayne bergues receyued therle loys lorde sware hym faythe loyaltie foreuer kynge people departed went parys moche honoured praysed enterprise ayd done cosyn lois erle flauders thus kyng great prosperite euery day encresed ryall estat sayd ther neuer kyng frauce helde like estat dyd kyng philyp ualoys p howe erle kent erle mortymer englande put deth cap xxiii yong kyng edwarde englande gouerned great space ye haue harde cousell quene mother edmonde wodstoke erle ket vncle sir roger mortymer erle march ye last enuy began growe bytwene therle kent therle mortym moch yt erle mortim enformed yong kyng cosentyng tholde quene isabell mother beryng ye kyng hande therle kent wolde haue enpoysoned hym thentent kynge hymselfe nexte heyre apparaunt crowne kynges yonger brother called john gaunt newly deed kyng gaue lyght credence theym causedde vncle erle kent taken openly beheeded without maner excuse harde wherwith many noble realme wer sore troubled bare gruge hertes towarde erle mortymer accordyng thenglysshe cronycle therle suffred dethe atte wynchester tenth day octobre thirde yere kynges raygne lyeth buryed frier winchestre myne auctour sayeth within whyle reported quene isabell kyng mother wt chylde therle mortymer wherof ye kyng enfourmed sayd mortym caused put deth therle kent vncle without good reason cause realme reputed hym noble man thanne kynges commaundement erle mortymer takene brought london byfore great lordes noble realme recyted open declaratyon ye dedes sayd mortymer kynge demaunded counsell shuld done hym lordes commen assent gaue iudgement sayed syr hath deserued dye sa ethe sir hewe spenser dyed iudgement delacyon sufferaunce mercy incotynent drawen throughout london set scaffolde membres cut hym cast fyre hert also bycause ymagined treason thanne quartered quarter sent foure best cyties realme heed remayned styll london within lytle space kyng commaunded thaduyce counsell yt quene mother shulde kept close castell doe ladyes damosel knyghtes squiers serue acordyng estat certayne lades assigned metayne ther noble estat dayes lyfe wyse shulde nat det castell wt tose suche sportes somtyme shewed byfore castell gate recreatyon thus lady ledde forth lyfe ther mekely one twyse yere kyng son wolde coe se thenglysshe cronycle sheweth dyuerse consyderations therle mortym suffred deth saynt andrewes euyn yere lorde thousande thre hundred xxix whiche passe ouer folowe myne authoure p thomage kyng edwarde englande dydde kynge fraunce duchye guyen cap xxiiii king doe two execucyos toke newe counselours moost noblest sagest son realme yere yt phylip ualoys crowned kyng france barones noble realme made homage fealty except yong king england nat done homage duchy guyen also nat somoned therto ye king france thaduise counsell sent ouer englande lorde auycenis lorde beausalt two table clerkes maisters parlyament parys named maister peter orlyaunce maister peter masieres iiii deted fro paris dyd somoch iourneis yt cae wysant ther toke see aryued douer ther taryed day abyde vnshypping horse bagages tha rode forth long cae wynsore kyng yong quene england lay foure caused knowen kynge occasyon commyng kyng englande honoure french kyng cosyn caused coe presence receyued houourably publysshed message ye kyng answered noble realme counsell nat hym desyred drawe lodon ther shulde answered wyse reason shulde content dyned kynges chambre departed lay nyght colbroke yt next day london nat long kynge came palace westmynster counsell comaunded ther certayne day lymited whan assembled frenche embassadours sent declared thoccasyon comynge delyuered letter fro maister thanne kynge went parte counsell take aduyse best hym thanne aduysed counsell shulde answered thordynaunce style predecessours bysshopp london frechmen wer called counsell chambre bysshop london sayd lordes asse bled kyng fraunce kyng grace soueraygne lorde hath harde wordes redde tenour letter syrs say vnto woll counsell kyng soueraygne lorde present go fraunce se kynge maister dere cosyn right amyably hath sent hym touchyng faith anohomage shall deuour euery thynge ought ryght syrs ye may shewe ye kyng yor maister within short space kyng englande maister shall arryue france reason shall requyre tha messangers feasted kynge rewarded many great gyftes iuelles toke leaue dyd somoche last came parys wher found kyng phylyppe whome recounted newes wherof king right ioyouse specially se kyng englande cosyn hadde neuer sene hym whan tidynges spredde abrode realm fraunce duke erles lordes aparelled best maner kyng frauce wrot letter kyng charles behaygne cosyn kynge nauarre certifyeng theym day tyme whan kyng england shuld hym desyringe hym day came thyder gret array counselled kynge fraunce shulde receyue kyng englande cyte amyas make prouysion commyng chamber halle hoste ries lodgynges made redy apparelled receyue company also duke burgoyne duke burbon duke lurren syr john artoyes purueyaunce thousande horse sixe hundred horse shulde come kyng englande yonge kyng englande forgate nat voyage fraunce aparelled hym company well sufficiently departed englande co pany two bysshoppes besyde bysshoppe london foure erles lorde henry erle derby cosyngermayne sonne ser thomas erle lancastre wrie necke erle salis bury therle warwyke erle hereforde vt barownes lorde raynolde cobham lorde thomas wage marshall englande lorde persy lorde many lorde mowbray mo xl knyghtes kyng co pany thousand horse kyng two dayes passing bytwene douer wysant kyng company rod bullayne taryed one day myddes august yere lorde god thousande thre hundred xxix none tidynges came kyng phylip fraunce howe kynge englande bullayne kynge fraunce sent constable great plentie knyghtes kynge englande thanne monsternell seesyde ther gret token loue good chere made bothe party thane kynge englande rodde forth withall rowt company constable fraunce rodde long came cytie amyas wher kyng phylippe kynge behaygne kynge mayllorgues kynge nauarre redy aparelled receyue kynge englande many duke erles great barownes xii peres fraunce redy feast make chere kynge englande peasably bere wytnesse kynge englandes homage ther kyng englande nobly receyued thus kynges prince taryed amyas space xv dayes meane tyme many wordes ordynaunces deuysed farr coude knowe kyng edwarde englad made homage kynge fraunce onely worde nat puttyng hades bytwene kynge fraunce handes none prince prelate lymitted hym kynge englande wolde nat procede farther doyng concernyng homage rather detmyned returne agayne englande redde openly priuyleges auncyent tyme graunted declared maner kynge shulde homage howe wyse shulde seruyce kynge fraunce kynge fraunce sayd cosyn woll nat disceyue ye haue done pleaseth v rightwell present tyme tyll tyme ye returned agayne realme ye haue sene vnder seales predecessoures howe wyse ye shulde thus kynge englande tooke leaue departed fro kynge fraunce ryght amyably prince retourned agayne englande laboured longe came wyndesor quene receyued hym right ioyously demaunded tidynges kynge phylippe vncle linage frauce kyng shewed knewe gret chere honour sayd mynde realme coude compared ye realme fraunce within space kyng fraunce sent englande specyall counsell bysshoppe chartres bysshoppe beannays lorde loys cleremont duke burbon therle harcourt therle tankermylle dyuers knyghtes clerkes ye counsell englande holden london parfourmaunce kyng englandes homage ye haue harde also kyng england counsell well ouersene maner fourme auncyent predecessours done homage duchy acquitayne many englande murmured sayd kyng lorde nerer true succession herytage crowne fraunce phylippe ualoys kyng fraunce kyng cousell wolde nat knowe speke therof tyme thus ther great assemble moch homage shulde parfourmed embassadours taryed styll england wynter tyll moneth may folowyng aunswere dyffinatyue finally kynge englande aduyce counsell syght priuyleges vnto gaue great fayth determyned write letter maner patentes sealed great seale knowle gyng therin homage ought kyng fraunce tenour report letter patentes foloweth edward grace god kyng england lorde ireland duke acquitayne present letter shall se send gretyng wold knowen made homage amyas ye right excellent prince right dere cosyn phylyppe kyng fraunce requyred hym shuld knowledge sayd homage make hym expresly promysinge bere hym fayth trouth dyd nat cause nat enfourmed trouth made hym homage generall wordes sayeng entred homage lyke maner predecessours duke guyen tymes past entred thomage kyng frauce tyme beyng syth tyme haue ben well enfourmed trouth therfore knowlege presentes homage haue made cyte amyas kyng fraunce generall wordes ought vnderstande worde lyege man hym owe bere faith trouth duke acquitayne pere fraunce erle poyters mutterell thentent tyme comynge yt shulde neuer dyscorde cause promyse v successours duk acquitayne homage made maner folowyng kyng englande duke acquitayne holdeth handes bytwene handes kyng frauce shall addresse wordes kynge englande duke acquitayne shall speke kyng fraunce maner yeshall become lyege man kynge lorde present duke guyen pere fraunce hym promyse bere faythe trouthe say ye kyng englande duke guyen successours sayth ye kyng frauce receyueth kyng englande duke guyen sayd homage lyege man wt faythe trouth spoken mouth sauyng ryght furthermore whan sayd kyng entreth homage kyng frauce therldome poyters muttrell shall put handes bytwene handes kyng fraunce sayd erldome shall speke kynge fraunce shall addresse wordes kynge erle say thus ye shall become liege man kyng frauce lorde present erle poyters muttrell hym myse bere fayth trouth say ye kyng erle poyters sayth ye kyng frauce receyueth kyng erle sayd homage fayth mouth sauyng ryght maner shalbe done renewed often homage shulde done shall delyuer successours duke guyen sayd homage made letter patentes sealed great seale kynge frauce requyre besyde promyse good faythe holde kepe effectuously peace co corde made bytwene kynges frauce kynges englande duke guyen c letter lordes fraunce brought kyng lorde kyng caused kept chauncery p howe lorde syr ubert artoyse chased realme fraunce cap xxv man world ayded kyng philyppe attayne crowne fraunce syr robert erle artoyse done sagelt great teste lordes fraunce hygh lynage extraughte fro blodde royall hadde wyfe suller iermayn sayd kyng phylyp allwayes chief speciall compaignyon louer hys astatis space iii yere done realme fraunce done aduyce withoute hym nothyng done fortuned kyng philyppe tooke meruailouse great pleasure hatred ageynst noble man syr robert artoyse plee ed hym wherof erle artoyse cause wolde haue wonne entent vertue letter layd forth whiche nat true sayde wherfore kyng suche displeasure yf hadde takyn hym ire surely hadde coste hym lyfe without remedye syr robert fayne boyde realme fraunce went namure erle john nephewe kyng toke erles wyfe two sonnes owne nephewes johne charles dyd put prison kept straytly ye kyng sware shuld neuer come prison long lyued kyng mynde wolde nat turned maner meanes kyng furye sente hastely busshopp laoul liege desired hym instauce wolde befye make warre agaynst erle namure without wolde put countrey roberte erle artoyse p busshoppe greatly loued kynge fraunce lytle loued neyghbours dyda kyng desired hym erle namure sore ageynst wyll caused erle artoyse auoyde lande erle robert went duke brabant cosyn right ioyously receyued hym dyd hym great coforte soone kyng frauce knew sent worde ye duke wold susteyue maynteyn sus erle artoyse co trey shulde haue greatter ennemy wold hym wolde make warre ageynst hym al best power realme fraunce duke sent erle artoyse pryuely arge tuel tent se kyng wold forther case anon kyng knew spyes euery corner kyng great dispyte duke shuld dele hym within brief space kyng pourchased reason golde syluer kyng behaigne cosin iermayn duke brabant busshop liege arche bysshop coleyn duke guerles ye matques julyers erle bare ye lord los lorde fawkmount diuers lordes alied guyther al ayenst duke brabant defyed hym entred great oste countrey esbayng hanut brent twyse ouer coutrey pleased kyng frauce sent therle ewe constable great oste men armes lia heynaulte sent wy kyng brother john de beamont fraunce peace sufferauce warr bitwene kyng duke brabant last kyng frace wi moche warke consented therto vpon condition duke shulde put hym selfe vtterly abyde ordynaunce kyng frauce counsaile euery mater kyng suche befyed hym ageynst hym also wt certayn day lymitted auoyde coutrey erle artoyse make shorte al duke dyd sore ayenst wyll p howe kyng edwarde ingland toke towne berwyke ageynst scottis cap xxvi ye haue harde recited truce bitwene inglande scotland space iii yere space ue yere kept well peace ccc yere nat good peace kept beit kyng edward ingland enformed yong kyng dauid scotland wedded suster sea ed towne berwyke whtche ought apperteyn realme ingland kyng edward first graunfather possession peasably also ye kyng e realme scotlande shulde holde chief crowne inglande yong kyng scottis nat done tha homage wherfore kyng ingland sent ambassad kyng scottis desyryng hym leue handis towne berwyke parteyned heritage kyngis inglande predecessours haue ben possession therof also somoned kyng scottis come kyng ingland homage realme scotland kyng scottis toke counsaile howe answere thys mater finally kyng answerde engli ambassadours sayd syrs noble realme meruaile greatly ye haue requyred v fynd nat auncientely realme scotlande shulde thyng bounde subgiet realme ingland nother homage wayes kyng noble memorye father wolde neuer homage kyng ingland warre made vnto hym like wyse wyll also kyng robert father conquered towne berwyke force armes agaynst kyng edwarde father kyng maister nowe father helde dayes lyfe good heritage lyke maner thynke best power howe lordes require meanes kyng master whose suster haue maryed wyll suffre v peaseably enioye frauches ryghtis auncetours haue done lette v enioye father hath woune kept peaseably lyfe dayes desyre kyng maister wold nat beleue euyll counsaile gyuen hym contrary ther prince wolde v wrong shuld aide succour defende v loue suster haue maryed ambassadours answerd said syr haue well vnderstand answere shall shewe kyng lorde lyke maner ye haue said toke theyr leaue returned inglande kyng whiche answere kyng ingland nothyng content somoned parliament holden westm noble wyse men realme assembled determine shuld best done mater meane tyme ser robert erle artoys came inglande dysguysed lyke marchaunt kyng rereyued hym right ioyously reteyned hym one counsaile hym assigned erledom rychemount whan daye parliament aproched noble lande assembled londo tha kyng caused shewed message howe wrytten kyng scottis answere kyng wherfore kyng desyred noble realme yt wolde gyue hym suche counsaile shulde ateyne sauyng honour ryght whan assembled counsaile thought yt kyng myght lenger bear honour iniuryes wronges kyng scott dyd hym dayly reported aduise kyng exortyng hym prouyde force strength men warre atteyne therby towne berwike entre realme scotland suche wyse shulde constrayne kyng scottis ioyfull come homage hym noble comons realme ingland sayd wold gladly willyngly go hym iourney theyr good wyls kyng thaked greatly desired redy aailed daye assigned asseble gyther new castell vpon tyne euery man went home p pared iourney kyng sent agayn ambassadours kyng scott brother lawe sufficiently somon hym wolde nat wyse aduysed kyng gaue full auctorite defie hym day assembly kyng oste aproched whiche day kyng inglade ost aryued new castell vpo tyne taried iii dayes residue oste comyng fourth day departed al oste toward scotland passed landes lord persy lorde neuell two great lordes northumberland marched scottis like wyse dyd lorde rosse lorde ligy lorde mombray kynge oste drew toward cite berwyke kyng scotland made answere ii messenger dyd fyrst wherfore opely defied somoned kyng ingland oste entred scotlad cousailed shuld nat tary siege berwike ryde forth burne countrey graund father dyd dyd whiche iourney wasted distroyed playn countrey scotland exiled diuerse townes closed dyk pale toke strong cattell enyagburth sette therin g passed secund scotlad lyn ran ouer countrey abowte scone distroyed good towne douf fremlyn dyd euyll abbey kyng ingland comaunded hurte shuld done therto kyng coquered countrey dondieu oubreten strong castell stadyng march ayenst wylde scottis kyng scott quene wyfe withdrawen vnto suretie scottis wolde appere afore englisshe men drawen forelf ged worth whiche wer inhabitable specially knew nat countrey wherin scottis wer theyr gooddis set lytle reuant maruaile thoughe thus dryuen kyng lorde xv yere age erle morrey yong nephew willyam duglas slayne spayn also age tyme realme scotland dispurueyed good capiteyns whan kyng ingland ronouer playne countrey scotlande taried ther space vi monethes sawe none wold come agaynst hym garnysshed diuers castels wonne thought make warre withdrew fayre easely toward berwike returnyng wan castell aluest parteynyng heritage erle duglas v leagis fro edeburge ther kyng set good capitayus rode small iourneis tyll came berwike whiche entre scotlande kyng layd rounde siege sayd wolde neuer depart then tyll wonne orels kyng scottis come reyse siege parforee within towne good men warre set kyng scottis cite ther many assaultis sore skrymysshes ygh euery daye cite wolde nat yelde vp symply alwaies thought reseued succour appered scott mornyng nyghtis made many rye trouble oste lytle hurte dyd englysshe oste well kept scottis coulde nat entre theyr dammage often tymes loste theyr men p whan berwike sawe comfort ayde came fro part theyr vitayles began fayle howe enclosed water lande began fall treate kyng ingland desired truee indure moneth within moneth kyng dauid theyr lorde hym come nat force reyse siege tha rendre vp cite lyues gooddis saued soudiers within myght safly go theyr countrey without dammage treaty nat lightly grauted kyng ingland wolde haue yelded symply haue pleasure bicause hold log ayenst hym finally content counsaile lord also ser robert artoys dyd put therto payne ben iourneye kyng shewed hym alwayes home uert enheriter crowne fraun wolde gladly kyng shuld haue made warre frauce left warres scotland wordes others inclined greatly kyng codiscend treaty berwike truee treaty grauted within cite sent worde kyng case stode coulde fynde remedy reyse siege cite delyuered vp thende moneth also castell marshal o toke possession kyng ingland burgess cite came dyd theyr feaute homage kyng sware hold hym kyng entred great solempuite taryed xii dayes made capitayn ther called syr edward bailleul whan kyng departed lefte sayde knyght certayne yong knyghtis squiers helpe kepe landis conquered scottis fronters therof kyng people returned london euery man theyre owne countres kyng went wyndesore ser robert artoys wt hym neuer ceassed daye nyght shewyng kyng ryght crowne fraunce kyng harkened gladly wordis thus season kyng ingland wanne parte realme scotland many expert knyght hym among sir wylliam mo tague syr walter manny hardy knyghtis dyd many dedis armes ageynst scottis better haue entre scotland fortified basfyde rosebourge made strong castel ser wylliam montague dyd well entreprises kyng made hymerle erle sa page missing surely sayd therle cannat deuyse puissant prince ayde hym duke brabant cosyn germayne also byss hoppe liege duke guerles hath suster wyfe archbysshop colayne marque jullers syr arnolde de baquehen lorde faulquemount lordes thei may make moost men warr inshort space knowe arre good men warre may well make x thousande men war haue wage therafter arre people wolde gladly wynne aduauntage yf kyng sonne maister might gette lordes part come party might well go ouer water dysse seke kyng phylippe fyght hym answere embassadours retourned england kyng reported done wherof kyng great ioy well coforted tidyng came fraunce multiplyed lytle lytle kyng phylippes enterprise ye sayd croysey beganne asswage ware colde coutermauded offycers sease makyng farther puision tyll knewe kyng edward wolde kyng edward ordayned x banerettes xl knyghtes sent ouer see ualencenes bysshoppe lyncolne theym thentent treat lordes thempyre suche therle heynalt named whanne come ualencennes eche kept great estate port spared nothynge yf kynge englande bene proper persone wherby dyd gette great reuo wine prayse yonge bachelars eche one eyen closed peace sylke sayd made vowe among ladyes contrey wolde natse wt one eye tyll done dedes armes frauce beit woldnat knowen therof whan thei ben well feested ualencenes bysshoppe lyncolne part copany went duke brabant feasted greatly agreed promysed susayne ye kyng englande copany contrey might go come armed vnarmed pleasure gyue best counsell coude also yf kynge englande wolde defy frenche kyng wolde entre countrey fraunce men warre wage might borne nombre thousande armes thus lordes retourned agayne ualencennes dyd somoch messangers myse golde syluer duke guerles kynges brother lawe ye marque jullers archebysshoppe colayne waleran brother lorde faulquemount came ualencenes speke lordes englande byfore erle haynalt lorde john brother meanes great somme flores eche shulde haue themselfe men made pmyse defy yt frenche kyng go kyng england wha pleased hym certayne men warre promysing also gette lordes take part wage beyonde ryuer ryne able bringe good nombres men warre lordes almayne toke leaue retourned ther owne contreis thenglysshmen taryed styll therle heynalt sent certayne messangers bysshoppe lyege wolde gladly haue hadde hym partie wolde neuer agaynst french kyng become man entred feaultie kyng charles behaygne nat desyred knewe well fermely ioyned frenche kyng reason maryage john duke normandy wyfe kyng doughter wherby knewe well wold nothyng agaynst frech kyng phow jaques dartuell gouerned flaunders cap xxix season great dyscorde bytwene erle flauders fle mynges wolde nat obey durst nat byde flaunders gret parell towne gaunt man maker hony called jaques dartuell entred fortune grace people thynge done dydde might commaunde wolde flaunders ther non though neuer great yt durst disobey commaundement alwayes goyng hym vp downe gaunt lx kore varlettes armed amonge thre foure knewe ye secretues mynde mette sone hated hym suspectyon incontynent slayne commaunded secret varlettes whanne soeuer mette persone made suche asygae theym incotynent shulde slee hym whatsoeuer without wordes resouynge yt meanes made many slayne wherby doughted none durst speke agaynst thynge wolde haue done euery man gladde make hym good chere varlet whan thei brought hym home house shulde go dyner lyst dyner returne agayne strete lodgyng abyde tyll come wayt hym tyll souper tyme souldyours eche foure grotes flemmysshe day truely payd wekely thus euery towne souldyers seruauntess wage redy commaundement espy ther person wolde rebell agaynst mynde enfourme hym therof assone knewe suche wolde neuer cease tyll banysshed slayne without respyte great men knyghtes squire burgeses good townes thought fauourable therle maner banysshed flaunders wolde leuey moyte landes owne vse thother halfe wyuess chyldren banysshed whome great nobre abode atsaynt diner speke properly neuer flaunders none contrey prince duke ruled countrey pesably long jaques dartuell dyd rule flaunderss leuyed rente wynages rightes pertayned therle flanders spe ded pleasure without acompt makyng whahe wold say ye lacked money byleued hym behoued none durst say agaynst hym whan wold borowe thynge burgesse none durst say hym nay englyssh embassadours kept honourable estate towne ualencennes thought shulde agreat comforte kynge lorde yf might gette flymmynges take part toke counsell therle mater answered truely shulde one grettest aydes coude haue sayd thought labour yt behalfe coude nat preuayle without gette first goodwyll jaques dartuell said wolde assay coude thervpon departed fro ualenceunes went flaunders departed thre foure co panies went bruges ipre gaut kept port made large dyspece semed syluer golde fell hades made many great promyses offer spake mater bysshopp certayne hym wet gaunt dyd somuch fayre word otherwyse gate thacorde jaques dartuell dyd gette great grace towne specially olde knyght dwelt gauut ther right well beloued called lorde courcisyen knight baneret reputed hardy knight alwayes serued truely lordes knyght dyd moche honour thenglysshemen valyant knyght ought stragers accused french kyng incontynent sent strayt commaundement therle flaunders shulde send sayd knyght assone hym strike hed therle durst nat breke kynges comanndemet dyd somoch knyght came hym sendyng thought non yuell incontynet taken heed stryken wherof many folkes sorie sore dysplesed therle welbeloued lordes contrey englysshe lordes dyd somoche jaques dartuell dyuerse tymes togyder counselles good townes speke besynes lordes englande desyred frauchyses amyties offred kyng engla de byhalfe often spake mater fynally agreed kynge englande myght come go flaunders pleasure howe beit sayd sore bouude french kyng myght nat entre realme fraunce make warre without shulde forfayt great somme florens desyred wold cotent answere yt tyme thenglysshe lordes retourned agayne ualencennes great ioy often tymes sent worde ye kyng englande spedde euer sent theym golde syluer ber charge gyue lordes almaygne desyred nothyng el season noble erle heynalt dyed vi day june yere lorde ccc xxxvii buryed frier ualencennes bysshoppe cabraysang masse ther many duke erles barownes welbeloued honoured people lyfe dayes dyscease ye lorde wyllyam sonne entred counteis heynalt hollande zelande wyfe dougther duke john brabat name jahane endowed lande bynche right fayre heritage profitable lady jahan mother went fontnels lescault ther vsed resydue lyfe great deuotion thabbey ther dyd many good dedes p certayne noble flauders kept yle cagaunt agaynst thenglysshemen cap xxx ordynaunces confortes kyng england get syde see kyng phylipp fraunce well enformed mater wolde gladly haue flemmyng part jaques dartuell surmounted maner people flauders none durst say agaynst opynion ye erle hym selfe durst nat well abyde countrey sent countesse wyfe loys sonne fraunce dout fle mynges season ther yle cagant certayne knyghtes squyers fla ders garyson sir dutres de haluyn syr john de radays sonnes lestriefe kept passage agaynst theglysshmen made couert warre wherof thenglysshe lordes beyng heynalt well enformed went way homewarde england shulde met withall dyspleasure wherfore nat well assured howbeit rode went ye countrey pleasure confort jaques dartuell supported honoured moche might lordes went doudrech holande ther toke shypping eschue passage cagaunt wher garison layd commaundement frenche kyng englisshe lordes cae agayne england priuely coude came kyng right ioyouse commyng whan harde garyson cagaunt sayd wolde prouyde shortly anone ordayned therie derby ser water manny dyuerse knyghtes squiers fyue hundred men armes two thousande archer toke shippyng london ryuer tames first tyde went grauesende next day margate thyrde tyde toke see sayled flauders aparelled selfe came nere cagaunt p batell cagaut bytwene thenglysshmen frenchman cap xxxi whan thenglysshmen sawe towne cagaunt made redy wynd tyde serue name god saint george approched blewe vp trumpettes set archer sayled warde towne cagaunt sawe well great shypp aproche knewe well englysshmen araynged dyke sandes baners made xvi newe knyghtes fyue thousande warr good knyghtes squiers ther sir guy fla ders good sure knyght bastarde desyred copany well deuoyre also ther sir dutres de hauyn syr john de roodes sir gyles de lestriefe sir symon syr john bonquedet made knyghtes peter anglemonster many knyghtes squiers expert men armes thenglysshmen desyrous assayle flemynges defende thenglysshe atchers began shout cryed cryes suche kepte passage fayne perforce recule backe first assaute dyuerse sore hurte englysshmen toke lande came fought hande hande flemynges fought valyantly defende passage theglysshmen assauted chyualrously erle derby day good knyght first assaut forwarde stryken erth lorde manny dyd hym great confort pur feat armes releued hym vp agayne brought hym pyll cryed lancastre erle derby approched euery part many hurt mo ye flemmynges englysshmen archer shot holly togyder dyd flemmynges moche damage thus hauyn cagant ther sore batell flemynges good men warre chosen erle flaunders defende passage agaynst thenglysshemen englande erle derby sonne erle henry lancastre ye wry necke therle suffolke syr robert cobham sir lewes byauchampe sir wyllyam sonne therle warwyke lorde bourcher syr water many dyuers sore batayle well foughten hande hande finally flemynges put chase slayne mo thre thousande hauyn stretes house syr guy bastarde flauders taken sir dutres de haluyn sir john de rodes wer slayne two bretherne bonquedent syr gyles de lestrief mo xxvi knyghtes squyers towne taken pylled good prisoner put shippes towne brent thus englysshemen retourned englande without damage kyng caused sir guy bastarde fla ders swere bynde hymselfe prisoner yere became englysshe dyd fayth homage kyng englande p kyng edwarde england made great alyaunces empyre cap xxxii dysconfeture cagaunt tidynges therof spredde abrode cou trey flaunders sayd yt without reason agaynst wylles therle fladers layd yt garyson jaques dartuell wolde nat ben otherwyse contynent sent messangers kynge edwarde recommendyng hym grace withall hert counsellyng hym come thyder passe see certyfyenge hym flemmynges greatly desyred se hym thus kyng englande made great purueyanc whan wynter passed toke see well acompanyed duke erles barownes dyuers knyghtes aryued towne andewarpe tha pertayninge duke brabant thyther came people partes se hym great estate kept sent cosyn duke brabant duke guerles marque jullers lorde john heynalt trusted haue conforte sayeng howe wolde gladly speke theym came andewarpe bytwene whytsontyde feest saynte john whan kyng well feasted th desyred knowe myndes whaue wolde b gynne promysed requirynge dyspatche mater breuely intet sayd come thyder men redy howe shulde great damage hym defarre ye mater long lordes longe counsell among fynally sayd syr commynge hyther nowe se thynge el nat nowe purueyed gyue full answere lycence shall retourne people come agayne pleasure thaue gyue playne answere mater shall nat rest v toke day come agayn thre wekes feest saynt john kynge shewed charge longe abyding thynkinge whan came thyther ben full purueyd haue made hym playne answere sayng howe wolde nat returne england tyll full answere thus lordes departed kynge taryed abbay saynt bernarde englysshe lordes taryed styll andewarpe kepe kynge company rode countrey great dyspence duke brabant went louane taryed long tyme often tymes sent frenche kyng desyring hym haue suspecyous hym nat byleue yuell informacion made hym wyll sayd wold make none alyance couenant agaynst hym sayrng also kynge englande cosyn germayne wherfore might nat deny hym come countrey day cae kyng englande loked haue answere lord excused sayd howe redy men duke brabant wolde redy part sayeng yt nere assone might knowe redy wolde nat behynde begynnyng mater assone kyng dyd moche spake agayne ye duke shewed answere lordes desyring amyte lynage faut founde hym sayeng parceyued well cold mater without wer quicker dyd otherwyse douted shulde lese therby ayde lordes amayne defaulte duke sayd wolde take counsayle matter whan longe debated mater sayd howe shulde redy firste sayd wolde speke agayne lordes dyde sende desyring come hym wher pleased best yt day apoynted myddes august counsell hale bycause yong erle heynalt shulde also ther hym sir john heynalt vncle whane lordes come parlyament hale longe counsayle togyder finally sayd kyng englande syr wese cause shulde make defyance frenche kyng thynges consydred without ye gette thagrement themperour wolde commaunde v name emperour may well thus long tyme past couenant sworne sealed kyng frauce ought take thyng parteyning thepyre kynge philyppe hath taken castell creuecure cambreysis castell alues pailleull cytie cambray wherfore themperour hath good cause defye hym v therfore sir ye get acord honour shalbe kyng sayd wolde folo counsayle ordayned marque jullers shulde go themperour certayne knyghtes clerkes kynges counsell duke gwerles duke brabant wold sende none fro hym lende castell louayne kynge englande lye marque copany foude emperour florebetche shewed hym cause commyng lady margarete heynault dydde payne forthe matter sir lewes banyer emperour wedded ther marque jullers made erle ye duke guelders byfore erle made duke themperour gaue commyssion foure knyght two doctours counsell make kyng edwarde englande bycarre generall throughout empyre therof sayd lordes hadde instrumentes publyke confyrmed sealed suffyciently emperour phowe kyng dauyd scotlande made alyaunce kyng phylypp frauce ca xxxiii season yonge kyng dauyd scotlande lost best part lande coulde natte recouer holde theglysshmend eparted priuely small company quene wyfe hym toke shippyng arryued bolayne rodde pares kyng philyppe gretly dyd feast hym offred hym castels abyde goodes dyspende condycion shulde make peace kynge englande without counsell agremet kyng philyppe knewe well howe kynge englande apparelled greatly make hym warre thus kyng ther retayned kyng dauyd quene long season neded coste charge scotlande came lytell substace mayntayne withall estate french king sent certayne messangers scotlade lordes ther kept warr agaynst theglissh men offryng great ayde confort wolde take peace tru e ye kyng englande without agrement thaccorde owne kyng likewyse promysed sworne lord scotlande couselled togyder ioyously accorded request sealed sware kyng lorde thus alyance made bytwene scotlande france endured long season ye frenche kyng sent men warre scotland kepe warr agaynst thenglysshmen ser arnolde dandregien alter marschall fraunce lorde garencieres dyuerse knyghtes squyers frenche kyng thought yt scottes shulue gyue somoch realme england yt theglysshmen shulde nat come ouer see anoy hym phow kyng edwarde england made bycare generall thepyre almaygne cap xxxiiii whan kyng england lordes hym alyed wer departed fro parlyament hale kyng wet louan made redy castell byding sent quene come thyder pleased sent worde wolde nat come then hole yere sent home certayne knyghtes kepe lande fro scottes lord knyghtes styll kynge rode aboute realme flanders henalt makyng grete dyspence gyueng great rewardes iuels lordes ladyes damoselles countrey get good wylles dyd somoche greatly praysed specially common people bycause port state kept feest sayntes marque jullers co pany sent worde kyng sped kyng sent hym shulde hym feest saynt martyne also hesent duke brabat knowe mynde wher wolde plyament shulde beholde answered arques countie loz nere countrey kyng sent alyes shulde hall towne apparelled hanged though ben kynges chamber kyng satte crowned wt golde fote hygher op nly redde letter theperour kyng made bycare generall liefrenaunt emperour power gyue hym make lawes mynistre justyce euery person thempours name make money golde syluer emperour also commaunded letter person empyre subgiettes shulde obey kyng england vycare hymselfe hym homage contynent ther clayme answere made bytwene party emperour right iudgement gyuen also renued iudgement statute affermed made emperours courte soeuer wolde hurt shuld make defyance thredayes byfore dede dyde otherwyse shulde reputed euyll doet lan dede whan done lordes departed toke day shulde appere cambray thre wekes ye feest saynte john whiche towne become frenche thus departed euery man went owne kynge edwarde bycare thempyre went louayne quene newely come thyder englande great noblenesse well accopanyed ladyes damosel englande kynge quene kepte house ryght honorably wynter caused money golde syluer made andewarpe great plentie yet duke brabant lefte nat great dyligence sent often messangers kyng philyppe lorde loys rauehen chefe counsellour dyuers euer excuse hym ye whiche cause knight often tymes sent laste abode styll frenche court kyng thentent alwayes excuse hym agaynst informacions myght made hym knyght dyd detroyre behalfe phowe kynge edwarde alyes dyd defye frenche kyng cap xxxv thus wynter passed somer came ye feest saynt john baptyst aproched lord englande almayne apa relled themselfe acoplyssh enterprise frenche kyng wrought asmoch coude co trary knewe moch intent kyng edwarde made prouisyon englande men warr redy passe ye see incotynent feest saynt john dyde kynge went uyllenort made copany lodged many myght towne without long ryuersyde tentes pauylyons ther taryed fro maudelyn tyde tyll lady day septembre abyding wekely lord thempyre specially duke brabant whose comynge abode whan kyng englande sawe howe came nat sent great messangers eche sommonyng come promysed mete hym machlyn saynt gyles day shewe hym taryed long thus kynge edwarde lay uyllenort kepte dayly cost charge well nombre xvi hundred men armes e fro thother syde see x archer besyde uysious matueylous great charge besyde great rewardes gyuen lordes besyde great armyes see frenche kynge part set genowayes normayns breton pycardes spanyardes redy see entre england assone ye warr opened lordes almayne kyng englande somons came machlyn moche besynesse finally acorded kyng englande might well sette forwarde within xv dayes thentent warr shuld ye laudable thei agreed send defyanc french kyng first kyng england duke guerles marque jullers sir robert dartoyse sir john heynalt marque musse ye marque blanquebourc lorde faulquemont sir arnold baquchen archbys shop colayne sir galea brother al lordes thempyre defyanc written sealed lordes except duke brabat sayd wold dede hymselfe tyme conuenyent bere defyances fraunce charged bysshop lyncolne bare parys dyd message suche maner yt coude nat reproched blamed safe co duct retourne agayne kyng machlyne phow sir water manny defyances declared made first iourney frace ca xxxvi firste weke frenche kyng thus defyed sir water manny assone knewe gate hym xl speres rode brabant nyght day tyll came heynalt entred wode blaton nat knowig shulde shewed moost priuyest aboute hym howe promysed ladyes damoselles came englande wolde first shulde entre fraunce gete towne castell dedes armes entet ryde mortaigne gete might partayned thane realme fraunce soo rode passed wode blaton came mornynge sonne risyng mortaygne aduenture founde wycket gate opynne alyghtedde company entred dyd sette certayne company kepe gate went hygh strete penon hym came great towre gate wycket fast closed whan ye watch castell harde brunt sawe blewe horne cryed treason treason euery man woke made redy kept selfe styll within castell sir water manny went backe agayne dyd set fyre strete ioyninge castell threscore house brent ye people sore frayed wende haue taken sir water company rode backe streight conde ther passed ryuer hayne rode way ualencennes coosted ryght hande came deuayne went abbay soo passed forth towarde bouhaigne dyd somoche captayne dyd let passe thorough ryuer thei came astrong castell parteyning bysshopp cambray called castell thyne ye sodely toke captayne wyfe win lorde manny made good garyson set therm brother called sir gyles ny afterwarde dyd moche trouble cytie cabray castell within leage towne sir water manny retourned brabant kynge soueraygne lorde founde machlyne ther shewed hym done phow say defyances made frenchman entred england cap xxxvii sone kynge phylyppe knewe vefyed kyng england alyes reteyned men warre euery syde sent lord galoys de bausyne good knyght sauoy cyte cambray made hym captayne ther hym sir thybalt de marneyle lorde roy sauoy frauce ii hundred speres kynge philyppe sent seased handes countie pontyeu kyng englande reason mother also set dyuers lordes thempyre therle heynalt neue duke lorrayne therle bar bysshop metz bysshop liege desy ryng wolde make yuell purchase agaynst hym realme moost part lordes answered howe wolde nothyng shuld agaynst hym erle heynalt wrote vnto hym right courtessy wolde redy alwayes ayd hym realme agaynst men seyng kyng england maketh warre bycare lyeutenaunt thempyre wherfore said might nat refuse hym coutrey confort bycause helde part countrey thempour assone sir e nuyriell sir peter bahuchet barbe noyre lay kept streightes bytwene england fraunce great nauy knewe ye warre opyn came sonday fore noone hauyu hampton whyle people masse normayns pycardes spanyerdes entred towne robbed pylled towne slewe dyuers defowled maydens enforced wyues charged vessel ye pyllage entred agayne shyppes whan tyde came dysancred sayled normandy came depe departed deuyded boty pyllages phow kyng edwarde besieged cyte cambray cap xxxviii kyng england departed fro machelyne went brussels people past ye towne came kynge xx almaynes kynge sent demauded duke brabat entensy go cambray el leaue duke answered sayed sone knewe besieged cabray wolde come thyder xii hundred speres good men warre kyng went nyuell lay one nyght nexte day mon heynalt founde yong erle heynalt receyued ioyously euer sir robert dartoyse kyng one priue counsell xvi xx great lordes knightes englande euer kyng honoure estate counsell hym dedes also hym ye bysshop lyncolne greatly renomed iourney wysdome prowes thus thenglysshmen passed forth lodged abrode countrey founde prouysion ynough money howbeit ayed truly nat whan kyng taryed two dayes mon heynalt thane went ualencennes xii hym entred towne mo person thyder come therle heynalt ser john vncle lorde faguyuelles ye lorde uerchyn lorde haureth dyuers therle lorde ye kyng therle went hand hande ye great hall redy aparelled receyue went vp steares hall bysshoppe lyncolne present spake loude sayd wyllyam bysshopp cambray admonysshe procurer kyng england vycare thepyre roe ye opyn gate cyte cambray ye nat ye shall forfayt landes woll entre byforce ther none answered mater bysshop nat present bysshop lyncolne sayd agayne erle heynault admonysshe name thempour ye come serue ye kyng england vycare cyte cambray suche nombre ye ought therle ther preset sayd right good wyll redy thus entred hall therle ledde ye kyng chabre anon sup redy ye next day king deted went aspre ther taryed ii dayes suffred men passe forth went cabray loged wy besieged cyte cambray roude dayly power encreased thyder came yong erle heynalt great atray syr john vncle lodged nere ye kyng duke guerles company marque musse therle mon erle sauynes lorde falquemot sir arnolde bouquehen withall thother lordes thempyre suche alyed kyng englande sixt day siege layd thyder cae duke brabant ix hundred speres besyde lodged toward ostrenan ryuer lescaut made bridge ouer water thentent go fro ye one hoost assone come sent defye frenche kyng compyengne wherof loys traneheu alwayes excused duke confused wold returne agayne brabant dyed sorowe frauce sege durynge ther many skirmysshes sir john heynalt lorde falquemont rod euer lightly togyder brent wasted sore countrey cambresys day lordes nombre v c speres men warr came castell doisy cambresys pertayning lord coucy made ther great assaut within dyd defende valyantly thei damage sayd lordes retourned lodgynges therle heynalt company saturday came gate towarde saynt quyntines made ther gret assaut ther john chandos tha squier whose prowes boke speketh moch cast hymselfe bytwene barrers gate fought valyantly squyer uermandoys called johanne saynt dager ther goodly feat armes done bytwene heynows coquered force baylles ther entred therle heynalt marshal sir gararde uerchyne ser henry dantoyng aduentured valyantly aduaunce honour gate called ye gate robert lord beamonde lorde falquemont lorde danghyen sir wyllyam manny company made ther asore harde assaut cambray soudyers set french kyng defended themselfe cyte valyantly thassauters wan nothyng retourned right wery well beaten logynges yong erle namure cae thyder serue ye yong erle heynalt desyre sayd wolde part long thepyre assone entred realme fraunce sayd wolde forsake go serue french kyng retayned hym likewyse thentent therle heynalt comaunded men payne dethe none shulde thyng within realme frauce season whyle ye kyng england lay siege byfore cambray xl men armes greatly constrayned assautes kyng philyp made somons peron uarmadoys kyng england counselled sir robert dartoys whome great affyance demaudyng hym whyther better hym entre ye realm fraunce encounter aduersary el abyde styll byfore cabray tyll biforce lord england cousell sawe well cyte strog well furnysshed men warr vytels artylary shuld long abyde ther tyll wonne cytie wherof certetie also sawe well wynter aproched nere yet done maner entprise lay gret erpece counselled kynge set forwarde realme wher might fynde plentie forage counsell taken lordes ordayned dyslodge trussed tent pauylions maner harnes departed rode towarde mnut saynt martyn thentre frauce thus rode good oroce euery lorde amog owne men marshal thenglysshe hoost therle northapton glocetter therle suffolke constable englande therle warwyke passed ther ryuer lescault ease whan therle heynalt acopanyed kyng vnto deptyng thepyre shuld passe ryuer entre realme fraunce toke leaue kyng sayd howe wolde ryde farther hym tyme kyng philypp vncle sent hym wolde nat haue yuell wyll wold go serue hym fraunce serued kyng england thempyre thus therle henalt therle namure copanyes rode backe quesnoy therle heynalt gaue moost part company leaue part desyringe redy whan sende sayd shortly wolde go kyng philyppe vncle phow kyng edward made sir henry flaunders knyght cap xxxix assone kyng edward passed ryuer lescaute entred ye realme fraunce called hym sir henry fladers tha yong squier made hym knyght gaue hym yerely cc sterlyng sufficiently assigned hym england ye kyng went lodged thabbey mout saint martyn ther taryed two dayes people abrode contrey duke brabat lodged thabbey uancellez whan french kyng beyng copiengne harde tydynges enformed somones sent ye erle ewe gynes costable saynt quyntines kepe towne froters ther agaynst ennemies sent ye lorde coucy owne contrey lorde hen sent many men armes guyse rybemont behayne fortress ioynyng thentre realme went hymselfe ward peron ye meane season yt kyng edward lay thabbey mout saynt martyn men ran abrode contrey bapau nere peron saynt quyntines founde contrey pietyfull ther ben warr long season fortuned ser henry flauders auance body eucrease honour day knyghts wherof sir john heynalt chefe hym lorde faulquemot lorde bergues lorde uaudresen lorde lens dyuers nobre v c auysed towne therby called honecourt wher moch peple wer gadered trust ye fortress therin coueyed good ther ben ser arnolde baquehen syr wyllm dunor copany tayned nothyng ther ther honycourt abbot great wysdome hardynes caused made without towne barrers ouerthwart strete lyke grate nat past half fote wyde euery grate made great puisyons stone quicke lyme men redy defende place lord whan came thyder lighted fote entred barrers gleuys handes ther began sore assaut within valyatly defended theselfe ther thabbot hymselfe receyued gaue many great stroke ferse assaut win cast downe stone peces tymbre potts full chalke dyd moche hurt thassaylers ser henry fladers helde glayue handes gaue ther great stroke last thabbot toke gleue hand drewe hym last set hand ser henres arme drewe sore pulled arme barrers shulder heldehym great auauntage barrers ben wyd ynough drawen hym ser henry wolde nat let wepen go sauyng honour thother knyghts strake thabbot rescue felowe wrastlyng endured longe space fynally knyght rescued gleaue abode thabbot day whan wrot boke past shewed gleue monkes ther yt kept treasur sayd day honycourt sore assaylled ye indured tyll nyght dyuerse wer slayne sore hurt syr johan heynault lost kynght hollande called sir herment whan flemyng heynowes englyssh men almaygnes fierse wylles within sawe howe coulde gette nothynge withdrewe selfe agaynst nyght ye next day mornyng kyng depted fro mount saynt martyn comaudynge person shulde hurt abbey comaundemet kept entred hermandoys toke day lodgyng tymes mount saynt ui tyne good order batayle saynt uyntines myght well se desyre yssue towne fore ryders came rynnynge barrers skyrmysshyng hoost taryed styll mout iyll next day lordes toke counsell way shulde drawe thaduyce duke brabant toke way thyerasse way prouisyon came dayly determyned kyng hy lyppe dyd folowe supposed wolde wolde abyde hym playne felde gyue hym batayle thus went forthe thre great batayls marshalles almaygnes first kynge englande myddle warde duke brabant rerewarde thus rodde forthe brennynge pyllynge countrey thre foure leages day euer toke logynge tymes company englysshmen almaygnes passed ryuer somme abbey ermans wasted countrey al company wherof sit johan heynalt lorde faulquemot sir arnold barquehen chefe rode drigny saynt benoyste good towne easely closed incontynent taken assaut robbed abbey ladyes vyolated towne brent departed rode towarde guy rybemont kynge englande lodged ehories ther taryed day men ranne abrode dystroyed countrey kynge toke way flammengerie come lesche thyerasse marshal bysshopp lpncolne fyue hunderd speres passed ryuer trysague entred laonnoys towarde lande lorde cou bret saynt gouuen towne matle nyght lodgedde valey besyde laon nerte day drewe agayne hoost knewe prisoner frenche kyng come saynt uyntines c thousand men passe ryuer somme lordes retournynge brent good towne called crecy dyuerse townes hamelettes ther p let v speke ser john heynalt company fyue hundred speres came guy brent towne bete downe mylles wt fortress lady jane owne doughter wyfe therle bloys called lewes desyred father spare therytage erle son lawe sit john henalt wolde nat spare enterprise retourned agayne kyng lodged thabbey sarnaques euer peple r ouer countrey lorde falquemont c speres came lonnion thyerasse great towne men towne fled great wood goodes fortifyed wood fellyng tymbre almayns rode thyder mette sir arnolde baquehen company ther assayled wood defedyd aswell might finally coquered put flight ther wer slayne sore hurt mo xl lost thus contrey ouer ryden dyd lyst p howe kyng englande french kyng toke day iourney fight togyder cap x kyng englande depted fro sarnaques went muttrell ther loged nyght next day went flamegery made loge nere hym wherof mo xl thousande couselled avyde kyng lyp fyght wt hym french kyng depted fro saynt duyntines dayly men came hym fro partes cae uyrofosse kyng taryed sayd howe wold nat go then tyll fought wt kynge englande alyes seyng within two leages toguyther wha therle heynalt du lnoy redy purueyed men warr knewe frenche kyng uyronfosse thynkyng gyue batayle thenglysshmen rode forthe tyll cae french hoost v c speres preseted hymself kyng vncle made hym small cher vycause ven wt aduersary cambray howe erle excused hymselfe sagely kynge counsayle well cotent ordayned marshal say marshall bertrame marshall try erle shulde lodged next englysshe hoost thus two kynges lodged bytwene yrofosse flamegery playne feldes without aduauntage thynke ther neuer sene goodly assemble noble men togyder whanne kynge england beyng chapell thyerasse knewe king ph ypp wt two leages called lordes host togyder demauded shuld honour saued sayd enten cyon gyue batayle lordes behelde eche desyr dde duke brabat shewe first entent duke said accorde shulde gyue batayle otherwyse sayd coude nat depart sauyng honour wherfore counsayled shulde sende harauloes frenche kyng demaunde day batayle haraulde duke guerles coude well langage offrenche enformed shulde say herode tyll came frenche hoost drewe hym kynge philyppe counsayle sayd ser kynge englande felde desyreth haue batell power agaynst power whiche thyng kyng philyppe graunted toke day friday nextafter tha weduisday haraude ourned well rewarded wt good urred gownes gyuen hym french kyng lordes bycause tidynges brought thus iourney agreed knowledge made therof lordes bothe hoostes euery man made hym redy matter thursday mornyng two knyghtes ther e heynaultes lorde sanguinelles lorde tupeney mounted horse two onely depted fro frenche hoost rode viewe englyssh hoost ro e co yng hoost fortuned lorde sanguynelles horse toke bridell tethe suche wyse ter coud nat rule hym ther wolde nat horse brought hym thenglysshe hoost fell handes maynes perceyued well none company set hym toke hym horse prisoner fyue orsixe gentylmen mayne none set hym raunsome whan vnderstode aynome demaunded hym knewe ser joh hepnalt answered yes desyred loue god bring hym presens knewe well wolde quyte hym rau therof almaygns ioyous brought hym lorde beaumounde incontynent dyde pledge hym fro maisters handes lorde sanguynelles retourned agayne therle heyualt horse agayne delyuered hym request lorde beamond thus passed day one thynge done ought remembred p kynges ordayned batayls yronfosse cap x whan friday came mornyng hoostes aparelled selfe redy euery lorde harde masse among owne copa yes dyuers wer shr uen first woll speke thorder thenglysshmen drewe forwarde feld made iii batels fote dyd put horse bagages lytell wood behynde tefyed first batell ledde duke guerles marque nusse marque blaquebour sir john heynalt therle o therle sauynes lorde faulquemont sit guyllam du fort sir arnolde baquche almayns amonge xxii banner lx penons hale viii men seconde batayle duke brabant lordes knyghtes countrey first lorde u se lorde bergues lorde bredangh lorde lorde aucelare lorde borguynall lorde stoneuort lorde wyten lorde elka lorde cassebegne lorde duffle ser thyrre alcourt ser rasse grez ser john cassebegne ser john filyfe ser gyles coterebe ser water otebergue thre bretherne harlebecque ser henry flaiu ders dyuerse barownes knyght flanders vnder duke baner lorde hallayne lorde sir hector yllains sit john rodes ser start gupstell ser wyllin strat ser de la mule many duke brabat xxiiii baners lxxx penons vii men iii bataile grettest ha kyng englande hym cosyn therle derby bysshopp lyncolne bysshopp durame therle salysbury erle northamton glocetter therle suffolke sir robert dartoyse called erle rychmont lorde raynolde cobhm lorde persy lorde roose lord montbray sir lewes sir john beauchampe ye lorde dalawarr lorde laucome ye lorde basset lorde fitz water sir water manny sir newe hastyngs sir john lyle dyuers nat name among ser john chandos moche honour spoken boke kyng wt hym xxviii baners lxxxx penons batayle vi men armes vi archer set batell wyng wherof therle warwyke therle penbroke ye lorde barkley lorde multon dyuerse cheyfe wer horsbacke thus whane euery lorde vnder banner comaunded marshal kynge england mounted palfray acopanyed onely sir robert dartoyse sir raynolde cobham ser water manny rode long batels right swetely desyred lordes wolde day ayde defende honoure mysed hym returned owne batell set euery thing good order comauded non shuld go ye marshal baner p nowe let v speke lordes fraunce dyd xi score baners iiii kynges vi duke xxvi erles mo iiii knyghtes comons fraunce mo lx kyngs ther kyng philyppe ualoys kyng behayne kyng nauerr king dauyd scotland duke normandy duke bretayne duke burbon duke lorrayne duke athene erles therle alanson brother kyng erle flaunders therle heynalt erle bloys therle bare therle forestes therle foyz therle armynacke erle dophyn auuergne therle loguyle therle sta pe therle uandosme therle harrecourt therle saynt pol therle guynes therle bowlougne therle roussy therle dampmartyn therle ualentynois therle aucer therle sancerre therle genue erle dreux gascongne languedoc many erles vycuntes long reherse great beauty beholde baners standerdes wauyng wynde horse barded knyghtes squyers richely armed frechemen ordayned thre great batayls eche fyftene thousand men armes xx men fote p howe two kynges departed fro uironfosse without batayle cap xlii might well marueyledde howe goodly sight men warr nere togyder shulde depart without batayle french men nat one acorde dyuers opynyons sayed great shame fought nat seyng ennemys nere owne countre raynged felde also promysed fyght sayd shulde great folly fyght harde knowe euery mannes mynde ieody treason sayd fortune cotrary kyng lese selde shuld put hole realme ieopardy lost though dyd dysconfet ennemes yet shuld neuer nerer realme englande landes parteynyng lordes hym alyed thus striuyng dyuers opynions ye day past tyll past noone sodenly ther started hare among frenchman suche sawe cryed made gret brut wherby suche behynde thought ben fightynge put helmes toke speres handes ther made dyuers newe knyghtes specially therle heynalt made xiiii wer euer called knyghts hare thus batell stode styll friday besyde stryfe bytwene counsellours france ther brought letter hoost recomendacion frenche kyng counsell fro kyng robert cicyle kyng sayd great astronomyer full great science often tymes sought bok thestate kyngs england frace founde astrology thefluens ye heues yt french kyng euer fought kyng edwarde england shuld discofited wherfore lyke king gret wysdoe douted peryll frenche kyng cosyn sent often tymes letter king philyppe counsayle wyse shulde make batayle agaynst thenglyss men kyng edwarde personally present dout writyng fro kyng cecyle dyuers great lordes fraunce sore basshed also kynge philyppe enfourmed therof beit yet great wyll gyue batayle counselled cotrary day passed without batell euery man withdrue lodgynges whan erle heynalt shulde nat fight departed withall hole company went backe nyght quesnoy kyng englande duke brabant lordes retourned trussed bagagis went
