nyght dauesnes heynalt next day toke leaue eche almayns brabances departed kynge went brabant duke cosyn friday batell shulde haue ben french kynge whan came lodgyng sore dyspleased bycause departed without batayle counsayle sayd howe right nobly borne hymselfe halyantly pursued ennemies done somoche put realme kyng englande shuld make many vyages conquered realme frauce next day kyng philypp gaue lycece maner men dept thanked right courtesly gret lordes ayde socour thus ended great iourney euery went owne frenche kynge went saynt omers sent men warre garysons specially tourney lysse doway townes marchyng thepyre sent tourney syr godmart dufay made hym captayne regent coutrey ther sent syr edwarde beaugewe mortayne whan ordred besynes drewe towarde parys p kyng edwarde toke hym bere armes fraunce name called kyng therof ca xliii whan kynge edward departed fro flamengery came brabat went streight brussels duke guerles duke jullers marque blanqueboure erle mon syr john haynalt lorde faulquemot lordes thempyre suche ben iournay brought hym thyder take aduyce counsell shulde done mater gone haue expedycion cause ordayned parlyamet beholden ye towne brussels thyder come desyred jaques dartuell gaut came thyder great company al counsel good townes flaunders ther king england sore desyred alyes thempyre shulde requyre flanders ayde mentayne warr defy french kyng go wher wolde haue doyng promyse recouer isle doway bethayne request well hard slemynges therupon desyred take counsell among themselfe toke cousell good leaser sayd kyng syr tyme ye haue made v request behalfe syr myght well doo sauyng honour saue ourselfe wolde gladly syr bounde faith othe somme two lyon floreyns pope chaumbre may make moue warre agaynst kynge fraunce soeuer payne lese sayd somme besyde ryn sentece cursyng syr ye wyll take armes frauce quarter armes englande call yourselfe kyng fraunce ye ought ryght woll take rightfull kyng frauce de maude quytace bondes ye gyue v therof king frace meanes shalbe assured dyspesed wt tha wyll go whyder soeuer ye wyll haue v kyng toke cousell thought sore mat take hym ye armes france name tha coquered nothing therof coud nat tell shuld fall therof whyder shuld coquere nat thother syde loth refuse confort ayde stemynges myght hym ayde tha ye kyng toke counsell lord thepyre lorde robert dartoyse specyall frendes finally good yuell wayed answered flemmynges wolde swere seale accorde promyse mentayne warre howe wolde good wyll promysed gette agayne lyle way bethayn answered howe content day assigned mete gaunt day kynge moost part sayd lordes counsayls generally flauders sayd mater rehersed sworne sealed king quartred armes frauce englande then forthe toke hym name kynge fraunce contynued tyll lefte agayne composicyo ye shall boke counsayle determyned next somer wold make great warre fraunce promysing besiege cytie tourney wherof flemmyng ioyfull thei thought strog ynough gete one goten leued shortly wynne agayne lysse way bethayne thappurtenauces tayning holden therle flauders thus euery man departed went home kynge englande went warpe quene abode styll gaunt often tymes vysited jaques dartuell lordes ladyes damosel gaunt kyng left flaunders therle salysbury therle suffolke went ipre ther kept great garyson made sore warre agaynst lysse whan kynges shyppes redy toke see sayled englande came london feest saynt andrewe honourably receyued ther coplayn te made hym dystruction hampton sayd trusted yere lenger shulde well reuenged p frenchman brent la de syr john heynault cap xliiii nowe lette v speke kyng philyppe greatly fortifyed nauy hadde see wherof syr kiry bahuchet barbe noyre captayns thei vnder great retynu genowayes normayns breton pycardes dyd wynter great damage realme englande somtyme came douer sandwyche wynchelse hastynges rye dyd moche sorowe thenglysshe men great nombre xl men ther none coude yssue en glande robbed taken slayne wan great pyllage specially wan great shyppe called christofer laden wolles goyng flaunders shyppe coost kynge englande moch money taken shyppe slayne drowned conquest frenchman ryght ioyeouse frenche kyng sent wrote lorde beamont lorde breme uidame chalon lorde john de la boue lorde john gararde loyre shulde make army ryde land syr john heynalt burne dystroy asmoche might obeyd gathered togyder nombre v c speres mornynge came towne simay gathered gyder gret pray countrey thought frenchman wolde nat coe farre haue passed wode thyrach frechmen burnt subarbes simay dyuerse vyllages nygh lande simay except fortress went aubeton thyerach ther deuyded boty season soudyours ca bray came lytell strong house without ca bray called relenques pertayning syr john haynalt bastarde sonne kept house xv soudyours hym assayled hole day togyder ye dyke wer frosen man might well come walles within trussed mydnight departed set fyre themselfe house next day whan cambray came thyder agayne sawehowe brent dyd bete downe stode capitayne house company went ualencennes ye haue well harde fore howe sir gualter manny toke castell thyne set therm brother called gyles manny made many skirmysshes cabray dyd moch trouble hapened day went fro garyson sixscore men armes came barrers cambray brunt great many armed within cyte came ye gate wher skirmyssh wher sir gyles put backe cambray yssued among cambreses ther yong squyer gascoyne called wyllyam marchant went felde well horsed shelde necke spere hande whan ser gyles many sawe hym rode f er ly hym ther ser gyles stryke harnes ye hert spere went clene body fell erth ther yers skirmysshe many stryken downe bothe partes finally cambray obtayned place drewe way ennemies toke sir gyles manny hurt brought hym cambray wt great toye incontynent dysarmed hym dyd gette surgions dresse wound wold gladly might escaped dyed next day thei myned send body two bretherne john tyrrey garyson bouhayne ostrenant though countrey heinalt tyme warr yet fro ters warde frauce euer good awayt ordayned horse lytter right honorably put body therin caused ii freres conuey bretherne receyued hym great sorowe bare hym freres ualencennes buryed two bretherne ny came castell thynel made sore warre agaynst cambray incounteruengyng dethe brother p season captayne turney turneyses sir godmarde fay fortress lorde beauye within mortayn ryuer lescaute stuarde carcassonne towne saynt amande ser amery poyters ouay lorde galoisde la baulme lorde uyllars marshall lorde marneyl cyte cambray knyghtes squyers soudyers france desyred none thyng ye myght entre heynault robbe yll countrey also bysshoppe cambray parys kyng coplayned howe heynowes done hym domage bret ouer ron contrey men kyng gaue lycence soudiers cabresys make rode heynalt th garysous made iourney nombre vi c men armes saturday mornyng departed fro ca bray also la male mayson rode forth day mette togyder went towne aspre ye good towne great without walles peo ther dout knewe warr towardes frenchman entred founde men woman house toke robbed towne pleasur tha sette fyre towne brent clene nothynge remayned walles within towne ther priory blacke monk great byldinges besyde church helde saynt wast arras frenchman also robbed place brent yerth pyllage retourned cabray tidynges anone came knowledge therle heynault bedde epe lodgyng called sale sodenly rose armed hym called vp knyghtes hym loged abrode nat sonne redy therle without taryeng son came market place ualencenes caused belle souned alaram euery man rose armed folowed therle lord ryden ye towne great hast toke way towarde aspre tyme ryden aleage tidyng came hym howe frenchman depted rode thabbey fountnels lady mother moche repayse hym dyspleasure sayd playnly dystruction aspre shuld derely reuenged realme fraunce good lady mother dyd asmoche coude swage yre excuse kynge dede wha therle ben ther certayne space toke leaue retourned ualencenes incotynent wrote letter prelate knyght contrey haue aduyce counsayle behalfe whan sir john heynalt knewe toke horse came therle nephue sone erle sawe hym sayd fayre vncle absence hath sette frenchman pride sir trouble anoyance sore dyspleased howe beit maner glad therof nowe ye well rewarded seruyce loue ye haue borne frenchman nowe behoueth make iourney fraunce agaynst frenchman vncle therle loke quart ye thynke best shalbe shortly done thus day parlyamet assigned mon came thyder resoried counsayle countrey also nolande zelande ther di iers opynyons wolde certayne sufficyent son shulde sent french kyng knowe cosentyng hurt done henalt tytle shulde make warre erles lande without defiaunce wold therle shulde reuenged lyke maner frenchman begon beit finally reason debated thought therle coude otherwyse make warr fraunce ordayned therle shulde make defyaunce frenche kyng entre byforce realme fra ce bere defyaces ordayned thabbot thybalt saynt crispyne tha letter defyance written sealed therle ye noble cotrey therle tha ked lordes good confort promyse ayde reuege agaynst frenchman thabbot saynt crispyne came fraunce brought de fyances kyng philypp made light therof sayd nephue outraous folc howe marchat haue cotrey bret thabbot returned therle counsayle shewed howe sped therle prepared men warre co trey brabant flanders great nombre togyder set forwarde towarde lande symay therlles intent go brenne landes lorde bremus also aubenton thyerache p howe therle heynault toke distroyed aubenton thyerach ca xlv aubenton douted greatly therle heynalt sir john vncle sent ayde great bayly uermadoys sent vydam chalons lorde beaumont lorde de la bone lorde lore dyuers nombre ccc men armes repayred ye towne certayne place determyned abyde heynowes defende towne gret towne full drapery heynowes cam friday lodged nere aubenton aduysed towne se quarter moost best taken mornyng aproched thre wardes baners right ordynatly also crosbowes erle heynalt ledde first batayle hym great nombre knyghtes squiers countrey vncle sir john heynalt seconde batayle wher plenty men warr thyrde lorde faulquemont good nobre almaynes thus euery lorde vnder owne baner begane sore assaut bowes began shote within without wherby dyuers sore hurt therle company came gate ther great assaut sore skirmysshe ther uydame calons dyd marueyles made gate thre sonnes knyghtes finally therle company coquered baylies byforce made ennemies withdrawe yt gate also gate towarde symay sir john de la bone sir john beamot ther also cruell assaut within wer fayne withdrawe gate leaue barrers heynowes wan brige also ther sore assaut suche fledde entred within went vp gate cast downe barres yron stone pott full quycke lyme wherby many sore hurt squyer henalt receyued suche stroke stone targe clouyn clene sonder stroke arme broken long hole saturday mornyng ther great assaut within dyd deuer defende themselfe finally towne wonne byforce pale defence broken first entred towne sir john heynalt baner great cryeng showtyng yu uydame chalons withdrewe hym company place mynster made semblant defende hymselfe log myght endure lorde bremus departed without order knewe well sir john heynalt lore dyspleased thought ben taken yt rausome shulde haue saued lyfe whan sir john heynalt knewe departed done somoche dyspleasure lande symay pursued hym lorde bremus sledde falt founde gate towne opyn entred ser johanne heynault pursued hym iuste gate swerde hande whane sawe escaped retourned agayne aubenton men mette certayne lorde bremus men folowed maister ther stayne without mercy erle company sought sore mynster ther uydam chalons dyd marueyls armes dyd two sonnes finally wer stayn scaped none suche fledde lorde bremus slayne taken ii men towne town robbed pylled goodes sent symay towne brent butnyng aubenton heynowes wet mauber fountaynes incontynent wan robbed brent towne also towne daube ueyll segny great segny lytell hamelettes ther mo xl erle went mouns gaue leaue men warr depart thanked wyse well content anone therle went make asure alyance kyng england stroger warre agaynst frechmen first made vncle sir john heynalt chefe maister gouernour holande zelande sir john lay styll mon prouyded contrey sent ualencenes confort ayde lorde autoyng lorde uerguy lord gomegynes sir henry huspharyce stewarde heynault hundred speares towne landrechyes bouhayne thre brethern almayns called courtars scaudyme sir gararde sass gynes towne dauesnes ye lord faulquemount thus dyde euery fortresse fronters fraunce p howe tourney made courney flaunders cap xlvi whan frenche kyng knewe howe heynowes brent contrey thyerache taken stayne knyghtes distroyed good towne aubenton commaunded duke normandy sonne yt shulde make iourney heynalt bring countrey case shuld neuer bere couerd agayne also ye kyng ordayned therle layll gastone kyng parys yt shulde make voyage gascoyne lyeutenant make warre burdeux bordeloys fortress helde kyng englande also frenche kynge enforced great nauy see commaunded kepe bondes flanders nat suffre kyng englande passe ouer see flanders payne lyues whan ye frenche kyng vnderstode flemynges made homage kynge englande sent vnto prelate vnder colour pope shewyng y wolde retourne knowledge themselfe holde hym crowne fraunce forsake kyng englande enchaunted sayd wolde trespaces wolde quyte gret money wer bound vnto hym oblygacion olde tyme also gyue many fayre franchyses ye slemmynges answered howe thought theselfe right well assoyled quyted thynge yt boude kyng fraunce frenche kyng complayned pope clement vi whervpon pope dyd cast suche sentence cursyng preest durst syng say ther diuyne seruyce wherof slemmynges sent great coplaynt vnto kyng englande apease sent worde yt whan came ouer see wolde bring preestes contrey syng mass whyther pope wolde nat sayd priuylege meanes flemynges somwhat apeased whan frenche kyng sawe coude nat tourne sle mynges fro opynion comaunded garysons tourney lysle make warre flem ouer ronne contrey ohn du roy ser mathue de trye marshall fraunce sir godmar du fay dyuers lordes made army men armes ccc crosbowes turney lylle doway euenyng ther departed fro turney day mornyng courtray yme son vp gathered togyther catall ther ran gat slewe hurt dyuers founde without thane retourned without domage droue al prayes wha came turney mo tha x shepe many swyne beates kyen wherof flemynges sore troubled jaques dartuell sware shulde derely reuenged incotynent comaunded good townes flanders men warr shulde wt hym turney day assigned wrote therle salysbury therle suffolke wer ipre shulde ther agaynst day lymitted wet gaut came place bytwene warpe turney called le pount de sere lodged taryed therles england franke bruges sayd two erles thought honour enterprise shulde nat delayed sent jaques dartuell promysing hym nat fayle day apoynted day departed ipre l speares fortie crosbowes went towarde place jaques dartuell abode passed towne lyle ceyued towne yssued xv c men fote horsbacke went iii partes thentent therles shuld nat scape two erles rode forth gyding sir u art de la crox kept log warr agaynst lyle knewe wayes contrey ipre came forthe erles gyde well gyded lyle nuely made great dyke wher neuer none whan sir uauflart hadde brought thyder sawe howe way nuely stopped sayd therles englande sir se well nat passe without danger lysle wherfore counsell let v turne agayne take way lordes sayde nay sir uauflart shall neuer sayd woll go way feare lysle therfore ryde byfore haue promysed jaques dartuell wt hym day thenglysshmen rode forth feare sir uauflart sayd sir ye haue taken vyage gyde haue ben wynter ipre wherof moch boude lyle yssue vpon v haue trust wyll abyde wyll saue selfe assone wer taken shulde cost lyfe loue better tha copany lordes dyd laugh hym sayd well yf holde well excused ymagined fell wer ware danger frenche busshement cryed stoppe sir ye shall nat passe way without lycence began shote ronne englysshmen assone syr uauflart sawe maner lyst ryde farther retourned assone myght gate hymselfe preace erles fell handes ennemies lyke fysshes nette closed rounde narowe strayet passage among hedg busshes dyke coude scape maner way forwarde backewarde whan sawe wer hardly bestad lyghted fote defended themselfe well might dyd hurt dyuers lysle finally defence coude nat auayle euer newe fresshe men warre came ther wer taken byforce yong squyer lymosyne nephue pope clement called remon yelded prisoner slayne couetyse fayre harnes fresshe apareyle two erles set prison hall lysle sent frenche kynge promysed lysle great rewarde good seruyce done hym whane jaques dartuell pont de ferre knewe tidyng sore dyspleased seased enterprise tyme retourned agayne gaunt p iourney duke john normandy made heynault cap xlvii duke john norma dy eldyst sonne french kyng made assemble saynt quyntines hym duke athene therle flaunders erle aucerr erle ewe constable fraunce therle porcyen therle roussy therle bresne therle de graut pre lorde couey lorde craon dyuers noble normandy lowe march whan assembled anone easter yere lorde ccc xl constable two marshal nombred company vi thousand men armes viii folowynge hoost went forthe feldes went towarde castell ca bre ser passed bohayn rode tyll passed sayd castell cambre lodged towne montays ryuer sels sir rycharde uerchyne stewarde henalt knewe spyes duke normandy moutays desyred certayne knightes squyers suche wer nere hym go hym thyder wolde bringe graunted hym departed fro house uerchyn hym l speares rode forthe fro sonne settyng tyll came forest yssuyng heynalt lytell leage fro montays tyme night rested hym felde sayde company howe wolde go wake duke montays wherof right ioyouse sayd howe wolde aduenture hym lyue dye thanked hym ser jaques de sart sir hery phalyse sir olpharte du guystelles sir john du chastellet sir bertrande squyers gyles thyerty sommayne baudwyn beaufort colebrier brule moreau lescuyer sawdart de stramen johan robersat bridoull de thyaulx dyuerse rode priuely came motays entred towne frechmen made watche stewarde company alyghted fayre great lodgyng wenyng theym duke lodged ther house loged ii great lordes normandy lorde baylleull lorde beaulte quickely assayled gate broken pynne whan hard cry heynalt basshed defeded theselfe well might ther lorde baylleull slayne lorde beautie taken fayne promyse seneshall fayth trouth yelde hymselfe prisoner wt thre dayes uale cens frenchman began stirr towne came logynges fiers lighted vp torch candels eche raysed vp woke duke rose armed hym hast displayed baner logyng euery man drue thyder heynoues withdrue backe sagely horse mounted whan wer gyder x xii good prisoner returned without damage wer nat pursued darke came day quesnoy rested rode ualencens mornyng duke comaunded dysloge entre heynalt bren contrey wt mercy fore ryders went forthe ii c speares captayns sir thybalt marncyle galoys baume lorde myrpois lorde rayuenall lorde sempy lorde john landas lorde hangest lorde tramels rode two marshal fyue c speres duke lord knyghtes fore ryders burnt forest bertran bertynguinell escarmayne uedegres wod uedegres sandes vpon ryuer cynell next day went forwarde brent osmelnall uyllers gomegynes marchepoys pestell aufroy pyepreux fresnoy obeys good towne banoy co trey ryuer homell second day marshal company made gret assaut skirmysshe castell uerchy e wan nothyng ther well defended went lodged ryuer selz bytwene ausey sansoy sir ualeron lorde falquemont captayne towne maubenge hym c speares almayns heynowes whane knewe frenchman rode brent contrey sawe howe poore peple wept armed hym company left towne kepyng lorde beau reuoyr lord montigny sayd wolde gladly fynde frenchman rode day coostyng forest moriuall agaynst nyght harde howe duke normandy loged ryuer sels sayd wolde go wake rode forthe mydnight passed ryuer gyde whan ouer made hym company redy rode fayre easely tyll came duke logyng whan nere spurred horse dasshed thoost cryed falquemont cut downe tentes pauilyons slewe dyuers men dyd great hurt hoost began sterre armed drewe part noyse lorde falquemont whan sawe tyme drue backe frechmen ther slayne lorde pyquegny taken prisoner vycont quesnes borgne rouuory sore hurt sir antony condune whan ye lorde falquemont thought best departed copany passed ryuer sels without damage wer nat folowed sonne risyng came quesnoy sir thyerrie uallecourt opyned gate next day dede duke normady caused trumpettes blowen passed tyuer sels entred heynalt suche rode ye marshall mitpoys lord noysiers galoys baulme sir thybalt marneyle iiii c speares besyde brigantes came quesnoy bariers made semblant gyue assaut within well prouyded good men warre artyllery shulde haue lost payne beit made lytell skirmyssh bayles last fayne wtdrawe quesnoy dyscharged certayne peces artyllery shotte great quarels wherof frechmen frayd sleyng horse withdrue backe goyng brent uergyn great uergyn lytell frelanes sa uers artes semeries artuell saryten turgies estynen aulnoy dyuers yt smoke came ualencenes frenchman ordayned batels mout caster nere ualencenes certayne lorde craon lorde mauluryer lorde mathelon lorde dauoyr two c speares rode towarde mayng came assayled great wre parteyninge john uernyer ualecens afterwarde teyning john neuell ther great fierse assaut endurynge nygh day frenchman departed slayne v vi within defeded themselfe well yt toke damage frenchman went try wenyng first comynge haue past water wne broken bridge defended passage frenchman coude neuer haue way thane ther among knewe passage contrey brought two c men fote passed plankes ponny sone ouer came try small nombre coude nat endure agaynst fledde dyuers slayne hurt day se neshall heynalt departed ualencens c men armes socour trye lytell fro saynt wast met rrv currours frenchman lorde boucyqualt marshall frace lorde surgeres sir wyllyam bladeau captayns passed bridge ualencenes called bridge de la tourell whan seneshall heynalt sawe ranne bare downe speare lorde boucyquault toke hym prisoner sent hym ualencens lorde surgeres scaped ser wyllyam blandeau taken sir henry dusphalyse wer taken slayne fewe scaped seneshal went towarde try came late frenchemen wonne came beatyng downe mylles lytell castell ther whan seneshall came leaser wer put backe slay ne put flight chased nere many lept ryuer lescalt drowned thus towne try delyuerd seneshall went passed ye ryuer lescalt deuayng copany rode castell uerchyn entred kepe defede yf nede season duke normandy mout caster nygh day thinkynge euer yt ualencennes wolde haue yssued haue fought hym wolde fayne haue done sir henry dantoynge rule towne nat ben wolde suffre man yssue gate cambresen moch kepe peple wt ye prouost towne fayre wordes great reason peased peple whan ye duke sawe wolde nat yssue gyue hym batayle sent ye duke athene marshal faunce therle aucerre lorde chastelon thre hundred speares rynne ualencens rode good order came bayls ye syde tourell taryed nat long feared shot sleynge horse howbeit ye lorde chastelon rode forwarde horse fell vnder hym yt fayne leape another retourned march brent bete downe mylles ye tyuer uyncell cae chartreux hoost agayne ther frenchman taryed behynde marlyto gette forage case kept tow therby teyning heyres heynault somtyme belongyng sir robert de namur yt right lady isabell wyfe whan parceyued frechemen yt behynde hoost howe thoost farre fro yssued set slewe many toke pyllage entred agayn toure season yet great batayle styll mount castres whan currers came euery syde toke counsayle shulde lordes sayd nombre suffycient assaut towne ualencennes finally determyned go cambray nyght went lodged monyg fountnelles made good watche next mornyng departed ar went brent monyg fountnelles abbay parteyning lady ualoys suster germayne fre che kyng wherof duke sore dyspleased caused hanged beganne fyre departyng brent towne try castell beate downe mylles brent prony romminy thyaur mouceaulr playne contrey twene cambray ualencennes thane duke came escandure castell parteynynge erle heynault standyng strongly ryuer lescault whiche garyson hadde greuyd sore towne cambray capytayne therof sir gararde sassegynes whan duke ben castell six dayes gyuen vp wherof countrey hadde great marueyle great suspect treason captayne sir gararde squyer called robert marmeaulr bothe dyed shamefully mon heynalt cambray bete downe castell bare stone towne make reparacyons withall p howe doway made iournay ostrenan howe therle heynalt england ca xlviii dystruction escandure duke normady went cambray gaue leaue co pany depart sent garysons doway first weke came doway yssued lyste theym thre hundred speares capytaynes sir loyes sauoy therle geneue therle uyllars galoys baulme lorde waurayne lorde uasyers went brent fayre contrey ostrenan heynault lest nothynge forteresses wherwith bouhay sore dysplesed sawe fyers smoke coude nat remedy soo sent ualencennes wolde yssue sixe hundred speres night thei shuld moche damage frenchman spredde abrode playne countrey howe ualencennes wolde natte go towne frenchman great pray brent towne nyche descoux escaudan monteny senayne uerlayne uargny ambretycourt lourg salr ruette newfuylle lyeu saynt amande vyllages contrey wan great pyllage whan doway gone home soudyers bohayne yssued brent halfe descon whiche frenche vyllages parteyning france iuste gate doway towne desquerchyne thus haue deuysed garysons countreis prouyded dyuerse skirmysshes feates warre vsed amonge theym tyme certayne soudyours almaygne sette bysshoppe cambray fortresse male mayson two leages fro castell cambresien marchynge parte nere ladreches wherof lorde poytrell captayne therle bloys though wer lorde therof yet rendred therle heynalt bycause frenche day almayns male mayson cae ye bayles landreches draue away gret pray whan landreches knewe therof lord poytrels armed company yssued rescue pray lorde poytrels formast hymselfe layd spere rest cryed frenchman sayd sir shame flye away squyer called albert colayne turned couched spere rest came rennyng agaynst lorde poytrell gaue hym suche stroke targe spere flewe peace yet sayd squyer strake hym agayne suche stroke spere entred harnes body iust hert fell f horse deed copanyons h ous lorde bansiers garard de mastyne john mastyn pursued frechmen suche wyse taken ayne moost part fewe scaped pray rescued suche prisoner landreches retourned agayne lorde poytrels deed whose dethe lorde floron long tyme captayne landreches castell ther thus day rode forthe frenchman day heynous dyuers encountrynges bytwene thus countrey heynault great trybulacion parte therof brent duke normandy styll fronters man knewe wolde coulde tidynges therle heynalt true englande wher kyng lordes made hym great made great alyance kyng departed englande went themperour loys banyer cause ye taryed long owne countrey also sir johanne heynalt gone brabant flaunders shewed erle brabant jaques dartuell desolacyon countrey heynalt prayeng name heynowes wold gyue th counsell ayde answered sure therle wolde shortly returne tyme sayd wolde redy go hym whyther wolde p howe duke normandy layed siege thyne leuesque cap xlix mean season duke normandy cambray bysshoppe burgess towne shewed duke heynowes get stelth strong castell thyne desyring hym comon profet countrey wolde fynde remedy ye garyson ther dyd moche hurt cotrey duke called agayne toguyder men warre artoyse uermandoys deted cambray came thyne ryuer lescalt fayre playne medowes towarde ostrenan duke caryed hym cambray doway dyuerse great engyns specially vi made reared agayne fortres engyns dyd cast night day great stone bete downe roffes chamber halle towres within fayne kepe vautes sellars thus within suffred great payne captayns within wer sir rycharde lymosyn englysshe two squyers heynault bretherne therle namur johane thyerry thre charge sayd often tyme company sir surely one dayes therle heynalt wyl come agaynst frenchman delyuer v honour ryd v paryll shal v great thanke haue kept fortres longe ingens without dyd cast deed horse beestes stynkig wherby within great dystres thaue thynge ayre hote myddes somer stynke ayre abomynable consydred howe finally coude nat long endure toke aduyse desyre truse xv dayes space sende aduertyse ser john heynalt ruler contrey therles absence without dyde socour space yelde vp fortres duke treaty put forth agreed vnto wt sent squyer called estrelart de sommayne sir john heynalt mon heynalt squyer foude hym nuely harde fro nephue therle howe comyng home warde countrey hadde themperour made great alyance hym kyng england lordes thempyre sir john henault shewed squyer sendyng worde thyne shortly shulde conforted returne nephue therle use duryng le heynalt returned home wherof peple wer gretly reioysed lorde beamonde vncle shewed hym mater done syth departyng howe duke normady fayne fronters brent dystroyed great part contrey therle answered howe shulde well amended sayng howe realme fra ce great ynough make satisfaction forfeturs done determyned brefelye go ayde men thyne honorably defended fortress ye erle sent men almayne flanders owne contrey came ualen cennes daylie nombre encreased departed then great aray caryag tentes pauilyons went lodged na ye playne long ye ryuer lescalt ther lordes heynalt sir john heynalt lorde ghyn lord uerchyn seneshall heynalt lorde dantoyng lorde barb son lorde lens sir wyllyam baylleull lorde hauereth chatelayne mon lorde montegny lord barbays sir thyrrie ualecourt marshall henalt lorde dalmed gomegynes lorde brisuell lorde roysine lorde trasegmes lorde de lalayne lorde mastyne lorde sars lorde uargny lorde beaury u dyuerse ther serue therle lorde also thyder came therle namur ii hundred speares cae duke brabant vi hudred speres duke guerles therle mon lorde falquemont sir arnolde baquechen dyuerse lordes men warre almaygne whytphall loged along ryuer lescault agaynst frenche hoost plentie vytails came heynalt whafie lordes thus lodged bytwene nauns illoys duke normandy part goodly nombre men warr sende worde father howe therls hoost dayly encreased frenche kynge bevnge peron raysed vp mo men warre sende sonne xii hundred speares hymselfe came sonnes hoost lyke soudyour myght come army vpon themperour without heshulde breke othe dyde duke normandy named cheife army dyd nothyng counsayle kyng father whan wtin thyne sawe therle heynalt suche puyssance right ioyeous fourth day yt erle come thyder ualence came thyder great ay john e boy sey prouost towne capytayne ther skirmyssh made agaynst frenchemen dyuers hurt bothe meane season within fortres bottes barge redy pa e ryuer le ault brought erle heyualt ioyously honourably receyued tyme two hostes lodged ryuer lescault chmen towarde fraunce heynowes towarde owne contreis forage rode forthe met nat bycause ryuer euer bytwene frechmen went brent cotrey ostrenan nat brent heynowes likewyse contrey cambreses also ayde therle heynault desyre jaques came thyther l thousande mmynges wel armed therle heynalt sent duke normandy haraltes ther might batell bytwene howe shulde great shame many men warre assembled togyder batayle duke answered howe wolde take aduyse counsell mater counsell long haraldes departed without answere third day therle sent agayne knowe duke intencyon duke answered nat yet fully counselled fight assigne day batayle sayng moreouer howe therle hasty whan erle harde thought delay sent gret lordes hoost shewyng done answere duke made hym desyring th haue counsell euery man loked man wold speke first last duke brabat spake sayd make bridge go ouer sight frechmen nat myne opynion knowe certaynly shortly kyng englande wyll come ouer thesee lay sege turney haue sworne ayd confort hym canne wherfore shulde nowe fyght frechmen fortune agayne v happe lese felde shulde lose vyage helpe shulde haue v vyctorie shulde v thanke wherfore intencyon without hym chefe warre fyght nat power fraunce whan shalbe turney hym frenche kynge agaynst v thynke wyll harde depart without batell wherfore wolde cousell let v depart lye great coost charge sure within x dayes shall fro kyng englande aduyce moost part lordes agreed therle heynalt desyred generall nat depart sone agreed tary lengar brussels wolde fayne haue ben gone louane day therle called hym sir john heynalt vncle sayd fayre vncle pray ryde downe long ryuer syde call ou r ryuer speke persone trenche hoost desyre hym shewe frenche kyng fro wyll make brydge ouer water may haue thre dayes respyte woll coe ouer gyue hym batell lorde beamond rode downe long ryuer lescalt xiii knyghtes hym penon hym last parceyued syde knyght normandy knewe hym armes called hym sayd sir maubousson pray speke knight sayd sir wold desyre quod lorde beamonde ye wyll go frenche kyng counsayle say erle heynault hath sende hyther take truse onely whyles yt might make brige ouer ryuer wherby myght passe ouer pray bring agayne answere shall tary tyll ye retourne lord maubusso strake horse ye spurres rode kyng tent ye duke normandy many lord ther shewed message short answere comaunded tell hym sent thyder ye case helde erle likewyse wold cotynue sayng wold make hym sell lande shuld haue warr euery syde whan lyst woll entre heynalt farr yt woll bren eotrey answer lorde maubusson reported lorde beamod thanked hym labour retourned therle found playng chesse therle namur assone therle sawe vncle rose harde answere frenche kynge sent hym wherwith erle dysplesed sayd well trust shall nat purposeth p batell see sluse flauders bytwene kynge england frenchman ca l let v leaue somwhat speke therle henalt duke normandy speke ye kyng england ye see intent arryue flaunders heynalt make warr agaynst frechmen mydsomer euyn yer lorde c c c xl thenglyssh flete departed ryuer tames toke way sluse tyme bytwene blanqueberque sluse see sir newe kyryell sir peter bahuchet barbnoyr mo sirscore great vessel besyde wer normayns bydaulr genowes pycardes nobre xl ther layd french kyng defend ye kyng englandes passage kyng england came saylyng tyll cae sluse whan sawe great nombre shippes yt mastes semed lyke gret wood demauded maister shyp peple thought answered sayd sir thynke normayns layd ye frenche kyng hath done gret dyspleasur englande brent towne hampton taken great shyppe christofer kyng haue long desyred fyght fre chmen nowe shall fyght grace god saynt george truly haue done many dysplesurs yt shall reuenged may king set shyppes order grettest befor well furnysshed archer euer bytwene two shyppes archer one shypp wt men armes made batell ly lofe archer confort euer moost wery yf nede ther great nombre countess ladyes knyght wyues damosel yt goyng se quene gaunt ladyes ye kyng caused well kept thre hundred men armes v c archer p whan kyng marshal ordered batayls brewe vp seales quarter wynde haue vauntage sonne last tourned lytell get wynde wyll whan normayns sawe recule backe maruell dyde sayd thynke selfe nat mete medyll v wherfore woll go backe sawe well howe kyng england ther personally reason baners dyd appareyle flete order wer sage good men warr see dyd set christofer yer formast many trumpettes instrumentes set ennemies ther began sore batell bothe partes archer crosbowes began shore men armes aproched fought bande hande better come togyder great hokes graperss prou cast one shyppe tyed fast togyder ther many dedess armes done takyng rescuyng agayne last great christofer first theglysshmen within taken slayne ther great noyse cry thenglysshmen aproched fortifyed christofer archer made hym passe byfore fyght genoweyss batayle right fierse terryble batayls see dangerous fierser batayls lande see ther i reculyng sseyng ther remedy fight abyde fortune euery man shewe prowes trouthe sir newe kyriell sir bahuchet bathe noyer ryght good expert men warre batayle endured fro mornyng tyll noone glysshmen endured moche payne ennemies foure agaynst one good men see ther king england noble knight ownehand stouer yongh like wyse erle derby pebroke herforde hutyngdon northampton glocetter sir raynolde cobham sir rycharde stafforde lorde percy sir water manny sir henry flaunders sir john beauchamp lorde felton ye lorde brasseton sir chandos lorde dalawarre lorde multon sir robert dartoys called erle rychmont dyuerse lordes knyghtess bare themselfe valy antly socours brug countrey obtayned vyctorie frechmen normaynss dysconsetted slayne drowned nat one scaped slayne whane vyctorie atchyued kyng nyght abode shyppe sluse great noyse trupettes instrumentes thyder came se kynge dyuers flaunders suche herde ye kynges comyng kyng demaunded burgess bruges howe jaques dartuell dyd answered gone erle heynalt agaynst duke normady lx ssemynges next day mydsomer day kyng toke lande kyng fote went pylgrimage lady ardebourge ther herd masse dyned thane toke horse rode gaunt quene receyued hym great ioye caryage ca e lytell lytell kyng wrote therle heynault theym within castell thyne certyfieng arryuall whan therle knewe therof dysconfyted army see dylloged gaue leaue souldyours depart toke hym ualencennes great lordes ther feasted honourably specially duke brabant jaques dartuell ther jaques dartuell openly market place presence lordes wold hym declared right kyng englande crowne fra ce also puyssaunce thre countreis flaunders heynault brabant surely ioyned one alyance dyde great wysdome plesaunt wordes people harde hym praysed hym moche sayd howe nobly spoken great experyeee thus greatly praysed sayd yt well worthy gouerne countie flaunders lordes departed promysed mete agayne within viii dayes gaunt se kyng england dyd kyng feasted honorably dyd quene nuly purifyed sonne called john duke lancastre wyfe doughter duke henry lacastre ther cou sell set uyllenort day lymitted p howe kynge robert cicyll dyd might pacyfie kyng fraunce englande cap whan french king harde howe army see dyscoufyted dylloged drewe arras gaue leaue men depart tyll harde tidynges sent sir godmar du fay tourney se lacked nothyng feared itemynges sent lord beautewe mortayn kepe fronters agaynst heynalt sent many warr saynt omers ayre saynt enaunt purueyed suffyciently forteresses frontyng flanders season ther raygned kyng cicyll called robert reputed great astronomyer alwayes warned frenche kyng counsell wyse shulde fight agaynst king englande sayd gyuen king englande right fortunate dedes kyng robert wold gladly haue sene two kynges good acorde loued somoch crowne fraunce right sorte se desolacyon cherof kynge cicyll auygnone pope clement colledge ther declared peryls likely fall realme fra ce warr byt wene sayd two kyng de syring wold helpe fynde meanes apease wher vnto pope cardynals answered howe wolde gladly intende therto two kynges wolde e p counsayle kynge englande alyes helde uyllenort cap lii counsayle holden uyllenort lordes foloweth kyng england duke brabant therle henalt ser john vncle duke guerles therle jullers marque faulquehoure marque musse therle mon sir robert dartoys lorde falquemont sir wyllyam dunort therle namur jaques dartuell many great lordes euery good towne flanders thre iiii personage maner counsayle ther grement made bytwene thre contreis fla ders brabat heynalt fro then forth eche shulde ayde confort case ther made assurace ech countrey thother two shulde gyue ayde shulde dyscorde one thyrde shulde set agremet bytwene nat able mater shulde put vnto kynge englande whose handes mater sworne promysed agre inconfyrmacion loue amyte ordayned lawe ryn throughout iii contres ye called lawe companyons alyes ther determyned yt kyng englade shulde remoue maudelentyde ley siege turney ther mete sayd lordes thers power good wnes euery man departed owne house aparell behalfe p howe kyng england hesieged cyte tourney great puysance cap liii frenche kyng departure lordes fro counsell uyllenort knewe part determynacion set tourney chefe men warr frauce therle ewe yong erle guynes sonne constable fraunce therle foytz bretherne therle amery narbon sir aymer poyters sir geffray charney sir gararde mountfaucon two marshal sir robert bertrand sir mathue de troy lorde caieur senesshall poyctou lord chastelayn sir john landas valyant knyghtes squyers came tourney founde sir godmar du fay ther toke regarde prouisyon towne well vytels thartyllerie forti ficatyon causen brought contrey otes prouysion p nowe let v retourne kyng englande whan tyme aproched alyes shuld mete tourney corne beganne rype departed fro gaunt vii erles contrey viii prelate xxviii baronettes ii c knyghtes foure thousande men armes archer besyde fotemen hoost passed towne andwarpe passed uer escalt lodged tourney gate called saynt martyne way arde lysle doway anone came duke brabant mo x men knyghtes squyers comons lodged brige aryes ryuer lescalt bytwene thabbey saynt nycholas gate uale tenoys next hym came therle heynault gooly company contrey many holande zelande loged bytwene kyuge duke brabaunt came jaques dartuell mo tha l thousande slemmynges besyde pre dropingne cassell bergues sent syde ye shall jaques dartuell lodged gate saynt fountayne duke guerles therse jullers marque blaqueboure marque musse therle mon therle sauynes lord falquemount sir arnolde baquechew almayns lodged syde towarde heynalt thus cytie tourney cnuyroned rounbe euery hoost myght resort eche none coulde yssue without spyeug p howe therle heynalt yed townes ne dorchyes cap liiii sige enduring without wer well prouyded vytels metely pri ce came fro partes mornynge erle heynalt v hundred speres departed fro hoost passed lysle brent good towne seclyne many vyllages currours ranne subarbes lens artoyse erle toke way rode towne durchies whiche taken brent nar closed also burnt landas ly dyuers good townes ouer ranne countrey gate great yllage retourned agayne hoost turney also flemynges often tymes assay led tourney made shyppes belsroys instrumentes assaut euery day lightly skirmysshyng dyuerse hurt one stemmynges toke moche payne trouble tourney among assautes ther one endured day ther many feates armes done lordes knyghtes tournay therat thassaut made shyppes vessel wrought intent haue broken baryers posterne arche well defended sle mynges wanne nothyng ther lost shypp sixscore men drowned night withdrue right sore traueyled siege enduryng soudyours sayut amandeyssued came hanon heynalt burnt towne vyolated abbey dystroyed mynster caryed away might saynt amande tyme frenche soudyours passed wood saynt amande came abbey uycongue made great fyre gate haue burnt whan thabbot sawe parell house hastely toke horse rode priuely wood came ualencennes desyring prouost ther lend hym certayne crosbowes whane desyre brought behynde rames set wood towarde hyghe way procelet ther shotte agaynst genowayes frenchman beyng gate uycongne whan sawe felt quarels lyght among commyng fro wood frayed retourned fast myght abbey saued p scottes wan agayne gret part scotlande whyle siege tourney cap lv howe reme bred sir wyllyam duglas sonne wyllm duglas brother dyed spayne therle patris therle surlant sir robert herssey sir symonde fresyell alysander ramsey captayns suche parte scotlande left vnwonne thenglysshmen cotynued forest gode0urs ye space vii yere wynter somer might made warr agaynst thenglysshmen beyng ther garyson somtyme good adueture somtyme yuell whyle kyng englande siege tourney french kyng sent men warr scotlande arryued saynt johans towne desyred scottes french kyng name wolde set make warr realme england kyng might fayne retourne home rescue owne realme leaue vp sige tourney frenche kyng promysed men money ayde scottes departed forest gedeours passed thorough scotlande wanne agayne dyuerse fortress past towne berwyke ryuer tyne entred contrey northumberlande somtyme realme ther founde gret plentie beestes wasted brent contrey durame retourned way dystroyeng countrey voyage distroyed thre dayes iourney realme englande thane retourned scotlande conquered agayne fortress holden englysshmen except cyte berwyke thre castels dyd great trouble stronge wolde haue ben harde haue founde suche countrey one strumelyn rosbourg third chyefe scotlande edenborowe whiche castell standeth hygh rocke man must rest one twyse soe hyest hyll captayne ther sir water lymosen valiantly kept castell thyne agaynst frenchman sir wyllyam duglas deuysed feate dyscouerd intencyon copanyons therle patris sir robert fresyell alysander ramsay agreed togyder tha toke ii c wylde scottes entred see made prouisyon otes mele cole wood pesably thei arryued port nere castelll edenbo rowe night armed theym toke x xii company suche dyd trust best dyde disgyse theym poore torne cote hattes lyke poore men co trey charged xii small horse sack otes mele cole dyde set company busshment olde distroyed abbey ther nere fote hyll whan ye day began apere couertly armed went vp hyll marchandyse whan mydde way ser wyllyam duglas sir symode fresyll disgysed went lytell came porter sayd sir gret fere haue brought hyther otes whetemele ye haue nede therof woll sell gode chepe mary sayd porter haue nede therof erly darre nat wake captayne stuarde let soe shall opyn vtter gate entred gate bayles sir wyllm duglas sawe well porter key handes great gate castell whan firste gate opynned ye haue harde horse caryages entred two came last laden cole made fall downe grounsyll gate thentent gate shulde nat closed agayne toke porter slewe hym pesably neuerr spake worde toke great key opynned castell gate sir wyllyam duglas blewe horne dyd cast away torne cote layed sackes ouerthwarte gate thyntent shulde nat shytte agayne whan busshment harde horne hast myght mounted hyll watchman castell noyse horne woke sawe peple wer comyng armed castell warde blewe horne cryed treason treson sir ryse arme shortly yonder men armes aprochynge fortresse euery man arose armed cae gate sir wyllyam duglas xii companyons defended gate coude nat close great valyantnesse kept thentre opyn tyll busshment cae within defended castell well might hurt dyuers without ser wyllyam scottes dyd somoch conquered fortresse englyssmen within slayne excepte captayne sire squyers scott taryed ther day made knyght contrey captayn ther called symode uessey hym dyuers contrey tidynges came kyng englande tourney p great hoost frenche kyng assembled rayse siege tourney cap lvi haue harde howe kynge englande besieged cyte tourney mo sixscore thousande men armes flemmynge bycause vytayles within cytie beganne mynisshe frenche lordes within caused uoyde towne maner poore people nat furnysshed abyue aduenture siege put opynne day passed duke brabates hoost shewed grefe caused besafely brought freche hoost ara kyng lay ther made gret assemble men owne co trey part empyre thyder came hym kyng behaygne duke loraygne therle bare bysshoppe mets coerdune therle mountbelieu sir john chalon erle geuyne erle sauoy lorde lewes sauoy brother lordes came serue frenche kynge power also thyder came duke bretaygne duke burgoyne duke borbone therle alanson therle flanders therle forestes therle arminacke therle bloyes sir charles bloyes therle harcourt therle damartyn lorde coucy dyuers lordes knightes came kyng nauarr goodly nobre men warre contrey fra ce helde frenche kyng therby cae serue hym also kynge scott certayne nobre apoynted hym p howe soudyers garyson bohayne dystrussed certayne soudyers mortayne towne conde ca lvii whan sayde lordes come ara frenche kyng remeuyd came lytell ryuerr thre leages fro turney water depe rounde full marysshes man coude passe lytell way narowe two horse coude nat passe fronte kyng lay passed nat ryuer durst nat next day hoostes lay styll lordes counsayled make bridge passe ouer water ease ther wey men sent aduyse passage whan well aduysed euery thyng thought lost labour shewed kynge howe ther passage brige cressyn thus mater abode case tidynges anone spred abrode howe french kyng lodged bytwene bridge cressyn bridge bonnes thentent fight ennemies maner people suche desyred honoure ue one part owed seruyce fauoure ther thre almayns bretherne bouhaygne whan harde howe two kynges aproched nere togyder like lyhode fight two desyred abyde styll kepe ye fortres sayd wolde go se chere tourney two knyght de te one called sir courrat dastra sir courrat lancenuch rode tyll came escampons besyde ualenc thinkyng passe ryuer lescalt conde bytwene fresnes escampons harde gret brunt men sawe howe came fleyng themwarde two bretherne nombre xxv speares encountred first demauded ayled fle away name god sir soudyers mortayne aryssued haue get great pray goynge therwith towarde fortresse also haue taken dyuers prisoner countrey tha two bretherne sayd sir ye lede v ther sayde yes went frenchman gyding poore men frechmen nere lady wood wer sixscore soudyers draue c great beestes certayne prisoner men cotrey captayne knyght burgone called john de frelays teyninge lorde beauieuu assone almayns sawe ascryed ran fiersly among ther sore fight burgonyon knyght dyd put hymselfe defence co pany nat ther dyuers sted nere chased almayns men countrey ther scaped fewe slayne taken sir john de frelays taken pray rescued rendred agayne men contrey aduenture almayns cae tourney wher welcome p iourney sir wyllm baylleull sir ualflart de la croyse made bridge cressyn cap lviii none frenche kyng lodged thus bridge bouues company heynous settyng sir wyllm bayllule lorde uauflart de la croyse sayd howe knewe contrey wolde bring place frenche hoost shulde haue wynnynge mornyng departed fro thoost sirscore copanyons knyghtes squyers rode towarde dont de cressyn made lorde bayllule chefe baner euery man shulde drawe nowe mornyng rode forthe certayne nobre legoys french party wherof ser robert de baylleull brother foresayd sir wyllm baylleull chefe captayn ther two bretherne dyuers party lyegois passed bride cressyn foragyng horse se coude fynde aduenture profitable heynowes rode mornyng without fyndyng adueture also passed bridge ther myst man coude nat se length spere hym whan heynous ouer ordayned sir wyllm baylluell baner shuld abyde bridge sir uauflart sir raflet de monceaur sir john de uerchyne shulde aduenture farther went farr dasshed thoost kynge behayne bysshopp liege lodged nere bridge lorde rademache made watche nyght poynt detyng bytwene ther sore conflict beit fynally heynous drue backe towarde brige liegoys lucebourzins folowed sir wyllm baylluell counselled repasse agayne bridge baner thei dyuers copany repasse heynous repassed agayne aswell might passynge ther many dedes armes done takynge rescuyng agayne fortuned sir uauflart coude nat repasse brige fayne saue hymselfe aswell might yssued preace toke away knewe well entred marsh among busshes rockes ther taryed fought styll brige ther liegoys ouercame ser wyllm baylleuls company therwith sir robert baylleull whan harde noyse parte cae rynning thyder baner hym whan heynowes sawe baner moraynes byleued ben baner sir wyllm bayllule drue thyder ther small dyfferece bytwene baners armes morians barres counterbarres two cheurons gowles cheuron ser robert baylleull ther lytell crosse golde heynous toke hede wherby disconfyted slayne john de uergny sir water du pont de large sir wyllm pype poix dyuers taken sir john de soyre sir danyell de bleze sir race de mo ceaur sir loys dampelen dyuers sir wyllm de baylleul scaped aswell might lost moche copany ser uauflart de la croyse marysshe trustyng haue ben ther tyll ben night haue scaped spyed rode longe marese made suche cry hym cae yelded hym selfe prisoner toke brought hym hoost delyuered hym maister wolde gladly haue saued hi knewe well ieopardy lyfe anone tidynges hym brought french kyng cotynent dyd send hym kyng immediatly sent hym lyle bycause done moche damage win towne dyd put deth wold wyse haue pyte hym put hym ransome p howe therle heynault assayled fortresse mortayne picardy dyuers maners cap lix dede sir robert bayllieull done frenche kyng ryght ioyouse within season erle heynault sir john vncle sene shall heynalt vi hundred speares heynowes almayns departed fro siege turney therle sent ualences shulde come mete hym mortayne come bytwene lescharpe lescault assayle mortayne came thyder great array brought great engyus lorde beauieu captayne within mortayn greatly douted assautyng bycause fortresse stode nere ryuer nere heynault party therfore caused xii c pyle driuen ryuer thyntent passage shulde way howbeit erle heynault heynous came thyder one syde ualencens part incotynent made assaut aproched barrers ther suche depe trench coude nat coe nere aduysed passe ryuer lescharpe coe syde towarde saynt amand make assaut gate toward maulde deuysed foure hundred passed ryuer mortayne closed thre te wekyst syde towarde mauld howbeit ther strength ynough parte came lorde beauieu hymselfe defende feared none sydes hande great glaue sharpe well elyd aboue blade ther sharpe hoke stele whan gaue stroke hoke shulde take holde loke whome fastened came hym el fell water meanes day cast water mo xii gate assant feresyst erle heynalt othersyde knewe nothyng assaut araynged aloge ryuer syde lescault deuysed howe might get riuer pyle byforce subtyltie might come iust walles ordayned make shypp gret engyn drawe pyle eche one carpenter set warke engyn made shyppe day ualencens raysed syde great engyn dyd cast stone fore troubled within thus first day passed night assayling deuysing howe might greue fortresse nexte day went assaut partes thirde day shypp redy thengyn drawe pyle dyd set awarke drawe ther many suche labour doyng coude drawe one wery craft lordes wolde neuer begon comaunded cease warke part within mortayne connyng maister makyng engyns sawe well howe thengyn ualencens dyd greatly greue raysed engyn castell nat great trymmed poynt cast therwith thre tymes firste stone fell xii fote fro thengyn without seconde fell nerer thirde stone hit euyn brake clene sonder shaft thengyn without dyer mortaygne made great shout thus heynous coude get nothyng ther therle sayd howe wolde wt drawe go agayne siege tourney dyd ualencens retourned towne p howe therle heynault toke towne saynt amande duryng siege tourney cap lx thre dayes therle heynault retourned fro mortaygne desyred certayne companyons go saynt amande dyuers complayntes soudyers saynt amand burnt thabbey hanon nere brent uycoigne done many dispyt fronters heynalt therle departed fro sige iii men came saynt amand syde towarde mortayne towne nat closed pale captayne ther knyght laguedoke seneshall cracassone sayd mo kes thabbey ther towne nat able holde agaynst hoost sayd rather wolde det wold kepe best power sayd maner counsell howbeit wordes nat byleued long iuels abbey caryed mortaygne suretie thyder went abbot moke men warr ualencenes came therles comaundement xii thousande men crosbo wes kept gate warde bridge lesharpe began ferse assaut many sore hurt bothe party assaut endured day ualencens coude get nothynge ther within scorned mocked sayd sir go way drink good ale agaynst night ualencennes withbre right wery gret marueyle coude tidynges therle lord therfore dysloged drewe towarde towne next mornyng tymes therle departed fro turney came saynt amand syde towarde mortayne incotynet made assaute feers cruell wan first bayles came gate war de mortaygne ther therle vncle made great assaut eche stroke heed stone basenettes clouen heedes sore astonyed last one sayd therle sir way shall neuer entre way strayet strongly kept sir make great rames wood like pyle let v ronne agaynst abbey walles shall peerse dyuers place get thabbey towne therle comaunded done anone gret peace tymber wer gote made sharpe euery pece twentie xxx person ronnyng ther agaynst wall brake wall dyuers place valyantly entred ther passed lytell ryuer ranne within ther redy seneshall carcassone baner hym goules sheffe syluerthre cheuorns sheffe bordred syluer indented copany defended valyantly heynowes long might defence coude nat auayle heynowes wer somany entryng thabbey ther monke called danne frossart dyde maruels kylled hurt hole ther stode x iii none durst entre place finally fayne depart sawe howe henous entred abbey dyuers place soo monke saued hymselfe aswell might went mortayne whan therle copany wer entred thabbey comaunded yt shulde put swerde sore dyspleased hym done suche hurt contrey towne anone full men armes chased sought fro strete strete euery house yt fewe scaped wer slayne seneshall slayne vnder standarde ii c men rounde hym agaynst night therle retourned turney next day ualencens cae gayne saynt amand brent clene towne thabbey minster brake belle goodly another day therle agayne deted fro siege vi c men armes went brent orchies ladas chell passed hanon ryuer lesharpe went france great abbey aryche called marchienes wherof sir amye uernaulx captayne hym certayne crosbowes doway ther therle made assaut captayne well fortifyed firste gate great depe dyke frenchman monkes ther defended theselfe right nobly heynous last gate botes barge therby entred thabbey knyght almayne drowned copanyon lorde falquemont called sir bacho de la wyer therle vncle seneshall dyd gate valyantly gate wone sir amye copany slayne taken ther taken dyuers monkes thabbey robbed brent towne also therle retourned siege tourney p takyng charles momorency dyuers frenchemen bridge cressyn cap lxi siege tourney long great kyng england supposed euer wyn knewe well ther moche people within scant vytayle wherefore thought famyssh sayde founde fomme courtesy theym brabaunt sufferynge vytayles passe hoost cyte brussels louane wer sore wery taryeng ther long desyred marshall thost might haue leaue retourne brabat marshall sayd well co tent must leue harnes hynde answere shamed neuer spake therof p nowe shall shewe iourney ye almayns made bridge cressyne wher sir robert bayllule dysconfited ye heynowes lorde rauderodece sir john son john raudebourg esquyer ser arnold baquehen sir raynolde descouuenort sir rorrant dasto sir bastyen de baste drelyer brother sir strauren de leurne dyuerse duchy jullers guerles rode forthe day also certayne bachellers heynalt sir floren beauryon sir latas de la hey marshall thoost sir john heynalt ser oulphart guystels sir robert gleuues therldome loz dyuers wer thre c came bridge cressyn passed without danger toke counsell shulde thought moste honour go wake french host ther ordayned lorde rauderondence son sir henry keukren sir tylman sausey ser olphart guystels ser lalemat bastarde heynalt robert gleuues jaquelat tyaulx shulde ryde sodenly dasshe frenche host knyghtes squyers nombre thre c shulde abyde styll brige kepe ye passage thus currours rode forthe nobre xl speres tyll came thoost dassht ouerthrue tentes pauilyons skirmysshed frenchman night two great baron france kept wache say lorde momorency lorde salieu whan harde noyse came baners yt part almaynz retourned towarde brige frechmen feersly chase sir olphart guystels taken purblynde also two bretherne mondrope jaquelet tyaulx wer nere togyder ech vnderstode others language frenmen sayd almayns sir ye shall nat scape thus one sayd lorde rauderodece sir take good hede thynke frenchman wyll bridge well sayd though knowe one way knowe tha tourned right hande toke way nat moche vsed brought hym co pany ye foresayd ryuer depe enuyroned maresshes coud nat passe ther fayne repasse bridge frenchemen euer rode great galoppe towarde bridge whaue came nere brige sawe great busshment ther sayd among themselfe trowe chase folysshly might lightly lese rather wyn dyuers retourned specially lorde saynt saulie baner company lorde charles momorency baner rode euer forwarde wold nat recule great courage sette almayns first brunt ther feerse encounter dyuerse ouer throwen bothe party cae thother syde thother almayns enclosed frenchman lorde renolde dyscouuenort knewe well baner lorde mommorency vnder banner swerde hand fightyng euery syde came sodenly right hande lyfthande toke bridell lorde mommorencies horse spurred forthe owne horse drewe hym batayle euer lorde mommorency strake gaue hym many great stroke receyued defended finally ther taken prisoner almayns dyde somoche obtayned place toke fourscore prisoner gentylmen passed bridge without danger came agayne siege tourney p howe flemynges saynt omers duryng siege cap lxii let v au aduenture tell flemynges whiche company ther captayns sir robert dartoyse sir henry fladers wer nombre xl townes ippre propyngne messynes cassell catelayne bergus flemynges lay vale cassell tentes pauylions cou tergaryson french garysons french kynge layed saynt omers saynt uenaunt townes forteresses aboute saynt omers therle dolphyne auuergne lorde kalengen lorde rocheforte nerse knyghtes syn also many brake downe dyuers house robbed fray anon knowen towne lordes within armed copany yssued nother gate vi baners ii c men armes vi c fotemen came secrete way flemmynges besy robbe pyll towne arkes nere saynt omers spredde abrode without captayne good order frechmen came good order batell bauers displayed cryeng cleremont dolphyne auuergne wherwith flemmynges basshed beatyn downe hepes chase endured ii leages ther slayne iiii viii c iiii c taken prisoner ledde saynt omers suche fledde scaped retourned hoost shewed companyons aduenture last tidynges therof came captayns sir robert dartoyse sir henry fladers sayd well enployed went forthe without comaundement capitayne nyght mydnight flemynges lyeng tentes slepe sodenly generally among ther fell suche feare te rose great haste suche payne yt thought nat dysloged tyme ynough bete downe owne tentes pauilyons trussed caryages fledde away nat abyding one wt kepyng right way wha tidynges came two captayns rose hastely made gret fiers toke torch mou ted horse came flemynges sayd sir ayleth wat thyng thus flye away nat well assured retourne name god ye blame thus flye chase wordes euery man fledde ne way owne house whan lordes sawe none remedy trussed harnes waganes retourned hoost tourney shewed aduenture flemmynges wherof euery man marueyle sayd ouercome fantyses p howe siege tourney broken vp reason truse cap lxiii siege endured long season space xi wekes thre dayes lesse season lady jane ualoys suster frenche king mother therle heynalt traueyled gretly one thother haue respyte peace twene party might depart wt batayle dyuers tymes kneled ye ete frenche kyng behalfe also made great labour lordes thempyre specially duke brabant ye duke jullers dought maryage also sir john heynalt somoch good lady procured ayde counsell loys daugymont welbeloued tie graunted yt eche partie shuld sende foure sufficyent person treat good way acorde party truse thre dayes apoynters shuld mete ly tell chapell standyng feldes called esplotyn day apoynted person mette good lady frenche partie ther charles kyng behayne charles erle dalanson brother frenche kyng bysshopp liege therle flanders therle armynack theglysshe partie duke brabat bysshop licolne duke guerles duke jullers ser john heynalt whan met made ech gret salutacyons good ther entred treaty day comuned dyuers way acorde alwayes ye good lady ualoys amog desyringe effectuously party wolde labour make peace howbeit first day passed wtout thing doyng retourned promysed mete agayne ye next day whiche day came togyther agayne place fell agayne treaty fell vnto certayne poyntes agreable thanne late coude nat put writynge day make ende make perfyght mater might thirde day met agayne finally acorded truse endure yere bytwene party ther men also bytwene scotlande suche made warr gascoyne poycton saton treuse begyn xl day next ensuyng within space euery partie gyue knowlege men wtout mall engyn suche copanyes woll nat kepe peace let chose frace pycardy burgoyne bretayne norma dy bounde peace without excepcyon peace begyn incontynent twene hostes two kynges also determyned bothe party eche name shulde sende foure fyue personage embassodours mete arras pope likwyse sende thyder foure ther make full confirmacyon without meane also truse euery partie enioy possede euery thyng possessyon truse incotynent cryed bothe hoostes wherof brabances right gladde sore wery long lyeng siege ye nexte day assone day lyght ye shulde haue sene tentes taken downe charyotes charged people remoue thycke man wold haue thought haue sene newe worlde thus good towne tourney safe without great damage howe beit within endured gret payne vytaylsbegan fayle sayd scant serue thre foure dayes moost brabances departed quickely grete desyre therto kyng englande departed sore agaynst mynde might haue done wyse manerhe fayne folowe wylles lordes byleue counsayls frenche kynge coude abyde lengar lay yuell ayre wether hote frenchman honour iourney bycause rescued tourney caused ennemies dete kyng englande lordes tie sayd ye honour reason taryed long within realme besieged one good townes therof also wasted burnt frenche contrey frenche kynge nat rescued tyme hour ought haue done gyuyng batayle finally agreed truse ennemies beyng styll siege brennyng contrey thus lordes departed fro siege tourney euery man drewe owne kynge englande came gaunt quene wyfe shortly passed see except suche shulde parlyament arras cherle heynalt retourned contrey helde noble feest mon heynault great iustes gararde uerchyn seneshall heynault dyd iust sore hurt dyed stroke sonne called johan good knyght hardy whyle good helthe french kyng gaue leaue euery man departe went hymselfe lyle thyder came tourney kyng receyued ioyously dyd shewe gret grace gaue frely franches ye lost longe wherwt ioyouse forsir godmer du fay dyuers knyght ben long gouernours ther made newe uost iurates acordynge auncyent vsages kyng departed fro lysle go parys nowe came season counsayle shulde arras pope clement thyder came legacyon cardynall napuls cardynall cleremont came parys wher kyng made theym mochehonour came arras fre che kyng ther therle alanson duke burbon therle flaunders therle bloys archebysshoppe sene bysshop beawayes bysshoppe aucerre kyng england ther bysshop lyncolne bysshoppe durame therle warwyke sir robert dartoyse sir john heynalt sir henry flanders whiche treaty ther many mater put forthe contynued xv dayes agreed poynt effect thenglysshmen demaunded ye frenchman wolde nothyng gyue onely rendre coutie poycton gyuen quene isabell maryage kyng englande parlyament brake vp nothyng done truse relonged two yeres lengar cardynals coude get euery man departed two cardynals went heynault desyre therle feested nobly p nowe speketh hystorie warres bretayne howe duke dyed without heyre wherby dyscencion fell cap lxiiii whan sayde trewse agreed sayled cyte turney euery lord maner people dysloged euery man drue owne contrey duke bretayne ben ther french kyng well furnysshed prince ther deted hom warde way sickenes toke hym dyed whiche tyme chylde neuer noue duchy trust haue brother father side called erle moutfort lyueyng wyfe suster therle loyes flauders sayd duke brother bothe father mother deed doughter lyue ye duke vncle maryed lord charles bloyes eldyst sonne therle guy bloyes erle suster kyng philypp france raygned promysed maryage ye duchy bretayne dyscease douted erle mountfort wolde clayme inherytance next blode yet nat proper brother germayne duke thought doughter brother germayne oughte reason nere inherytaunce dycease therle moutfort brother bycause fered dycease therle mountfort wolde take away ye ryght fro yongnese therfore maryed sayd sir charles bloys thyntent kyng philyp vncle housbande shuld ayd kepe right agaynst therle mountfort yf medyll thynge ye mater assone erle moutfort knewe duke brother deed went incotynent nauntes souerayne cytie bretayne dyd somoche burgess people contrey ther yt receyued chefe lord moost next blode brother dysceased dyd hym homage fealtie wyfe hert lyon determyned counsell call court kepe solempne feest nauntes day lymitted agaynst ye day thei sent noble counsails good wnes bretayne homage fealte hym soueraygne lorde meane season feest began therle mounfort great nombre men warr deted fro nauntes went lymogines enformed tresur father gadered many day ther kept secrete whan came ther entred cyte gret tryumphe dyd hym moche honour nobly receyued burgess clergie comons dyd hym fealtie soueraygne lorde meanes founde gret treasur delyuerd whan taryed pleasure deted treasur came nauntes coutes wyfe taryed grete ioye tyll day came feest made gret prouysios whan day cae man apered comaundement except one knyght called sir henry du leon noble puysaunt man kept feest thre dayes well might ther determyned retayne soudyers horsbacke fote dyspende gret tresure attayne purpose duchy constrayne rebel coe mercy soudyers wer retayned sydes largely payed great nobre fote horsbacke noble dyuerse countreis phowe therle mountfort toke towne castell brest cap lxv whan therle mountfort sawe howe peple ynough cou sayled go conquere cotre outher loue force subdue rebel yssued cytie nau te great hoost went strong castell standynge see syde called brest captayne therin sir garnyer clysson noble knyght one grettest barownes bretayne therle mountfort came brest constrayned countrey except fortress yt euery man folowed hym horsbacke fote none durste none otherwyse whan therle cae castell brest caused ser hery de leon sende captayn speke hym mouyng hym obey therle duke bretayne knight answered wold nothyng mocyon tyll otherwyse comaundement fro hym yt ought lorde ther right next day therle dyd assaut castell within castell iii c men armes euery man set part defence captayn toke xl good men armes came barryers ther sore assaut dyuers sore hurt finally ther came many assaylates bayles wonne byfore defedantes fayne retourne castell harde aduenture ther dyuers slayne captayne dyd valyantly brought company chyefe gate kepte warde gate whan sawe myschyefe feared lesyng castell sodenly lette downe portcolyse closed owne capteyne certayne without right nobly defeded themselfe sore hurt great daunger deth captayne wold neuer yelde hymselfe cast stone tymber yron pott quycke lyme assaylantes fayne drawe backe drue vp lytell portcolyse captayne entred co pany wer left lyue sore wou ded next day therle caused certayne inge raysed sayde howe wolde nat depart then tyll castell pleasure thyrde day vnderstode howe captayne within deed hurtes receyued entrynge castell trewe duke mountfort caused great assaut made certayne instrumentes made tymber caste ouer dyke come harde walles within defended themselfe aswell myght tyll noone duke desyred yelde take hym duke wold frely pardon whervpon toke counsell duke caused assaut cease fynally yelded lyues goodes saued therle mountfort entred castell certayne nombre receyued feaultie men chatelayne ther sette captayne knyght trusted moche retourned felde right ioyouse phowe therle mountfort toke cytie renes cap lxvi whan erle mountfort retourned felde stably hed captayns castell brest thane drewe towarde cite renes nat farr then euery wet made euery man homage feaulte ryght lorde dayly encreased hoost came renes pyght vp tentes lodged peple rounde aboute cyte subbarbes wtin made great semblant defence capytaine ther sir henry pennefort well beloued treweth valyantnesse mornyng yssned two hudred men dasshed hoost bete downe tentes slewe dyuers suche host kept watche night drue noyse fortresse withdrewe fledde agayne castell taryed longe dyuers theym taken slayne sir h pefort taken brought erle erle caused hym brought cytie shewed burgess yt wolde saue lyfe yelde vp towne el shuld hanged gate renes toke counsayle whiche enduredde longe common great pyte captayne welbelored among also consydred howe hadde small store vytayle long defende siege wherfore sayde wolde haue peace great burgess hadde ynough theymselfe wolde nat agre yelde vp towne dyscorde multiplyed farre great burgess one lynnage drewe parte sayde sir woll take parte drawe v drewe togyther one affinyte lynnage nombre two thousande whan co mon sawe began sterre sayde burgess many euyll vylanous wordes finally ran togyder slewe dyuers whan burgess sawe myschefe agreed sayd wolde desyred tha ceased fray comons ranne opyned gate yelded cytie therle mounfort dyde homage feaultie hym toke hym lorde dyd sir henry pe fort made therles counsayle phowe erle mountfort toke towne castell hanybout cap lxvii thus therle moutfort entred ito renes great feest lodged host styll feldes made peace agayne twene burgess common made ther baylyffes pronost alderman sergyantes officer taryed ther thre dayes dyslodged drue towarde stron gest castell bretayn called hanybout sta dynge port see see rennynge rounde gret dyke whan sir hery efort sawe therle wolde go thyder feared brother captayn ther cae therle cousell sayd sir hath pleased admyt one counsaylours sir haue gyuen fayth allegiance vnderstande ye purpose go hanybout sir knowe trouth towne castell suche strength nat easy wynne thynke surely ye may well lese tyme hole yere ye wynne perforce sir wyll please byleue shal shewe wayes howe wynne whaue force nat helpe subtylte craft must auayle ye wyll delyuer hudred men armes rueled woll haue shall go halfe leage hoost ye baner bretayn brother gouernour castell towne sone shall se banner bretayne knowe woll opyn gate let entre company assone within shall take hym prisoner take possessyon towne gate shall rendre brother handes pour pleasure hym without woll obey woll haue ye promyse fayth body ye shall son bodely hurt request therle promysed sayd ye bringe shall loue better euer sir henry penfort departed company apoynted agaynst euenynge came hanybout whan brother olyuer pefort knewe comyng opyned gate let hym entre wenynge ben come haue ayded hym came mette brother strete assone sir henry sawe hym aproched hym toke hym arme sayd olyuer ye army prisoner howe haue put trust thynkyng ye come hytherto ayde kepe towne castell brother sir henry mater gothe nat take possession towne therle mountfort nowe duke bretayne whome haue made fealtie homage part contrey hath obeyed vnto hym shall likewyse wer better ye dyd loue byforce ye shall deserue thanke somoche olyuer styred brother agreed hym therle entred toke possession towne castell set ther gret garison went withall host ennes made treatie yelded vp dyd fealtie homage hym soueraygne lorde stablysshed maner officer taryed ther thre dayes frothens went layd siege strong castell called roche peron captayne therin ser olyuer clysson cosyn germayne lorde clysson therle lay ther siege x dayes coude fynde wayes howe gette castell strong captayne wolde wyse agre obey nother fayre wordes foule erle left siege departed tyme went layd siege castell x leages then called aultoy therin captayne sir geffray malestroyt co pany sir juon triguyde therle assayled castell two tymes sawe well might rather lose ther wynne agreed truse day instance sir henry de leon euer styll hym soo treaty toke effect frend two knyght dyd homage therle departed left styll two knightes captayns ther contrey thanne went castell called goy la forest captayne sawe howe therle great hoost howe contrey sore yelded hym counsell sir henry de l whome captayne ben copany pruce granade dyuers strange contreis acorded therle dyd hym homage therle left hym styll captayne ther therle went caraches good towne stronge castell therin ther bysshoppe lorde therof prelate vncle sir henry de leon sir henris meanes bysshoppe agreed therle toke hym lorde vnto suche season somme shulde come shewe ryght duchy bretaygne p howe eele mountfort dyd homage kyng england duchy bretayne cap lxviii thus therle moutfort conquered countrey made hymselfe called duke bretayne went port see syde called g e thasie sent people abrode kepe townes fortress toke see certayne arryued cornwall englande port called chepse enquered kynge shewed hym howe ye wyndsore rode thyderwarde came wyndsore wher receyued gret ioye feest bothe kyng quene lordes shewed kynge counsayle howe possession duchy bretayne fallen hym succession deth brother last duke breten feared lest sir charles bloyes frenche kynge wolde put hym therof puyssance wherfore sayd come thyder relyue holde duchy kyng englande fealtie homage euer wolde defende hym agaynst frenche kynge shul e put hym trouble mater kynge englande ymagined warre agaynste frenche kyng shulde well fortifyed meanes howe coude nat haue profitable way hym entre france bretayne remembring howe almayns brabances done lytell nothyng hym caused hym spende moche money wherfore yously condyscending therle mountfortes desyre toke homage hand therle callyng hym selfe duke bretaygne ther kyng englande presence suche lordes ther bothe bretayne englande promysed wold ayde defende kepe hym liege man agaynst euery man frenche kyng homage promyses writen sealed euery tie part belyuerd besyde kynge quene gaue therle company many great gyftes wyse reputed hym noble kyng worthy raygne gret prosperyte therle toke leaue departed toke agayne thesee arryued forsayd port gredo base bretayne came nauntes wyfe sayde howe wrought good byscrete counsayle p howe therle moutfort somoned plyament parys request lorde charles bloyes cap lxix whan sir charles bloys helde hymselfe rightfull inherytour bretaygne reason wyfe harde howe erle mountfort conquered beforce countrey whiche reason ought came parys complayne kyng philyppe vncle whervpon kyng counselled wt noble realme might matter counsaylled hym therle moutfort shuld sufficyent messa gers somoned apere parys ther answere wolde make messa gers sent forthe founde therle nauntes makyng good chere made great feest finally answered howe wolde obey kynges comaundement made hym redy departed fro nantes came paris iiii c horse hym next day mounted horse rode kynges palayse ther kynge xii peres great lordes fraunce taryed commyng lorde charles blois th therle entred kynges chambre well regarded saluted euery person tha enclyned hymselfe kyng sayd sir come hyther comaundement pleasure kyng sayd erle mountfort doyng good thanke howbeit haue marueyle howe ye durste vndertake duchy bretayne wherin ye haue right another ne e ye ye wolde dysinheryt hym mentayne quarell ye haue ben wt myne aduersary kynge englande shewed ye haue done hym homage saine ther e sayd sir byleue nat surely ye yuell enformed behalf ser right ye speke sauyng dyspleasur ye ther wrong ser knowe none nere brother departed iuged playnly declared right nother nerer wolde rebell shamed leaue well sir kyng ye say well comaund ye holde ye det nat cytie parys xv dayes tyme xii peres lordes realme shall iudge mater thaye shall knowe right ye haue ye otherwyse ye shall displease therle sayd ser shalbe yo pleasure thane went fro court lodgyng dyner whan came lodgynge entred chambre satte ymagined many doutes finally small company mounted horse retourned agayne bretayne kynge wyst wher becoe thought ben lytell sicke lodgyng whan came nauntes shewed countesse done counsel herode townes forteresses wonne stablysshed good captayns soudyers horsbacke fote dyd gyue good wage p howe duchy bretayne iuged sir charles bloyes lxx thought frenche kynge sore dyspleased whan knewe erle mountforte departed beit taryed tyll ye xv day lordes shulde gyue iudgemet duchy bretayne whan day came iudged clerely ser charles bloys wyfe doughter brother germayne duke last deed father syde iudged haue right erle mountforte came another father neuer duke bretayne reason sayde though therle moutfort right forfeted two wayes one bycause relyued duchy nother lorde frenche kynge ought holde reason bycause broken kynges comaundement disobeyed rest prison goyng away without leaue whan iudgement gyuen playne audyence lordes thanne kyng called hym lorde charles bloys nephue sayde fayre nephue ye haue iudged fayre herytage great therfore hast go conquere agaynst hym kepyth wrongfully desyre frendes ayde shall nat fayle part shall lende golde syluer ynough shall commaunde sonne duke normandy go ser charles bloys inclyned hym vncle thankyng hym right humbly desyred duke normady cosyn erle alanson vncle duke burgoyne therle bloys brother duke butbone lorde loys spayne lorde jaques burbon therle ewe constable fraunce therle guynes sonne vycont rohayne lord ther sayde howe wolde gladly go hym lorde duke normandy lordes departed make redy make uysion agaynst iourney p lordes fraunce entred bretayne sir charles bloys cap lxxi whan lordes normandy duke alanson duke burgoyne suche shulde go sir chardu bloys ayde hym coquere duchy bretayne redy departed fro pares fro place assembled togyder cytie anger fro then went ancennys thende realme syde ther taryed thre dayes went forthe countrey bretayne whan feldes nombred company fyne thousande men armes besyde ge wayes thre thousande thre knyghtes gennes
