oyd lede one called sir othes de rue thother sir charles germaulx besyde many erosbowes whome sir galoys la baulme captayne went strong castell standynge hyghe mountayne called chastoceaulx ther thentre bretayne furnysshed men warr captayns ther two knyghtes lorayne called syr gyles sir ualeryan lordes frace toke counsell besiege castell thought shulde leaue fortres behynde shuld great damage beseged rounde made many assautes specially genowayes dydde might attayne prayse begynning lost often tymes company within defended themselfe sagely longe toke damage finally assaylant brought thyder somoch tymbre wod fagottes fylled therwith dyke might go ust walles within cast stone chalke brennynge fyre howbeit without came fote walles instrumetes wherby myght vnder couert myne walles yelded vp castell lyues goodes saued thafie duke normanvy chiefe ther delyuered castell sir charles bloys owne incotynent set ther good garyson kepe thentre conduct suche came theym went towarde nantes wher harde therle mountfort ennemy marshal currours hoost founde way went good towne closed ykes feersly assayled town ther fewe peple yuell armed anone towne wo robbed one half brent peple put swerde towne called carquesy within iiii fyue leages nantes lordes lay ther night next mornyng drue towarde nantes layed siege rounde pygh p tentes pauilyons men warre within towne burgess armed went defence apoynted host went barrers skirmyssh soudyers within yong buegesses ue agaynst ther byuees slayne hurt bothe party ther yuerse suche skirmysshes mornyng soudyers within cytie yssued adueture founde xv carte vytell comyng thoost warde lx person couey cytie ii c set anone dysconfyted slewe dyuers fled away scaped shewed thoost howe went rescue pray ouer toke nere barryers ther began great skirmysshe ther came many fro thoost within moch howbeit toke horse cart dyd driue gate thentent without shulde nat driue lightly away caryages soudyers cytie yssued helpe companyons also burgess ayde paretes fray multiplyed dyuers slayne sore hurt bothe party alwayes people encreased fro thoost newe euer yssued cytie last sir henry captayne sawe tyme retreyt abydinge sawe might rather lese wyn caused cytie drawe backe aswell myght yet pursued ere many slayne taken mo ii c burgess towne wherof therle motfort blamed sore sir henry de leon caused retrayt sone wherwith sir hery sore dyspleased mynde old coe therls cousell aften dyd many maruell dyd p howe erle mountfort taken nauntes howe dyed cap lxxii hard reported ther certayne burgess cite sawe howe goodes went wast without chyldren frendes prison douted wors shulde come aduysed spake togyder secretly finally cocluded treat lordes france myght come haue peace haue chyldren fredes clerely delyuerd prison made treatie secretly laste agreed shulde haue prosouers delyuerd set opyn one ye gate frenche lordes myght entre take erle moutfort castell without doyng maner hurt cyte thynhaby tantes goodes therin sayed purchased mean agrement sir henry de leon ben one erles chiefe counsaylours thus deuysed done mornyng frenche lordes entred went streyght castell brake opyn gate ther toke therle moutfort prisoner ledde hym clene cytie felde without doyng hurt cyte yere lorde god c c c xli feest saynt tha lordes fraunce entred cytie great ioye burgess dyd fealtie homage lorde charles bloys ryght souerayne lorde taryed thre dayes gret feest sir charles bloys couselled abyde ther cytie nauntes tyll next somer dyd set captayns suche garysons lordes went parys kyng delyuerd hym therle mountfort prisoner kynge set hym castell loure wher longe last harde reported ther dyed p nowe let v speke countesse wyfe courage man hert lyon cytie renes whanne lorde taken howe beit great sorowe hert yet valyantly recoforted frendes soudyers shewed lytell son called john sayd sir nat sore basshed erle lorde haue lost man se lytell chylde shalbe grace god restorer shall haue rich ynough ye shall nat lacke trust shall purchase suche capitayne ye shalbe reconforted whan thus conforted frendes soudyers renes wet fortress good townes ledde euer john yonge sonne dyd dyde renes fortifyed garisons euery thyng wanted payed largely gaue frely thought well enployed wet hanybout ther sonne taryed wynter often tymes sent byset garysons payed euery man full well truely wage p howe kyng englande thyrde tyme made warre scotes cap lxxiii ye haue harde yt siege beynge tourney howe lordes scotland taken agayne dyuers townes fortress fro thenglysshmen helde scotlande ther mo remayning theglysshmens handes onely castell esturmelyne cytie berwyke rousburge scottes lay styll siege certayne frenchman suche kyng philyppe sent thyder helpe esturmelyne within sore constrayned sawe well coude nat long endure whan kynge englande retourned fro siege tourney came owne realme couselled ryde towarde scotlande dyd rode thyderwarde bytwene mighelmas al sayntes comaundyng euery folowe hym berwyke euery man began styrre drawe thyder comaunded kyng last came yorke ther taryed people lordes scotlande wer enfourmed comyng kyng englande wherfore made sorer assautes castell esturmelyne costrayned within engyns canon wer fayne yelde vp castell sauyng lyues membres nothyng shulde cary away tidynges came kyng englande thane departed drewe toward esturmelyne came newcastell vpon tyne ther lodged taryed moneth abydinge prouysion host put see bytwene saynt andrewes tyde sayntes dyuerse shyppes perysshed suche tempest see small prouysion came thyder driuen hollande fryse wherby theglysshe hoost great defaute vytayls euery thynge dere wynter hande wyst nat wher haue forage scotlande scottes put goodes fortress kyng england ther mo tha vi horsmen xl fotemen lordes scotland wynning estur melyne rue forestes gedeours vnderstode well howe kyng englande lay newecastell great nombre brenne exyle realme scotlande toke counsell shulde thought themselfe small company mentayne warr seyng howe cotynued warres vii yere without heed captayne yet tha coude parceyue socoure fro owne kyng determyned sende kyng englande bysshop abbot desyre truse messangers departed fro scotland came newecastell wher founde kynge messangers shewed kynge counsayle cause comyng agreed trewse endure foure monethes condycion scotlande shulde sende sufficyent embassadours france kyng dauyd yt without wolde come within moneth may next folowing puyssantly resyst defede realme el clerely yelde themselfe englysshe neuer take hym kyng th two prelate retourned agayne scotlande incontynent ordayned sende fraunce sir robert ersay sir symon fresyll two knyghtes shewe kynge apoyntment kynge englande agreed sone truse bycause hoost lacked vytayll came backe agayne sent euery man home scottysshe messangers went towarde fraunce toke shypping douer p nowe kynge dauyd ben seuyne yere france knewe well realme sore distroyed thaue toke leaue frenche kyng go home owne contre confort people toke shypping wyfe suche copany port dyde put hymselfe vnder guyding maryner rychard flamont aryued port moroyse euer scotlande knewe therof knewe nothyng messangers gone france speke hym knewe nat retournyng home p howe kyng dauyd scotlande came great hoost newcastell vpon tyne ca lxxiiii whan yong kyng dauyd scotlande come countrey men came hym great ioye solem puyte brought hym towne saynt john thyder cae peple fro tie sehym euery man shewed hym damage dystrueti kyng edward thenglysshmen done scotlande sayd well shalbe well reuenged orels lose realme lyfe payne thane sent messangers partes ferr nere desyring euery man helpe hym busynesse sendyng thyder came therle orkeney great prince puyssaunt maryed kynges suster brought great nombre men warr hym dyuers lordes knyghtes souegne melbegne denmarche loue wage whan togyder lx men fote hackenayes iii armed maner whane redy remoued go england ther asmoche hurt might truse expyred el fight kynge englande caused suffre moch dysease scottes departed fro saynt johannes towne went donfremelyn next day ther passed lytell arme see went great dyligence passed edenborowe rousburge whiche englysshe made none assaut ther bycause wolde haue none copany hurt wast none artillary thought greatter dede retourned scotlande passed nat ferre fro berwyke went without assaut gyueng entred contrey northumberlande came ryuer tyne brennyng cotrey rou de last came newecastell vpon tyne ther lay people towne night mornig certayne nombre getylmen towne yssued nombre c c speres make skry scottysshe hoost dasshed scottyssh host right therle morets tentes bare armour syluer thre oreylles goules ther toke hym bed slewe many thoost moued wan great pyllage returned towne boldely great ioye delyuerd therle moret prisoner captayne castell lorde john neuell whan scottes vp armed ranlyke madde men barryers towne made great assaut whiche endured longe lytell awayled lost ther many men ther many good men war within defended theself wysely scottes fayne last withdrawe backe losse p howe kynge dauyd scotlande distroyed cytie dyrrame cap lxxv whan king dauyd counsayle sawe taryeng newcastell daungerous coude wynne therby nother profet honour departed entred contrey bysshoprike dyrram ther brent wasted byfore came cyte dyrram layed siege rounde made many great assautes lyke madde men cause lost therle morette knewe well ther moche richesse cytie contrey ther fledde thyder scott made ingens instrume te come walles make feercer assant whan scottes gone fro new castell thane sir john neuyll captayne mounted good horse toke away farre fro scottes dyd somoche within fyue dayes came chyrtsay wher kyng edwarde lay ther shewed king tidynges scottes kynge sende forth messangers euery part comaudyng euery man bytwene age lx xv excuse layd part drawe northwarde mete hym contrey ayde defende contrey scottes distroyed lordes knyghtes squyers drewe towarde northe kyng deted hymself hastely taryed man euery man folowed aswell might meane season scottes assauted cytie dyrrame ingens instrumentes feersly yt within coude nat defende themself cytie wonne byforce robbed clene brent maner people put deth without mercy men woman chyldren monkes preestes chanons ther abode lyue maner person house church distroyed whiche great pytie dystroy christen blode church godde wherin god honoured serued p howe scottes besieged castell therle salysburies cap lxxvi king dauyd cou selled drawe backe long ye ryuer tyne drawe toward carlyle went thyderward loged nyght besyde castel therle salysburies whiche well kept men warr captayne therof sir wyllm montagu son therle salysburis suster next day scottes dysloged go towarde carlyle moch cary age pyllage dyra whan ser wyllm montagu sawe scott passed without restyng tha xl yssued horsbacke folowed couertly hynder trayne scottes horse charged baggage yt might scat go gret pace ouertoke thetryng wood set ther slewe hurt scottz mo cc toke mo sixscore horse charged pyllage soled toward castell cry brunt flight came heryng sir wyllyam duglas charge reregarde past ye wood whan sawe scottes came fleyng ouer dale mou tayns great maruell copany ran forth rested nat tyll cae fote castell mounted hyll hast came bayls thegly sshmen entred closed barryers put pray saftie scottes began assayle feersly within defeded ther two wyllms dyd might eche greue assaut endured long thoost came thyder kyng whan ye kyng counsell sawe men slayne lyeng felde assaylantes sore hurt without wynning thyng comau ded cease thassaut lodge euery man began seke logyng gader togyder deed men dresse theym hurt next day kyng scottes co maunded euery man shulde redy assayle within redy defende ther sore assautand perylous ther might ben sene many noble dedes te ther within present noble countesse salysbury reputed sagest fayrestlady england castell parteyned husbande therle salisbury taken prisoner erle suttolke lyle flanders ye haue harde prison chatelot parys kyng englande gaue ye castell sayd erle whan maryed first sayd lady prowes gode seruyce done whan called sir wyllm montagu noble lady conforted greatly within regarde lady swere coforting man ought worthe two men nede assaut dured long scottes lost many men aduentured theselfe hardely caryed wood tymbre haue sylled dyke thyntent bring engyns ye walles within defeded themselfe valyantly assaylantes fayne drawe backe kyng comaunded ingens wel kept nyght next day enforce assaut euery man drue lodging except kept thyngens wept deth frendes conforted hurt castellsa well kynge dauyd cotynued sege shuld haue moche defende castell wher fore toke counsell amonge sende kyng edward lay yorke shewed suche prisoner taken scottes loked among shulde message coude fynde none wolde leaue castell presence fayre lady yt dede ther among great stryfe whan captayne sir wyllm montague sawe sayd sir se well trueth good wyll ye bere lady house loue shall put body aduentur message haue suche trust yt ye shall right well defende castell tyll retourne agayne thother syde haue suche trust king souerayne lorde shall shortly bring suche socours shall cause ioyfull trust ye kyng shall rewarde ye shalbe content wordes countesse wer right ioyefull whan night came sayd sir wyllm made hym redy priuely might happed well hym rayned nyght scottes kept styll within lodging thus mydnight sir wyllm montagu passed thoost nat sene rode forth tyll day met ii scottes halfe leage fro thost briuyng two ox cowe towarde thoost ser wyllm knewe well wer scottes set wounded bothe slewe catell thy tent yt thost shuld haue none ease sayd two hurt scott go yor wayes say kyng wyllm montague hath thus passed hoost goyng fetche ayde kyng englande departed mornynge kyng scott made fecrse assaut nothing coude wyn euery day lightly made assaut counsell dyd lese men yt kyng england might well come thyder castell wo one acorde counselled kyng depart sayeng abyding ther profet yet honour sayd sir ye haue honourably achyued enterprise haue done great dispyre englyssshmen ye haue ben contre xii dayes taken distroyed cytie dyrrame wherfore sir thynges cosydred good name ye retourned take pyllage ye haue wonne tyme ye may returne agayne whan pleaseth kyng wolde nat agaynst opynyons counsell agreed sore agaynst mynde howbeit next mornyng h byss ged host toke way streyght great forest gedeours tary case knowe kyng englande wolde farther god backe agayne el entre scotlande p howe kyng englande amour countesse salisbury ca lxxvii day yt scottes departed fro sayd castell kyng edward came thyder host noon came place wher scott saged sore displeased founde nat scottes ther cae thyder hast yt horse men wer sore traueled comaunded lodge ther nyght sayd howe wolde go se castell noble lady therin nat seue sythe maryed euery toke logyng lyst assone kyng vnarmed toke x xii knyghtes wt hym went castell salute countesse salisbury se maner assautes scottes defence made agaynst assone lady knewe kynges comyng set opyn gate cae richely sene euery man marueyled beauty coude nat cease regarde noblenes great beauty gracyous wordes countenaunce made whan came kyng knelyd downe yerth thankyng hym socours ledde hym castell make hym chere honour coude ryght well euery man regarded maruelusly king hym selfe coude nat witholde regardyng thought neuer sawe noble fayre lady stryken therewith hert sparcle fyne loue endured longe thought lady worlde worthy beloued thus entred castell hande hande lady ledde hym first hall chabre nobly aparelled kyng regarded lady basshed last wet wyndo rest hym sell gret study lady went make chere lordes knyghtes ther comaun ded dresse hall dyner whan al deuysed comaunded thane cameto kyng mery chere gret stu dy sayd dere ye study sor yo grace nat dyspleased aparteyneth nat rather ye shulde make good chere ioyfull seyng ye haue chased away enmies durst nat abyde let men study remynant kyng sayd dere lady knowe trouthe syth entred castell ther study coe mynde nat chuse muse cannat tell shall fall therof put herte cannat sir lady ye ought alwayes make good chere confort ther yo peple god hath ayded yo besynes hath gyuen great grace ye moste douted honoured priuce christedome kyng scottes haue done dy spyre damage ye may well amende whan shall please ye haue done dyuerse tymes sir leaue musyng come hall please yo dyner redy fayre lady kyng thynges lyeth hert ye knowe nat surely swete hauyng perfyt wysedom good grace noblenes exellent beauty se hath sore surprised hert nat loue without loue deed lady sayde ryght noble prince goddessake mocke tempt nat nat byleue true ye say noble prince ye wold thynke dyshonour lorde husbande valyant knight hath done grace gode seruyce yet lyethe prison quarell certely sir ye shulde case haue small prayse nothyng better therby neuer yet thoght hert trust god neuer shall haue man lyueng suche intencyon grace ought nat onely blame also punysshe body ye true iustice dismebred therwith lady deted fro kyng went hall hast dyner returned agayne kyng broght knyghtes sayd sir yf please come hall knight abideth wasshe ye haue ben long fastyng kyng went hall wassht sat amonge lordes lady also kyng ete lytell sat styll musyng durst cast eyen vpon lady sadnesse knyght maruell nat acustomed thought bycause scott scaped fro hym day kyng taryed ther wyst nat sotyme ymagined yt honour trouth defeded set hert case dyshonour lady true knyght husband alwayes well truely serued hym thother loue constrayned hym power therof surmounted honour trouth thus kyng debated hymself day night mornyng rose dysloged hoost drewe scottes chase realme toke leaue lady sayeng dere lady god comende tyll returne agayne requiryng aduyse otherwyse ye haue sayd noble prince lady god father glorious yo coduct put bylayne thought sir euer shalbe redy grace ser uyce honour myne therwith kyng deted abasshed soo folowed scottes tyll came cyte berwyke went lodged within iiii leages forelt gedeors wher askyng dauyd co pany entred trust great wyldernesse kyng england taryed ther iii dayes se scottes wold yssue fight hym thre dayes ther dyuers skirmysshes bothe tie dyuers slayne taken sore hurte amonge scottes sir wyllyam duglas dyd moost trouble thenglysshemen bare azure comble syluer thre starres goules p howe therle salysbury therle moret delyuerd prison exchaunge cap lxxviii sayd thre dayes ther noble men bothe party treatid peace bytwene two kynges treatie toke suche essect trewse agreed endure two yere frenche kynge wolde therto agree kyng scottes sore alyed frenche kyng might take peace without cosent frenche kyng wolde nat agree peace truse endure first day may folowyng agreed therle morette shulde quyte prisonment kyng scottes coude somoche purchase frenche kyng therle salisbury might lyke maner quyte prison whiche thyng shulde done feest saynt john baptyst next kyng englande agreed soner truse bycause warre france gascoyne poycton xaynton bretaygne euery place men warre wage kyng scottes sent great messangers french kyng agre truse fre che kyng cotent seyng desyre kyng scott tha therle salisbuey sent englande kyng england sent incotynent therle moret scotland p howe sir charles du bloys dyuers lordes fraunce toke cytie kenes bretayne cap lxxix knowen whan duke normady duke burgoyne duke alason duke burbon therle bloys constable fraunce therle guynes sonne sir james de burbone sir loyes spaygne lordes knyghtes fraunce whan departed bretayne conquered stronge castell chastoneaux cyte nantes taken therle moutfort delyuerd hym frenche kyng put hym prison castell loure parys ser charles bloys beyng nantes contrey obeyed hym rounde abydinge somer season make better warr wynter whan swete season somer approched lordes fraunce dyuers drue towarde bretayne great hoost ayde sir charles de blois recouer resydue duchy bretayne foude charles bloys na te determyned lay sege kenes countesse mountfort well preueted mater set ther captayne ser wyllyam cadudall breton lordes france came thyder dyd moche trouble assautes howbeit within defended themselfe valiantly ennemyes loste wanne whan countesse mountfort knewe lordes fraunce come bretaygne suche puyssance sende sir amery clysson englande desyring socourse kyng codycion therle mountfort son heyre shuld take wyf one kynges doughters shulde called duches bretayne king england london makyng chere therle salisbury newe come prison whan sir amery clysson come kyng made relacyon message kyng graunted request co maunded sir water manny take wt hym many men warr sir amery desyred shortly make redy go bretayne ayde countesse mountfort take iii archer best thus ser water sir amery toke see went two bretherne lyned sir loys sir john haz brabant ser hubert fresnoy ser aleyn syrefound dyuers vi archer great tempest toke see contrary wynde wherfore abode see xl dayes season lordes france sir charles de bloys kepte styll sege renes sore costrayned within burgess towne wold gladly haue take apoyntmet captayne sir wyllm cadudall wold wyse agree therto whan burgess common towne endured moche payne sawe socours comyng fro tie wold haue yelded vp towne ye captayne wold nat whan sawe finally toke hym put hym prison made couenaunt wt sir charles du bloys yelde vp towne next day condycion countes part myght go wayes whyther lyst without danger trouble ye lord charles de bloys dyd graut desyre th cytie renes gyuen vp ye yere lord iii c xlii begynning may sir wyllm nuadudall wolde nat tary ther went streyght hanybout countesse moutfort hard tidyngs sir amery clysson company p howe sir charles du bloys besieged countesse mountfort hanybout cap lxxx whan cytie renes gyuen vp ye burgess made homage fealtie lord charles bloys counselled go lay siege hany boute wher countesse sayeng therle beyng prison yf myght gette countesse sonne shulde make ende warre went hany bout layed siege therto castell also ferr might lande ye cou tesse hanybout ther bysshop leon bretayne also ther sir yue tribiquedy lorde landreman sir wyllm nuadudall ye chatelayne guyngnape two bretherne nuyreth sir henry olyuer penefort dyuers whan countesse company vnderstode frenchman commyng lay siege ye towne hanybout commauded sounde watche bell la euery man armed drawe defence whan sir charles frenchman came nere towne commaunded lodge ther nyght yong lusty companyons cae skirmysshyng barrers within yssued theym ther great affray genowayes frechmen loste wanne whan night came euery man drewe lodgynge next day lordes toke counsayle assayle batrers se maner within thyrde day made great assaute batrers fro mornyng tyll noone assaylantes drewe backe sore beaten dyuerse slayne whan lordes fraunce sawe men drawe backe sore dyspleased caused assaut begynne agayne ferser within defended theselfe valyantly countesse selfe ware harnesse body rode great courser fro strete strete desyringe peple make good defence caused damoselles woman cutte shorte kyrtels cary stone pottes full chalk walles cast downe ennemyes lady dyd ther hardy enterprise mouted vp ye heyght towre se frenchman ordred wtout sawe howe lordes people thoost gone ther felde thassaut toke agayne courser armed caused thre hundred men horsbacke redy went theym another gate wher non assaut yssued company dasshed frenche lodgynges cutte downe tentes set fyre lodgynges founde defence ther certayne varlettes boyes ran away whan ye lordes france loked behynde sawe lodgynges fyre harde cry noyse ther retourned ye felde cryeng treason treason thassaut left whan countesse sawe drewe gyder copany whan sawe coud nat entre agayne towne without great damage toke way went castell brest whiche nat ferr then whan sir loys spayne marshal host come felde sawe lodgynges brennyng sawe countesse copany goynge away folowed great nombre chased nere slewe hurte dyuerse theym behynde yuell horsed countesse moost parte company rode well came breste receyued great ioye next day lordes fraunce hadde lost tentes prouisyons thanne tooke counsayle lodge bower tree nerer towne great marueyle whan knewe countesse herselfe done enterprise towne wyst nat wher countesse become wherof great trouble fyue dayes harde tidynges countesse dyd somoche brest gate togyder v hundred speres mydnight departed fro brest sonne rysing came along one syde hoost came one gate hanybout opyned ther entred allher copany gret noyse trumpettes canayrs wherof frenche hoost great marueyle armed ran towne assaut within redy defende ther began feerse assaut endured tyll noone frenchman lost within noone thassaut ceased toke counsell sir charles du bloys shulde go fro sege gyue assaut castell alroy kyng arthure made hym shulde go duke burbone therle bloys marshall france sir robert bertrande sir henry de leon part geneuoys lorde loys spayne vycont rohayne withall spanyer de shulde abyde styll hanybout sawe well coulde haue profet assayle hanybout sent xii great engyns renes thyntent cast towne castell day night deuyded host one styll hanybout sir charles bloys aulroy within alroy well fortifyed two c companyons able mayntayne warre sir henry penfort sir olyuer brother chyefe capitaynes ther foure leages fro castell ye good towne uannes parteyning countesse capitayne ther sir gelfray malatrayt nat farre then also good towne guyngnape cathelayne dyuant captayne ther hanybout ye cou tesse lefte towne dynant wyfe chyldren lefte ther capytayne stede raynolde son bytwene two townes stode stronge castell parteynyng sir charles du bloys well kept soudyours burgonyons captayne sir gerarde maulayne hym knyght called pyer portbeufe wasted contrey costrayned sore sayd two townes ther coude ther marchandyse prouisyon entre great danger day wold ryde towarde uanes day towarde guyngnape day sir raynolde dynant layed busshment day gerarde maulayne rode forthe taken xv marchantes goodes driuyng towardes castell called rochprion fell busshment ther sir raynolde dynant toke sir gerarde prisoner xxv company rescued marchantes ledde forthe prisoner dynant wherof sir raynolde moche praysed well worthy p nowe let v speke countesse mout fort besieged hanybout sir loys spayne kept siege ther broken brused walles ye towne engins within began basshed day bysshop leon spake wt sir henry leon nephue sayd therle moutfort taken longe spake togyder agreed bysshop shulde coude cause copany within agre yelde vp town castell sir charles de bloys henry de leon thother syde shuld purchase pece forthe sir charles de bloyes lese nothyng goodes thus bysshop entred agayne towne countes incotynent douted yuell purchase desyred lordes knightes yt ther loue god shulde dout sayd suretie shuld haue socours within thre dayes howbeit ye bysshope spake somoch shewed many reason ye lordes great trouble night next mornyng brewe cousell agayne wer nere acorde haue gyuen vp towne sir hery coe nere towne haue taken possession therof countesse loked downe along see wyndo castell began smyle great ioy se socours commyng long desyred loude sayd twyse se socurs englande comyng towne walles sawe great nom pe great small fresshly decked comyng towarde hanybout thought well socours england ben see lx dayes reason contrary wyndes p howe sir water manny brought thenglysshmen bretayne cap lxxxi whan seneshall guyngnape perse tribyquedy sir galeran landreman knyght sawe socours comyng tha sayd bysshoppe sir ye may well leaue treaty sayd nat co tent folowe counsayle bysshoppe sayd sir company shall de part wyll go hym hath moost right semeth departed fro hanibout defyed coutesse ayders went sir henry de leon shewed hym howe mater went sir henry sore dyspleased caused incontynent rere vp grettest ingens nere cattell comaunded shuld nat sease last day nyght deted then brought bysshoppe sir loys spayne receyued hym great ioye dyd sir charles bloys countesse dressed vp halle chamber lodge lordes englande comyng dyd sende agaynst right nobly whan wer lande came great reuerence feested beest might thanked right humbly caused knyghtes lodge ease castell towne nexte day made great feest dyner night nexte day also ingens neuer ceased cast dyner sir gaultier many chefe company demaunded state towne hoost without sayd haue great desyre yssue breke downe great ingen standeth nere v oll folowe perse tribyquidy sayde howe wolde nat fayle hym first begynning sayd lorde ladre man armed yssued priuely certayne gate iii hundred archer shotte holly togyder kept ingen fledde awaye men armes came archer slewe dyuerse fledde bete downe great engyn brake peace thane ranne amonge tentes logynges set fyre dyuerse place slewe hurt dyuers tyll hoost began styrre withdrue fayre easely hoost ranne lyke madde men gaultier sayd let neuer beloued lady without haue course one folowers therwith tourned spere rest likewyse dyd two bretherne l dall haz brabant sir yue tribyquedy sir galeran landreman dyuerse companyons ran first comer ther myght well ben legges sene tourned vpwarde ther began sore medlynge hoost alwayes encreased wherfore behoued thenglysshmen withdrawe towarde ther fortresse ther might well ben sene bothe tie many noble dedes takyng rescuyng englysshmen drewe sagely dyke ther made stall tyll men wer sauegard resydue towne yssued rescue copany caused hoost recule backe whan host sawe coude good drewe lodgynges fortresse likewyse lodgynges countesse discedyd downe fro castell gladde chere came kyst sir gaultier manny companyons one two thre tymes lyke valyant lady p howe castell conquest wonne two tymes cap lxxxii next day sir loys spayne called counsell vycont rohayne bysshoppe leon lorde henry leon master geneuoys know ther aduyse best sawe well towne hanybout marueylously strong greatly socoured meanes tharchers england thought tyme lost abyde coude nat se howe wynne thyng ther agreed dyslodge nexte day go castell alroy sir charles bloys lay siege next day betymes pulled downe lodgynges drewe thyder purposed towne made great cryeng showtyng yssued aduenture selfe sone put backe agayne lost company coude entre gayne towne whan sir loys spayne cae sir charles bloys shewed hym reason left thesege hanybout ordayned sir loys spayne copany shulde go ley siege dynant nat closed pale water maresse sir loyes went towarde dynant came castell called conquest captayne ther countesse knyght normady called sir mencon hym dyuers soudyers sir loys came thyder gaue great assaut within defended well thassaut endured tyll mydaight morning began agayn thassaylantes persed nere came wall made great hole dyke depnesse byforce entred slewe within castell except knyght whome toke prisoner stablysshed ther newe chatelayne lx soudyers hym tha sir loys departed went layed seige dynaunt countesse mountfort knowledge howe sir loyes spayne assautyng castell conquest sayd sir water manny company might rescue castell shuld achyue great honour agreed therto deted next morning fro hanybout ther abode fewe behynde towne rode falt noone came castell conquest wherin frenche garyson day whan sir water manny sawe howe sir loyes spayne gone sory bycause might nat fight wt hym sayd company sir wyll nat dete hen tyll ise company yander within castell knowe howe wonne made redy assaut frenchman spanyardes defended theym selfe aswell might archer helde short glysshmen aproched walles found hole wall wherby cattell place entred slew within excepte x taken mercy thenglysshmen bret n drue agayne hanybout wolde set garyson co quest sawe well nat holden p howe sir loyes spayne toke towne dynant gerande cap lxxxiii nowe let v retourne loys spayne belieged towne dynant bretayne caused made lytell vessel make assaut bothe water lande whan burgess towne sawe howe dager lese lyues goodes yelded theself agayne wyll capten sir raynalt guyngnap slewe myddes market place cause wolde nat consent whan sir loyes spayne ben ther two dayes taken fealtie burgess set ther newe capyten squyer called gerard maulyne founde ther prisoner lorde pyers portbeufe hym went great towne see syde called gerand layd siege therto founde therby many vessel shyppes laded wyne marcha te brought thyder fro poycton ochell sell marchantes anon solde ne yuell payed loys caused spanyardes geneunys entre shyppes next day assayled towne bothe lande water within coude nat defend selfe lightly wonne byforce towne robbed people put swerde without mercy men woman chyldren fyue church brent vyolated wherof sir loys sore dyspleased caused xxiiii dyd de hanged labour ther moche treasoure euery man coude bere away riche towne marchan dyse whan towne wyst nat whyder go farther sir loys spayn hym sir othes orne certayne genowayes spanyardes entred shyppes aduenture along see syde se might wynne thyng ther vycont rohayne hysshoppe en ry leon nephue retourned choost sir charles loys lay slyll castell lroy ther founde many knyghtes lordes fraunce newely come thyder sir loyes poycters therle ualence therle aucerre therle porcyen therle joigny erle bolayne dyuerse kyng sent thyder canme owne good wylles serue sir charles bloys strong castell alroy nat wonne ther suche famyn within vii dayes eten horse lorde charles de bloys wolde nat take mercy without might haue simpley pleasur whan within sawe remedy secretely night yssued wyll god went thoost one syde yet ceyued slayne sir henry pennefort sir olyuer brother scaped lytle wood therby went streyght hanybout coutesse thus wansir charles bloyes castell alroy whan layne siege x wekes newly fortifyed place set therin newe captayns men warr departed went layed siege uanes wherin sir geffray maletrayt captayne next day certayne soudyers countess mountfort beyng towne ployremell yssued hope somwhat wynne came sodenly mornyng host sir charles de bloys aduentured themselfe farr closed lost many folkes thother fledde away chased gate ployremell whiche nat ferr fro uanes whan hoost retourned fro chase incontynent made assaut uanes byforce wanne bayles harde gate cyte ther sore skirmysshe many hurt slayne bothe party assaut endured tyll night ther truse taken endure next day burgess next day yelded vp towne whyther captayne wold ornat whan sawe wold none wyse departed towne secretly coude went hanybout sosir charles bloys frenchman entred ua ne taryed ther fyue dayes went layd siege cytie called traiz p howe sir water manny dysconfited sir loyes spayne felde camperle cap lxxxiiii let v returne sir loyes spayne whan porte guerand seesyde copany sayled forth tyll came bretayn bretonaunt port called camperle right nene quypercorentyn saynt mathue fyne portern yssued shyppes landed brent countrey gate moche rychesse whiche conueyed shyyppes whan sir gaultyer manny sir arnold clysson vnderstode tidynges determyned go thyder shewed myndes sir gyles tribyquedy cathelayne guyngnape lorde landreman sir wyllm caducall two brethern penneforde knyghtes ther hanybout agreed go good wylles toke shyppes toke theym thre thousande archer sayled forthe tyll came port wher shyppes sir loys spaynes lay incotynent toke theym slewe within theym founde suche rychesse maruell therof toke lande went forthe brent dyuers townes house departed themselfe thre batayls intent soner fynde ennemys left thre hundred archer kepe shippes wonne sette way thre partes tidynges anone came sir loyes spayne drewe togyder company withdrue backe towarde shyppes great hast encountred one thre batayls thane sawe well must nedes fyght sette men order made newe knyght nephue called alphons sir loys sette fiersly first rencou ter many ouerthrowen likely haue ben dysconfyted two batels nat come cry noyse people contrey drewe thyder batayle seerser thenglysshe archer shotte holly togyder geneuoyes spanyardes wer dysconfited slayne cotrey fell staues stone ser loys moche scape dyd flee shyppes vi scaped hym thre hudred nephue slayne whan cae shyppes roud nat entre archer england kept hym fayne gret ieopardy take lytell shypp called lyque suche copany coude get sayled away fast might whan sir gaulter copany cae shyppes entred best ship folowed chase sir loyes spayne euer fledde fast coude nat ouertake hym sir oyes last toke port redon entred towne taryed nat incontynent thengly sshmen landed place sir loyes company fayne get horse might rode then renes nat ferre then yuell horsed fayne fall handes ennemyes sir loys entred renes thenglysshmen breton retourned redone lay nyght nexte day toke agayne see sayle hanybout countesse moutfort contrary wynde fayne take lande thre leages fro dynant toke way lande wasted countrey dynant tooke horse suche coude get without sadyls cae rochprion sir gaultier manny saydsirs yf company nat soretraueled wolde gyue assaut castell knyghtes answered hym sayd sir set pleasure shall nat sake dye quarell al went assaut gerarde maulyn captayne ther made good defence perylouse assaut sir johan butler sir mathewe fresnoy sore burte many p howe sir gaultier manny toke castell gonyin forest cap lxxxv gerarv maulyn hadde brother called rengne maulyn captayne lytel tresse therby called fauet whasie knewe theglysshmen breton assayling brother rochprion thentent ayde brother yssued toke hym xl copanyons came thyderwarde afayre medowe wood syde foude certayne englysshmen lyeng hurt sette toke prisoner ledde fauet hurt sledde sir water manny shewed hym case ceased assaut company great hasse folowed ledde prisoner fauet coude nat ouertake regny prisoner entred castell thenglysshmen sore trayueled made ther gret assaut nothyng coude wynne well defended also late lay ther night entent assyle castell agayne mornig gerarde maulyn knewe toke horse night rode alone dynant ther lytell day shewed case lorde pyers portbeuse capitayne dynaunt assone day assembled burgess towne common hall ther gerarde maulyne wed theym mater suche wyse content go forth armed went towardes fauet sixe thousand men one sir gaultier manny knewe therof spye thane couusayled togyder cosydred great da ger dynant shulde come onesyde sir charles blois copany thother syde might enclosed tha agreed leaue copanyons prisone tyll another tyme might amende retourned towarde hanybout came castell called gony lafo rest yelded vp sir charles bloyes fyftene dayes sir gaultier sayde howe wolde go farther sore trayueled tyll made assaute castell se demeanynge ther made fierse assaut within quickely defended theym selfe sir gaultier encouraged company euer one theformast somoche archersshotte quyckely close togyder ther none durst appere defence sir gaultier dyd somoche parte dyke fylled busshes wood came walles pyckaxes instrumentes anone made great hole wall ther entred perforce slewe founde within lodged ther night next day went hanybout p howe sir charles bloyes toke towne carahes cap lxxxvi whan coutesse knewe comynge came mette kyssed made great chere caused al noble men dyne castell nowe season sir charles bloys wonne uannes lay sege carahes coutes motfort sir gaultier manny sent certayne messangers kyng englande signyfieng hym howe sir charles bloys lordes france conquered uannes renes dyuers good townes castelles bretaygne lickely wynne shortly resysted messangers arryued cornewall rode wyndesore kyng p nowe lette v speke sir charles bloys sore constrayned assautes ingens towne carahes yelded theym selfe vp sir charles receyued mercy sware hym homage fealtie toke hym lorde ther made newe officer taryed ther fyftene dayes tha determyned go lry siege hanybout yet knewe well towne well fortifyed sufficyent prouisyon thyder went layed siege fourth day thyder came sir loys spayne layen towne renes sixe wekes helyng suche hurtes well receyued knyght moche honoured welbeloued among frenche company dayly encreased ther dyuers lordes knyghtes france goyng spayne warde suche warres bytwene kynge spayne kyng granado sarasyne knyghts passed poyctou harde warres bretayne drewe way sir charles bloyes rayred vp agaynst hanybout fyftene sixtene great engyns whiche caste towne many great stone within set nat moch therby well defended agaynste somtyme wolde come walles wype derysion sayeng go seke vp company whiche resteth feldes camperle wherof sir loys spayne genowayes great dyspite p howe sir john butler sir hubert fresnoy rescued fro deth hanybout cap lxxxvii day sir loyes spayne came tent sir charles du bloyes desyred hym gyft seruyce euer done presence dyuerse lordes france sir charles graunted hym bycause knewe hymselfe somoche bounde hym sir requyre cause two knyghtes prison fauet brought hyther say sir john butler sir hubert fresnoy gyue pleasure sir gyft desyre haue chased dysconfetted hurt slayne nephue alphons nat tell otherwyse reuenged shall stryke heedes towne syght companyons wordes ser charles basshed sayd certenly right goodwyll woll gyue ye prisoner syth ye haue desyred surely shulde shamefull dede put dethe suche two valyant knyghts shalbe occasyon ennemyes deale likewyse wt fall lyke case knowe nat shall daylie fall chance warre dyuers wherfore dere cosyn requyre better aduysed sir loyes sayd sir ye kepe nat promyse wt knowe ye trouth shall depart company shall neuer serue loue agayne whyle lyue whan sir charles sawe none bote sent fauet two knyghts morning brought sir charles bloys tent yt coulde desyre coude nat turne sir loyes spayne fro purpose sayd playnly shulde beheeded anone dyner sore dyspleased wordes bytwene sir charles sir loyes thoccasion two knightes anone come knowlege sir water manny certayne spyes shewed ye myschefe two knyghtes called company toke counsaile best thought one thynge thought wyst nat remedy synde sir gaultier many sayd sir shuld great honour v might delyuer daunger yonther two knyghtes yf put aduenture though fayle therof yet kynge edwarde mayster woll canne v moche thanke therfore woll noble men herafter shall case leest shalbe sayd howe dyd deuoyre sir myne aduyse ye woll folow thynketh man shulde well adueture body saue lyues two suche valyant knyghtes myne aduyse deuyde selfe two partes one part incontynent yssue gate range themself dyke styrre thoost skirmysshe thynke hole hoost woll come rennyng thyder sir aymery ye shall capytayne company take vi thousand good archer shre hundred men armes shall take hundred men armes fyue hundred archer wyll yssue posterne couertly shal dasshe hoost monge lodgynges hynde whiche thynke shall synde good voyde shall haue suche shall well bring tent sir charles du bloyes thynke shall fynde two knyghtes prisoner ensure shall deuoyreto delyuer deuyse pleased incontynent armed houre dyner sir aymery clysson yssued company set opyn chiefe gate towardes hoost dasshed sodaynly thoost cut downe tentes slewe hurte dyuerse thoost sodayne fray hast armed theym drewe towardes thenglyssh men breton fayre easely reculed backe sore skirmysshe many manne ouerthrowen bothe party sir aymery drewe people longe bykes within barryers archer redy bothe sydes way receyue ennemys noyse crye great ye hole hoost drewe thyder left tentes voyde sauynge certayne varlettes meane season sir gaultier manny copany yssued posterne priuely cae behynde hoost entred lodgynges frenche lordes none resyst skirmysshe thane sir gaultier went streyght sir charles bloys tent founde two knyghtes prisoner hubert fresnoy sir john butteler made incotynent leape vpon two good horse brought thyder intent retourned incontynent entred agayne hanybout way thei yssued countesse receyued gret ioy season fought styll ye gate tidynges came lordes fraunce howe two knyghts prisoner rescued whan sir loyes spayne knewe therof thought hym selfe dysceyued demaunded way gone made rescue shewed hym howe entred hanybout thane sir loyes departed fro assaut went lodgynge right sore dyspleased lefte assant trayet two knyghtes aduentured selfe forwarde taken frenchman lorde landreman chathelayne guyngnape wherof sir charles bloyes hadde great ioye brought tent preched tourned sir charles parte dyd homage feaultie hym iii day lordes assembledde lorde charles tent take counsayle sawe well hanybout strong well fortifyed men warre thought shulde wynne lytell also countrey wasted wyst nat ther go forage also wynter hande wherfore agreed depart counsayled sir charles bloyes shuld sende newe prouisyons cyties townes fortress suche wonne noble capitayns good soudyours defende place fro ennemyes also man wolde treat trewse whytsontyde shulde nat refused p howe sir charles bloyes toke towne jugon castell cap lxxxviii counsell euery man agreed thaue bytwene saynt reymy sayntes yere ourelorde god ccc xlii euery man departed charles bloys went carahes withall lordes partie retayned certayne lordes styll hym counsayle hym besynesse whyle lay day burges riche marchant jugon taken marshall sir robert beannoys brought lorde charles burgesse rule towne jugon vnder countesse also welbeloued towne burges put feare lyfe desyred let passe ransome handled one wayes fell bargayn betray towne jugone leaue opyn certayne gate well trusted tawne kept kayes whan ther acomplysshe layed sonne hostage sir charles promysed gyue hym fyue hundred pounde yerely rent day poyntment came gate lefte opyn n ght sir charles company entred towne great puyssaunce watche castell dyd perceyue began cry larum treason treason towne began styre whan sawe towne loste fledde castell heapes burgesse done treason fled countenace whan day sir charles company entred house lodge toke wolde whane sawe castell stronge full men sayd wold nat go then tyll pleasure sir gerard rochfort captayne castell perceyued burgesse betrayed toke hanged hym ouer walles whan consydred howe sir charles made vowe nat det then tyll castell prouysion wolde nat serue x dayes agreed yelde goodes left lyues saued grauted made fealtie homage sir charles bloyes stablysshed captayne ye sayd sir gerard rochfort newely refresshed towne castell warr uisyon meane season certayne noble men bretayne spake truse certayn space bytwene sir charles bloyes countesse mountfort agreed ayders assisters also kynge englande sent countesse come englande assone trewse confirmed coutesse toke see passed englande p feest iustynge made london kyng england loue countesse salisbury cap lxxxix le haue well harde howe kynge englande great warres dyuers countreis men warre garysons gret cost charge picardy normady gascoyne xaynton poycton bretayne scotlande ye haue harde also kyng stryken loue countesse salisbury loue quickened hym day night fresshe beautie godely demeanour euer remebrance though therle salisbury one priuyest counsell one done hym best seruyce fell ye loue lady great desyre ye king se caused great feest cryed iustyng holden cyti lodon myddes august cry also made flaunders heynault brabat fraunce gyueng comer euery contrey safe coduct come go gyuen comaundement owne realme lordes knyghtes squyers ladyes domosels shuld ther without excuse comaunded expresly erle salisbury lady wyfe shulde ther bring ladyes damosel countrey therle graunted kyng thought none yuell gode lady durst nat say nay howbeit came sore agaynst wyll thought well ynough wherfore durst nat dyscouer mater husband thought wolde deale bringe kynge fro opynion noble feest erle wyllyam heynalt john heynalt vncle great nombre lordes knyghtes hyghe lynage great daunsynge iustynge space xv dayes lorde john eldyst son vycount beaumonde england slayne iustes ladyes damoselles fresshely besene accordyng degree except alys countesse salisbury went simply myght intent kyng shulde nat sette regarde fully determyned maner thynge shulde tourne dyshonour husbandes feest sir henry wrye necke erle lancaltre sir henry sonne erle derby sir robert dartoyes erle rychmount erle northampton glocetter erle warwyke erle salisbury erle penneforde erle hereford erle arundell erle cornewall erle uenforde erle suffolke baron stafforde dyuers lordes knightes englande noble departed kyng receyued letter fro dyuers lordes sundrie contreis goscoyne bayon flaunders fro jaques dartuell scotlande fro lorde rose lorde persy fro sir edward baylleull captayne berwyke sygnifyed kynge scottes helde simply trewse concludedd yere newely assembled togyder moch people entent coude nattell also captayne poycton xanton rochell burdeloyes wrote kyng howe frenchman made great preparacions warre peace made arras nere expyred wherfore tyme kyng take counsayle aduyse aunswered messangers fro poynt poynt p howe kynge englande sent sir robert dartoys bretayne cap lxxxx among thynges kynge englande wolde socoure countesse moutfort quene thanne kyng desyred cosyn sir robert dartoyes take certayne nombre men warre archer go coutesse bretayne dyde departed toke shypping hampton see great season bycause cotrary wyndes departed ester great counsell london kyng aduysed sende scotlande parfour maunce trewse endure two thre yeres consydring kyng somoche besynesse place kynge englande lothe therto wolde haue made suche warr scotland shulde haue ben fayne haue desyred peace howbeit counsayle shewed hym suche reason agreed therto among thynges counsell sayd great wysdome whan prince hath warre dyuers plac one tyme agre one truse another pacify fayre wordes thyrde make warre thanne bysshoppe sende legacyon went forthe processe retourned agayne brought relacyon howe ye king scottes wolde agre trewese without agrement frenche kynge kyng englande sayde openly wolde neuer rest tyll arayed realme scotlande shulde neuer recouered maunded euery man shulde hym berwyke eester except suche apoynted go bretayn feest ester came kynge helde great court berwyke chiefe lordes knyghts england ther taryed space thre wyckes meane season certayne good men laboured bytwene ye party haue trewse truse agreed endure two yere confyrmed french kyng euery man departed kyng went wyndsore sende lorde thomas hollande lorde john bayon two hundred men armes andfour hundred archer kepe fronters ther p nowe let v speke sir robert dartoyes yere fell hye nere g may myddes whiche moneth trewse bytwene lorde charles bloys countesse mountfort shulde expyre sir charles bloyes well fyed purchase countesse mou made englande confort kynge promysed whiche intent lorde loyes spayne sir charles germaux sir othes dornes layd see gernzay thre thousande genowayes thousande men armmes xxxii great shyppes p batell gernzay bytwene sir robert dartoys sir loys spayne see cap lxxxxi sir robert dartoyes erle rychmont hym therle pennefort ye erle salisbury therle suffolke therle quenfort baron stafford lorde spenser lord bourchier dyuers knyghtes englande copanyes countesse mountfort see last came yle gernzay eyued ye great flete genowayes wherof sir loys spaygne chiefe captayne marynars sayd sir arme quickely yonder genowayes spaniardes woll set thenglysshmen sowned trumpettes reared vp baners standerdes armes deuyses baner saynt george sette shippes order archer ye wynd serued sayled forth xlvi vessel great small sir loys spaygne ix greatter thre galyes thre galyes ye thre chiefe captaynes sir loyes spayne sir charles sir othes whan aproched nere togyder genowayes beganne shote crosbowes archer englande agaynst theym sore shotynge bytwene many hurte bothe party whane lordes knyghtes squyers came nere togyder sore batayle countesse day worth man harte lyon hande sharpe glayue wherwith fought feersly spanyardes genowayes great vessel cast downe great barres yron peace tymbre yt troubled sore thenglysshe archer batayle beganne tyme euynsonge nyght departed darke one coude scant knowe withdrewe eche fro cast ankers abode styll harnes thought fight agayne mornynge mydnight ther rose suche tempest horryble though worlde shulde haue endedd none hardy wold gladly haue ben land shyppes dasshed togyder went wolde haue ryuen peace lordes englande demaunded counsayle maryners best aunswered take lande assone might tempest great toke see daunger drownyng drewe vp ankers bare quarter sayle drewe fro place genowayes syde drewe vpp ankers toke depe see vesselles greatter thenglysshe shyppes might better abyde brunt see great vessel coe nere lande lickely haue ben broken deted toke foure englysshe shyppes laded vytell tayled shyppes storme hedeouse lasse day driuen hundred leages fro place wher fore englysshe shyppes toke lytell hauen nat ferre fro cytie uannes wherof ryght gladde p howe sir robert dartoys toke cytie uannes bretayne cap lxxxxii thus tourment ye see brake departed batell see bytwne sir robert dartoyes sir loyes spayne man coude tell whome gyue honour departed agaynst bothe wylles thenglysshmen toke lande nat farre fro uannes brought horse harnes lande tha deuysed sende nany hanybout go theymselfe ley siege uannes therin captayns sir henry leon olyuer clysson lorde turmyne lord loheac whan sawe thenglysshmen come besiege toke good hede defence bothe castell walles gate euery gate set knyght x men armes xx crosbowes p nowe let v speke sir loyes spayns company sore tourmented thesee great daunger nyght nexte day tyll noone loste two shyppes menne thane thirde day prime see apeased demaunded maryners parte lande nexte aunswered realme nauarre wynde hadde driuen theym bretayne sirscore leages tha cast anker fludde whan tyde came good wynde retourne rochell costed bayon wolde nat come nere met foure shippes bayon comyng fro flaunders sette toke theym shortly flewe sayled towardes rochell fewe dayes arryued gue rande ther toke lande hard ther howe sir robert dartoyes lay siege fore uannes sent lorde charles bloyes knowe pleasure shuld sir robert dartoys lay siege thousande men armes thre thousande archer wasted countrey brent dynant gony la forest none durst abyde playne countrey many assautes skirmysshes barryers uannes countesse mountfort styll sir robert dartoys siege also sir gaultier manny hanybout delyuered kepynge towne sir wyllyam caducall sir gerard rochfort toke hym sir yue tribyquedy c men armes cc archer deted fro hanybout went siege uannes incon ynent made great assaut thre place one ye archer shotte thycke within scante durst apere ther defence assaut endured hole day many hurt bothe party agaynst night thenglysshmen withdrue lodgyng within likewyse sore wery trayuell vnarmed hoost without dyd nat kept styll harnes except heed peces dranke refresshed aduyse sir robert dartoyes ordayned agayne thre batayls two assaute gate thethirde batayle kepe selfe priue tyll two batayls assayled long strength towne shulde ther lickelyho e defend tha ordayned thyrde batayle shuld sette moost feblest place towne ladder rope hokes yron caste walles de ysedde done sir robert dartoys first batell came made assaut night one gate therle salisbury ye seconde batell gate bycause darke thyntent make within abasshed made great fiers brightnesse therof gaue lyght cytie wherby within wende yt house ben fyre cryed treason many bedde rest trayuell day rose sodenly ran towardes lyght without order gode aray without counsell captayns euery man within armed thus whyle trouble therle quenefort sir water manny thyrde batell came walles wher defence made ladder mounted vp entred ye towne frechmen toke hede ocupyed place tyll sawe ennemis stretes euery fledde away saue themselfe captayns leaser go castell fayne take horse yssued postern happy yt might get saue hymselfe euer sene thenglysshmen taken slayne towne ouer ron robbed countesse sir robert dartoyes entred yt towne great ioy p howe sir robert dartoys dyed buryed cap lxxxxiii thus haue shewed cyte uannes taken fyue dayes countesse mountfort sir gualtier manny sir yue tribiquedy dyuerse knyght englande bretayne returned hanybout therle salysbury therle pennefort therle suffolke therle cornwall departed fro uannes fro sir robert dartoyes thre thousandemen armes thre archer went layed siege cytie renes sir charles de bloyes departed then foure dayes gone nantes left cytie many lordes knyghtes squyers styll sir loys spayne see kept fronters agaynst englande none coude go bytwene englande bretayne without great danger done yere englande great damage takyng thus uannes thenglysshmen countrey sore abasshedde thought hadde suche capitaynes ben able haue detended de agaynst worlde knewe well towne stronge well prouyded men warre artyllary mysadnenture sir henry leon lorde clysson sore basshedde ennemyes spake shame agaynst theym two knyghtes sore dyspleased mater gette togyder company knyghtes soudyours day apoynted met cytie uannes mothan xii thousande one thyder came lorde robert beaumanoyre marshall bretayn layd sege ye cite sydes assayled fersly whan robert dartoys sawe howe besieged cytie nat neglygent kepe defence without fierse cause wolde nat laye siege renes shulde nat trouble theym made feerse assaute gaue theym within moche wan barryers gate cutted cytie force englysshmen put chase dyuerse hurte slayne specially sir robert dartoyes sore hurte scapedde hardely vntaken departed posterne lorde stafforde hym lorde spencer taken sir henry leon sore hurte dyed thyrde day thus frenchemen wanne agayne cytie uannes sir robert darteyes taryed season hanybout sore hurte laste counsayled go englande seke helpe hurtes handled see soores rankeled laste landed brought london within shorte space dyed hurtes buryed london church saynt poule kynge dyd nobly obsequy though ben owne proper cosyne germayne therle derby dethe greatly moned englande kyng englande sware wolde neuer rest tyll reuenged dethe sayde howe wolde go hym selfe bretayne bringe countrey suche case shulde nat recouered agayne fortie yere incontynent sent letter throughout realme euery noble man shulde come hym within moneth prepared great nauy shyppes ende moneth toke see toke landyng bretayne nat farre fro uannes sir robert dartoyes ariyued thre dayes landyng prouisyon iiii day went towarde uannes season therle salisbury therle pebroke lyeng siege renes phowe kyng englande came bretayne make warre cap lxxxxiiii kyng englande ben lande certayne space went layed siege uanes towne ther sir lyuer clysson sir ry leon lorde turmyne sir geffray malestrayet sir guy lohearc supposed well kyng englande wolde come bretayne wherfore prouyded towne castell thyngs necessary kyng made great assaut endured halfe day lytell good dyd cyte well defeded whane countesse mountfort knewe kyng englande come departed fro hanybout accompanyed sir gaultier manny dyuers knyghtes squyers came uanes se kyng lordes thoost foure dayes retourned agayne hanyboute owne company pnowe let v speke sir charles bloyes nauntes assone knewe kyng england aryued bretayne sent worde therof frenche kyng vncle desyring socour whan ye king england sawe cyte strong hard reported howe countrey ther poore sore wasted wyst nat wher get forage nother beest tha ordayned deuyde nombre first therle arundell lorde stafforde sir water manny sir yue tribyquedy sir rychard rochfort vi c men armes vi archer kepe styll siege ua ne ryde distroy contrey kyng went renes wher ioy fully receyued lay siege done long season whan kyng ben ther fyue dayes vnderstode sir charles du bloyes nantes made great assemble men warre thane kynge departed fro renes left yll ther ther contynue siege kyng cae nauntes besieged farre might coude nat lay rounde cite great marshall hoost rode abrode distroyed great part countrey kyng ordayned batellon lytell moutayne without towne ryed fro ye mornyng tyll noone wenyng sir charles bloys wolde haue yssued haue gyuen hym batayle whan sawe wolde nat brewe lodgyngs fore ryders ranne baryers skirmysshed brent subbarbes thus kyng lay nauntes sir charles within wrote frenche kyng state thenglysshmen frenche kyng commaunded sonne duke normandy gyue ayde ser charles bloyes duke coe angyers made asseble men warr kyng englande made dyuers assautes nantes euer lost men wanne nothyng whan sawe assautes coude nothyng charles wolde nat yssue felde fyght wt hym ordayned therle uenforte sir henry vycont beaumot lorde er ye lorde rose lorde mombray lorde dalawarre lorde raynolde cobham lorde sir john lysse sixe hundred men armes two hundred archer kepe styll ye siege ther ryde distroy countrey kynge went layed sege towne dynant wherof sir peter portbeu e captayne kyng made fierse assautes within defended themselfe valyantly thus kyng england one season siege lyeng thre cite good towne bretaygne phowe sir henry leon lorde clysson taken prisoner uannes cap lxxxxv whyle kyng england thus bretayne wastynge distroyeng contrey suche hadlyeng sege ua ne gaue dyuers specially one gat day ther great assaut many feates armes done bothe party within set opyn gate came baryers bycause sawe erle warwykes baner therle arndels lorde staffordes sir water mannes aduenturyng themself teopdously thought wherfore lorde clysson sir henry leon aduentured themselfe couragyously ther sore skirmysshe finally englysshmen put backe knyghts bretayne openyd barryes aduentured themselfe left sir knyghtes gode nombre kepe towne yssued thenglysshmen thenglysshmen reculed wysely euer fought sawe auantage thenglysshmen multiplyed suche wyse last frechmen breton wer fayne recule backe agayne towne nat good order came forthe thenglysshmen folowed agayne many slayne hurt towne sawe men recule agayne chased closed barryers yuell tyme lorde clysson sir hery leon closed ther bothe taken prisoner syde lorde stafforde gone farre closed bytwene gate barye ther taken prisoner dyuerse hym taken slayne thus thenglysshmen drewe lodgynges breton cytie uannes phowe kyng englande toke towne dynant cap lxxxxvi thus ye haue harde knyghtes taken bothe party mo suche assautes nowe let v speke ye king englande lay sege dynant whan layne ther four dayes gate great bre bottes barge made archer entre theym rowe pale wherewith towne closedde none walles archer shot feersly yt non durst shewe defence ther certayne are whyle archer dyd shote hewed downe pale entred byforce tha towne fledde market place kept small order entred pale came yt gate dyd opyn euery man entred ye capitayne sir pyers portbeufe taken towne ouer ron robbed theglysshmen wan moche richesse towne great towne marchandyse whan kyng taken pleasure ther long pleased hym left towne voyde went uannes lodged p nowe let v retourne sir loys spayne sir charles germaur ser othes dornes admyrall see viii galeys xiii barkes xxx shyppes genowayes spanyardes kept coost bytwene england bretayne dyd moche damage came refresshe hoost uannes tyme set kynge englandes nauy lyeng aucerre lytell hauyn besyde uannes slewe great part kepte shyppes done moch damage yf thenglysshmen lyeng siege nat ron thyder hast yet asmoche hast made sir loys spayne toke away iiii shippes laded prouisyon drowned thre kyng counselled drawe part nauy brest hauen part hanybout done styll endured siege uannes renes p lordes france duke normandy brought bretayne agaynst kyng englande cap lxxxxvii howe let v retourne iourney duke normandy made season bretayne ayde confort cosyn syt charles de bloyes duke knewe well howe kyng englande sore damaged contrey bretayn besieged thre cytes taken towne dynant duke departed fro cytie angyers mo iiii men armes rxx toke heygh way nauntes gyding two marshal fraunce lorde momorency lorde saynt uenant rode duke therle alanson vncle therle bloys cosyn duke burbone ther therle ponthyeu therle bolayne ye erle uandome therle damartyne ye lorde craon lorde coucy lorde suly lorde frenes lorde roy many lordes knightes squyers normady dauuergne berry lymosen dumayn poicton xaynton long reherse dayly encreased tidynges came lordes lay siege nantes yt duke normandy commynge thyder xl men warr incotynent thei sent worde therof kyng england kyng studyed lytell thought breke vp siege uannes also siege renes togyder drawe nauntes counsell sayd hym sir ye good sure ground nere nauy sende lyeth siege nantes come let siege ly styll renes nat ferr shalbe euer redy come yf nede kynge agreed counsell sent nauntes came hym ua ne duke normandy came nantes wher sir charles de bloys lordes loged cytie men abrode co trey coude nat lodge cytie subbarbes p howe kynge englande duke normandy hoost agaynst hoost lodged uannes cap lxxxxviii whyle duke normady nauntes lordes englande lay siege renes day made great feerse assaut made many instrumentes saut assaut enduredde hole day wan nothynge lost byuers men within cytie lorde dancenysi lorde pont ser john malatrayt yuan charnell bertram grasquyne squyer defended selfe well bysshoppe cytie toke damage howe thenglysshmen lay ther styll ouer ran wasted contrey duke normandy departed host drue towarde uannes soner fynde ennemies enformed howe uannes moost ieopardy peryll lesyng two marshal went forthe sir geffray charney therle guynes constable fraunce made areregarde thus frenchman came uannes thother syde agaynst ther kyng englande say lay longe fayre medowe syde made great dyke host marshal fore ryders often tymes skirmysshed toguyder bothe party kynge englande sende therle salisbury therle pe broke lay ar siege renes come hym dyd thenglysshemen bretous partie well nombre ii v c men armes vi archer iiii fote frenchman foure tymes many well elled kyng england fortifyed hoost frenchman coude take aduauntage hym made mo assautes towne bycause sparyng artyllary thus two hoostes lay one agaynst longe season tyll well warde wynter pope clement sixt sende cardynall penester cardynall cleremount entreat peace rode often tymes bytwene party coude bring peace mean season ther many skirmysshes men taken slayne ouerthrowen bothe pties thenglysshmen durst nat go foragyng great copanyes euer great danger reason busshmentes layd also sir loyes spayne kept see coost moche danger thyng came thenglysshe hoost frenchman thought kepe kynge ther inmaner sieged also frenchman endured moche payne wete colde day night rayned wherby lost many horse fayne dyslodge lye playne feldes somoche water lodgynges last cardynals dyd somoch truse agreed thre yere kyng englande duke normandy sware vpholde without brekyng custome suche lyke case p howe french kynge caused heedes stryken lorde clysson dyuerse lordes bretayne normandy cap lxxxxix thus great assembly brake vpp siege raysed uannes duke normandy went nantes hym ye two cardynals kyng englade went hanybout countesse mountfort ther exchaunge made bytwene baron stafford lorde clysson whan kyng tary ed hanybout long pleased left ther therle penbroke sir wyllyam caducall thane retourned englande aboute christmas duke normandy retourned fraunce gaue leaue euery man depart anone lord clysson taken vpon suspecyous treason putte chatelet parys wherof many great marueyle lordes knyghtes spake eche therof sayde mater yt layd agaynst lorde clysson ther none coude tell ymagined false enuy bycause kynge england bare fauour delyuer hym exchang rather sir henry leon styll prison bycause kyng shewed hym auantage enemyes suspected hym auen ture nat true vpon suspect heeded paris without mercy excuse gretly moned anone ther dyuers knyghtes accused semblable case lorde maletrayt son lorde uangor sir thybault morilon dyuers lordes bretayne bre x knyghtes squyers lost heedes parys anone sayd ther put dethe famyne iiii knyghtes normandy sir wyllyam baron sir henry maletrayt ye lorde rochtesson sir rycharde persy wherby fell moche trouble bretayne norma dy lorde clysson sonne called father olyuer went countesse mountfort sonne age also without father dyed ye haue hard ye castell lour paris p order saynt george kyng edwarde stablysshed castell wyndsore cap c season king england toke pleasure newe reedefy castell wyndsore whiche begonne kynge arthure ther firste beganne table rounde wherby sprange fame many noble knightes worlde kyng edwarde deter myned make order brotherhode certayne nombre knyghtes called knyghtes blewe garter feest kept yerely wynsore saynt george day begynne order kynge assembled togyder erles lordes knyghtes realme shewed intecyon oyously agreed pleasur bycause thei sawe thyng moche honourable wher great amyte loue shulde growe encrease ther chosen certayne bre moost valyantest men realme sware sayled mentayne ordr naunces suche deuysed ye kyng made chapell castell wynsore saynt george stablysshed certayne chanous ther serue god enduyd fayre rent kyng sende publysshe feest heraldes fraunce scotlande burgone heynault flaunders brabant thepyre almayne gyueng euery knight squyer wolde come sayd feest xv dayes saule conduct feest whiche feest begynne wyndsore saynt george day nexte yere lorde ccc quene ther ac panyed c ladyes damosel noble lynage aparelled acordingly p howe kyng englande delyuerd prison sir henry leon cap c whyle kynge made preparacion wyndsore sayd feest tidynges came hym howe ye lorde clysson dyuers lordes lost heedes frauce wher kyng sore dyspleased moch purpose haue serued sir henry leon lyke case prisonne cosyn erle derby shewed hym counsayle suche reason asswage yre refrayne cou rage sayeng sir though kyng philyppe hast hath done foule dede put dethe valyant knyghtes yet sir blemysshe nat noblenesse sir say trouth prisoner ought bere blame dede sir put hym resouable raunsoe kynge sent knyght prisoner come presence sayd hym sir henry sir henry myne aduersary philyppe ualoyes hath shewed feleny right cruell put dethe suche knyghtes wherwith sore dyspleased thought v hath done dyspite v wolde regarde malyce shulde serue lyke maner ye haue done dyspleasure myne bretayne person woll suffre let hym worst power woll kepe myne honour content ye shall come lyght ransome loue cosyn derby hathe desyred ye woll shall shewe knyght answered sayd sir shal ye shall comaunde sayd kyng knowe well ye one richest knyghtes bretaygne yf wolde sore cease ye shulde pay xxx xl ute ye shall go myne aduersary philypp ualoyes shewe hym behalfe syth hath shamefully putte dethe valyant knyghtes dispyte say woll make good hath broken truse taken twene hym wherfore also renownce parte defye hym fro day forewarde ye woll message yo raunsome shalbe x scute ye shall pay sende bruges within xv dayes ye past see moreouer ye shall say knyghtes squyers partes leaue nat coe feest wyndsore wolde gladly se theym shall haue sure saue coduct retourne v dayes feest sir sayd knyght beste power shall accomplysshe message god rewarde grace courtessy ye shewe also humbly thanke lorde derby goodwyll sir henry leon departed fro ye kyng went hampton ther toke see thyntent arryue har ewe storme toke hym see endured systene dayes lost horse whiche caste see sir henry leon sore troubled neuer helth howe laste toke lande crotoy copany went fote abuyle ther get horse sir henry sicke fayne go lytter came parys kynge philypp dyd message fro poynt poynt lyued nat long dyed went countrey cytie angyers god assoyle soule p howe kynge englande sent therle derby make warre gascoyne cap c ii day saynt george approched gret feest shuld wynsore ther noble company erles barownes ladyes damoselles knyghtes squyers great tryumphe iustynge tournayes endured fyftene dayes thyder came many knyght dyuerse contreis flanders heynalt brabant france ther came none feest duryng dyuerse newse came kynge dyuers contreis thyder came knyghtes gascoyne ye lorde le lorde chaumount lorde musydent sende fro lordes countrey suche englysshe lorde de labreth lorde punye lorde mountferant lorde du lorde carton lorde grayly dyuerse also ther sent messangers fro cytte bayon fro bourdeaux messangers well feested kynge counsayle shewed hym howe countrey gascoyne good cytie bourdeaux febly conforted wherfore desyred hym sende thyder suche captayne suche men warr might resyste agaynst frenchemen great army kept feldes kyng ordayned cosyn erle derby go thyder chiefe captayne hym go therle penbroke therle quenforde baron stafforde sir gaultier manny lorde franque de la hall lyeure de brabant sir hewe hastynges sir stephyn de tombey lorde manny sir rychard haydon lorde normant fynefroyde robert lerny sir john norwyche sir rycharde rocklefe sir robert quenton dyuers fyue hundred knyghtes squyers two thousande archer king sayd cosyn therle derby take golde syluer ynough ye shall lacke depart largely therof men warr wherby ye shall gette loue fauoure kynge ordayned sir thomas daugorne bretaygne countesse mountfort helpe kepe countrey peace taken douted frenche kyng wolde make warre bycause message sent hym sir henry leon hym sent hundred men armes two hundred archer also kyng ordayned therle salisbury therle dulnestre northe tie hundred men armes sixe hundred archer scott rebelled agayne hym brent corn wall ronne bristowe besieged towne dulnestre thus kynge sent men warr dyuers place delyuerd captayns golde syluer sufficyent pay wage retayne soudyers euery company departed ordayned p nowe first lette v speke therle derby grettest charge toke shypping hampton sayled tyll aryued bayon good towne stronge cytie long englysshe landed ther sixt day june ye yere lorde iii c xliiii ther well receyued taryed ther seuyn dayes eyght day departed went burdeaux wher receyued solempne processyon erle derby lodged thabbay saynt andrewe whan erle laylle frenche kynges lyeutenant party vnderstode commyng thenglysshmen sende therle comyges erle pyergourt erle carman vycount uyllemure erle ualentenoyes therle myrande erle dura lorde maryde lorde delabard lorde pycornet vycont chastellone lorde newcastell lorde lestyne abbot saynt syluer lordes suche helde french partie whan togyder thane demaunded counsayle commyng therle derby answered howe thought themselfe strong ynough kepe passage bergerate ouer ryuer garon sayeng pleased well therle layll gascoyne kyng vnder ye french kyng kept contrey long warre endured taken dyuers townes castels fro thenglysshmen lordes sent men warr fro party went kept subbarbes bergerate whiche great inclosed ryuer garon phowe erle derby conquered bergerathe cap c iii whan therle derby ben burdeuxa xv dayes vnderstode howe lordes knyghtes gascoyne bergerath mornynge drewe thyderward caused sir gaultier manny sir franque de hall go marshalles hoost mornynge rode thre leages castell englysshe called mounterolyer lytell leage fro bergerath ther taryed day night next mornynge currours ranne varryers bergerath retourne reported sir gaultier manny howe sene parte demeanour frenchemen thoght symple mornynge thenglysshmen dyned tymes satte dyner sir gaultier manny behelde therle derby sayde sir yf good men armes shulde drinke euenynge frenche lordes beyng bergerath therle shall nat let wha euery man harde sayde let v go arme v shall ryde incontynent bergerath ther shortly euery man armed horsebacke whan erle derby sawe copany well wylled right ioyeouse sayde lette v ryde ennemies name god saynt george rode forthe baners displayed heate day tyll came vaylles bergerath whiche nat easy wynne part ryuer garon went whan frenchman sawe thenglysshmen come assayle sayde amonge theselfe howe shulde sone driuen backe yssued good order many villayns contrey yll armed englysshmen approched archer began shote fiers whanne fotemen felt arowes lyght among theym sawe baners standerdes waue wynde nat bene acustomed se thei reculed backe among owne armes thenglysshmen armes aproched dasshed amog enmys lewe bete downe euery part frenchman armes coulde nother aproche forwarde backewarde owne fotemen reculed without order dyd stoppe way ther many slayne sore hurt theglysshe archer bothe sydes way shotte holly togyder none durste approche yssue theym frenchman put backe subarbes bergerath suche myschefe first bridge baylles wonne clene force thenglysshmen entred pauement many knyghtes slayne sore hurte dyuers prisoner taken aduentuted theymselfe defende passage lorde mirpoyse slayne vnder sir gaultier mannes baner first entred whan therle layll sawe englysshmen wonne subbarbes slayne men without mercy reculed backe towne passed brige great trouble danger yt bridge ther soreskirmysshe lordes knyghtes fought hande hande lorde manny auaunced hymselfe ferre among ennemyes great daunger thenglysshmen toke ther vycount bousquetyne lorde newcastell lorde chastellon lorde de lescu frenchman entred towne closed theirgates lette downe portcolyse wente walles defence assaut skirmyssh endured tyll euenyng thenglysshmen withdrue right sore wery entred ye subbarbes wonne founde wyne v tayle sufficyet hole hoost two monethes next mornyng erle derby caused trumpettes sowned set people order batayle aproched towne made sore assaut endured tyll noone lytell dyd thenglyssh men assaut within defended selfe valyantly noone englysshmen drewe sawe well dyd lese payne lordes went counsayle determyned assaut towne water closed pale therle derby sende nauy burdeaux shyppes ther brought fro burdeaux bergerath lx shyppes barkes next day ye euenynge ordred batayls next mornyng son rysinge nauy redy assaut water baron stafford captayne thenglysshmen archer aduentured theym selfe valyantly came great barryer pale anone cast downe yerth thanne towne came therle de laylle lordes knyghtes ther sayde sir take hede ye woll great iedpardy lost towne lost oe lese haue lyues also yet hit better yelded ourselfe erle derby haue damage erle laylle sayd go place wher nedeth moost defence wyll nat yet yelde vpp towne wente defende pale archer barkes shot holly togyder none burst apere defence without slayne sore hurte within two hundred genowayes crosbowes nere pauysshed agaynste shotte helde englysshe archer well awarke day many hurt bothe party finally englysshmen dyd somoche brake downe great pane ye pale within reculed backe desyred treaty ew e graunted endur day nextnyght shulde nat fortify meane season eyther partie drewe lodgynges nyght lordes within towne great counsayle finally mydnight trussed bagge baggage departed towne bergerath toke waye towne ryoll nat ferre fro then next mornynge englysshmen agayne entred barkes came place broken pale ther founde certayne towne desyred wolde pray erle derby take mercy sauyng lyues goodes fro thensforthe wolde obeysaunt kynge englande erle quenefort therle penbroke sayde wolde speke gladly theym came erle derby shewed hym thyntent towne erle derby sayde mercy desyreth mercy ought haue bydde theym opyn gate shalbe assured myne two lord went agayne towne shewed erle derbyes intent assembled people toguyder sowned belle opyned gate yssued menne woman processyon humbly mette erle derby brought hym chiefe churche sware faythe homage erle name kyng englande vertue procutacyon erle hadde phowe erle derby conquered dyuerse townes fortress hyghe gascoyne cap c iiii day therle laylle come ryoll fro bergerate company deuysed depart themselfe one fortresse soe kepe fronter warre seneshall tholouz erle uyllemure sent auberoche sir bertrame de presse pellagrewe lorde phylippe dyone mount agret lorde mountbrandone mauldurane arnolde dyone mountgyse robert malmore beaumount laylloes sir charles poyters p nne agynoes thus knyght wer deuyded fro garyson garyson erle laylletaryed ryoll newe repayred fortresse whaue erle derby ta yed bergerath two dayes demauded seneshal burdeaur way best hym take sayde wolde natte lye styll seneshall aunswered howe thought best drawe pyergourt hyghe almaygne erle derby prepayred departe left captayne bergerathe sir john dela sante theglysshmen went forwarde came castell called lango wherof veigneur tholouz captayn thenglysshmen taryed gaue assaut castell bycause sayde wolde narte leaue suche castell behynde theym assaut englysshmen wanne lytell nexte day assauters brought fagottes tymber thynges fylled kes might go walles sir fra que de hall counsayled within yelde sayd might abyde long yt shulde late within desyred respyte gyue answere agreed whan counsayled party greed deted lyues bare way thynge went mousacke therle derby made capitayne lango squyer called aymone lyone hym xxx archer therle rode towne called le lacke towne met hym way brought hym kayes dyd homage kyng englande therle went forthe came mandurant whiche wanne assaut whan sette ruler went castell mountgyse toke also assaut captayne sende prisonere burdeaux rode punache also wanne also castell de la lewe taryed thre dayes fourth daye went forsathe wanne lightly also towre pondayre thane came great wne called beaumount laylloyes parceyninge inherytaunce erle laylle thre dayes erle derby lay made great assautes place well tifyed men warre artillery finally wonne many slayne therle derby set newe captayns men warre fro thense went chiefe wne parteyninge erle laylle wherof lorde philyppe dyone arnolde dyone capitayns englysshmen approched barryers archer shotte quickely towne durste nat appere defence firste day baylles harde gate towne wonne euenynge assaut seaced euery man drewe lodgynges next mornynge assaut began agayne dyuers place wyst nat well thane desyred haue peace haraulde sende day respyte treat meane season thane erle derby hym selfe
