went barryers speke theym towne hym baron stafforde lorde manny therle wolde shulde haue yelded themselfe simply agreed towne shuld vnder obeysance kyng englande shulde sende twelfe burgess cytie burdeaur hostage lordes knightes fraunce departed vnder saue conduct went ryoll phowe therle quenfort taken gascoyne delyuerd agayne exchaung cap c v conquest erle derby went bonu made great assaute many hurte bothe party finally takene newe refresshed captaynes men warre therle passed farther cou tie pyergourt passed bordall without assaute laboured longe laste came pyergourt therle countrey towne lorde roger quenfort vncle lorde dura sixscore knyghtes squyers countrey erle derby aduysed howe myght best assayle towne aduauntage well stronge soo thynges consydred thought nat beste enploy people ieopardy went lodged two leages thense lytell ryuer intent assayle castelle pelagrue mydnight yssued pyergourt two hundred speares day came lodgynges thenglyssh men slewe hurte many came erle quenfortes tent founde hym armynge sharpely assayled taken prisoner thre house gascoyns went backe host styred drewe agayne towne nedefull theym founde gate opyn hotely pursued driuen home barryers gascons lyghted defended barryers fought hande hande lost nothyng thenglysshmen retourned hoost erle derby went pelagrue ther sixe dayes made many great assautes ther delyuerance made erle quenfort company exchang vycount bonquentyne vycount chastellone lorde lescue lorde newcastell condycion landes pyergourt shulde abyde thre yeres rest peace lordes knyghtes countrey might well arme themselfe forfette nothyng robbed brent within countrey durynge space thus thenglysshmen departed fro pelagrue pertayned countie pyergourt erle derby went auberoche fayre castell stronge pertayninge bysshoppe tholouz thenglysshmen lodged theymselfe thoughe mynded abyde longe space dyde sende worde within yelde theselfe taken byforce deed without mercy within hadde great dout lyues sawe socour co mynge fro partie yelded themselfe became subgettes kyng england erle derby drewe towarde burdeaux left garyson aube coche sir fra que de la halle sir alayne fynefroyde sir john lynedall thane way came good towne called lyburne twelfe leages fro burdeaux layde siege sayde howe wolde nat depart thense tyll within tooke counsayle thynges consydred good yuell yelded therle derby dyd homage ther therle taryed thre dayes left erle penbroke lorde stafforde sir stephyn courey sir alysander hausayle styll lyborne therle derbythe erle quenfort sir gaultier manny rode streyght bourdeaux phowe therle layle layde siege auberoche cap c vi retournynge therle derby bourdeaux ioyefully receyued mette processyon offeredde hym euery thyng towne pleasure taryed sported hym burgess ladyes damosel towne pnowe lette v speke erle laylle ryoll whane vnderstode erle derby burdeaux lay styll lickelyhode wolde styrre farther season wrote erle pyergourt carmaynye couynes breuniquele lordes gascoyne frenche partie shulde assemble men come mete hym auberoche mynde ley siege therto obeyed hym kynge party gascoyne lordes knyghtes within auberoche nat ware siege tyll layd rounde none coude yssue entre without parceyuinge frenchemen brought four great engyns fro tholouz whiche dyd caste day night made assaut within sixe dayes broken roffes towres chamber within durste nat abyde lowe vautes intent host slee within el haue yelde simply therle derby knowledge howe siege lay auberoch knewe nat company wer sore oppressed whan sir franque de hall sir aleyne de fyneforde sir john lyndall thus besieged within auberoche sawe theselfe thus hardly bestadde demaunded among varlet good rewar de wolde bere letter therle derby bur deux one varlet stepped forth sayd wold gladly bere nat aduantage rewarde rather helpe delyuer daunger nyght varlette toke letter sealed seales thanne went downe dyke past hoost none remedy met firste watche past spake good gascoyne named lorde hoost sayd parteyned hym agayn taken among tentes brought herte hoost sherched letter founde hym soo kepte saue tyll mornynge lordes assembled togyder letter brought therle layle great ioye whanne perceyued within sore co strayned coude nat long endure toke varlet hanged letter necke dyd put hym engyn dyde cast hym towne varlette fell downe deed wherwith within sore troubled season therle pyergourt vncle sir charles poyters vycount carmany lorde dura horsbacke passed walles towne nere might cryed within sayd mockery sir demau de messanger founde therle derby syth went nyght retourned agayne shortly sir fraque de hall sayde sir though closed shall yssue whan shall please god erle derby wolde god knewe case knewe none durste kepe felde ye wolde sende hym worde therof one v shall yelde hymselfe prisoner raunsomed gentylman ought frenchman answered nay nay sir mater shall nat go erle derby shall knowe well ynough whan engyns haue beaten downe castell yerthe ye haue yelded vp simply sauyng lyues certaynly quod sir franque shall nat yelde felfe woll rather dye within frechmen retourned agayne hoost thre englysshe knyghtes sore abasshed stone fell towne gaue sore stroke semed lyke thondre falled fro heuyn p howe therle derby toke auberoch therle layle dyuers erles vycountes bre ix cap c vii mater taking messager letter necessytie auberoch shewed erle derby spye frenche hoost therle derby sent erle penbroke beyng bergerath mete hym certayne place also sende lorde stafforde sir stephyn tombey beyng lyborne erle hymselfe sir gaultier manny company rode towardes auberoche rode secretely suche guydes knewe co trey therle came lyborne taryed day abydinge erle penbroke whan sawe came nat went forth great desyre ayde auberoch thus therle derby therle quenforde sir gaultier manny sir rychard hastynges sir stephyn tombey lorde feryers yssued lyborne rode night mornyng wer within two lytell leages auberoche entred woode lyghted fro horse tyed horse pasture abydinge erle penbroke taryed tyll noone wyste nat well bycause thre hundred speres sixe hundred archer frenchman auberoch x xii thousande men yet thought great shame lese co panyons auberoche finally sir gaultier manny sayde sir lette v leape horse let v coost vnder couert woode tyll syde ioyneth hoost whan nere put spurres horse crye cryes shall entre whyle supper vnware v ye shallse dysconfited shall kepe none aray lordes knightes agreed sayeng euery man toke horse ordayned page baggage abyde styll ther rode styll long wode came lytell ryuer vale nere french host displayed baners prnons dasshed spurr horse cae fronte frenche hoost among gascoyns nothyng ware busshment goynge supper redy sette meate thenglysshmen cryed derby derby ouerthrewe tentes pauylions slewe hurte many frenchman wyst nat hasted whan cae felde assembled togyder founde englysshe archer ther redy receyue theym shotte feersly slewe man horse hurt many therle layll taken prisoner owne tent sore hurte erle pyergourt sir roger vncle tentes ther slayne lorde dura sir aymer poyeters therle ualentenoys brother taken euery man sledde myght best therle conynes vycount car mayne uillemny bruquell lorde de la borde taryde loged othersyde castell dreme backe wente feldes baners thenglysshmen ouercome basshed feersly among ther many proper feat armes done many taken rescued agayne whan within castell harde noyse without sawe thenglysse baners penons contynent armed yssued russhed thyckest preace gretly refresshed englysshmen fought ther wher shulde make long processe tho therle laylles partie nygh taken slayne yf night nat come ther fewe scapedde ther taken day erles vycountes nombre ix lordes knyghtes squyers taken ther englysshman armes ii iii prisoner thisbatell saynt larans nyght yere lorde ccc xl foure thenglysshmen delt lyke good copanyons prisoner suffred many depart othe promyse retourne agayne certayne day bergerath burdeaux englysshmen entred auberoche ther erle derby gaue supper moost part erles vycou te prisoner many knyghtes squyers theglysshmen gaue lande god thousande ouercome x ennemyes rescued towne auberoche saued copanyons within lickely hod shulde haue ben taken within ii dayes next day anone vpon sonne rysing thyder came therle penbroke company thre hundren spe re foure thousande archer thatie sayd therle derby certaynly cosyn ye haue done great vncourtesy fight ennemyes without seyng ye sent ye might haue ben sure wolde nat fayle coe fayr cosyn therle derby desyred gretly haue v taryed day tyll ferr past one whan sawe ye came nat durst nat abyde lenger ennemyes knowen comyng ben great aduantage ouer v nowe haue aduantage pray content helpe gyde v burdeaux taryed day nexte nyght auberoche next day tymes departed left captayne auberoche knight gascoyne called alysander chamont rode burdeaux ledde moost part prisoner p townes therle derby wanne gascoyne goyng towarde ryoll cap cviii burdeux wyst nat ioye make receyue therle derby sir gaultier man ny takyng erle laylle mo two hundred knyght hym thus passed wynter without doynge gascoyne ought remebred whan past eester yere lorde ccc xlv myddes may therle derby layne wynter burdeaux made great assemble men armes archer entent go lay siege ryoll first day fro burdeux rode bergerath wher founde therle pe broke like wyse made assembly ther taryed thre dayes departed nombred company founde howe men armes two archer rode longe tyll came saynt basyll layd siege therto within consydred howe greattest men moost part gascoyne prisoner sawe howe shulde haue socoure fro parte thynges consydred yelded themselfe dyd homage kyng england therle passed forthe toke way aguyllone way founde castell rochemyllone whiche well furnysshed soudyers artyllary howbeit therle derby comaunded gyue assaut ferse assaut within cast great barres yron pott lyme wherwith hurt dyuers englysshmen suche aduentured themselfe farr whan therle sawe hurt coude nothyng withdrue assaut next day made vyllayns countrey bring thyder fagottes busshes donge rawe erth fylled part dyke might go walles made ccc archer redy cc men countrey go pauysshes hauyng great pycares yron whyle dyd vndermyne wall archer shuld shote dyde none within durste apere defence assaut endured moste part day finally myners made great hole wall ten men myght entre front thanne within sore basshed fledde church somme stale away priue gate towne castell taken robbed moost parte slayne except suche fledde church therle derby caused saued yelded themself simply thau therle sette newe captayns two en squyers rycharde wylle robert therle went mountsegure lay siege therto taryed ther fyftene day captayne within sir hewe bastefoll euery day assaut great engyns brought thyder ro burdeaux fro bergerath stone cast brake downe walles roffes house therle derby sende towne shewyng taken byforce shulde dye wolde come vnder obeysance kynge englande wolde pardon take frendes towne wolde gladly haue yelded theym went spake captayne maner cou yle se wolde say answered theym sayd sir kepe defence ar able kepe towne halfe yere nede departed fro hym semyng well cotent nyght toke putte hym prison sayeng howe shuld neuer go therof without wold agre make peace therle derby whan sworne wolde deuoyre let hym prison went barryers towne made token speke erle derby sir gaultier manny ther present went spake knight sayd sir gaultier manny ye ought natte haue marueyle though close gate agaynst haue sworne feaultie frenche kyng se well ther persone behalfe wyll stoppe way thynke ye lyke go farther sir selfe menne towne desyre may abyde coposicyon ye make v warr space moneth duryng terme frenche kyng duke normandy come contrey strong fyght quyte couenaunt come nat one shall put v vnder obe sance kyng england sir gaultier manny went therle derby knowe pleasure behalfe therle content within shuld make fortifycation season also theglysshmen ther lacked vitayls might haue money co tent sent xii burgess towne burdeaux hostage thenglysshmen refresshed prouisyon towne none entred passed forth wasted exyled contrey plesant frutefull came castell called guyllon captayne therof came therle yelded vp castell lyues good saued wherof contrey gret marueyle named one strongest castels worlde wha captayne yelded vp castell soone came tholoum xvii leages thense towne toke hym layd treason charge hanged hym vp sayd castell stode bytwene two great ryuers able bere shyppes erle derby newe repeyred castell made captayne ther sir joh gombray tha e erle went castell called segart whiche toke assaut soudyours within slayne fro thense went towne le ryoll p howe therle derby layd siege ryoll howe towne yelded hym cap c ix thus erle derby ryoll layed siege therto sydes made ba e feldes waye prouisyon coulde entre towne euery day ther assaut siege ured longe space whan moneth e yred segur shulde gyue vp towne erle sent thyder owne gaue vp became vnder obeysaunce kynge englande captayne sir hewe bastefoll became seruant erle within vpon certayne wage hadde thenglysshmen lye longe ryoll nyne wekes made meane space two belf oys great tymbre iii stage euery belfroy fou great whelys sydes towardes towne couered cure boly defende fro fyre fro shotte euery stage ther oynted c archer strength men two belfroyes brought walles towne fylled dyke myght well brought iust walles archer stage shotte holly tog der none durst apere defence without well pauysshed bytwene two belfroys ther cc men pycaxes myne walles brake walles thaue burgess towne came one gate speke lorde hoost whan erle derby knewe therof sent sir gaultier manny baron stafforde whan cae ther founde towne wolde yel e lyues goodes saued sir ago de ban captayne within knewe ye people towne wolde yelde vp went castell copany soudyers whyle towne entrety g conueyed owne gret quantyte wyne prouisyon closed castell gate sayd howe wolde nat yelde vp e foresayd two lordes retourned therle derby shewyng hym howe towne wolde yelde themself towne lyues goodes saued thaue therle sende knowe howe captayne wolde ye castell brought worde agayne hym howe wolde nat yelde therle udye lytell sayde well go take towne mercy towne shall haue castell thaue lordes went agayne towne receyued mercy shulde go felde delyuer therle derby kayes towne sayenge sir fro heusforth knowlege selfe subgettes obey saunt king englande dyd sware shulde gyue comforte castell greue best power therle comaunded man shulde hurt towne ryoll none within therle entred towne laydsiege rounde castell nere might rered vp engyns caste nyght day agaynst walles dyde lytell hurt walles stronge harde stone sayd olde tyme ben wrought handes sarasyns made ther warkes strongely ther none nowe bayes wha erle sawe coulde good engyns caused theym cease called hym myners thyntent shuld make myne vnder walles whiche nat sone made p howe sir water manny founde towne ryoll sepulcre father ca c x whyle siege endured ye myners worke lorde gaultier manny remembred fader stayne goynge pylgrimage sait james howe harde youth howe shulde buryed ryoll thaue made enquered towne y manne coude shewe hym father tombe shulde haue hundred crownes labour aged man came sir gaultier sayd sir thynke ca e brynge nere place wher father buryed thanne lorde manny sayde wordes trewe shall kepe couenaunt p nowe ye shall maner howe lorde gaultiers father slayne trewe somtyme ther bysshoppe cambresis goscoyne borne house myrpoyse fortuned dayes ther tyme great tournayeng cambrey wher v c knyght party ther knyght gascoyne ourneyed lorde manny father sir gaultier knyght gascoyne sore hurt beaten neuer helth dyed knyght kynne sayde stho e wherfore lorde manny lynage two thre yere certayne good men laboured make peace bytwene dyd mendes lorde manny bounde go pylgrimage saynt james went thyder warde came foreby towne ryoll season therle charles ualoyes brother kynge philyppe lay siege ryoll whiche englysshe dyuers townes cyties pertayning kynge englande father kynge layed siege tourney lorde manny retournyng pylgrimage came se therle ua oys ther kyng ye lorde many went night lodgyng watched way certayne lynage hym yt lorde many made pylgrimage wtout therles lodgyng slayne murdred man knewe dyd howe lynage helde suspect ye mater stronge made suche excuse mater past ther none wold pursue lorde mannes quarell therle ualoyes caused hym buryed lytell chapell felde without towne ryoll whan therle ualoyes wonne towne walles made larger chapell within towne thus sir gaulter mane fader slayne olde man remebred mater present whan buryed thane sir gaultier manny went gode aged man place wher father buryed ther founde lytell tombe marble ouer hym seruauntes layd hym buryed thane olde man sayd sir surely vnder tombe lyeth father lorde manny redde scripture tombe whiche latyn ther founde yt olde man sayd trouth gaue hym rewarde wtin two dayes made tombe raysed bone father taken vp put ofer dyd sende ualencenes county heynalt freres ther made theym buryed agayne honourably dyde obsequy yght goodly yet kept yerely phowe erle derby wanne castell ryoll cap c xi nowe let v retourne siege castell ryoll endured xi wekes long wrought mynours last came vnder base court vnder geon coude nat gette stode harde rocke sir ag u de ban capten sayd company sir vndermy ar great daunger sore srayed sayd sir ye ar great danger also without ye fynde remedy year chefe wyll obey trucly haue kept house right honourably alonge season though nowe make composycion nat blamed assay ye canne get graunt therle derby let v depart lyues goodes saued delyuer hym castell sir agous dyscendedde downe fro hygh wre dyd put heed lytell wyndo made token speke host demaunded wolde haue sayd wolde fayne speke therle derby ye lorde ny whan therle knewe therof sayd ye lorde manny lorde stafforde lette v go fortresse knowe capten woll say rode togyder whan sir agous sawe theym toke cappe saluted eche sayde lordes trouth frenche kyng sende towne defende kepe castell power ye knowe right well howe haue aquyt selfe behalfe yet wolde might alwayes man may nat abyde one place sir yf woll please company wolde depart lyues goodes saued shall yelde vnto fortresse therle derby sayde sir agous ye shall nat go away knowe ryght well haue sore oppressed may haue whan lyst fortresse stadeth vpon stayes yelde simply wyll receyue sir agon sayde sir yf dyde thynke somoch honour gentylnes ye wold deale courtelly v ye wold frenche kynge shulde deale knyghtes goddessake sir blemyssh nat noblenesse poore sort soudyours within hath moche payne paryll poore lyueng whome haue brought hyther prouynce sauoy daulphyne sir knowe trouthe yt yf lest v shulde nat come mercy well best woll rather sell lyues suche wyse worlde shulde speke v sir desyre bere v copany armes shall pray therle two lordes went parte spake togyder spake long togyder dyuers thynges finally regarded trouthe sir agon consydred howe stranger also sawe coude nat vndermyne dongeon agreed receyue mercy erle sayde sir agon sir wolde gladly straungers bere good company armes content ye company depart lyues saued bere away nothynge armoure quod sir agon went company shewed spedde dyd harnesse toke horse wherof hadde mo sixe bought horse thenglysshmen whiche payed truely thus sir agon de ban departed fro ryoll yelded vp castell englysshemen sir agon company wente tholous phow therle derby toke towne mauleon towne franch gascoyne cap c xii whan erle derby taken pleasure ryoll went forth lest englyssh knyght ryoll repayre mende broken rode mountpesance made assaut within men countrey gone thyder goodes trust strength place defended theymselfe longe might finally castell wone assaut scalynge many thenglysshe archer slayne au englysshe gentylman slayne called rycharde pennenort bare lorde staffordes baner therle derby gaue castell squyer called thomas lancastre left hym garyson xx archer therle went towne mauleon made assaut wanne nat nyght lodged nexte day knyght gascone called sir alysander chamont sayd therle sir make though ye wolde dyslodge go part leue small sort people styll towne within woll yssue knowe theym well let chase men behynde let v lye vnder olyues busshement whan past v lette part v folowe retourne toward towne therle derby cotent counsayle caused abyde behynde erle quenforde hundred hym onely well enformed shulde trussed bagge baggage departed went halfe leage ther layd sir gaultier manny great busshmet vale amonge olyues vynes therle rode forth whan mauleon sawe erle departe styll abydinge behynde sayde among themselfe let v go yssue go fyght ennemyes ar abydinge behynde maister shall soone dysconfet whiche shall great honoure profette v agreed opynion armed quickely yssued myght first four hundred whan therle quenfort copany sawe yssue reculed backe frenchemen folowed gret hast ferr pursued past busshmet sir gaultier mannyes company yssued busshmet cryed manny part dasshed frenchman another part toke way streyght ye towne founde baylles gate opyn nyght wherfore within wende ben owne copany yssued tha thenglysshmen toke gate brige incontynent lordes towne suche towne yssued inclosed bothe behynde taken slayne suche ye towne dyde yelde therle derby receyued mercy gentylnes respyted towne fro brennyng robbynge dyde gyue hole seignorie sir alysaunder chamount whose aduyce towne wont sir alysaunder made brother captayne ther called antony chamont therle left hym certayne archer pauysshes therle departed came wyelfrache agenoys assaut castell also lefte captayne squyer called thoms coq thus therle rode contrey man resysted hym conquered townes ca men wanne ryches meruayle esteme p howe therle derby wanne cytie angolesme cap c xiii whan erle derby towne pleasure thasie herode myremot drawyng towardes burdeux iourney currours neuer aproched port saynt mary therle thre dayes myremont fourth day yelded therle gaue squier called john bristowe men wan lytell towne closed standyng ryuer gerone called thomynes stronge castell damassene whiche well garnysshed men armes archer came cytie angolesme layd siege therto therle sayde wolde nat depart thense tyll pleasure thane within made apoyntment erle sende xxiiii chiefe burgess burdeur hostage respyte peace moneth wt space frenche kynge sende suffycient persone kepe felde agaynst therle derby haue agayne hostag quyte bonde yf nat put theym vnder obeysaunce kynge englande done thasie erle rode blame layed siege therto within two captayns poycton sir guysshart dangle sir wyllyam de rochchouart sayde wolde yelde manne whyle siege endured englysshemen rode mortayne poycton sir boucyquant captayne made great assaut auayled nat dyuers hurt slayne departed then went myrebell alney came agayne siege blame euery day feate armes done terme moneth erpyred angolesme shulde yelde erle derby sent thyder two marshal whome cyte sware homage fealtie behalfe kyng englande peace gayne restored hostage erle sent thyder desyers john norwyche captayne styll siege endured blasmes thenglysshmen halfe wery wynter approched coulde wynne nothynge determyned go bourdeaux tyll another season dyllodged went ouer gerande burdeaux deted people dyuers garysons kepe fronter warre p howe sir godfray harecourt banysshed fraunce cap c xiiii season sir godfray harecourt fell indygnation frenche kynge great baron normandy brother therle harecourt lorde saynt sauyour vycount dyuers townes norma dy sayde enuy lytell great kyng duke normady wolde desyre openly banysshed realm fraunce yf kynge coulde haue gette hym yre wolde haue serued hym dyd sir olyuer clyssone beheeded yere parys ser godfray frendes gaue hym warnyng secretly howe kyng dyspleased hym auoyded realme assone myght went brabant duke cosyn receyued ioyfully ther taryed alonge space lyued suche reuenewes brabant ut fraunce coude gette nothynge kyng seaced landes constantyne tooke profet therof hymselfe duke brabant coude wyse gette agayne knyght kynges fauoure nothynge coude dyspleasure cost greatly realme fraunce specially contrey normandy token therof remayned hyndred yere ye shall hystorie p dethe jaques dartuell gaunt cap c xv season raygned flaunders great prosperyte puysaunce jaques dartuell gaut great kyng englande wolde desyre promysed ye kyng make hym lorde herytour flau ders endewe sonne prince wale therwith make count e flau ders duke dome cause feest saynt john babtyst yere lorde god ccc xlvi kynge englande come sluse many lordes knyghtes brought thyder hym ye yonge prince sonne trust promyse jaques dartuell kyng withall nauy lay hauyn sluse kept house thyder came vysette hym frendes flaunders ther great counsaylles bytwene kyng jaques dartuell one tie counsayls good townes flaunders partie countrey nat agrement kyng jaques dartuell preched theym shulde disheryte erle loyes owne naturall lorde also yong sonne loyes enheryte sonne kynge englande thynge sayd suerly wolde neuer agre vnto laste day counsayll whiche kept hauyn sluse kynges great shyppe called katheryne gaue fynall answere common acorde sayde sir ye haue desyred v thynge great weyghtie herafter may sore touche countrey flaunders heyres trewely knowe nat day persone worlde loue preferment moche sir thynge cannat alone without comynaltie flaunders acorde sir shall goo home euery man speke copany generally euery towne moost parte agre shalbe cotent within moneth shall agayne thane gyue full answere ye shalbe cotent kyng jaques dartuell coude haue none answere wolde fayne haue short day wolde nat thus deted counsayle euery man went home owne townes jaques dartuell taryed lytell season kyng styll promysed kyng bring entent disceyued assone came gaut went agayne suche gaunt ben sluse counsayle whan retourned gaunt jaques dartuell come towne great small assembled market place ther openly shewed request kynge englande made settyng jaques dartuell euery man began murmure agaynst jaques request pleased nothynge sayde grace god shulde suche vntrouthe founde willingly disheryte naturall lorde yssue enheryte stranger departed fro market place nat co tent jaques dartuell p nowe beholde se fortune fell ben welcoe gaunt bruges ipre wolde agreed opinyon dyde trusted somoche prosperyte greatnesse thought soone reduce pleasure whan retourned cae gaunt noone towne knewe co myng many assembled toguyder strete shulde passe whasie sawe hym began murmure began ron togyder thre heedes one hood sayde beholde yonder great maister woll order flaunders pleasure whiche nat suffred also wordes sowen ye towne howe jaques dartuell ix yere assembled reuenewes flaunders without count gyuen therby hath kept estate also send great rychesse countrey englande secretly wordes set gaunt fyre rode strete parceyued ther newe mater agaynst hym sawe suche wonte make reuerence hym came sawe theym tourne backes towarde hym entre house began doute assone lyghted lodgyng closed fast gate doores wyndose skante done strete full men specially small craftes ther assayled house bothe behynde house broken vp within house defended themselfe longe space slewe hurt many without finally coude nat endure thre part men towne assaut whan jaques sawe sore oppressed came wyndowe gret humylite barcheeded sayd fayre langage good people ayleth sore troubled agaynst maner haue dyspleased shewe shall make amendes pleasure suche harde hym answered one voyce woll haue acompt made great tresure flaunders ye haue sende way without tytell reason jaques answered mekely sayde certaynely sir tresoure flaunders neuer toke nothynge withdrawe selfys pacietly house come agayne morowe mornynge shall make good acompt reason ye shalbe content thane answered sayd nay woll haue acompt made incontynent ye shall nat scape v knowe trouthe ye haue sende great rychesse englande without knowlege wherfore ye shall dye whane harde worde ioyned handes togyder sore wepyng sayd sir suche ye haue made ye haue sworne defende agaynst person nowe ye wolde slee without reason ye may ye woll one man among goddessake take better aduyce remembre tyme past consyder great grac curtesyes haue done ye wold nowe rendre small rewarde great goodnesse haue done yo towne tyme past ye knowe ryght well marchanutdyse nighe lost countrey meanes recouered also haue gouerned great peace rest tyme gouernyng ye haue thynges ye wolde wysshe corne rychesse marchaundyse cryed one voyce come downe v prech nat hyghe gyue v acompt great treasoure flaunders ye haue gouerned long without acompt makynge whiche parteyneth nat offycerto receyue good lorde contrey acompt whan jaques sawe coude nat apease theym drewe heed closed wyndowe thought steale oute backesyde churche ioyned house house broken iiii hundred son entred house finally taken slayne without mercy one thoms denyce gaue hym dethe stroke thus jaques dartuell endedde dayes ben great maister fla ders poore men first mounteth vp vnhappy men sleeth ende tidynges anone spredde abrode countrey sorie therof gladde season therle loyes flaunders teremounde ryght ioyouse whan harde dethe jaques dartuell olde ennemy howbeit yet durst nat trust flaunders go gaunt whan kyng englande lay season sluse abyding answere fle mynges harde howe gaunt slaynr jaques dartuell great frende sore dyspleased incotynent departed fro sluse entred see sore thretnyng flemmynges countrey flaunders sayd howe dethe shulde well reuenged counsayls gode townes flaunders ymagined well howe kyng england wolde soore dyspleased dede thau determyned go excuse themselfe specially bruges ipre courtra andewarpe francke sent englande kyng salue coduct might come excuse kynge somwhat aswaged dyspleasure grauted desyre cae englande men estate gode townes flanders except gaut aboute feest saynt mychaell king beyng westmynster besyde lodon mekely excused dethe jaques dartuell sware solemly knewe nothynge therof tyll done man wolde haue defe ded best power sayde howe right sorie dethe gouerned contrey right wysely also sayde though gaunt hadde done dede shulde make sufficyent amendes also sayenge kynge counsell thoughe deed yet kynge neuer farther fro loue fauoure flaunders thynges except inherytaunce flaunders wyse flaunders woll put way fro ryght heyres sayeng also kynge sir ye haue fayre yssue bothe sonnes doughters prince wale eldest sonne canne nat fayle great prince without inherytaunce flaunders sir ye haue yonge doughter haue yonge lorde herytoure flaunders haue hym oure kepynge may please make maryage bytwene two euer county flaunders shall yssue chylde wordes suche apeased kyng finally content emmynges hym soo lytell lytell dethe jaques dartuell forgoten p dethe wyllm erle heynault dyed freese many hym cap c xvi season erle wyllyam heynalt beynge siege towne dautryche hadde lyen long season constrayned theym soore assautes otherwyse finally hadde pleasure anone season feest saynt remy erle made great assemble men armes knyghtes squyers heynault flaunders brabant hollande guerles jullyers erle company departed fro dordreche hollande great nauy shyppes sayled wardes freese erle heynault claymed lorde yf fresons men haue brought reason therle dede hadde great ryght slayne great nombre knyghtes squyers hym sir john heynault aryued nat nephue aryued another place whan harde deth nephue lyke manne mynde wolde haue tought fresons seruantes specially sir robert gluues thanne squyer dyd putte hym shyppe agayne agaynst wyll retourned agayne small copany came say gertrude hollande wher lady nece wyfe sayd erle named iahane eldest doughter duke brabant went lande buyche wa endowrie thus countie heynall voyde certayne space sir john heynalt dyd gouerne vnto tyme margaret heynault doughter therle aubertcame thyder toke possessyon herytage lordes dyde feaultie homage lady margaret maryed lorde loyes bauyer emperour almayne kynge romayns p howe sir john heynalt became frenche cap c xvii anone french kyng entreated caused erle bloys entreat lorde john heynalt become frenche promysing gyue hym reuenues fraunce englande assigned wher wolde hymselfe deuyce request dyd nat lightly agre spent floure youth scruyce kyng englande euer welbeloued kyng whan therle loyes bloyes maryed doughter thre sonnes loyes john guy sawe coude nat wynne hym meanes thought wold assay way wyn lorde saguynels chefe copany grettest counsell lorde john heynault bytwene deuysed make hym byleue englande wolde nat pay hym pencyon wherwith sir john heynault sore dyspleased renounced seruyce good wyll bare kynge englande whan frenche kyng knowe therof incontynent sent sufficyent messangers hym retayned hym counsayle certayne wage recompensed hym fraunce asmoche englande p great hoost duke normandy brought gascone agaynst therle derby cap c xviii frenche kyng well infourmed coquestes erle derby made countrey gascone thanne made great sommons noble nat noble able feare warre shulde orlyaunce bourges certayne day lymytted reason comaundement came parys duke ode burgoyne sonne therle arthoys colayne cae kynge thousande speares thane came duke burbone therle ponthyeu brother great nombre men armes thyder also came erle ewe guynes costable fraunce great co pany also therle tankernyll dolphyne auuerne therle forestes therle dampmartyne therle uandone lorde coucy lorde craon lorde sully bysshoppe bewuayes lorde frennes lorde beauiewe lorde john chaalon lorde roy dyuerse assembled cytie orlyaunce part loyre poycton xaynton rochell caoursyn lymosyn met march tholouz thes passed forthe towarde roueryng fou de moche company assembled cytie rodes march auuerne prouence last came cite tholouz coude nat lodged cytie nombre mo hundred thousand yere lorde god ccc xlv anone feest christmas duke normandy chefe hoost rode forth two marshal hym lorde momorecy lorde saynt uenant first went castell myremont englysshmen wonne captayne wtin one john bristowe made assaut within hundred englysshme frenchman sir loyes spayne genowayes crosbowes sparedde shotte within castell coulde nat defende selfe castell take slayne captayne marshal set ther newe men passed forthe came vyle franche agenoyes hoost layd siege assay led towne season captayne sir thomas corque nat burdeaux therle derby sent hym howbeit within defended themselfe valyantly finally taken perforce towne robbed brent slayne moste part soudyers hoost drewe cytie angolesme layd siege capytayne within squyer called john normell whan therle derby harde gret hoost howe wonne agayne myr mount uyle franche brent towne left castell voyde sent four knyghtes threscore men armes thre hu dred archer uyle franche entre castell close gate agayne towne promysed theym frenchman came thyder agayne assayle theym wolde socoure soeuer fell therof four knyghtes say sir stephyn co bey sir rycharde heldone sir raffe hastynges sir normant fynfroyde went thyder newely fortifyed towne castell therle derby desyred erle penbroke sir gaultier manny sir franque de hall sir thomas coque sir john de la touche sir rycharde beauayes sir philyp reckeleue sir robert neuyll sir thomas briset dyuerse knyghtes squyers go aguyllon kepe fortres wolde besore dyspleased shulde lost departed xl knyght squyers thre hundred men armes archer entred stronge castell aguyllon founde sixscore soudy redy therle derby left ther made prouisyon thynges necessarie foresayd four knyghtes came towarde uyle frache founde way great plentie beafes mottons corne toke towne repayred agayn castell mended walles gate towne last fyftene hudred men able make defence vytayle sufficyent sixe monethes duke normady long lyen sieg angolesme sawe howe coude nat wynne towne assaut euery day lost men comaunded make assautes remeue nerer towne day seneshall beaucayre came duke sayd sir knowe well marchesse countrey wyll please yout lette haue sixe hundred men armes shall go abrode contre gette vytayle hoost within whyle shall lacke duke content next day seneshall toke hym certayne knightes squyers lordes cotent go vnder hym first duke burbou therle ponthieu brother erle tankernyll therle forestes dolphyn auuerne lorde pons lorde partuey lorde coucy lorde daubigny lorde dausemont lorde beauiewe sir guyssharde dangle sir sayntre dyuerse ix c speares toke horse euenyng rode nyghttyll brekyng day mornyng came gret towne newly wonne theglysshmen called athenys aspy came sene shall sayd sir ther towne sixscore men armes gascons englysshe iii hundred archer woll defende towne ye gyue assaut sawe mornyng ii c great beestes putte towne medowes ioyninge towne seneshall sayd sir thynke best let co pany abyde styll valey woll go lx fecthe catayle hythee thynke thenglysshmen woll yssue incontynet rescue pray shall ye mete done seneshall threscore well horsed rode wayes couert towne gidyng spye tyll last cae fayre medowes wher catayle pastured tha draue beest togyder longe towne another way cae thyder castell walles sawe began blowe styrre towne waked beddes erely mornynge drewe togyder mounted horse yssued myght firste abode towne none certayne vylayns thenglysshmen hasted sore frechmen cryed sir ye shall nat go thus away frechmen came lytell space ouercome captayne sir stephyn lesey taken prisoner hym slayne frenchemen rode hastely towne wanne assaut without kepynge first batayle entred duke burbons sette newe captayns depted pray prisoner came next day hoost angolesme seneshall aucayre achyued great honoure dede howbeit ther gretter lordes hym tha hymselfe captayne tyme p howe john wyche scaped fro angolesme wha towne yelded frenchman cap c xix thus lordes fra ce helde great season sege angoleme ranne ouer countrey thenglysshmen hadde wonne dyd moche trouble toke many prisoner great prayes brought hoost two bretherne burbon achyued great laude prayse alwayes went forth formast whan john norwiche sawe duke wolde nat depart then tyll towne pleasure parceyued howe vitayls began wast erle derby made maner rescue theym also sawe well howe towne enelyued greatly frenche party wolde haue tourned frenche tyme durst therfore doubted treason herfore thought saue hymself co pany euyn purifycation lady alone went walles cyte wt wyng man wolde made token hatte host sawe signe came thyder demaunded wolde sayde wolde gladly speke duke normandy one marshal incotynent shewed duke went thyder certayne knyghtes hym assone captayne sawe duke toke cap saluted duke duke saluted hym sayde john howe woll yelde selfe sir nat yet determyned sir wold desyre honoure lady whose day shalbe morowe ye wolde graunt truse endure onely morowe none greue peace day duke sayde content departed nere day candelmas day john norwiche company armed trussed bere away opyned gate yssued oute hoost began styrre captayne rode sayd sir beware hurt none v woll none haue trus day onely agreed duke caiptayne ye knowe nat go demaunde hym reason trewse may ryde day whyther woll duke demanded pleasure mater duke answered sayde let depart whyder woll goddesname nat let woll kepe haue promysed thus john norwych departed company passed french hoost without damage went aguyllon whan knightes ther knewe howe saued hymselfe company sayde begyled ennemyes good subtyltie next day cytie angolesme went counsayle determyned yelde vp towne duke sent hym hoost certayne messangers last spedde well duke toke mercy pardoned yuell wyll entred cytie castell toke homage cytizens made captayne ther antony uyllers set hundred soudyers hym duke went castell dama ne helde siege xv dayes euery day assaut finally within slayn duke gaue castell landes therto squyer beausse called bourge mulle duke came thomyus ryuer garon lay siege certayne space laste within yelded vp goodes lyues saued sauely conducted burdeaur stranger departed towne came vnder obeysaunce duke duke taryed aboute ryuer garon tyll past ester went port saynt mary ryuer two hundred englysshmen kept towne passage well fortisyed taken assaut within ther set newe captayns men warr newe repayred towne thanne duke went aguyllone p howe duke normandy layd siege aguyllon hundred thousande men cap c xx duke normady lordes fraunce dyd somoche came castell aguyllone layde siege aboute fayre medowes along ryuer able bere shyppes euery lorde amonge owne company euery constable hym selfe ordayned marshal sege endured tyll feest saynt remy ther well c thousande men warr horse backe fote made lightly euery day two thre assaut moost comenly fro mornyng tyll nere nyght without ceasynge euer cae newe assauters wolde nat suffre rest lordes fraunce sawe well coude nat well come froters without passed ryuer large depe duke comaunded bridge shuld made whatsoeuer coste passe ryuer sette warke mo thre hundred workemen dyde worke day nyght whan knyght within sawe brige halfe made ouer ryuer decked thre shyppes entred theym certayne cae workemen chased away defender ther brake peace ben longe makynge whane frenche lordes sawe apayrelled shyppes resyst agaynst shyppes workemen beganne agayne worke bridge trust defender whan worked halfe day sir gaultier manny company entred shyppe came workemen made leaue warke recule backe brake agayn made besynesse nygh euery day last frenchman kept well workemen bridge made perforce thanne lordes army passed ouer maner bataylle assawtedde castell hole day togyder without ceasyng nothynge wanne nyght retourned lodgynges within amended broken worke men ynoughe next day frenchman deuyded assauters foure partes first begynne mornyng contynue tyll nyne seconde tyll noon thyrde euyn song tyme fourth tyll night maner assayled castell sire dayes togyder howe within nat sore traueyled alwayes defended themselfe valyantly without wanne nothynge onely bridge without castell thane frenchman toke counsayle sende tholouz eyght great engyns made foure gretter made xii cast day nyght agaynst castell within well auysshed neuer ston engyns dyde many hurt brake somwhat coueryng house wt also great engyns brake downe engyns without shorte space brake pecys sixe greattest without duryng siege often tymes ser water manny yssued hundred sire score copanyons went syde ryuer foragynge retourned agayne great prayes syght without day lorde charles momorecy marshall host rode forthe fyue hundred hym whane retourned draue hym great nombre beestes get togyder countrey refresshe thoost vytayle aduenture encountred sir gaultier manny bytwene great fight many ouerthrowen hurte slayne frenchemen fyue agaynst one tidynges therof came vnto aguyllon euery man myght yssued therle penbroke first company whan came founde sir gaultier many fote enclosed ennemyes dyde meruayls armes contynent rescued remounted agayne meane season frenchemen chased beestes quyckely hoost el lost yssued aguyllon set feersly frenchman putte theym slyght delyuerd company takenne tooke many frenchemen prisoner sir charles momorecy moche warke scape thenglysshmen retourned aguyllon thus euery day almoost suche rencounters besyde assautes day hole hoost armed duke commaunded tholouz carcassone beaucayre shulde make assaut fro mornynge tyll noone remergue caours agenoys fro noone tyll night duke promysed soeuer coude wynne brige gate shulde haue rewarde hundred crown also duke better mentayne assaut caused come ryuer dyuerse shyppes ba ge entred passe ryuer went bridge last theym toke lytell vessell went vnder brige dyde cast great hokes yron drawe bridge drewe sore brake chenes yron helde bridge pulled downe bridge parforce frenchman lept bridge hastely one ouerthrewe euery man desyred wyn hundred crownes within cast downe barres yron peces tymbre pottes lyme hote water many ouerthrowen fro bridge water dyke many slayne sore hurt howbeit bridge wonne perforce cost worthe coude nat wyn gate drewe backe lodgynges late thane within yssued newe made agayne drawe bridge stronger thane euer next day ther came duke two connyng men maisters carpentre sayde sir ye woll let v haue tymbre workemen shall make foure scaffoldes hygh hyer thane walles duke comaunded shulde done get carpenter co trey gyue good wag four scafoldes wer made four shyppes long first cost moch finysshed shulde assayle castell apoynted entred whan passed halfe ryuer within castell let go four martynetes newely made resyst agaynst scafoldes four martynettes dyd cast great stone often fell scafoldes short space broken within coulde nat pauysshed theym fayne drawe backe agayne agayne lande one scafold drowned water moost part win great damage therin good knyghtes desyringe bodyes auauce whan duke sawe coude nat come entent meanes caused thre scafoldes rest coudese way howe might gette castell promysed nat departe thense tyll wyll without kyng father dyd sende hym sende constable france erle tankernyll parys ye kyng shewed hym state siege aguyllone kynges mynde duke shulde lye styll tyll famyn syth coude nat haue assaut p howe kyng englande came ouer see agayne rescue aguyllone cap c xxi kyng englande harde howe constrayned castell aguyllon thought go ouer see gascoyne great ther made syon sent men real place wher thought spe money season lord harecourt came englande banysshed frauce well receyued kynge retayned hym fayre land assigned hym englande mentayne degree kynge caused great nauy shyppes redy hauyn hampton caused maner men warr drawe thyder ye feest saynt john baptyst yere lorde god c c c xiv kynge deted fro quene lefte gydinge therle cane cosyn stablysshed lorde persy lorde neuyll wardyns realme archebysshoppe yorke bysshoppe lyncolne bysshopp durham neuer voyded realme lefte euer ynough home kepe defende realme yf nede kyng rode hampton taryed wynde entred shyppe prince wale hym lorde godfray harecourt lordes erles barownes knyght copanyes nombre foure thousande men armes ten thousande archer besyde irysshmen walsshmen folowed host fote p nowe shall name certayne lordes went ouer kyng edwarde iourney first edward eldest sonne prince wale thane age xiii yeres erles herforde northamptone arundell cornewall warwyke hutyngdon suffolke oxenforth baron lorde mortymer erle marche lordes john loyes roger beauchape lorde reynold cobham lordes lorde mombray rose lucy felton brastone myllon labey maule basset barlett wylloughby dyuers lord bachelars john chandoys fytzwaren peter james audelay roger uertuall bartylmewe brie rycharde penbruges dyuers nat name fewe ther stager ther erle hauyou sir olphas guystels v vi knyghtes almayne many nat name th say rth day name god warde way towarde gascone thirde day ther rose cotrary wynde march cornewall lay ancre vi dayes space counsell meanes godfray harcourt counselled kyng nat go gascoyne rather set lande normandy sayde kyng sir cou tre normandy one plentyous countreis worlde sir ieody heed ye woll lande ther ther none tha shall resyst people normandy haue nat ben vsed warr knyghtes squyers contrey ar nowe siege aguyllon duke sir ther ye shall fynde great townes nat walled wherby yo men shall haue suche wynning shalbe better therby xx yere sir ye may folowe army tyll ye come cane normandy sir requyre byleue voyage kyng floure youth desyring nothyng somoche haut dedes armes inclyned greatly sayeng lorde harecourt called cosyn comaunded maryners set course normady toke shyp ye token thadmyrall therle warwyke sayd howe wolde admyrall vyage sayled gouernor nauy wynde wyll kyng ysse costantyne port called hogue saynt wast tydinges anone spredde rode howe thenglysshmen lande constantyne sent worde therof maryst kynge philypp well harde howe kynge englande see great army wyst nat way wolde drawe normandy bretayne gascoyne assone knewe kyng englande lande normandy sende constable therle guyues erle tankernell newely come hym sonne fro siege aguyllon towne cane comaundyng kepe towne agaynst englysshmen sayd wolde best departed fro parys good nombre men warre dayly came mo way came towne cane receyued great ioye men towne countrey drawen thyder suretie lordes toke hede prouisyon towne nat walled kyng thus aryued port hogue saynt wast nere saynt sauyour vycout right herytage lorde godfray harcourt ther kynge englande p howe kyng englande rode thre batayls normandy cap c xxii whane kynge englande arryued ogu saynt wast kynge yssued shyppe fo sette grounde fell rudely ye blode brast nose knyghtes aboute hym toke hym vp sayde sir goddessake entre agayne shyppe come nat lande day ell signe v kyng answered quickely sayd wherfore good token land desyreth haue whiche auswere men right ioyfull day nyght kyng lodged sandes meane tyme dyscharged shyppes horse bagages kyng made two marshal hoost one lorde godfray harecourt therle warwyke erle arundell constable ordayned therle huntyngdon shulde kepe e e shyppes c men armes iiii c archer also ordayned thre batayls one go right hande closyng see syde lyfte hande kynge hymselfe myddes euery night lodge one felde thus sette forth ordayned yt went see toke shyppes founde wayes long went forthe see lande came good port good towne called har ewe incontynent wonne within gaue feare ethe howebeit towne robbed moche golde syluer founde ryche iewels founde somoche rychesse boyes vyllayns hoost sette nothyng good furred gownes made men towne yssue go shyppes bycause wolde nat sustre behynde feare rebellyng agayne towne har ewe thus taken robbed without brennyng spredde brode countrey dyd lyst nat resyst laste came great ryche towne called cherbourgue towne wan robbed brent parte therof castell coude nat come stronge well furnysshed men warre thane passed forthe came mountbourgue toke robbed brent clene maner brent many townes countrey moch rychesse maruell rekyn thanne came great towne well closed called quar tyne ther also strong castell many soudyours within kepe thane lordes came shyppes feersly made assaut burgess towne great feare lyues wyues chyldren suffred thenglysshemen entre towne agaynst wyll soud ther putte goodes thenglysshmens pleasure thought moost aduauntage whan son dyours within sawe went castell englysshmen went towne two dayes guyder made sore assautes whan within se socoure yelded vp lyues goodes sauyed departed thenglysshmen pleasure good towne castell whan sawe might nat mentayne kepe set fyre therin brent made burgess towne entre shyppes done harflewe chyerburgue mountbourge wnes wonne see syde done batayle went see syde see togyder nowe let v speke kinges batayle whan sent first batayle longe see syde ye haue harde wherof one marshal therle warwyke captayne lorde cobham hym made marshall lede hoost lyft hande knewe yssues entree normandy better dyd ther lorde godfray marshall rode forthe fyue hundred men armes rode fro kynges batayle sire seuyne leages brennynge exilyng countrey plentyfull euery thynge grange full corne house full ryches riche burgess carte charyottes horse swyne mottous beestes toke lyst brought kynges hoost soudyours made count kynge none offycers golde syluer dyd gette kept themselfe thussir godfray harecourt rode euery day fro kynges hoost moost parte euery nyght resorted kynges felde kyng toke way saynt lowe constantyne came ther lodged ryuer abyding men rode long see syde whan come sette caryage therle warwyke therle suffolke sir thomas hollande sir raynolde cobhm copany rode one syde wasted eriled contrey lorde hare court hadde done kynge euer rode bytwene bataylles euery nyght logedde togyder pof great assemble frenche kynge made resyst kyng englande cap c xxiii thus theglysshmen brent exyled robbed wasted pylled good plentyfull countrey normandy thanne frenche kyng sent lorde john heynalt cae hym great nombre also kyng sende men armes duke erles barownes knyghtes squyers assembled togyder grettest nombre people bensene france hundred yere sent men ferr countreys longe came togyder wherof kynge englande dyde hym lyste meane season french kyng harde well dyd sware sayd howe shuld neuerretourne agayne vnfought withall suche hurtes damage done shulde derely reuenged wherfore sent letter frendes thempyre suche wer farthest also gentyll kyng behayne lorde charles son fro then called kynge almaygne made kynge ayde father frenche kyng taken hym armes thempyre frenche kyng desyred come hym withall power thyntent fyght kynge englande brent wasted countrey prince lordes made redy great nombre men armes almaynes behaynoes luxambroses came frenche kyng also kyng philypp send duke lorayne came serue hym ccc speares also ther came therle samynes samynoes therle salebrug erle flaunders erle wyllyam namure euery man fayre copany ye haue harde order thenglysshmen howe went thre batayls marshalles right hande lyft kyng prince wale sonne myddes rode small iourneys euery day toke lodgynges bytwene noone thre clocke founde countrey frutefull neded nat make uisy hoost onely wyne yet founde reasonably sufficyent therof marueyle though countrey afrayed tyme neuer sene men warre wyst nat warre batayle ment fledde away ferr might spekyng thenglysshmen left house well stuffed graunges full corne wyst nat howe saue kepe kynge englande prince batayle thre thousand men armes sixe thousande archer ten thousande men fote besyde rode marshal thus ye haue harde kyng rodeforth wastynge brennyng countrey without brekyng order left cytie constance went great towne called saynt lowe rych towne drapery many riche burgess towne ther dwellyng viii nynescore burgess crafty men whanne kynge came ther toke lodgyng without wolde neuer lodge towne feare fyre sende men anone towne taken clene robbed harde thynke ye great ryches clothes specially clothe wolde ther haue ben solde good chepe yf ther ben byers tha kynge went towarde cane greatter towne fall drapery marchauntdyse riche burgess noble ladyes damosel fayre church specially two great riche abbey one crynyte another saynt stephyn ye one syde towne one fayrest castels normandy capitayne therin robert blargny thre hundred genowayes towne therle ewe guynes constable fraunce therle tankernyll good nombre men warr king england rode day good order logedde batayls togyder night two leages fro cane towne lytell hauyn called naustreham thyder cae also nauy shyppes therle huntyngdone gouernour costable lordes france nyght watched well towne cane mornyng armed towne constable ordayned none shulde yssue kepe defence walles gate bridge ryuer left subbarbes voyde bycause nat closedde thought shulde haue ynough defende towne bycause nat closedde ryuer towne saybe howe wolde yssue strong ynough fyght kyng englande whan collable sawe good wyls sayd name god ye shall nat fyght without yssued good order made good face fyght defende theym putte lyues aduenture pof batayle cane howe thenglysshmen toke towne cap c xxiiii day thenglyssh men rose erly apayrelled redy go cane kyng harde noyse sonne rysing toke horse prince son sir godfray harcourt marshall leader hoost whose counsayle kyng moche folowed drewe towarde cane batels good aray aproched good towne cane whaue towne redy felde sawe thre batayls commyng good order baners stade de wauynge wynde archer nat ben accustomed se sore afrayd fledde away toward towne without order good aray constable coulde englysshmen pursued egerly whan constable erle takernyll sawe toke gate entry saued theselfe certayne englysshmen entred towne knyghtes squyers fraunce suche knewe way castell went thyder captayne ther receyued castell large theglysshmen chaselle many toke non mercy constable erle tankernyll beynge lytell towre bridge fote loked longe strete sawe men ayne without mercy douted fall hand last sawe englysshe knyght one eye called thoms holand afyue sixe knyghtes hym knewe sene pruce grenade vyages called sir thomas sayd howe wold yelde theselfe prisoner sir thomas came thyder copany mounted vp gate founde sayd lordes xxv knyghts yelded theym sir thomas toke thefor prisoner left company kepe theym mouted agayne horse rode streates saued many lyues lavyes damosel cloysterers fro defoylyng soudyers without mercy fell well season thenglysshmen er whiche able bere shyppes e lowe men went besyde bridge towne entred house cast downe strete stone tymbre ron slewe hurte mo fyue hundred englysshmen wherwith ky ge sore dyspleased night whan hard therof comaunded next day shulde putte swerde towne brent sir godfray harecourt sayd dere sir goddessake as wage somwhat courage let su fice ye haue done ye haue yet great voyage orye come calys whyderye purpose go sir towne moche people wyll defende house woll cost many yor men lyues ye haue yor wyll wherby paraueture ye shall nat kepe purpose calys shulde redowne rech sir saue people ye shall haue nede moneth passe thynke verely aduersary kyng philypp woll mete fight ye shall fynde many strayt passage rencouters wherfore men ye mo shall stande gode stede sir without sleynge ye shall lorde towne men woman woll putte haue pleasur kyng sayd sir godfray ar marshall ordayne euery thyng ye woll sir godfray baner rode fro strete strete comauded kynges name non hardy put fyre house slee persone vyolate woman whan towne hard crye receyued englysshmen house made theym good chere opyned coffer badde take lyst might assured ther lyues howe ther done towne many yuell dedes murdrers roberyes thus englysshmen lordes towne thre dayes ano wanne great richesse sent ba kesse barge saynt sauyoure ryuer austr hen two leag theus wher nauy lay kyng sende therle unty gdon two hundred men armes foure hundred archer nauy prisoner richesse gotte backe agayne englande kynge bought sir thomas hallande constable fraunce therle tankernyll payed twentie thousande noble phowe sir godfray harecourte fought amyens parys cap c xxv thus kyng england ordred besynesse beynge towne cane sende england nauy shyppes charged clothes iewelles vessel golde syluer rychesse prisoner mo lx knightes thre hundred burgess departed fro towne cane rode order dyde brennynge exilynge countrey toke way ewreus past fro then rode great towne called louyets chiefe towne normandy drapery rich full marchandyse theglysshmen soone entred therin nat closed ouer ron spoyled robbed without mercy great richesse thaue entred countrey ewreus brent pylled ye countrey except good townes closed castels kynge made none assaut bycause sparyng people artillery ryuer sane nere rone exle harecourt brother sir godfray harecourt frenche partie therle dr ux hym good nombre men warre thenglysshmen left roon went gysors strong castell brent towne brent uernon countrey roon pont de lache came nau te meulence wasted countrey passed stronge castell robeboyes euery place long ryuer sane founde briges broken last came poyssey founde brige broken arch oystes lay ryuer kyng lay v dayes mean season brige made passe hoost wtout paryll thenglysshe marshal ranne brode iust parys brent saynt germayne lay mountioy saynt clowde pety bolayne parys quenes bourge parys nat well assured theym selfe nat closed kyng philyppe remoued saynt denyse went caused pentessys parys pulled downe saynt deuyse redy c kynge behayne lorde john heynalt duke lorayne therle flaunder therle bloyes many great lordes knyghtes redy serue frenche kynge whan people parys sawe kyng epart came hym kn lyd downe sayd sir noble kyng woll ye leue thus noble cytie parys kynge say good people doute ye nat englysshmen woll aproche nerer sir within two leages assone knowe departynge woll come assayle v b able defende sir tary styll helpe defende gode cite parys speke kynge woll go saynt denyse men warre woll encountre englysshmen fight soeuer fall therof kyng englande uissoy lay ery kept ther feest lady august satte h robe scarlet furred army feest went forth order fore lorde godfray harecourt rode one syde fyue hudred men arme xiii hundred archer adueture encoutred great nombre burgess amyense horsebacke ryding kyuges comaundement parys quyckely assayled defended themselfe valyantly great nombre well armed foure knyghtes amyense captayns skirmysshe dur longe first metyng many ouerthrowen bothe partes finally burge e taken nye slayne thenglysshmen caryages harnes well stuffed goyng french kyng well apoynted bycause nat ne hym great season ther slayne felde ii hundred kynge englande entred contrey beauuosy rennynge yling playne countrey lodged fayre abbey ryche called sayu messene nere beaways ther king taryed night mornyng depted whan way loked behynde sa e abbey fyre caused incontynent xx hanged set fyre ther co maunded payne dethe none v late church bren abbey kyng past cite beaways without assaut gyueng bycause wolde nat trouble peple walt artillery day toke logyng bety lytell called nully two mar came nere beaways made assaut skirmysh barryers thre place whiche assaut e ured long space towne within well defended meanes bysshopp ther within finally thenglysshemen departed brent clene harde gat subbarbes night came kynges felde next day kyng depted brennyng wastyng hym night lodged good vyllage called gran uiller next day kyng past argies ther none defende castell wherfore sone taken brent went forth dystroyeng countrey came castell poys ther good towne two castels ther body two fayre damosel doughters ye lorde poys soue taken ben vyolated two englysshe knyght nat ben sir johan p hados sir basset defended brought kyng honour made gode chere demaunded whyther wolde faynest go corbe kynge caused ught thyder without paryll nyght kyng lodged towne poys towne castels spake nyght marshal thoost saue towne brennyng pay certayne somme orey nexte day assoue hoost departed graunted mornyng kyng departed hoost except certayne left receyue money towne promysed pay whan towne sawe thoost epart fewe left behynd say wolde pay neuer peny e set thenglysshmen defended themselfe aswell might sende thost socoure whan sir reynolde coh sir thomas hollande rule reregarde harde therof retourned cryed treason treason came agayne poys warde founde companyons styll fightyng towne anoue towne nigh slayne towne brent two castels beaten downe retourned kynges hoost araynes odged commauded maner men payne dethe hurte towne arsyn kyng mynded lye day two take aduy e howe myght passe ryuer necessarie hym passe ry er yeshall p french kyng folowed kyng englande beauuoys oys cap c xxvi nowe lette v speke kyng philyppe saynt denyse people aboute hym day encreased hasie day departed rode longe came copp gny du uyse thre leages fro amyense taryed kyng englande beyng araynes wyst nat passe ryuer large depe briges broken passage well kept kynges comaudement two marshal men armes two arthers went long ryuer fynde passag passed long pre came bridge atheny well kept gret bre knyghtes squyers men countrey englysshmen lyghted fote assayled frenchman mornynge tyll noone bridge well fortifyed defended englysshmen departed without wynning thynge went great wne called fountayns uer somme clene robbe brent nat closed tha went another towne called longe ponthieu coulde nat wynne bridge well kept defended deted went yqueny founde towne bridge castell well fortifyed na lykely passe frenche kyng hadde well defended passage thentent kyng englande shulde nat passe ryuer somme fight hym aduauntage el famysshe hym whane two marshal assayed place fynde passage coude fynde none retourned agayne king shewed howe coude fynde passage place night frenche kynge came amyense mo hundred men kynge englande right pensyfe next morning harde masse sonne rysinge dy oged euery man folowed marshal baners rode countrey uimewe aprochynge good towne abuyle foude towne therby whervnto come moche people countrey trust lytell defence thenglysshmen anone wanne within slayne many taken towne countrey kynge toke lodgynge great hospytall day frenche kynge departed fro amyense came araynes noone theglysshmen departed thense mornyng frenchman founde great prouisyon englysshmen left behynde bycause departed hast founde flesshe redy broches brede pastyes ouyns wyne tonne barelles tabuls redy layed frenche kyng lodged taryed lordes nyght kyng england lodged oysement nyght whane two marshalles retourned day ouer ronne countrey gate abuyle saynt ualery made greatskirmysshe kynge assembled togyder counsayle made brought hym certayne prisoner countrey ponthieu uymen kyng right curtesly demaunded theym ther among knewe passage byneth abuyle hoost might passe ouer ryuer somme yf woldeshewe hym therof shulde quyte raunsome xx company loue ther varle ed gobyn grace stept forthe sayde kyng sir promyse ieopardy heed shall bringe suche place ye hoost shall passe ryuer without paryll certayne place passage ye shall passe xii men front two tymes bytwene day nyght ye shall nat go water knee whan fludde cometh ryuer waxeth gret man passe whan udde gon whiche two tymes bytwene day nyght ryuer lowe may passed without danger bothe horsebacke fote passage harde botom whyte stone caryage may go surely therfore ye passage called blanch taque ye make redy dete tymes ye may ther sonne rysinge kynge say trewe ye say quytethe thy raunsome thy company moreouer shall g ue hundred noble kynge commaunded euery man sounde trumpette departe p batayle blanch que twene kyng englande si godmar du fay cap c xxvii kyng englande slepte nat moche nyght atte mydnight rose wne trumpette tha incontynent made redy caryages thynges atte brekynge day departed fro towne oysement rode guydinge go yn grace came sonne rysing blanch taque flu de vpp might nat passe kynge taryed tyll prime ebbe came frenche kyng currours countrey brought hym worde emeanoure englysshmen thought close kyng englande bytwene abuyle ryuer fyght hym pleasure whan amyese ordayned great barowne normandy called sir god mardu fay go kepe passage bla che taque englysshmen must pa el none place hym men armes sixe thousand ote genowayes soo went saynt rey g yer ponthieu fro then crotay wher passage lay also hym great nombre men countrey also great nombre theym mutterell twelfe thousand men one whan englysshe hoost come thyder sir godmardu fay araunged company defende passage kyng england lette nat whane ludde gone comaunded marshal entre ye water name god saynt george hardy coragyous entre bothe party many man reuersed ther frechmen arthoyes pycardy gladde iuste water drie lande frenchemen defended well passage yssuing water moche genowayes dyde great trouble c o owes thother syde archer englande shotte holly togyder frenchman fayne gyue place englysshmen sore batayle many noble feate armes done sydes finally thenglysshmen passed ouer assembled togyder felde kynge prince passed lordes frenchman kept none array departed myght best whan sir godmar sawe dyscon itu e fledde saued hymselfe edde abuyle saynt raygnyer fote coude nat ce ther slayne great nombre abuyle muttrell arras saynt raygnier chase endured great leag yet englysshmen nat passed ryuer certayne currours kyng behayne sir john heynault came behynd toke certayn horse caryages slewe dyuers coude take passage french kyng mornynge departed fro araynes trustyng haue founde thenglysshmen bytwene hym ryuer whan harde howe sir godmar du fay company ysco fyted taryed felde demaunded marshal best sayd sir ye nat passe ryuer brige abuyll sludde come blanche taque retourned lodged abuyle kyng englande whan past ryuer thanked god rode forthe lyke maner dyde called gobyn grace dyd quyte hym ransome company gaue hym hundred noble good horse kynge rode forthe fayre easely thought haue lodged great town called norell whan knewe towne ertayned coutesse da merle suster ye lorde robert arthoys kyng assured towne countrey asmoche pertayned went forthe marshalles rode crotay seesyde brent towne founde hauyn many shippes bark charged wynes po thieu pertayning marchauntes aynton rochell brought best therof ye kynges host one marshal e gate abuyle fro then saynt reygnier towne ruesaynt esperyte friday bothe batayls marshal retourned kynges hoost noone lodged toguyder nere cressy pouthieu kynge englande well enfourmed howe frenche kyng folowed hym fight said copany lette v take plotte groude wyll go farther tylle haue sene ennemyes haue good cause abyde ryght herytage quene mother lande gyuen maryage woll chalenge myne aduersary philyppe ualoys bycause nat eyght part nombre men frenche kyng therfore commaunded marshal chose plotte grounde som aduauntage dyde thyder kynge hoost went sende currours abuyle se frenche kyng drewe day felde natte went forthe retourned agayne sayde howe coude se none aparence commyng euery man toke lodgyng day redy mornynge sound trupet place thus friday frenche kynge taryed styll abuyle abyding copany sende two marshal ryde se dealyng thenglysshmen nyght retourned sayde howe englysshmen lodged feldes nyght frenche kyng made supper chefe lordes ther hym supper kyng desyred frendes h kyng loked erle sauoy shulde come hym thousande speares receyued wage thre monethes troy campaigne pof order englysshmen cressy howe made thre batayls fote cap c xxviii friday sayd kyng englande lay ye feldes contrey pletyfull wynes vytayle nede ben prouisyon folowyng cart caryages night kyng made supper chefe lordes hoost made gode chere whan departed take rest kynge entred oratorie kneled downe ye auter prayeng god deuoutly fought next day might achyue iourney honour aboute mydnight layde hym downe rest mornynge rose tymes harde masse prince sonne hym moste part compa confessed houseled asse sayde commauded euery man armed drawe felde place apoynted kyng caused parke made wodesyde behynde hoost ther set carte caryages within parke horse euery man fote parke one entre ordayned thre batayls first yonge prince wale hym erle warwyke canforde lorde godfray harecourt sir reynolde cobham sir thoms holande ye lorde stafforde lorde uy lorde dalaware sir john chandos sir bartylmewe de bomes sir robert neuyll ye lorde thomas clyfforde lorde bourchier lorde de la tumyer dyuers knyghtes squyers nat name wer viii hundred men armes two thousande archer thousande ye walsshmen euery lorde drue felde apoynted vnder owne baner penone second batayle therle northampton erle dell lorde rosse lorde lygo lorde wylough lord basset lorde saynt aubyne sir loyes tueton lorde myleton lorde de la sell dyuers eight hundred men armes twelfhundred archer thirde batayle kyng seuyn hundred men armes two thousande archer kyng lept hobby whyte rodde hand one marshal one hande hand rode fro reuke reuke desyringe euery man take hede day right honour spake swetely good coutenance mery chere suche dysconfited toke courage sayeng heryng whan thus visyted batayls nyne day caused euery man eate drinke lytell dyde leaser afterwarde ordred agayne bataylles euery man lay downe yerth hym salet bowe whan ennemyes shulde come pthorder frenchman cressy howe behelde demeanour thenglysshmen cap c xxix saturday frenche kynge rose tymes hard masse abuyle lodgyng abbey saynt peter departed rysing whan towne two leages aproc yng towarde ennemys lordes sayd hym sir good yt ye ordred yor batayls let fote men passe som nat troubled horseman ye kyng sent iiii knyght moyne bastell lorde noyers lorde beauie lorde begny ryde viewe thenglysshe hoste rode nere might well se part dealyng thenglysshmen sawe well knewe well howe come thyder vieu let alone made countena warde let retourne came whan frenche kyng sawe oure knyghtes retourne agayne tary came hym sayd sir tidynges four knyghtes eche loked ther none wolde speke copanyon finally kyng sayd moyne pertayned kyng behaygne done dayes somoch reputed one valyantest knight worlde sir speke sayd sir shall spekesyth pleaseth vnder ye correction felawes sir haue ryden sene behauyng ennemyes knowe ye trouth rested thre batayls abidyng sir woll counsell part sauynge dyspleasure copany rest lodg nyght behynde opany become hyther batayls beset gode order wyll late people wery array ye shall fynde ennemis fresshe redy receyue erly mornynge ye may order bataylles leaser aduyse ennemis delyberacyon regarde well way ye woll assayle theym sir surely woll abyde kynge comaunded shuld done ii marshal one rode another behynde sayeng euery baner tary abyde name god saynt denys formast taryed behynde wolde nat tary rode forthe sayd howe wold wyse abyde tyll ferr forward formast whan sawe come behynde rode forward agayne kyng marshal coude nat rule rode without order good aray tyll came sight ennemyes assone formast sawe reculed abacke good aray wherof behynde maruell basshed thought formast company ben fightynge might haue leaser rome haue gone forwarde lyst went forthe abode styll comons wayes bytwene abuyle cressy full wha sawe ere ennemies toke swerdes cryed downe let v e ther man though present iourney coude ymagen shewe ye trouth yuell order among frenche partie yet meruelous great nombre write boke lerned specially engysshmen well behelde dealyng also certayne knyghtes sir johan heynaultes alwayes kyng philyppe shewed knewe pof batayle cressy bytwene kyng england frenche kyng cap c xxx theglysshmen thre batayls lyeng grounde rest assone saw frenchman aproche rose vpon fete fayre easely without hast aranged batayls first prince batell archer stode maner herse men armes botome batayle therle northa pton therle arundell second batell wyng good order redy confort prince batayle nede lord knyght france caenat assemble togyder good order cae came hast yuell order yt one dyd trouble another whan french kyng sawe englysshmen blode chaunged sayde marshal make genowayes go begynne batayle name god saynt denyse ther genowayes trosbowes fiftene thousand wery goyng fote day six leages armed crosbowes sayde constable nat well ordred fyght day nat case great dede armes haue nede rest wordes came erle alanson sayd man well ease charged wt suche sorte rascalles faynt fayle nowe moost nede also season fell great rayne clyps terryble thonder rayne ther came fleyng ouer bothe batayls great nombre crowes feare tempest comynge anone eyre beganne waxe clere sonne shyne fayre bright right frenchman eyen englysshmens backes whan genowayes assembled toguyder beganne aproche made great leape crye abasshe thenglysshmen stode styll styredde nat thane genowayes agayne seconde tyme made nother leape fell crye stepped forwarde lytell thenglysshmen remeued nat one fote thirdly agayne leapt cryed went forthe tyll came within shotte thane shotte feersly crosbowes thenglysshe archer stept forthe one pase lett fly arowes holly thycke semed snowe whan genowayes felte arowes persynge heedes armes brestes many cast downe cro ow dyde cutte strynges retourned dysconfited whan frenche kynge sawe flye away sayd slee rascal shall lette trouble v without reason ye shulde haue sene men armes dasshe among kylled great nombre euer styll englysshmen shot sawe thyckest preace sharpe arowes ranne men armes horse many fell horse men amo ge genowayes whan downe coude nat relyue agayne preace thycke one ouerthrewe nother also amonge englysshemen certayne ascalles went fote great knyues went among men armes slewe murdredde many lay grounde bothe erles barownes knyght squyers wherof kyng englande dyspleased rather bene taken prisoner valyant kyng behaygne called charles luzenbourge sonne noble emperour henry luzenbourge nyghe blynde whan vnderstode order batayle sayde hym lorde charles son men sayde sir nat tell thynke fightynge sayde sir ye men companyons frendes iourney requyre bring farre forwarde may stryke one stroke swerde sayde wolde commaundement intent shulde nat lese hym prease tyed raynes bridelles eche sette kynge acomplysshe desyre thei went ennemyes lorde charles behaygne sonne wrote hymselfe kyng behaygne bare armes came good order batayle whasie sawe matter wente wrie partie departed nat tell whiche waye kynge father farre forewarde strake stroke swerde ye mo foure fought valyantly dyde company aduetured themselfe forwarde ther slayne next day founde place kyng horse tyed eche erle alansone came batayle right ordynatly fought thenglysshmen erle flaunders also parte two lordes co panyes coosted englysshe archer came prince batayle fought valyantly longe frenche kynge wolde fayne haue come thyder whanne sawe baners great hedge archer hym day frenche kynge hadde gyuen great blacke courser sir johan heynault made lorde johan fussels ryde hym bere banerre horse tooke bridell tethe brought hym currours theglysshmen wolde haue retourned agayne fell great dyke sore hurt ben ther deed page nat ben folowed hym batayls sawe wher maister lay dyke none lette horse thenglysshmen wolde nat yssue batayle takyng prisoner thane page lyghted relyued maister went nat backe agayn ye way came many way batayle bytwene broy crelly saturday ryght cruell fell many feat armes done came nat knowlege night dyuerse knyghtes squyers lost maisters somtyme came thenglysshmen receyued theym suche wyse euer nighe slayne none taken mercy raunsome englysshmen determyned mornyng day batayle certayne frenchemen almaygnes perforce opyned archer prince batayle came fought men armeshande hande seconde batayle thenglysshmen came socour prince batayle whiche tyme moche ye prince sent messanger kynge lytell wyndmyll hyll knyght sayd kyng sir therle warwyke therle ca fort sir reynolde cobham suche prince sonne ar feerlly fought aresore handled wherfore de syre batayle wolle come ayde frenchman encrease dout woll sonne shall haue moche kynge sayde sonne deed hurt yerthe felled sir knyght hardely matched wherfore hathe nede ayde well sayde kyng retourne hym sent hyther say sende aduenture falleth long sonne lyue also say suffre hym day wynne spurres god pleased woll iourney honoure therof aboute hym knyght retourned agayn shewed kynges wordes gretly encouraged repoyned sende kynge dyd sir godfray harecourt wolde gladly erle harecourt brother myght haue bene saued hard say sawe baner howe ther felde frenche partie sir godfray coude nat come hym betymes slayne coude coe hym also erle almare nephue another place erle alenson therle flaunders fought valyantly euery lorde vnder owne baner finally coude nat resyst agaynst puyssaunce englysshemen ther also slayne dyuers knyght squyers also therle lewes bloyes nephue frenche kyng duke lorayne fought vnder baners last closed among copany englysshmen walsshemen slayne prowes also slayne erle ausser therle saynt poule many euenynge frenche kynge lefte hym mo threscore one wherof sir john heynalt one remounted one kynge horse slayne arowe tha sayde kynge sir departe hense tyme lese nat selfe wylfully ye haue losse tyme ye shall recouer agayne nother season soo toke kynges horse bridell ledde hym away maner persorce kyng rode tyll came castell broy gate closed bycause tyme darke kynge called captayne came walles sayd calleth tyme nyght kynge sayde opyn gate quickely fortune fraunce captayne knewe kyng opyned gate let downe bridge kyng entred hym fyue barownes sir johan heynault sir charles momorency lorde beauiewe lorde dabegny lorde mountfort kynge wolde nat tary drake departed thense myd nyght rode suche guydes knewe countrey tyll came mornynge amyense rested saturday englysshemen neuer departed fro batayls chasynge man kept styll felde euer defended themselfe agaynst came assayle batayle ended aboute euynsonge tyme phowe next day batell englysshmen disconfyted dyuerse frenchemen cap c xxxi saturday whan nyght coe theglysshmen hard noyse frechemen reputed theselfe haue vyctorie frenchman dysconfited slayne fledde away made great fyers lyghted vp torchesse candelles bycause darke kyng auayled downe fro lytell hyll stode day tyll helme came neuer heed went withall batayle sonne prince enbrased hym armes kyst hym sayde fayre sonne god gyue good seuerance year good son thus ye haue aquyted nobly ye ar worthy kepe realme prince inclyned himselfe yerthe honouryng kyng father night thanked god good aduenture made boost therof kynge wolde manne shulde proude make boost euery man humbly thanke god sonday mornyng suche myst man myght nat se bredethe acre lande fro hym departed fro hoost commaudement kyng marshalles fyue hundred speares two thousand archer se might se frenchemen gathered agayne togyder place mornyng abuyle saynt reyngnyer ponthieu common rone beauioys yssued townes natte knowyng dyscofiture day met theglysshmen wenyng bene frechmen whan theglysshmen sawe sette fresshly sore batayle last frenchemen fledde kept none array slayne wayes hedge busshes mo thane seuyn thousande day ben clere neuer onescaped anone nother co pany frenchman mette englysshmen archebysshopp rone ye great priour fraunce also knewe nothynge dysconfiture day harde frenche kynge shulde fought sonday goynge thyderwarde whane mette englysshmen great batayle great nombre coude nat endure agaynst englysshmen nyghe slayne fewe scaped two lordes slayne mornyng thenglysshmen mette dyuerse french men loste way saturday layen nyght feldes wyst nat kyng captayns slayne many met shewed comons men fote cyties good townes france ther slayne foure tymes many slayne saturday great batayle p
