next day batayle cressey deed nobred theglysshmen ca cxxxii sonday kyng englande came fro masse suche ben sente forthe retourned shewed kyng sene done sayde sir thinke surely ther aparence ennemyes ye kyng sende serche howe many slayne sir reynolde cobham sir richard stafforde thre haraldes went serche felde contrey visyted slayne rode day feldes retourned agayne hoost kyng goynge supper made iust report sene sayde howe ther xi great prince deed fourscore baners xii c knyghtes mo xxx thousande theglysshmen kept styll felde yt nyght monday mornyng kyng prepared depart kyng caused deed bodyes great lordes taken vp conueyed mutterell buryed holy groude made crye countrey graunt truse thre dayes thyntent countrey might serche felde cressy bury deed bodyes kynge went forthe came towne muttrell see marshal ranne warde hedyn brent uabam seram dyd nothyng castell strong well kept lodged night ryuer hedyn towardes blangy next day rode towarde bolayne came towne unysame kyng prince lodged taryed day refresshe men wednysday kyng came stronge towne calys p howe kyng englande layd siege calys howe poore people put towne cap c xxxiii towne calys ther captayne knyght burgone called sir john de uieu hym sir andrewe dandrehen sir john de sury sir barbon de belborne sir godfray de lament sir pepyn de urmue dyuers knyghtes squyers whan kyng england come calys layd siege ordayned bastides bytwene towne ryuer made carpenter make house lodgynges great tymbre set house lyke stretes couerd rede brome lyke lytell towne euery thynge tosell markette place kept euery tuesday saturday flesshe fyssh mercery ware house cloth bredde wyne thyng necessarie cae england flanders ther might bye lyst theglysshmen ran often tymes countrey guynes triuynois gate saynt omers somtyme boleyn brought hoost great prayes kyng wolde nat assayle towne calys thought lost labour spared peple artillery sayd howe wolde famyssh towne long siege without french kyng coe reyse siege force whan capten calys sawe maner thorder theglysshmen constrayned poore meane peple yssue towne wednysday ther yssued men woman chyldren mo xvii c passed hoost demaunded deted answered sayde bycause nothyng lyue kyng dyd grace suffred passe host without danger gaue mete drinke dyner euery pson ii slerlyng almes dyners many prayed kynges prosperyte p howe duke normady brake vp siege aguyllou cap c xxxiiii duke normandy beyng sege strong castell aguyllou ye myddes auguste made great assaut castell ye part host assaut thyder come newely lorde philyp burgone erle arthoys bolone cosyn germayn duke normady yog lusty knyght assone skirmyssh begon toke horse spurres came skirmysshe warde horse toke bytte teth bare away maister stumbled dyke fell horse man knyght brosed fall neuer helthe dyed hurt anone ye frenche kyng sent sonne duke norma dy comaundynge hym wyse breke vp siege aguyllou retourne fraunce defende herytage fro theglysshmen thervpon duke toke counsayle lordes hym best hadde promysed nat depart then tyll wone castell lordes counsayled hym sythe kynge father sende hym depart next day tymes frenchemen trussed bagge baggage great hast departed towarde france within fortresse yssued penon lorde gaultiers manny dasshed amonge hynder company frenchemen flewe toke dyuerse theym nombre threscore brought fortres prisoner knewe iourney kynge englande made season fraunce howe lay siege calys french kyng departed fro amyense parys warde batayle cressy sore dyspleasedde sir godmar du fay bycause kynge sayd dyd nat deuer truely kepyng passage blach taque wher theglysshme passed ouer ryuer yt french king coud gette hym ye hete wold haue cost hym heed dyuers kyng counsell wolde yt shuld dyed sayd treto causer ye great losse kynge cressy sir john heynault excused hym refrayned kynges yuell wyll sayd howe coulde lye power resyst hole puysance thengly sshmen whan floure realme fraunce togyder coude nat resyst tha anone came kynge quene duke normandy well receyued p howe sir gaultier manny rode fraunce saue conduct calys cap c xxxv natlong sir gaultier ny fell comunycation knyght normandy prisoner demau ded hym money wolde pay raunsome knyght answered sayd wolde gladly pay thre crownes well lorde gaultyer knowe well ye kynne duke normandy welbeloued hym sure wolde sore oppresse sure ye wolde gladly pay x thousand crownes shall deale otherwyse woll trust faythe promyse ye shall go duke lorde meanes gette saue conduct xx copany ryde fraunce calys payeng curtesly expense ye get duke kyng shall clerely quyte ransome moche thanke greatly desyre se kynge maister wyll lye one nyght place tyll coe ye nat retourne agayn hyder within moneth yelde self styll prisoner knyght content went parys duke lorde obtayned pasport sir gaultier manny r horse hym onely knyght returned aguyllon brought gaultier ther quyted knyght norman raunsome anone sir gaultier toke way xx horse hym rode auuergne whan taryed place shewed letter lette passe whan came orleaunce letter rested brought parys put prison chatelet whan duke normandy knewe therof went kynge father shewed howe sir gaultier manny saue conduct wherfore requyred kynge asmoche might delyuer hym el shulde sayd howe trayed hym kyng answered sayd howe shulde put dethe reputed hym great ennemy sayd duke sir ye surely shall neuer bere armour agaynst kynge englande suche may let departyng sayd wolde neuer entre agayn kynges host thus mater stode certayne tyme knyght heynalt called sir mansart de sue purchased myght helpe sir water manny went often duke normady finally kyng cou selled delyuerd prison costes payed kynge sende hym lodgyng nesle parys dyned kynge kynge presented hym great gyftes iewels value thousande floreyns sir gaultier manny receyued condycion whan cam cales kyng englande maister pleased shulde take content kepe el sende agayne frenche kyng sayd spake lyke noble man thane toke leaue departed rode long iourneys came heynalt taryed ualencennes thre dayes fro then went cales welcome kynge whan ye kyng harde sir gaultier manny receyued gyftes frenche kynge sayde hym sir gaultier ye haue hytherto truely serued v shall trust sende agayn kyng philyppe gyftes gaue ye haue cause kepe theym thanke god haue ynough v good purpose moche good acordyng good seruyce ye haue done thanne sir gaultier toke iewels delyuerd cosyn called mansac sayd ryde fraunce kynge recomend vnto hym say howe thanke hym tymes gyft gaue shewe hym howe nat pleasure kyng maister shulde kepe therfore sende agayne hym knyght rode parys shewed kyng wolde nat receyue agayne iewelles dyde gyue knyght sir mansac thaked kyng nat wyll say nay p howe therle derby seson toke poycton dyuers townes castels also cyte poycters cap c xxxvi le haue harde howe erle derby cytie burduex duryng season siege aguyllone assone knewe ye duke normandy broken vp siege sende gascoyne knightes squyers helde englysshe partie came burdeaux lorde dalbret lorde de lanspere ye lorde rosam lorde musydent lorde punyers lorde torton lorde bouqton sir amery trast dyuers therle xii hundred men armes two thousand archer thre thousande fotemen passed theryuer garon bytwene burdeaux blay toke way zaynton came myrabell wan towne assaut castell also sette therin newe captayne soudyours rode alnoy wan castell towne wanne surgeres benon castell marant thre leages fro rochell coulde nat gette went mortayn ye see syde poyctou toke perforce made ther garyson thei rode lusignen brent towne castell wolde nat wonne went taylbourge wan brige towne castell stewe within bycause knyght theyrs slayne thassautyng countrey afrayed euery man fledde stronge holdes townes forsoke owne house made none aparance defence knyght squyers kept styll fortress made semblant fyght thenglysshmen last erle derby came layd siege saynt john dangle made gret assaut within towne ther men warre tyll agaynst night whan thassaut seased sir wyllyam ryonmayre towne moost part burgess sende therle derby haue saue conduct sixe burgess come hoost treat therle night el ye next day graunted next mornynge burgess came therles tent concluded become good englysshmen long kyng englande hym wolde kepe defende fro ye frenchman ther therle refresshed hym towne thre dayes toke homage burgess erle went stronge towne nyort wherin captayne lorde guyssharde dangle ther therle made thre assautes nothyng coude wynne departed then went burge saynt maxymen wonne perforce within slayne went mostrell boy wherin ther two hudred money maker forged money frechkyng sayde wolde nat yelde vp defende towne made suche feerse assaut within slayne therle newe fortifyed ye castell made garyson erle came cytie poycters whiche great large erle besieged one syde nat bre sufficyent lay rounde incontynet made assaut cytie great nombre meane people nat mete warre defended themselfe well tyme toke lytell damage assaut ceased euery man went logynge next day certayne knyghtes host toke horse rode towne returned made report therle sene determyned nexte day assaut cytie thre place greattest nombre assaut wher wekest place cytie thus done towne ther knight yt knewe ment feate warr people nat erpert dedes armes knowe howe defende assautes wekyst place thenglysshmen entred whan within sawe towne wonne fledde away gate ther slayne vii hundred put ye swerde men woman chyldren cytie ouerron robbed whiche full great richesse aswell thynhabytauntes countrey come thyder surety dyuers church distroyed many yuelldedes done mo ben doue therle nat ben comaunded payne dethe man breune churche house sayde wolde tary ten dayes therby part yuell dedes wereseased roberyes ynough therle lay ther xii dayes lengar myght haue done pleased hym ther none resyst hym contrey trymbled feare hym therle departed fro poycters left voyde great kept departyng moche rychesse wyst natte therwith sette nothynge golde syluer fethers men warre thanne retourned small iourneys saynt johan dangle therle rested hym certayne space thenglysshmen gaue many good iuels ladyes damosel ye towne dyd therle hymself made euery day gret dyners supper bankettes made great reuell sport among achyued suche grace among sayd moost noble prince euer rode horsebacke toke leaue made mayre ye burgess renewe othe kepe towne ryght herytage kyng englande erle retourned suche fortress wonne tyll cae therytie bourdeaux gaue leaue euery man depart thanked good seruyce p kyng scottes duryng siege calys came england gret host ca c xxxvii longe nowe syth spake kyng dauyd scotlande howe tyll nowe none occasion trewse takenue well trewly kept whan kynge englande sieged calays lay scottes determyned make warre englande reuenged hurtes taken sayde howe realme englande voyde men warr sayd kyng englande calys bretaygne poyctou gascoyne frenche kyng dyd coude styrre scottes warre entent kynge englande shulde breke vp siege retourne defende owne realme kynge scottes made sommons saynt john towne ryuer tay scotlande thyder came erles barownes prelate scotlande agreed haste possyble shulde entre englande come iourney desyred johan iles gouerned wylde scottes hym obeyed man el came thre thousande moost outragyoust people countrey whan scottes assembled one fyftie thousande fightynge menne coude nat make assemble soo secrete quene englande thanne marchesse northe yorke knewe dealynge thane sent menne lay herselfe yorke men warre archer came newcastell quene meane season kyng scottes departed fro saynt johannes towne wente done fremelyne firste day nexte day passed lytell arme see came esdermelyne edebrough nombred company thre thousande men armes knyghtes squyers thretie thousande hackenayes thanne came rousbourg first fortresse englysshe parte captayne sir wyllyam montague scottes passed without assaut makynge went forthe brennynge distroyenge countrey northumberlande currours ranne yorke brent moche without walles retourned agayne host within dayes iourney newcastell vpon tyne p batayle new castell vpon tyne bytwene quene england kyng scottes cap c xxxviii quene england desyred defende contrey came newcastell vpon tyne taryed came dayly fro te whan scottes knewe englysshe men assembled newcastell drue thyderwarde currours came rennynge towne retournynge brent certayne small hamelettes smoke therof cae towne newcastell englysshmen wolde yssued haue fought made fyers captayns wolde nat sulfre theym yssue next day kyng scottes xl thousande men one came lodged within thre lytell englysshe myle newcastell lande lorde neuyll kyng sent within towne wolde yssue felde wolde fyght theym gladly lordes prelate england sayd content aduenture lyues ryghtand herytage kynge englande maister yssued towne nombre twelfe hundred men armes thre thousand archer seuyne thousande walsshmen scottes came lodged agaynst theym nere togyder euery man sette order batayle quene cae among men ordayned four batayls one ayde another firste gouernaunce bysshoppe dyrham lorde percy seconde archbysshoppe yorke lorde neuyll thyrde bysshoppe lyncolne lorde mobray fourth lorde edwarde de baylleule captayne berwyke archbysshopp canterbury lorde rose euery batayle lyke nobre quantyte quene went fro batayle batayle desyring deuoyre defende honoure lorde kyng englande name god euery man good hert courage promysyng power wolde remebre theym aswell better thoughe lorde kyng ther personally quene departed fro recomendyng god saynt george anone bataylles scottes began set forwarde lyke wyse dyd theglysshmen archer began shote bothe party shot scottes endured shortspace ye archer englande shot feersly whan batayls aproched harde batell began nyne endured tyll noone scottes great are sharpe harde gaue many great stroke howbeit finally thenglysshmen obtayned place vyctorie lost many slayne scottes therle sys therle ostre erle patrys therle surlant therle dastredare therle mare therle john duglas lorde alysaunder ramsey bare kynges baner dyuers knyghtes squyers kynge taken fought valiantly sore hurt squyer northumberland toke hym called john coplande assone taken kynge went hym felde viii seruaunces hym soo rode day tyll fyftene leages fro place ye batayle nyght cae castell called oryulus sayde wolde nat delyuer kyng scottes man woman lyueyng onely kynge englande lorde day also taken felde erle morette erle marche lorde wyllyam duglas ye lorde robert uesy bysshoppe dadudame bysshoppe saynt andrewes dyuers knyghtes barownes ther slayne one xv thousande saued themself well might batell besyde newcastell yere lorde ccc xlvi saturday next sayur mychaell p john copland kyng scottes prisoner profet gatte therby cap c xxxix whan quene englande beyng newcastell vnderstode howe iourney men rode place batayle hade ben thane shewed howe kyng scott taken squyer called john coplande hadde caryed away kyng man knewe whyder quene wrote squyer co maundyng hym bring prisoner kyng scottes howe nat well done depart hym without leaue day thenglysshmen taryed styll ye place quene next day retourned new castell whan quenes letter brought johan coplande answered sayd kyng scottes prisoner wolde nat delyuer hym woman lyueng onely kynge englande souer ayne lorde kynge scottes sayd shuld sauely kept wolde gyue acompte hym thanne quene sende letter kyng calays wherby kyng enfourmed state realme kyng sende incotynent johan coplande shulde come ouer see hym siege calays johan dyd putte prisoner saue kepynge stronge castell rode england tyll cae douer toke see arryued calays whan kyng englande sawe squyer toke hym hande sayd welcome squyer valyantnesse hath taken myne aduersary kyng scottes squyer kneled downe sayde sir yf god grace haue suffred take ye king scottes true conquest armes sir thynke man ought haue enuy aswell god may sende grace suche fortune fall poore squyer great lorde requyre grace nat myscontent though dyde nat delyuer kynge scottes comaundement quene sir holde myne othe nat good maner kyng sayd johan good seruyce ye haue done valyantnesse somoche worthe hit must counteruayle trespasse taken excuse shame haue bere yuell wyll therfore ye shall retourne agayne home house tha e pleasure ye delyuer prisoner ye quene wyfe rewarde assigne nere house ye thynke best yourselfe tyue hundred pounde sterlyng yerely rent heyres euer make squyer body thane thyrde day departed retourned agayne englande whan came home owne house assembled guyder frendes kynne toke kyng scottes rode hym cytie yorke fro kyng lorde presented kyng scottes ye quene excused hym largely quene counsell content quene made good prouisyon cytie yorke castell rosbourg cyte dyrham towne newcastell vpon tyne garysons marchesse scotlande left marchesse lorde percy lorde neuyll gouernoure thanne quene departed fro yorke towardes london sette kynge scottes strong towre london therle morette prisoner sette good kepyng ouer went douer tooke see good wynde shorte space arryued calays thre dayes feest alsayntes whose co myng kyng made great feest dyner lordes ladyes ther quene brought many ladyes damoselles aswell acompany se husbandes father bretherne frendes lay siege calays done longe space p howe yonge erle flaunders ensured kynges doughter englande cap c xl siege calais enduredde longe many thynges fell meane season whiche canne nat write fourthe parte frenche kynge sette men warre euery fortresse marchesse countie guynes thoyes boloyne aboute calays great nombre genowayes normayns see whan th glysshmen wolde goo forragynge horsebacke founde many tymes harde aduentures often skirmysshing gate dyke towne often tymes slayne hurte bothe party day one part lost day kynge englande caused engyns made oppresse theym within towne within made agayne resist toke lytell hurt nothynge coude come towne stelth meanes two maryners one called maraunt mestryell dwelt abuyle theym two calays often tymes reconforted fresshed stelth often tymes great yll chased nere taken alwayes scaped made many englysshemen drowned wynter kyng lay yll siege thought ymagined euer kepe commentie flaunders frendshyppe thought meanes soner c e entent sende often tymes fayre promyses sayeng myght gette calys wolde helpe recouer doway appurtenaunces occasyon sache promyses whyle kyng normandy towardes cressey calays went layd siege bethwyn ther captayne sir dedeart de onty banysshed fraunce helde great siege towne ore constrayned assaut within knyghtes captayns set ye frenche kyng kepe towne say sir g ssray charney sir ewstace rybamount sir ba dwy nekyn sir john landas defended towne suche wyse flemmynges wa nothyng ther departed retourned agayne flaunders whyle kynge englande lay siege calys sent styll messagers flanders made great promyses kepe amyte hym oppresse drift french kyng dyde coulde drawe opynyon kyng englande wolde gladly erle loyes flaunders f fte e yere age shulde haue mar age doughter isabell somoche dyd kyng flemynges agreed therto wherof kynge gladde thought mariage flemynges wolde gladlyer helpe hym flemynges thought hauyng kynge englande partie might well r yst frenchman thought necessary profytable loue kyng englande rather frenche kynge yong erle ben euer norysshed amo ge noble men france wolde nat agre sayd playnly wolde nat haue wyfe doughter hym sle e father also duke johan brabant purchased greatly erle flaunders shulde haue doughter maryage promysing hym wolde take wyfe wolde cause hym enioy hole erldome flanders ayre meanes otherwyse also duke sayde frenche kyng sir erle flanders woll take doughter shall fynde meanes flemmynges shall take part sake kyng englande whiche promyse frenche kyng agreed maryage whan duke brabant kyng gode wyll sent certayne messagers fla ders burgess good townes shewed fayre reason counsayles good townes sent erle naturall lorde certifyeng hym wolde come flanders vse counsayle wolde hym trewe good frendes delyuer hym rightes iurysdictyons fla ders asmoche euer erle hadde erle toke counsayle went flaunders wher receyued great oye gyuen hym many great presentes as one kyng englande harde sende flaunders erle northampton therle arundell lorde cob dyde somoche offycers common flaunders rather lorde therle shulde take wyfe kyng englandes doughter doughter duke brab affectuously desyred lorde shewed hym many fayre reason drawe hym way burgess wer duke brabantes partie durste nat say contrary erle nowyse wolde concent therto euer sayde wolde natte wedde whose father slayne though myght haue halfe hole realme englande whane flemmynges sawe sayd howe lorde moche french yuell counsayled also sayd howe wolde good hym syth wolde nat belyue counsayls toke putte hym cortoyse prison sayd howe shulde neuer depart without wolde folowe byleue counsayls also sayd erle father belyued loued moche frenchemen wolde byleued shuld haue ben greattest lorde christendome recouered agayne lysle doway bethwyn yet alyue thus mater abode certayne space kynge englande lay styll siege calays kept great court christmas begynnynge lent came thyder gascoyne erle derby erle penbroke erle forte dyuers knyghtes squyers passed see erle thus erle flaunders long danger amonge stemynges cortoyse prison greatly anoyed hym last sayde wolde byleue cousayle knewe well sayd shulde haue profet contrey wordes reioysed greatly flemynges toke hym prison suffred hym go haukyng ryuer sport erle loued well euer ther good watche layde hym shulde nat steale away fro theym charged lyues take good hede hym also suche fauourable kyng englad watched hym nere coude nat pysse without knowledge endured longe last erle sayd wolde gladly haue wyfe kyng englandes doughter flemmynges sende worde therof kynge quene poynted day shuld come bergus abbey bringe doughter theym wolde bring thyder lorde erle flanders coclude vp maryage kyng quene gladde therof sayde flemmynges good men bergus bytwene newport grauelynge came moost saddest men gode townes flaunders brought erle lorde great estate kyng englande quene ther redy erle curtesly inclyned kyng quene kyng toke erle ryght hande right swetely ledde hym forthe sayeng dethe erle father god helpe day batayle cressey nexte day neuer herde worde hym heshulde yong erle se blant made thoughe ben content kynges excuse fyll communycacyon maryage certayne artycles agreed vnto kyng englande erle loyes flaunders great amyties ther swor e bytwene holden erle fyaunced isabell kyng englandes doughter promysed wedde iourney brake newe day apoynted leaser flemmynges retourned flaunders lorde kynge englande quene went agayne siege calays thus mater stode certayne tyme kynge quene prepayred greatly agayne maryage iewelles thynges gyue away acordyng behauyours erle flanders dayly past tyme ryuer made semblant maryage pleased greatly flemmynges thought sure ynough hym nat great watch made hym knewe nat well codycion lorde soeuer coutenance made warde inwarde courage frenche day went forthe hawkes weke maryage shulde haue ben finysshed fauconer cast faukon hearon therle cast nother two faukons chased hearon erle rode folowe faucon whan gode way aduantage feldes dasshed spurres horse galoped forth suche wyse kepars lost hym styll galoped forthright tyll came arthoyes ther suretie rode fraunce kyng philyp shewed hym aduenture kynge frenchman sayd howe dalt wysely englysshmen othersyde said howe betrayed disceyued kyng left nat kepe flemmynges amyte knewe well erle done dede nat cou sell wer sore dyspleased therwith excuse made kyng soone byleued behalfe p howe sir robert namure dyde ho age kyng england calays cap c xli whyle kynge lay siege calays ther came se kynge quene dyuers lord knightes flanders brabant heynault almaygne departed none agayne great gyftes gyuen season newely come countie namure liege dut holy lande sir robert namure lorde lespentyne hadde made hym knyght holy sepulcre sir robert yong lusty knight nat desyred bothe kynges came owne good mynde well acopanyed richely siege calayes presented hymselfe kyng englande ioyfully receyued hym dyde quene lordes entred greatly kynges fauour bycause bare name sir robert de arthoys vucle thus sir robert became kynges liege man kynge gaue hym thre hundred pounde sterlynge yere cofers payde bruges taryed kynge calays tyll towne wonne ye shall p howe thenglysshmen wanne rochdaren howe sir charles de bloyes layed siege therto ca c xlii longe nowe syth spake sir charles de bloyes duke bretaygne countesse mountforde bycause truse takenne uannes whiche well kept durynge trewse eyther partie kept peasably possessyon assone trewse expyred made agayne feerse warr coe bretaygne fro kynge englande sir thomas dangorne sir johan harewell came thyder fro siege calays hundred men armes foure hundred archer taryed countes mout forde hanybout sir castell bretone bretonant thenglysshmen breton part made often tymes iourneys agaynst sir charles de bloyes men somtyme wanne somtyme lost cu tre expled distroyed reason men warre day englysshmen wet layde siege good towne called rochedaren often tymes made autes towne well defended thenglysshmen wanne nothyng captayne within towne tassartde guynes within towne thre partes ratherenglysshe frenche tooke capytayne sayde wolde stee hym without wolde yelos hymselfe englysshe thanne hesayde wolde wolde haue hym thervpon let hym go ryed englysshmen tourned countes mountfordes parte styll capytayne towne left certayne soudyers kepe towne castell whan sir charles du bloyes herde therof sware mater shulde natte longe beso thatic sende menne aboute bretaygne normandy assembled cytie nauntes sixtene hundred menne armes twelfe thousande fote ther hym four hundred knyghtes xxiiii baners cae layde siege rochdaren lately wonne englysshmen great engyns caste day nyght sore costrayned within towne sende messangers countesse mountforde acordynge promyse sende theym ayde conforte countesse sende assemble men toguyder shortely thousande menne armes eyght thousande fote made capytayns theym forsayd thre knyghtes sayd wolde neuer retourne tyll reysed seige rochdaren el dye quarell sette forthe came nere hoost sir charles bloyes lodged ryuer syde night thyntent fight next day whan euery man rest sir thomas dangorne sir johan artwell caused halfe copany armed depted fro hoost mydnight sodenly entred lorde charles hoost one syde beate downe slewe moche people taryed longe hoost moued euery man redy coulde nat retourne agayne without batayle enclosed fought withall sharpely might nat bere frenchman dedes ther taken sir thomas dangorne sore hurt sir johan artwell saued hymselfe aswell might ryuer retourned company shewed adueture thanne determyned haue retourned agayne hanybout p batayle rochedaren howe sir charles de bloys taken thenglysshmen cap c xliii seson englysshemen thus counsayle determyned haue departed came knyght countesse mountforte called garnyer lorde cadudall hudred men armes assone come knewe demenour h sayde nay sir lette v nat thus tourne agayne leape horse suche haue non lette come fote lette v nowe go loke ennemyes nowe thynke selfe sure warant shall dysconfet horseman rode forthe fotemen folowed aboute sonne rysinge dasshed lorde charles ho st euery manne ther slepe rest thought haue tyme thenglysshmen bretous bete downe tentes pauilyons slewe people downe right sodenly taken ther moch people slayne sir charles bloyes lordes bretayne normady hym taken prisoner thus siege rochdaren reysed lorde charles brought hanyboute suche fortress partie helde styll wyfe called selfe duchesse bretaygne toke warre hande p howe frenche kyng assembled great hoost rayse kyng england fro siege fore calys ca c xliiii kinge philyppe knewe well howe men sore constrayned calays commaunded euery manne hym feest pentecost cyte amyense ther ther non durst say nay kyng kept great feest thyder came duke ode burgoyne duke normandy eldyst sonne duke orlya se yongest sonne duke burbon therle fo tz lorde loyes sau sir john heynalt erle armynake erle forestes therle ualentenoys dyuers erles baron knyghtes whan amyense toke counsayle frenche kyng wolde gladly passage flaunders myght haue ben opyned hym thought might sende part men grauelyng way refresshe towne calys syde fyght easely thenglysshmen sende great messangers flanders treat mater kynge englande suche frendes wolde neuer acorde yt curtesy frenche kyng said howe wolde go thyder syde towarde burgoyne kynge englande sawe well howe coude nat g calays b famyne made stronge castell hygh close vp passage see castell set bytwene towne see well fortyfied springalles bombardes bowes artillary castell threscore men armes two hundred archer kept hauyn suche wyse nothyng coude come thought therby within shulde soner famysshed season kynge englande exhorted flaunders yssued flaunders hundred thousande went layde iege towne ayre brent con rey nyuell la gorge estelles le uentre marche called la loe gate saynt omer turwyne kyng went towne arras sette many men warr garysons arthoys specially sent constable sir charles aygne saynt omers erle ewe guynes constable fraunce prisoner englande hath ben shewed flemmynges dyd frechmen great trouble departed whan flemynges returned french kyng company deted fro arras went hedyn host ye caryage held well length thre l ag contrey ther taryed day next day blangy ther rested take aduyse way go forthe counsayled go contrey called la belme yt way toke hym cc one passed countie franqueberg came streyght hyll sangattes bytwene calys wyssant came thyder goodly order baners displayed great beautie beholde puyssaut array calys whan sawe lodge semed newe siege p howe kyng england e passage calay well kept frenche kyng shulde nat aproche eyse siege cap c xl shall kynge englande dyd caused done whane sawe knewe french kyng came great hoost rayse siege whiche coste hym somoche good payne body lost many knewe well howe constrayned towne hit coulde nat longe endure defaute vitayls greued hym sore depart aduysed well howe frenchman coud nat aproche nother hoost towne two place downes see syde elles aboue hygheway many dyke rockes maresshes one way passe ouer bridge called newlande bridge thane kynge made na drawe long cost downes euery shyp well garnysshed obardes cro owes archer springalles artyllary wherby frenche hoost myght passe way kynge caused erle go kepe newlande bridge great bre men armes archer fre chemen coude natte passe way without wolde haue gone marsh whiche vnpossyble othersyde towarde calys ther hyghe towre kept archer kept passage downes fro frechmen well fortifyed great double ykes whan french men thus lodged mount sangate common turney fyftene hundred came towre within shotte passed dyke came fote wall pykes hokes fore assaute many tourney sore hurte laste wanne towre tha within slayne towre beaten downe french kyng sent marshal aduyse way myght aproche fyght englysshem went forthe whan aduysed passage straytes retourned kyng sayd howe nowyse coude come englysshmen without wolde lese people mater rested day nyght nexte day masse frenche kynge sende kynge englande lorde goffray charney lorde ewstace rybamount guy nele lorde bea ewe rodde stronge way sawe well harde passe way praysed moche order erle derby kepte bridge newlande passed rode tyll came kynge well acompanyed nobl men aboute hym thane fou e lyghted came kynge dyde reuerence hym lorde ewstace rybamont sir kynge maister sendeth worde v come mount sangate v batayle canne fynde way come therfore sir wol e shulde apoynt certayne counsayle lykewise bytwene theym aduyse place batayle kyng englande redy aduysed answere sayd sir haue well vnderstande ye de behalfe myne aduersary kepe wrongfully fro myne herytage wher ore sor e say vnto hym fro ye lyst haue bene nyghe ho knewe right well might come hyther soner wolde hath suffred abyde ere long ben gretly coste charge co de somoche wolde sone lorde alays wherfore natte determynedd folowe deuyse ase depart whiche poynt wynne haue ore desyred derely bought wherfore men canne passe way lett theym seke passage thynk come hyther thane lordes departe conueyed tyll paste newlande bridge shewed frenche kynge kynge englan e aunswere season whyle frenche kynge studyed ho ight kyng englande ca hoost two cardynalles pope cl ment legacion toke great pay e bytwene hoostes procuredde moche graunted certayne tre tie acorde respyte bytwene two kynges men beynge siege felde onely four lord apoynted eyther partie counsell togyder treat peace freche kyng ther duke burgoyne duke burbone sir loyes sauoy sir john heynalt thenglysshe partie therle derby erle northamton lorde reynolde cobham lorde gaultyer manny two cardynalles meanes bytwene party lordes mette thre dayes many deuyses put forthe none toke effect meane season kyng englande alwayes fortifyed host felde made dyke downes frenchman shuld nat sodenly come thre dayes passed without agrement two cardynalles returned saynt dmers whan frenche kynge sawe coude nothynge next day dysloged tymes toke waye amyens gaue euery man leaue depart whane within calays sawe kynge depart made great sorowe englysshmen folowed tayle french men wanne somers carte caryages horse wyne thynges toke prisoner brought hoost calays p howe towne calys gyuen vp kyng england cap c xlvi frenche kyng thus departed fro sangate within calays sawe well howe coure fayled whiche gret sorowe desyred somoche captayn sir john uyen went walles towne made sygne speke person hoost whan kyng harde therof sende thyder sir gaultier many sir basset sir john uyen sayd sir ye right valy ant knyghtes dedes armes ye knowe well howe kynge maister hath sende towne commaunded v kepe behofe suche wyse take blame hym dammage haue done lyeth oure power nowe socours hath fayled v sore strayned haue nat lyue withall muste dye el e rage famyn without noble gentyll kyng woll take mercy v requyre desyre hym haue pyte v let v go depart lette hym take towne castell goodes therin whiche great habundaunce sir gaultyer manny sayde knowe somwhat entencyon kynge maister hath shewed vnto v surely knowe trouth nat mynde ye within towne shulde departe wyll ye shulde put selfes pure wyll ransome suche pleaseth hym putte dethe suche lyste calays hath done hym suche cotraryes dispyghtes hathe caused hym dyspende soo moche good loste many menne sore greued agaynst captaynesayde sir harde mater v arhere within small sorte knyghtes squyers hath trewely serued kynge maister well ye serue yors lyk case haue endured moche payne vnease shall yet endure asmoche payne euer knyght dyd rather thaune consent worst ladde towne shulde haue yuell grettest v therfore sir pray humylite yet ye woll go speke kynge englande desyre hym haue pytie v truste hym somoche gentylnesse gace god purpose shall chaung sir gaultier manny sir basset retourned kynge declared hym hadde ben sayde kynge sayde wolde none otherwyse shulde yelde theym vp symply pleasure sir gaultyersayde sir sauyng dyspleasure ye may wronge ye shall gyue yuell ensample ye sende v seruauntes fortresse woll nat gladde go ye putte theym towne dethe yelded lyke wise woll deale v case fell lyke whiche wordes dyuerse lordes present sustayned maynteyned kynge sayde sir woll nat alone agaynst therfore sir gaultyer manny ye shall goo say capytayne grace shall fynde nowe lette sixe chiefe burgess towne come bare ed bare foted bare legged shertess haulters neckess towne castell handes lette si e yelde themselfe purely wyll resydewe wyll take mercy sir gaultyer retourned founde sir john uyen yll wall abydinge answere hanne sir gaultier shewed hym grace coulde gette kynge well sir johan sir requyre tary certayne spacetyll go towne shewe common towne sent hyder sir john went vnto market place wned co mon bell incontynent men woman assembled captayne mane reporte done sayde sir wyll none otherwyse therfore nowe take aduyse make shorte aunswere thanne people beganne wepe make sorowe nat hard hert sene wolde haue great pytie theym captayne hym selfe wepte pyt last moost riche burgesse towne called ewstace saynt peter rose vp sayde openly sir great small great myschiefe shulde suffre dye suche people towne famyn otherwyse whan meane saue theym thynke shulde haue great merytte lorde god myght kepe theym fro suche myschie e parte haue good truste lorde god dye quarell saue restdewe god wolde pardone wherfore saue wyll first putte lyfe teopardy whan thus sayde euery man worshypped hym dyuers kneled downe fete sore wepyng sore sighes tha another honest burgesse rose say e wyll kepe company gossyppe ewsface called john dayre rose vp jaques wyssant riche goodes herytage sayd also wolde holde company two cosyns likwyse yd peter wyssant brother thane rose two sayde wolde thanne went aparelled kyng besyred captayne went gate ther great lameutacyon made men woman chyldren departyng gate opyned yssued vt burgess closed gate agayne bytwene gate barrier sayd sir gaultier many sir captayne calays hole consent peple towne six bu ge swere truely day moost honourable riche notable burgess towne calys wherfore getyll knyght requyre pray kyng haue mercy theym dye nat sir gaultier nat say kyng wyll shall best thane barryers opyned sixe burgess went towardes kyng captayne entred agayne towne whan sir gaultier prese ted burgess kyng kneled downe helde vp handes sayd gentyll kyng beholde sixe burgess calays great marchantes haue brought kayes towne castell submyt oure selfe clerely wyll pleasure saue resydue people calays haue suffred great payne sir bescche grace haue mercy pytie v hygh noble erles barownes ther wept pytie kyng loked felly theym greatly hated people calys gre damage dyspleasures done hym see comauded heedes stryken euery man requyred kyng mercy wolde behalfe sir gaultier many said noble kyng goddessake refrayne courage ye haue name souerayn noble therfore nowe nat thyng shulde blemysshe renome gyue cause speke villany euery man woll say great cruelty put deth suche honest person owne wylles putte themselfe grace saue copany kyng wryed away fro hym comaunded sende hangman sayd calys hath caused many slayne wherfore shalt dye likewyse quene beynge great chylde kneled downe sore wepyng sayd getyll sir syth passed see great parell haue despred nothyng therfore nowe hubly requyre honour son virgyn mary loue yt ye woll take mercy sixe burgess kyng helde quene stode styll study space tha sayd dame wold ye ben nowe soe place ye make suche request nat eny wherfore gyue pleasure theym quene caused brought chambre made ye halter taken fro neckes caused newe clothed gaue dyner leser gaue ech sire noble made brought thoost sauegard set lyberte phowe kyng england repeopled towne calys englysshmen cap c xlvii thus strong towne calays gyuen vp kyng edwarde england yere lorde god ccc xlvi moneth august kyng englad called hym sir gaultier manny two marshal therle warwyke therle stafforde sayd sir take kayes towne castell calys go take possessyon putte prison knyghtes soudyours came thyder symply wynne lyueng cause theym auoyde towne also men woman chyldren wolde repeople agayne towne wt pure englysshmen thre lordes hundred went toke possessyon calys dyd put prison sir john de uien sir john surrey sir john belborne made soudyers bring harnesse place apoynted layed hepe hall calys thanne made maner people voyde kept mo person preest two auncyent personage suche knewe customes lawes ordynaunces towne signe herytag howe deuyded prepared castell lodge kyng quene prepared house ye kynges company kyng mounted horse entred towne trumpet tabour nakquayres hormyes kyng lay tyll quene brought bedd fayre lady named margarete kynge gaue sir gaultier many dyuers fayre house within towne therle stafforde lorde bethene sit bartylmewe bomes lordes repeople agayn towne kynges mynde whan cae englande sende london xxxvi good burgess calys dwell somoche towne myght peopled wt pure englysshmen entent kynge fulfylled ye newe towne bastyd made without towne pulled downe castell stode hauyn rasshed downe great tymbre stone brought towne kynge ordayned men kepe ye gate walles barryers ameded thynges within towne sir john de uien copany sent englande halfe yere london putte raunsome thynke great pyte burgess men towne calys woman chyldren whasie fayne forsake house herytages goodes bere away nothyng restorement frenche kyng whose sake lost moost part went saynt omers cardynall guy de boloyne come fra ce legacyon frenche kynge cosyn cytie amyense purchased somoche truse taken bytwene ye kynges englande fraunce contres herytages endure two yeres truse tie agreed bretayne clerely excepte two ladyes made styll warre one agaynst kyng englande quene retourned englande kyng made captayne calys sir amery pauy lumbarde borne kyng greatly auaunced kynge sende fro lodon xxxvi burgess calays ryche sage wyues chyldren dayly encreased nombre kynge graunted suche lyberties franchysses men gladde go dwell tyme brought lodon sir charles de bloyes called hymselfe duke breten putte cortoyse prison towre london kyng scottes erle morette nat ben longe request quene englande sir charles cosyn germayne receyuedde fayth trouth rode london pleasure might natly past one night london without kynge quene also tyme ther prisoner englande therle ewe guynes right gentyll knyght dealynge suche welcome wher soeuer came kyng quene lordes ladyes damosel pof dealynge br gant languedocke called bacon cap c xlviii yere two kynges helde well trewse taken bytwene sir wyllm duglas scottes beyng forest gedeours made warre dayly englysshmen also suche gascoyne poyctou xayntone aswell frenche englysshe kept nothyng trewse taken bytwene two kynges conquered often tymes townes castels one vpon byforce purchase stelth nyght day often tymes ther fell bytwene many fayre auetures somtyme frenchman somtyme thenglysshmen alwayes poore brigantes wanne robyng townes castels therby came riche made capitayns brigantes well worthe xl thousande crownes often tymes wold spy wher good towne dayes iourney two fro wolde assemble xx xxx togyder go couert wayes day nyght entre towne vnknowen ye mornynge sette fyre house towne wolde thynke done men warre flye away towne thanne brigantes wolde breke vp cofers house robbe take lyste slye away whan done among brigant languedocke spyed stronge castell couborne lymosyn rode nyght xxx co panyons toke castell stell lorde castell prisoner called coubourne putte hym prison owne castell kept hym longe last raunsomed hym xxiiii thousande crownes kept styll ye castell made sore warr contrey fayre promyses frenche kyng bought hym castell gaue hym x thousand crownes made hym vssher armes brigant bacon euer well horsed ap led armed lyke erle contynued longe lyued p another page called croquart cap c xlix lyke case brigantes bretayne made warre wanne townes castelles lyued robery helde man wanne thei kept theselfe solde countrey townes castels derely among one mayster called croquart poore page attendyng lorde dercle holland whan croquart began waxe man lorde gaue hym leaue depart go warres bretayne fyll seruyce man armes bare hymselfe well askirmysshe maister taken slayne thanne bycause prowes felowes dyde chuse hym capitayne stede mayster dyd gette somoche wynnyng townes castelles estemed worthe xl thousand crownes besyde horse wherof xx xxx good courser double horse brute one moost expert men armes countre chosen batayle one xxx englysshe partie wan ther price freche kyng made hym offer promyse wolde becoe frenche make hym knyght mary rychely gyue hym two thousande pounde reuenewes yerely wolde nowyse co set therto fortuned hym day ryde yonge horse bought thre hundred crownes spu red hym soo sore horse ranne away hym romnyng fell dyke brake maysters necke thus ended croquart p howe sir amery pauy lumbar solde towne calys wherof captayne lorde geffray charney fraunce cap c l season towne saynt omers lorde geffray charney kept fronters ther vsing euery thynge touchynge warre kyng thought howe lumbardes naturally couetonse wherfore thought assay gette towne calys wher amery pauy lumbarde capitayne reasone trewse saynte omers myght go calys calys saynt omers dayly resorted toguyder marchadyses sir geffray secretly fyll treaty sir amery pauy promysed delyuer frechmens handes towne castell calys xx thousande crownes nat done secretely kyng englande knowledge therof kyng send amery de pauy come england westmynster speke hym came ouer thought kyng nat knowledge mater thought done secretly whan kyng sawe hym toke hym apart sayd thou knowest well haue gyuen kepyng thynge worlde yt loue best next wyfe chyldren say towne castell calys thou hast solde frechmen wherfore thou haste well deserued dye lumbard kneled downe sayd noble kyng cry mercy trewe ye say sir bargayne may well broken yet haue receyued neuer peny kyrge loued well lumbard sayd amery woll thou go forwarde thy bargayne day thou apoyntest delyuer towne let haue knowledge therof condycion forgyue thy trespas thervpon lumbard retourned agayne calays kept mater secrete sir geffray charney thought well haue calays assembled certayne nombre secretly v hundred speares ther fewe knewe purposed thynke neuer made frenche kyng knowledge therof trowe kyng wolde nat consented therto bycause truse lumbard apoynted delyuer ye castell first nyght ye newe yere lumbarde sende worde therof brother kyng englande p batayle calays bytwene kyng englande vnder baner sir gaultyer manny sir geffray charney frenchemen cap c li whan kyng england knewe certayne day apoynted departed england thre c men armes vi c archer toke shyppyng douer euenynge arryued calays secretely man knewe therof went layde men busshmentes chamber towres within castell thane kyng sayde sir gaultyer manny woll ye chiefe enterprice sonne prince woll fyght vnder baner lorde geffray charney last day decembre nyght departed fro arras company came nere cali hour mydnight taryed abydynge company sende two squyers posterne gate castell calys founde sir amery redy demaunded hym tyme lorde geffray shulde come lumbarde sayde yes retourned maister shewed hym lumbard sayd made men passe newlande bridge good order batayle sende xii knyghtes hundred men armes go take possession castell calays thought well myght haue castell shulde soone gette towne seyng gode nobre men hym dayly might haue mo whane lyst delyuered lorde edwarde ren xx thousande crownes pay lumbarde sir geffray houed styll feldes priuely baner hym entent entre towne ye gate orels nat lumbarde lette downe bridge posterne suffred hundred men armes entre peasably sir edwarde delyuered postern xx thousand crownes bagge lumbarde sayde trust haue leaser tell wyll anone day cast ye bagge crownes coter sayde frenchemen coe sir ye shall entre dongyon shall sure lordes castell went thyder drewe apart barre gate opyned within towre ye king england two hundred speares yssued swerdes are handes cryeng manny many rescue weneth frenchman fewe men wyn castell calays frenchman sawe well defence coude nat auayle theym yelded theselfe prisoner ther fewe hurt put towre prison thengly sshmen yssued castell towne mounted horse frenche prisoner horse tharchers rode bolayne gate wher sir geffray banner hym goules thre skuchens syluer great desyre first shulde entre towne sayd knyghtes lumbarde opyn gate shortely ar lyke dye colde name god ser sayd pepy de werre lumbardes ar malycious people subtyll nowe lokynge crownes se good nat reken haue hole somme kynge englande prince sonne redy gate vnder bauer ser gaultier manny dyuers baners erle stafforde erle suffolke lorde john montagu brother therle salysbury lorde beachame lorde le lorde dalawarre lordes baners mo iourney great gate set open yssued whane frenchman sawe yssue herde cry manny rescue knewe well betrayed ser geffray sayd company sir slye clene lost yet wer better fight gode hert truste iourney shall englysshmen herd wordes sayd saynt george ye say trewely shame haue slyeth frenchman lighted fote put horse fro ordred themself batayle whan kyng sawe stode styll sayd let v order selfe fight ennemyes woll abyde v kyng sende part company newland bridge herde say ther great nombre frenchman thyder went sixe baners thre hundred archer founde lorde monau frenes lorde creques kepyng ye bridge bytwene bridge calays ther many crosbowes saynt omers ayre sore fray slayne drowned mo sixe hundred frenchman soone discomfytted chased water erly mornyng cotynent day frenchman kept grounde whyle many feates armes done bothe partes englysshmen euer encreased commyng calays frenchman abated frechmen sawe well coulde nat longe kepe bridge suche horse mounted shewed horse heles thenglysshmen chase many man ouerthrowen well horsed saued themselfe ye lorde frenes ye lorde creques lorde se py lorde louchinleych lorde namure many taken owne outrage might haue bensaued lyst whane fayre day euery man myght knowe french knyghtes squyers assebled togyder agayne turned fought feersly englysshmen ther frenchman toke good prisoner wherby bothe honour profet p nowe let v speke kyng ther vnknowen ennemyes vnder banner sir gaultyer manny fote among men seke enemyes stode close togyder speares v fore long first meatyng sore rencountre kyng light lorde eustace rybemount stronge hardy knight long fyght bytwene hym king ioy beholde last put sondre great company bothe party came way fought feersly togyder frenchman dyd ther right valyantly specially lorde eustace ribamont strake kyng day two tymes knee finally kynge hymself toke prisoner yelded swerde ye kyng sayd sir knyght yelde prisoner knewe nat kyng iourney kyng england ther ser geffray slayne taken ther slayne ser ry boy sir pepyn de la warre sir geffray taken th iourney achyued cali ye yere lorde ccc lviii ye last day decebre towarde next mornyng chapelet perles kyng englande gaue sir eustace rybemont cap c lii whan batayle done kyng returned agayne castell calays caused prisoner brought thyder ye fre chmen knewe well yt kynge ben personally hy vnder baner sir gaultier ny kynge sayd wolde gyue ght supper castell calys hour supper cae table couerd kyng knyghtes ther redy euery man newe arell frenchman also ther made good chere thoughe prisoner kyng satte downe lordes knygh hym right honorably prince lordes knyghtes englande serued kynge first messe seconde satte downe table well serued great leaser thane whan supper done table take away kynge taryed styll hall knyghtes frenchman bare heeded sauyng chapelet fyne perles ware eed kynge went fro one another frenchman whan came sir geffray charney lytell changed countenance loked hym sayd sir geffray reason shulde loue butte lytell wha ye wolde steale night fro thynge haue der ly bought hath cost somoch gode right oyouse gladde haue taken proffe ye wolde haue better markette haue whan ye thought haue calys xx thousande crownes god hath holpen ye haue fayled purpose therwith kyng went fro hym gaue neuer worde answere kynge cae sir eustace rybamont ioyously hym sayd sir eustace ye knyght worlde haue sene moost valyant assayle ennemyes defende hymself neuer founde knyght euer gaue somoche body body ye haue done day wherfore gyue price aboue knightes court right sentece kyng toke chapelet yt vpon heed beyng bothe fayre goodly tyche sayd sir eustace gyue chapelet best doar e journey past eyther party desyre bere yere loue knowe well ye fresshe amorouse often tymes among ladyes damoselles say wher soeuer ye come dyd gyue quyte prison ransome ye shall depart tomorowe please yere thousande thre hundred xlix kynge philyppe fraunce wedded seconde yfe wednisday xxix day january dame blanche doughter kynge philyppe nauerre dyed spayne ye age eyghtene yere also nynetene day february next begynning lent duke normandy kyng eldest sonne wedded seconde wyfe saynt geneuese nere saynt germayne lay jane cou tesse bolayne somtyme wyfe ye lorde phylyppe sonne duke eudos burgoyne lorde philyppe dyed aguyllone thre yere doughter erle wyllyam bolayne doughter l yes erle eureur lady helde handes duchy burgoyne countesse arthoyes bolayne auuergne dyuerse landes p dethe kynge philyppe france coronacyon sonne john cap c liii yere lorde god ccc l beginyng august sir raoll caours dyuerse knyght squyers nombre sixscore men armes fought castell called auleon within capitayne kynge englandes bretayne called sir thomas dagorne sir thoms ther ayn nombre c men armes hym yere xxii day august king philypp dyed nogeunt caryed ladyes church parys thursday buryed saynt denyse lyft hande hygh auter bowelles buryed jacopyns parys hert bourfontayne ualoys xxvi day septembre next ensuynge sonday sacred crowned reyns kynge john eldest son kyng philyp day quene also crowned ther king made certayne knyghtes eldest son dolphyn uyen loys seconde son erle alanson erle stapes lorde joh arthoys duke philypp orlyaunce brother kyng duke burgoyne son quene husbande lorde philyp burgoyn therle damartyn dyuers oday kyng departed went parys laon soyssons se lys kynge quene entred parys great tryuphe xvii day octobre kept great feest hole weke kyng aryed thet neele palys tyll saynt martyns tyde made ordynaunce lyament tuesday xvi day nouebre raffe erle ewe guynes constable france newly come prison england taken kyng house neele parys wher kyng prouost parys kynges comaundemet sae house put prison tyll thursday hour matyns day beheeded prison presence duke burbon erle armynake erle monford lorde john bolayne therle renell dyuers knyghtes present comaundement kyng palays costable beheeded high treason cofessed duke athene dyuers buryed ye augusty parys without walles church apoyntment kyng honour frendes sayd constable moneth january olowynge charles spayne kyng gyuen countie angolen made co stable france first day aprill next lorde guy neell marshall fraunce fought ayntou dyuers englysshmen gascoyns sayde marshall men dysconfited marshall taken prisoner lorde wy brother lorde arnolde dandrehen dyuers good friday x day aprill yere lorde ccc li presented reed hatte gyles rygalt roussy abbot saynt denyce made cardynall palais parys presence kyng bysshoppe laon parys authorite bull fro pope hadde na acustomed ther seprebre frenchman recouered towne saynt john dangle theglysshmen kept yue yere delyuerd vp theglysshmen bycause nothyng lyue wout e batayle moneth octobre publy hed fraternyte noble house saynt ouen e paris suche bretherne ther bare starre bonet mantell yere grettest darth man lyueng coude remebre throughout france ceptyer whete worthe parys viii li parisie septier otes lx parys busshell pee viii grenes moneth octobre day fraternyte saynt owen celebrate thenglysshmen toke towne guynes truse yer ther maryage made bytwene constable france doughter sir charles e bloys p howe kyng nauer made sir charles spaygne constable france slayne ca c liiii yere lorde ccc lii vygill lady myddes august lord guy neell lorde femot marshall france bretayne slayne bataile lorde briquebeke cathelayne beau wayes dyuers noble aswell bretayne march france iiii day septebre shulde fought parys duke bo sme agayne duke lancastre certayne wordes shulde say ye duke boesme duke apealed hym court frace two duke came felde armed lystes made sayd duke almayne chalenger duke englande defender though theglysshmen wer enemy french kyng thenglyssh duke came thyder vnder saue coduct fight defence honour yet frenche kynge wold nat suffre fight assone made othes case requysite horse redy speares handes kyng toke hym mater dyd set acorde gremet vi day decebre folowyng pope clement vi dyed auygnon xi yere poti ic te xi day moneth hour thre chosen pope cardynall lymosyn called tytle cardynall ostre bycause bysshoppe cleremont called comonly cardynall cleremont whan chosen pope n med innocet owne proper name stephyn ubert yere lorde iii c liii viii day january anone brekynge day mornyng kyng charles nauer erle eureur caused slayne towne egle normady hostre lorde charles spayne constable fra ce bedde certayne men armes sent dede hymselfe abode towne tyll done retourned agayne hym sayde hym lorde philypp nauer brother lorde lovs harcourt lorde godfray hat court vncle dyuers knyghtes squyers aswell normandy nauer kynge nauer copany went cyte deureur wherof erle fortifyed towne hym also ther lorde maule john maler lorde grauyll lorde morie mulent dyuers noble normandy thane kyng nauer went towne mant sent dyuers letter diuers gode townes france howe put deth constable dyuers great trespaces comytted sent erle namure french kyng parys excuse hym kynge sende mant cardynall bolayne bysshoppe laon duke burbon erle uaudone treat kyng nauerr though caused dye costable france yet thought shulde nat clene lese fauour frenche kyng whose doughter maryed therfore made request pardon kyng thought realme fraunce great warre shulde ense bytwene two kynges kyng nauer made great assembles men warre dyuers region fortifyed townes castle finally agrement made bytwene two kynges vpon certayne codycions wherof part solo weth herafter say french kyng shall delyuer kyng nauer xxxviii tornois lande aswell certeyn rent kyng nauer yerely tresur pares vpon la de frenche kyng ought assigne hym certeyne treat grauted long bytwene predecessos bycause countie cha payne also maryage kynge nauer maryeng kyng doughter maryage promysed great landes say xii land also kyng nauer wolde haue coutie beamot le roger land bretuell normady conch dorbec vycout potheu see bayllage costantyne thynges agreed vnto french kyng howbeit coutie beamont landes conch bertuell dorbec parteyned lorde philyp duke orleace brother french kyng gaue hym lades recopence therof also agreed lordes harcourt alyes shuld holde landes whersoeuer france lyst orels nat also agreed shuld holde styll sayd landes besyde helde parie lyst kepe e cheker two tymes yere nobly euer dyd duke normady also french kynge deth costable suche cosentyng therto myse oth neuer hurt damage son occasion also kyng nauerr haue great money french kyng ar kyng nauer wolde coe parys wolde haue hostage erle aniowe seconde son kyng came pares great nobre men armes iiii day march came lyament chabre wher kyng satte dyuers peres realme counsell ther cardynall bolayne ther kyng nauer desyred french kyng hym deth costable france sayeng gode cause offred ther proue el kynges pleasure also sayd sware dyd nat grudge kyng dispyte offyce sayeng also howe ther nothyng greuous dyspleasur kyng lorde jaques burbone constable kynges comaundement sette handes kynge nauer caused hym go backe kyng pres n tha quene jane quene blanche suster kynge nauer jane ben wyfe kyng philyppe last deed came frenche kyng kneled downe lorde reynold detrey sayd right redouted soueraygne lorde beholde two ladyes quenes jane blanche sir vnderstande howe kyng nauer dyspleasur whereof sorie requyre forgyue hym yuell wyll grace god shall bere hymselfe frohens forwarde people france shalbe pleased hym constable marshalles went agayne king nauer brought hym kynges presence ther stode bytwene two quenes ye cardynall sayd sir kyng nauer kyng maister nat well cotent dede ye haue done nede nat rehersed ye haue publysshed yourselfe youre owne writyng euery man doth knowe ye ar bounde kyng ye ought nat thus haue done ye blode nere euery man knoweth ye ought holde hym also ye haue wedded doughter fore trespasse greatter howe beit instaunce loue ladyes quenes hath effectuously requyred also kyng thynketh ye dyde wtout great aduysement small counsayle therfore ye kyng pardoneth good hert wyll two quenes kynge nauer kneled downe thanked kynge cardynall sayd agayne let euery man fro hensforthe beware though kynges lynage suche lyke dede surely though kynges sonne suche leest offycer parteyning kyng shall abyde iustyce realme case court brake vp euery man departed xxi day marche knyght baneret lowe marchesse called sir reynolde presigny lorde maraunt besyde rochell drawen hanged gybette iudgement parlyament kynges cou sayle yere lorde god ccc liiii moneth august erle harcourt sir loyes brother counsayled frenche kyng sayde shewed kyng mater dethe constable septebre cardynall bolayne went auygnon sayd kyng dyspleased hym howe space yere ben france preuy kynge season went realme france lorde robert de lorris chaberlayne kyng kyng takyn hym yre thought shulde haue cost hym lyfe bycause noysed shewed kynge nauerre certayne secretes frenche kyng like wyse lordes harecourt shewed kyng nauers secretes frenche kyng moneth nouembre kyng nauer went normandy without knowledge french kyng sported hym dyuers place tyll came auygnon moneth archebysshop rowan chanceler fraunce duke burbone dyuers englysshe lordes wente auygnon pope treat peace bytwene kynges england france also ye moneth frenche kyng went normandy cane toke handes landes kynge nauers set offycers euery towne castell except sixe say eareur pontheu chirburge gaurey auranges mortaygne wolde nat yelde vp ther naueroys within theym answered sayd wolde nat delyuer vp townes castels onely kyng nauer lorde sette moneth january saue conduct cae lorde robert de lorris frenche kyng xv dayes parys coude speke kyng whan spoken hym yet nat reconsyled full returned agayne auygnon ordynance kynges counsell one ther treaty bytwene englande france ende february tidynges cae howe trewse taken bytwene sayde two kynges endure feest saynt john baptyst mean tyme pope myght make peace therfore sende messangers bothe kynges shulde sende authorite embassadours conclude maner peace moneth frenche kyng made newe money fyne golde called florence ye lambe pyell grauyn lambe lii theym went marke weyght made kynge made xlviii goo marke weyght course flores prohibyted moneth sir grachet lore came parys speke kynge messanger fro kyng nauer retourned agayne february bare hym letter saue coduct kyng nauer yere lent came dyuers englysshmen nere ye towne naunt bretayne entred castell scalyng lii sir guy rochfort captayn towne dyd somoche assaut nyght wanne castell agayne thenglysshmen taken slayne easter yere lorde ccc lv kyng johan france sent normady eldest son charles dolphyn uienoys lieutenat ther taryed somer men contre grauted hym iii armes tor thre mouethes also moneth august kyng nauer came nauer castell chierburge constantyne hym x men warr one ther dyuers treates comuned bytwene kyng nauer frenche kyng suche castell eurur pontheau robbed pylled countre came castell couch whiche french handes wan newe fortifyed many thynges dyde nauereys agaynst frenchman finally ii kynges agreed kyng nauer went castell uernell dolphyne brought kyng nauer parys xxiiii day septebre kyng nauer dolphyn came frenche kyng castell lour kyng nauerr made reuerence excused hymselfe honorably departed realme france also sayd shewed hym kynge shulde nat well content hym frenche kynge desyred hym shewe made report answered syth deth costable nothyng agaynst french kyng true man ought haue done howe beit desyred french kyng pardon euery thyng promysynge true ought father chiefe lorde thane duke athene sayde kynges behalfe kynge doth pardon hym thynges good hert p inposycion gabell ordayned fraunce thre estate feates warres cap c lv also yere oure lorde ccc lv moneth octobre prince wale eldest son kyng england went gascoyne went nere tholouz paste ryuer garon went cracassone brent borowe cytie well defended fro then went narbon brenyng exilynge contrey moneth nouembre retourned burdeur great pyllage many prisoner man resysted hym yet contrey therle armynake lieutenant french kyng langnedocke also lorde foitz lorde janques burbon lorde pontheu costable france lorde john cleremont marshall fraunce farre gretter company prince yere ende octobre kyng england cae calys rode great hoost hedyn brake parke ther brent house within ke entred nat town castell frenche kyng made assemble cytie amyens heryng kyng englande rode towarde hym kyng england returnyng calys french kyng folowed hym tyll came saynt omers send marshall dauthayne dyuers kyng england offeryng fight body body power pouer day soeuer wold apoynt kyng england refused batayle retourned agayn england frenche kyng parys yere feest saynt andrue assembled pares kynges comau ment prelate france barownes counsayls good townes ther chanceler france lyament chambre resyted state warres france desyring thervpon take aduyce ayd might gyuen kyng mentayne defende sayd warres also sayde come kynges knowledge howe subgettes ar sore greued reason mutacyon money therfore kyng offereth make gode money durable wolde graunt hym sufficient ayde metayne warres answered say clergy mouth archbysshop reyns noble duke athene good townes mouth stephyn martell prouost marchant parys sayde redy lyue dye kynge put bodyes goodes seruyce requyring haue deliberacyon speke togyder grau ted yere vigyll cocepcion lady kyng gaue duchy normandy charles dolphyn uienoys eldest son next day made homage delyberacyon taken thre estate answered kyng lyament cha bre mouthes sayde thre son howe wolde fynde hym one yer xxx men cost charge finace pay wag many men warre estemed l parisien thre estat ordenid leuyed euery son euery estate noble euery man viii euery pounde gabell salt shulde ron realme bycause nat certayne inposicyon abell shuld suffyce therfore ordayned thre state shulde retourne agayne parys se knowe inposicyon w lde serue first day march day thyder agayne came except certayne great townes picardy normandy noble inposicion makyng came thyder founde first graunt wolde nat suffyce reys sayde wherfore ordayned newe subse say euery person blode royall otherwyse clerke lay relygious relygions except nat except householder curate church hauyng rente reuenewes office admnystracyon woman wydowes chyldren maryed natte maryed hauyng thynge owne others kepynge none age admynistracion euery estate authorite priuylege tha vsed haue vsed tyme past c reuenues vnder befor terme lyse herytage plege meanes office pe cion duryng lyfe wyll shall pay hiss ayde subsidy euery iiii xl souces x reuenues aboue xx souces labourer workemen lyueng labour shall pay x souces seruantes prentyses lyueng seruyces takyng c yere shall likewyse pay x taking money rate parys money countre courney money currant partes seruantes haue nat yere c s shall pay nothing wourthey haue good rate shall pay also beggers monkes cloystereus without offyce admynistracyon chyldren beynge warde vnder age xv yere hauyng nothyng handes noones hauynge reuenewes aboue x shall pay nothynge also woman maryed husbandes payeth value husbandess shalbe rekened aswell haue wife owne clerkess men church prelat abbottes pr chanons curate beforesayde worthe aboue c reuenewes yere benefic church patrimony one v shall pay iiii first c euery c tyll ye come v xl s shall pay nothyng may spe e aboue v moua l value benefyces shalbe estemed rate dymes whan pay excepcion priuyledge noble men men good townes may sp de aboue c reuenewes pay tyll come v euery c xl besyde iiii first c men gode townes insemblable maner tyll come reuenues mouables noble men haue na c reuenewes mouables shalbe estemed rekenyd value farther men haue nat iiii c reuenewes good shalbe rekenyd tyll iiii yt say c mouables x reuenues rate nay noble man haue nat reuenues onely c mouables nat past noble man hath nat reuenues nat past c mouables past iiii part mouables part reuenewes must estemyd togyder noble men iiii nat aboue saturday fyft day marche yere lorde ccc lvi rose disceyon bytwene comons towne arras great men co mon slewe day mo xvii chefe sonages towne monday slewe four banisshed dyuers nat towne co mon chefe maisters towne p french kyng toke kynge nauer beheeded erle harcourt roan ca c lvi also iuesday v day aprill myddes lent frenche kyng deted day fro meneuell harnes accopanyed wt cc speares amonge therle aniowe sonne duke orleance brother lorde john de arthoyserle ewe lorde charles brother cosyn germayn kyng erle tankernyll sir arnolde dadrehen marshall fraunce dyuers nombre abouesayd kyng cae streyght castell rowan posterne came nat towne founde hall dyner sonne dolphyne charles kyng nauerr john erle harcourt lordes preaux grauyll clere dyuers ther french kyng caused kyng nauer taken therle harcourt lordes preaux clere sir loys sir wylliam harcourt bretherne erle lorde frequent fryquant lorde tournbeu lorde maubeu mamesners two squyers olyuer double johan uaubatou dyuers kynge put prison dyuerse chamber within castell bycause syth newe reco sy acion made deth lorde charles late constable fraunce kyng nauerre ymagined treated dyuers thynges damage dyshonour frenche kyng realme therle harcourt spoken iniuryous wordes agaynst kyng castell ruell assemble conclude ayde gyuen kynge lettyng power ayd grau ted frenche kyng dyned toke horse rodde telde behynde castell called felde pardon thyder two cart brought therle harcourt lorde grauylle lorde maubeu olyuer double heed stryken foure drawen ye gybette rowan hanged heedes sette gybette day next day frenche kynge delyuered prison except thre yt say charles kyng nauer caryed parys put prison castell loure chatelette certayne frenche kynges counsell apoynted kepe also fryquet uaubatou put prison therfore lorde philypp nauer helde handes dyuers castels pertayning brother kyng nauerre normandy frenche kynge sende hym delyuer castels yet refused lorde godfray harcourt assembled togyder dyuers enemy french kynges brought ye contrey constantyne countre helde kept fro frenche kyng wednysday ester theyere lorde god ccc lvi sir arnold dadrehen marshall france went towne arras ther wysely wtout besynesse men warr toke mo hundred prisoner towne suche made rebellyon ther slayne dyuers chiefe burgess towne next day made xx beheeded ye kept styll prison knowe kynges pleasure behalfe meanes towne brought trewe obeysance kyng moneth june duke lancastre came costantyne fyll company lorde philyp nauerr lorde godfray harcourt foure thousande fyghtyng rode lyseur orbec po theau refresshed castell ben besieged two monethes lorde robert hotetot maister crosbowes fraunce layne sieg dyuers noble departed fro siege whan knewe commynge duke lancastre left behynde theym hast engyns artillary castell toke duke lacastre company rode robbyng pyllyng townes contrey passed toward bretuell newely refresshed bycause knewe founde ye cyte castell eureux newely yelded ye frenche kynge longe kept siege also sawe howe cytie bret cathedrall churche robbed well naueroyse yelded vp castell composycyon frenchemen lay siege left duke lancastre lorde philyppe nauerr went uernueyll perche toke towne castell robbed towne brent great parte therof frenche kyng made redy assemble assoone herde tidynges duke lancastre wente hym great nombre men armes fotemenne folowed conde goynge streyght towne uernueyll thanne duke company went towardes towne egle kynge folowed tyll came tuebufe two leages fro towne egle tha shewed kyng howe coulde folowe farther ther suche forestes ennemyes myght take hym whan lyste soo shulde lese labour go farther kyng retourned hoost went castell thilyers whiche hades nauaroes kyng toke sette men warr therin kyng went castell bretuell wherin men kyng nauers ye kyng lay siege space two monethes ye castell gyuen vp within went wher lyst goodes lyues saued p assemble frenche kyng made fight prince wale rode berry cap c lvii whan frenche kynge made iourney reconquered townes castelles base normandy pertaynyug kyng nauerre whome helde prisonne gone backe cytie parys nat long herde howe prince wale good nombre men warre ferre entred countrey aprochyng gode otrey berry kyng sayd sware wolde ryde fyght hym wheresoeuer founde hym kyng made agayne specyall assemble noble helde hym commaundement maner excuse layde parte letter one sene euery man payne dyspleasur shulde drawe mete hym march bloyes torayne entent syght thenglysshmen kyng make hast deted fro parys rode chartres better suretie thenglyssh men dyd ted dayly men warre resorted thyder fro partes aunergne berrey burgoyne lorayne heynault uermandoyse picardy bretayne normandy euer came set forwarde made muster lodged countrey as gnement marshalles lorde johan cleremont lorde arnolde dadrehen kyng sende also great prouisyon fortress garyson antowe poyctou dumayne torayne fortress wher thought thenglyssh men shulde passe entent close passage kepe fro vitayl shulde fynde foragefor horse howe beit prince co pany nombre two men armes sir archer rode ease bitayls ynough founde co tre auuerne right plentyfull wolde nat tary ther went make warre enemyes brent exyled cotrey asmoch might whan entred towne founde well replenysshed thyng taryed ther two thre dayes refresshe whan depted wolde distroy resydue strike heedes vessel wyne bren barly otes thyng thyntent enemyes shulde haue ayde therof rode forthe euer founde good cotres pletyfull berry torayne owe poyctou mayne plentyfull contre men warr thenglysshmen rode maner tyll came good cytie burges ther made gret skirmyssh one gate capitayns within lorde consant lorde hutyn kept cyte ther many feates me done thenglysshmen deted without doyng went issoldon strong castell feersly assayled thyder ca hole hoost howbeit coud nat wy getylmen defended valiantly passed farther toke way u great towne good castell yuell closed peple ther nat sufficyent make defence therfore perforce ther founde wyne vitayls gret plenty taryed thre dayes co refresshe host thyder cae tidynges prince french kyng charter gret assemble men warr howe tor ne passag aboue ryuer loyre closed kept none coude passe ryue prince counselled returne passe torayne poycton way bourdeaux prince toke way retourned whan done towne pleasure ken castell slayne mo st part within rode towarde remoren tyne french kyng send countrey thre great barownes kepe fronters lorde craon lorde boucequant hermyte chamont thre c speres rode contrey costyng theglysshmen folowed sixe dayes togyder coude neuer fynde auantage set theglysshmen rode euerso wysely coude nat entre syde aduauntage day frenchman putte themselfe busshement nere remorentyne marueylous strayte passage whiche englysshmen must nedes passe ye day ther departed fro prince bataile leaue marshal ye lorde bartylmewe breches lorde musydent gascoyne lorde petyton courton lorde dalawarre lorde basset lorde danyell paseler lorde rycharde pontchardon lorde nowell lorynch yong lorde spencer edwarde lorde dambretycourte two hundred menne armes ronne remorentyne passed foreby frenchman busshment nat ware assone passed frenchman brake came feersly thenglysshmen well forwarde herde noyse horse commynge parceyued ennemyes tourned stode styll abode frechmen came great randon speares restes cae ronnyng thenglysshmen stode styll suffre passe nat past fyue sir ouerthrowen first metyng thenglysshmen dasshed forthe horse frenchemen feerse skyrmysshe en red long many knightes squyers beaten downe partes dyuers taken rescued agayn long season man coulde tell better long fought batayle thenglysshe marthalles aproched whan frenchman sawe theym commyng long woode syde ledde might best toke wayes remorentyne englysshmen chase natte sparyng horse harde batayle many man ouerthrowen howe beit one halfe frenchman entred castell thre lordes saued theymselfe dyuerse knyghtes squyers well horsed howe beit towne taken fyrst commynge frenchman entred castell p howe prince wale toke castell remorentyne cap c lviii prince wale herde fore ryders fightyng toke way came towne remorentyne wherin moche people dyeng howe myght get castell prince comaunded lord sir john chandos go speke theym castell sir johan went castell gate made signe speke person within kept watche ther demau ded name dyd sende hym thyder shewed sir boucyquant hermyte chamount came barryers whan sir johan sawe theym saluted curtelly sayde sir sende hyder fro lorde ye prince wyll ryght courtesse vnto ennemyes thynketh sayeth ye wyll yelde vpp fortresse hym yelde selfe prisoner wyll receyue mercy kepe good company armes lorde boucyquant sayde arnat purpose putte ourselfe case great folly syth haue nede thynke defende selfe departed prince lodged men towne without ease next day euery man armed vnder baner beganne assayle castell right feersly archer dyke shotte holly togyder none durste scant apere defence swame ouer ye dyke bordes thyng hokes pike handes myned ye walles within cast downe great stone pott lyme slayne ye englysshe partie squyer called remond derge du lache copany captall beoffes assaut dured day without rest nyght englysshmen drewe logynges past nyght mornyng whan sonne rysen marshal hoost sowned tru pettes ordayned gyue assaut redy appayrelled whiche assaut prince personally reason presence greatly encouraged englysshmen nat ferre fro hym squyer called bernarde slayne stonne prince sware wolde nat depart styll castell within pleasure assaut enforced euery part finally sawe assautes coulde nat wyn castell wherfore ordayned engins caste wylde fyre base court dyde yt base court fyre fyre multiplyed suche wyse toke couerynge great towre couered rede wha within sawe must yelde ye wyll prince orels peryshe fyre thre lordes cae downe yelded prince prince toke hym prisoner castell left voyde p great hoost frenche kyng brought batayle poycters cap c lix takyng castell remorentyne therin prince company rode dyde distroyeng countre aprochyng antowe tourayne frenche kyng charterz departed came bloyes ther taryed two dayes amboyse ne day loch herde howe prince towrayne retournyng poyctou euer englysshmen costed certayne expert knyght fra ce alway made report ye kyng englysshmen dyd kynge came hay towrayne men passed ryuer loyre bridge orleance mchun saulmure bloyes towrs wher might nombre xx thousande men armes besyde ther xxvi duke erles mo sixscore baners foure sonnes kyng yonge duke charles normandy lorde loyes ye fro then forthe duke aniewe lorde johan duke berry lorde philyppe duke burgoyne season pope innocet sixt send lorde bertrand cardynall pyergourt lorde nycholas cardynall egle france treat peace bytwene frenche kyng enemyes first bytwene hym kyng nauerr prison cardynalles often tymes spake kyng delyuerance duryng sege bretuell coude nothyng behalfe cardynall pyergourt went tour ther herde howe frenche kynge hasted sore fynde englysshmen th rodde poycters herde howe bothe hoostes drewe thyderward frenche kyng herde howe prince hasted greatly retourne kyng feared shulde scape hym deted fro hay tourayn company rode chauuygny wher taryed thursday towne without along ryuer creuse next day kyng passed ryuer bridge ther weuyng englysshemen ben hym nat howe beit pursued passed ye bridge day mo th hrescore thousand horse dyuers passed chasteleraunt euer passed tooke way poieters othersyde prince wyst nat truely frenchman supposed nat farre coude nat fynde forage wherby gret faut hoost vitayle repeted distroyed somoch done whan berry aniowe torayne made better prouision friday thre great lordes france lorde craon lorde raoull coucy therle joigny taryed day towne chamygny part companyes saturday passed bridge folowed kyng thre leages tooke waye amonge busshes without wode syde go poicters saturdaye prince copany dysloged fro lytell vyllage therby sent hym certayne currours se myght fynde adueture frechmen nombre threscore men armes well horsed lorde eustace dambreticourt lorde john guystelles aduenture englysshmen frenchemen mette togyder forsayde wode syde frenchman knewe anone howe ennemyes hast dyd helmyttes displayed baners came great pase towardes theglysshmen nombre two hundred men armes whan englysshmen sawe great nombre determined slye let frenchman chase knewe well prince hoost nat farre behynde tourned hor e toke corner wood frechmen theym cryenge cryes made great noyse chased came ye prince batayle ware therof themselfe prince taryed ther haue worde agayne send forthe lorde raoll coucy baner went farre forward vnder prince baner ther batayle knyght fought valiantly howe beit takenne erle wyng vycout bruce lorde cha takene slayne fewe scaped prisoner prince knewe howe frenche kynge folowed hym suche wyse coude nat eschue batayle assembled togyder men commaunded man shulde go marshal baners thus prince rode saturday fro mornyng tyll agaynst night came within two lytell leages poicters captall de buz sir aymenon punyers lorde bartylmewe brunes lorde eustace dambretycourt prince sende forthe seyf myght knowe frenchman dyd knyghtes deted two hudred men armes well horsed rodde farre sawe great batayle kynges sawe feldes couered men armes englysshmen coud nat forbers sette tayle frenche hoost cast downe many yerth toke dyuers prisoner hoost beganne styrre idynges therof came frenche kyng entryng cytie poycters retourned agayne made ost saturday late lodged felde theglissh currours retourned agayne prince shewed hym
