sawe knewe said howe frenche hoost great nombre people well sayde prince name god lette v study howe shall fyght aduauntage night englysshmen lodged strong place among hedge vynes busshes hoost well watched frenche hoost p order frenchemen batayle poycters cap c lx sonday mornynge frenche kynge hadde great desyre fight englysshmen herd masse pauilyon houseled foure sone hym masse ther came hym duke orleaunce duke burbon therle pontheu lorde jaques burbone duke athene constable france erle tankernyll erle salebruce erle damartyne erle uantador dyuers great barownes france neyghbours holdynge fraunce lorde cleremont lorde arnolde dandrehen marshall france lorde saynt uenont lorde john landas lorde eustace ribamont lorde fyennes lorde geffray chargny lord chatellon lorde suly lorde neell sir robert dura dyuers kyng went counsell finally hit ordayned maner men shulde drawe felde euery lorde display baner set forth name god saynt denice trumpet blewe vp hoost euery man mounted horsebacke wet felde wher sawe kynges baner waue wynde myght sene great noble fayre harnesse riche armory baners penos floure france ther none durst abyde home without wolde shamed euer ordayned aduyce constable marshal made thre batayls ech warde xvi men armes mustred past men armes first batayle duke orleaunce gouern xxxvi baners twyse many penons seconde duke normandy two bretherne lorde loys lorde john thirde kyng hymselfe whyle batayls settyng aray kyng called hym lorde eustace rybamont lorde john landas lorde richarde beawyeu sayd sir ryde se dealyng thenglysshmen aduyse well nombre meanes may fight theym fote horsebacke thre knyghtes rode forth kynge wyght courser sayde high men sir among whan ye parys chartres roan orleaunce ye thret thenglysshmen desyre armes agaynst theym nowe ye become therto shall nowe shewe nowe shewe forthe yuell wyll ye bere reueng dyspleasurs damage haue done without dout shall fyght suche herde sayd sir god desname wolde se gladly ther thre knightes retourned agayne kyng demaunded tidynges sir eustace rybamont answered sayde sir haue sene englysshmen estymacion two thousande men armes four thousand archer fyftene hudred howebeit stronge place farre imagyne ar one batayle howbeit wysely ordred longe way haue fortifyed strongly hedge busshes one part archer long hedge none go ryde way must past way must ye go ye purpose fyght hedge one entre one yssue likelyhode four horseman may ryde front thende hedge go ryde men armes fote archer afore maner herse woll nat lightely disconfyted well sayd kyng woll ye counsayle v sir eustace sayde sir lette v lote except thre hundred men armes well horsed best hoost moost hardyest entent somwhat breke opyn archer thane batayls folowe quickely fote fight men armes hand hande best aduyce canne gyue thynke waye better let hym speke kyng sayd thus shall done two marshalles rode fro batayle batayle chose thre c knyghtes squyers moost expert men armes hoost euery man well armed horsed also ordayned bataylles alwayns shulde abyde styll horsebacke confort marshalles nede wherof erle salesbruce erle neydo erle nosco capitayns kynge johan france armed xx apayrell dyd put gyding eldest sonne lorde saynt uenant lorde landas lorde thybault bodenay lorde reynolde quenoll called archepreest armed armoure yongerle alanson p howe cardynall dyergourt treated make agremet bytwene frenche kyng prince batell poycters cap c lxi whan frenche kyng batayls ordred euery lorde vnder banner among owne men comaunded euery man shulde cutte speres fyue fote long euery man put spurres thus redy aproche cardinall piergort came great hast king came mornynge poycters kneled downe kyng helde vp handes desyred hym goddessake lytell absteyne settynge forwarde tyll spoken hym sayde sir ye haue floure realme agaynst handfull englysshmen regarde company sir ye may haue acorded without batayle shalbe profitable honourable haue theym maner rather adueture noble chiualry ye haue present sir requyre name god humylyte may ryde prince shewe hym danger ye haue hym kynge sayd pleaseth well retourne agayne shortely cardynall deted dilygently rode prince among men fote cardynall lyghted came prince receyued hym curtessy cardynall salutacyon made sayde certaynly fayre son counsayle aduyse iustely puyssaunce frenche kynge ye woll suffre treat make peace bytwene may prince yong lusty sayd sir honour people saued wolde gladly fall reasonable way cardynall sayd sir ye say well shall acorde shulde great pytie yf many noble men bothe party shulde come togyder batayle cardynall rode agayne kyng sayd sir ye nede nat make great haste fyght ennemyes canne nat slye fro though wolde suche groud wherfore sir requyre forbere day tyll morowe son rysinge kynge lothe agree therto forsome counsayle wolde nat cosent finally cardynall wed reason kyng acorded respyt place pyght vp yon reed sylke fresshe rych gaue leaue day euery man drawe lodgynges except constable marshalle batayls sonday day car yled ridynge fro one hoost gladly agree frenche kynge wolde nat agree without myght haue foure princy llest englysshmen pleasure prince yelde themselfe simply howe beit ther many great offer made prince offred rendre kynges handes euer wonne voyage townes castels quyte prisoner men taken season also swere nat armed agaynst frenche kyng seuyn yere kyng counsayle wold none therof vttermast wold prince c knyghtes shulde yelde theym selfe kynges prison otherwyse wolde nat whiche prince wolde wyse agre vnto meane season cardynall rode thus bytwene hoostes trust good certayne knight fra ce englande bothe rode forthe sonday bycause truse day cost hoostes beholde dealyng enemyes fortuned lorde john ca do rode day coostyng french host like maner lorde cleremont one trenche marshalles ryden auiewed state englysshe hoost two knyghtes retourned towardes hoostes mette togyder eche theym bare ou maner deuyee blewe lady enbraudred beame aboue apayrell lorde cleremont sayd chandos howe long haue ye taken bere deuyce nay ye bere sayd chandos aswell myne pours deny sayd cleremont nat truse day bytwene v shulde make good incontynent ye haue right bere deuyce sir sayd ca do ye shall fynde morowe redy defend proue feate armes well myne cleremont sayd ca do well word englysshmen forye deuyce nothyng newe yese good fayre departed doyng eche returned hoost cardynall pyergort coude wyse sonday make agrement bytwene party whan nere nyght returned poicters night frenchman toke ease prouision ynough englysshmen great defaut coude get forage coude nat depart without danger ennemyes sonday thenglysshmen made great dyke hedge archer stronger monday mornynge prince company redy apayrelled sonne rysing lyke maner frenchman morning tymes cardynall came agayne frenche hoost thought preachyng pacify party frenchman sayd hym retourne whyderye woll bringe hyder mo wordes treaty peace ye loue yor selfe depart shortely whan cardynall sawe traueyled vayne toke leaue kyng went prince sayd sir ye canne remedy byde batayle fynde none acorde frenche kyng prince sayd ye entent people god helpe right cardynall retourned poycters company certayne knyghtes squyers men armes fauourable frenche kyng prince whan sawe ye party shulde fight stale fro maisters went fre che hoost made captayne catelayne impastre tha ther cardynall knewe nothynge therof tyll come poycters certentie order englysshmen shewed fre che kyng except ordayned threhudred men horsebacke many archer horsebacke coost vnder couert mountayne strike batayle duke normandy vnder mountayne fote ordynaunce made newe frechmen knewe nat prince batayle downe amonge vynes closed wekyst parte caryages wyll name princypall lordes knyghtes ther prince erle warwyke therle suffolke erle salisbury therle stafford lorde john chandos lorde richarde stafford lorde reynold cobham lorde spencer lorde james audeley ye lorde peter brother lorde bercley lorde basser lord waren lorde dalawar lorde maulyne lorde wylly lorde bartylme brunes lord felton lorde rychard pe bruge lorde stephyne constracyon lorde brasfeton englysshmen gascon ther ye lorde prune lorde buger captall buz lorde johan chamont lorde delaspare lorde rosen lorde conseu lorde montferat lorde landuras lorde soulech lestrade nat name heynowers lorde eustace dabretycourt lorde john guystels two stra gers lorde dauyell phasell lorde denyce moerbertre prince company past nat viii men one ye frenchman lx fightyng men wherof ther mo thre thousande knightes p batell poycters bytwene prince wale fre che kyng cap c lxii whane prince shuld haue batell cardynall gone without peace trewse makynge sawe frenche kyng dyd sette lytell store said men sir though small company regarde puyssance ennemyes let v nat basshed therfore ye vyctorie lyeth nat multitude people wher god wyll sende yf fortune iourney shalbe moost honoured people worlde dye right quarell haue kyng father bretherne also ye haue good frendes kynsmen shall reuenge v therfore sir goddessake requyre deuoyers thin day god pleased saynt george day ye shall se good knyght wordes suche prince spake conforted people lorde sir john chandos day neuer went fro ye prince also lorde james audeley great season whane sawe shulde nedes fight sayd prince ser haue serued alwayes truely lorde father also shall long lyue say bicause made one vowe first batayle kynge father chyldren shulde howe wolde one first setter el dye payne therfore requyre yor grace rewarde seruyce euer dyde king yor father woll gyue sycence depart fro sette selfe may acomplysshe vowe prince acorded desyre sayde sir james god gyue day grace best knyght toke hym hande knyght departed fro prince went formast front batayles onely acompanyed foure squyers promysed nat fayle hym lorde james right sage valyat knight hym moche hoost ordayned gouerned day thus sir james front batayle redy fight batayle marshalles fraunce lykewyse lorde eustace dambreticourt dyd payne one formast sette whan sir james audeley began tte forwarde ennemyes fortuned sir eustace dambretycourt ye shall ye haue herde howe almayns french host apoynted styll horsebacke sir eustace beyng horsebacke layed spear rest ran frenche batayle knyght almaygne called lorde loyes coucoabras bare shelde syluer fyue ross goules sir eustace bare ermyns two hamedes goules whan almaygne sawe lorde eustace come fro company rode agaynst hym mette rudely bothe knightes fell yerth almayne hurt shulder therfore rose nat quickely dyde sir eustace wha vp taken breth came knyght lay grounde thane fyue knyghtes almayne came hym one bare hym yerth perforce taken prisoner brought erle nosco toke hede hym nat say whyther sware prisoner tyed hym chare lette hym stande batayle began partes ye batayls marshal fraunce aproched set forthe apoynted breke ye ray archer entred horsebacke way great hedge bothe sydes sette full archer assone men armes entred archer began shote bothe sydes dyd slee hurt horse knyghtes horse whan felt ye sharpe arowes wolde wyse go forward brewe backe stang toke feersly many fell maisters p ace coude nat ryse agayne moche marshal batayle coude neuer come prince certayne knyghtes squyers well horsed passed tharchers thought ye prince coude nat lorde james judeley four squyers front batell dyd maruels marmes great prowes cae fought sir arnolde dandrehen vnder owne baner ther fought longe togyder sir arnolde sore handled batayle marshal began dysorder reason shot archer wt ayde men armes came among slewe dyd lyst ther lorde arnold dadrchen taken prisoner men sir james audeley four squters day neuer toke prisoner alwayes fought went enemyes also french partie lorde johan cleremot fought vnder owne baner long coude endure ther beten owne coude nat relyued ransomed slayne wtout mercy sayde bicause wordes day sit john chandos within short space marshal batayls disconfyted fell vpon another coude nat go forth frenchman behynde coude nat get forwarde reculed backe came batayle duke normandy great thicke fote anon began opyn behynde whan knewe marshal batayle dysconfited toke horse deted might best also sawe rowt englysshmen comynge downe lytell mountayne horsebacke many archer brake syde duke batayle trewe say archer dyd company day great aduauntage shotte thicke frenchman wyst nat syde take hede lytell lytell englysshmen wanne grounde theym whan men armes englande sawe marshal batayle dysconfited duke batayle begane dysorder opyn lept horse whiche redy assembled gyder cryed saynt george gyen lorde chandos sayd prince sir take horse ryde forth iourney yors god day handes gette v french kynges batayle ther lyeth sore mater thynke verily valyantnesse woll nat flye trust shall haue hym grace god saynt george well fought withall sir herde say day shulde se good knyght prince sayde lette v go forthe ye shall nat se day retourne backe sayd auauce baner name god saynt george knyght bare dyde commaundement sore batayle perylous many man ouerthrowen one downe coud nat relyued agayne wtout great socoure ayde prince rode entred amonge ennemyes sawe ryght hande lylell busshe lyeng deed lorde robert dura baner hym ten twelfe men hym prince sayd two squyers thre archer sir take body knyght targe bere hym poycters present fro cardynall pyergourt say howe salute hym ye token done prince enformed cardynalles men felde agaynst hym nat pertayning right order armes men churche cometh goeth treaty peace ought nat reason ber harnes fyght neyther party ought indyfferent bycause men done price dyspleased cardynall therfore sende vnto hym nephue lorde robert dura deed cathelayn ampostre takenne printe wolde haue heed stryken bycause pertaynynge cardynall lorde candos sayd sir susfre season entende gretter mater paraduenture cardynall wyll make suche excuse ye shalbe content prince company dressed batayle duke athene costable france many manne slayne cast yerth frenchman fought companyes cryed mountioy saynt denyce ye englysshmen saynt george gyen anoue price company met batayle almaygnes wherof erle salesbruce erle nosco therle neydo capitayns short space put lyght archer shotte holly togyder none durst come danger slewe many man coulde nat come raunsome thre erles ther slayne dyuers knyghtes squyers copany ther lorde dambretycourt rescued owne men sette horsebacke dyde day many feates armes toke gode prisoner whan duke yle sawe prince aproche thought selfe duke kynges chrldren erle poycters erle tourayne ryght yong leued gouernors departed fro felde mo eyght hundred speares stake stroke day howe beit lorde guysshard dangle lorde john sayntre erle poicters wolde nat slye entred thyckest prease batayle kynges thre sonnes toke way chamigny lorde john landas lorde thy bault woodney sette wayt duke normady whan brought duke long leage fro batayle tooke leaue duke desyred lorde saynt uenant shulde nat leaue duke bring hym sauegarde wherby shulde wyn thanke kynge abyde styll felde met also duke orleaunce great copany hym also departed fro felde clere handes ther many good knyghtes squyers though maisters departed fro felde yet hadde rather dyed haue reproche kyng batayle ca englysshmen sore fyght many great stroke gyuen receyued kyng yongest sonne mette batayle thenglysshe marshalles therle warwyke therle suffolke theym gascons captall buz lorde pomyers lorde amery charre lorde mucydent lorde laguran lorde de la strade frenche partie came tyme ynough lorde johan landas lorde woodney lyghted fote wente kynges batayle lytell besyde fought duke athene costable fra ce lytell aboue hym duke burbone many good knyghtes burbonoyse picardy hym lytell one syde ther poyteuyns lorde de lorde partney lorde lorde montahoton lorde suggeres lorde johan sayntre lorde guysshar de dangle lorde argenton lorde lymyers lorde mountandre dyuerse also uycount rocheuatt erle daunoy burgone lorde james beauye lorde de la castell uilayn another parte erle uantadowre mounpenser lorde james burbone lorde johan darthoyes also lorde james brother lorde arnolde cernolle called archepreest armed yonge erle alansonne auuergne lorde mar ell lorde de la towre lorde chalenton lorde montague lorde rochfort lorde de la chayre lorde dachone lymosyn lorde delmall lorde norwell lorde pers buff er pycardie lorde wyllyam nerle lorde arnolde renewall lorde geffray saynt dygier lorde chamy lorde heley lorde mounsaunt lorde hangyes dyuers also kynges batayle ther therle duglas scotlad fought season right valyantly whan sawe dysconfyture departed saued hymselfe wyse wolde takenne englysshmen rather ben slayne englysshe parte lorde james awdeley ayde foure squyers fought alwayes chyefe batayle soore hurte body vysage longe breth serued hym fought laste ende batayle foure squyers tooke brought hym oute felde layed hym vnder hedge syde refresshe hym vnarmed hym bounde vp woundes aswell coulde frenche partie kynge johan day full right good knyght fourth part menne hadde done deuoyers aswell dydde iourney hadde bene lykelyhode howe slayne takenne excepte fewe saued themselfe kynge slayne duke peter burbon lorde guyssharde beauieu lorde ladas duke athene constable fraunce bysshoppe chalons champayne lorde wyllm neell lorde gustace rybamont lorde de la towre lorde wyllyam montagu sir guyuenton chabley ser ba de la house many fought companyes ther taken prisoner lorde wodney lorde pompador archpreest sore hurte erle uandos erle mon erle genuyll erle uandone sir loyes melwall lorde pyers buffyer lorde senerachet ther brunt slayne taken mo two hundred knyghtes p two frenchman fledde fro batayle poicters two englysshmen folowed cap c lxiii among batayls recounterynges chase pursuetes made day felde fortuned sir edwarde roucy whan departed fro felde bycause sawe feld lost without recouery thought nat abyde danger englysshmen wherfore fledd alone gone felde leage englysshe knyght pursued hym euer cryed hym sayde retourne agayne sir knyght shae flye away thus knight tourned thenglysshe knight thought haue striken hym speare targe fayled sir edwarde swarued syde fro stroke fayled nat englysshe knyght strake hym suche stroke helme swerde astonyed fell fro horse yerth lay styll sir edward lighted came coude ryse sayd yeld rescue reseue el shall slee englysshman yelded went hym afterwarde rau somed also fortuned squyer picardy called johan de helenes fledde fro batayle mette page delyuerd hym newe fresshe horse wheron rode away alone season felde lorde bercle englande yong lusty knyght day reryd baner aloue pursued sayd johan helenes whane folowed space leage sayde john tourned agayne layed swerde rest stede aspeare came ronyng warde lorde bercle lyft v swerde haue stryken squyer whan stroke come tourned fro englysshman lost stroke johan strake hym past arme lorde berclees swerde fell felde whan sawe swerde downe lyghted daynly horse came place wher swerd lay stouped downe take vp swerd frenche squyer dyd pycke swerde hym happe strake hym thy e knyght fell yerth coude nat helpe hymselfe johan lyghted horse toke knyghtes swerde lay grounde came hym demaunded wolde yelde hym nat knyght demaunded name sir sayde hyght johan helenes name certenly sayde knyght name thomas lorde bercle fayre castell ryuer seuern march wale well sir squyer ye shall prisonere shall bring sauegarde shall se shall healed hurt well sayde knyght content prisoner ye haue lawe armes wonne ther swar prisoner rescue rescue squyer drewe forthe swerde knightes thyes wounde opyn thafie wrapped bounde wounde set hym horse brought hym fayre easely chaterlerant taryed fyftene dayes sake dyde gette hym remedy hurt wha somwhat amended gate hym lytter brought hym ease house picardy yere tyll perfetly hole whan departed payed raunsome sire thousande nobuls squyer made knyght reason profette lorde bercley p howe kyng john taken prisoner batayle poycters cap c lxiiii often tymes aduentures amour ear fortunate uelous man canne thynke wysshe truly batayle nere poycters feldes beaumont malpertnes right great peryllous many dedes armes done came nat knowlege fyghters bothe party endured moche payne kyng john owne handes hyd day maruels armes axe hades wherwith defended hymselfe fought brekynge prease nere kynge ther taken erle tankernyll sir jaques burbon erle ponthieu lorde johan arthoyes erle ewe lytell aboue vnder baner captall bu taken sir charles arthoys dyuers knyghtes squyers chase endured gate poiters ther many slayne beaten downe horse man poyters closed gate wolde sussre noue entre wherfore stretebefore gate horrible murdre men hurt beaten downe frenchemen yelded themselfe farre might know englysshma ther byuers glysshe archer iiii v vi prisoner lorde pous gret baron poiton ther slayne many knyghtes squyers ther taken therle rochuart lorde danauemet lorde pertney xaynton lorde montendre lorde john sayntre sore hurt neuer helth repured one best knight france ther left deed among deed men lorde rychard dangle fought yt day kyng right valyat ly dyd lorde charny great prease bycause bare souerayne baner kyng owne bauer also felde goules thre scochyns syluer many englysshmen gascons came part perforce opyned kynges batell frenchman mengled amonge ennemyes somtyme fyue men vpon one getylman ther taken lord popadour lorde bartylmewe de brunes ther slayne sir gestray charny kynges baner handes also lorde reynold cobhm slewe therle damartyn ther great prease take kynge knewe hym cryed ser yelde el ye ar deed ther knyght saynt omers retayned wage kyng england called ser denyce morbecke serued englysshmen v yere bycause youth forfayted realme france murdre yt dyd saynt omers happenyd well hym next kynge whan take hym stepte forthe prease strength body armes came frenche kyng sayd gode frenche sir yelde kyng helde knyght sayde shall yelde cosyn prince wale yf myght se hym wolde speke hym denyce auswered sayd sir nat yelde shall bringe hym kynge sir denyce morbecke knyght arthops serue kyng englande bycause banysshed realme fraunce haue forfaytedde kynge gaue hym ryght gauntlet sayeng yelde great prease kynge foreuery man entorsed hym say haue taken kyng coude nat go forward yonge sonne lorde philyppe hym bycause prease price wale coragious cruell lyon toke day great pleasure fight chase ennemyes lorde john chandos hym day neuer left hym neuer toke hede takynge prisoner ende batayle sayde prince sir good rested sette baner high busshe people may drawe hyder sore spredde brode canse mo baners penons frenche partie wherfore sir rest refresshe ye sore chafed prince baner sette vpp hygh ou busshe trumpettes clarion began sowne prince dyd basenet knyghtes body chambre redy aboute hym reed pauilyou pyght vpp drinke brought forthe prince suche lordes aboute hym styll encreased came fro chase ther taryed prisoner theym whan two marshalles come prince demaunded knewe tidynges frenche kyng answered sayde sir none certenty thike verily deed taken nat gone batels prince sayd therle warwyke sir reynolde cobham sir requyre god forthe se ye knowe retourne ye may shewe trauth two lordes toke horse departed fro prince rode vp lytell hyll loke parceyued flocke men armes comynge togyder right werely frenche kyng fote great parell englysshmen gascoyns maisters taken hym fro ser denyce morbecke fore suche moost force sayd haue taken hym nay another haue taken hym straue shulde haue french kyng eschue peryll sayd sir stryue nat lede courtesly sonne cosyn prince stryue nat takynge great lorde make riche kyng wordes somwhat peased howe beit euer went made ryot brauled takyng kyng whan two foresayd lordes sawe herde noyse stryfe amog came sayd sir mater ye stryue sir sayd one frenche kyng taken prisoner mo x knyghtes squyers chalengeth takynge hym sonne thane two lordes entred prease caused euery man drawe backe commaunded prince name peyne heedes make noise aproche kyng nerer without comaunded thane euery man gaue rowme lordes lyghted dyd reuerete kyng brought hym son peace rest prince wale p gyft prince gaue lorde audeley batell poycters ca c lxv assone therle war wyke lorde cogham departed fro prince ye haue herde prince demaunded knyghtes aboute hym lorde audeley yf knewe thyng hym knyghtes ther answere sayd sir sore hurt lyeth lytter besyde faith sayde prince hurtes rightsorie go knowe yf may brought hyder el woll go se hym thane two knyghtes came lorde awdeley sayde sir prince desyreth greatly se outher ye must go hym el woll come sir sayde knyght thanke prince whan thynketh poore knyght called eyght seruantes caused theym bere hym lytter place prince prince tooke hym armes kyst hym made hym great chere sayd sir james ought gretly honour valyaunce ye haue day achyued ye grace renome v ye ar reputed moost valyant sir sayde knyght ye say pleaseth yeu wolde haue day thynge auaunced selfe serue acomplysshe vowe made ought nat reputed prowes sir james sayde prince take iourney best doar armes thyntent furnysshe better pursue warres retayne euer knight fyue hundred markes yerely reuenewes shall assigne myne herytage englande sir sayde knynght god graunt deserue great goodnesse ye shewe toke leaue prince right feble seruauntes brought hym lodging assone gone erle warwyke lorde combham retourned ye prince presented hym frenche kyng prince made lowly reuerence kynge caused wyne spyces brought forthe hymselfe serued kynge signe great loue p howe englysshmen wan gretly batayle poycters cap c lxvi thus batayle dysconfyted ye haue herd feld malpertnesse two leages fro poyters xxii day septebre yere lorde ccc lvii began mornyng endyd noon englysshmen wer nat retourned fro chase therfore prince banner stode busshe drawe men togyder night came fro chase reported slayne floure fraunce taken kyng lorde philyppe sonne seuyntene erles besyde baroner knyghtes squyers slayne fyue sixe thousande one whan euery man come fro chase twyse many prisoner nombre counsayled among bycause great charge dout kepe many shulde put many raunsome inco tynent felde dyd prisoner founde englysshemen gascoyns right courtesse ther many day putte raunsome lette go onely promyse faythe trauth retourne agayne bytwene christmas burbeux raunsomes nyght lay felde besyde batayle vnarmed theym nat vnarmed prisoner euery man made good prisoner yt day soeuer toke prisoner clere myght quyte raunsome hym pleasure suche prince made ryche honour goodes well ransomyng prisoner wynnynge golde syluer plate tewelles founde man dyd set thyng riche harnesse wherof great plentie fre chmen came thyder richely besene wenynge haue iourney p howe lorde james audley gaue foure squyers v c markes reuenewes prince gyuen hym cap c lxvii whan sir james awdeley brought logynge send sir peter audeley brother lorde bartylmewe brunes lorde stephane gousenton lorde wylly lorde ralfe ferres lynage called foure squiers serued hym day well trewly sayd sayd lordes sir hath pleased lorde prince gyue fyue hundred markes reuenewes yere herytage whiche gyft haue done hym small seruyce body sir beholde foure squyers hath alwayes serued truely specially day honour haue valyantnesse wherfore woll rewarde gyue resigne handes gyft lorde ye prince hath gyuen fyue hudred markes yerly reuenewes heyres foreuer lyke maner gyuen clerely disheryte therof inheryte without rebell condycion lordes ther euery man beheld sayde among selfe commeth great noblenes gyue gyft answered hym one voyce sir godde wyll shall bere wytnesse behalfe wher soeuer become thane departed fro hym went prince nyght wolde make supper frenche kynge prisoner ynough withall frenchemen brought englysshmen wanted vitayle thre dayes hadde bredde p howe prince made supper french kyng day batayle cap c lxviii day batayle night prince made supper lodgynge frenche kyng ye moost parte great lordes prisoner prince made kynge son lorde james burbone lorde john darthoys erle tankernyll therle stampes therle dampmartyne erle grauyll lorde pertenay syt one borde lordes knyghtes squiers table alwayes prince serued king humbly coude wolde nat syt kyng borde desyre kynge coulde make sayd nat suffycient syt table great prince kyng sayd kyng sir goddessake make non yuell heuy though god day dyde nat consent folowe wyll sir surely kynge father shall bere asmoche honour amyte may shall acorde reasonably ye shall euer frendes guyder sir thynke ye ought reioyse though iourney nat ye wolde haue day ye haue wonne hygh renome prowes haue past day valyantnesse partie sir say natte mocke partte ye sawe euery mannes dedes ar playnly acorded true se gyue price chapelette therwith frenchemen began murmure sayde among theselfe howe prince nobly estimacion shulde proue noble man god sende hym lyfe perceyuer suche good fortune phowe prince retourned burdeux batayle poycters cap c lxix whan supper done euery man wente lodgyng prisoner ye nyght putte many raunsome belyued faythes trauthes raunsomed easely sayd ther wolde sette knyghtes raunsome hygh myght pay ease maynteyne styll degree nerte day whan herde masse taken repast euery thyng trussed redy toke horse rode wardes poycters nyght ther come poycters lorde roy hudred speres nat batayle mette duke normady nere chauuigny duke sende hym poycters kepe towne tyll herde tidynges whan lorde roy knewe thenglysshmen nere commynge cytie caused euery man armed euery man go defence walles towres gate theglysshmen passe without aprochynge laded golde syluer prisoner retournynge assauted fortres thought gret dede might bringe frenche kynge prisoner ryches sauegard burdeaux rode small iourneys bycause prisoner great caryag rode day four fyue leages loged euer betymes rode close togyder good aray sauyng marshalles batayls rode euer fyne c men armes opyn passage ye prince shulde passe founde encounterers countre frayed euery man drue fortress prince rode shewed hym howe lorde audeley gyuen four squyers gyft fyue hundred markes hadde gyuen vnto hym prince send hym brought lytter prince receyued hym curtesly sayde sir james haue knoledge reuenewes gaue assone ye came lodgyng gaue foure squyers wolde knowe ye dyd whyder ye gyft agreable nat sir sayd knyght trauth haue gyuen shall dyde foure squyers present haue alonge season serued well truely many great besynesses sir last batayle serued suche wyse neuer done nothynge el bounde rewarde theym day neuer nothing rewarde sir man alone ayde confort toke acomplysshe vowe long fore made ben deed batayle nat ben wherfore sir whan consydred loue bare vnto nat ben curtesse wolde nat rewarded thanke god haue shall haue ynough long lyue wyll neuer basshed lacke good sir haue done without yor pleasure requyre pardon sir squyers shall serue well euer dyd prince sayd sir james nything ye haue done nat blame gode thanke therfore valyantnes squyers ye preyse moche acorde gyft woll render agayne vi c markes lyke maner ye thus prince hsi company dyd somoche past poyctou xaynton without damage came blay passed ryuer geron aryued good cytie burdeux canne nat recorded gret feest cherr cytie clergy made prince howe honourably ther receyued prince brought french kyng abbey saynt andrewes lodged bothe kyng one part princeliu ye prince bought lordes knygh te squyers gascone moost parte erles realme fraunce suche wer prisoner payed redy money ther dyuers questyons chalenges made twene knyghtes squyers gascoyne takyng frenche kyng howe beit denyce morbecke ryght armes true token shewed chalenged hym prisoner another squper gascon called bernarde troutes sayde howe ryght hym moche many wordes prince lord cause two chalenged eche fight quarell prince caused mater rest tyll came englande declaracyon shulde made afore kynge englande father bycause frenche kyng hymselfe ayded sustayne chaleg denyce morbecke enclyned hym prince therfore priuely caused delyuerd sayd ser denyce ii nobuls mayntene withall estate anone prince came burdeux ye cardynall piergort came thyder send fro pope legacyon sayd thane xv dayes prince wolde speke hym bycause chatclayne campost men agaynst hym batayle poicters prince belyued cardynall send thyder cardynall dyd somoch meanes lorde chamont lorde monferant captall buz cosyus shewed good reason prince co tent speke whan prince excused hymselfe sagely prince counsayle helde excused fell agayne prince loue redemed men resonable raunsoms ye cathelayne sette ransome x frankes payed cardynall began treat delyuerance frenche kyng passe brefely bycause nothyng done thus prince gascons englysshmen taryed styllat burdeux yll lent great myrth reuell spende folysshely golde syluer englande also great ioye whane harde tidynges batayle poycters dysconfityng frechmen takyng kyng great solemnytes made church great fyers wake throughout englande knyghtes squyers suche come home fro iourney moche made praysed p howe thre estate france assembled togyder parys batayle poycters cap c lxx seson batayle poicters duke lancastre ye coutie eureux march costantyne hym lorde philyp nauer lorde god sray harcort made warr normandy done season tytell kyng nauer french kyng helde prison lordes dyd might haue ben iourney poyters ye prince coude nat passage ryuer loyre well kept myght nat passe whan herd howe prince taken french kyng batayle po ters gladde brake vp iourney bycause duke lancastre sir phylyppe nauer wolde go englande dyd sende sir godfray harcort saynt sauyoursle vycont kepe ther fronter warre nowe let v speke frenche kynges thresonnes charles loys john returned fro besynes poyters right yong age counsell small recouery ther none wolde take hym gouernace realme france also lordes knyghtes squyers fledde fro batayle hated blamed comons ye realme scant durst abyde good towne th prelate holy church beyng france bysshoppes abbottes noble lord knyght uost marchates ye burgess paris cousels gode townes assembled parys wolde ordayne howe realme shulde gouerned tyll kynge delyuered prison also wold knowe fardet become great treasure ben leuyed realme deames maltotes subsidyes forgyng money extorcyons wherby people hath ben ouerlayd troubled soudyours yuell payed realme yuell kept defendedde none coulde gyue accompt agreed prelate shuld chose twelfe persones amonge theym shulde haue power theym clergy ordayne aduyse thynges couenable done lordes knyghtes chuse twelfe among sagest dyscrete persones determyne cause burgess chose twelfe common whiche sire thyrtie person shulde often tymes mete parys common ordayne cause realme euery matter brought theym thre estate prelate lordes comons shulde obey persones chosen begynninge dyuerse clectyon duke normady nat content withall counsayle p firste thre estate defended euermore forgynge money also requyred duke normandy wolde rest chaunceler kynge father lorde robert lorreys lorde robert bucy dyuers maisters cou te counsaylours kynges entent might make trewe acount taken leuyed realme counsaylles whan maisters counsaylours herde mater departed realme countreis abyde tyll herde tidynges p howe thre estate sende men warre agaynst lorde godfray harecourt cap c lxxi thre estat ordayned stablysshed name receyuers male tote deames subsidyes rightes pertayning kyng realme made newe money forged fyne golde called mouton also wolde gladly kynge nauer ben delyuerd prison castell creuecure cambresis thought dyuers thre estate realme fraunce shulde stronger better defeded wolde true realme sawe well thane fewe noble maynteyne realme nyghe takene slayne batayle poycters thane requyred duke normandy delyuer hym prisonne sayd howe thought great wronge kepte prisone wyst nat duke answered sayde howe durst nat take hym delyueraunce kyng father putte hym prisone coude nat tell cause season came tidynges duke thre estate lorde godfray harecout made fore warr normandy ouer ranne countre two thre tymes weke somtyme subbarbes cane saynt lowe eureux constance duke thre estate ordayned company men armes thre hundred speares fyue hundredde made four capitayns lorde rauenall lorde kenny lorde ryuell lorde friamyll men warre departed fro parys went rowan assembled partes dyuers knyghtes arthoys uermandoys lorde kenckey lorde loyes hanefkell lorde edward rousy lorde john fenes lorde ingram hedyn dyuers also normandy ther many expert men armes lordes rode costances made garyson p batayle constance bytwene lorde godfray harcourt lorde loyes rauenall cap c lxxii whan lord godfray harcot right harby knyght couragious knewe frenche men come cyte constaces assembled togyder many men coude gette archer sayd howe wolde ryde loke frenchman departed saynt sauyour le seuyn hudred men day frenchman forth curr brought worde agayne sene naueroyse also sir godfray sende also well viewed frenchman sawe baners penons nombre sir godfray sayd syth ou woll fight theym sette archer sette company good order whan sir loys rauenalt th demeanour caused company lyght fote aues targes agaynst archer commaunded none shulde go forwarde without commaunded archer began aproch feersly frechmen well armed pauysshed suffred shotte dyd theym great hurt frenchemen stode styll tyll archer spent arowes away bowes resorted backe men armes ranged longe hedg sir godfray ba er frenche archer began gathered vp arrowes ben sho also men armes began feersly aproche fo e fyght whan mette hande hande sir godfrayes fotemen kept none aray soone discofyteo sir godfray sagely rue hymselfe downe wyng closed whan frechmen sawe lyghted fote deuysed way might went fynde away sir godfray redy euer defende many hurt slayne frenchman de entre pleasure finally entred sore fyght many man ouerthrowen sir godfrayes men kepte good aray dyd nat promysed moost part theym e de whan sir godfray sawe sayd howe rathe aken frechmen toke handes set one legge thother stande surely one legge lytell croked strong armes ther fought valyantly long non burst well abyde stro two frenchman mounted horse ranne bothe speares tone hym bare hym yerth fote ame sw rdes strake hym body vnder harneys ther e slayne suche hya nygh slayne taken ped retourned saynt sauyour uycount feest saynt martyne wynter yere lorde ccc lvi p howe prince conucyed frenche kyng fro burdeux englande cap c lxxiii beth knight sir godfray harcourt frechmen retourned costances prisoner pyliage anone went france duke normandy called regent france thre estate wh receyued right honourably fro then forth saynt sauyour le vycont englysth lordes pertayning sir godfray harcourt solde kyng england dyscease dishery ed lorde loys harcort nephue cause wolde nat take par issone kyng engla de herde tidynges dethe lorde godfray harcort sorie therof tha sent incotynent men armes knyghtes uyers archer mo ccc see go take possessyon hym saynt sauyour le uycot worth xxc frankes yere made captayne land lorde johan lyle thre estate season studyed ou ordinance realme france gouerned wynter prince wale suche englande hym burdeux ordayned shyppes conuey frenche kyng sonne prisoner englande whan tyme departed aproched comau ded lorde albert lorde musydent lorde de aspare lorde punyers lorde rosen kepe contre tyll retourne agayne toke see certayne lordes gascoyne hym frenche kyng vessell hym self ease acompanyed two hudred men armes two thousand archer shewed prince thre estate realme france gouerned layed normandy crotoy two great armyes entent mete hym gette frenche kynge handes myght ther suche apered yet thei see xi dayes xii day aryued sandwych yssued shyppe lay night taryed two dayes refresshe thirde day rode canterbury whan kyng englande knewe comynge comaunded london prepare theym cyte receyue suche man fre che kyng london arrayed themselfe copanyes chiefe maisters clothyng dyfferent fro saynt thomas caunterbury frenche kyng prince made offerynges taryed day rode rochester taryed day nexte day dartforde fourth day london wher honourably receyued euery good towne passed frenche kynge rode london whyte courser well aparelled prince lytell blacke hobbey hym thus conueyed long cyte tyll came sauoy house pertayned herytage duke lancastre french kyng kept house long season thyder came se hym kyng quene often tymes made hym gret feest chere anone commaundement pope innocent sirt came englande lorde taylleran cardynall pyergort lorde nycholas cardynall dargell treated peace bytwene two kynges coude bring nothyng effect last good meanes cured truse bytwene two kynges assysters endure tyll feest saynt johan baptyst yere lorde god ccc lix truse excepted ye lorde philyppe nauerr alyes countesse mountfort duchy bretayne anone french kyng remoued fro sauoy castell wyndsore house holde went huntyng haukyng ther pleasur lorde philypp son hym prisoner abode styll london went se kyng pleasure receyued onely faythes p howe kyng scottes delyuered prison cap c lxxiiii ye haue herde howe kyng dauyd scotlande taken prisoner englande ix yere anone truse concluded bytwene englande fraunce two foresayd cardynals bysshoppe saynt andrewes scotlande fell treaty delyuerance kyng scott treaty suche maner kyng scotes shulde neuer arme hymselfe agaynst kyng englande realme counsayle consent subgetes arme greue make warre agaynst england also kyng scottes retourne realme shulde put payne dilygence men shulde agre ye realme scotland shuld holde fee homage kyng england realme wolde nat agree thereto yet kynge scottes swere solemply kepe good peace kyng englande bynde hymselfe realme pay within x yere fyue hundred thousande nobuls somonyng kyng england sende gode pleges hostage erle duglas therle morette erle mare erle surlant erle fye baron uersey sir wyllyam caumoyse abyde englande prisoner hostagers kyng lorde vnto tyme sayd paymet money full content payed ordynaunce bondes made instrumentes publykes letter patentes sayled bothe kynges kyng scott deted went realme wyfe quene isabell suster kynge englande hym honourably receyued realme went lay saynt johsis towne ryuer try tyll castell edenborough newe prepared p howe duke lancaster layed siege reynes cap c lxxv aboute myddes may yere lorde god ccc lvii duke lacastre made breten great army englysshmen breton ayde countesse moutfort ner yonge sonne nombre thousande men armes well aparelled v hundred archer departed day fro hanybout went forthe bre nyng exilyng contrey bretayne came good cyte reynes layed siege therto made many assautes lytell good dyde within uycount rowan lorde dela wall sir charles dignen dyuers also yong bachelar called bertraude lesquyne duryng siege fought englyssh man called sir nycholas dagorne batayle takene thre course speare thre stroke thre dagger eche knyghtes bare themselfe valyantly departed fro felde wt damage well regarded bothe theym within without season lorde charles de bloyes countrey pursewed sore regent fraunce desyring hym sende men warr reyse siege reynes regent suche busynes mater realme dydde nothynge cause siege lay styll reynes p knyght county eureuse called sir wyllyam granuyll wan cytie castell eureux french frenche kyng fro naaeroys ye haue herde capitulo c lxxvi knight named lorde granuyll tayning kyng nauer bothe fayth othe gretly displeased hym presetmet kyng nauerre also right dysplesant burgess eureur coude nat amende bycause castell enemy lorde dwelt two leages fro cyte osten tymes resorted cite burges house tyme euer loued well kyng nauer wha lorde came burgesse house wolde eate drinke hym speke comen many mater specially kyng nauer takyng wherwith wer nothing cotent tyme lorde sayd burges ye woll agre ishal day wyn agayne cyte bourge castell behofe kyng nauer howe may sayd burges captayn castell gode frechman woll neuer agre therto castell ye nothynge castell ouer maistreth cytie well lorde wyllyam ishall first behoueth ye gette acorde thre foure burgess prouyde redy house certayne men well armed ishall warrat peryll ye shall entre castell without anger asubtyltie wyll copase burgesse dyde somoche briefe tyme dyd gette hundred burgess opinyon lorde granuyll came cyte pleasure without suspectyon neuer harnes sir philyp nauerre iourney made bycause lande lay nere cytie eureur also frenche kyng whan wan cytie caused landes aboute bounde hym el wolde haue taken owne vse freuche kyng countrey hertes people styll naueroyse also kyng john ben fraunce englande durst nat haue done dyd thought mater france insore trouble also ceyued howe thre estate wer well mynded delyuerace kyng nauer whan saw mater redy well forward burgess opynyon well aduysed shulde armed hymselfe secrete armour dyd opp aboue cloke aboue vnder arme bare short batell axe hym went varlet riuy mynd came walkyng castell gate often tymes done walked vp downe often last capitayne came downe opyned wycket wont stode loked hym whan sir wyllyamsame hym went lytell lytell hym saluted hym courtesly captayne stode styll saluted hym agayne whan came nere togyder began speke dyuerse mater sir wyllyam demaunded hym herde newe tidynges oute fraunce capitayne desyrous newes sayd sir none pray ye haue herde lette parte right good wyll lorde wyllyam sir sayd fraunce kynge denmarke kyng irelande ar alyed togyder hath sworne go forthe togyder nat retourne agayne countreys tyll haue distroyed england haue brought agayne frenche kynge parys ar see mo c men englysshmen suche dout wot nat ther olde sayeng among theym dane shulde dystroy theym capitayne demaunded howe knewe tidynges sir sayde knyght flaunders dyd write certayne sent ye letter goodlyest chessemen euer sawe found mocke bycause knewe well capitayne loued well game chesse capitayne sayde sir pray lette se theym shall sende sayd sir wyllyam condycion woll play game wyne sayde varlette go thy way fetche chessemen bring hyther gate varlet departed capitayne sir wyllyam entred first gate capitayne closed wycket bolt locked nat thanne sir wyllyam sayde opyn seconde gate ye may well ynough without danger captayne opyned wycket dyd suffre sir wyllyam entre se castell entred hym varlet went streyght burgess men redy harnes house caused come harde castell gate sowned lytell horne deuysed shulde whane lorde wyllyam herde horne sayde capytayne lette v go seconde gate varlet commynge sir wyllyam passed wycket stode styll without capitayne wolde passed hym sette fore stouped downe put heed lorde wylliam toke vnder arme strake captayne sin stroke claue heed fyll downe deed groundsyll thane lorde wyllyam went first gate opyned hit whane watche man castell herde horne great marueyle ther co maudement gyuen towne payne dethe none shulde sowne horne loked sawe men harnes come ronnynge towardes castell gate cryed treason treason within ye castell came gate sore basshed whan sawe opyn capitayne deed ouerth wart gate lorde willyam axe handes defende entre incotynent ther came suche apoynted ayde lorde wyllyam entred first gate seconde gate droue backe ye soudyers dyuers taken slayne entred castell thus manere stronge castell eureux agayne incontynent cytie yelded vp put frenchman send lorde philyp nauer newely come englande thyder came made ther sauerayne garyson make war agaynst good countrey normandy hym sir robert canoll sir james physen sir fryquet friquant bascle marnell lorde jouell sir fondrigas dyd moche myschiefe france ye shall herafter p copanions wherof archpreest chiefe howe honoured auygnon ca c lxxvii season ther knyght called sir arnolde canoll comoly named archpreest assembled togyder great company men warr dyuers contrees suche lacked wage place takyng fre che kynge wyste nat wynne thyng fraunce first went towardes prouence toke byforce many stronge townes castelles robbed countrey auygnone none capitayne knight archpreest pope innocent sixt cardynalles beyng auygnon company great dout kept men day nyght harnesse made good watche whan archepreest copany robbed countre pope clergy fell treaty sure apoyntment came auygnone honourably receyued thoughe ben kynges sonne often tymes knyght dyned pope cardynals pardon synnes departyng rewarde xl thousande crownes hym company company departed styll archpreest kept company togyder sort copanyons wherof russyn walsshman capitayne cap c lxxviii also season rose company men warr contreys gathered togyder kept bytwene ye ryuer loyr ryuer sayne wherfore none durste go ryde bytwene parys orleaunce bytwene parys moutarg euery man sledde parys poore men countre fled orleance companyons made among captayne called ruffyn made hym knight meanes robbery pyssage marueylous riche day wolde ryde nere parys another day orlyaunce another tyme chartres towne fortresse sauynge suche stronge well kept robbed ouerron saynt arnolde gallardon broumalx aloe estampes chastres montleher plounyers ingastynoes mylly larchant chastellon montarges isy e dyuers great townes marueyll reherse rode contre xx xxx xl founde let also normandy see syde gretter company robber englysshe naueroys sir robert canoll chefe suche meanes wanne townes castels fortress without resystence ser robert canoll longe vsed lyke maner well worthe hundred thousand cr wnes kepte euer hym many soudyers wage pylled robbed well many gladde folowe hym p howe prouost marchantes parys slewe thre knyghtes regentes chambre cap c lxxix season thre estate thus ruled rose dyuers countrees certayne manere people callyng themselfe companyons made warr euery man noble men realme france prelate holy churche began waxe wery rule ordyna ce thre estate gaue vp rule suffred prouost marchantes dyll burgess parys bycause medled farther thane pleased withall day regent fraunce palays parys many nobleman prelate hym prouost assembled great nombre common parys suche opynion ware hattes one colour thnetent knowen prouost came palays men hym entred duke cha bre ther egerly desyred hym wolde take hym medlyng busynesse realme france realme pertayned hym enherytance might better kept suche companyons goeth realme wastyng robbyng pyllinge myght subdued duke answered howe wolde gladly entende therto yf wherwith said receyue profet rightes pertayning realme ought yf done nat report multiplyed suche wordes bytwene thre greattest duke counsayle ther slayne nere hym clothes blody blode himselfe great peryll sette one hattes heed fayne deth thre knyghtes two armes thyrd lawe one called lorde robert cleremont ryght noble man another lorde coflans knyght lawe lorde symonde bucy p howe kyng nauer came prison cap c lxxx forsayd auen ture certayne knyghtes lorde john pequigny vnder comfort prouost parys counsaylours good townes cae stronge castell alleres paylleull picardy kyng nauer prison vnder kepynge lorde trystram du boyse brought theym kept castell suche token king nauer delyuerd hades captayn nat tha brought hym great ioye cytie amyense well receyued lyghted chanons house loued hym entierly called guy kyrrecke kyng taryed fyftene dayes tyll prouyded hymselfe assured duke normandy regent france prouost marchantes parys hadde gette hym peace duke parys kyng nauer brought parys lorde john pequigny burgess amyense wher euery man gladde se hym duke made hym great feest chere behaued hym prouost sect exhorted hym therto therfore duke dissembled pleasur prouost parys p howe kyng nauerre preched solemply parys cap c lxxxi whan kynge nauer bene certayne tyme parys day assembled togyder prelate knightes clerkes vnyuersite ther shewed openly among latyn presence duke normady coplaynt greffes vyolence done hym wrongfully without right reason sayde howe none ought dout hym wolde lyue dye defence realme fraunce crowne therof bounde extraught father mother right lygne fraunce sayde wolde chalenge realme crowne fraunce coulde shewe ryght howe nerer therto kynge englande sermon langage pleasant greatly praysed lytell lytell entred fauour parys yt better beloued regent duke normady also dyuers cite realme france soeuer semblant prouost parys made kyng nauer lorde philyppe nauer wolde neuer trust wolde nat come parys alwayes sayd comynalte ther neuer certentie finally shame rebuke dyshonour p beginnyng rysing common called jaquere beauuosyn cap c lxxxii anone delyueraunce kyng nauer ther began meruelouse trybulacion realme fra ce beauuosyn bry ryuer marne leamoys seossons certayne people common vyllages without heed ruler assembled togyder beauuosyn beginnyng past nat hundred nombre sayd howe noble men realme fraunce knyghtes squyers shamed realme shulde great welth dystroy eche sayd true said one voyce shame haue dothe nat power distroy getylmen realme thus gathered togyder wt counsayle without armure sauyng staues knyues went house knyght dwellyng therby brake vp house slewe knyght lady chyldren great small brent house went another castel toke knight therof bounde hym fall stake vyolated wyfe doughter face slewe dy doughter chyldren slewe knyght great tourment brent beate downe castell dyd dyuers castelles good house multiplyed six thousand euer went forwarde encreased suche lyke fell euer euery gentylman fledde fro tooke wyues chyldren fledde x xx leages suretie left house voyde goodes therin myscheuous peple thus assembled without capitayne armoure robbed brent slewe gentylmen coude lay handes forced rauysshed ladyes damosel dyd suche shamefull dedes humayne creature ought thynke suche dyd moost myschiefe preased theym greattest maister dare nat write horryble dedes dyd ladyes damoselles amonge slewe knight dyd put hym broche rosted hym fyre syght lady wyfe chyldren yt lady ben enforced rauisshed x xii thei made perforce eate husband made dy yuell deth chyldren made among kynge one cleremont beauuosyn chose hym moost vngracyoust called hym kyng jaques goodman therby called companyons jaquery distroyed brent countrey beauuosyn corby amyense mot dydier mo threscore good house strong castelles lyke maner vnhappy people bry arthoyes ladyes knyghtes squyers contrey fayne flye away meaulx bry aswell duches normandy duches orlyaunce dyuers ladyes damosel orels ben vyolated murdred also ther certayne vngracyous peple bytwene parys noyon bytwene parys soyssons lande coucy countie ualoys bytwene brieche loan noyon soyssons brent distroyed mo hundred castelles good house knyghtes squyers countrey p howe prouost marchantes parys caused walles made cytie parys cap c lxxxiii whan gentylmen beauuosyn corboys uermadoys la de myscheuous peple conuersant sawe woodnesse amonge sent socours tredes flanders brabant heynault behayne ther came fro party gentylmen stranger countrey assembled togyder dyde sette people wher might fynde slewe hanged vpon tree heapes kynge nauer day slewe mo thre thousande besyde cleremount beauuosyn tyme take vp hadde ben togyder assembled mo hundred thousande whan demaunded dyd yuell dedes wolde answere say coude nat tell dyd sawe thynkyng therby haue distroyed noble getylmen worlde season duke normandy departed fro parys dout kynge nauer prouost marchauntes sect one acorde rode brige charenton ryuer marne ther made great sommons gentylmen defyed prouost marchates ayders prouost dout hym wolde nyght tyme come ouerron cytie parys nat closed sette workemen worke many coude gette made great dyke parys began walles gate space one hole yere thre hundred workman contynually workyng gret dede furnvsshe arme close defence suche cytie parys surely best dede euer prouost dyd ther el ben dyuers tymes ouer ron rob dyners occasyons p batayle meaulx bry companyons jaquery disconfyted therle fo captall b z ca clxxxiiii season whyle vngracious people raygned came pruce erle foyz captall b z cosyn ther way herde shulde haue entred fraunce great myschefe fell among noble men vnhappy people cytie meaulx duches normandy duches orleaunce thre hundred ladyes damosel duke orleance also two sayd knyghtes agreed go se ladyes confort power howe captall englysshe truse bytwene ye two kynges company threscore speares whan come meaulx bry welcome ladyes damosel ther whan jaquery vnderstode ther meaulx suche nombre ladyes yong damoselles noble chyldren assembled togyder ualoys came meaulx also certayne parys yt herd therof went nyne thousand dayly mo resorted came gate towne meaulx peple towne opyned gate suffred entre streates full theym market place noble ladyes lodged stronge place closed ryuer marne came nombre agaynst ye ladyes sore afrayed two knightes co pany came gate markette place yssued sette bilayns yuell armed therle foyz baner duke orleance captals penon whan bilayns saw men warr well aparelled yssued defende place mast began recule backe gentylmen pursued speares swerdes whan thei felde great stroke reculed tone fell hast ech noble men yssued baryers anone wan place entred among ennemyes beate downe heapes slewe lyke beestes chased towne slewe many thei wery made many heapes flye ryuer briefely yt day slewe mo seuyn thousand none scaped wolde folowed chase farther whan men armes retourned gayne towne sette fyre brende clene bilayns towne coude close therin bycause tooke part jaquery disconsyture thus done meaulx neuer assembled gayne togyder yong ingram lord coucy hym certayne men warr euer slewe theym myght mete theym without mercy p howe parys besieged duke normandy regent fraunce cap c lxxxv none aduenture duke normandy assembled noble men togyder coude gette well realme empyre wage thre thousande speares went layed siege parys towarde saynt antoyne long ryuer sayne lodged hymselfe saynt men ther euery day ran skirmysshing walles parys som tyme duke lay chareton another season saynt nothyng cae parys syde nother lande water duke caused bothe ryuers sayne marne surely kept brende village parys suche nat closed better therby chastyce theym parys parys nat ben fortifyed walles dyke bene distroyed none durst go parys go feare duke men rode bothe sybe ryuer sayne pleasure ther none resyst prouost kept styll loue ye kyng nauerr toke hym counsayle common day nyght dyd worke defence cytie kept great nobre men warre naueroyse englysshe archer companyons cytie certayne well dysposed person john mayllart symonde brother dyuerse lynage sore dyspleased duke normadyes yuell wyll prouost drawen opynion maner men none durst say contrary hym without slayne without mercy kyng nauer seyng varyaunce bytwene parys duke normandy thought supposed maner coude nat long endure state great trust co montie parys departed thense curtesly myght went saynt denyce kepte hym good nombre soudyers wage parys duke thus lay sixe wekes charenton ye kyng nauerre saynt denyce pylled eate vp countre euery syde bytwene party entreated peace archbysshoppe senus bysshoppe ausser bysshoppe beaumoys lorde momorency lorde fyenes lorde saynt uenant often went bytwene tie sagely demeaned busynesse yt kyng nauerre owne good wyll without constreynt went charenton duke normady excused hymselfe suspecte first dethe two knightes maister symonde bucy dispyte prouost one hym paleys parys sware vnknowen promysed duke stycke hym good yuell peace made bytwene kynge nauersayde howe wolde cause parys make amendes done duke content common parys shulde haue peace soo myght haue prouost xii burgess suche wolde chose within parys correct theym pleasure thynges agreed kynge nauer retourned saynt denyce duke went meaulx bry gaue leaue men warre dept certayne burgess parys suche hadde holpen make sayd treaty desyred ye duke come parys sayeng howe shulde hym honoure myght duke answered sayd wolde kepe ye peace made sworne vnto without brekyng part entre parys surely sayd wolde neuer tyll satysfacryon theym dyspleased hym prouost marchantes sect often tymes visyted kyng nauerre saynt denyce shewed hym howe dygnacion ye duke normandy sake bycause delyuered hym prison brought hym parys therfore sayd hym ir goddessake haue great truste duke counsayle kynge sayd certaynly frendes ye shall haue none yuell part shalbe therin seyng ye haue nowe gouernaunce parys wolde counsayle prouyde selfe golde syluer ye haue nede ye may euer helpe selfe hardely sende hyder saynt denyce trust shall kepe hit well shall alwayes entertayne men warr secretly ye haue nede shall make warre gaynst ennemyes thus prouost two tymes weke sende euer saynte denyce two somers charged floreyns kynge nauerr receyned money gladde chere pof parisyens slayne saynt clude theglysshmen besodyers paris ca clxxxvi season parys great nombre men warre englysshe naueroyse retayned wag prouost co mon cytie ayde agaynst duke norma dy bare themselfe right well warr du yng whan peace made bytwene parisyens duke certayne soudyours departed fro parys abode styll suche departed went kynge nauer receyued wage ther abode styll parys thre hundred sported spende merely money day stryfe fell bytwene theym parys ther slayne theym threscore wherof prouost blamed greatly cytie howe beit apease comons toke mo hundred fyftie put theym prison thre gate sayd common howe shulde slayne corrected acordyng trespaces wherby comons apeased whan nyght came prouost caused delyuered prison put towne lybertie went saynt denyce kynge nauer receyued retayned theym next mornynge whan parys knewe delyueraunce englysshmen prison greatly dyspleased prouost lyke wyse man dyssembled mater tyll forgoten englysshe naueroyse soudyers whan toguyder saynt denyce mo thre hudred determyned reuenged parys dispyte done defyed theym parys made eger warre agaynst theym slee maner people parys yssued durst nat go gate cytie desyred prouost wolde cause parte common armed yssue feldes fyght englysshmen prouost agreed therto sayd howe wolde go hymselfe day caused armed xii hundred yssued herde howe englysshmen made warre saynt clude departed two companyes entent ennemyes shulde nat scape poynted mete togyder certayne place besyde saynt clude went two wayes one partie went day mount marter coude nat fynde enemyes prouost lesse part noone returned entred parys gate saynt martyne done nothynge company knewe nat prouostes returnyng taryed styll feldes tyll wardes night thane retourned homewarde without array good order thought haue trouble went weryly heapes bare salette hande backe drewe swerdes naked shethes toke way entre parys gate saynt honoure sodenly went founde thenglysshmen lowe way foure hundred well apoynted whan saw frenchman sette first metyng beate downe mo two hudred frechmen fledde beate downe lyke beestes ther slayne chase mo sixe hundred pursued barryers parys aduenture prouost greatly blamed common sayd howe betrayed next day mornynge frendes slayne yssued parys seke deed bodyes bury englysshmen hadde made abusshment agayne slewe hurt mo sixscore thus myschiefe trouble parys wyst nat beware night day great feare also kyng nauerre began waxe colde aydinge bycause peace sworne duke normandy also outrage paris done thenglysshe soudyers wherfore well consented shulde chastysed also duke normandy dyd suffre bycause uost marchantes gouernyng cytie prouost sect natte suretie comons spake shamefully enfourmed p dethe prouost marchauntes parys cap c lxxxvii prouost sect among themself dyuers counsaylles secretly know howe shulde mayntene theselfe coude fynde meanes mercy duke normandy sende worde generally commens parys wolde kepe lenger peace without delyuerd handes twelfe parys suche wolde chose pleasure thyng gretly abasshed prouost company finally sawe well better saue lyues goodes frendes ratherr distroyed better theym slee thane slayne secreatly treated thenglysshmen made warre agaynst parys agreed bytwene theym prouost sect shulde gate saynt honoure gate saynt anthoyne houre mydnight lette englysshmen naueroyse prouyded redy ouerr ronne cytie dystroy robbe clene ercept suche house hadde certayne signes lymyted among theym house without suche token slee menne womenne chyldren nyght shulde haue done god enspyred certayne burgess cytie suche alwayes duke partie johanne mayllart symonde brother dyuers dyuyne inspyracion hit ought supposedde enfourmed parys shulde nyght distroyed incontynent armed theym shewed mater place haue ayde lytell mydnight came gate saint anthoyne founde prouost marchauntes kayes gate handes thanne john mayllart sayde prouoste callynge hym name stephyne houre prouost answered sayd johane wolde ye take hede towne wherof haue gouernynge god sayde john ye shall natte go ye nat houre good may sene kayes gate ye haue handes thynke betray towne quod prouost johanne ye lye falsely nay sayd johan stephyn thou lyest falsely lyke treatour therwith strake hym sayd company slee treatours thane euery man strake theym prouost wolde fledde john mayllart gaue heed fyll downe yerthe yet gossyppe lefte nat tyll slayne sixe theym hym taken putte prison thane people began styre stretes john mayllart acorde went gate saynt honoure founde certayne prouostes secte layde treason excuse auayled nothyng dyuers taken send dyuers place prison suche wolde nat taken slayn without mercy night wet toke dyuers beddes suche culpable treason confessyon suche taken next day john mayllart assembled moost parte common markette hall mounted stage shewedd generally cause hadde slayne prouoste marchauntes ther cousayle wysmen suche sect prouost ged dethe executed dyuers tourmentes dethe thus done john mayllart thane greatly grace common parys adherentes sende symonde mayllart two maisters parlyament sir johan alphons maister john pastorell duke normandy beyng charenton shewed duke mater desyred hym come parys ayde counsayle cytie fro then forthe sayeng aduersaryes deed duke sayde ryght good wyll came parys hym sir arnolde dandrehen lorde roy knyghtes lodged lour p kyng nauer defied realme france kyng beyng prisoner england cap c lxxxviii whan kynge nauerr knewe trauth dethe prouost great frede sect sore displeased bicause prouost ben euer hym right fauorable cause brunt went chiefe heed uostes treason thynges consydred cousell lorde philyp nauer brother ther wt hym saint denice detmyned make warr realm frace incontynent sende defyance duke normady parisyence hole body realme fraunce deted fro saynt denyce men ouerranne towne departynge robbed also melynne ryuer sayne quene blanche sustre somtyme wyfe kyng philyppe lady receyued hym ioyfully dyde putte pleasure kyng nauer made towne castell principall garyson retayned men warr almaygnes brabanses heynowers behaignenoyes fro euery place might gette men gladde serue hym payed largely hadde ynough wherwith suche money gette ayde prouost ye marchantes parys townes lorde philyyppe nauerre went maunt meulece ryuer sayne made garysons euery day kyng nauers company encreased thus kyng nauerre men beganne make warre realme fraunce specially noble cytie parys maisters ryuers sayne marne doysse naueroyse multiplyed suche wyse toke perforce strong towne craell wherby maisters ryuer doysse also wanne stronge castell hereell thre leages fro amyense wanne maucounsell thre fortress dyde great dysturbaunce realme france fyftene hundred ouer ranne countre without resystence anone wanne castell saynt ualery made strong garyson ther made sir wyllyam bo nemare john segures capitayns fyue hundred men ouer ran countrey depe abbeuyle porte crotoy roy mutterell whane naueroyse harde castell towne though right stronge made doutes get often tymes wold ryde night thyrtie leages come countrey wher doute thus stale wan castels fortress realme fraunce somtyme toke knyghtes ladyes beddes raunsomed fro toke putte owne house made capitayne towne craell lorde fondregas nauer gaue graunted sauecoductes wolde passe parys noyon fro noyon co paygne fro then soyssons laon place saueconductes well worthe hym whyle lay craell hu dred thousande frankes castell hereell lay lorde john piquegny pycarde good naueroyse men constrayned sore moutdedyer arras peronne amyense countrey picardy long ryuer castell mauconsell ther thre hundred men warre rabenoyes durychars franquelyn hannekyn chiefe capitayns ouer ranne countrey aboute noyon great townes countrey nat closed noyon wer rausomed pay euery weke certayne somme floreyns also abbeyes fayne ye el brende distroyed cruell ennemys maner people landes voyde nat laboured wherby great darthe rose realme fraunce p naueroyse pycard besieged castell maucounsell cap c lxxxix whan duke normady beyng parys knew howe men warr exyled countre tytell kynge nauerr yt dayly encreased sent thane good townes picardy uermadoyse desyring euery man acordyng might beare send certayne nombre men warre fote horse backe resyst naueroise wasted realme france wherof chiefe gouernaunce cytes good townes glad taxed themselfe might bere wage certayne men armes fote horsebacke archer crosbowes first went towarde cyte noyon went streyght garyson maucosell toke weakest garyson nauerose moost dyd hurt noyon good countre uermadoyse frenchman captayne bysshopp noyon hym lorde raoll cousy lord rauenall lord chaney ye lorde roy ser mathue roy brother diuers knyghtes squyers picar uermandoyse besieged mauco sell made dyuers assautes sore costrayned within sawe well coude nat long defende fortres without ayde wherfore send worde danger lorde john piquegny hereell fortress obeyed whan knewe therof made gret hast go conforte frendes mauconsell hesend secretly craell shulde redy seldes houre place apoynted euery man drewe place whan togyder nombre thousande speares thane rode night gyded came mornynge maucounsell mornyng suche myst man coude nat se bredyth acre fro hym thane sodenly dasshed frenche hoost natte warre theym slept hadde small watche thought mselfe well assured naueroyse beganne make cryes begane slee beat downe tentes pauylious made great skirmysshe frenchman hadde leasure arme theym fledde towardes noyon whiche next naueroyse folowed chase many slayne ouerthrowen bytwene noyon orcans abbey bytwene noyon bysshoppes bridge deed men lay grounde heapes wayes amonge hedge bussbes chase endured gate af noyon cytie great daunger haue lost suche bothe party sayde naueroyse lyst might haue entred towne within frayed forgate close gate towardes comptegne bysshoppe noyon takenne barryers sware trewe prisoner el hadde ben slayne day takenne lorde raoull cousey lorde raoll rauenall lorde chaunny two sonnes bourge rowmorey lorde turte lorde uendyenll lorde anthony coudune hundred knyght squyers slayne mo thanne fyftene hundred specially cytie tourney ther theym great nombre sayd seuyn hundred came thense retourned fewe outher ayne taken within maucounsell also yssued ayeded well disconfyture yere lorde god thousand thre hundred fyftie eyght wednysday nexte feest lady myddes moneth august naueroise ledde moost parte prisoner craell bycause gode towne stronge wan iourney great rychesse good prisoner rausomed also raunsomed burgess tourney good townes money stuffe suche neded speare heedes glaynes ax swerdes cote doublettes hose suche thynges knyght squyers raunsomed golde syluer good horse poore getylman nothynge pay tooke seruyce quarter yere halfe thre quarter coulde agree wynes vitaylles hadde ynough playne countrey delyuered theyn sufficyent came nothynge good townes stelth el sauee co ducte solde dere saue conductes euer excepted thre thynges hattes bieuer eustrydge fethers spere heedes mauconsell vyolated ye moste parte good abbey orcans wherwith capitayne maucounsell sore displeasedde naueroyse spredde abrode dyuerse place bothe sydes ryuers two men armes raby goyse dury robyn le scote toke scalynge good towne barley made garyson well fortifyed hadde wage vnder theym foure hundred soudyers payed monethly thus berley maucounsell craell heree ranne ouer countre lyst ther none withstode theym knyghtes countrey hadde ynough k e fortress house nauer se englysshmen went dydde lyst somtyme rode harneys somtyme vnarmed sported theym fro fortresse fortresse though countrey ben gode rest peace yong lorde coucy caused castels well kept souerayne countrey chanoyne robersart dyd trouble naueroyse often tymes dystrussed somme theym p howe certayne burgess amyens wolde delyuerd cytie naueroyse great famyne fraunce cap c lxxxx lorde johanne piquegny kynge nauers parte chiefe counsayle whose ayde delyuered prisone knyght lay kept garyson hereell thre leages fro amyense dyde somoche subtyltie wytte fayre language certayne burgess amyens greattest cyte shulde haue sufferedde naueroyse entre cytie burgess traytours cytie secretely chamber loftes certayne naueroyse shulde haue ayeded haue dystroyed cytie euenynge lorde johanne piquegny lorde wyllyam granuyll lorde fryquette fryquaunt lorde lynne belastoy lorde fondegray theym seuyn hundred fyghtynge men came gate amyense wardes hereell trust frendes within cytie founde gate opynne hit promysed thanne suche hydde within cyte chamber cellers yssued oute cryed nauerr thane cytie awooke rose cryed treason drewe gate busynesse bytwene boro cytie suche cae first kepte gate ther dyuers slayne sore hurte bothe party yf naueroyse hadde made great haste haue entred assoone came wonne cytie taryed borowe dyd ther feat cowardely night god enspyredd lorde morell fyennes constable fraunce erle saynt poule corby great nombre menne warr yssued rode great haste came cyte tyme naueroyse wonne borowe dyd payne wyn cytie whiche hadde done commynge two sayde lordes nat assoone entred cytie another gate drue streyght gate wher medlyng displayed baners ordred theymselfe strete yssued natte gate sawe well borowe loste without recouery socoures encouraged greatly theym cytie lyghted vppe many torchesse fyers whan lorde piquegny company vnderstode lordes come socour cytie thanne thought might lese thanne wynne therfore recreated menne soberly might naueroyse reculed backe wnedde retreat ouer ranne borowe brende wherin well thre thousande house good lodgynges parysshe church brende nothynge sauyd thus naueroyse retourned great rychesse gatte borowe amyense many gode prisoner went garysos whan gone constable france erle saynt poule sende companyes gate cytie commaundynge kepars payne dethe suffre manne yssue towne dydde mornyng tymes sayd lordes certayne burgess knewe well maner cytie went certayne burgess house suche hadde suspect treasonne tooke seuyntene incontynent beheeded openly market place specially abbotte gar consented treason hadde lodgedde moost parte naueroyse within house lyke case anone putte deth good cytie laone sixe greattest burgess cytie bysshopp ther hadde bene taken hadde dyed accused treasonne coude neuer excuse hymselfe secretely departed frendes hadde shewedd hym mater streyght wente kynge nauerre melyne ryuer sayne receyued hym ioyfully suche fortunesse fyll dayes within realme france wherfore euery lorde knyght kepars townes castelles kept euer good watche dede kynge nauerre hadde many frendes abrode realme yf hadde nat bene parceyued tymes hadde done many yuell myscheuous dedes realme yet dyd ynough season ou e normandy bretherne lay parys marchantes durste yssue oute ryde busynesse yf dyd anone ouerthorwen way soeuer toke realme full naueroyse maisters playne countrey ryuers dyuers cyties good townes wherby fyll dere season fraunce barell heryng solde xxx crownes golde thynges rate poore peple dyed hu ger season dured four yere specially good townes france salte get handes duke normandyes offycers solde atte pleasure gather therby money pay soudyours wage p naueroyse besieged saynt ualery pycardes howe realme full naueroyse cap c lxxxxi constable france yonge erle saynte poule dyd gette moche thanke prayse contrey picardy socoring good cytie amyense knyght squyers picardy fyll company toguyder agreed goo ley siege saynt ualery costable sende men good townes cyties picardy tourney arras lysle doway bethyne saynt omers saynt quyntyne peron amyens corby abuyle eche theym sende certayne nombre men costable many knyghtes squyers drewe thyder specially heynalt bycause suche herytages helde fraunce lorde dandrehen send thyder yong seneshall heynault lorde john uerthyne sir hewe datoygne cosynne dyuers came layde siege saynt ualery two thousande knyghtes squyers twelfe thousande common sende thyder gode townes cost charge specially abuyle sore charged hadde moost part prouysion fro thense siege endured longe season many great assautes skirmysshes dayly euer sowhat done newe yonge knyghtes squyers hoost often went forthe aduenture theymselfe often tymes founde wherwith sir wyllyam bonnemare johan segure company within towne wolde come barryers forteresse skirmysshe theym without hurt slayne bothe party within thre hundred companyons besyde towne caused ayde theym whyder wolde oriat feare lyues hoost caused brought thyder dyuers engyns abbeuyll amyense caused theym caste great stone whiche greatly troubled within within hadde great plentie artyllary canon springalles wherwith troubled greatly without season whyle siege lay thus atte saynt uallery kynge nauerre warred party realme fraunce arryued cherbourge captall bu cosyn kyng nauerre hadde retayned hym two hundred speares wage assone come normandy rode maunt founde lord philyppe nauer taryed certayne dayes secretely departed withall company rode nyght countrey uulgesyne beauuoysyne came cleremount great towne nat closed stronge castell mornyng captall scaledde forteresse howebeit regarde hit fortresse inpregnable yet wanne hit scalynge helpe archer first entred raumpynge vpp lyke catte bernarde de la salle tyme hadde scaled dyuers forteresses capytall company kept garyson long tyme traueyled greatly contrey uulgesyn beauuosyn ayde naueroyse fortress craell hereell mauconsell contrey abrode none durste mete theym thus euery parte realme fraunce warredde tytell kynge nauer taken many stronge castelles bry behaygne ualoyes bysshopriche noyon saynt lyz soyssons laon wherof dyuers knyghtes squyers dyuers countreis capitayns aboute pouns ryuer sayne prouyns troy ausser tonnerre suche warre yt none durst yssue gode towne fortresse bytwene chalous troy castell beaufort whiche enherytance duke lancastre capteyn sir peter audeley ouer ran contrey ther also pons ryuer sayne somtyme noget lorde eustace dambretycourt hanuer v hundred hym pylled countrey campaygne albrest squyer almaygne thre captayns kept champayne ryuer marne mo lx castelles strong house whan lyst yssue felde mo two thousande fightyng men contre vnder subiectyon robbed raunsomed contre robbed brende gode towne amery sparney good towne uertuz gode townes longe ryuer marne castell thyerie cyte reynes takenne good towne ronay strong castell han champaigne aboute saynt antony partoys farthermore countre burgoyne partoys ther lay thebault chafore john chanfore also tytell kynge nauer taken bysshopriche laungers strong castell called mountsangon therin lay garyson foure hundred soudyers ouer ran countre bysshoppe ryche uerdone towarde countre soyssons bytwene laon raynes another sort souerayne garyson uelly wher sixe hundred capitayne rabygoys dury englysshe retayned hym maner people wolde serue hym payed truely fro terme terme glad serue hym hym another companyon wage called robynle stotte went wan feest christmas stronge castell roucy prouisyon therin robbed towne made towne castell garyson afterward dyd moche hurt countre rau somed erle wyfe chyldren ther xii thousande floreyns golde print mutton kept towne castell wynter somer yere lorde ccc lix whatie therle roucy payed ransome went laone hym lyste season labourynge yerth wherby great darth realme p naueroyse chanoyn robersart disconfyted lannoys nere towne craull cap c lxxxxii season enfourmed ther fyll lorde chanoyn robersart fayre adueture fortuned day lorde pynon baneret uermandoyes rode threscore hym fro one frenche fortresse nother day hapenyd certayn garyson uylly garyson roucy rode forth adueture somwhat wyn capitayns nat thre hundred companyons togyder nere towne craull sawe lorde pynon rode vnder staderd good order way towardes craull anone perceyued frenchman lorde pynon sawe well howe wer naueroyse sawe howe coude nattescape without batayle coosted towardes craull naueroyse cutte way whan sawe fledde saue selfe well might naueroyse folowed fast cryeng saint george nauer better horsed frenchemen ouertoke within halfe leage ridynge lorde pynon perceyued great pytte large depe closed stronge hedge one lytell streyt place entre whan sawe aduauntage therof coude flye farther sayd company sir fote quickely better v abyde aduenture god w sende v defende ourselfe rather slayne taken fleyng alyghted whan naueroyse saw likewyse lyghted fote ther squyer lorde pynon sayd varlet leape vpon courser spare hym nat ryde garison pyer pount desyre chanon robersart come hast rescue v varlet sayde though fynde hym howe possyble shulde come hyder tyme hense fyue leages well sayde squyet yet thy deuoyre verlet rode forthe lefte maister feersly assayled pyllers uelly roucy lorde pynon copany defended themself great
