vertue kept aduauntage pytte fro mornyng tyll non without dysconfeture p nowe lette v speke varlet rode greathast pyer pount lanoyes dyd message canoyne robersart answered wolde deuoyre ryde place lorde pynon fightyng sayde knewe place well thane sowned trumpet company mounted horse nombre sixscore also sende varlet laon nat farre thense captayne ther enforme hym mater howebeithe wolde nat tary laon rode forthe gret galopp tyll founde lorde pynon copany sore traueyled naueroyse coude nat long haue endured without rescewe incontynent chanoyne robarsert layd speare rest dasshed among naueroyse ouerthrewe thre first co myng men fresshe lusty anone put abacke naueroyse wery fightyng day chanoyne robersart gaue suche stroke axe none durst abyde hym ayne place pyllers mothan hundred l suche scaped fro thense mette withall laon commynge thyder rescue great part naueroyse ayne thre hundred scaped fyftene person slayne taken p naueroyse yelded vp saynt uallery frenchman ben longe besieged cap c lxxxxiii haue shewed lordes pycardy arthoyes ponthieu bolonoyes lay great season siege saynte ualery made many assautes engyns instrumentes warre amonge aduentures fell lorde bauceen pycarde went vpon aprochyng castell better aduyse ther striken spring slayne within great plenty artyllary without coulde make none assaut without great damage siege endured fro begynning august tyll lent lordes wtout thought famyssh within seyng coulde nat get assaut straytes passage well watched nothyng coude come theym within nother water lande prouysion within began sore mynisshe durst nat yssue go foragynge also coude nother se socour counsayled togyder detmyned treat constable erle saynt poule might depart yelde vp fortres lyues good saued go whyder lyst treaty agreed sauyng shulde depart without harneys whiche erle saynt powle lothe vnto wolde haue symply season comyng saynt ualerys warde lorde philyppe nauer haue reysed siege leest wolde haue done power therto saynt uallery hadde nat gyuen vp fortresse soone wherwith lorde philyppe sore dyspleased coudenatte mende p howe lorde philypp nauer reysed vp thre thousande naueroyse haue reysed siege saynte uallery cap c lxxxxiiii french lordes styll felde araynged poynt departyng trussyng vp te te pauylions dystoging sodenly herde tidynges howe lorde philypp nauer go uerned landes vnder kyng nauer brother specially landes cou tie eureur hym obeyed maner men warre suche made warre realme france lorde john piquegny enfourmed hym howe saynt ualely lykely gyue vp fortresse lorde philypp toke courage go reyse liege secretly gathered togyder maunt meulence thre thousande men one hym yong erle harecourt lorde granuyll sir robert canoll sir john piquegny dyuerse knyghtes squiers come within thre leages saynt uallery tyme gyuen vp knewe ye trauth therof sir wylliam bonemare johan segure met way whan frenchman taken possession saynt ualery vnderstode commynge lorde philyppe nauer drue felde toke counsayle gyder co stable fraunce erle saynt poule lorde chastellon lorde poyx lorde beausault lorde helley lorde crestkes lorde edwarde rency lorde baudwyn denekyn dyuers lord knyghtes ther agreed go fight ennemyes commauded constable euery man array shulde marche towarde ennemyes euery man rode gode order thiderwarde whan naueroyse vnderstode frenchman commyng mo xxx thousand nat purpose abyde passed ryuer assone might entred castell long ponthieu horse harneys scant entred frenchman came thyder folowed hour euyn song styll nombre encreased co mon came good wnes picardy coulde nat come thyder soone men armes dyd frenche lordes determyned lodge nyght byde came next day make assaute lodged naueroyse within small prouysion aboute houre mydnight yssued backe posterne without noyse toke way uermandoyse gone two leages frechmen knewe therof armed folowed naueroyse trake horse thus naueroyse rode frenchman laste naueroyse cae thorigny alytell vyllage sta dyng hyll might se countrey aboute stode syde halfe bytwene saynt uyntyns peron uermandoyse naueroise rested refresshe horse shuld nedes fight ther great aduantage abyde enemyes nat long rested countre neth couered frechmen mo xxx thousand whan naueroyse sa made redy fight theym yssued lodgynges made thre batayls lorde robert canoll first seconde lorde philypp nauer thirde therle harecort euery batayle seuyn hundred euery man dyd cutte speares fyue fote longe hangyng hyll caused varlettes sette spurres erth ye rowel vp warde entent ennemyes shulde nat easely aproche nere theym lorde philyppe nauerr made yonge erle harcourt knyght yong lorde granuyll frenchman rested naueroyse lyghted fote wolde incontynent haue gone fought sayd men besore traueyled many behynde good taryed theym lette v lodge night anone woll late morowe may fight ordinately thus frenchemen lodged night set caryage rounde aboute theym whan naueroyse sa shulde natte fought withall night euenyng went vyllage thoringny made great fyers smoke make ennemyes byleue yt wolde lodge ther night assone darke night horse redy detmyned wolde whan darke priuely departed went ye ryuer passed gyde lytell vyllage nere bethencourt rode towarde woode bohaygne coosted rode night thane seuyn leages yuell horsed farre behynde garyson bouhayne toke prisoner also vyllayns countrey slewe coude nat folowe maisters lost way frenchman knewe nat departing tyll nere day light hast passed ryuer bridge saynt uintyne went towardes lyceuce aproche naueroyse soeche made haste warde saynt uyntyus came thyder day light thense two leages formast constable erle saynt poule watchman gate saynt uityne wha herde noyse without knewe ennemyes natre farre lodged thense nat well assured themselfe bridge vp demaunded sir ye aproch nere v tyme nyght constable answered sayde suche suche wolde passe towne gette afore naueroyse arstollen thorigny arre fledde v wherfore opyn gate commaunde name kyng watchman sayde sir kayes within towne iurates two watchman went towne kept kayes shewed mater answered ther shuld gate opyned without consent hole towne myndes knowen sonne vp came gate suche shulde gyue answere hole towne went vppe walles gate put heedes sayd co stable erle saynt poule sir desyre haue v excused tyme mynde comons towne fyue sixe shall entre yf please honour pleasure resydue go wher lyst lordes dyspleased gaue great dispytfull wordes saynt nuyatyns wolde nat opyn gate french lordes thought auayled nat pursue naueroyse farther departed lycence constable erle saynt poule went castell bohaygne soosore dyspleased none durst speke hym p naueroyse sir peter audeley brought nyght haue taken cytie chalons cap c lxxxxv thus departed iurney bytwene frenchemen naueroyse lorde philyppe nauer company rode day wylly passed guy de ryuer oyse thane refresshed whan sawe wer el pleasure rode normady rode fro fortresse fortreg maisters ryuers playn countrey entred agayne constantyne made warr normandy also kyng nauer melyn ryuer sayne great nombre men warr fyll sir peter audeley capitayne beaufort bytwene troy calons cast aduyce myght passe ryuer marue lytell aboue ye towne chalons come thabbey saynt peter shulde lightly entre towne taryed purpose tyll ryuer marne iowe assembled toguyder secretly certayne companyons part fyue sire fortresse aboute hym foure hundred sightyng men departed fro beaufort mydnight brought passage ouer ryuer marne men countrey brought hym thyder lighted fote delyuerd horse varlettes went ouer water whiche iowe whan wer ouer went fayre easely toward abbey saynt pet ye watchman ther abrode towne next abbey without towne herde clerely redoundyng naueroyse went harneys clateredd made noyse suche herde noyse maruell ment somtyme ye noyse seaced whan naueroyse stode styll rested whan went forth agayne noyse began wynde syde watchmensayd likelyhode ther besome theuys englysshe nauerose ar commyng steale towne let v ascry wake men cytie tymes went towardes abbey se coude nat sone sir peter audeley copany abbey court walles therof past nat foure fote hyght incontynent went abbey gate entred great strete cytie sore frayed cryed euery part treason trea son alarum men cytie armed assembled togyder came toward enemyes dyuers slayne first commyng fell yuell towne chalons peter chalons ben capitayne space hole yere hundred speares hym newly departed thense bycause nat payed wage pleasure cytie wer great nombre common rose euery syde feersly putte themselfe defence nedefull nowbeit loste many men naueroyse wan first w e bridge ouer marne beyonde bridge cytie assembled togyder defended first bridge sore fray certayne englysshe archer passed ouer gy e bridge shotte feersly none durst come within shotte skirmysshe endured tyll noone sayde cytie ben woune sir graucy nat knoledge day ryding naueroyse beaufort fearedd cytie chalous wherefore desyred dyuers knyghtes squiers go hym knewe well cytie chalons ther getylman name rode day nyght hym sir philypp jancourt lorde au eau beaupre lorde john guermyllon diuers nombre threscore speres assone came chalons drue streyght bridge towne defended gayust naueroyse dyd payne wynne towne lorde grancy displayed banner great desyre aproched naueroyse p erle roucy taken agayne seconde tyme cap c lxxxxvi commyng lorde grancy chalons gretly reioysed good cause confort ayd nat ben ben harde bestade wha sir peter audeley men sawe burgonyons withdrue way came founde ryuer syde barlettes horse thane mounted passed ryuer marne without lette retoured wt small conquest beaufort deptyng chalons right gladde ked god therof lorde grancy courtesly shewed gaue hym company fyue hundred frankes desyred sir john sars present neyghbour abyde counsayle defend agreed therto certayne wage shulde haue hymselfe company newly tifyed cytic wher neded charge theym towne season garysons uelly roucy mette apoyntment togyder went tooke assaut towne syssome made garyson maner people made capitayne hanekyn francoys alewdefelowe colayne ryuer ryne cruell dedes mercy ouer came brent countre slewe men woman chyldren nat raunsomed pleasure fyll therle roucy bare sore hert losse towne castell roucy naueroise taken fro hym season desyred knyghtes squiers hym hundred speares fortie men horsebacke cyte laon hym erle porcien lorde robert canency lorde montegny ostrenant rode towarde syssome way founde naueroise garyson brennyng byllage incontynent sette theym whan hanekyn company sawe lighted foote sette archer sore harde batayle laon returned cytie dyd good frenchman abode fought longe howe beit iourney nat erle roucy sore hurt takyn prisoner also ther taken lorde gerarde canency lorde motegny dyuers menne armes thus erle roucy twyse takefie lasse space yere lorde eustace dambretycourt season helde champayne seuyn hundred fightyng men wanne great rychesse ther rau somyng men uendages w le saucco cles helde vnder hym twelfe fortress lully louer abperamours maryed lady isabell jullyers somtyme boughter therle jullyers lady also loued lorde ace gret noblenes armes herd reported hym send often tymes hym courser hackeneys letter loue wherby sayde sir eustace har dedes armes euery man greatly vnder hym p thre quenes naueroise besiged duke normandy melune cap c lxxxxvii yeldyng vp saint alery ye haue herde duke normandy assembled togyder thre thousande speares departed fro parys wente layed siege melune ryuer sayne kept naueroyse within towne thre quenes first quene jane aunt kyng nauer sotyme wyfe kyng charles france seconde quene blanch somtyme wyfe kynge philyppe fraunce suster kynge nauerr th r e quene nauer suster duke norman dy duke nat siege hymself sende thyder lorde morell fyenes constable fraunce erle saynt poule lorde arnold dadrehen marshall france lorde arnold coucy bysthop troy lorde broquart fenastrages peter du bare philyppe armoyes nombre thre thousande speares be melune rounde aboute brought fro parys many engyns springalles whiche night day dyd cast sortres also made dyuers sore assautes naueroyse within sore abasshed specially thre quenes wolde glably siege reysed cared nat ho e captayns lorde john pypes lorde johan carbenauxe sayd sayre ladyes bismay nat one dayesye hall se siegereysed kyng nauerre hath sende v worde uernon also sir philyp nauer brother howe haue reysed certayne company men warre maunt meleux reyse siege also men warre garysons naueroyse woll come ou part duke normandy knewe naueroyse reyse siege rerayned soudyours party euer dyd send siege melune ther certen good people besyed selfe haue peace bytwene kynge nauerr duke normandy styll fraunce cardynall piergourt cardynall angell dyd somoche day taken trewse holden uernon thyder came duke normandy counsayle kyng nauer lorde philyppe brother counsaylles peace made king nauer sware good frenche peace coprised thre hundred knightes squyers duke doned yuell wyll yet duke excepted certayne wold gyue peace lorde philyppe nauer wolde nowyse agre sayd kyng brother ho enchauted dyd sore agaynst kyng englande lyed kyng alwayes ayded conforted hym lorde philyppe departed fro brother onely four person rode hast saynt sauyour le uycont garyson englysshe capitayne vnder kyng englande sir thomas agorne englande receyued lorde philyp ioyfully sayde howe aquyted hymselfe trewely kyng englande p howe broquart fenestrages frenchman ordayned bataylles agaynst lorde eustace dambretycourt englysshe champaigne cap c lxxxxviii bi treaty peace kynge nauer certaine townes castels normandy peace debate specially mant meulencke also ther peace made bytwene duke normady yong erle harcourt great part meanes lorde loyes harecourt duke cousayle house duke gaue erle mary age doughter duke burbone suster duches normandy thus siege brake vp melune towne abode freche yet peace realme france inuaded great warre made therin asmoche truse bytwene englande fraunce expyred suche men warre made warre iytell kyng nauer fraunce normandy burgone picardy champaigne brey beaufe made agayne great warre tytell kyng englande peace ther fortresse wolde tourne frenche companyons men warr hadde lerned well robbe pyll countrey raunsome people coude nat leaue two thousand ten twelfe horse owne wolde haue made warre shorte tyme shulde haue fayne haue gone fote breakynge vp siege melune duke normandy desyred lorde broquart fenestrages nacyon lorayne hym wag fyue hundred copanyons wolde helpe driue champaygne englysshmen suche made dayly warre countre agreed therto certayne somme florens shuld haue hym men assembled togyder men warr cha paigne burgoyne bysshoppe troy therle uadumont erle jouy lorde johan chalon lorde broquart fenestrages two thousande speares xv c cae strog castell han champaigne whiche englysshmen kepte yere halfe toke third assaut slayne lxxx englysshemen none take mercy frenchman went cytie troy whan well refresshed yssued twelfe hundred speares nyne hundred tode towarde nogent ryuer sayne lorde dambrety courte vnderstode ryding abrode assembled garysons vnder rule four hundred speares two hundred archer departed fro pons rode clene armed except heed peace rode hackeney great courser ledde hym nat ryden farre herde tidynges frenchman likewyse frechmen herde lorde eustace knowen frenchman ben great nombre wolde desyred lorde peter audeley albreth haue ayded might well made four hudred men lorde eustace gathered togyder men without towne nogent toke hight lytell hyll amonge vynes sette archer hym whan frenchemen came nere sawe theym ordayned thre bataylles first gouerned bysshoppe troy lorde broquart fenestrages second lorde john chalon erle jouy thirde erle januyll sir eustace amonge men sayde sits lette v fyght good courage iourney shalbe shall lordes champaigne somtyme erldome may kyng england suche seruyce repute kyng france woll gyue erldome called hym certayne yong squyers couragyous manny cosyn johan parys martyne spaygne made theym knyghtes made men lyght fote cut speares fyue fote long sette penon hym whiche ermyns two hameddes goules p batayle nogent bytwen lorde broquart fenestrages nacyon lorayne frenche partie sir eustace dambreti court nacyon heynalt englysshe partie cap c lxxx xix whan ser broquart fenestrages hardy couragiouse saw yt syr eustace wolde nat remoue batel sayd lette v sette soeuer fall aduaunced bataile syr eustace receyued first bataile ouerthrew ennemies mo lx nere hande clene discomfitted bataile ii fresshe bataile aproched whiche greatly ayded coforted fyrst tha ye third bataile came wynge comforted ii batailes frenche men iii agaynst one sir eustace glayue ouer threwe iiii herdiest ennemyes whan ser broquart sawe prowes strake hym ouer mennes heedes strake hym viser strake stroke thre tethe letted nat fight englisshemen vauntage hyll helde selfe cloose together none coude entre frencheme horsbacke englisshemen fote littel besyde englysshe archer part themselfe shot quyckely ye fre chemen frenchemen turned englissheme turned dyd ye frenche fortemen came felde ix c pauesses therby brake ye array archer shot coud nat hurt sure pa essed tha archer sore beten seconde bataile ye frencheme came horse backe slewe many went kept englysshe horse slewe wanne fewe scaped meane season two batailes fought englisshemen one syde fotemen side finally brake theyr array syr eustace standderde beaten downe torne many men slayne taken syr eustace fell hades knyght called syr henry quenelart great payne saue lyse comons troye wolde haue slayne hym great dedes armes done countrey champaygne also taken syr johan parys lorde martine spaygne diuerse knyghtes squyers suche saued selfe entred fortresse nogent whiche fewe nere slayne taken coragious manny left deed felde amonge deed men discomfytture frenchemen departed beynge sore hurte nere deed lyfte vp litel heed sawe nothynge aboute hym deed men lyeng grounde rounde aboute hym rose welle myght satte downe sawe well howe nat farre fortresse nogent whiche englisshe dyd moche sometyme crepyng somtyme restynge came foote towre nogent made token within shewynge howe one theyr companyons certayn came downe ye towre hym bare hym forteresse dressed woundes therehe gouerned hym selfe well heeled bataile yere lorde ccc lix vigill saynt john baptist p howe robbors pyllers kept fortress fraunce began declyne myracle cap cc dyscomfetture nogent ye riuer seyn lordes men armes fraunce went troye boty coquest brought theder non theyr prisoner set frenche garysons comos troye wolde haue slayne whan suche styll garyson pouns vnderstode howe theyr capitayne lorde eustace taken company slayne taken trussed shortly myght departed bicause wer fewe lyke wyse dyd torey esponay arcy mary pleusy fortress vnder obeysaunce lorde eustace dambreticourt left voyde doubte bisshop troye lorde broquarte fenestrages syr peter aubeley lefte nat garyson beauforte john segure nogente albret garyson gey ryuer seyne season dyed strangely castell herreell iii leages amiense lorde johan piquygny said stragled chamberlayn lyke maner dyed syr lucz bekusey counsaile season day certayne co pany syr peter audeleys rode forth entred towne called ronay robbed clene curate masse entred churche englisshe squier toke chalays fro aulter wherin prest shulde haue consecrated dyd caste wyne bycause preest spake hym strake hym gauntlet bludde felle vpon aulter departed went feldes squier hym patent corporal sodaynly horse beganne tourne take none durste approche nere hym horse man fell erthe eche strangled sodaynly tourned pouder companion made vowe neuer aft er violate churche season garison mauconsell wanted prouysion solde theyr fortresse noyon countrey xii motons golde departe theyr goodes went fortress craell cleremount hereell uelly pierpount roussey sissome whiche fortress ben long handes naueroys peace bitwene duke normandy kyng nauer englysse whan noyon maucosel rasshed erthe also john segure solde fortresse nogent bysshop troyes certayne florens wherof wrytynge vnder bysshops seale came ye cite troye alyghted bysshop lodgynge sayd hym ser john ye shall abyde thre foure dayes ye shall haue money come thether vnder assuraunce bysshop agreed therto comons cite beganne saye howe dothe bysshop tryfle mocke v sythe kepeth aboute hym greattest brybour robber fraunce wolde shulde gyue hym oure money rose great nobre opynyon sente kepe theyr gate shulde nat skape theym came harneys syxe thousande one sorte slee hym bysshops lodgynge whan bysshop sawe sayde fayre frendes come hyther vnder saue conducte ye knowe treatye bargayne betwene hym accorde hit great shame vntrueth vnder assurance hym villanye euer sayd entred halle force cha bre sought naro welye laste founde hym slewe hym hewed hym peces p howe frenchemen refused peace theyr kyng made englande cap cc longe sythe spake kynge englande non occasion speke hym tyll nowe long treuce endured war made bitwene assoone truce exspired fyrste day may yere lorde ccc lix daye garysons englisshe naueroyse made warr title kynge englande anone peace made betwene kyng nauer duke normandy lorde arnolde dandrehen retourned englande nat quytte prisoner takyng batayle poieters season kyng englande prince sonne frenche ynge lorde jaques bourbon mette london foure allonely guether counsayle agreed vpon peace vpon certayne article wrytten lettre sent fraunce duke normandy erle syr arnolde passed see arryued boloyn went parys founde duke kynge nauer ther shewed letter duke demaunded counsaile kynge nauer dyd counsayle hym prelattes noble fraunce counsayles good townes shulde assembled whiche thynge done semed kyng nauer duke bretherne counsayle realme sayde treatye greuous borne wherfore answered one voyce sayde two fordes letter brought ect therin preiudyciall realme yet wolde endure greatter myschiefe done rather mynisshe wyse realme france wolde also rather suffre kyng lye styll engla de whan french kyng vnderstode realme fraunce wolde nat agre apoyntmet sayd sonne charles ye cou sayled kyng nauerre deceyueth woll deceyue suche xl ye wha kyng englad knewe report sayd well wynter past shall entre realme france puysantly shall abyde long tyll haue ende warre el peace pleasure myne honour made grettest aparayle euer made season aboute myddes august lorde johan craon archbysshop reynes cytie parys coutre ther certayne knightes squiers countie ethell laon went layed siege castell oucy ther lay fyue wekes yelded vp lyues goodes saued go whyder lyst letter patentes sealed archebysshop erle porcyen erle brayne whan departed comons rose agaynst slewe part lordes moche payne saue captayne hanekyn francoyse thus therle roucy agayne towne castell p howe sir eustace danbretycour delyuerd prison great raunsome cap cc ii thus wynninge castell roucy sir peter awdeley dyed bedde within castell beauforde wherof suche companyons wer vnder right sorowfull englysshmen almaygnes thought coude better syth made warr kyng englande make capitayne sir eustace dambreticourt thane hole hurtes styll prisonere sende faucon haraulde therle uandumant sir henry ue ellart putte raunsome lorde sir eustace put fynanse pay xxii thousande frankes france companyons englysshe garysons champaigne payed sayd raunsome delyuered agayne courser hackeney lost batayle nogent horse lady isabell jullyers countesse kent englande sende hym whan copanyons lorde eustace among made hym souerayne euery man drewe entred cou tie rethell neuer stelth wanne good towne athyen ryuer esue founde mo hundred peces wyne ther made soueraygne garyson ouer ranne countrey reynes spoyled espernoy damp ary trayone good towne uertus wher englysshmen great profette ther made another garyson ouer ranne countrey ryuer marne fertyll myllon athyen ranne dayly meserees ryuer meuse douchery chenpoulux p howe sir broquart fenestrages made hymselfe payed force wage duke normady regent france ca c c iii season lorde broquart fenestrages duke ayde agaynst theglyssheme naueroyse holpen put fortress champaygne yuell payed wage ther owynge hym thyrtie thousande frankes sende certayne messangers parys duke gaue none answere pleasure retourned without money promyse knyght sende defyance duke realme fraunce entred good towne called bare ryuer sayne wherin ther wer nyne hundred house men robbed towne coude nat gette castell well kept toke thyem pyllage prisoner brende towne distroyed went costans made cheife garyson dyde countre champaigne yuell vylayne dedes euer dyd englysshemen naueroyse whanne men thus ouer ronne countre duke agreed hym desyred departed went lorayne fro whens came lefte realme fraunce countrey champaine peace whan done yuels ynowe season yere lorde god ccc li sir robert canoll made iourney thre thousande one wente marchesse bretaygne rode along ryuer loyre entred berry brennyng exylyng countre sayd taken hym passe auuergne go se pope cardynalles auygnone haue floring aswell archpreest done p iourney sir robert canoll made berry auuergne lordes gentylmen countrey pursued hym cap cc iiii suche lordes knightes auuergne co panyes purpose encountre sir robert canoell came within dayes iourney hym thre thousande speares sir robert ryden berry brenning exilyng countre entred auuergne resyst hym lordes knyghtes assembled auuerne lymosen therle forestes iiii c speares thus rode sir robert canoll men broght hym loritaygne callyng themselfe englysshmen whan lord thus within dayes iourney ennemyes ther lodged nyght next day came lodged mountayne nere thenglysshmen lodged nother lytell hyll eche theym might se others fyers made next mornyng french men auaunced farther noone cae mountayne right agaynst englysshmen bytwene lytell medowe xii acre lande incontynent englysshemen made redy batayle fight sette archer hangyng hyll frenchman ordayned two batayles euery batayle v men first ledde dolphyne auuergne erle cleremont called berault made knyght rearyd baner quartered auuergne merquell lorde robert daulphyn vncle lorde montagu lorde talencon lorde cochfort lorde serygnacke lorde godfray boloyne dyuers knight squyers lymosyn quercy auuergne rouergue seconde batayle erle forestes lorde john boloyn erle auuergne lorde darchyer sonnes lorde dachon lorde du e sir renalt forest brother therle many knyghtes squyers hauyng great desyre fyght enemyes semyng syde sir robert canoll co pany shewed howe hadd also great desyre haue batayle thus bothe hostes stode styll tyll nere night eche without goynge straytes saue certayne yonge knyghtes squyers get prise armes discended downe party lycence marshal came downe medowe iusted one another wanne felowe hym prisonerr thus night eche partie drewe lodgynges made good watche french lordes went counsayle ordayned hour mydnight shulde dyscend downe fro moutayne syde fro enemyes ward go two leages come othersyde mountayne ther enemy syde hyll easy inough mount thought coe erly thyder theglishmen shuld nat redy armed nat secretly spoken thenglysshmen knoledge therof englisshe prisoner stale away fro frenche hoost came sir robert canoll shewed mater tha sir robert wente counsayle suche trusted best thought thynges co sydred nat best abyde puysance frenchman trussed deted guydes men countrey suche prisoner hour mydnight frenchman putte themin array batayle rode ordayned tyme day came moutayne wher thoght haue founde englysshmen whan knewe departed caused certayne mount vp moutayne se coude knowe thynge theym retourned agayne reported howe sene theym passe suche away named howe goynge lymoges lymosyn whan lordes france herde brake vpp iourney deted euery man owne anone mariage made lorde berault daulphyne auuergne doughter erle forestes duke burbons suster p almaygnes abode kyng englande calays ryde hym realme france kynge johan beynge styll prisoner englande cap cc v season kynge englande made great prouisyon come fra ce suche nat sene lyke certayne lordes knyghtes empyre suche serued kyng prouyded yer greatly horse harneys thynges necessary degree assoone might came flaunders calays ther bode kynges comyng kyng englande came nat soone calays sayde shulde haue done wherfore moche people resorted thyder wyst nat wher lodge haue stablyng horse also bredde wyne hay otes uisyons dere scant ther none gette golde syluer euer said kyng cometh next weke thus taryed lordes almaygne behayne brabant flanders heynault fro begynnyng august feest saynt luke ther many wer fayne sell beste part iewelles kyng lodgyng wolde haue ben strayter towne full also dout lordes spende wolde nat depart fro calays tyll contented agayne expeses kyng sende nat fourth part many come owne good wylles trustynge haue aduauntage thought robbe pyll realme france kyng englande sende ouer duke lancastre foure hundred speares two thousand archer whane duke came calays lordes straungers made great ioye hym demauded tidynges kyng commynge duke excused kynge taryeng longe sayde howe prouisyon natte fully redy sayd fayre lord taryeng profyte woll go ryde fraunce se fynde ther wherfore sir requyre ryde ishall delyuer certayne somme money pay withall costes lodgynges ye haue spent towne calays ye shall haue prouision vitayle cary somers lordes thought great shame refuse duke offre graunted hym euery man newe shodde horse trussed deted nobly fro calays duke went saynt omers two thousande speares syde archer fotemen passed saynt omers without assaut rode bethwyne passed came mount saynt eloy good abbey riche two leages fro arras ther taryed four dayes refresshe theym horse founde abbey well wherwith whan robbed wasted countrey rode cambrey ther made great assaut slayne baneret englande dyuers within defended themselfe valyantly ayde conforte erle saynt poule lorde lamenall two hundred speares came towne backe gate whan thenglysshmen sawe coude gette nothyng departed folowed ryuer soe great scarsnes bred wyne came towne called cheresy founde plentie bredde wyne passed ryuer bridge nat broken ther taryed alhalowen day nyght day tydynges came duke howe kyng aryued calays commaundynge hym incontynent drawe towardes hym company retourned towarde calays wt hym also sir henry flaunders two hundred speares brabant sir henry beautresen lorde bergues lorde gerarde de la herde lorde fraque de halle heynault lorde gaultyer ny lorde john gomegynes behayne sir gaultyer de la haultpon sir reynolde de boulaunt lorde godfray hardnamont lord john sonne lorde dura thyrey ferram lorde ruse junepe lorde gyles sorles lorde john bermont lorde reynolde berg he dyuers almaygnes mercenaryes strange countreis canne nat name present tyme p great host kynge england brought france make warre kyng john beyng prisoner england order englysshe hoost cap cc vi duke lacastre lordes retourned towardes calys mette way foure leages fro calays gret multytude people countrey couered therwith rychely armed besene great ioye beholde fresshe shinyng armour baners w ynge wynde copanyes good order ridyng soft pase whan duke lordes mette kyng feested thanked seruyce almayns mercenaryes brabances behannoyes togyder shewed vnto kyng howe spent goodes horse harnes solde lytell nothyng left theym hym seruyce entent coe nat wherwith go home agayn vnto countreis shuld depart wherfore desyred noblenes take regarde kyng answered sayd howe nat redy gyue theym playne aunswere sayde sir thynke ye traueyled wherfore go wayes refresshe two thre dayes calays nyght morowe shall take counsell sende vnto suche answere reason ye shalbe content stranger departed fro kynge fro duke rode towarde calays nat ryden halfe leage farther met great multytude caryages prince wale nobly richely besene company wherof ther suche nombre cou trey couered rode soft pase redy raynged batayle though shulde incontynent haue fought thus rode euer leage two kynges hoost caryages bytwene hoostes whiche order stragers lyked maruelusly well p whan stragers well regarded company reuerently saluted prince lordes hym prince louyngly receyued coude ryght well toke leaue hym shewed hym nede desyringe wolde regarde necessytie gladly promysed rode tyll came calays seconde day kyng sent answere thre sufficient knyghtes shewed theym playnly kynge nat brought hym treasur sufficient pay desyred performe enterprice hath taken hande wolde go forthe hym take suche fortune falleth good yuell good fortune wynnyng fall haue part demaunde wage losse horse spence damage maye happ haue said kyng broght men ynough relame furnysshe enterprice answere pleasedd nat greatly lordes copany sore traueyled spended goodes layed horse harnes pledge solbe necessytie howbeit coude haue nothynge el kyng delyuerd certayn somme money bring home countrey howe beit lordes went agayne kyng serue hym aduenture thought shame retourne agayne without thyng doyng shall deuyse order kyng englande toke departed england nat thyng shortly passe ouer ther neuer departed englande suche army well ordred p kyng departed realme made lordes france suche prisoner put dyuers pla e stronge castelles realme surer frenche kyng set towre lo yonge sonne hym moche pleasure sport restrayned straytlyer kept euery man commaunded go douer shyppes redy passe ouer euery man drewe thyder none abode home bytwene age twentie threscore nere hande lordes knyghtes squyers went douer except suche kyng apoynted kepe realme castels march hauyns whan assembled douer kynge toke muster sayde playnly entencyon passe ouer realme france nat retourne agayn tyll made ende warre el sufficyent peace great honour profet el dye payne therfore sayd nat well wylling go ouer returne agayn backe euery man sayd gladde serue hym entred shyppes name god saynt george arryued calays two dayes feest alsayntes yere lorde ccc lix p kyng england departed fro calais order host ridyng picardy cytie reynes cap cc vii whan kyng prince son arryued calys also thre sonnes say lorde lyonell erle ulster lorde john erle rychmont ye lorde edmonde yongest foure people hadde dyscharged shyppes horse prouysion taryed ther foure dayes euery man co maunded make redy depart sayeng howe wolde ryde cosyn duke lancastre kyng mornyng departed fro calays company caryages best order euer army yssued oute towne sayd sixe thousand charyettes carte brought england well furnysshed ordred bataylles richely besene ioye beholde costable erle de la marche fyue hundred knyghtes armed thousand archer batayle kyng batayle thre thousande men armes v thousande archer good order ridyng constable batayle next kyng batayle came caryage contayned two leag length mo fyue thousand charyettes carte caryeng prouisyon hoost withall thynges householde nat besene caryed men warre handmylles ouyns bake suche thynges necessary next came prince batayle bretherne wherin two thousande speares nobly horsed richely besene order redy fyght rode nat past four leages day maner encountred duke lancastre strange lordes bytwene calys abbey lykes fayre playn kynges hoost ther fyue hundred varlettes wt matockes ax make euyn wayes caryage passe p nowe shall name vnto certayne lordes knyghtes englande passed see kynge company duke lancastre kynges cosyn germayn first iiii sonnes prince edward sir lyonell sir johane sir edmonde sir henry duke lancastre sir john erle de la marche costable englande erle warwyke erle suffolke marshall englande erle herforde northampton erle salysbury therle stafforde erle oxenford bysshop lyncolne bysshoppe dyrham lorde percy lorde neuell lorde spenser lorde rose lorde manny lorde renolde cobham ye lorde monbray lorde dalawar lorde john chandos sir rycharde penbruge lorde manne lorde wylloughby lorde feltone lorde basset lorde crabalton lorde sylua yer sir james awdeley sir bartylmewe de brunes lorde salyche sir stephyn gonsanton sir hewe hastynges sir johan lysle sir nowell lormych dyuers nat name rode arthoyes passed cytie arras toke way duke lancastre paste coude fynde nothynge lyue playne countrey lefte put fortress also coutre ben long poore sore wasted dere season realme france great famyne ranne generally contre yerth nat ben laboured thre yer otes whete nat come heynault cambresis people arthoyes uermadoys bysshoprike laone reynes dyed huger kyng englande departed owne realme herde great famyne countre lordes brought prouysion except otes strawe wherfore made good shyft horse might also season sore reyning weyt dyd great trouble horse also moost part day night reyned without cease wyne yere lytell worth kyng england rode small iourneys tyll aproched balpausmes shall shewe adueture fyll sir galahault rybamont right hardy expert knyght picardy ye shall knowe townes cyties castelles passage way kyng went surely kept euery towne picardy tooke soudyours wage suretie erle saynt poule two hundred speares cytie arras constable fraunce amyense lorde monsalt corby sir edwarde rancy sir ingram hedyn balpausmes sir baudwyn dannekyns maister crosbowes saynt nuyntines thus euery towne cytie knewe playnly kyng englande wolde come ley siege reynes peron uermandoys whiche kyng englandes way capitayne ruler towne englysshmen aproched dayly wherfore nat well ease towne standeth ryuer soe thenglysshmen lightly euer folowed ryuers last peron remembred sir galahaut rybamont nat receyued capitayne towne enfourmed tourney sende courtesse letter hym desyryng wolde helpe kepe towne perone suche company coude gette promysed gyue owne person euery day twentie frakes euery knight vnder hym ten euery speare thre horse one franke day sir galahaut desyred exercyse feat armes sawe howe desyred peron neyghburs lightly agreed sende worde howe wolde seconde day prepared hym gette suche company coude departed fro tourney thyrtie hym alwayes nombre encreased sende sir roger coloyne mete hym certayne place apoynted sir roger came thyder twentie hym last ser galahaut fyftie speares lodged one night chynge peron warde within two leages thenglysshe hoost lytell vyllage feldes whiche boyde people countrey fledde forteresses next mornyng defmyned entre peron nat farre then whan supper hour mydnight sette watche iangeled one another dyuers mater ser galahault sayde shalbe morowe betymes peron yet entre shall counsell ryde froter enemyes thinke among theym auaunce themselfe seke forage woll come abrode mornyng may fortune mete suche shall pay scotte agreed company kept secrete brekyng day redy horse sadled rode forthe good order went way peron coosted wodes se coude fynde aduetur came vyllage people fortyfied church sir galahaut lighted knewe well bredde wyne vitaylles within offered hym take wolde whyle ther sir galahalt called two squyers wherof bridoll tallone one sayd sir go ryde forth foldes dyscouer countre euery way loke ye se thynge come hyder agayne woll abyde two squyers well horsed rode forthe feldes went wood halfe leage thense mornynge ryden forthe sir renault boulant almaygne company duke lacasters returnyng agayne came place two squyers wende ben men armes countre ther busshement last spyed well howe almaygnes thane two squyers spake toguyder sayd must fayne v partie sir renault boulant spake demauded language almaygne bridoll answered coude well speke la gage sayd sir tayning sir bartylmewe de bonnes wher sir bartylmewe sayd sir renolde sir sayd ya der vyllage dothe tary sayde knyght sir sayde v hesende v abrode se coude fynde forage abrode countre fayth sayd knyght none haue ryden mornyng canne fynde nothyng wherfore go ryde hym bydde hym come away let v ryde togyder toward saynt quyntines se fynde ther better market good adue ture sir sayd squyer wolde haue hym copany call knyght renolde boulande say sir bartylmewe two squiers returned vyllage assone sir galahault sawe demaunded tidynges haue ye thing sone yes sir haue sene ynough sir yander wood sir renold boulant xxx wt hym hath ryden morning desyreth sore haue company ryde togyder towardesaynt quyntines sir galahaut say sir renolde boulant knight almayne reteyned kyng englande sir knowe well sayde squyers howe departed fro hym sayde sir galahaut shall shewe sayd sir bridoll shewed hym ye wordes ben bytwene whan sir galahaut herde studyed lytell demaunded counsayle sir ronger colayne suche knightes ther best answered sayde sir ye desyre euer fynde aduentur syth fall handes take theym alwayes right armes man ought greue ennemy counsayle lightly agreed sir galahault desyrous fynde enemyes lept courser dyd basenet vyser bycause wolde natte knowen dyd copany yssued vyllage toke feldes determyned wolde rode ye right hande warde wode wher sir reynold taryed lx men armes sir renolde nat past x whan sir renolde sawe theym displayed bauer hym came softely ridynge towarde wenyng hym englysshmen whane aproched lyft vp vyser saluted sir galahaut name ser bartylmewe de bonnes sir galahaut helde hymselfe styll secrete answered fayntly sayd lette v ryde forth rode men one syde almaygnes whan sir reynolde boulant sawe maner howe sir galahaut rode somtyme hym spake worde tha began suspecte nat ryden space quart houre stode styll vnder baner among men sayd sir haue dout knyght ye thynke ye nat sir bartylmewe de bonnes knowe hym well se well nat woll ye tell yo name ryde farther company therwith sir galahaut lyft vp vyser rode towardes knyght haue taken hym raygne bridell cryed lady rybamont sir roger coloyne sayde coloyne rescue whan sir renold boulat sawe case nat greatly afrayed drewe swerde ser galahaut wolde haue taken hym bridell sir reynolde put swerde clene throught hym drue agayne swerd hym toke horse ye spurres left sir galahaut sore hurt whan sir galahaltes men sawe maister case sore dyspleased sette sir renaldes men ther many cast yerth assoone sir renolde gyuen sir galahaut stroke strake horse spurres toke feldes certayne galahaultes squyers chased hym whan sawe folowed ner must tourne agayne el beshamed lyke hardy knight tourned abode tormast gaue hym suche stroke lyst folowe thus rode serued thre folowed hym wouded sore good ben handes euery stroke stayne man dyd moche daunger frenchman saued hymselfe without hurt enemyes reputed gret prowes dyd herde therof men ner slayne taken fewe saued sir galahault caryed fro thense sore hurt perone hurte neuer perfetly hole knyght suche courage hurt wolde nat spare hymselfe wherfore lyued nat longe nowe lette v retourne kyng englande howe layed siege reynes p howe kyng englande besieged cite reynes castell chargny taken thenglysshmen warre began agayne bytwene duke norma dy kyng nauer cap c c viii englysshmen dyde somoche passed atthoyes founde poore contrey entred cambresis founde better market nothyng put fortress bycause thought theselfe well assured kyng englande copany bycause helde thempyre kyng englande thought nat kyng went lodged beauuoyes cambresis ther abode foure dayes refresshe horse ouer ranne moost part cabresis bysshopp pyer cambray cou saylles lordes countrey good townes saue conduct send certayne messangers kyng englande knowe tytell made warre answered bycause tyme paste made alyance conforted frenchman mayntened townes forteresses maner made warre enemyes wherfore englysshmen sayd might well reason make warre agayne answere coude haue non wherfore ca bresys fayne bere damage aswell might thus kyng england passed cambresis went thierache men ranne ouer countrey sydes toke forage wher might gette day sir bartylme de bonnes ranne saynt quintyne adueture mette capitayne therof called sir baudewyn danekyn ther great fray bytwene many ouerthrowen bothe partes finally englysshmen obtayned vyctorie sir baudwyn taken prisoner bartylmew bonnes thenglysshmen retourned kyng lodged abbey fenney vitaylles ynought horse rode forthe without lette tyll came march reynes kynge tooke lodgynge saynt wall beyonde reynes prynce wale saynt thierry duke lancastre erles barownes knyghtes lodged vyllages aboute reynes nat case hert wynter saynt andrewes tyde great wyndes rayne horse yuell lodged entreated countrey two thre yere yerth nat benla boured wherfore forage gette abrode vnder x xii leages wherby many frayes somtyme theglisshmen wan somtyme lost good cytie reynes tyme capitayne sir john craon archbysshoppe place erle porcyen sir porcyen brother lorde de la bonne lorde canency lorde annore lorde lore dyuerse lordes knyghtes squyers march reyns defended cytie well tooke damage siege duryng cytie stronge well kept kynge england also wolde nat suffre assaut made bycause wolde nat traueyle hurte people kynge abode siege fro feest saynt andre beginnyng lent host rode often tymes abrode fynde adueture coutie rethell warke maysey douchery moyson wolde lodge host thre foure dayes robhe pylle cousrey without resistence agayne repaire oost season yr ustace breticourt toke good towne acherey ryuer esne therin founde great ple tye victailles specially wyne foude ther vessel wherof send great part kynge prince gaue hym great thauke therfore duryng siege knyghtes sought aduentures fortuned syr john chanoos syr james audeley lorde mucident sir richarde pountchardon companyes rode nere chalons champaigne came chargny en dormoy ryght faire castell well auewed made assaute couetted greatly haue castell two good knightes one named syr john chapel bare armes gold ancre sable sore assaute assaute lord mucident aduentured hym selfe forewarde stryken heed stone suche wyse dyed amonge men whose dethe knightes sore vispleased sware nat departe thense tyll castell theyr pleasure wherby assawte encreassed many sea armes done gascoyns sore displeased dethe theyr maister capitayne lorde mucident entred dyke without feare came walles mouted vp theyr targes ouer theyr hedes mean tyme archars shotte holy guyther none appered without great parell castell sore assayled laste taken losse hurte many two capytaynes taken certayne squyers reside slayne oute mercy rased downe brent muche myght castell bycause wolde nat kepe retourned theyr shewed kynge done duryng siege reinnes began agayne great grudge euyll wyll betwene kynge nauer duke normandye reason cause nat tell kynge nauer departed sodaynly parys went maunte ryuer seyne de ied duke normandy bretherne great meruayle tytle renewed agayne warre shadowe warre squyer bruceis called ostraste toke stronge callell robeboyls ryuer seyne leage maunte made garyso whiche dy moche hurte parys therabout also season lorde gommegines gone englade quene whan kyng sent straugers calayes repassed see agayn came heynalt hys companye certayne knyghtes squyers gascoyn england theyr entente go kynge englande siege reines yonge lorde gommegines desyrynge haue auauncement assembled certayne men warre guether iii c oone departed maubuge came uesnes haynaulte passed forthe atrelon tyme lorde ray laye grayson ray thierase good nombre knyghtes squiers hym knewe suche spyeng made lorde gommegines assembled certayne warre guether go siege reinnes ayde kynge englande knewe well must passe thierrasse soone knewe certaynte settynge forewarde sente worde therof certayne companyons thereaboute frenche partye specyally lorde robert chanoyne robersart gouerned yong erle coucis landes lay castell merle whan chanoyne knewe therof nat colde sette forward incontinent went lorde roy sourty speares ther lorde roy made chie capytayne iourney hit good reason great lorde pycardye well renowmed man armes well knowen many place went forthe nombre thre hundred men armes laye busshement knewe lorde gommegines shuld passe entred thierasse toke way reinnes nat doubtyng encountryng mornynge came vyllage called haberguy thought rest littell refress hym company alyghted entred village stable theyr horse meane season lorde gommegynes yong lusty ryght desirous dedes armes sayde howe wolde tyde village se yf coulde fyne better forage toke hym certayne cristo quyer bare penon departed abergey frenchemen say busshement lyttell village thynkyng haue entred towne nyght haue sette theyr ennemyes knew well lorde g meg e fel ha whan frenchemen sawe hym comynge pre company meruayle fyrste sent afore two currers brought worde agayne theyr nnemyes whan harde brake theyr busshement cryed roy name lorde roy lord roy came bane hym displa ed hym lorde flamot roy cosyn syr loys robersart hanoyn robersart brother syr stram bo ne roy whan lorde gomegines sawe case like hardy knyght abode ennemies wolde nat flee fyrst brount lorde gomegines ouerthrowen coude nat ce ouer vp agayne finally taken two squyers gascoyne hym fought right val auntly also cristoferde mur taken bare penon slayne taken excepte theyr varlettes scaped ronnynge awaye well horsed also nat chased p howe lorde roy dyscomfetted lord gomegines castell commercy taken englisshemen cap cc ix wwhan knyghtes squyers taken lorde gomegines suche issued village hym toke theyr horse spo anne village c yenge roy name lorde roy wherof towne wer sore abasshed whan saw theyr ennemyes nere parte vnarmed spred abrode village oude nat drawe together frenchemen toke theym theyr cha ne robersart prisonners bycause knowen baner fledde littell stronge howse enuyroned water standynge townes ende theym sayd howe best kepe affirmynge howe house strenge ynough kepe tyl might send worde case wer kynge englande beyng siege reinnes nat doubtynge woll incontinent sende ayde sayd doynge suerte theym seynge howe theyr ennemyes rounde thus stryfe among selfe myght mean space theder came lorde roy sayd r yelde vp selfe assaile ye deed inco ynent shall take per force workes moost hardyest abasshed yelded theymselfe prysoners theyr lyues saued allouly sent prisoner castell coucy frenche garysons aduenture fell yere lorde ccc lix wherof kyng englande whan knew sore displeased coude nat amend tyme nowe let v returne siege nne speke aduenture fell syr bertilmewe brennes besieged towne castell comercy within capitayne knyght champaygne called syr henry denoyr siege durynge reyns lordes ost lodged abrode coutrey lie theyr ease kepe wayes prouysion shulde entre citie amonge syr bertilmewe de bonnes company speares archer lodged nere comercy strong castell parteynynge ar hebysshoppe reynes whiche bysshop made stronge garyson castell doubted none assaute ther square tou e thick walled fensably fournisshed warre syr bartilmewe de bonnes layde siege therto sawe well howe coulde nat wynne assaute set warke certayne numbre miner gaue good wage bega werk night day dyd moche myned farre vnder great towre went sette vp proppes within knewe nothyng therof whan myners made ende towre fall wha yst came ser bar sayd syr haue great towte shall fall whan pleaseth well quo knyght ye haue well done tyll commaun e toke johsi de guyltell hym went castell madesigne wold speke within syr henry denoyr capitayne cameto bat mentes walles demaunded wolde haue woll sayd syr bartilmewe ye ye york orels ye deed without remedy howe quod syr henry began smyle prouyded thynges ye wolde haue v yelde symply whiche woll nat well quod bartilmewe ye knewe case ye stande ye wolde continent yelde vp withoute wordes quod syr henry case quod englysshe knyght shall shewe ye shall haue assurance entre agayn ye lyste syr henry iiii hy issued came syr bar johsi e guyltelles brought hym myne shewed hym great toure stode stage tymbre whan knyght sawe parell hys company sayd syr ye haue done great yelde v pleasure syr bartilme toke prisoner made euery come castell al theyr goodes set yer myne brent stage toure claue souder fell erthe lo syr mewe ser henry beholde nowe yf truth nat syr truesayd ser hery prisoner pleasure thanke courtesye v case shulde nat haue delte thus garison taken prisoner ca tell kynge englande la e siege reinnes vii weekes made none assaute knew well shuld haue lost payne whan ha longe wer hys men coulde fynde forage abrode lost horse beganne la ke bay departed good e waye chalo champaygne chalons went nged mery whiche called viii leages kynge laye mery counstable awarde went saynt florentyne sy edwarde rency capitayne ther great assaute good dyd kynge came thither lodged ther yuer mouson departed came tonnerre toke towne assaute nat castell whiche towne englysshemen founde beyonde myne whiche necessary within castell lorde fyennes constable fraunce great nombre men warre p howe kyng englande went wasted distroyed countrey howe came aguillo taried great prouysyon came ost cc chapitre kynge englande oost ested space v dayes yt good wynes foude ofte tymes assayled ye castell therin goode men armes syr baudwyn neken maiste crosbowes whan kynge well refresshed oost tonuer departed passed ryuer armencon lefte waye aussetre ryght hande toke waye noyers entent entre borgoyn lente tyme passed noyers without assaute lorde therof prisone euer syth bata le poicters kynge went towne called mo royall thense aguillon riuer selettes squier called john enson bare armes azute asko hy syluer wonne towne flauigny nat farre theuse founde therin great prouysion maner victaylles serue oo space moneth whiche came welle passe kynge laye aguillon fro wednysday tyll mydlet alwayes hals currou ouer anne coutrey wastynge e ilynge often tymes refresshed oost newe prouision kynge englande great men euer theym cariages emes pa lion mylles ouyns forge syeth bake forge shoos horse thynges necessary carte euery carte lest good horse brought englande also brought carte certayne botes made lether subtilly wrought sufficiently uery one receyue iii men row water riuers fysshe pleasure whiche dyd great lorde moche pleasure lent season also kynge koners horsbacke haukes ple houndes many greyhou ere euery daye eyther hunted hauked ryuer pleased hym r great lordes hundes well kyng euer ost went thre datailes euery ayle vawarde euery oost lodged themselfe eche leage th kynge kept thirde bataile whiche greattest maner kepte fro tyme remoued calais tyll came good towne charter kynge englande laye aguillon great uision oost meanes john alenson found f auig whyle kynge lay aguillon th yonge duke burgoyne counsayle request al countrey sent kyng englande certayne messangers lordes knyghtes treate respite nat burne countrey ouer ronne lordes went treate mater fyrst lorde ser ceaulme sallins great chau burgoyn ser jaques uiene ser john e ye ser hugh uiene ser william tho se ser john mo tmartin lordes foude kyng englande treatable ther composicion made betwene ye kyng englande countrey bourgoyn kynge made assuraunce hym nat ouer ren countrey space iii yeres haue redy somme ii frankes whan treaty agreed sealed kynge dislodged al oost ke right waye paris lodged ye er dyonne leon besyde uoselay peple laye alonge ryuer syde welnere thentre coutie neuers englisshemen entred gastenoys kyng sped hym iourneis came paris lay ii leag thes burg le royne thus kynge rode countrey distroyeng hym also garysons made warre hym beauuoisy pycardy france brye chapaigne destroyed nere countrey also kyng nauer march norma dy made also sore warre thus ye noble realme france sore greued side specially syr eustace dambreticourt laye chemy riuer esne great garison soudiers wasted raunsommed pilled countrey ouer ranne countie rethel douchery mesieres chene pou lleux tenay countie bay rode lay countrey lyst ii iii nyght together without let trouble whan lyst retourned agayne fortresse chemy true lordes knyghtes countrey thereabout sore displeased fortresse assigned many dayes amonge selfe mete go lay siege chemy howe neuer dyd nothyng companyons whoymagined nyght day howe might geat steale townes fortress nyght ame strong towne good castell laonnoyse nere montague fortresse called pierpont standyng maresse ye season within towne great nobre men coutrey brought thither theyr goodes trust stregth place whan chemy came thither watche within spared nat dangero mare went came walles entred towne wane without defence obded pleasure found ther rich euer founde towne wh day brent towne returned che well furnysshed great pyllage p kyng england put realme frace great tribulacio phicies frere auygnon thenglisshe busshement layd paris cap c c xi season frere minor full great clergie cite auigno called frere john roche tayllade whiche frere pope innocent vi held prison castell baignoux shewyng many meruailes come principally shewen many thynges fall prelate churche great super uitie pryde vsed amonge theym also spake many thynges fall realme fraunce great lordes chri ome oppression dyd pore como people frere sayd wolde proue sayynges auctorite ap lippi bokes holy sayntes prophettes whiche wer opened hym grace holy gooste shewed many thynges harde beleue many thynges fell say sayd nat prophette shewed auctorite aunciet scripture grace holy goost gaue hym v derstadynge declare auncient proph cie shewe cristen people yeres tyme whan suche thynges shulde made dyuerse bookes founded great ciences clergie wherof one made yere lorde ccc xlvi wherin written suche meruailes hard beleue howe many thynges accordyng therto ell whan demauded warres france sayd ben seen nat lyke shulde seen sayde warres fraunce shulde nat ended tyll realme vtterly wasted exyled euery parte whiche sayeng well seen noble realme fraunce sore wasted exyled specially terme sayd frere ha sette whiche yeres lorde ccc lvii lviii lix sayde yeres pryncis gentylmen realme feare shewe selfe agaynst people lowe estate assembled cou without heed capitayne shulde lyste realme fraunce whiche ye haue herde howe companyons assembled theym guether son theyr robbery pyllage wa riche became great capitaynes nowe lette v retourne kynge englande laye bourge royne two lyttell leages ro parys ooste towardes mou hery kynge sente herauldes paris duke normandy laye great companye men warre demaunde batayle duke wolde nat agree therto messangers returned without thynge whan kynge sawe shulde hau batayle sore isplease gaulter manny desyred kynge myght make rymyshe bayles parys kynge agreed therto named suche shulde go hym kyng made certayne newe knyghtes lorde fitz wa er lorde siluacier syr balastre william torceaux syr thomas spencer syr johan neuell syr richarde dostenay also kynge wolde haue made knyght colla dambreticourte sonne syr nicholas squier kynges body squ e excused hym selfe sayde coulde nat fynde bassenette lorde manny dyd enterprise brought new knyghtes skrymyshe barrier parys sore skrymyshe within cite mane good knyghtes squiers wolde gladly haue issued ye duke normandy wold agreed therto howe defended theyr gate barryers suche wyse toke litell ammage skrymy endured mornynge tyll noone diuers hurte partyes lorde manny withdrewe lodgynge taryed daye nexte nyght folowynge next daye kyng ged toke waye towarde moutlehe certayne knyghtes englande ga coyne theyr dislodgyng determined ly busshment thought ther many gentylme parys wold aduenture issue oute two hundred chosen men armes gascoyns englisshe layed selfe busshemet voyd house iii leages fro parys captall buz ser edmonde pomiers lorde courton gascoyns ther englisshe lorde neuell lorde mombray syr richarde pounchardon vi knyghtes chie capitaynes imbu shement whan frenchemen parys sawe dyslodgynge englysshe oost certayne yonge knyghtes drewe guether sayd good issued cite secretly folowe englisshe oost perauenture may happe somwhat wynne anone agreed purpose syr ra coucy sir rau remenall lorde montsault lorde helay chatelayne beauuoys begue uillaines lorde beausiers lorde ulbari sir gauwen ualouell sir fla ant roy syr elles cauilly syr peter armoises peter sauoise peares theyr copany issued well horsed well wylled dede armes rode way bourge le royne passed rode forwarde passed englisse busshemet whan passed englysshe men gascoynes brake sette cryeng theyr cryes trenchemen returned great meruaile incontinent knewe howe theyr ennemies stode styll set selfe ordre batayle couched speares agaynst englisshmen gascoyns first metynge sore iust diuerse cast erthe bothe party wer well horsed tha drew theyr swerdes entred eche amog gyuyng great stroke done many propre feat armes fight endured great space none coulde tell shulde haue victory ther captall buz proued hym selfe good knyght dyd handes noble dedes armes finally englisshemen gascoyns bare selfe well victorie abode theyr part many half many agayne frenche men frenche tie lord capremy good knyght fought valiauntly vnder baner bare slayne lorde taken prisoner freche knyghtes squiers seing theyr euyll aduenture retourned towarde parys fought euer fled sore poursewed chace endured tyll paste bourg le royne taken ix knyghtes squiers englyssheme gascoyns pursewed nat doubted issuynge paris ben take slayne whan done theyr feat retourned moutlehery kyng england brought thither theyr prisoner raunsomed courtesly nyght suffred go whither lyste trusted theyr faithes entencion kynge englande entre good countrey b au se drawe alonge ryuere loyre yt somer abyde britayne tyll august vyntage retourne agayne france lay siege parys wolde nat retourne agayne englande bicause sayd departed englande wolde nat retourne agayne tyll fraunce pleasure lefte men garisons make warre france champayn poicton ponthieu uimeu uulgesyn normandy al realme fraunce good townes cite suche toke parte theyr owne good wylles season duke normandye parys two bretherne duke orle aunse theyr vncle counsailes ymagined well courage kyng englande howe mebrought realme frace great pouerte sawe well howe realme coulde nat longe endure case rente lordes church nygh lost euery parte sage discrete persone chauncellour fraunce called syr william montague bysshop tyrwin whose cousaile moche frace ruled good cause euer counsayle good true hym ii clerkes great prudence abbotte clugny maister frier prechers called syr symon langres maister diuinite two clerkes desyre duke normandy hole counsaile fraunce departed paris certayn article peace syr hewe geneue lorde autun company went kynge englande rode beausse towarde galardon two clerkes ii knyghtes spake kyng began fall treatye peace hym hys alies whiche treatye prince wale duke lacastre erle marche called treatie nat concluded longe dryuynge allwayes kyng went forward embassadours wold nat leaue kyng stylsued folowed theyr pourpose sawe howe frenche kynge poure estate realme lykely great ieopardye warre contynued somer longer syde kynge englande requyred great thynges preiudiciall realme fraunce lordes wolde nat agree therto theyr honour al theyr treatie whiche endured xvii dayes styll folowynge kynge sent euer theyr proces dayely duke normandy citie parys euer desyrynge haue agayne answere shulde farther whyche cesse secretly sufficiently examyned regentes chambre parys answere sent agayne wryttynge shulde shulde offre ambassadours often tymes kynge went forewarde towarde cite charter place great offer made come conclusion warre haue peace whiche offer kynge england hard harted agree vnto entension kynge fraunce dye estate duke lancastre cosyn nat counsayled hym haue peace wolde nat agreed thervnto sayd kynge syr warre ye make realme frace ryght maruaylous ryght fauourable men wynne great ryches ye lese tyme thyngess consyderedde ye come entente ye maye happe make warre dayes lyfe syr wold counsayle syth ye may leaue warre honoure profytte accepte offer ben made vnto syr myght lese daye haue wonne twenty yere suche fayre subtyle wordes duke lancastre sayde good entencion welthe kynge subiectes co uerted kynge grace holy goost chief warker case daye kynge charter fell case greatly hu led kyngess courage whyle ambassadours treatynge peace none agreable answere fell sodaynly suche tempest tho der lyghtnyng rayne hayle kyngess oost semed worlde shulde haue ended fell heuyn suche great stone slewe men horse mooste hardyest abasshed kyng englande behelde churche lady charter auowed deuoutly lady agre peace sayd confessed lodged avillage nere charter called bretigny made certayne composicions peace vpon certayne article ordeyned syrmely concluded ambassadours kynge englande counsayle ther ordeyned good delyberacion aduyce letter called charter peace wherof effecte foweth pthe fourme tenor letter pea made charter bitwene kynges englande fraunce cap cc xii edward grace god kynge englande lord irelande aquitaine present letter shall come sende gretyng howe discencios debate striffess moued hereafter moued bytwene v ryght dere brother frenche kynge certayne commyssyoners procurer dere sonne prince wale hauyng sufficient power auctorite v hym hole realme one parte certayne commyssyoners procurer dere brother frenche kyng right dere nephewe charles duke normandy dolphyn uienne eldest sonne sayd brother fraunce hauynge power auctorite father part also hym selfe assembled bretigny nere charter whiche place agreed accorded sayd commyssyoners procurer eyther party vpon discencions debate warres discordes whiche treates procurer sonnes v hym also procurer sayd brother sayd nephew father hym swereth holy euangelyst hold kepe accomplysshe treatie whithe accorde amonge thynges brother fraunce sayd sonne bounde promyseth delyuer leaue v heires successours euer county cite townes castels fortress landes iles rente reuennues thynges foloweth besyde haue holde redy guyen sascoyne possede perpetually v heires successours demayne fee tyme maner hereafter declared say castell countie poicters al landes countrey poictow fee thowars landes bellville cite castell xayntis landes counte xaynton sydes ryuer charente towne forteresse rochelle theyr appurtenaunces citie castell agene countrey agenoyse citie towne castell pierregourte countrey therto belongynge cite castell lymoges landes coutrey lymosyn cite castell caours castell countrey tarbe la de coutrey countie bigore countie countrey la de gowre citie castell angolesme countrey therto perteynynge citie towne castell rodaix coutie coutrey rouergne duchye guyne lordes erle foiz erle armmake erle lisle uicount carmaine erle pierregourt uicount lymoges holdynge la de within foresayde bondes shall homage v seruicis due accustomed landes place maner fourme haue done tyme past kynges englande aunciently haue also uicount muttrel see dyd tyme past kynges englande haue landes muttrell haue ben debate partage landes brother fra ce promyseth make declaracion thero v shortly canne comynge fraunce also countie poictow nterly saue excepted thynge aliened awaye kynges englade tyme past wherby sayde countie purtenaunces haue ben holden persones frenche kynges said brother successours shall nat boude rendre v sayde alienacions haue ben done frenche kynges tyme beynge without meane sayd brother nowe hauynge agayne possession shall leaue entierly v excepte fre che kynges theym exchaunge landes kynges englande tyme beynge haue alyened transported thynge personnes frenche kynges perauenture yet nowe become handes sayde brother shall nat bounde rend v also rendre v suche thynges ought homage v successours ought none v successours tha shall delyuer v tenour ought within yere shall departed calais also castell towne calais castell towne seignorie merle townes castelles seignories sangates coulougne baynes wale oye landes woddes maresthes ryuers rente reuenues seignories auousons church appurtenaunces place lyenge bitwene boundes bourne folowynge say calais ryuer grauelyng also fro riuer falleth great lake guiens vnto fretin fro thense alonge valey moutayn karlenly enclosynge mountayne see sangatis apurtenauncis castell towne hole countie guynes townes castels fortress lades place homage men seignories woddes forestes right belongynge entierly towne calais merle place named well v haue obeyed sayd brother erle guynes tyme beyng thynges coprised present article merle calais hold demayn excepte heritage perteynynge church whiche shall styll remayne hooly church whereso euer also excepte heritage people merle calais vnder value c li lande yere money currat vnder heritage haue styll habitacios heritage beynge towne calais apurtenaunces shal abide styll inhabitantes lades townes countie guynes theyr demaynes shall styll remayne except hath ben said foresayd boundes bormes article calais iles addressynge la de couties place named iles whiche helde tyme sayd treatye hath agreed oursayd brother eldest son shulde renounce maner soueraynte resorte rightes shulde haue theym shall holde hys neyghbour without resorte soueraynte sayd brother realme france right oure sayde brother hath foresayde thynges yeldeth transporteth v perpetually also hit agreed semblably sayde son expressely renounce thynges oughte nat delyuered v sayde treatye specially name right crowne fraunce realme homage seueraynte demayne duchye normandy countie thouraine th couties aniou mayn souer homage duchie britaigne except right erle moutfort ought myght haue duchye countrey britaygne whiche reserue expresse wordes putte clene treaty sauynge sayd brother whan come calais shal ordre mater aduyse counsaylles deputed shal sette peace concorde bitwene erle mountforte cousyn lorde charles bloys challengeth demaundeth right heritage britaigne renounce demaudes make may make euer except suche forsayd thynges ought abyde v ought delyuered v heires treatie transport sese right myght haue thynges oughte nat delyuered v treatie whiche thynges viuerse altercacions specially bicause sayde renounciacion tra sportes sessynge leauynge sayde thynges shulde accomplysshed soone said brother hath delyuered v deputy cite castell poicters al lande countrey poictou fee thouars fayre towne citie castell agene lande countrey agenoyse citie castell piergourt lande countrey pierrigins cite castell caours lande coursin citie castell rodais lande countrey rouergne citie castell xaintes lande therto belogynge citie castell lymoges kynges england aunciently helde towne monterell vpon see thappurtenauces also coutie pontheu hole entierly saue excepte tenoure article coteyned sayd treatie maketh mencion sayde countie item castell towne calais castell towne seignorie sangates colougue baines wale oye landes ryuers maresshes woddes rente seignories thynges conteyned article ther makyng mencion also castell towne hole entierly countie guynes landes castelles townes forteresses place menne homage seignories woddes forestes ryghtes accordynge tenour article thero makynge mencyon playnly sayde treatye iles holde redy saye tyme thys sayd treatye peace brother frenche kynge haue promysed faythe oothe eche treatye peace holde kepe accomplisshe nat contrarye bound sayde brother eldeste sonnes obligacion promyse faythe othe one parte except certayne renounciacyons one accordynge tenour fourme sayd article peace whero tenour forme foloweth also hit agreed frenche kynge eldest sonne regent theyr heires euer soone may without male engin leest fest saynt michaell next comyng shall rendre delyuer sayde kynge englande heyres successours transport honour regalities obeisaunce homage liegeaunces men fee seruices reconisauces othes rightes feaulties imperiall iurisdictions hyghe lowe resortes saue gardes seignories souerainties apperteyneth maye apperteyne maner wise kynges crowne fraunce persone bicause kynge crowne fraunce euer city townes castels landes iles countreys place named theyr appurtenaunces appendaunces euer duke erle vicount archebysshop prelate holy churche baronnes noble kynges successours crowne fraunce nothynge reserued none theyr heyres successours frenche kynges reason kynge crowne fraunce make challenge demaude tyme come kyng englade heires successours men subiectes sayd bicause sayd contreys place forenamed son theyr heires successours persones city county landes countreys iles castelles place named altheyr appurtenaunces appendauces shall holde kynge england perpetually peasably frely haue ouer seignorie souerainte obeysaunce liegeaunce subiects predecessours frenche kynge haue tyme paste kynges e gl theyr heires successours shall haue holde peasably fore named coutreys theyr fraunchese lyberties perpetuall lorde soueraygne liege neighbour frenche kyng realme frace without knowledgynge souerayn b aunce homage resorte subiection without doynge tyme come maner seruice reconisaunce kynge crowne fraunce city county castelles countres landes iles place personnes named also accorded frenche kyng eldeste sonne shall renounce expressely sayd resortes soueraynties yght haue myght haue hynges suche present treatye ought apperteyne delyuered kynge englande semblably kynge englande eldest sonne renouseth thynges suche present treatie ought nat delyuered hym renounseth al demaundes realme fraunce specially name right armes challenge crowne realme france homage souerainte demayne duchie normandy duchie thourayne county aniou mayn soueraynte homage coutie countrey flanders demaundes kynge englande made tyme sayde chalenge may make tyme come sayd realme fraunce maner cause soeuer except thys treatye shulde delyuered kynge englande heires transport cesse leaue eche kyng perpetually al right ought haue sayd thynges whiche pre treatie ought deliuered eche tyme place whan said renouncia shulde done bicause sayd brother france eldest son holde accomplysshe article sayde peace haue expressely renounsed resortes tie comprised sayd article right ought haue myght haue sayd thynges sayd brother hath delyuered left v thynges hensforth shall abyde eyne v reason sayde treatye peace also lyke wyse expressely renouce suche thynges ought nat delyuered v sayde treatye heires also demaundes make may make sayde brother fraunce specially name ryght crowne frauce realme homage soueraintie demayne duchie normandy couties aniou main thourayn homage souerainte countie flanders demau de make may make sayd brother euer cause alwayes except present treatie ought abyde v heyres shall transporte sesse leaue hym v eche best maner shortly canne suche ryght eche v oughte maye haue euery thynge whiche thys treatie peace ought abyde remayne delyuered eche v reserued church menne churche perteyneth may apperteine occupied witholde occasion warres shall agayne recompensed restored rendred delyuered also townes forteresses habitacions dweller shall remayne abyde theyr liberty francheses dyd came handes seignory confermed sayde brother fraunce yf required nat co trarye foresayde thynges subiections v thynges v heyres successours jurysdiction coh rcyon churche rome wyll consent holy father pope shall conferme sayde thynges gyuynge monycions generall commaundementes accomplysshement theym agaynste v heyres successours agaynste subiectes comons college vniuersities syngular personnes someuer gyue generall sentence cursynge suspencion enterdytynge renne vpon v vpon theym doth contrarye ren e vpon v soone theym attempte occupyenge towne castell citie forteresse thynge doynge ratyfienge consentynge gyuynge counsayle comfort fauour aide priuely openly agaynst sayde peace whiche sentence curse nat assoyledde vnto tyme full satisfaction made haue susteyne dammage behalf ouer woll cosent holy father pope entent thys sayde peace shulde fyrmelier kepte holde perpetually paction con e eracyons aliaunces couenauntes howe euer named thyng preiu icyall agaynst said peace maner way present tyme made supposed ferme delyuered certayne peynes othes confyrmed holy father pope cancelled stande nought thynge contrary comon weale vnprofitable peace christente ispleasat god promesses othes suche case shalbe shewed discussed holy father pope none b de holde kepe suche promyses othes aliauces couenautes thentent tyme come suche semblable case shulde nat done attempt cotrary voy none effecte v shall punyss suche violaters brekers peace theyr bodyes gooddes ca shall requyre accordynge reason procure suffre done cotrary god forbyd wol reputed fals vntrewe ren suche estate blame defame kynge sacred ght ren suche case swere body lorde jesu christ sayde thynges holde kepe accomplysshe nat contrary nother v one maner case entent sayd bondes shulde fulfylled ynde v heires goodes v heires sayd brother france heires also swere holy euangelist v corporally touched shall perfourme holde accomplisshe forsayd case sayd thynges v promysed accorded woll like case brother deputy place terme maner made mencion present v letter copr sed therin rt strength sayd letter haue pro ysed delyuered sayd alwayes saued reserued v heires successours sayd letter e corpored none effecte v maner preiudice damage vntyll season sayde brother nephewe haue made fente elyuered foresayde renoncia ion accordynge maner euised tyll one letter nat agaynste v heires successours maner wyse foresayd case witnesse whiche haue tt scale present letter yeuyn calais xxiiii day octobre yere lorde ccc lx whan letter chartre called letter renunciacion well one kynge engrosed wrytten sealed red openly counsayle chambre beyng present kynges theyr counsayles whiche semed eche ryght good well ordeyned agayne kynges sware eldest sonnes euangelist corporally touched body jesu christ consecrated kepe accoplisshe nat broke forsayd thynges yet farther aduise regarde frenche kyng counsa e ende parliamet kyng englande requyred wolde gyue sende generall commiss tyme held vndershadow warre townes castels fortress realme fraunce werby myght haue suche commaundement auoyde departe kyng englande wo wolde nothyng welth good peace norysshed bitwene hym frenche kyng brother sworne promysed lyghtly agreed requeste semed reason kyng englande commaunded counsaile suche commission shuld made best maner myght accordynge entent frenche kynge counsayle speciall co sayle bothe kynges dr theym guether wrytten engrosed aduyse bothe counsayles certayn commission wherof tenor foloweth edwarde grace god kyng englande lorde ireland aquitayne oure capytaynes kepers townes castelles adherauntes alies beynge party fraunce aswell cardy borgoyn aniou berrey normandy britaigu auuerne chapaigu mayn thourayne bondes lymitacion demayne tenure fraunce gretynge peace accorde hath ben made bytwene v brother fraunce alies adherentes comprisynge debate discordes hath ben bitwene v tyme past may haue sworne body jesu christ also eldest sonne child blodd outers prelate baron knyghtes moost notable realme englande like wyse hath sworne sayd brother sayd nephewe duke normandy nephewes said child dyuers barones knyghtes prelate sayd realme fraunce kepe peace though hit fortune fall hereafter men warre realme subiectes enforce take thyng contrary sayd peace takynge withholdynge fortress townes cite castelles takynge pyllage prisoner restynge persone goodes marchandyses thynge doyng agaynst peace whiche v shulde right displeasaunt may nat wyll suffre passe vnder shadow dissimulacion maner wyse woll power said thynges fynde remedy therfore woll desire ordeyne deliberacion counsaile none subiectes whatsomeuer estate codicion enforce thynge contrary sayd peace indoynge pillage takyng withholdynge fortress prisoner gooddes euer perteynynge realme fraunce sayd brother subiectes alies adherentes euer doynge agaynst sayd peace nat leaue ceace wyll nat rendre agayne damage done within moneth requyred officer sergeauntes publike persones dede allonlye without processe condempnacion reputed banysshed realme power also oute realme landes oure sayde brother theyr gooddes forfaited v demayn may founde within realme woll comaund expressely made traytours rebel agaynst v accordynge custome done cryme high treason withoute gyuynge yt case grace remyssion sufferance pardon like wyse done subiect whatsoeuer estate realme syde lee side take occupye holde fortresse whatsoeuer ayenst wyll shuld perteyne vnto brenneth raunsometh townes persones pyllage robbery mouyng warr within power subiectes commaunde expressely enioyne seneschal bailiffes prouostes chatelaynes officer eschewynge hygh displeasure peyne losynge office publysshe cause publisshed presentes certayne notable place within theyr rule commaundement one sen harde none hardy abyde fortresse teynyng realm france beyng ordinance treatie sayd peace peyne taken ennemie v sayd brother freche kynge see sayd thynges kept entierly fro poynt poynt woll euery man knowe negligent fayle thus beside foresayde payne shall cause rendre damage theyr defautes negligence shalbe greued damaged beside shal punysshe suche maner shalbe ensamble wytnes whiche thynges haue made letter patetes yeuyn calais xxiiii day octobre yere lorde iii c lx phow pea made king england frenche kyng called eche bretherne warres britayne hostage delyuered englysshemen frenche kyng deliuered theyr handes ca cc xiii letter co myssyons made deuysed deliuered well ordeined aduyce cou sayle party bothe kynges content fell communycacion lord charles bloys lord john mountford claymes made duchie britayn eche clamed great right haue yt heritage theyr coicacio might bring peace cocorde yet finally ther nothyng done yt mat er infurmed aff kyng england great affectyon make peace supposed
