ye tyme come men warr ye theyr parte shulde auoyde suche fortress garisons hewe ye tyme helde realme france muste depart place therfore kyng england counsaile thaught erpedient profitable men warre thus lyued pillage shuld drawe ye duchie britayn whiche good plentifull countrey rather shulde retourne agayne englande robbe pille imaginacion made shortly englysshemen breke fro comunicacion article britayne whiche euill done great synne dyd nomore mater dyd kynges ben well wyllyng therto aduice counsailles peace might haue ben made bitwene party eche haue ben content hadde ben gyuen reason treatye therby lord charles bloys myght haue agayn child lay prisoner england also perauenture lyued longer dyd bycause ye nothyng done mater warres neuer great duchie normady ye peace made bitwene kyng ye shall recorded historye suche barous knyghtes coutrey britayne vphelde susteyned parte duke henry lancastre right valiant sage ymagined knyght greatly loued ye erle mou ford aduaucement sayd kyng john france presens kyng englad moost parte theyr counsailes syr yet truce taken raines bitwene ye lord charles bloys erle mountforde nat expired hath day endure vnto first day maye next comyng whiche season kyng england present aduice cou saile consent prince sonne shall sende yonge duke lorde john moutforde certayne counsayle fraunce shall haue full aurtorite power comyn determyne suche ryght sayde lorde john ought haue successio father duchie britayne thus counsaile guether good way shal taken bytwene thynke good trew e relonged vnto fest saynt john baptist nere folowynge duke lancastre deuysed done concludedde lordes spake mater rynge john france great desyre retourne fraunce reason shewed kynge englande good corage signes loue might also nephewe prince wale lyke wyse dyd kynge england hym confirmacion loue two kynges ordinaunce peace called eche brother gaue iiii knyghtes eche theyr partes somme viii frankes yerely reuenues say eche haue ii frankes also bicause lande saynt sauiour ye uicout constantyne profite whiche came yerely englande gyft sale lorde godfrey harcourt made kynge englande hath ben shewed whiche lande nat comprised ordinaunce sayd treatye peace therfore euer shulde holde lande shulde become subiecte homage therfore freche kyng therfore kyng englande gaue lande syr john cha do done often tymes acceptable seruyce hym child request kyng englade frenche kyng good delyberacion good courage loue cofyrmed sealed gyfte ser john chandos possede haue landes true heritage euer whiche fayre lande profytable one yere well worthe xvi hundred frankes besyde yet diuerse letter alyaunces made whiche cannat make mencion space fyftene dayes orthere aboute whyle two kynges theyr sonnes counsailours calais dayly commonynge newe ordinaunces deuysed confermed ratifye peace nat hyndrynge brekynge fyrst letter euer made berynge one date ye surete whiche haue sen copy regestres chaunceryes kynges pand whan thynges well made deuised ordeyned coude nat amended corrected thought reason great alyaunces boundes wherin said kynges theyr childre bode sworne kepe peace nat likely haue ben broken howe peace helde nat longe ye shall boke whan hostage ye redemption frenche kynge comen calys kynge englande worn kepe peasably realme vi frankes payd kyng englandes deputy kyng englande made supper frenche kynge castell calais right wel ordered kynges child duke lancastre moost greattest lordes baron englande serued kynges bare heeded supper fynally two kynges toke leaue eche ryght gracyously amyably frenche kynge returned lodgyng next mornyng ye whiche vigill saynt symonde jude frenche kynge departed calais suche thulde departe hym kynge went fote pilgrimage lady boloyn prince walys two bretherne company lorde lyonelle lorde aymo went fote dyner boloyn resceyued great ioy duke normandy redy taryenge lordes went fote churche lady dyd offerynges right deuoutly returned abbay whiche apparelled kynge receyue lordes englande day nexte nyght retourned agayne calats kynge theyr father fynally guether passed thesee hostage fraunce whiche vigill sayntes yere lorde c c c lx reason name nobleman realme frauce entred englande hostage frenche kyng first lorde philip duke orliaunce sometyme sonne kynge philip france also two nephewes duke aniou ye duke berry also duke bourbon erle alanson lorde john stampes guy bloys countie loys bloys brother erle saynt poule erle harecourt erle daulphyn auuergne ser ingram lorde coucy ser john ligny erle porccen erle bresme lord mo morency lorde roy lorde preault lorde stouteuill lorde clerettes lorde saynt wenant lorde toure aunergne diuers ye whiche cannat name also good cite parys roen reinnes burges berry towrs tourayn lyon riuer roan seins bourgoyn orleance troye champaigne amiens beauuoys arras tournay caen normandy saint omers lysle dowaye euery cite ii burgess thus fynally passed see came good cite london kyng englade commaunded enioyned officer great paynes shuld lordes theyr company curtoyse fauorable kepe defende theym theyr company euill rule whiche commaundement well kept vpholde al poyntes lordes hostagers sported withoute perill daunger cite pleasure great lordes went huntynge haukyng theyr pleasure rode countrey dysited lady damusels without co trollynge founde kyng england curtoyse amiable nowe let v somwhat speke frenche kynge come boloyn departed fro calais ye haue harde p commyssyoners ordeyned bothe party auoyde garisos realme france companion assembled together realme great euils dyd cap c c xiiii frenche kynge taried nat longe boloyn departed feest saint went montrell hedyn good cite amiens taryed tyll nere christmas departed went parys solemnly reuerently receyued clergye parys conueyed palys alyghted philip al lordes ther hym noble dyner apparelled neuer shewe deuise howe frenche kynge wa receyued retourne realme maner people presence greatly desyred amonge gaue hym many fayre riche gyftes visite hym thither came prelate baroness realme felted made great chere hym asshit wa theyr duite kynge receyued right swetely anone ofter kyng john wa returned fraunce ther passed see suche persones commytted kynge englande take possessyon landes countreys county ba wykes cite ca telles forteressess shulde delyuered reason teeatie peace made howe ye nat soone done diuerse lordes languedor wolde nat yr e obeye yelde selfe holde kynge englande frenche kynge hadde quyted theyr faith homage shulde haue done hym semed right con trarte obey engl hemen specially farre macches marche erle piergourt erle gomegines vicount chaltellon ount carmaing lorde pyncorne dyuerse maruailed greatly resort alligeance frenche kyng quyted wold haue englisshemen e sayd kyng ought nat acquite right myght sayd ther gascoy olde auncient charter priuileges graunted great charlemayne kynge fraunce myght nat put resort aliegeaunce court allonely therfore lordes first lde nat obey pointmet frenche kyng wolde hold accomply sworne sealed vnto sent thither lorde james bourbon dere osyn apeased moost parte sayd lordes became liege menne kynge england erle arminacke lorde dalbret many desyre frenche kynge lorde bourbon hiss cosyn obeyed englysshemen full sore agaynste theyr wylless also see syde poictou rochelss aynton thyss composicion right displea lordes knyght good townes con trey whan sawe theym become englisshe specially towne rochell wolde nat agree therto excused selfe often tymes contynued hole yere wolde nat suffre englisshemen entre towne meruaile reherse amiable swete word wrote frenche kynge desyrynge hym goddess sake wolde nat acquyte faith owe hym put demayne hades straungers sayeng rather taxed yerely halfe theyr substanc vnder handes englisshmen frenche kynge sawe well good wyls trouth bare hym theyr often excusacionss great p e ow sent wrote affectuously theym entent shulde fulfyll desire shewynge elles peace shulde broken defaute whiche shulde great preiudice realme france wha rochell sawe remedye sydered distresse theyr usacionss desire coude nat accepted obeyed full sore agains theyr wylles honest men towne sayde shall obeye englysshemen hense forth harte shall nat remoue frenche parte thus kyng england possession s nynge duchie aquitayne countie ponthieu guynes landes ought hau syde see say realme fraunce gyuen hym ordinance sayd treatye yere ser john chandos passed see reget lieutenat kynge englande toke possession sayd lades ye faithess homage erles vicountess baroness knyghtess squyers townes forteresses et euery place constable capitayness officer hiss ordinaunce laye hym selfe nyort helde great estate noble well wherwith ye kyng englande entierly loued hym wolde shulde well worthy good knyght curtesse benynge amyable liberall preu sage trewe cause valiauntly mayntayned hym selfe among lordes lady dammuselless neuer knyght tyme better beloued praysed euery creature meane season kynge englande takynge possession forsaid landes accordyng treatye peace certayne deputy stablysshed kynge englande bondes limitation frace certayne persones commytted fre che kynge cause maner men warre auoyde departe oute holdes helde comaundement kyng englande straitly peyne theyr lyues gooddes reputed ennemies kyng englande shulde leaue delyuer vp suche forteresses helde shulde perteyue frenche kynge knyghtes squ er suche owed geaunce kynge englande ob ed kynges commaundement rend ed rcaused rendred fortress helde wolde nat obeye sayeng howe made warre title kynge nauarre also many stranger great capitaynes great pyllers wolde nat departe almayns brabances flemmynges aynows manso fraco pore reason warres wherfore thought recouer selfe makynge warre realme fraunce whiche people perseuered styll theyr euyll doynge dyd moche euyll realme agaynste displeasure whan capitaynes thus departed courtesse maner fortress helde felde gaue leaue theyr men warre departe lerned pylle robbe thought retourne theyr owne countreys nat profitable perauenture durste nat bicause suche vyllayne dedes accused gathered selfe guyther made amonge sel e newe capitaynes toke election worste moost vnhappy personne theym rode forthe one fro mette guether agayne fyrste champaygne bourgoyn assembled great companyes whiche called late commers bicause hadde lyttell pylled realme france sodainly went toke strengthe forteresse genuille great gooddes therin whiche brought thyther theym countrey truste stronge place whan copanions thus found place suche great rich whiche estymed value hu dred thousande frankes deuyded hit amonge longe wolde laste kepte styll castell certayne space tyme ouer ranne wasted countrey champaigne busshopryches uerdun langers whan well pylled countrey passed first solde castell genuill theym countrey xx frankes entred bourgoyne rested refresshed taried mo theyr company dyd moche euill many villayne dedes theyr accorde certayne knyghtes squyers countrey ladde guyded theyr euyl doynges taryed longe space aboute besancon digon beaulne robbed countrey none reencoutred toke good towne guiercy beauuoys robbed pylled taried season aboute uuergi bicause coutrey plentyfull alwayes theyr nombre encreased suche departed oute forteresses lycence theyr capitaynes go whither drewe parte lent guether xvi thousand fyghtyngmen whan sawe selfe great nombre stablysshed amonge certayne capitaynes shuld obey thynges shall shewe name greattest maisters amonge theym fyrste knyght gascoyne called segu n battefoill company two thousande fyghtyng men also callebert callabaton guy pinespiote litel mechin batailler hanequin francois bourge espace nandon de baquerant bourg bourc bretuel nucharge scot arbretoury almayne bourdonnell bernarde salle robert briquet carnelle aymemon drtige garsiotte castell gironnet paux lortingo salle dyuerse aboute myddes lente companyons aduysed selfe drawe warde auignon go se pope cardynals passed countrey mascon addressed theymselfe go countie forestes ple tyfulle countrey towarde lyon riuer rosne whan frenche kyng herd tidynges howe companion daily multiplied wasted exyled realme therwith ryght sore displeased shewed hym aduyse counsayle companion myght sore encrease multiply myght euyll vilayn dedes realme fraunce euer done warre endured englisshemen therfore kynge counsayled shuld send army men warr fyght kyng wrote specially cosyn lorde james bourb towne montpellier put newely sir john chados possession kynge englande dyuerse landes city townes castels rtresseslyteynynge duchie acquita sayde kynge sayd wrytyng desired cosyn bourbon chief capttayne encountre fyght companion take men warre hym suche nobre myght stroge ynough fyght soone lorde bourbon herde tidynges incontinent went citie agenoise without restynge way sent letrers messangers euery parte desirynge commaudyng frenche kynges name knyghtes squiers come hym apparelled warre euery man obeyed commaundement whan assembled drewe toward lyos riuer rosne willynge fyght euill people lorde james bourbon well beloued realme fraunce euery man gladly obeyed hym knyghtes squiers party auuergne ymosyn prouece sauoy dolphynne uien party folowed hym also diuers knyghtes squiers duchie bourgoyn whiche yong duke bourgoyn sent thither al men armes drewe forwarde passed lyon countie mascon came coutie forestes lord james bourbon syster lady right child erle forestes husbande newely deed therfore gouerned countrey sir reynalt forest brother sayd erle receyued lorde james bourbon company ryght ioyously fealted well myghty also two nephewes presented selfe ryde armes besende countrey companion drawyng parte tha chaslon thourain wha vnderstode freche men gadered gether fyght capitaynes drewe guether take counsayle howe shulde maynteyne themselfe nombred theyr company found xvi fyghtyng men one sayd amonge selfe let v go agaynst frenche men desyre fynde v let v fyght aduauntage may orels nat fortune v shall riche great season well reason good prisoner goodes also shalbe redoubted whereso euer go none shalbe hardy encountre v lese shall lese wage pourpose agreed dislodged went vp mountaynes entre countie forestes come riuer loyre founde way good towne called charlien mascon made f erse assa wiche endured hole day coude wynne thynge well defended gentylmen countrey suche orels ben taken departed thense spred abrode countrey perteynyng lorde beauteu ther great dammage entred bysshopriche lyon went euer toke small hold way lodged euer dyd moche trouble whe came daye toke castell lo e lady within whiche castell called brunay thre leages lyon ther lodged rested perfect knowlege howe frenche men drawen feldes apparelled fyght p howe lorde james company discom companyos howe pe made cried crosse companyons taken brydge saynt esperyte answere made cap cc xv men warr thus assembled lorde bourbon beyng ly vnderstode route co panyous aproched faste toward wone towne castell brunay dyuerse holdes howe sore wasted eriled countrey tydynges greatly displeased lorde bour bicause gouernynge erle stes landes sone nephewes went felde sawe well howe great nombre men armes knyghtes squiers sent theyr courrours know theyr ennemies dyd shulde founde nowe shall shewe great malice companyons lodged moutayne suche pla coude nat diseryed auewed specially chief beste harneysed residewe worste harneysed arenged alonge hylle syde red frenche currours aproche nere retourne agayne withoute mage lorde james bourbon erle duzes raynalt forestes frenche company reported seen sayd syrs haue seen yonder company ennemies power wel aduysed thynges sen cosydered estimacion passe nat persones meruailously euil harneysed whan lorde bourbon herd report sayd archeprest sir ye haue tolde nombre fyghtyng men ye contrary sir quod thought neuer vnder ye sayd nat god thanked better v therfore nowe take hede ye wyl name god quod lorde bourbon wyll go fight ordered batayles set good araye redy fyght myght se ennemies hym made certayn newe knyghtes first owne dest sonne peter raysed baner also nephewe yonge erle forest lorde tournon lorde mo er lorde groslee daulph e also lorde loys sir robert beau ewe chaalon syr hewe uien erle dyuerse good knyghtes squiers desyrynge auaunce honour ouerthrowe companyos thus pylled countrey without title reason ordeyned archeprest sir reynolde carnoll shuld gouerne first bataile good expert knyght bataile xvi hundred fyghtynge men route companyons moutayne saw right well orderynge frenche men coude nat well se theyr gydyng aproche well theyr great daunger damage companyons hadde mountayne thousande cart lode great stone whiche greatly aduautage profitte frenche men sore desired fyght ennemies howe euer dyd coude nat come nexte waye therfore dreuen necessite cost aboute mountayne ennemies whan came syde great prouision stone began caste sore downe hyll dyd aproche bette downe hurte maymed great nobre suche wyse myght durste nat passe aproche nerer theym fyrst bataylle sore beaten defoyled daye dyd litell ayde theyr succour approched bataylles sir james bourbon sonne nephewes theyr baners great nombre good men warre went loste whiche great damage pite hadnat wrought better aduice counsayle dyd archepreste dyuerse knyghtes sayde hadde beste haue suffered theyr ennemyes haue dislodged oute holde haue fought case coulde nat herde p thus lorde james bourbon lordes theyr baners penons approched costedde sayde mountayne worste armed companyous caste styll contynewally stone theym suche wyse hardyest dryuen abacke thus helde estate great space great fresshe bataylle companyons founde awaye came aboute mountayne well raynged hadde cutre theyr speares syxe foote lengthe came ryenge one voyce brake amonge frenche men firste metyng ouerthrewe many erthe sore stroke bothe partess companyons fought ardetly marueyle caused frenchemen recule backe archpreest lyke good knight fought valyantly taken prisoner force armes sore hurte dyuers knightes uyers company wherto shulde make lengar rehersall mater effecte frenchman worse lorde james bourbone soore hurte sir peter sonne ther slayne yong erle forestes taken sir reynolde forestes vncle therle duzes sir robert beauieu ser loys chalon mo hundred knyghtess moche payne lorde bourbone sonne peter borne cytie lyon batayle yere lorde god thousande thre hundred threscore one friday easter day p greatly countre aba hed whan herde people dysconfyted ther none hardy stronge castell trymbled feare wise discrete men supposed ymagined great myschefe shulde multiply therby without god put som remedy lyon gretly abasshed wha knewe companyons vyctorie howe beit receyued swetely retourned scaped fro batayle sore dysplesed hurtes lorde bourbon sir peter sonne towne ladyes damoselles right goodly dyde visyte hym lorde james bourbon dyed thre dayes felde sir peter sonne lyued nat longe sore way led euery creature dethe thiss lorde bourbon frenche kyng ryght sore displeased coude nat amende behoued hym passe ouer sorowe well might lette v speke companyons parseuered styll yuell ded people reioysed coforted dedes well wynnynge iourney raunsomyng many good prisoner thus copanyons ledde tyme pleasure countrey none came agaynst theym incontynent discofyture brunay entred spredde abrode countie forestes pylled wasted countre except ye fore bycause great company almoost nothynge helde agaynst theym deuyded two partes sir seguyn batefoyle lesse parte howe beit company thre thousa de fightyng men went lay myle fro lyon fortefyed place maruelously company ther marchesse whiche one ye plentyfull countrees worlde whiche ouer ranne raunsomed people pleasure say countres syde beyond ryuer cou tie mascon archebysshoprike lyon lande lorde beauieu countrey marcylly nonnes countie neuers parte company nandos beaugeraunt espyot carnell robert briquet ortyngo bernarde salle lamyt bourge camas bourge bretuell bourge lespare dyuers one sorte affinyte drewe towarde auygnone sayd howe wolde se pope cardynalles haue money orels hare pyll countre taryed abydynge rausome suche prisoner taken also se truce helde bytwene frauce englande went towarde auygnon toke way townes fortress none helde agaynst countre afrayed also countre vsed warre suche small holdes wyst nat howe defende theselfe fro suche men warr companyons herde howe bridge saynt esperyte seuyn leages fro auygnon great treasure richesse countre assembled ther togyder trust stronge fortresse companyons aduysed among might wynne holde shuld gretly aduauntage profyte thanne thought maysters roane theym auygnon purpose stubyed tyll last caste aduyce haue herd reported maner g yot pyn ye lytell methyn rode company one nyght fyftene leages mornynge brekynge day came towne bridge saynt spyryt sodenly toke within ye whiche great pyte ther slewe many honest person defoyled many da wan suche tychesse coude great puruyaunces lyue meanes might r nne ase without dauger one son realme frauce another tyme empyre assembled togyder companyons euery day ran e auygnon wher pope great affray drede companyons made soueraygne amonge euer moost omonly enemy god worlde besyde frauce great nombre pyliers robber englysshmen gascoyns almaygnes sayd must nedes lyue helde styll certayne garysons fortress kyng englandes deputy comau ded auoyde departe wolde nat obey wherwith frenche kynge sore displeased counsell whan companyons dyuers place herde howe companyons ouer throwen lorde bourbon two thousande knyghtes squyers taken many good prisoner also taken ye towne saynt e pyrite great rychesse thyuge mcomparable thynkynge howe lykely wynne auygnon el putte mercy pope cardynalles coutre prouynce tha thought departe go thyder couetyse yuell dedes cause dyuers left vp fortress wente copanyous hope gette yllage whan p pe colledge ro ered cursed p opl greatly abasshed agaynst christen people dyde payne distroy chr ndom bandes done wt tytell reason ed countrey without cause robbed without spa yng euer coude gette de oyled woman olde yong without pytie slewe men woman chyldren without mercy doyng trespace suche dyde moost shamefullyst ded reputed moost valyaunt pope cardynalles preached openly assoyled pena cul wolde take croy wolde abandon bodyes wil lyngly distroy yuell peple co panyons ther chosen among cardynals sir peter monstier cardynall arras called dste chefe capitayne croysey mcontynent departed auygnon wente taryed carpentrase uyn myle fro auygnon ther retayned maner soudyers suche wold saue soules matteynyng sayd perdous shulde haue none wage wherfore tourney brake euery man deted lombardy owne coutrees went sayd yuell company dayly encreased thus haryed pope cardynals marchauntes auygnon dyd moche yuell tyll ferr somer season yere lorde god thousande thre hudred threscore one pope cardynals aduysed noble gentyll knyght good warryoure marque mounferrant kept warr done long space agaynst lordes myllayne pope sent forhym came auygnon honorably receyued pope cardynals atreaty made hym reason somme money shuld haue entent shulde get ceuntre sayd yuell copanyons retayne warres lombardy marque treated captayns companyons reason threscore thousand florens shulde haue among great wage ye marque shulde gyue agreed depart go hym lobardy might assoyled pena ct culpa agreed acomblysshed flores payed rendred vp ye towne saynt espyrite lefte marche auygnon passed forthe marque wherof kyng john france realme right toyouse whan sawe howe delyuered yuell people howbeit many retorned burgoyn sir seguyne batefoyle departed nat ye garyl ence wold nat leaue maner promyse realme france ferr better rest peace whan moost parte companyous thus passed forthe marque lande pyemot ther marque dyde well deuoyre agaynst ye lordes myllayne conquered dyuers townes caste fortress countrees agaynst dyuers encountrynges skyrmisshes honour profyte yere helpe better hande part entent agaynst two lord myllayne sir galea sir bernabe raygned gre prosperite fortuned sir seguyn batefoyle season garyson ence ryuer ie toke scalyng good cyte auuergne called b od therin taryed yere fortifyed suche wyse douted nothyng ouer ran coutre cler ty lacke puy case dieu moutferant ryon nonnet ussoyre udalle lande countie dalphyn lorde wherof tyme hostage englande countrees company dyde moche yuell whan sore enpouerysshed countre ther treaty deted toke hym great pyllage treasure went gascoyne fro whes came first sir seguyn write iherde recouted dyed maruelusly god forgyue hym trespaces amen p dethe duke lancastre occasyon warre bytwene frenche kyng kyng nauer howe prince wale came acquitayne ordre taken englande cap cc xv season de ted worlde englade gentyll duke lancastre called henry wher kynge ne knightes squyers ryght sorowfull coude nat remedy behynde left two doughters lady maha lt lady blanche therle heynault wylliam sonne lorde loyes banyer lady margarete heynalt maryed yonger suster lorde john erle richmont sonne kynge englande maryed suster duke lancastre right wyfe lorde james burbone abode styll pursuynge treaty bytwene lorde john mountfor lorde charles bloys right chy bretayne acordyng treaty calais ye haue herd concludyng therof great warres felt countre bretayne ye shall hystorie season frenche kyng purpose go auygnone pope cardynals go hy burgoyn whiche newly fallen hym kyng made redy iourney departed fro parys se saynt john baptyst yere lorde ccc lxii left charles eldest sonne duke normandy regent gouernour realme kyng hym welbeloued cosyn lorde john artoyse erle tankernyll therle dampmartyn boucequant marshall fraunce dyuers long rode small iourneys great dyspence taryeng euery ne cytie rode bourgoyn feest saynt michaell came newe towne auyguon lodgyng prepared copany gretly lled pope hole coledge visyted eche often tymes thus kynge taryed ther season wynter christmas pope innocent departed lyfe great dyscorde bytwene cardynals chosynge newe pope wolde haue dignyte spe ly cardynall boulay cardynall ourt two grettell colledge discencyon longe dyscorde nalles finally dyde putte mater vnto two foresayd cardynalles whan sawe coude nat haue theymselfe papal thaue concluded bytwene none shulde haue dyde cho electe abbot saynt uyctor mar ell pope good deuout holy man vertuous lyueng gret clerke greatly traueyled churche lombardy place ano creacion frenche kyng vnderstode lorde pi r luzenon kyng cypre hyerusalem shulde come tos pope howe past freche kyng sayd wolde tary ther tyll comynge great desyre se hym great goodnesse herde reported hym warre made agaynst sarazyns kynge cypre newly taken strong cyte salate agaynst enemyes god slayne euer within none except season wynter ther great counsell englande orderyng realme specially kinges chyldren cosydred howe yt prince wale held great noble estate might well valyant man puissant riche great herytage acq tayne wher habundaunce welth prosperite king counselled shulde send prince son pattes lande sufficyet duchy maynteyne withall dignyte estate also barones knight acquitayne wolde gladly haue hym among whiche made request kynge sir john chados ryght courtelse amyable yet rather haue owne naturall soueraygne lorde prince lightly agreed ordynauce prepared hym selfe good lady wyfe acordyng estate whan euery thyng redy toke leaue kyng quene bretherne departed england aryued rochell season departed world kyng englandes mother isabell frau doughter kynge philyp le beau sotyme frenche kyng buryed fre r mynors london right nobly reueretly ther beyng prelate barones englande lordes fraunce suche hostage ye prince prince deted england obsequy done departed aryued rochell wher receyued great ioy tayed space four dayes p howe kynges fraunce cypre toke croysey agaynst mfydeles gret purchace entent kynge cypre made many kyng prince dyuers place christendome cap cc xvii soone sir johan chandos alonge season gouerned duchye acquitayne herde howe prince comyng thyder departed fro nyort came goodly company knyghtes squyers towne rochell wher well receyued prince prince prince great honoure ioye brought cytie poycters thyder came se hym great ioye barownes knyghtes poy tou xaynton dyde hym feaultie homage ought wente burdeaux taryed long season prince thyder came se hym erles vycoutes barownes knyghtes gascoyne receyued right ioyously ye prince acquyted hym selfe nobly amonge theym euery man well content erle foyz came thyder se prince great chere feast peace made bytwene hym erle armynake whiche long space made werr eche anone sir john chandos made constable countrey guyene sir guychart dangle made marshall thus prince made suche knightes house loued best great offycers throughout duchy acquitayne tylled constableshyppes bayl wykes englysshe knyghtes kept great puyssaunt astates parauenture greatter countrey wolde done matter wente nat ordynaunces p nowe lette v leaue speke prince wale acquitayne prince speke kynge johan fraunce newe towne without auygnon tyme candelmasse yere lorde thousande thre hundred kyng peter cypre came auygnon whose comynge hole courte greatly reioysed dyuers cardynalles went mete hym brought hym paleys ye pope urbayne ryght ioyously receyued hym also dyde frenche kynge present whan ha e g ther certayne tyme taken wyne spice two kynges departed fro pope eche went theyr owne lodgyng ye season wage atell frenche kyng bitwene two noble expert knyghtes syr aymon pommters syr fouques archiac wha fought sufficiently frenche kynge treated peace accorded gether lente season two kynges aryed auignon often tymes visited pope receyued right usly often tymes whan kynge ciper pope freche kyng beyng present cardinalles declared howe christedome shuld noble worthy thyng open passage ouer see go agaynst enemyes christen fayth whiche wordes frenche kynge gladly herde pourposed hym selfe myght lyue iii yere go thither two cause moued hym therto fyrste bicause father kynge philyp auowed secondly entent therby drawe realme maner men warre called companyous ylled robbed countrey withoute title saue theyr soules pourpose entente frenche kyng reserued hym selfe without worde spekyng therof vntyll good fryday pope urban hym selfe preched chapell auignon beynge present kynges hole college cardinalles holy predicacion whiche right humble moche deuoute freche kynge great deuocion toke hym croysey swet h requyred pope accord consyrme voyage pope lygh ly agreed therto kynge toke oith hym syr calleran cardinall pierregourt erle artoise erle ewe erle dampmartyn erle tankeruille syr arnolde dandrehen great priour france syr boucequat dyuerse knyghtes present enterprise kynge cyper ryght ioyouse thanked ryght hartely lorde therof reputed hit great syngular meryte thus ye maye se frenche kynge sayd lordes toke weare aboue theyr garmentes rosse holy father pope voyage caused preched dyuerse place shall howe kyng cyper come thither moue voyage great go se emperour hyghe baroues empyre englande se kyng great lordes en ome thus purposed dyd ye shall history holifather pope frenche kynge offered promysed hym theyr bodyes goodes substance furnysshe voyage gaue hym full power publysshe grace pardon holy voyage therby cause lordes prynces rather enclyne thys holy voyage kynge well beloued reason shewed fayre language vttered lordes voyage rather haue herd hym predicacion poynt ed anone easter yere lorde ccc lxiii kynge cyper departed fro auignon sayd wolde go se emperour lordes empyre promysed returne agayne brabant flaunders haynault toke leaue pope frenche kynge case acquyted ryght well ward hym gaue hym many fayre gy wels pardon ye pope gaue hym men anone departyn kynge cyper frenche kynge toke leaue pope went towne mo pell er visite languedor longe space let v speke kynge cy voiage made rode longe ourne came almayn cite pragne foude emperour almayne syr charles behaigne receyued hym graciously lordes empyre present kynge cyper taryed thre wykes exhorted greatly theym empyre holy voyage euery place passed almayne emperour payde hys costes kynge cyper wente duchye jullyers duke made hym ryght great feast tha thense went ante also duke duchess receyued hym great honour towne bruzels diuers supper justis tournays pastymes honor coude ryght well hit departynge gaue hym great gyftes ieowels went flanders se erle loys like wyse dyd greatly feast honour hym specially brug dyd moche kynge well contente hym taryed somer alwayes exhortyng euery man holy voyage wherof dyuerse lordes great ioy desire p frenche hostage englande purchas kynge ciper made croisey cap cc xviii season kynge englande dyd grace iiii frenche duke ihostage say duke orleaunce duke aniou duke berrey duke bourbon lordes calais yt kyng content shulde ryde aboute calais space iiii dayes lyste euer iiii dayes ende come agayne calais sonne settynge thys kynge englande dyd good entente bicause shulde rather france purchase theyr delyueraunce iiii lordes thus beyng calais sent messangers dyuers tymes frenche kynge duke normandy eldest sonne desyrynge entende theyr delyueraunce accordynge promysed sworne whan entred englande sayeng el wold take hede therto selfe thought theymself prisoner though lordes right nere lignage kynge yet theyr messangers nat herde delyuered theyr pleasure wherwith lordes right sore displeased specially duke aniou sayd wold right wel prouyde remedy frenche kynge counsaile duke normandy wer sore besied voyage croysey taken vpon hym warres kynge nauarre made realme sent lombardy certayn companyons helpe hym warre cause toke regard lordes laye hostage say foresayde iiii duke delyuer messangers whan came fraunce whan kyng ciper visited lordes sayd countreys rode iourneys came calais founde iii sayd duke duke orleaunce duke berrey duke bourbon duke aniou gone frauce nat tell estate iii duke prisoner receyued kynge ciper calais right ioyously kynge acquyted hym right swetely wer guether ii dayes kynge cyper passed see arryued douer taried two dayes refresshed hym tyll cariage vnshypped rode smalle iourneys ease tyll came london honorably receyued feasted lordes fraunce also england sent mete hym kynge englad erle herforde syr gaulter manny lorde spenser syr rawoll feryes ser guyshart penebruges ser richard stury accompanied brought hym lodgyng cite london nat recout hole day noble diner supper chere feastes made hym kynge englande presentes gyftes ieowels gyuen hym say trouthe well worthy hauehit come thither fro farre great expense exhorte kynge take hym redde crosse helpe open passage goddes ennemies kynge englande excused hym selfe graciously right sagely agayne kynge cyper repassed see arryued boloyn herde waye howe frenche kynge duke normandy lorde philyp yongest sonne great parte counsayle shulde good towne amyense thither rode kynge cyper founde kynge newly come thider part counsaile nobly receyued recounted spedde voiage whiche glad whan kynge cyper ben certayn space tyme sayde tought hadde nat yet thynge done tyll hadde seen prynce wale say enge grace god wolde go sehym lordes poictom acquitayne frenche kynge accorded wel shulde desired hym retourne wolde come frauce kyng ciper promysed thus departed amience went towarde beaunoyse passed riuer seyn last came poicters tyme prince angolesme shulde kepe great feast justis tournay xl knyghtes many squiers loue princesse brought bedde faire sonne called edwarde soone prince knewe comynge kyng ciper sent mete hym ser john chaudos great nombre knyghtes squiers house brought hym great ioye reuerence prince receyued hym right honorably nowe let v leaue kynge ciper returne fre che kynge recount entencion counsatle come amience enfourmed true hit kynge johst fraunce inpourpos go englande se kynge edwarde brother ye quene syster cause assembled counsaile tyme counsaile coude nat make hym vary fro pourpose yet counsa ed hym sore contrarie diuers prelate barones fraunce sayd howe toke hym great foly put hym selfe daunger kynge englande kyng answered sayd syrs haue foude kynge england brother quene child moche trouth honour nat prayse moche wherfore doubte nothynge wyll ryght courtesse true frende case also wyll excuse sonne duke aniou returnyng frace wordes none durst say contrarie syth determined ihym self kyng ordeyned agayne son duke norman dye regent gouernour realme fraunce vntyll retourne agayne promysed lorde philyp yong son returne agayne wolde make hym duke borgoyn heriter duchie wha purueyaunce redy accordynge entent prouision bolloyn hym departed amience rode tyll came hedyn kept christmas daye thither came se hym loys erle flaunders kyng taried ii iii dayes innocetis day departed fro hedin p howe kynge john fraunce returned england dyed duke normandy defended hym agaynst naueroyse mante meulent taken howe syr bremont de la discomfetted ca cc xix king john dyd moche iourneis came boloyn lodged abbay taried tyll wynde wyll hym sir john artoyse erle ewe erle dampmartyn great priour fraunce boucequant marshall fraunce sir tristram maguelles sir peter syr john uillers ser john anuil ser nicholas braque diuers knyghtes squiers whan theyr ship charged yt ye mar ners saw good wind gaue knowlege therof kyng tha ye kyng entred ship aboute mydnyght people shippes longe sayled arriued englande douer day vigill epiphany anoue tidynges came kyng england quene eltham vii leages fro london frenche kyng come lande douer sente thither diuers knyghtes house ser bartilmewe brunes sir alayne bouquesels sir richarde pennebruge dyuers departed fro kynge rode toward douer founde frenche kynge made great honoure chere hym amonge thynges sayd howe kynge theyrlorde right ioyous comynge frenche kynge lyghtly beleued theym nexte day kyng hys companie lepte theyr horse rode caunturburye came thither dyner entrynge churche saynt thomas kyng dyd ryght great reuerence offred sh ryche e kynge tar ed de dare departed ood towarde dou last came ame kynge england great nom hym recey comynge thy dyner bitwene ther great dausyng yonge lorde ed hym selfe daunce bothe frenche englysshe olde hym became hym dyd canne nat honorably kynge en ande quene receyued freche kyng day departed elthame london maner people itie mette receyued hym great er ce brought reat london lodgyng sa whiche ordeined castell lodged suche blodde laye hostage first orleaunce brother sonne duke berrey osy duke bout alenson guy bloys erle powle dyuers thus kynge taried parte wynter mong lordes owne blodde right ioy often tymes kynge englande child visited hym duke larence duke lancastre lorde mon one kynges sone diuers me made great feastes guether dy er upper diuers pastymes lodgynge sauoy whan pleased frenche kyng went kynges palaice westm secret ryuer temes often tymes two k nges whan met wayled lorde james bourbon sayeng great damage hym great mysse hym theyr copany became hym right well among great lordes nowe let v leaue speke frenche kyng returne kyng ciper came aguillon prince wale co syn receyued hym right ioyously like wyse dyd barones knyghtes er poictou ainton suche prince vicout tho yong lorde pouns lorde per ey syr loys arcourt guyssharde ngle englande r john handos thomas felton sir nowell lorwiche syr richarde pountchardon sir symon bassell sir ba wyn franuill sir daugorises diuers aswell cout ey englande kyng ciper well honored feasted prince prin esse sayde barones knyghtes taried monethe ser john chandos ledde hym sportynge aboute xainton poictow went sawe good towne rochell east whan hadde visited countrey retourned agayne angolesme great feast prince helde tyme great plen tye knyghtes squiets anone feast kyng ciper toke leaue prince knyghtes countrey fyrst shewed theym principally wherfore come thither taken hym edde crosse ba e pope confermed dignite priuilege perteyned voyage howe frenche kyng deuocion diuers great lordes enterprised sworne tha prince knyghtes answered curtesly sayd truly voiage maner men honour take hede pleasure god passage one open shulde nat alone shulde fynde wolde gladde desyre auaunce honor wordes kynge ciper well content departed sir john chandos helde hym company tyll principalite vnderstode retourned agayne fraunce parys wenynge haue founde kynge dyd nat kynge nat retourned oute englade lay sore sicke lodgyng sauoy london euery daye enpayred worse worse whiche greatly displeased kynge englande quene phisi iens sayde great pa ell knewe right well duke normandy parys gouernynge realme fraunce syr boucequant come oute englande hadde enfourmed duke howe stode kynge hys father kynge nauarre also knewe certaynte therof thynge sorye hoped frenche yng dyed warre whiche made shulde better hym wrote captall beusm erle foyes desyringe hym come normady hym sayeng howe wolde make hym souerayne capt ayne retynewe captall departed fro erle foyes toke way kyng nauer went desyred certayne knightes squyers go hym howbeir fewe thus meane season captall thus comyng war e kyng nauerre kynge john fraunce dyed bedde englande sauoy cytie london wherof kyng englande quene chyldren many englande right sory heuy great honour loue kynge hym euer sythe peace made bytwe e tha duke orleauce brother duke berry sonne ryght sorowfull dethe sent incotynent great hast worde therof ouer see duke normady wherof duke right sory good reason howbeit knowynge hym selfe successour herytage fraunce seynge howe kyng nauerr dayly fortifyed garysons agaynst hym thought tyme prouyde good counsell remody behalfe seasonne knyght bretayne toke euer frenche partie called syr bertram e guescly renowme hym nat greatly knowen tyme sauyng among knyghtes bretayne hym abydinge styll brerayne alwayes makynge warre lorde charles bloys con tre syr bertram reputed valyat knyght welbeloued men warr greatly duke normades grace grea vertues h herd reported hym whanthe duke herde dethe father dout greatly kynge nauerre sayd sir boucequant sir suche men ye haue wyll ye ryde normandy ther ye shall fynde sir bertram guesc yue loke togyder make army agaynst kynge nauerr kepe surely ryuer seyne sir boucequant sayd shulde done departed toke hym good nombre knyghtes squyers toke way normandy saynt germayns shewed wolde go castell rolebosse wherin certayne companyons dyde che yll throughout worlde rolebosse stronge castell yuer yne leage fro tyme full companyons made warr well kyng nauer frenche kyng capy whome obeyed retayned certayne wage gaue called uatayre austarde expert man arm bolde borne towne brusels copany robbed countre hym ther none durst go fr parys maunt roane ponthois well bete downe naueroyse frenchman specially constrayned ore maut whan sir bo equant parted fro parys fayned take way role osse howbeit taryed certayne place sir bertram gu scly e company ryden castell deur u spoken within wold wyse open gate lette hym fiersly dyde cast stone hym whan sawe departed wente marshall syr boucequant taryed hym lytel fro rolebosse whan met togyder fyue hudred men armes two capitayns great counsell togyder howe shulde mayntene themselfe specially gette yf myght towne maut determyned boucequaunt hundred hym shulde ryde maunt hast though sore afrayed say howe garysone rolebosse dyde chase desyringe open gate let saue garde lyues lette take season gate sir bertram hole company shulde come entre towne lyst thought without coude get maner wyst nat howe elles gette counsell determyned good lordes kept secrete among selfe thus sir boucequant ed sayd company rode towarde maunte syr bertram rode thyderwarde another way put theselfe busshment nere maut whan sir bouceq uant aproched nere maunt spar led brode lyke men discofyted chased knyght sir boucequant came maunt resydue came one another called arryers sayd ye good people maunt open gate let v entre r fold weth yuell murdr r ro eboyse chaseth v hath vtterly disc ted v within sayd sir ser boucequat marshall duke normady sent hym haue fought rol boyse theues wt haue behoued whyder wolde nat wyll ake myne without ye wyll open gate let v come forsocour wt answered wenynge wordes ad ben true sayd sir knowe well yt roleboyse enemyes also care nat whem haue warr also thother part duke normady ha kyng nauer lor therfore great dout lest shulde marshall frace saytheye shall haue hurt nat come countre roleboys wor opened gate suffred sir boucequant alwayes lytell lytell wed bytwene hyndermast quant men formast sir me men maunt leaser ne gate sir boucequant n logyng vnarmed ther apease towne shuld na mystrust sir bertram co pany came galoppyng entred ye tow saynt jues clesquy dethe eroyse enterd logyn pylled robbed euer foun coke prisoner slewe lyst season thus entred another company breton came ke leage then entred therm lly sayd men nt thyder sir wyllyam grauyll maunt many mo meul thought wordes bycause came way fro maunt well coulde come none way se ryuer seyn brige therfore beleued opened ryers breton entred gate cryed saynt yue eles people downe right fledde themselfe aswell myght sawe selfe disceyued hus maunt meulecke ta duke normandy right kyng nauer right sore displeased whan knewe therof tha kyng nauerr set good capitayns townes castels toke great domage losse maut meulec fayre entre fraunce ye weke captall beusz arryued chyerbourge foure hundred men armes kyng nauerr made hym great fest shewed hym maner co playnt howe duke normandy caused townes maunt meuleck stollen fro hym captall answered sayd sir please god shall go forwarde trust shall spede well shall haue theym agayne many mo sayd howe duke normandy goynge reynes crowned shall go hym noyaunce domage thus comynge captall beusz yt kynge nauer ryght ioyouse sayd yt incotynent wolde make iourney fraunce sende men warre partes wher coudymagen haue season normandy marne knyght englade tyme ben kynge nauerr warres ryght well expertman armes called sir john jonell copany thre hudred men armes kyng nauer sent hym desyringe wolde come serue hym suche nombre knyght condyscended kynges desyre came put hym seruyce duke normandy knewe ryght well howe kyng nauerr assembled army howe captall shulde chiefe capitayne wrote sir bertram clesquy desyring hym bretos kepe fronter warr kyng nauer promysyng send hym people ynowe fight agaynst power kyng nauer ordayned sir boucequat shulde tary kepe maut meulec sir bertran company breton went towarde uernon shorte space duke normandy send hym great nombre men warre therle aucer vycount beaumount lorde beauiewe dyuers knyghtes squyers season come frauce serue duke normandy gascone lorde dalbret sir aymon punyers sir peteton corton soldyche lestrad dyuers wherof duke normady coude great thank desyring ryde normandy agaynst ennemyes lordes obeyed duke rode normandy excepte lorde dalbret taryed styll duke men rode forthe iourney also season fronters bretayne breton knyght frenche partie called beamont uale company xl speres breton came eureur within towne ther knyght called sir guy granuyll alsone herde fray armed soudyers mounted ontheir horse rode felde tyme sir beamont done enterprice departynge sir guy grauyll asctyed sayd beaumount ye shall nat thus departe firste ye must speke eureux shall teche knowe whan sir beamont herd tourned horse layed speare rest came agaynst sir guye two knyghtes mette rudely toguyder son speares sheuered peace satte surely none fell passed forthe course theyr retournynge drewe swerd therwith copanyes mette tyme many borne yerthe bothe partyes br ton acquyted theym selfe valiantly howbe finally coude nat obtayne place fayne ther abyde people came styll towne slayne taken none scaped taken sir beaumont dela uale sir guy granuyll ledde hym prisoner castell eureur resydewe suche taken thus happed aduenture wherof sir guy greatly praysed beloued kyng nauer eureux phere begynneth feat warre done tyme kyng charles wherof beginnyng speketh obsequy kyng john yong kyng charles honorably crowned reynes gret expeses done beginyng batell cocherell thus asye haue herde kyng cypre retorned fra ce came parys duke normady ther duke bretherne duke ani ou lorde philyp duke burgone taryed body ye ge father whiche comyng englande kyng cypreholpe coplayne dethe kyng maruey lously displeased therwith bycause hyndringe vyage croyse cl thed hym selfe vesture doloure day came thar body frenche kyng aproched parys body broght thyder therle artoyse therle da marten great priour frauce duke normady bretherne kyng cypre moost part clergy parys went fote met body beyonde saynt denyce frauce ther solemply buryed tharchbysshop sencesang masse seruyce done dyner whiche right noble lordes prelate returned parys helde parlyament generall counsell determyne realme shuld ordred ye realme might nat longe without kyng counselled thaduyce prelatis noble realme shulde drawe cite reyns ther crowne duke norma dy yet called none wise also wrote vncle uyncelant duke brabant luzeburge also therle fla ders desyring coronacyon trinyte sonday next comyng sca son whyle lordes made theyr puruey aunce kynges coronacyon frenchemen naueroyse aproched nere togyder normady cite eureux come captall beuz made ther assemble men warr companyons suche coude get p nowe let v speke hym sir bertram clesquy iourney batayle bytwene tuesday nyte sonday duke normandy shulde crowned kynge cathedrall churche reyns whan captall beusz made assemble cite eureux archer brigans left cytie capyten called sir mychell dorgery sent couch lorde guy grauyll kepe fronter warr departed fro eureur men armes archer herde say ow frechmen wer abrode wyst nat toke feldes great desyre ynd th red copany de yt v c spetes iii c archer c men warr h dyuers good knight squiers specially baneret realme nauer called lorde sal expert armes helde gr st men armes er copany knight england called sir john jo ell ther also ye lorde peter sauyle grauyll ye lorde bertra frake blassoll marenell uers wyll encouter ser bertra clesquy fight h tha drue passy ye b ge tharch thoght frechmen shulde passe ye ryuer seyne ther ware nat passed redy p happed friday whytson w ke captall copany rode wode aue ture met haraude armes called kynge faucon mornynge deted fro freche hoost assone captall se hym knewe hym well made great e yng kyng england tha mauded hym fro whens ame k tidyng frechmen sir name god knowe well wher depted fro day seke aswell ye captall beyond b ge tharche syde sir fau passed bridge uernon beleue nowe passy nobre e captall cap ten haue pray shewe ser fau ar well c fightyng men sir bertra clesquy hath grettest copany bretos also ther therle aucer vycount beamont lorde loys chalon lorde bea maister cro bowes tharchpreest lorde edward remy gas one ther copany lorde dalbret lorde mon punyers lorde suldyche l strad whan captall herd gascons named marueyled gretly blussed dyspleasure sayd faucon true ye say yt lordes gascone ar ther lorde dal br c pany sir harald ye fayle wher lorde dalbret hiselfe captall ser faucon parys reget duke n rm dy aparelleth hiselfe go reynes sayd sonday next comyng shulde crowned kyng captall layd hand heed sayd great displeasur saynt antones cap gascon agaynst gascone sir faucon taryeth harald tha chprest sent speke fro hym vnderstand harald tharch preest wolde speke captall sayd faucon say frenche haralde nede nat go farther let hym shewe tharchprest wyll nat speke hym ser johan jonell stept forthe sayd sir wyllye nat speke auentur pro yte captall sayd nay warrant nat fyte tharchprest great brauler come v wyll angle ye meane tyme ymagen strengthe auewe nobre whiche paraueture shall torne pre dyce aduauntage therfore haue hast speke tha faucon harau wet thother haraud wher taryed vnder hedge excused captall wysely well content went tharchprest shewed hym faucon sayd p thus frechmen naue royse knolege eche report two harald aparelled theself echeto mete whan captall herd faucon nobre frechmen incotynet sent certayne messagers cyte eu eu ye capten ther desyringe hym sende cite maner copanyons yt able warr yt shulde mete hym cocherell thought fynde frenchman surely sayd wherso euer met wolde fyght whan tidynges came capten eu eu named leger dorgery comau ded euery man able ryde horse shulde go cyte drawe captall ther deted towne sixscore yong men na yon towne wednysday captall lodged noone moutayne copany frenchman de forwarde fynde tyll cae ryuer called yt countre iton ran towarde eureux springeth nere couch lodged wedn sday fayre medowe longe yt ryuersyde next mor yug bothe partyes sent c rous se coude tidynges eche eche made report within two leages togyder naueroyse rode faucon led way came fro noone came way cocherell sawe frenchman orde yng theyr el ther great nobre baner enos semed double ombre dede naueroyse rested without lytell wode capitayns drue togyder ordred batayls first made thre batayls well proply fote sent caryages page lytell wode set sir john jonell inthe first batayle withall men armes archer englande seconde batayle ledde captall beusm batayle iiii c fightynge men one hym lorde saulx nauer yong lusty knight lorde wyll grauyll ser peter sankeuyll third batell ledde thre knyghtes yt say lorde bascles nell lorde bertram franke lorde sans lo yns iiii hudred whan ordeyned batayls toke vautage lytle hyll ther besyde right hand bytwene wode fronte hyll aranged selfe enemyes sette captals baner busshe thornes set lx men armes defende fro enemyes dyde thentent yf sparkeled abrode shulde drawe standarde determyned nat dyscende downe fro mou tayne maner cause let enemyes come wolde fight p howe polesy counsell sir bertram clesquy nau oise dysceded downe fro moutayne fight frechmen captall taken cap cc xxi thus ye haue herbe naueroyse englysshmen arenged moutayne whyle fre chmen ordred batayls wher made thre rere garde first sir bertram clesquy breton ordeyned co captals batayle seconde therle aucerr hym vycount beamond lorde baudwy enekyn maister cro bowes fre chmen pycard normayns sir edwarde rency sir ingram yn sir loys enekerques dyuers good kynght squyers thirde batayle archpreest burgonyons hym lorde chalons lorde beau e lorde john uyen dyuers batayle assigned assemble agaynst b scle marnell rout batayl whiche reregarde gascoyns wherof sir aymon pomyers lorde sul dyche e strade lorde perducas dalbreth lorde peteton curton soueray g e capitayns gascoyne knightes aduysed well behauynge captall howe standarde set busshe kept certayne nombre sayd yt behoued wha batayls assembled togyder shulde endeuoure theselfe coquere captals standerde sayeng howe might get enemyes shulde sone discofyted also gascons auysed another ordynaunce day right fitable lordes frauce wer along space togyder cousell howe shulde mayn tene themselfe sawe well enemyes great auauntage gascons spake worde well herde said sir knowe well captall worthy knight founde lande long able fight shall v great domage let v ordayne xxx horsbacke best men armes company let xxx take hede nothyng addresse themselfe captall whyle e tend coquere standerd might horse let breke prea may come captall take hym cary hym felde done shal haue ende batayle may taken meanes iourney shalbe people wyll sore abasshed takyng knightes fraunce bretayne acorded lyghtly euyce sayd good counsell wolde among chose xxx best men armes among mounted xxx best horse copany drewe syde felde well determyned shulde resydue taryed felde fote good array p whan frauce well ordred batayls euery man knewe shuld ther comonyng amog shulde crye day ban shulde drawe determyned cry lady aucerr mak capitayne yt day cherle aucerr erle wolde wyse agree therto take charge hym excused himselfe right graciously saying lord thanke ye honour ye wolde put surely wyll nat therof ouer yong haue suche charge honor ye first iorney yt euer therfore ye shall take another many good knight sir bertram clesquy tharchprest maister ye crosbose lorde loys chalon lorde aymon pomyers sir edwarde recy haue ben many great iorneys knowe howe order suche mater better therfore pray holde excused ye knyghtes regarded eche sayd hym noble erle aucer ye ar ye gretest among v lande lynage therfore right ye ought heed certenly sir ye say pleseth day shalbe one copanyons shall lyue dye byde myne aue ture ye soueraynte surely wyll none therof beheld eche aduysed might make chefe capiten auysed yt best knight copany ben best proued sit bertra clesquy tha ordeyned comon acorde yt cry shulde yt day lady clesquy shulde obey day sir bertra thing ordeyned stablysshed euery lorde knight vnder owne sta derd penon regarded enemyes hye ye hyll wolde nat departe fro ther strength thought nat gretly anoyed frechmen bycause yuell moutyng yt hyll also sone hote biggest faynt fastyng nother wyne vitayle dyde good wtout certayne lordes yt lytell flagon wyne anon empty made ye mornyng prouision vitayle thought haue fought enemy mornynge dyde nat escryed nere myght naueroyse englysshmen ye day ferr gone coude assembled togyder whan lordes frauce sawe behauyng naueroyse drue toguyder maner counsell de myne whyder shuld go fight enemyes nat dyuers opinyons wold go fight wt sayng shulde gret blame otherwyse yt sadde well ysed argued ye cotrary sayd go fyght wher auautage shalbe gret ell v v wyll haue iii finally wolde nat agre go danger yt myght fall ye naueroyse aduysed well maner sayd among theselfe beholde yonder enemyes wyll coe anon fight v besemyng make redy therto ther certayne knight squyers normayns prisoner ye naueroyse let go faythes went priuely freche host sayd lordes ther sir auyse well ye let day passe wt batell yor enemyes wyll morowe gretly recoforted sayd among yt lorde loys nauer shulde coe iiii c speres word enclyned gretly fight enemyes soeuer dyd made redy haue set forwarde poynt thre four tymes euer ye wysemen helde backe sayd sir let v abyde lytell space se wyll hert arso great presuptuous yt wolde gladly fight v ther many ouercome hete ye sone tha noon fasted day armed sore chafed sayd among go vp hyll fight ar lykely lost therfore let v drawe day logyng morowe let v take cousell thus dyuers opinyons whan lordes knight frauce sawe ye gouernyng theglysshmen naueroyse howe yt wolde nat dete holde yt hye noon day also herde ye wordes yt prisoner came fro sayd also saw ye te peple sore traueyled hete ye sonne right displesant thaduyce sir bertram clesquy toke cousell said sir se well yt enemyes desyreth sore fight v howbeit wyll nat discende holde wtout meanes yt shall shewe let v make semblant wtorawe backe nat fight day also people ar sore traueyled hete let v sende varlettes caryage spare horse ouer bridge water let v withdrawe backe lodgyng goynge backe lette v redy tourne agayne nede let v se wyll wyllyng fight v wyll dyscend downe hyll chase v se let v redy tourne agayne theym shall deale easely counsell accepted company euery lorde drewe hym vnder owne standerd caused tru pettes sowne retrayt commaunded knightes squyers varlet passe bridge cary ouer caryages thus passed ouer men armes passed fayntly whan ser john jonell expert knyght great desyre fyght frechmen sawe maner howe drue backe sayd captall sir let v go quickely se nat howe flye away said captall trust nat therto yuell entet begyle v sir john jonell auauced hymselfe great desyre fight wt enemyes sayng company saynt george soeuer loueth let folowe wyll go fight enemyes toke speare hande wente forthe batayls dyscended downe hyll company captall knewe therof whan sawe yt sir john jonell gone fyght without hym toke great presupcyon sayd hym sir let v go downe hyll quickely sir john jonell shall nat fight without captall copany auaunced downe hyll whan frenchman sawe discend fro ye hyll came playne feldes ryght ioyouse sayd lo nowe may se haue desyred day sode ly torned cryed lady clesquy dressed baners agaynst ye naueroyse asse bled togyder fote ser john jonell coragiously assebled baners agaynst ye batayle breton whome ser bertram chefe capitayne dyde many feat armes hardy knight thus knight squiers sparcled abrode playne fought togyder suche wepyns eche entred others batayle fought great corage wyll englysshmen naueroyse cryed saynt george fre chemen lady clesquy many good knight frenche parte sir bertram clesquy ye yong erle aucer vycout beamont ser baudwen denekyn ser loys chalon ye yong lorde beauieu sir antony yt day rered baner sir antony daneskerly ser edward recy ser ingram hedyn also gascoyns first ser aymon pomyers ser perducas dalbreth ser suldych de le strade ser peteton corton dyuers sorte gascoyns dressed agaynst captall company agaynst great desyre mete eche sore batayle many noble feate armes done acheued ought nat ly willyngly might deman ded wher tharchpreest season great capitayne great company vnder rule bycause make mencyon hym shall shewe trouthe soone archpreest sawe batayle begyn gette hym selfe prease sayd company hym bare standerd charge ye loue fere displeasur ye abyde thende batayle deuours aswell ye cane wyll departe nat retorne agayne may nat day fight armed agaynst knight felde agaynst v demaunde answere haue shewed thus departed one squyre onely hym repassed ryuer lette remnant deale resydue felde myst nat sawe baner company thende batayle wherfore beleued surely yt ben sonally nowe shall shewe ye bataile howe ended begynnyng batayle whan sir johan jonell come downe hyll company hym captall also company trusting haue vyctorie howe beit case tourned otherwyse sawe frechmen torned good array ordre perceyued well howe ben hasty coe fro aduauntage howbeit lyke valyant knyghtes basshed nothynge thought wynne victory handes playne felde lytell reculed backe assebled togyder people made way archer come forthe behynde whan archer forwarde shotte fiersly togyder frenchman well armed strongely pauyssed toke lytell hurt letted nat fyght entred among thenglysshmen naueroyse lykewise among ther bytwene cruell batayle toke strentgh armes wrestlyng speres are wepyns eche fro toke prisoner bothe partes thus fought hand hand valiatly marueyle holde ye may well beleue great preas parell many ouerthrowen stay e ther none spared say playnly frechmen nede tha slepe hande people hardy full corage wherfore behoued euery man aquyte theselfe valyantly defende bodyes kepe countre take aduantage whan came poynt el ben disconfyted surely breton gascons dyd acquyte theselfe right well day dyd many noble feate armes shall shew xxx apoynted set captall right well horsed toke hede nothyng el executyng enterprice charge togyder cae captall wher fyghtyng great axe hande gaue therwith great stroke none durst aproch nere hym xxx force horse brake pea came captall clene e toke began batayls sore euery place captals men cryed rescue payne au yled nothing captal caryed felde tyme herd tell bett phowe thenglysshmen naueroyse discofyted batayle cocherell howe yong kyng frauce made broder duke burgoyne castels fortress wonne cap cc xxii great batayle thenglysshmen naueroyse entended folowe rescue captall saw caryed away frenche te sir aymon pomyers ser petyton corton sir souldyche de la strade lorde dalbretes company entended coragyous wyll dresse towarde captals standerd stode busshe sore batayle standerd well defeded good men warr specially sir bascle marnell sir geffray rouselone ther many rescue many one hurt cast erthe nowe beit naueroyse standerd ouerthrowen bascle marnell slayne sir geffray rouselone taken prisoner sir aymon pomyers man coude tell became whider slayne taken whan captals staderd taken torne peace meane season breton frechmen pycardes normayns burgonyons fought valiatly stode well hand naueroyse caused somwhat recule ther deed freche tie vy cout beamont great domage lusty yong knyght lykely haue pued noble man copany great payne caryed felde herde recounted bothe tie nat bensene aforei suche batell suche nombre well fought batayle fote hand hand medled togyder eche tie fought wepyns ther many gret stroke gyuen are steell ther sore hurt ser petyton corton sir suldich de la strade suche wyse coude good day sir john jonell whome batell began dyd day many feate armes hurt dyuers plac body finally take prisoner squyer briten copany ser bertra clesquy caryed prease ther slayne freche tie maister crosbowes sir loys hennebreq dyuers naueroyse lorde saul many men day dyed prisoner ser john jonell ther taken ser wyllm grauyll ser peter sankuyll ser geffray rouselon ser bertram frake dyuers fewe naueroyse saued wer nere take slayne place batayle normady nere cocherell tuesday xxiiii day may yere lorde iii c lxiiii pafter discofytur deed dispoyled euery man takyng hede prisoner dressyng hurt part frechmen repassed bridge drawyng lodgyng right sore traueyled wery season ser guy grauyll son sir wyllm grauyll departed mornyng fro garyson couch l speres thentent haue come captall batayle began wherfore made great haste came place batayle ben frenchman wer behynd cryed copany sayng ne agayne sir behold cometh mo enemyes sir aymon company ther redy whan sawe naueroyse set staderd high busshe cause frenchman drawe thyder whan ser guy herd cry lady clesquy sa e nat captall none copany sawe moche peple lye deed groude parceyued well naueroyse ben disconfyted retorned way came euenyng frenchman toke hede prisoner ther moche spekyng enquiring archpreest whan knowen nat batayle men excused hym well coude xxx toke captall neuer seassed tyll brought hym castell uernon next day frechmen dysloged went one lefte parte prisoner pdf coronacyon kynge charles fyfte cap cc xxiii trinyte sonday yere lorde ccc lxiiii kyng charles e heyre kyng john crowned sacted kynge great churche lady reyns also quene wyfe dought duke peter burbone tharchebysshop place ther present kyng peter cypre duke anion duke burgone sir uyncelat behayne duke luzenburge brabant erles ewe dapmactyn takernyll uademont many prelate lord cite great feelt solemnytees v dayes kyng departed wente parys nat recounted hole day solenyties great f stes parys made lordes retourned owne countrees suche ben kynges coronacyon kynges comynge parys yongest brother put possessyon duchy burgone departed fro parys great nobre men went toke lyuery season homage baron knyghtes cytes castels good townes duchy burgone whan visited coutre retorned parys season tharchpreest apesed kyng displeasur suche excusacions layd hymselfe nat iourney cocherell shewynge might nat armed agaynst captall captall request lorde dalbret let prison faithe trouth captal ayded gretly excuse arch preest kyng knight frauce suche spake yuell hym also th newly ouerthrowen burgone besyde dyuyn iiii c copanyons pyllers coutre wher gyllot du pyn talbert tacylbordon john chafour capitayns season kyng caused beheded ser peter sanguyll cytie rone bycause become naueroyse sit grauyll ben case sir guy son nat sent worde kyng put dethe father wolde lyke wise serue sir beamon de la uale great lorde bretayne prisoner wherfore lynage kynred dyd somoch sute kyng exchange made bytwene sir beamon sir grauyll eche delyuerd season ser bertra clesquy gate agayne castell roleboyse vi frakes payd capten therof named uaster retorned agayne brabat fro whens came yet dyuers copanyons helde styll sudry tress calr normady perch placs dyd moch hurt trouble realme frauce tytle king nauer owne quarell robbe coutre without reason true tytle fre che kyng sent brother duke burgone agaynst pyllers duke made somons cyte charter tha drue felde hym ser bertram clesquy sir boucequat therle aucer sir loys chalon lorde beauieu ser aymon punyers sir rauenall begue vyllayns ser nicholl lyne maister crosbowes ser edmarde racy ser ingra hedyn nobre v fightynge men whan sawe wer great nobre deuyded thre ptes wherof sir bertram clesquy wet toward costatyne throwe march cherburge kepe froters naueroyse shuld hurt domage coutre mandy hym lorde auter erle joney sir arnold dandrehen many knightes squiers briten normandy seconde bataile lorde de la ryuer copany dyuers knyghtes squyers frauce pycardy sent erldome eureux duke hymselfe grettest company went layd sege marchranuyll stronge castell naueroyse brought thyder many engyns fro cyte charter whiche dyde cast day night dyde within moche trouble iourney duke burgone made agaynst garysons naueroyse socour freche kynge sent sir charles bloys ca cc xxiiii meane season warr thus beause normandy makyng warre agaynst naueroyse enemyes realme ther sir loyes nauer charge warr vnder brother kyng defyed freche kyng bycause warr touched chalenge enherytance batell cocherell assembled togyder men warr coude get dyde moche meanes gat certayne capitayns copanyons nombre xii hundred speres hym sir robert canoll sir robert ceney sir robert briquet carsnell dayly encreased loged bytwene ryuer loyre ryuer dallet ouerran great te coutre burbonoyse mo lyns auuergne saynt peter mynster saynt pursayn sir loyes copany day ccc whome sir bertram de la sale ortyngo capitaynes departed passed loyre besyde marcilly nonnes rode long night day aryued charytie ryuer loyre great towne well closed incotynent sealed entred taryed styll place entred feared lest towne set busshmen therfore durst entre farther tyll fayre day meane season towne caryed goodes botes whiche ryuer loyre themselfe wyues chyldren sorowed away towarde cytie neuers whiche fyue leages then wha day naueroyse englysshmen gascoyns suche scaled towne went forward towne founde house voyde tha determyned kepe towne fortify thought stode metely ouer ron countre bothe sydes ryuer loyre tha sent worde therof si lois nauer marche auuergne incotynent sent sir robert briquet thre hundred speares passed countre without resystence entred bridge ouer loyre charite whan met togyder thought selfe strong ynowe began make sore warre realme fraunce nowe lette v speke duke burgoyn lay siege marcherauyll oppressed within sore yelded vp towne sauyng lyues goodes departed duke sent sir boucequant sir johan uyen marshall burgoyn take possessyon towne made capitayne therof squyer called guyllyam charter hym fourtie soudyers duke went company canerolles layd sege ther stode playne countre nowe let v speke sir john de la ryuer lay syege acqueney nere passy coutie eureux copany ii gret kyng might spende lyst wtin castell aqueney englysshmen norman frenchman naueroyse bene ther euer sythe batayle cocherell defe ded right valyantly well fortifyed artyllary vytels howbeit finally fayne yelde vp castell lyues goodes saued departed caryed goodes cherbourge taryed tha sir john de la ryuer garnisshed castell frenchman wente towarde cytie deureux hym sir hewe castell lorde sany sir mathewe roy sir monfange lorde ely lorde cresques lorde capy sir edwarde roucy sir ingram hedyn dyuers knightes squyers frau ce meane season duke burgon dyde moche canerolles fayne yelde pleasure soudyers straugers taken mercy certayne pyllers nacyon frau ce ther taken put dethe came duke certayne burgess charter desyred duke wolde gyue wage rewarde engens castell canerolles whiche done great hurt tyme past duke gaue wolde therwith charter sette men warke beate clene downe erthe duke wente vnto castell called drewe playne countre beau therin certayne pyllers duke within slayne duke went castell named pru besiged made many assaut wanne finally yelded vp lyues onely saued goodes bare away nothyng frenchman within kept styll prisoner duke toke possession castell gaue knight beausse called sir peter du boyes thentent shulde fortify kepe sufficyently duke went refresshed cytie charter part hoost whan ben fyue dayes went beseged castell conuay whiche done moche trouble countre duke caused sixe great engens reysed agaynst meane season whyle duke made assantes normady sir loys nauer ouerran lowe cou tre auuerne kept styll feldes sore enpouerysshed countre none duell encountre hym also garyson char te dyd lyst also therle mounthelyert alyes almayne entred duchy burgoyn besancon wasted countre whrefore freche kyng sent duke gone shulde breke vp sege co uay drawe parys go burgone whan duke herd ry promysed nat depart fro conuay tyll cousell sayd sythe kynge sent hym myght well depart breke promyse made therof semblaunt conuay marshall enquired wolde yelde vp simply duke pleasure answered nay howebeit sayde content yelde vp castell theyr lyues goodes saued whiche fre accepted departed duke delyuered castell knyght beau named philyppe arciers newly fortifyed duke wet charter gaue charge moost parte company erle auserre sir boucequant ser loys ancer duke went parys hym sir loys alenson forde beauiewe lorde uyen burgonyons came kyng brother uaur countie bry taryed one day rode longe champaig toke way langers wente gadered men warre togyder thus burgonyons made froter warr agaynst enemyes archpreest lorde castell uylayne lorde uergy lorde grancy lorde sobournon lorde rougemont ryche man named john boloyn lorde prises sir uyen lorde castell bysshoppe langers right ioyous comynge duke lorde rode towarde enemyes xv hundred speares drawen beyond ryne burgonyons entred beyond countie moutbelyart brent went meane tyme frenche kyng sent sir morean fennes costable two marshal sir boucequant sir moto brauyll great nombre knyghtes squiers go ley siege charite ryuer loyre dyde nigh euery day skirmysshed within duke burgon moost part co pany ben county moutbelyart come parys kynge se duke mo speres siege charite ther sege thre knyght squyers skirmysshed often tymes garyson yt ther hurt bothe tie ther made newe knight reysed baners yssu charite made first sir robert alenson son erle aleson dyed cressy sir loys aucer son therle au r deed brother therle ther present thus charytie sore oppressed gladly wolde haue redred vp fortress coposicion duke burgon wolde haue pleasure taken fro ryuer purueyauce coude come season sir loys nauer exyled hym march auuergne assembled people euery syde entent reyse siege charytie two thousande fightynge men sente bretayne sir robert canoll sir gaultier hewet sir mathewe gornay knight squyers shulde come serue hym iourney whervnto sore desyrous redy sege alroy therl mountfort whan sir loys sawe coud get drewe chorbourge ordynaunce kyng brother season thentent sir charles blo shulde haue mo men warr hym frenche kyng sent duke goyn yt shul e eyue charytie lyues saued co dy onally shulde swere yt thre yeres shulde nat armed kyng nauers parte thus charytie yelded themselfe vp lyues saued aryed away goodesse departed foote passed throughe realme fraunce duke saue conducte wont olde tyme dwell chary e came thyder agayne abyde duke retourned parys frenche kynge acorded cosyn sir charles bloys shulde haue realme nombre thousande speares wrote sir bertram clesquy normandy shulde go bretayne ayd cosyn ser charles blois agaynst sir john mountfort tydynges sir bertram right oyouse alwayes toke lorde charles naturall lorde departed normady suche people coude gette go bretayne sir boucequant kept styll siege normandy stede long rode sir bertram copany came nau te bretayne founde lorde charles bloys good lady wyfe receyued hym ryght swetely conde hym great thanke come thyder socour ayde hym counselled togyder howe shulde maynteyn forthe warr also moost parte bretayne entensyon ayde sir charles bloyes whome reputed duke bretayne thinkynge reyse syege alroy fight lorde mountfort thyder came great baroney knyghtes fraunce normandy erle au erre erle joye lorde frauyll lorde prie begue uyllers dyuers good knyghtes squyers good men armes dynges came lorde mountforte lay siege aulroy howe lorde charles bloys made great as ble men warr howe dyuers lordes frau ce come hym dayly came newe besyde conforte lordes knyghtes squyers bretayne assone lorde mountfort knewe tidynges sent worde therof duchy acquitayne knyght squyers ther englande specially sir john chandos desyring hertely great nede wolde confort hym trust bretayne shulde many dede armes whiche knyghtes squyers auaunce theyr honour shulde entende whan sir johan chandos sawe erle mountforte desyred hym effectuously asked lycence prince wale lorde maister answered sayd content shulde go sayeng breche ye peace bytwene englande fraunce frenchemen lykewise toke parte sir charles bloys agaynst erle mountforte good leaue frenche kyng sir johan chandos ryght ioyouse made prouisyon desyred dyuers knyghtes squyers acquitayne haue gone hym howbeit ther fewe wold go hym sauyng suche englysshemen yet hym cc speares many archer rode longe poyctou xaynton entred bretayne came syege alroy ther founde erle mou forte receyued hym right ioyously gladde comynge sir olyuer clysson sir robert canoll tha semed generally none yuell coude come sythe sir johan chandos theyr company also dyuers knyghtes squyers englande passed see desyringe auaunce bodyes fyght frechmen came siege alroy ayde erle mountforte receyued great ioye englysshe breton nombre sixtene hundred fightyng men eyght nyne hundred archer nowe let v retourne sir charles bloys ytie na te made ther somons gadered togyder warre euery part wher thought get well enformed howe erle mountfort greatly reconforted englysshmen desyred barownes knyghtes squyers bretayne sache done homage de helpe ayde hym defende herytage agaynst enemyes came baron bretayne serue vy lorde yon sir charles lorde eur lorde tor myne lord dancennes lorde male yt lor lorde dangore lord lohea lorde pont nd dyuers cannat name lord men loged cyte nauntes ylages ther whan assembled togyder nombre hundred speares fraunce thes lordes counsciled lorde charles nat ary longe ryde towarde enemyes departynge good lady wyfe sayd presens sir cle quy lord knightes bretey sir ye goynge defende myne herytage myne whiche lorde mountfort taketh fro v wrongfully without cause god knowe lordes bretayne present knowe ryght well right enheryter therfore sir requyre hartely ye make ner ordynaunce composycion agrement peace therle mountfort hole body duchy may remayne hasband grauted departed company toke lady whome reputed uchesse ro e towarde ynes thyder lodged ta refresshed enemyes aduyse su fi yent place yght case might fyade aduauntage ther great cacion amonge knightes squyers aunce bretayn suche thyder ayde sir charles bloys full swere courtesse parauentur w lde gladly haue codyscended peace haue en tent parte duchy bretayne name god wife knightes hym might nat fall treaty peace p howe sir charles bl y came agaynst erle mountford mordynaunce ba ayle howe sir johan chados came agaynst hym howe many eche tayle cap cc xx bitwene alroy wher therle mountfortlay sige eages coutre tha oyng came therle mou fort howe lorde charles bloyes aproched nere hym goodlyest men armes best ed apoynted euer sene come fraunce dynges thenglysshmen right ouse great desyre fight eueryman dressed harnesse poynt shed speares dagger are ha gen helmes bassene te vysers maner harnes thoughe shortely shulde stande ha capitayns drewe er f r sir johan chandos whose counsayle specially wolde ruled sir ambreticourt sir robert lle sir e caurell sir mathewe gourney knightes counsayled therle mo sorde nexte day shulde take de thanne take aduyse shewed hoost shulde next day redy apparelled sette order batayle thought shulde fight tynent nyght passed day came saturday englysshemen breton yssued oute holdes came properly good ordynaunce behyude castell aulroy toke place grounde sayde howe wolde abyde enemyes hour prime sir charles bloyes hoost came thyder deted friday fro uannes night lodged within thre lytell leages alroy sir charles bloys company ordred best maner coude deuysed rode close toguyder yf one cast thynge among wolde haue rested spere poyntes se theglysshmen toke great pleasure thus frenchemen rested good array enemyes toke fel e amonge usshes commaunded marshalles none shulde go forward without comaundement stode styll good aray euer redy batayle whiche desyre wyll lorde charles bloys cousell sir bertram clesquy great capitayne gretly beloued ye baron breteyn aduyse ther ordayned thre batels reregard vnderstande sir bertra leadyng ye first great nobre knightes squiers bretayne seconde led therle aucer therle jony plenty knightes squiers fra ce lorde charles bloyes copany great baron breteyn vycont rohan lorde leon lorde nagor sir charles dynan lorde dacenes ye lorde malestroyt dyuers eregard lorde raix lorde rieux lorde tornemyne lorde pont dyuers baron knight squ er euery batayle good fightyng men ye lorde charles bloys esy desyringe euery batell yt day true deuoyre tooke soule part paradyse yt shulde fight rightfull quarell promysing euery man acordynge desertes well rewarded p nowe let v speke englysshmen breton ordred batayls sir johan c handos princypall capitayue ouer though therle mountfort chiefe kyng englande writen hym shulde specially entend busynesse sonne therle mountfort shuld haue doughter maryage aboue knightes moost nerest
