therle mountfort well ymagined cosydred demeanour frenchman mynde praysed gretly good ordre sayd pereth surely flour honour cheual among yonder company besyde great wyt good ordre said openly sir tyme yt order batayls enemyes hath gyuen v ensample suche herd sayd sir ye say trouthe ye mayster chefe counsellour therfore order acordyng pleasure none yt shall coutrole also ye knowe better order suche mater made thre batayls reregarde firste sir robert canoll sir gaultier huet sir richard burlke seconde sir olyuer clysson sir eustace dabreticourt si mathue gorney thirde therle moutfort hym selfe wayt hym euery batayle v c men armes iiii c archer whan cae ordring reregard called hym sir hewe caurell sayd sir hewe ye shall kepe areregard v c ye shall kepe wyng styre nat fro place maner cause wtout yese n de batayls breke ordisaray aduenture ye se suche nede drawe thyder confort whan ye haue done kepe agayne stall ye day ye nat better seruyce whan sir hewe caurell well herd sir john chandes greatly shamed displeased sayd sir delyuer areregard purpose nat medell ther sir haue marueyle ye se shulde nat one ye first fight enemyes sir john chandos right well auysed sayd sir hewe set nat areregarde bycause ye nat good knyght copany neuer mynde knowe truly ye wolde gladly one formast right able ye ordeyn therto bycause ye sage knight well aduysed ser must behoue one v two must wherfore hertely requyre sir promyse faithfully ye wyll shalbe great aduautage v ye therby shall tayne great honour moreouer promyse first request euer ye desyreme shall graut howbeit wordes sir john chandos coude speke sir hewe caurell wolde nat agre therto reputed grete shame desyred goddessake holdyng vp hades put therto effect mynde fight formast word sir johan chandos almost wept sayd right swetely sir hewe must behoue el selfe therfore consyder whiche better sir hewe aduysed hym selfe tho wordes halfe cofounded sayd certesse ser knowe well ye wyll nat desyre thyng shulde dishonoure sy wyll none otherwyse content sir hewe caurell toke hym charge reregard drue part wyng set hym good order thus ye saturday viii day octobre yer lorde iii c lxiiii batayls ordred eche fayre playne nere lroy bretayne whiche goodly sight beholde might haue ben sene baners penons wauyng wynde harnesse richely aparelled specially frechmen properly dressed ioye beholde thus th red batayls bothe tie lorde beamanoyre great baron ryche bretayne went bytwene party entretyng peace glad besy hym selfe therin exchewyng parels lykely fall suffred go come bytwen party bycause sworne prisoner thenglysshmen might nat armed saturday went often tymes tyll noone meanes gat bytwene party certayne respyte day night vntyll next day sonne risynge euery man brewe logynge toke ease refresshing suche euenyng capitayne alroy yssued garyson bycause ye truse also stretched went peasably hoost lorde charles bloyes receyued hym right ioyously capitayne called henry hanternell squyer good man armes company fortie speres good companyons well armed horsed suche holpe kepe fortresse whan lorde charles sawe capitayne smy lyng enquyred hym state castell squyer answered sayd sir thaked god haue yet prouisyon sufficyent kepe two thre monethes nede well henry lorde charles morowenexte ye shall well delyuerd agrement peace el playne batayle sir squyer god gyue grace faythe lorde charles haue copany xxv c men armes wel aparelled likely acquyte nobly euer dyde copany came frau ce sir squyer great aua tage ye ought gretly thanke god therfore sir bertram clesquy baros knightes squyers fraunce bretayne thus courtesly coe serue thus lorde charles passed forthe yt nyght comunynge wt one nyght sir john chandos sore esyred certayne englisshmen shulde nat cosent peace bytwene therle mountfort lorde bloyes sayd spende poore therfore wolde recouer somwhat gayne batayle el lose togyder sir john chandos promysed agree peace p whane sonday came mornyng euery man hoost apar le himselfe hoost sir charle bloys ther many e sayd houseled suche wolde lykewise dyd therl moutfortes host lytell sonne rysing euery man drewe vnder owne batayls good ordre dyd day anone lorde beamanoyre came entreat peace gladly wolde haue party agreed cam first warde sir johan chandos yssued batayle soone sawe hym comynge met hym whan lorde beamanoyr sawe saluted hym right humbly sayd sir johan chandos requyre goddes sake set acorde party shuld great pyte yt many noble men shulde fight guyder susteyning quarels sir john cha o said sir beamanoyre wyll nat therfore aduyse yt ye ryde farther oure people determyned yf enclose among wyll slee therfore ye may say lorde charles bloys howe soeuer sir john mountfort wyll haue batayle forsaketh treaty peace saith wyll day duke bretayne el dye place whan lorde beamanoyre vnderstode sir john chandos angry mynde sayd cha do chandos nat thentent lorde sir charles bloys yet hath great wyll fyght lorde hath hath people ther departed without mo wordes retourned lorde charles bloys lordes bretayne taryed hym sir john cha do retourned erle mountforte enquyred hym howe mater went aduersary sayd sir sendeth worde lorde beaumanoyre fro whome departed howe soeuer wyll fyght day duke breteyn el dye payne answer sir johan chandos made thentent gyue lorde better corage thus finally sayd sir take hede nowe ye wyll whyder wyll ye fight nat sir erle ye name god saynt george let v go god helpe right cause baners auau ce dyde lorde beaumanoyre whan retorned lorde charles sayd sir sir lorde saynt yue haue herde proudest worde sir john chandos yt euer herde sayd therle moutfort shulde day duke bretayne sheweth playnly ye haue ryght therto whiche worde sir charles chauged colour sayd right god knoweth myne affermed baron bretayne caused baners auaunced name god lytell hour prime batayls aproched nere togyder whiche goodly sight beholde haue herde recorded sene frechmen close togyder man coude nat cast appell among shuld fallen bassenet helme euery man armes bare spere right befor hym cut fyue fote length shorte axe hangyng syde cae fayre easely euery man good array baner right well aduysed also englisshmen right properly apoynted assembled met togyder first breton sir bertram clesquy encountred batayle sir robert canolle sir gaultier hewet lordes bretayne bothe sydes sette baners lordes claymed duke eche agaynst first encountre sore batayle truely archer shot beginnyng right fiersly howbeit shotte dyde lytell hurt frenchemen well armed pauysshed tharchers bygge men lyght cast away bowes entred amonge frenchman bare ax first metyng pulled frenchemennes handes ax wherwt fought ryght hardely done many eat armes many one taken rescued gayne one downe herde hym releue agayne without great helpe batayle wherin lorde charles dressed theym selfe streyght agaynst lorde mountfortes batayle hym erle rohane lorde lyon sir charles dynan lorde quyntyne lorde da cenes lorde rochforde euery lordes baner hym sore foughten batayle mountfordes parte beginnynge sore oppressed thane sir hugh caurell wynge great batayle good men warr sawe copany ordre drewe thyder sette agayne ordre whiche dealynge gretly aueyled day phowe sir john chandos disconfyted bataile therle aucer howe sir bertra clesquy disconfyted taken lorde charles bloys slayne batell pytefull complaynt therle mountfort made dethe cap c c xxvi also sir olyuer clysson sir eustace danbreticourt sir richard brulle sir johan bourchier sir mathewe gourney dyuers knyghtes squyers fought batayle erle aucerr erle joignye whiche great batayle well furnysshed good menne warr ther many noble dede done many taken rescued agayne frenchman breton one parte fought ryght valyantly ax helde handes lorde charles bloyes proued hymselfe merueylous good knyght also aduersary therle mountfort valyant knight sir john chados dyd day many noble feat dayes right valyant knight hardy redouted enemyes sage batayle well aduysed full experyens counselled euer therle mountfort alwayes toke hede cofort men sayd sir thus thus drawe syde syde therle ruled hymselfe alwayes counsell part sir bertram clesquy lorde tornmyne lorde dauagour lorde raix lorde loheat lorde bornay lorde malestroyt lord pont lord prier many good knightes squyers bretayne normandy ther lord charles blois fought valiantly long fought batels assebled eche except reregard theglyssmen wherof ser hewe caurell chefe soueraygne kept alwayes batell wyng toke hede nothig redresse agayne te thyng mysse among among knight sir olyuer clisson well aduised maruels body grete axe hades wherwt brake opened prese none durst aproche nere hym aduetured himselfe often tymes ferr great danger moche batell therle iucerr erle joigny sore encoutred stroke stryken vyser bassenet poynt axe entred eye wherby h lost euer syght eye stroke yet delt styll lyke noble knyght recouerynge batayles baners somtyme downe well fightynge releued agayne bothe partes amonge knyghtes sir johan chandos good knyght valyantly fought helde handes gaue suche stroke none durst aproche hym great myghty knight well formed membres came fought agaynst batayle erle aucers frenchman done many noble dede force well fightyng batayle broken brought suche myschefe brefely disco fyted baners penons batayle ouerthrowen erthe lordes put flight great danger mischefe nat ayded coforted fro part euery man ynough defende hymselfe say trouthe whan discosyture falleth ar ouercome discofyted lytell one fall ther falleth thre iii x x xxx x slye ther foloweth c thus fortuned batayle alroy lordes cryed cryes wherby herde recoforted men drue nat herde prease ferr fro men ho wheit finally erle aucer force armes sore wounded taken vnder standerd sir john chandos yelden prisoner erle joigny also lorde prier great baneret normandy pyet season batels fought styll valyantly breton helde longe space good ordre howbeit speke truly armes kept nat ordre well thenglysshemen breton therle moutfort dyde gretly aueyled day batayle wyng sir hewe caurell ledde whan theglysshmen sawe frenchman begyn breke opyn batell greatly reconforted frenchman suche horse redy aperelled mounted stedd away fast myght sir john chandos copany hym dressed theselfe agaynst batell sir bertram clesquy whiche batayle done marueyls armes opyned many good knightes squters brought great myschefe gyuen many great stroke heuy are many bassenet clouen sodre many man wounded dethe say trouth ser bertram clesquy copany coude leger endure enemyes ther taken sir bertam clesquy squyer englande vnder standerd sir john chandos season sir johan chandos toke prisoner lorde bretayne called lorde raix right hardy knyght whan batayle breton began thus breke batayls clene discofyted lost aray euery man fledde away fast might saue selfe except certayne good knyghtes squyers bretayne wold nat leaue lorde charles bloys rather dye departe reproche drue hym fought right valtan ly ther done many noble dede armes lorde charles blois che helde themselfe togyder certayne space defedyng themselfe right valyantly howe beit finally coude nat defende selfe disconfyted brought ordre force armes moost parte englysshmen drewe parte baner lorde charles bloyes disconfyted cast erthe slayne bare lorde charles slayne face towarde enemyes bastarde sonne called sir johan bloys dyuers knightes squyers bretayne vnderstode ordayned englysshe hoost better bataile sir charles bloyes founde place none shulde take hym raunsome slee hym semblable wyse frechmen ordayned sir john mountfort atteyned vyctorie day determyned haue ende warre whan cae flight ther great slaughter many good knyght taken brought myschefe floure cheualry tyme takene slayne fewe men honour scaped specially banerett bretayne ther slayne ser charles dynan lorde lyon lorde da cenes lorde dauagour lorde loheat lorde gargoll lorde malestroyt lorde pout dyuers knyghtes squyers whiche canne nat name ther taken erle rohan ser guy lyon lorde rochfort lorde raix lorde ry x therle tonoyre sir henry malestroyt sir olyuer manny lorde ruyll lorde franuyll lorde raneuall dyuers normandy dyuers good knyghtes squyers fraunce therle aucer joigny br uely speke disconfyture great mighty moche good peple therin slayne well f ldes chase whiche endured eyght great leages cuyn raynes ther many aduentures came acall knowledge many one slayne taken fortuned fall handes cruell courtesse ba e nere alroy bretayne yere lorde thousande ccc lx foure great disconfytur ye haue herde lordes englande bretayne retourned lefte chase people ther drewe erle mountfort sir john chandos sir robert canoll sir eustace dambretycourt sir mathewe gourney sir johan bourchier sir gaultier hewet sir hughe caurelle sir richarde brulle sir rycharde tancon dyuers came hedge syde ther vnarmed sawe well iourney theyrs certayne set baners standerdes hedge baner armes bretayne busshe drawe people thyder sir johan chandos sir robert canoll sir hugh caurell knightes drewe therle mountfort smylyng sayde hym sir laude god make good chere ye haue day conquered herytage bretayne erle enclyned hymselfe ryght courtesly sayd openly euery man myght sir john chandos good aduenture thus fallen great wytte prowes whiche knowe well sir pray drinke toke hym flagon wyne wherof dronke refresshed hym moreouer sayd sir besyde god ought canne moost thanke creature lyuyng therwith ther came sir olyuer clysson forchased enstamed long pursued enemyes moche payne retourne agayne people brought hym many prisonere came therle mountfort lyghted fro horse refresshed hym meane season came two knightes two haraldes serched among deed bodyes se ser charles bloys deed nat sayd openly sir make good chere haue sene aduersary ser charles deed therwith erle mountfort arose sayde wolde go se hym good wyll se hym deed lyue thyder went knyghtes hym whan come place lay syde couered vnder shelde caused hym vncouered regarded hym ryght piteously studyed certayne space sayd sir charles fayre cosyn howe opinyon many great myschiefe hath fallen bretayn god helpe sore dyspleaseth fynde thus howe beit none otherwyse therwith began wepe sir john chandos drewe hym backe sayd sir departe hen thanke god fayre aduentur fallen without dethe man ye coude nat come herytage bretayne tha therle ordayned sir charles bloys shulde borne guyngant incotynent great reuerence buryed honorably apertayned good true valyant knight body sanctifyed grace god called saynt charles canonised pope urban v dyde yet dothe many fayre myracles dayly p truce gyuen bury deed hatayle alroy dyuers castels yelded vp therle moutfort howe seged capantoretyne cap cc xxvii deed bodyes dispoyled thenglysshmen retourned fro chase tha drewe lodgynges vnarmed toke ease toke hede prisoner caused theym wounded well serued serched monday mornynge erle moutfort made knowen cytie reynes townes ther wolde gyue truce thre dayes cutet might gather togyder deed bodyes bury holy place whiche ordynaunce well taken accepted erle mountfort lay styll siege alroy sayd wold nat depart then tyll wonne tidynges spredde abrode dyuers countrees howe sir john mountfort counsell ayde englysshmen felde agaynst sir charles bloys disconfyted put dethe taken cheualry bretayne agaynst hym sir johan chandos great renome maner people lordes knightes squyers suche ben felde sayd wytte high prowes thenglysshmen breton felde tidynges frendes ayders sir charles bloyes right sorowfull sore dyspleased whiche good reason specially frenche kyng disconfyture touched hym gretly bycause dyuers knight realme ther slayne taken sir bertram clesquy whome greatly loued erle aucer erle joigny barones bretayne none except frenche kyng sent loyes duke aniou march bretayne recofort countre desolate disconforted loue lorde charles bloyes whome lost also reconforte countesse bretayne wyfe sayd lorde charles sore disconforted dethe husbande pyte beholde whiche duke aniou boude maried doughter promysed faythfull entent gyue vnto good cyties castels bretayne remnant countre bretayne good counsell confort ayde case wherby good lady whome called mother countrey certayne space gret trust vnto suche season frenche kyng ereche parels put prouisyon ye shall herafter also tidynges came kyng englande erle moutfort writen hym therof v day batayle ended alroy letter brought kynge enlande douer parseuant armes ben batayle kyng inconsynent made hym haralde called wynd sore enformed haraulde dyuers cause kynge englande douer shal shewe trouthe ther treaty thre yere bytwene lord edmo de erle cambrige one kynges sonnes doughter therle loys flauders maryage therle flauders newly agreed vnto pope urban fyft wolde dispence nere lynage duke lacastre lorde edmonde brother many knightes squyers ben flauders erle receyued right honorably signe great peace loue erle flaunders come calais passed see came douer kyng parte counsell redy receyue hym ther whan forsayd purseuant came kyng brought hym tidynges batayle alroy whiche kyng ther right ioyouse lykewise erle flaunders loue honour auauncemet cosyn germayne erle mountfort thus kyng england therle flau ders douer space thre dayes feestes great sportes whan well sported done assembled erle flaunders toke leaue kyng departed vnderstande duke lancastre lorde edmonde passed see agayne hym helde company tyll came bruges p nowe let v speke therle moutfort dyd bretayne cap cc xxviii erle mountfort ye haue herde lay styll sege alroy said howe wolde nat departe then tyll pleasure wt castell nat case lost capitayne henry fetenycle abydden felde chefe company wherfore fewe within socour came none fro parte therfore toke counsell amonge determyned yelde vp castell lyues good saued entreted therle counsell erle many thynges take hede bycause knewe nat howe countre wolde de demeaned therfore toke mercy suffred peasably departe toke possessyon forteresse sette men rode farther whiche dayly encreased menne warr archer resorted dayly hym also dyuers knightes squyers bretayne torned part specially breton bre te taryed thre dayes towne jougowe made two great assautes wherin dyuers sore hurt bothe theym within without whan jougowe sawe howe assayled socoure comynge warde han detmyned nat haryed vndone toke therle mountfort lord opened gate sware become men foreuer erle remoued offuers towne sette newe rode towne dynan layed siege whiche endured long wynter towne well garnysshed vitayls good men warre also duke amou erhorted kepe like good men warre promysed conforte whiche caused abyde suffre many great assaut whan sawe purueyaunces began mynisshe socoure apered entreated pea erle mountforte gladly entended therto desyred nothingels shulde knolege hym lorde dyde entred towne dynan great solempnyte dyde hym homage fealtie tha rode forthe army tyll came cytie campecorentyne besieged rounde brought thyder great engens fro uanes fro dynan sayd wolde nat dete then tyll pleasur thenglysshmen breton sir john chandos taken batayle alroy dyuers prisoner wolde put none raunsome bycause shulde nat asseble gyder gayne make newe felde agaynst therfore sent po xaynton burdeaur rochell kept prisoner meane season breton englysshmen one part conquered countre bretayne p peace made erle mountfort shulde abyde duke bretayne howe frenche kynge rendred clysson lande maryage duke normady howe captall beu became liege man frenche kynge afterwarde renounced hym agayne cap cc xxix meane seasone erle mountforte lay siege campecorentyne sore beten oppressed engyns assautes men ran ouer countre left nothyng vntaken without hote colde heuy aduentures frenche kynge well enformed theron dyuers counsayls purpose ymagynacions howe myght besynesse bretayne harde te coude nat well remedy without styrringe realme make warr agayne thenglysshmen bretayne wherin counsell wyse great delyberacion counsell sayd sir ye haue helde opinyon lord charles bloyes cosyn lykewise dyde kyng father kynge philyp graundfather gaue hym maryage duchy bretayne wherby many great yuels inconuenyentes hath fallen sythe bretayne countreis sir lorde charles bloys cosyn kepynge defendynge ryght bretayne deed slayne ther non syde right warre chalenge releue two sonnes john guy next heyres ar englande prisone sirye dayly howe erle mountfort coquereth taketh townes castels reputeth owne true herytage sir thus ye may lese ryght homage ye ought haue bretayne whiche ryght noble thyng realme wherfore ye ought greatly doute losse therle mountfort become liege man holde duchy bretayne brother kynge englande father dyde olde tyme ye canne nat haue agayne without great warre great hatred bytwene kyng englande wher good peace whiche wyll nat counsell breke therfore sir thynke thynges cosydred ymagined good send certayne messangers haue treaty bytwene therle mountforte knowe howe wyll maynteyne agree peace bytwene hym countre lady calleth herselfe duchesse sir messangers feleth hym dysposed mater acordyng therto ye may take aduyse ye vttermost better abode styll duke bretayne wyll holde right subget ought lorde rather mater shulde great parell lesyng whiche wordes kynge gladly enclyned vnto ordayned lorde johan craon archbysshop lorde craon cosyn sir boucequant shulde go yt voyage campacorentyne treat erle mountfort counsell ye state peace ye haue herde thus thre lordes deted well instructed shulde longe rode tyll came sege englysshmen breton campacorentyne named messangers fro frenche kyng therle mountfort sir johan chandos cousell receyued right ioyously lordes frauce shewed right sagely occasyon comyng thider weresent first entreaty therle moutfort answered howe wolde take counsell aduyce mater gaue day answere meane season thre lord went lay cytie reyns erle mountforte sent englande lorde latymer shewe kyng england treaty frenchman desyringe hym haue cousell behalfe kyng englande whan enfourmed mater sayd howe wolde counsell therle moutfort haue peace alwayes might duke bretayne somwhat recopence lady callynge selfe duchesse honest thynge assignynge certayne rent yerely payd place wher myght sure haue without daunger lorde latimer brought worde agayne therle kynges answere letter reed answere herde erle mountfort counsell sent frenche messangers come hoost theyr answere made right courtesly sayd theym howe erle mountfort wolde wyse departe forsake chalenge duchy bretayne wolde abyde duke bretayne called wher freche kyng wolde haue hym opyn peasably cyties townes castels make faithe homage ryghtes duke bretayne haue done tyme paste content gladly knowlege frenche kyng naturall lorde hym homage seruyce presens peres frauce also gyue ayde helpe reconforte cosyn wyfe therle charles trepassed helpe delyuer cosyns sonnes prison englande answere pleased right well lordes frauce toke day tyme mater coclude nat incontynent sent duke aniou angiers whome ye frenche kyng gyuen full power auctoryte conclude treaty el leaue pleasur whan duke aniousaw effect mater toke counsell longe space finally counsayled accepte treaty two knightes sent retorued agayne answere writen sealed lordes fraunce departed fro reyns went siege campacorentyne ther finally ye peace made agreed sealed therle moutfort abode duke bretayne condycionally chyldren body laufully begoten duchy retourne chyldren lorde charles blois lady wyfe lorde charles bloys disceassed shulde countesse poynteure whiche lande yerely rent xx frankes also lorde mountfort shulde come fraunce whan soeuer kyng sent hym homage holde duchy bretayne hym confyrmacion herof charter instrumentes publyke made sealed bothe party thus therle mountfort entred duchy bretayne abode duke therof certayne space tyme tyll tidynges warr came ye shall herafter history also ordynaunce peace frenche kyng restored agayn lorde chsson lande whiche taken fro hym kyng philyp somtyme kyng thus lorde clysson aquaynted hym frenche kynge dyde wolde wtout nothyng done thus coutte bretayne right ioyous whan sawe rest peace duke toke faythe homage cy tie good wnes castels prelate gentylmen within space duke maryed doughter prince wale whiche lorde thomas hollande maryage made good rytie nauntes right nobly also fortuned wynter queue jane aunt kyng nauer quene bla che sustre dyd somoch peace made bytwene french kyng king nauer ayde wysoome lorde captall beufz dyde might conclude peace therby aquyted prison frenche kyng shewed hym dede great sygne loue gaue hym fayre castell de nemoux appurtenaunces whiche well worthe yerely reuenewes thre thousande frankes captall became liegeman frenche kyng whose homage kyng right toyouse loued well seruyce suche knyght captall tyme seruyce endured longe season whan came principalyte prince enformed case stode greatly blamed hym sayd coude nat acquyte hym selfe trewely serue two lordes couetous take lande fraunce wher nother loued honoured whan captall sawe hymselfe case home taken reputed prince naturall lorde sore shamed excused hymselfe sayeng sir nat sore bounde frenche kyng may soone agayne haue done mysed sent seruaunt kyng renounced al kynge gyuen hym taryed styll hym selfe prince aquyted prison composycion peace taken bytwene frenche kyng kyng nauer frenche kyng coposicyon townes maunt meulecke kyng rendred hym therfore castels normandy season deted frau ce lorde loys nauer went lo bar dy mary quene naples departyng frenche kynge certayne castels delyuered vp normandy somme threscore thousande frankes lorde loys wedded quene naples lyued longe tyme god forgyue hym fautes right good knight courtesse season yet ther styll frau ce great nombre companyons whiche wyst nat seyng warres bretayne ended copanyons pursued euer dedes armes takynge pyllages aduauntages fro whiche coude nat wolde absteyne chefe recours fraunce called realme fraunce chambre durst hurte acquitayne lande wold nat suffre also say trouthe moost parte capitayns gascons englysshmen vnder obeysaunce kyng englande prince ther bretayne nat many wherfore dyuers realme fraunce murmured agaynst kynge englande prince sayd couertly howe aquyted nat themselfe well agaynst frenche kyng seyng nat good wylles put realme yuell disposed people wyse sage men fraunce consydred without dyde put remedy driue theym realme eyther batayle meanes money el length lykely distroy noble realme frauce holy christendome p season hongry kyng wolde gladly haue hym great warre agaynst turke dyde hym great domage wrote pope urbane v auignon certifyeng hym wolde gladly realme fraunce delyuered nombre companyons hym warres agaynst turke lyke wise wrote letter frenche kynge prince wale entreated sayd companyons offred golde syluer passage answered wolde nat waye sayeng wold nat go ferr make warr shewed among themselfe owne company ben ho gry howe ther suche straytes yf fought coulde neuer escape dye shamefully whiche affrayed lust go thyder whan pope frenche kyng sawe wolde nat agre acordyng desyers also wolde nat auoyde realme frauce dayly multiplyed thought theym another waye meanes cause auoyde season ther kyng castell called dame peter full marueylous opinyos rude rebell agaynst comaudement holy churche mynde subdue cristen neyghbours kinges prince specially king aragon called peter gode true cristen prince taken fro parte realme thynking haue remenant also kynge dampeter castell thre basterd bretherne whiche kyng allphons fader lady called ryche drue theldest called henry seconde dancylle thyrde sauses king dampeter hated wolde nat suffre come syght often tymes might haue gotten wolde haue stryken heedes ho wbeit welbeloued kynge father lyfe gaue henry theldest countie desconges kyng dampeter brother taken fro hym therfore kepte dayly warre toguyder bastarde henry right hardy valyant knight ben long fraunce pursued warre serued frenche kynge loued hym right entierly kyng dampeter comon brute ranne put dethe mother chyldren wherwith right sore displesed good cause also besyde put dethe exyled dyuers great lordes realme castell cruell without shame menfeared douted hated hym ferr durst also caused dye right good holy lady wyfe called lady blanche doughter duke peter burbone suster germayn frenche quene countesse sauoy whose dethe ryght displesaunt lynage whiche one noblest lynages worlde besyde ther ran brute hym among owne men howe amyably alyed kynge granade kyng tresbell maryne kyng tresmesaries wer goddes ennemyes infydeles wherefore owne men feared wolde hurt owne countre violatyng goddes church began redy take fro theym rente reuenewes helde prelate prison costreyned tyranny wherof great complayntes came dayly holy father pope requyring fynde remedy whose complayntes pope condyscended sende incontynent messangers castell kynge dampeter comaundyng hym incontynent without delay sonally come court rome wa clens purge hym suche vyllayne dedes gyltye ho wbeit kyng dapeter full pride presumtuousnesse wolde nat obey coe ther delt shamefully pope messagers wherby ran greatly indignacyon churche specially heed church holy father pope thus yuell kyng dampeter perseuered styll obstynatesynne aduyse counsell taken pope coledge waye might correct hym ther determyned nat worthy bere name kynge holde realme therein playne consistory auygnon chabre excomunycacion openly declared reputed infidell tha thought shulde constrayned corrected helpe companyons realme fraunce kyng aragon hated king castell sent also henry bastarde spayne coe auygnon pope whan come pope made henry bastarde legytyue laufull obtayne realme castell dampeter cursed condemned sentence pope ther kyng aragon sayd howe wolde open passage thorough countre prouyde vitayls purueyaunces maner people men warre wolde pursue go castell cofounde kyng dampeter put realme ordynaunce frenche kynge right ioyous dyde payne helpe get prison sir bettram clesquy prisoner sir johan chandos payed rausome hudred frankes parte therof payed frenche kynge pope henry bastard payed resydu delyueraunce fell treaty copanyons promysed great profyte yf wolde go realme castell wherto lightly agreed certayne somme money depart among iourney shewed prince wale knightes squyers hym specially sir johan chandos desyredde one capitayns sir bertram clesquy howbeit excused hym sayd myght nat go thyder yet iourney nat lette dyuers knightes princis went thyder sir eustace dabreticourt sir hewe caurell sir gaultier hewet sir mathue gorney sir dalbret dyuers chefe capitayne enterprice made lorde john burbon erle marche counter wyne dethe cosyne quene spayne thynges ruled counsayled aduyse sir bertra clesquy therle marche oly yong lusty knight also lorde antony beauieu went vyage dyuers good knyghtes sir arnolde dandrehen marshall frauce begue uyllayns lorde dantoyng heynalt lorde brusnell sir johan neuyll sir guynyars baylheull sir johan berguetes almayne saynt uenant dyuers whiche nat name lordes auauced vyage made assemble languedocke mountpellyer therabout passed narbone go towarde parpygnen entre syde realme aragone men warre nombre xxx thousande ther chefe capitayns companyons sir robert briquet sir johan caruell nandon bergerace lanny lytell meclyne bourge camus bourge de lespare batyller espyot aymemon dortyng perote sauoy dyuers accorde one alyaunce hauyng great desyre put kyng dapeter realme castell make king therle descoges brother henry bastarde whan men armes shuld entre realme aragon enterprice ye priuely sent kyng da peter blynde hym message redy well enfourmed entente howe comyng hym ye realme castell set nothyng therby assembled people resyst agaynst light thentre realm message desyring hym open strayt countre gyue free passage pylgrimes god enterprised gret deuocyon go realme grenade reueng dethe passyon lorde jesu christ distroy infydeles exalte christen faythe kynge dampeter tidynges dyde nothyng laugh sayd wolde nothynge desyre obey poynt suche rascall company whan knightes men armes knewe wyll answere kyng da peter wherby reputed hym right orgulus presumptuous made hast myght auaunce hym hurte coulde passed realme aragon founde passage redy open vitayle euery thyng redy apparelled metely price kyng aragon great ioye comynge trustyng meanes conquers agayne fro kyng castell landes kyng dampeter taken fro byforce men warr passed gret ryuer departeth castell aragon entred realme spayne whan conquered townes cyties castels streytes porte passage whiche kynge dampeter taken fro kynge aragon sir bertram company delyuered kyng aragon codycion alwayes fro then forth shulde ayde conforte henry bastarde agaynst dampeter tidynges came ye kyng castell frechmen breton englysshmen normayns pycardes burgonyons entred realme passed great ryuer departyng castell aragon howe wonne agayne syde ryuer whiche cost moche payne trouble wan first right sore dysplesed sayd well shall nat go wene shall made specyall commaundement throughout realme gyueng knowledge letter messagers sent vnto shulde without delay come hym entent fight men warr entred realm castell ther fewe obeyed commaundement whan thought haue great asse ble men warr disceyued fewe none came hym lordes knightes spayne forsoke refused tourned brother bastard wherfore fayne ye el ben taken sore behated enemyes also owne men none abode aboute hym excepte one true knyght called ferrant castres wolde neuer forsake hym none aduenture dampeter went syuyle best cytie spaygne whane come thyder great sewerty wherfore trussed put cofers treasure toke shyppe wyfe chyldren departed fro cyuyle ferrat caster knight hym arryued lyke knight disconfyted galyce called cologne ther stronge castell therin wyfe chyldren entred say two yonge doughters constance isabell men cousayle none ferrant castres p lette v shewe henry bastarde howe perceyuered enterprice cap c c xxx thus haue shewed kynge dapeter soore behated owne men throughout realme castell bycause marueylous cruell iustyce done occasyon distruccyon nobleman realme whiche put deth slayne handes wherfore assoone sawe bastard brother entre realme great puyssauce drue hym receyued lorde rode forthe caused cyte townes borowes castels opyned hym euery man hym homage spanyard one voyce cryed lyue henry dye dampeter hath v cruell yuell lordes ledde forthe henry throughout realme castell lorde gommegaulx great mayster gallestrane maister saynt james thus maner peple obeyd crowned hym kyng cytie estyrages prelate erles barownes knightes made hym reuerence kyng sware alwayes maynteyne kynge el nede requyred dye quarell thus kyng rode fro cytie cytie fro wne wne alwayes euery place reuerence done hym lyke kynge thane gaue knightes straungers suche came hym realme castell great gyftes riche iewels largely euery man reputed lyberall honourable lorde comonly normayns frenchman breton sayde hym lyberalite howe well worthy lyue reygne ouer great realme dyde season right puyssantly great prosperyte thus bastarde spayne came seignory realme castell made two bretherne dancyle sances eche theym erle great reuenewes profyte thus hery kyng castell galyce cyuyll tollette lyssebone vnto suche season puyssaunce wale acquitayne put therof set agayne kynge dampeter possessyon signory forsayd realmes ye shall hystorie whan kynge henry sawe hymselfe estate euery man obeyed hym reputed hym kyng lorde sawe nothynge lykely cotrary desyre ymagined caste aduyce exalte name enploy nombre suche companyos come serue hym realme fraunce make voyage kyng granade wherof spake dyuers knightes well agreed therto alwayes king ry helde styll hym prince knightes sir eustace dabretycourt sir hugh caurell shewed theym great token signe loue trust shulde ayde serue hym voyage grenade whyder hoped go anone coronacyon departed fro hym moost parte knightes fraunce gaue great gyftes departynge retourned erle marche sir arnolde da drehen lorde beauieou dyuers sir bertram clysquy taryed styll castell kynge sir olyuer manny breton certayne nombre companyons sir bertram clesquy made costable realme castell acorde kyng henry lordes coutre nowe let v speke kyng dampeter howe maynteyned hymselfe p howe kynge dampeter requyred prince wale ayde hym agaynst brother cap cc xxxi haue well herde kyng dampeter driuen casteil cologne see wyfe two doughters domferrant castres hym onely ye meane season brother bastarde puyssance warre gote fraunce conquered castell countre yelded ye haue herd right ore afrayed nat well assured castell colongne douted greatly brother bastarde knewe well yf knowledge beyng wolde come puyssaunce besege hym wherfore thought wolde nat abyde parell therfore departed nyght toke shyppe wyfe two doughters domferrat castres golde syluer sowelles wynde contrary coude nat drawe fro cost fayne entre agayne fortresse colongne king dampeter demaunded doferrant knight howe shulde maynteyne hym selfe complayninge fortune hym contrary sir knight ye dete fro hen good ye ye dyde send cosyn prince wale knowe yf wolde receyue nat pytic somwhat tendre nede necessyte dyuers wayes bounde therto reason great alyaunces kyng father toguyder prince wale noble gentyll bloode courage whan knoweth trybulacion thynke verely wyll take therof great compassyon wyll ayde set agayne realme none well worlde fered redouted beloned men warre sir ye good stronge forteresse kepe season tyll ye tidynges acquitayne cousayle acorded lightly ye kyng dapeter tha wrote letter right pyteous amyable knyght two squyers desyred message toke iourney entred see sayled long arryued bayon whiche cytie helde kyng englande demaunded tidynges prince shewed howe burdeaur toke horse rode longe came burde aux ther toke lodgynge anone wet abbey saynt andrewes prince messangers shewed howe come castell spanyardes messangers fro kyng dapeter castell whan prince knewe therof sayde wolde se theym knowe wolde haue cam kneled downe saluted hym acordynge vsage recommaunded kynge mayster hym delyuered letter prince toke vp messagers receyued letter opyned reed good leyser wherin founde howe pyteously kynge dampeter wrote signifyeng hym pouertie myschiefe howe brother bastarde puissaunce great amyties purchased first pope frenche kyng ye kyng aragon helpe copanyons put hym fro herytage realme castell wherfore desyred prince goddessake waye pytie wolde entend prouyde counsell remedy wherin shulde achyue grace god worlde nat ye ryght way true crysten kyng di herpt right full heyre enheryte puyssaunce tyranny bastard prince valyant knight sage closed letter handes sayd messangers sir ye right welcome fro cosyn kyng castell ye shall tary space v ye departe ye shall haue aunswere prince knightes knewe ryghtwell ledde logynges spaynisshe knight two squyers prince taryed styll chambre mused greatly tidynges thanne sent sir john chandos sir thoms phelton two chefe counsayle one seneshall aquitayne constable whan come hym sayde theym smylynge sir ye shall newe tidynges spaygne kyng dampeter cosyn complayneth greatly bastarde henry brother hath taken fro enheritauce hath put hym realme ye haue herde reported theym hath come fro then requyreth v instantly confort ayde apereth letter ye prince reed letter worde worde two tymes two knightes herde well mater whan reed ye letter sayd sir ye two sir john ser thomas ye speciall counsell whome haue trust assyaunce wherfore desyre counsayle ye thynke best two knight behelde eche without worde spekyng tha prince agayn sayd sir speke hardely ye thinke mater ther price couselled two knight enformed shulde sende kyng dapeter men warr cologne wher acordinge tenor letter also report messangers ye men warr shulde bring cyte burdeur ther playnly knowe wolde say acordyng shuld word take aduyce gyue hym suche cousell reason shuld suffyce answer pleased right well prince tha desyred go cologne viage bring sauegard hym kyng dapeter first sir thoms felton souerayne chefe army sir richarde potchardon sir neez lornyche sir symonde burle sir wyllm rousealx army ther shulde xii shyppes furnisshed archer men warr knight made uisyon go galice messangers depted fro burdeux rode bayon ther taried thre four dayes abyding wynde weder v day de tynge kyng dapeter castell aryued bayon himselfe deted fro colongue great hast dout durst nat abyde ther le ger brought fewe men wt suche treasur tidynges comyng great ioye theglysshmen sir thomas phelton copany cae hym receyued hym right swetely shewed ther redy ye comau demet ye prince lorde haue coe cologne place haue broght ye prince whiche tidyng ye kyng dapeter ryght ioyouse thanked gretly prince knightes p comyng king dampeter thus bayon sir thoms phelton knightes certifyed price therof right ioyouse within short space knightes brought kyng dapeter ye cyte burdeux prince gretly desyred se cosyn kynge dapeter hym honoure feest yssued burdeux acopanyed dyuers knight squiers went mette kyng dyd hym great reuerece bothe worde dede whiche coude right well ther prince tyme ye coulde shewe honour whan prince well feasted rode burdeux prince toke kyng aboue wyse wolde otherwise rode togyder kyng dapeter shewed prince bastard brother chased realme castell also pituously coplayned hym ye vntrouthe men shewyng howe forsaken except one knyght whiche ther hym called damferrant castres price right curtesly sagely recoforted desyring nat abasshed disconforted though lost trusted shulde puyssance god restore hym agayne losse moreouer take vengeaunce eneymes thus talked togyder rode longe ye came burdeux lyghted abbey saynt andrues wher prince prince kept house kyng brought fayre chambre redy aparelled hym whan chaged went princesse ladyes receyued right curtesly coude right well might ouer longe make reporte mater chere feestes sportes wherfore passe ouer brefely shall shewe kyng dapetersped prince cosyn founde right amyable curtesse well codyscended desyers howbeit ther counsell sayd vnto hym ye shall p dampeter came burdeaux wyse sage maginatyue lordes aswell gascoyn england prince cousell euer truly serued hym gyuen hym good counsayle thought euer sayd prince sir ye haue herde say dyuers tymes moche enbraseth holdeth wekelyer hit trouthe ye one princesse worlde moost praysed honoured redouted holdeth syde see great landes seignories thanked god good rest peace ther kyng nere farr present tyme yt dare displease ye renomed good chiualry grace good fortune ye ought therfore reason cotent wt ye haue seke nat get enemyes sir say nat non yuell knowell kynge dapeter castell driuen realme hye mynde right cruell full yuell condycions hym hath ben done many yuell dedes realme castell hath caused many valyant man lose heed brought cruelly ende without maner reason vilayne dedes cosent disceyued put realm also besyde enemy churche cursed holy father ye pope reputed hath ben great season like tyrant without tytell reason hath alwayes greued made warr neybours kyng aragon king nauer wolde haue dishetyted puissance also brute ro neth throughout realme owne howe caused dye wyfe cosyn doughter duke burbone wherfore sir ye ought thynke consydre yt nowe suffereth ar roddes stroke god sent chastyce gyue ensample christen king prince beware nat hath done suche word seblable prince couselled kyng da peter arryued bayon word prince answered thus sayeng lord thynke byleue certely ye counsell truely best power knowe well well enfourmed lyfe state kyng dapeter knowe well yt without nobre hath done many yuell dedes wherby nowe disceyued cause present yt moueth gyueth v corage willyng ayde shall shewe nat couenable bastard shulde hold realme herytage put owne realme brother ryghtfull enheryter lande whiche thyng kynges king sonnes shulde wyse suffre cosent great preiudice agaynst state royall also besyde kyng father kyng dapeter hath gret season ben alyed togyder great cofederacions wherfore boude ayde cause yt requyre desyre v thus ye prince moued corage ayde cofort kyng dapeter trouble besynes thus answered counsell coude nat remoue cut purpose mynde euer fermely set yt mater whan king dapeter castell come ye prince cyte burdeux humyled hym selfe right swetely prince offred great giftes profyte sayeng wolde make edwarde eldest sone kynge galyce yt wolde dete hym men great good richesse left behynde hym realme castell bycause durst nat bring hym ryches sure kepynge yt none knewe himselfe wordes ye knightes gaue good entet englysshmen gascos naturally couetouse prince counselled asseble baron duchy ac qui tayne specyall counsell ther burdeux great counsayle kyng dapeter shewed openly wold meyntayne hym selfe howe wolde satisfy euery man yf prince wolde take hym bring hym agayne countre tha ther letter writen messangers sent forthe lordes knyght sent therle armynake therle comygines lorde dalbret erle carmayne captall beufz lorde cande vycount chastyllon lorde lescute lorde rosem lorde lespare lorde chamont lorde musydent lorde turtoni ye lorde pyncornet baron knightes gascoyne uerne also therle foix desyred come thyder wolde nat excused hym selfe cause dysease legge might nat ryde sent thyder counsayle parlyament thus holden ye cyte burdeux came erles vycou te baron wyse men aquitayne xaynton poictou duercy lymosyn gascoyn whan come went cousell thre dayes state ordynau ce kyng dapeter spayne alwayes ther present counsayle prince cosyn reasonyng alwayes fortify quarell besynesse finally prince couselled yt shulde send suffyciet messangers kyng father england knowe cousell shulde yt case pleasure answere one knowen ye lord sayd wolde take cousell togyder make price suche answere reason shulde well content ther chosen named four knightes prince shulde go englande kyng say sir dalawar sir noell lornisshe sir johan sir hely pomyers thus deted brake vp counsell euery man went home owne house kyng dam peter taryed styll burdeux prince princesse dyd moche honour made great feest chere forsaid four knyght depted apoynted go englande toke shippyng sped well iourney helpe god wynde arryued hampton ther rested one day refresshe th vnship horse caryages second day toke horse rode longe came cyte london ther demau ded wher king shewed howe wynsore thyder met right welcome well receyued bothe kyng quene aswell bycause pteyning prince sonne also bycause lordes knightes great recomendacion delyuered letter king kyng opened reed whan lytell studyed sayd sir ye shall go logynges shall sende certayne lordes wyse counselle shall answere wt shorte expedicyon answere pleased well knightes next day retorned london within shorte space kyng came westm hym moost grettest counsell sone duke lacastre therle arudell therle salysbury therle many sit reynold cobham erle percy lorde neuyll dyuers prelate ther bysshop wynche stre lyncolne london kept great cousell long vpon princ letter request made kyng father finally semed kyng counsell athyng due resonable prince take bring agayne king spaygne owne herytage opely agreed thervpon wrot notable letter dyrected fro kyng fro cousell england prince baron aqtayn letter said messangers depted agayne cyte burdeux wher founde prince kynge dapeter whome delyuered letts fro kyng england ther newe day counsell set cyte burdeux thyder cae suche sent ther reed openly counsell kyng englandes letter deuysed playnly howe wolde prince son name god saynt george shuld take hym set agayn kyng dapeter herytage bastarde brother wrogfully taken fro hym without reason falsely apereth hath put therof also kynges letter made mecyon howe moche bounde therto bycause certayne alyaunces olde tyme made bytwene king castell cosyn ayde hym case reqred therto desyred wherfore desired letter frendes subgettes prince son myght ayded counselled aswell though present selfe whan barones acquitayne herde reed letter comaundementes kyng pceyued kyng pleasure prince lorde tha toyously answered sayd sir weshall gladly obey kyng souerayne lordes comau dement reason obey hym wyll serue vyage kyng dapeter lykewise sir wolde knowe shulde pay v wage wyll hard get men warr stra ge countre prince behelde kyng da peter sayd sir kyng ye people say answere behoueth answere seyng mater kinge dapeter answered prince sayd right dere cosyn ferr golde syluer treasur haue brought hyder nat xxx part somoch haue left behynd long wyll endure shall gyue part ther people prince sayd sir ye say well remnant shal becoe dettour pay case requireth whiche shall lend nede tyll come castell sir kyng da peter ye great curtesy grace counsayle dyuers sage men therle armynake lorde pomyers sir john chandos captall beufz dyuers cosydred prince coudenat well make vyage without acorde cosent kyng nauer coude nat entre spayne coutre thorowe strayt rayncenalt passage nat surety haue bycause king nauer henry bastard newly made alyauce togyder thus ther moche comunynge howe might achyue purpose determyned yt shulde another day assigned counsell kept cytie bayon ye prince shulde sende suffycient embassadours ye kynge nauer desyring hym counsayle bayon determynacion euery man deted fully cocluded bayon day lymyted prefixed ye meane season prince sent sir johan chandos sir thomas phelton kyng nauerre thane cytie panpylone two sage well languaged knightes dyde moche came kynge nauer made faythfull couenaunt worde writyng sealed sayd parlyament bayon theron messangers retorned agayne prince shewed tidynges day assigned lyament ther came cyte bayon kyng spayne dampeter prince erle armynacke lorde dalbreth barones gascoyne poictou guercy rouerne xayntonge lymosyne thyder came personally kyng nauer prince kyng dampeter dyde hym great honour bycause thought better spede hym thus cytie bayon ther great counsell whiche endured v dayes prince counsayle moche coude bringe kynge nauerr desyre man nat easy woune sawe nede hym great ower ye prince brought case finally sware promysed sealed kyng dampeter peace loue ferme alyaunce confederacion lyke maner kyng dapeter dyde hym vpon certayne coposicyons ther ordeyned whiche prince wale mean bytwene chefe deuysour therof whiche kyng dampeter kyng castell gaue sealed acorded kyng nauer heyres euer lande groyng lyeth bothe sydes ryuer also lande countre sauanter towne castell appurtenauces also towne saynt john de prede port marchesse whiche lades townes castels seignories taken fro byforce also kyng nauer shulde haue xx thousande fra kes opening countre suffre passe peasably maner men warre mynistre vitayls purueyauces money whiche florens kyng dampeter became dettour ye kyng nauer whan barownes acquytayne knewe treaty made co fermed desyred knowe shuld pay wage price great affection warde vyage becae dettour wage king da peter becae dettour prince whan thynges ordayned fully confermed euery knewe ought shulde haue soiourned ther space xii dayes ye kynge nauer departed home owne coutre lordes departed euery owne prince went burdeaux kyng dapeter taryed styll bayone prince sent haraldes spayne certayne knightes capitayns englysshemen gascoyns fauourable obeysaunt hym signifyenge howe pleasure shulde take leaues henry bastarde come hym sayeng howe nede thentent employ ocupy otherwise whan haraldes brought letter castell knightes fro prince ceyued prince pleasure tha toke leaue kynge henry assoone coude curtesse maner without discoueryng price entencyon bastarde kyng henry right lyberall curtesse honorable gaue lycence many great gyftes thanked greatly seruyce deted fro spayne sir eustace da bretycourt sir hewe caurell sir water huet sir mathue gorney sir johan deureux company dyuers knight squiers whiche nat name ye prince house departed shortly might season companyons wer spedde abrode coutre knewe nothynge sayd knight dyde howbeit wha knewe gadered gyder sir robert briquet johan treuyll sir rebours ser perducas dalbreth sir gar du chast na bergerant bourge lespare bourg camus bourg bartuell bastarde kynge henry knewe nat yt prince mynde bring agayne brother da peter castell soone knight dyd knowen shulde nat haue departed soone dyde might well haue letted knowen knightes departed assoone kyng henry knewe therof made great semblant sayd sir bertra clesquy styll hym sir bertram beholde ye prince wale wed v wyll make v warr bring agayne iewe calleth hym selfe kynge spaygne byforce realme sir say therto sir bertram answered sayd sir valyant knight take hym enterprice wyll power acheue yf may therfore sir say cause passage strayt sydes well kept none may passe entre realme lycece sir kepe yor people loue knowe certaynly ye shall haue frauce many knightes great ayde whiche gladly wyll serue sirby lycence wyll retorne thyder meane tyme kepe yor people loue knowe well shall fynde fraunce many frendes sir shall get many faythe kynge henry ye say well shall order remenant acordyng wyll within lytell space sir bertram departed wet aragon wher kyng receyued hym ioyously ther taryed xv dayes tha departed went mountpellyer ther founde duke ou also receyued hym ioyously whome loued right entierly wha ben ther season departed went frauce kyng receyued hym great ioye phowe kyng henry alyed kyng aragon prince sent howe prince counsayled pursue warre lorde dalbreth discofyted seneshall tholous cap cc xxxii wha tydyng spred abrode spayne aragon fraunce prince wale wolde bring agayne kyng da peter realme castell ther many therof great marueyle moche comunyng therof said ye prince toke hym ye enterprice pride presupcyon maner angry honour ye sir bertra clesquy gotten conqueryng realme castell name kyng henry made kyng sayd ye pyte reason moued prince wyll ayde king dampeter bring hym agayne herytage nat thyng due resonable bastarde kepe realme haue name king thus dyuers plac ther dyuers knightes squyers sondrie opynions howbeit incontynent kynge henry wrote letter kyng aragon sende hym great messangers desyringe hym shulde wyse acorde make coposicion price none alyes promysing euer good neighbour frende kyng aragon loued hym entierly also often tymes founde kynge dampeter ryght fell cruell said made full assuraunce lese great parte realme wolde make maner agremet prince accorde kyng dapeter promysinge also open countrey suffre passe maner men warr suche wolde go spayne place confort ayde lette theym power wolde greue trouble hym kyng aragon kept well truely myse yt made kyng henry assone knewe trouthe kyng dampeter ayded ye prince copanyons drawyng partie incotynent closed passage aragon straitly kept set men warre mountayns watche passage straytes catholon none coude passe great parell howbeit co panyons founde another way suffred moche yuell great traueyle coulde passe escape danger aragon howbeit came marchesse countie foyz founde coutre closed agaynst therle wolde wyse suche peple shulde entre countre tidynges came prince burdeux thoght ymagined nyght day howe honour might furnysshe vyage fynde meanes howe sayd companyons might come acquitayne herde passage aragon closed howe entre countie foyz great payne dysease prince dowted kyng henry kyng aragon wolde deale copanyons nombre xii thousande feare gyftes cause take part gaynst hym thasie prince determyned sende sir john chandos treat retayne hym seruyce also erle foyz desyringe hym loue amyte displeasure co panyons promysing hym soeuer yuell domage hym part countrey wolde make amendes therof double message lorde sir johan chandos toke departed fro cyte burdeux rode cyte aste gascoyne rode longe came therle foyz dyd somoche acorde suffred passe throughout countre peasably founde companyons countre called basell ther treated sped well made couenaunt hym serue ayde prince viage vpon certayne money shulde haue prest sir john chandos sware promysed shud haue came agayne therle foyz desyringe hym right swetely people reteyned wt prince might suffred passe one sydes countre erle foyz right agreable prince maner subgette please hym agreed shulde hurte hym countre sir johan chandos made couenaunt hym shulde maner domage sent squyer haralde companyons treaty made bit wene therle foiz retorned prince recounted howe spedde price byleued loued hym right well well co tent done voyage season prince lusty floure youthe neuer wety full satysfyed warr sythe first begynning bare armes euer entended achyue hygh dedes armes enterprice age spayne set agayne kyng chased therof byforce armes owne realme honoure pytie moued hym therto often tymes spake sir johan chandos sir thomas phelton moost speciall counsayle demaundyng thought knight answered thought nothyng well sayd sir certaynly gretter enter price without comparyson put realme kyng dampeter hated men euery man soke hym whan thought wolde haue ayded nowe possessed preset tyme realme bastarde kynge entierly hath loue noble prelate realme haue made hym kyng haue promysed maynteyne hym estate soeuer befall therfor sir wyll behouable haue company great foysson men armes archer ye shall fynde well whoe fight ye come spayne sir counsayle breke greattest parte plate treasure wherof ye haue great plenty make therof money dete therof largely co panyons suche wyll serue voyage loue contente go loue kynge dampeter wolde nat serue also sirsend englande kyng father desyring hym ayde hundred thousande frankes whiche frenche kynge ought sende englande short space sir gather asmoche money ye shall greatly stande hande without taxyng talagyng subgettes countre ye shall better serued loued counsayle dyuers good true counsayles gyuen prince knight content ther caused two te plate brokene make money therof gyue therof largely sayde companyons also sent englande kyng father forsayd hundred thousande frankes kynge englande parceyued well busynesse nede prince son acorded lightly request sent letter frenche kyng pay sayd bringer therof send aquytauce somme hundred thousande fra kes delyuered brought prince departed amonge men warre day prince chambre sportynge cyte angolesme hym dyuers knightes gascoyne poyctou englande ther bourded hym talked vyage spayne meane season sir johan chandos copanyons prince tourned heed warde lorde dalbreth sayde hym sir dalbreth nombre men warre may ye well serue viage sir yf desyre fredes may well make thousad speares lande kept prince fayre thyng tourned hym sir thomas phelton towarde knyghtes englande sayd theym englysshe faythe one ought well loue lande wher ther suche baron canne serue lorde thousand speares torned hym agayne lorde dalbreth sayd sir retayne seruyce vyage sir name god content retayning fell great myschiefe ye shall hystorie nowe lette v retourne companyons alyed retayned prince suffred moche yuell trouble entred principalyte catholon aragon fayne departe thre companyes grettest part went costyng foiz borne seconde cathelone armynake thyrde went aragon acorde therle dalbreth therle armynake therle foyz co pany moost parte gascoyns co pany thre thousand went deuyded dyuers companyes thre hundred four hudred togyder drewe toward bysshopriche tholouse mountanbon ther knight fraunce seneshall tholous called guy dazay whan knewe companyos aproched rode sondre companyes togyder passed nat nobre thre thousande herde howe sore wery traueyle yuell armed horsed worse arayed sayde wolde nat suffre suche people shulde aproche tholous realme fraunce wherfore sayd pleasure god wolde go fight sent mynde purpose lorde amorry erle narbon seneshall carcasson beaucayre knightes squyers officer therabout sendyng requiryng ayde kepe defende fronters agaynst yuell co panyons suche sent vnto obeyed hasted coe assoone might cyte tholous whan come togyder nombre fyue hundred speares knightes squyers four thousande men coutre toke feldes towarde montaubon vii leages fro tholous came first passed forthe abyding company p whan erle narbone sir guy dazay souerayne leader frenche army departed fro cyte tholous went lodged nere montanbon whiche vnder obeysaunce prince therin captayne knight named sir johan come lordes fraunce sent currours montaubon thentent drawe fortresse companyons ther within wha capitayne knewe frenchemen come thyder army great marueyle bycause lande parteyned price spake company dyde moche assuraunce spake frenche currours demauded sent thyder auaunced theym ouerron prince lande neybour seyng prince frende kynge realme fraunce sir nat commauded lordes make answere content mynde ye wyll go send wyll make answere well sir sayd capitayne desyre go desyre sende saue coduct wherby may go come el sende worde playnly tytell wyll make warre agaynste knewe certayntie wolde send worde therof lorde prince wyll shortly prouyde remedy sirsayd shall go shewe desyre retourned shewed lordes wordes ther saue conduct gette name sir johan come brought montabon departed fyue hym went frenche lodgynges founde frenche lordes redy receyue hym redy aduysed answere hym saluted agayn demauded cause sent currours army men warr fortresse mountaubon whiche parteyned prince answered hym sayd sir wyll inuade sone make warre wyll chase ennemyes soeuer knowe sir said knight enemyes wher name god sayd erle narbon within montaubon robber pyllers countrey suche hath sore ouerron realme frau ce sir johan curtesse neyghbours ye wolde nat suffre pyll robbe poore people without cause suche tytell meanes ther moueth often tymes great hatred discorde bytwene lordes prince therfore put forteresse el ye frende frenche kyng realme lordes capitayne trouthe ther men warre within garyson sente thyder fro lorde ye prince retayned serue hym therfore nat mynde cause depart sodenly haue done displeasure yet nat se ye right men warre must lyue haue ben acustomed realme fraunce prince lande therle narbone sir guy dazay sayd yea men warr suche nat lyue pyllage robbery haue vncurtesly ouer ryden oure countrees whiche shall derely abye may gette felde haue taken brent pylled done many yuell dede n bandes tholous wher ye greuous complayntes ar come heryng shulde suffre thus contynue shulde false traytours kyng soueraygne lorde hath set v kepe defende countre also shewe fro v sythe knowe shall fynde shall make v amendes el shall cost v answere capitayne mo taubon coude nat haue departed right yuell content mynde sayd threttes wold nat breke entencyon retourned forteresse shewed wordes company pwhan companyons herde tidynges nat well assured nat able make party agaynst frechemen helde themselfe euer redy toke good wache fortuned v dayes wordes sir perducas dalbreth wt great route companyons shulde passe moutaubon forther passage entre principalyte gaue knowlege therof towne whan sir robert cem companyons ther towne closed sieged frenchman knewe tidynges right gladde sent worde secretly sir perducas company howe ye frenchemen sieged thretned greatly also sent worde capytayns nombre whan sir perducas herd nothing abasshed drewe togyder company cae entred montaubon wher receyued great ioye togyder deuysed howe shulde maynteyn themselfe agreed next mornynge shulde armed yssue towne drawe towarde frenchman desyre might passe peasably wolde nat suffre passe fight aduenture theymselfe best power determyned dyde mornynge armed theym sowned trumpett mounted horse yssued montaubon frechmen redy raunged felde whan harde brute noyse montaubon co panyons coude nat passe tha sir perducas dalbreth sir robert cem rode afore assurauce went spake frenche lordes desyring suffre might passe peasably frechmen sayd howe lust comen sayeng howe shulde nat passe way without poyntes speares swerdes frenchman cryed cryes sayde auaunce baners toward yonder pyllers robber robbeth worlde lyueth euery without cause reason whan companyons sawe surely howe behoued theym fight el dye ther shame alyghted horse rauged selfe fore abyde enemyes fyersly comynge towarde lykewise lyghted came fote ther began shote chase eche gyue great stroke many beaten downe bothe party ther sore fierse batayle well fought many feate armes done achyued many knight squyers layed long erthe beit frenchemen two agaynst one wherfore beginnynge dyde driue companyons backe barrers towne whiche entryng ther many man slayne companyons ben harde case capitayne towne nat ben caused armed maner people co mauded straytly euery man power shulde ayde helpe companyons retayned prince towne armed put array entred ye skirmysshe woman ye towne entred house went vp batylmentes solers cast downe frechmen stone hote chalke thycke nioche couer theym targes dyuers sore hurte fayne recule backe wherby companyons toke courage fore great parell inuaded frechmen fresshly agayne wiche tyme ther suche feates armes done prisoner taken rescued agayn lyke case nat bensene longe tyme companyons fewe regarde frenchman howbeit euery man dyde payne best coude biforce armes droue ye towne frenchman fortuned ye season whyle batayle thus foughten another rout copanyons ledde bourge bertuell nandon bergerant nombre foure c entred backesyde towne mo taubon ryden night gret hast come batayle knowlege howe frenchman besieged companyons montaubon entred fray frenchman sore assayled reason ye comyng newe fressh people batayle endured fro ix ye bell tyll past hye none finally frenchman discoufyted put chase happy coude get horse dete iourney ther takenen therle narbon sir guy dayzay therle duse lorde montmorelon seneshall carcasson seneshall beaucayre mo hundred knyghtes fraunce prouynce march ther many squier riche man tholous mountpellyer ther ben mo taken ben chased howbeit companyous fewe yuell horsed therfore durst nat aduenture ouerfarr held content done skyz mysshe motaubon vigyll lady august yere lorde god thousande thre hundred threscore sixe phowe companyons let theyr prisoner depart faithes pope defended pay rau word king mallorques prince departynge prince go spayne cap cc xxxiii dysconfyture takyng sayd prisoner said perducas balbreth sir robert cem ser rohan come bourge bertuell nandon bergerant company parted boty wynning wher great plenty suche prisoner kept styll owne profyte raunsome quyt pleasure raunsomed prisoner right curtesly euery man degre courtesly bycause aduenture came themso fortunatly valyantnesse dedes armes sucheas let go faythe promyse dayes lymitted bringe raunsoms burdeur place apoynted prisoner deted went home owne countrees companyons went prince receyued right ioyously sent loge abyde marchesse basell among mountayns p shall shewe befell mater erle narbon seneshall tholous put rausome promysed faythes pay season ther rome pope urban ye fyfte entierly hated maner people companyous long tyme cursed bycause ye vilayne dedes done whane enfourmed sayd iourney howe yt therle narbone ouerthrowen sore displeased therwith suffred tyll herde howe put raunsome coe home owne countrees enemyes handes sent eche expresse wordes defended theym wyse pay raunsome assoyled promyse thus lordes knightes quyted rausome suche ben taken mountaubon durst nat trepase pope comaudemet happed well lordes knightes squyers fortuned yuell companyons abode loked euer money trusting haue arayed aparelled lyke men warr made great prepara yon trust therof wherof disceyued ordynauce pope right coutagyous complayned often tymes therof sir johan chandos costable acquitayne ouer sight right armes suche mater howbeit dissymuled aswell might bycause knewe well pope cursed howe yt dedes tourned pyllyng robbery farr euer coude neuer remedy mater nowe let v speke prince wale aproche viage shewe howe perseuered first hath benshewed dyde moche companyons acorde ye nombre ii thousande fightyng men greatly cost retayne theym susteyned bare charge deted principalyte fro nyng august beginyng february besyde prince receyued retayned maner men warr soeuer coude get also forsayd kyng henry retayned men warr euery parte ealme fraunce place came serue hym bycause alyaunces bytwene frenche kyng hym also retayned companyons breton suche fauourable sir bertram clesquy sir bertramme budes alayne saynt poule wyllyam bruex alayne connet capitayns companyons prince might haue also hym many stragersmen warr flemynges almayns brabances lyst sent home agayn many rather haue owne subgettes principalyte stranger also came hym great ayde englande whan kyng englande father knewe viage went forward gaue lycens one sonnes duke johan lancastre go prince wale brother great nombre men warr four hudred men armes four hundred archer whan prince knewe brother comynge therof ryght ioyouse season came prince burdeaur james kyng mallorques called hymselfe possessyon nothynge realme kyng aragon kept fro hym byforce stayne prisone kynge mallorques cytie called barselone therfore yonge kyng james reuenge dethe father recouer herytage fledde owne realme prince maryed quene naples prince made hym great greatly conforted whan kyng shewed prince reason occasyons comyng parceyued wronge kynge aragon done hym kepyng fro hym enherytaunce also slayne father prince sayd ser king promyse faithfully return spaygne shall entende sette agayne herytage outher treaty force promyse pleased greatly king taryed styll prince burdeaux abydinge departynge dyde prince hym honour caused de delyuered hym hym necessary bycause strager farr countre nat ther owne appetyte dayly ther came great coplayntes prince companyons howe dyde moche hurt men woman cou tre wher lay people marchesse wolde gladly ye prince shuld auauce forthe viage ye whiche prince right desyrous howe counsayled shulde sustre feest christmas first passe thentent might haue wynter backes whiche counsayle prince inclyned bycause ye prince wyfe great chylde toke moche thought departyng wherfore ye prince wolde gladly seher delyuered departed part gladder haue byde meane season ther gret prouysion made viage bycause shuld entre realme wher shulde fynde small prouisyon whyle thus orned burdeaur countre full men warr prince kepte often tymes great counsayle among thynges enformed lorde dalbreth cou termaunded thousande speares letter scut hym fro prince conteynyng thus sir dalbreth sythe haue taken v volutary wyll vyage whiche entend shortely procede consydring great busynesse charge disease haue well straungers suche entred seruyce great nombre companyons whiche nombre great wyll nat leaue theym behynde v parels yt may ensue also se howe lande may kepte myne absence may nat go yet abyde behynde therfore ordayned v counsayle viage ye shall serue v hundred speares discharge resydue let lyste thus god kepe fro burdeux vii day decembre letter sealed prince gretseale sent lorde dalbreth owne countre right besy prepare towarde viage sayd prince shulde departe shortely whan sawe prince letter opened reed two tymes ouer better vnderstande great marueyle foude written mynde marueylusly displeased sayd howe mylorde prince iapeth mocketh thus sythe wolde shulde gyue leaue departe viii hundred speares knightes squiers whome comaundement haue retayned haue let profyte dyuers wayes incontynent displeasur called clerke caused write letter prince maner dere sir greatly marueyled letter ye haue sent sir nat well fynd take counsayle howe oughtor answere behalfe tourneth great preiudyce blame company haue owne ordynaunce comau dement retayned redy aparelled seruyce haue letted takynge profyte place might haue theym determyned haue gone ouer thesee spruce costantyne jerusalem knyghtes squyers dothe auaunce selfe sir haue great marueyle sore displeased shulde thus put lykewise haue gret marueyle therof maner haue deserued dere sir please knowe nat assure deuyded fro copany lest worst departe surety wyll alldepte god kepe sauegarde written c whan prince herde answere toke great presumpcyon dyd dyuers knightes england ther counsayle prince shoke heed sayde englysshe enfourmed burdeux asayd prince lorde dalbreth great maister countre whan wyll breke ordyuaunce deuysed counsayle god shall nat go weneth lette byde wyll without thousand speres trust god shall furnysshe viage certayne knightes englande yt ther said sir ye knowe full lytell myndes gascoyns howe proude loue v lytell neuer dyde sir remembre ye nat howe highly greatly bare theselfe agaynst ye cyte burdeux whan kynge johan fraunce fyrst brought thyder said maynteyned playnly onely ye atteyned achyue viage takyng ye kyng right well apered ye great treaty space four monethes wolde consent frenche kynge shulde caryed englande first behoued satisfy myndes kepe loue wordes prince helde peace howbeit thought neuerthelesse first occasyon hatered bytwene prince lorde dalbreth thus lorde dalbreth great parell prince high great courage cruell herte wolde ryght wronge euery lorde vnder comaundement shulde holde hym therle armynake vncle sayd lorde dalbreth whan herde displeasure bytwene prince lorde dalbreth nephue came burdeux prince sir johan chandos sir thomas phelton hym whose counsayle prince moche ordred good meanes prince displeasure apeased lorde dalbreth shulde bringe mo two hundred speares whiche nothynge ioyouse yet people neuer loued entierly prince dyd howbeit ther remedy bere passe ouer trouble aswell might uhus whyle prince makynge prouysion abyding comynge brother duke lancastre princesse trancysed grace god delyuered fayre sonne day thre kynges colayne whiche yere wente wedinsday hour thre ther wher prince people ryght ioyouse friday christned noone chur saynt andrewe cyte burdeaux archbysshoppe place christned bysshop dagen dagenoys kyng mallorques godfather chylde name rycharde afterwarde kyng englande ye shall hystorie sonday hour prime deted fro burdeux prince great yumphe men warr howbeit moost part hoost passed lay cyte ast gascoyn prince sonday night came cytie ther taryed thre dayes shewed duke la brother comynge passed see fyue dayes arryued bretayne saynt mathewes fyne come nauntes duke bretayne gretly feested duke lancastre passed poiccou aynton came blay ther passed ryuer gyronde came burdeux went abbey saynt andrewe wher princesse lay ioyously receyued hym dyde ladyes damozeks ther duke thought ary lenger toke leaue sustre princesse departed withall co pany rode long came cyte dast wher founde prince brother made great ioye eche loued togyder entierly ther great token loue shewed bytwene company anon duke lacastres comyng thyder came erle foyz made great erence chere prince brother offred selfe poyntes commaundemet prince coulde well honour lordes acordyng estat honoured hym greatly thanked comyng thyder prince gaue hym charge coutre absence desyringe kepe well tyll retorne therle ioyfully acorded desyre toke leaue deted home countre prince duke lancastre brother sported cite ast people spredde abrode countre entre passage nauerr nat certayne yf shulde passe waye nat yet kyng nauerr promysed open passage wordes ran hoost newly agreed kyng henry wherof prince counsayle hadde great marueyle kyng dampeter right sore displeased meane season whyle wordes thus ranne sir hugh caurell people aproched nauer toke cyte myrande towne quenes bridge wherof countrey sore frayed whiche tidynges came kynge nauerr whan parceyued companyons wolde entre land byforce sore displeased wrote worde therof prince prince let mater passe brefely bycause kyng nauer thoght kept nat trewe promyse kyng dampeter prince wrote shulde excuse hym selfe wordes layed hym ther openly sayde clene tourned kyng henry whan kinge nauer vnderstode trayson layed hym angry sent knight prince called ser marten kar came cyte ast excuse kynge nauer demeaned hym selfe wisely prince apeased displeasure knight shuld retourne nauer kyng mayster causyng come saynt john de pie du port prince take counsayle shulde go speke el sendsuffyci cut messangers thus sir marten karr departed fro prince retourned nauar kynge shewed howe spedde condicyon founde prince cousayle also codycion departed fro knight dyde somoche brought kyng nauar saynt john went cyte ast prince whan prince knewe kynge nauar saynt johans de pie du port determyned sende duke lancastre brother sir johan chandos two lordes small company rode towne saynt john sayd knight king nauar receyued right ioyoully ther longe counsayle togyder finally acorded kyng nauer shulde aproche nerer prince certayne place called pyerferade thyder prince kyng dampeter shuld come speke ther renewe couenauntes ther eche knowe shulde haue kyng nauer dyd thentent better assured promyses thought selfe douted copanyons entred coutre treaty acorde bytwene nat sealed feared shulde nat haue desyred whan wolde treaty retourned duke la castre sir john chandos recou ted prince kynge dampeter spedde whiche pleased right well kepte day came place assigned also kyng nauar moost speciall counsayle ther thre lordes kyng dampeter prince wale duke lancastre one party kyng nauer partie long comunyng toguyder deuysed acorded euery man shulde haue ther renewed treaty among ther kyng nauer knewe certayntie shulde haue realme castell kyng dapeter sware good loue peace confederacyon bytwene deted amyably sondre hoost might passe whanit pleased passage straytes openyd vitels aparelled realme nauer money kynge nauer went cytie panpylone prince brother kyng dampeter went cytie ast ther dyuers knyght lordes poictou bretayne gascoyne nat come prince hoost taryed behynde hath ben sayd nat fully knowen whyder prince shulde haue passage nat tyll thende treaty concluded specially fraunce supposed shulde nat passe way rather kyng nauer shulde haue broken viage whiche fell contrary whan knightes squiers knewe certayntie therof parceyued passag opened auaunced selfe fast might knewe well prince wolde passe shortely nat retourne agayne without batayle thyder came lorde clysson fayre copany men armes last cae yuell wyll lorde dalbreth two hundred speares vyage kept copany captall beufz mater confederacions knowledge therof fraunce alwayes messangers comyng goynge reportyng alway knewe herd wha sir bertram clesquy duke aniou knewe howe yt prince passed howe passage nauer opened enforsed somons thoght surely mater shuld nat ended without batayle toke way towarde aragon come king henry fast might maner people folowed suche commaunded dyuers realme fraunce place suche thought auaunce selfe gette honour p passage price howe passed compauy cap cc xxxiiii bitwene saynt john de pie du port cytie panpylone vnder mou tayns ther straytes perylous passage ther hudred place passage hudred men may kepe passage agaynst worlde also season colde moneth february whan passed passed toke wyse counsayle howe meanes shulde passe shewed playnly coudenat passe atones therfor ordeyned shulde passe thre batayls thre sodry dayes monday tuesday wednisday moday vowarde wherof captayne duke lancastre company constable acquitayne sir johan chandos xii hundred penons armes felde syluer sharpe pyll goules two marshal acquitayne ser rycharde dangle sir stephyne consenton penone saynt george ther also sir wyllyam beachaump sone erle warwyke sir hewe hastynges lorde neuyll serued sir john cha do xxx speares vyage charge bycause takyng batayle aulroy also ther lorde dalbreth sir gar castell sir richarde canton sir robert cem sir robert briques johan treuelle aymery roche chouart gayllart moytre wylliam cleceton uylleboyes butteler panter ther penons vnder sir johan chandos rule nombre x thousande horse passed monday sayd tuesday passed prince wale kyng dampeter also kynge nauer come agayne ye prince bere hym company ensygne ye redy passage prince ther sir loys harcourt vycont chatelerat ye vycont roche choart lorde parteney lorde pynau lorde taneyboton poictenyns sir thoms phelton gret leneshall acquitayne sir wyllyam brother sir eustace dambretycourt seneshall edmonde marnell lorde peter suffyer bre four thousande men armes ten thousand horse tuesday yuell passage bycause wynde snowe howbeit passed forthe lodged countie panpylone kyng nauer brought prince kynge da peter cytie papylone supper made great chere wednisday passed kyng james mallorques erle armynake therle dalbreth nephue sir bernard dalbreth lorde gyronde therle pyergort uycont carman therle gomygues captall beufz lorde clysson thre bretherne pomyars sir johan sir hely sir edmonde lorde chamont lorde musedent sir robert canoll lorde lespare lorde condon lorde rosen sir petyte courbon sir aymery tarse lorde de la barde sir bertram caude lorde pyncornet sir thomas wystusuble sir perducas dalbreth ye bourge beriuell nandon bergerant bernarde de la salle hortygo launt companyons ten thousande horse easy passage thane passed day hole hoost lodged countie panpylone abyding eche refresshynge horse lay styll thus panpylone space thre dayes bycause founde coutre plentyfull bothe flesshe breed wyne purueyauces horse howbeit companyons payed nat euery thynge demaunded coude nat absteyne fro robbynge pyllyng coude get panpylone waye dyde moche trouble hurte wherwith kynge nauerr right sore displeased coulde nat amende repented hym often tymes opened passage ye prince company parceyued well howe hadde therby hurt profyte howbeit season nat say thought
