sawe well consydered nat thane mayster owne countre dayly great coplayn te made hym one countre wherwith hert sore costrayned displeasure coude nat remedy howbeit caused counsayle suche knewe well companyons ben company fraunce normandy dyuers place desyre absteyn selfe fro robbyng pillynge coutre dyde whome promysed p great somons king ry made howe sent price somon fight sir olyuer manny toke kynge nauer prisoner cap cc xxxv king henry spayn well enformed ye prince passage messangers spyes dayly comyng goyng therfore prouyded men armes comons ye realme castell entent resyst prince brother dampeter daylye taryed comynge sir bertra clesquy great socours frauce sent specyall comaundement realme subgett payne lyues good landes euery man acordynge estate outher fote hors backe come hym ayde defende realme kyng henry welbeloued also castell moche payne trouble ayde make hym kynge therfore obeyed hym ye rather dayly resorted hym saynt domynyke bre threscore thousande men sote hors backe redy comaundement pleasure lyue dye hym nede requyre whan kynge henry herde certayne worde howe prince withall hoost realme nauer passed ye straytes rousenaulx thane knewe well ther remedy fight prince whiche made semblant ryght ioyouse sayd openly high prince wale valyant knyght bycause shall knowe right jabyde loke fight hym wyll write parte myne entent sent clerke wrote letter thus right puyssanut honourable lorde prince wale acquitayne gyuen v knowlege people passed porte drawynge hyderwarde howe ye haue made accorde alyaunce enemy entent make warre agaynst v haue therof great marueyle neuer forfeyted wolde nat wherfore ar ye come suche great army thus v take fro v soo lytell herytage god hath gyuen v ye haue grace fortune armes prince nowe lyueng wherfore thynke ye glorify yourselfe puyssaunce bycause knewe certaynte ye seke gyue v batayle wyll ye knowe wher euer ye entre castell ye shall fynde v kepe defend seignery written c whan letter sealed called hym haraulde sayd go thy way fast thou mayst prince wale bere lettre fro haraude departed toke ye way nauer tyll founde prince kneled downe delyuered hym letter fro kynge henry prince reed letter two tymes better vnderstande sent certayne counsayle made haraud departe lytell syde prince reed letter counsayle demaundynge theym abuyce mater meane season prince sayd counsayle se well bastarde stout knyght full great prowes sheweth great hardynesse write v thus prince counsayle longe togyder howbeit finally agreed nat write agayne haraud tha shewed must abyde season ye prince pleasure wold write agayne hym none therfore commaunded tary tyll hadde answere thus haraude taryed styll ease pleasure day haraude brought letter sir robert phelton auau ced hymselfe forthe demaunded ye prince gyft ye prince enquyred wolde desyre sir requyre gyue lycence departe hoost ryde ther dyuers knightes squyers company desyring auaunce themselfe sir promyse shall ryde forwarde shall knowe behauyng enemyes way drawe wher lodge prince grau ted hym ryght good wyll requeast wherof thanked prince departed hoost chefe capitayne enter price company sir wyllm felton brother sir thomas duforte sir robert canoll sir gayllarde uiguyer sir rafe hastynges sir dangouses dyuers knightes squyers seuyn score thre hudred archer well horsed good men armes also ther ser hew stafforde sir richarde cauton sir symo burle ought nat forgote men armes rode nauer suche gydes came ryuer marke whiche rude depe passed loged vyllage called nauaret helde selfe better knowe wher kynge henry meane season whyle knightes thus lodged nauaret prince marchesse panpylone tyme kyng naner taken prisoner rode fro one towne nother frenche partie sir olyuer manny wherof prince part great marueyle princis host supposed done owne meanes bycause wolde couey prince go copany bycause knewe nat howe ye mater shulde go bytwene kyng henry kynge dampeter howe quene wyfe therof sore dismayed disconforted came kneled knee prince ayd dere sir goddessake haue mercy n delyuerauce kyng husba take fraudeletly yet nat owen therfore ir desyre ye loue god may haue agayn tha prince answered certaynly ayre lady co takynge v right displesant trust prouyde remedy shortely wherfore desyre confort selfe age one achyued shall entende ther thing delyuerauce ye quene nauer retourned ther le knight sir marten ar vndertoke guyde prince realme nauer dyd get gydes people otherwyse coude nat haue kepte right way thorowe straytes perylous passage thus prince deted fro then ther loged copany passed place named sarris whiche right perylous passe narowe yu li way ther many sore troubled lacke vitayle founde lytell passage tyll came saueter saueter good town gode countre plentyfull march ther towne vtter bandes nauer entrynge spayne towne helde king henry princis host spred abrode countre companyons auaunced themselse assayle towne saueter take byforce robbe pyll wher vnto great syre cause great rich yt knew within towne whiche cou brought th der trust strength towne towne thought nat abyde parell knewe well cou e nat long endure resyst agaynst great hoost therfore came oute rendred selfe kynge dampeter cryed hym mercy presented hym key ye towne kynge dampeter counsayle ce toke mercy el wolde nat haue done wyll wold haue distroyed howe beit receyued prince kynge dampeter kyng mallorques duke la castre entred towne therle armynake lodged therabout vyllages p nowe lette v leaue prince somwhat speke men towne nauaret forsayd knightes yt ther greatly desyred auaunce bodyes fyue dayes ourney fro owne hoost wher departed fro first often tymes yssued nauaret rode marchesse enemyes lerne enemyes entented kyng henry lodged felde hoost desyryng greatly idynges ye prince marueylyng gretly haraud retourned nat often tymes men rodenere nauaret lerne tidynges thenglysshmen erle ancell brother kyng dame henry certaynly enfourmed ther men warr garryson towne nauaret wherfore thought go se nerer first day knightes englande rode nauaretet e en ynge farforthe came kyng heryes lodgynge made ther great mysshe marueylous awoke host slewe tooke dyuers specially knight kept wache taken without recouery retourned agayne nauar et without domage ye nexte day sent prince haraude saueter signifyeng hym hadde done sene puyssaunce ennemyes wher lodged knewe well informacyon suche prisoner taken tidynges ye prince right ioyouse knightes well borne selfe ye fronter enemyes yng h ty right sore displeased theglysshmen yt lay nauaret thus escryed hoost sayd howehe wolde aproche nerer enemy auau ced forwarde whan sir thomas phelto company naueret knewe kynge henry passed water drewe warde fynde prince determyned departe fro nauaret take feldes knowe certayntie spanyard dyde sente worde prince howe kynge henry aproched fast semyng desyring greatly fynde hym men prince saueter wher vnderstode kyng henry passed water tooke way come fight right ioyouse sayd highe euery man herde hym aythe bastarde henry valyant knight ardy signe great prome eketh thus v sythe dothe lykewise reason ought mete fight togyder therfore good departed fro hen go forwarde get uyctoria enemyes come next mornynge departed ro ter first prince atayle dyde moche came ther founde sir thomas phelton sayd knyghtes whome made great chere demaunded dyuers thynges deuysing togyder currours came reported yt ue currors enemyes wherfore knewe certayne kynge henry ho nat farr reason demeany age sene among spanyardes whan prince vnderstode ti ynges cause tru pettes sowne cryed alarum hoost whan euery man herde drewe order array ranged batayleredy fight euery man knewe departed fro sauete r shulde order take dyde incontynent ther might haue sene great noblenesse baners penons beaten armes wa g wynde shulde say great noblenesse beholde vawarde well ranged marueyle behold wherof duke lancastre chiefe hym sir johan chandos constable acquitayne gret copany batayls made dyuers newe knightes duke lacaltre vaward made newe knight sir rafe camoys sir water lomyche sir thoms damery sir john grandon nombre xii sir john chados made dyuers englysshe squyers knight corton clysson prior wyllm f rmeton amery roch ch art gyrad de la motte robert briquet prince made first knight dampeter king spayne sir thomas holand sonne wyfe princesse sir hugh sir philyppe sir denyse courtnay sir john onnet ser nicholas bonde dyuers lykewise dyd dyuers lordes batels ther made day ccc newe knight day yll redy ged batell abyde enemy came fa er forward day ther currours sene kyng hery taryed socours shulde coe aragon specially sir bertram clesquy comig hi iiii fightyng men without thought wolde nat fight wherof prince right ioyouse areregard wherin wer vi behynd vii leages countre wherof prince sore displeased hert yt taryed longe howe enemyes come forward day sully e termyned haue receyued sought euer g marsha sir dangle sir steuyn gossenton comaunded euery man dra e logy ge next mornyng redy yng trupettes euery man ye order ben day euery man obeyed sauyng sir thomas ph l suche copany euen yng ted fro prince rode orwar two leages nerer enemyes knowe dyd euenyng therle brother kynge henry hym logyng talked togyder dyuers armes aduetures sayd brother sir ye knowe well ar loged nat farr fro v yet ther hath auewed sir requyre gyue leaue mornyng may ryde toward certayne nobre suche hath grea esyre sir promyse shall yde nere wyll bringe certayne knowlege kynge henry whan sawe desyre brother greed therto lightly proper hour bertram clesquy came hoost iii fightyng men fraunce aragon wherof kyng copany right oyouse honorably receyued c pany therse anxell forgat nat purpose desyred suche go pleased hym wold adly haue desyred sir bertram clesquy sir arnold dadr hen begue u llayns vycont roche breten aragon bycause lately come hoost let alone also kyng henry charged hym wyse speke therof therle sell let passe toke hym fra ce aragon nombr ire thousande horse well appayrelled hym brother xanses copa p howe certayne company duke lacastres disconfyted counsayle kynge henry wolde nat byleue letter prince wrote kyng henry counsell sir bertram clesquy gaue answer letter cap c c xxxvi whan day ye next mornyng mou ted horse deted fro kynges hoost good array rode war de theglysshe logynges sonne rysynge valley met part sir hugh caurelles company harnesse lodged nyght leage fro englysshe hoost assoone frenchman spanyardes sawe ran shortely disco tyted moost parte slayne harnesse sir hugh hym selfe came behynde whan sawe toke another way howbeit parceyned chased fayne flye wt company duke lancastres host spanyardes sixe thousand rode brunt one corner vawarde duke lancastres hoost cryed castell bete downe logynges ewe hurt moch people tha host began styre arme drewe ye duke lodgyng redy armed baner hym englysshmen gascoyns drue theym vnder baners penons redy fight duke went vp lytell mountayne hym came sir john chandos two marshal dyuers knightes squiers puttyng themselfe order array besyde duke anone came prince king dampeter euer cae set selfe order batayle therle anxell brother hadde thought haue mountayne first auautage herde say fayled purpose whan sawe coulde nat haue thenglysshe hoost redy apparelled departed assembled company togyder rode forthe trustyng fynde good aduenture departed dyd dyuers feates armes certayne englysshe knyghtes gascoyns departed fro array strake amonge spanyardes bare dyuers erthe alwayes ye great batell stode styll moutayne lokyng euer whan shuld haue fought thus returnynge spanyardes aprochynge owne host encoutred sir thomas phelton brother sir richarde tancon sir dago sir hugh hastyng sir gaylerd uigor nobre c c knighttes squiers englyssh gascons valey met spanyardes cryed castell ye name kyng henry theglysshe copany seyng great copany spanyard coude nat escape fro conforted selfe aswell might kept togyder felde toke aduautage lytell hyll spanyard came rested theselfe ymaginynge meanes might best fyght sir wyllm phelton dyd great feat armes great outrage disceded downe hyll speare rest prouynge courser ran among spanyard strake knight rudely speare ye spere ran clene body knyght fell downe deed sir wyllm enclosed rounde enemyes fought valiantly knight might dyd enemyes great domage striken ye erthe brother sir thoms felton knyght hym moutayne sawe fought dyde marueyls armes sawe well parell coude nat cofort hym without lesyng themselfe stode styll array mountayne sayd knyght fought styll long coude endure finally ther slayne spanyard frenchman ymagined howe might inuade theglysshmen moutayne day ther dyuers feates armes done chyued sotyme parte wolde discende downe ye mountayne fyght enemyes recule wisely backe agayne thus estate tyll hye noon prince wolde gladly haue coforted knowen therof delyuered parell nat ware therof therfore behoued abyde aduentur whan thus endured scrymiss hyng gret season tha therle anxell sore displeased endured long sayd hye copany lordes shame thus day ought tyme haue deuoured auaunce forwarde let v fyght fierse wyll ther nothyng wyll gote without derely bought tho wordes frechmen spanyardes auaunced forthe hardy courage came close togyder coulde nat broken mountayne done many feat armes theglysshmen gascons defended themselfe power right valyantly spanyardes entred among coude nat endure finally taken coquered byforce armes non escaped certayne varlettes page saued themselfe horse night came prince host day redy ranged hyll syght takyng sayd knyghtes squyers erle auxell sa x brother company retorned hoost ryght ioyouse nyght came kynge henry brother made present kynge suche prisoner taken recounted kynge sir bertram clesquy sir arnolde dan drchen howe met dyde also ouerthrowen te sir hugh caurels copany chased hym duke lancastres host ther dyd great domage hoost assembled howe retournyng mette knightes whome taken kynge henry hard well wordes great ioy glory answered therle brother sayd fayre brother ye haue marueylusly well spedde wherof ye shalbe gretly rewarded trust surely thother shall passe ye way sir arnolde dadrehen sayd sir sauyng grace wyll nat say agaynst rather amende one thyng sir say yt whan soeuer ye shall assemble ye prince batell ye shall fynde men warr suche ded armes requyreth ther floure chiualry worlde ther shall ye fynde sage hardy coragious fightyng men dye place wyll nat flye one fote sir necessary ye take good hede counsell mater sir ye wyll counsayle ye shall disconfyte without stroke strikyng thus ye wyll kepe ye straites passage prouisyon may coe ye shall famysshe discofite shalbe fayne retourne owne countre warde without good order array tha may haue yor desyre acomplysshed kyng henry answered sayd marshall soule dere father desyre moche se prince proue puyssauce myne wyll neuer depart hen without batayle thake god haue men ynowe first haue seuyn thousande men armes well horsed barded feare shote archer also haue xx thousande mouted genettes cap pee haue threscore thousande men comons speares dartes pauesses may great feate haue sworne nat fayle dye payne wherfore sir arnolde ise cause abasshed let v greatly conforted puyssaunce god oure talkyng ther knightes brought kyng wyne spyces kynge toke therof gaue lordes part hym euery man retorned logynges theglysshmen gascoyns prisoner made assurauce deuyded one fro another lette v retorne prince speke som ordynaunce p prince wale duke lacastre sayd day moutayn night enfourmed men thus taken slayne wherwith sore displeased coulde nat amende drue logynge next mornyng prince toke counsell determyned det fro then dyd went loged uictoria stode batayle redy fight enformed ye prince kyng hery brother copany nat farr then cae nat forward prince copany great lacke vitayls prouisyon selfe horse loged yuell countre harde kyng henry company lay good frutefull countre princ hoost lofe breed solde floreyn euery man gladde gyue coude haue gote also tyme foule troublous wynde rayne snowe daunger disease sixe dayes whan prince sawe spanyardes cam nat forwarde fight gret distresse determyned go seke passage place thane disloged toke way nauaret passed coutre called ye coutre ye gard whan passed came towne called uienne ther prince duke lancastre refresshed therle armynacke lordes two dayes went passed ryuer departeth castell nauer bridge groynge amonge gardeyns vnder olyues ther founde better coutre howe beit great defaute vitayle whan kyng henry knewe prince people passed ryuer groynge departed fro saynt muchaulte wher hadde longe layen went lodged nauerette ryuer whan prince harde kynge henry aproched right ioyouse sayd openly saynt george bastarde semeth valyaunt knight sythe desyreth sore fynde v trust shall fynde eche shortely thane prince called hym duke lancastre brother dyuers counsayle wrote answere kyng henry letter sent ye tenor wherof foloweth edward grace god prince wale acquitayne right honourable renomed henry erle christemar present tyme calleth selfe kyng castell syth ye haue sent v letter haraud wherin conteyned dyuers artycles makyng mecyon ye wolde gladly knowe take fre de louer enemy cosyn kynge dapeter tytell make warr entred army royall castell answere therto knowe ye trouthe susteyne right maynteyn reason aparteyneth kynges princ also entertayne great alyau ce kyng england dere father kyng dampeter haue longe togyder bycause ye renomed ryght valyat knyght wolde gladly coude acorde hym roguyder shall somoche cesyn dampeter ye shall haue great te realme castell crowne herytage ye must renounce sir take cou sayle case enteryng castell wyll entre ther thynke best dure owne pleasure written groynge xxx day marche p whan letter written closed sealed delyuered haraude brought ye taryed answere thre wekes thahe departed fro presence prince rode longe came naueret amonge busshes wher kyng henry lodged drue kynges logyng moost part ye great lordes hoost came thyder tidynges heraude brought haraud kneled downe delyuered kyng lettre fro prince kyng toke opened called sir bertram clesquy dyuers knightes cousell letter reed well consydred sir bettram sayd ye kyng sir knowe trouthe ye shall haue batell shortly knowe well prince therfore sir loke well mater necessary ye take good hede besynesse order people batayls sir bertra kynge name god puyssaunce prince dout nothynge haue thre thousande barded horse whiche shall two wynges batayle haue also seuyn genetours well xx thousande men armes best foude castell galyce portyngale cordowen cyuyle x thousande good crosbowes threscore men fote dartes speares launce abilymentes warre hath sworne nat fayle dye ye payne therfore sir bertram trust haue vyctory grace god whome trust right haue quarell therfore lord desyre good corage p prince comauded people redy fight kyng henry ordayned batayls howe fought fiersly togyder confort kyng henry dyde people cap cc xxxvii thus ye haue harde kyng henry sir bertra clesquy deuised togyder dyuers mater lefte talkyng prince letter kyng heries ente cion haue batayle entended ordre felde people therle anxell brother sir sanxes gretly renomed hoost iourney made ye haue herde prince friday seconde day aprell dil loged fro groyng auaunced forwarde araynged batayle redy fight knewe well kyng henry nat farr then day auauced two leages thre day cae nauaret ther toke logyng prince sent forthe currours auiewe ennemyes knowe wher lodged departed fro hoost rode forward sawe enemyes hoost also loged nauaret brought report therof price euenyng prince caused secretely shewed hoost first wnyng trumpettes euery man aparell hymselfe seconde armed thirde lepe hors backe folowe ye marshal baners penon saynt george none payne dethe auaunce without commaunded lyke maner prince done friday insendyng currours dyde kynge henry parte knowe wher prince lodged whan true report therof kyng called ser bertram clesquy toke counsayle aduyce howe perseuer caused peple suppe go rest ye fressher hour mydnight redy apparelled drawe felde ordayne bataylles knewe well next day shuld haue batayle night spanyardes toke ease rest well wherwith plenty vytels thynges englysshmen great defaut therfore great desyre fight outher wynne lese mydnight trumpettes sounded kyng heryes hoost euery man made hym redy seconde blast drewe lodgynges ordred thre batayls first sir bertram clesquy lorde robert rosebertyne therle dune erle aragon ther wer stranger aswell fraunce coutrees ther two barones heynalt lorde dautoyng sir alar lord brisuell ther also begue uillayns begue uylliers sir john bergutes sir gawen baylleull almayne saynt uenant ther made knight dyuers frauce aragron prouens marchesse ther ther well batayle four thousande knightes squiers well armed dressed vsage frauce seconde batayle therle auxell brother therle saures batayle genetours ther xv thousand fote hors backe drue lytell backe lyft hande ye first batayle third batayle grettest gouerned kyng henry himselfe company ther seuyn thousand horsmen threscore thousande fote crosbowes thre batayls fourscore sixe horsebacke fote tha kynge henry lepte stronge mule ye vsage countrey rode fro batayle batayle ryght swetely prayeng euery man day employ themselfe defende kepe honour shewed himselfe cherefully euery man ioyfull beholde hym went agayne owne batayle yt tyme day light ye sonerisyng auaunced forthe towarde nauaret fynde enemyes good order batayle redy fight prince wale brekyng ye day redy ye felde ranged batayle auauced forwarde good order knewe well shulde encountre enemy none went ye marshal batayls suche currours apoynted thus lordes bothe hostes knewe report currours yt shulde shortely mete went forward hostyng pase eche toward whan son risyng vp great beauty beholde ye batayls armurs shinynge agaynst son thus went forward tyll aproched nere togyder prince copany went ouer lytell hyll discedyng therof ceyued clerely enemyes comyng towarde whan disceded moutayne euery man drue batayls kept styll rested euery man dressed aparelled hymselfe redy fight sir john chados brought baner rolled vp togyder prince sayd sir beholde baner requyre dysplay abrode gyue leaue day rayse sir thanke god haue lande herytage suffycient maynteyne withall prince kynge dampeter tooke baner bytwene handes spred abrode ye syluer sharpe pyle goules delyuered sayd sir johan beholde baner god sende ioye honoure therof sir johan chandos bare baner owne copany sayd sir behold baner kepe owne toke right toyfull therof sayd pleasure god saynt george wolde kepe defende best power baner abode handes good englysshe squyer called wyllm alery bare day aquaynted right nobly anon thenglysshmen gascoins lighted horse euery man drewe vnder owne baner standerd array barayle redy fight great ioye se consyder baners penons ye noble armery ther bataylles began lytell auaunce prince wale opened eyen regarded towarde heuen ioyned handes togyder sayd uary god jesu christ hath formed created cosent benygne grace may haue day victory myne enemyes ryghtfull quarell sustayne ayde kynge chased owne herytage whiche gyueth courage auaunce selfe restablysshe hym gayne realme layed right hande kyng dampeter hym sayd sir kynge ye shall knowe day euer ye shall haue part realme castell nat therfore auaunce baners name god saynt george wordes duke lancastre sir johan chandos aproched duke sayde sir wylliam beauchamp sir wylliam beholde yonder enemyes day ye shall se good knyght el dye quarell therwith aproched enemyes first duke lancastre sir johan chandos batayle assembled batayle sir bertram clesquy ye marshall sir arnold dandrehen foure thousande men armes first brunt ther sore encountre speares sheldes certayne space coude get within ther many dede armes done many man reuersed cast erthe neuer relyued whan two first barayls thus assembled ye batayls wolde nat longe tary behynde aproched assembled togyder quickely prince batayle came erle anxes batayle prince kyng dampeter castell sir marten dela care represented kynge nauer first metynge prince mette erle anxes batayle therle brother fledde away without order good array wyst nat two thousand speres hym seconde batayle opened anone disconfyted captall beufz lorde clysson company came fote slewe hurt many prince batayle kyng dampeter came ioyned batayle kynge henry wher threscore thousande men fote horsebacke batayle began fierse cruell partes spanyardes castillyans slynges wher cast stone wise ther claue brake many bassenet helme hurt many man ouerthrue erthe archer englande shotte fiersly hurtespanyardes greuously brought great mischefe one parte cryed castell kynge henry parte saynt george guyen first batayle duke lancastre sir johan chandos two marshal sir guy harde dangle sir stephyne consenton fought sir bertram clesquy knightes frauce aragon ther done many dede armes harde open others batayle dyuers helde speares handes foyning presing eche fought shorte swerdes dagger thus beginnynge frenchman aragon fought valiantly good knight englande endured moche payne daye sir johan chandos good knight dyde vnder baner many noble feate armes aduentured himselfe farre closed amonge enemyes sore ouerpressed felled downe erthe hym fell great bygge man castell called martyne ferrant gretly renomed hardynesse amonge spanyardes hedyde entent haue slayne sir johan chandos lay vnder hym great danger sir johan chandos remembred knyfe bosome drewe strake martyne backe sydes wounded dethe lay sir johan chandos tourned hym ouer rose quickely fete men aboute hym moche payne broken prease come hym wher sawe hym felled saturday mornynge bytwene nauer nauaret batayle right fell cruell many man brought great myschefe ther done many noble dede armes ye prince duke lacastre brother sir john cha do sir guysshard dagle captall befz lorde clisson lorde raix sir hugh caurell sir mathue gourney sir loys harcourt lorde pons lorde partney gascoyns fought valyantly erle armynake lorde dalbret lorde pomyers brethern lorde musedet lorde rosen therle pyergourt therle gomegynes therle carmayne lorde condons lorde parr lorde chamont sir bertylmewe cande lorde pyncornet sir bertram dalbreth lorde garonde sir aymery tast souldiche strade sir peteton corton dyuers knightes squyers aquyted themselfe right nobly armes power vnder penon saynt george baner sir johan chandos companyons nombre xii hundred pensels right hardy valyant knightes sir robert ceney sir perducas dalbreth robrt briquet sir gar castell sir gaillard uiger johan cresnell nandon bergerat aymon dortyng perrot sauoy ye bourg camus bourge lespyne bourge bertuell esperry dyuers freche partie sir bertram clesquy sir arnold da drehen xances sir gomes garybz knightes fraunce arragone fought right nobly power howbeit none aduauntage companyons hardy strong knightes well vsed expert armes also ther great plenty knightes squiers englande vnder baner duke lacastre sir johan chandos ther lorde wyllyam beauchamp sonne erle warwyke sir rafe camoys sir water ursewyke sir thomas emery sir john grandon sir john dyper sir johan du pre sir amery rochechoart sir gayllarde de la motte mo ii hundred knightes whiche nat name speke truely sayd sir bertram clesquy marshall dandrechen begue uillaynes lorde dantuell lorde brisuell sir gawen baylleull sir johan bergeretes begue uillers ye almayne saynt uenant good knightes squiers fraunce ther acquyted themselfe nobly trouthe spanyard done parte well frenchman dyde thenglysshmen gascoyns shulde haue moche haue suffred payn dyde faute nat kyng ry dyde better well admonysshed desyred haue done deuoyre valiantly promysed haue done kynge bare hym selfe ryght valiantly dyde marueyls armes good courage coforted people whan flyenge openyng came among theym sayd lordes kyng ye haue made kyng castell haue sworne promysed dye ye wyll nat fayle goddessake kepe promyse yt ye haue sworne acquyte agaynst shall acquyte agaynst shall nat flye one fote longe may se deuoyre wordes suche full confort kyng henry brought men togyder agayne thre tymes day owne hades fought valiantly ought greatly honoured renowmed marueylous dangerous batayle many man slayne sore hurte comons spayne acordyng ye vsage countre slynges dyd cast stone great vyolence dyde moche hurt whiche beginnynge troubled greatly englysshmen whan cast past felt sharpe arrowes lyght amonge coude lengar kepe aray kynge henry batayle many noble armes well spayne lysbone aragon portyngale acquyted right nobly gaue nat vp lyghtly valiantly fought speares iauelyns archegayes swerdes wyng kynge henry batayle ther certayne well mouted always kept batell good order bataile opened brake array syde euer redy helpe bringe agayne good order englisshmen gascons aduauntage bought derely wan noble chiualry great prowes armes say trouthe prince hym selfe chefe flour chiualry worlde right noble valyant k ghtes squyers lytell besyde prince batayle kynge mallorques company fightynge acquitynge selfe right valiantly also lorde martyn de la karr representyng kynge nauer dyde right well de oyre nat speke dyd day right nobly aboute prince tayle dyuers good knyghtes well englande gascoyne sir rycharde pount chardon sir thomas spenser sir thomas hollande sir nowell lornyche sir hugh sir philyppe courtnay sir johan comette sir nycholas bonde sir thomas comette dyuers se shall ayntonge sir baudwyn fran yil seneshall burdeaux rochell poictou angoleme rouerne lym pyergourt sir loyes marnell sir raymon danduell dyuers ther none fayned fight valiantly also hadde good cause spaygniardes castyle mo hundred thousande men harnesse reason great nombre longe coude ouercom kyng dapeter greatly chafed moche desyred mete bastarde brother sayd yt horeson calleth hymselfe kynge castell kynge henry fought ryght valyantly helde people togyder right marueylously sayde aye good people ye haue crowned kyng therfore helpe ayde kepe herytage haue gyue wordes suche spake day caused many right hardy valyaunt wherby abode felde bycause honor wolde nat flye fro place p howe sir bertra clesquy disconfyted taken kyng henry saued hym selfe spanyardes fledde nombre deed cyties yelded vp kyng dampeter aunswere made prince cap cc xxxviii batayle best fought lengest helde togyder company sir bertram clesquy many noble armes fought helde toguyder power ther done many noble feat armes englysshe parte specially sir johan chandos day dyde lyke noble knight gouerned cou sayled day duke lancastre lyke maner dyde prince batell poycters wherin greatly renomed praysed whiche good reason valyant man good knyght acquitynge hym selfe nobly among lordes prince ought greatly recommended day toke hede takyng prisoner owne hades alwayes fought went forwarde taken copany vnder baner dyuers good knightes squyers aragon frauce specially sir bertram clesquy sir arnolde dandrehen sir begue uillaynes mo threscore prisoner thus finally batayle sir bertram clesquy disconfyted therin taken slayne well frauce aragon ther slayne begue uillyers taken lorde antoy ge heynault lorde bresuell sir gawen bayllieull sir johan bergenettes sir alemant saynt uenat dyuers drewe toguyder baners baner duke lancastre sir johan chandos two marshalles penon saynt george went toguyder batayle kyng henry cryed hygh voyce saynt george guyen spanyardes copany sore puta backe ye captall beufz lorde clysson fought valyantly also sir eustace dambreticort sir hughe caurell sir souldyche sir johan dureux acquyted selfe day right nobly prince shewed hymselfe lyke noble knight fought valyantly enemyes othersyde kyng henry acquited hymselfe right valiatly recouered tourned agayn people day thre tymes erle anxell thre thousande horsmen hym departed fro felde began greatly disco fyted euer redy flye co pany euer kynge henry theym sayde fayre lordes wherfore wyll ye thus forsake betraye sythe ye haue made kynge set crowne heed putte herytage castell handes retourne helpe kepe defende abyde grace god night shalbe wordes suche lyke encoraged people suche wyse made theym abyde lengar felde durst nat flye shame whan sawe kynge lorde valiantly fight speke amyably dyed mo thousande fyue hundred person might well haue saued themselfe haue taken tyme aduantage loue lorde kynge hadde nat whan batayle marshalles passed throughe ennemyes disconfyted ye grettest nombre spanyardes coude nat susteyn defende lengar began flye away great feare without good array order toward cyte nauaret passe great ryuer wordes kyng henry coude say wolde nat retorne whan kyng sawe myschefe disconfyture people sawe recouery called horse mounted theron put hymselfe among fledde toke nat way nauaret feare enclosynge toke another way schewyng paryls knewe well taken shulde dye wtout mercy tha englysshmen gascons lept horsebake began chase spanyardes sledde away sore disconfyted great ryuer entre bridge nauaret ther hydeous shedynge blode many man slayne drowned dyuers lepte water whiche depe hydeous thought lyue drowned slayne chase amonge ther two valyant knightes spayne beryng abyte relygion one called great priour saynt james great maister calatrane co pany saue themselfe entred nauaret nere chased backe englysshmen gascoyns wan bridge ther great slaughter thenglysshmen entred cytie enemyes entred strong house stone howbeit incontynent byforce knight taken many men slayne cyte ouerron pylled whiche greatly thenglysshmens profyte also wanne kyng henry lodgynge wherin founde gret richesse vessell iowelles golde syluer kyng come thyder great noblenesse whan disconfyted layser retourne thyder agayne saue left hydeous terryble discofyture specially ryuer syde ther many man slayne sayd herde reported ther present one might haue sene water ran nauaret coloure reed blode men horse yt ther slayne batayle bytwene nauer nauaret spayne yere incarnacyon lorde jesu christ thousande thre hundred threscore sixe thirde day aprill whiche saturday disconfyture batell nauaret whiche done noone prince caused baner reysed vp highe vpon busshe lytell hyll entent drawe people thyder thyder drue came fro chase thyder came duke lacastre sir johan chandos lorde clysson captall beufz erle armynacke lorde dalbret dyuers barones reysed vp high baners drawe people thyder euer came raynged felde also ther loyes kynge mallorques baner hym whervnto company drue lytell besyde sir marten de la karr baner lorde kynge nauer dyuers erles baron whiche goodly thinge regard beholde came thyder kynge dampeter right sore chafed comynge chase great blacke courser baner beten armes castell hym assoone sawe prince baner alyghted wente thyder whan prince sawe hym comynge went mette hym dyde great honour kyng dampeter wolde haue kneled downe haue thaked prince prince made great haste take hym hande wolde nat suffre knele tha kynge sayd dere fayre cosyn ought gyue many thakes prayses iourney haue attayned day meanes prince sayde sir yelde thankes god gyue ye prays vyctorie hath come onely nat lordes prince counsayle drewe toguyder comuned dyuers ters long prince styll ther people retourned fro chase han ordayned four knyghtes four harauldes go serche feldes knowe people taken nombre slayne also knowe trouthe kyng henry whome called bastarde whether lyue deed prince lordes went lodgynge kyng henry spanyardes well easely lodged great large well replenysshed thynges necessary souped nyght great ioye souper knightes haraudes went visyte felde retourned reported ther slayne enemyes men armes fyue hundred threscore comons aboute seuyn thousande fyue hundred besyde theym drowned wherof nombre vnknowen owne company ther slayne four knightes wherof two gascoyns thirde almayne fourthe englysshman comons nat past xl shewed howe coude nat synde kyng henry wherof kyng dampeter right sory saturday nyght rested selfe made good chere well wherwith founde plenty wyne vitayls refresshed ther ye sonday palme soday sonday monynge whan prince vp redy apparelled yssued pauyllion came hym duke lancastre brother erle armynacke lorde dalbret sir johan chandos captall beufz lorde pomyers sir gyrarde dangle kyng mallorques great nombre knyghtes squyers thane anone came prince kyng dapeter whoe prince made great honoure reuerence kynge dampeter sayde dere fayre cosyn pray requyre ye wyll delyuer false traytours coutre bastarde brother sanxes suche shall cause lese heedes haue well deserued prince aduysed hym well sayd sir kynge requyre name loue lygnage ye wyll graut gyfte request sayde good cosyn haue therfore content soeuer ye desyre graunt prince sayd sir requyre gyue people realme suche hath rebelled agaynst whiche courtessy ye shall abyde better rest peace realme except wyllyam garilz hym content ye take pleasure kyng dampeter acorded desyre though agaynst wyll durst nat deny prince soo moche bounden hym sayde fayre cosyn graunt request good hert tha prisoner sent prince acorded kynge lord caused forgyue yuell wyll brother erle sanxes shulde make couenant swere fealtie homage seruice hold truely euer become men knowledge lorde kynge euer courtesy dyuers dyde prince kynge whiche smally rewarded ye shall hystorie also prince shewed great curtesy baron spayne suche prisoner kinge dampeter taken displeasure dyed without mercy sir wyllyam garylz delyuered kyng whome hated sore wolde take taunsome hym made heed striken logynge kyng dampeter mouted horse erle sanxes brother become men marshalles sir guyssharde dangle sir stephyn gosenton fyue hundred men armes departed fro prince hoost rode burgus came thyder monday mornyng burgus well infourmed iourney nauaret atchyued howe kynge henry discofyted thought nat kepe towne agaynst dampeter dyuerse richest towne moost notablest yssued towne presented ye kayes cyte receyued hym lorde brought ye cyte burgus great ioye solemnyte sonday prince abode styll logynges monday euynsong disloged went lodged berguet ther taryed tyll wednisday went cytie burgus ther prince entred towne great reuerece duke lancastre therle armynacke dyuers great lord people made logynges without towne coude nat haue lodged within ease whan prince lodgyng ther gaue redred iugementes armes thynges therto aperteyninge kept felde wage batayle wherfore might well sayd spayne come day handes vnder obeysaunce prince wale kyng dampeter helde ester towne burgus taryed thre wekes ester day sturges tollet lysbone cordowane galyce cyuyle march lymitacions realme castell came thyder made homage kynge dampeter gladde se prince damferant castres ther great chere made bytwene whan kynge dampeter taryed terme haue shewed sawe ther mo rebelled agaynst euery man hym obeysaunt prince sayd sir kyng ye nowe thaked god peasably kyng yor owne realme without rebellyon let sir copany tary great charge expence therfore requyre uyde money pay wage hath holpen bring agayne realme fulfylling promyse wher vnto ye haue sworne sealed sir shortlyer yt ye gretter thanke weshall gyue shalbe yor profyte ye knowe well warr must payed lyue el wyll take wher may get kynge answered sayd cosyn wyll holde kepe accomplysshe power haue sworne sealed vnto sir present tyme haue money wherfore wyll drawe v marchesse ciuyle ther wyll procure money wyll satisfy euery party sir ye shall abyde styll vale olyfes whiche plentyfull countre sir shall returne agayne short tyme co uenyetly may ye farthest whitsontyd answere right pleasant ye prince cousayle shortly kynge dampeter departed fro prince rode towarde ciuyle thentent get money pay men warr promysed prince went loged vale olyfe lordes people spred abrode ye countre get vitayls plentyfull horse ther thus soiourned small profyte countre companyons coude nat absteyne selfe fro robbyng pillynge countre p honour gyuen prince vyctorie spayne howe kyng henry came fra ce make warre prince land answere kyng dapeter sent prince howe prince departed spayne came fraunce cap cc xxxix tidinges spred abrode france englande almayne countre howe prince wale puyssance batell disconfyted kynge henry taken slayne drowned men day batayle mo c thousande men wherby prince gretly renomed chiualry highe entprice moche praysed place herde therof specially thempyre almayne realme englande almayns flemynges englysshmen sayde prince wale chefe floure chiualry howe suche prince well worthy gouern worlde sythe prowes achyued suche thre highe entprices done first batayle cressy poictou setonde ten yere poycters iii nowe spayne nauaret englande cytie london bourgesses made great solemnyte tryumphe vyctorie aunciently wont kynges whan ouercome enemyes realme fraunce made lamentable sorowes losse good knightes ye realme fraunce whiche slayne iourney specially made sorowe sir bertram clesquy sir arnolde dandrehenne taken prisoner dyuers kept right courtesly put fynance raunsome nat sir bertram clesquy soone sir johan cha do hadde rule hym wolde nat delyuer also sir bertra made great sute therfore p nowe let v somwhat speke kyng henry dyde whan departed fro batayle let v retourne agayne prince kyng dampeter castell kinge henry sayd saued hym selfe well myght withdrewe fro ennemyes ledde wyfe chyldren soone might cytie ualence aragon kyng aragon godfather frende hym recounted aduenture anone sayd kyng ry counsayled passe god ye duke aniou motpellyer shewe vnto hym aduenture aduyce pleasaunt kynge arragon consented well shulde go thyder bycause ennemy prince nere neighbour thus kinge henry departed fro kynge arragon lefte cytie ualence wyfe chyldren rode longe paste narbone whiche firste cytie realme fraunce syde beseers countrey came mountpellyer founde duke aniowe loued hym entierly greatly hated englysshmen though made warre duke whan well enfourmed kynge henryes busynesse receyued hym ryght ioyously recounforted hym well might kynge taryed hym certayne space went auygnone se pope urbayne departynge go rome thane kynge henry retourned agayne mountpellyer duke aniou longe treaty toguyder shewed thought selfe knowe many thynges right well sene apparet howe kynge henry dyde gette duke aniowe castell nere tholous marchesse principalyte called rockemor assembled toguyder companyons men warr breton nat passed ouer spaygne prince begynnyng thre hudred men warre tidynges anone brought lady princesse burdeux howe kynge henry purchased hym ayde socoure sydes thentent make warr principalyte duchy guyen wher greatly abasshed bycause helde hymselfe realme fraunce wrote letter sent messangers frenche kynge desyringe hym nat consente bastarde spaygne shulde make maner warre seyng resorte court fraunce certifyeng moche yuell might ensue many inconuenyentes fall therby kynge condyscended lightly princesse request hastely sent messangers bastard henry castell rockemore ye fronters mou taubon begynnynge make warre countre acquitayne prince lande commaundynge hym incontynent auoyde oute realme make warre lande dere nephue prince wale acquitayne bycause gyue ensample subgett shulde nat hardy take part bastarde henry caused yonge erle auser putte prison castell loure parys bycause soo great conuersaunt kynge henry bastarde sayd hadde promysed ayde great nombre men armes thus frenche kynge caused breke voyage purpose thus commaundement frenche kynge kyng henry obeyed whiche good reasone yet lefte nat enterprice departed fro rockemore foure hundred breton hym alyed suche breton knightes squyers foloweth firste sir arnolde lymosyn sir gesfray rycons sir pouns lakonette sylue buddes alyot de calays alayne de saynt poule thesemen armes breton rode ouer mountaynes entred bygoure principalyte toke scalynge towne called bannyers thane fortifyed repayred well strongly ouer rode prince lande dyd great hurt domage therin thane princesse dyde send sir james audeley abydinge behynde prince acquitayne chiefe soueraygne gouernoure kepe countrey howe sayd kynge henry bastard breton dyde great hurte domage countrey dayly power entreased p nowe lette v retourne prince wale company vale olyfes aboute abydnge comynge kyng dampeter castell thus whan prince hadde soiourned vale olyffes vntyll feast saynt johan baptyst somer abydinge co myng kynge dampeter came nat coude nat certayne tidynges hym prince right soore troubled called counsayle togyder knowe best behalfe prince counsayled sende two thre knyghtes kynge demaunde hym kepte nat day hadde assigned message sende sir nowell lornyche sir rycharde pontchardon sir thomas balaster rode long iourneis came cytie cyuyle founde kyng dampeter semblant right ioyously receyued knightes dyd message hadde charge lorde prince kynge answered excusyng himselfe sayd sir certaynly greatly displeaseth v cannat kepe promyse haue made oure cosyne prince whiche haue often tymes shewed vnto people party people excuseth themselfe say canne make money longe companyons countrey haue thre foure tymes robbed oure treasourers commynge oure cosyne prince oure money therfore requyre shewe cosyne fro v requyre hym wyll withdrawe putte oure realme yuell people companyons leaue ther owne knyghtes whoe name hym wyll paye delyuer somes money desyreth v bounde paye hym aunswere knyghtes coulde haue hym tyme departed wente agayne price lorde recounted hym counsayle hadde herde sene whiche answere prince moche dyspleased sawe well kynge dampeter fayled promyse varyed fro reason season prince thus abode vale olyffes hadde bene space four monethes nighe somer kyng mallorques fell sicke sore diseased lay sycke bedde putte raunsome sir arnolde dandrenhen begue uyllaynes dyuers knyghtes squyers fraunce bretaygne taken nauaret exchanged sir thomas pheltone sir rycharde centon sir hughe hastynges dyuers sir bertram clesquy abode styll prisonere prince englysshemen counsayled prince sayde yf delyuered sir bertram clesquy wolde make hym greatter warre euer done helpynge bastarde henry bygour takene towne banyers made great warr quarter therfore sir bertram clesquy nat delyuered tyme whan prince wale herde excusacyons kynge da peter moche displeased thane demaunded counsayle behalfe people desyredde retourne home bare full great trouble heate infectyue ayre countrey spaygne also prince hymselfe nat verry well case therfore people counsayled hym retourne agayne sayeng howe kynge damepeter hath greatly faylled hym blame great dishonour shewed openly euery man shulde retourne whan prince shulde remoue sent ye kyng mallorques sir hugh cortnay sir johan chandos shewynge hym howe prince wolde depart spayne desiryng hym take aduyce wolde dete nat prince wolde lothe leue hym behynde kyng mallorques said sir thanke greatly prince present tyme nat ryde remoue tyll please god knightes sayde sir wyll lorde prince shall leue certayne nombre men wayte coduct whan ye able ryde nay surely sir kyng shall nat nede knowe nat long wyll able ryde departed retourned prince wyng done well sayd prince please god hym price departed company went cytie called madigray ther rested vale called foyrie bytwene aragon spayne ther taryed moneth ther certayne passage closed agaynst ye marchesse aragon sayd hoost kynge nauarr newly retourned prison agreed bastarde spayne kynge aragon let prince passage yet dyde nothyng apered howe prince doute hym bycause owne countrey came nat hym meane season ther sent certayn place bytwene aragon spayne certayne person bothe party great comunyng togyder dyuers dayes finally agreed kyng aragon shuld opyn countre suffre prince people returne passe peasably without lette coutre payeng courtesly yt toke came prince ye kyng nauer sir martyn de la kar whan saw mater go suche wyse bytwene kynge aragon prince made prince honoure coude deuyse offred passage hym dere brother duke lancastre dyuers knyghtes englande gascoyne wyse wolde companyons shulde take way passage nat naurr prince lordes whan sawe way nauarr mete necessary aragon thought nat refuse kynge nauars offre thanked hym greatly thus prince passed realme naurr kynge sir martyn de la karr conueyed tyll came passage rounseualx then passed iourneyes tyll came cytie bayone wher receyued great ioye prince refresshed hym four dayes departed rode burdeaulx also receyued great solemnyte lady princesse mette hym yonge sonne edward age thre yer deted lordes men warre one another lordes gascoyne went home owne house companyons came also pricipalyte abyding wage prince moche boude promysed pay power soone money though kyng dampeter kepte nat promyse hym yet said shulde nat beare losse therof sythe well serued hym kynge henry bastarde garyson ba nyers bygoure departed then suche men warre wente aragon kynge ther loued hym entierly ioyously receyued ther taryed wynter made newe alyaunce bytwene hym kynge aragon promysed make warr agaynst kynge dapeter breton company sir arnolde lymosyne sir geffray rycouns sir yons de lankane rode passage spaygne made warr kynge henry p nowe lette v speke delyueraunce sir bertram clesquy prince wale returned acquitayne brother ye duke lancastre englande euery lorde owne sir bertra clesquy styll prisoner prince sir johan chandos coude nat come raun fynaunce whiche sore displesaunt kyng henry might haue mended fortuned enformed day prince called hym sir bertram clesquy demaunded hym dyde answered sayd sir neuer better reason shulde prison moost renowmed knight worlde whome sayd prince sir sir johan chandos sir sayd realme frauce place ye feare moche ye dare nat let prison whiche full great honour price vnderstode well wordes sir bertram clesquy parceyued well howe owne counsayle wolde wyse shuld delyuer vnto tyme kyng dampeter payed hym suche somes bounde said sir bertram sir ye thinke kepe feare yo chiualry nay thynke nat swere sait george nat therfore pay raunsome hundred thousande frakes ye shall delyuered sir bertram desyred gretly delyuered herde poynt might depart toke prince worde sayd sir ye name god wyll pay lasse wha prince herde say wolde gladly haue repeted hym selfe also counsayle came sayd sir ye haue nat done well lightly put raunsome wolde gladly haue caused prince haue reuoked couenaunt prince true noble knight sayd sythe haue agreed therto wyll nat breke promyse shulde v great rebuke shame reproche shulde nat put hym raunsome seyng content pay suche great hundred thousande frakes acorde sir bertram clesquy right besy studyed dayly howe get rausome dyde moche ayde frenche kynge frendes duke aniou loued entierly yt payed lesse moneth hundred thousande frankes departed went serue duke aniou two thousande fightyng men prouens duke lay siege towne tarraston whiche helde kyng naples season maryage concluded twene lorde lyon duke clarence erle ulseter sone kynge englande doughter lorde galyanche lorde myllan whiche yonge lady nere therle sauoy doughter lady blanch suster thus duke clarece acopanyed noble knight squyers england cae frace wher king duke burgon duke burbone lorde coucy receyued hym great ioye parys passed ye realme france came sauoy wher gentyll erle receyued right honorably chambrey thre dayes greatly feested ladyes damosel deted therle sauoy brought myllan ther duke wedded nece doughter lorde myllan ye monday next feest holy trinyte yere lorde thousande ccc lxviii p nowe let v retourne busynesse fraunce cap cc xl ye haue well herde recounted maner ye vyage prince wale made spayne howe deted then nat well cotent kyng dampeter howe returned acquitayne whan thus returned maner men warr folowed bycause thought nat abyde behynde spayne bycause kyng dampeter payed nat wage promysed thus whan returned price nat paymet redy wolde haue vyage spayne sore mynisshed wasted richesse marueyle thynke theron soiourned companyons vpon countre acquitayne coude nat absteyn theselfe fro robbyng coutre well vi fightyng men last prince desyred departe realme countre nat able susteyn leger capitayns copanyons englysshmen gascos sir robert briquet johan treuell robert ceny sir gaylarde uyger bourge bertuell bourge camus bourge lespare nandon bergerant bernard de la sale many whiche wolde nat displease prince yssued principalyte shortely might entred realme frauce whiche called chambre passed ye ryuer loyre came champayne bysshopriche raynes alwayes nombre encreased adueture selfe serched aboute realme fraunce dyde many yuell trybulacions vilayne dedes wherof complayntes came dayly frenche kynge counsayle howe beit coude fynde remedy durst nat fight people marueyled greatly prince wale wolde sende theym thyder make warre frenche kynge sente lorde clysson made great capitayne agaynst yuell companyons bycause good knyght hardy kynge hym great loue fauoure season maryage made bytwene lorde dalbret lady isabell bourbone whiche prince nothynge gladde rather lorde dalbret ben maryed place whiche cause price spake great wordes agaynst hym greattest counsayle aswell knightes squyers excused hym might sayeng ye prince howe euery man wyll gladde auauce himselfe nere gode knight ought nat blamed though purchase owne honour profyte leaue nat therby serue price maister bounde wordes suche semblable price somwhat apeased howe euer semblant made nat well content thought verily maryage shulde cause drawynge loue fro hym fro theym toke parte whiche trouthe ye shall afterwarde hystorie p howe baron gascone complayned freche kyng price wale kyng henry retourned spayne alyaunces kynge dampeter made cousayle sir bertram clesquy gaue kyng henry howe kynge dampeter disconfyted cap cc xli season companyons turmented thus realme frau ce prince counsayled couusayle reyase fowage acquitayne specially bysshoppe bade state price princesse great christendome none lyke counsayle reysinge fowage called noble barownes gascoyne poyctou xaynto dyuers cyties good townes acquitayne nyorte parlyament holden shewed specially generally bysshoppe bade chauncellour acquitayne presens prince howe maner fowage shulde reysed declarin ge howe prince nat mynde yt shulde endure lengar fyue yeres ronne throughout countrey reysing therof thyntent pay suche money ought reason iourney spayne whiche ordynaunce well agreed poyctous xaynton lymosyn rouergne rochell condycion prince wolde kepe cours coyne stable vii yere dyuers marchesse gascoyne refused purpose ye erle armynacke lorde dalbret neuewe erle gomynges uycount carmayne lorde de la barde lorde cande lorde pyncornet dyuers great barownes sayenge howe tyme past whan obeyed frenche kynge nat greued oppressed wt subsydes inposicyons sayde wolde long coude defende sayeng howe landes segnyories fre excepte fro dettes prince haddesworne kepe maynteyne howe departe peasably fro parlyament aunswered wolde take better aduyse retourne agayne bothe prelate bysshoppes abbottes barownes knyghtes prince cousayle coude haue none answere thus departed towne nyort commaunded theym prince shulde returne agayne thyder day assigned thus barownes lordes gascoyne retourned countrees agreed fermely toguyder wolde nat retourne agayne ye prince suffre fowage rynne landes thaue made warre agaynst prince therfore thus countrey beganne rebell agaynst prince lorde armynacke lorde dalbret lorde gomegynes erle pyncornet dyuers prelate barownes knyghtes squyers gascoyne went frau ce made great complayntes frenche kynges chambre kyng peres beynge present greffes prince wale wolde sayeng howe e sorte ought frenche kynge drawe souerayne lorde kynge wolde nat breke peace bytwene hym kynge englande began dyssemble sayd sir surely inrysdictyon herytage crowne fraunce wyll alwayes kepe augment haue sworne dyuerse artycles peace whiche remembre nat therfore shall visyte beholde tenoure letter moche may shall ayde shall gladde agre prince dere nephue parauenture nat well counsayled put yo subgettes fro fredoms fraunchesses answere kynge made tyme content soo abode styll parys kyng purpose nat retourne agayne owne countrees wt whiche prince nothynge well content alwayes styll perseuered ye purpose reysinge fowage sir johan chandos one greattest counsayle contrary opinyon wolde gladly prince wolde haue left whan sawe ye prince wolde nat leue purpose thyntent wolde bere blame reproche mater tooke leaue price made excuse go normandy visyte lande saynt sauyoure uycount wherof lorde nat thre yeres prince gaue hym leaue departed poyctou went constantyne taryed towne saynt sauyour tha halfe yere alwayes prince proceded reysynge fowage whiche yf hadde brought shulde haue well worthe euery yere xii hundred thousand fra kes euery fyre haue payed yerely franke riche haue borne poore p nowe let v retourne kyng henry season realme arragon lette v shewe howe perseuered moost parte state prince besynesse well knowen kynges kyng peter aragon kyng henry layed great wayte knowe vnderstode well howe barownes gascon gone parys frenche kynge maner began rebell agaynst prince whiche nothyng displeased specially kynge henry thought attayne agayne conquere realme castell whiche hadde lost meanes prince kyng henry toke leaue kynge arragon departed fro towne ualence great arragon hym ther went uycount roquebertyn uycount roodes thre thousande horseman sixe thousande fote certayne genowayes hadde wage rode towarde spaygne tyll came cytie burgus whiche incontynent opyned rendered vp kynge henry receyued lorde fro then wet uale olyfe kynge henry vnderstode kyng mallorques styll ther whan towne uale olyfe vnderstoode burgus yelded vp towne kyng henry thought natte kepe towne agaynst hym yelded receyued lorde assone kyng entred towne demaunded kyng mallorques ye whiche shewed hym tha kynge entred chambre wher lay nat fully hole dysease thane kynge went hym sayde sir kyng mallorques ye haue ben enemy great army ye haue enuaded realme castell wherfore set handes therfore yelde selfe prisoner el ye ar deed whan kynge mallorques sawe hym selfe case defence wolde helpe hym sayde sir kynge truely deed yf please sir gladly yelde vnto none therfore sir mynde put mannes handes shewe rather dye put handes v ter enemy kyng aragon sir said kyng feare nat wyll right yf dyde otherwyse blame ye shall prisoner outher acquyte raun pleasure thus kyng mallorques taken ky g henry caused hym well kept ther rode ye cyte lyon spayne whi incontynent opened agaynst hym p whan towne cite lyon spaygne thus rendred kynge henry countre marchesse galyce tourned yelded kynge henry hym came many great lordes barownes done homage kynge dapeter euer semblant made hym prince yet loued hym nat bycause olde tyme ben cruell euer feare wolde tourne ueltie agayne kyng henry euer amyable meke promisyng mo therfore drue sir bertram clesquy nat co pany comyng two thousand fightyng men deted fro duke amou achyued war proues broken vp sege taraston coposicion nat shewe sir bertra clesquy ther dyuers knightes squye fraunce desyring exercyse feate me came towardes kyng hen layd si ge tollet dynges came kyng dapeter howe countre tourned bastarde brother ther lay marchesse cyuyll portyngale wher smally beloued whan herde therof sore displeased agaynst brother agaynst castell bycause forsoke sware gret othe wolde take cruell vengeaunce shulde ensample sent commaundement suche trusted wolde ayd serue sent suche ae nat turned kyng henry sent homage hym whan kyng dapeter sawe men began fayle began dout toke counsayle domferant ca tce neuer fayled hym gaue hym counsayle shulde get asmoche people gyder might aswell granade place hast ryde agaynst brother bastarde dyde conquere countre kynge dampeter sent incotynent kyng portyngale cosyn germayne also sent kyng granade bell maryn kyng tramesames made alyaunces thre sent hym mo xx thousande sarazy helpe hym warr thus kynge dampeter dyde somoche christenmen sarazyus nombre xl thousand men marchesse cyuyll meane season whyle kynge henry lay atsiege sir bertram clesquy came ii fighting men receyued great ioye host gretly reioysed comyng bing dampeter made asse ble marchesse cyuyll desyrynge greatly fight bastarde brother departed fro ciuyll toke tourney towardes tollet reyse siege ther whiche fro vii dayes iourney tidynges came kyng henry brother dampeter aproched co pany mo xl thousande men one thervpon toke counsell whiche counsayle called knyghtes frau ce aragone specially sir bertram clesquy whome kyng moost ruled counsayle kynge henry shulde auaunce forthe encountre brother dapeter codycion euer foude hym incotynent set fyght hym sayeng kyng sir say cometh great puyssaunce sir yf haue great layser comyng may tourne v great dyspleasure therfore sir go hastely beware parauenture shall fynde hym company case dispur eyed shal haue hym aduauntage shall disco fyte hym dout nat counsayle ser bertram clesquy well herd taken kyng henry euenyng departed fro hoost certayne best knyghtes fightyng men coude chose hoost left resydue company ye kepyng gouernyng brother therle anxell rode forthe seuynspyes euer comynge goynge euer brought hym worde brother dampeter dyde hoost kyng dampeter knewe nothynge howe brother came hastely towarde hym wherfore copany rode large wtout good order mornyng kyng henry people met encountred brother kyng dampeter lyen night castell therby called nantueyle well receyued good departed then mornyng wenyng full lytell haue ben fought day sodenly hym baners displayed came brother kyng hery brother sanxes sir bertram clesquy whome kynge host greatly ruled also wt ther begue uillaynes lorde roquebertyn vycout rodaix copanyes sixe thousand fightyng men rode close togyder ran encountred enemyes cryenge castell kynge henry lady clesquy discofyted put backe first brunt ther many slayne cast erthe ther none taken raunsome whiche apoynted sir bertram clesquy bycause great nobre sarazyns ther whan kyng dapeter myddes prease among owne people herde howe men assayled put abacke brother bastard ry frenchman great maruell therof sawe well howe betrayed visceyued aduentur lese men soresparcled abrode howbeit like gode hardy knight good coforte rested felde caused banerr vnrolled drawe togyder people sente worde behy de hast forwarde bycause fightynge enemyes wherby euery man auauced forward baner ther maueylous great ferse batayle many man slayne kyng da peter parte kyng henry sir bertram clesquy sought enemyes coragyous ferse wyll none coulde endure agaynst howe beit nat lightly done kyng dampeterand copany wer sixe agaynst one taken sodenly discofyted suche wyse marueyle beholde tthis batayle spanyardes one agaynst another two kynges alyes nere nantueyle whiche day right ferse cruell ther many good knightes kynge henryes parte sir bertram clesquy sir geffray rycons sir arnolde lymosyn sir gawen baylleule begue uillaynes alayne saynt poule alyot calays dyuers also ye realme aragon ther vycount roquebertyn vycout rodaix dyuers good knight squiers whome nat name dyde many noble dedes armes whiche nedefull theym founde ferse stronge people agaynst sarazyus iewes portyngales iewes fledde turned backes fought stroke granade belmaryn fought fersely bowes archegayes dyd day many noble dede armes kyng dampeter hardy knight fought valyantly great axe gaue therwith many great stroke none durst aproch nere hym baner kyng henry brother mette recoutred agaynst eche cryenge cryes batayle kyng dampeter began opyn domferant castres chefe counsay lour kynge dampeter sawe perceyued well howe people began lese disconfyted sayd kyng sir saue yor selfe withdrawe castell nauntueyle sir ye ther ye sauegarde ye taken enemyes ye deed without mercy kyng dampeter beleued counsayle deted assoone might went warde nantueyle came thider suche tyme founde gat opyn entred onely xii son meane season company fought styll feldes sparcled abrode ther sarazyns defended selfe well might knewe nat countrey therfore flye thought none auayle tidyng cam kyng henry sir bertram clesquy howe kyng dampeter fledde withdrawen castell nantueyle begue uillaynes pursued hym thyder castell one passage whiche passage begue uiyllaynes pyght standerd whiche tidynges king henry sir bertram clesquy right ioyouse drewe parte sleyng beatyng downe ennemyes lyke beestes wery kyllyng chase endured iii houres day ther moo xiiii thousand slayne sore hurt ther fewe saued except suche knewe palsages countre batayle besyde nantueyle spayne xiii day moneth august yere lorde god thousande thre hundred threscore eight p howe kyng dampeter taken put dethe kyng henry agayne kyng castell tenour certayne letter touchi ge frenche kyng kynge englande counsayle gyuen kyng charles fra ce make warre kyng englande cap cc xlii disconfyture yt kynge henry obteyned victory layed sege rounde castell natueyle wher kyng dapeter kynge hery sent resydue company tollet wher lay siege tidynges therle auxell therle sares right ioyfull castell nantueyle right stronge able haue hold agaynst long space ben purueyed vitayle thynges necessary ther nat castell scant serue four dayes wherof kyng dapeter company sore abasshed straitly watched day night byrde coud nat come castell without spyeng kyng da peter seyng hymselfe thus set rounde enemyes knewe way peace concorde great ymaginacyon peryls consydred defaut vitayle counsayled depart priuely ye hour mydnight xii person hym aduentur grace god gydes apoynted bring hym sauegard aboute tyme mydnight next kynge dampeter domferant caster xii person departed castell night darke begue uillayns kept watch without night ccc hym kynge dapeter company yssued castell went downe hye way priuely coude deuyce begue uillayns euer dout lest shulde scape whiche caused hym make surerr watche thought herd men passe downe hye way sayd hym sir kepe styll preuy thinke folkes come way wyll go knowe seke tyme night auenture ther comynge reuitayle castell begue stept forthe dagger hande came man nere kynge dapeter sayd art thou russhed forth horse fro hym passed begue stept kyng dampeter next sayde art shewe thy name thou art deed toke hym bridell thought shulde nat passe fro hym dyde whan kyng dampeter sawe suche route men warre hym coude nat scape sayd sir begue uillayns kynge dampeter castell yelde prisoner put company whiche ar xii person hand pleasure sir requyre waye gentylnesse bring sauegard shall pay rausome ye wyll desyre thanke god haue ynough wher may scape fro handes barstarde brother begue enformed answered said sir shall bring company sauegarde brother shall knowe nothynge thus king dampeter brought begues lodgyng proper loging sir yone kaonet nat ben ther space hour whan kynge henry therle roquebertyn certayne came logyng assoone king henry entred chambre sayde wher horeson iewe calleth himselfe kyng castell kynge dampeter alryght hardy cruell knyght auaunced himselfe sayd nay thou art hores sonne sonne kyng alphons ther toke kyng hery brother armes wrestled hym ouer thrue hym benche set hand knyfe slayne hym without remedy vycount roquebertyn nat bene toke kyng dampeter legge turned hym vp sedowne kyng hery aboue drue longe knyfe strake kyng dampeter body ther men came helpe hym ther slayn also knight england called ser rafe helme somtyme called ye grene squier squyer called james roulant bycause made defence domfe rant caster none yuell remayned prisoner begue uyllayns sir lyon kaonet thus ended kyng dampeter castell somtyme reigned great prosperyte slayne lefte thre dayes aboue erthe thynke great pyte next day lorde natueyle yelded hym kynge henry toke hym mercy tho wolde tourne tidynges ran ouer castell kyng dapeter slayne wherof fredes sory enemyes ioyfull whan kynge portyngale herde howe cosyn kyng dapeter deed right sorowfull sware sayde dethe shulde reuenged sentincotynent defya ce kyng henry made hym warr kept marchesse ciuyll agaynst certayn season kyng henry left nat purpose pursuyng enterprise returned tollet yelded vp streight hym countre ther last kyng portigale thought nat kepe lengar warr agaynst kyng henry ther peace made bytwene meanes prelate lordes spayne thus kinge henry abode peace kyng castell hym sir bertram clesquy sir olyuer many knightes squyers fra ce bretayne kyng henry dyd moche bounde without helpe nat obtayned purpose made sir bertram constable spayne gaue hym lande soyrie whiche yerely worthe xx trankes sir olyuer nephue gaue lande crete yerely worth x frakes also gaue fayre land dyuers knightes squiers kynge went lay burgus wife child prosperyte good adueture gretly reioysed frenche kyng duke aniou also kyng aragon tyme dyed sir lyon englande duke clarence past see ye haue herde maried doughter galays lorde myllayne bycause dyed stragely lorde edwarde spens company kept warr agaynst hym certayne space finally enformed trouthe p nowe let v retourne aduentures duchy acquitayne ye haue herd howe prince determyned reyse fowage lande people thought shulde theyr gret charge specially gascone lowe march poytou xayton rochell acorded lightly therto bycause nere prince abidyng also wer euer obeysant ferme stable prince tho cou tree bring mater passe ye prince counsell dyuers lyamentes nyort angoleme poyters burdeux bergerat alwayes angoleme teyned styll sayd wolde pay nothyng sayd wolde nat suffre fowage ryn coutre sayeng howe theyr resort hath ben alwayes chabre fre che kyng whiche resorte prince sore displeased argued agaynst sayd ought haue resorte ther affirmynge howe french kyng quyted resortes iurisdyctions whan redred land kyng england well aparet tenour charter ye peace wherin maketh playne mecion ther article reserued frech kyng peace answered agayne gascons sayeng howe nat power frenche kyng aquyte fro resort prelate baron cyties good townes gascone wolde neuer haue suffred neuer wyll agayn though realme frauce shuld euer abyde warr thus prince lordes gascoyne susteyned styll opinyon abode parys frenche kyng therle armynake lorde dalbret therle pyergort erle comygines dyuers dayly enformed kyng howe prince great pride presumpcion wolde trede vnder reyse vp newe thyng countreis whiche sayd wolde neuer suffre done consydering resorte hym therfore desyred prince shulde apelled chambre lyament peres frauce answer ther grefes trouble wold french kyng wolde entertayne lordes gascone requyred ayde confort souerayne lorde shulde drawe none court lesynge seignory codiscended request agaynst wyll cause sawe well shuld turne haue opyn warr without good tytell reason wolde lothe moue also sawe realme sore troubled co panyons enemyes also brother ye duke berry hostage england therfore toke great leyser case ye season came frauce lorde guy ligny erle poule without taking leaue thenglysshmen great subtylte maner howe longe reherse therfore wyll passe ouer brefely erle hated englysshmen yt coude say good dyd asmoche might frech kynge shulde codiscend request ye gascons knewe well prince apeled ye court lyament shulde great occasion mouyng warr opynion erle poule agreed dyuers prelate erles baron knightes realme frace sayd kyng howe kyng england nat well kept peace whervnto sworne sealed acordinge tenor treaty made bertiguin besyde de charter cofermed calays sayd thenglysshmen hath hated realme frauce syth peace made dyde sir say ye shall fynde trouth ye cause charter peace reed kyng england son bounde faithe othe kynge better enformed trouthe kepe ye rightes realme caused brought chabre counsell charter peace made reed ouer often tymes better examyne ye poyntes artycles coprised amonge ther one submyssion wheron kyng counsayle arested moost bycause spake clerely playnly loked tenour wherof foloweth edward grace god kyng england lorde irlande acquitayn present letter seyth send gretyng knowe finall last acorde peace made bytwene v oure right dere brother french kyng conteyned two artycles coprisyng ye forme folowing first wher sayde foresayd kynges bounde cause cofermed sayd artycles coprised peace ho la father pope delyuerd sentence fro court rome touchyng fection accoplysshment present treaty delyuerd tie lest within thre wekes french kyng shulde aryued calys also thentent artycles treaty passed shulde ferme stable ther shulde made certayne bondes delyuered foloweth say letter sealed seales bothe kynges eldest sonnes suche shulde deuysed counsayles bothe kynges also sayd kynges child shulde swere gret lynage nobre xx shulde kepe ayde kept asmoche lyeth sayd artycles acorded agreed aco plysshe without fraude male engin also bothe kynges shuld best power fredes bring rebel obeysance acordyng forme truce also bothe kyng shulde submyt theselfe realmes correction pope thetent shulde costreyne censuries churche euer shulde rebell fall concorde peace besyde bothe kynges heyres othe assurance shulde renouce grace pro dede done though disobeysance rebellyon puyssance subgett french kyng wherby kyng shulde let accomplysshe sayd artycles yet kyng england heyres yt shuld make warr realme frace kynges togyder shulde enforce theselfe reduce rebel peace concorde also though subgett kyng england wolde nat rendre townes castels fortress helde realme fraunce whiche ought delyuerd reason peace iust cause wherby kyng englande shulde let acoplysshe ought reason treaty kynges togyder shuld make warr agaynst rebel bring good obeysance recouer suche townes castels fortress delyuer ther ought shulde ther made fyte sure bandes coude deuysed aswell holy father pope coledge cardynalles also ther another artycle ye treaty sayeng thus token perfyte knowlege desyre haue norisshe petuall peace loue bytwene v brother france renounce presentes renounce grace processe dede agaynst sayd brother heyres successours realme france subgett therof promyse swere haue sworne body jesu cryst v successours ye shulde nat suffre done dede worde thyng ayenst renuciacio agaynst thyng coteyned forsayd artycles suffre done cotrary maner way whiche god beve wyll yt reputed false forsworne ryn suche blame disfainy kinge sacred ought suche case clerely renouce dispesacions absolucions ye pope obteyned wyll stande nought valure yt ayd v nat maner case fermlyer vpholde sayd artycles put v heyres successours iurisdyction correction ye church rome wyll consent yt holy father pope conferme sayd treaty ordayne monycions generall comaudemetes agaynst v heyres successours agaynst subgett comos vniuersiteis colleg singuler son soeuer gyueng sentece generall cursyng suspedyng interdityng ryn v asson atept cotrary ye said trety ocupyeg wa castels fortress thing doyng ratifyeng gyueng cousell cofort fauour ayde priuely openly agaynst sayd artycles also haue caused dere eldest sonne edwarde prince wale swere also yonger sone lyonell erle ulster john erle richmont edmond langley right dere cosyn phylyp nauar duke lacastre bretayne therles stafford salisbury ye lorde many caprall befz lorde motford james audley roger beauchampt john chandos rafe ferres edward spens thoms wyllm phelton eu state dabretycourt frake de hall john mo bray bartylmewe brome henry percy dyuers also shall cause swere assone coueniently chyldren moost te great prelat erles baron noble realme england witnesse herof haue put seale present gyuen towne calais yere lorde ccc threscore xxiiii day octobre p among writynges ben grau ted aswell bertigny besyde charter calays whan kynge johan ther sayd charter one well reed examyned kyng charles presece chefe cousell ye prelate baron france sayd kyng sir ye kynge england prince son haue nat fulfylled sayd peace haue taken townes castels kepe great domage realme rausometh pylleth people paymet redecion yet tie vnpayed therfore sir subgettes haue good ryght iust cause brek peace make warr agaynst theglyshmen take fro bretayn haue syde water also counsayle shewed secretly great delyberacion sayeng sir hardely take warre forye haue cause sir assone ye one begyn warr ye shall se fynde yt ye duchy acq qui tayn shall turne aswell prelate baron erles knight squiers burgess good townes ye may se sir howe prince wolde cede reysing fowage nat bring purpose ther hatred withall son poictou xaynton querry lymosyn rouerne rochell suche nature yt wyse loue theglyshmen theglyshmen proude presutuous neuer dyd also besyde ye officer price dothe suche extorcios people xainto poitou rochell take abadon reyseth somoch tytell ye price ther none yt sure haue thing owne also getylmen countre attayne offyce prefermet ye englyshmen seruant prince hath thus french kyng moued cousayled moue warr naely duke aniou lay tholous desyred gretly warr leued nothing theglishmen bycause suche displeasure done hym tyme past also gascons sayd often tymes kyng dere sir bounde haue resorte court therfore hubly requyre yt ye wyll right lawe ye rightfull price worlde v right great grefes extorcions yt price wale people doth wolde v sir ye refuce v ryght shall tha purchace selfe remedy place shall yelde put selfe vnder iurisdyction suche lorde shall cause v haue reason therby shall lese seignory ouer v french kynge othe lese thinkyng might great hurt preiudice realme answered right curtesly sayd sir faute lawe good counsayle ye shall nat nede resorte court onely mynde howbeit suche besynesse behoueth worke folowe good cousell aduyce thus kyng draue nigh ye space yere kept styll hym parys payed e pences gaue great gyftes iowelles alwayes raused besecretly enquered amonge peace broken bytwene hym englande whyder wolde maynteyne quarell nat answered warr one open frenche kyng shulde nat nede care part sayd stronge ynough kepe warr price puyssance also kynge sent abuyle knowe yf wolde tourne take parte become frenche answered desyred nothynge worlde moche french hated deedly glysshmen thus french kyng gate hym r de te el durst nat haue done dyde season borne charies kynges eldest son yere lord ccc l viii wherof realme france ioyfull lytell borne charles dalbret byrthe two cosyn germayns realme ioyefull specially frenche kyng p howe french kynge sent n prince wale apell yere personally chambre eres france parys answere agaynst baron gascone cap cc xliii moche french kyng exhorted cou sayle ofte requyred gascoyne ther apell made formed sent quitayne apele prince wale lyament paris deuysed rle armynake lorde dalbret erle ergo rt therle comynges vycont rmayne lorde de la barde lorde ncornet dyuers chiefe causers mater apele coteyned howe great grefes gascons co pleyned prince wale acquitayne wolde people therfore made resort frenche kyng reqryng prince might apelled syth made frech kyng iuge whan apell made duely corrected wyse cousell france concluded sayd counsell shulde signifyed prince shulde apelled apere proper person parys cha bre peres france answere co playntes made ther agaynst hym bere apell comaunded clerke well langaged suche besynesse knyght wt hym called caponell caponall copany deted fro parys toke theyr way towarde poictou passed berry tourayne poyctou xaynton came blay ther passed ryuer came burdeux wher prince princesse alwayes euery place said messangers fro french kyng wherfore ye better welcome euery place toke vp logynge taryed ther night next mornyng couenyent hour went abbey saynt andrewes wher prince loged ther well receyued whan prince knewe comyng caused coe whan came presens kneled downe made reuerence delyuered prince letter credence prince toke reed sayd sir ye welcome declare message yt ye haue charge shewe v tha clerke said right dere sir let delyuered v paris lorde french kyng whiche letter mysed faithes publysh openly presens sir touche prince began change colour great marueyle might knightes howbeit refrayned hymselfe sayd say sir ye wyll good tidyng wyll glad clerke toke ye writyng reed word word tenor herafter foloweth charles grace god french kyng nephue prince wale ac tayne send gretyng dyuers prelate baron knight vnyuersites comynaltes college march lymitacyos coutre gascone dweller habitantes bondes realme besyde dyuers duchy acquitayne drawen coe court haue ryght certayne grefes trouble vnlaufull feble counsell symple informacion haue purpose whiche haue marueyle therfore withstande remedy mater coioyned ryall magesty segnory comaunde come cyte paris proper son ther shew present v chambre peres ther right forsayd complayntes grefes moued people claymeth haue resorte court nat fayled hasty wyse ye sight herynge letter wytnelse wherof presentes haue set seale gyuen parys xxv day january p whan prince wale reed letter great marueyle shoke heed behelde fersely ye frenchman whan lytell studyed answered maner s wyll gladly go parys vncle sythe hath sent thus v assure shall bassenet heed l men company two frenchman kneled downe sayde dere sir goddessake take pacy ce take nat apell great dispyte nat displeased v sir messangers sent lorde french kynge whome must nedes obey subgettes ought obey wherfore sir behoueth v comaundement sir soeuerye wyll gyue v charge say shall kyng prince lorde nay price sir nat displeased sent hyder kyngyomaister nat well counselled copoy e hym selfe oure subgettes make hym selfe iudge wher hath nothyng maner ryght shalbe well shewed rendring puttyng possessyon ye kyng
