father duchy acquitayne quited maner resortes hath caused appele agaynll hath none resort right court england kyng dere father shalbe otherwyse ensure shall cost hundred thousande mennes lyues therwith prince departed went chambre lefte styll ther knightes englande came sayd sir e may depart whan yelyst logyng ye haue right well acoplysshed message loke none answere ye haue knight clerke departed went lodgyng dyned dy er trussed mounted horsbacke departed fro burdeur toke way tholous warde thy shewe duke iou spedde prince sore dyspleased apele knightes hym counsayled prince yt two french messagers shulde haue ayne laboure prince charged cotrary howbeit agaynst many sore ymaginacyon whan shewed hym howe deted without lycence yt rydden towarde tholous tha called hym ser thomas phelton seneshall rouergne sir thomas pountchardone sir thomas percy chauncellour bysshoppe bale prince demaunded yf frenche messangers saue conducte hym nat answered knewe none hath sayd prince shoke heed sayd nat couenyent yt shulde thus lightly dete coutre make tageling ye duke ou loueth v lytell wyll glad yt haue thus somoned v owne hous trowe thing cosydred rather messagers myne owne subgett therle armynake lorde dalbret therle pyergort therles comynges carmayne frech kyng therfore bycause great dispite yt haue done v wold ouer taken put prison prince cousell right ioyouse sayd ser fereye haue taryed long fro purpose cotynet seneshall dagenois comau ded take ser wyllm moke right good knight england yt shulde ryde stoppe ye messagers deted folowed long yt last ouertok lande dagenois arested made occasyon price co maudemet arestyng spake worde prince sayd howe host wher lay last compleyned horse yt sayd changed knight ye clerke great marueyle tidynges excused theselfe excuse coude nat auayle brought cytie dagen putte prison let page departe went cytie tholous recorded duke aniou hole mater wherof nothyng displeased thought well therby shuld begyn warr hatred prepared couertly therfore tidyng came french king pag went recouted hole mater hym herde sene whiche kyng sore displeased toke great dispyte toke cousayle aduyse theron specially wordes shewed price shulde say whan said wolde come sonally vncle answere apell made agaynst bassenet heed lx men warre copany agaynst french kyng made prouysion ryght subtelly wisely thought well weighty mater make warr agaynst kyng england puyssance seyng howe put predecessours tyme past somoche labour trauell whefore thought harde mater begyn warr sore requyred great lordes gascon guyen also shewed great extorcions domag thenglysshmen dyde dayly likely tyme come grauted warr yuell wyll cosydring distruction poore people thought shulde ensue therby p howe duke berry dyuers hostage engla de returned frace ca c cxliiii agaynst ferse aswere prince frech kynge counsell uyded therfore priuely season returned france england duke john berry kyng englande gaue leaue hole yere bare himselfe wisely neuer retourned agayne made suche excusacious meanes warr opyn ye shall herafter also lorde john harcort retourned owne coutre kyng england gaue leaue dete instance sir loys harcort vncle poyctou teyning price fell sicke whiche happy hym sickenes endured tyll warr newly begon therby neuer returned agayne englande guy bloys yong squyer brother therle bloys frake fre delyuerd england whan ceyued french kyng whoe lay hostage dyd nothyng delyuerance fell treaty lorde coucy wedded doughter king engla de yerely great reuenewe kyng england cofers bycause wyfe ther treaty bytwene kyng englande sone lawe sit guy bloys cousell bothe bretherne lord john blois sir guy agrement frenche kyng clerely resigned kyng england handes therldome soyssons land kyng englad gaue son lawe lord coucy dyd quyte hym iiii yerely reuenewes thus couenat made engrosed sir guy bloys delyuered also therle peter alanson leue kyng eng returne frace space wher abod long founde many excusacions yt neuer returned hostage howbeit beleue finally payed xxx frakes aquytall also duke loys burbone happy lay also hostage england suche grace kynge engl shewed returned france whyle parys french kyng bysshop wynchestre discessed chau cellour england ther preest kyng england called sir wyllm wycan great kynge thyng done without nothinge done whan bysshoprike wynchestre voyd kyng englade desyre sayd preest wrote duke burbone wolde sake make suche sute holy father pope urbane chapelayne might haue bysshoprike wynchestre promysing duke doyng entreat hym right curtesly prisoumet hostage whan duke burbone sawe kyng england messagers letter therof right ioyouse shewed mater french kyng kyng cousayled go pope dyde departed went auygnon pope nat gone rome duke made request pope grau ted gaue bysshoprike wynchestre pleasure content kyng englad wold fauorable coposycion delyuerance foresayd wy shulde haue sayd bysshoprike duke burbone returned frace englande treated kyng cousell delyuerace wolde shewe bulles fro pope kyng loued well preest duke burbone delyuered quyte payed xx frankes sir wyllm wy bisshop wyn chester chancellour englande thus lordes delvuered hostag england p let v returne warres gascoyne whiche began bycause appell ye haue herde p howe therle piergourt vycot carmane baron gascoyne discofyted seneshall rouergne cap c c xlv haue herde price wale toke great dispyte somonyng made appere parys full inte syon acordyng sayd messangers apere sonally france great army next somer sent incontynent theglysshe capitayns gascons acorde suche ryuer loyre desyring nat dete farr then sayd trusted shortly set warke tidyng moost part copanyons right ioyouse prince dayly impered sickenesse taken spayne wherof men greatly dismayd case might nat ryde frenche kyng well enformed perfyte knowlege disease phicysions surgions france iuged malady dropsy vncurable sir caponell caponall clerke taken rested sir wyllm monke put prison castell dagen ye haue herde erle comynges therle piergort vycont carman sir bertrm taude lorde de la barde lorde pyncornet ther owne countreis toke great dispyte takyng said messangers name cause went message wherfore thought counterueng opyn warre sayd great dispyte nat suffred vnderstode sir thoms wake ridyng roddes fortefy fortresse shuld departe fro dagenois lx speares whan sayd lordes knewe therof right ioyouse layd busshment c c c speares encoutre sir thoms wake copany thus sayd seneshall rode lx speares c c archer sodenly brake great enbusshment gascoyns wherof thenglysshmen sore abasshed thought lytell bushment defeded theselfe well might frechmen fersely assayled first metyng many cast erthe finally theglyshmen coude endure leger discofyted stedde many taken slayne sir thoms stedde el ben taken saued hymselfe ayde horse entred castell motaubon gascons returned coutreis ledde prisoner coquestes tidyng anone brought prince tyme angoleme howe seneshall rouerne disconfyted therle pyergort suche apeled hym court parys right sore displeased sayd shulde derely reueged landes done outrage incontynent prince wrote sir john chados costantyne sauyour le vycont comau dyng hym incotynent sight letter coe hym wtout delay sir johan chados wolde nat disobey prince hasted moch might come came angoleme prince receyued great ioye prince sent hym certayne men armes archer garyson motabon make warr agaynst gascons frechmen dayly encreased ouer ran prince lande sir thomas wake assone myght went roddes refresshed fortifyed newly cytie also towne castell myllan marchesse mountpellyer euery place set archer men warr sir john cha do beyng motaubon kepe march froters ther agaynst frechmen wt baron knyght price sent thyder wt hym lorde captall beutz two bretherne pomyers sir john sir hely soldyche lestrade lorde partney lorde pons sir loys harcourt lord pyname lorde tanyboton sir rich pountchardon lordes knightes made often yssues therle armynakes co pany lorde dalbret men kept fronter ther agaynst ayde therle pyergourt therle comynges vycout carmane vycont tharyde lorde de la barde dyuers alyance one affinyte thus somtyme one te wanne somtyme thother aduentur falleth feates armes season duke anioy lay styll styred nat thinge herde brother frenche kynge comaunded hym wyse make warr agaynst prince tyll commaunded otherwyse hym p season frech kyng drewe hym certayne capitayns copanyons howe sent defyance kynde englande cap cc xlvi frenche kyng season secretly subtelly get hym dyuers capitayns companyons sent march berry auergne kyng cosented shulde lyue vpon coutre comaundyng make warr tyll otherwyse comaunded frenche kynge wolde nat knowen warr therby thought shulde lese ye enterprice trusted haue therldome poictou kyng englande perfetly knowen french kyng wolde haue made hym warr wolde right well haue wt stande domage poitou wolde well prouyded ye good towne abuyle englysshmen well haue furnysshed garysons ye said cou tre wolde haue ben styll souerayne ouer seneshall countie englysshman called sir nycolas louayng good fauour kyng englande worthy true drawen wylde horse wolde neuer cosent shame cowardnesse villany season sent engla de therle salebruee sir wyllm dorman fro frenche kyng speke ye kyng england counsayle wyng howe partie ye peace dayly yuell kept aswell reason warr copanyons made sixe yere cotynually realm france dyuers accydentes wherof frenche kyng enformed nat well cotent therwith kyng englande caused ambassadours tary styll england space two monethes space declared dyuers artycles often tymes kyng wherof ye kyng sore displeased howbeit set lytell ther charged french kyng counsayle shewe whan french kyng secrete certayne knowlege howe within abuyle wolde become french warres opyn gascone howe people redy aparelled gode wyll make warr agaynst prince entre principalyte howbeit thought haue reproche tyme coe sayd hym shuld send people kyng englande prince lande take townes cyties castels fortress wt defyace wherfore couselled send defy kyng england dyd letter closed breton varlet bare whan came douer ther founde ye erle salebruce sir wyllm dorman returnyng frace acoplysshed message whome varlet declared te message comauded whan herde yt deted englande fast might passed see right ioyfull whan aryued bolen season prince sent rome pope urbane sir guysshard dagle dyuers mater touchyng qui tayne foude pope right fauorable sutes returned agayne way herde howe gascoyns frenchman made warr agaynst prince howe ouerran pricipalyte wherof sore abasshed feare might returne without dager howbeit cae getyll erle sauoy founde pyemot towne pyneroll made warr agaynst marque saluces erle sauoy receyued ioyously company kept two dayes gaue great gyftes specially sir guysshard dangle therle greatly honoured bycause noble chinalry wha deted aproched nerer bondes fraunce bolone herde euer tidyng worse worse purpose saw well yt case coude nat returne guyen well knowen therfore gaue gouernace copany knight called ser iohn sore wedded dought good frechman borne ye march breten toke charge conduct home father lawes company went lande lorde beauieu ther passed ryuer acquyted hym selfe lorde beauieu brought hym company ryon auuerne duke berry ther offerd good freche sayd myght brought peasably owne house bretayne father lawe ser guy shard dangle disgysed hym selfe lyke poore preest yuell horsed arrayed passed fraunce marchesse burgoyne auuerne dyde somoche great payne entred pricipalyte came angoleme price wher right welcome another knight went rome called sir wyllm cens feare came homwarde came abbey cluny burgone ther taryed fyue yeres durst neuer go oute house yet last yelded hymsefe french nowe let v retourne breton brought freche kyng defyace ye kyng englad p defyance delyuered kyng englande howe erle saynt poule lorde chastellon conquered therldome poictou cap cc xlvii foresayd varlet dyde moche came london vnderstode ye kyng cousayle westm holdynge great counsayle prince warres bytwene hym baron knightes gascone se shulde maynteyned men shulde sent england ayde hym ther came newe tidynges ye whiche made haue busynesse frenche varlet dyd somoch entred chambre wher kyng counsayle sayd howe varlet sent french kyng brought letter kyng englande kneled downe kyng offred hym letter kynge greatly desyred knowe ment caused receyued opyned reed p kyng consayle great maruell therof whan vnderstode defyance behelde well seale sigue sawe clerely howe authorite caused varlet departe sayeng hym howe hadde right well done message wherfore might departe whan wolde shulde haue let returned assone might season ther styll england hostagers erle dolphyn auuergne therle porseen lorde mallurer dyuers wer great heuynes hert whan herde tidynges knewe nat ye kyng wolde kyng counsayle great dispyte varlet shulde thus bringe defyace sayd howe nothyng atenant warr bytwene two gret prince kyng englande frenche king shulde publysshed varlet thought ben metely shulde haue ben done prelat valyat man baron knyght beit sawe remedy cousayled kyng incontynent shulde sende great army poyctou kepe fronters ther specially ye towne abuyle ye whiche great danger lesyng kyng content ther apoynted go thyder lorde percy lorde neuyll lorde carbeston sir wyllm wynsore ccc men archer mean season whyle lordes made redy coe douer passe see ther came tidynges poictou ye nothyng ioyfull assone therle guy poule sir guy chastellon maisters crosbowes france thought likelyhod kyng englande defyed drue toward poictou sent secretly comaudemet ye knightes squiers artoyse heynalt cambresis uermadose uyen picardy yt shuld incotynent come dyde nombre sixscore speares came abuyle set vpon gate determyned men warre entred without doyng hurt towne tha sir hewe chastelon chefe leder men warr went streyght wher thought fynde ye seneshall poictou ser nicolas louayng dyd somoche foude toke prisoner also toke riche clerke valyat man tresourer poitou yt day frechmen toke many riche prisoner thenglisshmen lost towne abuyle ye day fre chemen ran saynt ualery entred therin toke crotay also towne derne see syde anone came ye erle saynt poule bridge saynt remey ryuer somme whervnto ther certayne englysshmen withdrawen erle assayled great scrymysshe many noble dedes armes done atcheued therle made knight ther galetan eldest sonne dyde day right nobly thenglysshmen ther sore assayled finally discofyted slayne takefie bridge forteresse also brefely speke countre coutie poictou clene delyuered fro thenglysshmen none abode ther hurte countre tidynges came kyng englande london howe poyctou forsaken hym become frenche wherwith ryght sore displeased many harde ymaginacyon agaynst hostagers france styll lo howe beit thought shulde great crueltie shulde bewreke displeasur yet sent burgess cyties good townes fraunce whome hostage dyuers townes fortress englande kept strayter harder kepte therle dolphyne auuergne raunsomed xxx thousande frankes therle porseen x thousand fra kes lorde roy kept styll prison great daunger nat well beloued kyng englande none courte wherfore behoued hym endure moche sorowe trouble vntyll suche season delyuered great fortune aduenture ye shall hystorie p howe kyng englande sent great nombre men armes fronters scotlande duke berry duke aniou made somos go agaynst prince wale cap cc xlviii whan kyng englande sawe thus defyed frenche kyng cou tie poictou lost cost hym moche repayring townes castels house spent theron hundred thousande frankes ouer aboue reuenewes therof sawe well howe lykely haue warr party also shewed hym yt scottes newly alyed freche kyng purpose make hym warre wherof sore displeased douted warr scottes frechmen knewe well scottes loued hym nat bycause domages done tyme past kynge sentemen warr fronters scotlande berwyke rokesborowe newcastell place ye fro ters also sent great nauy see aboute hampton gernsey yle wyght shewed hym howe frenche kyng apparelled great nauy go see come lande englande yt wyst nat whiche part take hede thus thenglysshmen sore abasshed bycause sodayne warre assoone duke aniou duke berry knewe defyance made warr opyn thought nat slepe made speciall somos one auuerne tholous assemble make warr ye principalyte duke berry redy comaundement barownes auuergne bysshoprike lyon bysshop ryke mascon also lorde beauteu lorde uyllers lorde tornon sir godfray boloyne sir johan armynacke sir johan uyllemure lorde mo tague lorde talenson sir hugh dolphyn lorde rochfort dyuers incotynent drewe towrayn marchesse berry began make sore warr good countrey poyctou founde well garnysshed men warre bothe knightes squyers ther great aduauntage marchesse towrayne french garysons forteresses sir loyes saynt julyan sir wyllyam bordes carnet breton thre companyons great capitayns men warr dyd feates armes agaynst thenglysshmen ye shall p howe kynge englande sent erle cambridge erle penbroke prince sone howe passed bretayne capitulo cc xlix duke lancastre enheritauce champayn castel betwene troy chalons called beauforte wherof englysshe squyer called purceuaunt damors capitayne whan squier sawe warr open bitwene frenche kynge kyng englande tourned hymselfe became frenche sware then forth fayth alligeance frenche kyng greatly rewarded hym left hym styll capitayne castell accompanyed another squier champayne called yuan ii great companyons gether dyd many feates gether agaynst englisshemen also chanoyn robersart always ben good frencheman al renewyng warr became englissh dyd fayth homage kyng englande ryght gladde seruice thus knyghtes squiers turned theyr copy partes duke anion procured companyos gascoyn ser perducas dalbreth lyttell mechin bourg bertueil aymon dortingue peter sauoy raff bray nandon pan became freche wherof englisshmen sore displeased theyr stregth dayly lassed nadon bagerant bourg lespare burg camus ser robert briquet robert thin john trenelle gailard dela mote aymery rochecho art abode styll good englysshe companyons englisshe gascoyns theyr accorde affinite abode bysshopryke man base normandy taken towne called uire distroyed cou trey thus companyons turned one parte eyther englisshe frenche kynge englande counsayled sende sonne erle cambrydge erle penbroke duchie acquitayne prince certayne nombre men warre named shuld go voyage lorde tarbeston ser brian stapleton sir thomas balestre ser john truues dyuers entred assoone myght see iiii c men armes iiii c archer sayled towarde britayne wynde wyll arryued hauen saynt malo isle whan duke bretayne ser john mountford knew arryued countrey right ioyous sent incontinent knyghtes receyue ser john laigingay ser john augustin comynge erle cambridge erle penbroke right ioyous knewe nat whether lordes knyghtes good townes bretayne wold suffre passe coutrey nat sayd lordes england desyred duke myght passe duke fauorable englisshemen loth displease acorded theyr request shulde passe countrey payeng shulde take without riot grudge erle cambridge erle penbroke theyr company drew companyons castell gontierland towne uire toke forth passed ryuer oire bridge nates without doyng hurt ye coutrey season sit hugh caurell great nombre companyons march arragon newly come spaigne soone knewe frenchemen made warre prince company passed fo arragon entred bigore came prince cite angolesme prince made great chere gladde hym kept hym styll tyll companion come normandy hadde solde theyr fortress come hym soone wer come angolesme ye prince ordeyned ser hugh caurel theyr capitayn nombre ii thousande fightyngemen prince sende landes erle armynack lorde dalbreth burne exile countrey made great warre dyd moche great domage countrey p howe erle cambridge erle penbroke arryued angolesine howe prince sent ouerrenne countye piergourt cap cc l erle cambridge erle penbroke arryued saynt malo ye haue harde taried tyll theyr company past agrement duke bretayne whan well refresshed leaue departe went nantes duke receyued right honorably taried hym iii dayes refresshed people fourth day passed ouer great ryuer loyre bridge nantes rode longe iorneis yt came angolesme foud prince princesse prince right ioyous comyng brother erle cambridge erle penbroke demaunded kynge father quene mother bretherne dyd whan taryed iii dayes prince sente make iourney countie piergourt ii lord theyr company made redy toke leaue prince went forth goodly array wer iii fyghtyng men helpe dyuers knyghtes squters poictou xainton lymo syn quercy rouergue lordes entred coutie piergourt dyd many great domag whan burned ouerran parte coutrey went layd siege fortresse called bourdeill ii squiers bretherne capitaynes within called erualdon bernardyn batefoll beside countie diuers good capitaynes whiche erle piergourt sende thether kepe garisons fortress whiche right well prouyded fore artillarie vitailes thynges necessarie maynteyne kepe place long space also within good wyll thus durynge siege bourdeill many feat armes many saute many reculyng many skrymysshe nere hande dayly ii squiers within right hardy prowde loued lytell englisshe men came oft tymes barrier skrymysshedde without day wanne day loste aduentures warre often tymes falleth nowe vp nowe downe syde march aniou towrayne fyghtynge men well frenchemen breton bourgonyons pycardes norman angeuyns dyd aften tymes great domage princis lande ouer whome capitaynes syr john de belle sir wylliam bourdes ser loys saynt julian carnet breton agaynste men warr fronters poictou xainton dyuers knyghtes princis specially sir symon burle ser dangouse nat iiii part men frenchemen frenchemen thousand fightyng men mo englisshemen past nat two thre hu dred prince sent great nombre iiii army mo taban v hundred ser john chados copanions landes erle armynacke lorde dalbreth also great company ser hugh caurell greattest company brother therle cabridge siege bourdeil wherfore fewe agaynst frechemen poictou howe acquited themselfe right nobly dyd theyr deuour kepe fronters garisons neuer refused fight skrymysshe frechemen thoughe nothynge lyke nombre day frenchemen certayne knowlege englysshemen brode feldes wherof right ioy full layde selfe busshement englisshemen shulde returne co myng fro enterprise done bytwene mirebel lusignen broken way frenchemen came nobre v c ser john de bueil ser wyllyam de bourdes ser loys saynt julian carnet breto capitayns company sore fight many man reuersed erth englisshemen right hardely fought valiantly defe ded selfe long myght endure ser symon burle ser angouse proued day noble knyghtes howe finally auayled nothyng hadful regard frenche partye discomfitted per force caused flee ser angouse saued hym selfe well myght entred ye castell lusignen ser symo burle sore pursewed taken prisoner companye eyther taken slayne fewe skaped fre chemen returned theyr garisons right ioyous theyr aduenture lyke wyse frenche kynge whan herd therof prince rightsore displeased sorowefull takynge ser symon burle loued entierly good reason cause euer ben right noble coragious knyght alwayes right valyantly borne hym selfe susteynynge kynge englandes parte al companyons slayne taken skrymysshe wherof ye prince al parte right sorowfull whiche meruayle comonly sayde one worthe c c nat worthe one truely sometyme fortuneth one man hole countrey saued wytte prowes nother hole countrey lo thus fortune chaunces world ofte tymes falleth p howe sir john chados toke tarriers howe erle piergourt dyuers othe knyghtes besieged riamulle quercy ca cc li thys aduenture thus fell bitwene mirebel lusigne ye haue herd englissheme theyr companyons rode wiselier together nowe letvs speke ser john chandos ser guysshard dangle copanies motaban vii leages tholouse made many horrible enterpryses whan sawe layne longe space thought nat enployed well season except kepyng froters therfore determined go lay siege tarriers tholousayn prepared thyng redy departed fro mo taban went tarriers besieged rounde perceyued well howe coude nat geat noassaute none wayes ease without mynynge sette theyr mynours warke atcheued theyr warke well day toke entred ye towne within slayne towne robbed spoyled iourney thought haue taken another towne iii leages tholouse called lauall layde busshement wodde xl couertly armed vnder ha byte villaynes countrey goyng towne disceyued villayne boye foote theyr company discouered theyr enterprise fayled entet returned agayne mo taban season abrode feldes erle piergourt therle comynges erle lisle uicount carmayn uicount brunikel uicount lautre ser bertram tharide lorde de la barde lorde pincornet ser perducas dalbreth bourge lespare bourge bertueill ayemon dortingue jaquet de bray perrot sauoy arnolde pan nombre x entred quercy comaundement duke aniou cite tholouse brought lande great tribulacion brent exyled cou trey came riamulle quercy besieged towne seneschall quercy well prouyded towne maner thynges therin many good englisshe men whiche wold nat yelde vp ye towne dye therfor ye towne wolde gladly haue gyuen vp lordes knyghtes france sent iiii great engins cite tholouse whan come dressed reised vp caste nyght day stone great peces tymber ye fortresse besyde set mynours warke made theyr boste wynne towne breuely alwayes englysshemen within lyke noble valiant men comforted eche set lytell theyr mynynge p howe archebysshopp tholouse conuerted frenche kynge prayer request citie caoure dyuerse townes howe duke guerles duke julliers defied french kynge cap cc lii meane season whyle frenche knyghtes thus quercy march lymosyn auuergne duke betrey auuergne great nombre menne warre syr john armynac hys vncle lorde john uillemur roger beaufort lorde beauiew lorde uillers lorde sergnac lorde calecon ser griffith motague sir hugh dolphin great nombre good knyghtes squiers ouerran march rouergue quercy lymosyn dyd great domage enpouerysshed greately countrey nothynge helde agaynste meanes duke berrey archebysshop departed tholouse right good clerke went caours wher brother bysshopp preched publysshed suche wise frenche kyngis quarell meanes citie caours turned frenche sware faythe homage thence forthe frenche kynge sayd archebisshop rode forth preched declared frenche kynges right title quarell suche wise al countrey became frenche caused turne mo lx townes city castelles fortress helpe ayde duke berreys company men warr syr john armi nake rode abrode coutrey caused turne frenche sigac gaignac capedonac diuers good townes strong castelles preched frenche kynge great ryght iuste cause quarell people harde hym beleued hym also naturally ye people myndes rather frenche englisshe ye whiche helped moche matter lyke maner archebysshop went aboute prechynge shewyng right quarel frenche kyng bondes lymitacions languedoc pycardy dyuerse prelate clerkes well sufficietly dyd deuours shewe preche sayd quarel frenche kynge comon people cyties good townes specially sir wyllia ormans preched sayd quarel fro cite citie fro towne towne wysely notably harde hym lent selfe opinion busynesse realme hym wordes coloured marnayle speke therof besyde frenche kyng hym selfe moued deuocion caused made contynual procession clergie hym selfe quene wolde go bare foote requyrynge besechynge god deuoutely assist mainteyne ye right realme france whiche hath ben season great tribulacion also kynge caused subiectes constreynte prelate lyke maner dyd kynge englad realme bysshop tyme london made many prechynges declaracions shewyng people fre che kynge great wronge hadde renewed warre dyd agayngste ryght good reason proued diuers artycles poyntes openely shewed saye trouth necessite kyng syth determyned make warre shewe people ordre cause quarelles myght better wyls helpe ayde theyr lordes whiche awakened one realme kynge englande sent brabant haynault knowe myght geat ayde desired duke aulbert rule gouernance countie heynault tyme wolde open cou trey suffre hym go come abide nede waye passe realme france army duke aulbert requeste kynge englad vncle desyre ye quene aute lyghtly condyscended theyr desyres ayde good mocyon edwarde duke guerles kynge englandes parte wedded duke doughter duke julyers cousyn germayne two tyme faythe homage boude kyng englade desyred shulde retaygne eche nombre thousande speares coste charge wherfore ii lordes aduysed well shulde good kynge englande geatte alied hym duke aulbert sore tempted therto great gyftes kynge englande promysed hym suche knyghtes hadde sente vnto hym whan lorde comynges freche kynge herde therof returned heynaulte counsayle lorde john werthyn neschall heynaulte countrey moste gouerned wyse valiant knyght good freche hart well beloued ye duke duchesse brake purpose englisshe messa gers helpe therle bloys ser john bloys brother lorde ligny lorde barbason duke countrey abode neuter held none partes answere made jane duchesse brabant kynge charles frace sage wyse subtyle wrought treatie iii yere knewe well good frendes heynault brabant specially parte cousailours ye great lordes colour make warr seme ye fayrer copied diuers letter touchyng peace confirmed calays ther closed substance dede thynge kynge englande childre sworne kepe article letter sealed submytted make renuciacions resityng suche comyssions ought haue delyuered theyr people al article poynt made thyng hym quarell condempnynge englisshemens deades letter kynge caused publysshed courtes great lordes entent shulde better enformed quarel inlyke wyse opposit dede kynge england shewed quarel almaygne place thought haue ayde duke guerles nephewe kynge englande sonne suster duke juliers cosyn germayne child tyme good true englysshe great dispight defiaunce frenche kynge made ye kyng englade done varlet myndes greately blamynge frenche kynge counsaile doyng sayd warre bitwene great princis fre che kynge kynge englande ought publysshed defied notable sone prelate bysshops abbottes sayeng howe frenche men dyd great presumpcyon pryde wherfore sayd wolde send defye freche kyng notably dyd dyuerse knyghtes almayne entet shortly entre fraunce suche dedes armes remembrauce therof shulde seen knowen xx yere howe dyd nothynge purpose broken another way thought ye shall historie p duke bourgoyn maryed doughter erle flaunders cap cc liii haue harde howe ye space v yere gether ye kyng eng made moche purchase haue doughter therle fla ders haue ben maried son edmond erle cambridge deuises ordenances longe reherse wherfore wyll passe ouer breuely kynge england coude maner geat pope urban consent gyue dispensacion mary erle fraunders sued vnto fro partes specially frenche kyng brother duke bourgoyn wha sawe maryage wolde nat take england howe tyme doughter maryed mo child thought yoge duke bourgoyn mete mariage sent certayne messangers england treate kyng acquitaunce messangers dyd well deuour kynge englande thought none euyl quited erle flaunders couenauntes touchynge ye mariage doughter messangers returned bruges shewed erle lorde howe spedde wher ryght ioyfull nat longe mariage duke bourgoyn erles doughter driue agreed shewed mariage erle flaunders fyfty thousande frankes towne doway lisle delyuered gage money yt frenche kynge gaue thys maryage erle flaunders toke possessyon therin dyd putte people two townes attributed flauders reason gage shewed say anone composicion proceded mariage whiche done confirmed towne gaut great feaste solempnyte day ye maryage ther many lordes barones knyghtes specially ye gentyl lorde coucy sent thither frenche kynge euery man greatly feasted great iustes tryumphes euery man wense owne whan kynge englade sawe erle flaunders bycause sayde maryage alyed fraunce wyste suppose whether erle flaunders wolde take parte agaynst hym duke bourgoyne sonne lawe succession shulde heyre disceace ornat also myste nat rou nauntes b twene frenche kynge erle flaunders wherfore kynge englande harder flemmynges bothe lande see came marchandise wherof freche kynge nothynge displeased wolde gladly warre hadde ben open bitwene englisshemen flemynges howe wise men flaunders bourgesses good tow e wyl ye warre comynalte flaunders susteyned rather opinion quarell kynge englande better frenche kynges kynge englande sought frendes party ede hym seynge great warres rebellion dayly rose agaynst hym vnderstode well kyng charles nauarr cosyn base mandy wolde soone agree accord behated frenche kynge bicause certayn landes kept claymed enheritance whiche frenche kyng n ed whiche theyr counsayles ben often tymes guether coulde neuer make agrement bitwene mat er hanged styll eche takyng good hede kynge nauarre fortifyed greatly townes castels constantine countie deureur good townes normandye helde hymselfe ch erburge men warr euery garison hym ser eustace da er court gouernour towne oud passage saynt clement close constantyne whyche perteyned kynge nauarre parcell age called towne carentyn syr ustace chief kynges counsaile kynge englande sent vnto hym also hisman knyght entent shulde knowe kynge nauarres mv de knyght dyd moche kynge nauarre pr uy company entred shyppe called ly came kynge england made hym great feast longe gether fynally concluded soone kynge nauarre returned chierbourge shulde sende defye frenche kynge put al castelles fortress englisshe men whan confyrmed kynge nauarre departed returned agayne normandy towne chierbourge brought thyther certayne knyghtes englande euyllfortune theyr returnynge home ward see mette norman pyrates fiersely assayled farre stronger englisshmen norman conquered slewe wolde nat take one mercy whiche aduenture kynge englande right sore displeased howe coude nat remedy anone kynge nauarre returned chierbourge ser eustace dambreticourt sent prince toke leaue ye kyng nauarr go serue prince whiche kynge gaue hym leaue sore agaynste hysmyll howe ser eustace shewed hym many reasonable cause laste departed toke see arryued company saynt malo rode nauntes passe ryuer loyre agrement duke bretayne stered nat partye syr eustace trauayled longe came poictou came towne angolesme prynce receyued hym great ioy tha anone sente hym syr john chandos captal beu montaban makyng thyr fronter agaynste frenche men thyther syr eustace ryght well come company p howe constable france constable heynaulte reysed army men warre assaile arde howe fortresse reainuille taken englysshemenne slayne cap c c liiii season knyghtes pycardye assembled together go assaute arde sir more fyennes constable france sir john uertyn constable heynau capitaynes companye commaundement frenche kynge assembled guether towne saynt mer thousand spear knyghtes squyers went mostred bastid arde whiche well furnysshed englysshe men frenche men sayde wolde laye ege therto englysshe men thyng abasshed made redy defende theyr fortresse nede daye frenchemen heynowes assembled together felde good array fresshe mauer goodly syght beholde baners standardes wauynge wynde gaue assaute towne nat greatly theyr profyt diuerse sore hurt wounded conquered nothynge shewed syft daye beparted fro arde without doynge great hurte returned euery man home owne howse thus brake vp urney p howe lette v speke farther countreys siege iamuille quercy layde frenchemen xii thousande fyghtyngemen companyons theyr felawes ppe within two dayes iourney lay duke berreys companye syr john armynake syr john uillemure lorde beau ew auuergne bourgoyne well iii thousand whiche redy come siege nede assy te frenchemen syr john chandos captall beufz syr guysshard dangle englysshemen kept fronter montaban knewe well howe frenchemen hadde layde siege reainuille nombre sawe well nat able fyght themnor reyse siege erle cambridge erle penbroke laye siege bourd lf wolde wyse breke vppe siege frenchemen reainuille set myners awarke also hadde engyns dyd caste daye nyght myners caused great payne walle salle wherby towne taken englysshemen within slayne without mercy whiche great pitye forthere many good squyer nacion towne taken tomercy coudicio fro thence forth shulde e good frenchemen newe capitaynes officer kepe towne nede men warre departed went abrode contrey uercy rouergue refresshe lye theyr case companyons went citie caours capitaynes aymon rtingo pecotte sauoye lyttell mechin jaques braye arnolde pan ouerranne distroyed countrey erle pierregourt erle lisle erle comynges u count carmayn lordes returned theyrowne coutreys syr hugh caurell syr robert brequet joh tresnelle lanut nandon bergerat bourge camus bourge bretueil bourge lespare nombre companyons made great warre burned distroyed landes erle armynacke lorde dalbreth p season seneschall rouergue right valyaunt man good englysshe knyght called syr thomas witeualle kepte towne castelle millan dayes iou ney fro montpellier howe countrey aboute hym turned frenche yet kept fortresse yere halfe also fortresse bretayne called wanclere whiche space made many noble issue vnto tyme syr bertram clesquy put hym oute ye shall thys history wayes styll siege endured bourdeilf p seneschal poictou bu ned exyled lande lorde chauuigny toke asaute towne breuse newely turned frenche capitulo c c lv march po tou sir john bue syr wyllyam bourdes ser loys saynt julyan carnet breto ii hundred fightyng men imagined studied night day howe myght geat assaute skaynge wyse townes fortress poictou day gatte slelth skalynge castell called roche posay entre poictou ye riuer creuse two leages fro haye tourayn nere chatellerault riuer cou trey poictou great feare frenchemen layde great garison repayred castell fortyfyed furnysshed artillarie victayles whan tydynges came prince sore displeased coude nat amend sent ser guyssharde dangle ser loys harecourte lorde parteney lorde pinane diuerse beynge montaban ser john chandos shulde come hym purpose sende place accordynge princis comaudment departed fro montaban came angolesme prince incontinent sent poicters kepe citie make fronter agaynst frechemen tyme great baron poictou lorde chauuigny vicount breuse forsoke englysshe parte became frenche towne also furnysshed towne breton men warre went hymselfe fraunce kynge aduenture prince barones poictou sore displeased vicount rochecoart insuspecte enfourmed prince howe wolde turne frenche wherfore prince sent hym shewed hym entent vicount excused hym selfe well myght howe commytted prison abode longe space daunger season great seneschall poictou vnder prince ser james audeley right sage valiant knyght assembled gether great armye baron knyghtes poictou hym syr guysshard dangle ser loys harecourt lorde pons lorde parteney lorde pinane ser geffey dargenton ser maubrun l er lorde tannaybouton ser william moutaudire diuers knightes squiers poictou xii c speares also hym ser band wynsenesch xainton lordes made theyr assembly poicters departed good arraye rode tyll came berrey began burne exile cou trey dyd many great domages went ito tourayn soeuer went coutrey sore turmeted brought great tribulacion strong kepte styll felde last entred lorde chauuignys countrey newly turned frenche parte burned distroyed except fortress day came towne breuse gaue therto assaute whiche endured hole daye day wonne lyttell withdrewe lodged sayde howe wolde nat departso thought well towne preignable rose sprynge day sowned trompett assaute approched towne euery lorde good arraye vnder owne baner whiche saturday fiers assaute within towne defeded selfe wel myght knew wel stode ieody lyues ther done day many noble feat armes englysshe archer shotte holly gether none durst loke loope defede towne finally pure force ye towne wone gate cast downe euer man entred wolde xvi beste yt within taken hanged theyr harneis dispight vicout maister falsely become freche ye towne burned inhabitauntes within loste euer many slayne drowned englysshemen returned poicters refresshe selfe p syr robert canol made maister gouernour princis co panye howe syr perducas dalbreth turned englisshe cap cc lvi sir robert canol bretayne fayre heritage alwayes ben good englisshe loued serued kynge england sone ben dyuers iourneis whan vnderstode fre chemen made prince great warre wolde dysheryte hym hys enherytaunce acquytayne conquerynge wherof hadde sore dyspleased therwith mynde pourposed assemble guether suche people myght go serue prince owne coste charge ymagyned dyd gatte gether frendes nombre lx men armes many archer prepared foure shyppes hauen bretayne called kaouke whan prouysion redy departed deruall drew porte toke see company sayled longe arryued kaye rochell bourgesses rochel made hym good chere agaynst theyr harte howe durstedo none otherwyse founde syr john deureux capitayne rochel vnder prince seneschall syr john chandos sir thomas percy syr roberte canol wel receyued capitayne kept hym good companye taryed ii dayes rode forthe tyll came angolesme prince princesse right gladde comyng made hym suche chere prince made hym mayster chyef soueraygne knyghtes squyers hys courte bycause valoure noble chyualrie commaundynge courte obbey hym theyr soueraygne answerd well content whan hadde ben space fyue dayes euery man redy shulde go hym toke leaue prince departed fro golesme acompanyed prince knyghtes syr richarde pontchardon ser stephyn gosenton syr dagloiret syr noel lorniche sir wyllyam torciel sir hugh hastinges sir john triuet sir thomas spenser sir tancon sir thomas balaster sir nicolas bonde sir wyllyam monke seneschall agenoys sir baudwyn franuille mo thre score knyght lx men armes fyue hundred archer many brigantes hauyng good myudes fynde frenchemen fyghte thus sir robert canol companye rode forthe towarde agen come quercy companyos rode longe came citie agen taryed lytell space refresshe self abyde theyr eunemies season sir robert canoll knowledge howe sir perducas dalbreth capitayne certayne nombre companyons iii c aboute season countrey purchase duke aniou turned frenche sir robert canoll sent certayne herauldes messangers hym gaue hym salue conducte come speke hym feldes certayne place lymytted came hym sir roberte made hym great chere lyttell lyttell fell together talkynge sir robert canol shewed hym howe greatly blame turne hym selfe frenche forsake serue prince well hath honored loued hym tyme paste wherto shuld make loge processe sir robert canol preched moche ser perducas dalbreth turned agayn became englisshe company hym turned companyons gascoynes mo v c wherof duke aniou sore displeased thought lasse surete sayd sir perducas tydynges came citie caours co panios aymon ortigo lytel mechin jaques bray perot sauoy arnolde pan ther kepe garyson whiche tidynges sore troubled myndes considered thought wel garison great feble kepte agaynste puyssaunce englisshe men departed thence gaue vp towne bysshop bourgesses ye went priory called durmel whiche fortified determ ed kepe agaynst theyr ennemyes soone englysshe men knewe ther came thither besieged place made many assaute within well fortified artillary ablementes warre toke litell hurt whan ser john chandos ser thomas phelton captall beufz ser john po mers ser thomas percy ser eustace dambreticourt knyght princis montaban vnderstode ser robert canol besieged fortresse durmell tha determined go thether ther thought enploy well season departed fro montaban mo iii c spear lefte ii c behynde kepe garison capitayns ser aymery charter souldiche lestrade ser bernarde dalbreth lorde geronde aboue sayd lordes rode spedely come siege durmell rode founde way stronge frenche towne called monsac ye kept alonly ye towne knewe nat aduise ye towne sente forthe theyr courrours brought worde agayne towne stroge without siege saute wold nat wone toke counsayle gether se best determined nat beste let theyr enterprise guyng durmell wherfore passed yerly mornynge nat gone leage thence mette certayn men foure somers laden vitayle anone toke rested demauded fro whens came whyther wolde sayd departed tholouse entent go monsac brynge thyther theyr victayle straytlyer examyned state towne people within afrayed feare theyr lyues shewed howe towne lacked victayle nat vitayle nough twone abyde siege space fo e dayes howe neuer ge cylman name man warre within towne saue onely dweller within tha drewe counsayle agayne vtterlye determyned wolde go farther tyll hadde assayed geat sayde towne monsac returned agayne toke ictayle themselfe deliuered horse agayn vitailers badde go seke newe prouisyon wente layde siege monsac harbored themselfe though wolde nat go thence moneth made semblant assaute ye towne next day layde suche artyllarie agaynst walles whan towne sawe afrayed knewe well coude nat longe endure bycause lacke victayle beganne treate englysshe knyghtes fynally knoweledged prince wale theyr lorde kepe holde towne ym euer fro thence forth without fraude gyn myght sytte styll rest nothynge theyrs taken ser john chandos companye requeste towne ordeyned capitayne knyght called syr roberte mytton twenty men armes hym fourty archer costes wage towne rode forthe tyll came durmell ser robert ca companye laye siege eche made great chere feaste token loue laye siege good ordre p howe sir robert canol sir john chandos departed fro durmell without wynnyng wente layde siege garyson dome cap cc lvii siege thus endured durmelle many skrymysshes dedes armes done many good knyghtes men armes without within good men warre well expierte vsed therin orels coude nat haue endured halfe long dyd lay siege without great aduantage worse case within ii cause one rayned day nyght whiche euyl men horse defaute vitayles wist nat eate loffe breade worthe iii olde grotes yet worse sometyme coude geat none money howe often tymes hadde plentye wynes whyche dyd great comforte case fyue wekes finally whan sawe coude wynne nothynge bycause garyson stronge laye great jeopardye disease determyned departe thence dydde drewe castell towne dome whyche stode plentyfull countrey besieged garyson within capitayne lorde gouernour syr robert dome hym cosyn called syr peter sanglette geat fortresse victayle abrode countrey aboute whan englysshemen gascoynes noumbre fyftene houndred men armes two thousande archer brygauntes hadde thus layde siege fortresse assauted place couragiously reised vp dyuerse great engyns dayly ther saute skrymysshes many feates armes acheued whan hadde layen thus siege space fyftene dayes sawe gatte conquered nothynge laye great payne trauayle toke aduise cou saile concluded sende worde angolesme prince certifieng hym theyr estate chandos heraulde comaunded go message dyd moche come prince tha hym small company knyghtes squyers one way warre whan heraulde came prince kneled downe recomended hym ye knyghtes squiers left siege dome ther sagely discretly declared prince state ordynauce siege also delyuered prince letter credence whan prince wel vnderstad matter sayd wolde take aduyse matter caused ye herauld abyde ther v dayes ye vi day delyuered hym letter sealed vnder owne seale sayd departyng chandos recomaunde v al company departed toke way towarde quercy nowe let v speke oste howe dyd mean season thys heraulde wente came theyr message p howe sir robert canol sir john chandos departed fro dome without hurt doyng went toke gauaches rochemandor diuers townes wet newly turned frenche ca cc lviii anone cha do heraulde departed message fro ye oste ser john chandos ser roberte canoll syr thomas phelto ye captall beufz ser james audeley knyghtes squiers went counsayle concluded breke vp siege perceyued well howe coude geat nothyng determined go ye cou trey wynne townes garisons suche newly turned freche exhortyng duke berrey thus knyghtes dislodged departed fro dome went gauaches whiche incontinent yelded vp became englisshe rested iii dayes toke cousayle shuld whan departed went fortresse whiche frenche companyons newely taken called foins soone within fortresse sawe englissheme come suche puisaunce gauaches gyuen vp also yelded vp theyr fortresse became englisshe sware alwayes continue yet wer forsworne ye shal englisshemen passed forth came rochmador garison easely fortified yet thought nat yeld vp fortresse whan englisshemen came towne wel aduised maner within set forth theyr artyllarie gaue assaute good ordre many wer hurt shotte within without whiche assaute endured hole day nyght englisshemen withdrewe theyr lodgynges mynde assayle agayne next day night within toke cousaile together perceyued wel howe sorely assauted mooste wysest sayd howe length coude nat endure taken force shulde dye towne brent spoyled without mercy thynges considered good euyll fell treatie yelde vp englisshemen agreed fro daye forth shulde become englisshe fulfyll made solempne othes beside theyr charge sende theyr town oste xv dayes gether somets vitayles paye vitayle certayn price set amonge thus rochmador abode styll rest englisshemen passed forth towarde uille franche tholosain wastynge distroyenge countrey puttyng pore people great miserie conquerynge townes castels newely turned freche force treatye last came uille franche whiche well purueyed maner vitayle artyllarie al playne coutrey drawe thither besieged ye towne within foure dayes gaue many great assaute werby dyuers hurte bothe within without thynges considered within perceyued well coude nat long endure knewe maner apparant reskewe comyng warde co posicion became englisshe shuld haue domage thus uile frache became englisshe wherof duke aniou lay tholouse sore displeased wha knewe therof coude nat amende tyme sir john chandos left capitayne englisshe knyght called sir robert roux passed forther distroyeng countrey nowe let v returne siege bourdeill erle cambridge erle penbroke perceiuered theyr warre p howe erle cambrydge erle pebroke toke great aduyse garyson bourdeill cap c c lix meane season yt barones knightes englande made iourneys aswell rouergue quercy agenoyse siege al season endured styll garyson bourdeill whiche space xi wekes whiche season many autes skrymysshes feates armes done acheued nygh euery day comoly daily wtin wold come al theyr power barrier theyr wne without gate valiauntly skrymysshe commers bare selfe proprely praysed ooste without thus estate endured great season likelyhod longer done pryde presumpcion hadde nat men owe ryght hardy well fournysshed vitailes artillary oste without beganne ware werie sawe wel howe laye theyr great cooste charge wanne lytell day toke theyr counsayle howe maynteyne theyr siege aproche towne ther cocluded next day mornyng shulde armed kepe selfe lodgynges secretly sende certayne nombre skrymysshe within thought welle within wolde issue accustomed whan fought returne agayne make semblaunt though fledde entent drawe ennemyes fortresse ordeyned haue nombre horseman redye come bitwene towne stop whan wolde returne appoyntment concluded sayenge yf nat meanes shulde nat geat towne easely none wayes nexte mornynge yerly caused theyr people armed sente cc towne skrymysshe whan capitaynes within erualdon bernardya sawe come ryght ioyous armed al theyr company vii score yonge lusty companyons opened theyr gate came barrier encountred theyr ennemies right fyersly laste englysshemen reculed back none whan within saw issued theyr standard said let v auaunce surely oures folowed fiersly fleer fledde fayntely ouerthrowen taken prisoner bicause wolde haue lytel olde sayenge coueteth al leseth companyos folowed farre fro theyr fortresse whan wolde haue returned coude nat ser john mo tague kept busshment v hundred fyghtyng men made knight tyme erle cambridge ther encoutred enemy wha bour deill sawe knewe well foolysshely aduentured selfe drewe gether lyke valiaunt men fought dyd ther feates armes meruaile record helde selfe vndiscomfitted space ii houres styll fyghtynge theyr enemy doynge suche dedes armes yt englysshemen toke great pleasauce theyr valiant dedes syr john montague day good knyght valiant finally bourdeill discomfited slayn taken none skaped englisshe prisoner reskewed agayn erualdon bernardyn batefoll capitaynes taken meane season skrymysshe erle cambridge therle penbroke auauced barrier conquered gate also erle cabridge baner entred forttes thus ye englissemen garison bourdeill caused men towne swere fayth trouth kepe towne ye prince ther made newe capitayne lord mucydent companye lx archer within brake vp theyr armye concluded go angolesme prince knowe pleasure wolde commaund thus siege brake vp bourdeill euery returned nowe let v returne knyghtes england gascoyne rode quercy let v speke chandos herauld newes brought fro prince wale phowe sir robert canoll sir john chandos sir thomas phelton ordred people retourned prince cap cc lx thus forsayd men warr companyes rode march rouergue quercy turned theyr parte townes castels brought countrey great tribulacion chandos herauld came fortres quercy soone sawe ye herauld come made hym great demaunded hym tydynges answered said prince saluted al desired moche se velyucred princis letter toke red wherin founde howe prince wold ser john chandos ser thomas phelton captal beufz shuld returne hym ye cyte angolesme ser robert canoll men copanyons shuld abide styll make warr dyd wha lordes chief al company vnderstode tidynges beholde eche demauded ech best sayd one voyce sir robert canoll ser ye se vnderstand howe lord prince hath sent v hath ordeyned ye shuld abide styl countre chief gouernor al men warr sir sayd lorde prince putteth honor wold s knowe trouth wt wyll nat abide veyt wyl departe determined returne prince knowe pleasure entent playnly thus brake vp great vyage iorney ther departyng sent ser perducas dalbret towne rochemador kepe fronter agaynst frenchemen sayd companios sir ye haue herde howe prince hath sent v yet knowe nat ye caus ther fore shall shew ye shall ye shall assemble toguyder companyes entre marchesse lymosyn auuergne make ther warre wtout warr ye nat lyue sir promyse faithfully ye wynne towne forteresse orcastell wher soeuer yf fortune ye ther besieged wyll confort wyll reyse siege wha herde promyse sayde sir shall best trust yor promyse paraduenture shall haue nede therof thus departed eche fto brake vp iourney lordes wet streight angolesme prince made great chere lytell ther come prince oute countie pyergourt erle cambridge erle penbroke sir johan mountagu pnowe let v speke englysshe companyons departed fro sir john cha do howe perceyuered phowe englysshe companyons toke castell bell perche therin duke burbons mother also toke stroge castell sait seuere berry cap cc lxi among sayd companyos ther thre squiers great capitanes hardy well experte warr specially sautyng scalyng townes forteresses one named ortygo seconde bernarde de wyske thirde de la sale thre thought nat syt ydell dede wherby spoken copany wet lymosyn seneshall gouernoure ther vnder prince sir johan deureux thre forsayd squyers toke aduyse assay get forteresse fraunce knewe well bell perche burbonoyse stronge castell therin dwelled duke burbons mother mother frenche quene vnderstode spyes good lady castell alone without company good watche harde reported howe ye constable castell wolde often tymes ryde take ly tell hede saue kepynge place page duplicate page duplicate copanyons certayne dyde chose slept nat purpose rode day night mornyng came bell perche scaled castell toke good lady within thane sawe well howe forteresse good strong good plentyfull coutre sayd trusted kepe agaynst men also night toke another castell called saynt seuere marchesse lymosyn gaue sir johan deureux tidynges anone knowen france howe bell perche taken thenglysshmen quenes mother within wherof freche kyng sore displeased ye quene duke burbone coulde nat amende tyme season sir loyes sanxere right valyant knight hardy chosen admytted one ye marshal warr france howbeit lyued sir arnolde dandrehen aged brused armes trauayle tyme passed yt coude nat well helpe selfe coulde lengar attende office howbeit wolde ere harnesse tyme nede p nowe let v speke somwhat busynesse picardy assembly made tornehen frenche kyng season somer made great appayrell shyppes vessel porte hareluce entent haue sent army englande well furnysshed good men armes knightes squiers wherof sir philyppe brother duke burbon admytted chefe gouernour thentent haue distroyed englande frenche kyng lay cyite roane better bring purpose euery weke two thre tymes wolde go se shyppes great mynde affection besyde comaundement spredde ouer realme rone ueulguessyn beaumosyne ther came dayly men warr great nombre marueyle regard dayly great pruisyon came yf ben castyle portyngale howebeit lorde clysson one chiefest kynges counsayle acorded nat age discounsayled kyng noble realme fro iourney engla de sayeng howe nat well accustomed make warr thenglysshmen alleged therto dyuers reason knewe codicyons nature englysshmen state englande dyd natwithstadyng coude nat breke ye kyng purpose cousell viage shulde go forward king england son duke lacastre dyuers counsell well enformed army viage frenchman wolde coe make warr owne coutre wherof right ioyouse furnisshed porte passage see agaynst poictou normandy receyue came ye realme englande fully determyned fight wolde come realme kyng england counsayled send son duke lancastre certayne nombre men warr calais kyng himselfe named shulde go son thyder erle salisbury therle warwyke sir water manny lorde rose sir henry percy lorde basset lorde wyllouby lorde dalawar lorde de la poule sir thoms grautsome sir aleyn bourchier sir richard story dyuers v c men armes v c archer cae douer whan shyppes redy passed see arryued strong towne calays ther toke landyng lodged towne season kyng england writen specially desyring sir robrt framur serue hym warres certayne nobre men warr sir robert ben alwayes good englysshe answered said wolde redy whan soeuer pleased kyng england comaund hym assone knewe ye kyng child shulde aryue calys ye felde make warr frace assone herde ye duke lacastre aryued calys somoned company thought wolde serue ayde hym apparelled voyage hastely coude let v retorne ye busynesse poictou p castell roche sur yone rendred thenglysshmen capitayn therof put dethe comaundement duke aniou cap cc lxii le shall knowe deytyng baron knyghtes guyen chandos heraud brought tidynges fro prince went one accorde towne angoleme founde prince receyued ioyounlly lytell retourned erle cambridge therle penbroke ye conquest burdeyll ye haue herde thus lordes made great feast chere togyder whan mette toke cou sayle aduyse toguyder best enploy forthe season remembred howe party aniou fayre castell stronge parteynyng ye duke aniou called roche sur yon determyned go ley siege therto wynne might prepared iourney ther came baron knightes po tou ser james audeley lorde pouns lorde partney sir loys harcourt sir guysshard dangle lorde pynan lorde ta boton sir mabrion lymyers seneshall rochell sir thoms percy whan assembled togyder mo thre thousand speares departed rode long came castell roche sur yone whiche strong well kept well prouyded defence wt men warr purueyance artyllary capitayne ther set duke aniou called sir johan blodeau vnder many good companion cost charge duke aniou sayd lord layd sege roude castell good order made brought thyder fro towne thoars fro cytie poycters dyuers great eugins caused reared vp agaynst castell besyde gonne springals hoost vytayle ynough ther came plentie fro poyctou fro marchesse adioynynge whan sir johan bloudeau sawe howe besiged many good men warr ther nighe baron knyghtes acquitayne perceyued well howe conforte ayde comyng towarde hym fro te began afrayed sawe well lordes ther wold nat departe tyll castell byforce otherwyse erle cambridge company sir johan chandos byuers knyghtes well acquaynted capitayne ben company tyme passed came barryers dyde moche promyse assurance spake hym handeled suche wyse nat subtell howbeit good knight dred vp castell nat rescued space moneth tha haue vi thousande frankes purueyaunces ye castell treaty without abyde styll suertie without makyng warr bothe party duryng terme sayd coposicyon nat rescued within terme aforesayd rendre vp castell treaty thus concluded capitayne within signifyed mater duke aniou french kynge duke berry lordes whome thought ayded thentent might better excused fro blame reproch layd charge sendyng castell fayre stronge right necessary frenche countrey aniou tourayne yet nother rescue confort assone moneth passed expyred englysshe lordes desyred capytayne kepe promyse also delyuered good pledge sayd capitayne sayd company sirssyth frenche kyng duke aniou woll wylfully lese fortresse nat kepe alone without ayded ther yelded vp castell thenglysshmen toke possessyon therof right gladde therof delyuered capitayne vi thousande frankes suche prouisyons within castell copany surely co neyed towne angyers assone come thyder arested gouernour towne put castell prison herd say night put sacke cast ryuer drowned strayte comaudement duke aniou bycause toke golde syluer ye delyerance castell whiche able selfe haue kept ye space yere nede reqred thus theglysshmen possessyon castell roche sur yone aniou ther set great garison repeyred castell sufficiently returned agayne angoleme prince toke leaue departed owne house sir james audeley valyant knight seneshall poictou went lay fot neythe countie fell sicke sore malady yt therby length dyed wherof prince princesse right soroufull lykewise baron knightes poictou obsequy solemply done cytie poicters prince beyng ther personally anone request baron knightes poicton sir john chandos constable aquitayne made seneshall poictou wet say cyte poiters made ten yssues iourneys agaynst frechmen helde shorte durst nat ryde great route copanies season delyuered prison vycont rochchoart whome prince kepte prisone bycause suspect haue tourned frenche request frendes poictou suche aboute prince prince delyuered gaue agayne landes assoone vycount delyuered prisone went priuely parys frenche kynge tourned became frenche retourned owne lande without knolege parys set thybault du pont breton forteresse contynent sent defyed prince wale made great warre p nowe lette v somwhat speke duke lacastre p howe duke burgoyne deted fro cyte roane thentent fight duke lancastre howe lodged eche agaynst tornehen cap cc lxiii whan duke lancastre come calays ye haue herde well refresshed people ther thought nat lye ther ydelnesse rather dedes armes france intent departed fro calays day thre hudred speares many archer passed besyde guynes rode long tyll passed ryuer ostre ther spred abrode countre toke way towarde abbey lynques ther toke great pray ledde calys another day toke another way went towardes boloyne dyde great domage playne countre tyme therle guy saynt poule sir galeran sofie certayne nobre men warr lay cytie turwyn yssued nat herde theglisshmen rode abrode cou tre thought selfe nat able fight kepe felde agaynst none tidynges came frenche kyng lay roane made great asse ble ye haue herde howe duke lancastre come calais howe dayly men made rodes yssues france whan frenche kyng herde yt bothe counsayle newe ymaginacions weke determyned duke burgoyne shulde haue taken see haue gone england kyng cousayle debated best yt case go fight thenglysshmen yt syde see el kepe forthe iorney england ther fermely cocluded yt euery man shulde dysloge make redy go towarde calays duke burgoyne first purpose broken determyned go fight thenglysshemen yt syde see wherof euery man glad aparelled theselfe duke burgone deted copany toke way passe ryuer abuyle dyde moche iourneys came muttrell hedyn saynt poule ther frech men abode eche shewed duke lancastre frechmen aproched nere fight wherof glad yssued calais intent toke felde valey tornehen nat ben ther long gentyll knight ser robert namur came thyder serue hundred speares well furnysshed whose comyng duke lancastre right ioyfull sayd fayre dere vncle ye right hartely welcome sir shewed v howe duke burgoyne aprocheth sore fight v sir goddes name wolde gladly se thus theglysshme loged vale tornehen fortefyed campe strong hedge dayly ther came prouisyon calais currors ran ouer countie guyens forage vitayls lytell gat playne countre distroyed lost euery thynge fortress came duke burgoyne company lodged hyll tornehen agaynst englysshmen frenchman lodged good order toke great space grounde herde say duke burgoyne ther mo foure thousande knightes consydre resydue nat great nombre thus ech agaynst long space without thyng doynge though duke burgoyne great nobre sawe ther hym good men warr seuyn agaynst one englisshmen yet wolde nat fight without leaue ye kyng brother nat mynde shuld fight yet trouthe yf frenchman set forwarde haue fought englysshmen wolde nat haue refused redy euery daye receyue good order euery man fully determyned shulde dyd yssue bycause fewe bre strog place thought nat departe nysely oute aduantage sundrie tymes dyuers bothe party wolde yssue scrimysshe somtyme wanne somtyme lost chaunce often falleth suche aduentures tyme loyes erle flaunders greatly inclyned honoure profyte sonne duke burgoyne lay season fayre house newly buylded besyde gaunt often harde tidynges duke hym messagers comynge goynge alwayes counsayled duke shulde wyse breke passe ordynaunce kynge brother counsayle p nowe let v leue thus retourne busynesse farther coutreis knightes squyers hadde ynough bycause warres habundant place p howe sir johan chados brought countre aniou great trybulacion howe wasted dystroyed landes bycount rochchoart excepte forteresses cap cc lxiiii meane seasone iorney thus made tornehe ther fell dyuers aduetures poictou whiche ought nat forgotten sir johan chandos seneshall ther lyke hardy valyat knight euer desyringe fynde frenchman fyght assembled togyder poicters certayne nombre men armes sayenge howe wolde ryde aniou retourne agayne towrayne se frenchemen marchesse fronters whiche purpose signifyed therle penbroke lay mortaygne garyson two hundred speares whiche tidynges erle ioyfull well content haue rydden forthe knightes counsayle brake purpose sayde sir ye yet yong noblenesse yet come sir put selfe co pany sir john chandos whatsoeuer ye shall haue brute voyce therof ye shall reputed companyon therfore sir better sythe ye great lorde ye ye enterprise selfe parte let sir johan chandos selfe sythe bacheler regarde estate wordes abated erles desyre therby wyll go forthe ser johan chandos made excuse hym howebeit sir john chandos wolde nat breke purpose goyng forth enterprice made assemble poicters deted thre hundred speares knyghtes squyers two hundred archer hym sir thomas percy sir stephyn gosenton sir richarde pountchardon sir eustace dabretycourt sir richard tecon ser thoms spens sir nowell lornysshe sir dangoses sir thomas balastre sir johan tryuell sir wyllm mountendre sir wyllm manbrius lymers sir geffray dargeton dyuers men armes archer rode forthe good ordynaunce passed poitou entred aniou sent forthe currours bren exyle ye playne countrey dyde many yuels good plentyfull countrey aniowe none came fight taryed ther space xv dayes specially plentyfull co called londonoys cetourned agayne bytwene aniou tourayn long ryuer creuse entred lande vycont roche choart brent wasted countre left nothyng abrode without fortresse came towne roch choart assay ed right valyantly howbeit wanne nothyng ther towne well fortifyed good men warr thybault pont lyon talay capitayns within ye towne thenglysshmen passed forthe sir johan chandos knowledge howe marshall frace sir loyes sanxere great nombre men warr hay tourayne tha great desyre go thy sent worde therof therle pebroke de syringe go hym hay tourayne mete hym casteleraulte chandos heraude wente message founde therle mortayne redy assembled certayne nombre tent make iourney enemyes erle made excuse counsayle knightes sayeng might nat coe sir john chandos tyme heraude retourned foude maister casteleraut shewed hym answere fro therle pe broke whan sir john chados herde nat well content mynde ceyued well howe therle left enterprice presumpcion pride sayde well goddes name gaue leaue moost parte company departe went agayne cytie poicters p howe sir loyes sanxere cae therle penbroke slewe diuers people besieged erle house cap cc lxv nowe let v shewe therle john pe broke dyde assone knewe sir johan chandos gone backe agayne poycters gyuen leue men departe erle prepared ryde forthe hym thre hudred speares englysshe po ctenyns departed fro mortaygne ther certayne knightes squyers poictou xaynton england ben sir johan chandos came erle penbroke went forth company rode forthe passed poyctou toke waye sir johan chandos taken entred aniou brent exyled countre toke lefte taryed certayne space countre lodo noyse tooke way lande vycont roche choart wher dyde great domage hurt whan frenchman garysons march tourayne aniou poyctou herde two iourneys thus made countrey aniou herde howe pride therle pebroke yonge man disdayned go forthe copany sir john chandos determyned encountre might thinkyng easely disconfyte sir johan chandos assembled togyder secretely certayne nombre euery garyson ther aboute made capitayne sir loys sanxer marshall france secretely night went forthe roche poizay poictou frenche company sir robert sanxere cosyn marshall ser johan uyen sir johan bulle sir wyllyam bordes sir loys saynt julyan carnet breton nombre vii hundred erle penbroke done iourney retournynge entred agayne poyctou made ende brennyng vycont roch hoartes landes company sir bauden fanuyll seneshall xaynton sir thomas percy sir thomas spenser sir dangoses sir johan ornych sir john herpedan sir james surgeres sir johan couson sir thomas saynt albyn sir robert twyforde sir symon ausagre sir john mortayne sir john couchet dyuers thus englysshmen poyctenyns rode forthe dismay herde maner tidynges men warr great pyllage praye entred agayne poyctou day came hye noone village called puiernon toke lodgynge wenyng surety varlett settyng vp horse dressing supper sodenly frechmen well aduysed shulde came towne speares reest cryed cryes lady sanxere marshall fraunce beate downe euery syde englysshmen st etes house noyse gret reysed men vp great affray sodenly taken noyse came therle pe broke sir thoms percy sir thomas fra uyll knightes howe frenchman wer come assayled lordes went lodgynges assembled companyes togyder coulde nat drawe togyder frenchman stronge englysshmen coulde nat endure first brunt ther taken slayne mo sixscore erle hadde remedy withdrawe assone might place templers closed stone walles erle suche entred place resydue taken slayne moost parte harnesse horse loste ther erle penbroke lost baggage richesse whane frenchemen knewe place therof right ioyouse sayeng amonge theym selfe nat scape v oures shall nowe derely abye domag haue done aniou towrayne frenchman drewe place good order redy assayle sawe well place pignable assayled place right fiersly shewed many noble feate armes frenchman good men warr assayled place rounde right valyantly erle thenglysshmen payned themself moche might defende theymselfe stode well hande frenchman hadde certayne scalynge ladder theym aduentured selfe mount vpon walles pauesses theym feare shotte castyng stone whan vp fierse lye receyued knightes squyers speares swerdes handes soo fought frenchman hand hande caused discende downe faster came vp suche archer within shotte fiersly frenchman drue abacke assaut endured tyll night frenchman right wery sore traueyled retrayt reculed backe sayeng hat day tyll nexte mornyng purposed come agayn thassaut thynges cosydred frenchman sayde surely nat long endure ayenst v shall rather famyshe lodged night kept good watch ye place ye may knowe trouhe therle penbroke copany natte well ease sawe well great ieopardy parceyned well howe nat stronge ynough endure many good knightes also artyllary place lon made sembl thought night yf nede whan wa night de red squyer ey great trust depart backe p terne ryde poicters speke sir john chados shewe case wynge also howe yf lyst might come tyme ynough rescue trusted defende place tyll nexte day past noone squyer sawe great dager said wolde gladly message also sayde knewe well way thider mydnight backe posterne toke way whiche thought shulde haue ben xt way howbeit knowledge went night way yt faire day coude get right waye mornynge frenchman armed sowned thassaut sayeng wolde assaut place cole mornyng rather heate day erle penbroke slept lytell night copany fortifyenge walles stone thynges sawe well howe frenchemen ordeyned assayle agayne within frenchemen drewe place good ordre made assaute skalyng ladder mouted vp walles pauesses defend heedes thought great honour soeuer coude mount fyrst howe thenglisshmen nat idle redy defed theselfe el ben taken defe ded selfe merueylously cast downe stone pauesses bassenett ouerthrue slewe hurt dyuers dyde suche dedes armes yt ye neuer herde feble place well defeded fewe people agaynst many good knightes squyers ther assaut endured fro mornyng tyll noone p howe sir johan chandos came socour erle penbroke ca cc lxvi bitwene mornyng ix ye day whan thassaut moste feresest frenchman sore dyspleased theglysshmen endured longe wherfore sent vyllag ther pike matockes breke downe vndermyne wall whiche thyng englysshmen douted moost erle pe broke called squyer hym sayd frende take courser yssue backe posterne shall make waye ryde streight poicters shewe sir john cha do state dangere recomaunde token toke ryng fro fynger delyuered sayd take sir johan chandos rynge knoweth right well squyer tooke enterprice thought shulde great honour might acheue scape speke hym toke rynge mounted inco tynent courser departed preuy way saute endured toke way poycters meane season assaute terryble feyrse frenchman englysshmen defended selfe right valyantly good courage stode theym well hande nowe let v speke first squyer departed fro puirenon hour mydnight night rode way whan mornyng fayre day tha knewe way rode toward potter tyme horse wery howheit came thyder nyne clocke ther alyghted sir johan chandos lodging entred founde masse nd came kneled downe dyde message comaunded sir johan chandos nat content day therle pebroke wolde nat ryde hym ye haue herde wherfore nat lightly enclyned make great hast sayde wyll harde v com thyder tyme ynough masse anone masse table couered redy dyner seruaunt demauded wolde go dyuer sayde yes sythe redy wente hall knightes squyers brought hym water wasshynge came hall seconde squyer fro erle penbroke kneled downe toke rynge purse sayde ryght dere sir erle penbroke recommaundeth token desyreth tely come conforte hym bring hym daunger puyrenon sir johan chandos tooke rynge knewe well sayd coethyder tymes harde yt case ye shewe lette v go dyner sat downe copany eate first course seruedde seconde course eatynge therof sodenly sir johan chandos greatly ymagined mater last cast vp heed sayd company sir erle penbroke noble man great lynage sonne naturall lorde kynge englande hath wedded doughter euery thyng companyon therle cabridge hath requyred come hym besynesse jought consente desyre socour confort may come tymes ther put table fro sayde sir wyll ryde towarde puyrenon wherof people hadde great ioye inco tynent apparelled theym trumpettes sowned euery man mounted horse best might soone herde sir johan chandos wolde rydeto puyre non conforte erle penbroke company besiege euery knight squyer man armes went felde mo two hundred speares alway encreased thus rode forthe toguyder tidynges came frenchemen hadde contynually assawted forteresse mornynge tyll highe noone spyes sayd theym sir aduyse well sir johan chandos deted fro poicters mo tha cc speares comynge hyderwarde great hast hath gret desyre fynde whan sir loyes saxere sir john uyen sir john bulle capitayns herd tidyng wisest among said sir people sore wery traueyled assautyng thenglysshmen bothe ster day day therfore thynke better fayre easely returned saue garde wynninges prisoner haue gote rather abyde aduenture comyng sir johan chandos company fresshe lusty feare may lose shall wyn ye whiche counsayle well beleued behoued nat long tary trupettes wned retrayt company drewe fro assaut assembled togyder trussed vp harnesse cariage retourned toke way poizay erle penbroke company knewe anone therby howe frenchman knowledge comyng sir johan chandos erle sayde sir lette v yssue ryde toward poicters mete dere frende sir johan chandos lepte horsebacke suche horse fote two two horse yssued castell rode towarde poycters nat rydden aleage encountred sir johan chandos company ioyfull metynge sir john chandos sayde sore displeased came nat frenchman departed rode togyder talkynge space thre leages thane toke leaue eche sir johan chandos retourned poitters erle penbroke mortaygne fro whens firste departed marshalles fraunce company returned potzay departed otie euery went owne garison ledde prisoner raunsomed theym courtesly lyke maner acustomed bytwene englysshmen frenchman p nowe lette v retourne assemble tornehen speke ye deth moost gentyll quene moostly detail moost courtesse yt euer quene vdayes whiche fayre lady philyp heynault quene englande irelande p howe quene philyp englande trepassed mortall lyfe thre gyftes desyred kynge husbande dyed cap cc lxvii meane seasone whyle noble men fra ce thus assembled tornehen whome duke burgon chefe souerayne duke lancastre theglisshmen parte fell england heuy case comon howbeit right pyteouse kyng chyldren realme good quene englande many good dedes done tyme many knight socoured ladyes damosel coforted largely depted goodes people naturally loued alwayes nacyon heynaulte countrey wher borne fell sicke castell wyndsore whiche sickenesse contynewed longe remedye dethe good lady whanne knewe parceyued remedy dethe desyred speke kynge husbande whan put bedde right han e toke kynge right hande right sorowfull hert said sir haue peace ioye great prosperyte vsed oure tyme toguyer sir nowe pray departyng ye wyll graut thre desyres kynge tyght sorowfully wepyng sayd madame desyre ye wyll graunt sir sayde requyre firste maner people suche haue dault marchaundyse syde thesee beyond may please pay euery thynge owe theym secondly sir suche ordynauce promyses haue made church well countrey beyonde see wher haue hadde deuocyon maye please accomplysshe full fyll thirdely sir requyre may please take none sepulture whan soeuer shall please god call transytorie lyfe besyde westmynster kynge wepynge sayde madame graunt desyre good lady quene made signe crosse comaunded kyng husbande god yongest sofie thomas besyde anone yelded vp spiryte whiche beleue surely holy angel receyued great ioy vp heuen lyfe dyd neyther thought dede thyng wherby lese soule ferr creature coulde knowe thus good quene englande dyed yere lorde ccc lxix vigyll lady myddes august whose dethe tidynges came tornehen englysshe hoost wherof euery creature sore displeased ryght roufull specially son duke la castre howbeit ther sorowe behoueth length borne forgoten therfore thenglysshmen left nat order remayned long space frechmen certayne knightes squyers france ther dayly sawe enemyes concluded toguyder nexte mornynge go serimysshe englysshmen acorde mo thre hudred knightes squyers uer mandois artois corbois eche gaue warnyng without knowledge marshal ye next mornyng yt day lyght horsbacke redy armed toguyder assembled rode forthe without noyse makyng rode hyll tornchen take aduantage come one corner thenglysshe hoost whiche corner loged sir robert namure company nyght kepte watche mornynge drawen tent set table eate meate armed saue bassenet ye lorde poicten therwith came frenchman syde happe suche kepte watche nat vnarmed fortuned well anone redy defende ennemyes encountred brake way anone tidynges cae sir robert namure howe men fightyng frenchman therwith put table fro hym sayd let v go helpe men incontynent put bassenet heed caused one take baner displayed one sayd sir thynke best ye sent duke lancastre fight nat without hym answered shortly sayd send wyll wyll go nexte way men loue lette folowe therwith went forth glayue hande aprochyng ennemyes lorde poicten sir henry sanxels hym dyuers knightes founde men fightyng frenchman great nombre lykely haue done great enterprice assoone sawe sir robrt namures baner come drewe abacke gyder feared hoost styrred dyuers place sir robertes baner slayne knyght uermandoise called sir robert coloyne great domage right swete courtesse ryght good knight frechmen retourned agayne without doyng feared rather lese wyn sir robert thought nat folowe folisshely assembled men togyder went lodgyng whan sawe frenchman gone p howe duke burgoyne depted fro duke lacastre without batayle howe duke lacastre went calays ca cc lxviii thys
