aduenture ther nothing done ought remembred displeased mochsom party yt long nere togyder fought nat sayde euery day among shall fight whiche day cae neuer sayd duke burgoyne wolde nat breke ordynaunce kynge brother hadde straytely commaunded shulde gyue batayle thenglysshmen euery day messangers bytwene comyng goynge duke burgoyne thane enfourmed ymagyned consydered howe lay great cost charge howe coude lye lengar honour hadde four thousande knyghtes mo sawe well enemyes handfull men nombre nother fought shulde nat wherfore hesent knight ye kyng brother shewyng mynde wolde haue leue fight el departe kyng knewe well duke desyred reason commaundyng sight letter shulde dillodge gyue leaue men warr departe come hymselfe parys sayenge howe wolde go himselfe owne propre sone fight englysshmen whan duke burgoyne herde tidynges gaue knoledge therof secretly greattest host sayeng sir must disloge kyng heth comaunded hour mydnight thyng trussed euery man mou ted horse set fyre logynges whiche tyme sir henry saxels kept watche ser robert namures copany spyed fyre two thre mo sayd hymselfe fere frenchman wyll wake v night semeth dealyng said hym let v go awake lorde robert namure entent frenchman fynde v nat slepe sir henry came lodgynge lorde namur called chaberlayns sayd sir houefull ye wake lorde went bedde syde awoke hym shewed hym mater answered well se shall shortely tidynges call vp folkes let euery man quickely armed dyde also shortly armed whan men assembled togyder caused one take baner went streight duke lancastres tent nere armed warnynge mater anon redy lordes lytell lytell drewe anone aboute euer came raynged batayle fayre softely without noyse light caused archer redy raynged theym suche place thought frenchman shulde coe purpose come fight theym whan stand thus space two house sawe none came great marueyle duke demaunded lordes best hym sayd one thyng sayd another euery man opinyon duke sayd sir water manny sir howe say sir sayd nat tell shulde say sir ye shulde myne opinyon ye shulde ordayne men armes archer maner batayle euer lytell lytell auauce forwarde sir anon wyll day lyght shall se perfitely duke agreed counsayle howe counsayled contrary wyse wolde haue duke remoue fro felde strife togyder certayne space last ordayned certayne sir robert namures company certayne sir ualeran de brome company shulde mount hors backe bycause mete able enterprice xxx best horseman deted rode towarde frenche host agayne ser galtyer manny sayd duke sir neuer beleue without frenchman fledde therfore mount horse company folowe quickely ye shall haue day fayre iourney duke sayde sir haue hytherto alwayes folowed aduyse counsayle euer wyll neuer beleue many valyant men armes noble knightes frenche partie wolde thus shamfully depart parauenture fyers haue made drawe v warde begyle v anon currours wyll come wyll bringe v perfyte knowledge euery thynge thus talkynge currours came sayd purpose sir gaultyer many shewed sene founde sayde howe founde body certayne poore vitaylers suche folowed host sir gaultier manny great honoure opinyon duke lancastre drewe lodgyng vnarmed thought haue gone dyned frenche men lodgynges sauynge fyre smoke made wolde nat suffre nyght went thyder supper lodged night toke ease next mornynge dislodged retourned calays whan duke burgoyne dysloged went day saynt omers lay host deted euery man whyder wolde whiche great payne bringe togyder agayne p weke erle penbroke beynge poyctou great displeasure sir loys sanxere sir johan uyen sir john bulle delt puyernon hath b wed thought reuenged might departed fro mortayne company two hundred speares came angolesme prince made great erle desyred lette haue certayne nobre men haue leaue make iourney sayeng great desyre reuenge dispites frechmen done late price loued hym entierly grauted desyre season ther newly come price fro countie armynake sir hugh caurell brought hym moo fyue hudred men warr companyons prince commaunded hym go erle penbroke iourney also erle desyred sir loys harcourt sir guyssharde dangle sir percyuale coloyne lorde po lorde parteney lorde pynan sir thomas percy sir thomas pontchardon dyuers knightes princ house gladly grauted go hym wha togyder fyue c speres thre hundred archer fyftene hundred men maner brigantes launce pauesses folowynge hoost fote thus therle penbroke deted co pany rodeso long rae aniou began brenne wast distroy countre passed one syde brennynge winnynge townes small holdes raunsomed playne countrey sauyour loyre lodged subbarbes assayled towne coude nat get within sir robert sanxere kepte defended towne coutre aboute brent distroyed hughe caurell company came bridge ryuer loyre called bridge see anone kept disco fyted bridge wonne yed suche wyse kept long also iourney englysshmen toke wanne abbey ryuer loyre called saynt whith newly fortifyed suche wyse made therof great garyson whiche greatly domaged countre wynter somer tyme ther poyctou abbey yet called saynt saluyn euyn leages fro poycters whiche abbey monke gretly hated super abbot shewed well bycause hatred yt betrayed abbot couet meanes delyuered abbey towne sir loys saynt julyan carnet breton toke frenche kynges name repeyred made ther good garysone takyng saynt saluyn sir johan chandos sore displeased bycause sene shall poictou thought hymselfe lyued long get agayne howesoeuer dyde hadde taken shulde repent p nowe let v lytell season leaue spekyng busynesse poictou speke duke lancastre p howe countre uermadoise countie saynt poule wasted sir hugh chastellone taken cap cc lxix whan duke lacastre come agayne calays departyng fro tornehen company refresshed thre dayes thanne thought agayn ryde forth make iourney france two marshal therle warwyke lorde roger beauchampt commaunded euery man drawe felde wherof euery man gladde desyringe ryde fraunce departed fro calays good ordre euery man knewe shulde first day went fyue leages nexte day came saynt omers ther great scrimysshe gate theglysshmen rested nat ther greatly passed went lodged morres hersault thirde day came turwyn within towne therle guy saynt poule great nobre men warr thenglisshmen passed toke way hedyn yt day loged lytell ryuer whan erle saynt poule sawe yt thenglysshmen wet towarde countre knewe well went nat thyder profyte hated hym moche departed night delyuered cyte lorde saynt pye sir johan ray rode tyll cam towne saynt poule nexte mornynge englisshe men came thyther made great skrymysshe commynge thyther erle saynt poule happy towne hym company towne kept saued el ben great adueture lesyng thus duke lancastre companye toke theyr pleasure coutie saynt poule burned exiled playne countrey dyd great domage castell perides lady dowaire duke aduysed castel gauged ye depnesse dyche speare howe assyed nat made good face passed came fayre castell called lucheu whiche perteyned erle saynt poule burned towne dyd nothynge castell passed came saynt require englisshemen rode day nat past iii foure leages euer burned countrey went passed ryuer somme planchesse vnder abbeuille entred countrey uimeu purpose go harfle ryuer seyne burne frenche nauy erle saynt poule ser moreau fiennes constable france great nombre folowed pursued costynge englysshe hust wherfore ye englisshemen durst nat ryde farre abrode high waye euer kepte themselfe close gether redy fight theyr enemy nede thus rode uimeu countie ewe entred archeby sshopryke roan passed depe rode longe came harflewe lodged erle saynt poule gote entred towne ii c speares thus englisshmen laye harflewe assayled nat iiii daye dislodged made theyr retourne lande lorde stouteuille burned vp moost parte countrey came francquesin drewe toward oysemont repasse riuer somme blanchetache season towne abuille capitayne hugh chastellon maister crosbowes france whan perceyued duke lancastre wolde repasse riuer somme armed hym caused x xii company lyke wyse arme mo mouted horse sayeng howe wolde go se kepyng gate rowray thentent thenglisshmen passed shulde nat se well kepte early mornyng great myst tyme sir nicholas louuaing tyme paste ben seneschall poictou yere ser hugh chastellon taken hym prysoner raunsomed hym x frakes stacke sore mynde great desyre entent reuenged geat agayne loste mornynge xx hym departed fro duke lacastres host knewe right wel passage straytes aboute well vsed space ii iii yeres gether thought putte hym selfe auenture busshement bitwene abbeuille castell rouuray passed lyttell streyght way maryse rested hym certayne olde wast broken howses man wolde neuer haue thought company englisshemen wolde haue lyen busshement nere towne thus ser nicholas company kepte selfe preuy last ye waye came ser hugh chastellon x hym armed except bassenet whiche page bare hym great courser passed ouer lyttell ryuer thought haue gone haue spoken crosbowes kepte gate knowe yf harde thyng englisshemen whanne sir nicholas louuayng sawe hym knewe hym wel coude nat haue ben ioyous one gyuen hym xx thousad frankes came busshement sayd company come syrs lustely beholde yonder desire haue maister crosbowes desyre haue hym aboue creature lyuynge set spore horse sydes cowched hys speare reste came towarde sir hugh chastellon sayd yelde chastellon thou arte deed syr hugh great meruayle whens men warre came sodaynly vpon hym leaser put bassenet mount courser wha sawe hard case sayd shuld yelde sir nicholas answered lauuainge syr hugh eschewe ye perel deth sawe wel coude nat flee sayde yelde take sir nicholas sayde come ryde v behold yonder cometh duke lacastre company wyll passe foreby brunt ther slayne valyat burgresse abuyle called laurence dancons great domage thus great fortune sir hugh chastellon maister tyme crosbowes france capitayn abuyle taken sir nicholas louuayne whose takynge duke lancastre right ioyfull englysshmen sir hugh chastellons frendes men towne abuyle right sorie takyng coude nat amend tyme englysshmen passed ryuer blanchtache drue towardes towne rue see syde monstrell dyde somoche iorneys retourned agayne cae towne calays duke lancastre gaue stranger leaue dete deted fro hym sir robert namure sir ualeran borme almayns duke lancastre retourned agayne england thynkyng make warr tyll nexte somer tha saynt martyns day wynter deted sayde stranger howe whan came agayne wolde come moche stronger dyd tyme desyring cosyns duke guerles duke jullyers coe mere go france p nowe let v leue speke besynesse picardy ther nothyng done tie gret season let v speke mater poitou wher moost dedes armes fell p howe sir john chados slayne batayle howe finally frechmen disofyted taken batayle cap cc lxx greatly greued sir john chandos takyng saynt saluyn bycause vnder rule seneshall poyctou set mynde might recouer agayne byforce stelthe cared nat might haue enter dyuers night made sudrie busshmetes aueyled nat sir loyes kept toke euer good hede therto defeded fro dagers knewe well takyng therof greued sore sir johan chandos hert fell night first day january sir johan chandos beyng poycters sent assemble togyder dyuers baron knightes squiers poitou desyring coe hym priuely coude certeyned wolde ryde forthe refused nat desyre loued entyerly shortely assembled togyder cyte poicters thyder came sir guysshard da gle sir loyes harcourt lorde pons lorde partney lorde pynan lorde tanyboton sir geffray dargenton sir maubruny lyniers sir thomas percy sir baudwyn fesuyll sir richarde pontchardon dyuers whan togyder assembled thre hundred speates departed night fro poicters none knewe whyder shulde go except certayne lordes redy scalyng ladder came saynt saluyn ther lighted delyuered horse varlettes whiche mydnight entred dyke yet hadde nat entente shortely sodaynly herde watche horne blowe shall tell wherfor blewe nyght carlonet departed fro roche poisay xl speares hym coe tyme saynt saluyn speke capitayne sir loys saynt julyan thentent haue ryden togyder poictou se coude gette pray called vp watchman whiche made hym sounde horne englysshmen othersyde fortresse herynge watche blowe great noyse place feared lest ben spyed spyes knewe nothyng sayd frenchemen syde haue entred place therfore drue backe agayne dyke sayd let v go hen night haue fayled purpose remouted horse retourned hole togyder chauuigny tyuer cruse two leages then poictenyns demaunded sir john chandos wolde comaunde farther seruyce answered sayd sir retourne home agayne whan please name god day wyll abyde styll towne ther departed knightes poictou england nombre cc speares sir johan chados went house caused made good fyre styll hym sir thomas percy company scneshall rochell sayd sir john chandos sir entent tary day ye truly sir demaude sir cause desyre syth ye wyll nat styre day gyue leue wyll ryde way wt co pany se fynde adueture go yoway sir name god sir johan chandos departed sir thomas percy xxx speares copany passed bridge chauuigny toke longe way ledde poicters sir john chados abode styll behynde full displeasure fayled purpose stode kechyn warmyng fyre seruantes tangeled hym thetent bring melancoly seruant prepared hym place rest hym demaunded nere day ther wt cae man house came hym sayd sir haue brought tidynges tell sir surely frechmen ryding abrode howe knowest thou ser sayd deted fro saynt saluyn waye ryden sir nat tell certentie surely toke high way poiters frechmen canst thou tell sir sir loys saynt julyan carlonet breton well sir johan chandos care nat haue lyst night ryde may happe encoutred thoughe nat ther taryed styll certayne space gret study last whan well aduysed hymselfe sayde whatsoeuer haue sayd trowe good ryde must retourne poicters anone wyll day true ser knight hym said make redy wyll ryde forthe dyd mouted horse deted toke right way poicters costyng ryuer frechmen tyme nat past leag hym way thinkyng passe ryuer bridge lusar ther englysshmen knowlege trake frechmen frechmens horse cryed brayed bycause theglysshe horse sir thomas percy anone fayre light day begynnyng january mornyng soone light whan frechmen breton within leage bridge reyued othersyde bridge sir thoms percy copany lykewise reyued frechmen rode fast might get aduantage bride sayd beholde yonder fre chmen great nombre agaynst v therfore let v take auatage bridge wha sir loys carlonet sawe theglysshmen make suche hast gette bridge dyde lykewyse howbeit theglysshmen gate first lighted fote raynged theselfe good order defende bridge frechmen likewyse lighted fote delyuered horse page comaundynge drawe backe dyde put selfe good order go assayle theglysshmen kept theselfe close togider nothyng afrayed though handfull men regard frechmen thus frechmen bretous stuyed ymagined howe meanes aduantage might assayle englisshmen therwith ther came behynd sir johan chandos baner displayed berynge therin syluer sharpe pyle goules jakes lery valyant man armes dyd bere hym xl speares aproched fiersly frechmen whan thre forlonges fro bridge frenche page sawe comynge afrayed ran away horse left maists ther fote whan sir john chandos come nere sayd harke ye frechmen ye yuell men warr ye ryde youre pleasur ease day night ye take wyn townes foteresses poyctou wherof seneshall ye raunsome poore folke without leaue ye ryde clene armed shulde seme coutre ensure nat ye sir loyes carlonet year great maisters yere half haue sette myne entent fynde encountre nowe thanke god se speke shall sene stronger hath ben shewed often tymes ye haue greatly desyred fynde nowe ye may se john chandos aduyse well great feates armes wherwith ye renowmed goddes leaue shall proue whyle suche langage spoken sir john chandos copany drewe toguyder sir loyes carloner kept selfe close togyder makyng semblat glad fought withall mater sir thomas percy othersyde bridge knewe nothynge bridge hyghe myddes none coude se p whyle sir johan chandos reasoned thus frenchman ther breton toke glayue coude bere le ger cae englysshe squyer called sunekyn dodall strake brest yt cast hym downe fro horse sir john cha do whan herde ye noyse besyde tourned way sawe squyer lye erth frechmen layeng tha chafed tha sayd company sir howe suffre squyer thus slayne fote fote lepte fote company sunekyn rescued batayle begone sir johan chados right hardy coragyous knight baner company cote armes hym great large beten armes whyte sarcenet two pylies goules one behynde semed sufficyent knyght great feate armes one formast glayue hande marched ennemyes mornyng ther fallen great dewe grounde som moyst goyng forwarde stode fell downe ye ioyning enemyes arysing ther light stroke gyuen squier called jakes saynt martyn glayue whiche stroke entred ye flesshe vnder eye bytwene ye nose forheed sir john chandos sawe nat stroke commyng syde blynde ye one eye lost ye sight therof fyue yere hunted hart laundes burdeaur also vyser stroke rude entred brayne whiche stroke greued sore ouerthrue erthe tourned payne two tymes vp downe wouded dethe stroke neuer spake worde whan men saw mysfortune right dolorouse tha vncle edward clifforde stepte bestrode frechmen wolde fayne haue defended valyantly gaue rounde stokes none durst aproche nere also john chambo sir bertram case semed lyke men mynd whan saw maister lye ye erth breton frechmen gretly coforted whan sawe capitayne enemyes ye erthe thynking verily yt dethes woude auaunced selfe sayd ye englyshmen yelde ye ye canne nat scape v ther englyshmen dyd marueyls armers aswell defende themselfe reueng maister sir john chandos whome sawe lye harde case squyer ser john chandos spyed jaques saynt martyn hadde gyuen maister mortall stroke ran hym fiersly stroke hym suche voylence glayue pearsed bothe thyes howe stroke lefte nat styll fight sir thomas percy copany knowen aduenture othersyde ye brige shulde well haue socoured hi bycause knewe nothyng therof herde frenchman wenyng ben gone backe therfore company departed toke waye poycters knewe nothynge busynesse thus englysshmen fought styll bridge lusac done many feat armes breuely englysshmen coude endure lenger agaynst frechmen moost parte disconfyted taken alwayes edwarde clyfforde wolde nat depte fro nephue lay thus yf frenchman hadde ben happy haue horse ther redy nat page ronne away fro orels might haue departed moche honour profite many gode prisoner lacke lost wherfore sore displeased sayd among selfe yuell order iourney yet faute page nat departe seyng heuy armed sore traueyled canat go fote countre whiche full enemyes contrary v sixe leages fro next forteresse haue also dyuers copany sore hurt may nat leaue theym behynde v thus case wyst nat sent two breton vnarmed feldes se yf might fynde page horse ther came sir guyssharde dangle sir loyes harcourt lorde parteney lorde tanyboton ye lorde dargenton lorde pynan sir jaques surgyers dyuers englysshmen nobre two hudred speares rode seke frenchman shewed howe abrode fell trake horse cae great hast baners penons wauyng wynde assoone breton frenchman sawe comyng knewe well enemy tha sayd englysshmen whome taken prisoner sir beholde yonder cometh bande company socour perceyue well nat endure agaynst yebe prisoner wyll quyte ye wyll kepe v wyll become prisoner rather yeld v tha cometh yonder aunswered ye wyll e content thus englysshmen losed prison poictenyns gascoyns englysshmen came speares restes cryeng cryes frechmen breton drewe syde sayde sir leaue v hurt prisoner redy englysshmen affirmed said prisoner carlonet prisoner sir bertram case sir loyes saynt julyan sir johan cambo none maister uhe barowns knightes poicto sore disconforted whan sawe seneschall sir johan chandos lye erthe coude nat speke lamentably complayned sayd sir johan chandos floure chiualry vnhappely glayue forged thus hath wouded brought parell dethe wept piteously hym herde vnderstode theym well coulde speke worde wronge handes tare heeres made many pytefull complaynt specially suche owne house seruauntes vnarmed layde pauesses bare softely mortymer next forteresse baron knyghtes retourned poycters ledde prisoner vnderstode jaques martyn yt thus hurte sir johan chandos lytell taken hede hurtes dyed poiters noble knight sir johan chandos lyued nat hurte past day nyght dyed god haue mercy soule hundred yere ther nat curtesse fuller noble vertues good condycions amonge englysshmen whan prince pricesse erle cambridge erle pebroke barowns knightes englande suche guyen herd dethe orted sayd lost syde see dethe frendes also enemyes right soroufull englysshmen loued bycause noble nesse founde hym frenchman hated bycause douted hym yet herde dethe greatly complayned among right noble valyant knightes france sayeng great dommage dethe sayd better ben ben taken lyue ben taken lyue sayd sage ymaginatyue wolde haue foude maner good meanes wherby peace might haue ensued bytwene realmes englande fraunce welbeloued kyng englande kyng wolde beleue rather worlde thus bothefrenche englysshe spake dethe specially englysshmen hym guyen kept recouered p howe lorde coucy lorde pomyers wolde nat entre warre nother one part howe lorde maleuall lorde marneyle tourned frenche cap cc lxxi dethe sir johan chandos sir thomas percy made seneschall poictou fell lande saynt sauiour vycount fell kynge englandes andes gyue wher shuld please g e knyght called sir alayne bourchier experte man armes sit johan chandos whiche yerely uenewes somme four hundred thousande frankes prince successessour heyre neuer maryed none heyres within certayne space suche hadde ben taken bridge lusac put fynance rausome payed ayde helpe frenche kynge retourned agayne garysons sir loyes saynt julyan carlonet breton sir wyllyam bourdes season ther knyghtes france fore troubled mynd bycause sawe thus nightly dayly warre multiply bytwene two kynges france englande specially lorde concy touched gretly fayre enherytance englande aswell hym selfe wyfe doughter kynge englande whiche lande must renounce wolde serue frenche kynge whose blode nacyon determyned selfe dissemble bothe kyng forget tyme thought departe realme france season go sporte otherplace ordered departure sagely toke leaue frenche kyng small co pany departed rode sauoy honorably receyued erle baron knightes countre whan ther long pleased hym departed passed forthe lombardy came lordes myllayne lorde galea lorde barnabo begynning right welcome lyke maner departed duchy acatayne sir aymon pomyers knight price sayeng howe long warr dyde endure wolde nat beare armes nother one parte knyght went cypre holy sepulcre dyuers pylgrimages also season newly come parys sir johan burbone helde parte lande prince frenche kynge wolde gladly haue hym renounce homage prince become frenche erle wyse wolde lyke maner wolde lorde pyerbuffier another baneret lymosyn also parys two great baron lymosyn sir loyes maleuall sir raymon marneyle nephue also ye season parys forsoke prince became freche garysons made gret warre prince wherof kynge englande counsayle sore displeased also dyuers barones guyen became frenche without constraynt owne wylles kyng englande counsayled shulde write couert letter sealed seale borne two thre knightes poictou acquitayne ther publysshe theym cyties castels good townes season delyuered prison dagen sir camponell camponall excha ge another knight prince ben taken scrimysshe pyergourt called ser thomas balaster clerke yt said knight remayned styll prison dagen sir camponell returned frace pnowe lette v speke letter sent acquitayne kyng englande tenour wherof herafter foloweth pthe copy letter sent kyng englande acquitayne howe chasteleraut taken bell perche besieged frenchemen cap cc lxxii edwarde grace god kynge england lorde irelande acquitayne present writynge shall se reed knowe consyderyng regardyng busyness sayd march lymitacions seignorie acquitayne stretchynge fro heed heed haue ben enformed certayn trouble greffes vexacyons done thought bedone right dere son prince wale say de countreis whiche bounde withstande remedy thynges touchynge hate yuell wylles bytwene v true frendes subgettes therfore presentes anouce pronouce certify ratify good wyll great delyberacyon counsayle therto called woll dere sonne ye prince wale forbere leaue maner accyons done bedone restore agayne suche hath ben greued oppressed hym subgettes offycers acqtayne costes spences domag leuyed leuyed ye name ye sayd aydes fo wage true subgettes frendes aswell prelate men holy church vnyuersiteis collage bysshops erles vycontes baron knightes comynalties men cyties good townes tourned kepe holde false informacion symple aduyse opinyon aduersary french kyng pardon trespas sight letter retourne agayne v within moneth desyre true frendes kepe selfe styll state nowe saue faythes homag nat reproched whiche thyng shulde greatly displease v lothe wolde se vpon dere sone prince men make laufull coplaynt thyng greued oppressed haue ben tyme past shall cause haue amendes suche wyse reason shall suffice entent norisshe peace loue concorde vnite bytwene v march ly mytacions aforesayd bycause euery man shulde repute mynde wyll trouthe wyll euery man take haue copy presentes whiche haue solemply sworne kepe maynteyne nat breke precyous body jesu christ present right dere sonne johan duke lancastre wyllm erle salysbury erle warwyke therle hertforde gaultier manny lorde percy lorde neuyll lorde bourchier lorde stafforde richard pebroke roger beauchap guy brian lorde e lorde dalawar alayne boncquesell richard stry knight gyuen palys westm ye yere reigne xliiii v day nouembre letter brought fro kyng englande principalyte duchy acqtayne notifyed publysshed copyes sent secretly parys vycont rochchoart lorde leuall lorde marneyle suche turned frenche nowbeit letter thus sent publysshed countrey acqtayne herde nat left lyst nat standyng dayly turned frenche te assone sir loys saynt julyan retourned roche poy say sir wyllm bordes garison hay tourayn carlon et saynt saluyn secretly made forthe iorney armes hardy copanyons well mounted mornyng came chasteleraut scaled towne nerehand taken sir loys harcourt lay bed slepe logyng towne ry fayne flye sherte barefote barelegged fro house house fro garden garden great dout feare takyng frenchman scaled fortresse ferr sledde cae put selfe vnder bridge chasteleraut whiche men fortifyed ther saued selfe kept selfe long space thus breton frenchman maisters ye towne ther made good garison made carlonet capitayn dayly breton frenchman went bridge fought scrimysshed kepte duke loyes burbon sawe well englysshmen companyons countre burbonoise howe drtygo bernard de wyst bernard de la sale helde castell bell perche good lady mother wtin wherof great displeasur aduysed hi make iourney go lay siege bell percly nat dete then tyll wonne whiche enterprice desyred freche kynge gyue leaue whiche kynge lightly agreed vnto sayeng howe wolde helpe maynteyne siege thus departed fro parys made assemble molyns auuerne saynt porcyns great nombre men warre lorde beauieu came serue hym thre hundred speares ye lorde uyllers rosellon hundred speares dyuers barowns knightes auuergne forestes wher lorde right wyfe doughter gentyll lorde berault erle dolphyn thus duke went layd siege bell perche made great bastyd n dayly drawe vnder couert dayly scrimysshed within also duke ther four great engins cast night day great stone toopes towres house beaten downe great parte towres wherof duke mother prisoner within gret feare sent messangers duke sonne desyringe hym cease assantes thengins sore feared troubled duke burbone knewe well request desyre done meanes ennemyes aunswered wyse wolde cease forbere soeuer fell whan within sawe howe sore oppressed howe strength ye frenchemen daylye multiplyed theym newly come sir loyes sanrer marshall fraunce great plenty men warre determyned gyue knowledge poore estate sir johan deureux seneshall lymosyn lay soubterayne two lytell tourney fro certifye howe lordes poictou gascoyne whan departed fro iourney quercy promysed faythes toke fortresse france besieged howe shulde comforted thus incotynent wrote letter secretly night sent varlet ye forteresse sir john deureur whan messager came remembred well mater suche token shewed hym whan reed letter sayd wolde gladly ayde helpe rather sped sayd wolde go selfe angolesme prince lordes ther trustyng enduse bell perche shulde conforted delyuered parell departed fro fortresse rode longe came angolesme wher founde prince erle cambridge therle pe broke sir john montagu sir robert canoll sir thomas percy sir thomas phelton sir guyssharde dangle captal beufz dyuers ther sagely shewed howe companyons besieged castell bell perche duke burbon erle saynt poule frenchman whiche wordes ye lordes gaue good heryng sayd howe gladly wolde cofort acordyng promysed enter price chefe erle cambridge erle penbroke incontynent prince sent comaundement subgettes sight letts shulde hast drawe towne lymoges thyderwarde auaunsed knightes squyers co panyons men armes cam thyder commaunded whan assembled mo xv c speares thre thousande men warr quickely passed cae bell perche lay othersyde towne agaynst frenchman lay kepte styll bastyde whiche stronge aswell fortified aswell enuyroned towne thenglisshe forager wyst nat whyder resorte forage howbeit vitayls brought fro poyctou whan might conuey sir loys sanxere marshall france signifyed state thenglysshmen parys ye kyng knightes ther made writynges seadules set vp pale place sayeng thus among knightes squyers desyring fynde dedes armes certifye trouthe erle ca bridge therle penbroke copany ar come bell perche thentent reyse siege ther layd men ther longe hath endured payne haue costreyned within forteresse pure necessyte must yelde vp el fyght v byforce armes therfore come thyder hastely ther shall ye fynde noble dedes armes certaynly theglysshmen lye small order ar suche place might soone haue great domage thus exortacion marshall dyuers good knyghtes realme fraunce auaunsed part howe beit knewe well gouernour bloyes allart toustayne l speares came thyder dyd therle porcyen sir hugh porcien brother p howe therle cabridge erle penbroke ledde way fro garyson bell perche duke burbons mother within cap cc lxxiii whan erle cabridge erle penbroke ben thus ye fre chmen space xv dayes saw howe wolde nat yssue bastyde fight toke cousayle aduyse sende heraulde knowe wolde sent chandos heraude message shuld say went said sir lordes maysters hath sent wolde ye knowe yt gretly marueyled sythe ye haue perfyte know lede haue ben space fyftene dayes yet ye wolde nat yssue strayte fight therfore send worde ye wyll coe towarde wyll suffre take plot groude fight let haue vyctorie god wyll sende vnto duke burbon sayd chados shall say maisters yt wyll nat fight wylles apoyntment knowe well yonder wyll nat departe hen breke vp siege tyll haue wonne castell bell perche sir heraude shall shewe pleasure departed heraud retourned maisters shewed answere whiche nothyng pleasant went counsayle sayd agayne chandos go agayne yonder lordes shewe wyse declared hym message went whan came sayd lordes maisters lordes sendeth worde sithe ye wyll nat fight surely purpose iii day hen houre ix noone sette horsebacke lady burbone conuey awaye syght lorde burbone sonne sir bydde rescue ye well duke se lady mother ledde away shalbe right displeasant beit trust haue agayne whan may sir heraud syth ye haue sayde mocheto v say agayne maisters wyll put ye felde afyftie company shall put many take vyctorie may get sir heraude shall shewe ye haue sayd therwith chados departed came agayne therle cambridge lordes shewyng duke burbons answere also demaunde howe beit thought nat soo ordayned departe then lede lady burbon within teresse ben sore traueyled engens hoost p howe duke burbone gaue leaue men whan knewe good lady mother ledde away cap cc lxxiiii whan day cae set mornyng sowned trupettes armed company drewe felde good aray batayle fote horsebacke redy fight baners sta dardes houre ix mynstrels blewe vp highe voyded castell bell preche maner men lady burbone mouted rey well dressed ladyes damosel englysshmen departed aboute noone lady awayted sir eustace dabreticourt sir john deureux drewe principalyte lady prisoner certayne space among companyons roche ua cloyre limosyn takyng pri ce neuer well content whan soeuer case spoken sayd yt men taken besyde copanyons wolde incontynent haue caused haue ben delyuered without delay whan companyons spoken vnto delyuerance sayd soeuer bargayne made wold haue knight agayne sir symon burle prisoner among frenchman nat douted duke burbone sore dyspleased englysshmen ledde away mother anon departed sent take possession castell bell perche owne whiche englysshmen lefte clene voyde duke repayred newe fortefied castell made stroger thus brake vp great iourney euery man went owne frechmen ben ther duke burbone went agayne owne garysons duke retourned knightes squyers france kyng made great chere gladde comyng therle pebroke company went towne mortaygne poictou men armes companyons retourned poytou xaynton serched coutre get lyueng dyd many villayne dedes coulde nat absteyne selfe fro doyng yuell anone departed fro prince sir robert canoll went bretayne castell doruall nat ben ther past moneth king englande sent hym incontynent without delay excusacions layd te shuld passe see came englande speke whiche comaudement wolde nat breke aparelled selfe toke see arryued cornwall saynt myghels mount rode longe came wyndsore founde kyng great ioye comyng baron realme cause thought shulde haue nede hym good capitayne leader men p howe duke aniou came fro tholous parys howe kyng charles sent duke berry brother acqtayne agaynst englysshmen cap cc lxxv season duke aniou deted fro tholous rode great array realm france cae cyte parys founde kyng brother duke berry duke burgoyne bretherne receyued ioyoully bytwene foure bretherne whyle laye parys dyuers counsayls togyder state busynesse realme france se warre shulde make howe maynteyne somer folowynge fully purposed ordayned shulde make two great armyes iorneys acqtayne wherof duke aniou copany shulde gouerne one entre guyen ryall bergerath duke berry shulde gouerne army entre lymoges quercy bothe armyes mete towne angolesme besiege prince within also concluded great delyberacion cousell send ser bertram clesquy valy knight oft valy antly hath fought sauegard crowne frace desyre take costable france whan ye king bretherne fully determyned cou sell sported space tyll begynnig moneth may duke aniou toke leue thinking first returne owne countre bycause longest iorney deted first coueyed baron knight frace bycause welbeloued long duke rode yt came moutpellyer ther taryed moneth went tholous assembled togyder men warr wher might get ther many yt kept feldes kept fronter agaynst theglyshmen n rouergne quercy lytell mechyn nandon pauns perot sauoy bourge camus antony lenegre lamyt james bray great nobre season caours done moche hurt coutre duke berry also cae burges berry made ther great assemble knightes squyers france burgoyne also duke burbon went coutre assembled great nobre knightes squiers countie forest burbonoise also sir peter alenson brother prouyded selfe gretly warr season sir guy bloys newly retourned spruce wher made knight reysed baner scrimyshe made agaynst enemy god assone gentyll knight returned heynault herde tidynges great iourney towarde cosyns duchy acquitayne purueyed selfe greatly go yt viage dented heynalt wente parys presented hym selfe kyng glad se apoynted go duke berry certayne nobre armes knightes squiers ser guy bloys deted fro paris rode ward orlyance go berry lyke maner ye fre che kyng ordayned army king england also set forth two great armyes duke lacastre ordeyned iiii c men armes many archer go duchy acqtayne cofort ayde bretherne thought surely yt tie grettest warr shulde made freche king also kyng england thaduyse cou sell made another army go picardy ser robrt canollshuld chefe gouernour thought knight metely ye leder men armes long tyme vsed warr sene great experiece ther therfore desyred thus kynge englande ioyously condiscended therto toke voyage go calays france fight frenchman might mete felde whiche thought sure prouided iourney suche went season delyuered prison duke burbons mother exchaunge sir symon burle ser eustace dambreticourt dyde helpe moche treaty wher duke burbone frenche quene thanked greatly season ther ben great treatyes bytwene frenche kynge kynge nauarr lay chierbourge moche dyde treater peace bytwene shewed frenche kyng tyme hym kepe warre kynge nauarre sayd ynough kepe warre agaynste englisshemen sayenge howe better let go owne rather greatter euyls shuld ryse kynge nauarre shulde suffre englysshemen arryue passe fortress cloux constantyne shuld therby greatly greue countre normandy whiche thynges sayd ought greatly redoubted consydered moche enduced kynge agreed peace went towne roan ther peace confyrmed kynge nauarr ther went archebysshop roan erle alenson erle salebruche syr wylliam dormas ser robert lorry foud kyng nauar uernon ther made great feast tha brought ye kyng nauarr roan frenche kyng ther agayne confyrmed aliau ce confederacions sworne put writyng vnder seale vnderstode kyng nauar makyng peace shuld renouce mysses loue ben bytwene hym kyng england returne agayne nauarr shulde defye kyng englad surete loue holden kept bitwene hym freche kyng kyng nauarr went yt freche kyng fro roan paris agayne new feast solepnities whan inough sported tha leaue taken kynge nauer departed amyably fro freche kyng left behynde two sonnes kyng vncle wet moutpellyer countie foi owne countre nauer nowe let v retourne busynesse acqtayne p howe sir bertram clesquy deted spayne went tholous duke aniou receyued ioyously ca cc lxxvi shall knowe hath ben sayd duke aniou ben france agreed yt assone returned la guedoc shulde entre byforce guyen coude wyse loue prince thenglyssmen neuer dyde departyng frenche kyng sent letter wt great messangers castell kyng henry desyring hym sende fraunce sir bertram clesquy also kyng duke aniou wrote sir bertra shulde fynd meanes come shortely fraunce messangers dyd message ye kynge spayne thought nat kepe ayenst frenche kynges desyre wolde make non excuse sir bertra clesquy made redy shortely coude toke leue kyng henry dyd somoche came tholou wher duke aniou ther assembled great nombre knight squyers men warr taryed nothynge comynge sir bertram comyng duke greatly reioysed ordayned de parte fro tholous entre price lande season come hapton england duke lacastre iiii c men armes many archer shippes vessel redy withall purueyance mynde sayle bourdeaux myght haue wynde duke lorde rose sir michell de la poule sir robert rouxe sir johan saynt lowe sir wyllyam beauchampe p howe monsac moutpellyer yelded duke aniou duke berry lay siege cytie lymoges cap cc lxxvii duke aniou deted fro cyte tholou great aray good order hi therle armynake lorde dalbret therle piergourt erle comynges vycont carmayne erle lyle vycont brune kyell vycont narbon vycont talar lorde de la barde lorde pyncornet sir bertra tande seneshalles tholous carcassone beauchair dyuers ii speares knightes squyers vi fote lauces pauesses sir bertram clesquy chefe capitayne company tooke way dagenoise way founde feldes mo copanyons season ben quercy rydinge warde agen first forteresse came monsacke countre suche feare reason commynge duke iniou suche great nobre dyuers townes forteresses trymbled feare nat wyll holde warre agaynst assoone come moysac yelded became frenche wente thounyns ryuer garon frenchman rode ease folowynge ryuer came porte saynt mary incotynent tourned frenche euery place frenchman put people made garisons bothe towne castell thounyns yelded vp became french ther set newe capitayne xx speares hym toke way moutpellyer iguyllon brennyng distroyeng countre whan come good towne mountpellyer within sore afrayed duke aniou yelded selfe vp frenche kyng went stronge castell aguyllon four dayes within sir gaultyer manny copany yelded hym selfe castell duke aniou wherof bergerath great marueyle yelded selfe soone capitayne within bergerath captall beufz sir thomas phelton hundred speares englysshe gascoyns lyke maner duke aniowe company entred prince lande countre agen tholousen lyke wise duke berry tyme company rode lymosyn xii hundred speares horsebacke thre thousande fote conquerynge townes castels brennyng exilyng cou trey hym duke burbon erle alenson sir guy bloyes sir robert alenson erle perche sir john darmynake sir hugh dolphyn sir john uyllemore lorde beauieu lorde uyllers lorde senar sir geffray motagu sir loyes malleuall sir rayman marnell sir john boloyne sir godfray vncle vycont duzes lorde sully lorde talenton lorde cofant lorde dappecher lorde dacon sir john damenue ymbault peschyn dyuers good baron knightes squyers men armes entred lymosyn dyd ther great uries came layed siege lymoges within towne ther fewe englyshmen whiche sir hugh caurell left therin garison seneshalll countre prince wale towne angoleme well enformed two great armyes aswell duke aniou duke berry howe entred great strength countre two tie also shewed hym likelyhod wolde drawe towarde angoleme besiege princesse within towne prince valyant man ymaginatyfe answered sayd howe enemyes shulde nat fynde hym closed nother within towne yet castell said howe wolde mete playne felde caused letter written sente forthe true frendes subgettes poictou xaynton rochell rouergue quercy gore bygore agenoise desyring commaundyng come hym hast moche power men warre coude make mete hym towne cougnac ther hadde stablysshed assemble anone departed fro good lady pricesse wyfe hym richarde yonge sonne meane season prince made thus assemble frenchman rode forthe wastyng distroyeng coutre came lynde good towne standyng ryuer dordone leage fro bergerath capitayne therof sir thomas batefoyle knight gascoyne within towne set ther defende duke aniowe erle armynake lorde dalbret erle pyergourt vy count carmayn baron knyghtes came thyder layed siege forte resse sayeng howe wolde neuer depart then tyll forteresse commaundement towne good strong well furnysshed artillary captall beufz sir thoms phelton ben ther nat past xv dayes refresshed garyson thought well within might kepe well fortresse yf lyst consydering ayde helpe might haue shortely fro bergerath nede requyred howbe people towne sore enclyned become frenche great desyre harken promysses duke aniou made vnto finally capitayn sir thoms batefoyle fayne agre also certayne somme money shulde haue great fyte yerely duke aniowe ther vpon become good frenche ordayned mornynge shulde let frenchman entre towne treaty couenat nat close kepte knowen bergerath nyght towne shulde delyuered mornynge tyme towne bergerath come erle cabridge two hundred speares present whan reporte made tidynges captall beufz sir thomas phelton hadde great marueyle therof sayd wolde delyuere towne mydnight departed fro bergerath rode towarde lynde brekyng day came thyder caused gate op ned rode towne tyll came gate frechmen shulde entre whiche tyme entrynge sir thomas batefole redy make way entre captall befz stept forthe swerde hande lighted fote nere gate sayd sir thomas batefole false traytour thou shalt dye first thou shalte neuer trayson therwith stroke hym swerde suche wyse fell downe deed erthe whan frenchman parceyued captall baner sir thoms phelton knewe well fayled entent wherfore reculed togyder turned backes fledde away towne abode styll englysshe gret parell haue ben robbed brent englysshmen men within slayne bycause consented trayson howe excused selfe sayd howe dyde nothyng consented nothynge feare pricipally feare capitayne passed ouer two lordes abode styll ther long season tyll duke aniou copany departed then toke another way p nowe lette v speke state ordynaunce englande army sir robert canoll made realme fraunce p trewse made bytwene englande scotlande sir robert canoll brent exyled countre picardy uermandoise cap cc lxxviii sir robert canoll copany parted englande great treaty bytwene englande scotlande whiche treaty wysely handled sadde discrete counsayle bothe party peace grauted bytwene bothe kynges cou treis liege people endure ix yere scott myght pleasure arme serue take wage englysshe frenche pleasur without brekyng peace wherby sir robert canoll copany hundred speares realme scot lande whan sir robert canoll redy copany went douer past forth calays ther arryued toke lande well receyued capitayne sir nicholas stamborne whan ben well refresshed ther space seayn dayes taken counsayle parte shulde drawe mornynge deted toke felde nobre xv hundred speares foure thousande archer hym englande sir thoms grantson sir alayne bourequeselles sir gylbert gyfford lorde saluatier ser johan bourchier sir wylliam mesucyle ser geffray orsell dyuers knightes valyant men armes first day wet nere fiennes sir moreau fienes constable france tyme owne castell fiennes great nombre knight squyers well purueyed aduysed receyue englysshmen mornyng englysshmen came thyder thynkyng assayle castell anone sawe howe coude take none aduauntage passed forthe coutie guyens entred countie faucobrige brent came cite turwyn dyde nat assayle well prouyded thought shulde lose payne thanne toke way throught coutre terrenoyse entre artoise dayly rod four leages past nat bycause caryage men fote toke lodgynge euer noone lay great vyllag last came cytie arras lodged towne mount saynt eloy arras brente wasted countre ferr durst stretche abrode frenche kyng season set gret garysons cyties townes castels fortress bridge passage defende agaynst assautes whan sir robert canoll company refresshed two dayes mount saynt eloy deted went passed cytie arras sir wyllm mesuell sir geffray dursell marshal englysshe hoost thought go se arras nerer toke two hundred speares foure hundred archer departed great batayle auaused selfe subbarbes towne came barryers whiche foude well furnisshed cro bowes men armes within towne sir charles poicters lady artoise made semblant yssue fight thenglysshmen whan englisshmen taryed barryers certayne space sawe non yssued agaynst drue agayne batayle departyng thought make knowledge ben set subbarbes fyre thentet haue drawen towne men war mynde fyre dyd moch hurt domage ther brent great monastery freers prechers cloyster thenglysshmen passed forthe toke ye way bapalmes brennyng wastyng cou tre last came uermandoise cae roy brent towne passed forthe went hem uermadois wherinto people withdrawen goodes dyde lyke wise saynt quintyns peron thenglisshmen founde nothyng abrode saue ye gra ge full corne august rode forth fayre easely two thre leag day whan came wher plentie vitayle taryed ther two thre dayes refresshe horse day came towne whiche chefe countre ther marshal spake capitayne assurance sayd howe say wyll ye gyue shall respyte countre saue fro brennyng robbyng fell coposicyon playne cou tre shulde gyue pay certayne florens countre saued sir robert canoll gate voyage sayde meanes dyuers tymes aboue somme hundred thousande frankes wherof afterwarde shente accused kyng englande yt nat well done deuoyre yt iourney ye shall hystorie lande lorde couey abode peace ther nother man woman hurt value penny yf sayd belonged lorde couey last englysshmen came cyte noyon whiche well furnyshed men warre ther englysshmen taryed aproched nere might aduysed se maner assaut might preuayle nat sawe towne well aparelled defence sir robert canoll loged abbey dolkans people day came cyte raynged maner batayle se yf garyson comontie towne wold yssue fight nat wyll ther scottysh knyght dyde goodly feate armes departed fro company speare hande mounted good horse page behynde soo came barryers knyght called sir johan assucton hardy man couragious whan barryers noyon lighted fote sayd page holde kepe horse departe nat hen went barryers within ye barryers ther good knightes sir johan roy sir launcelat lourys x xii great marueyle sayde knight wolde sayd sir come hyder se se well ye wyll nat yssue barryers therfore wyll entre wyll proue knyghthode agaynst wyn ye therwith layed rounde hym hym thus alone fought agaynst hour dyd hurt two thre towne walles garettes stode styll behelde great pleasure regarde valyatnesse dyde hurt whiche might haue done hadde lyst haue shotte cast stone hym also frenche knightes charged let hym alone togyder long fought last page came nere barryers spake langage sayd sir coe away tyme depart company departyng hen knight cd well gaue two thre stroke armed lept barryers lepte vpon horse without hurt behynde page sayd frenchman adue sir thanke sorode forthe owne company whiche dede moche praysed many folkes p howe noyon toke englisshmen set fyre bysshops bridge howe frenche kyng sent sir bertra clesquy cap cc lxxix sir robert canoll depted fro siege noyon people brent towne bysshoppes bridge ryuer dyse wheri ther many fayre house knightes squyers wt towne noyon great dyspleasure fyre vuderstove sir robert copany departed lx speres went noyon cae fyre founde ther styllparte set fyre towne dyuers ther pylle robbe moost parte slayne ther frenchman wonne mo xl good horse rescued dyuers prisoner saued fro brennyng many fayre house returned agayne noyon mo xv prisoner strake heedes p englysshmen rode forthe good order come larroyse passe ease ryuer dyse ryuer ewe dyde hurte countie soyssons bycause parteyned lorde coucy trewe coosted euer certayne lordes france vycont meaulx lorde chauny lorde raoll coucy lorde wyllyam mehung sonne erle tankernell folkes wherby englysshmen durst nat breke order euer kepte selfe close togyder also frechmen wolde nat medyll euery night lodged within stronge holdes good townes englysshmen abrode playne cou tre wher founde plentie vitayls newe wynes wherof made great large thus rode countre bre nyng wastynge last passed ryuer marne entred champayne passed ryuer aube tourned march prouynce passed dyuers tymes ryuer saync drewe towarde cyte parys benshewed howe freche kyng made ther great assemble men warr whome erle saynt poule lorde clyssone shuld chefe gouernours wherfore thought drawe thider wylling fight semyng thenglisshmen desyred nothyng el batayle therfore frenche kynge wrotte sir bertram clesquy acquytayne duke aniou commaundyng desyring sight letter shulde drawe incontynent france shewyng wolde set warke place season pope urbane fyft came cyte amou ben foure yere togyder rome came thyder trust make peace bitwene two kyng warr renewed agayne whiche sore displesant pope whose comyng aniou cardynals march greatly reioysed thought fare better nowe let v speke prince wale howe parceyuered warres ye haue herde recorded howe price wale made assemble congnac thentent ryde agaynst duke aniou brent wasted coutre comaudement thyder auaused baron knightes squyers poictou xaynton landes helde prince erle penbroke departed fro garyson cae prince season duke la castre arryued burdeux wherof prince right ioyouse taryed nat longe ther deted vnderstode price wold encoutre enemyes dayes iourney fro congnac encountred erle penbroke lyke wise goyng prince made great chere eche whan met rode gyder co gnac wher foude prince princesse erle cabridge right glad comyng dayly came men warr poictou xaynton rochell bygore goute gascoyne marchesse nert adioynyng vnder obeysance price frenche partie duke aniou erle armynake lorde dalbret erles vycontes knightes squyers conquered cyties castels townes fortress comynge mo xl aproched within fyue leages burdeux wasted countrey bergerath lynde vnderstode well howe price made assemble congnac also howe duke lancastre arryued wt great nobre men warr speares archer drue counsayle take aduyse howe shuld perceyuer warr newly sent ser bertram clesquy frenche kyng came fro duke berry kepyng siege cytie lymoges suche wyse constrayned within poynt yelde certayne meanes codicyons counsayle duke aniou lordes hym sir bertram clesquy called reason ther many reasos alleged layd finally thing cosydred counsayled duke aniou breke vp iourney tyme send people garysons warr garyable sayeng howe done sufficyetly tyme also nedefull lordes gascone erle armynake therle piergourt lorde dalbret dyuers drawe owne coutreis kepe defende make fronter warr knewe nat price entent sayeng assembled toguyder great army comon acorde departed eche fro duke aniou went cytie caours spredde abrode people coutre put garysons erle armynake lorde dalbre retourned countreis prouyded furnisshe townes castels thynking surely haue warre made people redynesse kepe defende cou treis nede p nowe let v speke sir bertram clesquy departed fro duke aniou dyde somoche came copany cyte lymoges wher duke berrey duke burbone lordes fraunce siege phowe limoges yelded duke berrey howe duke brake vp army cap c c lxxx whan syr bertram come agayne sege frenchman greatly reioysed comyng anone pursued treaty begon bytwene bysshoppe lymoges cytie duke aniowe finally bysshoppe cytie tourned became frenche duke berrey duke burbone entred cytie sir guy bloys lordes france great ioye toke faythe homage cytie refresshed rested thre dayes determyned ther counsayle breke vp army tyme duke aniou done retourne owne coutreis kepe defende townes forteresses bicause sir robrt canoll styll abrode felde fraunce also sayd howe right well sped wynnyng suche cytie lymoges counsayle aduyse nat broken thus lordes departed eche fro sir bertram ab de styll party lymosyn two hundred speares kept castels lorde maleuall whiche tourned frenche whan duke berrey departed fro lymoges ordayned set cytie request bysshop sir johan wyllemur sir hugh de la roche roger beauforde hudred men armes went berrey duke burbon bonoyse lordes farther march went home owne countreis nowe lette v speke prince howe spedde pwhan tidynges come prince cytie lymoges tourned freche howe bysshop gossyp whome great trust confydence chefe ayder yelde vp cyte become frenche whiche prince sore displeased set lesse force men churche hadde great trust tha sware father soule wherby neuer forsworne wolde gette agayne wolde make traytours derely abye falsnesse whan moost te people come nombred xit hundred speares knightes squyers thousande archer thousand men fote departed fro towne cognac hym two bretherne duke lancastre erle cambridge sir thomas phelton captall befz abode styll bergerath kepe fronter agaynst frechmen companyons coutre prince also sir guyssharde dangle sir loyes harcourt lorde po lorde parteney lorde pynau lorde tanyboton sir percyuall coloyne sir godfray dargeton potenyns gascons lorde mountferant lorde camont lorde logueren sir aymere tharse lorde pomyers lorde musydent lorde lespare souldyche estrabe lorde gerond dyuets engliss hme sir thomas percy lorde rose lord wyllm beauchape sir mychell dela poule lorde stephan gosenton sir richarde pontchardon sir baudwyn franuyll sir symon burle sir dangouse sir john deureur sir wyllm mesuyll dyuers nat name heynouse ther sir eustace dabrety court companyons sir perducas dalbret nandon bergerath thyder came le bourge de laspare le bourge de bretuell espyot bernarde de wyst dyuers men warre went good ordynaunce toke feldes coutte trymbled prince dyseased coude nat ryde caryed horse lytter toke way lymosyn entent come lymoges last thyder came lodged rounde cytie prince sware wolde neuer departe then tyll hadde cytie pleasure bysshoppe within burgess consydered well howe greatly trespassed prince wherof repented coulde nat remedy nat lordes maysters owne cytie sir johan wyllemur sir hugh de la roche roger beaufort capitayns within cytie coforted greatly people sayd sir nat afrayed strong ynough resyst agaynst price power assaute canne nat hurt greue v well furnysshed artyllary whan prince marshalles well ymagined consydered puyssance strength cytie knowledge nombre men warre within sayd assaut coulde neuer wyn prince thought assaye way alwayes company great nombre myners sette awarke vndermyne knyghtes within parceyued well howe vndermyned began make dyke countermyne entent breke myne phowe sir robert canoll entred realme france great nombre men armes came nere parys cap c c lxxxi sir robert canoll hath ben sayd great nombre men armes entred realme france rode small iourneys great expence thorowe realme poor people playne countre payed derely therfore englysshmen went cae dyde great hurt shewed maner howe desyred nothynge batayle whan passed coutres artoise uerma doyse bysshopriche laon archebysshopriche raynes champayne tourned bry came cytie parys lodged day two nightes whiche tyme freche kyng might well se lodgynge saynt poule fyres smoke made gastenoyes p day constable france sir moreau fyenes within parys erle saynt poule therle tankeruyll erle salebruch vycount meaulx sir raoll coucy feneshall heynault sir edwarde rauncy sir anguerrant douden lorde castell julyan sir johan uyan lorde de la ryuer dyuers knightes squyers valyant men fraunce none theym dyde yssue day kynge wolde nat suffre lorde clysson one moost pricypall counsayle best b leued herde dyde put great doutes sayd kyng sir ye haue nede enploy people agaynst yonder sort madde let go nat take herytage put realme smoke gate saynt james barryers erle saynt poule vycount roan sir rafe coucy lorde canyne lorde creques sir edwarde rauncy sir anguerant doudyn tuesday mornyng englisshmen dissoged sette fyre vyllages wher lodged fyre might playnly sene parys ther knyght company made vowe day wolde ryde walles gate parys stryke barrier speare furnysshyng vowe departed fro company speare fyst shelde necke armed pecesse good horse squyer another behynde bassenet wha aproched nere parys toke dyde helme left squyer behynde hym dasshed spurres horse came galopynge barryers whiche opyn lordes wende wolde haue entred towne nat mynde whan hadde stryken barryers auowed turned reyne drue backe agayne departed knightes fraunce sawe hym depte sayd go way ye haue rightwell quyted selfe nat tell knyghtes name countre blasure armes goules two fuss sable aborder sable howbeit subbar be asore encountre passed pauement founde bocher bygge well sene knight passe helde handes sharpe heuy axe long poynt knight returned agayne toke heed bocher came syde gaue knight suche stroke bytwene necke shulders reuersed forwarde heedlynge necke horse yet recouered agayne bocher strake agayne axe entred body payne knight fell erthe horse ranne away came squyer abode mayster stretes ende squyer toke horse great marueyle becoe maister well sene ryde barrier stryke therat glayue retourne agayne thanne rode lytell forthe thyderwarde anone sawe mayster lay vpon erthe bytwene foure men layeng stroke wolde haue stryken stethy tha squyer affrayed durst go farther saw well coude nat helpe maister ther fore retourned fast might ther sayd knight slayne knightes gate caused buryed holy grounde squyer retourned hoost shewed adueture mayster wherof sorie displeased night loged bytwene moutle hery parys lytell ryuer lodged tymes sir bertram clesquy made great warre countie lymoges howe toke castell saynt yriell cap cc lxxxii season sir robert canoll made thus vyage price wale two bretherne lay cyte lymoges sir bertram clesquy copany whiche nombre two hundred speares rode one syde countre lymoges lay nat felde neuer night feare englysshmen euery night lay forteresse suche tourned frenche parteyning sir loyes maleuall sir raymon marneyle howebeit euery day rode forthe dyde great payne conquere townes forteresses prince well aduertysed toney sir bertram made dayly coplayntes came howe beit wyse wolde breke vp siege sir bertram clesnuy entred vicoute lymoges cou tre yelded dyde holde duke bretayne lorde johan mountford ther sir bertram beganne make great warre name lady wyfe lorde charles bloyes whome enherytaunce somtyme belonged made great warre none came agaynst duke bretayne thought full lytell sir bertra wolde haue made warr agaynst hym sir bertram came towne saynt yriell wherin neuer gentylman defende towne wherfore afrayed yelded vp obeysaunce lady bretayne whose name sir bertram made warr saynt yriell breton made great garison wherby wan dyuers townes limosyn nowe let v retourne prince wale p howe price toke cyte lymoges howe four companyons dyd marueyls armes ca cc lxxxiii space moneth prince wale cytie lymoges ther ther assaute scrimysshe dayly myned within knewe wel myned made countermyne agaynst haue distroyed theglysshe myners fayled myne whan princis myners sawe coutermyne fayled sayde prince sir whan soeuer shall please shall cause part wall fall dyke wherby ye shall entre cytie ease without daunger whiche wordes pleased greatly prince sayd woll morowe tymes yeshewe forthe execute warke myners set fyre myne next mornyng prince habbe ordayned fell downe great pane wall fylled dyke wherof englysshmen gladde redy armed selde entre towne fote men myght well entre case dyde ranne gate beate downe fortifyeng barryers defece agaynst downe sodaynly towne nat ware therof prince duke lancastre erle cambridge erle penbroke sir guyssharde dangle companyes entred cyte fote redy apelled yuell pyll robbe cytie sle men woman chyldren commaunded great pytie se men woman chyldren kneled downe knee price mercy enflamed yre toke hede theym none herde putte dethe mette withall suche nothyng culpable pyte taken poore people wrought neuer maner treason yet bought dererr great personage suche done yuell trespace nat harde hert within cytie lymoges yf remembraunce god wepte pyteously great mischefe sawe eyen mo thre thousande men woman chyldren slayne heeded day god haue mercy soules trowe martyr thus entrynge cytie certayne company englysshmen entred bysshoppes palys founde bysshop brought princ presens beheld hym right fersly felly best worde coude haue hym wolde haue heed stryken hadde syght nowe lette v speke knyghtes within cytie sir john wyllemure sir hugh de la roche roger beaufort son erle baufort capitayns cytie whan sawe trybulacion pestylence ranne ouer company sayd one another deed without defende selfe therfore lettevs sell lyues derely good knightes ought sir johan wyllemure sayde roger beauforte roger behoueth ye made knight roger aunswered sayd ser nat yet worthy knyght thake sir good wyll ther sayd nat leaser speke long togyder howbeit assembled togyder place agaynst olde wall dysplayed baners nobre lxxx person thyder came duke lanca stre therle cambridge companyes lighted fote frechmen coude nat long endure agaynst thenglysshmen anone slayne taken howbeit duke lancastre hymselfe fought longe hande hande agaynst sir john wyllemure strong knight hardy therle ca bridge fought agaynst sir hughe de la roche erle pebroke agaynst roger beaufort squyer thre frechmen dyde many feates armes ocuped otherwyse prince charyote came behelde gladly apeased himselfe beholdyng lo ge fought togyder thre frechmen one accorde beholdyng swerdes sayd sir ye haue coquered v v accordynge right armes sir duke lancastre loke nothyng el therfore receyue prisoner thus forsayd thre frenchman taken enfourmed p howe cytie lymoges brent distroyed bysshop delyuered fro dethe howe sir bertram clesquy chosen constable cap cc lxxxiiii thus cytie lymoges pylled robbed clene brent brought distructyon theglysshmen departed coquest prisoner drue co gnac wher lady pri cesse price gaue leaue men warr dete dyde season felt hym selfe nat well ease alwayes sickenesse encreased wherof bretherne people sore dismayed nowe shall shewe bysshop lymoges great paryll lesyng heed duke lancastre desyred prince gyue bysshop wt pleasure prince content caused delyuered duke bysshope fredes newly enformed pope auygnon bysshoppes takyng whiche fortuned well bysshoppe el ben deed pope swete wordes entreated duke lancastre delyuer sayd bysshoppe duke wold nat deny pope grauted sent auignon wherof pope right gladde p nowe let v speke aduentures fraunce frenche kynge enformed distructyon conquest cytie lymoges left clene boyde towne desert wherwith sore displesed toke great passyon domage anoy thenhabytantes tha aduysed fraunce cousell noble prelate comons realme yt necessyte frechmen shulde haue chefe gouernour called costable ser mo reau fyennes wolde leaue gyue vp office right valyant man ha de great enterpriser dedes armes thyng cosydred ymagined comon acorde chose sir bertram cles quy yt wolde take moost valyant knight moost vertuous moost able execute offyce moost fortunate knewe tha bare armes crowne fraunce kyng wrote sent certayne messangers shulde come speke parys messangers foude countie lymoges toke fortress castels made yelde lady bretayne wyfe sir charles bloys newly taken towne called brandon rydyng towardes another whan kyng messangers come receyued ioyously right sagely coulde right well messanger delyuered kyng letter dyd message whan sir bertram sawe comaundement kyng wolde make none excuse cocluded go knowe kynges pleasur deted assone myght sent moost parte men garysons suche coquered made souerayne kepar sir olyuer many nephue rode forthe long iourneys cae parys wher founde kyng great bre lordes cousayle receyued right ioyously dyde great reuerence ther kynge shewed howe cousayle chosen constable fra ce excused selfe right sagely sayd sir nat worthy poore knight regarde great lord valyant men fraunce though fortune hath lytell auaunsed thanne kynge sayde sir nothynge ye excuse behoueth take ordayned determyned counsayle fraunce whiche wyse wyll breke sir bertram excused self agayne another way sayd right dere sir noble kynge may nat dare nat withsay yo noble pleasure howe sir trouthe poore man lowe blode come offyce constable fraunce whiche great noble offyce conuenyent wyll exercyse acquyte selfe well offyce must commaude well rather great men small personage sir beholde lordes bretherne nephues cosyns hath charge many men warr hoost iourneys sir howe durst bolde commaunde certaynly sir enuy great ought fere therfore sir requyre grace pardon gyue office wolde gladlyer haue tha may better execute office kynge answered sayde sir bertram excuse nat way haue nother brother cosyn nephue erle barowne realme shall obey yf contrary shall angre hym shall parceyue well displeasur therfore sir take ioyously office requyre sir bertram sawe well excusacyons coude make shulde nat auayle finally accorded opinyon kynge ryght sore agaynst wyll great ioye sir bertram clesquy made constable fraunce farther aduauncement kyng caused hym sytte table shewed token loue coulde deuyse gaue hym offyce dyuers gyftes great landes herytage heyres euer promocyon dyde helpe greatly duke aniou p howe sir bertra clesquy lorde clysson disconfyted bridge bolayne certayne sir robert canols company cap cc lxxxv anone sir bertram stablysshed costable france sayd kyng sir lyke grace wyll go ryde agaynst sir robert canolle march aniou mayne wordes pleased well kyng said sir take shall please ye thynke best shall obey constable purueyed iourney gathered togyder men armes breton deted fro kyng rode towardes mayne copany lorde clysson cam cytie man ther made garyson lorde clysson another towne nere therto aboute nombre fyue hundred speares sir robert canoll company styll countre howe nat one opinyon englysshe knyght amonge called sir johan maystrude agreed nat myndes alwayes counsayled agaynst iourney sayeng howe lost tyme traueyled theym selfe without conqueryng thyng knight hadde great company hym sir robert canoll sir alayne boucquesell lodged nere man sir thomas grantson ser gylbert gifforde sir geffray oursell sir wyllyam mesuyll great company behynde whan ser robert canoll ser alayne boucquesell knewe constable fraunce lorde clysson come countre therof right ioyfull ser robert canoll said tidynges good v let v drawe togyder take aduantage surely ser bertram clesquy noueltie newe offyce come loke v haue rydden ouer great part realme france yet haue founde maner aduentur lette v sende myndes entente sir hugh caurell saynt mors loir sir robert briquet sir bertram ceyn capitayns companyons suche nere aboute v desyre theym come v incontynent thynke wyll gladde coe yf may ouerthrowe newe constable lorde clysson great enemy vnto v shall v great honoure profyte bytwene sir robert canoll sir alayne boucqsell ther maner discorde alwayes folowed one counsayle incontynent sente letter messangers secretely vnto sir hugh caurell sir robert briquet desyring come forthe thentent fight frenchman lyke wise sent sir thoms grantson sir gylbert gyf forde sir geffray dursell mete certayne place trust fight frenchman ryde knightes capitayns apparelled themselfe kepe apoyntmet toke forth iourney come company nombre two hundred speares sir robert canoll sent nat secretly companyons sir bertram clesquy knowledge therof whan well enformed entent armed nyght season deted company garyson proper night sir thomas grantson departed lodgynge sir geffray dursell sir gylbert gyfforde ser wyllyam de mesuyll came toward sir robtt canoll wher thoght fynde howbeit way shorted place called palse pount uolant frenchman met togyder sodenly frechmen four hundred speares theglysshmen two hudred speares ther ferse batayle well fought long endured assoone met lighted fote came rudely eche fought speares swerdes right valyantly howbeit place abode frechmen obteyned vyctorie agaynst englysshmen slayne taken none escaped except page boyes suche lept maysters horse saued selfe ther taken sir thomas gratson sir gylbert gyfford sir geffray drsell sir wyllin mesuyll sir philyp courtney sir hugh spens dyuers knightes ledde prisoner cyte man tidynges anon brought sir robert canoll sir hugh caurell sir robert briquet companyons wherof sore difpleased brake enterprice bycause aduentur saynt mors loyre came nat forthe kept styll logyng sir robert canoll sir alayne boucquesell withdrue backe brake vp iourney entred bretayne sir robert went owne castell doruall gaue leaue men armes archer depart take aduatage wher thought best departed went ouer agayne england sir alayne boucqsell went wynter towne saynt sauy vycont whiche kyng englande gyuen p howe pope urbane dyed howe gregory chosen howe sir raymon marneyll taken englysshmen cap cc lxxxvi disconfyture thus pont uolant wher parte englysshmen ouerthrowen wherby iourney broken sir bertram clesquy noueltie offyce costable france done dede wherby gate great renome laude came agayne france lord clysson led great parte englysshe prisoner brought cytie parys without daunger courtesly raunsomed theym without constraynt dyde let go faythes putte nat stockes noryrons yet prison almaygnes prisoner gette greater raunsome cursed people without pytie honour therfore none ought take mercy frenchman kepte good company prisoner raunsomed courtesly without greuaunce p discofytur prince wale right sore displeased duke lacastre copany beyng congnac recoqueryng lymoges tyme christmas pope urbane fyft dyed auygnon ben valyaunt clerke wyse good frenchman cardy nals entred coclaue dyde chose amonge newe pope cardynall beauforde called gregory xi whose creacyon deuyne prudece freche kynge ryght ioyoule bycause semed good frenchman whose creacyon hym auygnon duke aniou dyde great payne cause pope p season ther fell sir eustace da bretycourt harde aduenture rode lymosyn euenynge came castell lorde pyer buffyer whome reputed haue ben speciall frende louer good englysshman dyde put sir thy balt du pont man armes breton castell caused hym take sir eustace prisoner tooke hede hym heledde away prisoner afterwarde raunsomed hym xii thousande frankes wherof payed four thousande sonne france abode hostage resydue duke burbone repledged hym dyde moche payne delyuerance bycause sir eustace dyde payne delyuer lady mother whome copanyons taken bell perche sir eustace delyuerance went lay carenten beyonde waches saynt clement base normandy good towne whiche kynge naucr gyuen ther dyed god haue soule longe lyued right valyant knight season ser raymon maruell depted fro parys go owne countre newly retourned frenche way met harde aduentur founde great rout englysshmen sir hugh caurelles ledde knight poytou hesell knightes handes coude nat scape taken prisoner brought poyctou sayde knightes castell takynge sir raymon anone knowen englande kynge enformed therof kyng wrote knight comau dyng incotynent sende hym enemy false traytour sir raymon marnell sayeng howe wolde take suche vengeance hi shulde take ensample promysing knight gyue hym takyng vi frankes knygh called sir geffray dargenton wolde nat disobey kyng maisters commauadement said wolde fulfyll pleasur sir raymon marnell enformed howe king englande wolde haue sent hym howe mayster determyned sende hym ouer englande whan knewe abasshed good cause prison began make moost lametable coplayntes coulde deuysed moche kept hym englysshman great pyte hym right swetely reconforted hym sir raymon sawe conforte danger seyng shulde ledde englande kynge discouered sorowe kepar day sayd hym dere frede ye wolde delyuer daunger promyse faythe trouthe departe halfe landes make enheryter therto neuer fayle englysshman poore man consydered howe sir raymon parell lyfe howe promysed great curtessy hym great pytie copassyon sayd sir shall payne saue ser raymon right ioyfull answere sware faytl kepe promyse farthermore wolde desyre deuysed howe might accomplysshe entences whan nyght englysshman bare kayes castell towre wherin sir raymon prisoner hadde kay posterne dyde moche let hym feldes toguyder went great woode entente shulde nat folowed night suffred moche payne coude thought went seuyn leages fote nyght harde frost wherby cutte fete mornyng came frenche fortresse receyued ioyfully theym forteresse whome sir raymon recounted aduenture wherof thanked god trouthe next mornyng wha knowen gone men horsebacke folowed late thus sir raymon scaped retourned lymosyn shewed frendes howe englysshe squyer shewed hym great curtesy soeuer thenglysshman greatly honoured cherysshed among sir raymon wolde haue delyuered hym one halfe herytage accordynge promysed englisshe squyer wolde wyse take moche toke onely c c yerely reuenewes sayenge sufficyent hym maynteyne ther astate p howe prince wale lefte duchy acquitayne kepyng duke lancastre howe four breton knightes toke castell mount paon cap c c lxxxvii season cyte burdeaux dyed eldest sone prince princesse wherof right sorie reasone prince counsayled shulde retourne englande owne countre thentent rather therby recouer helth counsayle gyuen hym phisycions surgyons knewe disease prince agreed well therto sayd well content thervpon made prouision vnderstode erle cabridge brother erle johan penbroke ordayned retourne kepe co pany whan prince shulde departe acquitayne shippes redy tyuer garon hauen burdeaur prince pricesse yong sonne richarde beyng ther made speciall somons burdeaux barownes knightes gascoyne poictou place lorde vnder obeysaunce whan come toguyder chambre prince shewed ben lorde kepte peace moche lay power maynteyned great prosperyte puysance agaynst enemyes shewyng recouer helthe wherof gret nede purpose retourne englande desyring beleue serue obey brother duke lancastre lyke maner done hymselfe trustynge shulde fynde hym good lorde curtesse requyringe cousell assyst hym busynesse barones acqtayne gascoyne poictou xainton promysed sware faythes shulde neuer defaute founde dyde fealtie homage duke promysed loues seruyce obeysance sware vpholde kepe presence prince kyst mouthe order taken prince taryed nat long cytie burdeux entred shyppe pricesse chyldren erle cambridge erle penbroke fyue hundred fightynge men besyde archer long sayled without danger domage aryued nampton ther toke lande refresshed two dayes tooke horse prince lytter came wyndsore wher kynge receyued swetely chyldre ther enformed al state guyen whan prince ben king long pleased prince tooke leaue went owne house camestades p nowe let v leaue speke prince shewe somwhat besynesse acquitayne anone prince departed fro burdeux duke lancastre made obsequy cosyn edwarde sofie prince brother whiche nobly done cytie burdeux therat baron gascoyne poictou sworne obeysance meane season obsequy lordes burdeux ther yssued fortetesse pyergourt two hundred speares breton whiche sente thyder duke aniowe whiche company ther four knightes capitayns right hardy valyant knightes called sir wyllyam louall sir alayne aussay sir loyes mally lorde darcy lordes rode companyes stronge castell called mount paon perteyning knight whan breton coethyder ronne barryers made semblant assayle castell capitayn within called sir wyllyam mount paon shewed himselfe haue rather freche hert englysshe tourned yelded vp place receyued breton castell sayd wolde kepe place agaynst worlde newe repayred fortifyed tydynges anone knowen burdeux duke lancastre sayd lordes hym sir nat beuoyre shulve breton brode haue taken fortresse mountpaon marchyng nere whiche takynge duke lordes hym great shame ordayned go thyder departed fro burdeaur wedntsday duke lancastre lorde pons lorde parteney sir loys harcourt sir guy sharde dangle sir percyuall culoyue sir godfray dargeton sir jaques surgeres sir maubrune linyers sir wyllm montendre sir hugh uinoy lorde crupenacke dyuers baron knightes poictou xaynton gascon captall befz lorde pomyers lorde chamount lorde mountserant lorde langueron souldyche lestrade sir bernard dalbret lorde getonde sir amery charse dyuers englande ther sir thoms phelton sir thoms percy lorde rose sir mychell de la poule lorde wyloughhy ser wyllyam beauchape sir richarde pontchardon sir bandras franuyll sir dago dyuers aseuyn hundred speares fyue hudred archer rode right ordinatly towarde mountpaon came thyder whan sir wylliam mout paon knewe comyng thyder duke lancastre copany sawe besieged thought selfe surety knewe well yf takenne force heshulde nat escape fro dethe thinkynge surely shulde nat taken mercy bycause forfet done gyueng vp place breton dyscouered entent forsayde four knightes sayd sir wyll leaue castell wyll depart go pyergourt kepe departed wente pyergourt lefte owne castell kepyng foresayd four knyghtes p howe four knightes breton defended selfe valiantly agaynst duke lancastre howe fynally duke toke foure rausome ca c c lxxxviii whan duke lacastre baron knyghtes come castell mountpaon layed siege therto made gret proyisyon lodgynges necessaryes thoughe shulde haue taryed space seuyn yere lay nat ydell incontyuent apelled themselfe assayle castell caused villayns countre cutte downe great quantyte wode tymbre cast dyke thus fyftene vayes togyder dyd nothyng alwayes cast stuffe dyke wode tymbre layed ouer strawe erthe within space fylled great te dyke might well coe walles scrimy within vyde nigh euery day fyue sixe assaut wher many noble dedes done foure breton knyghtes within right valyaut men armes defended selfe right nobly wherfore ought greatly commended though englisshmen gascoyns came nere yet nat afrayed lost great thyng nere garyson ther breton garyson called saynt maquayre johan malestroyt syluester budes capitayns euery day herde spekyng feates armes done mountpaon great desyre sayd often tymes one another knowe well companyons right valyaunt may dayly ded euery day haue fyue vivatayls yet lye styll nothyng certayuly acquyte v nat well thus great desyre go rescue might whan spoken consydred peryll leaue owne forte resse voyde wyst nat well tha tyme syluester budes sayde felow john ye shall go el wyll chose whyder johan answered sayd syluester ye shall abyde wyll go ther longe stryfe whiche shulde go last acorded sware made promyse company shulde drawe cuttes shulde haue longest strawe shuld go forthe abyde drewe longest cutte fell syluester budes great laughyng among company syluester toke fable apparelled selfe mounted horse departed xii men armes rode long euenyng entred towne castell moutpaon wher knyghtes companyons within great ioye gaue great prayse siluester bud haue shewed ther euery day assautes moutpaon right well knight within aquyted themselfe deserued great honour vntyll ye tyme great parte wall ouerthrowen neuer afrayed basshed englysshmen ordayned mantel instrumentes warr wherby aproche nere walles ouer dyke fylled ther brigant well pauessed great pykes yron wherwith vndermyned walles suche wyse great pane wall fell downe xl fote long lordes hoost ordayned batayls archer shotte holy togyder non within durst one apere abrode whan sir wylliam lonuall sir alayne houssay sir loyes maylley ye lorde darcy sawe howe case nat able endure kepe holde tha sent heraulde horse backe duke lancastre haue treaty myght heraulde came duke shewed hym entent comyng duke thaduyse cousayle gaue respyte speke hym
