counsayle heraulde retourned shewed maysters howe hadde spedde four knightes went duke sent sir guyssharde dangle dyke spake togyder demaunded vnder maner duke wolde receyue sir guyssharde hadde charge answered said sir ye haue greatly displeased lorde duke ye haue kept castell agaynst xi wekes wherby hath lost dyuers men wherfore wyll nat receyue grace mercy without ye wyll yelde self simply also delyuer first sir wylliam moutpaon yt may put deth hath deserued lyke treatour tha sir loyes mailly answered sayd sir guyssharde sir wyllyam mountpaon whome ye desyre haue deluered swere vnto truely knowe nat wher nat castell sythe ye layed siege therto sir harde thyng v yelde selfe vp symply ye wolde haue v sythe sent hyder soudiers gette selfe wage lyue lyke maner ye sende somtyme selfe gladde take wag therfore sir make marchadyse shall sell selfe derely shall spoken hu dred yeres dethes sir desyre returne duke shewe desyre hym receyue v courtesly certayne composycion raunsome lyke maner wolde shulde e dalt yf fallen suche lyke daunger aunswered sir guyssharde sayde sir shall best power retourned duke tooke hym captall beufz lorde rousayne lorde musyden entent rather spede whan come duke shewed hym many fayre wordes condyscended request soo toke four breton knightes syluester budes company mercy prisoner hadde agayne full possession forteresse mountpaon toke fealtie towne sette ther two gascone knightes kepe fourtie men armes many archer newe repayred fortifyed place refresshed vitayle artyllary p howe duke lancastre gaue lycence people departe retourned himselfe burdeux howe lorde pons tourned fre che howe seneschall poyctou assembled togyder company cap cc lxxxix conquest mountpaon duke hadde sette capitayns well fortifyed fortresse dysloged gaue lycence euerye man departe wheder wolde departed eche fro retourned owne countrees duke went cytie burdeur poictenyns coutre gascone wente home owne townes castels companyons spredde abrode coutre dyde moche hurt yuell well lande frendes ennemyes whiche duke suffred bycause thought shulde haue nede agayn shortely warres tyme sorer without comparyson poyctou countre kept great garyson castell mountcontor foure leages fro thouars seuyn leages fro poicters sir peter guerfyll jordayne colloyne capitayns ranne dayly outher thouars el poicters dyde great hurt countre helde englysshe part also castell leraunt capiten carlonet breton hym seuyn hundred breton dyde great domage countre also garyson roche pousay saynt saluyn ranne dayly abrode countre baron knightes poictou suche helde englysshe parte durst nat styrre abrode without rode great companyes feare frechmen thus closed cou trey anone wynning moutpaon lordes poictou wt drawen owne countrees ke yng fro ter agaynst frenchman ye tyme secrete treaty bytwene lorde loys saynt julyan vycount rochchoart frenchman great gyftes comynge fro frenche kynge night day traueyled drawe poictou acorde moche dyde lorde pons turned frenche agaynst wyll good lady wyfe men towne pouns poictou lady abode styll englysshe husbande frenche tidynges baron knightes poictou englysshe sore displeased lorde pouns great lorde whan duke lancastre knewe therof right sore displeased lorde pons praysed gretly wyfe men pons wolde abyde styll englysshe ayde counsell lady duke ordayned knyght go thyder right valyant hardy called ser aymemos bours thus ranne daylye towne somtyme dyde nothynge somtyme chased awaye retourned domage englysshmen troubled lordes knightes poictou one agaynst another stronger ouercae wekar nother ryght lawe reason minystred parte fortress castels intermedled one within englysshe frenche eche ronnynge pyllynge eche without sparyng certayne baron knightes poyctou suche englysshe aduysed well howe forteresse mountcontour traueyled theym garyson wherfore determyned go thyder besiege made somons men warr asse ble towne poyters name seneschall poytou sir thomas percy whiche comaundement knightes squyers obeyed fyue hudred speres two thousande brigantes pauessed wt archer suche ther poictou sir guyssharde dangle sir loyes harcourt lorde parteney lorde pynan lorde tannyboton lorde cupenac ser percyuall coloyne sir godfray dangenton sir hugh wynay lorde coyes lorde puyssances sir jaques surgeres sir maubrune linyers dyuers englysshmen yt poictou ther lorde baudwyn franuyll sir dangoses sir water hewet sir richarde pontchardon whan assembled poycters redy apparelled departed toke way mountcontour well furnysshed lay siege p howe seneshall poictou toke moutcontour howe sir bertra clesquy tooke dyuers townes castels rouuergne howe besieged cytie duse cap cc lxxxx castell moutcontour standeth marchesse aniou poyctou marueylous strong fayre four lea thouars moche dyde englysshmen poite yns ye nombre thre thousande fightynge men came forteresse hadde brought theym great engyns fro thouars fro cytie poicters anone reysed vp agaynst castell whiche dyde cast nyght day castell besyde daylye assautes gyuen theym within scrimysshes ther done many noble feates armes poicteuyns ther certayne companyons wolde nat lye styll john creuell dauyd hollegraue two sir gaultyer hewet capitayns sir peter cressell jordayne coloyne within bare selfe ryght valiantly dayly came ye bar ye fought englysshmen among assautes made whiche many tenthe day come thyder made suche assaute good order clene force pearsed ye walles entred conquered frenchemen slayne within except peter jordayne fyue sire men armes taken mercy aduenture enterprise sir thomas percy sir loyes harcourt sir guy sharde dangle acorde counsayle baron knightes gaue castell sir gaultyer hewet john creswell dauyd hollegraue companyons fyue hundred fightynge men thentent kepe fronter warr agaynst aniou mayne lordes departed euery man went home owne thus forteresse mountcontour fronter abode kepynge foresayd knightes made stronge garyson well fortifyed kept long season dyde moche trouble countre ther dayly ranne outher anioweor mayne nowe lette v retourne speke sir bertram clesquy constable fraunce ye kynge paris euersyth comyng fro bridge uallant lorde clysson ouerthrowen englysshmen ye haue herd well herde howe englysshmen poictou guyen kept feldes soone candelmasse past springyng tyme began sir bertram thought reyse gather army asseble lordes knightes ryde parte lyke maner theglysshmen ryd poytou quercy rouuergue coutrees ther englysshmen dyde ryght honorably maynteyned selfe euersyth rene wyng warre also company sir johan deureur newly come countre limosyn taken auuergne castell cytie towne toguyder named duse whiche sir bertram clesquy thought ought nat suffred sayd wolde drawe part kynges lycence assembled guider great nombre men armes departed fro parys alwayes nobre encreased long constable rode cae auuergne ther ye duke berrey duke burbone erle alenson erle perche brother erle saynt poule dolphyn auuergne erle uandon erle porceen lorde sully lorde montague sir hughe dolphyne lorde beauieu lorde rochforte lorde talenson great nombre barownes knightes squyers marchesse fraunce long rode came cytie duse lodged besieged cytie lay xv dayes ther gyuen many great ferse assaut coude nat gette forteresse win ther englysshmen valyantly defeded holde frenchman departed rode farther constable pties rouuergue chefe lord went auygnon se pope gregory duke aniou anone visytacion lordes spoken duke aniou departed fro auygnon drewe agayne constable rouergue conquered townes castels thenglysshmen came towne lamulae layed siege therto whiche sir thomas ueulq fare helde hadde kept long also roche uauclere ye sayd englysshe knightes composycion yelded sir bertram dyd dyuers castels fronter limosyn whan sir bertram hadde refresshed hym toke way retourne towarde cytie duse auuergne came thyder layd siege therto thyder brought great engyns fro ryon cleremont dressed vp fortresse also apparelled maner instrumentes assautes phowe duse yelded vp sir bertram howe sir robert canoll displeasure kyng englande howe request lord peace made agayne cap cc lxxxxi whan englysshmen within cytie duse sawe order maner constable france also perfyte knoledge howe sir thoms ueulquefare departed hadde forsaken forteresse rouergue also sawe well howe co forte comyng fro parte drewe counsayle determyned yelde vp treaty none otherwyse made costable wyse poyntmentes deted without danger blame hadde wolde cary also conueyed sauegarde saynte symere lymosyn thus sir bertra wan voyage dyuers place countrees englysshmen helde retourned fraunce ye haue herde iourney yt sir robert canoll made fra ce howe retourned owne castell deruall bretayne trouthe certayne englysshmen retournyng englande enformed kynge agaynst hym kynge counsayle nat well cotent whan sir robert canoll knewe therof sende excuse hym two esquyers dyde well deuoyre kyng cou sayle parceyued well yuell falsely enformed hym well content agayne hym helpe sir alayne bouquesell knightes kyng helped excuse hym sir johan ourde bought derely taken putte execusyon openly london execusyon hym excuse yuell wordes sir robert canoll abode styll kynges grace prince phowe erle herford dyuers englysshmen discofyted bretayne lee dyuers flemynges assayled cap cc lxxxxii kyng englande seyng howe frenchemen made warr gat frendes wher coude hadde accorde duke guerles nephue duke jullyers agreed assemble toguyder certayne bre men warr entre frace season kynge englande sent erle herford knightes housholde bretayne speke ye duke certayne mater bytwene ye season flemyng englysshmen frendes mette togyder see ther flemyng lost nothynge content aduenture met eche hauyn breten called la bay emysshe nauy patron johan peterson englysshemen sir guy brian assoone mette set eche vpon ther great batayle sore erle herforde ther sir richard stury sir thomas wysque fought togyder right valyantly flemynges nobre better purueyed mater taryed long space purpose yet lytell aduantage batayle thus see endured space thre houres ther done many noble feate armes many man wounded hurt shotte hadde graped shyppes guyder hokes yron one coude nat flye fro another finally vyctorie abode thenglysshmen flemynges disconfyted sir johan peterson patron taken taken slayne none escaped englysshmen turned backe agayne englande conquest prisoner brake vp vyage tyme shewed tidynges kyng england right ioyouse adueture whan knewe flemynges gaue assaute occasyon disconfyted johan pete son sent prisone al yuers place realme p howe kyng englande sent great nauy lee agaynst flemynges peace made bytwene cap cc lxxxxiii disconfyture thus flemyng bay bretayne kyng englande sent men warr ye see agaynst flemynges commaundyng make sharpe warre agaynst flemynges kepe passage nothyng shulde coe thyder without danger whan brug ipre gaunt herde therof drewe counsayle thynges consydred ymagined thought nat profitable haue yuell wyll englande nere neyghboure susteynynge aydinge erle lorde therfore good townes sent suffycient men englande treat peace kyng counsayle spedde well retourne dyde bring peace countre flanders flemynges certayne artycles sealed bothe tie abode good state rest peace p nowe lette v lytell speke realme mayllorques p howe kynge mayllorques displeasure kyng hery spayne wet made warre kynge arragon cap cc lxxxxiiii ye haue herd rehersed howe kyng james mayllorques takenne vale olyffes castell whan kynge henry conquered agayne spa gne prisoner sayd kyng henry whan quene naples wyfe marque suster knoledge takyng sore displeased therwith prouyded remedy therfore shall shewe maner sente certayne valyant men entreat kyng ry rausome dyde moch set raunsome somme hundred thousande frankes ii ladyes payed curtesly kyng hery well content assone kyng mayllorques departed retourned naples taryed nat dyde moche golde syluer many fredes dyuers partes toke way entent make warre kyng arragon aduersary whome coude nat loue slayne father kept away herytage kyng cae auygnon pope gregory xi ther taryed moneth made complayntes suche wyse pope agreed desyre shulde make warre agaynst kyng arragon entent recouer herytage kynge prouyded men warre coude get bought derely bothe englysshe gascoyns almaygnes breton certayne copanyons wherof sir gasyen castell sir john malestroyt syluester budes jaques bray capitayns xii hundred fightyng men went forthe entred nauer taryed season consent kyng nauer entred aragon began warre agaynst kyng aragon ouer ran countre toke lytell fortress sore traueyled playne countre rau somed men toke prisoner ye kynge aragon douted greatly warre sent men warr fronters whome erle roqbertyn therle roddes capitayns whyle warre thus began cruell fell kynge james mayllorques fell sicke agayne vale sorey whiche sickenesse dyed therby arago es peace rest great season companyons made warre departed retourned fraunce thyder thought haue aduantage profyte let v speke duke lacastre p howe duke lancastre wedded theldest doughter kyng dampeter spayne howe confederacions made bitwene frenche kyng kyng spaygne cap cc lxxxxv duke johan la castre cytie burdeux garon hym dyuers barones knightes squyers acqitayne fortune stode metely well englysshe parte howe beit dyuers baron p tou limosyn tourned fre che partie made often yssues ry mysshes agaynst enemyes duke lancastre wydower without wife good lady blanche lancastre derby disceassed barones gascoyne consydred kynge dampeter castell two doughters first wyfe suster ye kyng portyngale cytie gascoyne thyder brought see kept certayne knightes fro party cyuell doute kyng henry assone knewe dethe father two ladyes dysconsolate great trouble great pite trewe herytoursto castell ryght successyon kyng dapeter father whiche mater sir guyssharde dangle shewed duke sayng thus sir like ye mary knewe wher great maryage wherby heyre shal kyng castell also great almesse confort maydens bistresse specially doughters kyng beyng case sir faythfull seruantes wolde cousayle take theldest wyfe nat tell wher ye shulde well maryed agayne moche prosyte shulde come therby uhese word entred duke hert well pleased hym well content send two ladyes theldest called costance isabell sent four knightes ther spedde iourney brought sayd lady whan duke knewe comyng rode burdeaur mete lytell fro burdeaur vyllage called rochsort maryed eldest called constance whiche daye maryage ther great feest great bre lordes ladyes thanne duke brought wyfe burdeux agayne great feest ioy made good lady suster greatly feested ther ladyes damosel burdeux gyuen great gyftes fayre presentes loue duke uhe tidynges came castell kynge henry baron realm alyed fay homage howe nese maryed duke lancastre also enformed yonger shulde wedded erle cambridge whan duke retourned englande wherof kyng henry ryght sore displeased called counsayle toguyder counsayled hym shulde sende great messangers frenche kynge treate hym whiche counsayle kynge agreed sente wyse sufficyent personage fraunce departed dyde moche iourneys came cytie parys wher foude kyng receyued great ioye feest bytwene kyng counsaylours kyng henry hadde procuracyons sealed treate procede cause name lorde plyament treaty counsayle secrete otherwise take effect finally season ther corded ordayned confyrmed alyaunces confederacions right great large sworne eply bothe party holde fermly nat breke agaynst maner way two kyng abyde fermly vnyte peace loue alyace frenche kyng sware worde kyng wolde ayde helpe kyngs castell busynesse make maner peace acorde kyng englande shulde comprised treaty sir bertram clesquy helped greatly loued enterely kynge henry thynges confyrmed agreed embassadours departed retourned spaygne founde lorde lyon spaygne right ioyouse comynge home well sped reason alyaunce kyng ry thought hymselfe better assured conforted p howe duke lacastre ordayned gouernours guyen ledde wyfe hym englande howe kyng englande ordayned erle penbroke gouernour poitou ca c c lxxxxvi nowe let v retourne ye duke lancastre cyte burdeux feest saynt mychaell thought tourne englande better enforme kynge father besynesse acquitayne lytell depture ordayned therfore assembled cytie burdeux barownes knightes guyen englysshe shewed purposed retourne englande certayne mater profyte theym countre acquitayne next somer wolde come thyder agayne yf kynge father pleased wordes pleased duke ordayned lorde captall beufez lorde musydent lorde lespare gouernours countre gascoyne englysshe poytou ordayned gouernours sir loyes harcourt lorde parteney xaynton sir loyes dargentou sir wyllyam moutendre left seneschal offycers ordayned shulde go duke englande certayne person gascoyne xaynton poictou shewe kyng england state besynesse aquitayne sir guyssharde dangle lorde pynan sir aymery tarse abyue theym duke taryed certayne space whan redy apparelled entred shyppes hauyn burdeux duke departed great company men armes archer threscore vessel company purueyauce ledde hym wyfe suster spedde well see good wynde arryued hampton england yssued shyppes entred towne ther rested space two dayes departed rode wyndsore kynge receyued duke sonne ladyes damosel knyghtes stranger great feest specially gladde se ser guysshard dangle pthe season dyed gentyll knyght sir gaultier manny cytie london wherof barones englande right sorie trouthe good cou sayle alwayes sene herde buryed great solempnyte monastery charterhouse besyde london ye day obsequy kyng chyldren prelate banrons knightes englande landes bothe englande beyonde see fell erle johan penbroke hadde wyfe lady anne doughter heyre erle penbroke sent entre lande fallen heynault ii knightes dyde well deuor duke aubert helde erldome heynalt rule atteyned purpose wynter ther dyuers counsayls englande among lord state realme howe shulde tayne warr next somer folowynge entet make two viages one guyen france calys way kyng sought frendes party aswell almayne ye march empyre wher gate dyuers knightes squyers acorde also made marueylous great apparell hoost lyke nat ben often sene freche kyng knowlege secretes purpose whervpon toke counsayle made prouisyon fortifyed cyties townes castels pycardy sette euery place great garysons men warre thentent defende countre fro mysaduenture whan somer come kyng edwarde england hadde holden feest solemnyte saynt george wyndsore vsage yerely ser guyssharde dangle entred fraternyte kyng chyldren baron englande whiche called fraternyte knight blue garter kyng went lodon palays westmynster great cousayle orderyng realme bycause duke lancastre shulde season passe fraunce playnes pycardy erle cambridge kyng desyre sir guyssharde da gle poyton ordayned erle penbroke shulde go poictou vysyte countre make warre agaynst frenchman syde gascoyns poicteuyns requyred kyng letter mouthe sir guyssharde da gle wolde nat send sonnes wolde sende erle penbroke whoe greatly loued desyred haue knewe good knight hardy kyng englande sayd erle pe broke baron knyghtes ther assembled counsayle john fayre sofie ordayne go poictou company sir guyssharde dangle ther ye shall souerayne gouernour men warre ye fynde wherof great pletie surely enformed also theym gothe erle kneled downe kyng sayd sir thanke grace highe honoure ye putte sir shall gladly seruice one leest marshal thus brake vp counsayle kynge retourned wyndsore sir guyssharde dangle hym spake hym often tymes besynesse poicton guyen sir guyssharde sayd sir assoone lorde erle penbroke one arryued shall make good warre shall nombre foure fyue hundred speares obeyng may well payed wage kyng answered sir guysshard care nothyng hanyng golde syluer whan ye come make warr withall haue ynoughe well content enploy marchandyse sythe toucheth realme phowe erle penbroke departed englande go poyctou howe spanyerdes fought hauyn rochell cap c c lxxxxvii thus suche wordes kynge past tyme often wt sir guysshard dagle loued trusted reason season cae therle pebroke shulde departe tooke leaue kyng company ser others grauntson ordayned go hym great company hym certayne knyghtes enformacyon sir guissharde dangle suche certayne somme money pay wag thre thousande men warre soo made spede tyll came hampton taryed xv dayes abydinge wynde wynde wyll entred ito shippes deted fxo hauyn ye name god saynt george toke course towarde poitou kyng charles frauce knewe te cousell england ca nat tell howe whoe knewe well sir guysshard dagle gone england thetent get kyng good capitayne coutre poytou also knew howe therle penbroke shulde go thyder charge frenche kyng well aduysed therof secretly sent army men warre see spanyerdes desyre bycause owne men gone kyng ry castell bycause confederacyon alyaunce bytwene spanyerves fourtie gret shyppes xiii barkes well purueyed decked spaynysshe shyppes soueraynes patrones flete four valyaut capitayns ambrose de boucquenegre cabesse de uacadent ferrant de pyon radygo de la rochell spanyerdes lyen great space ancre thesce abydinge retournyng poicteuyns comyng therle pe broke knewe well howe entetes come poitou therfore lay ancre towne rochell happed day vigyll saynt johan baptyst yere lorde god iii hundred lxxii erle penbroke copany shulde arryue hauyn rochell founde foresayde spaignyerdes lette arryuyng gladde theyr comynge whanne englysshemen poicteuyns sawe spaignyerdes ther parceyued howe must nedes fight conforted themselfe howbeit nat agally matched nother men shyppes howe armed putte selfe good order archer redy fight tha spaynisshe shyppes well prouyded great nombre men warre brigantes arbalasters gones great barres yron plomettes leed cast downe anone began aproche makyng great noyse great shyppes spaygne toke wynd fetche tourne englysshe shyppes whome lytell feaced came full sayle thus beginnyng ther great cry noyse one englisshmen bare selfe right well erle pebroke made certayne squyers knightes honour ther great batayle harve englysshmen hadde ynough spanyerdes great shyppes hadde great barres yron great stone dyde cast downe perse englysshe shyppes hurte therwith many man right yuell amonge knyghtes englande poictou great noblenesse knight hode prowes shewed erle pe broke fought receyued enemyes ryght fersly dyde day many noble feat armes owne handes lyke maner dyde sir othes grautson sir guissharde da gle lorde pynan knight p howe rochell towne wolde nat socour erle penbroke howe seueschall rochell lorde tanyboton came socour hym cap cc lxxxxviii haue herde reported theym ye batayle englysshmen poyctenyns desyred greatly coquer laude prayse armes neuer men dyde valyantly fewe people regarde de also farr lasse nombre shyppes lesse quantyte therfore myght well marueyled howe endured long noble knightode reconforted helde strength hadde ben lyke shyppes spanyerdes hadde taken lytell aduauntage helde selfe close toguyder none durst abyde stroke withoute well armed pauessed castyng downe plommes leed great stone barres yron hurte troubled theym marueylously sore hurt wounded dyuers knightes squyers people towne rochell sawe well batayle neuer auaunsed come helpe erle penbroke company valyantly fought ennemyes dyde lette alone thus batayle stryfe endured tyll night departed eche fro cast ancres first day englysshmen lost ii barge laded uisyon within putte dethe night sir johan hardan seneshall rochell made gret desyres towne mayre johan chaudron shulde arme cause armed cominalte towne entre barge shyppes go ayde cofort company day valiantly fought ennemyes towne hadde wyll mater excused selfe sayd ynough kepe towne menne see wyst nat howe fight spanyerdes see yf batayle lande sayd wold gladly go forthe seneschall coude nat get forthe nothynge coude tyme within ye towne ther lorde tanyboton sir jaques surge re sir maubrune linyers also desyred theym towne go forthe whan sawe request coude nat auayle foure knightes went armed copany suche wolde go forthe whiche small nombre entred four barkes brekynge daye whan fludde came wente company gaue great thanke commynge wed vnto erle penbroke vnto sir guyssharde dangle howe towne rochell wolde nat come forthe helpe ayde socour hym company erle answered sayd well must behoue v abyde grace god ye adueture fortune trustyng one fynde season cause rochell repent vnkynde dealyng p erle penbroke taken prisoner disconfyted spanierdes howe departed fro hauyn rochell theyr prisoner day captall beutz came rochell cap cc lxxxxix whan day come ye fludde began spanyerdes wayed vp ancres makyng great noise trumpettes sette selfe good order dyde ye day furnysshed great shyppes fulle men warre toke aduauntage mynde close englysshe shyppes nothynge nombre spanyerdes foresayd foure patrones spanyerd came good order englysshemen poyctenyns sawe well order drewe togyder set archer therwith came spanyerdes full sayle began feirse cruell batayle spanyerdes cast great hooke yron graped shyppes toguyder englysshe shyppes coude nat parte erle penbroke sir guyssharde dangle ther xxii knightes right valiantly fought suche weapens hadde thus fightyng contynued longe space howe beit spanyerdes hadde great aduauntage englysshmen great shyppes caste downe great barres yron stone whiche sore traueyled englysshmen thus cryeng showtynge fightynge eche endured tyll thre clocke ther neuer men endured traueyle see tha englysshemen dyde day moost parte men sore hurte castynge barres yron stone plomettes leed sir aymery tharse ye valyant knight gascoyne ther stayne also sir john lantonne knight body erle penbroke erles shyp ther fastened four great shyppes wherof cabesse wakadent dom ferant de pyon gouernours many good fightyng men dyd moche entred erles shyppe done many feate armes ther therle taken shyp taken slayne first ther takenne knightes sir robert bufforce sir johan cursone sir johan grimyers slayne sir saymon houssagre sir john mortayne sir johan couchette fought styll poictenyns sir guyssharde dangle lorde pynan lorde canyboton dyuers knyghtes copany another shyppe sir othes grautson ambrose boucquenegre radygo rochell takenne spanyerdes none scaped outher taken slayne whan taken chefe maysters left slayeng seruauntes maysters desyred wolde forbere theym sayeng howe wolde pay suche lyke danger erle penbroke sir guyssharde dangle shulde fayne take aduenture god wolde sende besyde losse many good knyghtes squyers takenne slayne day kyng englande lost greattest losse disconfyture lost hole coutre ye shall herafter history p shewed thenglysshe shyp wherin treysure richesse wher sir guyssharde dagle shuld haue payed soudyers wage guyen perysshed drowned therin nothyng therof came profyte day whiche vigyll saynt johan baptyst night next daye tyll noone spanyerdes lay styll ancre rochell makyng great ioye tuned well knight poictou called ser jaques surgeres spake swetely fayre mayster quyt ye payeng thre c frakes cae salt john day dyner towne rochell ther knowen ye iorney spedde slayne taken dyuers burgess towne shewed semblant howe sorie displeased howbeit dede right ioyouse neuer naturally loued englysshemen whan oone past saynt johans day tyde came thespanyerdes wayed vp ancres spred seales departed makyng great noyse trumpettes mynstrelsies long stremers wauynge wynde beaten armes castell penous standerdes great pleasure beholde thus case departed toke ther course towardes galyce daye saynt johan ther came rochell great bre men armes gascoyns englysshe nat herde aduenture knewe well spanyerdes lay lyen longe space hauyn rochell therfore came thyder conforte yd towne men warr gascoyns ther captall beufz ser beras de la launde sir peter landuras sir soudyc sir bertram de franke englysshmen ther sir thomas percy sir richarde pontchardon sir wyllm ferryton sir dangoses sir baudwyn frauyll sir water hewet sir johan deureur whan lordes copany nombre sire hundred men armes coe rochell towne made good chere outwarde bycause durst none otherwyse enformed sir jaques surgeres batayle spanyerdes see shewed theym howe selfe batayle taken raunsomed tidynges barones knightes ryght sorie displeased reputed theym selfe right vnfortunat nat ben ther complayned greatly losse erle pebroke sir richard da gle thus taryed rochell nat say howe longe take counsayle aduyse howe shulde maynteyne forthe warr p nowe lette v leaue lytell whyle speke lette v speke sir yuan wale howe dyde season p howe ir yuan wale discofited thenglisshmen yle gernsay howe frenche kyng sent spayne men warr lay sege rochell cap ccc yua wale son prince wale kynge edwarde put dethe ca nat say cause gaue principalyte sone made hym prince wale yuan came fraunce complayned kyng charles fraunce iniuryes kynge englande done hym slayeng father takyng away rytage frenche kyng retayned aduaunsed greatly made gouernour certayn men warr somer kyng delyuered four thousande fightyng men sent see toke shippyng harflewe sayled forthe towarde englande came theyle gern say agaynst normady wherof aymon rosse squyer honour kyng england capitayne whan knewe frenchman aryued yle yuan wale nothynge content made somons yle nat great quantyte assembled owne yle nombre viii hundred came certayne place ther fought ye sayd yuan sore batayle endured along space howe beit finally englysshmen disconfyted flayne place mo four hudred aymon fled away el ben deed taken saued selfe moche payne entred lytell castell two leages then called cornette whiche aymon well fortifyed disconfytur sayd yuan drewe togyder men hadde knowledge howe aymon entred castell cornette drewe thyder layd siege therto made dyuers assautes castell strong well purueyed good artyllary nat easy wonne duryng siege cornette aduentur fell see takyng erle penbroke sir guyssharde dangle company rochell ye haue herde whiche tidynges whan french kyng herde therof right ioy ouse entended thereby rather pursue warre poictou thought yf englysshmen began one lytell declyne lightly cyties townes wolde gyue vp rendre theselfe frenche kynge desermyned poyctou xaynton rochelloyse wolde sende season constable thyder certayne men armes make hote warr countrees bothe lande see sayenge englysshmen ther capttayne chefe ruler frenche kynge sent letter sayd yua lay sege castell cornet yle gernsay whiche siege kyng well enformed howe castellby lykelyhod preignable therfore kyng commauded hym sight letter dete breke vp siege entre shyppe whiche kyng sent hym purpose sayle spayne kyng henry gette hym barkes galeys admyrall men warre come lay siege see towne rochell whan sayd yuan sawe kynges message co maudement obeyed therto brake vp siege gaue leaue company departe delyuered shyppes bring harflewe himselfe entred great shyppe toke course towarde spayne thus befell siege cornette yle gernsay p howe kyng englande sore displeased takyng therle penbroke sir bertram clesquy toke castell mount morillon cap ccc kyng england sore displeased wha herde army sent poictou ouerthrowen spanyerdes see wer suche loued hym coude nat de tyme tha sage therealme thought surely countre poictou xaynton likely lost reason sayd mysse happe shewed kyng duke lancastre long counsayle mater determyned erle salysbury fyue hundred men armes shulde go thyder uer yle aduyse taken ther nothyng done came busyness hande bretayne letted iourney wher kyng repented whan coude nat remedy spanyerdes taken erle penbroke ye haue herd taryed certayne space see bycause wynde contrary howbeit last arryued porte saynt andrewe galyce entred towne noone brought prisoner castell bounde cheanes yron acordyng custome courtesy nat shewe like vnto almaynes day yuan wale arryued shyppe porte toke lande entred house wher domferant pyon cabesse wakadent brought erle penbroke knightes shewed yuan chambre howe englysshemen house prisoner yuan great desyre se knowe went forthe hall went thyder encountred erle penbroke whome knewe ryght well yet nat often sene tha sayd reproch erle pebroke ye come countre homage suche landes ye holde principalyte wale wherof rightfull heyre whiche kynge hath taken fro yuell counsayle aduyse erle penbroke abasshed whan sawe prisoner strange land knowyng nat man spake hym language answered shortely sayd gyue langage yuan sonne prince aymon wale whome kyng englande put dethe wrongfully hath disheryted whan may helpe right dere lorde frenche kyng shall shape therfore remedy wyll ye knowe may fynde place conuenyent may fyght shall right ye haue done also erle herforde edward speser father counsaylours lorde father trayed wherof ought displeased amende whan maye stepte forthe knight erles called sir thomas sait speke sayd yuan maynteyne hath ben lorde oweth shulde owe homage cast downe gage quarell ye shall fynde hun shall take vp thanyuan answered sayd ye prisoner haue none honour apele ye haue nat rule yourselfe ye vnder rule haue taken whan ye quyte shall speke mater shall nat rest thus tho word certayne knight spaygne came bytwene departed sondre wtin whyle sayd capites ledde prisoner toward cytie burg spayn yelde kyng henry byding whan kyng henry knewe comyng aproched nere cytie sent eldest sonne called johan called chylde castell great nombre knight squyers mete englysshmen theym honoure king knewe tight well aparteyned noblenesse wha come dyde moche honour bothe word dedes anone kyng sent dyuers te realme kept howe let v retourne busynesse poitou ye nat lytell let v speke gascoyns englysshe knightes saynt john day nyght came towne rochell ye haue herd weresore displeased yt cae nat day haue bene batayle haue ought spanyerdes tha toke counsayle thyng best great dout rochell ordayned sir johan deureux seneshall rochell thre hudred men warr kepe ye towne thought longe strong ynough towne durst nat rebell order taken captall beufz chefe gouernoure company sir thomas percy sir dangoses sir richarde pontchardon souldyche sir bereas de la la de companyes departed fro rochell nombre foure hundred speares toke way subyze ther certayne bre helde church small forteresses fortifyed soone lordes came thyder draue away wanne holdes rydde clene marchesse season kepte feldes marchesse aniou auuerne berrey constable fraunce duke berrey duke burbone erle ale son dolphyn auuergne ser loys sa xere lorde clysson lorde de la uale vycount rohan lorde beaumanoyre great nobre barony fra ce nombre thre thousande speres rode long tyll assembled togyder constable poyctou layd siege castell called mountmorillon assaut wan slewe euer wer within newe manned frenchman went chauigny stadynge ryuer cruse beseged ther lay two dayes thirde day place yelded vp within taken mercy rode came luzat wher ther towne castell also yelded vp without abyding assaute went cytie poicters lay one night without amonge vynes wherof cytie sore abasshed douted siege howe beit hadde none tyme next mornyng frenchman departed went castell moncoutour wherof john cresuell dauyd holegraue capitayns vnder threscore hardy valyant men warre greatly constrayned march aniou thourayne freche garysons wherfore costable sayd wolde nat dete then tyll pleasure p howe constable fraunce besieged mountcomptour howe departed then go duke berrey limosyn besege saynt seuere cap ccc ii costable france ye sayd lordes knyghtes rode long thei cae castell montcountour sixe leages fro poycters whan come thyder layd siege therto assayled valyantly bycause dyke brode caused tymbre wode cutte downe villayns countrey brought thyder cast dike fyll cast strawe erthe theron four dayes fylled dyke might ease go ye walles made sore assaut within defended selfe valyantly whiche great nede great parell takyng howe valyant good warr kepte selfe place moche payne hurt day sirt day costable breton came agayne assaut pauesses pykes matock handes pearsed walles dyuers place within weresore basshed howbeit defeded selfe valiatly euer men dyde john cresuell dauyd holegraue capitayns ymagyned consydred parell parceyued howe constable co pany nat mynde det tyll wonne castell sawe well yf taken force shulde dye also parceyued howe cofort comynge fro parte wherfore thynges cosydred entred treaty yelde vp selfe lyues goodes saued constable wolde lengar greue company sore oppresse castell bycause sawe well valyant men armes contente shulde departe without hurte bodyes toke goodes except golde syluer departed coueyed poicters thus constable castell montcountour newe fortifyed taryed space refresshe company bycause wyst nat whyder drawe poicters place whan cyte poicters knewe howe constable breton wonne agayne castell montcountoure abashed tha sent incontynent messangers sir thomas percy seneshall rydynge copany captall sir thomas percy knewe tidynges sir johan deureur castell rochell enformed howe constable fra ce hadde ben poicters aduysed place whersore thought verely shulde besieged also herde howe seneschall nat wherfore thought wolde go conforte poicters departed fro rochell fyftie speares sette squyer called pbylpot maseyle capitayne tyll retourne agayne rode poiters entred cytie wherof within thanked greatly tidynges came sir thoms percy captall men cytie poicters desyringe coe feared siege layed wolde bring moche helpe ayde coulde certifyenge hym howe frenchman stronge sir thomas shewed tidynges captall entent knowe wolde say therto captall sayde wolde take aduyse mater aduise taken nat de myned breke owne iourney mater gaue leaue ser thoms percy departe fro hym dyde rode poicters wher receyued great toye towne great lye desyred presens ther founde sir johan deureux eche made great shewed constable styll montcountoure howe poicters newly refresshed men warre season came knowlege howe duke berrey great nombre men warre auuergne berrey burgoyne marchesse lymosyn fully determyned lay seige saynt seuere limosyn whiche parteyned sir john deureux capitayns therof vnder hym sir wyllyam percy rycharde gylle richarde horne acertayne nombre good men warr hadde ouerronne countre auuergne limosyn done moche yuell wherfore duke berrey determyned drawe thyder sent desyred constable myght wyse come hym sayd entent constable wyse subtell knight ded consydred well yt lay siege poicters shulde lytell auayle seyng cyte newe refresshed men warre wherfore sayde wolde drawe duke berrey departed fro moncoutour host ordred kepyng garyson rode forthe tyll came duke berrey thaked moche comyng copany great hoost whan bothe hoostes assembled togyder toue toguyder tyll came saynt seuere well four thousande men armes belieged garyson determyned nat departe then tyll hadde fetrsly assayled sir wyllm percy valiantly defended fortresse twdynges came cycle poycters sir john deureur lorde saynt seuere howe duke berrey doulphyn auuergne costable fraunce lorde clysson vicount rohan foure thousande men armes besieged fortresse saynt seuer limosyn wherof sir johan deureur right pensyue sayd syr thomas percy present report makyng sir thomas ye se nelhall countrey haue great puyssaunce sir requyre helpe socour men lost haue helpe sit quod gladde wold synde remedy loue wyll departe go let v go speke lorde caprall beufz nat farre hen let v best moue hym go helpe reyse siege fight frechmen departed fro poicters left kepyng cytie mayre called johan reynalt good trewe iuste man long rode toygder founde captall feldes ridyng towarde saynt john dangle two knyght shewed hym howe frenchman taken mountmorillon besyde poietres also strong castell montcountour siege saynt seuere parteyning sir johan deureur also shewed hym howe sir wyllm percy within castell gylle richard horne men lost captall studyed lytell wordes answered sayd thynke best shulde cousayle ther dyuers knight called answered sayd sir hath ben great season haue herde say ye desyre greatly fight frenchman sir ye nat better fynde nowe therfore sir drawe thyder sende comaundement poictou amou shalbe men ynowe fight good wyll haue therto faythe captall cotent shall shortely fight grace god saynt george contynet captall sent letter baron knightes squyers poictou xaynton prayeng straitly comaundynge come hym certayne place lymytted suche comaundemet came vnto came towarde captall hast coude lorde partney sir loys harcourt sir hugues uynou sir perciuall colen sir amery rochchoart sir jaques surgeres sir geffray argeton lorde puissance lorde rosyllon lorde campenac sir john dangle sir wyllyam mo tender dyuers whan wer assembled togyder nyne hundred speares tyue hundred archer p howe saynt seuere endutyng great assaut yelded vp sir bertram clesquy cytie poicters tourned theselfe frenche cap c c c iii tidyndes came hoste saynt seuer sir bertra clesquy lord howe thenglisshmen poicteuyus aproched fast warde thentent reyse siege whan constable herd comaunded euery man harnesse go feirsly assaut none disobeyed commaudement cam frenchman breton forteresse well armed pauessed began great assaute euery lorde vnder owne baner shuld say gret beauty beholde ther xlix baners great nombre penons costable sir loys sarere mat shall greatly traueyling encorage men thassaut aduaused forthe knightes squiers nacions encrease honour dyde marueyls marmes passed clene dyke full water cae walles coulde within wolde nat recule backe euer went forward dyke duke berrey duke borbone erle alenson dolphyn auuergne great lordes couragyng people bycause great lordes behelde euery man auaused hym selfe wyllingly nat doutyng parell dethe sit willyam percy two squyers honour capitayns fortresse sawe well fersly assayled without rest contynue nat possyble kepe place also sawe conforte mynge theym warde parte knewe none frendes nere space x leages therfore entred treaty constable eschewyng gretter domage howe sir bertram cosstable well enformed howe nyght shulde tydinges thenglysshmen therfore agreed soner castell receyued sauynge lyues entred fortresse great ioy made great feest caused company drawe felde sette ordre batayle redy fight sayd sir auyse well enemyes aprocheth fast thynke yet nyght shall haue batayle therfore let euery man make hym redy howbeit englysshmen made great ha whan knewe saynte seuere taken p nowe lette v speke poicters howe maynteyned themselfe season fell poicters great discencyon among themselfe thre partes towne wolde gladly haue tourned frenche john reynalt mayre towne parte come tie wolde abyde styll englysshe howbeit rychest burgess churche wherof great pletie wolde wyse constable france shulde sent sent secretly hym shulde come hastelye take possessyon cytie promysed open gate agaynst wherfore co able right ioyouse shewed mater duke berrey duke burbone agreed constable shulde depart fro thehoost thre hundred best horsed men company departed rode say night folowyng lytell rest xxx leages nother way englysshmen kepte mornyngethey arryued poitres founde gate open redy shulde receyue hadde taryed lengar space leage ridyng come late john reynalt suche part sent hast sir john ubrues sir johan percy hundred speares hubre archer redy within leage cytie f takynge thus good cytie poicters knight squyers gascone poictou england sore abasshed suche assembled toguyder ther poyctou nombre viu c speares four hudred archer drewe cou sayle determyne howe ruled sawe well greate parell wyll nat well whome put trust barownes knyghtes poycton spake worde conforte englysshmen sayd surely sir greatly displeaseth v besy ness countrey nat amede sir suertie longe endure house fortresse poycton may drawe shall true faythfull naturall lorde kyng englande englyss knightis ther sayd sir specy trust dye quarell ye shall fynde v euer true companyons thus felde ther great cousell among thynges consydred determyned poicteuyns shulde drawe gyder one way englysshmen nother way ther depted right amiably eche fro say lorde pertenay lorde thouars rosilly sir aymery rochchoart john dangle loyes harcourt percyuall coloyne capitayn thowars hughe briane reynalte thouars wylliam capenac jaques surgeres knightes toke way thouars englysshmen say sir johan ubrues sir richard pontchardon thomas percy dangoses geffray dargenton mathewe fonques thomas gourney water hewet johan cresuell toke way nyorth wher thought haue entred without let whan came thyder founde gate shyt bridgs drawen towne sayd howe surely shulde nat entre drewe togyder counsayle determyned nat suffre dealyng good aray assayled towne within defe ded howebeit ther within gentylman wyst warrement conquered englysshmen coulde haue kept towne agaynst yll ben night ben greatly conforted constable fraunce sente thyber thybalt pount two hundred men haue refresshed towne beit came late towne taken assaute robbed great nombre men woman slayne abode styll englysshmen harken newes p howe frenchman toke captall beufz soubise batayle howe rochell tourned frenche cap ccc iiii whyle thenglisshmen nyorth durst nat well dete sondre cae rochell yuan wale copany ye admyrall king hery spayn called dapradigo de roux hym xl great shippes viii galys full men warr layd selfe towne maner stege none coude yssue entre without daunger within rochell seyng theself nat well assured fell treaty priuely yuan wale admyrall spayne agreed yt within woute shulde nat trouble vexe eche styll spanyerdes frenchman lay towne ancre spy abrode ye countre poitou xayn ton knowe se done euery place capitayne castell rochell called philippe mansell constable frauce poicters sent lorde pouns thybault du pont thre hudred speares castell soubise whiche stronge stadyng see syde open ye mouthe tharent see gyueth win castell lady therof great copany men warr howbeit sent squier socour john granuyll captall beufz costable acqtayne saynt john dagle contynent soone worde therof sent sir henry hay seneshall angoleme sir wylliam lorde marnell nephue sir raymond marnell johan cresuell syr thomas percy incontynent came hym assemble ordynauce ye siege yuan wale enformed therof lay rochell toke four c speares moost speciallest surest men warr company dyde put thre barge departed hym selfe sir james mount ye morellette brother lefte radigo de rouxe admyrall spayne styll resydue company rowed secretely towarde soubise arryued syde right agaynste lorde pouns knewe nothynge busshement nomore dyde captall made asseble saynt john dangle knowen therof wolde haue taken hym gretter copany dyde sent backe great parte co pany left another parte within towne saynt johans dangle departed two hudred speares mo rode longe nyght tyme came nere hoost frenchman nere castell soubise alighted besyde lytell wode rested lytell horse selfe mouted agayne displayed baners penons sodenly dasshed ye frenche hoost makyng cryes ther sore scrimysshe many man slayne sore hurt frenchman nat ware taken lorde pons thybault pount lx best company put slight tha yuan wale came rout passed tharent barge brought theym great nombre tortches fagottes ablementes fyre night darke four hundred speres fresshe men lusty dasshed among theglysshmen gascons thought clene acheued enterprise spred brode nat togyder aboute pyllage takynge hede prisoner clene force beten downe within shorte space disconfyted auaused forthe hardy squyer uermadoyse called peter danyels aproched nere captall beufz toke prisoner clene feat armes whiche captall knyght gascon englande frenche kynge frechmen desired haue bycause ryght hardy good capitayne also taken ser thoms percy preest wale called sir dauy also taken sir henry hay sir more lyne dyuers sir water huetscaped moche payne sir petyton corton sir wylliam ferencon carmyll fled towarde towne soubyse hadde socour lady soubyse barryers caused gate opened entred dyuers next daye yuan wale brought barge shyppes soubise gaue feirse assaut also dyde lorde pons thybalte pont taken rescued howbeit within towne defended selfe right valiantly lady sawe well towne nat strong ynough endure long space agaynst hope socour seyng ye captall taken prisoner tha called knyghtes counsell toke suche aduyse sent treat frenchman treaty toke effect suche knight within towne might det pleasur wout domage drawe niorth xaintes lusygnen whyder soeuer pleased lady soubise put selfe vnder obeysance frenche kyng lande thus deted thenglysshmen fro soubyse brought sauegard whider pleased tha frechmen toke possessyon towne fealtie lady sware fro then forth obey french kyng land yuan wale ser james moutioy copany toke shyppes brought captall prisoner great shippes yt lay styll rochell lorde pons breton hasted greatly ryde great copany suche costable frauce sent vycont rohan lord clysson torayne beaumanoyre rochfort sir wyllm bord olyuer many reynalt limosyn geffray ricon yon lanconet alayne saynt poule carsuell dyuers cae towne johan dangle made great assemblant assaut within towne sawe howe countre began fast lost chefe capiten taken prisoner sawe socour fro te yelded vp became french breton rode augolesme lykewise turned french tie dyd talybourge cae xayntes lay two dayes capiten therof called fere con sayd wolde nat yelde vp lightly made good seblaut defece within towne bysshop therof good french turned cytezins toke capitayne sayd wolde e hym without wolde cosent yelde vp towne french feare agreed might det quyte clere dyde frenchman toke possession cyte castell xaintes sir willm ferecon coueyed burdeur p rochell lay styll ancre yuan wale copany dapradigo rour admyrall spayne xl great shipp iii barge viii galys spayne great treaty bytwene towne without howbeit coude nat turne french long castell englysshe possessyon englysshme wherfore helde styll dissimulyng theglyshmen tyll euer lytell lytell thenglysshmen deted lorde deureux left garyson kepynge squyer called philyp mansell hym aboute hundred copanyons one burges mayre towne called john caudrer day assembled togiderte wyllinge becoe frenche rather englysshe sayd vnto sir se dayly howe neighbour turne frenche feare lest shortly shalbe enclosed shall nat knowe way styrre yssue towne therfore good tymes toke hede might get ye castell often tymes hath done v trouble displeasur nowe easely kept philyppe mansell nat greatly ingenyous shall shewe hym haue receyued comaudement fro kyng englande co teyning howe shulde cause men towne armed coe place shall name take muster vieu nombre also castell write agayne certetie therof kyng therby shall comaund hym kynges name come castell make muster beleue wyll lightly let v well prouyded busshment two hundred men harnesse lyeng amonge olde walles without castell whan castell yssued lette steppe forthe bytwene bridge whiche wyll auayled downe lette v redy furnysshe oure enterprise shall take pleasure therby shall haue bothe castell agreed purpose seuered purpose longe tyll mayre chefe enterprise day desyred philippe mansell come dyner dyuers great burgess suche englysshe parte made great dyner talked dyuers mater par taynynge kyng englande dyuer mayre brought letter sealed kynges great seale cause philippe mansell beleue hym better coulde nat rede knewe well seale mayre redde lettre pleased wyse written mayre sayd philippe sir yese kyng souerayne lorde hath commaunded also shulde comaunde name ye make morowe mustres lyke wise shall thought none yuell sayd cotent departed nyght day mayre toke two hundred men put busshment nere ye castell among olde walles ther mornyng mayre caused ye watche bell sow ned euery man towne armed philyppe mansell lykewyse caused within ye castell armed wherof ther l sufficient able men warr yssued castell wha one past busshement stepte forthe bytwene ye bridge thenglysshmen englysshmen sawe well betrayed ranne busshment haue goten agayne thentre castell mayre came incontynent comynaltie towne nombre ii men englisshmen assayled bothe behynd taken fayne yeloe sauyng lyues howbeit yet towne nat ye castell thenglysshmen lefte xii company styll within castell drawen vp agayne bridge tha mayre cae philippe ther capitayne company sayde sir harken say vnto without ye yelde vp incotynent castell heedes shall stryken bridge fote englysshmen answered sayd wolde best power delyuer castell went spake ye castell agreed delyuer vp castell condycion within castell also suche taken shulde put shyppe co ducted saue garde mayre burgess rochell cytie burdeur thus agreed rochell castell assone duk berrey bur bone burgoyne marshall sanrere bycont rohan lordes sully pons clysson beaumanoyre dyuers baron frauce herde tidynges departed fro berrey fro marchesse l osyn aniou determyned drawe towarde poicters constable fraunce goyng thyderward lordes toke way poictou towne called saynt maxat whiche yelded assoone euer came thyder castell taken assaut within ssayne tooke castell marle thane castell dowaye dyuers forteresses founde waye whan come poiters sent certayne messangers treat burgess rochell howe beit towne wolde nat open gate let lordes sayd wolde nat yelde vp sone howbeit sayd wolde please ye duke berrey lordes send saue coduct coe poiters wtinsixe dayes wolde bring hole mynd behalfe frenche messangers retourned lordes shewed mynde town rochell coduct grauted poycters went certayne burgess rochell sayd lordes fra ce well content vnder frenche kynge myght caste downe castell erthe ther beneuet castell made condicy towne rochell rochellois shulde euer vnder resort demayne ye frenche kyng neuer put away maryage maner peace may happe come realme france euer codycion also towne haue mynt forge money bothe whyte blacke forme alay parys lordes frauce wolde nat agre tyll knewe frenche kynges pleasure behalfe lord gaue saue conduct rochell go kynge knowe pleasur xii burgess towne went parys kyng accorded desyre feested greatly gaue great gyftes whan retourned rochell shewed charter sealed kynge confyrmed chabre kyng peeres frauce incotynent beaten rased downe erthe great castell rochell sent ye great lordes frauce poicters shulde come rochell wolde set open gate thyder came constable fraunce two hundred men armes hym receyued great ioye hym dyde feaultie homage frenche kynge good procuracion fro frenche kyng receyue kynge hadde stablysshed hym party p ardye representyng owne body p howe sir bertram clesquy co stable frauce toke dyuers castels rochelloys howe kynge england toke see come reise sege thouars cap ccc v whan constable fraunce sir bertram clesquy four dayes ye towne rochell shewed towne shuld ordre theselfe then forwarde departed went poycters foresayd duke lordes went felde conquere certayne fortress ye march rochell ye nombre thre thousand speares departed fro poyctres went besteged castell benon whiche fayre castell stronge sayde wolde nat departe then tyll pleasure castell capitayn vnder captall benon squier countie foiz called wyllm pons hym knyght naples named sir james ye frenche lordes made dyuers assautes within defended theselfe right valyauntly nat farre thers fortresse surgeres wherin certayne englysshmen kept vnderthe captall euennyng sayd wolde go wake frenche hoost soo ther rode forthe xl speares ye sent fro marant came sovenly constable lodgynge dyde hurte dyuers men specially ssewe squier hoost began styrre arme soone myght englysshmen hadde done enterpryse without danger retourned agayne tresse without domage wherof ye constable sore displeased sware neuer departe then tyll taken castell benon slayne within mornyng caused maner men arme drawe maner bylementes assaut gaue suche assaut long nat sene suche another tha men armes breton entred dyke nat sparynge selfe came ye fote walles pauesses heed myned walles pike marueyle beholde dyde somoche beate downe great pane ye wall wherby entred without danger castell taken within slayne many coulde founde sayd constable caused castell agayn repayred set therin newe garyson frenchman drewe castell morant within yelded vp sauynge lyues goodes went surgeres also yelded vp ye obeysance frenche kyng englyshmen deted durst nat abyde comyng constable constable went castell fountnay countie whiche wyfe sir john harpen dan kept beseged towne castell gaue therto dyuers assautes finally within composicyon departed lady many wolde constable coueyed thouars frechmen possessyon towne castell foutuey refresshed newe people constable lordes frace went layd sege thouars wher moost parte knightes poictou vycont thouars lordes pertney pousanges corse crupenac sir loyes harcourt geffray dargenton james surgeres percyuall coloyne frenche lordes made poicters rochell dyuers engyns wher assayled traueyled greatly poicteuyns within thouars thynges consydred entreated frenchman haue peace theselfe lad syll feest saynt michaell next folowyng whiche shulde yere lorde iii c lxii ye meaue tyme sende kyng england lorde certifye hym estate codycion nat ayded one sonnes within sayd terme yelde landes obeysance french treaty agreed vnto knightes france retourned parys thyder brought captall beufz put prison vnder sure kepyng towre temple kyng right glad takyng caused delyuered squyer toke hym xii thousande frankes messangers went fro poicteuyns came englande shewed kyng prince cousayls state poictou xaynton whan kyng sawe howe lost lytell warre cou treis lades cost hym moche wynning great study long space sayd howe shortely wolde go ouer see hymselfe suche puyssance wolde abyde gyue batayle hole power france sayd wolde neuer retourne agayne englande tyll coquered agayne moche lost el lese resydue season ther agreat army redy charged attend duke lancastre shulde arryue calys imyned king cousayle shulde go poyctou xaynton towarde rochell yt thought next voyage moost nedefull kynge made great somons throughout realme englande comaundyng euery man coe harnes hapton ther day assigned ther take see ther none durst wold disobey comaundement euery man departed fro owne countre drewe see syde ther redy foure hundred vessel one lordes drewe kyng westmynster besyde london ther ordayned bytwene kynge prince sonne kyng englande dyed viage prince rycharde sonne prince borne burdeur shulde kyng englande whan lordes come kyng departed prince shewed happed dye kyng father sonne richarde kynge englande discease graundfather prelate lordes knightes ye comynalte loued well prince ay fayre iourneys acheued well englande beyond thesee therto ioyously kynge first sonnes lordes englande prince caused swere scale departed thynges done kyng prince duke la castre therles cabridge salisbury war wyke arundell suffolke stafforde lorde spenser newly come oute lombardy lordes percy uyen rose dalawar barones knyghtes englande nombre thre thousande men armes x archer came hapton wher toke shyppyng great flete euer kyng went englande voyage sayled towarde rochell costynge normady bretayne dyuers wyndes frenche kynge made great assemble men warr poictou holde iourney thouars day apoynted countre full men warre also gascons lorde archebalt grayly vncle captall beufz desyre ser thomis felton seneshall burdeux cae wt thre c speres copany ther lordes dura corton musydent rossen lagoren landuras ser peter corton sir wyllm fereton englysshemen deted fro burdeux came nyorth ther founde sir water huet sir john ubrues sir thoms percy johan cresuell dyuers yt whan togyder xii c fightyng men sir richarde pontchardon cae xii c season kynge englande sonnes great army see coulde take lande rochell ther wynde fortune cotrary case space ix wekes feest myhelmas aproched yt kyng cousell sawe well coude nat coe tyme ynow kepe day rescuyng thouars wher kyng sore displeased gaue lycece people dete wheder lyst thus retourned great nauy england wynde wyll returnynge ther arryued burdeux ii c fayles marchauntes englande wyne whan nere mighelmas barones englande gascone cae fro niorth go towarde thouars mete kyng england whan sawe kynge came nat hadde great marueyle acquyte theselfe sent certayne messangers tho war baron poictou suche ther messagers sayd right deresirs sent hyder fro lordes gascone englande vnder obeysaunce kynge englande sir nyorthe twelfe hundred fightyng men redy apparelled ayde serue maners sir desyre haue knowlege sro whyder absence kyng england chyldren shall ayde confort nat sir well cotent company aduentur bodyes goodes barones poictou sayd howe wolde take counsayle aduyse ca sir thake greatly barones gascone englade hath sent hyder redy socoure v knightes poictou drewe togyder first day greed nat lorde parteney one greattest company woldeth shulde kepe day receyue sayd ayde representynge kynge englande lordes cotrary opinyon sayeng howe sealed sworne howe kyng one chyldren nat personally sayd day yelde vp obeysance freche kyng wherfore lorde partney went lodgyng nat well content howe afterwarde entysed agreed mynd sent worde agayne sayd messagers tha ked good wylles howe kyng englande one chyldren must nedes ther acordyng treaty sworne sealed vnto wher gascoyns englysshmen nyorthe sore displeased coude nat amende myghelmas day came fro poy cters ther came thouars holde iourney duke berrey burgoyne burbone constable france lorde clysson dycount rohane dolphyn auuergne sir loyes saurere lorde sully great lordes france ten thousande speares besyde thouars euyn daye ofsaynt mychaell stode ordynaunce batayle agaynst nyght withdrue logynges mornynge two bretherne frenche kynges constable fraunce demaunded knightes poictou within thouars delyuer town acording promyse othes halfe answered sayd howe shortely wolde come poicters put themselfe landes vnder obeysaunce frenche kyng whiche answere sufficyent lordes france departed fro thouras duke gaue lyc moost parte companyons lorde clysson departed gret nombre men warre apoynted constable went mortayne see whiche englysshe capitayne therof squyer england called james clere hym threscore copanyons whan lorde clysson come mortayne made feirse assaute whiche hym selfe howe assaute wanne nothyng night drewe lodgyng capitayne within seynge selfe sore oppressed sent priuely lordz gascoyn englande beyng nyorth shewyng yt wolde com thyder night wolde receyue fortresse wherby might lightly passe lodgynges lorde clysson two hudredmen secretely lordes departed fro nyorthe fyue hundred speares rode nyght tyll came mortayne habbe great besyre atrape lorde clysson howbeit spye departed fro nyorthe knewe entente came hastely lorde clysson foude himsyttynge supper sayd sir enemyes departed fro nyorthe nombre v hundred commynge thanne lorde clysson put table fro hym armed hast mouted horse company departed sodaynly left behynde great parte caryages rode longe came poicters englysshmen sayled entente retourned agayne nyorthe right sore displeased anone departed fro nyorthe left garyson sir dangoses cresuell sir johan wet retourned englande went burdeur returnyng brent lorde partneys la de thus poictou coquered except fortress nyorth elyseth mortymer mortayne lysignen castell accart la roche suryone gausar toure larbre merris fortress made dyuers yssues assautes neighbour sotyme chasyng somtyme rechased agayne p howe sir bertram clesquy beseged castell syreth englysshmen disconfyted howe countrey poictou xaynton rochell clene delyuered theglysshmens handes cap ccc vi duke bretayne pesably owne countre sore displeased domage englishman sayd kynge englande puyssaunce made hym nothynge kynge englande nat ben alwayes made warr hym lende syluer golde also doughter maryage duke wolde gladly countre shulde rather holde kyng englandes parte fraunce howe beit moost parte lordes knightes squyers bretayne hertes good frenche specially lorde clysson de la uale vycount rohan chefe ruler bretayne lordes sayd duke sir assone parceyue ye take parte kyng englande agayne frenche kyng souerayne lorde wyll forsake leaue countrey bretayne howe duke coude nat hyde corage hert sayd sir ye great wronge kynge englande spake great wordes certayne lordes bretayne french kyng drawen loue hert bretayne except sir robert canoll desyred sawe defence made duke wolde gyue knowledge therof entent fynde remedy therfore duke parceyued well men hadde insuspect layed great wayt douted leest shulde sende hym parys wherfore sent kyng engla de shewyng case desyring sende hym men warr defende nede kynge englande sent hym lorde neuyll foure hundred men armes many archer arryued saynt mathewes defyne poterne ther helde ne without doyng maner domage coutre payed truely toke wynter duke wolde neuer put fortresse whan knightes bretayne sawe englysshmen come countre ayde confort duke toke great dignacion closed fortress shewed moche yuell wyll towardes duke thus matter abode great varyaunce wynter assone wynter past sir bertram clesquy constable france departed fro poicters xiiii hundred fyghtyng men went layd sege towne castell syreth hym breton knyghtes sir alayne beaumont john beaumanoyre arnolde limosyn geffray ricoynan lanconet geffray konyell dyuers knight squyers layed siege syreth closed selfe pale thentent nat troubled nyght often certayne aproched fortresse scrimysshed within defended selfe right valyantly fell siege enduryng sir robert mycon sir nicotyn scotte kes fortresse sent knowledge estate sir johan ubrues sir dangoses capitayns nyorthe contynent sent garyson lusygnen dangosey assembled nyorthe departed nombre sixe hundred seuyn speares good men warr besyde folowers long rode came syreth four leages fro nyorthe whan come syreth rested space tyme apparell selfe bene better haue sette lodgynges constable anone worde comyng howe araynged felde hobeit constable nat greatly afrayed made men armed drawe toguyder sayde nowe fayre sir howe say haue wyll fight enemyes beleue surely must houe v fyght sayd sir thanke god shalbe welcome v constable aduysed set busshment watche castell thought well wolde yssue set ther two hudred entent thanne caused cast downe moost parte pale hoost thentent shulde nat lette hym company whan wolde yssue ordayned two batayls one gouerned sir alayne beaumount sir geffray carnuell commauded none shulde passe baner without commaundement euery man shulde kepe lodgynge nowe lette v speke sir robert mycon sir robert le scot aboue castell sawe thenglisshmen redy apparelled feldes sayd lette v arme selfe yssue shall one passe throughe breton assoone folkes knoweth fightynge wyll come great domage shall knowe issuyng armed nombre lx yssued horsebacke skrymysshe hoost encountred busshement layd ther sore scrimysshe englysshmen enclosed coude nother recule backe go forwarde taken slayne none escaped two capitayns taken season englysshemen felde costable styll perclose issued nat feared englisshmen great enbusshement wode behynde englysshmen brought thyder certayne nombre poicteuyns breton robber pyllers nombre two hundred whome englisshmen sent scrimyshe frenche host soone cae constable batayle tourned selfe sayd howe good frenche wolde constable parte pleased hym constable sayd content haue sette wynge one syde lerned maner dealynge englysshmen knewe howe maner busshmet behynde p whan constable fraunce vnderstode toyouse drewe people toguyder caused de bannerre auaunce forthe drewe wynge two bataylles went forthe fote castynge downe pale cryenge ourlady clesquy whan englysshmen sawe yssue holde raynged selfe fote auaunsed forwarde great desyre fyrst metyng encoutred costables batayle fought valiantly passed batayle brought many man erthe breton wysely ordred two batayls beyng wyng came fresshe lusty basshed among thenglysshmen wery yt sore reculed backe howbeit lyke valyant men full courage fought ax swordes burdeaux wherwith gaue great stroke ther good knyghtes bothe partes nobly aduentured selfe exaulte honour batayle well fought many proper dedes armes done takyng rescuynge bene sene many day playne felde without aduauntage euery man dyde best power many man sore hurt cast erthe great myschefe howbeit finally thenglisshmen dicofyted fewe scaped taken slayn ther slayne good squyers richard mesuyll wylliam dursell james ubille sore hurte taken sir john ubrues aymery rochchoart dauyd hollegraue rycharde olyue john cresuell dyuers englande poytou bataile syreth yere lorde god thre hudred lxxii xxi day marche p constable returned folkes lodgynges toke hede hurte men prisoner wherof great plenty afterwarde constable sent speke castell sir alayne beaumounte shewed taken force shulde dye without mercy garyson put constable mercy receyued grace suffred passe quyte saue conducte go burdeaux thus frenche men castell lande put vnder obeysauce frenche kyng tha breton great heate came niorth whiche good towne poictou season euer susteyned englysshmen kepte euer great garyson soone niorth knewe costable came warde went presented hym kayes towne brought hym towne great ioye breton refresshed four dayes depted great aray xiiii hundred speares went forteresse lusiguen yelded vp composicion garison within departed lyues saued moche coude cary owne saue conducte conuey burdeux thus frechmen castell seignory men therof became subgettes french kyng tha breton rode castell alart constable sent lady wyfe sir rycharde dangle within yelde vp castell desyred haue assurance ye might go poicters speke ye duke berry constable grauted desyre caused coueyed thyder one knyghtes wha came duke kneled downe duke toke vp demau ded request sir required constable fraunce yt shuld put landes vnder obeysauce frenche kyng sir ye knowe well lord husbande lyeth yet prisoner spayne sir lande gouernance woman small defence sir nat heritage husbade myne owne pleasure peraduenture shulde thynge agaynst pleasure wolde thanke therfore shulde blamed sir apease set lande peace shall copounde selfe myne shall make warr ye wyll make warre v sir wha husbande come prison beleue well wyll drawe englade shall send hym worde coposicion sir sure wyll sende mynde shall answere duke answered sayd dame agre well desyre condicion none fortress prouyde men warre vitayls artyllary otherwise present tyme thus agreed lady retourned castell caused siege reysed shewed letter fro duke berrey cotayning purpose deted constable went mortymer lady wherof yelded herselfe put landes vnder obeysance frenche kynge also yelded vp castell dyenne whiche partayned thus poictou xainton rochell quyte delyuered fro englysshmen whan constable set garysons good sure kepyng euery place sawe rebellyon march vnto ryuer gyronde returned fraunce also dyde duke berrey burgoyn burbone moost parte baron frauce suche ben sayd coquestes kyng greatly feested retournynge iapes whan sir bertram came parys kyng kyng coude nat honor moche thus costable abode kyng parys ioye myrthe p seige bercerell dethe kyng scottes peace bitwene frech king kyng nauar howe duke bretayne fledde englande howe costable frauce conquered duchy cap ccc vii season lordes clisson lauall uangour tournemen rieux rochfort vicount rohane sir charles dignen bannerette bretayne marshall blarouille lordes hambe ruille fouteuyll granuyll farnyll denneuall cleres banerettes normady people great plenty bretayne normady went layde siege stronge castell bercerell greatly constrayned assautes within ther two capitayns englysshmen sir johan aparte sir johan cornwall certayne companyons yt valiantly defended theym selfe siege done many noble feate armes many issue many saute many scrymysshe lytell ther beside ther sege saint sauyour vicount sir thomas trybles sir johan de bourge sir philippe pecharde thre bretherne maluriers seige layde two garysons ouerran countre base normandy thyng abrode forteresses also raunsomed toke prisoner bysshopriche bayeux deureux kyng nauer consen yng therto conforted dyuers tymes bothe vitayle suche wer garisons countie deureux nat acorded frenche kyng garysons chierbourg gouerell couch bretuell deureux diuers vnder obeysanuce kyng nauerr greatly enpouered wasted coutre normady sametyme good meanes made bytwene ye two kynges specially labour erle sale bruses taken moche payne bytwene also bysshop deureux dyde moche brought acorde two kynges mette togyder right amyable castell uernon ryuer sayne sworne dyuers great lordes frauce kepe peace loue vnite cofederacyon togyder euer ye kyng nauer went frenche kyng realme fraunce kynge dyde hym moche honour reuerence ther kyng nauer put landes normandy handes gouernynge frenche kyng lest two sonnes charles peter ye kyng vncle departed went backe agayne nauerre thus peace endured foue yeres howbeit ther fell agayne bytwene great discorde ye shall herafter hystorie ye wyll loke therfore howe beit thynke ther wyll none ende made therof present boke p viii day may yere lorde thre c lxxiii passed lyfe towne edenborowe kyng dauyd scotlande buryed abbay dofre lyn besyde kyng robert de bruse father dyed without sonne doughter laufully begoten body ther kyng right successyon nephue named robert seneshall scotlande goodly knyght sonne p howe certayn ordeyned englande kepe countre howe erle salisbury william neuyll phillyp courtnay dyuers men armes enterd see landed bretayne howe costable frauce went thyder duke bretayne went englande cap ccc viii seson ordeyned englande entent kepe coutre erle salisbury willyam neuyll sir phylippe courtnay shuld take see certayne nombre men warr sayd howe yuan wale comynge see sixe thousande men lande brenne countrey lordes englande hadde xl great shyppes besyde barge two thousande menne armes besyde archer thus departed fro cornewayle toke see toke way towarde bretayne came saynt malo isle brent ye hauen towne seuen great spaynisshe shyppes wherof countre maruayle sayd howe thought surelye duke bretayne hadde caused townes castelles cyties duke great suspect kepte strayter forteresses dyde secretnesse duke mynde dyscouered certayne knightes bretayne shewed dyuers wordes shulde spoken duke moche fr kyng ordeyned costable make iourney bretayne comaudyng hym take possession townes cytes castels tress sease rebelles bothe good bodyes constable deted fro parys went angiers made somos thyder came duke burbon erle alenson erle perche therle porceau dolphyn auuergne vicountes meaulx dausnay sir rafe coucy robert saynt poule raf rauenall loys sansere marshall fraunce great nombre barony chyualry uerma doyes artoyes pycardy besyde came thyder march aniou poitou tourayn patte erle salisbury army beyng saint malo isle knewe well frenche assemble sawe well howe countrey bretayne agaynst duke depted fro then hysshyppes sayled long came brest whiche one strongest castelles worlde whan duke bretayne knewe constable comynge durste trust lengar uennes dignan beyng good towne bretayn though one inclosed shulde great went castell alroy whiche bitwene uenes renes helde parte made ruler englysshe knight called sir johan augustyne duke left wyfe desiring kepe well knyght promised duke rode saynt mathues fyne potern ye towne closed hym then duke went kouke tokeshyppynge thentent arryue englande thus constable fraunce entred bretayne ther came company lordes knightes bretayne suche ben siege bercerell left vp siege lord normandy whan constable come reynes within knew well come cease handes freche kyng duke landes kynge counsayle sayd howe duke forfayted landes bycause sustayned englysshmen enemy townes castelles also selfe tooke parte kyng englande agaynst erowne fra ce whome helde duchy bretayne faythe homage wherfore reynes thought make warre peaseably ceceyued constable knowledged hym lorde name frenche kyng whan constable possessyon reynes roode hastely towne dignan whiche yelded vp vnder obeysaunce frenche kyng constable went cyte uenes also yelded vp went luzemont assayled taken force wtin slayne costable wet jugon whiche put selfe vnder obeysance frenche kynge lyke wyse dyde castell gouy ye forest roch yen towne guigante saynt mathewe fyne poterne saynt malo isle constable went quipercorentyn tourned also french campelly credo galande dyuers forteresses fyrst constable ouerran breton bretouant bycause always enclyned tather duke johan mountfortes parte breton gallet ye haue herde whan duke went englande set sir robert canoll gouernour ye duchy howbeit ther fewe lord obeyed neuertheles furnisshed wel castell dyriuall gaue kepynge therof cosyn called sir hughe broit sir robert went brest costable wet hanybout capitayne therin vuder duke squier england named thomelyn ubyche also therin knight sent sir robert canoll called sir thomas priour fourscore one assone frechmen come thyder beganne assayle castell brought thyder fro dyuers place certayne engyns great gonne wherwith dyuers castelles forteresses specially towne capelly taken wherof james rosse squire englade capitayne coude nat taken mercy fell hades sir olyuer clisson slewe glayue also slewe dyuers hand pyte mercy englysshman fell daunger nowelet v retourn siege hanibout constable fraunce caused engins reared vp agaynst towne castell went saut sware yt woldesuppe castell within defended selfe valyauntly costable sayd sir ye within certayne shall coquere wyll suppe night within towne knowe trouthe yt cast stonne quarell wherby leest copany hurt make myne auowe god ye shall lese lyues whiche wordes abasshed towne went house let englysshmen alone defeded themselfe ryght valyauntly longe myght endure towne great englysshmen coulde nat take hede euery place frenchemen entred towne englisshmen slayne except two capitayns taken bycause within towne obeyed constable commaudement therfore comaunded none shuld hardy maner domage p whan constable frauce thus conquered towne stronge castell hanybout taryed ther xv dayes went towne kouke ye meane tyme therle salisbuty sir wyllm neuyll sir bertram stapleton sir wylliam luzy hadd newe refresshed forteresse breest bothe men armes archer artyllery vitayle tokeshippyng thentent defende countre frechmen styll felde bretayne ye sayd englisshmen wyst nat whyder costable wolde brawe whan ye costable cae towne kouke whiche hauen towne wan byforce assaut englisshmen slayne wihin except capitayne named sir john langay taken mercy towne ye frechmen newe repayred drewe towne brest wher lorde neuyll sir robert canoll c men armes many archer ye lordes frauce bretayn beseged towne vi fyghting men soone layd thesiege sent ser olyuer chsson name duke aniou certayne nobre go lay sege roche sur yon thenglysshmen kept lorde clysson besieged towne rounde reared vp dyuers engyns whiche brought fro angiers poiters breton cae thyder dyuers noble men getylmen aniou poictou assauted sayd howe wolde nat dete then tyll ye tyme ye duke aniou often tymes refresshed lay thesege vitayle thyng styll constable lay sege brest duke burbon erles alenson piergourt dolphyn auuergne byuers lordes frauce wanther lytell brest one strogest castels worlde bicause sir robert canoll capitayne within lordes fraunce determyned send ley siege castell duriuall thyder went dyuers lord bretayne tourayn four hundred fightynge men p howe frenchman laye iege four sundry place tone howe roche suryon yelded selfe became frenche howe englysshmen came brest cap ccc ix thus lordes frauce helde tone four seges one bercerell another brest roch sur yon iiii duriuall eche made many great assaut within roche sur farthest fro copany cofort made composycion enemy wtout socoured within space moneth shulde dete put ye castell vnder obeysance french kyng whiche day lorde clysson knyghtes copany cae thyder whan rescue cae reyse siege castell yelded vp thenglysshmen deted vnder saue conduct lorde pons went burdeur lorde clysson went then siege duryuall brought great engins also samesege cae constable frauce duke burbon therles alenson perche great nobre barony cheualry frace thought dyde lose tyme lyeng brest howbeit left styll ther two fortifyed selfe place kepe wayes non shulde entre issue brest refressh fortresse whan sir broes within duryuall sawe selfe sore oppressed douted greatly takyng fortresse deuysed treaty haue respyte two monethes without rescued duke bretayne able kepe felde reyse siege within sayd space yelde vp forteresse duke aniou constable men armes came fro ye duke bretayne coost frenchman within sitte styll rest peace treaty put shewed duke aniowe agreed duryuall durynge sayd terme shulde nat take fortresse ayde help sir broes delyuered certayne getylmen knyght squiers hostag behalfe treaty coposycion costable rode nautes cytie shyt fast gate agaynst bycause came suche great army sent hym knowe entecyon constable answered sayd howe sent thyder ye french kyng lord take possession name duchy bretayn sir johan mountforte calleth hym selfe duke hath forfayted tha burgess nautes demaunded take counsayle answer wha long counsayled came forthe sayde sir great meruayle v ye thus take herytage lorde duke frenche kyng commaunded v receyue hym duke lorde hym haue swerne fealtie homage hath sworne v gouerne v subgettes thus haue taken hym knowe cause fraude suspection ifye coe towne vertue suche procuraryon ye haue agre ye shall entre condicyon hap duke
