bretayne lorde retourne countre wyll become frenche prelate barones gentylmen good townes breten knowlege lord tha quyte without domage nowe tyme also ye receyue te reuenues bretayn let styll remayne hand vntyll suche tyme haue tydinges whiche shalbe agreable v constable sware fulfyll procurer frech kyng case thus costable entred rytie nauntes chiefe cytie bretayne company whan sir robert canoll souerayne breest vnderstode howe sir hugh broes cosyn made composycion fortresse duryuall frenchman sawe well howe coulde nat departe fro then ther go co fort castell duriuall wtout wolde make coposycion lyke case began treat frechmen brest answered without costable coude nothyng two knightes two squyers englande saue coducte went constable besyde nau te wher lay ryuer loyre great copany frauce bretayne treaty toke suche effect yt brest respite xl dayes wtin space shulde beso conforted men warte able fyght constable el yelde vp forteresse meane season brest abyde styll case tha without reuitaylyng enforsyng thyng fortresse messangers retourned agayne sir robert canoll sent sufficyent men bothe knightes squiers constable hostage constable put prison yt ben siege brest departed constable gaue lycence frenche king sent fortifye cyties townes castels fortress picardy duke lancastre aryued calais great armye whan erle salisbury see yt season kept fronters bretayne normady also kyng englande newly reconforted thousande men armes two thousande archer whan vnderstode co posycion brest sayd goddes grace wolde fight frenchemen sayled longe arryued brest toke lande copany brest euery night went agayne shyppes euery daye raynged batell fight enemyes brewe thider constable gyuen lycence moost parte copany helde styll two siege one bercerell duryuall thought full lytell erle salisbury wolde haue come thyder strongly dyde departed fro march nauntes whan day delyueraunce brest dyde aproche howe wha day came went nat thyder knowledge howe englisshmen suche strengthe able fyght hym therfore thought warke great sadde aduyse dyd taryed styll remoued nat ther taryed vii dayes whan therle salisbury beyng breest hadde taken place grounde auauntage sawe constable fraunce breton came nat forwarde sent thyder haraude whan came constable sayd sir erle salisbury lordes england send worde haraude armes tyme ye haue layd siege castell towne brest sir lordes maisters vnderstand howe certayne composycions treatyes made bitwene towne nat comforted daye lymytted whiche nat nowe long vnto shulde yeld vp towne castell wherfore sir maye please knowe come breest kepe day defende fortresse therfore sir desyre drawe forwarde ye shalbe fought withall without dout ye wyll nat desyre sende agayne suche hostage ye haue entent constable sayde haraulde ye bringe v good tidynges wherfore ye welcoe ye shall say maysters howe haue greatter desyre syght haue fight v beit nat place treaty made agreed vnto therfore saye lette theym drawe parte place without fayle shall sought withall haraud retourned brest dyde message sent hym agayne constable another message whan came sayd sir coe agayne fro lordes maisters whome haue shewed euery thynge ye comaunded say whan last sir nowe say howe men see lately coe then haue brought horse sir say haue nat ben acustomed go farre fote wherfore sende worde ye wyll sende horse wyll come place ye wyll apoynt fyght kepe day fayre fared constable nat mynde enemy somoche auantage send horse shulbe reputed great outrage mynded wolde demande good hostage sufficient answere v horse agayne sir haraud haue suche commaudement answere mater howe beit sir say ye wyll nat agre poynte ye haue lawfull cause retayne styll hostage yehaue therfor sir yesend ye ye shulde costable sayd nat abuysed retourned haraude erle salisbury company brest whan vnderstode shulde nat fought wall hostage delyucred sore dyspleased howe taryed styll without remouyng tyll day expyred parceyued well constable cae nat fight entred brest newe reuitayled towne refresshed greatly fortresse te whan constable sawe englysshmen cae nat forwarde fyght hym deted toke hostage sayd prisoner said englysshmen brest hadde nat kept truely apoyntment rescuyng brest bycause erle salisbury hadde newly refresshed vitayled fortresse erle salisbury deted fro brest entred agayne shippes kepe march fronters commytted also sir robert canoll whan departed fro brest went streight owne forteresse duryuall assoone come castell shewed duke aniou costable beyng nauntes supposed fortuned sir robert canoll brake treatie apoyntment made renounsed send worde duke aniou constable wolde kepe apoyntmeut men made absence without leaue sayeng suche authorite whan duke herde came sonally sege duriuall phowe dyuers englysshmen slayne disconfited lorde soubyse ribamont howe garysons soissons discofyted englysshmen cap c c c x calais aryued duke lancastre duke bretayne mo thre thousande men armes x thousande archer englysshmen whiche voyage ben ordayning imagenynge thre yere theym erles warwyke stafforde suffolke lorde edwarde spcusar one greattest barones englande constable tyme hoost lordes wylloughby pole basset hubelles holenton sir henry percy loys clyfforde wylliam beauchape chanoyne robersart water hewet hughe carleton stephyn gosenton rychard pot chardon dyuers knyghtes squyers england whoe nat name french kyng knewe right well passage englysshmen prouyded sufficyetly sure kepyng townes cyties forteresses castelles picardy artoys uermandoyse hadde set men warre breton burgonyons pycardes normayus dyuers soudyers empyre thus englysshmen departed fro calais aparelled caryages wherof great plenty rode forthe thre batayls aswell ordred coude deuised first ye batayle wt marshal wherof erles warwyke suffolke chefe two duke lancastre bretayne noble copany thyrde batayle led constable lorde spe ser thre batayls marched forwarde kepyng themselfe close togyder alwayes harnesse redy fight founde whome euery night lay togider made gode wache went neuer past thre leages day none went marshal baners without comaudement passed motrell wherof lorde handboure capitayne made ther none assaut past saynt omer turwyn currours brent lande therle saynt poule went nere arras two duke lodged abbey mount saynt eloy ther taryed two dayes departed costed arras assayled nat knewe well shulde lese labour went bray ryuer ther two marshal made great assaut gate within ther garyson good knightes squyers picardy whome vicont mealx capitayne sir rafe menac chanon robersart day strake downe glayue thre erthe gate ther sore scrimysshe howbeit frechmen kept well forteresse lost nothynge englysshmen passed coostynge ryuer thynking passe ouer ham uermandois saynt quintynes thus went forthe thenglysshe host wher duke lancastre chefe gouernour ordynauce kyng england father lorde bousyers heynalte cae frauce passed bridge ham towne desyred effectuously yt wolde reteyned wt helpe ayde agaynst thenglysh men agreed ther taryed two dayes tyll englysshmen past toke way aboue entre verma doys passe ryuer strayter passage whan lorde bousyers knewe thenglysshmen nygh past ouer howe yt drue towarde saynt quintynes rybamont wher lorde clyn whose doughter mariage lorde ther fayre lande herytage also hym self ther fayre lande ye right wyfe knewe well castell rybamont vnpurueyed men warr toke leaue ham greatly thanked seruice done departed suche nombre whiche great nobre rode long came saynt quintynes great parell countrey full englysshmen came suche danger soner entred englisshe currours chased hym gate lorde bousyers founde towne sir wylliam bourges capitayne vnder french kyng receyued ioyously desyring hym byde helpe defende towne lorde bousiers excused selfe sayde howe hadde enterprised enter towne rybamont kepe towne fortresse bycause capitayne wherfore desyred sore sayd sir wylliam hadde hym saynte quintynes xii cro bowes departed went nat farre past spyed company englysshmen toke another lowe way beside knewe well countre day rode great parell towardes rybamount rode encoutred knight burgoyne called sir johan bulle goynge towardes saynt quitynes whan one spoken lorde bousyers retourned hym rybamount xl speares xx crosbowes thus aproched rybamont sent one currours enforme towne comyng helpe ayde defende towne ye meane season sawe wher comyng company englisshmen nombre fourscore frenchemen sayd beholde yoder enemy comynge fro pyllage let v go dasshed spurres horse sydes galopped forthe fast might cryeng lady rybamont came amonge englysshmen disconfyted slewe moost parte theym happy myght escape whan frenchemen hadde thus ouerthrowen englysshmen went rybamont founde lorde chyne come thyder lytell xl speares xxx crosbowes castell company lodgyng vnarmed herde watchman castell cryeng harnesse sir armes aprocheth towne drewe togyder demaunded watchman nobre like lyhode answered sayd howe aboute nombre fourscore men armes lorde bousyers sayd sir behoueth v go fyght shuld great blame v sulfre goby nere fortresse lord chin sayd fayre sonne ye say trouthe cause oure horse coe display baner sir john bulle sayd lordes ye shall nat go without counsayleis go wyse lye parauenture currours whiche marshalles englande constable hath sent hyder cause vsto go fortresse issuyng parauentur may tourne folly lorde bousiers sayd ye wyll leue shall go fight brefely happe may befall wyll go fight theym dyde helme lepte horse yssued hym sixscore englysshmen fourscore ser hugh caurelles company nat hymselfe styll duke lancastre howbeit sixe knightes many squiers come thyder reuege companye ouerthrowen soone frenchemen gate founde incontynent englisshmen couched speares ranne among frenchman frenchman opyned let passe dyd wherby rose suche dust one coude nat se knowe another frenchman closed selfe agayne toguyder cryed lady rybamont many man ouerthrowen bothe te lorde chyn plummet leed hande wherwith brake bassenetes suche attayned vnto bygge goodly knyght well formed membres last suche stroke helme nere fallen squyer nat kept hym vp whiche stroke greued hym longe lyued ther dyuers englysshmen gret marueyle saw penonsemblable armes without difference lorde coucy sayd howe lorde coucy hath sent men hyder agaynst v ought frende ther harde batell howe finally englysshmen taken slayne fewe scaped lorde bousiers prisoner two bretherne pennenort knight squyer sir johan bulle two prisoner went rybamont foreby englysshe hoost withoute scrimysshe also forbare brenne lande lorde coucy domage lombardy medlyd nothyng warr fraunce englysshmen went loged valeys vnder laon ther brueres crescy dyd moche domage countre lonnoys howbeit tyme frenche kyng caused goodes playne countre forteresses townes castelles whiche well prouyded englissmen coude haue none aduantage aproche assayle also englysshemen nat mynde enploy season ther rather frenche kyng sente downe power men haue fought frenche kyng alwayes commaunded wyse gyue batayle wolde shulde euer pursued kept shorte euery night frenchman laye fortress day pursued thenglysshe host went euer close toguyder happed beyonde soissous mornyng sixscore thenglysshe speres ran ouer countre came within da ger busshment burgonyons frechmen wherof sir john uyen john bulle wyllyam bordes hugh porcien john coucy vycont mealx lordes rauenall bone capitens dyuers thre c speares alwayes costyng get auatage theglishmen night lyen felde made bushment lytell wode soissons thenglysshmen cae mornynge seke pyllage host lodged behynde whan englysshmen past frenchman cae busshment displayed baners penons whan theglisshmen sawe yt great company nere rested toke aduyse sent hoost behynde whiche longe leage fro sir gaultyer great capitayne nat farr then whan herde therof lept vpon horse great haste speare fyste without enet vyser rode thyderwarde without aduyse cousayle men solowed fast might fray stryken necke fell downe deed theglysshmen fought valiantly finally slayne taken fewe escaped taken englysshe knightes prisoner sir john radwyn thomas faulque hughe bromewell thomas spenser thomas ebreton nycholl gascoyne john candley philyppe cambrey hughe harpe done lyonet dautryne squyers johan galarde thomas brudlay henry mamefort guy chuet wyllm dautry john menet antyque wylliam gausull john fobret tomelyn solerant wyllm quiteuyn robert bouchell ro daudley rafe stanby thomas arthus tyding came englysshe hoost howe company fightynge marshal made hast remoue hoost parte coude nat soone auaunce mater past done burgonyons frechmen withdrawen withall prisoner englysshmen wyst nat seke thus fell encountre enformed whiche nere douchy besyde soissons xx day february yere lorde thousande thre c threscore xiii p two iourneys rabymont douchy fell none aduenture duke lancastre realme frauce mencyon ought made englysshemen passed many strayte passage alway rode wisely close togyder freche kynges counsayle sayd kyng sir lette go finally nat attayne heritage shall wery selfe nought often tymes whan storme tempest ryseth countre last wasteth away selfe lykewise shall sene englysshmen p hostage layd duriuall beheeded howe sir robert canolle beheeded agayne suche prisoner also duke lancastres iourney cap ccc xi le haue well herde howe sir robert canoll come castell duryuall ye whiche helde owne herytage brake treaty yt made bytwene men duke aniou wherfore duke came thyder siege duke claymed owne enherita great company lord knightes bretayne poictou lowe march french kyng wolde co stable ye lorde clysson yt shulde returne farce ayde brother duke burgoyne pursue englysshe men hesent often castell duryuall obey let hym haue possessyon castell whan daye past castell shulde haue ben delyuerd yet lay styll siege hadde great marueyle within thought knewe well sir robert canoll entred castell newe refresshed duke lord sent haraude sir robert canoll sir hughe broes made treatie whan haraulde come forteresse sayd sir lordes hath sente hyder knowe cause ye nat acquyte hostage delyuer castell couenant ye sir hugh haue sworne sir robert canoll sayd haraude say vnto maisters howe men coude make composycion without myne agrement returne shewe haraude retourned recounted lordes sir robert canoll said sent hym agayne newe message whan sayd sir lordes yet sendeth worde composycion shulde receyue forteresse person tyll day prefixed sithe tyme day haue receyued sir robert canoll fortresse ought nat haue done therfore sir knowe trouther without ye yelde vp castell hostage shall beheeded sir robert answered god haralde manysshing maisters wyll nat lese castell duke cause men dye shall serue lyke case haue within bothe knightes squyers prisoner though myght haue hundred frankes wyll saue neuer one whan haraude departed hadde made reporte duke aniou called forthe hangman made brought forthe hostag two knightes asquier caused heedes stryken nere castell within might se knowe incontynent sir robert canoll made borde put wyndowe hall brought thyder four prisoner thre knightes squyer whome might haue hadde great rausome made four heedes stryken dyde cast downe dyke bodyes one way heedes nother way brake vp siege maner men went frauce namely duke aniou went parys ye kyng brother constable lorde clysson rode toward cyte troyes englysshmen march passed ye ryuer marne toke waye towarde anxere tyme pope gregory xi sent frauce legacyon archbysshoppe rohan bysshoppe carpentras treat peace yf might bytwene frenche kyng kynge englande prelate moche laboure ryde bytwene frenche kynge bretherne duke lancastre alwayes englysshmen rode forthe thorough countreis forestes auuergne limosyn ryuer loyre dordone lothe thenglysshmen nat ease iourney lykewise nat frenchman folowed costed pursute ther dyed thre knightes heynault sir fateres berlaumount bridoll montague begue uerlan also englysshe part dyed solonge duke lancastre bretayne rode forwarde cam bergerath four leages fro burdeux alwayes frenchman pursued duke aniou costable rode aboue towarde rouuergue roddes tholouse come pyergourt ther two sayd prelate rested rode euer prechynge bytwene party layed many reason bring acorde party harde wolde nat condiscende peace without great aduatage christmas duke lancastre came burdeux ther bothe duke lay wynter lent folowynge company departed whan iourney paste retourned englande lorde basset company wherwith kyng nat content reproued hym bycause retourned nat duke sonne anone feest easter yere lorde god thousande thre hundred xiii duke aniou beynge pyergourt assembled great army hym constable fraunce ye parte barones knyghtes bretayne poictou aniou tourayne also gascoyne sir johan armynake lordes dalbret pyergourt erles comynges narbone vycountes carmayne uyllemure thalare erle dolphyn auuergne moost parte lordes auuergne limosyn vycount myndone lordes de la barde pyergourt sir robert de charde xv thousande menne foote also great nombre geneways cro bowes tooke way towardes highe gascoyne came saynt syluere wherof abbot lorde howe beit stronge towne yet abbot douted shulde lose force therfore fell treaty ye duke aniou thought nother hym selfe la de shulde abyde warre duke indygnacion sayeng town fortresse small thynge regard townes castels hygh gascone whyder supposed ye duke goyng therfore desyred hym leue rest peace certayne composycion none men shulde make warre non made also lyke maner herytours lordes gascoyne dyde duke accorded hym hadde hostage behalfe sent kepte pyergourt hoole hoost wherof duke anio chiefe drewe towardes mount marsen towne lourde highe gascone wherof sir arnold de uyre capitayne frechmen layd siege therto demaunded wolde yelde vp duke aniowe towne soone agreed therto knyght kept sayde howe erle foiz delyuered hym place wherfore sayde wolde delyuer none person whan constable herde caused euery man assaute castell suche wyse wonne force capitayne slayne dyuers bo men woman towne ouerron robbed left detyng left men therin frenchman entred lande castell bone ouerran tha passed lande castell neufe whiche assayled went towarde byenre came entre lande lorde lescute rode forwarde came good towne good castell called sault held ye countie foiz landes arere fee gascoyne prince wale went spayne mynde haue made warr agaynst ye countie foiz bycause wolde nat holde hym also ye duke aniou coquered moost part acquitayne shewed hymselfe lorde ther wolde haue possessyon layd siege towne sault gascoyne whiche nat easy wyn within capitayn sir wyllim pan whan erle foiz sawe howe frenchman conquered landes arerefees reason shuld holde french kyng orels kyng englande sent vicount castell bone lordes mersalte castell neufz lescute abbot saynt syluere whanne come sent saue coduct go speke duke aniowe lay styll siege saulte duke accorded therto lordes went hoost duke agreed landes shulde abyde respite peace tyll ye myddes august tyme ther shulde apere ye towne mo sac day certayne nombre men warre french kynges parte kyng englandes part party coude kepe felde wolde holde la de peace euer whiche couenant parforme therle foiz lordes layd good hostage duke aniou went pyergourte hole army gaue lycence man departe season ther exchange made certayne land prisoner spaygne whiche landes kynge spayne gyuen constable frauce lorde manny suche seruyce done spayne costable gaue lande saryen castell exchange erle pebroke taken prisoner rochell ser olyuer many gaue lande grece lordes sir richarde dangle wyllim nephue othes gratsone john de gremeres tanyboton season began treatie bytwene duke aniou duke lancastre pyergort assurance towarde duke aniou duke lancastre helde himselfe kynge regent theglysshe march ther respyte warre agreed bytwene ayders endure tyll last day august yt two duke shulde begynning septebre march picardy duke aniou saynt omers duke lacastre calys truce thus taken duke lacastre duke breten therles warwyke suffolke stafforde lordes spenser wyl loughby chanoyne robersart henry percy lorde mauue lord knightes viii day july deted fro burdeux returned englande whan capitayns bercerell sir johan pert johan cornwall kept tresse space yere agaynst frechmen lay siege sawe socoure ayde comyng warde vytayls began sore mynisshe toke aduyse togyder de myned make composycion fell treaty lordes hambuye stonuyll blaynuyll franuyll lordes normandy lay siege right wery wolde gladly haue fallen treaty howe beit first wolde knowe kyng mynde acorded right well therto duke bretayne nat personally bitwene tyme feest allsayntes next comyng ye towne bercerell wise able reyse siege el within yelde vp composycion ther de lyuered hostage therle penbroke put raunsome sixe thousande frankes lomberdes bruges becae dettours therfore promysed payment therof assoone hole good poynt erle rode vnder conduct constable frau ce feuer sickenesse toke hym ye way horse lytter brought cyte arras sickenesse toke hym sore lay bedde final lye dyed constable lost money therle penbroke left behynde hym sonne age two yere sir richarde dagle made finauce shall shewe ye haue herde howe lorde roy prisoner englade child doughter heyre frendes sayd lorde roy fell treaty sir olyuer manny knyght bretayne nephue sir bertram clesquy delyueraunce lorde roy meanes exchaunge one prisoner haue wyfe lorde roys doughter great lynage tha sir olyuer many sent kyng englade knowe knyght wolde gladlyest haue delyueced lorde roye kyng enclynod haue sir rychard dangle delyuered quyte eche lord ny wedded doughter lorde royes sayde lorde roye maryed doughter lorde wille floren heynalt knyghtes sir tanyboton sir othes grantson johan gruners put fynauce meanes sir olyuer manny passed easy courtesse rausome p howe dyuers townes yelded vp french kyng gascon sir hugh chastellon retourned fro prison howe castell bercerell normady yelded vp fre che cap ccc xii whan myddes august began aproche iourney shulde hold monsac duke anioue came thyder great nobre men warr came lay monsac sixe dayes thyder came body apere parte englysshmen thought reason treaty made bitwene duke aniou duke lancastre iourney shulde haue ouerpast duke aniou counsayle nat mynde duke sent erle foiz vicount chatell boine lordes marsen chatell neufe lescute abbot saynt syluere shuld holde couenaut el duke sayd wolde sle hostag entent wolde entre landes suche puyssaunce wolde compell cry mercy lordes putte selfe landes vnder obeysance frenche kyng monsac opened towne whiche fayre garison went presented key duke aniou hym dyde fealtie homage duke company entred taryed xviii dayes meane season oke counsayle parte shulde drawe soone myddes august shulde past truce shulde expyred whan daye past duke aniou went ryoll whan layen siege thre dayes ye ryoll put themselfe vnder obeysaunce frenche kyng went langon whiche also yelded vp saynt marquayre condose basylle towre prudece mauleon towre drowe nombre xl townes castels tourned selfe frenche viage last tourned frenche dauberoth euery place ye duke layd newe garisons whan ordayned euery thyng accordyng pleasure retourned fraunce constable lykewise kyng sent gaue lycence moost parte company departe lordes clisson beaumauoyre dauangourt ray ryon vycontes rohan lauall came ye siege bercerell holde iourney ye day prefixed sayd howe duke bretayn sir robert canoll lorde spenser comynge thyder reyse siege ye haue herd sir hugh chastellon master crosbowes taken abbeuile sir nycholas louuayn caryed england coude come rausome bycause axed moche fynauce howe marchaunt flaunders auaunsed hymselfe dyde somoche subtelly gate hym englande maner howe ouer long tolde therfore passe breuely whan come gayne fraunce kyng restored agayne office maister ye crosbowes sent abuyle kepe fronters two hundred spea e countre aboute obeyed sir johan bertheouyllers capitayn boloyn sir henry isle capitayne dept suche garysons tyrwinnyn saynt dmers lykos fiennes mount roye lorde comynges capitayne arde sir johan ubrues assembled arde viii hundred speares erly mornyng departed ran towarde boloyne se coulde fynde adueture day capiten boloyne lx speares issued rode towarde calais lykewise fynde aduenture returnynge encountred sorde compynges company ryden warde boloyne capitayne boloyne saued hym selfe moche payne lost xiiii speares chase lorde comynges retourned agayne mornynge maister crosbowes made muster hym great nombre arthoys uermadoyes aboute yt nombre thre hudred speares tyme erle saynt powle newly come picardy fro lande lorayne day rydynge lady boloyne pilgrymage herde way howe maister crosbowes wolde likewise tyde thyder met rode forthe togyder came arde taryed ther certayne space ye felde knewe nothyng theglysshmen brode felde englisshmen knewe nothyng whan frenchman ben certayne tyme arde sawe man issue returned abbey lyques soone departed fro arde englisshman issued priuely rode longe priuy wayes knewe countre last mette lorde comynges returnyng warde arde tolde hym howe frenchemen ben arde departed tyme frenchman past tornehen certifyed thenglisshmen tydynge abrode capitayne arde tourned costed one syde layd busshment thre hudred speares lytle wood besyde liques wherof sir hugh chastellon chefe capitayn ordayned yt yong erle saynt poule great nombre knightes squiers shulde tyde forthe nat far then along great hedge lorde comynges sir ubreues company restyng lighted fote good order sir johan harlston went forthe xx speares breke frenche busshement determyned fly suffre frechmen chase rode forthe feldes yonge erle saynte poule brode te hundred speares sayd company let v auance forthe yoder enemyes basshed spurres horse ran fast might sir john harlston turned caused chase along hedge theglysshmen redy rainged archer assoone frenchman came englysshmen receyued speares ax archer began shote ouerthrewe men armes beate downe horse done many feate armes fynally frenchemen enclosed ouerthrowen yong erle saynt poule takenne prisoner squyer duchy guerles taken lorde pouns clarry sir william melle charles chastellon lionet daraynes gauues uaisnell henry isle johan brother chastellayn beauuoyse dyuers knightes squiers contynent disconfyture lorde chastellon banner thre hudred speares came hedge ende whan sawe disconfyture company drewe company toguyder departed without stroke gyuen thenglysshmen haynowes led prisoner towne arde night lorde comynges bought therle saynt poule squier taken hym prisoner anon went englande presented kyng thanked hym therfore hadde therby great profyte season come fraunce duke aniou constable fraunce also arche bysshoppe rohan bisshoppe crapent ben long kyng parys passed forthe go saynte dmers kepe daye apoyntement duke lancastre also come calys lord bocnyer hym wente bruges anone duke aniowe came saynt dmers great array sent hym cosyn sir guy bloys came thyder haynalt lay frontres fraunce fla ders towarde arde croyes aboute ba llule flaunders cassell ther constable fraunce lordes clysson lauall sir dlyuer manny mo vi hundred speares kepe countre let shulde come erle flauders great trust also wolde neuer come brug nothyng entreatours coude v ye haue herd howe bercerell besieged space yere howe made composicion yelde vp fortres without reskewed feast sayntes whan day began aproche ye french kyng sente thyder great nombre men warre knightes bretayne normandy excepte suche constable ther mershals frauce sir lewes saxere sir mouton blanuylle erle harecourt sir james uien admyrall fraunce doulpoyu auuergne sir johan bulle dyuerss lordes helde iourney day bercerell none came thyder apere forte resse yelded vp euery man departed wolde sir john apert men cornewall tooke see retourned englande lordes frauce toke possessyon forteresse bercerell newe repayred refresshed men artyllary puruyances anone comaudment french king men warre went layd siege saynt saluyour vicount costantyne whiche parteyned sir johan chandos dethe ye kyng englande gaue sir alayn boucquesell tha englande hadde lefte capitayne squier called charenton sir thomas cornet johan de bourge thre bretherne maulurier sixscore men warr saynt sauiour besieged see sir johan uien admyrall frauce lande lord bretayne normandy ther great hoost dressed vp engyns agaynst towne whichesore traueyled within forteresse nowe let v speke lord bruges entreat peace freche parte duke anion burgoyne erle salebruch bysshoppe amiens chiefe bayeux englisshe parte ye duke lacastre erle salisbury bysshop lodon last thentent none yuell trouble shulde coe lordes none men rode dayly bytwene party therfore agreed truce endure fyrst day may next march calais ryuer landes styll warre sent bretayne lorde clysson lorde de lauall companyes kepe fronters p howe duke bretayne arryued bretayne tooke dyuers castels forteresses force trewce made bytwene french kyng kyng englande alyes cap ccc xiii whyle lordes entreatyng peace brug duke bretayn englande ye haue herde sawe well howe countre great trybulacion nighe countre turned agaynst hym countesse wyfe castell alroye selfe ye kyng englade right hertely loued hym sayd fayreson knowe well howe loue ye haue put balance landes put seignory fayre herytage ye certayne shall right well recouer agayne woll make peace frechmen without ye coprssed therin haue agayne herytage duke hubly thaked hym season duke bretayne assembled toguyder hapton thre archer payed wage ordynance kyng englande halfe yere two men armes yt iorney went therles ca bridge marche lorde spenser sir thoms holade nicholas camoire edwarde twyford richarde pontchardon johan esselle thomas grantson hugh hastyng lord maue pole diuers knightes squiers duke bretayne company arryued saynt mathewes tyne potern bretayne toke lande contynent assayled ye castell without towne castell nat greatly fortifyed nother men artillery engylsshmen toke force slewe within whan within towne saynte mathewes knewe therof opened gate receyued duke lord thenglisshmen went towne polle de lyon whiche stronge well closed made great assaute archer beyng dyke shot holy togyder fewe none durst shewe selfe defence towne wonne ouerron exyled went brue de uaulx well fortifyed men armes purueyaunces lordes clysson beaumanoyre vycount rohan dyuers lordes bretayne lytell fore refresshed fortresse euery thing neded duke englisshmen layd siege therto whan saynt sauyour vicout vnderstode howe duke bretayn lordes englande arryued bretayne trusted wolde come thyder reyse siege whiche greatly desyred greatly co streyned engyns dyde cast day nyght wyst nat kepe theselfe danger toke aduyse entreat frechmen haue truse endure ester yere lorde thre hundred lxxv whiche vi wekes within tyme shulde fought withall orreysed fro sege el yelde vp forteresse lyues good saued truce taken lay styll siege made warre eche duryng season vicont rohan lord clisson beaumanoyre laye fronter agaynst duke bretayne glisshmen lay sege saynt bru de uaulx herde reported howe sir john deureux nere campelly made great warre countre newly repayred fortifyed lytell fortresse wherin made garyson called nouell fort capelly coulde nat issue towne without trouble sent worde therof lorde clysson lamballe company departed then left men behynde kepe towne rode longe came newe forters layd seige therto whiche tidynges came duke bretayn siege saynt brue de uaulx ye duke made myne bene makyng ye space xv dayes tyme loste myne labour whan duke lordes hoost knewe sayd thynges consydered thought loste tyme abyde lenger wherfore sayd better go ayde sir john deureux may fynde felde hath layde siege hym trust shall haue fayre iourney disloged rode towarde newe forteresse whiche lordes bretayne made assayled wyse fote wall feared nothynge caste downe well pauesshed also within lytell stuffe cast downe therwith hast came one sayd sir get hen yonder cometh duke bretayne englysshmen nat past two leages hen trupet sowned retrayte drewe abacke toke horse departed went campelly whiche nat far then closed gate lyfte vp brydges tyme duke bretayne come thyder barones englande company past ye newe fortresse hadde spoken sir johan deureux thaked comyng el ben soone taken duke layde siege towne campelly set forthe archer brigates well pauessed made great assaut englysshemen fayned nat dyd within ther dyuers hurte bothe partes euery day assaute elles skrymysshe within sawe well howe coulde nat long endur sawe socours comyng also sawe well yt coulde nat yssue departe fortresse closed euery syde also knewe well taken byforce shulde haue mercy specially lorde clysson thenglysshmen hated hym sore tha lordes bretayn within began entreat duke yelde selfe vp vpon courtes raunsome duke wolde haue symply moche payne last gat arespyte viii dayes duryng respyte fell well within forteresse two knyghtes england one sir nicholas carsuell sir water durswyke sent duke bretayne fro duke lancastre comaundyng vertue treatie peace made brug bitwene kyng england ye frenche kyng wherof brought charter sealed trewce without delay sight leaue make warre incontynent truce reed publysshed hoost also shewed within capelly wherof right ioyfull say lorde clisson vicont rohan lorde beaumanoyre ye trewce came well thus brake vp siege capelly ye duke bretayn gaue leaue departe except suche dayly house went alroy wyfe erles ca bridge marche sir thomas holande erle irelande lorde spenser englysshmen retourned agayne englande whan duke bretayn ordred besynesse great leaser refresshed towne castell breest alroy retourned agayne englande wyfe hym day trewce made bruges endur hole yere bytwene kynges englande fraunce alies duke burgoyne one parte duke lancastre parte sware come thyder agayn feest alsaynt eche parte shulde holde enioye euery thyng possession said terme englysshmen thought saynt sauiour vicount shulde saued reason treatie frenchman sayd fyrst couynant shulde passe last ordynance whan day aproched ofsaynt sauyoure shulde yelde vp el rescued frendes french kyng sent thyder great nombre men warre vi thousande speares knightes squiers besyde people none came thyder reyse siege wha day expyred ther yelded vp frenchlordes full sore agaynst wylles yt forteresse well sittyng englysshmen capitayne sir thomas tynet johan de bourc thre bretherne malurier englisshmen went carentyn toke shyppynge retourned englande constable fraunce newe refresshed forteresse saynt saluyour vicount sette breton knight capitayne therin vnderstode frenche kynge gyuen seignorie iorney lorde coucy made austrych deth prince wale howe coulde founde maner treatie peace bitwene two kyng also dethe kynge englande edwarde thyrde cap ccc xiiii season come frauce lord coucy ben longe lubardy erle uertue sonne sir galea makyng warre sir barnabo alies bycause pope gregory xi holy colledge rome lorde coucy succession mother suster duke austryche last disseased wherby ought enheryter duchy duke deed without issue waye maryage austrich gyuen duchy lande another farther lynage lorde coucy wherof lorde coucy hadde often tymes complayned emperour lorde charles behayne theperour knewe well yt lorde coucy right therto howe might nat ease constrayne austryche strong countre many good men warre lorde coucy made warre conforte aunt suster duke lytell auayled whan thus coe fraunce kyng made great chere aduysed sawe well howe fraunce many men warre satte ydell wherfore thought coude nat better ocupyed helpe right durynge trewce bytwene fraunce england lorde couey desy kyng let haue breton ouer ronne realme make warre hym austryche kyng wolde gladly companyons hys realme accorded desyre kynge lende gaue nat tell wheder lx thousade frankes departe among sayd companyons rode forthe warde austryche ye feest ofsaynt michell dyd moche yuell wayes w also ther dyuers baron knyghtes squiers frauce arthoys uermandoys haynaulte rdy vicountes meaul daunoy sir ra e co arone roy peter bare dyuers desyring bodyes get honour whan feast alsayntes began aproche tha came agayn bruges entreate peace fro frenche kynge duke burgoyn erle sal bruce bysshoppe n duke lay atsaynt omers ro kynge englande thyder came duke lancastre duke bretayne erle sal sbury bysshop london towne bruges well garnysshed dyuers astates specially duke burgoyn kept noble astate duke lan astre ther ser robert namur kept good company longe duke flaunders ther ambassadours archebysshop rohan bysshoppe carpetras went styll laboured bytwene bothe tie layd forthe many good reason none came effecte lordes farre sondre treaty frenche kynge demaunded haue agayne hundred thousande frankes whiche payed redempcion kyng john haue cala raysed beaten downe whiche kyng englande wolde neuer consent trewce contynued feest saynt johan baptyst next yere lorde thousande thre hundred lxxvi lordes aryed styll bruges wynter somer returned euery part owne coutreis except duke bretayne taryed styll flaunders erle loys cosyn made gode cher p season trynite sonday past worlde oure chi alry englande edwarde prince wale tayne kynges pala westmynster besyde london enbawmed put leed kept tyll feast saynt michaell next entred greatter sole ytie whan parliament shulde ther kyng charles fraunce bycause lynage dyd obsequy reuerently holy chapell paleys parys many prelate noble realme frauce truce prologed first day aprill next let v somwhat speke lorde coucy almayns whan austriche almayns vnderstode lorde coucy coe strength make warre caused brent distroyed thre dayes ourney countre along ryuer went mountayns place inhabytable wha lorde cou wende haue founde vytayle hoost coude get none wherby suffred wynter moche trouble dysease wyst nat whyder go forage gette vitayle horse dyed huger colde sicknesse therfore whan springyng tyme began returned agayne fraunce went dyuers place refresshe selfe frenche kyng sent moost parte co panyons bretayne base normandy yde rest thought well shulde haue sowhat short tyme retournyng lorde cou fraunce began good frenche bicause ounde kyng amyable condiscende desyre also counsayle sayd ne nat voide heritage vnder shadowe kyng englandes warr sayd frenche name blode armes extraction sent wyfe englande kept styll eldest doughter left yonger styll englande wher brought vp norisshed frenche kyng sent lorde coucy bruges ther entreate peace great lordes nat onely duke bretayne styll cosyn therle flaunders busyed selfe lytle treatie peace feest saynt mychaell whan obsequy prince done fynisshed kyng englande made knowen duke lacastre erle cambridge lorde thoms yongest baron erles prelat knightes englande howe yonge richarde shulde kyng discease caused swere solemly maynteyne christmas day kyng made hym sytte table aboue owne chyldren great estate representyng shulde ky alter discease sent bruges kyng englandes parte john lorde cobham bysshoppe herforde mayre london frenche partie thyder came erle salebruche lorde chastellon maister phylbert le two bysshoppes embassadr alwayes went bytwene party treatynge peace spake mariage bytwene yong prince englande lady doughter frenche kyng departed aswell frauce englande made report bothe kynges lent secrete treatie bytwene two kyngesat moutrell see sent kynge englande calais sir rycharde dangle rycharde stan ge ray cha er fro frenche kyng sent lorde cou riuyer sir nycholas braque nycholas brasier along season treated sayd mariage frenchman offered enfourmed dyuers thyng wolde haue agayne otherthynges suche named el nothyng entreatours went made report lord trewce agayne relonged fyrst day maye came agayne calais erle salisbury bysshop saynt dauyd chaucellour englande bysshoppe herforde frenche kynge muttrell lorde coucy sir wylliam dormans chaucellour frauce durst neuer trust mete toguy er place bytwene mutterell cal bytwene mutterell boleyn fronters thyng two bysshoppes embassadours coude orshewe thus entreatours abode astate tyll expyred whan warr open sir hughe caurell sent kepar calais whan pope gregoriebeynge non vnderstod peace coude wene frauce england right sorousull ordred busynesse shortly went rome whan duke breten e yere erle flauders cosyn sawe ye warr open toke leaue therle wet grauelyng thyder came therle salisbury sir rycharde dangle went calais ther taryed space moneth went englande came shene foure leages fro london long temmes syde kynge englande laye sore sy ke past worlde gyll ofsaynt john baptyst yere lorde thousande thre hundred lxxvii great sorowe made englande incontynent passage realme stoppedde none shulde yssue realme wolde nat dethe kyng shuld soone knowen fraunce tyll haddeset realme ordre tyme ther came englande erle salisbury sir rycharde dangle body kyng edwarde thirde great processyons ynges lamentacyons sonnes behynde hym noble prelate englande brought long cytie london open visage westmynster buried besyde quene wyfe anon yong kyng richard crowned palays westmynster great solem ytie stode duke la llre bretayne xi yere age moneth july whiche day made four erles nyne knightes first lorde nycholas vncle made rle olengy lorde percy erle northumberlande sir thomas dangle erle huntyngdon lorde mombray erle notyngham yonge kyng putte vnto rule gentyll knyght sir rycharde dangle accorde lande instru ted noble vertues realme englande gouerned duke lancastre soone frenche kynge knewe dethe kynge edwarde sayd howe yght obly valiantly hadde reyg ed well ought putte newly remem raunce amonge nombre worthyes assembled great nombre noble prelat realme dyd ob quy ye holy chapell palys paris anone dyed ye eldest doughter frenche kyng ensured haue maryed wylliam heynault eldest sonne duke aubert p howe freche kyng sent great nauy see howe dyuers townes brent englande howe duke burgoyne tooke dyuers castels calys cap ccc xv meane seasone whyle sayd trewce endured frenche kyng uyded greatly shyppes andgaleys kynge spayne sent admyrall sir ferraunt sause sir johan de uien admyrall fraunce whan tre wee expired went brent towne rye four dayes dethe kyng edwarde vigill saynt peter july slewe men woman founde tidynges came london therles cambridge bouligney went douer great nombre men warre erle salisbury lorde montagu went march towarde hapton french army toke laude ile ubyq brent therm dyuers wnes lamed dartmouth plomouthe plesume dyuers whan brente pylled towne ubique went agayne ye see costed forewarde came porte called poc redy erle salisbury lorde montague defended passage howebeit brente parte towne poc toke see agayne costed towardes hapton wolde dayly haue taken lande englande englysshmen company erle salisbury rode dayly alonge see cost kept euer fro takyng lande ye frenchman came hapton redy sir johan arudell great nombre men warre archer defended towne elles ben taken frenchman departed went towarde douer toke lande day lytle abbay called lians ther many men countre assembled hadde made priour place sir thomas cheyny johan fuselle chefe capitayns set selfe good array defende passage frechmen small aduauntage coste moche people coulde take lande fynally force good fightyng toke lande ther sore scrimysshe howe beit englysshmen dryuen backe putte flyght two hundred slayne two knightes priour taken prisoner frenche men entred agayne shippes lay styll night ancre abbey frenche men knewe first dethe kynge edwarde englande prisonners coronacyon kyng richarde great parte ordre made englande rulynge realme sir johan uyenne caused barke departe sent therin knight aryued harflewe knight rode parys founde kynge shewed hym certayne tidynges deth kyng edwarde whiche sayeng kynge gaue credence frenchman spanyardes departed sayled forthe wynde wyll came tyde threof clocke douer sir edmonde erle cambridge sir thomas brother erle buckynghame redy hundred thousande baners displayed abydinge frenchman sixscore shippes galyes frenchemen came foreby porte taryed nat passed toke depe see see began ebbe howe beit englysshmen taryed styll day nextnight frenche men nexte tyde came hauen calays entred ye haue herde sir johan captall beufz taken prisoner soubise kept towre teple parys kyng england prince whyle lyued wolde gladly haue hym delyuered ther also moche entreatie made cousell bruges ther offred exchange yong erle saynt poule thre four knyghtes frenche kyng cousayle wolde nat cosent therto howbeit french kyng made shewed priour hym kepyng wolde swere neuer beare armes agaynst ye crowne fraunce wolde condiscende delyuerance captall answered wold neuer make othe dye prison abode prison sure kepynge v yere lytell ioye toke prisonment lytell pacyence long last dyed prison french kyng caused hym entered ryght solemply therat dyuers barownes knightes prelate frauce thus feblyssed thenglissh capitaynes yere dyed also lorde spensar great baron englande good knight hym wyfe doughter sir bartylmewe brunes abode sonne four doughters anone dethe sayde captall frenche quene delyuered fayre doughter named mary whiche byrthe quene toke suche sicknesse ye dyed quene full noble vtues doughter gentyll duke burbone lorde peter dyed batayle poycters obsequy done abbay saynte denyse buryed great solempnyte wherat ther nighe ye noble prelate fraunce namely marchesse parys season sir hughe caurell capitayne calais sir john harlston capitayn guynes lorde gomegines capitayne arde made many iourneys picardy euery weke thre four often tymes ran saynt omers arkes moton fyenes therabout boloyne somtyme tyrwyn specially garyson arde dyde moche hurt countre wherof complayntes came oftentymes herynge frenche kyng whervpon toke cousayle knowe might best restrayn shewed hym howe ye garyson arde nat stronge might easely begoten kyng sayd haue wyll spare cost within lytell space made somos men warre secretely man wyst whider wolde sende chefe duke burgoyne brother xv hundred speares well furnysshed sodenly cae bastyde arde besieged rounde duke burgoyne erle guynes marshall blanuyle lordes clysson lauall rougemont ryuer bregyde frannyll danuyll dautoyng raueuall angest sir james burbone seneshall heynalte dyuers knightes barones engyns cast nyght day stone two hundred weight assayled right feirsly lorde gomegynes lorde forteresse whan sawe hym selfe enclosed many noble men warre promysed wonne assaut hym shulde dye also nat well prouyded artillary longe endure procurement lorde raneuall cosyn germayn entred treaty yelde vp garyson lyues good saued treaty long makyng howe beit last forteresse gyuen vp suche wolde departed brought calais sir gawen bayllule sir wylliam bourdes made capitayne ard kepar long tyme vicount meaulx thirdly capitayne ther lord sampy day arde delyuered duke went layd siege castell arduyche wherin capitayns thre bretherne mauluryer duke lay thre dayes made dyuers assautes last within yelded vp castell brought calys marshall fra ce duke went besieged uauclinen whiche also yelded vp dyde whan duke newe refresshed place vitayls men gaue lycence euery man departe wet himselfe fraunce kynge lordes breton went bretayne tidynges brought duke bretayne aryued brest great army lordes burgoyne place retourned euery man owne p howe warre began agayn bytwene freche kyng kyng nauerre howe kynge nauer lost coutie deureux except chierbourge whiche beseged frenchman iorney duke lancastre made bretayne cap ccc xvi haue herde peace made uernon bytwene frenche kyng kyng nauar howe kynge nauar left two sonnes vncle frenche kyng ther great suspect layde squyer beyng frenche kynges court attendyng two sonnes kyng nauarr squyer called james rue also clerke great maister kyng nauars cousayle great gouernour countie deuxeux called maister peter tartre iuged dethe cruelly executed parys ther shewed people howe mynde haue enpoysoned frenche kynge kyng reared vp great army men warr made costable chefe leader lorde de la ryuer dyuers baron knightes went normady fortress castels kyng nauarre whiche fayre noble well garnysshed layd siege forteresse called ponteau de mere dyuers gones engyns ablemetes saut whet troubled sore forteresse within howbeit dyde defende selfe valiantly ther dyuers saute scrimysshes longe space durynge siege castell sore brused wtin sore oppressed desyred oftentymes constable gyue vp forteresse elles yf taken force promysed shulde dye customably suche costables promyse naueroyse sawe vitayls began mynisshe knewe well howe kyng nauer farr fro yelded vp fortresse coueyed chierbourge good fortresse rased beaten downe erthe whiche cost moche makynge therof also walles poteau de mere beaten downe frenchman went besieged fortresse mortayne lay great season within saw maner ayde confort comyng fro kynge nauarr also forteresses nat able make resystence agaynst frenchman gaue vp dyd season costable brought frenche kynges obeysaunce townes castelles fortress countie deureur forteresses beaten downe erthe townes vnclosed thentent shulde neuer ryse warre vnto realme fraunce meanes castell towne kyng nauer shulde haue countie deureux also fre che kynge made gabelles subsydies rynne aswell parte realme fraunce also tyme kyng spaygne made bastarde brother entre nauarr great nombre men warre began wynne countre assayled townes fortress yt kyng nauerr coude make resystence agaynst sent worde therof yonge kyng richarde englande desyring ayde agaynst frenche kynge countie deureux selfe abyde styll nauar kepe fortress ther agaynst kyng spaygne kyng richarde aduyse counsayle sent sir robert roux nombre men armes archer see toke lande chierbourc thyder came ben put fortress countie deureux frenche constable whan ther togyder great nombre chosen men prouyded well fortresse beleued beseged whan constable lorde de la ryuer copany coutie deureux nothyng left aparant kyng nauer vnclosed vnder obeysance french king tha cae chierbourc strong nobly fouded first julyus cesar whan coquered englande port see frenchman layed siege rounde except see syde determyned nat departe then tyll sir robert de roux copany within made many issue day night ther ther day nyght scrimysshe frenchman coude seke dede armes founde ynowe euer answere many slayne taken aswell one parte durynge siege whiche lasted remynaunt sommer thanne sir olyuere clesquy made day busshement began scrimisshe frenche men driuen backe busshment sir olyuer clesquy cae enbusshment ranne feirlly thenglysshmen naueroyes ther harde encoutre bothe party many man borne erthe slayne hurte taken rescued fynally sir olyuer clesquy taken prisoner asquier nauer called john coq put chierbourge scrymysshe ended domage frenchman englisshmen sir olyuer sent englande abode prisoner long space london put raunsome thus great cost charge frenchemen abode styll great parte wynter lytell conquest sawe well lost tyme lyeng ther thought well chierbourc inprignable alwayes might newe refresshed vitayls men see wherfore frenchemen dislodged layde counter garysons agaynst chierbource mountbourge pount done charentyn saynt lou saynt saluiour vicount euery man badde leaue dete yere lorde thousande thre hundred lxxviii ye haue well harde howe duke bretayne departed bretayn hym wyfe englande abode suche laude englande whiche called countie richemont laboured sore yong kyng richarde cou sayle haue helpe ayde recouer lande agayne whiche tourned frenche coude nat herde season duke lancastre enfourmed wolde go bretayne great armye dyuers forteresses castels wolde yelde vp specially saynt malo isle fayre fortresse hauen see duke lancastre reysed vp army went hampton toke see great nombre lordes knight men warre archer sayled forthe tyll came saynt malos toke lande discharged purueyance layd siege aboute towne saynt malo within towne nothyng afrayd well prouyded vitayls men warr cro bowes valiantly defended selfe duke lay longe space whan constable fraunce lorde clisson knewe therof made great sommons men warre cae towarde saynt malos reyse siege man wolde haue thought dyuers tymes batayle shulde haue bytwene party englysshmen often tymes ordred themselfe redy gyue batayle constable lorde clysson wolde neuer aproche nere batayle myght bytwene whan englisshmen ben ther great space sawe well towne hadde wyll yelde vp duke lancastre counsayle disloge seyng lost tyme lyeng toke agayne see returned englande gaue leaue euery man departe p howe castell alroy bretayne yelded vp frenche frenche garyson layd mountbourge agaynst garyson chierbourc cap ccc xvii tyme castel alroy possession duke bretayn lay styll englande frenche kynge sent dyuers lordes fraunce bretayne great nombre ley siege castell alroy alroy knewe socour comyng fro parte wherfore fell treatie nat socoured duke bretayne kyng england certayn day lymytted yelde vp place whiche treaty agreed day came frenchman kept iourney none pered nother fro duke bretayne fro kyng englande castell gyuen vp put vnder obeysauce freche kyng castels good townes bretayne deted fro alroy suche duke bretayne p yere lorde thousande thre hu dred lxxviii anone easter kyng charles fraunce sawe well howe chierbourc made sore warre countie constantyne ordeyned sir wyll bordes valiant knight good capitayne keper souerayne capityne constantyne fortress ther chierbourc sayd sir wyllim fayre company men armes cro bowes genowayes wente laye mountbourge made counter garyson agaynst chierbourc desired nothyng moche fight englysshmen chierbourc co sydering howe hym floure men armes garysons season sent capitayne chierbourc englisshe knight called sir john harlston whome haue often spoken ben long space capitayne guyens toke shippyng hampton iii hudred men armes many archer arryued chierbourc sir othes grantson englisshmen ther sir johan aubourge sir john orsell dyuers knyghtes squyers assoone arryued discharged horse baggage taryed ther certayne dayes made redy ryde abrode coutre make warr also sir wylliam brodes frenche partie imagyned nyght day howe myght domage englysshmen season two knightes layd many busshementis eche aueyled nothyng nat fortune mete somtyme companyes met togyder rode sekyng aduentures mette often tymes ouerthrewe eche somtyme frenchman wanne somtyme lost long rode forthe layd wayte eche mornyng sir wylliam bordes garyson montbourge thought ryde forthe towarde chierbourc fyght sir johan harlstone yf myght encounter hym drawe felde rode forth withall company puyssauce aswell men armes crosbowes fote parte sir john harlston knewe nothyng frenchman wer abrode also great desire ryde forthe mornyng sowned trumpettes caused co pany armed aswell horsebacke fote went feldes ordayned shulde byde forteresse rode forthe great array ordayned sir orsell capitayne fotemen ordeyned currours likewise done sir wylliam bordes long bothe party rode forthe last currours ca nere toguyder eche aduysed well eche retourned owne hoost reported certayntie enemyes two capitaynes right ioyouse founde longe sought whan two capitayne herde reporte courrours drue companyes togyder displayed baners standerd aproched eche soone nere togyder within shotte bowe frechmen lighted lykewise dyde englysshemen archer cro bowes began shote men armes aproched speares handes rainged well closed gyder assembled togyder te began foyne speares stryke ax swexdes sore harde bataile well fought men armes proued well valyatise prowes sir wylliam bordes armed pes axe hande strikyng right syde lyft whome soeuer gaue full stroke went erthe ther dyd suche dedes armes owne body hat ought praysed foreuer syde sir johan harlstone capitayne chierbourc fought valiantly axe fote amonge formast ynough matched hard parte many valyant dede done day many man slayne hurte sir johan harlston borne downe erthe great adueture lyfe force armes rescued batayle endured long space well fought well contynued bothe tie ther none great aduauntage dyuers slayne hurte bothe party fynally englysshmen fought long good hertes obtayned place frenchman disconfyted slayne taken fewe noble men sayed sore fought withall power departe thinkyng outher dye el vaquesshe enemyes taken ser wylliam bordes squyer heynault called wylliam de beaulyau man armes long lyen among englysshmen garyson calais whome sayde sir wylliam yelded selfe right soroufull iourney nat ben ther thenglisshmen brought frenchman great myschefe many taken prisoner thende ye batayle great pytie deed whan thenglysshmen dispoyled deed men sir john harlston copany departed fro place leyde prisoner spoyle went agayne chierbourc ye may well knowe englisshmen made great toye thiss iourney ye god sent sir wylliam bordes de greatly feested son well worthy made moche discomfyture bytwene mountbourge chierbourc saynt martyns day yere lorde thousande threhundred lxxir whan frenche kynge knewe tydinges howe garison mountbourge capitayne taken slayne howe countrey great afray yt discofyture kyng sage well abuysed dedes purueyed incontynent remedy sent delay moutbourge newe men warre kepe fronters fortress countre agaynst garyson chierbourc cheife men warre sir johan uyen sir hugh bremalles helde march agaynst thenglysshmen ordynance frenche kyng abandoned forsoke mountbourge countre constantyne whiche goodly plentyfull countre caused men woman chyldren issue forsake countrey constantyne lefte vp fayre house possession people went coutre constantyne frenchman kepe froter dune careton saynt malo march ioyning constantyne p iorney duke iou made agaynst thenglisshmen countre burdeloyse cap ccc xviii ye haue well herde howe duke burgoyne made viage march picardy right honorable profytable yt frenchman howe ordeyned arthoise castels possession capytens men warre kepe specyally towne iper stallysshed abyde vycounte meaulx lorde saynt pee newly fortifyed towne stronger ynough frenche kynge ryght glad tydingess reputed yt iourney right honourable sent incontynent letter saynt omers comaunded towne ayre shulde well garnysshed well largely prouyded necessaryes thynge done comaunded thus iourney brake vp howbeit lorde clisson breton brake nat copany assoone myght drewe bretayne tidynges come ye lorde clysson breton whyle ayre janequyn de clere squier englande good armes issued englande come bretayne kept bastydes breest wherfore breton drewe thyder fast might brought theym sir jaques uertayne seneshall heynalt duke burgoyne retourned fraunce kyng brother p season great assembly men armes march burdeuux comaundement ye duke aniou constable iourney agaynst gascoyns englisshmen wherof shall speke playnly whan shalbe better enfourmed therof yet tyme duke burgoyn made armye picardy hath shewed duke aniou good cytie tholouse good lady wyfe night day ymagined subtelly howe myght thyng contrary thenglyssmen sawe knewe well howe dyuers townes castelles longe ryue dordone fronters rouurgue tholosen duercy costreyned greatlye countre traueyled moche poore people vnder obeysance wherfore aduysed prouyde therfore remedy determyned mynde go laye siege bergerath bycause kaye gascoyne fronter rouuergue duercy lunosyn bicause yt knewe dyuers great barones gascoyne contrary lorde dura lorde rosen lorde ucydent yt lorde langurant lorde guernols carles sir peter landuras dyuers therfore aduysed make hym selfe stronge puyssante made great assemble resyst agaynst sayd lordes stronge kepe felde wrote sir johan armynake desirynge hym nat fayle b synes likewise sent lorde dalbret sent fraunce constable marshall fraunce sir loys sa xere beside lorde coucy dyuers knight squiers picardy britayne normandy desired greatly great wyll serue auauce body feates armes acheue honour praise ther come constable marshall fraunce duke knewe well howe ther great discorde bytwene cosyns frendes lorde pointer gascons sir thoms phelton great shall burdeux burdeloys reason cause shall shewe tyme yere lorde thousande thre hudred lxxv ther done cruell iustyce cytie burdeaux done comprised sir thomas phelton lieutenant kyng englande march burdeur lorde pomiers called sir wyllm maner treason wherof great marueyle cytie burdeur comaundement seneshall taken lorde pomers clerke counsayle secretary nacyon burdeau called johan coulone proued infourmed lorde pomiers shulde yelde himselfe castels frenche parte coude make non excuse saue fro deth wherfore lorde pomiers clerke openlye beheeded cytie burdeux people wherof hadde great merueyle lynage toke dede great dispyte thervpon departed fro burdeu fro burdeloys gentyll knight sir edmond pomiers vncle forsaid lord pomiers toke dede great shame sware kyng englade wolde neuer deare armur went ouer see holy sepulchre dyuers pylgrimages whan retourned turned himselfe frenche put selfe land vnder obeysance frenche kynge incontynent defyed lorde lespare gascone made hym great warre bycause forsayd iudgement also cause suspectyon bycause castell fron taken delyuered frenche hades whiche herytage lorde pomiers beheeded ther taken suspect treason sir johan plessac sir peter landuras sir bertram fraunce put prison burdeaur remayned space monethes howebe delyuered labour purchase frendes bycause ther coude nothyng proued agaynst thus endured longe space great daunger case wordes ran agaynst sir gaylart uyghier wherof great marueyle nat countrey lombardy lorde coucy seruyce pope gregorie helped excuse hym whan herde reporte knyght abode styll right engedred gascon suche besynes great hatredes couert enuy wherby fell many great myscheues whan duke aniowe sawe tyme dete tholouse moost parte men warr come drawen felde specially constable frace whome great trust confydence departed fro tholouse toke right way bergerath keper therof capitayn ser parducas dalbret castell lytell leage fro languedoc called mou ux ryght fayre castell longe traueyled duke anious hoost aryued bergerath lodged nigh ryuer might ye ease selfe horse duke aniou many noble men fyrst sir johan armynake great rout costable frau ce great company sir loys sanxer sir john bulle peter bulle yuan wale sir more trisiquidi somtyme englisshe parte bretayne one french breton also sir alayn beaumont sir alayn housey sir wylliam peter mornay sir johan uers sir baudwyn cremoux thybalte pount helyot calay dyuers good men warre ther made lodgynges alonge fayre medowes ryuer syde dordon great pleasur beholde nere duke lodgyng constable fraunce lodged often tymes companyons desired auaunce bodyes went scrimysshed barryers soo hurte wounded aduenture falleth often tymes suche dedes armes iday siege layd bergerath came duke hoost well acompanyed men armes brigates lord dalbret sir bertram cosyn receyued great ioye hoost gretlye enforsed viii day duke capitayns hoost counsayle se howe myght greue bergerath dyuers wordes deuyses long one poynt whiche assayle towne thought agayne assautes people myght sore hurt lytell effect day counsayle brake vp determyned full conclusyon sauyng contynewe styll siege loked dayly mo men warre commynge fraunce specially lorde coucy scrymisshes done bergerath howe englisshmen fre chemen gascoyns feirlly recoutred eche ca ccc xix sir thomas felton beyng burdeaulx knowynge enemyes wtin xii myle puyssaunce nat able resyst agaynst wherof nothyng ioyouse season knewe well howe duke aniou made somons sente state fraunce sent worde therof england kyng cousayle sent thyder dyde lytell good nothyng matter realme englande great bariauce among selfe one agaynst specially duke lancastre nat fauoure comen people wherby dyuers incydent parels fell england whiche season deted men warr england nother go gascoyne yet bretayne wherof kepte fronters vnder yonge kynge englande nothyng ioyouse sir thoms felton desired lorde lespare go englande better enfourme kyng vncles state gascoyn therby prouyde cou sayle desyre sir thomas felton lorde lespare entred thesee rose suche tempest agaynst driuen spayne encountred shippes spayne hadde ther great bataile suche fortune taken prisoner ledde spayne remayned tha yere halfe styll behated lynage lorde pomers sir thoms felton right valyaute man wrote sent specially lord musident lorde dura lorde rosen lorde langurant foure chefe barones moost puyssaute gascoyn englisshe party desiryng honour herytage kynge englande wolde come helpe defende countre coe puyssance burdeaulx knyghtes suche wolde truely acquyte kyng lorde officer redy come burdeaulx whan togyder nobre v hundred speares thus burdeaux burdeloys season whyle duke aniou lay siege bergerath sir thomas phelton foure barones gascone toke counsayle aduyse determyned ryde forthe agaynst frenchman entre place se myght spye aduauntage conquere thyng agaynst enemyes departed burdeaux one company mo thre hundred speares toke way ryoll came towne called yuret lodged busshmet knewe nothyng frenchman wherby great domage thus helde styll siege bergerath wher many scrimishe made many seate armes acheued bothe within without beit lytell wanne therby frenchman sir parducas dalbret capitayne defended valiauntly towne hoost without thentent greue sorer enemyes sent rioll great engyn called truye engyn made yt wolde cast great stone hudred men armes myght well within aproche assayle towne sir peter de bulle ordeyned fetche engyn sir john uers sir baudwen cremoux sir alayn beaumont lord mount calay lorde gaures departed fro hoost thre hundred speares passed gyde ryuer dordon rode towarde ryoll came forby place bitwene bergerath rioll called yuret wher englisshmen mo four hundred speares knewe nothyng comyng frenchman tidynges hoost constable englysshmen ridynge abrode man coude tell incontynent constable doute men sent another company men armes countergarde forager gone engyn whiche newe company capitayns sir peter mornay yuan wale thybault pount alyotte calay company ther two hundred men armes well apoynted sir peter bulle company gone engyn dyde moche came ryoll ther charged many chares engyn returned agayne towardes hoost another waye came broder passage bicause cariage came yuret nere thervnto within leage fayre adueture ther mette company owne felowshy whan togyder vi hundred speares rode leyser thynking themselfe insuerty tydinges cae sir thoms phelton ye baron gascoyn bryng yuret frechmen abrode comynge fro ryoll passe way towardes bergerath great engyn whiche tydinges ryght ioyouse sayd thynge ye moost desired armed mounted horse made selfe redy whan abrode felde nat long sawe frenchman comynge good ordre great nombre assoone eche knewe reputynge eche enemyes desirynge auance fight prouyng horse couchyng speares crieng cryes encountred eche fyrst metyng goodly iustes noble dedes armes acheued many knight squier ouet throwen etthe clene force armes ylous poyntes many hard aueture falleth ther helyot calay right experte squter good man armes striken fro horse stryken throte tauelyn burdeaux sharpe rasure whiche stroke cut sonder vaynes necke fell erthe ther dyed whiche great domage aduenture ended tyme dayes knight berrey lymosyn called sir wyllm lignac experte man armes valyant dyde day many valiant dede armes p howe englisshmen ouer throwen greattest lordes gascon taken howe bergerath tourned became frenche dyuerse townes castels march army duke aniou made cap ccc xx sayd encouter well fought bothe partes place called yuret nere ye village whan speres broken drewe swerd wherwith fought ryght valiatly doone many noble feate armes many prisoner taken rescued agayne slayne englysshe partie knight gascone called lorde gernos calais frenche parte slayne thybaulte du pount batayle endured longe season well fought many valyant men caused batell endure lenger fynally englysshemen ye gascons coude nat obtayne place frenchman conquered victory clene force armes ser wylliam lignac owne handes toke prisoner sir thomas phelton seneshall burdeux also taken lorde mucydent lorde dura lorde langurant lorde rosen ye batayle fewe scaped outher englysshe gascoyns taken slayne suche sledde toke way towarde burdeaux encountred seneshall landes sir wylliam helmen mayre burdeaux sir johan multon hudred speares wers myng yuret whan herde tyding losse felde retourned agayne hast burdeaux batayle clene done prisoner putte saue garde retourned bergerath siege duke aniou greatly reioysed tidynges whan harde howe men hadde sped howe flour gascoyne enemyes taken prisoner specially sir thomas phelton done hym many great displeasure reputed aduenture valure v hundred thousande frankes sir peter bulle company last retourned came agayne hoost bergerath well receyued brought ye duke aniou constable baron knyghtes fredes reputed noble profytable iourney next mornynge great engyn rered vp agaynst bergerath nere myght whiche greatlye abasshed towne tooke counsayle toguyder spake capitayne sawe well coulde nat longe endure coulde parceyue maner socoure comyng warde consydering howe sir thoms phelton seneshall taken chiualry gascon shuld haue trust sir perducass sayd sir strong ynough kepe towne haue vitayle artillary sufficyent therfore let v make none euyll marchandise mater abode styll casetyll next mornynge sowned hoost trumpettes assawte constable frauce beyng felde wolde assayle towne exchewynge hurtynge men sent speke bergerathe made shewed howe hadde capitayns prisoner shulde haue ayde socour howe case become frenche put themselfe landes vnder obeysance frenche kynge also shewed assayled taken force howe towne shulde putte fyre men woman chyldren ye swerde without mercy wordes abasshed greatlye bergerath desyred take counsayle dyd burgess towne went counsayle without callyng capitayne agreed become frenche soo myght lyue peasably without hauynge men warre amonge whiche lightly agreed whan sir perducas dalbret capiten herde treatie mounted horse made men passe ouer bridge departed went garyson moneyn bergerah yelded vp frenche parte constable fraunce toke possessyon therof set therin capitayne men war kepe whan yt bergerath thus tourned french duke aniou counsayled go forthe ley siege chastellon ye ryuer dordone tidynges therof spred abrode felde euery man prepared go thyder duke constable men warre except marshall frau ce abode behynde abyde lorde coucy came night marshall rode mete great company receyued right amyably taryed night place wher duke ben night duke ye day came fayre medowe way chastellon ryuer dordon ye lorde coucy ther sir edmond pomyers sir tristram roy lorde faignels lorde jumont sir john rosey sir robrt cleremont dyuers knightes squyers mornynge depted fro lodgynge rode company marshall fraunce tyll came duk hoost wher receyued great ioy goyng towarde chastellon towne called saynt foy vowarde came chastello assayled towne saynt foye right feersly within towne men warre made small defence wolde haue yelded vp yelding pylled robbed siege layd chastellon endured xv dayes many scrimysshes barryers within towne dyuers englisshmen gascoyns suche fledde fro dysconfyture yuret right valiantly defended towne suche lordes gascone taken prisoner ye duke aniou hoost dyd asmoch might cause towne yelde vp ye duke howe beit sir thomas phelton dyde nothyng mater bycause englysshman also toke hym prisoner sir john liguac put hym raunsome pay xxx frankes whan money payed lyuered nat ne long four baron gascone desyred ntysed becoe frenche last content made promyse duke ou faithes honour euer good frenche bothe themselfe la de meanes duke aniou delyuered quyte fre departed ro duke promyse lorde du lorde rosen thentent go owne countreis lorde lan uras lorde mu ent abode styll hoost duke pleasur daylye hym lod baron gascoyne founde right yable let passe dyde whiche repented shewe howe lorde dura lorde ro departed comuned togyder sayde owe may well serue duke aniowe frenchman haue alwayes good therfore moche bett p myse duke kyng englande naturall hath done moche v concluded go burdeaur shewe sir wyllm elman howe th wyse abyde frenche togyder tyll came bur receyued great oy become frenche han en shall mayre bur howe done answered costraynt manas hyng feare lyues ay e promyse duke aniou becoe french sir say playnly maky promyse alwayes hert re ed faythes naturall lorde kynge englande therfore soeuer haue said done wyll neuer becoe whiche wordes knyghtes england right oyouse sayeng selfe right val atly lorde fyue dayes duke beyng yll chastello worde came lorde dura lorde rosen turned agayne becoe englyshe whiche duke constable ye duke sent lorde lorde ang mater ded sayd thervnto lo de rightsore displeased sayd sir thought breke promise wyll breke sir haue promysed wyll vpholde reproche v abyde vnder obeysance syth men co quered v clene force armes sir duke beleue well god whan deptehens first thyng wyll shalbe ley siege bef ye wne dura next ye towne rosen thus duke aniowe abode styll towne chastellon ryght sore displeased th se two sayd lordes gascoyne towne chastellon parteyned ye herytage captall whome frenche kyng prison parys siege thus enduryng thas lon ther fell great famyn nother golde syluer coulde gotte thynge lyue frenchman fayne ryde xv myles gette vitayle hoost often tymes returned agayne great parell dyuers castelles forteresses englysshe fronters whiche issued made busshmentes encountred streyghtes passage whan sawe strong ynough ye frenche forager wolde set hurt lee many take away vitayls wherfore frenchman durste ryde great companyes long siege endured within costray assawtes engyns fayne yelde vp lyues goodes saued men warre within deted bagge baggage wet saynt macayre wher ther good towne stronge castell whan chastellon yelded vp duke aniou toke possession therof faythe homage dweller within towne sette newe officer made capitayne ther knyght thowrayn called sir james moutmartyn whan duke departed then tooke aduyse whyder shulde drawe counsayled goo saynt maryne way dyuers lytell forteresses whiche duke thought nat good left hynde bi awse forager fyr laydsiege sauueter tidynges came duke otherwyse harde lorde dura lorde ro sayd howe surely burdeau vnder maner could knowe whiche wordes spra hoost came herynge lorde mucydent lorde spake lorde sir peter bulle desirynge helpe excuse sayd lordes sayng great symplenes beleue lyghtly fleyng wordes promysed spake duke therof answered sayd wolde ryght glad knowe contrary harde sauueterre whiche helde thre dayes capitayne yelded vp forter e sauynge lyfe goodes duke passed forth came saynt basyll good towne whiche incontynent lded vp put selfe vnder obeysance frenche kyng duke went mountsegure fyrst gaue assaut myst lodged nyght next mornyng made redy agayn assawte wherof within abasshed went counsayle finally concluded yelde vp towne lyues g de saued receyued duke rode farder came closed towne bytwene saynt ayre ryoll called amberoche ther duke four dayes could haue treaty gyue vp tha duke went saynt p howe duke aniou toke force saynt macayre towne dura assaute dyuers forteresses agaynst englisshmen cap ccc xxi dayly duke hoost multiplyed encreased men came hym fro partes knyghtes squiers auauce bodyes siege layne saynt macayre within suche men warre goone suche fortress ben yelden vp wherby towne ye stroger better defended ther dyuers great assautes made many fayre ysshe barryers duke ayned siege endurynge certayne companyes shulde men armes sprad abrode shal frau ce great route sir percyuall norman wylliam moncontoure great company men armes brode feldes ayes toke dyuer townes small holdes brought cou e aboute vnder obeysance frenche kyng none withstode countre voyde vnprouyded men warre thenglysshe part yt edde went burd ur men war returned agayne ye hoost saynt macayre knewe well howe coude nat long dure dayly shewed taken force shulde dye without mercy wherof douted comons secretly treated ye frenchman yelde vp towne lyues goodes saued warr within parceyuing well entente douted greatly comons yt shuld make yuell bargayne wherfore brue castell whiche right strong able kept therin put yt pyllage towne towne yelded vp put selfe vnder eysance frenche kyng tidynges cae duke whyle lay siege moutsegu e ye duches wyfe tho ouse ther delyuered sonne wherof duke hoost right ioyouse hardynes atempt dedes armes assone saynt ayre gyue p duke entred eased refresshed towne good loging well furnysshed ye castell h ged gy eysed dyd ylous great stone yron great hed within thus whyle duke siege true tidynges cae dura lorde rosen brought haraud ely become englysshe agayne duke sayd let v make end wyll go lay siege dura made irse assaut castell wolde nat eau nd castell sawe ailed sydes codde onfort sawe well duke ca able wolde nat dete then tyll castell wyll ther fayrnesse fou nesse thynge cosydred fell yelded vp castell lyues goodes receyued coueyed macayres towne become frenche therin duke made newe capitayns disloged toke ye way towarde dura long rode came dura firste aprochyng duke ordayned assayle towne euery man prepared saut crosbowes well pauessed aproched towne ladder redy mount ther began sore cruell assaut suche mounced fought hande hande within assaut endured longe space ladder ther done many feates armes fightynge hande hande assaut endured parte day last trumpettes sowned retreat euery man drewe logyng night tyme came hoost sir alayne de la haye sir alayne saynt poule great company breton ryden towarde lyburne assayled englysshe garyson named cadyllac whiche taken byforce slayne within mornynge duke aniou comaunded euery man go assaut desyringe best haralude made cryed hoost soeuer entred first dura shulde haue rewarde fyue hudred frankes couytousnesse wynning rewarde many one auaunced icoded themselfe many ladder anone reared vp agaynst walles feirse assaute yong knightes squyers desyring auau ce bodyes aduetured selfe right valiantly lorde langurant mouted vpon ladder swerde hande one first payned selfe moch haue entred first towne nat wynning fyue hundred frakes exalt name sore displeased ye lorde dura bycause tourned lightly englysshe agayne lorde langurant dyde daye marueyls armes owne men also stranger marueyle dedes auauced hymselfe moche forwarde put lyfe great ieopardy within clene force rased helme heed ben deed withoute remedy squyer hadde nat ben folowed nere rouered hym targe lorde togyder discended downe ladder lytell lytell dyscendyng receyued ye targe many great stroke greatly praysed sawe also sir trystram roy sir percyuall daneuall another ladder assayling sautyng right valiantly lyke wise dyd sir john jumont sir john rosey eche doyng marueyls armes another lope wall ladder lorde sereell fought hande hande enemyes euery man sawe hym sayd likely entre towne semyng first knight dyde nat aduenture hym selfe onely profyte rather gette honour fortune warre ryght peryllous happed hym putte downe feersly glayue fell downe botome dyke fall brake necke ther dyed lyke case dyed squyer bretayne bare armes goules two cheurons chekard golde syluer asure whose dethe constable sore displeased assaut began fiersar euery part lorde mucydet proued day good knyght shewed well dedes howe true frenche man thus byforce towne dura co quered first entred sir trystram roy sir john rosey men warre within towne fledde castell p howe yuan wale layd siege mortayne howe scott toke stelthe castell berwyke agaynst wyll kynge englande cap ccc xxii thus towne dura take slayne within men warre toke logyng vnarmed toke ease next mornyng constable frau ce mounted horse marshall fra ce went aduysed well castell toke good hede syde moost best assayle thynges consydred sawe well castell right stronge harde wyn without long siege returned shewed duke aniou maketh mater duke haue sayd sworne wyll nat departe hen tyll haue castell wyll constable answered sir godd grace yeshall nat beforsworne reared vp engyns agaynst castell whan within sawe dealyng towne frenchman consydering howe assautynge shulde right perylous thought fall intreatie entreated constable take mercy lyues good saued yelde vp castell duke anio toke counsayle aduyse constable wolde nat wyll trauayle people thirde day receyued mercy departed brought thyder wolde constable toke possession castell enfourmed duke aniou comaunded castell shulde beten downe ye conquest castell towne dura duke aniou ordayned abyde sir johan jumont sir tristram roye sir johan rosey hundred speares kepe fronters agaynst burdelois duke thought returne tholouse se good lady wife tha newly churched fayre sonne thought churchyng kepe great feest tholouse ordeyned suche townes hadde conquered men warre garysons resyst pusantly agaynst enemyes sayd yuan wale sir yeshall take charge breton poicteuyns angeuyns yeshall go poictou ley siege mortaigne see whiche lorde lestrade kepeth come nat then maner commaudement fro kyng fro tyllsuch season ye haue ye full possession therof garyson hath done moch trouble v sir yuan beste power shall commaundement duke ordayned apoynted shulde go yuan poyctou departed fro duke nombre fyue hudred speares toke way xaynton goo towardes saynt john dangle duke costable lorde coucy marshall frauce sir johan sir peter bulle returned backe tholouse ther foude duches newly puryfied tyme ther made great feest iustyng
