constable lorde coucy retourned fraunce marshall sanxere went auuergne ayde baros made warre englysshmen limosyn auuergne frontres p howe let v shewe howe yuan wale layed siege season mortayne howe co strayned within garyson yuan wale gladd obey commaundement duke aniou knewe well soeuer duke dyde pleasure kyng also knewe well kynge bare charge enterprise came xayntes poitou ther refresshed plentyfull countrey company lorde pouns lorde thouars lorde umaroyse lorde jaques surgeres great nobre knightes squyers poictou breton norman capitayns sir more trysiqdy sir alayne housey sir alayne saynt poule sir percyuall daneuall wylliam mountcomptor lorde momorette brother men warre departed whan redy went layed siege mortayne whiche fayrest strongest castell standyng ryuer garon nere mouthe see thus yuan co pany layed siege mortaigne made bastydes lytell lytell prepared thynges necessarie knewe well assaut shulde neuer wynne castell way sauyng long siege famyne ther yuan ordayned four bastydes castell none coude reuitayle towne nother lande see ye yong knightes squyers desiryng auaunce bodyes went often tymes barryers ye castell scrimysshed within bytwene ther done many proper feate armes within castell knight called souldiche gascoyn right valyant knight good man armes whose counsaile within ruled moche capitayns wyne vitayls within sufficyent small necessary great scarcyte durynge siege kyng charles frauce though helde hymselfe parys sported pleasur without armyng owne son yet kept warr diuers place agaynst theglisshmen enemy gatte hym alyaunces well within realme countrey aboute predecessours foure fyue kynges greatly helde loue suche thought haue ayde bycause sawe well kyng richard englande yong realme trouble discorde therfore sent scotland dyuers tymes bothe kyng robert kynge dauyd vncle alwayes entertayne loue desyring euer make good sharpe warr thenglysshmen traueyle shuld haue puissaunce passe ouer see moche happed kynge robert scotlande season kyng edwarde ye thirde deed kyng rycharde crowned assembled cousayle edenborowe scotlade moost parte barones knyghtes scotlande suche thought shulde seruyce shewyng howe thenglysshmen tyme past hadde done many great inconuenyences brennynge countreys beatynge downe castle stayeng raunsomyng men sayeng also sir nowe ye tyme come may well reuenged yonge kynge englande kyng edwarde deed wonte haue good fortune barownes yong knyghtes suche desyred reueged domage done theglysshmen answered one voyce howe redy apparelled ryde englande daye next whan pleased hym aunswere pleased greatly kyng scotes thanked ther kyng ordeyned four erles chefe capitayns men warre erle duglas erle moret therle maure erle surlant constable scotlande sir archambalt duglas marshall hoost sir robert uersy made somons certayne day morlane makynge assemble departed fro valiantsquier scotland called alysander ramsey thought enter prise acheue great feate armes toke fortie well mounted rode long night priuely day morning came berwyke whiche englisshe capitayn towne squyer erle northumberlandes named johan byset castell capitayne valyant knight called sir robert abenton whan scotes come berwyke kept selfe priuy sente spye towne castell se codicyon spye entred downe dyk ther water none coude abyde quycke boylyng sande spye loked harkened aboute coulde nat se creature returned shewed maister alysander ramsey auaunsed brought company priuely dyke ladder dressed vp walles alysander one first ye mounted vp swerde hande entred castell company folowed hym none withstode whan within went ye chefe towre wher capitayne slepe sodenly great ax brake vp dore capitayne sodenly awoke slept night made small watche derely bought opened chambre dore wenyng noyse made owne soudiers wold haue robbed murdred hym bedde bycause displeased weke lept wyndowe downe dyke great feare without order good aduyse fall brake necke ther dyed watchman halfe slepe herde noyse woke parceyued well howe castell scaled betrayed sowned trumpet trahey trahey johan byset capitayne ye towne hearyng voice trumpe armed caused towne armed drewe castell herde well noyse scottes made within coulde nat entre gate shytte bridge drawen capitayne johan byset remembred great aduyce sayd towne aboute hym lette v breke downe stayes brige syde within nat yssue wtout danger incotynent ax beate downe ye bridge stayes therof towarde towne john byset sent messanger anwyke xii lytell myles then lorde percy certifyeng ye mater desyring coe without delay great puyssaunce rescue agayne castell berwyke taken stelthe scottes moreouer johan bysette sayd thomelyn fryant messanger lorde case ye leaue v howe scottes closed within castell canne nat yssue without leape ouer walles therfore desyre hym make hast alysander ramsey company thus scaled castell berwike thought done great enterprice dede johan byset nat prouyded asodayne remedy el ben also lordes towne slewe theym within rastell whome pleased resydne toke prisoner shytte vp fast towre sayd nowe let v go downe towne let v take good therin riche men ye towne bringe castell tha sette fyre towne nat kepte v within thre foure dayes shall haue rescue scotlande shall saue pyllage departyng let v sette fyre castell pay hoost purpose agreed desyred wynne pyllage toke eche glayue hades founde ynowe castell opened gate let downe bridge whan bridge downe rope ye helde brake asondre restyng place brige broken awaye towarde towne whan johan byset sawe maner company began shoute crye sayd asirs kepe ye shall nat departe then without leaue whan alysander ramsey sawe maner without sawe knewe well howe aduysed beyng castell closed agayne gate feare shotte fortifyed castell thinkynge haue kept dyd cast dyke deed putte vp towre prisoner thought place stronge ynough kepe long leest tyll rescue myght come scotland baron knightes scotlande assemblyng togyder morlane ther also therle duglas departed fro alquest come dombare p nowe lette v speke squier sent johan byset anwyke lorde percy erle northumberlande signyfieng hym sayd aduenture p howe erle northuberlande wan agayne castell berwike howe entred puyssantly scotlande cap c c c xxiii longe rode thomelyn fryant cae anwyke early mornynge lorde percy bedde neuerthelesse dyde moche spake hym busynesse hast sayd sir scottes hath mornyng taken stelth castell berwyke sir capitayne towne hath sente hyder gyue knowledge therof seyng ye warden countre whanne erle herde tidynges made hast moche might conforte berwike sent letter messangers ouer coutre knightes squyers coe berwike incotynet helpe ayde hym agaynst scottes hadde taken stelth castell berwyke anone knowen coutre euery man departed fro owne house knightes squiers archer crosbowes anwyke came lorde neuyll lorde lucy ye lorde blelles ye lorde graystoke lorde stafforde capitayne newcastell right valyant knight called sir thoms mosgraue first came berwyke erle northumberlande euery day people came thyder hym tenne thousandemen besieged castell nere byrde coulde nat come oute without knowledge began myne vnder castell soner coe entente scottes wynne agayne castell tidynges came barownes scotlande howe erle barownes knightes squiers northumberlande habde besieged company castell berwike determyned go reyse vp siege refresshe vitayle castell sayd howe alysaunder ramseys enterprice valyauntly atempted sir archambault duglas constable scotlande sayde alysaunder cosyn cometh noble gentyll hert enterprise suche feate wynne castell berwyke ought greatly comfort helpe hym dede may siege shall tourne great noblenesse wherfore lette v go thyder ther ordayned shulde go hym shulde byde toke hym fyue hundred speares best hoost rode towarde berwyke tidyng came englysshe lordes berwyke scottes comynge reyse siege reuitayle castell went cou sayle determyned take place abyde enemyes fight desyre lorde percy caused company redy armed aparelled fight make muster founde selfe nombre thre thousande men armes seuyn thousande archer whan erlesawe great nombre sayd lette v kepe place men ynough fight puyssaunce scotlande abode fayre playne without berwike two batails good order nat space houre sawe certayne currours scottes well horsed ridynge aduyse thenglisshe hoost ther certayne knight squyers wolde gladly haue ryden haue scrimysshed lorde percy wolde nat suffre sayde let hole bataile come wyll fight v wyll aproche nerer v englysshmen kept selfe styll close togyder scottes came nere aduysed well two batayls nombre people whan currours well aduysed dealyng englysshmen retourned maisters shewed sene sayd sir haue ryden nere englysshe hoost yt haue well aduysed behauyng sir say vnto redy abidyng two fayre batails fayre playne euery batayle v thousand men therfore nowe take good aduyse aproched nere ceyued well howe currours scotlande wolde nat styrre send one man rynne v whan sir archambalt duglas knight scotlande herde tidynges pensyue sayd nat se shulde profyte ryde nowe agaynst englysshemen ten agaynst one v chosen men wherfore may lose wyn folysshe en price cometh good proueth nowe alysander ramsey ther vncle alysanders called sir wyllyam lindsey dyde great payne confort nephue sayeng sir trust nephue hath made enterprice taken castell berwike wyll tourne great blame ye lese thus paraduentur herafter ther none wyll hasty inpart suche another case answered sayd coude nat amende nat behouefull many nobleman ther shulde put selfe adue ture lost rescuynge one squyer determyned retourne agayn owne coutre lodge mountayns besyde ryuer twyde withdrue thyder good layser whan erle northumberlande erle notyngham barones englande parceyued scottes came nat forwarde sent forthe currours knowe becoe brought wordehow gone towarde morlan beyond castell ro bourge agaynst night englysshmen drewe agayne logynges made good watche night morning euery man redy aparelled go assayle castell ferse assaute whiche endured almoost day ye neuer se hardyer men fewe scottes better defeded place dyde englysshmen ladder whiche reared vp walles englysshmen mouted vp targes came fought scottes hande hande cast downe dike thyng ye moost troubled scottes archer shot holy toguyder almoost ther none durst come defence wall long assaut contynued last englysshmen entred byforce slewe many found nat one within scaped slayne except alysander ramsay taken prisoner thus castell berwyke delyuered fro scottes erlemade johan byset capitayne newly repayred castell made bridge newe agayne taken p howe erle northuberlande erle notyngham englisshmen entred great puyssaunce realme scotlande cap ccc xxiiii wynning agayn castell berwyke erles northumberland notyngham whiche two greatest men al englyssh hoost wha assembled men togyder determyned ryde enemyes coude fynde fyght early mornyng departed toke way towardes rosebourge long ryuer twyde whan ryden togyder ye space two leages toke newe counsaile deuyded company sent one parte toward mauros great abbey blacke moke ryuer aude whiche departure bothe realmes thentet se knowe might fynde scottes parte company rode towarde morlane thynkynge one two wayes shulde tidynges scottes company rode mauros capitayne sir thomas mosegraue hym thre hundred speares many archer thus departed one ridyng ye ryght hand left hande sir thoms mosegraue sonne rode longe came mauros toke lodgyng good hour refreshe selfe horse knowe iustly wher scottes become sent forthe two squyers well horsed suche knewe countre se coulde tidyng two squiers whan departed fro maisters rode longe sodenly busshment scottes whome sir wyllyam lyndsey chefe aduenture se coude tidynges berwike howe nephue alysander ramsay spedde ye castell berwyke tidynges thenglysshmen company xl speares assoone two squyers entred within busshement sodenly beset rounde taken wherof knight great ioye demau ded fro whens came teare speke loth dyscouer dedes maystres behoued theym speke knyght sayd shulde lease heedes tolde nat trouth euery thyng wolde demaunde whan sawe none remedy spake shewed howe castell berwyke wonne agayne within slayne except alysader ramsay howe therle northumberlande erle notyngham ryden long ryuer twyde fynde scottes howe sir thoms mosegraue sonne sir john asheton sir richard beton thre hu dred speares many archer lodged taryed abbey mauros also howe sent knowe iustly scottes faythe sir wylliam lyndsay ye haue nowe founde v howbeit ye shall tary v delyuered besauely kept fro startyng away sir wylliam lindsey called man armes sayd go way ryde hoost shewe ye haue harde englisshmen woll abyde styll tyll nyght se canne tidynges messanger rode forthe tyll came great village beyond morlan called hodbray ryuer twyde among mou tayns fayre medowes good countre wherfore scottes taryed ther euenyng thyder cae squier founde erle duglas erle morette therle surlant sir archambalt duglas scottes squyer brought lordes whome shewed mater ye haue herde whan scottes vnderstode howe ye castell berwike conquered agayne sore dyspleased sorowfull howe recomforted agayne whan herde howe sir thoms mosgraue sonne knyghtes squiers england lodged mauros determyned go thyder dislodge enemy assay coude recouer parte domage mouted departed fro hondbray rode towarde mauros right hande knewe well countre come thyder mydnight ther fell rayne wynde whiche strake face proudest theym beaten rayne wynde co de scant syt horse page e may er speares lette fall brake euery man fro lost waye chiefe capitaynes rested priuely vnder great wood syde suche k yghtes sage wyse sayd howe rode folyshly good season tyme ryde say ng howe myght rather lese therby wyn taryed couered horse vnder tree tyll day began ere suche colde made fyers warme coulde make yre endured moche payne wod gr ne grounde wete rayne wether endured tyll sonne rose tha wether clere vp sonne shone arkes began synge cap tayns drewe gyder take counsayll shu fayled en nt coe maurose nyght tyme thought b st yt shulde refresh se horse sende abr th forager dyd rode abrode village besyde brought companyes haye hotes horse vitayle maysters mornynge englisshmen lay mauros sent forager ottysshe forager encountred eche englisshmen hadde none aduauntage ther dyuers slayne hurte e lost tidynges ame sir thoms mosegraue mauros wherby knewe scottes nat farre fro founed trompettes sadled horse armed determyned take de dyde anone scott knewe therof forager made halte refresshe horse armed sette good ordre batayll r couert long ye wode syde hundred speares two thousande called yomen glay e dagers wepyns warre sir ar duglas erle duglas sayd none otherwyse shall haue englisshmen rydeth mornyng therfore let v redy lette v yght se tyme conuenyent certayne men armes yscouer enemyes aryed self styll p howe sir thomas mosegraue englisshmen discomfytted scottes deth frenche quene cap ccc xxv sir thomas mosegraue sonne englisshemen desyred greatly fynde ye scottes departed fro mauros toke waye towardes morlane left ryuer twyde left hades went vp mountayne called saynt gylle scotyshe currours ryght well aduysed englisshmen returned company shewed dealynge englisshmen howe estimacyon nat past thre baners x penons whiche tydinges scottes ryght ioyfull sayd one wyll let v go ryde name god saynt gylle ar cryed one cry duglas saynt gylle nat ryden space halfe leage sawe enemyes englisshmen tha eche party sawe well behoued fyght ye erle duglas made sonne knyght called sir james made hym reyse baner lyke wyse dyde two sonnes kyng scottes sir robert sir dauyd bothe reysed baners made xxx knyghtes scottysshe parte knyght suede called sir george besmede bare armes syluer myll pyn gowles border endented gowles also sir thomas mosegraue made sonne thomas knyght dyuers house lyke wise dyd lorde stafforde lord gascope ordred archer set wynge thenglisshmen cryed day lady arleton beganne ferse recounter archer began shote men armes began styrre scottes great nombre archer coulde nat take hede euery place bytwene tie many goodly course me many man ouerthrowen erth dyuers taken reskewed agayne begynnynge sir archambalt duglas mighty knight ygge sore feared enemyes whan came aprochynge lyght foote handes longe swerd wherof blade two el length heuy man lyghtly lyft vp fro ye erthe lyght ynough gaue therwith suche stroke yt whome euer hytte full wente erthe nat hardiest englissh parte refused stroke sore batayle well fought longe hi endured nat long scottes thre agaynst one say nat nay englisshmen bare selfe ryght valyantly howe beit fynally dyscomfytted sir thomas mosegraue taken prisoner sonne also dyuers knightes squyers scottes sixe score good prisoner chase endured ryuer twyde dyuers slayne discofytur scottes drewe owne countre determyned go e enbourge knewe prisoner erle northuberlande therle notyngham countrey ryuer twyde way towardes roseburge howe men ynowe fyght power scotlande daye wherfore thought myght well br ke vp army drawe saue garde kepe prisoner toke better aduyse drawe homward gone agayne lde lodgynge great aduenture haue ben beaten shall shewe howe erle northumberlande erle notyngham ba one englande whan departed fro berwyke sir thomas mosegraue departed fro knowlege spyes scottes lodged hodbray wherof ryght ioyouse soo determyned come nyght rymysshe came thyder ye night departed mornynge rayned sore coulde nat attayne entreprise lay woodes tyll mornynge sent spyes knowe scottes become brought worde agayne howe scottes departed howe coulde fynde none tha drue towardes mauros ty yng sir thomas mosegraue sent longe ryuer currours coulde tidynges scottes isco ture felde saint gylle ye haue harde currorrs met owne company sleynge falt myght shewed euer knewe batayle currous retourned suche mette slyeng tolde certaynte batayle coude nat tell howe many slayne howe many taken whan englissh lordes herde tydynges pensyue good cause dyspleased two cause one bycause hadde lost men bicause coude nat fynde scottes desyred sore fyght withall wolde fayne haue folowed wyst nat way scottes gone nyght drewe went mauros lodged incontynent trewe worde cae batayle howe sir thoms mosgraue sone sirscoremen armes taken prisoner scottes led edeborowe thenglisshe lordes sawe well yt behoued bere domage present tyme bicause coude nat amende passed nyght aswell myght mornynge dysloged lorde percy erle northumberlande gaue leue euery man departe home went owne cou trey thus brake vp iourney parte scottes went edenbourg therle duglas sone abode styll way alquest great tidynges ran ouer scotlande iourney men made knyghtes squiers toke pleasure prisoner raunsomed curtesly lyst p nowe lette v leaue speke scotlande presente tyme lette v speke insydentes fell fraunce p tyme monethe february frenche quene dyed p ysicyons sayde owne faulte laye chyld bed fayre lady named ateryne duches berrey qwene beyng chyldbed nat well ease physicions defeded wyse shul e nat enter bayne sayd contrary dissease ryght perylus nat withstandyng wolde nedes bayned fell sycker dyed kyng charles fraunce wydower neuer maryed p howe warre began agayne bitwene naueroyse frenchemen begynning cisme holy churche ca ccc xxvi deth freche quene dyed also qwene nauer suster germayne frenche kyng deth qwene nauer great murmuryng rose bytwene sagemen customyers countie uire whiche normandy whiche ryght successyon mother shulde kyng nauers child within age vnder rule kepynge vncle kynge charles frauce kyng charles nauer suspect tyme made consented reysed many euilles incouenyences realme fraunce nat worthy holde herytage realme fraunce vnder shadowe child season ther came acquitayne ye constable frauce hadde ben season duke aniou brought company lorde mucydent gascon se kyng acquaynted dyd bytwene kyng constable ther many secrete cousayls state realme fraunce nauer whiche nat sodenly knowen shall shortly speke yt mater iustly cronycle matter fell season worlde shall shewe begynning pestylence inconuenyens began churche god wherby christendome great trouble varyance therby many great mischefes grewe folowed ye haue harde howe pope gregorie xi name cytie auygnon whan sawe coude finde maner peace bitwene kynges englande frauce wherwith great dyspleasure greatly trauelled made cardynalles aduysed selfe deuocion go reuyset rome see apostolyke whiche saynt peter saynt poule edefyed made promyse euer came degre pope wold neuer kepe see saynt peter kepte ordayned pope man feble complection sickly endured moche payne thus beyng auignon sore lette besynesses fraunce sore traueyled kyng brethern moch payne leyser take hede thyng selfe churche sayd selfe wolde go farther fro rest caused prouysyon made ryuer gennes wayes shuld passe apertayned suche highe astate sayd cardynals sir make redy woll rome mocyon cardynalles sore abasshed displeased loued nat romayns wolde fayne haue tourned purpose coude nat whan frenche kyng knewe therof sore displeased thought hadde pope nerer hande place kyng wrote incotynent brother duke aniowe tholouse signyfieng syght letter shulde go auignon pope breke voiage rome possyble duke dyd kyng commaunded came auignon wher cardynalles receyued great ioy lodged pope palays ofter therby speke pope ye may well knowe spake pope shewed dyuers reason haue broke purpose pope wolde noo wyse consent therto take hede besinesses syde moutayns pope gaue duke full puyssance myght reseruyng certayne case papall whiche myght nat gyue man put owne handes whan ye duke sawe coude nat come entent reason fayre word coude shewe toke leaue pope sayd departyng holy father ye go good countre among suche people ye lytle beloued ye woll leue foutayne faithe realme wher holy churche hath moost fayth exellence worlde sir dede churche may fall gret trybulacion ye dye right likely say phisycions romayns malycious traytours shalbe lord maysters cardynalles shall make pope owne wyll howe beit wordes many pope neuer rested tyll way came marcyll galeys gene redy receyue duke retourned agayne tholouse pope gregorie entred see marcyll great company good wynde tooke lande gennes newe refresshed galays toke see agayne sayled tyll cae rome romayns ryght ioyfull comynge chiefe rhome mounted horse brought rome great tryumphe lodged saynt peter palys often tymes vysited churche called lady great within rome wherin great pleasure dyd make therin many costly warkes within whyle comynge rome dyed buryed ye sayd church obsequy made pope aparteyned anon dethe pope gregory cardynalles drewe conclaue palays saynt peter anone entred chose pope acordyng vsage one shuld good profytable holy churche romayns assembled togyder great nombre came bowrage saynt peter nombre xxx thousand one entent yuell mater went nat accordynge appetytes came oftentymes conclaue sayd harke ye sir cardynalles delyuer atones make pope ye tary longe ye make romayne woll natchaung yf ye make romayne people counsayles woll nat take hym pope ye putte youre selfe aduenture slayne cardynals danger romayns herde well wordes nat ease assured lyues apeased yre well myght fayre wordes somoche rose felony romayns suche next ye conclaue thentent make cardynalles frayde cause codiscende rather opinyons brake vp dore conclaue cardynalles cardynalles went surely haue slayne stedde away saue lyues one waye nother romayns nat content toke put togyder agayn whether wolde nat cardynalles seynge theselfe daunger romayns great parell lyues greed among selfe sor please people deuocyon howbeit good electyon chase holy man cardynall romayne nacion whome pope urbayne fyfte hadde made cardynall called cardynall saynt peter electyon pleased greatly ye romayns good man ryghtes belonged papalyte howe beit lyued nat thre dayes shall shewe romayns desyred haue pope owne nacion ioyfull newe pope ye toke hym hundred yere age sette whyte mule ledde vp downe ye cytie rome exaltyng shewyng howe vaquesshed cardynals seyng pope romayn accordyng owne entente somoche good holy man sore traueyled fell sycke dyed thyrde daye buryed churche saynt peter lyethe p orgulous wordes romayns sayde electyon newe pope agayne howe warre renewed bytwene french kyng kyng nauerre cap ccc xxvii dethe pope cardynalles right sorowfull saw well howe matter shulde nat goo well passe thought pope lyued haue dissimuled amonge romayns two thre yeres laste haue brought see apostolyke place rome napoles gennes daunger romayns ye dethe pope brake purpose cardynalles went agayne conclaue greater dauger ye romayns assembled togyder agayne conclaue made semblant breke vp slee dyde nat chose pope acordyng myndes cryed cardynalles sayd sir aduyse yo well ye delyuer v pope romayne content el woll make herd reeder hattes suche wordes manasshes abasshed greatly ye cardynall hadde rather dyed confessours martyr bryng selfe daunger parell made pope none colledge cardynals archbysshop bare great clerke greatly traueyled welthe holy churche promocyon papalyte romayns peased cardynall genne put heed wyndowe conclaue sayd hygh ye people rome sir apease haue pope romayne bartylme de angle archbysshop bare people aunswered one voyce content archebysshoppe nat rome thynke napoles incontynent sent whiche tydynges ryght glad came rome comyng great feest made hym ryghtes parteyned papalyte called urban sirt name romayns great ioy creacyon signifyed church christentie also emperours kynges duke erles cardynalles sent worde frendes chosen good trewe eleciyon howbeit repented spoken largely mater pope renounced grace gyuen also dyuers departed fro countres place went rome haue grace p let v leaue somwhat speke mater lette vp retourne princypall history besynesses fraunce ye haue harde right well howe kyng nauer hadde wyfe freuche kynges suster loue one sayd purposed herytage chyldren kyng nauer whiche fallen ryght mother ye french kyng vncle succession suster ought haue power therof name chyldren seyng chyldren kepynge wherby lande kynge nauer helde normandy shulde ye french kynges hand long nephewes age mater kyng nauer doughted greatly knewe well vsage custome frauce aduysed two thynges one sende bysshop panpilone sir martyn car fraunce kynge desyring hym hertely good loue fauoure send two sonnes charles peter pleased nat send hym bothe two lest sende sone charles bycause towardes treaty maryage doughter ye kyng castell second thing nat withstandyng sent thus fraunce yetsecretly sent also normandy visyte refresshe castelles pertaynyng hym thentent frenchman shulde nat take handes feared one theis possessios shulde nat haue agayn whan wolde sent two valyaunt men armes naueroyse great trust one called peter basylle ferando normandy ye sayd enten fyrst messangers went frauce bysshop panpylone sir marten car spake kyng great leysar right humbly recomaundyng kyng nauer desyringe name wolde sende hym two sonnes kyng answered sayde wolde take aduyse counsayle mater answered kynges name kyng beyng present two chyldren also nephewes kynge loued right entierly wherfore coulde nat better place kyng nauerre ought content rather suffre fraunce kyng vncle place also ye kyng wyll wyse depart fro kepe aboute hym estate chyldren kyng lyke nephewes answere ye messangers coude nat haue meane season messangers frauce peter basylle ferado arryued chyerbourge great prouisyon whiche putte dyuers place townes castels kyng nauers normandy visyted kynge nauers name countie eureux made newe officer sette people pleasure retourned agayne nauerre bysshoppe panpylone sir marten carr shewed kynge howe spedde frau ce kynge nauer nat gladde tidyges whan coulde nat haue owne sonnes began great hatered hert towarde frenche kynge whiche wolde gladly haue shewed might puyssance selfe nat great greue realme fraunce without helpe ayde realme suffred mater tyll better cause speke displeasure done hym hadde frenche kyng cousayle well enformed kyng nauer newe reuitayled castels townes normady knewe nat entent season thenglysshmen made secret army see two thousand men armes horse army duke lancastre erle ca bridge chefe capitayns ye norman reported surely french kyng armye came costes normady coulde nat tell parte wolde drawe vnto fraunce thought ye kynge nauer caused come normandy delyuer suche castelles wherfore sayde kynge sir go hastely lorde castels ye may happe tary long englisshmen haue may moche hurt realme fraunce shall one best entree haue lordes normady cyties townes castels belongyng kyng nauer season taken fraunce two secrataries kyng nauers clerke squyer cleke called peter tertre squyer james rue brought parys examyned somoche knowen theym secrettes realme nauerre howe determyned haue done domage kyng el haue poysoned condempned dye execucyen done parys beheeded quartred tydynges multyplied kyng nauer ye frenche kynge sware wolde neuer attende none thynge tyll ryd normandy taken possession behoffe nephewes townes castelles kyng nauer helde dayly ther came sore informacions frenche kyng agaynst kynge nauer also sayde openly ye duke lacastre shulde gyue doughter kateryn kynge nauer meanes kyng shulde gyue duke lancastre hole countye deureur wordes lightly beleued frauce kyng nauer lytell trusted among tyme french kynge came rohan assembled great army men warre wherof lorde coucy lorde de la ryuer chefe capitayns met togyder towne called lyseur cytie normandy parteynynge kyng nauer two lordes two sonnes kyng nauer charles peter shewe countrey warre made name ye two chyldren herytage fallen ye ryght mother howe yt kynge nauer right kepe moost parte men armes ioyned loue kyng nauer coude nat departe seruyce also naueroyse assembled suche kyng nauer hadde sent thyder caused warr easyer fayre p howe frenche kynge ceased lande kyng nauers cap ccc xxviii frenche kyng sent commyssioners mountpellyer cease ye lande seignorie handes whiche kyng nauerr helde whan comyssioners say sir wylliam dormans sir johan merger come mountpellyer sente moost noblest son towne shewed comyssions mountpellyer obeyed myght none otherwise nat obeyed benyuell duke anio constable fraunce countrey great armye desyred nothynge moche haue warre mountpellyer ther taken prisoner two knyght normandy gouernours countre vnder kynge nauer also sir guy grauell sir lyger dergesy taryed prison long tyme thus wne mountpellyer barony become frenche nowe let v returne french army normandy howe lorde coucy lorde de la ryuer sped came eureur layd siege therto garysons parteyning kyng naue closed fast garysons gaynst frenchman nat mynde soo soone yelde vp whan kyng nauer vnderstode ye frenchman taken possessyon mountpellyer cou tre yt great nombre men armes countre eureux pillyng beatyng downe townes castelles hadde dyuers magmacyons counsayls trusted best finally cocluded counsayle coulde haue conforte without englysshmen wherfore concluded shulde sende sufficyent sonage letter credece yong kyng englande counsayle desyrynge alyed hym swere fro day forwarde good trewe englysshe parte putte handes suche forteresses helde normandy message comaunded clerke go great trust called mayster aschall sayde hym maister paschall go wayes englande moche ye may bring good tidynges fro forthe wyll alyed englysshemen clerke dyde commanded made hym redy toke shyppyng sayled long yt arryued cornwall rode tyll cae shene besyde london kyng englande spake kynge reco maunded kynge nauerr mayster hym kynge made hym good present erle salisbury sir symond burle toke speke gyue aunswere tyme sayd sir suche day kyng wyll lodon send cou sayle whiche tyme ye shall herde day assigned mayster paschall shewed kyng counsayle theffect message spake sagely well herde answered counsayle kynge nauers offre ought nat refused howe make great alyance kynge nauer desyreth behoueth come hyder englande owne proper person thentent may herde speke hym selfe wherby mater shulde take better effect answere mayster paschall departed returned nauer shewed kyng done behoued hym go englande selfe se yong kyng englande speke selfe hym cousaile kyng nauer answered sayd cotent go theder made redy shyp called lyne whiche wolde go see withall maner wyndes without parell kyng nauer toke ship entred see preuy company hym sir marten carr mayster paschall sayled longe arryued englande p alyences kynge nauer made kynge englande howe frenche kynge men warre dyuers place cap ccc xxix alytell detyng frenche kynge kyng nauer great hate knewe couertly king nauers house secremesse bytwene hym kyng englande howe kyng henry castell defyed made warre agaynst kyng nauer left detynge behynde ye vycont chastellon lorde lestrade father uyen bascle great nombre men warr aswell cou tre countie foiz kepe froters agaynst spanyerdes p whan see hadde wynde wyll arryued cornwall rode wynsore kynge richarde counsayle receyued hym great ioye thought better spede lande normandy specially castell chierbour wherof thenglysshmen desyred greatly lordes kyng nauer shewed sagelye kyng englande cause co mynge well herde well conforted content shall shewe howe treatie went bytwene two kynges one thyng kynge nauer shulde fro then alwayes true englysshe shulde neuer make peace realme fraunce kynge castell without knowledge consent kyng englande kyng englande men puyssance coude gette townes castelles kynge nauer ought haue normandy agaynst frenchman townes castels shulde abyde euer englysshe souerayntie euer reserued kynge nauerr whiche thynge englysshmen praysed moche bycause thought meanes shulde haue asayre entre frauce thorough normandy kyng england shulde sende tyme thousand speares two thousande archer ryuer gyronde burdeur bayone men armes entre nauerr make warre agaynst kyng castell nat departe fro kyng nauer realme tyll hadde made ende warre spanyerdes men warre one entred nauer kynge nauer pay wage stuffe sufficiently acordyng rate kynge englande wonte paye men warre dyuers treaty alya nces made ordayned also written sealed sworne kept bothe partes named suche shulde go normandy suche shulde go nauer bycause duke lacastre erle cabridge nat treatie ordayned treatie shulde sent sealed tent shulde make hast entre normandy duke bretayne present treatie ring charles frace right sage subtell soo well shewed hymselfe longe lyued well enfourmed armye englande yet knewe certetie suspecte whyder wolde drawe normandy el bretayne dout therof helde many men armes bretayne wherof lorde clysson lorde de lauall vycount rohan lorde beaumanoyre lorde rochfort capitayns besieged breest bastydes none otherwyse wherefore might vitayle brest whan lyst rowne capitayne valyant squye englande called james clerke bycause frenche kyng knewe well kynge nauerr alyed englande thought surely returne wolde entre treatie aduersary kyn englande douted armye thus see lest shuld take lande norma dy entre castelles parteyninge kyng nauer therfore sent hastely lorde coucy lorde de la ryuerr shulde shortely coulde get fayrnesse foulnesse suche castelles belongynge kynge nauer specially suche nere seesyde ne knewe well chyerbourge wolde nat caselye wonne lande coude nat euitayle refresshe men basse march bretayne normandy breton sir olyuer clysson capitayne normayns sir diuoye sir percyuall p siege lorde coucy lorde de la ryuer layd carentyne castelles townes kynge nauerre lost normandy cap ccc xxx lorde de la yuer esieged carentyne great puyssaunce ca tyne hadde capitayne name nat sithe deth sir eustace dambreticourt dyed ther capitayne ther foure yere hadde conforte counsayle selfe sawe well agaynst great nombre also admyrall fraunce sir johan uyen admyrall spaygne great nombre menne warre chy rbourge knewe nothynge treatie kyng nauerr howe hadde spedde englande dayly assayled two wayes one armyes way wordes lorde coucy lorde de la ryuer wolde gladly haue towne carentyne last dyde moche treatie gyuen vp obeysance frenche kyng right reserued true enhery toure kyng nauers sone treaty lordes fraunce acorded reserue chyldes right cared nat might haue townes castels possessyon thus carentyne put therin newe men warre departed went castell molmeur within thre dayes treatie wente couch lay fayre ryuer dorne whiche rynneth cane ther taryed tyll knewe myndes couch yelded vp treatie lorde coucy lorde de la ryuer alwayes chylde nauer whiche helped moch mater euer whan yelded vp french kyng comyssioners euer treatie condycion might depart whan lyst whyder wolde suche departed went farther eureur wherof done ferant naueroyse capitayne p conquest couch departed wet past ther made assaut dyuers hurt bothe party day yelded vp castell became frenche finally euer kynge nauer normandy excepte eureux chyerbourge yelded vp become french whan wonne castels small holdes countre vnder obeysaunce went layed siege eureux ther wente olde vsage moost strongest naueroyse normany deureur neuer loued perfitely none lorde kyng nauer eureux besieged right puissantly endured long season within feraudo capitayne dyde many feate armes owne handes season kynge nauerre retourned owne countre trusted haue ayded englysshmen howe dyde hym profyte apered duke lancastre erle cambridge hadde wynde agaynst come normandy alsoo armye made englande foure thousande men armes eyght thousande archer assoone come hampton entred shyppes feest saynt johan baptyst departed founde plommouthe erle salisbury sir johan arundell shulde haue gone bretayne haue refresshed brest hanybout coulde haue wynde entred duke lancaster army toke lande yle wight taryed longe space tidynges outher bretayne oute normandy herde tidynges howe army fraunce one see wherfore sent sir john arundell two hundred men armes foure hundred archer hampton eschewe parels might fall see p men warr duke aniou retayned agaynst theglisshmen siege spanyerdes helde bayone cap ccc xxxi bicause fre che kyng thought uyde remedy resyst enemy shewed normayns englysshmen se great puyssance coude nat tell whyder wolde go sent specyall commaudement realme euery man knightes squyers shulde redy apparelled warre go come commaunded lykewise duke aniou season retayned men warre sydes entent haue layde siege burdeux company brother duke berrey constable fraunce flour chiualry gascone auuergne poictou limosyn better come entent haue nombre men warre consent kyng brother gathered languedoc somme two hudred frankes howbeit coude nat enterprice season kyng sent duke berrey brother constable frauce barones suche thought shulde hym seruyce well knewe englysshmen see wyst nat whyder wolde drawe though enterprice laquen doc broken yet poore men hadde payed great somme money entent nat money agayne season kyng castell xx thousade spanyerdes catelayns helde siege bayone ther lay wynter many feate armes done bothe lande water radig de rour dampe ferrant castell ambrose bouchenoyr peter bascle lay ancre bayone two hundred vessel dyde moche trouble bayone whiche towne capitayne valyant knight englande called sir mathewe gorney wytte prowes conforted towne greatly sayd within spanyerdes entent length yf dethe nat fallen among ther fell suche mortalyte hoost fyue ther dyed thre kyng henry castell hym ygr macer tollet sayd ayre ther enuenomed corrupted ther remedy great danger parell dethe bycause doubt kynge dyslodged brake vp siege spanyerdes breton season wonne brode countrey dyuers castels small holdes entred kyng castell wet colongne sent hys constable laye siege paupylone x thousande spanyerdes whiche cytie vicounte chastellon lorde lescute bascle two hundred speares greatly toke hede cytie kyng nauer newly reuirned englande tudela abydynge dayly suche socours shulde haue come then ordeyned kyng englande counsayll ordeyned haue come thyder lorde neuyll sir thomas de termes plommouthe thousande men armes two thousande archer thentent haue come burdeaul beit coulde haue passage desire great army englande duke lancastre toke landyng saynt malo e whiche anone knowen departed house vicount bellyer sir henry malatrayt lorde co bre came entred saynt malo two hudred men armes wherof capitayne morsonae greatly reioysed el great daunger p issue iourneys englisshmen made season dyuers place fraunce also piteous dethe yuan wale cap ccc xxxii sir johan arundell hampton two hundred men armes four c archer hard ben taken see shyppe normandy howe duke lancastre army hadde scoured hauyns normandy frenchman see incotynent ordeyned four great shippes charged prouisyon entred shyppe sayled tyll came hauen chierbourc receyued great ioy tyme castell kepynge naueroyse departed sauynge peter bascle aboode styll capitayne taryed englysshmen chierbourc nat likely wonne without famyn one strongest castelles worlde hath dyuers fayre issue sir johan arundell taryed fyue dayes reuitayled castell departed agayne hampton capitayne p nowe let v speke siege saynt malo whan englysshmen entred fyrst isle saynt malo found many vesselles rochell charged good wyne merchauntes anone solde wyne shyppes burnt tha layde siege saynt malo men ynowe englisshmen spred abrode countrey dyde moche hurt moost comonly kept feldes sir robert courbes sir hughe brone nephe knewe right well countre chanon robersarte dayly rode forthe somtyme wanne somtyme lost wasted brent countrey saynt malo duke lancastre erle cambridge brother army hadde vitayle plenty came ynoughe englande saynt malo dyuers assautes marueylously well defended ther ryght good men warre within wherfore nat easy conquered hoost caused made dyuers mantel assaute foure hundred gonne layed rounde towne whiche greatly constrayned within among dyuers assautes ther one marueylous ferse whiche endured hole day therat dyuers englysshmen slayne sore hurt defended selfe valiantly lost nat man slayne knyght englande called sir peter lescume whose dethe duke brother right sore spleased ye haue herde yuan wale lay siege mortayne poitou four bastydes towne lorde lestrade capitayne fyrst bastyde parte siege lay syde rock castell geron one see whiche basty de yuan hym selfe kept seconde bytwene water castell lowe posterne none coude entre issue therat third bastyde syde castell fourth church saynt legar halfe leage castell foure bastydes mortayne sore constrayned bycause lenght siege endured yere halfe within nothyng lyue norshowe fete confort soc oure apered none fro parte wherfore sore abasshed siege thus enduryng mortayne issued realme englande march wale squier walshman called james laube small getylman well shewed getylman wyll neuer set mynde euyll entent sayde departed englande charged enfourmed knyghtes englande treason dyde ynan wale gretly behated englande gascon bycause captall beufz whome toke helped therto soubyse poictou taken frenchman wolde nat delyuer hym agayne meanes nother raunsome exchaunge yet erle saynt poule offered golde syluer wolde nat taken whan sawe pure melancoly dyed temple parys wherof frendes great displeasure walsshe squier james laube season arryued bretayne dyd somoche came poictou euer went named hym selfe beseruaunt yuan wale spake good frenche sayeng howe come wale speke yuan anone beleued conueyd countre mortaygne siege wente wisely yuan shewed hym owne langage coe countre se hym hym seruyce yuan thought none yll lightly beleued gaue hym moche thankes comynge sayd howe wolde right gladlye haue seruyce demauded tidynges countrey wale shewed trewe tidynges vntre made beleue howe countre wale wolde gladlye haue hym lorde wordes brought james greatly loue yuan euery man naturally desyreth go owne coutres therof yuan made chamberlayne james euery day aquaynted yuan wale nat moche trust man somoch yuan loued james laube distructyon pytie good valyant man armes somtyme sonne prince wale kyng edwarde england caused lese heed cause nat tell kyng edwarde ceased handes prouynce wale yuan youthe came fraunce shewed trouble kyng philyppe beyng fre che kyng kept styll log lyued one chyldren chambre neuewes alenson lykewise dyde kyng johan bare first armes batell poicters nat taken better hym ben ther slayne whan peace made bitwene kynge englande frenche kynge yuan wente lombardy contynued warre whan warre began agayne bytwene englande fraunce returned agayne fraunce bare selfe well greatly praysed welbeloued frenche kyng lordes p nowe lette v speke ende whiche lothe sauynge shewe truely fell tyme yuan wale hadde vsage beyng mortayne siege gladly mornyng whan vp redy wolde come castell sytte downe kembe heed good long space syt beholde castell countrey beynge doute feare af thynge lyghtly went none james laube oftentymes made redy none wherby last came endyng day mornyng betymes wha wether fayre clere nyght hote coulde nat slepe howebeit rose dyd syngle iacket shyrte mantell cloke aboue went thyder wonte go sate hym downe james laube hym euery man beynge lodgynges slepe early morning ther made lytell watche thought theselfe sure castell whan yuan sette olde stocke wode sayd james go lodgyng fatche combe wyll refreshe tytell season sir shall done wente came agayne combe comyng trowe deuyll entred hym besyde combe brought hym lytell jauelyne spayne large heed stele strake yuan sate clene body fell downe starke deed whan hadde done left styll dart body went way drewe vnder couert castell soo came barryers let made signes enter brought soudyc lestrade sir haue delyuered one greatest enemyes ye quod sowdic yuan wale james howe soudic thus james shewed hole mater ye haue herd fro poynt poynt whan soudycherde shaked heed behelde right felly said hast murdred knowe routhe thynges consydred sauyng dede profyte shulde cost thyne heed sithe done nat vndone agayne howe beit great domage gentylman slayne shall haue rather blame therby prayse ende yuan owen wale wheder ye wyll one slayne great vnhap treason wherwith hoost whan knewe ryght sorie displeased euery man herde therof specially kyng charles frauce greatly complayned dethe howe beit coulde nat amende yuan buryed church saynt leger hadde made bastyde halfe leage fro castell mortayne gentylmen hoost buryeng whiche done ryght honourably howe beit siege helde styll mortayne good knyghtes squiers breton poicteuyns frenchman geatter desyre conquere castell hadde thought neuer departe then tyll wonne elles reysed puyssance wolde fayne haue ben reuenged dethe yuan wale lay styll without sawte geuynge knewe well lacked vitayle within castell none coulde come p nowe let v leue speke siege mortayne returne siege saynt malo fyrst speke siege eureux howe dyd lay p howe within eureux yelded selfe frenche two hoostes assembled gyder saynt malo cap ccc xxxiii siege beyng eureux lorde coucy lorde de la ryuer souerayns hoost herde often tymes tidynges fro french kyng lay rohan nere men myght thought haue eureux shortly hande outher byforce composicion perceyued well englisshmen began waxe strog bretayne wherfore wolde haue men warre drawe thyder reyse siege saynt malos fight ye englysshmen two lordes eureux aquyted selfe ryght valyantly euery daye made assaute also sente many treaty burgess towne shewynge howe suffred selfe greued without reason mynysshe goodesse suffre house countrey beaten downe brent naturall lorde charles nauer herytage countye eureux fallen reason dethe countesse mother counsayled nat holde erroure opynyon folysshe naueroyse suche ferando careth nat lease besyde ryghtfull quarell sayd wolde neuer departe then tyll castell wyll force shulde haue mercy towne newe peopled stranger offer wordes manasshes shewed eureux euery day assayled within began doute apered maner comfort tha sayde one another se well frenche kynge desyreth nat countre castell eureux hym selfe nephewe charles nauerre fell treatye lorde coucy whan ferando knewe burgess towne fell treatye kept hym selfe within castell wolde nat come none treatyes finally towne coutre yelded vp lyues goodesse saued receyued charles nauerre lorde besieged ferando within castell began entreate wolde suffre depart without daunger wolde yelde vp ye castell lordes content departed castell brought chyerbourc conquest eureux capytayns hoost drewe rohan kyng lay tidynges well knewe thenglysshmen laye siege saynt malos bretayne kyng receyued ioyfully specyally lorde coucy lorde de la ryuer bycause well spedde lordes abode styll normandy styll retayned wage french kyng season lay styll rohan hadde sure knowledge howe englysshmen puissantly besieged saynt malos howe within sore constrayned euery day enpayred thought wolde lothe lese men good towne saynt malos ben one englisshe thought bretayn sore weaked syde therfore resyst englisshmen kyng made great assemble none durst disobey comaundement sytte styll home kynge sent two bretherne thyder duke berrey ye duke burgoyn erle alenson erle de la marche dolphyn auuergne therle guefe sir johan bolayne many great barones knyghtes countreys also kyng comaunded constable sir bertram clesquy yt shulde nat behynde constable wolde nat dysobey went forthe great company men armes poictou aniou towrayne also ther two marshal fraunce yt marshall bleunylle also sir olyuer clisson lorde leon baron bretayne x thousande men armes ye feldes mo hudred thousande horse lodged euer nere gyder coulde bytwene englisshmen ryuer arme see often tymes whan see ebbed knyghtes squiers wolde go dyuers feates armes enemyes playne ryuer neuer suche assemble made bretayne frenchman puyssat lyke wise englisshmen eche parte thought fyght euery day shewed selfe felde baners penons waueryng wynde great pleasure behold frenchemen wolde come downe ryuer syde make semblant fyght wolde say beholde yonder enemyes anon ye see wyll ebbe wollcome ouer wyll se come fight semythe haue wyll therto feare fortune batayle thynke chiefe gouernours wyll nat suffre aduenture fyght v playne batayle fasynge mustryng dayly bytwene day erle cambridge sware sayd ther mo suche assembles wolde nat come fyght wolde go ouer fyght soeuer fell therof day vowarde constable fraunce sawe well howe englysshmen hote hasty ordayned season batayls sandes nere ryuer coulde fote erle cambridge whan sawe maner sayd loue folowe wyll go fyght dasshed water whyche lowe fludde comynge came iust ryuersyde baner tha englisshmen began shote agaynst ye frechmen ye constable fraunce drewe abacke people went back felde thought veryly englisshmen wolde come ouer water wolde gladly haue caused haue done duke lancastre great batayle redy haue folowed brother sene hadde bene nede sayd gerarde brees squier heynaulte hym gerarde beholde brother howe aduentureth hymselfe semeth howe sheweth ensample ye frenchemen howe wolde fayne fyght semeth haue small wyll therto thus contynued deades armes done nother party fludde began ryse englisshmen drewe backe ryuer went lodgynges frenchman lyke wyse suche muster assembles siege durynge done dyuers feates armes frenchman kept well fronter englisshmen durst nat passe ryuer soo dyuers tymes hygher countre certayne knyghtes squiers breton suche knewe well countrey rode brode certayne companyes passed ryuer gydes often tymes encountred englisshe forager sometyme fought soe ouer throwen sometyme wan sometyme lost aduentures warre often tymes falleth siege thus endurynge lordes englande dilygently attayne purpose concluded make myne therby entre saynt malos otherwyse thought coulde nat get towne full good men warre well furnysshed ordynance artyllery whiche helped merueylusly well also thenglisshmen nigh euery day fayne armed asse ble gyder abyde batayle frenchman wolde haue come forwarde wherfore leyser make assawtes towne gonne wherof great plenty troubled sore within towne aduysed place make myne set mynours warke p nowe lette v lytell space leaue spekyng siege speke siege mortayne poictou p howe englysshmen came reysed siege mortayne cap ccc xxxiiii haue harde bethe yuan wale howe slayne howe breton poicteuyns styll siege mortayne sir james mountmore sir percyuall deyneuall wylliam mountcountour sir james surgeres capitaynes wold nat leaue siege dethe yuan wale souerayne capitayne great desyre reuenge dethe forteresse also ye haue herde howe sir thoms triuet sir wyllm scrope sir thomas berton sir wylliam sendrue great nombre men armes archer ordayned go march burdeaux reskewe mortayne sir mathewe gornay bayon dayly occupyed therabout march agaynst gascons suche helde forteresses sayd four knyghtes companyes layen plomouthe vii monethes could haue wynde serue go gascoyne wherof ryght sore displeased coulde nat amende also ye haue harde howe lorde neuyll englande ordeyned great nombre men armes archer go comforte kyng nauer agaynst spany ardes ordeyned seneshall burdeux founde men warr styll plomouth eche glad anon lord neuels comyng wynde wyll toke shippynge sayled towardes gascoyne one flete sixe score vesselles xl barkes myght well thousade men armes two thousande archer hadde let see good wynde entred hauen burdeux euen lady septembre yer sorde thousand thre hundred lxxvii whan breton poicteuyns laye siege mortaygne sawe suche flete shippes passe makynge great feast brunt w ynge trompettes ryght pensyue within castell ryght ioyfull hoped well shortely reskewed elles enemyes haue batayle thought surely nat come thyder nought great feate armes sir james mountmore capitaynes hoost drewe guyder counsayle determyne best repented forsakyng treaty offred lytell soudic lestrade offred rendre vp ye forteresse myght departe burdeur lyues goodes saued frenchman wolde nat therof sent aulde castell shewyng howe content receyue treatie soudic answered howe mynd fall treatie socour come wherfore wolde frely departe yde pleasure ye siege lay styll lorde neuyll company came burdea ioyfully receyued sir wylliam man seneshall landes sir johan multon mayre cytie archbysshop burgess ladyes lorde neuyll lodged abbey saynt andrewes seneshall burdeur anone made assemble knyghtes squiers gascons suche helde englisshe parte four thousande ordeyned shyppes vesselles ryuer garon departed fro burdeux go reyse siege mortayne anone tydynges knowen frenche hoost howe thenglysshmen gascons comyng downe ryuer garon reyse siege elles yght capitayns drewe counsayle thynges considered thought nat able abyde puyssance wherfore determyned shulde rather l e tyme hadde spent put themselfe farder daunger parell sowned dis ogyng without thyng doyng farder drewe poictou departed nat certayne breton walshmen parteynynge yuan wale sayd howe able abyde ye world kepe fortresse saynt leger entred drue artyllary knightes englande gascon comynge full sayles barge ryuer garon rested thentre mortayne toke lande lytell lytell landed put selfe order redy assayle fortresse saynt leger wherin breton first comyng ther sore assaut whyle assaut lorde neuyll sent haraude mortayn soudic knowe howe dyde haraude dyde co mauded brought worde agayne dyd rightwell showes fete assaut saynt legerendured well thre houres wan nothing dyuers men sore hurt lodged night myndes nat depart then tyll wonne holde sore displeased lord motmore french knightes nat ben fortresse saynt leger wiselye departed left ther breton p howe englysshmen recouered dyuers castelles frenchman burdeloys cap ccc xxxv next mornyng lorde neuyll knightes england ordayned gyue assaut saynt leger sowned trupett ye assaute aproched fortresse ther began sore assaut fortresse stode rocke none coude easely aproche therto wekest syde ther dyuers great dyke none coude easely aproche assaylers traueyled sore wanne lytell dyuers men sore hurt slayne thassaut ceased thought best fyll dyke haue aduantage togyue assaut great payne dyke fylled breton within seyng douted dyde good reason fell entreat englysshmen great mynde ye kyng nauers busynesse also thought delyuer certayne fortress burdelois holden frenche breton agreed treatie holde saynt leger gyuen vp within departed whyder lyst lyues goodes saued thus saynt leger englysshe lordes wente castell mortayne founde soudic lestrade case haraud reported refresshed euery thyng neded castell newe furnysshed retourned agayne burdeaux way cae water ryuer garon whan come agayne burdeaux refresshed meane season knowledge sire leag then ther barone helde fortresse called saynt mauberen coutre called medoc dyde moche hurt countre tha thenglysshe lordes charged prouisyon ryuer garone artyllary toke horse aboute thre hudred speares came lande saynt mauberen ther gascoyns lorde neuyll sir axchambalt grayle lorde rousy lorde dura ye lorde ternon whan barones companyes come saynt mauberen toke lodgynge incontynent gaue assaut whiche feirse terryble breton within good men warre capitayne one called huguelyn ruled first assaut dyde breton lytell hurt thenglysshmen drewe lodgynge next mornynge reysed vp engyns cast stone breke downe toppes byldinges towre iii day ordayned gyue asore assaut sayeng rybaud shulde nat longe endure agaynst sore feirse assaut many man slayne hurt ther neuer men better defe ded selfe breton dyde howe finally seyng confort comyng fro parte warde fell treatie sawe well ennemyes wolde nat departe then tyll hadde pleasure thoughe shulde lye longe therfore ye treatie toke suche effect gaue vp saynt mauberen departed goodes without domage went poictou whyder lyst whan lorde neuyll lorde therof newly repayred forteresse furnysshed newe men artillary sette therin gascoyns kepe squyer gascoyne called peter brasyas capitayne lorde neuyll returned burdeux dayly herde siege endured panpilone nauer whiche besieged chylde castell herd certayne tidynges kyng nauer also kynge nauerr herde worde whiche greatly displeased hym p nowe let v retourne besynesse bretayne normandy speke siege saynt malo howe myne made thenglisshmen agaynst saynt malos lost siege reysed cap ccc xxxvi towne saynt malo ther sore siege many soore saute gyuen thenglysshmen well four hundred gones shot night daye fortresse agaynst capitayne within called morfonas valyant man armes set mynde ye defence forteresse good counsayle sir hery maletrait lorde co bore vycont bellere dyd valyantly toke tyme lytell hurte coutre ye haue herde floure fraunce aswell great lordes nombre xvi thousande men armes knyghtes squyers well hundred thousande horse gladly wolde haue fought theglisshmen lykewise englysshmen wolde gladly haue done parte coulde haue founde aduauntage thynge whiche brake purpose oftentymes ryuer bytwene wha studde came ther coude none passe ouer none might coe alwayes myne went forward within great dout ye may well knowe suche assembles coude non otherwyse forager eyther tie somtymes met felde ther expert knyghtes squyers bothe party many feat armes done ouerthrowen myners wrought sore day night vnder erth thentent come towne way make pane wall fall men might entre myne morfonace within douted gretly knewe well myght lost cared none assaut towne well furnysshed vitayls artyllary kepe two yere yf nede great thought breke myne long thought theron traueyled ther last came entente great aduenture many thynges falleth warre erle richarde arundell shulde haue kept watche one night certayn owne men therle toke great hede charge saynt malos knewe therof spyes wyse wha ie sawe tyme trust watche departed secretly towne hoost beyng slepe came without noyse makynge ye place wher myne makynge myners nigh made ende warke morfonace copany beyng redy come ease without defence brake myne myners cae neuer myne fell downe whan done sayde wolde awake watch next towne thentent hoost shulde knowe howe valiantly done entred one syde felde cryeng cryes beatyng downe tentes lodgyng sleynge men hoost began styrre morfonace copany drewe saynt malos without hurte danger hoost began assemble ye duke great marueyle might demaunded shewed defaut watche myne lost tyme duke lancastre sent therle arundell sore rebuked aduenture excused selfe aswell might howbeit ther sore ashamed hadde rather haue spent hundred thousande frankes shulde haue fortuned thys aduenture thus fallen myne broken lordes ye hoost drewe counsayle knowe beste theym behelde eche sawe well howe lost season whiche nat likely recouered agayne begyn newe myne thoght shuld neuer bring ende tyme passed wynter drue determyned thynges cosydred best dyll g retourne england agayne ordayned euery man shulde dyslodge go shyppe flete laye styll ancre hauen saynt malo anone euery man dislodged shippe wynde wyll sayled towarde engla de aryued hapton ther toke lande ther knewe sir john arudell capiten hapton gone chierborc refresh ye garison ther thus brake vp theglishe army euery man drue owne house repassed see went owne countreis comons englande began murmure agaynst ye noble men sayeng howe hadde done season lytell good specially bycause saynt malos escaped wherfore erle arundell hadde lytell grace loue p howe sir olyuer clesquy taken chierbourge cap ccc xxxvii anone departure englysshmen fro saynt malo fre chemen refresshed newlye towne castell constable frau ce breton determyned go lay siege chierbourc wherof sir johan har ston capitayn hym dyuers knightes bothe englysshe naueroyse hole host frauce went nat thyder departed duke berrey duke burgoyne duke burbone erle de la marche dolphyn auuergne great lordes sent countreis dyuers went rohan se kynge receyued theym right ioyously thre hundred speares breton normayns wente ualonges thre leages fro chierbourge made bastyd knewe well sir johan arudell newly refresshed chierbourc supposed tha bytwene chierbourge ualoges syde ther highe wodes forestes endured cyte costances chierbourg might yssue ryde aboute countrey whan lyst wode away sore hedged bothe sydes whan ryding coude none aproche chierbourge one strogest castels worlde garyson ualoges right sore displeased coude domage englysshmen haryed coutre sir olyuer clesquy brother sir bertram came fro catyminy rode throughe wode aduysed chierbourg right nere thentent se ther might siege layde therto howe thought leest might gette towne whiche stode higher castell shulde great enterprice thought might fortify towne none shulde yssue castell great domage sir olyuer perseuered styll purpose toke hym fyftene speares guydes suche coude surely bring hym throughe wodes mornynge departed fro ualonges came woodes tyll agaynst chierbourg ye day tyme sir johan arundell come towne castell squyer nauer called johan coq hym entent shewe towne ther herd tidynges howe frenchman come thyder aduyse place sir johan coq haue herde howe sir olyuer clesquy brother sir bertram hath past wodes hath aduysed towne sir god sake let v pursue hym sir warrant bringe suche away shall nat escape v shall fall handes shall coquered lytell lytell faythe quod sir johan arundell content armed secretly toke two hundred speares entred wodes wher frenchman rode day knewe nothyng eche whan sir olyuer well aduysed towne whiche sawe right stronge place impossyble besieged withdrue toke way towarde ualoges way came hadde nat rydden space two leages sir johan arundell johan coq came streyght well gyded cryed lady arundell whan sir olyuer herde crye sawe redy mete hym wysshed selfe agayne ualonges thane mounted good courser thynking saue selfe eynge sawe well tyme place sight aduantage men entred thycke woode wyst nat whyder fewe kept togyder johan coq lyke valyant man armes folowed chase sir olyuer nere finally toke hym prisoner ten xii ther taken resydue saued selfe woodes gate ualonges whan might ther shewed sir wylliam bordes company howe spedde reason busshement howe sir olyuer clesquy taken wherof ther soore displeased howbeit coude nat amende sir olyuer ledde castell chierbourg shewed howe shulde pay raunsome x thousande frankes tidynges anone knowen bothe englande fraunce mater abode styll long estate sir olyuer clesquy prisoner longe season chierbourge kepyng johan coq nauer toke yet sir johan arundell profyte afterwarde sir olyuer made fynance hymselfe taken long space first whan garison chierbourg well refresshed sir johan arundell departed went agayn hampton wherof capitayne ther abode styll chierdourg sir john harlston capitayne dyuers knyghtes englande sir john coplande sir john bulle sir thoms bygorne dyuers knightes squyers toke good hede fortresse toke domage p nowe lette v leaue speke chierbourc tyll tyme come therto agayne let v speke sir johan neuyll seneshall burdeaulx company sir thomas tryuet howe perseuered p chylde castell spanyerdes lay siege panpilone suche castelles englysshmen conquered frenchman handes ca ccc xxxviii lorde neuyll beynge burdeur well entourmed howe chylde castell great nombre spanyerdes layde siege good towne papylone vycont chastellon lorde lescute raymon ramesen dyuers within coude certayne troynges kyng nauer wherof hadde marueyle supposed shortely fro hym coutremen burdeaur ther desyred lorde neuyll nat departe countre suffre none men warre dete long frenchman fortress coutre specially coplayned fortresse bersat whiche sayde dyde oche countrey lorde neuyll demaunded nombre breton within bersatte shewed fyue hudred fightyng men called hym seneshall landes sir wyllyam scrope sayde sir take two thre hudred speares many archer go way loke bersat somoche delyuer countre shall attende greatter mater two knightes wolde nat disobey toke two hudred speares many archer passed ryuer garon rode towarde bersat ye season bersat te abrode rydinge nombre corespeares long ryuer garon thetent se might fynde shyppe capitayne one pyergourt called sir bertram raymon good man armes within litell leage bersat encountred englysshmen whan sir bertram sawe must nedes fight affrayed ordred men good array nere gascoyns englysshmen came speares couched spurres horse first comynge ther dyuers ouerthrowen bothe party many feate armes done nowe b finally frenchman coude nat endure thenglysshmens dedes also mo nombre chosen men somoch garyson bersat slayne taken fewe scaped ther taken sir bertram raymon sir wyllm hemon rode bersat wha garison sawe ther men taken slayne sore abasshed gaue vp forteresse lyues saued thus bersat became englisshe returned burdeur p day ye night alsayntes ye yere lorde ccc lxxviii theglysshmen entred bersat day kyng nauer came burdeux man wyst receyued ryght honorably well lodged ease men demauded tidyng coutre spanyerdes answered plainly ye childe castell besieged papylone great puyssance yt within cyte sore constrayned tha desyred acordyng ye apoyntment made kyng englande wolde helpe confort people reyse siege knightes englande offred themselfe said good mynde ye neglygece siege shulde nat vnreysed ordayned therfore said kyng sir returne yor owne coutre make spiall assebly yor men shallbe ther day apoynted let v assemble togyder shabe stronger men also knowe countre better answered said s ye say well thus shalbe done thirde daye departed toke way see syde ther bayon dare gascone certayne fortress holden breton longe kynge nauer rode yt came towne saynt johans ther abode p meane season whyle kynge nauer made vyage burdeux taryed retourned agayne john castell son kyng spayne costable realme castell chefe warr called dome peter moriche helde thesiege panpylone great nombre vnder ther therle done alphons therle medyna therle manos therle ribydie peter ferant salesque peter gousart modesque dyuers knightes squiers castell spanyerdes came towarde panpylone taken brent towne lornich cytie uyen besyde groynge neuer lorde nauerr durst apere euery man kept owne holde knewe rightwell ye kyng nauer alwayes messangers comyng goyng coude nat remedy wtout ye helpe glishmen ye lorde neuyll burdeur sent thyder kynge englande hiss counsayle knewe rightwell liage lyace made bytwene kyng englande nauer yet faynted slacke acomplysshing therof thought hym selfe called hym sir thomas tryuet right valyant knight sayd sir thoms ye knowe well howe sent hyder take hede froters cou tre put enemyes also co fort ye kyng nauer hath ben v hath shewed v nede hath ye present whan promysed shulde serue wherfore behoueth v el shalbe blamed wherfore dere sre de louer ordayne chefe gouernour warre ye take sixe hundred speres thousande archer go nauer wyll abyde marchesse bycause seneshall burdeux haue charge therof comytted kynge englande therfore wyll take hede suche aduentures shall fall yet coutre nat rydde enemyes sir sir thomas ye honour worthy shall gladly obey reason shall aquyte vyage best power lorde neuell sayd sir well conforted ye arwylling go within lytell space sir thomas tryuet departed fro burdeux toke way dare gascoyne ther sir wylliam condone sir thomas berton sir john asfull sir henry paule sir wyllm croquet sir loys malyn sir thomas fourque sir robert haston gascons great nombre whan men warre come cytie dare herde tidynges kyng nauerre saynt john du pye du port made somons men warr wherof right gladde cytie dare capitayne englysshe knight called sir mathue gorney vncle sir thoms tryuet receyued nephewe right ioyfully company ayded lodge theym ease thentent sir thomas tryuet nat haue rested haue kept way kyng nauerr sir mathewe sayd fyre nephue sytheye suche puyssaunce behoueth delyuer countre certayne breton frenche men kepeth well xii fortress bytwene bayone ye leaue behynde wyll v wynter moche trouble sir ye coutre wyll moche thanke sir desyre sir sir thomas wyll sette euery thyng order came forteresse called mountpyn whiche ye breton helde therin capitayn squier countie foyz called tayllerdon soone men armes come thyder made sore assaut fortres taken within slayne excepte capitayne taken prisoner castell newe furnysshed newe went farther castell called careyllat kept also frenche gascons men warre gaue assaute therto fayled yt assaut winnynge dislodged next mornynge made feirse assaute ye force wan slayne within except capitayne breton bretonant called yuonet aprisydie delyuered englysshmen prisoner castell brent passed farther came another fortresse called besenghen therin capitayne squyer gascoyne called roger morlac englysshmen two dayes treatie within deted domage went whyder lyst fro then went tassegnon castell stadyng thre leages fro bayoue layd siege whan bayone herde howe siege layde right ioyfull cae siege v hudred men towne speares pauesses brought greatest engyn bayone fortresse done moche trouble bayone desyred nothyng moche dystructyon strength coulde nat haue get aduyse helpe englysshmen nat ben lay xv dayes yet whan treaty ye wtin wet way without domage wer brought sauegard bregent whiche helde ye french parte bayon bought castell thre frankes beate downe caryed stone bayone men warr well receyued euery thyng desyred payeng therfore p spanyerdes departed fro siege papylone howe englysshmen arryued nauer howe dyde cap ccc xxxix kyng nauer beyng saynt john towne right sore trobled dyspleased mynde theglisshmen taryed longe countrey great ell surely cyte panpylone ben spanyerdes wysdome good kepyng vycont chastellon nat ben capyten ther two c speares gascons wyse order kept fro parell towne tedula nauer capitayne sir perducas dalbret cyte myranda capiten therle pulloys hym sir roger brother another strong towne nauer called arkes capitayne knyght cateloy e called sir raymon bageth trust capitayns kyng nauer held saynt john towne countre wasted ouerrynne enemyes none kepte feldes spanyerdes knewe well length long siege cyte panpylone shulde wonne yelded vp wyll therto vycount chastellon lorde lescute wyllm paur toke good hede feared danger last spanyerdes began ware wery wynter drewe saynt andrewes tyde vitayle began fayle ware scante fayled sorer vycount roquebertyn nat ben refresshed threscore somers laden vitayls elles vitayls fayled alhalowtyde kyng nauer sent knyght called sir peter bascle englysshmen prayeng make hast thought taryed ouer long seyng promyse nede togyder knight dyde moche came marche bayone founde englisshmen castell called poulat dyde message sir thomas tryuet sayd castell lay one wolde nothyng tyll came nauer badde knyght promyse retourne departed castell within two dayes gyuen vp treatie within departed castell newe refresshed newe men countre well peace howe styll lytell fortress kept church mynsters whiche dyde hurt countre great puyssaunce englysshmen wolde tary lenger sayd wolde go nauer reyse sege papylone el fight spanyerdes sir thomas tryuet sir mathewe gorney men retourned dar ther taryed four dayes departed toke way nauer sir mathewe gorney retourned bayone owne men kepe countre conquere smale forteresses breton kept long sir thoms tryuet iourneyd cae saynt john du py du port foude kyng nauer receyued right ioyously knightes lodged towne men warre countre tyme kyng nauer somoned maner men assemble cyte myra da ther none wolde resyst agaynst kynges comaundement euery man prepared selfe go panpylone fight spanyerdes tidynges came hoost howe thenglysshmen great puyssance kyng nauer saynt john towne nombre xx thousande men warr capitayns drewe togyder counsaile se best outher abyde kynge nauer orels withdrawe backe cousayle long capitayns wolde theglisshmen shulde byden sayd nay bycause nat strong ynough abyde fresshmen theymselfe sore traueyled reason long siege finally concluded dyslodge euery man drawe owne countre moost enclyned dete ther valyant knight vsed marmes said nat agaynst honour dete cosydring kyng hery castell beyng owne countre sent xv dayes past sonne breke vp siege thus spanyerdes dysloged departed set fyre lodgynges drewe towardes groyng saynt domynikes castell whan within panpylone sawe det right ioyfull nat ben tymes ease p tidynges came kynge nauer thenglysshmen beyng saynt johans towne howe spanyerdes goone owne countrees semyng therwt right sore displeased gladly wolo haue fought spaynyardes dyslodged went towarde panpilon ther founde vicount chastellon lorde lescute receyued ioyfully whan refresshed two thre dayes determyned eparte go lye garysons large mountayns nauer arre ryght colde wynter bycause great snowes tha ordayned englisshmen shulde go lye tudela lorde lescute pont de la royne erle pulloys sir roger brother go corell lorde chastellon mundon thus men warre departed kynge nauer abode styll panpylone owne palys garysons nauer kepte peace without doynge thynge wynter wolde nat ryde abrode lyke wyse spanyardes departed kynge henry went cyuell wyfe chyldren sir thomas tryuet company beynge tudela remembring howe done nothyng sythe came nauer worde espyes howe spanyardes departed drawen thought ryde towarde spaygne enploy tyme veserue wage secretely gathered togyder certayne nombre men armes archer sent worde therof erle pulloys sir roger brother came two c speares thre hudred pauesses assembled togyder tudela vii c speares xii c archer many brigantes charged somers great plentie vitayls deted loged christmas euyn afayre medowe ryuersyde fote moutain called mout cane whiche deted thre realmes nauer castell aragone syde moutayn countre called vale sorie day marueylous hote day tyme yere p howe englysshmen naueroyse ran realme spayne pillage gat cap ccc xl whan hadde dyned went cousayle knowe shulde thyng day ornar bicause christmas euyn seyng entryng lande enemyes determyned shulde ryde night mornyng christmas day might redy scale cytie vale de sorie counsayle kept euery man made redy entente ordayned shulde goo enterprice thre hundred speares resydue fotemen shulde lye styll ther lay tyll mornyng worde howe company spedde therle pulloys c speres sir thomas tryuet copany gydes bring thyder shulde yde foure copanyes secretlyer entprice easly come entent two houres within night armed lept horsbacke trupettes capitayns gydes knewe well wher shulde mete agayn mounted hyll fayre playne sodenly ther fell suche hayle snowe marueyle grounde couered snowe rode tyll morning coude fynde eche vnhappy wether englisshmen fell well cyte toke hede bushment nat ware therof thenglisshmes apoyntment kept houre apoynted nat fayled haue wonne towne p whan sir thoms tryuet sawe fayled purpose sore displeased mynde gathered togyder copany well might tooke newe counsayle dranke eate lytell dyner whiche shorte sir raymon balgette naueroyse chosen fortie speares go rynne towne drawe oute genyciens within knight rode cytie cae barryers great scrimysshe genyciens two hundred yssued oute began shote cast men armes euer lytell lytell drewe backe bringe farther fro towne yuell handled men armes busshmet nat drawen forward cae feirsly wt speres strake among bete downe many slayue driuen towne agayne great mage tha closed barryers gate mounted walles wende surely haue assaut theglysshmen thought retourne day light retourned agayne lodgyng wher foude rest men lay night next mornyng whiche saynt stepbyns day drue towne called quasquam normandy founde kyng nauer come thy er christmas day englysshmen ae quasquam day brent certayne vyllages specially brent robbed great vyllage called nygret phowe peace made bytwene kyng spayne king nauer dethe kynge henry spayne coronacyon johan sonne cap c c c xli tidynges came kyng hen castell cyuell ye hert realme howe englisshmen brent towne uale de sorie makyng warr kyng nauer wherof sore displeased sware shulde amended wrote letter john castell sonne shulde make somons throughout realme assemble guyder noble men sayeng howe wolde shortely spayne reuenge hym kyng nauer excesse done hym chylde castell wolde nat disobey comaundement kyng father sent commaundement drewe hym maner men warre meane season sir thomas tryuet thought assemble certayne nombre men warre go towne alpharo spayne dyde departed euenynge fro quasquam fro kynge nauer hym one hudred speres chosen men armes nexte mornyng came within lytell leage towne made busshement sir wylliam sendrine sent rynne towne andrewe andrac ten speares cae lytell ryuer broke went streight towne passed great trouble andrewe andrac made horse leape ouer came barryers began great noyse towne sownyng trumpett men warr within towne assembled togyder opyned gate barryers yssued began scrimysshe sayd ten speares ther two past ryuer retourned whan sawe people comyng warde made horse agayne leape ouer broke whan ye towne sawe fewe enemyes knewe nothyng bushment folowed fast past ryuer lytell aboue wher knewe passage chased tenne speares busshment sir thomas tryuet company cae forthe cryeng cryes bare many erthe say trouthe spanyerdes coude nat longe endure retourned well might ther fewe saued outher slayne taken fray great towne thenglysshmen beleued first comynge haue towne bycause men discofyted fayled purpose ye woman saued towne assone men issued past ryuer closed barryers gate mouted vp walles made semblant defende selfe whan sir thomas triuet sawe order maner sayd beholde yonder good wyues towne haue done let v retourne agayne canne nothyng returned passed agayne lytle broke went quesquam ledde theym prisoner whiche dede sir thomas tryuet great thake laude prayse kyng nauer fyftene dayes made iourney alpharo spanyerd came feldes twentie thousande horsmen fotemen great wyll fight englysshmen whan kyng nauer herde therof came tudela sir thomas tryuet company hym sente garysons realme nauer coe wolde nat disobey commaundement desyred nothyng el spanyerdes taryed nothyng comynge kyng henry deted f ceuyll great nombre came saynt dominykes ther rested lay ye felde whan johan castell knewe kynge father come went fro alphare saynt dominykes king father entent spanyerdes haue goone ley sege tudela haue closed kynge nauer haue fought hym kyng nauer well enformed knewe well nat puyssaunce abyde batayle agaynst kynge henry xl thousande men horsebacke ote bitwene kynge henry kynge nauer ther certayne noble men bothe realmes prelate baron ymagined great parell domage might fall bothe party shulde ee entreated bytwene tie haue respyte warr bytwene haue leysar entreat toke great payne goyng comyng bytwen party coude bring entent englisshmen two thousande feirse agaynst spanyerdes cou sayled kynge nauer batayle syde spanyerdes great nobre wherfore sette lytell thenglysshmen naueroyse therfore harde bringe treatie good effect busynesse therof toke moche payne labour last respyte taken bytwene endure sixe wekes thetent meane season entreat full peace entent make yf myght maryage bytwene chylde castell eldest sonne kyng henry doughter kyng nauer wherby peace shulde surelyer cotynue whiche kynge nauer well agreed bycause doughter shulde highly maryed pand moreouer prelate baron party thought also mary kyng nauers son kyng henryes doughter somoche treatie toke effect kyng henry shulde sende freche kynge desyringe suffre charles nauer kepynge come nauer dyde desyre frenche kynge sente formance treati mariage kyng nauer shulde ay pledge space ten yere kyng henry towne castell lestoyll cytie castell tudela towne castell de la garde kyng henry shulde yelde rendre englysshmen sir
