perse courtney prisoner lorde parre gascoyne thynges done sealed confyrmed accorded sworne kept stable ferme euer bytwene two kynges realmes whiche yt euer shulde breke peace maner wayes shulde rynne sentence pope whyle treatyes makyng kynge nauer bounde englysshmen ye xx thousande frankes acquyte hym selfe agaynst sent vycont chastelon arragon kynge borowe hym sayd somme money haue pledge therfore good townes panpylone myrando quenes towne corell saynt johans towne thus englysshemen payed delyuered departed fro kynge nauer went bur eux fro englande maryage made bytwene charles nauer kyng herys doughter called jane right fayre lady pthe yere dyed kyng henry castell son john crowned kyng kynge accorde prelate baron realme spaygne castell cecyll galyce candonne sware faithe homage euer began warre bytwene kynge portyngale kyng johan castell wh che endured long ye shall nowe lette v retourne busyness fraunce phowe lorde lagurant wounded dethe howe capitayne garyson boutuylle disco fyted castell yelded vp frenche cap c c c xlii haue herde howe lorde mucydent tourned frenche yer parys tyll last wery thought haue ounde freche kyng otherwise warde thanne wherfore angrye mynde repeted hym selfe tourned freche sayeng howe feare rather tha thyng thought steale fro parys go owne coutre yelde selfe agayne englysshe seruyce kyng englande pleased moche better seruyce frenche kyng hadde aduysed dyde gaue knowlege knewe except owne seruantes howe sicke kepte lodgynge euenyng lept horse vnknowen toke thre person hym deted fro parys rode toward owne coutre men folowed lytell lytell longe rode came burdeux founde sir johan lorde neuyll seneshall burdeux whome shewed aduenture became agayne englysshe sayde howe hadde rather false faythe french kyng naturall lorde ye kyng englande thus lorde mucydent abode englysshe long lyued wherof duke aniou sore displeased said sware euer coude get hym shulde lese heed wherof lorde mucydent well enfourmed thought kepe hym selfe ryght well danger season lorde langurante styll frenche experte knight dyde moche hurt trouble suche landes parteyned lordes becoe englysshe lorde rosen lord dura lorde mucydent wherwith thre lordes weresore displeased set myndes howe might slee vtterly enemy lorde la gurant rode forthe day xl speares came nere englysshe forteresse called cadylhatte herytage captall beufz bretherne gascoyns lorde lagurant made abusshment company sayd sir tary styll wyll go ryde yonder forteresse alone se wyll issue agaynst v rode forthe came ye barryers castell spake kepars demauded bernard courant capitayne sayde shewe hym howe lorde langurantis desyreth juste hym course yf good man valyant armes sayde wyll nat refuse ladyes sake yf hedo shall tourne hym moche blame shall repute whersoeuer go cowardnesse hath refused ryn one course spere squyer bernardes answered sayd sir langurant haue well herde wordes sir ye wyll suffre lytell shall go speke maister ifye wyll abyde warrant ther shalbe reproche cowardnesse wyll tarye lorde langurant squyer went founde maister chambre ther shewed wordes ye haue herde whan bernard herde hert began swell pre sayd gette harnesse sadell horse shall nat go refused incontynent armed mounted horse toke targe speare opyned gate barryers issued felde whan lorde langurant sawe comyng reioysed couched speare lyke good knyght dyde bernarde dasshed horse bothe well horsed hytte euyn bothe sheldes fell peces passyng bernarde sholdred sir langurantes horse suche wyse lorde fell sadell whan bernard sawe hym ye erth ryght ioyfull tourned shortely horse lorde langurant risynge vp bernarde bygge valyant squyer toke hym bassenet bothe handes drewe sore reysed heed dyde cast bassenet vnder horse fete lorde langurantes men beynge busshement sawe brake comyng rescue maister lorde bernard sawe comynge drewe dagger sayde lorde langurant sir yelde prisoner rescue rescue el ye deed lorde langurant trusted rescue men spake nat worde agayne whan bernarde sawe enflamed feruentyre douted leest shulde lese ye lesse strake lorde langurante heed whiche bare suche wyse brake skoll brayne dasshed horse entred barryers lyghted made redy defede selfe ifnede whan lorde langurant men coe hym founde wouded dethe right soroufull toke caryed hym aswell might owne castell next day dyed thus befell season lorde langurant season dede armes done rocheloys helyot playsac gentyll squyer valyaunt man armes capitayne boutuyll englysshe garyson sixscore speares englysshe gascoyns pylled sore countre ranne nigh euery day towne rochell el towne saynt john dangle helde two townes suche feare doubte durst nat issue stelth wherof knyghtes squyers coutre right sore displeased thought one day prouyde remedy el slayne taken ennemyes felde day assembled towne rochell two hundred speares towne moost comenly helyot playsac copany dyde moost hurt vnto ther poyctou xaynton lorde thowars lorde puissace sir james surgeres percyuall coloygne sir raynolde gomers sir hugh uynon dyuers knightes squyers hauyng gret desyre fight ennemyes capitayns knewe spyes helyot playsac abrode comynge apere rochell gette ther pray lordes knyghtes went rochell euenyng well armed horsebacke toke feldes detyng ordayned next mornyng shulde put feldes catell adueture done deuysad next mornyng helyot playsac copany came rochell barryers company gadered togyder catell coude fynde made driuen countre hadde nat driuen catell space leage frenchman ii c speares came sodaynly wyng whome englisshmen nat ware came speares poyntes amonge first metynge ther many cast ye erthe helyot playsac sayde fote fote euery man let v nat natflye let horse go day shall haue horse ynowe agaynst v shall haue small losse horse ther helyot copany lighted fote put theself good order likewise dyd frechmen feared sleyng horse ther sore batayle longe endured fought hand hand ther done many feates armes many one taken rescued agayne finally poicteuyns xayntons vytorie enemyes discofyted nighe slayne taken fewe scaped pray catell agayne rescued helyote playsac taken prisoner led rochell anone adueture lordes fra ce wente castell boutuyll whiche anone taken easy ynough wynne ther none within make defence thus castell botuyll frenche wher countre great ioye helyot plaisac prisoner long space p howe frenche kynges messanger let vyage scotlade debate began bytwene frenche king therle flaunders cap ccc xliii season retourned englande sir thomas tryuet sir wyllyam helman dyuers knightes squyers suche ben spaine ayde kyng nauers warr cae kyng englade chertsay two vncles duke lancastre therle cambridge knightes ioyfully receyued kyng lord ther desyred shewe tidynges fro party shewed knewe bothe spayne nauer peace made bytwene two kyng spayne nauer howe kynge nauer maryed charles eldest sonne kyng heryes doughter fro poynt poynt treatie bytwene duke lancastre therle cambridge right pe syfe wordes thought named selfe heyres spayne ryght wyues demauded howe long syth kyng henry bastarde dyed whider spanyerdes crowned john sone knightes answered sayd dethe kyng henry cocona yon johan sonne nat present tyme come backe nauer sir haraude preset ye may knowe euery thyng please thau ye heralde called forthe demaunded duke lancastre mater answered sayde sir request shall ye meane season whyle noble papylone abyding acomplysshment treatie whiche made goode wylles leaues taryed behynde styll kynge na er wher good chere bothe hym men went hym fro pa pylone saynt domynikes agaynst whose comyng kynge henry issued towne goodly copany met v great signe loue peace ther kyng nauer gretly honoured hym gaue night honest supper supper tidynges brought howe great wylde boore lodged laundes therby ordayned next mornyng shulde go hunt boore dyde whiche huntyng ther bothe kyng great co pany boore taken night returned agayne great loue saynt domynikes next day kyng henry departed went peter ferando day agaynst men fell sicke dyed kyng nauer comyng warde hym se hym way herde worde dethe wherof right sorie retourned agayne toke leaue hym wente castell knowe tidynges ther kyng henry dyed whitsonday anone xxv day july day saynt james saynt christofer johan castell eldest sonne crowned king cathedrall churche cytie burgus whiche coronacion baron prelate spaygne galyce cordowayne euyll sware holy e gelyst take mentayne hym kyng made day two hudred tenne newe knyghtes many great gyft gyuen next mornynge great company noble men went abbey ladyes withoute burgus called urches ther herde masse dyned dyner ther great iustyng vycont roqbertyn arragon price returned agayne burgus feest endured xv dayes duke la castre enquered kyng portingale desyred ther ornat sir heraud desyred nat wolde nat come thyder said answered messanger came hym howe wolde nat go coronacyon sone bastarde faithe duke lancastre rightwell counsayled say wordes hym great thanke therfore trust mater shall nat longe abyde case brother wyll demaude herytage wherof calleth hym selfe kynge v nowe lefte talkynge called drinke pnowe lette v leaue speke mater retourne busynes frauce king charles frauce reygned ryght sage subtell well shewed longe lyued tho kept hym selfe preuy chambre takyng pleasure sporte yet conquered agayne predecessours lost felde armed swerdes hades wherfore greatly comended bicause knewe well yt kyng robert scotlande realme ther made warr mortall hate theglysshmen two realmes coude neuer loue togyder therfore entent norisshe loue bytwene fraunce scotlande frenche kynge thought send knight secretary counsayle kynge robert scotlande scottes speke aduyse countrey knowe might make good warre englande scotlande yuan wale lyfe tyme enfourmed hym scotland place ye worlde wherby englade might moost anoyed purpose freche kyng many ymaginacio last ordayned knight sage man called sir peter lorde bournesell said sir ye shall go message scotlande recomende kyng baron shewe h howe realme redy pleasur haue treatie frendes therby season come may sende people thyder wherby maye haue entre england way lyke maner predecessor haue tyme past goyng thyder comyng homewarde wyll ye kepe suche estat messager comissary ng shulde cost charge sir knyght shall pleaseth taryed nat long wha redy departed fro parys dyde moche iourneys came scluse flauders taryed abode wynde passage xv dayes wynde cotrary meane season held great estate well stuffed vessell golde syluer hall largely though bene lytell duke better mynstrels played seruyce dayly bare werde garnisshed golde syluer men payed well euery thynge great estate yt knight kepte house stretes dy er towne great marueyle bayly towne behelde well officer ther vnder erle flaunders coude kepe lenger secret wherin dyde yuell sent worde therof erle lay bruges duke bretayne cosyn whan therle flaunders studyed lytell mater helpe duke bretayne ordayned knight shulde e brought hym baylye retourned agayne sluse came vncurtesly french knyght set hande hym rested hym erle flauders name wherof knight gret marueyle sayd ye bayly meaneth messanger comyssary frenche kyng sir bayly beleue well howbeit ye must nedes go speke therle flaunders hath comaunded bring hym knight coude make scuse company brought bruges therle whan erles chambre therle duke stode togyder leanyng wynd garden warde knyght kneled downe sayd sir beholde prisoner whiche worde erle sore displeased sayd dispyte yre sayest rybaude thou art prisoner bycause haue sent speke thy maisters seruant may ryght well come speke thou hast nat well acquyted thy selfe sythe thou hast ben long scluse knowynge nere yet nat come one se speke thou haddest disdayne sir knight sauynge displeasure duke bretayne toke wordes sayd among bourders iaglers palys paris kynges chambre ye ette realme ye lyst play kynge pleasure well oryuell ye wyll yourselfe ther price ye blode ryall ye among haue one brought hym hate displeasur kyng herde one trust wyll many suche people taken gybettes wyll full knight sa styll knee ryght sore abasshed wordes hearyng suche wordes right harde howbeit sawe well better hym kepe tonge speke gaue answere wordes whan sawe tyme toke leaue therle lordes departed presence noble men erle made hym way made hym drinke returned agayne sluse logyng shall shewe f though purueyance redy aparelled wynd wyll haue sayled scotlade yet durst nat put himselfe danger see shewed spyed theglysshmen lay scluse howe kept voiage likely taken caryed england bicause doutes brake vyage returned parys kyng ye may well knowe lorde burnesell tolde lesse frenche kyng done erle flaunders also nedefull tell excuse kyng marueyle retonrnyng season dyuers knyght kynges chambre specially sir john guystels heynalt cosyn therle fla nbers great displeasure wordes knight therle fladers finally coude kepe toge leger sayd nat suffre word thus spoken dere lorde sir knight ye wyll say dyde ye say let vyage quarell appele felde gage lorde bournesell nothyng abasshed answere sayd sir johan say thus howe thus taken bayly sluse brought erle flauders ye haue herde sayd lykewise dyde duke bretayne ye wyll say contrary wyll receyue gauge wyll say lorde guystelles wordes kynge nat content sayde let v go hen wyll wordes de ted went cha r onely cham right lorde bu well frely spoken agaynst wordes john guystels sayd smylyng hath holden fote well wolde nat xx frankes done fortuned sir johan guystels chaberlayn kyng yuell beloued courte wery therof thought nat abyde da gers toke leaue kyng departed fro court went brabant duke uy elant brabat receyued toyfully french kyng sore displeased therle fladers bicause thought yuers realme yt letted lorde sell age scotland al eloe styll hym duke bretayne cosyn greatly kynges displeasur kyng p rceyued well howe erle flaunders nothyng kynges grace anone kyng wrote sharpe letis cosyn erle flauders thretnyng hym bycause susteyned hym duke bretayn reputed enemy erle wrote agayne kyng excusing himselfe aswell might aueyled nothynge kyng sent agayne sharper letter shewyng playnly yt without wolde putte duke bretayne copany wolde surely displease wha therle flauders sawe kyng pursued cause suche effect toke aduyse hym selfe thought wolde shewe h thretnynges good townes specially gaut knowe wolde say mater sent bruges pre cortrey departed duke bretayne copany went gaunt lodged posterne wher oyfully receyued burgess lo ed well haue among han people good townes set come therle assembled togyder pleace made shewed john de la faucell entency lett reed freche kyng sent two monethes whan letter erle spake sayd ye sir good townes flauders helpe god haue ben lorde longe season haue kepte gouerned good peace power ye haue nat sene co trary haue entertayned gret prosperyte lyke maner lorde ought kepe menne subgettes great displeasur ought men frenche kyng thus hateth wyll hate bycause sustayne company duke bretayne cosyn germayne nowe nat welbeloued fraunce dare nat well trust men owne countre bycause fyue six baron loueth nat wherfore king wolde shulde driue hym countre whiche shulde strong thyng say nat nay dyde confort cosyn outher townes castelles agaynst realme fraunce kynge myght haue good cause complayne nat nat wyll therfore haue assembled togyder shewynge parels may happe fall therfore wolde knowe myndes whyder shall abyde styll nat answered one voyce sir let hym abyde styll shulde nat sir man lyuyng wyll make warre ye shall fynde redy lande flauders ii c men warr serue wordes greatly reioysed therle sayd sir thanke ended parlyament therle well cotent men gaue euery man leaue dete peace whan erle sawe tyme retourned bruges duke bretayne thus mater haged traunce erle great grace wt people countre peace prosperite abode nat long great trybulacion ye shall hystorie p howe duke bretayne deted flauders howe therle saynt poule taken prisoner howe maryed englande warres fell bretayne cap ccc xliiii ye may well knowe howe frenche kyng knowlege mater howe erle answered loued hym nat one whyt better howe must let passe coud nat haue tyme sayd howe therle flauders moost proudest prince knewe man myght haue sene well maner kyng erle lorde kyng wolde moost gladly haue brought somwhat reason whan sawe withsayd displeased tha erle flaunders kynges writyng great displeasur bycause kepyng duke bretayne yet nat withstanding kept styll long pleased tary made kepe goodlye estate finally duke bretayne cou sayle drawe englande tooke leaue therle cosyn went grauellyng thyder came erle salisbury fyue c speares thousand archer dout freche garysons brought calais wherof sir hugh caurell capitayne receyued right ioyously whan duke taryed ther fyue dayes wynde wyll toke see erle salisbury company aryued douer came yong kyng richard receyued great ioye dyde also duke lancastre therles cambridge buckynghame great lordes englande ye haue herde sir ualeran lusenburge yong erle saynt poule taken prisoner bytwene arde calays englande kyng pleasure kyng edwarde lyfe tyme bought hym lord gomegines first prisoner bycause made iourney whan taken squier armes coutre guerles yonge erle saynt poule abode longe prisoner englande delyuered trouthe kyng offred hym oft tymes exchage captall bu z whyle lyued frenche kyng cousell frauce wolde wyse therof wherof kyng englande great disdayne thus ater cotynued long space yong erle styll prisoner englande fayre castell wynsore curtesse kepar might go sport haukyng bytwene wynsore westm beleued faythe season princesse mother kyng richarde lay wynsore doughter lady maude fayrest lady englade therle saynt poule yong lady true amour togyder eche somtyme met togyder daunsynge carollyng tyll last spyed lady discouered mother howe loued faithfully yong erle saynt poule mary age spoken bytwene therle saynt poule lady maude holande therle set rausome pay sixscore frakes whan maryed lady maude rebated threscore thousande threscore thousande pay whan couynant maryage made bitwene therle lady kyng englande suffred erle repasse see fetche raunsome onely promyse retourne agayne within yere erle came fraunce se frendes kyng therle flaunders duke brabant cosyns fraunce yere made harde informacyon agaynst erle saynt poule layed charge shulde delyuer thenglysshmen strong castell bohaygne frenche kyng caused rested kept suretie kynge shewed howe therle saynt poule wolde haue made yuell treatie hym realme erle wyse coude excused also cause kepte prison castell mon heynaulte lorde chanon robersarte lorde uertayne sir james dusarte gerarde dabyes length mater came none effecte coulde nothynge proued agaynst delyuered yong erle retourned agayne englande acquyte promyse wedded lady dyde moche payed threscore thousande frankes passed agayne see entred nat frauce bycause kyng loued nat coutesse wyfe went lay castell han ryuer ewre whiche castell lorde mor ane hadde wedded suster lent hym lye laye longe kynge charles fraunce lyued erle coude neuer gette loue p nowe lette v leaue speke mater retourne busynesse fraunce season bretayne kept close agaynst frenche kynge agaynst duke howe beit good townes bretayn helde selfe close duke name many great marueyle toke hym lorde also dyuers knightes squyers bretayne acorde also ther alyed coutesse ponthyeute mother chyldren bretayne sir bertram clesqui constable frauce ye lorde clysson lorde de lauall vycont rohan lorde rochfort helde countre warre puyssance came dayly oute frauce pontorson saynt malo theyle lay great nombre men armes fraunce normandy auuergne burgoyne dyde moche hurt coutre duke bretayne englande knowledge euery thynge howe duke aniou anger dayly distroyed countre also knowlege howe ye good townes kept selfe close name certayne knyghtes squyers parte wherof conde good thanke yet nat withstadyng durst nat well trust ieoparde retourne bretayne trust men alwayes douted treason also kyng englande duke lancastre wolde nat counsayle retourne rencounters made normady howe geffray tetenoyre amergot marcell copanyes toke dyuers castelles auuergne cap ccc xlv normandy burgoyne ther garyson sir wylliam burdes chefe capiten ther company ye lytell seneschall ewe sir wylliam marsell sir braq braquemont lorde torcy sir percyuall danyuall begue dury sir laucelot lorry dyuers knyght squiers frenche partie night day ymagined howe myght domage chierbourg wherof sir john harlston capitayne garyson chierbourg issued oft tymes whan pleased whan lyst might ryde couerte man preuy issuynge bycause great wodes nere wherin made suche way might ryde normandy pleasure without danger frenchemen fortuned season french menne rode abrode chierbourge lykewise none knowynge aduenture mette eche place called pastoy ode like valyant knightes desyringe fight eche lighted fote except sir launcelotte lorry sat styll horse speare hande shelde necke ther demaunded course iustyng ladyes sake ther ther rightwell vnderstode ther knightes squiers englysshe parte amour aswell vnderstode sir johan coplande right hardy knight went hym ran togyder rudely encoutred eche thenglysshe knight gaue sir laucelot suche stroke shelde speare pearsed throughout body wou ded dethe great domage hardy knight yong ioly ryght amorous dethe sore complayned bothe ther el englisshemen frenchemen encountred togyder fought hande hade ther good knightes frenche parte sir wylliam burdes lytell seneshall ewe sir willm marsell sir braque braquemont dyuers fought ryght valyantly also englyshmen ther fought day valiantly sir johan harlston sir philypart picourde sir john burle sir john coplande dyuers finally good fightyng englisshmen vyctorie enemyes knightes squyers taken slayne specially squyer heynalt called wylliam beauleu sir wyllm burdes taken prisouers brought chierbourge founde sir dlyuer clesquy taken prisoner thus fell iorney enformed p also auuergne limosyn fell dayly feates armes marueylous enterprices specially ye castell mount uetadore auuergne whiche one strongest castels ye cou tre whiche betrayed solde breton moost oruell knight called geffray tetenoyre shall shewe howe erle tentadore mountpeser right auncyent knyght good peasable man ocupyed nomore warr kepte hym styll house erle hadde squyer hym called pouns de boy serued hym longe smale lyueng profyte seruyce sawe well shulde haue lytell profyte mayster ther ran thought vngracyous deuise went made secrete treatie wt geffray tetenoyre limosyn howe wolde delyuer hym castell uentadore vi frankes made couenant yt shulde none yuell maister therle uentadore putte hym castell courtesse maner good hym done breton englisshmen entred dyde maner hurt erle none men kept nothyng sauyng vitayle artyllary whereof ther great ple tie erle wyfe chyldren went mountpeser besyde agueperse auuergne geffray tetenoyre company kept uetador wherby dyde moche hurt countre toke dyuers stronge castels auuergne rouergue limosin quercy gynalda bygore agenoise tetnoyre ther capitayns dyde many feates armes amergot marcell squyer lymosyn thenglisshe parte toke strong castell casuryell auuergne bysshopryke cleremont ouerrant countre pleasure company ther capitayns diuers castels bourge calart bourge angloys bourge champayne raymonde de fore gascoyne peter bearne bearnoys amergot marcell rode forthe season xiii hym aduenture toke ye way aloys warde saynt floure whiche fayre castell bysshoprike cleremont knewe well yt place nat kept porter onely whan cae nere ye castell amergot sawe porter sat blocke wtout gate breton coude shote well cro bowe sayd sir wyll ye slee porter ye first shote ye amergot requyre breton shot quarell strake porter right heed porter whan felte hym selfe stryken entred gate thinkyng haue closed coude nat thentryng fell downe deed amergot copany made hast entre entred wycket founde porter deed wyfe hym right sore afrayed dyde hurt demaunded wher capitayne answered said cleremot assured lyfe wolde delyuer key castell mayster towre dyde put asmoche stuffe coude cary away went saynt flour cytie leage then cytie sore abasshed wha knewe alois englisshe coutre anone amergotte marcell toke strong castell balon stelth scalyng whan wtin capitayne slepe great towre towre nat likely force towre castell might agayne amergot aduysed subteltie handes father mother capitayne brought towre made semblant stryke heed without wolde yelde vp towre good folkes douted dethe sayde sonne towre sir haue pyte v wept pyteously squier thought yt father mother shuld neuer dye sake yelded vp towre put hym castell thus balone englysshe whiche dyde moche trouble countre suche thought yuell resorted thyder el causuryell two leages fro lymoges el carlat aloys uentadore suche place whan garisons assembled toguyder nombre sixe hundred speares ranne ouer coutre coutie dolphyn auuergue trouthe lorde cupyer great enemey lykewise lord forterell bastarde forterell brother squyer burbonoyse called gordones clene feate armes day toke amergot marcell prisoner raunsomed hym v thousande frankes thus dedes armes fortuned lymosyn countre p cisme made church maner howe breton made warr roc quene naples put landes pope handes cap ccc xlvi hath ben long sithe spake holy church wyll retourne therto mater requyreth ye haue well herde howe exortacyon romayns cardynalles raygned apease people rome greatly moued agaynst made pope archbysshoprike bare called bartylmewe de angle hereceyued papalyte called urbayne sire opyned grace vsage thentencyon dyuers cardynals whan myght se better hour tyme wolde agayn returne election bycause pope nat profytable also church said f sshe man malincolyous wha sawe hym selfe prosperyte puyssance papalyte dyuers kynges christned ioyned wrote dyde put vnder obeysaunce wherof wared proude worked heed wolde haue taken away fro ye cardynals dyuers rightes olde customes whiche greatly displeased spake togyder ymagined howe nat well worthy gouerne worlde wherfore purposed another pope sage discrete churche shulde well gouerned purpose cardynals putte payne specially chosen pope thus somer wer purpose entended make newe pope durst nat shewe myndes generally bycause romayns tyme vacacyon courte dyuers cardynals departed fro rome went rome sport dyuers place pleasure pope urbane went another cytie called tyeulle ther lay long season vacacion tyme whiche myght nat longe endure rome ther many clerkes sudrie place worlde abydinge grace whiche promysed dyuers cardynals one acorde assembled togyder voyces rested sir robert genesue somtyme sonne erle genesue first promocyon bysshoppe therouene bysshoppe cambrey called cardynall genesue election parte cardynals called clement season marchesse rome right valyant knight bretayne called syluester bude vnder hym two thousande breton yere right well borne hymselfe agaynst florentynes vnder pope gregorie cursed bycause rebellyon meanes syluester bude come mercy pope clement cardynals parte secretly sent company ca entred castell angle better constrayne romayns pope urbayne durst nat departe fro tyeulle suche cardynals acorde doute breton great nombre chosen men warre whan romayns saw selfe danger sent soudyers almayns lumbardes daylye scrimysshed breton clemet opyned grace clerk suche wolde haue signifyed name ouer worlde whan frenche kynge raygned certifyed therof great marueyle sent brother noble prelate realme rectour maister doctour vnyuersyte parys knowe whiche electyon outher first seconde shulde holde vnto mater nat shortely determyned dyuers clerkes varyed finally prelate fraunce enclyned clemet dyde kynges bretherne moost te vnyuersite parys kynge enformed great clerkes realme obeyed pope clement helde true pope made specyall commaundement oute realme euery manne shulde take repute clement pope euery man shulde obey god erthe king spaygne opinyon erle sauoy duke myllayne quene naples beleuyng thus freche kyng vpon clement coloured greatlye dedes realme fraunce reputed chiefe fountayne beleue christen faythe bycause noble church prelasies therin lyued charles boesme kyng almaygne emperour rome praigne behayne aduertised mater wherof gret marueyle though empyre almayne except bysshoprike trect beleued faithe courage entencyon pope urbane wolde nat spekyng yet fayned dissymuled lyfe tyme wolde answere whan spoken mater courtesly baron prelate realme contente howe church empyre obeyed pope urbayne scotlande helde clement erle loyes flaunders greatly agaynst clement tie brabant heynalt lege wolde euer abyde urbanyst sayeng howe dyde pope great wronge erle beleued renomed party wher conuersant church lordes helde opynion heynaulte church lorde called albert abode neutre obeyed one ye wherfore bysshoppe cambrey reygned tyme called john lost heynalt reuenewes temporalty season ther sent fraunce heynalt flaunders brabat fro pope clement cardynall poicters right wyse valyant sage clerke ensygne preche people first election ther shewed howe constraynt chase first archebysshop bare pope frenche kyng bretherne prelate fraunce mekely receyued hym gladly entended busynesse wordes semed spake trouthe gaue faythe whan ben season fraunce went heynalt also ioyously receyued lykewise brabant bothe duke duchesse dyd ther nothyng el thought retournyng haue gone lege toke counsell wente nat thyder retourned tourney thought haue gone flauders haue spoken therle shewed hym nothyng ther bycause ye erle helde wolde holde urbayne lyue dye cardynall departed fro tourney went ualencennes cambrey lay longe space hope alwayes good tidynges thus christen realmes variacyon church great dysference bycause pope urbayne greatter partie speke moost profytable reuenewes playne obeysance clement clement consent cardynals sent auygnon make redy paleys hym entent go thyder assoone might went cyte foudes opyned grace thyder drewe maner clerkes suche wolde take grace kept vyllages many soudyers made great warre rome bourage saynt peter traueyled day night dyuers assautes scrimysshes also castell angle without rome dyd moche trouble romayns rome enforsed selfe soudyers almayns puyssance rome assembled toguyder day coquered bourage saynt peter breton drewe castell angle howe handled force armes gaue vp lyues saued tha breton deted drewe foundes countre romayns bete downe castel angle brent bourage faynt peter whan sir syluestre bude countre herde howe men hadde lost bourage saynt peter castell angle right sore displeased studyed howe reuenged ye romayns shewed spyes howe day romayns noblest men cytie rome shulde assemble togyder counsayle capitolle assoone knewe assembled toguyder certayne nombre rode forth couert wayes secretly came rome euenynge entred gate naples wha breton within toke ye streyght way capitoll came thyder cousell rome issued chabre breton couched speares ranne among slewe bete downe great nombre moost notablest cite ther slayne sixe baneretes two hudred riche son great nombre hurt whan breton hadde done enterprise withdrewe agaynst night began late yt nat pursued night sodayne fray wyst nat take hede frendes sore hurte passed nyght great dystresse sorowe herte soo buryed deed dressedde hurte mornyng romayns aduysed selfe great crueltie poore clerk rome faute slewe hurt mo thre hundred specially breton fell handes ther mercy thus went mater rome reason state pope dayly bought dere suche without faute meane season clemet cardynals lay thus foundes quene napoles came thyder se hym dyde put selfe vnder obeysaunce pope clement quene ben longe purpose put realme cecyll wherof lady countie prouence whiche depedeth realme hades pope pleasur gyue highe prince realme fraunce beyng suche puyssace kepe agaynst suche hated deedly discended realme hugry whan quene naples come foundes humbled selfe lowly pope clement cofessed hym discouered secretes hert sayd holy father holde dyuers noble herytages realme naples realme cecyll puyll calabre countie prouence trouthe kyng loyes cecyll duke puyll calabre father whyle lyued knowledged landes holde churche dethe bedde toke hande sayd fayre doughter ye enherytour many che countre sure many great lord wyll seke haue maryage bycause fayre herytage ye haue therfore doughter wolde ye shulde vse cousayle mary yourselfe highe prince may puyssant kepe maynteyne herytage rest peace fortune ye haue none heyres delyuer landes handes pope beyng lyue kyng robert father hour dethe gaue lyke charge therfore fayre dought charge discharge promysed faithe presence chabre shulde acomplysshe last desyre holy father discease consent noble cecyll naples maryed andrewe hungry brother kyng loyes hungry whome hadde yssue dyed yonge ayes prouence discease maryed agayne prince tarent called charles doughter kyng hungry displeasure hadde andrewe brother first husbande went made warre agaynst husbande charles tarent toke fro puyll calabre toke batayle ledde prison hungry dyed yet agayne acorde noble cecyll maryed agayne kynge james maiogres sent frauce sir loys nauer haue maryed doughter dyed way fell kyng husbande went conquere herytage maiogres whiche kyng arragon taken fro byforce dysheryted caused father dye prison departed fro sayd sir lady haue puyssance rychesse sufficyent maynteyne estate acordynge desyre howe beit preached moche shewed many fayre reason desyring recouer herytage fayne consent hym take pleasure departynge desyred hym haue gone kyng charles fraunce haue shewed busynesse haue ordred hymselfe counsayle howe dyde nat hurt wet prince wale promysed haue ayded greatter trust price wale frenche kyng nere lynage meane season whyle vyage wrote frenche kyng sent great messangers desyring send noble man blode mary doughter entent myne herytag shulde nat without heyre kyng sent cosyn sir robert artoyse wedded doughter vyage kyng husbande made dyed agayne maryed sir othe broswyche bycause sir charles de la paixe sawe sir othe shulde haue myne herytage long lyued made v warre toke v castell locufe whan see highe feared wolde haue ouerflowen v whiche tyme afrayed yelded v foure sir charles de la paixe lyues saued helde v prisone husbande doughter husbande happed sonne doughter dyed treatie husbande delyuered puylle calabre might come hym also entedeth come heryrage naples cecyll prouence seketh alyance wyll take way ryght churche sone deed may therfore holy father wyll acquyte agaynst god acquyte soules predecessours put handes herytages ought haue cecyll naples punyll calabre prouence gyue pleasure gyue whome soeuer pleaseth suche may obteygne agaynst aduersary sir charles de la paix pope clement receyued ioyfully wordes toke gyft great reuerence sayde fayre doughter naples shall ordeyn yor herytage shall haue heryter owne blode noble puyssant resyst agaynst wyll offer wronge wordes gyftes publyke instrumentes autentyke made entent mater shulde abyde ferme stable tyme come playne knowledge shulde therof p howe pope clement wente auygnon gyftes gaue duke aniowe howe sir siluester budde company beheded countre flaunders aduersyte cap ccc xlvii whan quene naples sir othe brouswiche done thynges wherfore come foundes pope toke leaue departed went naples nat longe pope clement imagyned hym self abyde long party rome nothyng protytable sawe well howe romayns pope urbayne trauayled greatly gette loue neapolitan sir charles de la paix therfore douted lest passage wayes shuld closed agaynst shulde nat get auygnon whan wolde princypall specyall cause inclyned hym go auignon thentent gyue duke aniou ryghtes quene naples gyuen vnto hym forsayd seignoris wherof instrumentes past sealed ordayned secretely sagely besynesse toke thesee cardynals galies vessel come arragone hadde wynde wether wyll arryued withoute domage merseyll wherof countre ryght gladde then went auignon sent worde comynge french kyng brethern ryght gladde comyng duke aniou lay cytie tholouse went se pope comynge pope gaue hym gyftes wene naples gyuen hym duke aniou alweys desyred high seignories great honour receyued gyftes great magnyficence hym heyres euer sayd pope shorte tyme might wolde go strong march wolde able resyst wolde wronge quene naples duke taryed pope xv dayes returned tholouse duchesse wyfe pope clement delyuered men warre sir bernard de la sale flouremont make warre agaynst enemyes season march thuskayne italy valyant knight englyssh called sir john haconde dyde done many noble feate armes issued realme frauce whan peace made bitwene two kynges bretigny besyde charter tyme poore knyght thought retourne agayne englande owne countre thought coude wynne nothynge whan sawe men warre shulde auoyde realme fraunce ordynauce treaty peace made selfe capitayne certayne nombre copanyons called late comer went burgoyne assembled great nombre suche rutters englisshe gascons breton almayns companyons dyuers nacyons haconde one cheyfe briquet carnell whome batayle brumauxe made helped gette pount le spiryte bernard forge whan warred haryed cou trey agaynst pope cardynals ther entreated went marque moutferrant kept warre lordes myllayne marque brought beyonde mountaynes delyuered lx thousande frankes wherof hacond parte x thousande company whan acheued warr marque dyuers returned fraunce sir bertram clesquy lorde de la marche lorde beauiewe marshall fraunce sir andrewe dandrehen brought spayne agaynst kyng dampeter kyng henry parte sir johan hacond co pany abode styll italy pope urbayne fyfte longe lyued hym warres myllayne lyke wyse pepe gregorie raygned sir johan hacond lorde coucy fayre iourney agaynst therle uertues sayd trouth lorde coucy ben ouerthrowen erle uertues lombardes haconde hadde nat ben came ayde fyue hundred bycawse lorde coucy wedded kynge englandes doughter none cause sir johan haconde knyght right hardy great experyence well renomed march italy dyd many great feates armes romayns urbayne called selfe pope aduysed selfe whan clement departed fro march rome sende make mayster gouernour warre sent retayned company acquyted selfe right valiantly daye helpe romayns disconfyted syluester bude great company breton slayn taken syluester bude brought prisoner rome great daunger lese heed say trouth ben better hym haue beheeded day brought rome otherwyse honoure frendes afterwarde pope clement caused hym lese heed cytie mascon another squier breton called wyllm boyleau suspect treason bycause issued romayns prison coulde nat knowen treaty meanes came auygnon taken takynge culpable cardynall amyens hated sythe made warre rome pope bycause feldes daye companyes toke sayd cardynalles somers wherin great quatyte vessell plate golde syluer departed among companyes coulde nat payed wage wherfore cardynall toke deade great displeasure couertly accused treason whan come auygnon treason layd theym howe falsly betrayed pope thervpon sent mascon beheeded bothe thus mater went tyme coutreis sir bertram clesquy sore displeased dethe syluester bude cosyn pope clement cardinal lyued long shuld well haue knowen th bene ryght sore displesant hym p nowe lette v leaue speke mater let v entre speke warres flau ders whiche began season whiche harde cruell wherby moche people slayne exyled countre tourned suche case sayde hundred yere shulde nat recouered agayne shall shewe meane occasyons vnhappy warres began whan tribulacyons began first flau ders countre welthy riche meruayle men good townes kept suche estate wonder tell therof warres began first pride enuy good townes flau ders one another gaut agaynst bruges bruges agaynst gaunt townes one agaynst another suche resort warr coude ryse among without therle flaunders lorde dyd consent therto feared beloued none durste displease also erle ryght sage subtell kept vnder warr yuell wyll people wolde wyse suffre warre ryse among well thought ymaginacyons whan differece shulde ryse bytwene people shulde febler lesse set neighbour also kept vnder warre another cause howbeit thende driuen vse consydred gret distructyon shulde fall therby bothe body goodes alwayes lyued great prosperyte peace moche pleasure christen prince warr began light cause sydent iustely consyder speke f good wytte sage aduyse lorde neded nat haue hadde maner warre shall saye redeth hereth redde warke deuyll ye knowe el ye haue herde say wyse sage howe deuyll subtelly tiseth night day make warre sey peace seketh lytell lytell may come vngracyous entent fortuned dayes fladers ye may clerelye knowe se treatie order mater foloweth p princypall rote cause warre bytwene erle flau ders flemynges howe whyte hattes set vp johan lyon cap ccc xlviii season whyle duke loys flauders greattest prosperyte ther gaunt burgesse called johan lyon sage man cruell hardy subtell great enterpriser colde pacient ynough warkes john lyon great erle apered erle entysed slee man gaut whoehe displeased erles comaundement couertly johan lyon made matter fell hym slewe hym whiche burgesse sore complayned therfore john lyon went dwelt doway iii yere helde great estate porte therles cost slaughter day johan lyon lost euer gaunt banysshed towne foure yere erle flaunders dyd moch made peace returne gayne towne gaunt haue agayne great fraunches euer wherof dyuers gaunt flaunders hadde great meruayle ther ryght sore abasshed done besyde thentent shulde recouer agayne losse mayntayne astate erle made chefe ruler shyppes maryners nauy office well worthe yere thousand frakes yet deale trewely thus johan lyon great erle none lyke season anotherlygnage gaunte called mahewes ther seuyn bretherne chiefe maryners amonge seuyn bretherne one theym called gylbert mahewe ryght sage manne moche subtell bretherne gylbert mahue great enuy couertly johan lyon bycause sawe great erle studyed night day howe myght put fauoure erle dyuers tymes mynde haue slayne brethern durst nat feare erle long studyed ymagined mater laste founde way chiefe cause hated shall shewe better come found acyon mater aunciently ther towne dan great mortall warr bytwene two maryners lynages one called peter guillon john barde gilbert mahewe bretherne come one lynage johan lyon couert hate long norysshed bitwene two paties beit spake ete dranke gyder lynage gylbart mahewe made mater johan lyon dyd moche gylbert mahewe without stroke gyuyng aduysed subtell dede erle flau ders wolde tyme lye gaunt gylbert mahewe came aquaynted hymselfe one nere aboute erle day sayd sir lord therle wolde might haue euery yere great profyte shyppes nauy wherof hath nowe nothyng whiche profyte straungers maryners shulde paye johan lyon chiefe ruler wyll truely acquyte selfe getylman sayd wolde shewe erle dyde erle lykewyse dyuers lordes lyghtly enclyned naturally harken profytte nat regardyng ende may fall therby may haue rich couytousnes disceyueth answerd sayd let gylbert come wyll wyll say cae gylbert spake erle shewynge dyuers reason resonable erle thought answered sayd thynke well done yt shulde thus john lyon sent knewe nothyng mater presence gylbert mahewe erle shewed mater sayd john ye woll may haue great profyte mater johan lyon true man sawe well nat thynge resonable done howe durst nat say contrary sayd sir thyng ye demaunde gylbert mahewe hathe brought forthe nat alone wyll hard mater maryners johan therle ye wyll acquyte truely mater wyll done sir shall therin best power soo departed gylbert mahewe intended brynge fauoure johan lyon erle entended none thyng make hym lese offyce came sixe bretherne sayd sir tyme nowe ye socoure ayde mayntayne mater good trendes brethern shulde helpe eche haue dryue mater shall discomfyt john lyon without stroke strykyng shall bryng great displeasure erle nowe great fauoure whatsoeuer say ne parlyament kepe youre owne openyons erle requyre suche thynge debate well matter wyll say styll mayntayne yt johan lyon wyll truely acquyte selfe ordynace may done knowe moche lorde erle mater come nat entent johan lyon shall lease fauoure offyce gyue offyce whan one haue ye shall agre therto puyssant ynough towne rule resydue none wyll say agaynst v tha shall john lyon shalbe ouerthrowen thus shall reuenged wtout stroke gyuyng brethern accorded parlyament came maryners redy johan lyon gylbert mahewe shewed erles pleasure newe statute wold reyse nauy lys lescaulte whiche thynge semed ryght hard cotrary olde custome chiefe spake agaynste gylbert mahewes bretherne johan lyon chiefe ruler ryght ioyouse wolde true power mayntayne olde auncyent fraunchesses lyberties went sayde bene contrary euyll entent towardes johan lyon reported erle answere maryners sayd sir thynge nat well done great hurt may come therby sir please let mater rest olde auncyent estate make newe thyng amonge answere pleased nothyng erle sawe mater might brought vp reysed shulde well worth yerely seuen thousande florens helde peace tyme thought soo pursewed fayre word treaty maryners alwayes johan lyon founde ryght obstynate case gylbert mahewe came erle counsayll sayd howe john lyon aquyted slackely mater ye erle wolde gyue offyce johan lyon hathe wolde handell maryners yt erle flaunders shulde heretably haue ye sayd profyte erle sawe nat clere couytusnes good blynded owne counsayll put john lyon offyce gaue gylbert mahewe wha gylbert mahewe sawe howe offyce within lytell space turned syxe bretherne purpose made erle haue entent profyt wherfore neuer better beloued ye parte maryners howebeit behoued suffer seuen brethern great puyssant ayde erle thus subtell meanes gylbert mahewe get elfe fauoure erle gaue many gyftes ioweles nere erle wherby loues also gaue many great presentes erle whiche blynded meanes gate loue gyftes presentes gylbert mahewe reysed ye maryners wherof many nat well content howbeit durst speke worde contrary iohan lyon meanes purchase gylbert mahewe erls fauoure loue kept howse lyued owne endured suffered paciently euer done gylbert mahewe chefe ruler shippes couertly euer hated johan lyon toke away thirde fourth te profyte shulde haue shyppes john lyon suffered spake worde sagely dissymuled toke gre euer done sayd ther tyme styll tyme speke gylbert mahewe one brother called stenuart subtell man aduysed well maner johan lyon sayd brethern prophesyeng came passe sir john lyon suffereth nowe hangeth downe heed dothe policy feare wyll length make v lower tha nowe highe cousayle one thyng whyle thus erles fauour letre v slee hym shall soone e take charge shall parelles bretherne wolde wyse consent therto sayd wyse shulde hurt sayeng howe man ought nat slayne without sentence judge thus matter contynued certayne space tyll deuyll neuer slepeth awaked bruges digge ryuer lys haue easment course water erle well accorded sent great nombre pioners men armes assyste tyme past wold haue done gaunt puyssance brake purpose tydynges came gaunt howe bruges byggynge turne course ryuer lys ye shulde greatly preiudyse gaunte many folkes towne began murmure specyally maryners touched nere wherfore sayd bruges shuld nat suffred dygge haue course theryuer wherby towne shulde distroyed said preuely god help nowe johan lyon hadd ben styll gouernoure shulde nat haue thus bruges wolde nat haue hardy attempt farre agaynst v johan lyon well aduertysed matter began lytell wake sayd selfe haue slept season shall apere small occasyon shall wake shall set suche trymble bitwene towne erle shall coste perauenture hundred thousande mennes lyues tidynges dyggers encreased ther woman come fro pilgrymage lady bolayne wery sate downe market place ther dyuers men demauded fro whens came answered fro bolayne haue sene way ye greatest myschefe euer came towne gaunte mo fyue hundred pioners night day worketh ryuer lys nat let wyll shortly torne course water woman wordes well harde vnderstande dyuers place ye towne towne began mone sayd dede ought nat suffred consented vnto dyuers went johan lyon demaunded counsayll howe shuld vse selfe mater whan johan lyon sawe selfe sought desyred haue good wylles loue greatly reioysed howe made semblant ioye thought nat yet tyme tyll mater better certayned sore desyred wolde speke declare thought wha spake sayd sir ye wyll aduenture remedy mater behoue towne gaunte ye renewe olde auncyent custome somtime vsed towne ye brynge vp agayne whyte hattes maye haue chiefe ruler whome maye drawe ruled wordes gladly herde sayd one voyce wyll haue lette v reyse vp whyte hattes made whyte hattes gyuen delyuered loued better haue warre tha peace nothynge lese chase johan lyon cheife gouernoure whyte hattes whiche offyce toke ryght gladly entent reuenged enemyes bryng discorde bytwene townes bruges gaunt erle lord ordeyned shuld go agaynst dyggers bruges johan lyon souerayne capytayne hym two hundred companyes suche rather haue hadde warre peace wha gylbert mahewe brethern sawe maner whyte hattes nat ioyfull therof stenuart sayde bretherne sayde howe johan lyon shulde discomfytte v length ben better ye beleued haue lette haue slayne rather shuld te nowe likely whyte hattes hath brought vp nay nay quod gylbert whan haue one spoken lorde erle warrant shall layde downe agayne lette alone entprise agaynst pyoners bruges profyte oure towne el say trouthe towne lost iohan lyon company white harte departed fro gaunt wyll slee pyoners suche kepte tidynges came pyoners howe gauntoyes came great puissaunce wherfore douted lese lafte warke went backe agayne bruges neuer hardy dyg agayne whan john lyon company sawe nothyng retourned agayne gaunt johan lyon lafte nat offyce whyte hattes went dayly vp downe towne john lyon kepte styll estate wolde say secretely holde well content eate drinke make mery nat afrayed thyng ye dispende suche shall paye tyme come scotte wyll nat gyue nowe one peny p howe exhortacion john lyon gautoyes sent certayne notable burgess towne gau te erle flaunders co seruacyon priuyleg olde fraunchesses desyre therle made laye downe whyte hattes cap ccc xlix weke johan lyon thus donse haue met pioners bruges ther came dyuers frau chesse gaunt coplayne hadde th rule lawe sayd sir erclo besyde v whiche within fraunchesse gaunt one burgess erles prison haue desyred therles baylye delyuer hym hath playnely answered wyll nat delyuer hym whiche playnely agaynst priuylege towne gaunt therby lytell lytell priuyleges shall broken whiche time past haue ben noble highly pray sed besyde well kept maynteyned none durst breke theym moost noblest knight flaunders helde hym selfe well reputed burgesse gaunte lawe aunswered sayde howe wolde write bayly desyringe hym burgesse may delyuered trewely offyce extendeth nat farre kepe oure burgesse erles prisone wrote bayly forthe delyueraunce burgesse beynge prisone erclo baylye answered sayd nedeth wordes maryner say quod baylye name roger dauterne gaunt thoughe richer man ten tymes shall neuer go prison without lorde erle commaunde haue puyssance arest haue powere delyuer wordes roger dauterne reported gaut wherwith sore displeased sayd howe answered right proudely answeres insydentes well pyoners bruges wolde haue dygged agaynst herytage profyte gaunt suche semblable dedes wherby fraunchesses gau te shulde haue bene hurte began ryn throughe towne abrode countrey vnhappy rybaudes called whyte hattes entent feared renomed behoueth lynage folysshe outragyous maynteyne sustayne peasable tidynges maryner burgesse gaunt beyng erles prison erclo whome bayly wolde nat delyuer spredde abrode towne graunte dyuers folkes beganne murmure saye howe nat suffred syttynge styll beynge softe maynteyninge fraunchesse might lese whiche hath ben noble johan lyon entended alwayes one thynge sette trouble towne gaunt agaynst erle lorde suche wyse shulde nat apease agayne moch sorowe great dommage wherfore nothynge displeased aduentures wolde alwayes one fallen threttie put forthe wordes couertlye dyde throughe towne sayeng howe whan soeuer offyces bought towne iurysdictyons priuyleges canne nat well kepte erle receyueth nowe yerely thre four thousande frankes beyonde olde vsage customes wherby marchauntes maryners greatly complayneth theym leaueth resorte towne gaunt bothe ualencennes doway lyle bethayne tourney maye thynge wherby towne may lost lytell lytell daylye frau chess takenne away auncyent priuyleges yet manne dare speke agaynst gilbert mahewe ruler meane craft gylbertes te herde owne eares dayly suche wordes knew well howe dyde ryse johan lyon durst nat remedy johan lyon hadde sowed throughout towne whyte hattes gyuen suche co panyons hardy outragyous wyse none durst assayle also johan lyon wente neuer alone whan soeuer went house euer hym two thre hundred whyte hattes neuer wente abrode towne without hadde bene great cause greatlye desyred haue counsayle insydentes fell within gaunt without conseruynge fraunchesse towne lyberties therof whan cou sayle wold shewe generall word people spake soo fayre rethorike great craft suche herde hym gretlye reioysed langage wolde say one voyce true sayd great prudence johan lyon sayd people sir say nat shulde hurt nysshe parte lorde erles enherytace though wolde canna reason iustyce wolde nat suffre v shulde seke crafte incydent wherby shulde displeasur indygnacion ought alwayes loue fauoure prince lorde lorde therle flauders good lorde right hye prince feared renomed alwayes hath kepte v peace prosperyte whiche thynges ought knowe suffre largely boude therto traueyled v displeased v made warre hared v haue put payne haue goodes howe soeuer present tyme yuell cousayled enformed agaynst v agaynst fraunchesses good towne gaunte bruges fauoure apereth well pioners bruges beyng came take away herytage take away ryuer wherby oure towne gaunt shulde distroyed also wolde haue made castell donse agaynst v bring v danger make v weaker knowe well howe bruges promysed hym tyme paste tenne xii thousande frankes yerely haue theym easment ryuer lys therfore counsayle lette good towne gaunt sende erle sadde discrete personage shewe hym boldely mater well touchynge burgesse gaunt prisone erclo whiche baylye wyll nat delyuer mater wherwith good towne gaunte nat content also matter herde lette shewed hym also counsayle thynke dull deed nede may lyst make resystence agaynst aunswere one herde good towne gaunte maye take aduyse punysshe trespasse shall founde culpable agaynst whanne johan lyon hadde shewed wordes people market place euery man sayd saythe well went home owne howses woordes thus spoken john lyon gylbert mahewe nat presente douted whyte hattes brother stenuart alwayes prophesyed tyme come whan retourned brother sayd haue alwayes sayde say yet agayne howe john lyon shall distroy v cursed hour ye nat let alone slayne shulde neuer haue ouercoe v coe soo lyghtly vp nowe nat puyssance dare nat anoy greue hym nowe greatter towne erle gylbert answered sayde holde thy pea fole whan wyll ye erles puyssance whyte hattes shall cast downe suche bereth nowe shall haue nede hatte charged certayne burgess go ambassade erle saddest men towne gylbert mahewe one chosen go caused johan lyon entent spake thynge contrary erles displeasure yt erle shulde displeased well departed founde erle male dyde somoche fynally accorded well erle graunted requestes touchyng prisoner erclo promysynge kepe mayntayne fraunchesses gaunt without brekyng defended bruges shulde nat hardy dygge herytage gaunt better please gaunt comaunded bruges fyll agayne dyke made amy ably departed fro rle returned gaunt recorded done therle lorde howe woll mayntayne fraunchesses without brekynge howe beit desyred fayrnesse laye downe whyte hattes tho wordes erles seruauntes brought agayne prisoner fro erclo yelded agayne waye restablysshing wherof great ioy answere makynge johan lyon x xii moste notable company whan herde erle requyred yt whyte hattes shulde layd downe euery man held peace johan lyon spake sayd ye good people present ye know haue sene late howe ye whyte hattes hath better kept fraunchesses outher reed blacke hattes haue done colour ye sure say sayd assoone ye whyte hattes layde downe ordynaunce erle wolde haue wyll nat gyue frauchesses nat thre pen whiche word blynded ye people euery man departed then parte went home house sayde let alone john lyon say trouthe haue nat sene hym good profitable towne matter stode styll case johan lyon feare lyfe imagined anone fell thought gylbert mahewe hadde wrought mater agaynste hym company last voiage erle bycause therle made amyable answere thought fynde remedy ordayned made secretely capitayns whyte hattes senteners muquateners sayd s say vnto copany day nyght purueyed redy assoone knowe mouyng lette come better slewe slayne sythe haue begon farre ordayned done euery man redy p howe whyte hattes slewe bayly market place good howses maryners distroyed great brullynge gaunt cap ccc l nat long baily gaunt roger dauterne came gaunt two hundred horse ordayned erle gylbert mahewe bretherne deuysed bayly two hudred men brought hym came downe longe stretes erles baner hande whan came market place rested set baner anone drue gylbert mahewe brethern ruler meane craft ordayned men armes shulde go johan lyon house take chiefe ruler whyte hattes v sire company moost culpable haue ben brought castell gaut ther haue heedes stryken johan lyon thought lesse well aduysed dede spyes watchesse euery corner towne knewe well comynge bayly knewe certayne dyd whyte hattes iourney set drewe togyder tymes came johan lyon howse redy strete abydyng came x xx euer came fell aray strete whan assembled nombre four hundred john lyon departed fyrse lyon sayd let v go traytours wyll betray ye good towne gaunt thought well swete wordes gylbert mahewe brought v last daye fro erle disceyte distructyon v shall make repent company went great pase alweys nombre encreased dyuers fell company hadde whyte hattes ryed treason treason came strayt lane market place ayly representyng erles parson assoone gylbert mahewe bretherne sawe johan lyon come place fledde way fast myght dyd except suche ye bayly brought soone john lyon come place capytayne whyte hattes agreat company hym came ye bayly wordespekyng toke cast erthe slewe erles baner cast downe grounde torne peace touched man bayly came aboute john lyon whan erles men sawe bayly deed erles baner torne greatly abasshed toke horse voyded towne ye maye well knowe gylbert mahewe bretherne enemyes john lyon wer nat well assured selfe owne house wherfore departed fast myght voyded ye towne one nother left behynde wyf chyldren herytages went assoone myght erle shewed hym howe bayly slayne whiche tydynges therle sore displeased gode cause done hym great dispyte sayde sware howe shulde greatly recompe sed euer returned agayn gaunt shuld neuer haue peace ensample townes gylbert mahewe bretherne abode styll erle johan lyon whyte hattes perseuered styll outrage roger dauterne thus slayne departed none apered whyte hattes reuenged johan lyon entented ouer ryn maryners bicause loued nat sayd sir fore false traytours mahewes wolde day distroy fraunchesse towne gaunt ran alonge stretes house foude body departed sought lodgynges strete strete chambre chambre whan johan lyon harde howe none coulde founde sore displeased gaue good company house pilled robbed thynge left though ben false traytours ye towne whan done returned owne howses officerr erles nother within ye towne without one sayd done euyll tyme durst nat whyte hattes multiplyed none durste displease went stretes great companyes none wolde mete sayd dyuers place towne without also howe supportacyon officer riche men gain whiche lykely durst begyn suche ryot enterprise sle erles bayly holdynge erles baner handes doyng office without bolsterer co forter dede multyplyed strong ye towne cared maner ayde self ther none durst displease withsay thyng wolde bayly roger dauterne taken ye freers buryed churche whan thynge thus fortuned dyuers good men sage ryche towne gaunt rightsory began speke murmure sayd ech howe done great outrage sleyng thus therles bayly doyng offyce right lorde therle must nede displeased likelyhode neuer haue rest pea howe vngracyous people brought towne parell dystroyed withoute god fynde remedy howe wordes none durst fynde meanes correct amende done rage johan de la faucell gaut man right sage greatly renomed sawe howe mater gone farre sawe howe outragiously slayne bayly thought mater shulde yuell length entent shulde nat suspect erle towne departed fro towne priuely might wente fayre house without gaunt abode fayned hym selfe sicke none spake hym owne men dayly herde tidynges gaunt left behynde hym moost parte goodes wyfe chyldren styll towne thus dissymuled season p howe xii burgess gaut sent erle flauders meane season white hattes pylled brente fayre castell andrehen cap ccc li gode men gaut riche notable marchantes hadde within towne wyues chyldren marchandyse heritage bothe within towne without lyue right honourably without dangere nat well ease hertes se besynesse gaunt knewe well hadde sore forfayted agaynst erle lorde thought well howe wolde dyde therin remedy shulde fayne make amendes trespass nowe rels another tyme put selfe erles mercy wherfore thought better tymes rather late toke counsayle togyder se howe might vse selfe profyte honoure bothe towne counsayle called johan lyon capitayns whyte hattes elles durst nat haue done many word dyue purpose deuysed finally one acorde counsayle shulde chose xii notable person sende erle requyringe hym mercy dethe bayly whome slayne meanes might haue peace wolde gladde myght comprised peace nothynge el demaunded erles parte burgess chosen shulde go viage alwayes johan lyon sayd good fauour lorde prince howbeit wolde co trary thought sayde selfe mater nat yet wolde bring vnto burgess departed wet male besyde bruges ye erle first comyng made cruell ell countenance agaynst gaunt xii burgess made pytefull complaynt erle requyred hym holdyng vp handes wolde haue mercy theym excused selfe dethe bayly lawe notable person ye towne sayd right dere sir acorde v maye bringe peace v towne gaunt whiche loueth well sir promyse tyme come rage shalbe greatly recompensed hath done caused done ye shall content shall townes ensample xii burgess made humble requestes erle somwhat refrayned yre meanes yt made hym acorded ordayned ycles peace therle pardoned yuell wyll agaynst gaunt amendes shulde made came newe tidynges shall shewe iohan lyon gaunt thought cotrary sayde cousayle howe good fauoure lorde knewe certaynte hadde moche trespassed agaynst erle peace shulde neuer made peace graunted thought shulde dissymulacyon shulde cost lyfe laste therfore thought hadde rather shamed parell aduenture lyfe euery day shall shewe dyde whyle counsayle towne therle peace assebled togyder whyte hattes craftes gaunte suche accorde came purpose subtell meanes tha sayd sir ye know well haue displeased lorde therle flaunders howe haue sent vnto hym knowe nat yet reporte wyll bring outher peace warr ye erle nat easy apeased hath suche wyll rather styre hym displeasure quyetnesse gylbert mahewe brethern ther hudred hyndrers ye peace rather one forderer therfore good toke good hede selfe haue warre knowe shall ayde v howe shall get v loue among ruler suche crafte suche craft cause morowe come ye feldes many men ye get ther shall se howe able euery howe furnysshed better aduysed tyme late shall coste v nothynge yet shall feared drad answered sayd well deuysed let done next day went bruges gate went feldes fayre playne without gaunt called andre hen johan lyon behelde gladly x thousade well armed sayd beholde goodly company whan ben certayne space hadde gone aboute sayd sir counsayle let v go erles place syth nere shewed howe maketh great prouisyon may fortune great preiudice oure towne gaunt agreed therto came andrehen whiche without great kepynge defence entred sought house none vngracious company pylled robbed euer founde within moche ryches erle made warderobe johan lyon made semblant thoughe bene sore displeased howe beit nat apered wha departed fro castell come agayne felde loked behynde sawe ye place fyre fyre xx place castell nat people puyssance quenche also great wyll johan lyon though great mernayle sayd howe cometh yonder fyre lordes howse answered sayd nat tell aduenture well nat tha amend better brent aduenture rather v also thynges considered perylous neighbour v lorde might ther set suche garyson might haue done v great domage shulde haue warr answered sayd ye say trouthe retourned ye towne gaunt dyde day done yuell inough moche cost mo two hundred thousande mennes lyues one princypall thyng wherwith erle moost displeased therfore johan lyon dyd bycause wolde haue peace knewe well soeuer treatie made likely lese life castell andrehen hadde cost erle flauders bylding therof two hudred thousande frankes loued best ye house good men gaunt de yred haue peace aduenture right sorou ull howbeit coude nat de durst make wordes therof whyte hattes sayde howe castell brent vnhappe none otherwyse tidynges came erle flau ders atte male brought worde sayd sir knowe trouthe fayre house andrehen whiche hath cost moch ye well loued brent brent erle ye surely sir quod howe erle sir vnhappe sayde erle dede shall neuer haue peace flaunders long johan lyon lyueth hath couertly made sette fyre shall derely bought made burgess gaunte come hym sayde ye yuell vnhappy people ye pray swerde hade haue grauted yor requestes ye wyll selfe folkes haue bret house whiche loued among thynke nat haue done dyspyte ynoughe sleynge bayly doynge offyce teare baner treade vnder fete knowe trouth sauynge myne honoure haue gyuen saue conduct shulde cause need stryken departe presence say yonder vnhappy people gaunte shall neuer haue peace treatie tyll haue theym whome wyll stryke heedes none shall haue mercy burgess fullsor e tidyng bycause natte culpable dede began excuse none excuse wolde serue erle sore displeased wolde nat themspeke made auoyde presence toke horse returne gaunt shewed howe well spedde great peace apoyntment castell nat bene brent also shewed howe erle gretly manasshed send worde shulde neuer haue peace hym tyll many towne pleasur lyst haue good people ye towne sawe well howe mater went yuell howe whyte hattes caused none hardy durst speke p therle flauders went fro male lyle housholde sente lordes knyghtes flauders suche helde hym haue counsayle howe myght besynesses howe reuenged gaunte hadde done many dispyghtes gentylmen flaunders sware hym good true ought lorde without meane wherfore therle greatly reioysed sent men castelles teremont rypemont aloe gaures andwarpe made great prouision p deth johan lyon capitaynes gauntoyse made good townes flau ders alyed selfe gaunt cap c c c lii iohn lyon greatly retoysed wha saw therle flaunders wolde take peace gaunte seyng coude coe peace hadde put ye towne gaunt forewarde warre ye must nedes whether wolde nat contynue warre sayd openly sir ye may se vnderstande howe lorde erle flauders prouydeth selfe agaynst v wyll haue peace v therfore cousayle best greued opressed let v knowe townes flaunders wyll take parte dare answere theym towne grautmont wyll nat agaynst v take parte lykewyse wyll courtray within fraunchesse courtraye oure chambre beholde bruges great prowde mater fyrst moued good ye go strong fayrenesse rygour may bring acorde sayd good processe tyme suche shulde go iourney made redy departed fro gawnte aboute ix thousande men great caryages laye fyrst nyght donse next mornyng aproched bruges came within lytell leage therof araynged themselfe feldes set selfe ordre batayll caryag behynde johan lyon ordayned certayne ruler dyuers craftes shulde go bruges knowe entetes went bruges founde gate fast shytte well kept shewed thentent wherfore come thyder kepers sayd wolde go gladly shewe myndes ye borough maisters chefe ruler towne dyd ruler answerd go shewe theym howe wyll go cousayle take aduyse mater returned shewed answere whan johan lyon harde aunswere sayd auaunce forewarde bruges byde tyll take counsayll shall nat entre moche payne better assayle take counsayll wherby shall sodely taken purpose kept gauntoyse came barryers dyke bruges johan lyon formast mounted blacke courser incontynent alyghted toke axe hande whan ye kept barryers nat stronge inough make defence sawe gauntoyse aproche redy gyue assaut went stretes towne market place cryed euer went holde gautoyse redy gate go youre defence arreredy assaute ye towne assembled gyder haue gone cousayll ryght sore abasshed leysar speke gyder ordayn besynesse part comynaltie wolde gate shulde haue ben opened behoued el ben yuell ryche men borough maysters ruler towne went gate gauntoys redy apperelled make assaut borough maysters ruler bruges gouernynge towne day opened wycket speke johan lyon opened ye barryers gate treat long spake togyder good frendes entred toguyder johan lyon rode borough mayster whiche became hym well hardye couragyous men clene armed folowed hym fayre sight se entre good ordre came market place araynged men streres johan lyon helde hande whyte warderere bytwene gaunt bruges ther made alyance sworn alwayes good frendes togyder gaunt myght somou lede whyder euer wolde anone ye gauntoyse arnynged market place john lyon certayne capitayns went vp hall ther made crye good towne gaunt comaundynge euery man shulde drawe lodgyng fayre easely vnarme noyse mouyng payne needes man dislodge normake noyse lodging wherby strife shuld ryse payne also man take thynge fro another without paye therfore incontynent sayd payne crye one made another crye made towne bruges euery man shulde mekely agreable receyue gauntoyse house mynyster vytaylles acordynge comen price towne pryce shulde nat reysed maner thyng noyse made debate moued thynges kept payne heed euery man went house soo thus ryght amyably gaunt bruges two dayes alyed bounde selfe eche surely oblygacyous writen sealed thirde day gaunt departed went towne dan gate set open comyng curtesly receyued taryed two dayes sodenly seknesse toke john lyon wherwith swelled nyght ye syknes toke hym supped great reuyll damosel towne wherfore sayde ther poysoned wherof knowe nothyng wyll nat speke far therin knowe well next day fell sycke nyght layed lytter caried ardenburg coude go farther dyed wherof gaunte ryght sorie sore dismayed dethe johan lyon enemyes ryght gladde fredes sory brought gaunt bycause dethe hoost returned whan tidyng dethe came gaunt people right sory well beloued except suche erles parte clergy came agaynste brought towne great solempnyte though bene erle flaunders buryed right honorably churche saynt nycholas obsequy done yet deth johan lyon alyances promyses made bytwene gaunt bruges brake nat good hostage towne wherfore helde dethe john lyon erle ryght glad gylbert mahewe bretherne ruler meane craftes gaunt suche erles parte erle made sorer prouysion dyde castelles townes sent towne ipre great nombre knightes squiers ye lyberties lysle doway sayd howe wolde haue reason gaunt anone dethe johan lyon gaunte aduysed howe coulde nat longe without capitayns ordayned aldarmen craftes synkquateners porte four acordyng aduyse moost hardy cruell person fyrst chase johan drunaur johan boulle rase de harsell peter du boy people sware mayntayne obey capitayns payne heedes dyde contrary capitayns sware agayne kepe maynteyne honour fraunchesses towne foure capytayns styrred gaunt go ypre franke haue obeysance el slee capitayns people departed fro gaunt good array xii thousande clene armed came courtrey courtay suffred entre towne without daunger parteyned frauches gaunt toke ease two dayes ye thirde day departed went ipre toke two hudred men armes crosbowes courtray toke way touront whan came rested tooke counsayle aduysed send thyder thre foure thousand men capitayne whyte hattes treat ipre great batayle folowe confort nede requyred ordayned done came ypre whan iperre specyally meane craftes knewe comynge gaunt armed toke market place fyue thousade ther ryche men towne puyssance knyghtes garyson set erle went ordynatly gate touront gauntoyse without desirynge haue fre entre knyghtes squire redy raynged gate shewed good defence dede gautoyse neuer entred without great domage auncyent craftes towne agaynst knyghtes wyll wolde gauntoyse shulde entre men towne went market place came gate whiche knyghtes kept sayd sir open gate let fredes neyghbours gaunt entre wyll shall entre towne knightes answered yt shulde nat entre said howe stablisshed erle flaunders kepe towne whiche wolde best power sayng howe lay nat puissance gaunt entre somoche wordes multiplyed suche wise bytwene gentylmen towne last cryed sle beate downe shall nat maysters oure towne sore scrimysshe long endured stretes knyghtes nat sufficyent force resyst agaynste towne fyue knyghtes slayne wherof two sir robert sir thomas hundrey great domage great daunger sir henry dautoynge moche payne ryche men towne saued hym dyuers gate sette open gauntoise entred lordes maisters towne without domage hurt whan ben two dayes taken surety towne sware lyke maner forme bruges courtray grantmont danne done delyuered hostage entent departed right courtesly went agayne gaunt p howe gauntoyse besieged towne warpe gret assaut made teremond erle lay cap ccc liii erle flaunders lay lyle vnderstod howe ipre turned gauntoyse parte meanes meane craftes towne sore displeased aswell dethe knightes yt slayne towne cause howe sayd well haue lost ipre tyme shall recouer agayne nother tyme myschiefe shall stryke many heedes shall beware therby abasshed erle specyally entended prouyde ye towne warpe prouision good men armes supposed gauntoyse wolde come thyder lay siege therto thought shuld great domage lordes towne therby shulde haue good ryuer lescault flete therofat pleasure therfore therle set thyder great nombre knightes squiers flaunders heynalt arthoyse maysters whyder yt towne wolde nat capitayns gaunt returned fro ipre towne agayn herde howe therle made great prouision ye towne warpe determyned goo lay siege therto nat departe then tyll slayn within beaten downe gate walles therof made comaundement gaunt euery man shulde redy apparelled go thyder capytayns wolde lede whiche crye non wolde disobey charged tentes pauilyons prouisions departed fro gaunt came loged warpe fayre medowes long ryuer lescalte thre dayes came bruges lodged syde next owne towne brought great prouisyons came ipre great array propringe messanes also grantmont flemynges warpe nombre mo hundred thousande hadde made brydges shyppes nayled toguyder ryuer lescalte go one another erle flaunders beynge lysle purpose go teremont hadde sent almayne guerles brabant great nombre knyght squiers specially ye duke mon cosyn came serue great nombre knyghtes squiers went teremont founde erle flauders come thyder fronters haynalt brabant ryght ioyfull comynge thus siege contynewed andwarpe many great assautes made flemynges scrimysshes nyghe euery daye manlye dedes armes doone barryers men slayne hurt flemynges aduentured selfe often tymes folisshely often tymes pride slayne hurte within towne ther viii c speares knyghtes squiers right valiant men also vii baros lorde guystels lorde uillers lorde hullut lorde scornayse flemynges heno wayes lorde danghen lorde dantoing lorde bosnell ye lorde taux lorde gomegines thre bretherne sir johan sir dannyell sir josse lord stanburge lorde carue sir gerrarde marquelles lorde cohen sir rafe monteney sir henry hamede sir johan gres many knightes hundred fyue made good watche hadde trust towne caused haue wyfes chyldren mynsters church burgess kepe owne house feare gonne fyre flemynges cast often tymes ye towne haue set towne fyre wherfore within caused howses couered erthe entent fyre shulde hurte siege thus beynge andewarpe flemynges capitayns knowledge howe lorde erle teremonde duke mon cosyn hym gauntoyse sent sixe thousand men go thyder gyue assaut teremonde rase harsell capitayne came tuesdaye nyght lytell village leage fro teremond ryuer ture lodged flemynges ordayned certayne nombre shyppes come downe ryuer assayle water well lande anone mydnyght armed made redy fyght incotynent whan one come teremonde thought take lordes bedd went forthe men countre aduertysed howe flemynges goynge night teremond went gaue warnyng wachemen teremonde saynge sir take good hede certayne gauntoyse lyeth nyght nat farre hen nat tell purpose doo kepars gate went shewed knyght wach called sir terrey bredero holandre whan knewe therof toke better hede made surer watche gaue warnyng therof castell euery house ye towne wher knightes lodged poynt daye lyght flemynges came bothe lande water reoy assaute whan towne castell sawe aproche began sownde trompettes awake company moost parte knyghtes squiers redy armed erle lay slept ye castell whan vnderstode flemynges come thyder gyue hym assaut rose armed issued castell baner tyme ther sir gossuyn urle great bayly flauders lorde gau sir gerard raseghen sir philyp mamynes dyuers sir philyp rungi burgonyon lordes drewe vnder exles baner went assaut whiche begone ryght ferse cruell flemynges brought shyppes gonne crosbowes shote great quarelles whosoeuer hyt dyed stroke agaynst shot quarelles within great nombre pauesses also erle within many good crosbowes whiche dyde moche hurt amonge flemynges duke mon baner hym company lorde bredero sir josse sir terey de la ware sir wyuant chuperoyse dyuers euery man doynge ryght well deuoyre nother gate within sir robert dalle sir johan uillayne lord wyndscot sir robert marshall sore assaute bothe lande water flemynges many hurte ther bothe partes howe beit moost flemynges aduentured selfe somtyme folisshly assaut endured without cease fro ye mornyng erly tyll none slayn knyght erles parte called sir hugh de reny burgonyon great domage sore complayned hardynesse slayne without rase harsell dyde beare hym selfe right valiantly wordes aswell dedes whiche greatly encoraged gauntoyse p assautes made andwarpe peace made bytwene flemynges therle fladers mean duke burgoyne great wyt aduyse cap ccc liiii afternoon assawte seased rase harsell sawe well traueyled vayne howe ye within teremond many good valyantmen armes wherby parceyued nat easy get also men began wery sowned retrayte withdrewe long ryuer fayre easly toke agayne nauy ye next day went agayne andwarpe siege lay long styll flemynges lordes feldes ryuer prouisyon coude entre towne without great parell syde towarde haynaulte howe somtyme vitaylers wolde aduenture selfe wynnyng whan hoost slepe put selfe within bailes andwarpe towne amonge assautes made one endured hole day made dyuers newe knyghtes within towne heynalt flauders artoyse newe knyghtes came fought gauntoyse barryers good scrimysshe many feate armes doone dyuers flemynges slayne hurte made lytell therof lytell feared dethe wherby aduentured selfe largely whan slayne hurte folowed wolde pull backe sette themselfe shewed hardy visage thus contynued assaut whiche endured tyll nere nyght andwarpe retourned towne closed gate barryers buryed dedde dressed busely hurte flemynges lay thus siege andwarpe trusted sege coquere towne within famyne assaut knewe well siege lay rounde nothynge coude come towne nother lande water longe lyeng coulde nat greue moche bycause owne countrey nere owne house wherfore lacked nothyng nedefull hadde vitayle euery thynge largely better price shuld haue outher bruges gaunt erle flaunders sawe well ye towne great nombre knyghtes squiers douted greatly one poynt lest long sege shulde famysshed within wherfore wolde gladly ther ben honourable treaty dede warre thus men greued greatly neuer good wyll also lady hys mother margarete countesse arthoyse ryght sory se blamed erle therfore toke moche payne appease countesse lay cytie arras wrote mater duke burgoyne whome herytage flau ders shulde fall dethe therle reason lady margaret wyfe duke well informed mater euery daye harde tidynges went arras counsayle hym sir guy de la tremoyll sir john uyen admyrall fra ce sir guy pountayllers dyuers countesse artoyse glad se shewed duke right sagely warr bytwene erle flaunders sonne countrey sayeng howe greatly displeased ought displease euery reasonable man howe great nombre honourable men within towne andwarpe great ell desiryng therfore duke goddessake fynde remedy duke answered sayd bounde howe wolde beste power anone duke deted fro arras went tournay receyued great ioy turnay desyred greatly haue peace bycause marchandise fro ryuer lescalt whiche closed fro duke burgoyne sent abbot saynt marten hoost andwarpe knowe capitayns gaunte wolde fall treaty abbot brought worde gayne duke burgoyn loue wolde co tent ye duke gaue salue conduct bridge roone flemynges likewyse treatie endured fro mornynge tyll nyght duke came bridge rone speke flemynges duke retourned tournay erle company went hym treatye
