endured xv dayes harde fynde meanes peace bycause flemynges wolde haue andwarpe entent haue beaten downe duke counsayle wolde wyse consent therto flemynges great fierse orgulous set nothyng peace reputed andwarpe tho within maner yelded coulde nat go without daunger duke burgoyne sawe flemynges proude harde fall treatie hadde great maruayle ment therby day gate saue conduct marshall go towne speke knyghtes marshall burgoyne went andwarpe founde company good poynt howe beit great nede thyng yet spake valiantly sayd say v duke burgoyne lette make none euyll bargayn feare v thanked god good poynt haue feare enemyes aunswere pleased greatlye duke burgoyne styll bridge rone howe lefte nat pursute peace say trouthe bruges ipre frake wery sore anoyed sawe well wynter aproched shewed myndes counsayle sayd howe duke burgoyne hadde taken great laboure come hyder v hath offered v thynges shulde pardoned erle lorde returne gaunt abyde ther v neuer make semblant thyng past thinges ought enclyne v peace truely ought knowe lorde nat take fro herytage wordes apeased moche gaunte accorded sayeng daye duke burgoyne gaue dyuer gaunt bruges ipre courtray ye day concluded siege shuld reysed good peace flauders bytwene erle men erle pardon euery thynge nothynge reserue without excepcy dissymulacion erle come dwell gaunt within yere gaunt make agayne castell dandrehen whiche gauntoyse hadde brente noyse ranne sure confyrmacyon thynges johan prunaux shuld go courtray duke charter pea shuld made sealed clause duke retourned tournay johan prunaux johan boulle abode styll hoost next day peace cryed bytwene bothe partyes siege brake vp euery man went home owne howses erle gaue lycence sowdyers departe thanked stranger good seruyce done went lysle ther finysshe vp alyances brother burgoyne hadde made countreys ther sayd pea two vysages sayng howe wolde rebell agayn shortely erle parte agreed peace entent haue danger noble knightes squiers andwarpe great parell iohan prunaux departynge fro siege andwarpe went tournay ther duke burgoyn mad good made parfyt ordynauce peace duke burgoyne ye erle flaunders sealed therto johan prunaux returned gaunt shewed howe spedde duke burgoyne sore desyred gaunt shewed swete wordes cotent kepe peace ferme stable bytwene warpe reysyng sege gauntoyse wolde haue two gate towne beaten downe walles bytwene bycause shulde alwayes open entre atte pleasure whan erle flaunders ben certayne space lysle duke burgoyne gone fraunce went towne bruges taryed longe season shewed couertlye great displeasure certayn burgess towne made none prouisyon among displeasure bycause hadde soone forsaken turned seruyce gaunt burgess excused trouthe nothyng faute faut meane craftes wolde nedes alyed gaunt whan john lyon cae thyder ye erle passed displeasure aswell myght howe thought neuer lesse p nowe lette v leaue speke hym flaunders let v retourne busyness bretayne p howe duke bretayne returned englande bretayne request men wyll englisshe men maryage yonge kynge englande cap ccc lv ye haue herde duke bretayne englande kynge richarde vncles made hym right good chere lande warre great trouble frenche kyng sent thyder costable great nombre men armes pot toyson mount saynt mychaell made warre countre cyties good townes bretayne wherfore countre greatlye desyred presence duke lorde sent hym dyuers messangers letter durst nat trust tyll prelate barones bretayne good townes murmured therat sayde haue sent duke letter dyuers tymes alwayes excuseth selfe name god quod hath good cause sende hym simply well sytting sent hym knight ii dyscrete sage whome myght truste shewe playnly state countre purpose well alowed holden two valyant knightes chosen go englande sir geffray quaresmell sir eustace housey desyre request prelat baron aparelled selfe go englande toke shippyng cone wynde wyll arryued hampton fro then rode tyll cae london wher found duke bretayne duchesse sir robert canoll receyued gret chere ioye knyghtes shewed duke lorde state disposycion countre howe people desyreth haue coe home delyuered letter credence fro baron prelate good townes bretayne duke beleued well knyght letter also great ioye said howe wolde shewe mater kyng vncles dyde whan kyng englande vncles enformed mater howe countre bretayne prelate baron good townes except claquy clisson rohen lauall rochefort sente lorde ye duke desyring hym returne owne countre kyng vncles sayde sir best ye go youre owne countre syth ye thus desyred mayntayne yourselfe amonge noble men sir shall sende men warre suche conforte shalbe able kepe fro ters agaynst enemyes leaue duchesse wyfe behynd mother brethern go make warr agaynst ennemyes wordes duke greatly reioysed made hym redye shortely ordayned departynge hampton toke leaue ye kynge vncles ladye princesse duchesse wyfe departyng made great alyance kyng englande sware hym faythe shortely conforted englysshmen wolde alwayes abyde best power tourne countre englysshe kyng promysed shulde euer fynde englysshemen redy helpe hym soeuer maner wolde desyre departed englande sir robert canoll two knyghtes come thyder hym one hundred men armes two hundred archer toke shippyng hampton sayled porte guerrande toke lande rode uennes receyued great ioye countrey gladde whan knewe come home duke refresshed hym fyue dayes thanne went nauntes thyder came se hym barownes prelate knightes squyers ladyes damoselles offryng hym seruyce putte selfe vnder obeysance complayning greatlye frenchman frenche co stable lay reynes dyde moche hurte countrey duke apeased sayd frendes shall haue shortly comforte englande without ayde englande nat well defende countrey agaynst frenchman bygge v seynge nat one owne countrey whan ayde kynge england shall sende v one come haue done v wronge shall quyte agayne wordes right ioyfull tho duke bretayns parte p season saynt andrues tyde ther dyed sir charles boesme kyng almayne emperour rome whyle lyueng dyde moche golde syluer great alyances hadde electours emperour sware sealed hym disceasse make sonne emperour ayde hym kepe siege ays abyde agaynst men wolde deny hym whan deed charles sonne emperoure wrote hym selfe kyng almayne boesme kynge romayns season ther great cousaile englande amonge kynges vncles prelate baron realme mary yonge kyng richarde england thenglysshmen wolde gladly haue hym ben maryed heynalt loue good lady quene philyp wyfe kyng edwarde thirde good gracyous lady realme large honorable come heynaulte duke aubert doughters mary duke lancastre wolde haue hadde kyng nephewe haue hadde eldest doughter lady blanche lacastre wyfe realme wolde wyse consent therto two reason first bycause lady cosyn germayne whiche nere blode mary toguyder cause wolde kynge shulde marry withoute realme haue therby alyaunce spekyng doughter kynge boesme almayne emperour rome aduyse euery man agreed go almayne treate mariage set right sage valyant knight ben kynges mayster nere counsayle alwayes prince wale kynges father called sir symonde burle ordayned hym thynges necessarie iourney departed arryued calayes grauellyng bruselles founde duke uyncelant brabant duke aubert erle bloyes erle saynt poule sir wylliam lye great nobre knightes heynalt brabant place ther great feest iustynge kepte therfore lord assebled duke brabant duchesse kyng englandes sake receyued knyght ryght honourably whan knewe cause wherfore went almayne right gladde therof sayde shulde goodlye maryage bytwene kynge englande nephue knyghtes departyng sent letter hym kyng almayne shewynge hym howe hadde great desyre affectyon maryage shulde take good effecte knyght departed fro bruselles went louuayne go colayne p howe englysshmen sent bretayne tourmented see howe gautoise desyred haue erle flaunders lorde coe dwell towne gaunt cap ccc lvi season ordayned englande kyng counsaile two hundred men armes foure hundred archer shulde goo bretayne chyefe capitayne iourney shulde sir johan aru dell hym shulde go sir hugh caurell sir thomas banystre sir thomas tryuet sir water pole sir johan bourchyer ye lorde ferres lorde basset knyghtes drewe hampton whan hadde wynde entred shyppes departed first day wynde reasonable good agaynst night wynde tourned contrary whyder wolde nat driuen cost cornwall wynde sore streynable coulde caste none ancre also durst nat mornyng wynde brought yrisshe see rage tempest thre shyppes brast wente wrake wherin sir johan arundell sir thomas banystre sir hughe caurell hundred men armes whiche hundred fourscore drowned sir johan arundell capitayne perysshed whiche great domage sir hugh caurell neuer lyfe soo nyghe dethe euer shyppe excepte hym selfe seuyn maryners drowned seuyn maryners saued toke holde table mastes strength wynde brought sandes howebeit hadde dronke waterr ynoughe wherof ryght sicke yuell ease daunger escaped sir thomas tryuet sir johan bourchyer lorde ferres lorde basset dyuers sore tourmented gret parell tempest ceased retourned agayne hampton went backe agayne kynge vncles recounted aduentures wenyng sir hughe caurell ben drowned nat gone sicke london thus brake vp iorney wherby duke bretayne coude haue comforte englysshemen whiche ryght contraryous hym season wynter folowyng frechmen made hym right sore warre breton sir olyuer clysson company toke ye towne dynat bretayne reason vessel barge towne pylled robbed kept agaynst duke long season p nowe lette v retourne busynesse flaunders whan ye peace agreed bitwene erle flaunders gaunt meanes duke burgoyne wherby gat selfe moche thanke countre entent pleasure gaut haue lorde therle flauders dwell gaunt kepe householde erle also counsayled ye prouost hardebeque nexte hym wherby shulde norisshe great loue bytwene hym gaunt erle laye styll bruges came nat gaunt wherof great marueyle specially good rychmen gaunt suche sage wyse desyred nothyng peace palyerdes white hattes suche desyred rather stryfe debate cared nothyng erles comynge knewe well yf came shulde priuely corrected laste yuell dedes done nat withstandynge doubte yet gouernyng lawe cousaylers good men towne wolde thynge shulde come thyder shuld go requyre thought ferme peace without erle came thyder ther ordayned xxiiii men go bruges shewe erle great affection haue deted honorably aparteyned ye shulde go lorde sayd towne sir retourne neuer agayne gaunt without ye bring therle ye ye shall fynde gate closed agaynst thus burgess gaunt rode forthe towarde brug bytwene bruges donsay herde say howe erle comynge gauute warde wherof right ioyouse hadde nat ryden past leage farther mette erle feldes burgess stode styll bothe sydes waye erle company passed passed burgess enclyned selfe ryght lowe humbly made great reuerece erle erle rode without great regardyng lytell putte hande hat way made theym semblant erle rode one syde gautoise tyll came donse rested erle dyde dyne gauntoyse wente lodgynges dyned also dyner gauntoyse good array came erle kneled aldowne therle sat preseted ryght humbly affection seruyce towne gaut shewed hym howe great loue gaunt desyred moche haue hym hath sent hym sir departynge sayde v folly v retourne agayne gaunt without brought thyder v erle right well herde wordes helde peace certayne space last whan spake sayd fayre softely sir beleue well ye saye dyuers gaunt desyreth haue among haue marueyle remembre nat wyll nat remebre tyme past haue shewed haue courtesse meke gentyll requestes haue suffred putte countrey gentylmen whan haue complayned acquyte lawe iustyce haue also opyned dyuers tymes prison delyuer oute burgess whan haue desyred haue loued honoured countre haue done clene contrary haue slayne baylye distroyed house men banysshed chased away myne offycers brent ye house worlde loued beste enforced townes brought entente slayne knightes towne ipre haue done many tres pass agaynst seignorie noyfull recorde wolde coude neuer thynke shall whyder wyll nat ryght dere lorde sayd gaunt goddes sake neuer regarde ye haue thynges doned trouthe quod erle wordes tyme coe wyll ye shalbe neuer worse shewe vnto sir great cruelty felonyes haue foude gaunt erle apeased hym selfe rose vp fete caused ryse sayde lorde ruyselyers hym go gette wyne gaunt dranke departed lodgynges taryed night dyde erle next day togyder rode wardes gaunt p howe erle flauders entred towne gaunt departynge then withoute knowledge towne howe walles andwarpe beaten downe whyte hattes felowes cap ccc lvii whan gaunt vnderstode erle comynge right ioyfull came met hym fote horse backe mekely enclyned self lowe dyd hym reuerence passed forthe withoute worde spekynge lytell enclyned heed came logynge called posterne dyned many presentes gyuen towne came se ye lawe towne humbly enclyned themselfe hym reason requyred erle sayd sir good peace requyreth nothyng peace wherfore wolde whyte hattes layd downe amendes made dethe baylye sore requyred therin lynage sir quod men lawe ryght well entent shulde sir requyre grace humylyte maye please morowe nerte come open place shewe entent people wha se wyll reioysed wyll euery thynge ye shall desyre erle accorded request euenynge many folkes knewe ye towne howe erle shulde next mornyng viii clocke market place preche people good men ryght ioyfull therof foles outragious people gaue feare therof sayd howe preched inough howe knewe well johan prunaux rase de harsell peter boyse johan boule capitayns whyte hattes douted lest mater shulde layd charge spake togyder sent suche company outragious worst sayd sir take hede nyght morowe lette armure redy euer sayde put nat whyte hattes market place morowe viii ye bell make styrring stryfe without begon shewe companyes el sende worde therof sayd shulde done morning viii cloke came market place nat togyder dyuers plumpes erle came market place horsebacke co panyed knyghtes squyers lawe towne johan faucyll xl rychest towne therle came long market place cast eye whyte hattes mynde right sore displesed lighted mounted vp wyndowe leaned therat reed clothe began speke ryght sagely wynge fro poynt poynte loue affectyon hath displeased ther shewed howe prince lorde ought beloued feared serued honoured men howe done contrary also shewed howe hath kepte defended agaynst men howe kept peace profyte prosperyte passage see whiche closed fro first entrynge lande shewed dyuers reasonable poyntes whiche wyse men vnderstode conceyued clerely euer sayde trouthe dyuers gaue good care hym neuer whytte suche hadde rather haue warre peace whan hadde space one hour shewed finally sayde howe wolde good lorde lyke maner hadde tyme past pardoned iniuryes hate yuell wylles hadde agaynst hadde done wolde therof kepe rightes seignories tyme paste ben vsed howe desyred shulde begyn newe thyng custome whyte hattes shulde layd downe wordes spake euery man helde peace whan spake whyte hattes ther suche murmurynge sperynge might well parceyued cause therle desyred theym swetely euery man drawe owne house soo euery man departed place whyte hattes first came thyder laste taryed whan erle passed smyled folisshely behelde hym made reuerence hym wherof erle sore displeased mynde sayd knigh te whan came lodgynge trowe shall neuer come easely myne entent whyte hattes vnhappye people hert gyueth ye mater wyll nat rest longe case nowe ferr canne parceyue likely many yuell dedes though shulde lese canne nat suffre theym pride yuell doynges thus therle flauders foure fyue dayes deted retourned thyder agayne went lysse ther ordayned lye ye wynter departyng fro gaunt toke leaue man departed displeasure wherwith dyuers towne right yuell content sayde howe sholde neuer haue good hym wolde neuer loue howe deted fro tyme done tyme past gylbert mahewe bretherne counsayled seyng departed sodaynlye fro gaunt johan prunaur rase harsell peter de boyse johan boule yuell capitayns ryght ioyouse departyng sowed lewde word towne sayeng howe somer coe therle men wyll breke peace wherfore sayd good euery toke hede hym selfe prouyde towne corne vitayls esshe salte suche thynges sayeng howe coulde se suretie erle gaunt made prouision dyuers thynges necessarie towne wherof erle enfourmed great marueyle wherfore douted selfe suche wyse say trouthe thynges cosydred say haue sayd may marueyled howe gaunt dissymuled selfe begynninge dyde riche sage notable person towne nat excuse selfe dedes begynnyng whan johan lyon beganne bring vp first white hattes might well haue caused haue layed downe lyst haue sent maner person agaynst pioners bruges suffred bycause wolde nat medell busynesse prease dyde consented done whiche derely bought specially suche riche wyse afterward lordes selfe durst nat speke nothynge gaunte wolde sayd ye nother john lyon gylbert mahewe warres enuyes wolde neuer departe sondre whatsoeuer warre ther bytwene one wolde euer one euerredy defende fraunchesses towne whiche well sene made warre whiche endured seuyn yere whiche tyme neuer stryfe amonge towne thynge sustayned kept moost thyng bothe within without suche vnyte dystaunce amonge ye shall herafter hystorie nat long therle flaunders departed fro gaunt returned lyle sir olyuer dauterne cosyn germayne roger dauterne slayne gaunt sent defyance towne gaunt dethe cosyn lykewise dyde sir philyppe mamynes dyuers defyances made foude fourtie shyppes maryners parteyninge burgess gaunt comyng ryuer lescaulte charged corne ther reuenged dethe cosyn shyppes maryners hewed maryners dyde putte eyen sent theym gaunt maymed whiche dispyte gaunt toke great iniury lerned men gaut whome complayntes came right sore displesed wyst nat well say great murmuryng towne moost parte people gaunt sayd howe therle flaunders caused ther durst manne excuse hym assoone johan prunax herde tidynges tha capitayn whyte hattes wtout worde spekyng lawe nat say whyder spake ye capitayns copanyons nat thynke rather ye tha nay toke parte whyte hattes dyuers folowers redy inoughe yuell departed fro gaunt came daynly warpe whan entred first watche kepers feared man company entred ye gate nombre fyue thousande mo next mornynge sette warkemen warke carpentars mason suche ther redy hym commaundement ceassed nat tyll beaten downe two gate ye walles towres bytwene layde vp downe dyke towarde gaunt howe may gaunt excuse selfe thus cosented dede warpe beatynge downe walles gate moneth sent men haue come backe agayne whan herde first might well haue excused dyde nat wynked rather eyen suffered tyll tidynges came erle lay lysle howe john prunaur stelthe come andwarpe beten downe two gate walles towres whiche tydinges erle sore displesed also good cawse sayd vnhappy cursed people deuyll trowe shall neuer ioye long gaunt haue puissance sent gaunt counsayle shewynge great outrage hadde done howe people beleued makyng peace seyng yt peace whiche duke burgoyne made great labour payne nowe thus broken mayre lerned men gaunt excused selfe sayd sauynge erles displeasure neuer thought breke peace neuer wyll therto though johan prunaur done outrage selfe towne gaunt wyll wyse auowe suffer sustayne playnely truely excused selfe sayd moreouer howe erle cosented therto issued house suche haue done great outrage slayne may med burgess whiche great inco uenyence hole body towne howe say ye sir therles comissaryes replyed sayd sir se well ye reuenged nay nat towne though yt johan prunaur haue done thus andwarpe yt done reuengyng say nat treaty peace maye proue shewe lyst take recorde duke burgoyne myght haue done andwarpe haue brought poynt nowe desyre duke burgoyne ware suffred vndone ye tyme erles comyssaries sayde apereth well wordes ye haue caused done ye canne nat excuse selfe therin sithe ye knewe johan prunar gone andwarpe armye men warr stelth vnder shadowe peace hath beaten downe gate walles therof ye shulde haue gone haue defeded fro doyng suche outrage ye shewed complayntes hurtyng mayminge burgess gaunt ye shulde therin haue gone ye duke burgoyne made peace haue shewed coplaynt ye amended youre mater ye haue nat done thus nowe sithe ye haue lorde erle flaunders thus displeased ye sende excuse selfe ye desyre peace swerdes hades ensure one day wyll take cruell vegeance worlde shall speke therof erles comyssaries departed fro gaunt went cortray lyle shewed therle done thexcusacyons yt gaunt made selfe p howe gauntoyse rendred warpe house noble men flaunders bete downe howe warre began bitwene gauntoyse right cruell without pytie cap ccc lviii hearyng spekynge treatynge processe may well marueyled marueylous mater therin gyueth ye right warre whiche tyme great cruell flauders gaunt sayeng howe good iust cause make warre nat se yet coude neuer se vnderstande erle loued euer peace rather warre reseruyng alwayes highnesse honour dyde nat desyre delyuer burges prison erclo yet slewe bayly tha agayne doned great outrage thentent haue kept peace ouerthat agayne day moued countrey flaunders agaynst slewe towne ipre fyue knightes went assayled beseged warpe dyde payne haue dystroyed yet agayne erle peace wolde make none amendes dethe roger dauterne whiche lynage often tymes desyred wherfore somwhat reuenged dethe cosyn certayne maryners whome warr myschefe begon yet resonable cause shulde beate downe walles andwarpe thynke dyd many none occasyon sayd therle rather dette shulde make amendes hadde ben done maryners euer wolde delyuer agayne warpe erle lysle counsayll right sore displeased kept warpe wyst nat well howe gette agayne repented peace hadde gyuen gauntoyse wrote often tymes comaundynge delyuer vp warpe orels wolde make cruell warre shulde euer remembrance gaunt wolde wyse auowe dede broken peace finally certayne good people gaunte ryche men wolde haue thyng wylles peace went bytwene mater john faucyll gylbert guyse sir symon bet dyuers xii day gaunt beynge towne warpe retourned gayne gaunte delyuered towne erles seruautes apease erles displeasur john prunaur banisshed gaut flaunders bycause aduyce comons taken warpe without knowledge substance towne gaunt parte erle banysshed flaunders sir phylippe mamynes sir olyuer dautern galoys mane basterde wrydrymines tho cause mayminge maryners burgess gaunt without knowledge erle reason banisshynges bothe partyes apeased johan prunaux forsoke countrey flaunders went athe brabante dwelled sir phylip mamynes went ualencennes coutie haynalt whan gaunt knewe therof dyd somoch prouost ualencennes called john patryse fayre maner caused sayd knyght departe then departed good wyll went warlam besyde way taryed tyll harde tydinges knyghtes squiers voyded flau ders went brabant assoone erle agayne possessyon warpe sette warkmen warke newe repayred towne better euer bothe wall gate dyke gautoyse knewe well howe erle newe fortefyed warpe made semblaunce therof bycawse wolde faulte shulde founde brekynge peace foles outragyous people sayde amonge selfe lette erle alone warke though make warpe ofstele yet nat endure agaynst v lyst peace thus flaunders gaunt euer suspect erle erle dayly brought erle harde tidynges gaunt lykewyse gaunt erle johan de faucyll went dwelled nazareth fayre house leage fro gaunt hel ay styl dissymulynge moche myght wolde nat counsayle gaunt bycause wolde nat noted erle also kept fro erle moche myght kepe still loue gaunt thus swamme bitwene two waues makyng selfe newter nere coulde meane tyme whyle erle repayred towne warpe procured soo moche letter cosyn duke burgoyne sende hym johan prunaur beyng athe dyd sent hym erle sent lysle beheeded sette one whele lyke traytour thus dyed john prunaur ye erle went ipre dyd great justyce beheeded many yuell ruled people suche dethe hys fyue knyghtes slayne opened ye gate gaunt dyd thentent shulde take ensample mater ye gauntoyse well enfourmed wherfore douted dyde specyally capytayns suche bene forth iourneys warpe sayd amonge selfe certaynly erle may wyll destroy v loueth v well wyll haue nothyng lyues hath nat put deth johan prunar say trouth dyd john prunaur great wronge whan banysshed fro v therfore culpable deth ende shall coe may gette v wyll therfore lette v take good hede ourselfe peter de boyse sayd sir yf ye wyll beleue shall nat house stande vpright neuer genytlmans countrey aboute gaunt reason gentleman house nowe standyng maye distroyed take nat hede therto betymes prouyde remedy trouthe let v go forthe bere downe capitayns heter du boyse johan boule rase de harsell johan de launoy dyuers companyes departed day fro gaut brent beate downe gentylmens house aboute toke euer departed among selfe whan done retourned agayne founde neuer man wolde say sir ye haue done euyll whan gentleman knyghtes squiers beynge lysle erle harde tydinges howe house brent beten downe goodes takenne awaye ryght displeased nat without good cause sayd erle sir dispyght must pride gaunt beaten downe erle gaue leue abandoned knightes squiers make warre agaynste gauntoyse counteruenge domag dyuers knyghtes squyers flaunders alyed selfe tog der desyred frendes heynalt de reuenge gautoyse made capitayne e flaunders yongest sonne bastarde erles ryght knyght knyght company somtyme lay warpe another tyme gaures somtyme alos teremond scrunysshed gautoyse dayly sotyme ran barryers towne gaunt beate downe wyndmyls towne dyd great dispyght gaunt knyght heynalt called sir james uerchyn sene shall heynalt dyd many feates armes season aboute gaunt aduentured hym selfe often tymes ryght ieoperdously fought two thre tymes barryers wanne bassenetes crosbowes bylementes warre knyght loued well noble feate armes bene valyant knyght hadde lyued long dyed yonge bed castell ubre besyde mortayne whiche great domage p howe noble men flauders made warre agaynst flemynges dethe sir berteram clesquy coustable fraunce cap ccc lix whan gauntoyse sawe selfe thus mocked warred gentleman flaunders right angry therwith thought haue sente erle aubert erle haynault desirynge haue founde meanes haue caused gentylmen leaue warre gaynst whan thynges consydered thought shulde lese payne sure erle aubert wolde thynge wolde nat dysplease put thynge hym shulde displeasure might yuell lyue fauoure countrey holand zelande haynault ben closed fro thought selfe lost therfore left purpose toke nother counsayle yt send knyghtes squiers haynalt suche herytages rente reuenues gaunt ye precynct therof shulde come serue theym el lese rete reuenues sent auayled lytell set lytell comaundementes gaunt sent lorde dautoyng sir herne heryter towne gaunt constable shulde come serue el lese suche ryght bycause came nat wolde come bete downe house lorde dautoyng sent worde howe wolde come serue cost charge distruccyon yt shulde haue nother trust wolde ennemy holde nothynge theym erle flauders lorde whome owed seruyce obeysace lorde dautoyng helde well promyse made mortall warre agaynst dyde great domage made great prouisyon castell whiche garyson dyde moche traueyle gaunt also ye lorde daughen yonge squier called gaultyer dyd also great dispyte gaunt thus contynued styll warre gauntoyse durst nat issue towne without great companyes whan founde enemyes hadde mercy hauyng better slewe thus began warre ryght cruell bytwene erle flauders gauntoise whiche cost hundred thousande mennes lyues twise tolde great payne fynde outher ende peace capitayns gaut knewe well trespassed agaynst lorde erle flaunders agaynst duke burgoyn yt treatie peace sealyng sweryng soeuer yet thought shulde neuer haue peace shulde cost lyues dought feare caused opinyon kepe styll warre agaynst erle gentylmen flaunders also feare gaue courage kepe warre aduentures fell ye shall story erle flauders beyng l e harde dayly newes fro gaunt howe brent beate downe gentylmens howses wherwith sore displeased sayd howe wolde take suche vengeance wolde bryng gaunt vnder flame fyre rebelles within erle stronger agaynst sent baron flaunders abandoned countrey resyte agaynste whyte hattes apoynted two gentylmen captayns say galoys mamynes peter destreueles two copanies bare erles baner thre wekes lay bytwene warpe courtrey ryuer lys dyde great domage gaut whan rase harsell herde therof yssued oute gaunte whyte hattes came douse hadde thought haue founde erles company men armes whan knewe gau toyse comyng withdrewe towarde tourney taryed towne gauntoyse lay great season orches danne uorlam marchantes durst nat go bytwene doway tourney feare sayd howe gautoise wolde go lay siege lyle therle towne alyed selfe bruges ipre grantmont courtray acorde brug ipre varyed nat agreed craftes sayde shulde great folly ay siege farre lysle erle might haue great alyaunce ayde frenche kyng hath doutes stopped good townes flauders makyng warre layeng siege season thetent erle shulde haue helpe ayde fre che kyng duke burgoyne son sent messangers meke letter kyng desyring hym goddes sake yt shulde gyue counsayle ayde therle fla ders domage hurte wolde nothing peace loue obeysance seruice lorde wherfore sayde lorde dyde great wrong traueyle greue euer dyd sustayne frauchesse lyberties whiche lorde wolde take fro crueltie kyng som enclyned without semblant makyng lykewise dyd duke aniou brother erle flaunders cosyn yet nat greatly fauours bycause duke bretayne whome kepte hym countrey agaynst wylles longe season wherfore tooke great hede busynesse dyde pope clement sayd god sent therle flauders rodde punysshment bycause enemy helde pope urbane agaynst season good knight co stable fraunce sir bertram clesquy auuerne great nobre men armes lay sege new castell raudone thre leages fro cytie pye auuergne closed castell nyne englysshemen gascoyns enemyes realme fraunce yssued lymosyn many forteresses costable gaue many sore assautes castell sware wolde neuer departe then tyll castell pleasure great sickenesse tooke hym lay bedde siege brake nat vp men angrye sickenesse sir bertram dyed whiche great domage frendes ye realme fraunce borne freers pye ther one night fro hen caryed saynt denyse frau ce layde sepulture nere tombe kynge charles whiche kynge made hym dayes laye kynges fete obsequy done right honorably though hadde ben kynges sonne kyng bretherne notable persones realme fraunce thus dethe sir bertram clesquy office constable shyppe fraunce voyde ordayned aduysed shulde constable named dyuers great baron fraunce specially lorde clysson lorde coucy kyng wolde lorde coucy shulde haue offyce shulde regent picardy kyng gaue lande mortayne fayre herytage lyeng bytwne tourney ualencennes sir james uerchyne put therof constable heynalt helde succession father ben lorde therof great season lorde coucy great fauour frenche kyng kyng wolde haue hadde hym constable fraunce gentyll knight excused hym selfe dyuers reason wolde nat take sayd howe sir olyuer clysson worthy haue worthy knyght hardye beloued knowen amonge breton soo thus mater abode longe season sir bertrams men returned fraunce castell yelded vp day ser bertram dyed garison went lymosyn garyson uentadore whan fre che kyng sawe costables men gaue great gyftes p nowe let v leaue speke shewe howe sir thomas erle buckyngham yongest sonne kyng edwarde thyrde made great armye men armes archer passed hoost throughe realme fraunce went bretayne p erle buckyngham yongest sonne kyng edwarde iii passed great armye thorough realme fraunce go bretayne duke cap ccc lx haue herde howe whan duke bretayne departed englande kyng richard vncles promysed hym sende men armes archer ayde hym kyng kept promyse yuell fortune came therof sir johan arundell sent thyder two hundred men armes suche fortune nyghe perysshed see tempest sir hughe caurell sir thomas tryuet saued gret payne ther perysshed fourescore archer many men armes mo fortune army broken tyme duke bretayne great marueyle parte coulde worde coulde nat consyder ymagenne lette hadde fayne wolde haue knowen entent haue hadde comforte sore ouerpressed sir olyuer clysson sir guy de la uall sir olyuer clesqui erle langueuylde lorde rochforte frenchman lay aboute fronters bretayne duke counsayled sende sufficient messangers englande knowe cause came nat hast theym forther nede helpe lorde beaumonoyre sir eustace housay desyred duke coutre take voyage englande answered content go letter fro ye duke bretayne fro cou tre deted toke shyppinge wynde wether pleasur arryued hapton yssued vessell toke horse rode london whytsontyde yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore kynge englande anone certifyed comynge kynge went wyndsore kepe feest penthecost hym vncles gret nombre baron knightes englande thyder came two foresayd knyghtes bretayne honourably receyued kynge vncles delyuered letter kynge vncles reed knewe therby howe duke bretayne countrey desyred effectuously ayde confort two knight knewe ye dethe sir johan arundell perysshed see goyng towarde bretayne duke lancastre excused mater sayd howe kyng counsayle faute fortune see agaynst whiche man canne resyst whan god wyll haue knyghtes helde kyng excused greatly complayned ye dethe knyghtes perysshed see feest pethecost passed helde parlyament westmyuster kynges counsayll meane season dyed lodon sir rychard dangle erle hutyngdon buryed frere augustynes kyng caused obsequy done right honourably great nombre prelate barones englande bysshoppe london sange masse anone began parlyament ordayned sir thomas wodstocke youngest sonne kynge edwarde thirde dyuers barones knyghtes squiers hym shulde passe see lande calayes soo passe grace god throughe fraunce thre thousande men armes many archer come bretayne lyke sonne kyng p toke hym great thynge passe throughe realme fraunce whiche great soo noble wherin noble chyualry valyant men armes whan thynges thus determyned voiage cocluded agreed kyng englande vncles sent letter duke bretayne countre gyueng knowledge entente counsayle parlyament concluded lo howe without faute sir thomas wodstocke erle buckingham yongest sone kynge edwarde thirde shulde shortely passe see come socour kyng englande honoured greatly knyghtes bretayne gaue great gyftes likewyse dyd vncles departed returned bretayne delyuered letter duke opened red sawe contayned shewed lordes knyghtes countrey well content aunswere kynge englande vncles forgate nat voiage apoynted sent chosen apoynted go erle buckyngham bothe baron knyghtes squiers payed wage douer thre monethes wage begyn assone shulde arryued calayes well men armes archer passage delyuered franke fre passed lytell lytell arryued calays xv dayes past boloyne sawe well howe men armes archer issued englande landed calays gaue knowledge therof ouer countrey frenche garysons entent shulde take hede euery man parte whan tydynges knowen bolonoyse thoronyse countie guynes knyghtes squiers countrey drewe forteresses put therin hadde feare lesynge capitayns boloyne arde monteire spirlo que tornehen horne lyques castelles fronters entended greatly prouide place thought seynge englisshmen come ouer suche nombre yt shulde haue assautes gyuen tydinges passage ye englisshmen brought kyng charles beyng parys co tynent sent ye lorde coucy saynt quintynes shulde prouyde formen warre go picardy comforte cyties townes castelles fortersses lorde coucy obeyed kynges comaundement reason made somos knightes squiers picardy arthoyse uermandoyse mete peron uermandoyse tyme lorde saynt pye capytayne arde boloyne sir johan bouillers sir thomas wodstocke erle buckynghame yongest sonne kynge edwarde thirde arryued calays thre dayes maudlyn tyde moneth july yere lorde god thousand thre hundred fourscore p howe erle buckyngham englisshmen departed fro calats go frauce order cap ccc lxi whan erle buckynghame aryued calays companyons great ioye thought well nat tary long go forth vo age erle refresshed two dayes calays thirde daye departed toke way marquegnes reason shewe name bauers pensels erle first erle buckyngham hymselfe therle stafforde wedded nece doughter ye lorde couey therle dymestre lordes rode baners displayed lorde spensar constable hoost lorde fytz water marshall lorde bassette lorde bourgthyer lorde ferres lorde morlay lorde parsy sir wyllyam wynsore sir hughe aurell sir hugh hastyng sir hughes one assent rode standerdes penons sir thomas percy sir thomas tryuet sir wyllyam clynton sir yuon sir hugh torell lorde uar eustare sir johan harbeston ser wyllyam feruytone lorde briame sir wyllyam fabre sir johan sir nycholas court sir johan mase sir thoms camoyse sir rafe sonne lorde neuell ser henry bastarde ferres sir hughe broe sir orsell sir thomas west lorde dauyd holograue hugh lyn bastarde bernarde coderers dyuers warre rode good great array first day de calais went farther marquegues rested toke counsayle way best take furnysshe voyage dyuers cu neuer ben fraunce e e hymselfe dyuers great barones knightes therfore resonable suche person hadde ben fraunce knewe countre shulde haue suche rule gouernynge myght honour threwe whan englysshmen tyme past ben fraunce euer suche ordynaunce amonge sware euer kyng englande counsayle two shynges one shulde neuer disclose secre person lyueng among themselfe der entended go seconde thyng sware promysed make maner treatie enemyes without knowledge kyng cousayle whan chese baron knightes squyers company rested marquegnes thre dayes euery man company come calais capitayns determyned way take deted went tyll came arde rested bastyde arde thentent shewe themselfe armes within forteresse made newe knightes erle buckyngehanm therle dymestre also lorde morlay two knight put baners moreouer therle made knightes suche foloweth first lorde fytzwaters sonne sir roger strange sir john pre sir john coll sir james tytiell sir thomas ramston sir johan neuell sir thomas roste host went lodged hosque forsayd newe knyght made bycause vowarde went day stronge house stadynge ryuer syde called folant within squyer owner house called robert good man armes hadde well furnysshed house good men armes whiche gote therabout nombre xl made good semblant defede selfe house baron knyghtes newe knyghthod enuyroned towre folat began fiersly assayle within within valiantly defended themselfe done many feates armes within shorte holly quickely togyder hurt dyuers assaylantes suche aduetured themselfe moche forwarde within dyuers good crosbowes sent thyder capitayne saynt omers request squyer feared englisshmen wolde passe house wherfore thought kepe best power dyde bare hymselfe ryght valiantly erle dymestre spake highe worde stode dyke baner hym whiche worde greatly encouraged people sayeng sir howe thus oure newe knyghthode peuysshe douchouse holdeth agaynst v longe stronge place fortress realme fraunce shall holde longe agaynst v sythe small house endureth longe sir fore lette v shewe newe chiualry herde wordes noted ryght well aduentured selfe largely dyde entred dyke came harde walles theglissh archer shotte holly togyder scant non durst apere defence ther dyuers slayne hurt ye base court wonne brent finallye wonne howe first defended theselfe tight valiantly neuer man within wounded dethe thus house folant taken robert folant within taken prisoner therle dymestre temnant taken prisoner men hoost lodged ryuer houske abydynge sir wyllyam wyndsore ledde rerewarde nat come came night nexte day disloged rode esperleque lodged capitayne saynt omers seynge englysshmen nere encreased watche towne nyght watched two thousande men entent saynt omers shulde nat sodayuly wonby englysshmen next mornyng sire clocke englisshmen dislodged rode saint omers whan towne sawe thenglisshmen come armed ordayned selfe market place go gate walles good dely cyon shewedde theym howe englysshmen wolde assayle nat thought knewe well towne strong thought shulde lose wynne howe erle buckyngham neuer ben fraunce thonght wolde sesaynt omers bycause semed fayre farre walles gate towres steples rested hoost mountayne halfe leage fro towne araynged good order thre houres ther yonge knightes squyers thought proue theymselfe rode barryers towne hesyred iust knighted squyers towne coulde haue none answere retourned agayne half day erle cae saynt omers made agayne newe knightes first sir rafe neuell sir bartylmewe bourgehter sir thomas camoyse sir fouke corbette sir thomas danglure sir rafe perypars sir aoyes saynt albyne sir johan paule newe knyghtes first churalry proue themselfe rode barryers towne desyred iustes wered retourded agayne hoost whan erle company sawe frauce suche within wolde nat yssue feldes array passed farther day loged esquyles bytwene say tyrwyn nexte daye rodeth warde tyrwynne whan garysons county bolayne artoyse guynes sawe dealynge englysshmen howe went alwayes forwarde without restyng shewed wylles eche others determyned pursue englysshe hoost thynkynge therby somwhat wynne gathered togyder assembled vnder standerde lorde fresures lorde saynt pye two hudred speares coosted pursued englisshmen englysshmen kept themselfe euer close guyder without disorderynge frenchemen coude gette none aduantage howe somtyme frenchemen encountred englysshe forager ouerthrue fore durst nat go foragynge companyes thus thenglysshmen rode forthe paste tyrwynne without thynge doynge lorde saynt pye lorde tresures ther hoost lodged bethwyn taryed day shall shewe ye haue herde howe kynge rycharde englande thaduyse vncles cousayle sent lmayne knight called sir symon burle ye kynge romayns haue sustre maryage knight well spedde king romayns assented therto counsayle great baron court kyng romayns sent englande sir symon burle duke casson aduyse realme englande se howe shulde please suster make enue mater cardynall rauene redye englande helde pope urbane conuerted englysshmen opinyon urbane haryed comyng said duke kyng englandes desyre duke brahantes bothe company asau coduct passe realme frauce come calays cae bethwyn came sawe therle buckyngham receyued norably next daye toke leaue eche almayns came ayre saynt omers calays therle hoost went liques lodged day bohayne alway lorde saynt pye lorde fresures pursued host morning host disloged went towarde bethwyn towne great garyson knightes squyers teynyng lorde couty lorde ha gest sir johan sir trystram roye sir g ffray chargney sir guy harcourt dyuers hoost passed bethwyn went douchers night lorde saynt pye lorde fresures entred bethwyn next day went arras founde lorde coucy receyued ioyfully demaunded theym way englysshmen toke answered said lyen night chers shewed hym howe rode wysely close togyder lorde coucy said semeth well demaunde nothyng batayle whiche shall haue kynge lorde wyll gretherto haue aco plysshed viage therle buckyngham passed arras good order batayle went lodged anette next day myramount clery ryuer somme whan lorde coucy beyng arras vnderstode howe tooke way sent lorde hangest bray ryuer somme company xxx spea e knightes squyers peron set jaques uerchyn seneshall heynault lorde haureth sir john roy dyuers went hym selfe towarde saynt quitynes sent lorde clary dyuers uermadorse wolde nat neglygence countre shulde haue taken domage p howe lorde brymewe chyldren takenne englysshmen copany howe garyson perone chased towne hastely cap ccc lxii nyght englysshmen lodged clary certayne knightes amo ge sir thomas triuet sir wyllyam clynton sir yuon fytzwaren mouynge lorde uarchyne knewe well coutre knewe well howe lorde coucy great nombre arras thinkyng surelye wolde ryde next mornynge se yf coude mete englysshe forager knewe well desyre dedes armes thought fortuned englysshemen thretie speares rode forthe folowed farre fro forager aduenture day departed fro cytie arras lorde coucy great copany toke way towardes saynt quyntines whan feldes lorde brimewe chyldren departed fro lorde coucys company thretie speres lyke men desyred fynde aduentures sodaynly frenche men englisshmen mette eche ther remedy fight cryed cryes first metyng many ouerthrowen slayne hurt bothe party ther done many feate armes lyghted fote dyde valyantly space one houre none coulde tell hadde better howe finally englysshmen vyctorie sir thomas tryuet toke lorde brimewe sonnes johan loyes taken sixtene men armes thother saued selfe englysshmen retourned gayne hoost taryed aboute peron knowledge prisoner howe lorde coucy perone thousande speares coude nat tell wheder wolde fight nat daye wente hoost forager lorde uerchyne ferchras bastarde brother sir yuon fytzwaren dyuers rode mount saynt quyntyne laye busshment knewe well seneshall heynalte peron certayne men armes knewe well yonge lusty wolde yssue seke aduenture dyd vowarde sent men armes ren perone terrey soubezmayne bastarde uertayne hugelyn caurell hopkyn haye mounted good horse rode barryers towne within seneshall heynaulte fyftie speares caused barryers opined thought haue trapped fore ryders fell chasyng fledde none towarde busshemet whan busshment sawe frechmen chase company issued enbusshment lytell sone whan seneshall company sawe great nombre agaynst retourned fledde englysshmen folowed fast spurres wolde driue horse frenchman founde barryers opyn happe howe nere folowed dyuers wer taken prisoner sir richarde marquylles sir loyes uerchyn honarde honardery vytall saynt hyllary tenne men armes saued selfe whan englysshmen knewe howe seneshall lorde hauerathe lorde clerey twentie knyghtes scaped away sorie sayde taken shulde well payed fourtie thousande frankes retourned hoost doone day hoost taryed thre dayes clery ther fourthe day departed went abbey uancyll thre leages fro cambrey nexte day towarde saynt quyntines p day company duke burgoyne rode abrode xxx speares came fro arras saynt quyntines sir thomas tryuette sir yuon fytzwarenne lorde uertayne dyuers englysshmen beyuge foregers wolde haue taken lodgynge encountred burgonyons fought togyder endured nat longe anone burgoyons dysceuered fledde away sauyng selfe many might howe sir johan moruay hode styll place penon hym fought valiatly finally taken ten men armes hym englysshemen went fousons two leages fro amyens ther vowarde lodged p howe englysshmen brent wasted countre champayne encounterynges hadde way prisoner toke cap ccc lxiii next mornyng wha therle buckyngham herd masse toke way towarde saynt quintynes towne great nombre menne warre yssued nat ther certayne currours ran barrier anon deted bycause hoost passed without taryeng went origny saynt benet lodged vyllages therabout towne origney fayre abbey nonnes tyme abbesse aunt lorde uertayne vowarde desyre abbey towne saued fro brennyng therle lodged abbey euenyng next mornyng great scrimysshing ryllemont nat ferr fro hoost dyuers slayne hurt party next mornyng hoost disloged fro origny went cressy passed uaux besyde laon lodged syssone next day passed ryuer aigne bridge uayre wet hermouyll hormissy four leages fro reynes founde nothyng way euery thyng put good townes fortress french kyng abandoned armes euer coude get abrode countre thenglysshmen gret nede specially flesshe determyned sende reynes treate sende vitayle host certayne qua tyte beestes brede wyne reynes answered howe wolde nothyng desyre badde lyst englysshmen sore dyspleased answere within weke currours brent beyonde lx vyllages marchesse reyns also theglysshmen certayne know lege howe reyns within dyke great nobre beestes forwarde came thyder made men entre dyke chased beestes none durst issue towne make desece archer dyke shotte thicke non durst apere walles englysshmen mo xx thousande beest one yet agayne towne shewyng wolde burne cornes without wolde sende host seme brede wyne raynes douted tidynges sent sire chares laded asmoch brede wyne coude cary meanes corne saued fro brennynge thenglysshmen passed reynes good order batayle went beaumount passed ryuer besyde reynes whan disloged fro beaumount ryuer yell rode fort e passe ryuer maren cae conde ther founde bridge broken howe ye stayes postes stode styll founde plankes tymbre made agayne brige passed ouer lodged vyllages maren next day came towne uertues ther great scrimysshe castell dyuers sore hurte therle lodged towne uertues nyght towne brent saue abbey wherin erle lodged elles also brent towne withdrawen castell wolde gyue nothyng saue next mornyng host disloged passed castell moymer whiche parteyned herytage lorde chastellon scrimysshers came barryers passed forthe lodged pelayng aprochyng towarde cytie troy next day plancy ryuer aube rode forthe lorde new castell johan brother raymonde saynt marsyn gascoyns englysshemen xl speares one foude none adueture great whyle wher sore displeased last saw comynge feldes great company men armes ridyng towarde troyes lorde hangest company englysshemen gascoyns proched horse spurres folowed lorde hangest well auewed douted lest greatter copany dede sayd company sir lette v ryde towarde plancy saue selfe englysshmen hath discouered v nere v lette v saue selfe castell plancy drue thyder englysshmen fold wed fast man armes lorde uertaygnes retynewe experte man armes named peter berton well horsed layd speare rest ranne lorde hagest fledde speare poyat touched backe behynde hym thinkyng haue stryken sadell howe beit lorde hangest lost nother sadell slyrroppe yet styll man armes helde styll rennyng ye spear poynt backe came plancy entryng castell lorde hangest daynly lepte fro horse entred fote dyke castell entended saue hym came barryer great scrimysshe castell shotte sore many good crosbowes done many proper feate armes one part great payne lorde hangest saued right valiantly ought first entryng castell styll came thyder people ye vowarde lorde uer taygne sir thomas tryuet sir hughe caurell dyuers came thyder ther asore batayle ther slayne taken frenche parte xxx ye base courte castell brent castell assayled partes ye whiche well defended mylles aboute plancy brent beten downe hoost drewe agayne togyder passed ryuer aube bridge angle rode towardes ualant ryuer sayne thus daye lorde hangest great aduenture day lord vowarde sir thomas tryuet sir hughe caurell lorde uertayne bastarde brother peter berton dyuers rode forthe encountred sir johan roye xx speares parteyninge duke burgoyne rydinge troyes englysshmen spyed theym folowed fast coulde driue horse frenchemen thought saue selfe nat men ynowe abyde moost parte saued selfe sir johan roy dyuers put selfe within barryers troyes open tournynge agayne englysshemen tooke four prisoner came shorte saue selfe amog whiche squyer ye duke burgoins called gyon expert armes horse right sore chafed rested felde backe myre ther fought right valiatly agaynst two englysshemen spake hym englysshe badde yelde wyst nat sayd bastarde uertayne retourned fro chase came sayd squyer frenche yelde whan vnderstode said agayne getylman bastarde answered sayd yetrewely well yelde toke gauntelet swerde englysshmen wolde haue slayne hym bastardes hades sayeng howe nat courtesse take hym prisoner howe bastarde stronger saued prisoner nyght questyon made therof marshalles thynges consydred bastarde kept styll prisoner raunsomed hym ye night trusted hym faythe sent hym nexte day troyes hoost lodged balade ryuer sayne cae village leage fro troyes called ber nare saynt symple ther great lordes great counsayle togyder p howe thenglisshmen came troyes bastydes duke burgoyne made withoute troyes resyst englysshmen cap ccc lxiiii cyte troyes duke burgoyne made somons entensyon wyll syght thenglisshmen bytwene ryuer sayne yone also baron knyghtes squyers fraunce desyred none thyng charles frenche kynge wolde wyse acorde therto bycause doute fortune remembred moche great loss domag noble realme tyme past vyctories englysshmen wherfore wolde wyse shuld sight great aduauntage p duke burgoyne troyes hym duke burbone duke bare erle ewe lorde coucy sir johan uyen admyrall see lorde uyenne saynt croyse sir james uyenne sir water uyen ye lorde tremoyle lorde uergy lorde rengemont lorde hambey seneshall heynalte lorde saynt pye barone haber lorde roy vycont dassey sir wyllyam bastarde langers mo two thousand knightes squiers shewed howe lorde tremoyle sent duke kyng parys get lycence fight englysshmen nat returned ye day thenglysshmen came troyes frenchman within troyes thought surelye englysshmen wolde nat passe wt lokyng towne wherfore made without towne bowe shotte fro ye gate bastyde great tymbre wherin myght well thousande men armes euenyng hoost ayns went cousayle determyne shulde next day concluded euery man baners penones well armed shulde ryde troyes abyde selde sende towne demaude batayle next mornynge armed sette theymselfe thre batayls came fayre playne troy taryed two harauldes chandos aquitany sente erle buckyngham whan come erle sayd sir go wa troyes shewe lordes howe beyssued oute englande dedes armes might haue demaude therfore bycause knowe well howe great parte oure delyse chiualry frauce within towne therfore shewe become way wyll thynge say shall fynde v felde forme maner ye shall leaue v suche wyse ought fynde enemyes haraldes departed rode towardes troyes thentre bastyde opyned coude nat gette gate towne yssued oute many men armes cro bowes settyng selfe order batayle harauldes cote armes therle buckynghams lordes demaunded wolde answered sayd howe sente speke duke burgoyne season harauldes shulde haue done message duke burgoyne lord hym sy sette men ordre batayle englisshmen thought verely haue batayle wherfore ther made newe knyght fyrst sir thomas tryuet brought baner rolled vp toguyder erle buckyngham sayd sir please shall day display baner thanked god haue reuenues sufficyent mayntayne withall pleasethe ryght well erle erle toke baner delyuered sir thomas tryuet sayde sir thomas pray god gyue grace nobly day alwayes sir thomas toke baner displayed delyuered squier whome trusted well soo went vowarde ordayned capitayue lorde latymer marshall lorde fitz water ther made newe knyghtes sir peter berton sir john sir thomas paulle sir john syngule sir thomas dortyngnes sir john uassecoq sir thomas brasey sir johan brauyne sir henry uernyer sir johan coleuyll sir wylliam eurart sir nycholas styngule sir hughe lunyt went fyrste batayle bycawse first skrimysshe erle called forthe gentyll squyer countie sauoy ben desyred fore haue ben made knight arde saynt omers squier called rafe gremers sonne erle gremers erle buckyngham sayd sir god pleased thynke shall haue day batayle wherfore wyll ye knight squier excused hym selfe sayde sir god thanke noblenes ye wolde put vnto sir wyll neuer knyght without made handes naturall lorde erle sauoy batayll examyned noo farther great pleasure holde englisshmen felde frenchman made preparacyon bastyde thought well leest haue scrymishe thinkyng suche men thenglisshmen wold neuer passe without soe maner face skrimysshe duke burgoyne without towne armed peces hande soo knyghtes squiers passed hym bastyde great prease man coulde go forewarde harauldes coulde nother go forwarde backewarde wherby coulde nat come duke message comaunded besyde erle buckynghams commaundemet two harauldes dyuers sayd sir ye shall go forth message besyde say duke burgoyne howe duke bretayne countrey hath sent kyng englande haue comforte ayde agaynst certayne baron knyghtes bretayne rebel duke wyll nat obey lorde moost parte countrey dothe make warre countre shadowe selfe vnder frenche kyng bycause kyng englande wyll ayde duke countrey hath nowe specially sent one vncles erle buckyngham certayne nombre men warr go bretayne confort duke countre arryued calays hath taken way passe throughe realme fraunce forwarde iourney hyder cytie troyes knewe well great nombre lordes specially duke burgoyne sonne french kyng disseased brother kyng nowe wherfore ye may say howe sir thomas erle buckyngham sonne kyng englande disseased vncle kyng nowe desireth batayll harauldes went demaunded haue hadde letter credence consernynge mater answered shulde haue letter next day moruynge taken counsayle sayde howe wolde sende letter badde dept sayd go wayes say ye haue ben enformed ye credable ynough lyst beleue haraldes departed ye haue herde newe englysshe knyghtes hadde begon scrimysshe trouble certayn knightes fraunce sayd haraudes sir get hen ye great parell yuell people towne whiche doute caused haraldes retourne agayne without thyng doyng message p nowe let v shewe done scrimysshe first ther englisshe squyre borne bysshoprike lyncoln expert man armes nat se whyder coude se nat spurred horse spear hande targe necke horse came russhyng downe way lepte clene ouer barres barrier galoped gate duke burgoyn lordes fraunce reputed dede great enterprise squier thought haue returned coulde nat horse stryken speares heaten downe squier slayne wherwith duke burgoyne ryght sore displeased nat ben taken lyue prisoner therwith great batayll erle buckynghams came foote towarde men armes bastyde made dores wyndowes table saye trouth nothyng holde agaynst suche men warre englisshmen wherfore coulde nat longe endure whan duke burgoyne sawe comyng thicke great nombre consideryng howe nombre nat sufficyent agaynst comaunded euery man entre towne except crosbowes entred gate lytell lytell whyle entred genowayes cro bowes shot continually hurte dyuers englisshmen sore scrymishe anone bastyde conquered coulde nat endure agaynst englisshmen frenchman entred agayne gate entred set theselfe ordre stretes duke lorayne lorde coucy duke burbon dyuers bytwene gate barryers many feate armes done slayne hurt taken whan englisshmen sawe frenchman withdrawe backe lykewyse reculed backe stode styll ordre bataile space two houres returned lodgyng next day went maylleroys uycount nere sence burgoyne hoost taryed two dayes refresshe get vitayles countre great plenty thus ye haue harde well howe englisshmen rode throughe realme frauce go bretayne sayd also mayntayned howe duke bretayne countrey sent made warre name lorde kyng englande named selfe sowdyers duke bretaynes kyng charles fraunce well fourmed mater sagely wysely abuysed parels insydetes might growe warre sawe well howe countre bretayne ayde englysshmen cotrary hym therby feared leest fortune warr shulde harder specially reason duke bretayne good townes bretayne shulde enemyes opyned enemyes wherby shulde haue great preiudyce wherfore sent swete letter gracyous nauntes whiche key chefe towne bretayne shewynge howe theglysshmen rydde realme make auaunt afferme howe soudyers sent comons bretayne also wyng howe wyll contynue yuell ronne maledyction sentence holy father pope forfeyture two hudred thousande florens whiche maye laufully take whervnto boude writyng sealed treaty made tofore wherof haue copy wherfore ought nat forget also shewed howe hath ben alwayes frende louer hath conforted ayded always busyness counsaylinge shulde nat farre wherby might take wronge sayeng howe suche tytell complayne hym entre suche warre receyue ennemyes wherfore counsayled well aduysed haue ben yuell exorted cou sayled feble counsayle yet wolde pardon opyn nat towne englysshmen enemyes doyng promysed menteyne kepe vp fraunchysses lyberties renewe yf nede requyred wha offer thus made frenche kyng presented nau te well debated amonge notable towne sayd howe kynge cause right say dyd surelye sayde howe sworne writynges sealed howe shulde neuer none anoyaunce realme fraunce ayde assyst none enemy kynge realme wherfore toke hede mater sent secretly kynge desyring hym take thought mater sayd thenglyshmen shulde nat sustayned entre towne renne make warre realme fraunce howbeit desyred kynge nede requyred ayded coforted men sayde wolde open towne none whan frenche kynge herde treatie right gladde therof beleued well wordes nauntes ben alwayes good frenche knewe thynge duke bretayne uennes beleued surely nauntes wolde haue ben trewe stedfast hym haue opened towne englysshmen whan came thyder p nowe let v retourne englysshmen lodged nere sence burgoyne whiche cytie duke bare lorde coucy lorde saynt puye lorde fresures companyes p howe englysshmen rode pylled countre gastenoyse beause howe french squyer right valyaunt requyredde englisshe squier iust hym cap ccc lxv whan erle buckyngham hoost well rested maylleroyes vicount toke counsayle drawe gastenoyes passed ryuer dyone theyr oreryders went faubories sece next day lodged saynt john nemour therabout beause gastenoyes ther hoost taryed thre dayes bycause good pletyfull countre founde toke counsayle whyder shulde holde kepe playne way beause el ryuer loyre determyned take way beause go towardes tourey beause castell tourey lorde saynt pye sir olyuer manny sir guy baueux great nombre men warre yenuyll beause lorde uylames barroyse barres dyuers iii c speares thus castels fortress beause men warr set syst agaynst thenglisshmen englysshe vowarde came scrimysshed tourey dyuers hurt bothe partes erle buckyngham hoost lodged founde ther great plenty vitayls scrimysshe tourey ther squyer beause auaunsed selfe wt settyng person came barryers scrimysshynge sayd englysshmen sir gentylman among loue lady wyll dede armes redy issue armed peces hors backe ren thre course speare stryke thre stroke axe thre stroke dagger nowe let v se amorous amonge squyer called gawen mychaell worde request anon spredde among englysshmen englysshe squyer called joachym cathore stept forthe sayd redy delyuer request let hym come castell lorde fitz water marshall hoost came barryers sayd sir guy le baueux cause squyer coe forthe shall fynde one wyll gladd delyuer shall assure hym thynges gawen mychaell right ioyouse wordes armed hym incontynent lordes dyde helpe arme hym sette hym hors backe yssued castell thre varlettes bare thre speares thre ax thre dagger greatly regarded englysshmen beleued afore frenche man wolde fyght body body chalenge shulde haue thre stroke swerde also thre swerdes borne hym erle buckingham enformed chalenge sayd howe wolde go se hym selfe mouted horse erle stafforde erle dymestre hym cause seased assaut tourey englysshmen drewe thyder se iustes englysshman cae forthe armed peces mouted good horse whan come place speares delyuered ran eche myssed reason stryuinge horse seconde course met ataynted therle buckyngham sayd hola cease late sayd constable cause cease haue done ynough day shall ende enterprise another season leysar haue nowe take good hede french squyer lacke nothyng lette hym well kept oure owne squyer shewe cause shewed castell take care squyer shall go v forme enterprise nat prisoner scape lyue shall returne agayne parell erles wordes acomplyshshed shewed squier ye marshall howe shulde ryde without daunger whan erle content ye shall delyuered sir quod squyer god wyll haraude sent castell shewe mater within p next day rode yeuyll beause alwayes beyng hope fyght enemyes well knewe howe pursued costed party frenchman great nombre greatter say trouthe frenche lordes knightes squiers great wyll desyre fight englysshmen sayd among selfe howe great shame suffre longe vnfought withall whan spake kynge therof sayd euer sir let alone kepe waye shall lengthe lese selfe thus englysshmen kept forthe waye thentent entre bretayne ye haue harde yenuyll beause mo thre hundred speres hoost passed barryers ther lytell scrimysshe passed forthe lost payne without yenuylle fayre wyndmyll whiche beaten downe erle buckyngham came yt ruyll alighted house teplers vouarde went puyset aduertysed howe stronge towre xl companyons within thenglysshmen went assayled stode playne grounde lytell defence great assaut endured nat longe englysshe archer shotte holly toguyder ther none durst apere defence towre taken within slayne taken thenglysshmen sette fyre towre passed forthe coulde fynde good water whiche great myschefe came ermoyne loged ther fro then wente lodged forest marcheaunoy p iust bytwene gawen mychaell fraunsois joahym cathore angloys word kyng charles fraunce sayd deth bedde cap ccc lxvi within forest mar cheaunoye abbey monkes sesteause wherin noble house buyldynges olde tyme edified bylded valyat noble man therle bloys gaue thervnto reuene wes rente warres sore mynisshed lyuelode erle buckynghame lodged herde masse lady day septembre ordayned gawen mychaell shulde furnysshe chalenge agaynst joachym cathore nexte day day thenglysshmen came towarde marcheau noy within towne ther capitayne tyme knyght countre called sir wyllyam saynt martyne ryght sage knyght valyant armes whan englysshmen sawe maner castell withdrewe lodgynges lorde fitz water came castell uerby nat gyue assaute vnto speke lorde therof barryers bycause knewe eche ben toguyder tyme pruce lorde fitz water knowledged hym selfe lorde uerby desyred hym olde acquayntance sende wyne courtesy promysed saue landes fro brennyng wastynge lorde uerby sent hym wyne largely thretie myches therwith whiche lorde fytz water gaue hym great thankes kept well promyse next daye lady day gawen mychaell jochyme cathore armed theym mounted horse performe enterprise met speare poyntes rudely frech squyer iusted right plesantly englysshman ranne lowe strake frenchman depe thygh wherwith erle bucking ham ryghtsore displeased thother lordes sayd howe shamefully ron eche strake thre stroke swerdes therle sayd howe done ynough sayd howe shulde mo tor sawe squyet blede sore han gawen mychaell vnarmed erle sent hym haraude hundred fra kes gaue hym leaue depte home agayn owne company sendyng worde howe acquyted hym right valiantly gawen mychaell retourned agayne ye frenche lordes englysshemen departed fro marcheaunoy toke way towarde uandoue came lodged forest coulonbers ye haue herde howe fre che kyng sent dyuers treaty couenauntes certayne townes bretayne entent shulde nat open townes englysshmen shewyng dyde otherwyse shulde soore trespasse agaynst hym shulde indonable naunces sent kyng secretely shulde doute promysinge wolde make treatie shulde agaynst kynge lorde yf englysshmen dyde aproche towne kynge sende socoure whiche frenche kyng well agreed charged counsayle take hede therto treaty sir johan de bulle hadde busynesse therof vnder duke aniou lay anger duke burgoyne cytie man therabout castelles forteresses aboute lordes duke burbone erle bare lorde coucy erle ducke duke lorayne moche people aboue nombre sixe thousande men armes sayde amonge selfe howe wolde whyder kynge wolde nat fight englysshemen past tyuer sartie whiche departeth mayne owe p season sickenesse toke frenche kynge wherby hym selfe suche loued hym greatlye discomforted sawe hym remedy shortly shulde dye knewe well hym selfe howe coude nat lyue longe sayde phisycions surgyons shall shewe trouthe common brunte ranne kynge nauetr whan frenche kyng duke normandy lay wolde haue poysoned kyng receyued poyson case heare body went nayles handes fete body became drie staffe without remedy emperoure rome vncle whan herde speakynge malady sent hym conyng phisycion greattest mayster reputed arte worlde whan mayster come fraunce kynge duke normandy one knowlege disease said knewe well poysoned greate parell dethe dyde one greattest cure hath herde kylled venym within hym best parte therof made heer nayles growe agayne made hym hole brought agayne strength venym euer yssued hym lytell lytell arme lytell pype whan mayster departed fraunce gaue kynge receyte vse long lyued sayd kynge loke whan yssue pype drieth vp surely ye shall dye ye shall haue fyftene dayes respyte ye fall sicke euer ye dye remembre soule kynge remembred well wordes bare pype xxii dayes whiche thynge often tymes abasshed hym suche phisycions moost trust ten tymes reioysed hym sayd sir good medycins ye haue shall make lyue long great ioye wherin great trust besyde kyng disease right greuous specially tethe wherof hadde marueylous payne kynge knewe well maladyes yt shulde nat lyue longe later dayes thynge moost conforted hym god hadde sent hym thre fayre chyldren two sonnes doughter charles lewes katheryne whan issue arme began drie vp doutes dethe began aproche prouyed therfore like noble prudent sage prince euer warkes sent thre bretherne duke berrey duke burgone duke burbone let seconde brother duke aniowe alone sent nat hym bycause knewe well sore gyuen couy ousnesse king sayde thre fayre bretherne ordynauce nature fele well knowe howe shall nat lyue long wherfore recommaunde kepyng sonne charles loke ye vse youre selfe good vncles shulde nephewe ye acquyte selfe hym trewely crowne hym kynge soone ye dethe counsayle hym alwayes well trewely lyeth trust chylde yonge lyght spiryte therfore great nede well counsayled gouerned teche cause taught pointes state ryall ought kepe mary hym high place realm maye fare better therby longe gone herde mayster astronomy say affirme youthe shulde haue moche shulde escape fro many daungerous parelles wherfore haue dyuers ymagmacyons howe might without growe reason flauders thanked god busynesse realme fraunce standethe right good poynte duke bretayne craftie subtell man hath hadde alwayes herte rather englysshe frenche wherfore wyll requysite ye kepe noble men good townes bretayne loue amyte wherby yeshall breke parte entet prayse greatly breton alwayes haue serued helpte kepe realme fro myne ennemyes wyll ye make lorde clysson costable thynges consydred se man mete offyce seke maryage sonne charles almaygne entent alyaunce might stronger ye well vnderstande aduersary kyng englande wyll mary haue alyaunce poore people realme ar sore oppressed tourmented therfore putte away shortely ye thynges though haue sustayned greueth ryght sore lyeth heuy courage great alyance haue ye good townes bretayne hath caused forbere fightynge longe haue done kynge spake dyuers wordes whiche canne nat resyte rehersall duke aniowe absent kyng douted hym bycause couytous thoughe kynge dyde absent hym houre dethe putte hym farre fro busyness realme fraunce yet duke aniowe thought medyll neuer lesse absence alwayes messangers comynge goynge bytwene paris anger euer reported hym certayntie kynge brother also duke secrete person alwayes kynge whome knewe euery thynge day kynge dyed paris nere kynges chambre thought prepare himselfe ye shall nowe wyll pursue mater touchyng englysshmen goyng bretaygne p lorde mauuoyson taken prisoner englisshemen lorde hagest skaped dethe kyng charles fraunce fifte name cap ccc lxvii whan erle buckyngham yongest sonne kyng edward thirde departed fro forest marcheaunoy rode towardes uandon forest colombiers rode gyder sir thomas triuet sir willyam clynton xl speres aduenture encountred way lorde hangest comyng fro uandone xxx speares englisshmen knewe incontynent frechmen ran feirsly frenchman sawe ouer matched thought nat therfore abyde also nat farre fro uandone rode thyderwarde fast myght englysshmen ouer throwen speare sir robert hangest cosyn lorde hagest john mo decryes syxe takene prisoner lorde hangest came barryers opyn happe entred therat toke speare tourned hym defence right valiantly englysshmen hadde twelfe prisoner day de forthe sir robert ca company encountred ye lorde mauuoyson defendyng selfe right valiantlye howe finally sir robert canoll toke h owne handes daye hoost passed uandone wente ausey next day saynt cales ther rested two dayes went pount uolayne thus englysshmen rode forthe founde man spake agaynst cou trey full men warre great nombre cytie mauns duke ou rode towres tourayne bloyes orlyaunce came parys knowledge howe brother kynge laye great ieopardy nat likely scape wherfore thought dyeng men armes kepte styll garysons pursued theng ysshmen men armes fraunce ordayned trouble englysshmen moche might thynkynge enclose countrey amysshe coude fyght aduantage whyder frenche kynge wolde nat made passage ryuer sartre thought englysshmen shulde passe great defence brought thyder great pyle wode dra e downe force ryuer wherby man coude passe also yssuinge ryuer made great depe dyke coude passe erle buckyngham copany departed fro pount uolayne came ryuer sartre rested coulde fynde passage ryuer great depe yuell passe certayne place vowarde rode longe ryuer coulde fynde passage pyle driuen water lordes lyghted aduysed well passage sayde must ned passe waye wyll go farther therfore let v go force drawe pyle thanne ye shulde haue sene lordes knyghtes squyers entre ryuer aduenture toke great payne r coulde gette pyle howe finally drewe opyned passage great payne nowe ye may co ydre french men pursewed knowen dede might haue th great age formast coude nat haue ben ayded came bycause great mary hadde past moche dyde englysshe men passed ouer came noyen ryuer sartre p day englisshmen passed ryuer sartre charles frenche kynge dyed house saynt poule parys soone duke io brother knewe eyen closed toke seased kynges iewels whiche without nombre dyde put saue kepynge behoue thynkyng came right well passe ayd hym warres thought make wrote hym selfe kynge cycell pulle calabre h erusalem frenche kynge caryed cytie parys open visage discouered bretherne two sonnes behynde hym abbey saynt denyse buryed right honourably lyke maner hadde ordayned lyfe tyme sir bertram clesquy constable laye fete though kynge charles lyfe tyme well ordayned gouernyng realme howe shulde haue ben ordayned yet duke aniou folowed nothinge ordynaunce toke hym incontynent gouernynge reygned aboue bretherne howe wolde charles nephewe shulde kynge wolde haue gouernyng realme aboue bycause eldest none fraunce durst saye agaynst hym thus kynge dyed myghelmas anone discease lordes frauce aduysed sone halowen tyde wolde crowne yonge kyng charles reynes coronacy thre vncles kynge well agreed saye duke aniowe duke berrey duke burgoyne myght haue gouernynge realme tyll kynge came age one twetie yeres sware noble prelate fraunce knowledge coronacyon yong kinge gyuen outwarde partes duke brabant duke aubert bauyer erle sauoy erle bloyes duke guerles duke julyers erle armynake erle foim duke barle duke lorayne lorde coucy erle dolphyne auuergne styll pursute englysh wherfore nat sent coronacyon erle flaunders desyred coe thyder day assigned alhalowen day whiche sondaye fell yere dethe frenche kynge gaunt ryght sorie dyde moche good warre loued lytell erle flaunders p nowe let v speke englysshmen leaue coronacyon frenche kyng p howe englisshmen arryued bretayne howe duke excused hym selfe long taryenge fro cap ccc lxviii season englysshmen knewe hynge parell frenche kyng passed ryuer loyre lodged nogen departed wente porle two leages fro sable power france cite ma therabout dyde nothynge alwayes coosted englysshmen sayde wolde fight theym whan tydynges came amonge theym howe frenche kyng deed purpose broken dyuers lordes returned fra ce herken tidynges englysshe men lay styll thre foure dayes departed went saint peter auren fro then argens next day hoost passed ryuer mayenne thorough mary great payne coulde nat passe two thre front space two leages frenchman knowen therof assayled vowarde ewarde coude na haue gyuen mane helpe englysshmen doubted moche passage howe beit passed came cosse four dayes alwayes hope newes bretaine duke bretayne hanybout marchesse uannes herde often tymes worde englysshemen howe aproched nere bretaygne wyst nat well demeaned whan dethe frenche kyng shewed hym lette soone ouerpasse loued hym lytell sayd hym rancoure hate realme fraunce bycause kynge charles nowe deed minisshed one halfe haue hated father haue loued right well sonne haue made warre father hath ayeded sonne howe must acquyte trewely agaynst englysshmen come hyder request haue passed thoroughe realme frauce therfore must kepe haue promysed one harde poynt vnderstande good townes bretaygne closed fast wyll nat suffre entre thervpon duke called counsayle hym lorde mounboursyer sir stephyn guyon sir wylliam tanneguy sir eustace houssey sir geffray caiemelle le ewe lyon sayd sir ye shall ryde mete erle buckynghame aprocheth nere countre bretaygne thynke ye shall mete nat farre hen wherfore go recomaunde hym salute lordes say vnto th fro shortly wyll reyns mete therfore lette take way ther shall togyder take aduyse shall contynue forthe shewe fynde nat countre poynt whan sent england wherwith ryght sore displeased specially nauntes rebell knyghtes departed message rode towarde nautes company fortie speares englysshmen departed fro cosse entred forest grauell passed throughe came uyter bretayne ther better assured thanne knewe well shuld pursued frenchemen fro then wente chateau briant ther rested bycause comynge duke knightes thyder uhe erle buckyngham lordes englande receyued sayde knightes messangers duke bretayne right honorably toguyder great counsayls englysshmen sayde howe great marueyle duke bretayne countrey nat otherwyse aparelled apered receyue seyng come thyder request taken suche payne passe thorought realme fraunce lorde mounboursyer spake resydue excusynge duke sayde lordes ye haue good cause reason saye ye duke great wyll kepe acomplysshe ordynaunces couenantes made hym accordynge power canne acordynge wyll specially canne nat rule nautes whiche kay bretaygne nowe rebelles haue determyned receyue towne menne warre frenche partie wherof lorde duke gretly marueyled first alyed theym selfe good townes bretaygne haue taken parte also lorde thynketh haue made newe treatie aliance newe yonge frenche kynge shall crowned halowmas next comyng wherfore sir lorde desyreth holde hym excused moreouer ye wyll take way towardes reynes thyder wyll come hauyng great desyre se wyll natte fayle wordes greatly contented erle buckyngham englysshmen sayd howe duke coulde saye better duke messangers retourned agayne hanibout uannes duke englysshemen taryed castell briaunt foure dayes departed came subbarbes reyns gate cite closed wolde suffre man armes entre cytie erle buckingham lorde latymer sir robert canolle sixe lodged within cytie duke cousayle taryed fyftene dayes abydinge duke bretayne came nat wherof hadde great marueyle within cytie reyns lorde mon teraulewe lorde mountforde bretaygne sir geffray quarmell sir alaye de la houssey capitayne reynes sir eustace brother dayly excused duke bretayne canne nat say whyder hadde good cause nat englysshmen began nat well content bycause duke came nat nauntes kepte cytie close nat well assured englysshmen lodged reynes wherfore sente duke aniowe made treaty shewyng hym howe nat stronge theselfe kepe defende cytie shulde haue assaut without wolde sende men armes desyringe hym request agreed foure duke hadde realme gouernaunce aniowe berrey burgoyne burbone sent thyder mo sixe hundred speares good men armes men estate gret valure thus nauntes well coforted men armes entended repayre towne poyntes bringe case able resyst assaut gyuen therto englisshmen beyng reynes therabout began murmur grudge agaynst duke bycause came nat tha determyned sende vnto hym sir thomas percy sir thomas tryuet ordayned go duke fyue hundred speares conducte dyscouer many archer departed thursdaye hoost saturday erle buckyngeham wente lodged saynt sulplyces bretaygne taryed thre dayes went cabore taryed foure dayes duke bretayne departed fro hanybout come uannes euery daye knewe demeanyng thenglysshmen owne menne suche determyned thynges consydred speke acordynge honour suche alyaunces made coude lengar driue vnderstode howe sir robert canoll sir thomas percy sir thoms tryuet comyng towarde hym toke way go reyns day departed fro uannes met englisshe knightes made great reioysynge eche felde duke demaunded tidynges therle buckyngham knihgtes answered sayd howe left hym reynes right marueylously displeased bycause herde worde fro hym duke excused hym selfe sayd howe faithe lesse troubled rode toguyder welcome uannes knowledge howe englysshe hoost dyslodged fro cambre comynge towardes hayde mauseyre helde waye next day therle buckyngham duke mette ther shewed great loue bytwene ther duke right honestly excused hym selfe therle theglisshmen taryed long sayde cause bycause founde nat countre well disposed trusted wherfore coude nat kepe promyse made englysshemen begynnyng somer answered erle sayde fayre brother bretayne ye wyll wyll nat abyde shall correcte rebel ayde puyssance ye haue toguyder day lye maye come v englande shall bringe vnder yor subgettes suche wyse shall happy whan may coe axe mercy suche wordes long toguyder talkynge eche theym drewe lodgynge next daye rode toguyder determyned erles counsayle shulde go reynes duke ther coclude mater night duke bretayne erles counsayle abode mauseyr erle returned hayde next day duke wet reynes lorde latymer sir robert canoll sir thomas percy sir thomas try uet erles counsayle company thre dayes cousayling mater p howe duke bretayne englysshmen beseged nauntes coronacyon kynge charles sixt name scrimysshe done nauntes cap ccc lxix last counsayle acorded sworne holy euangelystes duke bretayne shuld come lay siege nau te erle buckynghams company within fyftene dayes comynge englysshemen
