thyder yt duke bretayne shuld bringe cause brought ryuer loyre plentie barge barkes sorer therby constrayne nautes duke men nat departe fro siege tyll towne wonne thynges conclude determyne therle buckyngham sent hayde present confyrmynge treatie came lodged subbarbes reynes done erle lordes entred reynes dyned duke duke solempnely sware faythe holy euangelystes wold come power nauntes thervpon departed went hanibout englysshemen abode reynes fyftene dayes orderyng busynesse mater naunt well enfourmed howe shulde beseged wherfore ordayned theym selfe redy receyne one greattest capytens within nauntes sir johan baroyes barres ryght valyant expert knight hym ther capitayne clesson johan castell moraunte morfonace sir johan maletrayt lorde tournemyn dyuers floure men armes prouyded wysely suche thynges wanted aswell ryuer gate towres suche parte thought siege shulde p nowe lette v leaue spekyng mater retourne coronacyon younge kynge charles fraunce tyme crowned reynes ye must knowe nothyng spared touchyng noblenesse coronacyon younge kynge charles fraunce crowned kyng sonday xii yere age yere oure lorde thousande thre hundred fourscore solempnyte coronacyon great bre great lordes foure vncles ther berrey burgoyne burbone also great vncles uyncelyn duke brabant duke bare ye duke lorayne erle sauoy erle de la marche erle ewe sir wyllyam de namure erle flaunders erle johan bloyes ercused selfe many great lordes whome canne nat name thus yonge kyng entred reynes saturday euensongtyme ryght well acompanyed noble mynstrelles special lye mo xxx trumpettes kyng alighted churche lady reyns vncles bretherne company also cosyns yonge gentylmen nauer labreth bare harcourt great nombre yong squyers chyldren two great lordes realme fraunce whome yonge kynge day coronacyon made knightes saturday kynge herde euensong churche lady vsage moost parte nyght newe knightes sonday ashalowen day churche richely apparelled highe masse solempnely sacred anoynted tharchbysshop reynes holy ampell wherwt saynt remy consacred clouis first christen kynge euer fraunce oyntment sent downe almighty god heuyn holy angell euersythe kynges fraunce hathe consacred therwith yet apereth nothyng touched whiche right worthy noble thyng kyng made yonge newe knightes went offyce ye masse right solempnely archbysshop reynes sange masse yonge kynge habyte ryall chayre lypt vp high apparelled clothe golde ye yong newe knyghtes lower scaffoldes fete couered clothe golde newe constable frauce sir olyuer clysson late chosen offyce dyde right well offyce aparteyned great lordes fraunce richely aparelled kynge sat magestie oyall right precyous ryche crowne heed church day full noblenesse man might nat remoued fete newe begynninge yong kyng reioyse therby people fraunce maner imposycions aydes gabelles fowages subsydies thynges yuell taken wherby realme hurt enpouerisshed vtterly layd downe sette part whiche greatly pleased people masse wet palais bycause hall lytell receyue suche nombre people made ye court palais hyghe great stage couered dyner ordayned satte yonge kyng fyue vncles brabant aniowe berrey burgoyne burbone table farre fro kynge archbyshop reyns prelat sat ryght hande great lord serued lorde coucy lorde clisson ser guy de la tremoyll admyrall ye see dyuers great courser trapped erthe clothe golde thus honour daye contynued next day many great lordes toke leaue kyng vncles retourned owne countrees day kynge went dyned abbey saynt therrey two leages fro reynes abbey shulde gyue hym dyner reynes day whan sacred thus ended feest coronacyon kynge charles fraunce kynge went parys greatly feested entre feest solempnyte great counsayle gouernynge realme ordayned duke berrey shulde haue gouernyng languedocke duke burgoyne picardy normandy duke aniou abyde kyng haue princypall gouernynge mynistracyon realme erle saynt poule repealed agayne fauour grace kyng charles last disceased duke aniowe duke brabant made peace reyns whose fauoure greatlye erle saynt poule departed fro hanne ryuer hewre bysshopriche leage hadde layne longe space retourned fraunce wyfe hym brought vnto castell bouhaygne put ocupyed land toke agayne owne profyte p nowe let v lytell leaue spekynge sayd mater retourne insydentes bretayne erle buckyngham ye knowe howe couenautes treaty made bytwene duke bretayne erle buckyngham besege nautes whan duke bretayne departed fro reynes lorde mounbrousyer sir stephyn guyon lorde houssey company rode uannes towarde hanyboute erle buckyngham company ordayned go sege nauntes departed fro reynes ther lodged went day lodged castell briant nexte day bayne thirde day tyeull fourthe lodgyng toke foubours nauntes erle lodged gate saluetout lorde latymer costable hoost lorde fytzwater lorde basset loged gate saynt nicholas ryuersyde sir wyllm wynsore sir hughe caurell lodged amonge folkes ryght honourably nere erle might within towne great bre knightes squyers bretaygne beause aniou mayne entended defende towne charge therof moche towne busynesse therwith saynt martyns nyght sir johan barroys barres styred moued company within towne sayde sir se well enemyes nere v yet haue nat waked therfore cousayle night go scrimysshe certaynly sir ye speke nobly shewe v ye wyll haue v shall gadered toguyder euenyng nombre sixscore choyse men opyned gate saynt peter constable lorde bassette lorde fytwater lodged frenchman set good order gate bycause retrayt capitayns company barrois barres johan castell morant capitayne clysson came hoost supper crye barres entred lodginges beate downe hurt many anone englysshemen raynged lodgynges whan frechmen sawe retourned kept theym toguyder ryght sagely retourned towne englysshmen came thyder scrymysshed ther entryng puttyng backe beatynge bothe party frenchemen entred barryers ther dyuers slayne hurt bothe sydes barroyes barres entred agayne towne lytell domage scrimyshe reputed well done bothe party saynte martyns daye nyght barroyes barres spake company sayde sir thinke well done yt tomorowe early toke sixe seuyn great barge two hundred men two hundred crosbowes let v go ryuer visyte ennemyes take lytell hede syde agreed nyght gote copany toguyder day entred besselles rowed downe ryuer toke lande besyde lodgynges sir johan harleston lodged therby great lodgyng brekyng day frenchemen rounde lodgynge assayled anone sir johan harlston company armed redy defece right valiantly archer shotte agaynst crosbowes sore scrimysshe dyuers hurt surely lodgyng ben taken conquered sir robert canoll nat ben lodged nat farre then company baner dysplayed came priuely parte also sir wyllyam wyndsore hadde knowledge therof copany came thyder styll englysshmen drewe fro partes frenchman drewe backe ryuer warde come vesselles retourne barge sore scrymysshe valiantly departed capitayns dyde great feates armes howe frechmen taken slayne drowned retourned nauntes moche herde enterprise reputed gret valure p lettes duke bretayne might nat come lege nasites scrimysshes made ca ccc lxx whan englysshmen parceyued howe na te woke often tooke counsayle kepe better watche fortuned night vii night barroys barres made scrimysshe yssued agayne night gate erle buckyngham lodged two hu dred men armes hundred crosbowes night almayns kept watche ther capitayns sir algars sir thomas rodes barroys dasshed watche hymselfe one first ther sore scrimysshe sore beaten lodged erle rose went scrimysshe whan frenchemen parceyued howe prease began encrease multyply withdrewe towardes gate scrimysshed euer wet ther dyuers hurt shotte bothe party specially sir thomas rodes knight almayne shotte ye bassenet heed whiche stroke dyed within thre dayes whiche great domage valyant knight frenchman breton entred agayne nauntes lytell domage taken sixe prisoner thus mater stode thenglysshmen euer made good watche euery night loked none thyng waked reysed fro rest thus therle buckyngham lay nauntes abyding dayly duke bretayne came nat promysed sworne nothynge kepte wherof erle hadde marueyle ment coude tidynges fro erle sent dyuers messangers letter wyng hym howe dyde yuell deuoure wolde nat kepe promyse made sworne acomplysshe cytie reynes letter therle sent hadde neuer none answere agayne englysshmen supposed messangers slayne waye bycause none retourned agayne truely great parell men without ben countre well acopanyed wayes bytwene nauntes hanybout sore watched none coude scape way without takyng shulde knowen whens came whyder wolde ye entent letter worde shulde go bytwene duke erle yf suche taken slayne also forager hoost durst nat ryde forthe great companyes knightes squyers countre assembled togyder wolde wyfe land shulde haryed ouerryden somtyme whan foude xx xxx englysshmen toguyder foragynge wolde sette take fro sore beate hurt wtout hauyng remedy wherwith hoost right sore displeased wyst nat whoe haue amedes say trouthe duke bretayne himselfe dyd asmoche coude bring ye men cou tre agreed go ley sege nauntes hym acordyng promyse made therle buckyngham coude nat bringe playnly sayde hym howe nother knight squyer countre wolde go hym helpe distroy owne countre warre englisshmen long englysshmen shulde abyde bretayne wolde neuer arme take parte duke demauded dyde consente sende thenglysshmen answered howe gyue feare frenchman ye shulde nat lese auncyent vsages rather thynge case frenche kyng wyll nothyng good wyll make hym warre answere duke coulde nat haue parte lorde clysson constable fraunce lorde dynant lorde de lauall vicont rohan lorde rochforde great lordes bretayne toguyder closed fast townes caused well kept sayd duke caused shewed hym messangers howe shulde well aduysed dyde sayeng howe simply cousayled sende englysshmen make warre distroy owne countre promysinge hym howe shulde haue conforte yf went nauntes lay siege promysed englisshmen whiche ought nat haue done wolde distroy landes party put hym suche trouble shulde nat knowe well wolde knowledge putte hym selfe vnder obeysaunce frenche kyng ought sayde wolde best make peace yonge kynge sayeng also howe haue corage agaynst kyng charles nowe deed wyll come abyde loue son moost highest lordes bretaygne duke thus serued moche duke wyst nat say coude fynde sure astate people wherfore behoued hym disseble alwayes sege lay styll nauntes lady daye aduent nyght frenchman went counsayle determynynge awake hoost nyght bycause longe lyen styll yssued oute towne two hundred speares wherof sir almery clysson cosyn germayne lorde clysson lorde amboyse capitayns gouernours entred hoost wher sir wyllm wynsore lodged issued gate richbourge night sir hughe caurell kepte watche tyme lorde amboyse made knight sir almery clysson made hym knyght men armes frenchman breton cae fierse wyll first comyng wan barres watche whiche kept sir wyllyam gysenton sore scrimysh many man ouerthrowen sir willm wyn sore sir hughe caurell beyng tentes heryng noyse armed cae thyder ye chiefe noyse bothe party fought valiantly frenchman breton entred agayne posterne richebourge wher issued wtout great domage taken knyght prisoner ten armes men ther thre taken p scrimysshe barrois barres almery clyssone made christmasse euyn agaynst englysshmen beyng nauntes cap ccc lxxi monday ygyll christmas yssued nauntes euenyng gate sauetout sir barrois barres lorde solette sixscore men armes came dasshed erle buckynghams lodgynge nyght erle domestre kept wathe great scrimysshe many ouerthrowen englysshmen byggerr thanne frenchman wherfore driuen backe baryers gate byforce ther slayne taken xvi slayne englysshe knight called sir hughe tytiell stryken bassenet wherof dyed euery man drewe lodgynges done yt nyght frenchman determyned agayne make scrimysshe christmas night withall power kept en prise secrete therle buckyngham englysshmen awaked often tymes breton frenchman beyng wtin nautes also forager feldes great payne serchyng vitayle forage horse durst nat ryde great companyes therle company great marueyle duke bretayne cae nat herde maner ridynges fro wher nat content foude euer worse worse feble couynaunt kepte hym wyst nat whome complayne shulde right determyned christenmas sende agayne duke sir thomas tryuet sir robert canoll sir thomas percy uannes hanybout shewe duke fro erle dothe yuell deuoyre hath nat acquyted selfe otherwyse tha hath done agaynst howbeit apoyntment broken sayd among thyng consydered ymagined thought might nat eblysshe hoost siege yt coude nat go duke without wet toguyder went fyue sixe hundred speres togyder happe mete thousande shulde yuell matche dout wolde nat depart fro hoost kept selfe toguyder christmas euyn night ye barrois barres sir almary clysson page duplicate page duplicate orde damb lorde destolet cha clysson john castelmorant n within nautes issued te sayut e gret desyre trouble company vi hundred men armes whan without gate two partes one toke way strete feldes let lodgynge lorde latymer lord fitzwater kept watche nyght sir wylliam renton first comyng wan bayles watche droue backe great force constable lodgynge lorde latymer ther taryed lorde uertaynes lodgyng great skrymishe great assaute frenchman determyned haue taken agreat dauger takynge watche moche socour came sir fitz waren lorde uertayne sir nycholas trayton dyd many great feat armes constable marshall enfor ed themselfe come thider sowned trumpettes armed sir wylliam sir hugh caurell harde ye noyse trompettes knewe voward sory sowned trumpettes made great baners lyghtes displayed baners came thyder hundred men armes many archer also sir thomas triuet sir thomas percy lorde basset euery man vnder owne standerd came scrymisshe tyme vowarde great nede ayde lykely haue loste lodgynges whan lordes knightes come frenchman reculed backe gyder right sagely drewe backe towardes towne skrimysshyng done many noble dede armes frenche knyghtes aduentured selfe auaunce renowme ladyes sake soo sir tristram de la aylle taken prisoner folyshe hasty enterprise squire haynalte called thierry sommayne uhus contynued scrymisshe moost parte frenchman entred nauntes howe beit suche dedes armes euer slayne hurt taken yet retourned great domage many prisoner englisshmen hadde went lodgynges whan gate cllosed tha caused hurte men dressed likewyse hoost drewe lodgynges yet brake nat watch rather made stronger watche dyd cristmas day feestes nothynge doone howe beit englysshmen euery nyght loked waked scryes yet ye thyng touched coude tydin ge duke bretayne vitayls forage soo scant moche payne gette howe within towne hadd ynough came tyuer loyre oute good countreys poictou xaynton rochell p howe englysshmen departed fro seige nauntes fayre excuse duke bretayne made erle buckynghame cap ccc lxxii whan erle buekyngham englysshe men bene longe siege nauntes aboute space two monethes foure dayes parceyued well yt duke bretayne kept nat promyse comynge tha determyned dislodge fro then go uannes speke ye duke knowe entent dislodgynge knowen hoost disoged next day neweres day rode forthe ordre batayle lyke maner dyd whan past fraunce first nyght departure lodged niorch taryed thre dayes refreshe bycause bridge broken moche trouble make agayne gette ouer cariages yet made hoost passed ryuer uolayne saturday wente loged loheacke taryed two dayes fro then grosy ther taryed two dayes next day passed ryuer aust brydge brehaigne taryed fayre playne countre day departed passed ryuer cytie uannes enformed countrey howe erle buckynghame englisshmen coming lodge towne wist nat whyder suffer entre towne nat went hanybout duke daye came towarde hanybout mette duke feldes within two leages uannes comyng thyder whan duke sawe men uannes comyng warde demaunded tydinges whyder went sir tydinges shewe ynowe sir erle buckynghame englisshmen comynge yonder entencyon enfourmed lodge good towne uannes sir loke please without comaundement wyll thyng sir haue made agayne brydge brehaigne whiche broken ryuer aust whan duke harde studyed lytell sayd sir nat frayde haue dought euery thynge shalbe well ynough suche men wyll hurte ame bounde certayne treaty whiche must nedes vpholde acquyte trewely therin wyll go uanes morowe thynke wyll come thyder go mete ye erle brother moche honoure canne bounde moreouer ye shall cousayle ye shall offre present hym keyes towne say vnto howe towne redy receyue howe beit desyre sworne yt within xv dayes required departe wyll departe yelde agayn ye keyes towne counsayle wyll gyue burgess answered sayd sir shall ye haue ordayned soo rode forthe duke uannes duke lodged nyght englisshmen nyght lodged saynt johans lytell village two leages fro uannes nyght erle buckynghame receyued letter fro duke wrote hym kynde brother welcomyng march uannes next mornynge whan erle hadde harde masse toke horse copany rode good ordre towarde uannes towarde fyrst erle batayle rerewarde folowyng erles batayle thus met duke bretayn yssued uannes mete space great leage whan mette made eche great honoure reuerence metynge whiche right honourable rydyng toguyder erle right hande duke left erle began say saynt mary fayre brother bretayne long space hath bene haue taryed nautes siege ther abydynge accordyng treaty couenant made bytwene halfe yet ye came nat faythe duke coude none otherwyse wherwith ensure greatly displeased howbeit coulde nat amende men cou trey thynge coulde shewe vnto alyaunces requestes hadde made yet wolde neuer go siege nau te kept selfe stronge fronters lorde clisson lorde dynant lorde dornall vycount rohan lorde rochforde kepe thentreis issue bretayne suche ioyned well knyghtes prelate burgess good townes ar nowe rebell agaynst wherwith ame greatly displeased sythe faulte ye fynde vntrewe sir shall shewe ye shall doo nowe harde wynter colde cuyll season kepe hoost gyder ye shall come uannes abyde tyll aprell maye refreshe shall ordayne place company passe tyme well ye may somer weshall reuenge v mater erle answered sayde god wyll sawe well wolde none otherwyse duke brought hym uannes entrynge towne comen people came erles presence sayd sir bycause reuerence great signory noble honoure wyll nat agaynst entryng towne sir apease people towne surety ye shall swere vnto v holy euangelyst within xv dayes ye required departe towne ye suffre done v maner domage hurt fayth erle buckynghame ame content swere kepe fulfyll lordes sware othe fayne doo el haue lyen feldes thus erle buckynghame lodged eytie uannes hym selfe lay duke house pleasaunt fayre castell handyng within towne named motte company lodged towne subbarbes duke bretayn company went asnotte bode somtyme came uanes se erle comen hym lorde latymer lorde fytz water sir thoms percy sir thomas triuet vowarde lodged towne hambout neuer came within gate laye subbarbes feldes sir robert canoll lorde fitz waren diuers shulde haue lodged towne called ouyn percorentyn wolde neuer open gate wherfore fayne lodge subbarbes feldes thus endured suffered season great dissease pouerty nat worth thre pen solde xii penny yea worse somtyme coulde get nothynge money horse dyed pouertie colde wyst nat whyder go foragyng whan went great parell neighbour enemyes vicount rohan tyme march uannes two stronge castelles one called cayre lynguisshant two castelles great garysons layde vycount whiche dyd moche trouble englissh forager helpe garysons pertayning lorde clysson castell josselyn montagu moncountour suffred duke bretayne sayde howe coude nat amende tyme constable fraunce lorde clisson made warre frenche kyng countre great nombre men warre wherfore englysshmen durst nat departe one fro another thynges consydered howe lodged feldes without defence great marueyle hadde hurt uannes coude nat lightly haue reskewed lay campernell hanybout numpercorentyne say trouthe duke went betwene defended power shulde nat distroyed sayde cousayle howe febly acquyted hym towarde erle buckyngham seyng suche promyse made vnto season parys kyng foure great lordes sent duke bretayn purchase peace say vicont rohan sir charles lorde dynnant sir guy lorde de lawall sir guy lorde rocheforde foure lordes bretayne hadde entysed dyuers tymes duke sayng thus sir ye shewe selfe worlde howe corage englisshe ye haue brought countrey englisshmen wyll take fro herytage may get vperhande profyte pleasure haue loue ye beholde kyng nauer trusted moche suffred entre towne castell chierbourge neuer syth wolde departe kepeth owne herytage lykewise ye put closed townes wyll neuer depart agayne dayly wyll refresshed newe men beholde howe kepe styll brest nat mynde delyuer agayne whiche right herytage sir let suffice beloued owne men countrey wyll neuer renounce frenche kyng serue kyng englande sir wyfe englade wyll cause leue owne herytage hath cost moche payne gette alwayes abyde warr ye tha one man maye youre countrey close selfe agaynst sir leaue counsaylynge frenche kyng loued nat deed nowe yonge kyng fayre good bolde spiryte suche hath hated father nowe serue sir shall make peace sette acorde ye shall abyde lorde duke bretayne great puyssance let englisshmen returne home owne countre wordes suche sayd baron shewed duke dyuers tymes nyghe conquered wylles howe yet fayned dissymuled frenche kynge counsayle englysshe men also tyll myght se ende warre shulde come vnto secrete treatyes foure barones bretayne made parys kyng vncles erle buckyngham barones englande knewe nothyng tyll conclusyon taken perceyued departed bretayn done nautes dede armes erle buckynghame wherof shall make mencion mater nat forgotone season gawen mychaell jaques cathore dyd dede armes therle buckyngham dyuers lordes knight squyers cae thyder se fra ce came thyder fro march caunoy bloys moche sir raynolde thowars lorde pousances barowne poyctowe spake wordes lorde uertaygne sayd gladly woldedo dedes armes hym thre course speare thre stroke axe lorde uertaygne wolde nat refuce request accorded therto wolde incontynent haue delyuered hym soeuer profyte domage shulde take therby erle buckyngeham wolde nat suffre commaunded knight nothing speke ther howe wordes enterprise armes abode styll purpose two knightes lyke wordes ther spoken day squyer sauoy called bastarde clarens edwarde beauchampe sonne sir roger passed well one lykewise bytwene galoys daunoy sir wyllm clynton bytwene sir hoyan dareyns sir wylliam franke thus erle buckyngham lodged subbarbes nauntes knyghtes squyers fraunce within nauntes thane lorde uertayne syde requyred apealed armes wolde come delyuer theym nauntes capitayns nautes nat agreed excused men said howe within nauntes soudiers sette ordayned kepe towne word passed ouer tyll therle buckingham came towne hanybout campelle quynpercoretyne whan come arestes sir raynolde thowars lorde barroyes barres sir hoyan darreynes great nombre knyghtes squyers came castell josselyne seuyn myles fro uannes constable fraunce also erle marche great nombre knightes frau ce wordes shewed costable enterprise dedes armes agaynst englysshmen constable herde well wordes sayd sir sende worde howe shall gyue saueconducte come dedes armes firste galoyes daunoy sir lyonell darreynes sende worde redy enterprise armes thre course horsebacke spear whan sir wylliam clynton sir wylliam frake vnderstode howe desyred sommoned dedes armes frenchman right ioyfull toke leaue erle buckyngham lordes englade go thyder thyder wente certayne knyghtes squyers company ther iusted right valiauntly bothe party dyde dedes armes ordayned sir rainolde thouars sir john castell morant bastarde clarens desyred lorde uertayne sir johan dambrety court edward beauchampe delyuer chalenge thre englysshe knightes good wyll go fight castell josselyne constable saueconduct dedes armes done therle buckingham bytwene englysshemen frenchemen answeres made haraldes saueconductes cap ccc lxxiii whane erle buekyngham come ua ne vnderstode frenchemens request answered sayde harauldes sir ye shall say constable therle buckynghame sendeth hym worde howe puyssaunt able gyue saueconduct frenchemen gyue englysshemen therfore suche desyreth dedes armes let come uannes shall gyue saue conducte come retourne bringe company suche shall please whane constable herde answere ymagined hym selfe howe therle buckyngham sayd trouthe howe reason shulde se dedes armes done nauntes well hadde sene dedes armes castell josselyne constable sayd erle buckynghame speketh lyke noble valyant knight sonne kyng wyll saythe suche wyll go thyder shall sende hym saueconducte theym knightes squyers made redy nombre xxx haralde came uannes saueconducte whiche gyuen sealed therle buckyngham departed fro castell josselyne thre knightes shulde dedes armes company cae uannes lodged subbarbes englysshe men made theym good chere nexte day apoynted fyght came fayre playne place without ye towne came thyder therle buckingham erle suffolke erle deuonshyre barownes co pany brought theym forthe shulde dedes armes firste lorde uertaygne agaynste sir raynolde thowars lorde pousances sir johan dambrety court agaynst ser trystram de lauall edwarde beauchampe agaynst bastarde clarens englysshmen toke one syde frenche men shulde iust fote armed peces bassenettes vysures good speres heedes burdeaux redy fight p foloweth feates armes ffirst lorde pousances poictou lorde uertaygne heynaulte two barownes great prise hardynesse came eche agaynst fote holdyng speares handes sparyng nothynge eche lorde uertaynge stryken nat hurte strake lorde pousances suche wise pearsed ye mayle brest theron blode folowed great marueyle nat worse hurt thane strake thre strok finysshed armes without domage went rested theym behelde came sir johan dambreticourt hey nalt agaynst sir trystram de laualle poictowe dyde armes right valyantly without domage left came edwarde beauchampe clarens sauoy bastarde squyer ryght hardy stronge bygger membres thane englysshe man came eche agaynst mette great wyll strake eche brest suche wyse edwarde beauchampe ouerthrowen backewarde wherof englysshemen sore displeased whane vp agayne toke speare came agayne agaynst clarens mette agayne edwarde beauchape agayne ouerthrowen erthe wherwith theglysshe men sorer displeased sayd edwarde weake medyll frenche squyer deuyll hym iuste agaynst hym departed shewed howe shulde whan clarens sawe maner desyringe perfourme armes sayde lordes ye wronge sythe ye wyll edwarde shall sette stede may performe myne entprise erle buckynghame demaunded sayd shewed hym sayd frenche man spake valyauntly stept forthe englysshe squyer knight called jenequyn fetaceilles came erle kneled downe desyred myght perfourme batayle therle acorded therto jenken fetaceilles came forthe armed hym peces toke speare bastarde clarens mette eche foyned thrust sore eche speares flewe peces ouer heedes seconde coupe dyde lykewise thirde also speares broken lordes bothe party reputed dede goodly feate armes toke swerdes whiche right byg sixe stroke brake foure swerdes thane wolde haue fought ax erle wolde nat suffre theym sayde wolde nat se fight vttraunce sayeng done ynough drewe abacke came forthe one jeneken clynton englysshe agaynst one johan de castell morant frenche man made redy armes jenken clynton squier honour erle buckynghame ryght nere hym howe sclender small body therfore erle nat content shulde haue armes bygge aman johan castell morant putte toguyder assay came right rudely toguyder englyssheman coude nat endure agaynst frenche man foyninge englysshe man ouerthrowen erthe erle sayd howe nothynge euenly matched thanne came jenequyn clynton certayne erles company sayd jenequyn ye nat metely acomplysshe feate armes erle buckyngham nat content enterprise commaundeth go rest departed johan castell moraunt seyng maner sayde sir ye thynke squyer lytell deale sende another pleasure entent may performe myne enterprise el shulde villany also shulde haue wronge shulde departe withoute doynge dedes armes constable marshall hoost sayde ye say right well done sayd knight sir wyll delyuer knight whiche aunswered sir wylliam fermyton sayd shewe vnto knyght howe shall nat dethens without doyng dedes armes please lytell rest hym shall anone delyuered shall arme agaynst hym answere pleased moche john castell morant went satte downe rest hym anon englysshe knyght redy came place two knight cae fote eche agaynst rudely speares lowe couched stryke eche within foure quarter johan castell moraunt strake englysshe knight brest suche wyse ser wylliam fermyton stombled bowed fote lytell fayled hym held speare lowe bothe handes coude nat amende strake sir johan castell moraunt thighe speare wente clene throughe heed sene handfull othersyde sir johan stroke reled fell nat thane englysshe knightes squyers ryght sore displeased sayd foule stroke sir wylliam fermyntone excused hym selfe sayde howe sorie adueture howe knowen shulde haue ben wolde neuer haue begon sayenge howe coulde nat amende bycause glausynge fote constraynt ye great stroke sir john castell morant gyuen hym thus frenchman departed toke leaue erle lord toke lytter sir john castell moraunt brought castell josselyne great paryll dethe reason hurt thus ended dedes armes euery man drewe owne parte englisshmen uannes frenchman castell josselyn p howe duke bretaine made peace frenche kyng howe englysshmen retourned countrey dede ardone bytwene frenche squyer englisshe cap ccc lxxiiii dedes armes done whyle erle buckyngham lay uannes ther nothyng ought remembred hath ben sayd englisshmen laye uannes hanyboute camperle quynpercorentyne passed wynter well might dyuers great dommage ryght great daungers lacked vitayle theym selfe horse coude fynde forage countre tyme ye yere graunges barnes voyde odder spente frenchemen theym selfe sore wasted distroyed bycause ennemyes shulde haue ease therby daunger englysshemen longe frenchemen garisons fronters wherfore englysshmen durst nat ryde vitayle came englysshmen see frome corne wall frome gernesay fro ysle wight whiche somwhat conforted theym elles horse hadde dyed famyne hunger season parys kyng fro duke bretaygne uycount rohane lorde de laualle sir charles dynaunt sir guy rocheforde dyde purchase duke peace whiche agreed sawe well coude nat kepe promise englysshe men without wolde lese countrey entent erle buckyngham company passe ouer wynter marchesse uannes aswell might begynnynge somer retourne frauce make warr hadde sende worde state condycion kyng englande duke lancastre kyng englande counsayle thought erle buckynghams entecy right good wrote hym wolde shulde sende hym worde howe season wolde sende ouer another armye men warre lande chyerbourge thentet bothe armyes shulde mete toguyder wherby thought shulde great feate warr frauce frenche kynge vncles counsayle ymagined well poyntes also somwhat enfourmed therof say de also among theym secrete counsayle duke bretaynge townes toke parte englysshemen realme fraunce shulde thane haue moche foure barownes bretaygne representynge duke conceyued well busynesse layde forthe doutes specially shewed duke antowe hadde souerayne gouernynge realme fraunce tyme also duke aniowe entending make voyage within two yere shorter tyme poule calabre lothe vyage shulde haue ben broken lette therfore enclyned lightely duke bretaignes peace wolde become faythfull true homage frenche kynge agreed peace made also agreed shulde helpe englisshmen shyppes returne coutreis also agreed yt ye garison chierbourge hadde ben viage serue erle buckyngham wolde retourne lande garison shulde haue good saueconducte kyng go throughe realme fraunce without harnesse certayne knyghtes squyers englande company lyst departynge englysshemen bretaynge duke come fraunce kyng vncles faythe homage kynge duke bretayne ought naturall lorde frenche kynge mater written sealed suffyciently brought duke bretaygne marchesse uannes accorded men hadde done right yuell wyll knewe well coude nat without ye yuell wyll englysshmen whan knowledge treatie rae erle buckyngham englysshe men howe duke bretaygne agreed freche kyng therwith greatly displeased yuell content duke sayeng howe hadde sente come bretaygne neuer sythe came dyde neuer acquyte hym selfe trewely agaynst theym ought haue done wherfore sayd poynt trouthe hym anone duke bretaygne came uannes erle buckyngham shewed secretely howe menne made peace frenche kynge whiche fayne agree elles haue lost countre great wordes bytwene duke humyled hym selfe excused hym moche myght knewe well maner wronge howe fayne entente englysshmen shulde departe oute bretayne therle made cryed cyte uannes men dyde owe thynge towne shulde come forthe shall payed therle rendred agayne kayes towne burgess therof thaked pleasure done hym delyuered erle money shippes uannes hanybout camperle lodged erle buckyngham departed fro uannes xi day aprell baners displayed order batayle came hauyn thyder cae duke bretayne sir alayne housey lorde monbroiser sir stephyn gyon sir wyllyam tribiquidy sir geffray quaresmell dyuers duke counsayle sent erle shyppe desyringe hym speke duke erle wolde nat come agayne lande sent theym lorde latymer sir thomas percy two came spake duke bretaygne comuned toguyder space thre houres englysshmen promysed departyng wolde moche erle shulde speke another day retourued agayne shyppe shewed erle done duke anone myd night fludde came maryners wynde wyll demaunded erle wolde erle wolde haue speakynge duke sayde sir drawe vp ankers aueyle sayles lette v go whiche incotynent done thus departed englisshmen fro hauyn uannes sayled towarde englande dyde englysshmen fro hauyns came toguyder see p nowe lette v speke knightes squiers retourned chierbourg lande recorde aduentures fell waye constable fraunce castell josselyn seuyn myles fro uanes gyuen safecoduct dyuers knightes englysshe nauerosse go lande garysone chierbourge knyghtes hadde serued erle buckynghame sayde voyage amonge sir fitz waren sir wyllyam clynton sir johan burle departed fro uannes toke way castell josselyn lodged towne without castell thynkinge dyne departe whan alyghted lodgyng certayne companyons castell knyghtes squyers came se men warre often tymes wyll specially englysshmen french men amonge frenchemen squyers good man armes parteyninge lorde burbone erle marche one loued entierly called johan boucmell bene tyme garyson boloyne sir wylliam bourdes frenchman agaynst garyson chierbourge whiche tyme bene dyuers wordes spoken dedes armes haue ben done bytwene hym englysshe squyer called nycholas clyfforde whiche nycholas present whan frech men come englysshmens lodgyng comuned toguyder behelde eche johan boucmell began speke sayde nycholas clyfforde nycholas dyuers tymes haue wysshed deuysed dedes armes toguyder nowe haue foude eche place tyme may accomplysshe nowe constable fraunce lordes present therfore requyre let v nowe haue thre course fote speare eche v agaynst nicholas answered sayde johan ye knowe ryght well nowe goynge waye saueconducte lorde youre constable therfore ye requyre nat nowe done nat chiefe saueconduct vnder knightes thoughe wolde abyde wyll nat frenche squyer answered nycholas excuse nat meanes let copany departe lyst promyse couenaunt armes one doone bytwene shall bringe vale chierbourge without domage ell make ye dout therof nycholas answered sayd thynke well ye wyll bringe thyder beleue trueth ye se well howe go throughe countre without harnesse haue none v yt though wolde arme haue nat wherwith answered johan excuse nat shall shewe ye shall haue harnes dyuers sortes comaundement shall brought place shall dedes armes beholde well chose whiche ye wyll shal arme whan nicholas clifforde sawe himselfe sore aposed sham fast cause present de mater sawe well howe john offered hym moche reason coulde nat honestye refuse hym moreouer johan sayde hym sir take parte couenaunt ye wyll shall nat refuse rather thanne shulde nat dedes armes tha nicholas sayd howe wolde take aduyse shewe mynde departed may nat nowe lordes vnder whome jame wyll nat agre therto promyse soone come chierbourg boloyne letre knowe comyng thyder shall incotynent come delyuer chalenge nay nay john seke respite haue offered yet offer many thynges honourable wyse ye departe auynge honoure without doyng dedes armes sythe requyre nycholas wordes sorer displeased sawe well trewe ye layd sore charge ther frenchman went castel englisshmen abode styll lodgynge dyned whan frenchman castell lytell speakyng wordes hadde ben bytwene johan bourmell nycholas clyfforde soo moche wordes therof came hearyng costable studyed lytell therat knyghtes squiers countrey desyred hym wolde put payne yt dedes armes myght done constable sayd content ther whan dyned englyssh knightes suche wolde departe went castell se ye coustable speke bycause shulde sende lest vii knightes conduct bretayne normandy chierbourge whan come castell constable receyued swetely sayd sir ja rest ye shall nat departe day tomorowe masse ye shall se dedes armes done bytwene squier ye shall dyne dyner ye shall departe suche guydes shall bryng chierbourge agreed hym dranke wyne returned lodgynge two squters johan nycholas aduysed well ye batayle must furnyshe next day next mornynge bothe harde one masse confessed slept horse lordes fraunce one parte englisshmen parte came gyder fayre playne place without castell josselyn taryed johan boucmell made redy two harness fayre good accordyng promysed englysshe squier sayde hym nycholas chose whiche ye wyll haue wolde noo wyse chose gaue fyrst choyse frenche squier tooke one armed hym therwith nycholas dyd helpe arme hym dyd lyke wyse agayne whan bothe two armed toke good speares one lenght eche tooke hys place came fayre pace foote eche agaynst whan shulde aproche couched downe speares fyrst stroke nicholas clyfforde strake johan boucmell one brest stroke dyd slyde vp gorget mayle speare heed dyd entre throte dyd cutte sonder orgonall vayne spere brake tronchion stacke styll squiers necke stroke wou ded dethe englisshe squier passed went sate downe chayre whan lordes sawe stroke sawe howe tronchyon stacke styll came hym toke bassenet drewe tronchion sone turned worde spekyng fell downe deed sodenly englysshe squier coulde nat come tyme ynough certayne wordes haue stauched hym wolde haue holpen whan sawe deed sore dyspleased bycause aduenture seyng howe shulde sle valyat man armes sene erle marche wold haue pyte se sorowe made squier loued hym entierly costable reconforted sayd suche dedes armes let man loke thynge el though yuell fortune fallen squier englysshman nat blame nat amende collable sayd thenglisshmen sir let v go byne tyme constable agaynst good wylles hym castell dyner wold nat breke promyse dethe squier erle marche wept piteously squier nicholas clifforde went lodgyng wolde nat dyne ye castell sorowe doute frenche squiers frendes constable sent behoued hym go castell whan come constable sayd certaynly nicholas beleue verely se well ye sory dethe johan bourmell jercuse ye nat amede god helpe bene case ye ye haue done nothyng wolde haue done myght better man greue enemy tha enemy shuld greue suche aduentures armes sate downe table dyned leysar dyner done wyne drouke costable called hym lorde barrois barres sayd hym sir make redy wyll ye shall conduct englysshmen chierbourg way open townes castels mynistre thynges necessary knight answered said sir ryght good wyll shall done toke leaue costable knightes present went lodgynge mouted horse departed fro castell josselyn rode pontorson mount saynt mychell vnder conduct gentyll knight barrois barres neuer left tyll cae chierbourge thus ye haue herde deted erle buckynghams army bothe see lande p nowelet v retourne busynesse flaunders season gaunt maynteyned selfe also erle flaunders lorde howe parceyuered agaynst made right sore cruell warre p howe warre began agayne twene erle flaunders flemynges ipre disconfyted busshement cap ccc lxxv trouthe erle flauders begynning feared lytell flemynges gauto thought well bring vnder wisedome armes lytell lytell specially sithe john lyon john prunaux deed gaunto great capitayns great affiaunce dyde counsell rase de harsell capitayne chatelayne gaunt johan bannoy capitayne courtrey capitayns johan bulle peter boyse arnolde clerke peter nuyte season stryne bytwene great men comons within towne bruges meane craftes wolde haue euery thing pleasure great men wolde nat suffre rebelled tertayne weyuers fuller slayne apeased great men bruges sente erle lysle desyringe hym goddes sake come theym chiefe lorde helpe subdue common erle gladde tidynges departed lysle sir wyllyam namure co pany great nombre knight squyers flauders came bruges wher r ceyued great ioye erles comyng ther taken principal hertes gauntoise suche suspecte put prison mo fyue hudred lytell lytell hee de stryken whan franke vnderstode erle peasably bruges feared put selfe erles mercy receyued great ioye dayly power increased also franke alwayes haue taken erles parte ydue flaunders erle seyng brought vnder subiection bruges franke vnder hym knyghtes squyers countre heynault arthoyse thought lytell lytell conquere agayne countrey punysshe rebel first ordayned sayd wolde go se ipre hated greatly bycause opened gate lightly theym gaunt sayd made treaty let enemyes slee knightes shulde repent might gette ouer hande made somos franke bruges sayeng howe wolde go ipre tidynges came ipre erle lorde ordayned hymselfe come assayle toke counsayle determyned sende worde therof theym gaunt thentent shulde sende men assyst towne ipre nat bygge ynough selfe kepe without ayde gauntoyse mysed sworne ayde whansoeuer nede sent couertly letter gaunt capitayns signifyed state erle howe thretned coe assayle gaunt remembred well howe boude fayth promyse ayde confort set two capitayns john bulle arnolde clerke sayd sir ye shall take thre thousande go hastely ipre confort oure good frendes incontynent departed fro gaunte thre thousande men came ipre wherof towne great ioy erle flaunders issued bruges great nombre men came tourande nexte day pourpringue taryed thre dayes tyll menne come aboute twentie thousande men warre gaunt knewe right well mater erle wolde go puissantly ipre determyned assemble puysaunce go courtrey ipre togyder fight therle sayeng myght one tyme ouercome shulde neuer releued capitayns departed fro gaut rase de harsell peter du bouse peter le nuyte johan de launoy dyuers centenyers cinquantenyers whan felde nyne thousande longe reiourned came courtrey receyued great ioye john de launoy capitayne therle flaunders beyng pourpringue therabout vnder stode gaunt comyng ipre co trey way erle toke aduyse helde company togyder gaut departed fro courtrey wente rolers rested sent worde theym ipre howe come thyder wyng wolde yssue towne power suche sent shulde togider men ynowe fyght erle whiche tidynges ipre right ioyfull next day issued mo viii thousande johan bulle arnolde clerke gouernours therle flauders power marchesse knewe howe ipre yssued towne mete gaunt canne nat tell howe meanes moche therle ordayned passage ye ipre must passe two great busshmentes sone hase bastarde flaunders lorde da ghien dyuers knight squyers flauders heynalt bruges franke euery copany ther x thousande men whan ipre gauntoise johan bulle feldes nat iourneyed past one myle founde two wayes one went rolers tourande rested toke aduyse whiche way shulde take arnolde le clerke sayd counsayle let v go se oure felowes rolers faythe johan de bull thynke better lodged mount dore sure knowe well peter de boyse rase de harsell sithe haue sent v surely wyll fyght erle wherfore sure wyll aproche nere hym therfore counsayle let v go way determyned take waye whan gone two myles wery goyng fote ware bytwene two busshmentes whan sawe cryed betrayed ther neuermen yt made lasse defence dyde euery man dyd coude saue selfe retourned ipre toke feldes fledde best might without array order erles men toke slewe without mercy howbeit john bulle arnolde clerke saued selfe fledde towardes courtrey mette gauntoise departed fro rolers way rosebeque whan peter de boyse sawe fledd demanded ayled answered sayd coude nat tell sayde nat leyser knowe mater sayd fledde lyke men betrayed peter de boyse dyuerse imagination go forewarde retourne agayne fleer fyght theyr ennemies chased orelles drawe courtray thynges consydered determyned drawe backe tyme whiche thought moost profitable drewe abacke batayle raynged good ordre day returned courtray thither also drewe many fled lodged within cortray made gate well kepte thentent shulde nat sodenly taken whan john bulle arnolde clerke returned rekened theyr people knewe well gaunte suche ben sent iper loste nombre xii c many iper bus hement chased fled iper cortray fewe skaped ben deed taken chased nat farre toke hede nothynge slee within theyr bushement whiche saued residue iper sore abasshed whan sawe theyr people returne beaten discofited day issued demauded howe myght dyuerse answered sayde howe john bulle betrayed brought shamfully slayne ye haue hard often tymes recorded howe harde warke apease commontie wha styrred say bycause gaunte whan day drawen backe courtray disco fytted knewe well john bulle towne mo thousand drewe together said let v go false traytour john bulle hath betrayed v hym noe toke way brought v bushement ennemyes beleued arnold clerke ben suretie wolde haue brought v oure owne company john bulle nat ben hath solde betrayed v brought v betrayed discomfytted loo ye may se howe comons accused hym treason yet thynke veryly cause ben sayd solde betrayed erle wold neuer haue returned agayn rather haue bydden styll erle howe nat excuse hym yt cost hym lyfe shall tell howe gauntoyse went toke hym lodgynge brought hym streat striken peces euery man bare awaye pece hym thus ended john bulle next day gauntoyse departed fro courtray returned gaunte dyd sende john de lanuoy castell gaures castell erles standynge ryuer lescaulte john made garyson p howe iper courtray turned erle flaunders parte howe towne gaunte besieged cap ccc lxxvi nowe let v speke erle flauders copany whan thus theyr bushement ouerthrowen gautoyse slayne iii aboute gaute iper erle determyned drawe towarde towne iper laye siege therto counsayled done drewe thither people great nobre knyghtes squyers flauders heynault artoys come thyther serue erle whan iper vnderstode erle came strogely sore afrayed ryche men towne toke counsayle sayd amonge selfe howe wolde open theyr gate go mete erle put selfe vnder obeysaunce crye hym mercy shewe hym howe gau toyse force reason comontie fuller weauers suche vnhappy people towne thought erle pytefull wolde haue mercy ordeyned dyd mo iii c company came towne iper keyes gate fell downe theyr knee erle cryenge mercy dyd put selfe theyr towne pleasur erle pite toke mercy entred puyssauce towne iper taried iii wekes sent home agayne frake bruges therle lay iper caused beheedded mo vii c fuller weauers suche maner people brought fyrst towne john leon gauntoyse slayne suche valyaunt men erle sette ther whiche cause erle sore displeased thentet yt shuld rebell sent iii c ye notablest prison bruges tha toke way courtray brynge towne obeysauce whan courtray vnderstode therle theyr lorde came strogely howe iper vnder obeysauce greatly doubted sawe comfort apparent fro graunte wherfore aduised lyghty yeld theyr lord thynkynge better hold therle ought owe theyr fayth homage rather gauntoyse ordeyned iii c best towne foote go ye feldes therle keyes towne whan therle came kneled downe cryed mercy erle pitie receyued mercy entred towne ioyously al made hym reuerence honor toke ii c best towne courtray sent lisle daway hostage tent towne shuld rebelle whan erle ben vi dayes went bruges refresshed hym xv dayes made great somons thentet lay siege gaute residue flauders commandement erle departed fro bruges came layd siege gaute lodged place called briet thither came erle ser robert namure serue erle certayne nombre men warre accordynge erle wrytte vnto hym syr william namure nat fraunce kynge duke borgoyn siege began feast decollacion saynt john baptist ser water danhien marshall oost flauders yonge hardy feared payne perill whatsoeuer fell erle lay thus towne gaute yet coude nat constrayne towne kept styll open iii iiii theyr gate yt vitayles myght come without dasiger brussels brabant right fauourable also liege coforte theyr opinion sent message sayenge thus ye good people gaunte liege knowe well howe ye soretrauayled haue moche erle lorde wherof sore displeased syrs knowe treuth dyd marche nere within iiii v leages shulde gyue suche comforte men ought theyr good neyghbours fredes ye farre fro v also countrey brabant betwene v wherfore must forbeare thought ye nowe besieged yet nat discomforted god knoweth doth good townes ye ryght warre wherfore busynes shall acheue better thus liege sent gaunte comforte therle flauders thus besieged towne gaute syde towardes bruges towarde courtray toward brussels therle coude nat come lay siege bicause great riuers say ryuer lyse ye ryuer lescault saye vnto thynges consydered gaute one strongest townes yt worlde behoueth mo tha ii c men besiege rounde stoppe fro ryuers passage also ostis lye nere together el coude nat coforte one another bicause riuers also ther moche people towne gaute dayes men defence iiii score meable beare harneis bitwene lx yere xv p whan therle layen siege space moneth men haze sone marshall made many askrymysshe gaut day wone day loste aduentures warre falleth therle cousayled day sende bruges iper pourprynge skrymysshe gauntoyse place called ye longe brydge thought yt myght wynne place shuld great aduautage profitte tha shulde entre iiii craftes therby aproche nere gaute ordeyned syr josse ualuin chief capitayne enterprise whan come passage foude nat disgarnisshed well prouyded great nombre men gaute peterdu voyse peter de nuytee rase de harzelles beganne sore skrymysshe shotyng gonne crosbowes party wherby dyuers slayne wouded right well gauntoyse dyd acquyte selfe reculed theyr enemy wanne force goldsmythes baner bruges cast downe water ther goldesmythes great nombre slayne hurte specially ser josse ualuin thereslayne whiche great vomage returned agayne without doynge gauntoyse bare selfe valiauntly p howe erle flaunders reysed vp siege fro towne gaute batayle betwene hym gauntoyse cap ccc lxxvii ourynge siege gaute many skrymysshes towne lorde danghien ye seneschall heynault haze flanders whan myght spy maner aduautage toke none rau tyme put abacke leyser loke behynde gaute drewe together bre vi rase harzelles arnolde clerke john launoy capitaynes departed gaute without daunger oste went alour good closed towne erle lyenge garison dyuerse knyghtes incontynent knewe comynge gautoyse fled towne gate towarde brussels el ben deed towne incontinent brent spoyled gauntoyse wherin conquered great pyllage fro thence went teremod stronge towne yet assaute conquered ther slayne ser philip namure gauntoyse lordes towne nat castell lord wyndscot kept valiantly gauntoyse went granmout whiche newly turned erles parte treatie lorde daghien nat tell whether treason nat ye gau toyse entred force many within slayne whan made voyage retourned agayne gaunte great praye pyllage p whan erle flauders sawe lost tyme lyeng siege gaute howe laye great coste charge great payn hym people sawe well within lefte nat hym issue bren coutrey knewe well howe conquered teremode granmont duryng siege therfore therle cousayled departe thence bicause wynter approched dyd sent people home theyr owne house refresshe sente lorde danghten lorde montigny warp garison beside ye men armes ii cc good archer englande wherof made great counte erle went bruges lay warpe made dyuerse skrymysshes gauntoyse issued nere hande euery day feldes none coude go gaunte brynge thyther vitayles marchaundise withoute slayne taken whan came monethe aprill wynter past erle assembled agayne people fro iper fro cortray fro pourprynge fro dan fro sluce fro franke departed fro bruges went nieule taried certayne space men armes made capitayne lord danghien erle nombre xx determyned go gawres john launoy whan knewe comynge erle sente worde therof gaute rase de harzelles ayde comfort rase assebled together vi issued oute gaunte wente towarde gawres foud nat john de launoy douze syde ryuer pylled countrey drewe together rode forth daye met warpe douze goyng toward therle gautoyse dyd assayle slewe vi c lorde danghiea nat company gone therle ye feldes betwene bruges douze wha tydynges came erle lorde danghien howe warpe receyued suche domage sore displeased ordeyned yt lorde danghien iiii shulde go gaures thynking fynde john launoy ther nat drawen backe gaunte pyllage prisoner whiche ther great quantite next day rase de harselles departed gaute vi john launoy hym also day issued gaunt peter du boyse vi arnolde clerke copany went brent suburbes courtray retourned towarde douse mete theyr owne company came late whan johan launoy rase harselles came nyeule founde erle copany redy felde abyding non thyng batayle therles hoost gauntoyse founde eche without knowledge mornynge whan rase harselles john launoy sawe must nedes fight set men thre batayles euery batayle two thousande men moost hardyest gaunt peter du boyse arnolde clerke many abrode felde knewe nothynge copany erle nere togyder shulde fight dyd ordayned among departed fro gaunte founde therle hole puissauce shulde nat fyght hym without toguyder thought theymselfe nat bygge ynoughe encountre erle without toguyder one batayle sworne vpholde saye trouthe rase harsels might haue let batayle lyst wolde haue kepte himselfe styll towne haue taryed tyll peter du boyse hadde come hym erle wolde nat haue assayled theym towne shortely as one rase de harsels knewe therle incotinent great pride yssued felde sayd howe wolde fight enemyes haue honoure hymselfe nat abyde peter du boyse company great trust owne company good hope fortune gaunte thought coude lose nothyng well shewed ye day great wyll hadde fight ye shall reatly therle flauders reioysed whan sawe rase harsels issued nieule abrode ye felde redy fight therle ordred men nombre xx thousande xv hundred speares knightes squyers flaunders heynalt brabant artoyse heynault lorde danghien marshall hoost hym lorde motigny lorde bastarde da ghien gyles ryston johan burlemont dyuers flaunders ther lorde guystels sir guy guystels ye lorde cornettes lorde hulluc lorde halwyn sir danyell halwyn sir tyrrey disquetan sir johan discoubourcke lorde gentus sir johan uillayne sir gerarde mortigiliet dyuers ther made certayne newe knightes yong seneshall heynalt dyed bedde aubyes besyde mortayne therle made fyue batayls euery batayle foure thousande men euery man great desyre ron enemyes day lorde lieurghien bare therles baner whan batayls well ordred fyue batayls aproched agaynst thre batayles gauntoyse first settynge aproched thre erles batayles two wynges comfort bataylles nede requyred erle hym selfe prayed copany well deuoyre take vengeance outragyous gauntoise putte hym moche payne also sayd good townes sir ye sure flye away ye better slayne without mercy shall coost heedes therle set bruges first batayle frake seconde ipre courtray thirde propigne bergues cassell bourge fourthe batayle retayned hym selfe lyle doway andwarpe thus assembled batayls cae eche agaynst gauntoyse rase harselles ledde first batayle hardyest therfore wolde formast thentent get honour coude encountred agaynst batayle bruges ledde lorde guystell brotherne sore encountre batayls assembled toguyder ther many ouerthrowen one te thother gau toyse dyd many proper dedes armes erle farre greatter nombre thre agaynst one ther good assaut long endured coude knowe sene shuld haue better whan batayls ioyned togeder flaunders cryed lyon decofortyng eche thother cryed highe voyce gaut gaunt one tyme erles company adue ture haue worse lost grounde ben slayne without remedy peter de boyse vi hym feldes might well se ye batayle coude nat come thyder comfort ayde company bycause marisshes water bytwene therle lost felde men fledde peter de boyse shulde haue met none shulde haue scaped erle shulde outher haue ben slayne taken whiche shulde haue ben great domage flaunders likelihod neuer haue recouered agayn p howe gautoyse brent churche nieule howe white hodes slewe dyuers noble erle flaunders parte cap ccc lxxviii rase harsels john launoy none auau tage assaylinge erles men erle many noble knight many goodman bruges ipre courtray andwarpe danne sluse franke also erle foure men agaynst one whan erles batayls assembled toguyder many gauntoyse coulde nat endure opyned reculed towardes towne nieule assone brake array erles men entred among slewe heapes gautoyse reculed towardes mynster nieule whiche stronge holde ther great slaughter entryng gauntoyse mynster john de launoy abasshed discofyted entred mynster saue selfe went steple suche copany coude get hym rase de harsels abode behynde reculed company dyde great feate armes dore finally striken longe pyke body slayne p thus ended rase harsels ben great capitayne gaut agaynst therle gauntoyse loued hym greatly bycause wysedome prowes valyatnesse ende rewarde whan therle flau came mynster sawe howe gauntoyse fledde churche comau ded sette fyre mynster comaundemet shortely done fyre fagottes strawe set togyder rounde churche fyre anone mounted vp couerynge mynster dyed gauntoyse great payne brent quicke suche issued slayne cast agayne ye fyre johan launoy steple seinge hym selfe poynt brent cryed without raunsome raunsome offred cote whiche full florens saue lyfe without dyd laughe scorne hym sayde hym johan come windowe speke v weshall receyue make leape lykewise ye haue made v leape wtin yer yt houeth make leape wha john launoy sawe selfe poynt yt without remedy fyre toke hym nere yt sawe well shulde brent thought better hym slayne brent helept wyndowe amog enemyes ther receyued speres swerdes cut peces cast gayne fyre thus ended john launoy sixe thousande men rase de harsels johan de launoy gaut gaut suche serued gautoise wage ther scaped away alyue thre hundred resydue slayne dyke thefelde towne brent mynster peter de boyse great batayle felde coulde nat ayde bytwene batayle rase de harselles great mary moche water wher fore coude nat come departed fro place well raynged good order batayle sayde lette v go fayre easely towardes gaunt rase harselles johan launoy copany hath spedde yuell disconfyted nat say shall fall v yf folowed assayled erles men let v kepe v togyder let v fight valyatly lyke theym fight right herde hym said wolde departed toke way towarde gaut fayre bataile well rainged good order fledde fro batayle retourued gaunt shewed aduenture howe rase harsels johan launoy company discomsyted slayne batayle nieule whan gaunt herde tidynges sore afrayed sorousull dethe rase welbeloued great trust hym euer founde good capitayne true bicause rase gentylman borne sonne alorde lady serued trewely money loued honoured towne demaunded come thyder flyeng fro felde wher peter de boyse durynge felde nat sene hym knewe nat answered sayd nat tell wher sawe hym nat tha towne gaunt began murmure agaynst peter de boyse sayde howe yuell aquyted hym selfe nat felde seyng sixe men warr towne determyned soone peter du boyse shulde returne wolde slee agre lorde therle put mercy beleue doone thus done wisely thynke sortlye haue come peace dyde nat thus whiche derely bought like wyse dyde countre flaunders yet day euery thynge nat ought flauders whan bataile nieul done erle vnderstode peter du boyse great batayle gauntoyse styll abrode feldes goynge gaunt erle demaunded counsayle whyder shulde go fyght nat lordes knyghtes aunswered hym howe done ynoughe daye howe men wery nede rest counsayled sende fyue sixe hundred men armes pursue se dyde sayeng howe paraueture myght happe fynde enemyes lodged night suche place wolde loke dislodgynge mornyng erle content cousaile done anone apoynted shulde go copany lorde daughien chefe capitayne deted fro nieuie rode vnder couert se demeanour gauntoyse laste sawe gauntoyse wher disceded downe hyll kepynge selfe close good order lorde danghien copany pursued farre one syde peter de boyse gautoyse sawe well made semblant sayd peter de boyse company sir lette v kepe way breke none order yf come v let v receyue theym thynke wyll nat medyll v thus rode tyll came gaunt lorde daghien retourned erle peter de boyse company entred gaunt peter du boyse receyued poynt haue bene slayne bycause nat holpen rase de harsels batayle nieule peter de boyse excused hymselfe sayd howe sende rase wyse shulde fight erle without company bycause erle great puissauce rase dyde clene contrary therfore though yuell become hym nat therwith sir knowe surely sorie moche displeased dethe man may towne gaunte hath lost hym right valyant man sage capitayne therfore conuenyent seke another discrete sage good renome el let v put selfe vnder obeysace erle shall distroye v make v dye villayne dethe beholde nowe chose ye wyll outher perceyuer cotynue haue done el put v erles mercy ther none answered hym batayle nieule dethe rase de harselles excused bycause gaue hym none answere sayde sore dyspleased mynde specially nat content burgess ther present best moost notablest towne sir guysbert grut sir symonde brette made semblant shewed well displeasure yere past yeshall whan lorde daghien lorde montigny hase flaunders route retourned nieule erle shewed sene therle departed went bruges sent home people good townes sende franke lorde daghien warpe whan gaunte vnderstode erle gone backe bruges people departed fro hym styrring mouyng peter de boyse gaunt drewe togyder sayd sir let v go forwarde let v nat colde make warr let v shewe ourselfe lyke people entprise deted gaut mo fyftene came strongly courtray layd siege towne whyle feest processyon bruges whiche yere lorde thousande thre hundred lxxxi ten dayes bret subbarbes countrey whan erle herde therof sente gentylmen garisons comons ipre franke departed fro bruges nombre xxb thousande toke waye towardes courtray fyght gauntoyse reyse siege whan peter de boyse gautoyse herde erle comyng warde great nobre determyned lenger kepe siege departed went lodged douse nieule sayeng howe wolde abyde erle sent worde estate gaunt sent rerebande entent stronger haue people departed agayne fro gaunte nombre xv thousande came company nieull douse lodged togyder feldes abydinge erle whan erle come harlbecke besyde courtrey vnderstode gauntoyse departed wardes gaunte lodged nieule douse erle cousayled nat pursue gaue leaue men departe sent lorde daghien heynowers bastarde sonne hase flauders warpe garyson whan gauntoyse sawe therle came nat departed fro nieule fro douse toke highe way warpe come gaunt daye passed sente warpe certayne nombre men arnolde clerke capitayne barryers towne scrumysshe within towne knightes squyers within coulde nat absteyne theselfe came scrimysshed ther hurt slayne dyuers bothe party last departed entred gaut euery owne house thre dayes arnolde clerke ordayned go gaures xii hundred whyte hobes lye castell ther maner countre garysone agaynst warpe thyder went arnold clerke copany nat ben ther long vnderstode certayne knyghtes squyers issued warp seke aduentures arnolde clerke departed fro gaures xb c layd selfe busshment mete yt issued mornynge warpe wherof dyuers gentylmen lorde cornayse lorde remseles sir johan uyllayns lorde danghien galoys mamynes bastarde cornayse blancharde calemey knight squyers retournynge warpe busshment brake ther dyuers slayne hurt ouerthrowen gautoyse toke non mercy ther knightes squiers horse dyde good seruyce broched spurres horse retourned warpe barrier towne lighted put selfe defence abyding company var lettes yet coude nat entre clene slayne mo thre score arnolde clerke retourned lodged night abbey therby called chem abbey foude peter destonehoyr galoys mamynes c copany arnolde clerke assayled abbey great payne galois mamynes saued hym selfe departed backe posterne entred bote night tyme went warp shewed lorde danghien lorde montigny sir danyell halwyn knightes ther night arnolde clerke whyte hodes thabbey chem slayne dyuers company said howe thought verily peter destonehoix slayne dede arnolde clerke copany made leape wyndowe ther receyued wt glayues slayne whiche great domage p howe white hoodes capitayn slayne phylyppe dartuell chosen capiteyn gaunt cap ccc lxxix whan knightes squyers yt within andwarpe vnderstode arnolde clerke whyte hodes nombre xii hundred abbey chem take ther dyuers companyons right sore displeased determyned sende night spyes se myght fynde enemyes next mornyng ordayned dyde mornyng spyes brought report howe white hodes determyned abyde day wherwith lordes knightes right ioyfull armed theym lorde daghien lorde motigny lorde bresuell sir michaell de la hamarde mo tha sixe hudred knight squiers heynalt many flauders warpe thre hudred speares mo thousande crosbowes varlet whan aproched nere sent sir olyuer chem hundred speares hym begyn assaut entent drawe abbey arnolde clerke ocupy tyme whyle fote men crosbowes come theym sir danyell sir peter disquemake hase flauders came abbey chem cryed flau ders lyon bastarde gauntoyse nat ware busshment bycause early nat fully redy arnolde clerke coude bringe men toguyder good arraye lorde danghien lorde lens lorde bresuell lorde cornayes lorde montigny batayls entred behynde towne cryeng danghien set gauntoise whyte hodes valiauntly coulde nat endure brake order yt slayne abbey feldes xi hudred xii hundred arnolde clerke slayne two pike flyeng layd vp leanyng agaynst hedge disconfytur lorde danghien knyghtes retourned warpe dede reputed great prowes whan therle flauders knewe tidyng greatly reioysed sayd lorde da ghien fayre goodson shulde proue noble valiant man say trouthe lorde danghien honour countie ol flaunders whyle therle lay bruges called nat onelye cosyn also fayre sonne whan knowen gaunte arnolde clerke deed men discofyted many sore abasshed said among selfe besynesse proueth yuell lytell lytell capitayns men slayne thynke haue done yuell moue warr thus lorde dothe minysshe v thus lytell lytell yuell wyll hatered twene gylbert mahue johan lyon turneth great domage trowe haue longe sustayned opinyons johan lyon peter de boise haue brought v depe warr hatered erle lorde nowe nat knowe nat howe fynde remedy haue mercy peace yet wer better xx xxx dyd repent thane hole towne thus dyuers yt sayde eche priuely durst nat speke generally dout yuell one sect daylye encreased puissaunce begynnynge poore companyons without substauce golde syluer ynough whan neded coplayned capitayns well herde coforted anone riche men towne shulde sent whan come feare durste nat refuce capitayns wolde say sir behoueth good towne gaut make shyft pay soudyers aydeth helpeth defende kepe iurysdictyons fraunchiese behoueth companyons muste lyue wolde aske euery man lyst selfe none durst saye nay hadde incontynent shulde haue bene slayne borne hande howe bene traytours good towne gaunt loued nat welthe honoure profyte therof thus knaues yuell dysposed people maysters good towne gaunt contynued long warre bytwene erle flauders lorde say verye trouthe thoughe ryche noble men good towne gaut thus beaten suche roddes ther ought none rie therof coude nat excuse themselfe theyr owne fautes cause theyr owne trouble reason proueth howe whan therle flauders sende baily haue done iustyce certayne rebel euyll disposed people myght lyst abydden hym haue gyuen hym confort doyng iustice whiche dyd nat semed hadde leauer mater gone yuell dyd rather well rather haue warr theyr owne lorde tha peace well myght knowe warre yuell people shuld lordes towne shulde theyr maisters nat put downe agayne whan wolde proued well john faucell entent dissymule mater departed towne gaunte went dwelte heynaulte wherby thought pourged blame warre bytwene therle towne thynkynge beare blame neyther party howe matier layde charge dyed therby whiche great domage john faucell tyme right sage noble wyse hard haltynge lordes theyr cou sayles se clerely man coude well ayde cousayle touchyng hym selfe coude nat take best waye nat say whyder culpable nat artycles examyned lyle ser symon rayn knyghtes yuell fortune turned agaynst hym dyed like wyse fallen capitaynes gaut susteyned rebellion agaynst theyr lord also hath coste syth many ma lyfe gaut parauenture many one defaulte p whan peter du boyse sawe towne gaure dayly enpaired febled well theyr capitayns theyr men sawe well howe riche men began waxe wery mynde leaue warre wherfore doubted greatly imagined well meanes worlde coude peace made erle shuld besure lyfe remebred hym selfe john lyon maister studyed meanes wrought saw well coude nat thynge alone nat wytte vnderstandyng gouerne hole towne gaute wherfore thought wolde nat haue pryncypall charge folisshe enterprise thought couertly haue study remembred hym selfe man whiche nat greatly taken hede towne gaut wyse man wysdome nat knowen nat taken hede tyll day called philip dartuell sone jaques dartuell tyme vii yere togyder gouernaunce countie flauders harde peter du boyse john lion maister dyuerse auncient men gaunte often tymes saye countrey flaunders neuer loued honored feared tyme jaques dartuell whiche endured space vii yere hard dayly gau toyse say howe whan jaques dartuell lyued theyr busynes good estate sayd might haue peace wyls erle glad whan might v peter de boyse remebred well wordes hym selfe sawe jaques dartuel sonne called philip right couenable gracious man quene englande lay gaut sege turney godmother loue named philyp peter de boyse euenynge came philip abydynge mother house lyued honestely theyr rente peter de boyse began reason hym began open mater wherfore come hym sayd thus philyp ye wyll take good hede wordes beleue counsayle wyll make greattest man countie flau ders howe syr sayd philip shall shewe sayd peter ye shall haue gouernynge mynistration towne gaunte nowe great necessyte haue souerayne capitayne good name good renoume meanes father jaques dartuell shall ryse agayne towne remembraunce euery man saythe syth dayes countrey flaunders hath nat ben loued honored feared lyued shall lyghtly set stede ye lyst selfe whan ye auctorite ye shall gouerne selfe counsaile tyll ye haue ful vnderstandyng euery case whiche ye shall soone lerne tha philip mannes state naturally desyred auaunced honored haue tha answered sayd peter du boyse ye offre great thynge beleue state ye speke swere faythe shulde nothynge without cousayle peter answerd said howe say ye beare selfe high cruell amonge comons specially suche thynges shall haue man nothynge worthe without feared doubted tyme renowmed crueltie thus must flemynges gouerned ama must set lyfe men haue pitie therof lyues swalowes larkes whiche taken season eate fayth sayd philip ca right well well sayd qd peter shall make ye shalbe soueraygne aboue therwith toke leaue hym departed nyght passed next daye came peter du boyse came place assembled moo iiii secte tydyng knowe howe shulde ordered shulde chief capitayne gaunte present lorde harzelles moche busynes within gaunte ordred goynge outward wold nat medle amoge named dyuers persones towne gaut peter de boyse stode styll harde well spake openly sayd sir beleue well ye say ye speke good affection great deliberation corage ye haue kepynge honour profite towne also suche persones ye haue named right able haue well deserued haue parte gouernynge towne gaute s knowe one wyll medle therwith thynke ther shulde nat meter man therfore better name peter desired shewe name named hym sayd sir philip dartuell cristened saynt peter towne gaunte noble quene england called philip season jaques dartuel tournay kynge englande duke brabant duke guerles therle heynault whiche jaques dartuell philip father gouerned towne gaute coutrey flaunders well neuer well ruled syth haue hard say dayly auncient men knowlege therof say towne neuer well kepte syth tyme flaunders great iopardie lost wysdome recouered ser knowe truthe ought better loue braunches membres cometh high valiant man soone peter du boyse sayd wordes philip dartuell entred euery man courage said one voyce let v haue hym wyl haue none go send hym nay nat qd peter du boyse let hym nat sent fore better went hym knowe nat yet howe wyll maynteyne hymselfe let hym first examyned p ordynaunce gaute warre spaygne por tyngale cap ccc lxxx peter du boyse wordes ther dyuerse folowed came house phylyp dartuell knewe right well theyr comynge mater lorde harzell peter du boyse peter le mite x xii chief alderman craftes shewed phylyp dartuell howe good towne gaunte great daunger withoute myght haue capitayne souerayne without within might ordre al maner people abidynge gaunte wherfore said gaue al theyr voyces hym dyd chose hym theyr soueraygne capitayne good renome name loue good father better cotent hym wherfore desyred hym affectuously wold take hym charge sware vnto hym fayth trouth theyr lorde promysyng euery body within towne shuld vnder obey sauce philip vnderstode well theyr wordes requestis right sagely answered sayd sir ye require great thyng thynke ye remebre nat well howe case standeth whan ye wolde shuld haue gouernynge towne gaute ye say loue pdecessors father draweth prpose al suice father dyd yet last slayne among shuld take gouernyng ye speke last slayne shulde haue small rewarde philip quod peter du boyse past nat recouered worke counsayle ye shall alweys well cousayled euery shall prayse sayd philip wold loth wyse taken vp amonge brought market place made hym assurauce mayres alderme maisters euery crafte gaunte thus philip made chief capitayne al gaute thus begynnyng great grace spake swetely euery man thynge hym delt wysely euery man loued hym parte reuenues perteyned erle flauders gaut heritage caused distributed lorde harzels bicause gentylnes honestely mainteyne estate euer flaunders without towne gaunte loste clerely p nowe let v leaue lytell speke busynes flaunders let v somwhat speke englande portyngale ye haue harde well howe kyng henry castile drsseased eldest sone john crowned kynge wyfe crowned quene doughter peter aragon warre beganne betwene kynge fernando portyngale kynge castile certayne occasion betwene specially dealynge ladyes constance isabel doughters kynge dampeter fyrst maryed duke lancastre seconde erle cambridge kynge portyngale sayd howe kyng castile wrogfully withoute cause disherited two cosyns castile nat suffred suche two noble ladyes shulde dysheryted fro theyr heritage matier myght rone longe shulde forgoten wherby ladyes shulde neuer recouer theyr ryght whiche thynge sayd wolde nat suffr seynge one theyr nexte kynsmen wel loue god kepe reason justice whiche sayde euery noble man ought entend inclyne defied kyng john castile crowned kynge spaigne galise castile cyuyll thus kynge portyngale made hym warre sayde article kynge john defended hym ryght valiantly agaynst hym sent froters garison great nombre men armes resist agaynst enemyes begynnynge lost thynge right sage good knyghtes frauce hym comsorted hym greatly warris gaue hym good counsaile begue uilames ser peter sone sir john bergettes ser william lignac ser water puissac lorde taride ser john ser tristram roy dyuerse gone thyther erle buckingham ben britayne freche kynge great aliaunce confederacions kynge castile wherfore kynge portingale aduysed sende certayne messangers england kynge vncles thentent haue ayd hym suche wyse myght able maynteyne hys warre agaynst spaignardes called hym wyse valiant knyght great lord called john ferrande hym shewed entet sayd john ye shall beare letter credence englande nat sende better messanger none knoweth well besynes frace ye ye shall recommende kynge letter shewe hym howe susteyne cosyns theyr right spaigne galice cyuill wherfore say require hym sende vncle duke lancastre wyfe certayn nobre men armes archer wha come trust make good warre owne puissauce trust recouer heritage sir said knyght yo pleasur shall fulfyll message nat loge entred shyp voyage departed fro hauyn citie lissebone longe sayled arryued plommoth day houre tyde therle buckyngham arryued certayne vessel returned fro britayne englissheme sore fortune see lost iii theyr shippes charged men prouision flete sprede abrode great storme wynd arryued great perill iii hauyns englande comynge knyght oute portingale therle buckyngham right ioyfull made hym ryght good chere demaunded hym tydynges shewed hym dyuerse thynges portyngale spaygne rode together tyll came good citie lodon kynge englande p whan therle buckyngha come londu cite made hym good chere went kynge westm ii vncles hym duke lancastre erle cakridge knyght portingale company whan kynge lordes knowlege hym made great semblant ioy greatly honored hym preseted letter kynge red presence vncles kynge tha dyd thynge counsayle vncles yonge knyght exammed bicause brought letter credence demaunded cause comyng portingale englande answerd sagely shewed mater ye haue harde whan lordes well vnderstande hym answered sayenge kynges name thanke cosyn ye kynge portingale putteth hym selfe foreward besynes maketh warre agaynst aduersary requireth reasonable wherfore shall hastely haue ayde kynge shall take aduise howe shall ordered mo wordes knyght straunger loue tydynges yt brought pleasaunt duke lancastre erle cambridge feasted dyned kynge taried space xv dayes tyll vtas saynt george ye kynge vncles thyther comesyr robert namure se kyng make relef helde kynge inglande parliament counsaile assigned westm shall tell well besynes portingale whiche newe mater truce expired fyrst day june great counsaile prelate barones england howe shuld ordre mat mynd send duke lancastre portingale sayd farre longe voyage sende hym thyther went myght happe repent vnderstode scottes made great apparell entre england sothan determined theyr cousaile duke lancastre knewe well march scotland dealyng scottis thought wolde sooner fall treatie hym rather great lorde england howe scottes wolde hym erle cambrydge v c speares many archer shulde goo portingale duke lancastre coulde somoche scottes honour realme truce might endure iii yere myght well go portingale moneth auguste septembre kynge cousayle thought best therby enforce army hys brother also nother poynt wherfore duke lancastre went nat englande bicause kynge englande sente certayne messagers duke tasson arche bysshopp rauenne kynge almayne haue syster wyfe orelles knowe howe mater shulde stande ther longe treatye therof space yere englande bysshop saynt dauys syr symond burle haue conclusion matier myght counsayle accorded kynge lordes parliament brake vp poynt named wrytten barones knyghtes shulde go portyngale erle cambridge p howe erle cambrydge departed oute englande goo portyngale howe comons englande rebelled agaynst noble men cap ccc lxxxi duke lancastre ordered busynes departed fro kyng fro brethern goyng sware brother erle cambrydge returnyng scotlande wolde ordre busynes yt wold hastely folowe hym portyngale great cause lette thus duke lancastre departed toward scotland wt owne men laste parliamet holden london ordeyned ser ry percy erle northuberlade shulde wardeyn lande northuberland bysshopriche duram fro then wale ryuer seuerne departed fro loden go charge xv dayes duke lancastre departed also tha departed fro kynge fro therle buckyngham brother erle cambrydge go towardes voyage portyngale made prouysion ploumoth vstayled shyppes toke hym wyfe lady isabell sone john entent bryng portingale whiche accoplisshed wt erle cambrydge lordes first lord mathue gornay constable host lorde chanon robsard lorde john new castell lord wyllm beauchape marshall thost ye souldic lestrade lord barrere lorde chalebore sir willm helmon ser thomassymon mylles wyndesore sir john caderut diuers nombre v c men armes many archer lordes theyr men came ploumoth lodged abyding wynde lytle lytell shypped stuffe toke horse bicause way farre sondre bytwene englande lucebone portingale ye portingale knyght alwayes styll copanye taried ther iii wekes abydynge wynde contrary ja meane tyme duke lancastre went toward scotlande came cyte berwike next towne scotland england whan ther rested hym sent haralde armes scotland towarde baron ther shewyng howe come thyder speke march vsage ben wolde come treat send hym worde elles knewe ryght well harauld departed rode edenbourg wher kyng robert scotland therle duglas ye erle de la marc erle morette lordes scotland assembled together
