hadde knowledge duke lancastre comyng thyder treat wherfore assembled chife towne scotland ioynyng fronters england ther harauld dyd message well herde length aunswere well content duke speke harauld brought salueconduct duke company endure longe march comuned togyder thus harald retourned berwyke shewed howe hesped duke depted fro berwyke left uision behynd hym towne went rosebourge lodgyd next day went lodged abbey mamo ryuer yt abbey departed england scotland sundre duke taryed copany tyll scottes come monbanne iii lytle myle then whan come thyder sent worde duke thus treatie began bytwene ye scottes englysshmen whiche endured xv dayes ye meane season whyle treate ther fell england great myschife rebellion mouyng comon people dede england poynt haue ben lost without recouery ther neuer realme countrey great aduentur tyme bycause ease ryches comon people whiche moued rebellion somtyme dyd fraunce dyd moche hurt suche incidentes realme fraunce hath ben greatly greued marueylous thing poore foundacion myschife began englande gyue ensample maner people wyll speke therof enfourmed incidetes therof ther vsage england yet diuerse countreys noble men hath great frauches ouer comons kepeth seruage say tenautes ought custome laboure lordes landes gather bring home theyr cornes threshe fanne suage make theyr hey heaw wood bring home thyng ought seruage ther mo people englande realme thus noble men prelate arre serued specially countie bredpest sussetter bedford vnhappy people sayd countreys began styrre bycause sayde kept great seruage begynning worlde sayd ther bonde men wherfore maynteyned yt none ought bonde without dyd treason lorde lucifer dyde god sayd coude haue batayle nother angelles spirittes men fourmed similytude lordes sayng shuld kept vndre lyke best sayd wold lengar suffre wolde one labored dyd thyng theyr lordes wold haue wage therfor aswell imaginacion folisshe preest coutie rent called johan wall folysshe wordes ben thre tymes bysshop canterbury prison preest vsed often tymes sondayes masse whanne people goynge mynster go cloyster preche made people assemble dout hym wolde say thus aye good people mater gothe nat well passe englande shall nat tyll euery thyng co mon villayns gentylmen may vnyed toguyder lordes greatter maisters haue deserued shulde kept thus seruage come fro one father one mother adam eue wherby say shewe gretter lordes sauynge cause v wyn labour dispende clothed ueluet chamlet furred grise vestured poreclothe haue wynes spyces good breed haue drawyngout chaffe drinke water dwell sayre house haue payne traueyle rayne wynde feldes cometh labour kepe maynteyne estate called bondman without redilye seruyce beaten haue seuerayne may coplayne wyll v v right lette v go kyng yonge shewe hym seruage shewe howe wyll haue otherwyse el wyll prouyde v remedy go togyder maner people nowe bondage wyll folowe v thentent made fre whan kyng seyth v shall haue remedy outher fayrnesse otherwyse thus john wall sayd sondayes whan people issued church vyllages wherfore many meane people loued suche entended goodnesse sayde howe sayd trouth wolde murmure one another feldes wayes went togyder affermyng howe johan wall sayd trouthe archebysshoppe canterbury enformed sayeng john wall caused hym taken put prison two thre monethes chastice hym howbeit ben moche better begynnyng ben codempned perpetuall prison el haue dyed rather haue suffred hym haue ben agayne delyuered prisone bysshop conscience let hym dye whan johan wall prison retourned agayn errour dyde wordes dedes moche people london enformed suche great enuy riche suche noble beganne speke among sayd howe realme englande right euyll gouerned golde syluer taken fro theym named noble men thus vnhappy men london began rebell asse bled togyder sent worde forsayd countreys shulde come london bring theyr people promisyng howe shulde fynde london open receyue comons cytie acorde sayeng wolde moche kynge shulde nat one bondman englande promise moued kent essex sussex bedforde countreis rose came towardes london nombre l thousande capitayne called water tyler company jaques strawe johan balle thre chefe soueraygne capitayns heed water tyler dede tyler house vngracious patron whan vnhappy men began thus styre london except suche theyr bande greatly afrayed mayre london riche men cytie toke counsayle togyder whan sawe people thus comynge euery syde caused gate cite closed wolde suffre man entre cytie whan hadde well imagyned aduysed nat thought shulde therby put subbarbes great parell brent opened agayne cytie entred gate place hundred two hundred bytwentie xxx whan came london entred lodged yet trouthe thirde parte people coude nat tell aske demaunde folowed eche lyke beestes ye shepherdes dyde olde tyme sayeng howe wolde go conquere holy lande last came nothynge lykewise villayns poore people came london hundred myle lx myle l myle xl myle xx myle fro coutreis london moost part cae fro countreis beforenamed came demaunded euer kyng gentylmen countreis knightes squyers began doute whan sawe people began rebell though dout good reason lesse occasyon might haue bene afrayed gentylmen drewe toguyder aswell might p daye vnhappy people kent comynge london retourned fro canterbury kynges mother prince wale comynge pylgrimage great ieopardy haue ben lost people came chare delt rudely wherof good lady great doute lest wolde haue done vilany damosel howe god kept came one day fro caunterbury london neuer durst tary waye tyme kyng richarde son towre london mother founde hym hym erle salisbury archebysshoppe caunterbury sir robert namure lorde gomegines dyuers dout people yt thus gadered toguyder wyst nat demaunded rebellyon well knowen kynges courte people began styre house kyng cousayle dyde prouyde remedy therfore whiche great marueyle thentent lordes good people suche wolde nothing good shulde take ensample correct yuell rebellion shall shewe playnlye mater p yuell dedes come englande dyde kynges offycers howe sent knight speke king ca c c c lxxxii monday feest corpus christy yere lorde god thousande thre hundred lxxxvii people yssued oute house come lo speke kynge made fre wolde haue bode man englande first cae saynt thomas caunterbury johan balle thought haue founde bysshop canterbury london kyng whan wat tyler jacke strawe entred canterbury comon people made great feest towne assent toke counsayle go london kyng sende copany ouer ryuer thames essexe sussexe county stafforde bedford speke people shulde come farder syde london therby close london rounde kynge shulde nat stoppe passage shulde mete toguyder corpus christy day caunterbury entred saynt thoms churche dyde moche hurte robbed brake vp bysshoppes chambre robbynge bearing pyllage sayd chauceller englande hath good market gette toguyder richesse shall gyue v nowe accompte reuenues englande great profytes hath gathered sythe kynges coronacyon whan thys monday thus broken abbey saynt uyncent deted mornyng people canterbury toke way rochester sende people vyllages goynge beate downe robbed house aduocates procurer kynges courte archebysshoppe mercy none whan come rochester good chere people ye towne taryed sec e went castell ther toke knyght rule therof called sir johan moton sayde hym sir behoueth go v shall souerayne capitayne wyll haue knight excused hymselfe honestly shewed dyuers consyderacions excuse auayled hym nothyng sayde vnto hym sir johan ye nat wyll haue ye deed knyght seyng people fury redye slee hym douted dethe agreed toke hym agaynst inwarde wyll lykewise dyd countreis englande essexe sussexe stafforde bedforde warwyke euyn lyncolne brought knight gentylmen suche obeysance cansed go wheder wolde nat lorde molayne great barone sir stephyne hale sir thomas guysighen nowe beholde great fortune might haue come entente wolde haue distroyed noble men englande therafter nacyons wolde haue folowed haue taken fote ensample gaunte flaunders rebelled agaynst lorde yere parisyens rebelled lykewyse founde mallettes yron ther mo xx thousande ye shall herafter hystorie first wyll speke englande whan people thus lodged rochester deted passed ryuer came braforde alway kepynge styll opynions beatyng downe place house aduocates procurer strikyng heedes dyuers son long went forwarde tyll came within foure myle london ther lodged hyll called blacheth went sayd euer kynges men noble comons englande whan london knewe come nere mayre ye haue herde closed gate kept straitely passage order caused mayre called nicholas walworthe dyuers riche burgess cyte nat sect ther london vnhappy opinyons mo xxx thousande people thus beyng lodged blacheth determyned sende knight speke kyng shewe hym howe haue done wyll hym honour howe realme englande hath nat ben well gouerned greet space honoure realme comon profyte vncles clergy specially archebysshop caunterbury chau celler wherof wolde haue accompt knight durst none otherwise came ryuer thames towre kynge hym towre desyrynge tidynges seyng knyght comyng made way brought kynge chambre kynge princesse mother two bretherne therle kent lorde john holland erle salisburye erle warwyke erle oxenforthe archebysshop caunterbury lorde saynt johans ser robert namure lorde uertaigne lorde gomegynes sir henry sauselles mayre london dyuers notable burgess knight sir johan moton well knowen amonge one kynges offycers kneled downe kynge sayd right redouted lorde lette nat displease grace message must nedes shewe dere sir byforce agaynst wyll sir john sayd kyng say ye wyll holde excused sir common realme hath sente desyre come speke blacheth desyre haue none sir ye nede nat haue dout persone wyll hurte holde wyll holde kynge sir say wyll shewe dyuers thynges whiche shall ryght necessarie take hede whanne speke whiche thynges sir haue charge shewe sir may please gyue answer suche may apease may knowe trouth haue spoken haue chyldren hostage tyll retourne agayne theym without retourne agayne wyll slee chyldren incontynent thasie kyng made hym answere sayd sir ye shall haue answere shortely kyng toke counsayle best hym anone determyned yt next mornyng kynge shulde go downe ryuer water without fayle speke whan sir johan moton herde answere desyred nothynge el toke leaue kyng lordes retourned agayne vessell passed thames went blackeheth left mo threscore thousande men ther answered next mornynge shulde sende counsayle thames ther kyng wolde come speke answere greatlye pleased theym passed night well might fourthe part fasted lacke vitayle none wherwith sore displeased whiche good reason season therle buckynghame wale fayre herytages reason wyfe doughter erle northuberlande herforde voyce london howe amonge people sayd certaynlye howe sene hym amonge bycause one thomas companye man countie cambridge lyke erle also lordes lay plummouth go portyngale well infourmed rebellyon people thus began ryse wherfore douted lest vyage shulde haue bene broken el feared lest comons hampton wynchestre arudell wolde haue come wherfore wayed vp ancres yssued hauyn great payne wynde sore agaynst toke thesee cast ancre abyding wynde duke lancastre march scotlande bytwene morlane roseburg entreatyng scottes shewed hym rebellyon wherof doute knewe well lytell beloued comens englande howe tidynges yet dyde sagely demeans hym selfe touchynge treatie scottes erle duglas therle moret erle surlant therle thomas uer say scotes treatie knewe right well rebelly englande howe comen people euery parte began rebell agaynst noble men wherfore scottes thought englande great daunger lost therfore treaty styffer agayne duke lancastre counsayle p nowe lette v speke common englande howe perceyuered p comons englande entred london great yuell dyde dethe bysshoppe cauterbury dyuers cap ccclxxxiii mornyng corpus christy day kynge rycharde herde masse towre lodon lordes toke barge therle salisbury therle warwyke erle suffolke certayn knight rowed downe longe thames redereth wher disceded downe hyll x men se kyng speke whan sawe kynges barge comyng beganne showt made suche crye though deuylles hell ben amonge brought sir johan moton entent kynge nat coe wolde haue stryken hym peces promysed hym whan kynge lordes sawe demeanour people best assured drede kynge counsayled barownes nat take landynge rowed vp downe ryuer kyng demaunded wolde sayd howe come thyder speke said one voyce wolde ye shulde coe lande shall shewe lacke erle salisbury aunswered kyng sayd sir ye nat suche order array kynge ought speke wordes sayd kyng counsayled returne agayne towre lodon dyde whan people sawe enflamed yre retourned hyll great bande ther shewed answere howe kynge retourned towre london cryed one voyce let v go london toke way thyder goyng beate downe abbeyes house aduocates men court came subbarbes lodon whiche great fayre ther bete downe dyuers fayre house specially brake vp kynges prisones marshalse delyuered prisoner within dyde moche hurt bridge fote thret london bycause gate bridge closed sayenge howe wolde brenne subarbes coquere london byforce slee brenne common cytie many within cytie accorde drewe toguyder sayde nat let good people entre ye cyte felowes v therwith gate opyned people entred cytie went house satte downe eate drinke desyred nothynge incontynent brought euery manne redy make good chere gyue meate drinke apease capitayns john ball jacke strawe watte tyler wente london twentie thousande cae sauoy way westmynster whiche goodlye house teyned duke lancastre whan entred slewe kepars therof robbed pylled house wha done sette fyre clene distroyed brent whan done outrage left nat therwith went streight fayre hospytalle rodes called saynt johans brente house hospytall mynster went fro strete strete slewe flemmynges coulde fynde churche place ther none respyted fro dethe brake vp dyuers house lombardes robbed theym toke goodes pleasure none durst saye nay slewe cytie riche marchaunt called richarde lyon whome tyme watte tyler done seruyce frauce tyme rycharde lyon beaten hym whyle varlet whiche watte tyler remembred came house strake heed caused borne spere poynt cyte thus vngracyous people demeaned selfe lyke people enraged wode day dyde moche sorowe london agaynst night wente lodge saynt katherins towre london sayenge howe wolde neuer depart then tyll hadde kynge pleasure tyll accorded wolde aske acomptes chaucellour englande knowe good become leuyed realme without made good acompte therof shulde nat profyte whan done yuels straugers day night lodged towre ye may well knowe beleue great pytie daunger kyng suche forsome tyme vnhappy people showted cryed loude thoughe deuylles hell bene among euennynge kynge counsayled bretherne lordes sir nicholas walworthe mayre london dyuers table riche burgess ye night tyme shulde issue towre entre cyte slee vnhappy people whyle rest slepe thought many dronken wherby shulde slayne lyke flees also twentie ther scant one harnes surely good men lodon might well haue done ease house secretely frendes seruauntes redy harnesse also sir robert canolle lodgyng kepyng treasure sixscore redy comaudemet likewise sir perducas dalbret london moche ther myght well assembled toguyder eyght thousande men redy harnesse howe beit ther nothyng done resydue common cytie sore douted leest shulde ryse also common threscore thousande mo erle salisbury wyse men kynge sayd sir ye apese fayrnesse best moost profytable graunt theym euery thynge desyre shulde begyn thynge whiche coulde nat atcheue shulde neuer recouer agayne oure heyres euer disheyrited cousaile taken mayre countermaunded commaunded shulde nat styrre dyde comaunded reason cytie mayre xii alderman wherof nyne helde kynge thre toke parte vngracyous people well knowen whiche full derely bought friday mornynge people beyng saynt katheryns nere towre began apparell selfe crye shoute sayd without kyng wolde coe speke wolde assayle towre take byforce slee within kyng douted wordes counsailed shulde issue speke kynge sende shulde drawe fayre playne place called myleende wher people cytie dyde sport somer season kyng graunt desyred cryed kyng name soeuer wolde speke kyng let hym go sayd place ther shulde nat fayle fynde king people began departe specially comons vyllages went place went nat thyder nat one condycion ther desyred nothynge richesse vtter distruction noble men haue lodon robbed pylled princypall mater begynnynge whiche well shewed assoone towre gate opyned kynge yssued two bretherne erle salisbury erle warwike erle oxenforthe sir robert namure lorde bretaygne lorde gomegynes dyuers watte tyler jacke strawe johan ball mo foure hudred entred towre brake vp cha bre chambre last founde archebysshoppe caunterbury called symon valyant man wyse chefe chaunceller englande lytell hadde sayd masse kynge glottons toke hym strake heed also beheded lorde saynt johans frere mynour maister medicyn teyning duke lancastre slewe hym dispyte maister sergeant armes called john laige four heedes set foure logn speares made borne stretes london last set highe lodon bridge though ben traytours kyng realme also glottous entred price chambre brake herhed wherby sore afrayed sowned ther taken vp borne watersyde put barge couered conueyed place called quenes warderobe daye night lyke woman halfe deed tyll conforted ye kyng sonne ye shall p noble england great paryll haue ben dystroyed howe rebel punisshed sende home theyr owne house cap ccc lxxxiiii whan kyng came sayd place myleende without london put company two bretherne erle kent sir johan holande lorde gomegynes durst nat apere ye people whan kynge lordes ther foude threscore thousande men dyuers vyllages sondrie countreis englande kynge entred amonge sayd swetely ye good people kyng lacke ye wyll ye say suche vnderstode sayd wyll ye make v free euer selfe heyres landes called bode reputed sir sayd king well agreed therto withdrawe home owne house suche village ye cae fro leaue behynde euery vyllage ii thre shall cause writynges made seale theym seale whiche shall haue conteyning euery thynge ye demaunde thentent ye shal better assured shall cause baners delyuered euery bayliwyke shyre countreis wordes apeased well comon people suche symple good playne men come thyder wyste nat said well said desyre better thus people beganne apeased began withdrawe cyte lodon kyng also said worde whiche greatly contented sayde sir amonge good men kent ye shall haue one baners ye essexe another ye sussexe bedforde ca bridge germeney stafforde lyneche one also pardon euery thinge ye haue done hyder ye folowe baners retourne home house answered wolde thus people departed went london kynge ordayned mo xxx clerkes fridaye write dilygece letter patentes sayled kyng seale delyuered people whan receyued writynge departed retourned owne countreis great venym remayned styll behynde watte tyler jacke strawe john ball sayd people thus apesed yet wolde nat departe acorde mo xxx thousande abode styll made prese haue kynges writyng seale entetes putte cytie trouble suche wyse riche honest person robbe pylle house london great feare wherfore kepte house preuily fredes suche seruauntes euery man accordynge puyssaunce whane sayde people fridaye thus somewhat apeased shulde departe assoone hadde writynges euerye manne home countrey kynge rycharde came royall quene mother ght sore afrayed coforted well coulde taryed night yet shall shewe aduenture fell vngracyous people cyte norwiche capitayne among called guillyam lystre stufforde daye corpus christy people entred london brent duke lancaster house called sauoye hospytall saynt johannes brake vp kynges prison dyd hurte ye haue herde tyme assembled toguyder stafforde lynne cambridge bedforde germeney comynge towardes london hadde capitayne amonge called lystre came rested norwiche comynge caused euerye man ryse left villayns behynde cause rested norwyche shall shewe knight capitayne towne called sir robert sale gentylman borne grace reputed sage valyant armes valyauntnesse kynge edwarde made hym knight body one ye biggest knightes englande lyster company thought haue knyght make hym chife capitayne entente feared beloued sende hym shulde coe speke felde el wolde brenne towne knight consydered better hym go speke rather thane shulde outrage towne mounted horse yssued oute towne alone came speke whan sawe hym made gret chere honoured hym moche desyring hym lyght horse speke theym dyde wherin dyde great folly whane lyghted came rounde hym began speke fayre hym sayde sir robert ye knight man greatlye beloued countrey renowmed valyaunt man thoughe ye thus yet knowe well ye gentylmanne borne sonne villayne suche therfore coe v maister shall make great lord one quarter englande shalbe vnder obeysauce whan knight herde speke thus greatlye contraryous mynde thought neuer make suche bargayne answered felonous regarde flye away ye vngracyous people false yuell traytours ye wolde yt shuld forsake naturall lorde suche company knaues ye dishonoure euer rather ye hanged ye shall shall ende wordes thought haue lepte agayne vpon horse fayled styrroppe horse sterted away cryed sayde slee hym without mercy whan herd wordes let horse go drue good swerde began scrimysshe made great place hym pleasur beholde ther non durst aproche nere hym ther aproched nere hym euery stroke yt gaue cutte outher legge heed arme ther none hardye feared hym dyde suche dedes armes marueyle regard mo fourty thousand vnhappy people shotte caste hym vnarmed say trouthe bene yron stele yet muste nedes haue ben slayne yet dyed slewe xii hande besyde theym hurte finally stryken erthe cutte armes legges strake body peces ende ser robert salle whiche great dommage whiche dede afterward knyghtes squyers englad angry sore displeased wha hard therof p nowe let v retourne kynge saturday kynge departed fro warderobe royall went westmynster harde masse churche lordes hym besyde churche lytle chapell image lady whiche dyd great myracles kynges englande euer great truste confydence kynge made orison image dyde offryng lepte horse lordes kynge rode towarde london whan ryden lytle way lyft hande way passe without london p propre mornynge watte tyler jacke strawe john ball assembled company comon gether place called smythfelde euery fryday markette horse together affinite mo xx thousande yet many styll towne drynkynge makynge mery tauernes payed nothyng happy made beste chere people smythfelde theym kynges baners whiche delyuered theym daye glottons mynd ouerrenne robbe london daye theyr capitaynes sayde howe done nothynge yet lyberties kynge hath gyuen v v small profitte therfore lette v one accorde lette v ouerrenne riche puyssaunt citie essex sussex cambrydge bedforde arundell warwyke reedynge oxenforde guylforde linne stafforde germeney lyncolne yorke duram come hyther wyll come hyther wallyor lyster wyll bringe hyther fyrst lordes london haue possession ryches therin shall nat repent v leaue come wyll haue fro v thys counsayle agreed therwith kynge came waye vnware theym thought haue passed waye withoute london hym xl horse whan came abbaye saynt bartilmeus behelde people kynge rested sayde howe wolde go farther tyll knewe people ayled sayenge trouble howe wold repease agayne lordes hym taried also reason wha sawe kynge tarye whan watte tyler sawe kynge tary sayd people syrs yonder kynge wyll go speke hym styre nat fro hence without make signe whan make yt sygne come slee theym excepte kynge kynge hurte yonge shall hym lyst shall leade hym v englande shall lordes royalme without doubt dowblette maker london called john tycle hadde brought glotons lx doublettes whiche ware demaunded capitaynes shulde paye hym doublettes demaunded xxx marke watte tyler answered hym sayd frende appease yourselfe thou shalte well payed day ended kepe nere shall thy credytour ther spurred horse departed fro copany came kynge nere hym horse heed touched ye crope kyng horse first worde sayd syr kynge seest thou yoder people ye truly sayd kynge wherfore sayest thou bycause sayd commaundement haue sworne fayth trouth wyll haue theym good tyme sayd kyng wyll well watte tyler sayde thynge demaunded ryot beleuest thou kynge people many mo london comaudement wyll dete frome thus without hauynge thy letter sayde kyng ye shall haue theym ordeyned shalbe delyuered euery one eche wherfore good felowes withdrawe fayre easely people cause dete lodon entent eche village towneshippes shall haue letter patentes haue promysed wordes watte tyler caste eyen squyer kynge bearynge kynges swerde wat tyler hated greatlye squyer squier displeased hym wordes bytwene theym sayde tyler arte thou gyue thy dagger nay sayde squier wyll nat wherfore shulde gyue kynge behelde squyer sayd gyue hym lette hym haue squyer toke hym sore agaynst wyll whan watte tyler began play therwith tourned hande sayde agayne squyer gyue also swerde naye sayde squyer kynges swerde thou arte nat worthy haue thou arte knaue moo thou thou durste nat speke wordes moche golde qua tite yonder abbaye faythe sayd wat tyler shall neuer eate meate tyll haue thy heed wordes mayre london came kynge xii horse well armed vnder theyr cootes brake prease sawe harde howe watte tyler demeaned hym selfe sayde hym ha thou knaue howe arte thou hardy kynges presence speke suche wordes moche kynge began chafe sayd mayre sette handes hym kynge sayde tyler sayd mayre goddesname haue sayde displease yes truely quod mayre thou false stynkynge knaue shalt thou speke thus presence kynge naturall lorde commytte neuer lyue without thou shalte derely abye wordes mayre drewe oute swerde strake tyler great stroke heed fell downe feete horse soone fallen enuironed hym aboute wherby nat sene copany squyer kynges alyghted called john standysshe drewe sworde put watte tyler belye dyed vngracious people assembled perceyuynge theyr capytayne slayne beganne mourmure amonge selfe sayde capitayne slayne lette v go slee therwith araynged selfe place maner batayle theyr bowes theym thus kynge beganne great outrage howe turned beste soone tyler erthe kynge departed company alone rode people sayde owne men syrs none folowe let alone whan came vngracious people put selfe ordinaunce reuenge theyr capitayne kynge sayde theym syrs ayleth ye shall haue capitayne kynge rest peace moost parte people harde kynge speke sawe hym amoge shamefast beganne waxe peasable departe suche malicious euyll wolde nat departe made semblant though wolde somwhat tha kynge returned owne company demauded theym best done cousailed drawe feld flye awaye boote sayd mayre good thynke surely shall haue shortely comforte london suche good men parte pourueyed haue theyr fredes men redy armed theyr house meane tyme voyce bruyte ranne london howe vnhappy people lykely sle kynge maire smythfelde whiche noyse maner good men kynges partye issued theyr house lodgynges well armed came smythfelde felde kynge anone nombre vii viii thousande men well armed fyrste thyther came syr robert canoll ser perducas dalbret well accompanyed dyuers alderman london theym vi hundred men harneys pusant man citie kynges draper called nicholas bre brought hym great company euer came raynged foote ordre bataylle parte vnhappy people redy raynged makynge semblaunce gyue batayle theym dyuerse kynges baners kynge made iii knyghtes one mayre london sir nycholas walworthe syr johan standysshe syr nycholas braule lordes sayde amonge theym selfe shall se ennemyes wolde gladly slee v myght haue better hande v sir robert canoll counsayled go fight slee yet kyng wolde nat cosent therto butsayd nay wyll nat wyll sende theym commaundynge sende agayne baners therby shall se wyll outher fayrnesse otherwise wyll haue well sayd sir quod therle salysbury newe knightes sent knightes made token nat shote whan came nere speche might herde sayd s kyng commaundeth sende agayne baners thynke wyll haue mercy incontinent delyuered agayne baners sent kyng also commauded payne heedes suche letter king bring forthe tosende agayne kynge many delyuered letter nat kyng made torne presence soone kynges baners delyuered agayne vnhappy people kept none array moost parte dyde caste downe bowes brake array retourned london sir robert canolle sore dyspleased myght nat go slee kyng wolde nat consent therto sayd wolde reuenged well ynough thus folysshe people departed one way nother kyng lordes company ryght ordynately entred london great ioye firste iourney kynge made wente lady princesse mother castell royall called quenes wardrobe hadde taryed two dayes two nightes right sore basshed good reasone whan sawe kyng sonne greatly reioysed sayde fayre sonne payne great sorowe haue suffred day kynge answered sayd certaynly madame knowe well nowe reioyse selfe thanke god nowe tyme haue day recouered myne herytage realme englande whiche hadde nere lost thus kyng taryed day mother euery lorde went peaseably owne lodgynges crye made euery strete kynges name maner men nat beyng cytie london haue nat dwelt space one yere departe suche founde sonday sonne risyng yt shuld taken traytours kyng lose heedes crye thus made none durste breke maner people departed sparcled abrode euery man owne place johan balle jaques strawe founde olde house hydden thinkyng haue stollen away coulde nat accused owne men takyng kyng lordes gladde thanne strake heedes watte tyler also ser lodon bridge valyaunt mennes heedes taken downe sette thursday tidynges anone spredde abrode people strange countreis whiche comyng wardes london retourned backe agayne owne house durst come farther p howe duke lancastre kepte selfe styll scotlande feare rebellyon howe kynge punysshed traytours chefe maisters cap ccc lxxxv nowe lette v speke duke lancastre meane season rebellyon marchesse scotlande treatyng peace therle duglas lordes scotlande scottes knewe right well rebellyon englande likewise dyde duke lancastre howe neuer made semblant ther ofto scottes sore treatie thoughe englande ben good rest peace longe treatie debated amonge last truse taken endure thre yer bytwene englande scotland whan truse thus accorded lordes eche parte made good chere eche erle duglas sayd duke lacastre sir knowe right well rebellion comon people england parell realme england incidece sir repute take ryght sage valiant man sith ye haue cotinued treaty frely ye haue done ye wolde neuer make semblant therof sir say yt offre ourselfe yfye haue nede redy ayde v vi c speres seruice faith sayd duke fayre lordes thake woll nat refuse offre howe thynke veryly kynge lorde hath good counsayle mater shall right well come passe desyre haue salucconducte myne returne coutrey nede tyll mater apeased erle duglas erle moret kynges auctorite grauted hym desyre thy departed scottes returned edenbourge ye duke went berwyk wenyng duke haue entred towne whan passed waye ther left prouision capitane towne called ser mathue redmayn refused hym entre closed gate agaynst hym sayng howe comauded erle northumberlande princypall soueraygne march frounters northumberlande whan duke herde wordes sore displeased sayd mathue redmayn ther northuberlande gretter soueraygne shall lette passe way left prouisyon meaneth tydyng faith ser sayd knyght true say co maundement kynge sir ryght sore agaynst wyll must nedes therfore ser goddessake holde excused thus commaunded payne lyfe ye shall nat entre towne none ye may well knowe ye duke la castre hadde great marueyle sore displeased wordes nat knyght onely theym ordeyned mater seyng hadde traueyled besynes england haue hym suche suspecte stoppe fro hym first wne bytwene england scotlande imagyned greatly hymselfe discouered nat thought courage made prease knyght thought well knyght wolde nat without expresse commaundemet brake mater sayd ser red ayn haue knowlege ye tidyng englad ser sayd know none countrey sore meuyd kyng soueraigne lorde hath written lordes knyghtes good townes contrey redy come whan soeuer sendith costables kepars cyties townes castelles northuberland hath sent strayt commaundement payne deth suffer man entre place vnder theyr rule take good hede theyr charge comon people rebelleth london knowe certayn worde offycers bysshopryche lincolne cambridge stafforde bedford norwich haue writen ye comon people vnder haue great desyre mater shuld go euyll ther shulde trouble england ya sayd duke countreys lancastre derby lynsetur rebellion ther sir sayd knyght thynge yt passe lyncolne duke mused lytle deted fro knyght toke way roseburge receyued constable whan passed set ther duke lancastre cousayled bycause knewe nat surely ye mater dyd englande whome beloued hatyd shuld send lordes scotland desyring send quantite men warre conuey hym scotlande saueconduct thus sent erle duglas lay alquest whan erle sawe lettre great ioy made great cher messager sent worde therof erle moret therle de la mare brother desyring incontinent without delay mete morlane thyrd day certayne nombre well horsed aparellyd assone lordes knewe sent theyr men frendes came morlan ther foude erle duglas rode together nombre v c speres came abbey mauros ix lytle myle fro roseburge way met duke ther made great chere eche longe rode together tyll came cite edenbourge wher kynge scottes moost parte euer kynge lay good castell bigge towne fayre hauyn tyme kyng nat wylde scottysshe duke lancastre greatlye honoured erle duglas barownes scotlande castell delyuered duke lye lay season tyll tidynges came hym englade nat soone wolde maruell regarde yuelles vnhappy people howe malyce hatered spake duke without cause voyce brute ran englande tyme rebellyon howe duke lacastre traytor kyng howe become scottysshe anone founde false contrary vngracyous people bringe realme trouble sowed abrode word knowleged ye hour whan executed dethe say lyster watte tyler jacke strawe uaquyre johan balle fyue throughout realme chiefe souerayne capitayns fyue part realme maisters gouernours specially hatered duke lancastre well shewed first entryng lodon brent house sauoy clene erthe besyde sprede abrode england false wordes howe duke scottysshe parte dyuers plac turned armes vp downe lyke traytor derely bought dyde lost heedes labour nowe shall shewe vengeaunce kyng englande toke vngracious people meane season duke lancastre scotlande whan people repeased uaquyre executed dethe lystre stafforde watte tyler jacke strawe johan balle dyuers london kyng cousayled go visyte realme euery shire bayliwyke vyllage pourge punysshe sayd yuell doer gete agayne suche letter byforce gyuen dyuers place bring agayne realme good order kyng sent secretely certayne nombre men armes come day apoynted dyde nombre fyue hundred speares many archer whan come kyng deuysed kyng departed fro lo housholdmen onely toke way kent wher first vngracyous people began te styrre forsaid men warre folowed kynge costed hym rode nat copany kyng entred kent came vyllage called comprimbre called mayre men towne hym whan come fayre place kyng made shewed one cousayle howe erred agaynst kyng howe nere tourned englande trybulacyon losse bycause kynge knewe well busynesse begon nat wherfore better dyde beare blame therfore comaunded shulde shewe yt culpable pain euer kynges indygnacion reputed traytours agaynst hym whan ther assembled herde request sawe well suche culpable shulde excuse thother beheld eche last sayd sir beholde hym towne first moued contynent taken hanged haged nombre seuyn letter kyng gyuen demau ded agayne delyuerd agayne torne broken people sayd sir ye assembled comaunde kyng name payne dethe euery man go home owne house peasably neuer grudge ryse agaynst kyng none offycers trespace ye haue done kynge dothe pardon therof cryed one voyce god thanke kynges grace counsayle lyke maner kyng dyde comprimbre dyd cauterbury sadwyche germeney conculle place kent likewise dyde plac realme wher rebellyon ben hanged beheeded mo fyftene hundred kyng cou sayled sende vncle duke lancastre scotlande kyng sent hym knyght house called sir nycholas carnefell knight rode long cae edenbroughe founde duke company delyuered letter credence fro kynge duke obeyed reason also gladly wolde retourne englande owne herytage toke way come ro bourge departyng thaked lordes scotlande conforte done hym susteyninge hym realme longe pleased hym erle duglas therle moret scotlande brought abbey maurose thus duke came rose bourge newcastell vpon tyne dyrham yorke euery place founde cyties townes redy apparelled reason p season dyed london knight called sir rycharde dangle erle hutyngdon maister kynge reuerently buryed freres prechers london day obsequy kynge two bretherne princesse mother great nombre prelate barownes ladyes englande dyde hym great honour truely getyll knight well worthy haue honoure tyme noble vertues knight ought haue mery true amorous sage secrete large prewe hardy aduenturous chyualrous thus ended gentyll knight sir rycharde dangle p yuell wyll duke la castre conceyued courage refuce made berwyke howe erle cabrige arryued portyngale cap ccc lxxxvi whan duke lancastre retourned scotlande englande shewed counsayle howe hadde spedde trewse taken scottes forgate nat howe sir mathue reedmane capitayne berwyke closed gate agaynst strayte commaundement erle northumberlande duke enquered kyng nephue wolde auoqe dede nat semed kynge dyde auowe faintly duke helde pea abode tyll feest oure lady myddes moneth auguste whiche tyme kyng helde soleyne court westmynster great nobre noble lordes englande erle northumberlande erle nottyngham dyuers lordes ye northe kyng made knightes day yong erle penbroke sir robert maubre sir nycholas twyforde sir adam francoys feest kyng purpose ryde reedyng oxenforthe couentre punysshe yuell doer sayde rebellyon dyde lyke maner done kent sussexe essexe bedforde cambridge feest oure lady westmynster dyner great wordes bytwene duke lancastre erle northumberlande duke sayd hym henry percy beleued nat ye hadde bene great englande close gate cytie towne castell gaynst duke lancastre erle humyled hym selfe spekyng sayd sir deny nat knight dyde canne nat strayt commaundement kynges grace presente straitly enioyned commaunded myne honour lyfe shulde nat suffre maner person lorde entre cytie towne castell northumberlande without heryter place sir kynge lordes counsayle well excuse knewe well ynoughe howe ye scotlande wherfore shulde haue reserued quod duke say ther ought reseruacyon haue bene made vncle kyng haue kept myne herytage well better hathe done next kyng seyng howe gone busynesse realme scotlande excuse nat excuse ye haue done yuell greatly agaynst myne honoure haue gyuen therby ensample bring suspect haue done shulde treason scotlande whan retournyng kyng townes closed agaynst specially prouisyon wherfore say ye haue aquyted yor selfe right yuell blame sclaundre ye haue brought pourge presens ye kyng present cast agaynst gauge reise yedare kyng stepte forthe sayd fayre vncle la castre done auowe must excuse erle northumberlande speke hym payne lyfe commau ded hym shulde kepe close ye townes marchesse ye knowe well howe realme great trouble parell faulte clerke wrote letter neglygence oure counsayle trouthe shulde haue reserued wherfore wyll also desyre lay parte yuell wyll ye haue erle take charge discharge erle behalfe kneled downe duke erle arundell erle salisbury erle suffolke ye erle stafforde erle dymester sayde hym sir ye howe amyably truely kynge spekethe wherfore sir ye ought condiscende pleasure well quod duke enflamed yre shall holde peace mused lytell made lordes ryse thanked sayd fayre lord none amonge ye lyke case sure ye wolde sore displeased pleaseth kyng haue reason content ther ye peace made bytwene duke erle meanes kynge lordes seconde day kyng toke iourney sayd fyue hundred speares many archer folowed euer costed kynge vyage kyng dyde great iustyce rebelled agaynst howe lette v leaue speke kyng englande speke erle ca bridge vncle shewe howe dyde portyngale haue well herdhere therle cambridge lay hauyn plummouthe fyue hundred speares many archer abydinge wynde sayle portyngale longe lay last wynde wether came disancred departed towarde lysbone thought arryue first day costed englande cornewayle ii day also thyrde daye entred highe see spaygne harde fortune rose suche tepest shyppes great parell harde adueture dethe specially shyppes wherin gascoyns sir johan newcastell souldicke lestrade lorde de la barde fourtie knightes squyers lost syght erle cambridge flete erle sir olyuete beauchampe marshall hoost ser mathewe gourney constable chanoyne robersarde passed tempest great daunger longe sayled wynde starres arryued cytie lysbone tidynges came anone kynge portyngale taryed loked euer comynge englisshmen kynge sende knightes mete theym honourably receyued kyng dampferant came castell mette therle cambridge receyued hym great honoure brought castell called wyne spyce yonge johan cambridge sonne erle kynge portyngale made great ioye sayde beholde sonne shall haue doughter bothe proper goodlye one age child gret ioye eche helde eche hande meane season whyle kyng portyngale made cher erle straungers companye well lodged came oute shyppes cytie lysbone great well furnysshed euery thynge well prouyded agaynst comyng englysshmenne lordes mery well ease howe ryght sorie company thought lost see tempest el driuen da ger moore granade whiche yf thought good lost made great complayntes say trouthe well worthy coplayned sore tossed tepest neuer men greater daunger dethe scaped passed straytes boundes realme tramesuynes bell maryne oft tymes great aduenture takynge sarazins couted themselfe lost deed neuer trust coe lande great daunger xl dayes suche wynde brought wheder wolde nat agayne ye spaynisshe see whan wynde fayled ancred aduenture founde two great shyppes comyng sayd fro flauders charged marchaundyse goynge lysbone englysshe shyppe came purte standerdes whan lysbone marchauntes sawe armes saynt george shyppe men armes halfe afrayed laste whan aproched sawe made theym great chere marchauntes dyde putte knyghtes agayne great parell ye shall herafter knightes demauded marchautes tidynges answered sayd howe kynge portyngale englysshe men spaigne besieged kynge castyle ciuyll tidynges knightes right ioyfull sayd howe wolde go thyder fronter ciuyll departed marchautes left theym wyne prouysion refresshe gascoyns sayde maryners sir bringe v streyght ciuyll company lye siege maryners sayde name god tourned thyderwardes sayled longe tyll aproched nere therto maryners wyse sage wolde nat theyr maysters shulde lost neglygently caused ladde mout vp toppe shyp se coude spy maner siege layd ciuyll outher water lande ladde sawe euery thynge parfitelye sayde surelye maner siege nother lande water maryners sayde lordes sir ye nat well truely enformed surely ther siege nother lande water ciuyll shulde apere hauyn therfore sir goynge thyder without ye wyll lose kynge castyle cytie wherin wolde realme great payne maryners myght beleued laste lened sayled longe syde cyuyll entred see portyngale last arryued hauyn lysbone thesae houre daye done churche saynt katherine solempne obsequy englysshe men morenyng blacke ye may well knowe ioye ynoughe whane arryued porte gret feest made gascoyns ioye forgate payne feare endured see nowe lette v leaue speke busynesse portingale ther yet dede armes done lette v nowe speke busynesse flaunders season season busynesse england warres fladers nat rest bytwene erle gauntoyse ye haue herde philyppe dartuell chosen souerayne capitayne gaunt oppynyon peter de boyse counsayled hym take hym offyce cruell entent feared philyppe folowed scole doctryne nat bene long offyce whan caused xii heedes strykenne hym sayde principally causers dethe father reuenged cause p philyppe dartuell begane raygne great puyssaunce greatly feared beloued specially suche folowed warre wynne fauoure loue spared nothynge abandoned euery thynge might demaunded howe gaunt made warre wyll aunswere therto acordynge haue herde necessyte accordynge quantyties euer supported poore reason vnyte amonge theym endured great puyssaunce thynges consydred gaunt one moost strogest townes worlde brabant holande zelande make warre thre countreis flaunders make warre enclosed likely lost famysshed thre countreis made warr wherfore endured lengar season whyle philyppe dartuell made newe offycer alderman wayuers accused trayson sette prison proue trouthe accused went house foude certayne poudre saltpeter wherwith done helpe towne siege otherwyse hole yere passed wherfore beheeded drawen towne lyke traytour gyue ensample erle flaunders determyned lay siege gaunt made great somons lordes knyghtes squyers men good townes sende malynes whens moche people also sende cosyns sir robert namure sir wyllyam arthoise ther came moche people coutesse arthoise mother newely departed lyfe assemble cae lorde da pier great company knightes squyers countie heynalt therie went layde siege gaunt syde towarde bruges towarde heynalte whyle siege endured many scrymisshe somtyme sorte wyght companyons wolde yssue gaut somtyme driued home agayne losse sometyme wan season dyde moost dedes armes moost renomed yong lorde danghien moost commonly lustye companyons suche sought dedes armes wolde euer companye season lorde danghien foure thousande horse men besyde fote men wente layde siege towne grauntmont gautoyse tyme sayd lorde bene traueyled haryed sore nothynge conquered tyme came puissantly good order day sauted towne mo xl place saute hym selfe sette forthe first owne baner gret assaute well cotynued euery syde houre noone taken coquered entred ye gate lorde da ghien company whan towne sawe towne lost without recouery fledde gate wher none enemyes euery man saued hym selfe myght great murdre men woman chyldren ther none taken mercy ther mo v c men ye towne slayne great nobre olde people men woman brent lyeng beddes whiche great pytie sette fyre towne mo thre hundred place wherby hole towne brent church nothynge left hole thus grautmont prosecuted put fyre flame lorde danghien retourned thost erle flaunders gaue hym great thanke dede sayde fayre sonne ye valyant man shall god pleased good knight yehaue gode begining distructyon thus towne grauntmont sonday monethe june whyle siege lay stylle gaunt lorde daghien called water wolde neuer lye rest lodgyng euery day sought aduetures day great nobre daye fewe durst nat parceyuer enterprise yt nere euery day hym ye hase flaunders done aduenture fortuned tuesday mornyng lorde danghien yssued logyng lorde montigny company ser mychell hamsede cosyn bastarde danghien brother julyen toyson hutyn donay dyuers went scrimisshe gaunt wont aduentured theselfe farre toke good therby gaunt hadde layde sore busshment towne mo hudred pykes sayd busshmet suche fledde fro grautmont whan wonne entente set nothyng el howe might trap ye lorde daghien reuenged hym domage done thought euer free hardy wolde aduenture selfe largely thought came passe whiche pyte lorde danghien rout toke hede tyll enclosed gauntoyse escryed dethe lorde daghyen demaunded counsayle lorde motigny hym sir eustace motigny answered sayd nowe late take cousayle let v defede selfe sell lyues derely dye none remedy knyght made signe ye crosse recomended selfe god saynt george entred amonge enemy coude nat flye wer forwarde enbusshe dyde dedes armes well might coude nat longe endure enemyes hundred agaynst one great nombre long pykes wherwith gautoise gaue great stroke peryllous well apered ther lorde danghien slayne hym bastarde brother gyles toyson dyuers valyant knight haynalte lorde montigny saynt christophe sir michell hamsede sore hurte ben slayne without doute hutyn donay force armes hadde nat saued hym yet moche payne saue howe meane tyme gautois dysarme knyghtes slayne entent beare wne gaunt knewe well slayne lorde danghien wherof hadde great ioye meane tyme hutyn donay brought prese parell sir mychell hamsede p thus iourney fortuned agaynst lorde daghien nat douted erle flaunders dethe great sorowe whiche well shewed bycause ye loue brake vp siege gaunte night day made great soro dethe sayd water water fayreson aduenture thus fall youthe wyll euery man knowe gaunte shall neuer haue peace tyll haue great amen de shall suffyce erle sende gaunt haue agayne body lorde danghien whiche gautoyse wolde nat delyuer erle sende thousande frankes haue body whiche gauntoyse dyde departe amonge themselfe body lorde daghien brought hoost sente anghien towne wherof lorde thus loue yong lorde danghien thesege brake vp gaunte erle departed wente bruges gaue leaue people departe sende certayne fortress flaunders gaures andewarpe teremonde curtray fortress nere gaunt erle sende legeoys shewynge bycause ycoforted gaunt vitayle prouisyon therfore broken vp siege desyringe cofort vitayle liege answered proudely wolde aduysed wolde ayn ton huy dygnet therle coude haue none answere sent cosyns duke brabat duke aubert bayly heynalte holande zelande dyuers messangers right sage knyght shewe hym ye towne gaut styll erroure occasyon great confort gaunt hath people countreis bringynge dayly fresshe vitayle desyring therfore prouyde r medy two lord wolde nat gladlye anythyng displeasure cosyn erle excused selfe honestly sayd howe knewe nothynge therof fro then forthe wolde loke therto set good order answere suffycient erle flaunders duke aubert holande wrote bayly heynalte sir symone de la layne sende hym copy erles letter request erle made hym besyde commaunded shulde deale countre heynalt tiding displeasure towarde therle fladers cosyn dyde wolde nat content baylye obeyed reason dyde commaundement throughe haynalte commaundynge wyse cary vitayle maner thynge gaunte dyde shulde ronne greatly duke displeasur lyke crye defence made brabante none durste go gaunte stelthe wherof gaunt beganne dismayed prouisyon gan ta fayle ben great famyne holande nat conforted wolde nat leaue ayde commau dement duke aubert coulde make seasone sage men wyse counsaylours heynalt brabant liege set day counsayle holden harlequebec besyde courtrey mette gaunt sende thyder twelfe ye moost notablest men towne ther shewed generally moost te towne except suche rybaudes vnthriftye people desyred nothynge yuell noyse gladlye sayde wolde haue rest peace soeuer came therof counsayle wyse counsaylours good townes flaunders ther erles counsayle liege brabant heynalte mater well debated vpon certayne article peace gauntoyse retourned towne suche gaunte desyred rest peace drewe house two riche men gaut hadde bene treatie one called sir gylbert gente sir symone bette demaundynge theym tidynges dyscouered mater soone frendes sayeng good neyghbours shall haue good peace please god loueth peace rest shall haue yuell dysposed ye towne gaunt corrected punysshed p howe two valyant men gauut slayne peter de boyse philyppe dartuell rebellyon parys agaynst frenche kyng cap ccc lxxxvii sayd moost come ly dothe say peter de boyse thought hym selfe nat well assured lyfe spyes euery newe tidynges suche hadde ben sayd treatie reported towne treatie brought gylbert gent symon bette whan peter de boyse vnderstode madde mynde therfore toke mater hym selfe sayd corrected warre yet shall nat first mater shall nat go wene shall haue bene treatie rule euerye thynge lyst may happe nay purpose nat yet dye thynke warr hath nat endured long shall yet suche good maysters johan lyon wyllyam craforde dethes nat yet well reuenged mater e nowe trouble yet wyll bring trouble dyde shall shewe howe proper euennyng cou sayle shulde haue ben next day counsayle hall reported treatie taken harlequebecke peter de boyse came euennynge ph lyppe dartuels house founde hym chambre lyenge wyndowe musynge studyeng first worde spake sayd philyp dartuell tidynges nay trulye say men returned fro counsaile harlequebecke mord shall hall tidyng haue brought true peter knowe redy wayes haue taken purpose take suche haue hath shewed frendes certayn lye philyppe treatie yt haue made wolde make lyeth ieopardy heed peace taken bytwene erle towne knowe trouthe lorde harsels suche capitayns haue ayded v warre shalbe first shall dye riche men shall go quite wyll bring v daunger go selfe free euer opinyon johan lyon maister alwayes erle hath marmosettes gylbert mahewe bretherne prouost harlequebecke lynage alderman meane craftes fled away ought wysely loke mater se best philyppe aunswered sayd peter shall shewe mynde let v gyue knowledge oure alderman capitayns morowe redy aparelled market place lette v two entre hall hundred v content treatie let alone ye wyll auowe dede abyde puissantly without feared among comons nothyng agreed peter de boyse departed sende ruler capitaynes vnder hym commaundyng men redy mornynge market place tidynges obeyed durste none otherwyse also euer redy yuell next mornyng hour ix mayre alderman riche men towne came market place entred hall thyder came ben treatie harlequebecke thyder came peter de boyse philyp dart well suche secte well acompanyed whane assembled sette suche wolde sytte lorde harselz myste nat sent excused himselfe bycause sicke nat well ease saye ye wyll peter du boyse stede beynowe let v wyll say hath bene harlequebecke rose vp two notablest men companye gylbert gente symone bette one sayde lordes gaunt haue bene parlyament harlequebecke haue moche payne traueyle also good men brabant liege heynalte make acorde agrement bytwene oure lorde erle flaunders v gaunte finally requestes helpe lady brabant sent thyder cousayle duke aubert meanes good towne gaunt come peace agrement oure lorde erle maner two hundred men suche shall sende v name writyng within fyftene dayes must sende erles prison lysle put theym clerely mercy pleasure free noble doute wyll haue mercy theym wordes peter de boyse stepte sayde gylbert gente howe durste bolde make suche agrement sende two hundred oure men gaunte towne oure enemye great rebuke shame towne gaunt better gaunte turned vp downe gaunt shulde haue suche reproche make warre ende shamefully haue herde may well knowe ye shall none two hu dred prisoner also symon bet ye haue chosen youre selfe nowe wyll chose ourselfe philyppe dartuell set handes false traytours wolde betray dyshonour towne gaunt ther peter de boyse drewe oute dagger came gylbert gent strake hym belly fell downe deed philyppe dartuell drewe dagger strake symon bet slewe hym lykewise cryed treason treason slayne hadde men aboue beneth men great lygnage richest men towne gette selfe towne saue selfe done two slayne apease people bringe beleue sende men cryenge sayenge false traytours gylberte gente symone bette wolde haue betrayed towne gaunte thus mater passed two notable men slayne man reuenge whan therle flauders beyng bruges herde tidynges sore displeased sayd desyre cosyns brabante lightly agreed haue peace gaunt nowe tyme haue wrought falsely wyll knowe shall neuer haue peace agayne wyll haue pleasure thus ther slayne towne gaunte two balyant men ryche sage might eche spende owne patrimony two thousande frakes yerelye sore moned priuely non durst speke theym openly thus warre feyrsare garysons gaunte night day busye stoppe prouisyon comynge gaunt brabant haynalde dutst nat aduenture bring thyng gaunt erles men mette vitaylers wolde slee horse bring prisoner ande warpe teremonde vitaylers feared parell therof pin season common parys rose rebelled agaynst kyng cou sayle bycause kyng cousayle wolde generally reyse vp throughe fraunce ayedes fo wage tayles subsydes rynne dayes charles father king parisyens rebelled sayde howe kynge last disceassed quyte lyfe tyme howe kyng sonne coronacyon reynes acorded kyng counsayle auoyded parys went lay myeulx bric soone kyng departed fro paris comons rose harnesse slewe ceassed aydes brake vp prison dyuers house towne robbed pylled toke euer foude came bysshoppe paris house brake vp prison delyuerd hugh aubert hadde bene prouost parys tyme kynge charles dayes iust sentence condempned prison dyuers yuell dedes hadde done consented whiche tyme wolde haue hadde hym brent parisyens delyuered happe rebellyon common departed towne assoone myght feare leest shulde takenne agayne went owne countrey burgoyne ther shewed frendes adueture people parys duryng rebellyon dyde moche hurte many good menne happy fell nat rebellyon company mater bene moche worse thus kynge myeulx thre vncles hym duke aniowe duke berrey duke burgoyne sore dyspleased rebellyon determyned sende thyder lorde coucy sage knight treate common apease coulde better phowe lorde coucy apeased discencion rebellyon parys great preparacyon duke aniou made make hym selfe kynge napoles cap ccc lxxxviii lorde coucy called enguerrant came paris nat army peasable maner owne seruauntes lyghted lodgynge sende chiefe begynners rebellyon whan come hym shewed fayre manere howe hadde done ryght yuell slee kynges officer hadde done broken kynges prison delyuered kynges prisoner sayeng howe kyng counsayle wolde hastye rygorours shulde sore repent whiche kyng wolde nat bycause loueth parys well borne therin also chife cytie realme therfore wyll nat distroye people therin shewynge theym howe come thyder meane bringe peace promisynge howe wolde desyre kynge vncles done euer done aunswered sayde howe wolde none yuell haue warre kynge vncles wolde imposycions subsedyes gable shulde layde downe parys cytie shulde exempte fro suche mater sayenge howe wolde ayde kynge manere manere quod lorde coucy answered sayd wyll content pay certayne golde syluer euery weke certayne man apoynted receyue helpe paye soudyers men warr fraunce somme wyll ye paye quod lorde coucye suche somme quod shall agree vpon lorde coucy treated mater owne good wylles ceased theym selfe paye wekely tenne thousande florence certayne man admytted receyuoure therof thus lorde coucy departed fro wente myeulx brie kynge vncles shewed done kynge counsayled best receyue offre parisyens sayenge howe good entre theym lytell lytell lykewyse shulde good townes fraunce seynge parys dyde thus begynne lorde coucy retourned parys brought peace fro kyng parisyence wolde kepe promyse hadde made sayde wolde receyuer apoynted receyue florence euery weke money shulde nat go parys none entent pay men warr wha nede requyred money shulde nat enployed kyng vse norprofyte none vncles thus mater contynued certayne space parisyence peace kynge wolde nat come parys wher parisyence sore displeased lykewise rohane rebelled common people rose slewe cathelayne ther suche sette imposycions aydes gabelles whan kyng vncles herd therof right sore dyspleasedde doughted greatlye cyties townes wolde lyke case kynge cousayled shulde go rohan dyde apeased comons doned dethe chatelyne done also ordayned receyuour whome payed euery weke certayne somme florens therby peace thus ther began great yuel fraunce toke fotynge ensample gauntoyse commonties throughout worlde sayd howe gaunt good people valyant lye sustayned fraunchises wherfore sayde ought beloued praysed honoured knowen duke aniowe great high entent ymaginacion go realme napoles wrote hym selfe kynge puyle calabre cicyle pope clement gyuen hym herytage vertue letter patetes quene napoles gyuen hym duke aniowe sage ymaginatyfe highe courage enterprise sawe well tyme come accordyng state begon whiche lothe make lesse thought therby lytell lorde fraunce whan noble highe herytages fallen hym ii kyngdoms napoles cicyle thre ducheris puyle calabre prouence reason coutreis wherof reputed hym selfe lorde kyng thought shuld attayne great rychesse therfore set entent night day howe might fourme viage knewe wolde nat without great conforte golde syluer great company men warre resyst agaynst wolde let viage duke aniowe occasyon gadered toguyder moche rychesse coulde kept hym loue parys asmoche might knewe well within parys rychesse great habudaunce also sende erle sauoye whome great affyaunce desyringe hym nat fayle hym busynesse promysynge soone cae sauoy wolde gyue wage hole yere thousande speares countrey erle sauoy gret ioye tidynges greatly loued dedes armes answered messangers howe wolde gladly serue duke sayde couynaunt wherof duke aniowe gladde loued greatlye co pany erle sauoy besyde duke aniowe retayned men armes nombre nyne thousande made preparacyon hym selfe company parys maner thynges tentes pauylyons ordynaunce shulde tayne kynge whan purpose go farre countrey p nowe lette v leaue speke hym season returne erle cambridge company beynge portyngale kynge p howe englysshmen rode comaundement kyng portyngale howe castell sygheire portyngale taken cap ccc lxxxix erle cambridge company refreshed theym longe space lysbone kyng portyngale englysshemen gascoyns aduysed well countrey cause neuer bene vnderstode maryage accorded bytwene doughter kyng portyngale age tenne yeres erle cambridge sonne age called johan lady named beatryce weddynge two chyldrene made great feaste amonge lordes prelate realme younge layde toguyder one bedde maryage thus ended whiche endured space eight dayes kynge portyngale counsayle ordayned men warr lysbon shulde dete place kepe fro ters therle cambridge copany ordayned go lye another towne called estremour englysshmen gascons shulde lye another countre called besy ouse yonge johan cambridge shulde abyde kynge wyfe whan chanone robersarde englysshe knight gascons toke leaue kyng departe go garisons kyng sayd sir comaunde ryde nat agaynst enemyes without leaue knowledge ye wyll nat content answered howe wolde nat ryde tyll lycence thus departed rode towne besyous ii dayes iourney fro lysbone asmoche fro ceuyll wher kyng spayne lay knewe ryght well comynge erle cambridge company sent worde therof fraunce suche thought wolde serue whan knewe therof sawe warre likely spaygne gladde therof dyuers suche desyred auaunsed warre made redy toke way spayne chanoyne robersarde lay garyson besyouse company englysshe gascoyns tyme sayd company sir thynke lye thus long styll nothyng honour haue done yet nothyng agaynst enemyes wherfore sette lesse store v therfore ye wyll cousaile sende kynge portyngale desyringe hym gyue v leaue ride som enemyes answered sayde content sir johan chandonich sent message came kynge lysbone dyde message charged kyng sayd wolde wyse shulde ryde forthe knight coude gette none thyng kyng retourned lordes said sir kyng wyll wyse ye shall ride forth sorer displeased tha said among selfe howe nat order men warr tolye long styll garyson without doynge dede armes thus made couynaut ryde forthe aduenture day rode feldes nombre four hundred men armes many archer enterprised besiege great towne parteyninge mayster saynt johans wente thyderwarde toke another way went castell sighyre wherin threscore men armes spaynierdes garyson whome peter gousses brother capitayns chanone robersarde chefemouer iourney rode ther hym sir olyuer beauchampe sir mathewe gourney mylles wyndsore lorde talbotte sir adam symon sir john foudre bastarde brother kyng englande souldycke lestrade lorde newcastell lorde de la barde raymon marson dyuers rode tyll came castell sighyre made redy assayle whan within parceyued shulde assayled orday ned defence anone day saulte began right sore cruell englysshmen entred dyke wherin water came iust walles well pauesshed cast stone hewe pykes entre walles within cast downe barres yron stone hurt dyuers day chanoyn robersarde dyde marueyls armes dyde eperus varlet archer stode longe dyke shot holly toguyder none aboue durst apere defence one halfe theym within sore hurt slayne shotte brother peter gousses capytayne castell called bartylmewe proper man armes hardynesse moche aduenturyng slayne thus assaut contynued fro mornynge tyll noone knyghtes squyers bothe englysshe gascoyns spared nat assayle castell great wyll courage bycause dyde enterprise without knowledge kyng portyngale therfore dyde payne conquere castell entent renome therof shulde come lysbone men myght say howe well spedde begynnyng chanoyne robersarde sayde sir thought yesterday castell shulde nat haue holde long agaynst v longe conqueryng townes castelles spaygne galyse shall neuer lordes wherwith knightes squyers toke courage wordes chanoyne robersarde pauesse receyued great stroke wherwith sore hurte brosed hym yong squiers heynalt called fro ssart mullyer bare hym selfe valiauntly assaut dyde artyllary castell stone barres yron began mynisshe within sawe well xxv men armes thre sore hurt parell dethe coulde nat longe endure force shulde taken sawe capitayns brother slayne determyned take respyte ye meane tyme treate peace thanne made token speke englysshmen assaute ceased assaylantes came dyke wherof nede ther many theym sore traueyled hurte sir mathue gourney constable hoost sir mylles wynsore marshall went demaunded wolde say capitayne sir peter gousses sayd sir se well ye wyll nat depart hen tyll ye haue fortresse ye hurt people let v take counsayle one another say company capitayne wyll rendre fortresse godes lyues saued sir take right couenaunt armes ye tyme stronger therfore behoueth v thus englysshe knyghtes sayd wolde take counsayle dyde whan determyned answered sayd howe within shulde departe whan lyst theyr goodes shulde abyde styll castell shulde haue nothing lyues whan peter go sawe none remedy acorded therto right sore agaynst wyll thus castell gyuen vp put handes thenglysshmen spaynierdes departed without sauecoduct went esteryes maisters saynt jaques lay howe founde hym nat ther vnderstode englysshe men abrode therfore entred feldes foure hundred men armes spaynierdes castylians trust mete englysshmen aduauntage fyght p howe chanoyne robersarde company retourned garyson maryage kynge englande doughter kynge rhomayns cap ccc lxxxix whan knight england coquered ye castell sigheir right ioyfull repayred lefte therin xl company dyd furnyshe artillary purueyaunces sette good capitayne kepe counsayled toguyder best determyned go agayne first lodgynges englysshmen gascoyns deted thre route behynde kepe ye felde abode chanoyne robersarde hym certayn englysshmen gascoyns almayns threscore speares many archer rode day seconde day mornyng hole toguyder entred great towne portyngale called huence castell concrelet right without wode syde wode nere concrelet huence maister saynt james busshmet four hundred men armes soone englysshmen parceyued drewe togider made coutenance feare rode forthe good pase spaynierdes great nombre made semblant breke busshement helde selfe styll close beleued englisshmen nere hande great batayle therfore durst nat assayle thus departed eche fro without doynge spaynierdes retourned night esteryes chanoyne robersarde uesyouse shewed company howe sene spagynierdes bytwene concrelet huence sayd bene toguyder wolde haue fought sorie nat bene toguyder whan tidynges came knowledge kyng portingale made semblant dyspleased bycause rode forthe without comaundement ordinaunce thus englysshmen gascoyns lay styll garysons wynter without thynge doyng worthy made cyon whiche greatly anoyed lyeng styll nat wylles p meane tyme johan kyng castyle sende frenche kynge vncles socour shewyng howe erle cambridge arryued portyngale ye voice ranne realmes castyle portyngale howe kyng englande duke lancastre brother puissantlye acompanyed shulde come portyngale erle cambridge ayde next somer wherfore desyred frenche kynge accordynge suche alyaunces confederacions realme frauce realme spaygne hath toguyder reason good loue amyte wolde sende men warre hym next somer entent resyst enemyes french kyng counsayle consented well therto sawe well howe kyng spayne desyred nothyng reason ordayned fraunce gyue maner men warre lycence go thyder kyng delyuered first prest money sir olyuer clesquy brother sir bertram clesquy constable fraunce ordayned take voyage begynnyng springyng tyme dyde knight squyers bretayne fraunce beause picardy aniowe berrey bloyse mayne passed companyes haue ye ease passage opyn throughe ye realme aragon founde euery thyng redy wage payed payed nat euery thyng toke whan abrode countrey whiche great hurte poore common ye haue herde howe kyng richarde englande space yere hadde ben treatie kynge charles almayne wrote hym selfe tytell kyng rhomayns haue suster lady anne maryage howe sir symon burle sore traueyled mater howe duke tasson almayne ben englande confyrme maryage mater cocluded kynge rhomayns sende suster englande duke tasson great company knightes ladyes damosel royall astate ateyned suche lady came first brabante towne bruesels duches brabant receyued company goodly maner duke brabant vncle doughter themour charles thus ye lady anne behayne helde brusels vncle aunte space moneth durste nat go then shall tell p shewed ther see xii vessel mayns bytwene caleys hollande robbed pilled ye see cared nat kepte boundes see flaunders zelande abyding comynge yonge lady french kyng wolde gladly haue broken maryage greatlye douted alyaunce bytwene englande almayne howe alwayes sayd nat honorable take ladyes warre coloryng warr bitwene lordes make warr fayrer prince wale father kyng richarde englande sayd consented takyng lady burbone mother french quene taken price seruautes castell belperch brought guyen raunsomed wherfore frechmen thought myght take kyng englandes wyfe reuegyng therof shulde wronge feare doute therof lady lay styll brusels space moneth duke brabant sende counsayle fraunce lorde rousselas lorde bousqueher shewe kynge vncles nephewes duke brabant chyldren suster lordes brabant spedde well frenche kyng cousayle sure saue conduct lady passe outher lande see wheder pleased throughe realme fraunce froters therof calais normains see countermaunded agayne frenche kyng vncles wrote duke brabant dyde sake onely none pleased moche duke brabant duchesse suche wolde passe see departed fro brusels lady toke leaue duke vncle ye duchesse aunt ladyes damosel countrey suche helde company duke sende hudred speares conuey gaunte rested day gauntoyse dyde gret honour fro then went bruges erle flaunders receyued ryght honourably rested thre dayes rode forth came grauelyng redy erle salysbury erle dymester fyue hu dred speres many archer brought calays brabansies retourned soone delyuered barones englande yonge lady taryed nat longe calayes wynde wyll entred shyppe friday mornynge company horse shyppes day aryued douer ther rested two dayes thirde day rode saynt thomas caunterbury founde erle buckyngha receyued honourably long lady rode forthe came london honourably receyued burgess ladyes damosel countrey cytie kyng englande wedded chapell palays westmynster xx day christmas great feast tryuphe holden euer syth deted first almayne gentle noble knight sir robert namur left nat tyll maryed kyng englande wherof hadde great thanke bothe kyng englande kyng almayne kyng england maryage brought ye quene wyfe castell wyndsore kept great house ioyously togyder lady prince kynges mother abode styll ye quene also ye tyme court quene duches bretayne suster kyng rycharde lois husband duke bretayne coude nat haue delyuered englade kyng englande counsayle wolde wyse cosent sende bretayne bycause husbande ye duke become french lordes knightes england sayd tyme duke bretayne acquyted hymselfe fasly erle buckyngham men nowe last vyage made frace hath sent wyfe yet wyll nat sende hym wyll rather send thyder ii enemy john guy bretayne chyldrene saynt charles breten hath right herytage bretayne hath duke reason puyssaunce ayde semyng cosydreth yuell ye goodnes haue done hym wherfore must lykewise shewe hym vylany doth v trewe two lord john guy bretayne child saynt charles bloyse prisoner englande kept stronge castell kepynge sir peter dambreticourt desyred curtes maner kyng englande counsayle shulde holde bretayne fayth homage kynge englande wolde thus kyng england promysed recouer right bretayne john haue wife ye lady phylippe lancastre wydowe answered wyse wolde sake fre che dye prison thus ye materhanged kynge englande knewe one fermly myndes desyred therto p howe french kyng could haue money receyuour parys howe duke aniowe passed italye noble chyualry cap ccc xci le haue herd howe parysiens greed kyng pay certayne florens euery weke floreyns payed certayne receyuour apoynted kyng nat wet nat parys happed kynge besynes money pay men warre suche sent castell wherto boude ye aliaunces made kyng sent parys receyuour shulde prepare hym hundred thousande frankes sayd wold comforte ayde kyng john castell receyuour answered ye kyng letter message right graciously sayd howe money mough howe beit myght delyuer none without hole consent ye towne parys wordes pleased nothyng kyng sayde wolde puruey right well remedy whanne myght dyd entente tyme purueyed hym money helpe good townes pycardy thus great discecion bytwene kyng parys kyng wolde nat come parys abode mieulx senles compayne bout wherof parys sore displeased greatest sure tie meane hadde duke aniou wrote hym selfe kynge cecyll hyerusalem taken hym armes therof duke comonly lay parys gate moche good helpe hym viage gate toguyder great money sayd roquemore besyde auignon two myllions florens entreated parys fayre langage ye soueraynte aboue bretherne bycause eldest hundred thousande frankes kyng coude gette none vncles berrey burgoyne whan duke aniou made prouision springyng tyme yere toke iourney passed realme came auignon wher greatly feasted pope cardynals thyder came hym barones ruler good townes prouence receyued hym lorde dyd hym homage feaulte dyd put selfe obeysance thyder came ye gentle erle sauoy cosyn certayne lordes knightes also well receyued pope cardynals duke aniou delyuered erle sauoy great money sauoy great nombre duke therle toke leaue pope departed toke way dolphyn uien euery good towne good chere men warre went last entred lombardy whiche passage redy open duke entred lombardy euery towne great feast chere specially myllayne honored beyonde measure sir galea sir barnabo great rich iuels marueyle recounte euery place duke aniowe helde astate lyke kynge euer went made money floreyns whyte money pay menne warre whan came coustane aprochyd rome kept selfe nerer togyder dyde romayns knewe right well comyng greatly fortifyed agaynst ye romayns capitayn englisshman called sir john ha onde hadde longe lyued amonge romayns knewe fronters hadde many wdyours felde atte wage romayns almayns nacyons quarell pope urban rome nothynge afrayde comynge duke aniowe whan spake hym shewed hym howe duke aniou erle sauoy company comyng rome warde lykelyhode put hym downe fro siege apostolyke bycause clementyns wolde aunswere saye christe protege no christ helpe v fray aunswere wolde make thus men warre duke aniou callynge hym selfe kyng napoles cecyll hyerusalem duke puylle calabre erle sauoy company costed italy coustane march denconnye lande patrimone entred nat rome duke aniowe wolde make noo warre rome ye romayns thought viage enterprised departed frauce euery place went kept ye state kynge euery man praysed hym men warre lyked well paymet tyme ye cytie napoles enemye sir charles de la payx lyke wyse wrote hym selfe kyng napoles cecyll hyerusalem duke puyll calabre claymed kyng rightfull enherytauce without heyre lawfull maryage kynge napoles deed charles helde gyft quene made pope vayne shewed opinyon two reasos one sustayned sayd neapolitan ayded hym sustaynynge cesilyens lykewise sayd howe quene napoles coude nat gyue away another mannes herytage though gyft hadde bene good alowed court rome yet dyd nat well helde pope urbane nat clemet question debate sir charles de la payx layde selfe ye begynnyng wrought wysely sore fortifyed furnysshed castell leufe whiche moost strongest castell worlde set enchautment see nat passyble wone nygromancy art ye deuyll vitailed thre four yere hym certayne men warre kept place knewe well napoles wold nat forsake though lost puyll calabre ii thre yere thought recouer agayne lyghtly ymagyned mynd duke aniou wolde entertayne suche nombre men warre hadde brought hym whiche shulde nat long lye puyssaunce outher faulte vytayle money wherby thought shulde constrayned departe within two thre yere ymagined whan wery good rule wolde fyght aduauntage thoughtes ymagynacions hadd charles de la payx wherof sawe take effect terme passed presired truly prince christned without frenche kyng kynge englande coude kepe four yere gyder suche nombre men warr owne countreys ye duke aniou hym brought ouer mountaynes xxx thousande fyghtinge men begyn suche enterprise behoueth ye beginnynge wysely consyder ymagin whan duke aniou company entred puylland calabre countrey incontynent tourned people shewed howe desyred thyng haue none lorde duke aniou thus shorte tyme lordes cyties townes coutrey vnder obeysance suche ben coutreyes whiche one greatest march world sayde affyrmed howe yt bycause great plenty welthe haboundeth party people ydell wyll laboure whan men warre countrey whiche founde replenysshed welth wherof right glade duke aniou erle sauoy erle uandon chyualry fraunce bretayn sauoy passed forthe came march napoles napoles ye feare men warre wolde neuer close gate towne kept styll open thought well ye duke aniou shulde neuer en towne displeasure within towne people thought shulde lese hym selfe lyst house nat easy wonne plankes boordes take away whan lyst vnderneth see none dare enterprise fyght enchaunter connynge man nygromancy march napoles came duke aniou sayd sir ye wyll shall rendre castell leufe tho within pleasure howe may duke sir quod shall shewe shall enchautment make ayre thycke within shall thinke great bridge see ten men go front whan within castell se bridge wyll afrayde shall yelde mercy wyll thanne dout assayled shulde taken perforce duke great marueyle wordes called hym erle uandon erle genesue sir john sir peter benill sir moris maum shewed theym enchauntour said wherfore great marueyle duke sayd fayre mayster bridge ye ye speke may people assuredly go theron castell assayle sir quod enchauntour dare nat assure passeth bridge make signe crosse hym shall go noughte bridge shall fall see duke began laugh certayne yong knyghtes present sayd sir godsake let mayster assay connyng shall leue makyng signe crosse v tyme redyer way nat gette enemyes well duke shall take aduise mater therle sauoy nat present came duke sone p howe erle sauoye caused enchauters heed bestryken howe chanone robersarde company toke dyuers castels spayne cap ccc xcii whan erle sauoy come ye tent duke aniowe maister enchauntour thanne departed ye duke shewed hym ye wordes maister offred erle bethought litle sayd sir sende hym lodgyng shall examyn hym sir knowe well enchauntour whome quene napoles sir othes bresuych taken sir castell leufe caused craft see seme high within castell feared see shulde haue ouer flowen castell wherof soo abasshed went haue dyed sir man ought nat haue great trust suche people sir ye may se vnhappynes coutrey nature onely nowe please haue profite enchautour wolde nowe betray theym whome one delyuered quene napoles husband sir charles de la payx duke sayd sir shall sende lordes fell mater ye erle sauoy returned lodgynge next day enchauntour came duke saluted hym assone duke sawe hym sayd one seruauntes go bring maister erle sauoy squier came mayster sayd sir lorde duke wyll ye go speke erle sauoy sayd sir cotent ye squier brought hym erles tente sayd sir maister lorde ye duke hath sent whan erle sawe hym great ioy sayd mayster trouth ye wyll cause v haue castell leufe good chepe ye say sir quod enchautour shall sir meanes caused hath nowe sir charles de la payx wyn quene napoles doughter sir robert arthoyse husbande ser othes bresuich sir man world ye sir charles dela payx reputeth moost feare faythe erle sauoy ye say well wyll sir charles de la payx shall knowe hath great wronge feare shall assure ye shall neuer enchauntmet disceyue yet none wolde nat tyme come shulde reproched highe enterprise wherin many noble knightes squyers assembled shulde anythyng enchautment shuld wyn enemyes suche craft called seruaut sayd go get hangman let hym stryke maisters heed without delay sone erle comaunded incotinent done heed stryken ye erles tent thus ended maister enchautour payed wage acordyng desertes p nowe wyll leue speke duke aniou vyage speke besynes portyngale shewe howe englisshmen gascoyns parceueryd whan came beginnyng ye moneth aprill knightes yt garyson towne uesious lyen ther long season nat ryden forth wha syghiere toke aduyse
