among selfe ryde forthe great marueyle ye kyng portyngale erle cambridge thought ye bene ten monethes coutrey portyngale ryden forthe one tyme whiche great shame tha determyned sende erle cambridge shewe myndes souldych lestrad sent cae estremouse erle lay sayd hym sir copany hath sent hyder knowe pleasure ye wyll haue great marueyle cause ye haue brought coutrey lye longe styll whiche great displeasur sir desyre knowe pleasure ye wyll wolde fayne doynge somewhat sir erle ye knowe well whan deted englade lorde brother duke lancastre promysed faythe soone returned scotlande wold come hyder certayne nombre men warre thre thousande many archer sent hyder state ame none entent aduyse coutrey ame sure shortely shall tydynges haue great marueyle taryeth long recomende copany shewe haue shewed howbeit may nat wyll nat let ryde forthe haue sore affection therto ye knowe well kynge portyngale payeth wage therfore must ordred hym fayth sir souldich payeth yuell hole company complayneth oweth v yet wage vi monethes wyll pay right well erle money shall come right well poynt thus departed souldiche fro erle returned company shewed ye haue harde sir chanone robersard wyll nat lye styll se well dothe disseble v wolde nat shulde ryde forthe thentent shulde haue cause demaunde money opynion ride forth determyned thervpon made euery thynge redy apoynted euenyng whan wolde ryde forthe next mornyng cae sir john ferand knight ye kyng portigales ben infourmed howe wold ryde forth brought letter ye chanone robersarde whiche red founde therin howe kynge portyngale defended hym wyse ryde forthe sayeng howe knewe well yt styrring rydyng forthe enterprise procurynge tydyng ye chanone robersard sore displeased sayde knyght sir se well kynge wyll nat wyse shulde ryde forth take yt byde styll lodgynge thynke yt knyghtes better valyaunt wyll leaue enterprise ensure nay ye shall se tomorowe determyned ryde sir quod ye knyght comaunde ye kynges name byde styll nat styrre faythe chanone wyll nat sir comaunde ye syth ye come fro kyng thus mater rested nyght morning sowned trupets knyghtes squiers armed mounted horse came chanone robersardes lodging dyd nat arme himselfe knyghtes squiers rested chanone robersarde came wyndowe spake shewed howe kyng wolde nat shulde ryde forthe none hym faythe quod wyll seynge beso forewarde counsayle shalbe reproche v ryde forth though ye abyde behynde chanone robersard sawe well none boote hym arme ryde forthe dyd dyd knyght portyngale sir john ferande wherfore sore displeasure kynge lyke haue dyed fore thus desyre companyons armed issued towne uesyouse entred feldes ye nombre four c speares many archeres toke way geuyll came towne called bane longe rode forthe came towne bane ther lyghted fote parte thought moost prignable ther set selfe array redy gyue assaute entred ye dyke drie without water came walles mad ferse assaut myned vnder hewed walles tyme towne bane noo men warre men towne yuell armed howe beit defence dyd cast dartes stone aswell might lenght coulde nat endure taken bega treat fynally yelded vp towne goodes lyues saued sayng howe fro then forthe wolde vnder obeysance kynge portyngale thus receyued ye men warre entred towne well refresshed sel e wet regarded castell sawe well howe prignable yt euenyng hoost castell dyd skrymysshe mornyng made assaut within defended themselfe castell capitayne gentleman countrey howbeit good man warre well apered called peter jagouse sone sawe yt assayled many good men warr afrayd fell treaty yelded selfe ye castell lyfe saued suche within taken newe refresshed men armes archer departed came nother castell vii myle then called courtise set selfe ordre gyue assaut dyd right fersly yt within defended selfe ryght valyauntly power assaut capitayne slayne within castell called radulphes right subtle expert man armes slayne arrowe aduetured selfe far defece deed coulde nat longe endure castell taken within moste parte slayne thus chauone robersarde company castell courtyse whiche newe fortifyed repeopled agayne thau depa ted aprochyng cyte ceuyll great pof great pillage proyes done chanone robarsarde company agaynst kynge castyll discencyon among cap ccc xciii moch dyd men warr englisshmen gascoyns came ja x myle fro ceuyll whiche towne fe ly inclosed within towne mynster right stronge whiche countrey fortefyed trust strenght place comyng towne taken brent mynster ayled whiche assaut enduced one hour wherin ther great pyllage entred fyrst many men slayne ode forthe enfourmed mary therby great boty downe valey besyde mary mo xx thousand beastes swyne e kene mouton whiche tidynges great ioy went thyder entred mary e men beestes driuen toke aduyse returne uesyous olde logy g returned toke way thyder came thyder next day nyght pray wherby well vitayled becae iourney whan ser john ferande come lys bone kyng portyngale shewed hym howe hadd sped great pray brought uesyous wenyng kynge wolde haue bene content nat kynge sayd hym thou false aytour howe durst yu hardy agaynst co masidment made none shulde yde consent contrary thy selfe company ye holy saynt james shall cause hanged knyght fell knee sayd sir capitayne dyd aquyte well truly obeyng comaundment resydue cawsed hym go forthe gaynst wyll made also go shewe wayes countre sir syth iourney hath taken good effect ye ought pardon howbeit wordes kynge made hym put prisone remayned tyll erle cabridge caused delyuered whan cae lys kyng ye shall herafter thenglysshmen gas o returned towne uesyous ther taryed great space de myned send kyng portingale wage behynde sende forthe lorde tal ot baron whan coe lysbone spoken kynge come kyng answered said two tymes rydden forth agaynst comaudement wherin displeased hym whiche delayed payment lorde albot coude haue non answere retourned copany shewed kynges answere wherwt sore displeased weke therle cambridge remoued fro estremuse came lodged uesious abbey freres wtout towne knightes squiers englade gascone right gladde therof amog companyons ther myght natforbere wage longe amonge selfe said marueylously euyll delt haue ben countre nyghe space yere yet haue wage nat capitayne hath recey ed wolde neuer haue suffred haue forborne longe sayynges murmuryng multiplyed among tyll last sayd wolde endure lengar amonge selfe set day speke togyder fayre mynster towne ryght ouer agaynst freres erle cambridge lodged chanone robersarde sayde wolde say trouthe nedefull hym el mater hadde ben worse mornynge whan assembled except chanon robersard nat coe ther sir willm beauchape sir mathue gorney vncle lorde talbot sir wyllm helmon gascons lorde de la barde lorde newcastell souldyche lestrade dyuers began speke make coplayntes eche among ther knyght bastarde brother kyng englandes called sir john soltier right bolde spekyng sayd erle cambridge hath brought v hyder alwayes redy aduenture oure lyues hym yet holdeth wage counsayle lette v one alyaunce one accorde let v amonge ourselfe reyse vp baner saynt george let v fredes god enemyes worlde without make selfe feared gette nothynge faythe quod sir wyllyam helmon ye say right well let v agreed one voyce regarded among shulde capitayne aduysed yt case howe coude nat haue better capitayne sir john soltier shulde haue good leysed yuell thought metelyer therto tha reysed vp penon saynt george cryed soltier soltier valyant bastarde frendes god enemyes ye worlde determyned first ouerron towne uesyous make warre agaynst kyng portyngale sir mathewe gourney sir wyllyam beauchampe gaue counsayle nat ouerron towne uesyous counsayle coude nat herde reysed vp penon saynt george departyng mynster chanone robersarde came entred ye prese sayde loude fayre lordes wyll ye haue good order temperaunce selfes ye se well ye sore dismayed cae hym sir johan soltier sir wyllm helmon shewed done purpose tha chanone fayre langage refrayned sayde sir remembre ymagin well dede yt ye enterprise thynke folly outrage nat better distroyed selfe make warre countrey enemyes shall tidynges therof shall therby enforce self whan se go nat forward thus shall lese two maner wayes shall reiose assure enemyes nowe doute also shall false oure trouthe therle cambridge soltier wolde ye shulde haue suende oure wage cometh haue money sythe came portyngale thoughe ye payed nat yet ye haue fayre sufferyng fayth quod chanone haue payment ye haue without knouledge ensure wyll receyue nothynge knightes sayd sir beleue well sir euery thyng must haue course sir shewe ye howe may honourably issue mater haue hasty delyuerace ye might payed wage nat shortely well payed mater wyll go yuell chanon robersard began speke sawe well howe englysshe copanyons displeased kyng portyngale sawe well money wolde apease sayd thus fayre lordes counsayle state nowe let v go speke therle cambridge shewe hym nedes shalbe soltier yt ye wyll auowe sayeng content maner went forth penon saint george cae freres wher therle lay goyng dyner copanions mo vii c entred court demauded therle cae cha bre hall speke knightes ther auaused forthe soltier bolde spyrite spake sayde sir come presens dyuers without sir ye haue brought v englande owne nacion sir ye chefe capitayne wag haue non aske none man kyng portyngale neuer come hym seruyce ye shulde nat haue payed v ser ye wyll say yt warr nat kyng portyngals shall pay self well enough oue wag first wyll ouerron coutre catche wyll soltier therle say nat ye shalbe payed ouerron countrey ye shall cause haue great blame kyng portyngale also kyng englande sir soltier wolde ye yt shulde sir therle wolde ye shulde take thre knightes one englande another almayne thirde gascone let thre go lysbon kyng shewe hym nede ye coplayne long delay payment wage ye haue remedy ye haue cause folowe entprise faith chanon robersarde lorde therle cabridge speketh sagely valiantly purpose determyned kept styll penon saynt george sayeng howe lythe reysed one accorde realme portyngale wolde nat laye downe agayne longe ordayned shulde go kyng message sir wyllyam helman named go englysshmen sir thomas symon almaynes lorde newcastell gascoyns thre knightes dyde moche came lysbone foude kyng made good chere demaunded theym howe companye dyde sir quod good poynt wolde ryde forthe ryght good wyll enploye tyme otherwyse haue done lyeng styll nothyng agreable well kyng shall ryde forthe shortely co pany shewe fro sir quod sir willyam helman sent hyder fro thentet shulde shewe behalfes sythe came countre haue nother prest wage whiche desyre generally haue sir harde thyng haue loue seruyce warre without otherwise payed tha haue bene sir haue bene great thought long space bycause coude nat tell whome shulde longe sir haue layde charge therof capitayns wherby lyckely growe moche yuell sir capitayns excused knowen haue receyued nothyng ye knowe well say truely sir wyll payed wage ye wyll haue seruyce ye pay nat certify v wyll pay selfe sir take aduyce make answere may shewe pleasure abyde nothyng el kyng thought hym lytell sayd sir wyllyam reason payed haue sore displeased haue rydden forthe co trary comaudement nat ben bene payed tyme sir quod sir wyllyam haue rydden hath ben honour profyte haue taken townes castels ouer rydden cou tre enemyes almost ceuyll whiche honorable enterprise ought nat lose tymes also wolde nat lose wyls ser returne say wyll pay theselfe without haue gracious answere haue hyderto well kyng within xv dayes farthest shalbe payed euery peny say vnto therle cabridge wyll speke sir knight ye say well shall comaudement king went dyner made dyne hym owne table passed day next day returned copany soone knowen come home copany resorted knowe tydinges brought shewed kynges wordes cotent losirs soltier ye may se well sotyme ryot bothe good haue well aduaused forthe payment lytell wyldnesse dothe euer well feared p thre knight went therle cambridge shewed hym howe sped howe kyng wolde shulde coe speke hym lysbone therle deted next day rode lisbone ther receyued son doughter right amiably ther kyng made certayne poyntment ryde forthe kyng made somos realme euery man felde bytwene ueryous clemens vii day june euery man made hym redy sayd place day lymited comyng therle lysbone sir johan ferand delyuered prison therle toke leaue retourned copany shewed poyntmet wherof euery man gladde anon cae money pay wage al payed contet capitayns alwayes kept vp styll penon saynt george p kyng castell portyngale assembled puyssauces howe peace made bytwene agaynst wyll thenglyshmen cap ccc xciiii kyng johan castyle season gadered togider men warre fraunce place two thousande speares knightes squyers four thousand besyde owne coutre wherof well ten thousande horsbacke many fote whan knewe howe kyng portingale wolde ryde ordayned honorably vse warre seynge knewe hym selfe p yssant bothe money men sent kyng portyngale demau dyng hym delyuer certayne pese lade portyngale might de myne batayle puyssaunce agaynst puyssaunce resused offre delyuer hym spayne kyng haralde charge go message rode lysbon ther dyde message kynge answered haralde sayd howe wolde take aduyse mater whiche way wolde take whan detmyned promysed sende worde ther kynge spayne haralde departed agayne ceuyll foude kyng fraunce aragon galyce coe kyng ther shewed answere euery man well content nat long kyng portyngale aduyse englysshemen shulde delyuer certayne place batayle owne countrey ordayned suche shulde go viewe place conuenyent entent went forthe sir thomas symon souldiche lestra aduised place bitwene clue ale de lore whiche fayre playne place fyghton two knyghtes company scrimysshe wente aduyse place foreryders kyng castyls dyuers hurt slayne bothe party finally retourned kyng portyngale shewed hym hadde aduysed place wherwith euery man well content kynge ordayned knyght almayne named sir johan custodore go kynge castyle message haralde hym departed rode ceuyll dyd message shewyng hym howe shulde haue place delyuered hym bitwene clue ualede lore within fyue dayes departed fro cuyll shulde fynde kynge portyngale redy gyue hym batayle sayeng nowe desyred nothyng el tidynges spanyerdes ryght ioyfull also frenche men knightes spaygne toke messangers portyngale made great chere day helde good company coude next day brought jafreys retourned messangers retourned kyng portyngale shewed hym howe done message aunswere wherwith kynge well cotent nat long kynge portyngale went lodged hym hoost place aduysed bytwene clue uale delore fayre playne among olyues nobre xv thousandemen fourthe daye thyder came erle cambridge englysshe men good order nombre sixe hundred men armes many archer lodged theselfe ioyninge kynges company whan kyng spayne knewe kynge portyngale lodged felde wher batayle shulde made semblant though gladde therof sayd let v go forthe enemyes abydeth v tyme ryde desyred batayle acorded v kepte promyse made none otherwyse shall haue batayle lette v drawe thyderwarde comaunded euery man shulde go forwarde departed logynges knightes squyers geneuoys genetours folowed kyug baner went lodged within two lytell myles place apoynted kynge castyle genetours nombre threscore thousande men thus maner two hostes lay one thother bytwene hyll towne uale de lore parteynyng kyng spayne thyder resorted men whan lyst refresshe cytie clue parte hyll teyning kyng portyngale bytwene two hostes moutayne ther done dayly ded armes yong knyghtes bachelers desyring auauce theselfe contynued space xv dayes faut nat kyng castell batayle rather kynge portyngale sawe well nat stronge ynough fight spaynierdes douted parell myght fall sawe well ther discofyted realme lost euer fro hym also season loked euer comynge duke lancastre company englande promysed bring hym foure thousande men armes many archer erle cambridge certifyed kyng portyngale wolde come thought nat cotrary wolde haue come duke lacastre beginnyng whan departed englande promysed hym faythe soone retourned scotlande wolde incontynent come portyngale suche nombre able fight kynge spaygne true duke lancastre dyde might kepe promyse bycause trouble ben yere englande certayne incydentes fallen flau ders kyng englande cousayle wolde nat suffre hym dete englande wolde nat consent voyage portyngale tyme men warre shulde go oute englande whan kyng portyngale sawe coude haue none conforte englisshmen thought seke another way mayster castrane dapeter modesque bysshoppe bruges bysshoppe lysbon entreated peace bytwene portyngale spayne moche dyde peace taken englysshmen neuer called therto wherwith therle cambridge sore displeased wolde gladly haue made warre agaynst kynge portyngale thought selfe strong ynoughe countre natso therfore behoued hym suffre peace whider wolde nat thenglysshmen sayd kynge portyngale right yuell delte euer syth begynnynge endyng euer dissymuled spanyerdes neuer wyll fyght kyng portyngale excused hym selfe sayd howe faute englysshemen duke lancastre shulde haue come dyde nat wherfore coude none otherwyse take peace phowe kyng spaygne maryed agayne kyng portyngales doughter cap ccc xcv kyng castyls hoost younge knight frauce called sir trystram de roy desyred greatly auauce honoure whan lawe peace made bitwene two kyng ther shulde batayle determyned nat go spayn tyll done dede armes sende haralde thenglysshe hoost requyryng knightes squyers syth bataile fayled bytwene two kynges knight squier wolde answere hym thre course speare cite uale delore whan tidynges came englysshe hoost knightes squyers spake toguyder sayd howe offre ought nat refused yonge squyer englande called myles wyndsore wold hono made knight vyage sayd vnto haralde frende retourne maister say sir trystram de roy myles wynsore sendeth hym worde morowe nexte cyte uale de lore shall ther delyuer desyre haralde returned recorded tidynges maysters sir tristram right ioyouse next mornynge myles wyndsore departed felde rode warde cyte uale de lore whiche nat farr mountayne passe well companyed ther hym sir mathue courney sir wyllyam beauchampe sir thomas symon souldyche lestrate lorde newcastell lorde de la barde dyuers well hudred knightes squiers place wher batayle shulde bytwene also thyder came sir trystram de roy well acompanyed frenche men breton myles wyndsore made knight handes souldyche lestrade hym reputed best knyght copany thus two knight armed peces well horsed speares redy ha de ranne eche brake speares eche vpon rudely without hurt ran seconde course thirde course strake eche rudely myddes sheldes speare heedes entred throughe plate harnes bare flesshe hurt speares brake tron hyons flewe ouer heedes ayre course praysed sawe toke leaue eche right honorablye retourned euery manne owne partie war vsed ther peace bytwene bothe realm eycher partie departed went home thus army brake vp tyme tidynges came kynge spaynes hoost howe kynge granade made great warre agaynst kynge barbary kyng trayne samayns wherfore suche knight wolde go thider shuld receyued wage kynge granade wolde sende sure saue conduct assone become granade shulde haue prest wage quarter yere hande wherby certayne knyghtes fraunce sir trystram de roy sir geffray carney sir peter cleremot dyuers toke leaue kyng castyle went thyder seke aduentures lykewise dyde englysshe men nat many therle cambridge brought home agayne englande son also wher shewed well nat content kynge portyngale take way son hym maryed kynges doughter sayde howe sonne coulde nat endure ayre countrey euer kynge coulde say erle wolde nat leaue behynde sayd kyng sonne yong abyde portingale wherfore fell ye shall p yere peace thus made bytwene spayn portyngale erle cambridge retourned englande quene castyle dyed doughter kyng aragon kyng spayne wydower debated prelate lord bothe countreis spayne portyngale lady beatryce portigale coude nat higher maryed thanne kynge spayne bring two realmes full accorde peace kyng portyngale agreed ye maryage deuorsed doughter fro erle cambridge sonne pope dispensacion cofyrmed newe maryage thus kyng portyngales doughter made quene spaygne castyle galyce first yere kyng spaynes maryage wife fayre sonne wherof gad great ioye dyed ferrande kyng portyngale howbeit portingale wolde nat suffre realme come kynge spayne right wyfe made kyng bastarde brother kynges dysceassed called maister denys bastard portyngale denys ryght valyant man armes alwayes bare armes portigale thus crouned kynge wherby grewe moche warre bytwene spayne portyngale ye shall boke whau therle cambridge co pany retourned realme englande kyng duke lancastre made great chere reason demauded tidynges shewed manere warre duke lancastre whome matere moost touched bycause chalenge made realme castyle named hym selfe heyre therof right tytell wyfe lady custaunce somtyme doughter dompeter kyng castell therfore demauded brother erle ca bridge howe demeaned selfe portyngale therle shewed hym howe ye two kynges layen hoost fyftene dayes one fayre brother bycause kynge portyngale coulde worde fro lightly accorded ye peace coulde neuer se ye euer wolde codiscende batayle wherof partie sore dyspleased wolde gladly haue put adueture sir bycause canne se sure state trust therfore haue brought agayne sonne hath maryed kyng doughter sir duke thynke ye good cause sauyng feare breakyng maryage paraduenture kynge may fynde aduautage another place wyll gyue doughter pleasure faythe sir quod therle happe wyll thinke haue done nothyng wherof shulde repent entred communycation mater p nowe lette v leaue speke warres spayne portyngale retourne warres gaunte erle countrey flaunders whiche right feirse cruell p great necessyte vytales gaut endured socoured liege cap ccc xcvi season distruction brinnyng towne grauntmont ye reysyng siege gaunt cause displeasure ye erle flaunders dethe cosyn yonge lorde dangheyn slayne enbusshment gauntoyse ye haue herde knyghtes squiers good townes made warre gaut garisons ye countre helde erle agaynst gaunt except four mestiers theym vytayle came gaunte vitayle cae gaunt countie alos erle flauders sone knewe foude remedy incotynent sent garyson teremot comaudyng ouerryn brenne playne countrey countie alos whiche done comaundment poore folkes beastes fayne flye way brabant haynalte moste parte go beggyng yet countrey parteynyng foure mestiers fro ther came euer ayde vitayle gaunt thus wynter erle flauders constrayned sore gaunt coulde haue nothyng come nother land water erle wonne cosyns duke brabant duke aubert coutreis kept close agaynst gaunt nothynge came fro then without stelth great aduenture parell dyd sage men sayd howe coulde nat longe endure ye must dye famyne garner voyd people coulde gette breed money whan breed baken towne fayne kepe stronge hande el comon people dyed hunger wolde haue taken byforce great pyte se poore people bothe men woman chyldren ye suche right notable fell dauger euery day encreased complayntes wepynges cryes made phylyp dartuell souerayne capitayne great pytie compassyon made many good order wherof greatly praysed caused garner abbey opened ryche men sette resonable price corne wherby towne greatly conforted corne ther came stelthe holande zelande tonne full flower bysket breed whiche greatly conforted hadde bene longe discomfyted nat bene comforted sayd coutreys defeded brabant duke ye payne dethe shulde cary thyng gaunt gaunt wolde ieoparde fetche tha myght gyue sell pleasure whan ye tyme lent came great dystresse lenton stuffe ther departed towne xii thousande sowdyers suche nothyng lyue ouercome famyne came towne brusels towne closed gate agaynst feared knewe nat thoughtes whane nere brusels sende certayne copany vnarmed gate towne desyred towne godsake haue pytie suffer haue vitayle money saynge howe dyed hunger sware howe thought none yuell coutrey good men brusels pytie brought vytayle money passed tyme countrey space thre wekes coulde entre good towne came louayn pytie dyde moche good refresshyng capitayne leader frau ce atreman made treaty good townes season gaunt lay march louayne capitayne spake maysters cytie lyege compassyon bysshoppe liege sir arnolde darcle promysed sende erle flaunders moche make peace sayeng vnto ye good men gaunt coutrey lyege nere brabant haynalte ye shuld otherwyse comforted v ye maynteyne fraunches howe beit shall ayde moche maye wyll ye marchauntes vse marchandyse may go come coutrey reason fyue sire hundred carte laded corne owner corne may truly payed therfore wyl suffer marchaundyse passe thorowe brabant peace though brusels closed knowe well feare yuell wyll haue great copassyon duke brabant ye duches desyre cosyn erle flaunders inclyneth rather parte reason wayes great lordes wyll holde eche offer loue legeoyse offered gauntoyse therof greatly reioysed thanked hertlye sayd howe suche people frendes gauntoyse great nede fraunces atreman burgess gaunt yt cyte liege toke leue ye maysters liege ordayned certayne men go countrey gette chares two dayes sixe hundred charged corne wherof moost nede wente forthe caryage passed bytwene louayn brusels whane fraunces atreman came company shewed loue courtesy ye liege offred offereth yet moreouer sayde howe wolde go brusels speke duches brabant desyre fynde meanes howe good towne gaunt myght haue peace erle flaunders sent vnto knowe pleasure contente shulde come speke went brusels tyme duke brabant lusenburge frauces thre entred brusels came duches lodgyng coleberge duches parte counsayle fraunces atreman kneled downe sayd ryght honorable dere lady benygne grace may please haue pyte compassion gaunt come mercy erle flaunders meanes right dere lady meanes ye coude cause lorde therle discende reason haue pytie poore men gaunt ye shulde herin great almes dede madame liege wolde gladly help therto best power lady aunswered ryght humbly sayd howe discencyon bytwene cosyn erle gaunt displeased right greatly howe longe tyme wolde gladly bene peace bytwene could haue founde meanes howe also sayd ye sir gaunt ye haue oft tymes displeased hym haue holden marueylous opynios agaynst hath caused susteyne styll displeasur agaynst howbeit goddessake pytie shall enploy herin best shall sende desyring wyll come tourney shall counsayle somoche ye may haue ther counsayle haynalte liege ye say wyll ye truely madame haue promysed v well duches ye shall se shall best madame quod god rewarde bodely gostly tooke leaue departed fro brusels came company chariotes taryed dyd moch came towne gaunt whan tydinges came gaut men retourned hadde brought mo sixe hundred chares vytayle ryght ioyfull howbeit brought wolde nat suffyse towne gaunt space xv dayes yet disconforted great comforte went agaynst cariage moche people maner processyon kneled helde vp handes marchautes brought sayng ye good people ye haue done great almes thus conforte meane people gaunt nothyng lyue ye nat come fyrst laude prayse god chares conueyed market place discharged corne deuyded delyuered weight moost nede fyue thousande gaunt coueyed agayne chares brabant dauger knewe well erle flaunders beynge bruges knewe well gaunt sore costrayned coude nat longe endure nothyng sory pouertie nomore counsayle wolde gladly haue sene distruccyon towne gylberte mahewe brethern fell lent monethe marche aprill yere lorde god thousande thre hudred fourscore one erle flaunders purpose come puissantly euer dyd lay sieg gaunt determyned entre four mestiers brinne hym bycause ayded gaunt vytayle erle sent mynde entent good townes flauders comaundyng redy ye processyon day one past bruges sayd wolde departe go lay siege gaunt also wrote knyghtes squiers held heynalt shulde hym bruges within viii dayes p harde aunswere erle flaunders made gaunt nombre men armes parys fraunce cap ccc xcvii somons therle flaunders made yet duches brabant duke aulbert bysshope liege traueyled moch therle day let cousayle shulde mete treat peace cytie tourney though erle lothe therto yet desyre lord greed haue counsayle mater cyte tourney ye weke ester yere lorde thousande thre c lxxx two hymselfe day assigned thyder came bysshoppe lyege good townes nombre xii sir lambert perney rightsage knight also duches brabant sent thyder ye moost notablest persones cousayle certayne euery good towne also duke albert sent thyder countie haynalte counsayle sir symon de la layne baylife dyuers came tourney ester weke gaunt sent thyder xii notable person wherof phylippe dartuell chyfe gaunt greed whatsoeuer ende ii made none shulde suffer dethe pleased ye erle content banyssehd gaunt coutie flau ders foreuer vpon concluded philippe dartuell moch pytie comon people dyspleasure done erle yet content put hym selfe erles mercy whan departed fro gaut go tourney men woman chyldren fell downe knee holdyng vp handes de syring hym soeuer myschefe endured wolde bring peace whiche crye pytie determyned shewed whan liege heynalt brabant hadde ben tourney space thre dayes ye day apoynted past sawe erle came nat nat comyng great marueyle toke counsayle togyder determyned sende brusels dyd sent ser lambert perney brabant ye lorde compelant haynalt sir willyam herman sixe burgess thre countreyes whan erle sawe thre knight made great chere reason whan knew message aunswered howe nat ease come tourney tyme howe beit sayde bycause come traueyled haue hym tournay ye honoure suche come thyder instance lady brabant suster duke aulbert cosyn bysshoppe liege sayd content sende hastely tourney fynall answere cousayle thre knyghtes coude haue non aunswere tyme retourned agayne tournay shewed howe erle answered sixe dayes came tourney erle lorde rasels lorde gountris sir johan wylliam prouost harlequebec excuse therle bycause came nat declared erles full entent touchyng ye peace sayng howe gaut haue peace erle without wyll generally maner men gaut age bytwen xv lx come towne gaut theirshyrtes bare heeded halter neckes mete erle bytwene bruges gaunt erle doo pleasure outher let lyue put dethe pleasure whan aunswere made relacyon therof declared gaunt counsayls thre coutreis abasshed euer baylyfe heynalte sayd sir ye great parell euery take hede himselfe thynke ye take way put yourselfe wyll wyll nat put dethe seyth presens paraduenture wyll hath displeased hym tha thynke shall haue suche meanes pytie paraduenture suche weneth selfe moost parell may hap come pardon mercy therfore sir wolde cousayle take offre refuse nat ye thynk wyll longe ye recouer agayne suche nother offre sir quod phylip dartwell haue charge go far bryng good people gaunt poynt ensure wyll nat sir whan come agayne gaunt haue shewed therles pleasur knowe trouth wyll nat wyll ensure shall nat let v sir thanke traueyle good dyligence ye haue ho mater gaunt toke leaue cousayls thre cou treis made well semblant wolde wyse agre purpose departed returned gaunt brabant thus brake vp cousayle tour nay euery man went home therle flaunders demauded aunswer gaunt made shewed hym erle sette lytell prise knewe well hadd endured suffred moche coulde nere suffre longar wherfore thought shulde haue shortely honorable ende warre bring gaunt poynt townes shulde take ensample p season comons parys began agayne murmure bycause kynge came nat thyder feared lest king wolde haue come sodenly certayn men warr ouerryn cytie haue put dethe whome hadde lyst dought parell made great watche euery nyght stretes market place reysed vp cheynes man shulde ryde entre among persone founde abrode ix clocke without well knowen amonge deed parys ryche men men armes nombre xxx thousande well harnessed peces knyght ought also seruauntes right well harnessed bearynge great malettes yron stele confounde helmes whan nombred viewed thought theselfe able fight greatest prince world people called rowtes malettes parys p howe fyue thousande gau toyse yssued gaunt fyght therle bruges aunswere phylip dartuell shewed cap ccc xcviii whan phylip dartuell company entred agayne gaunt great nombre comon people desyring nothing peace ryghte ioyfull comynge trustynge good tidynges came agaynst hym coude nat restrayne demauded tidyn ge sayng dere sir phylip dartuell reioyse v good worde let v knowe howe ye haue sped whiche demaundes phylippe gaue none aunswere passed holdynge downe heed helde peace people folowed hym precyng tydinges one twise rode lodgynge warde sayde folowed hym sir retourne house day god ayde morowe ix clocke come market place ye shall tydinges shewe aunswere coulde haue none hym wherof euery man greatly abasshed whan phylippe dartuell alighted lodgynge suche bene tourney hym euery man gone owne lodgynges peter de boyse desyred tydinges came euenyng phylyps house two went togyder chambre peter demauded hym howe spedde phylippe wolde hyde nothyng fro hym sayd fayth peter therle flaunders hath answered cousayle sent tourney wyll take maner persone within towne gaut mercy one thanne another faythe quod peter say trouthe dothe right well counsayled opynion te taker well one another nowe mater come euen myne entent also entent good mayster john lyon deed nowe towne wyll trowbled wyll harde euer apease agayne nowe tyme take bridell tethe nowe shall sene sage hardye towne gaunt outher shortly towne gaunt shall moost honoured towne christendome el moost desolate leest dye quarell shall nat dye alone therfore philyp remembre selfe well night howe ye may make relacyon morowe people determynacion counsayle holden nowe tourney ye may shewe maner people may cotent ye haue redy grace people two cause one bycause name somtyme jakes dart well yor father maruelusly well beloued cause ye entreat people mekely sagely comon sayng towne wherfore people wyll beleue lyue dye ende shewe counsayle saye howe ye wyll thus thus wyll saye therfore behoueth take good aduyce shewyng wordes wheron lyeth honour truely philyppe ye say trouthe trust speke shewe besynes gaut gouernours capitayns shall outher lyue dye honour thus departed nyght eche fro peter de boyse went home howse philyp dartuell abode styll ye may well knowe beleue yt whan day desyred come philyp dartuell shulde generally reporte effect cousayle holden tourney people towne gaut drewe market place wednisday mornyng ix bell philyp dartuell peter de boyse pe de myrt frauces atreman thother capitayns came thyder entred vp comon hall philyp leaned wyndowe began speke sayde ye good people trouth desyre ryght honourable lady lady brabante ryght noble duke aulbert baylife heynalt holande zelande lorde bysshop liege cousayle agreed accorded tournay sonally therle flau ders certyfyed sayde lordes haue nobly aquited theselfe sent thyder ryght notable cousaylours knightes burgess good townes good towne gaut ther day assigned lokyng abyding erle flaunders came nat wolde nat come whan sawe came nat comynge thane sente bruges thre knyghtes thre countreys burgess good townes traueyled moche sake went bruges founde hym made great chere sayd harde well message answered sayd honoure lordes loue suster lady brabant sayd wolde sende cousayle tourney fyue sixe dayes well instructed shulde playnly shewe full entencyon mynde aunswere coude none haue retourned gayne v tourney day assygned therle came fro hym tourney lorde ranessels lord goutris sir johan uillayns prouost harlequebec ther shewed graciously lordes wyll certayne arest warre howe peace myght bytwene erle towne gaunt fyrst determynatly sayd therle wyll euery man towne gaunt except prelate church religion aboue age xv yere vnder age lx shirtes bare heeded bare foted haulters neckes auoyde towne gaunt go xii myle then playne burlesquans shall mete erle flaunders acompanyed suche shall please hym wha seyth v case holdyng vp handes cryeng mercy shall haue pytie compassyon v please hym sir nat knowe relacion counsayle shamefull punycion iustyce shall suffre dethe moost parte people shall appere day nowe sir cosyder well ye wyll come peace meanes nat whan philyp dartuell spoken wordes great pytie se men woman chyldren wepe wryng hand loue father bretherne husbandes neyghbours tourmet noyse philyp dartuell began agayne speke said pea sir pea contynent euery man styll began speke sayde ye good people gaunt ye nowe assembled moost parte ye haue harde haue sayde sir se none remedy shorte counsayle ye knowe well necessyte lacke vitayle sure xxx thousande towne dyd eate breed v dayes passed sir thre thynges must necessyte one fyrst ye wyll let v enclose ourselfe towne mure vp gate tha confesse v clene god lette v entre church mister let v dye famyn repetant synnes lyke martyr people noo man wyll haue mercy yet state god shall haue mercy soules shalbe sayd euery place shall herde deed valyauntly lyke true people el secondly let v men woman chyldren go halter neckes shyrtes crye mercy lorde erle flaunders thynke herte wyll nat indurate whan seyth v state hert wyll molefy take mercy people selfe wyll fyrst pea displeasure shall present heed content dye gaunt el thyrdly let v chose towne fyue sixe thousande men moste able best apoynted let v go hastely assayle erle bruges fyght hym dye voiage least shalbe honourable god shall haue pytie v world shall say valiantly truly haue kept maynteyned quarell batayle god wyll haue pytie v aunciantly put puissance ye handes nabugodonosor duke mayster chyualry whome assyrience discomfyted shall reputed moost honorable people hath raygned syth dayes romayns nowe sir take good hede whiche thre weyes ye wyll take one must ye nedes take suche next hym harde hym best said ser haue trust cousayle v sir loke ye cousayle v shall folowe faythe philyppe counsayle let v go army men agaynst erle shall fynde hym bruge soone shall knowe comynge wyll issue fyght v pride bruges aboute hym nyght daye enfourmeth styreth hym fyght v god wyll grace haue victory disconfyte enemyes shall recouered foreuer moost honoured people worlde disconfyted shall dye honourably god shall haue pyte v therby people gaunt shall escape erle wyll haue marcy therwt answerd one vocye wyll thus wyll thus wyll make none ende philyppe aunswered sayd sir wylles thus retourne home howses make redy harnesse morowe somtyme day wyll departe gaunt go towarde bruges abyding nothynge v profytable within fyue dayes shall knowe shall dye lyue honoure shall sende constable euery parysshe fro howse howse chose moost able best apoynted men state euery man departed market place made redy wednysday kept ye towne close nother man woman entred issued towne tyll thursday mornyng euery man redy suche shulde departe nombre v thousand men nat past two hundred chares ordynaunce artyllary vii carte vitayle fyue bysket breed two tonne wyne hadde two tonne left behynd towne harde departynge lefte behynde hardly bestadde pytie beholde went forthe abode behynde sayde sir nowe departure ye knowe ye leaue behynde neuer thynke come hyder agayne without ye come honor otherwyse ye shall fynde thynge soone tidynges ye outher slayne disconfytted shall sette towne fyre distroy ourselfe lyke people dispayred yt went forthe sayd comfort sir pray god v truste shall helpe v also retourne agayne thus fyue thousande deted fro gaunt small uysion thursday went lay myle without gaunt brake nat vp prouisyon passed nyght thynges founde abrode countre friday went forth nat touchyng yet vitayle foregers founde somwhat countre wherwith passed day lodged seuyn myle fro bruges ther rested toke place grounde deuyse abyding enemyes great plasshe standynge water wherwith fortifyed theymselfe one parte parte caryages passed night p order batayle gauntoise howe discofited erle bruges meanes cap cccxcix wha came saturday ye mornyng weder fayre clere holyday called bruges day custome made processyos tydinges cae howe ye gauntoyse coe thyder ye shulde haue sene gret murmuring bruges last worde therof cae therle co pany wherof erle great marueyle sayde beholde yonder vngracyous people gaunt trowe deuyll hath brought distruction nowe tyme come haue ende warre thanne knightes squyers came hym receyued graciously sayd shall go fyght yonder vnhappy people gaunte yet quod erle rather dye swerde famyne erle counsayled sende thre men armes felde se demeanoure enemyes marshall flaunders apoynted thre squyers valyaunt men armes go se behauyng gau toyse p lambert lambres dama buffey johan beart thre departed fro bruges rode towarde ennemyes meane tyme whyle thre went forthe bruges made redy yssue go fyght gauntoyse shall shewe sowhat order saturday mornynge phyllyppe dartuell ordayned comaunded euery man shulde make hym redy god caused mass songe dyuers place certayne freers euery man cofessed hym prayed god grace mercy ther certayne sermos made enduryng hour halfe shewedde people freers clerkes figurynge people israell whome kynge pharaon kepte long seruytude howe ye grace god delyuered ledde lande behest moyses aaron kyng pharaon egypciens slayne taken lykewise quod freers ye good people ye kept inseruytude youre lorde erle flaunders neighbour bruges whome nowe ye becoe shall fought lykelyhode enemyes haue great wyll fight feare lytell puyssauce sir take hede god knoweth seythe thynge shall haue mercy thynke nothynge ye haue lefte behynde ye may well knowe without recoueraunce ye disconfyted therfore sell lyues valyantly dye none remedy honorably nat dismayed thoughe great puyssaunce people yssue oute bruges agaynst vyctorie lyeth nat puyssaunce people onely god grace hath ben often tymes sene well macabeus rhomayns small people good wyll trustynge grace god hathe disconfyted agreat nombre people sir quarell ye haue good right juste cause therfore many reason ye ought hardy good cofort thus suche word freers preched ye people mornynge wherwith well content thre partes hoost houseled wynge theym selfe haue great trust god mass songe assembled toguyder lytell hyll phylyppe dartuell great sentence shewed fro poynt poynt ryght thought quarell howe often me towne gaunt requyred ode erle haue mercy coulde neuer come poynt hym great confusyon domage towne gaunt enhabytautes therof also sayeng howe come farforthe recule agayne coude nat also retourne thynges consydered coude wynne nothynge therby hadde lefte nothynge behynde pouertie heuynesse moreouer sayd sir thynke nother wyues chyldren thynke honour thus suche fayre word philyppe dartuell shewed among well langaged coude speke rightwell well became hym finally sayd fayre lordes lette v truely equaly dete oure vitayle eche lyke bretherne wtout maner outrage whan spende must behoue v seke newe thinke lyue right humbly chayres discharged bred deuyded constable two tonne wyne bottomes set vpwarde dyned bredde wyne contente small repaste tyme felt selfe better disposed bothe courage membres thane eaten meare whane dyner past set selfe order drewe selfe within rybaudeur whiche hyghe stake bounde yrone sharpe poynted whiche vsed euer beare warre set batayle closed selfe within estate thre squyers sende fro therle se demea nynge founde aproched nere might well auiewe cae iuste stake gauntoyse neuer styred theym lette alone made semblaunt right ioyefull comynge currours rode bruges therle founde hym lodgyng great nombre knightes squyers hym came preace erle spake loude bycause erle wolde shulde herde shewed howe hadd rydden nere gauntoyse myght haue shotte lyst suffred passe peasably also shewed sene baners erle demaunded nombre people estymacyon answered surely farre coude disery past nat fyue sixe thousande erle sayd well let euery man appareyle hymselfe wyll go fight shall nat dete without batayle therwith trumpettes dyde sowne throughe bruges euery man armed assembled market place set theselfe order baners vsage erles lodgynge assembled lordes knightes squyers whan euery thing redy therle went market place sawe great nombre people well ordred araynged wherof reioysed comaudement euery man drewe bone order feldes great pleasure beholde xl thousande armed men hors hacke fote came nere place gauntois rested tyme therle come thyder past noone sonne began declyne soe sayd erle sir ye se yonder enemyes handefull men regarde company sir nat flye away wolde counsayle nat fight night let alone tyll morowe sir therby ye shall se wyll shall febler nowe haue nothynge eate erle acorded well counsayle wolde shulde haue ben done bruges hote hasty fight wolde nat abyde sayd set shall nat long endure bruges began shote gonne gaut discharged one thre c gonne one shotte tourned bout plasshe water caused son eyen bruges greued sore entred among cryed gaunt soone bruges herde crye gaunt herde many go ne come among sawe howe ser full front lyke fals herted people yuell courage gaue way gautois entre among without de fence cast downe weapens tour ned backes gautoyse seyng well howe enemyes disconfyted kept selfe styll close toguyder beate downe bothe sydes theym euer wente forth cryeng gaut sayeng also folowe folowe enemyes discomfyted let v entre bruges god hath regarded v euenyng pytie sayd dyd pursued bruges sharp lye ouer toke slewe taryed nat kept styll way euer bruges fledde many slayne beaten downe among bruges defence trowe neuer vnhappy people recreantly maynteyned selfe great pride bobance wolde thynke suppose ymaginacyon ben treason whiche nat non symple defence yuell fortune fell p howe towne bruges taken gautoyse howe erle flaunders saued hym selfe poore woman house towne bruges cap cccc whan erle flaunders copany sawe yuell der rule bruges sawe howe discofyted owne follye coude se recoueraunce fledde awaye gauntoyse therle abasshed discofyted fledde away euery man saue hymselfe trouthe bruges wolde haue retour ned agayne assayled gauntoyse helpe bene lykely haue recoue red agayn saw remedy fledde towarde bruges fast myght fader taryed nat sonne sonne fader men armes brake array hadd lyst take way bruges prease great way towarde bruges maruayle tose clamoure crye slayne hurt gautoyse fo lowyng bruges cryeng gaunt gaunt styll goynge forwarde beatyng downe people moost parte men armes wolde nat put themselfe parell howbeit therle counsayled drawe bruges one first shulde entre close gate thentent gauntoys shulde nat lordes bruges therle seyng none remedy recouerauce abydynge felde sawe well euery man fledde also darke nyght wherfore beleued cousayle gyuen hym toke way towarde bruges baner came gate entred first xl set men kepe gate close gau toyse dyde folowe erle rode owne lodgyng sende towne commaundyng euery man payne dethe drawe market place thentensyon erle recouer towne meanes dyde nat ye shall meane tyme therle logyng sende forthe clerkes euery warde fro strete strete haue euery man drawe market place recouer towne gauntoise pursewed sofiersly enemyes entred towne brug assone within towne first thyng dyde went streyght market place set selfe array erle sende knight called sir robert marshall gate se gautoise dyde whan cae gate founde gate beaten downe gau toyse maisters therof bruges met hym sayd sir robert retourne saue selfe ye towne gaunt knight retourned therle fast might comyng lodgynge hors backe great nobre cressett lyghtes hym go yng market place knight shewed therle knewe howe beit erle wyllyng recouer towne drewe market place entryng hym seyng place raynged gauntoyse sayd therle sir retourne agayne ye go farther ye deed taken wt enemyes raynged market place abyde shewed hym trouthe whan gautoyse sawe clerenesse lyght comyng downe strete sayd yonder cometh erle shall come oure hades philyppe dartuell commaunded fro strete strete wente erle came amonge theym man shulde hym bodely harme take hym lyue haue hym gaut make peace lyst therle trusted haue recouered came ryght nere place gauntoyse dyuers men sayd sir go farther gauntoyse lordes market place towne ye entre ye market place ye dauger slayne taken great nombre gauntoyse goynge fro strete strete sekynge ennemyes haue certayne towne bringe fro house house wolde sir gate ye nat yssue gauntoyse lord therof owne lodgynge ye nat retourne great nombre gauntoyse goyng thyder whan therle herde tidynges whiche right harde hym reason greatly abasshed ymagined parell thane beleued counsayle wolde go farther saue hym selfe myght tooke owne counsayle comaunded put lyghtes sayd hym se well recouery let euery man departe saue hym selfe well may comaunded done lyghtes quenched cast stret euery man departed therle went backe lane made varlette vnarme hym dyd cast away armure put olde cloke varlettes sayd hym go thy way fro saue thy selfe thou canst haue good tonge thou fall handes thyne enemyes aske thyng nat knowen towne answered sayd ser dye therfore wyll speke worde thus abode erle flauders alone might well saye great daunger harde aduenture tyme fallen handes enemyes bene daunger dethe gautoyse went fro house house serchyng erles frendes euer founde brought market place without remedy philyp dart well capitayns put dethe god frende erle saue parell neuer suche daunger lyfe neuer ye shall hystorie hour mydnight erle went fro strete strete backe lane last fayne take house el founde gaunt went ye towne entred poore woman house whiche nat mete suche lorde ther nother hall palys chabre poore smoky house nothyng poore hall blacke smoke aboue smale placher ladder vii steppe mount vpon plancher poore couche wher poore womas chyldren lay therle sore abasshed trymblyng entryng said good woma saue thy lorde therle flauders must hyde myne enemyes chase ye good shall rewarde therfore poore woman knewe hym well ben often tymes gate fetche almes often sene hym wet sportyng incotynet hap answered made delay bene taken talkynge fyre sayd sir mount vp ladder ley selfe vnder bedde ye fynde chyldren slepe meane tyme woman sat downe fyre another chylde armes erle mouted vp plancher well myght crept bytwene couche strawe lay flatte coude euyn ther rutters gaut entred ye hous sayd sene entre house foud woman syttyng fyre chylde sayd good woman sawe entre v house dyde shytte dore hym sir quod sawe man entre house nyght went rightnowe cast lytell water dyd close dore agayne coulde nat tell howe hyde hym ye se easment haue house ye may se bedde aboue placher lyeth poore chyldren one toke candell mouted vp ladder put vp heed aboue placher sawe ther none thyng poore couche chyldren lay slept loked sayde company go hen lese lesse poore woman sayth trouth creature chyldren deted house ther none entred hurt wordes erle herde ryght well laye vnder poore couche ye may well ymagin tha great feare lyfe might well saye nowe one poorest prince worlde myght well say fortune worlde nothynge stable yet good happe scaped lyfe howe harde peryllous adueture myght well hym spectacle lyfe ensample p nowe let v leaue erle flaunders harde estate speke bruges howe gauntoyse parceyuered p howe gaunte spared marchauntes straungers howe erle parted fro bruges went lysle howe receyued ioyously cap cccc fraunces atreyman one chefe capiteynes rutters sent philyppe dartuell peter de boyse seke aboute brug enemy kepe ye markette place nyght tyll next day might se lordes towne straytely comaunded shulde hurte marchaunt straunger beyng bruges sayeng howe reason shulde take hurte warre commaundement well kept chefe occasyon fell foure mestyers alwayes ben fauourable erle warpe place gauntoyse went serchyng foude slayne without mercy nyght slayne han xii hundred one many robberyes yuell dedes ye whiche came nat knowledge dyuers house robbed pylled wome defoyled distroyed coffer broken vp moost poorest gaunt becoe riche sondaye mornynge ioyfull tidynges cae towne gaut howe company disconfyted erle chiualry lordes maysters bruges ye may well beleue knowe tidynges greatly reioysed people beyng tribulacyon ioye made dyuers processyons laudynge god regarded eye pytie conforted gyue vyctorie enemyes alwayes came fresshe tidynges theym vyctorie wherby reioysed wyst nat lorde harsels abidynge gaunt taken sonday monday thre foure thousande men harnesse gone andwarpe taken ye towne pleasure towne abasshed whan herde tidyng nigh feare fledde towne heynaulte place haue saued selfe therto redy aparelled whan sawe gaunte came nat warde courage came also suche knyghtes came thyder dyde confort sir johan bernage sir tyrrey du ban sir flureant hurle thre knightes conforted andwarpe vnto suche tyme si dama hallone came thyder fro erle ye shall ther neuer people dyde enemyes gaunte dyde bruges dyde hurt man smale craftes towne without sore accused whan philyp dartwell capitayns gaut sawe lordes bruges comau dement vnder obeysauce made crye euery man payne dethe shulde drawe logynges nat robbe pylle make debate without comaunded enquered man knewe therle become sayd howe fledde saturday sayd howe styll towne hyd coude nat founde capitayns gaut toke lytell hede therof wereso reioysed vyctorie cared nothynge nother erle baron knight flauders reputed selfe great thought haue vnder obeysace philyp dartuell peter de boyse remebred whan deted fro gaut left vitayle purueyauce ye town therfore sent streyght certayne nombre men dan scluse thetent belordes therof vitayle whan suche sent cae dan opyned gate towne put handes euery thyng commaudement taken fayre cellers good wynes poyctou gascone rochell farre coutreis fyue sixe thousande tonne layde shippes chares conueyed gaunt lande water went farther came scluse whiche towne incontynent opyned theym put vnder obeysaunce founde great quantyte corne meale shyppes cellers marchau te straungers bought payed sende gaunt water lade thus towne gaunt refresshed delyuered fro misery grace god wyse coude nat haue ben done gautoys ought well remembre god playnly holpen seyng fyue thousandemen nere famysshed disconfyted xl thousandemen home owne doores capitayns cause proude therof proud therof god displeased theym well sene yere passed ye shall storie gyue ensample people enformed beleue well sonday night erle flauders yssued towne brug meanes nat saye dyde helpe make way nat tell beleue yes yssued fote alone olde symple cloke whan feldes ioyfull might well say howe escaped daugerous passage went forthe aduenture went thicke busshe tose way myght take knewe nat well wayes nat wonte go fote stode vnder thicke bussh night herde aduenture man speke came knight maried bastard doughter called sir robrt marshall therle knewe hym well wordes passed said robert ye knight knewe erle well speche sayde sir ye haue made day seke many place bruges howe ye gette let v go way quod erle tyme tell aduentures pray let v moche may haue horse sore wery goyng fote pray let v take ye way lysle ye knowe yes sir knight knowe well wente forthe nyght tyll next mornyng coude get horse yet coude gette none first founde mare whiche toke fro poore man vyllage erle lept without sadyll panell night came lysle wher moost te knightes fledde felde come thyder fote hors backe soe gone hollande zelande sir guy guystels arryued good port founde zelande towne therle guy bloyes made hym good chere departed largely hym wylled tary ther hym long shulde please hym thus desolate reco forted lord resorted vnto pyte reason noblenesse gentylnesse ought ayded noble gentyls p great richesse gau toyse founde bruges howe townes flaunders yelded gaunte except warpe cap cccc ii tidynges spredde brode dyuers coutreis disconfyture bruges therle lorde done gauntois wherwith ther diuers people reioysed specially commynalties good townes aboute gaunt bysshoprike liege ioyfull thoughe mater ben owne lykewise rohan parys frauce durst haue spoken whanne pope clement herde therof thought hym lytell sayde surely disconfyture stroke god gyue ensample erle god sende tribulacion bycause rebell opinyons also great lord frauce place sayd howe erles aduersytie nat greatly complayned well deserued beare ben presuptuous loued lorde neighbour frenche kyng wherfore coplayned lesse secucyos howbeit olde sayng hath yuell fortune men wyll speke worst therof specially towne louayne greatly reioysed victory gauntoyse erles trouble harde case ye duke brabant lorde purpose make warr beate downe gate kepe therby rather vnder also sayd towne louayn gaunt hadde bene nere brusels wolde haue ioyned togyder haue one wordes deuyses duke duches brabant enformed behoued tyme close eyen holde downe heedes tyme speke thus gaunt beynge bruges deuysed many newe thynges among deuysed beate downe two gate towarde gaunt fyll dyke thentent bruges shuld neuer rebell gaunt whan shuld departe take fyue hundred men bruges thentent kepe feare subiectyon thus meane season whyle capitayns bruges beatyng downe gat walles fillyng dyke sent ipre courtray berges cassell propringne bourbourc townes castels flaunders see cost shulde vnder obeysauce sende keyes townes castels submittynge themselfe obeysauce seruyce obeyed none durst say agaynst came bruges puttyng selfe vnder obeysauce philyppe dartuell peter de boise two named wrote selfe souerayn capitayns specyally pihlyppe dartuell moost besyed selfe charge flaunders longe abode bruges kept estate prince euery day playenge lodgyng dore mynstrels dyner supper serued vessell syluer thogh erle flaunders well myght kepe estate erles vessell golde syluer ieowels founde house bruges ther nothyng saued also sent certayne nombre gauntoyse merlle fayre house erles standyng halfe myle fro bruges went thyder dyd moche hurt brake downe howse brake downe fownte wherin erle christned layd charyotes golde syluer ieowels thynges founde ther sent gaunt terme xv dayes goyng comynge caryages fro bruges gaunt pyllage get iourney harde exsteme profyte gate whane gaunt done wyll pleasure towne bruges sent fiue hudred notablest burgess towne gaunt lye ther hostage fraunces atreman peter de myter thousande men coueyed theym thyder peter de boyse abode capitayne bruges tyll gate walles beaten downe dyke fylled philyppe dartuell departed four thousande men went ipre maner people came agaynst hym receyued honourably though bene owne naturall lord come first lande dyd put selfe vnder obeysauce made newe mayres alderman made newe lawes came thyder cassell berges bourbourcke propringne submytted selfe vnder obeysauce sware faythe trouthe holde hym lorde erle flaunders whan thus done taken assurance taryed ipre space viii dayes departed came courtray also receyued great ioy taryed thre dayes sent messangers letter warpe comaundynge come hym vnder obeysauce seyng howe countrey tourned gaunt howe behynde dyd nat dyd wherfore sent worde surely yt gauntoyse shulde lay siege nat departe tyll towne slayne whan tydinges message came warpe sente fro philyp dartuell thre knyghtes answered hotely sayde howe set lytell manassyng sonne tryer hony ye herrtage therle lorde shuld sone gyue none suche sayeng howe wolde de dye quarell thus messangers retourned agayne courtrey p howe therle flaunders lysle howe andewarpe sieged gauntoyse flemynges cap cccc iii whan philyp dartuell herde messanger speke report howe grayson warpe sette nothynge hym sware euer cost coutrey flaunders wolde nothyng entende tyll taken towne cast downe erth sore dyspleased thought bene well puyssauce seynge flaunders inclyned hym whan soiourned sixe dayes courtrey renewed lawe hadde taken fealtie homage though bene erle flauders returned gaunt ther met procession great ioye erle naturall lorde neuer honourably receyued people worshypped hym lyke god bycause gaue counsaile wherby towne recouered estate puissauce coude nat estemed great rich welth came daily water lande fro bruges fro dan fro sluce lofe breed thre wekes togyder worth olde grote worthe four mytes wyne worth xxiiii grotes valued two grotes euery thynge gaunt better chepe tourney ualencennes philyppe dartuell kepte great stable good horse lyke great prince well stuffed thynge howse though bene erle flaunders better therle apoynted lysle also flaunders offycers bayliffes costables receyuours dayly brought substauce wherby maynteyned astate ware scarlet gownes furred myneuer lyke duke brabant erle haynalt dyd also hadde chambre accompte paye reken euery thyng erle gaue dyuers supper banketes ladyes damosel lyke maner erle done spared nother golde syluer pleasure wrote called himselfe phylip dart well regarde ouer loker flauders erle flaunders beynge lysle moche thynke whan sawe countrey sore rebelled agaynst hym coude nat se puyssance himselfe euer recouer agayn townes vnite one acorde agaynst hym whiche coulde neuer great force puyssaunce countrey spake nomore dyd honour wolde nat knowe hym lorde neuer bene alyaunce duke burgoyne maryed doughter lady margaret whome duke two fayre sonnes alyaunce stode erle good stede happy also hym kyng charles deed yonge kyng vnder gouerning vncle duke burgoyn myght leade kyng pleasur also kyng yong good wyll warre wherfore lesse maystrie styrre therto therle hoped duke burgoyne wolde sone set hym theron wolde shewe howe boude ayde men whan men wyll rebell agaynst thought kynge charles lyued styll tyll tyme wolde haue done nothynge men supposed wolde therby anexed countie flaunders crowne fraunce therle flauders nat well grace wolde haue done thynge hym without knowen well p nowe let v leaue speke deuyses tyll tyme retourne therto agayne lette v shewe howe erle flaunders beynge lysle great losse bruges vnderstode howe sir terrey damayn sir fiurant de heulle kept styll towne andwarpe kept euer sythe besynes brug knewe well knyght nat able resyst agaynst puyssance flaunders came lay siege therto thought wolde shortlye refressh towne therle called sir danyell halwyn sayd sir wyll ye go warpe souerayne capitayn take hundred fyftie speares hundred crosbowes two hundred varlettes speares pauesses take ye hede garison gyue charge therof newe vitayle corne whete otes sault flesshe wyne fro frendes neyghbours tourney wyll nat fayle v nede sir knyght shalbe done sir shall take good hede towne sythe please shall shall none yuell come therto fawte danyell erle sure knyght toke leaue erle went andewarpe refresshed towne newe men warre vitayle thynges necessary whan philyp dartuell beyng gaut vnderstode tydinges howe andwarp refresshed newe men sayd wolde prouyde remedy sayng howe nat suffred greatly preiudyce dyshonour countre flauders towne helde agaynst wherfore sayd wolde go lay siege therto nat departe then tyll beaten downe put dethe tho within knyghtes sent comaundement countre flaunders euery man shulde redy ix day june andwarpe none durst disobey comaundement men good townes flauders franke bruges made redy came layd siege andwarpe lay abrode feldes medowes marsshes philyppe dartuell capytayn whome ordred helde great estate andwarpe reared tayllage flaunders euery fyre euery weke pay four grotes ryche beare feble wherby gate togyder moch money none excused payed seruautes none countrey made euery man paye poore ryche whyder wolde nat sayd siege mo hudred thousande men flemynges pyled ryuer lescalt great pyle great tymbre shyppe coulde come fro tourney andewarpe hoost thynges plentyfull market clothe furres mercery euery saturday market vyllag therabout brought thyder frutes butter mylke chese pulleyn thynges tauernes plentyous wyne though bene brusels renyshe wyne wyne poyctou fraunce malueseys wynes straunge countreis good chepe euery man myght go come passe repasse without parell heynalt brabat almayne liege none fraunce p howe gauntoyse assayled towne andwarpe dyuers tymes howe ran lysle countrey realme fraunce cap cccciiii whane sir danyell haulwyne capytayne andwarpe entred first towne deuyded ye vitayle ther egally euery man porcyon sent away horse beate downe howses ioyninge walles couered erthe feare fyre gonne shotte wherof hoost great plenty also made woman chyldren lodge church mynsters dyuers auoyde towne dogges clene auoyded slayne cast ye ryuer companyons within made dyuers issue dyd moche domage hoost without within two bretherne squyers arthoyse lambert lambres trystram two dyd dyuers tymes great feates armes toke away dyuers tymes vitayle fro hoost prisoner also thus siege contynued somer entensyon philyp dartuell cousayle abyde ther tyll famysshed towne sawe well assautyng shulde lese moche people gaunt made hyll andwarpe marueylus gret engyn xx fote large xl foote longe called engyn moton cast gret stone towne beate downe house also make within afrayd made marueylous great bombard l fote lengthe shotyng stone marueylous weyght whan bombarde shot might well harde day tyme fyue myle nyght ten made suche noyse goynge though dyuels hell bene ye way dyuers engyns wher put ye towne great trouble howbeit capitayns within dyd cofort towne made good resystence coulde wolde issue thre four tymes ye weke wherby gate honour blame profyte domage whyle siege laye thus styll warpe deted fro hoost xii hudred men thynkyng beate downe knightes gentylmens house led flaunders gone dwell heynault brabat arthoyse wyues chyldren gauntoise dyde purposed dyd moche hurt flaunders lefte gentylmans house vnbrent cast downe erthe thanne came agayne marlle erles howse beate downe left stadyng ther founde cradell wherin erle kept youthe brake peces fayre bayne wherin wont bayned also beate downe chapell bare away bell went bruges founde peter de boyse peter de myrt dyd great gaue great thanke doone rutters whan well refresshed selfe bruges toke way bridge warueston passed ryuer lyse came towne lysle beate downe certayne wyndmyls set fyer dyuers vyllages flaunders issued lysle fote horsback mo four thousande ther dyuers flemynges slayne taken beheded lysle bene well pursued scaked fewe howe beit rutters gaunt entred tourneses dyd moche hurt brent towne helehyer vyllages parteyning realme frauce returned great ioy proy siege andwarpe tydinges came duke burgoyn tha bapaulmes arthoyse howe gauntoyse pylled ouerryn coutrey brent certayne vyllages realme frauce incontynent duke wrote kyng campayne duke berrey brother duke burbon kyng counsayle entent shulde fynde remedy duke burgoyn wolde nat yt flemynges done dyd thought well erle flaunders shulde fayne requyre freche kyng helpe ayde el neuer likely entre herytage flaunders also thynges consydered warre somwhat displeased duke burgoyne reason wyfe deth therle flauders next heryterto flaunders season erle flaunders heden shewed hym howe rutters gaunt bene merlle beaten downe howse dispyte hym ye chambre wherin borne also howe broken fount wherin christened also armery bayne broken sore dyspleased many ymaginacyons sawe countrey lost tourned agaynst except teremount andewarpe coulde se recouery without puyssaunce frauce determyned thyng consydered wolde goo speke sonne lawe duke burgoyn bapaulmes shewe besynes thervpon departed fro hedyn went arras ther rested two dayes next day went bapaulmes alyghted erles place whiche thanne owne erle arthoyse good lady mother deed duke burgoyn great compassyon erle father lawe ryghtswetely dyd comforte sayd sir faythe owe kyng shall entede nothyng helpe el shall lese remnant nat conuenyent raskall nowe flaunders shulde suffred rule countrey chyualry gentylnes myght distroyed ye consequentlye christendome erle well recomforted duke sayd wolde helpe ayde departed went cyte ara season therle prison two hudred men dyuers good townes flaunders hardly kept nothyng breed water euery day shewed ye shulde lese heedes whan erle retourned come arras ye honour god lady caused delyuered sawe well fortuned flauders nat meanes nothyng gilty therof made sworne true faythfull dyd gyue eche golde syluer go lysle doway whyder lyst selfe wherby therle dyd get great loue went heden request duke burgoyne made frenche kyng kynge toke hym beare flyenge harte cap cccc v duke burgoyn gate nat couenaunt made father lawe th erle flauders soo departed fro towne bapaulmes hym sir guy tremoyle sir john uyen admyrall fraunce dyd payne comfort erle two chyefe counsayle duke duke company came saynt lyse kynge two vncles hym duke berry burbone ther duke burgoyn receyued great ioy demauded tydinges flaunders siege andwarpe duke answered right sagely shewed mater whan sawe tyme toke aparte duke berrey shewed hym howe gauntoyse full pride done deuoyre payne distroy noblenes also shewed howe brent pylled realme fraunce thyng preiudicyall confusyon shame realme fraunce sayng howe ought nat suffered fayre brother quod duke berrey wyll speke kynge mater two chyfe cousayle yt enfourme kyng therof ther none shall say agaynst entente howe beit moue warre bytwene fraunce flaunders whiche hath bene longe peace behoueth haue laufull tytell barones lordes fraunce ioyned agreed therto el aduenture might blamed beare faut fortuned nat well kyng yonge euery man knoweth wyll soone agre counsayle mater well well shall come therof yuell come therby shall beare ye charge blamed good cause euery man shall say beholde yonder kyng vncles duke berry burgoyn howe yuell haue counsayle kynge haue brought ye realme frauce warr neded nat wherfore dete brother say let v call togyder moost parte prelate noble realme fraunce let v shewe mater presence kyng matter personally toucheth bycause herytage flauders therby shall generally euery mannes wyll opinyon ye say ryght well quod duke burgoyne ye haue deuysed shall done wordes kynge entred chambre hauke hande spake merely vncles sayd amy fayre vncles mater ye speke great counsayle wolde gladly knowe myght sir duke berrey ye may knowe right well parteyneth greatly sir beholde vncle ye duke burgoyn complayneth greatly flaunders false villayns flauders hath put herytage therle naturall lorde noble men nowe lye siege andwarpe mo hudred thousande flemynges wherin haue besieged great nombre getlemen flemynges haue capitayn called philyppe dartuell pure englysshe courage hath sworne neuer depart then tyll haue wyll towne within without power frauce reyse hym fro siege ye hath resarued othe therfore sir say wyll ye ayde cosyn flauuders conquere agayne herytage whiche proude villayns hath taken fro hym faythe kyng fayre vncles haue great wyll therto godd sake let v desyre none thyng armed yet neuer bare armure behoueth thynke raygne puyssace honour lerne feates armes two duke eche regarded great pleasure kynges wordes duke berry spake agayne sayd sir ye haue sayd passingly well thus sir ye bounde dyuers reason sir couty flaunders demayne fraunce ye haue sworne kepe maynteyne right liege men also sir therle flauders cosyn wherfore ye ought loue hym therfore sir sythe ye good mynde kepe styll answere therafter euery person speketh therof sir shall assemble hastely prelate barones realme shall shewe mater presens sir ye wyll speke hertely ye v euery man wyll say haue kynge highe enterprise noble wyll corage faithe kyng fayre vncles wolde shulde redy morowe next go iourney fro hen forth grettest pleasure desyre go flauders abate pride flemynges whiche wordes two duke great ioye came duke burbone shewed hym mater ye haue herde great desyre kyng go flau ders wherof duke burbon great ioy thus mater hanged estate kyng vncles wrote letter lordes counsayle frauce desyring come day assigned campyen lyament shulde ther holden certayne besynesse realme frauce euery man obeyed reason kyng right gladde tidyng mynde sore therof man coude set hym therfro kyng sayd oft tymes ther gret delayes made mater sayd thought one shulde enterprise great mater shulde nat long delayed delay enemyes take aduyce aduautage also whan parels warr layd hym wolde answere say ye neuer enterpriseth lytell thynge atchyueth thus yonge kyng oft tymes deuysed knightes squyers chambre p nowe shall shewe dreme fortuned king season whyle lay saynt lyse occasyon whiche dreme ordayned deuyse flyeng hart enformed ca iiii c vi fortuned whyle kynge lay saynt lyse night lay bedde slepe visyon semed hym proly cyte ara wher neuer ben hym chiualry realme frauce thought thyder came hym therle flaunders dyd set fist fayre faucon pelerin sayeng thus sir gyue faucon best euer sawe best flyeng beater downe foules whiche present kyng thought great ioye sayd fayre cosyn thake therwith thought regarded constable fraunce sir olyuer clysson sayd vnto hym sir olyuer let v two go feldes proue gentyll faucon cosyn flauders hath gyuen thought costable answered hym sayd sir lette v go whan pleaseth thought toke horse two alone went feldes founde plentic heerons flye kyng sayd constable let faucon flye shall se howe wyll chase game costable cast faucon mounted highe ayre coude scant se kyng thought toke way streyght flauders kynge sayd lette v ryde byrde wolde nat lese thought rode tyll came great maryse thicke wode kyng sayd let v light fote nat passe wode hors backe lighted tha thought varlettes came toke horse kynge constable entred wode great payne traueyled long came fayre great launde ther kyng thought sawe faucon chasyng heron fightyng hym semed kyng faucon chased heron last lost sight wherwith thought sore displeased seyng coude nat folowe hauke thought sayde constable feare shall lese faucon wherof sorie haue lure nothynge el wherwith call agayne poynt kynge thought apered sodenly hym great hart wynges enclyned hym selfe hym wherof great ioye thought howe sayd constable sir abyde wyll mount hart folowe faucon kynge thought mounted flyeng hart howe hart acordyng kynges desyre dyde beare ouer great wodes tree ther howe faucon beate downe great plentie foules marueyle beholde semed kynge whan faucon long flyen beaten downe many heron thought called inco tynent faucon came sat downe fyst hart flewe agayne ouer wodes brought kyng launde costable taryed hym great ioye comynge assoone lyghted thought hart departed neuer sawe hym ther kyng thought howe shewed constable howe hart borne hym easly neuer rode easly also thought shewed hym bountie faucon therwith semed hym varlett cae brought horse mounted toke hyghe waye came agayne arras therwith king awoke great marueyle visyon remembred euery thynge therof ryght well shewed chabre hym fygure hart pleased hym moche ymaginacion set theron one firste incydentes whan went flauders fight flemynges toke deuyse beare flyeng hart philyppe dartuell good aduentur begyuning batayle agaynst bruges good fortune discontyture therle bruges yet subtyll man warre nother sautyng layeng siege nat ben brought vp therin youthe bene vsed fisshe angle rod riuer lescalt whiche well apered whyle laye siege warpe coude nat get towne thought presumpcyon syght hym shulde haue made andewarpe haue yelded hym nothyng disposed bare selfe lyke valyant men made often tymes scrimysshes barryers slewe hurt dyuers flemyng drewe agayne towne without domage suche issue la bert lambres trystram brother lorde lunelhyen bare greattest renoe flemynges sawe well howe dyke towne large full water coude nat che assatle moche payne danger determyned amonge selfe gette fagottes strawe fyll dyke come walles fight hande hande ordeyned done howe within made count sayd ther treason among selfe towne wold set thyng siege sawe layde therfore sir danyell halwyn capitayne bring euery thyng doute kept hym selfe day night euer aboue towne ordeyned none towne shulde come walles towne without copany men warr dyde lost heed labour lay styll siege flemyng great plenty vitayls comyng land water lordes countrey flauders alwayes wynning money countreys flaunders holande zelande brabant also parte haynault stelthe brought euer vitayles hoost philyp dartuell euer courage englisshe french wolde gladly ben alyed kyng englande wherby thought frenche kynge duke burgoyne came army shulde ayded englysshmen redy hoost cc archer englande whiche stolen garyson calys toke wage ther wekely payed p messangers philyppe dartuell sent englande also fraunce deth sir parducas dalbret cap iiii c vii philyp dartuell entent coloure dedes knowe sayde hym frauce determyned write name hole countre flaunders freche kyng submytting selfe requyring kyng tak busynes bring agayne parfyte loue lorde erle flau ders thus wrote certayne letter kyage counsayle delyuered messanger commaundyng hym go kynge letter dyde rode long came saynt lyse founde kynge vncles whome delyuered letter kyng toke reed letter ye presens vncles counsayle assoone reed well vnderstande dyde nothynge laughed therat thane ordayned take messanger set hym prison bycause come presens kyng wtout saue conduct ther remayned thre wekes whan philyppe dartuell knewe great indygnacion therat caused come hym capitayns hoost sayd sir ye may se honour frenche kynge dothe v sythe haue written hym amyably ther vpon hath recayned messenger kepeth hym prison certainly constrey neth v sore alyed englisshmen thynke nat contrary duke burgoyne fraunce leadeth kyng lyst hym selfe kyng chylde thynke yt wyll leaue mater nay surly ensample messanger whome kepeth prisone wherfore haue good cause sende england wel comon weale flauders suretye gyue dout feare enemyes therfore wolde shulde sende ten xii notablest men wherby knowledge therof might come frauce kyng ther counsayle shulde thynke wyll alye selfe kyng englande aduersary beit wyll nat alyance shortly made without haue nede thanne haue yet wolde men shulde entre communicacyon doo haue iust cause demaunde kyng englande two hudred thousande crownes somme jaques dartuell father countrey flauders lent somtyme ye kyng englande whyle tourney siege pay therwith sowdyers wolde men shulde say kyng englande vncles counsayle howe generally countye flaunders good townes therof suche lent sayd desyreth haue agayn sayd done offre kynge england enter flaunders frauce lyst surely thynke bett v ayde ourselfe owne haue helpe straungers thynke shall neuer attayne soner nowe kynge realme englande thynke wyll nat forsake alyauce suche coutre fla ders nowe nowe theglysshmen haue nat see cost bytwene burdeux scluse except calys chierburge brest lande entre fraunce therfore countre flaunders shulde serue well poynt bretayne except brest closed agaynst duke bretaygne hath sworne good french nat wyll coe therto bycause loue cosyn germayne therle flaunders herde philyp speke answered sayd philyp ye haue full well spoken wyll thus done whosoeuer wyll co trary loueth nat comon fyte fauders philyp dartuell taryed nat long wrote peter de boyse peter de myrt capitayns brug also ipre courtrey shewyng said purpose thought good done ther chosen good townes flaunders one two burgess euery towne towne gautsixe first chosen frauces atreman rase de uerdell loys de vaux sir john stotler martyn bondrell water iacob berner clerke chosen bysshop gaut pope urbane mayster john dalbrest ben deane lady church turney aduysed tyme ther shulde bisshop gaunt posse haue profytes bysshop turney shulde haue whan xii burgess redy aparelled toke leaue departed fro siege warpe begynning moneth july dyde moche came calais capitayne ther called sir johan dalbrenes receyued whan knewe wolde go englade purueyed shyppes taryed thre dayes toke passage aryued douer went lodon tyme kyng te cousayle ser johh motagu ser symon burle sir willm beachap westm enheryte ser perducas dalbret barony chaumont gascone kynges hand shall shewe maner king edward olde tyme gyuen sir johan chandos helde long lyu dethe gyuen sc thomas felton newly deed therby landes fell agayne kynges handes whiche lande might nat long without gouernour kepe ioyned landes lorde dalbret thane good frenche abuysed kyng englandes counsayle sir perducas dalbret well serued kynges englad bothe edwarde richarde prince countre burdeloyse xxx yer wherfore thought well worthy haue lande well able defende kepe fro men sir perducas dalbret whan receyued lades sayd vnto kyng presens cousayle noble men sir take receyue herytage myne heyres condycion serue agaynst men except house dalbret fro whens come agaynst shall neuer make warre suffre myne heritage rest peace kyng answered sayd content put hym possessyon lande nowe shall shewe fell parducas dalbret whan come gascoyne taken possessyon landes seneshall burdeloyse gyuen hym possessyon lorde dalbret great ioy therof thought well cosyn wolde make hym warr landes dalbret chaumont abode good loue rest lorde dalbret held great loue cosyn hoped euer dyssease wolde put hym possessyon sayde landes chaumounte sir parducas nat mynded last whan lay deth bed sawe must nedes dye called men dyd sede yong squier proper man armes called parduche sayd gyue presence men land chaumot thou euer good englysshe true faythfull kyng englande wyll yt house dalbert whiche become thou make agaynst warre wtout outrage squier answered sayd sir co maudement shalbe done perduche albert lorde chaumot gascone thus dyed sir ducas shewe hym p howe kyng englandes cou sayle mocked flemynges prisoner exchaunged cap cccc viii whan gauntoyse come london kynge counsayle certifyed therof sent knowe wold haue came company palays westmynster founde redy duke lancastre erle buckyngham therle salisbury moost parte
