kynges counsayle howe kynge nat present first comynge men flaunders gaunte enclyned lordes englande clerke chosen bysshop gaut spake sayde lordes become hyder sent fro towne gaunt fro hole countre flaunders haue counsayle confort ayde kyng englade upon certayne artycles good reason aucyent alyauces bytwene englande flauders desyre nowe renewe nowe nedefull coutre flauders without lorde good townes cou tre hath nowe gouernour whiche man called philyp dartuell recommaundeth hym principally kyng counsayle desyreth take gre offre shall make whan soeuer shall please kynge englande arryue flaunders shall fynde countre opyn receyue rest refresshe hym longe shall please hym also shall haue commaundement countre flau ders hundred thousande men armed redy hym seruyce moreouer lordes cou tre flaunders maketh one request haue agayne two hundred thousande crownes somtyme jakes dartuell good townes flauders lent king edwarde good memorie sege turney siege calais entencyon good townes flauders alyauce passe farther first repayed sayd som done king england may well say flemyng frendes togyder haue fre entre flaunders go shall please whan lordes englande herde wordes request began eche regarde smyled duke lacastre sayd fayre lordes flauders wordes demaunde requyreth haue cousayle go wayes london logynges kyng shall take aduyse requestes shall answere ye ought contente gauntoyse answered sayd god graunt departed fro counsayle lordes abode styll guyder began laughe amonge selfe sayd haue ye nat sene fleminges herde requestes make demande conforted say howe haue nede therof yet demaunde haue money resonable request shulde ayde pay thus reputed flemynges right proude presumptuous demaude haue agayne two hundred thousande crownes olde dette sayd xl yere paste neuer better poynt frenche kyng wyll come flau ders flemynges nat demaunded foresayd somme crownes haue desyred kyng confort ayde kyng wolde haue gone sent flau ders puissauntlye haue bydden batayle ayde flemynges prince worlde wente otherwyse ye shall herafter storie uidynges came fraunce cou sayle nowe philyp dartwell whose courage englysshe countre flaunders sent englande certayne men make aly auces thenglysshmen voyce ran comon renome kyng englande great puissauce shulde come season aryue flauders lye gaunt tidinges lightly beleued howe flemynges wolde fortify selfe maner awyse deuysed messanger come fro philyppe dartuell whoe helde prison shulde delyuered say trouthe ther cause retayne hym delyuered sent thost warpe season bruge taken certayn burgess turney kept prison flemynges wed well howe lyue haue warre wt frauce peace whan tourney sawe dyde moche atrapped toke certayne burgess courtrey kept prison tourney thus ther engendred hatred dayly bytwene frauce flauders howbeit lordes tourney wolde nat dede shulde tytell warr flemynges neighbour without comaudement frenche kyng whiche comaundement nat therefore deuysed sende two burgess flemynges haue eschange prisoner prisoner ther chosen go message johan bone john pycart wente thoost warpe spake philyp dartuell honour cytie tourney nat loue frenche kyng sayd welcomed receyued amyably philyp sayd howe kyng nat deserued loue whan messager sent hym good entent shulde put prison sir two burgess ye haue agayn messager true philyp feare loue sir tell wherefore ye become v sir burgess haue agayne men cytie tourney prison bruges sir philyp kepe lyke wise ye kepe men cortrey sir ye shall nat lese comyng rendre agayne shall rendre sir ye speke well shall done ther acorded make eschange philyp dart well wrote peter de boyse peter de myrt beyng bruges shulde delyuer prisoner tourney receyue prisoner courtrey whan deted philyp dartuell sayd sir take hede say wyll nat betray ye towne turney vnder frenche kyng wyll haue treatie vntyll season teremonde andwarpe opyned v therfore sir come v shall nat go home agayne therfore costrayne people marchaunt nother come go flauders ieody loke none thyng frenche kyng wyll coe make v warre burgess tourney vnderstode well word deted returned turner shewed ye haue herd ther made comaudemet non shulde go marchandise flauders payne indygnacyon frenche kyng prisoner delyuered tourney durst nat marchaudyse flauders whan wolde haue marchaudyse fladers wolde go ualencennes heynaulte holande zelande brabant liege might go come make marchau dyse flaunders p thus sege laye styll andwarpe philyp dartuell gaunt lay mount andewarpe syde towarde heynalte engyns great bombardes gonne whiche made suche noyse whan losed noyse therof might well herde sixe leages next lodged bruges beyonde ryuer lescalt next ipre courtrey proprigne cassell franke bruges vyroned rounde aboute towne thus towne enuyroned fle mynges thought siege famyne within somtyme within wolde yssue somtyme wan somtyme lost aue ture falleth often tymes suche case ther none assaut made philyppe dartuell wolde nat folisshely aduenture men sayd wolde haue without assaut seyng howe coude haue conforte fro parte byrde coude scant haue flyen towne host shulde haue sene set rounde p letter sent philyp dartuell fro comyssaries frenche kyng howe messangers bare letter taken set prisone cap cccc ix nowe let v retourne french kyng vncles cousayle frace detmyned sende turney certayne prelate knyghtes realme treate flemynges knowe playnly entetes ther apoynted go tourney sir myles ormayns bysshop beauuoys bysshop anxere bysshop lan sir guy honcourt sir trystram de boyse came tourney comyssaries fro frenche kynge ther johan bone enfant john pycart newly coe thyder fro sege andwarpe shewed comyssaries lord frace howe philyppe dartuell whan toke leaue hym sayd sir wyll neuer harken treatie tyll warp teremonde v opyned well lordes philyp dartuellis great pride beit yet nat mayster good townes flaunders therfore let v sende write gaunte bruges ipre let v sende euery towne letter messanger must haue maner entre comunycacion yf purpose begyn wrote thre letter thre pricipall townes flauders euery lre began euer philyp dart well cotent sayd letts foloweth philyppe dartuell copanyes good people thre townes flauders franke bruges please knowe frech king hath sent v party hope good peace concorde may made bytwene noble prince therle flauders cosyn comors countre flauders renome brute rynncth howe ye go seke alyauce kyng englande whiche thyng agaynst reason preiudice realme frauce crowne royall kyng may wyse suffre wherfore desyre name frech kyng ye wyll gyue v sauecoduct thetent may go coe sende make peace bring mater suche co clusyon kyng may cotent prayeng write v answere entente behalfe thus oure lorde kepe written tourney xvi day octobre whan thre letter coteyning one thing writen sealed delyuered thre men sayde s ye shall go gaut ye bruges ye ipre bring v agayne answere answered shulde done deted euery man way whan one aryued gaut philyp dartuell ther tyme el gaut wolde nat haue opyned letter without hym opyned letter reed whan done laughed therat depted fro gaut returned sege andwarp bare lre hym messager abode styll prisone gaunte whan come siege called lorde harsels copanyons reed letter sende fro frenche kynges commyssaries sayd sir thynke frenchman tryfell countre flauders sayd burgess turney whan wolde tidyng frau ce entende treatie wtout warpe teremonde yelden v therwith came tydinges fro bruges fro pre howe receyued lyke letter messenger retayned set prison well sayde philyp sayd howe wolde write agayne commyssaries frauce dyd wrote suscripcyon ryght noble discrete lordes comyssaries fraunce content whiche letter foloweth right dere puissaunt lordes right noble discressyons please knowe haue receyued right amiably letter v sent fro ryght excellent charles frauce makyng mencyon ye ryght noble lordes ar come tournay treat peace acord name bytwene v ryght hygh prince erle flaunders sayd countrey howe ye haue sayd kyng counsayle suffycyent puyssance authorite conclude acomplyssh tourney right dere good fredes beare wytnes letter patetes v sene reed bycause kynge writeth ryght displesaunt hym discorde hath long endured wherof haue great marueyle howe may tyme past whan gaunt assysed warpe lytle valur also whan comon cousayle thre good townes flauders wrote vnto souerayne lorde haue made peace accorde pleased nat whiche nowe semeth v wolde also lyke maner haue receyued letter patentes coteyning howe two tymes ye haue written v ye haue come two tymes entente acordyng answere haue sent haue wyll entet harken treaty peace townes fortress whiche closed agaynst countrey flaunders specyally agaynst towne gaut wherof regard opyned wyll commaudement good towne gaunt wtout first done make treatie ye desyre thynke king dothe may assemble great puyssaunce ayde cosyn colour treatie se well fals hed may wrought meane tyme hath ben done wherfore entencyon sure redy defence hoost shall redy apparelled defende enemyes hope ayde god haue vyctorie haue tyme moreouer gyue knowledge brute howe ye thynke flaunders treate haue alyaunce kynge englande haue socoure hym wherin ye saye agaynst right bycause subiectes crowne fraunce howe kynge soueraygne lorde wherfore ye say ought aquyte v truely agaynst hym haue done tyme past haue sende hym letter soueraygne lorde requyring hym haue made peace whervnto hath gyuen v none answere messager taken sette prisone whiche thynke great blame suche lorde moreouer yet repute hym blame wrote hym souerayne lorde nat wyllynge sende v aunswere bycause pleaseth hym nat thought yet thynke seke profyte countrey flauders meanes suche wyll helpe v howe beit yet nothynge kyng may helpe mater forteresses opyned v therfore defended tourney whan laste v oure hoost shulde nomore come suche maner v maner letter credece mouth without sauecoduct yet coe bruges gaunt letter wherfore haue taken messangers gyueng ensample bringe suche letter thynke ye study treason specially agaynst philyppe dartuell fro whiche god defende wherfore wyll ye knowe traueyle nought without fortress opyned v whiche trust ayde god shortely shalbe thus god kepe written andewarpe xx day octobre yere lorde god thousande thre hundred lxii philyp dartuell regarde flaunders whan philyppe dartuell thus writen letter aduyce counsayle well examyned sealed bethought hym shulde beare demaunded prisoner taken andwarpe shewed varlet arthoyse taken day scrimysshe comaunded shulde brought hym philyppe sayde thou art prisoner may make dye wyll howbeit syth thou art thou shalte delyuered vpon couenaunt thy faythe thou shalt delyuer suche letter shall take french kynges counsayle nowe tourney whan varlet harde spekyng delyueraunce neuer ioyouse went verely haue dyed sayd sir swere faithe shall beare letter whyder shall please hell phylyp began laughe sayd thou sayest well philyppe gaue hym two crownes delyuered hym letter caused hym conueyed hoost set way turney whan cae turney went lodgynge bysshoppe laon came bysshop dyd message fro poynt poynt ther demau ded hym tydinges hoost andwarpe shewed moche knewe dyned dyner bysshop departed company wolde nat open letter tyll present whan thre bysshoppes togyder opyned letter redde good leyser made due examynacion therof spake togyder sayde howe philyp dartuell shewed full pride presumpcion sayd howe loued lytle maieste royall frauce toke cousayle togyder sayd howe prouost cousayle towne turney knewe right well howe sent letter philyp dartuell townes flaunders wherfore sayd shulde well done shuld answere philyp made sent prouost sowned comon bell counsayle drewe togyder letter red two thre dtymes wyse men ha great marueyle presuptuous wordes therin written determyned copy letter shulde remayne styll turney therwith cousayle deted euery man logyng philyp dartuell beyng styll hoost warpe repeted nothyng writen roughly comyssaryes frauce repented hym written amiable uost turney wyng honour way dissymulacion dyd bicause wold nat beare blame norisshe hate myght fall therby thus philyppe wrote maner foloweth superscripcyon right honorable sage dere frendes prouost cytezins tourney p letter sent tourney fro philyp dartuell howe frech kynge counsayle enformed answer flemynges made comyssaries cap cccc x right dere good fre de please knowe haue receyued letter makynge mencyon ii burgess yuell bearer letter gaunt bruges fro comissaryes fraunce retayned v requestes delyuered prisone wherby good loue affectyon hath bene bytwene comons flauders shulde perceyuer ye write whiche loue right dere frendes semythe v ryght lytell come knowledge frenche kynge duke burgoyne brytayne assembleth togyder come ayde erle flaunders recouer countrey fyght v letter ye haue sent v treat peace wherfore thynke way treat peace shall take hede therof redy shalbe euer defence day nyght prisoner burgess shall kepe v tyll know certetie assebles said lordes tyll pleasure delyuer whan burgess last fladuers treat peace ye knowe well ther ordeyned comaunded person fro then letter otherwyse shulde go come without sauecoducte sayd comyssaries haue done contrary thentent make debate dyscorde wherfore dere frendes desyre ye wyll sende parsone burges flaunders fro fro none lordes thyng tou chynge owne caw may shall lyke maner wolde ye shuld v haue aspeciall trust affyaunce ought haue good neyghbours generall entencyon flaunders marchantes marchadyses shulde passe repasse safelye one countrey without interupcyon let thus god kepe written hoost warpe xxii day moneth october yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore two philyp dartuell regarde flaunderrs aboute thre dayes ye first letter sent lordes comissaryes frauce lordes hall counsayle brought letter varlet doway shewed howe host ande warpe sent letter receyued redde good leysour finally lordes fraunce sayd tourney sir counsayle best ye make none alyaunce quayntance flauders ye ye shall haue thanke therof fraunce receyue letter sent fro kynges counsayle knowe ye ye shall receyue blame domage therby mater nat longe contynue turney answered sayd howe wolde perceyuer counsayle sayng grace god wolde nothynge wherby shulde haue reprofe thre dayes commissaryes departed fro tourney went kynge peron hym thre vncles duke berrey burgoyne burbon day erle flaunders come kyng shewe greues yt feaulte countye arthoyse whiche fallen hym yere dethe mother whan ye sayd comyssaries coe kyng counsayle red two letter philyp dartuell flaunders sent tourney toke great dispyte sayd begynninge kynges raygne suche pride vsed flaunders ought nat suffred whiche wordes erle flaunders thynge dyscontent erle kynge counsayle made complayntes well harde kynge answerde hym sayd cosyn retourne arthoyse breuely shalbe ara nat shew better quarell shulde proche enemyes erle well content aunswere departed went hedyn kynge wolde go flaunders abate pride flem mynges predecessours done set clerkes awarke sent letter messangers euery cost realme commaundynge euery man without delay best aparell ye warre come hym arras day lymited shewyng howe pleasur god wolde go fight flemynges flaunders man durste disobey euery man made redy bothe nere farr auuergne rouergue tholousyn gascoyne limosyn poyctou xaynton bretayne bur bonoyse forestes burgoyne doulphyn sauoy barroyse lorayn cyrcuites countreys fraunce euery man came towarde arras arthoyse great assemble men warre marueyle consyder p howe philyp dartuell made passage flauders kept howe dyuers french knyghtes lost flaunders coulde nat retourne agayne cap cccc xi erle flaunders beyng heden harde euery day newes fro kynge fro ye duke burgoyn ye gret assemble made frauce erle comaunded countre arthoyse man payne dethe shulde put countrey logynges maner thyng forteres closed towne wolde men warre shulde sarued eased euery thynge abrode countrey kynge came arthoyse founde euery thyng great plenty euery grange full corne therle flauders came arras dyd homage kyng countie arthoyse kyng receyued hym liege man sayde fayre cosyn please god saynt de nyce shall sette peaseably herytage flaunders shall abate pride philyp dartuell flemynges wyse shall neuer able rebell agayne sir erle haue great trust therby ye shall attayne suche honour worlde shall prayse certaynly great pride flaunders philyppe dartuell beyng siege warpe well enfourmed howe frenche kyng puissance commyng hym sayd men sir wenyth yonge ryottouse kynge entre flaunders yere yet yong assayle v shall cause ye passage entres kept shall nat lye power yere passe ryuer lyse sent gaunt lorde harsels whan come sayd sir harsels ye knowe well dayly howe frenche kyng apareleth hym selfe distroy v behoueth v regarde wisely take counsayle mater sir ye shall abyde siege wyll goo bruges lerne certayne tidynges encorage people good townes shall stablissh suche people passage french men shall nat passe ouer therto accorded lorde harsels philyppe dartuell departed fro siege rode bruges like great lorde penon displayed armes bare felde sable thre hat te syluer whan came bruges founde ther peter de boyse peter de myrt capitayus bruges ther shewed howe frenche kynge puyssance wolde come flauders wherfore wyll ye peter de boyse go passage comynes kepe ryuer ye peter de myrt shall go bridge warneston kepe passage cause ye bridge broken aboue ryuer tyll ye come gerge hasels meureuylle cour tray frenchman nat passe shall go ipre refresshe comfort erortyng kepe fermly v yt haue sworne eche shall nat frenche kynges puyssance passe ryuer lyse entre flaunders passage well kept bothe peter answered sayd sir ye say well lette done ye say worde englande truely philyppe yet none wherof marueyle nowe parlyament london wherfore thynke shortly shall worde frenche kyng nat hasty trust shall haue ayde englande hope kynge englande maketh assemble ye englysshmen wyll aryue nyght suche nombre shall nat nede feare frenchman ayde flauders vnder obeysaunce excepte teremonde warpe p mean season besynes ye kyng arras men warre assembled arthoyse tournesyes lysle certayne knyghtes squiers beyng aboute lysle entysinge hasell flauders thought enterprise wher renomed day ther gadred togyder sire score men armes knight squiers rode passed ryuer lysle pounte amenyn two le age fro lysle whiche bridge nat broken rode towne harle ther chased nigh people towne laram rose townes range belle alarum whan hasell flaunders sir johan jumot chatelyn wyllone sir henry du le knyghtes squyers well moued coutrey sawe tyme returne toke agayne way returne bridge passed founde great nombre flemynges breakyng bridge whan broken parte therof couered agayn hey strawe shuld nat aspyed ther knyghtes founde redy aparelled gyue batayle great nombre villayns countrey knightes couched speares ran withall force flemynges opened gaue way sayd none fledde sayde amonge themselfe let v flye gyue way sure bridge wyll nat beare shall se anon good game hasell flaunders knyghtes dasshed one bridge nat able beare many howe hasell xxx passed ouer wolde haue passed bridg brake vnder fell downe horse men many slayne whane behynde sawe sore abasshed wyst nat whyder flye saue themselfe entred ryuer thynkinge swymme ouer coude nat ye water depe bankes hyghe horse coulde nat gette vp great myschefe flemynges came slewe without mercy mad fall agayne water drowned sir johan jumont great aduenture lost bridge brake vnder hym yet valyantnes body saued hym selfe sore hurt heed body sire wekes coude helpe selfe recou tre slayne ye chatelayn wyllon bouchars saynt hilary dyuers slayne drowned also sir henry duffle slayne drowned mo threscore happy coude saue selfe many hurt sore wouded scaped tydinges came lordes fraunce beynge arras howe men lost iourney howe hasell flauders folysshly taken hym enterprise complayned nat suche expert men warr sayd dyd great folly passe ryuer without gyde entre great towne retourne agayne waye went without kepynge assage meane season none enter se wysemen warre bycause rode lyke foles came pthe ordynaunce frenche kyng made entre countie flaunders passage stoped broken cap iiii c xii mater passed ouer forgote philyppe dartuell departed fro bruges wente ipre wher receyued great ioy peter de boyse went co mynes wher men coutrey assembled made ye bridge vnuayled redy broken downe incotynent nede requyred wold nat clerely pull downe aduautage countrey passe repasse beastes ouer water lyse proper hour philyp dartuell came ipre tydinges came howe bridge amenyn frenchman dystrussed howe hase flaunders nere taken tydinges philyppe dartuell greatly reioysed laughyng encourage sayd sir grace god good ryght haue mater shall take suche ende kyng yong counsayle passe ryuer lyse shall nat retourne agayne fraunce thus philyp dartuell fyue dayes ipre preched openly ye market place encourage people cause kepe promyse also shewed howe frenche kynge without tytle reason comyng distroy wherfore sayd good people nat abasshed though coe v shall nat puyssaunce passe ryer lyse shall cause passage well kept haue ordeyned commynes peter de boyse agreat nombre men good trewe loueth honoure flaunders peter de myrt warneston passage water lysear broken coe ouer place one two also haue harde tidyng men sent englade shall haue shortly great comfort ye englysshmen haue good alyaunce therfore let v lyue hope honoure shall v therfore good frendes ipre ye true kepe faythfully promyse ye haue promised good towne gaunt hath endured moche payne mayntayne right fredome flauders suche wyll kepe true promyse lette holde vp handes towarde heuen token loyalte therwith suche harde hym speke lyfte vp handes philyp discended fro scaffolde wher hadde preched went lodgynge taryed day next day depted wente towarde warpe sege passed courtrey taryed two dayes nowe let v leaue speke philyppe dartuell retourne ye yong kyng charles frauce ara hauyng great wyll desire entre flaunders abate pride flemynges dayly repayred men warre fro partes whan kynge soiourned viii dayes went lens arthoyse ther taryed two dayes thirde day nouembre departed wet seclyn rested chiefe constable fraunce marshal fraunce burgoyn flauders counsayle howe shulde ordred comon saynge hoost howe thyng impossyble entre flaunders seyng howe passage strongely kept also dayly rayned sore wayes enpayred men coulde skant go forthe wyse men fraunce sayd home great outrage enterprise voyage season yere bring kyng farre forwarde countre sayng also howe bene better hym haue taryed tyll somer make warre countrey hadde neuer bene specially season yere also sayd howe ryuer lyse yuell passe place skape certayne place thanne marshal demaunded fro whens ryuer dyde come sayde howe came fro ayer fro saynt omers well constable sythe hath begynning shall passe well inough lette v ordre peple let v take way saynt omers shall passe ye ryuer ease entre flaunders let v go alonge countrey flemynges proude outher ipre place wyll coe fyght v purpose agreed marshal thervpon rested nyght next mornyng lorde dalbret lorde coucy sir aymemon pompers sir john uyen admyrall fraunce sir willyam poyctres bastarde langres begue uyllanes sir raoll coucy erle conuersant vycount dacy sir raoll rayneuall lorde saynt sir arture hedyn sir anton darchyes lorde saynt pye sir willyam bordes lorde logeuple ye lorde sully sir trystram lestouet sir olyuer clesquyn sir moryce treguidy ser guy bayeur sir lucas lestrughen ser nycholas pamell two marshalles fraunce sir loys saurere sir loys blanuell ye marshall burgoyne marshall flaunders sir anguerant helwyn came constable fraunce take aduyse howe shuld passe outher lyle go comynes el arualueston passage kept el go hygher vp towarde gorge uenoy saynt uenant passe ye ryuer lyse among lordes dyuers opinyons suche knewe countre sayde surely tyme goynge countrey land cassell surmes uerthes way shall holde constable ye lorde coucy sayd cou sayle let v goo tourney lette v passe ryuer lescaulte take way andewarpe way easy ynoughe lette v fyght enemyes shal haue let one passed ye ryuer tourney let v go streight andewarpe ryghtfull iudgement philyp dartuell shall daily refresshed vitayle uruyance cost haynalt shall folowe v fro tourney along ye ryuer wordes well harde dyuers well vpholden ye costable marchals inclyned rather go right way nother ryght hande lyfte sustayne opinyon layd dyuers reason sayng shuld go seke passage ye right way myght sayd nat lyke good men warre lest assay passe comynes whiche kept also withdrawe selfe fro enemyes warde wyll reioysed therby haue newe refresshynge take newe counsayle say howe fled away also one poynt ought dowted knowe nat astate ye englisshmen incydet ayde shulde come yt cost shulde great let v therfore thynke best delyuer ye mater shortly coud deuised therfore goddes name let v take way comynes god shall helpe v haue tyme passed repassed great ryuers greater ryuer lyse nat kept long fro v lest whan ryuer syde let v take aduyse suche copany voward haue sene xx xxx yere often tymes passed daugerous ryuer one ouer enemyes shalbe hundred tymes abasshed went ease ye right hande left right way also beyng one ouer may reken selfe lordes flaunders euery man acorded last apoyntment kept nat broken bycause ye lordes togyder sayd nedefull aduyse regarde ye ordre batayls apoynt shall go constable vowarde knowe shall make ye wayes batayle shalbe fotemen ordeyne shalbe currers discouer enemyes shall kynges batayle seruyce shall shall beare oriflambe frauce apoynt shall assyst knowe shall wynges reregard thynges toke aduyse counsayle determyned sayd lordes offycers ser joy halwyn lorde rambures shuld gouernours fote men shulde go hoost make wayes cut downe hedge wodes busshes fyll valeys pull downe hyls necessary thynges nombre xvii hundred lx vowarde marshal fraunce flaunders burgoyne hadde vnder rule xvii hundred men armes seuen hudred crosbowes besyde four thousande men foote erle flaunders delyuered well pauessed harnessed ordeyned therle flaunders batayle wherin hadde men armes knyghtes squiers fotemen nombre xvi thousande shulde wynge vowarde recomfort nede required also ordeyned bytwene batayle erls vowarde kynges batayle shulde folowe therin ye kynges thre vncles berry burgoyn burbon erle marche sir james burbon brother erle cleremount dolphyn auuergne erle dampe martyn erle sanxere sir john boloyne ye nombre sixe thousande men armes two thousande crosbowes genoways ordeyned reregarde two men armes two hundred archer chyefe gouernour sir john dartoyse erle ewe ser guy erle bloyse sir warans erle saynt powle sir wyllm erle harecourt lorde chastelon lorde sere beare oryflambe apoynted sir peter villers sour knyghtes acompany hym sir robert bayeux sir moris sancourt ser guy triguidy bandon de laheuse kepe baners bourge ruet bourge mout dowset lord enteded surely neuer retourne fraunce tyll fought philyppe dartuell puyssaunce therfore made thyng redy fyght next day nede requyred also lorde de la bret lorde coucy sir hugh haulon apoynted set ordre batayls aray marshal ye lodgynges apoynted lodge kyng ye batayle sir willyam bannes lorde champreny also ordeyned yt day batayle shulde kynge horsebacke none except viii valyant men horsbacke hym lorde rayneuall begue villanes sir aymemon pomyers sir anguerant halwyn vycount dacy sir guy bayeux sir nycholas penuell sir willyam bourdes whiche eyght lorde rayneuall sir anguerant helwyn fronte kynge begue uyllayues vycount dacy called dyuers place uycout dan noy two knyghtes besyde hym behynde hym foure knyghtes named sir olyuer clyssone constable fraunce sir willm poycters bastarde langres shulde ryde dyscouer aduyse maner enemyes daye batayle whane thynges apoynted determyned euery thynge nedefull thanne counsayle brake vp euery man departed lodgynges suche hadde nat bene counsayle shewed shuld also ordeyned yt next day kyng shulde departe passe towne lysle nat rest lodge abbay marquette vowarde passe farther towarde comynes warneston soone myght p howe frenche men coulde nat passe bridge comynes passed without knowledge flemynges cap iiii c xiii thus ordeyned euery thynge done next day vowarde dyslodged went toward comines foude wayes redy made ye lord fransures sir joyse helwyn taken great laboure make wayes redy monday whan constable marshal vowarde come bridge comynes fayne stoppe foude bridge broken nat possyble make agayne defece made contrarie flemyng beyond ryuer puyssaunt ynough lette kepe passage agaynst wolde scrimysshe assaut ix thousande peter de boyse capitayne made good semblant defende bridge men bridge causey raynging bothe sydes constable lordes fraunce behelde maner countrey ymagined well thynge impossyble passe way without bridge newe made thafie caused ryde vp downe ryuer syde myle two se passage dyde retourned agayne shewed maysters coulde nat fynde place horse coude take lande syde ryuer constable sore dyspleased sayde haue bene yuell cousayled take way yet bene better haue gone saynt omers byde dager orels haue passed ryuer lescaulte tourney lorde coucy sayde haue gone streyght way warpe haue fought ther enemyes sythe must fight wyll proude wolde haue bydden v theirsege sir loyes sa xere sayd counsayle let v lodge daye cause people lodge well whan come lette v sende lyle ryuer gette shyppes nayles lette v make bridge morowe agaynst ye fayre aedowes sithe none otherwyse sir joy halwyn sayd sir haue well aduysed howe ye great let bytwene lysle sir ryuer called menyn ryuer shyppes barkes must passe shulde come hyder sir flemynges haue broken ye bridge haue put bytwene ioystes great tymbre stake impossyble vessell passe nat tel constable shall good toke way ayre ther passe ryuet lyse sythe haue passage meane season constable marshal fraunce burgoyne comynes abusyon wyst nat certayne knightes squiers enterprised valiantly assay passe ryuer meanes go fyght flemynge wynne towne passage comynes ye shall thus vowarde coe fro lyle comynes lorde sait pye dyuers knyghtes heynalt flaunders arthoyse also fraunce without knowledge constable marshalles determyned togyder sayd wyll go gette two thre lytell botes launche ryuer lyse beneth comynes couerte place wyll sette great stake bothe sydes ryuer tye rope therto ryuer nat large meanes shall get ouer great nombre men shorte space may go assayle enemyes behynde beware wyn passage acordynge counsayle lorde saynt pye made brought lysle barke rope necessary also sir herbert belperche sir johan roy companyons toguyther voyage broughte theym another barke also sir henry manny sir johan malestrayt sir john chaudronne breton brought another lorde saynt pye firste entredde barke cordes stake pytched great planke stake one syde tyed corde therto thane thre varlettes passed ouer farther syde barke caryed ende corde sette another great stake tyedde ende corde stake done varlettes retourned barke maysters constable fraunce two marshal bridge fote comynes anone enformed said besynes costable sayd sir loys saxere one marshal sir go way se possible passe ryuer meanes ye haue herde deuysed ye se possyble fynde meanes get mo barkes sayde knyghtes prepared selfe redy passe whan sawe barkes redy ther wt ther came sayd marshall frauce great rout behelde well maner lorde saynt pye sayd hym sir may please shall passe pleaseth right well marshall howbeit ye put yourselfe great aduenture enemyes comynes knowe may great domage sir lorde saynt pyhe nothyng aduetureth nothynge getteth name god saint denys trust passe ar morowe night trust fight enemyes lorde saynt pye set penon barke entred hymselfe first hym nobre ix none lauched corde tyed syde ryuer issued wet lytell wode besyde bycause wolde nat sene rerewage drue agayne barke entred therle couersant sir daghien baner also lorde uertayne brother ix passed mo agayne thirde tyme ther passed many therwith cae two bark sir herbert belperch sir john roy breton anone laged ryuer ordred knigh passed ther none passed good men armes passed good wyll great marueyle holde suche prese passe marshall nat bene wolde haue ouer charged barkes tidynges came costable lordes frace beyng comynes peple passed ye haue herde constable sayd seneshall reur go requyre se yonder passage whider people passe sayd nat knight neuer ioyouse nothyng euer herde strake horse spurres co pany xl men armes whan cae passage sawe maner therof ther passed redy full nobre c l lighted sayd howe wolde passe lykewise marshall frace coude nat let hym tidynges came costable howe cosyn lorde rieux passed ouer ryuer costable lytell began muse sayd cause cro bowes come forthe scrimyssh flemyng beyond bridge kepe busy thentent take hede men passyng ryuer knewe wolde ryn distroy passage ye sle passed whiche rather dye shulde coe passe crosbowes men fote gonners shote ouer brige towne ther began sore strimysshe made semblaunt passe bridge flemynges well pauessed made redy defende passage thus endured monday anone night dayes short styll ther passed men armes sayd barkes ouer drue togyder lytell groue ther besyde couert nowe beholde thynges cosydred whan parell harde aduenture within comynes ceyued bene distroyed moost parte lost bothe barkes rope god dyde thentent abate pride flemynges p howe frechmen passed ryuer lyse put selfe batayle flemynges cap cccc xiiii repute also euery man ought reken enterprise great valyantnesse passed knightes squiers vowarde whan late stale fro thost went passage passe copanyons passed lorde de lauale vycount rohan lorde de la belyer lorde cambort sir olyuer lorde clesquyn barroys barres lorde colet sir raynalde thouars lorde pousanses sir wyllyam lignacke water pa lorde thouars sir loyes sir trystram de la gayle vycount aur lorde mailly breton poicteuyns beruyers francoys burgonyens stemynges arthoysens troyens heynouers great nombre whan passed ryuer nyght nombre four hundred men armes chosen men warre nat varlet passed ouer whan sir loyes sanxere sawe many passed ouer sixe baners xxx penons thought shulde haue bene great shame hym without passed lyke wise knightes squyers entred barkes hym passed lorde haygest sir perciuall raynuall dyuers whan togyder sayd nowe tyme go toward comynes loke oure enemyes se yf may lodge towne dyde bassenettes made selfe redy went forthe mare long ryuersyde good order baners penons wauyng redy fight lorde saynt pye formast front chyefe gouernour leader company bycause knewe countre better thus comyng good order towarde towne peter de boyse flemynges redy raynged causey dyd cast eyen long ryuer syde sawe men armes aproche wherof marueyle peter de boyse said uyls hell hath brought men armes hyder way haue passed ryuer lyse hym sayd sure passed bark botes wt knowledge ther bridge passage bytwene curtrey coude passe shall shall go fight nay nat quod peter lette come lette v abyde oure strength beneth highe ouer therfore haue great aduauntage shulde dyscende downe fight theym dyde nat well lette v abyde tyll darke night let v take cousayle done farther suche nombre long endure agaynst v batayle knowe shyfte countre nat cousayle beleued flemynges neuer remoued place helde selfe styll foote bridge raynged louge causey good order batayle made tenuce semyng though set nothyng passed came thorough maryse ryuer syde aprochyng comynes constable fraunce thother syde ryuer dyde cast eyen sawe syde men armes baners penons lytell batayle comynge towardes comynes blode began trymble feare sawe well great bre flemynges raynged good order batayle agayust said great displeasur saynt jues saynt george lady heuen se yonder se parte chefe flour army whiche nowe harde aduenture wolde good deed syth se great outrage sir loyes sanxere wolde haue thoughtye ben atemate wyser se ye nowe howe ye durst put aduenture many noble knightes squiers nowe company fewe nombre agaynst ten xii thousande fierse proude people wyll take none mercy ye nede nat helpe rohen lauall rieux beaumanoyr longuyle rochfort mauuy malestroit couersant suche suche coplayne without counsayle ye wyll put yourselfe adueture wherfore co stable frauce ye lese faut shalbe layd shalbe sayd sent thider gyuen comaundement none shulde departe fro hoost opart passe bridge whane sawe many noble men passed sawe dealyng sayd highe voyce abandon passage euery man wyll assay passe maner meanes wordes knightes squyers auaunced selfe fynde way engin howe passe bridge incotynent night necessyte must leaue labour castyng bordes plankes ioystes layd pauesses passe ouer flemyng moche defede theselfe wy nat well take hede sawe beneth bridge maryse great nobre men armes standyng close gyder styll comyng also sawe syde bridge scrimysshyng sore dyde might make bridge agayne thus ye haue herde frenche men passed barkes nyght came priuely thoroughe mary myre anclees nowe beholde consyder payne endured valyantnesse seyng howe long nightes wynter decembre bode longe colde night harnesse fere myre bassenett heedes without meate drinke certaynly say ought reputed great valyatnesse trewely handfull men regarde flemynges within comynes countre thus stode nouther durste enuade assayle determyned stande styll tyll fayre day sayeng eche shall se whan day flemynges wyll come stregth assayle v whan come let v crye cryes one voyce euery man owne crye orels lord thogh lordes nat suche cryes shall abasshe lette v stryke among good courage wyll god gyue v grace disconfyte yuell armed haue good speares well heeded good swerdes habergyns beare shall nat defende thus good conforte abode night constable syde ryuer towarde lysle great feare hert wysshed hym selfe puissauce within ye towne comynes marshal burgoyn flaunders sayd conforte hym sir nothynge abasshed passed ouer chosed men warre valyaunt great wysdome wyll nothyng good order discrecyon sir wyll nat fight day night nere aprochynge sir ye haue abadoned passage passe wyll morowe assoone day shall oure beste passe bridge haue prouyded daye woode tymbre shall nede trust shall soone ouer reconforte haue nede yonder vnhappy people shall nat endure agaynst v thus costable recoforted sayeng suche valyant son co pany p howe frenche men passed ryuer lyse disconfyted flemyng slewe many wan passage comynes cap cccc xv peter de boyse knewe well armes marysse nere ioyning comynes thought selfe suretie bycause knewe natte thede shulde sawe well copany sixe seuyn thousande men sayd sir yonder men armes haue passed ryuer nat made stele haue laste day traueyled nyght stamped myre thinke nowe brekyng vp newe mornyng best set men ynoughe close rounde beate one ther none wyll medyll v let v make noyse tyll tyme come feate othersyde french knightes mary nat farre fro enemyes nat ease stode myre soe ancles mydde legge howe greate pleasure desyre coquere passage honour made forget payne traueyle yf bene somer wynter ben pleasure theym erthe colde wete nightes long tyme rayned heedes whiche ran downe bassenettes stode euer redy fight loked euer whane shulde assayled remembraunce wherof made forgette paynes lorde saynt pye aquyted selfe right nobly formast euer went priuely spye se harken dealyng enemyes whan retourned shewed companye howe noyse amonge sayeng paraduenture bycause wyll redy purpose thus wente spye enemyes dyde tyll last breakyng day flemynges plumpe without maner noyse came softely towarde maryse whanne lorde saynt pye watchyng sawe certaynly comyng cam company sayd sir let v sette enemyes comynge hande come fayre softely without noyse wenyng sette v beware therfore nowe lette v shewe ourselfe lyke men warre incotynent shall haue batayle wordes euery man apparelled hymselfe redy set selfe good order coude deuysed whan aproched made cryes apoynted receyued flemmynges speare poyntes suche wyse ye mayle cootes coulde holde two thre folde clothe wolde haue doone constable fraunce herde well crye noyse sayd sir surely company fightynge god ayde canne nat tyme thus frenche men receyued flemynges ye good speare heedes burdeaux whiche went throughe habergyns shulders bellyes heedes suche wyse flemyng gaue backe frenche men wanne grounde peter de boyse formast front hurt speare shulder also heed bene deed without remedy men nat saued hym xxx gret varlettes whome apoynted wayte euer owne person toke hym armes bare prease myre great euery man waded mydde leg men armes bene vsed great feates armes beate downe flemynges slewe without mercy cryed saynt pye lauall sanxere rieux anghien cryes fle myng began abasshed discomfyted began recule backe fall one vpon nother frenche men entred among thyckest spared slee ben dogges surely good cause ye flemynges achyued prise ouer bene serued sauce p whan flemynges sawe howe assayled valyauntly men armes conquered causey bridge determyned set fyre owne towne two cause one thentent cause frenchman recule backe secondly cause owne company also recule backe towne deuysed dyd put fyre dyuers howses towne thynkynge therby haue abasshed enemyes whiche auayled nothynge frenchman valyauntly dyd pursewed styll betyng sleyng slemynges forsoke towne entred feldes drewe togyder sent ye countrey styrre reyse vp people uertaygne propringne uergues rolers mesiers warneston townes cause come comynes belle began braule wherby myght well knowen ther besynesse hande drewe noyse went saue themselfe goodes ipre courtrey woman child forsoke house left bestes corne mouables behynde went towarde comy ne ayde company fyghting ye meane season whyle frechmen passed ryuer lise lytell barkes hande enemyes constable great bande vowarde dyd myght passe ye bridge great prease bycause constable hadde abandoned passage euery man wolde aduenture euery man preased forthe lette passe lordes passed day ye bridge moch parell fayne lay pauesses targes ioystes bridg passe ouer nyght caused brought two lode nayles greatly dyd helpe amende bridge within short tyme bridge made agayne good stronge company passed ouer tuisday mornynge fought passage therle flaunders vnderstode howe fought passage comynes sent thyder sixe thousande men fote ayd company came done ye bridge newe made constable sent bridge warneston make bridge agayn caryage myght easly passe ouer p howe french kynge passed ryuer lyse howe philyppe dartuell made ordynaunce resyst kyng puissance cap cccc xvi tidynges came tuisdaye kynge abbey marquetes vncles howe ye passage comynes conquered vowarde passed ouer wherof greatly reioysed tha ordeyned kyng shulde passe harde masse lordes also dranke lept horse toke way comynes voward delyuered towne clene fro flemynges slayne stretes feldes four thousande besyde kylled ye chase mylles church hyden selfe feare sone breton ouer lept horse entred chase fynde flemynges ouer ryn countrey whiche fat ryche lorde ryeux lorde de lauall lorde malestroyt vycount bellyer lorde comborte company rode long came uerayne agreat towne whiche anon taken brent within put dethe ther breton great pillage profite lykewise spredde brode countrey founde house full clothe fethers cloth golde syluer flemynges trust strength comynes nat voyded goodes countrey breton entred fyrst countre dyd set thyng clothe ryches ye golde syluer founde suche came toke left thyng behynde fysshe came net ye may well knowe tydinges wyll anon spredde abrode tuisday worde cae philyp dartuell lay siege andewarpe howe frenchman passed ryuer lyse barkes ye monday howe conquered passage comynes howe ther sixe thousande menne slayne thought peter de boyse also slayne tidynges philypp greatly abasshed began greatly marueyle demauded lorde harsels best answered sayd go gaut assemble togyder men ye gette towne come hyder agayn youre puyssaunce drawe towarde courtrey whan kyng vnderstandeth ye come stronglye wyll aduysed come moche farther countrey also trust shall shortlye tidynges fro oure company englande may kynge englande vncles wyll passe see great puyssaunce soe whiche shall come well passe v marueyle greatly quod philyppe dartwell englysshe men tary long seyng knowe frenche men entred countre wotte nat mean therby specially marueyle owne men nat fro howe soeuer wyll go gaunt fetche ye rerebande shall come agayne fight fre che kyng whatsoeuer come therof enformed howe kynge hath twentie thousande men armes whiche mounteth lx thousande men warre shall bringe many agaynst hym batayle yf please god grace yt may discofyte hym wt good ryght haue shalbe moost honoured lorde worlde discofyted great fortune hath fallen gretter lorde thus philyppe dartuell lorde harsels toguyder deuysinge ther came certayne person suche bene batayle comynes verifyed ye haue herde thane philyppe dartuell sayd peter du boyse deed lyue answered sayd sir nat deed sore hurt batayle gone bruges therwith philyp lepte horse xxx men hym toke way gaut went lytell way se certayne men yt deed garyson andwarpe issued night make scrye hoost ther xii slayne stode behelde sawe haraude comyng gaunt warde belongyng kyng englande called irelande comyng haraude philyppe right ioyefull bycause came englande demauded hym tidynges sir quod haraude fyue yor men knight englande called sir wyllyam fermeton come gaunt acorde kynge englande vncles generally consent realme englande haue brought letter enformed whiche letter comyth regent flaunders whan ye knowe letter conteyne great alyances ye shall haue englande men one retourned ye shall knowe oforte ye shall haue well quod philyppe ye otente moche deuysing feare wyll late go way hoost lodgynge brought lorde harsels philyppe rode forthe gaunt ryght pensyfe suche wyse man coude haue worde hym nowe let v speke frenche kynge let v shewe howe parceyuered whan harde howe ye passage comynes bridge newe made departed fro abbey marquette rode forth toward comynes good order euery man degre kyng came tuysday comynes vncles lodged towne vowarde dyslodged went lodged mount ipre people caryage passed comynes warnestone wednisday kynge came lodged mount ipre sae wednisday rerewarde passed ye bridge comynes wherin two thousande men armes two thousande crosbowes erle ewe erle bloyse erle saynt powle erle harcourt lorde chatelon lorde sere gouernours whan night yt lordes thoght haue rested traueyle fell sodenly larum skrye lordes thought surely haue batayle thought flemynges ipre cassell bergues bene gadred togyder come gyue batayle lordes armed agayne set basse nettes set forthe baners penons ordred men euery man vnder owne ensygnes thus stoode nygh nyght myre myde legge lordes endured moche payne erle bloyse nat bene acustomed suffre cold longe nyghtes nouebre suffred honour went surely haue bene fought incontynent nothing skrye arose certayne varlettes amonge selfe howe lordes endured payne bare well myght p howe towne ipre dyuers put selfe vnder obeysance french kyng ordre kynges hoost cap cccc xvii thursday mornyng rerewarde dislodged fro comynes drue company mount ipre kyng lordes toke counsayle best whether shulde go ipre courtrey bruges meane season french forangers ran ouer countrey founde catayle thynges maruayle consydre one ouer passage comynes lacked thynge whan ipre sawe kynge puyssaunce nere passage comynes conquered nat well assured selfe drewe togyder cousayle rych notable men towne wolde euer shulde haue sent crye kyng mercy sende hym keyes towne capitayne gaunt set ther philyp dartuell wold wyse shulde yelde sayng sir towne stronge inough well prouyded may byde siege longe ynogh nedebe meane tyme philyppe dartuell regent wyll gather puyssance come fyght ye kyng rayse siege thinke nat contrary answered sayd nat surety thynke nat lye philyppe dartuells power withstand kyng helpe englysshmen whiche nothyng lykely therfore thynke best yelde v french kyng none moche rose wordes bytwene rose agaynst capitayne slewe called peter uanelayre whan ipre hadde done dede caused two freres go kynge vncles desyring kyng wolde take amyable treaty ipre kynge aduyce counsayle gaue saue conduct xii ipre abbote come go saue knowe wolde desyre ye frers returned ipre xii chosen towne abbote go kyng ye mount ipre whan came kyng kneled downe offred hym become alwayes vnder obeysance without meane reseruacion kyng consent counsayle yt thought reduce countrey faire meanes myght receyued offre codicyon ipre shulde pay kynge xl thousande frankes towardes charge comynge thyder whiche ipre made refuse ryght ioyfull therof thus ipre taken mercy desyred kyng vncles come towne refressh wherof sayd towne wolde ryght gladde kyng agreed therto consyde ryng howe fro then myght go flaunders whiche parte wolde thus ipre returned towne people therof right ioyfull whan knewe receyued mercy anon xl thousande frank gadered among payed kynge entred ipre tyme kynge lay styll mount ipre came tydynges howe yt parysiens rebelled determyned sayde amonge selfe haue beaten downe castell beautye standyng wode uyncenes also castell lowre strong howses parys thentent yt shulde nat greued one amonge thought haue said well spake right yuell apered sayd sir let v nat thus iyll season knowe howe kynge lorde dothe iourney flauders gaunt come entent trust shall wyll good tyme let v nat begyn thyng afterwarde repent v sayde called nycholas flemynge wordes parysiens seased outrage helde selfe styll parys prouided thynges harnes abylment richely though bene great lordes harnessed men cape pe lyke men armes mo tha xxx thousand many malles dayly caused harnes made solde euery man wold bye beholde se myschiefe shulde haue fallen kyng noble chiualry hym bene discomfyted flauders may well thought noblenes shulde haue ben deed lost fraunce well peraduenture place rebellyon called jaquery neuer great horible likely haue bene lykewise reynes chalons champayne ryuer marewe villayns rebelled thretened gentleman ladyes chyldren suche abydinge behynde kynge also orleance bloys rohan normandy beau uoysen dyuell entred heeddes haue slayne nobleman god nat purueyed remedy ye shall af hystorie nowe let v retourne flaunders whan cassell bergues bourbourcke grauelyns furnes dunkyrke propringe tourront uaylant messyne vnder stode howe ipre become frenche yelded vp towne vnder obeysance frenche kyng gracyously receyued theym mercy greatly reioysed recomforted thus whane well ymagyned sayd townes toke capitayns bounde fast thentent shulde nat skape brought theym mount ipre please kyng cryed hym mercy knee sayng noble kyng put bodyes goodes townes vnder youre obeysance sir shewe playnly ye ryght lorde haue brought chyefe capitayns philyppe dartuell sette rule v agaynst wylles obey sir pleasure shall lyke best sir haue ruled v pleasure kynge counsayled take mercy amonge shulde gyue kyng lx thousande frankes towarde charge therby catayls thynges abrode feldes shuld saued nat brent distroyed whiche coposicion ryght gladde thanked kynge counsayle skaped capitayns bene sette philyp dartuell sayd townes beheeded mounte ipre apoyntmentes treaty erle flaunders nat made preuy noue nat cal led counsayle somewhat anoyed hym voyage men lay euer wynge bycause flemynges ordeyned comaunded kynges name payne dethe yt man hoost shulde speke flemysshe p howe frenche kynge departed fro mout ipre howe philyppe dartuell flemynges apareled selfe fyght cap cccc xviii whan frenche kyng hoost vowarde rerewarde lyen mount ipre longe hadde pleased men solde moche marchadise suche stuffe abrode countrey lysle doway tourney solde franke worthe foure breton yt thought wyn thane charged wagans horse stuffe cloth lynen wollen golde syluer plate vessell dyd sende sauegarde ouer ryuer lyse fraunce seruauntes kynge went ipre lodged towne many myght refresshed fyue sixe dayes bruges well enfourmed howe ye kyng ipre howe countre grauelynge yelded hym wyst nat outher yelde nat howbeit dyd tyme moost pricypall cause moued nat yelde bycause hadde agreat nombre men towne philyppe dartuell siege andwarpe ye nombre seuen thousande also towne gaunt lying hostage moost notablest marchauntes bruges entent peter de boyse shulde surer rule also peter de boyse peter de myrt monge shewyng sayeng thus fayre sir good men bruges dismay nat though kynge come ipre ye knowe well howe auncyently puyssance sent kyng philyppe courtrey auncetours discomfytted slayne lyke wise shall slayn disconfyted philyppe dartuell hathe great puyssance wyll nat leaue mater thus wyll fyght kyng may well right fortune fauorabell gaunt nowe may discomfyte kyng nat one shall skape repasse agayne ryuer lyse thus hour countrey wonne agayne soo thus ye towne shall reputed good true mayntayninge fraunches grace philyp dartuell v gaunt wordes suche lyke shewed dayly peter de boyse peter de myrt refrayned bruges fall treatie french kyng meane season burgess gaunt bene englade aryued calayes sir willym fermeton englysshe knyght sent countre flaunders kyng englande conclude flemynges peace taken bytwene coun trey capitayne calys sir johan deluerays sayd sir ye welcome present tyme ye may passe farther frenche kyng ipre countrey bytwene tourned hym shortly ye shall tydinges sayde philyp dartuell assembleth power fyght kyng shall knowen shall haue better flemynges discomfyted ye haue nothyng flaunders kyng lese ye felde thus men gaunt sir willyam fermeton taryed styll calays p nowe lette v speke philyppe dartuell howe parceyuered hadde great desyre fyght kynge well shewed came gaut ordeyned euery man able beare armes towne kept shulde folowe hym euery man obeyed made beleue grace god shuld discofyte french men shuld styll lordes gaunt dyuers countreys hadde hym towne ten thousande men harnes arerebande came courtrey sent bruges audyn ardanbourc sluse four mestyers chatelayne gratmont teremonde aloys raysed among th xxx thousade lodged one nyght andewarpe next day departed went courtrey hadde company fifty thousande men harnes tjoynges came kynge lordes fraunce philyppe dartuell puyssance aproched fast towarde said ye company threscore thousande men vowarde departed fro jore reregarde hoost whyle lordes thus feldes endured moch payne hart wynter begynnig december rayned nygh euery day lordes fayne lye euery nyght hygh wayes euery houre loked batayle dayly said hoost howe enemyes co meth morowe sayde forager went dayly forthe foragyng kynge lodged myddes felde monge men philyppe dartwell copany taryed long came lordes fraunce sore dyspleased wether soo sore wolde fayne mater bene determyned kyng floure chiualry frauce philyp dartuell ye flemynges proude whan hardy fight ye kyng leyen styll ye siege andwarde fortefyed selfe reason rayne foule wether fell frenchman wolde neuer haue gone haue fought coulde nat lightly haue fought great payne parell philyppe glorifyed fayre fortune victory bruges semed thynge coude go agaynst hym hoped well lorde worlde ymaginacyon doughted nothyng french kyng puyssance wolde nat haue done dyd ye shall p maruayle came flemynges nyght howe ordeyned batayle one company cap cccc xix wednisday night ye batayle next day philyp dartuell puyssance came lodged fayre grounde right stroge bytwene dike lytell groue woode strong hedge yt lightly man coulde come well bytwene hyll rosebeque ye kyng lay night philyppe dartuell made supper lodgyng capitayns right plenteous prouisyon ynoughe folowynge supper sayd faire sir ye se well armes hope well morowe shall haue besynes kyng hathe great desyre fynde v fyght lodged rosebeque nowe require kepe faythe trouthe nat abasshed thyng ye se vpholdynge ryght lette v frely fyght mayntayn iurisdictyons flauders admonyst people well deuoyre ordre well wisely good order array may haue victory iourney morowe ye grace god shall fynde lorde dare fyght agaynst v felde shall honoure v though comfort englisshmen company shulde haue renome nat also say company saue parsone alyue therby shall lyue rest kynge floure fraunce none lest hynde wherfore comaunde payne deth man take prisoner without kynge hymselfe wolde saued chylde e ought pardoned knoweth nat yet dothe led shall bring hym gaut lerne speke flemysshe duke erls parsones slee comons fraunce wyll nat dyspleased surety wolde none shuld returne agayne fraunce trust shall philyppe supper acorded opinyon answered one voice sayd sir ye say well thus shalbe done toke leaue retourned lodginges companyes shewe ye haue harde thus passed nyght hoost philyppe dartuell midnyght enfourmed fell hoost maruaylous thynge neuer harde none lyke maner thus whane flemynges rest lodginges howbeit knewe well enemyes hyll nat past leage fro enfourmed philyp dartuell brought damosell gaunt philyppe lay slept couch besyde lytell fyre cole pauilyon sayd damosell ye houre mydnight issued pauilyon loke ye ayre se tyme night likly hode could nat slepe loked towarde rosebeque sawe skye dyuers fume fyre flyeng fyres frenchman made vnder hedge busshes damosell harkened thought harde great brute bytwene hoost french hoost thought harde frenche cryes cryeng moutioy saynt denyce cryes thought mount dorre bytwene rosebeque thyng sore afrayed entred pauylyon sodenly awaked philyp sayd sir ryse vp shortly arme haue harde great noyse mount dorre leue frenchman comyng assayle word rose cast gowne toke axe hande yssued pauylion se damosell shewed hym herde hym selfe semed hym great tournement onthe sayd hyll incotynent entred pauilyon caused trumpet blowen soone trumpet blowen euery man arose armed watche sent incotynent philypp dartuell knowe use styrred vp host seyng cause shewyng howe sent enemyes hoost styrring quod philyppe wherof rose noyse mount dorre sir herde noyse sent thyder knowe went hath made report whan came herde sawe nothyng sir bycause founde nothynge made noyse therof styrring vp hoost shulde haue styrred without cause ought haue ben blamed labour whan watche shewed philyppe wordes apeased hym selfe hoost howbeit marueyle mynde myght sayde fendes hell played tourneyed batayle shulde next daye ioye great pray likely haue ther euer sodayne afray philyppe dartuell flemyng dout betrayenge good leysar armed made great fyres eate meate dranke wherof sufficient hour day philyppe sayd sir good drewe felde order peple entent thoughe frenche men come v breakyng day may redy receyue accorded sayeng issued lodgynges came hethe without woode great large dyke newly made behynde full busshes genepar small busshes ordered batayle one company report costables nombre l thousande chosen men dyde sette lytell lyues also threscore archer englysshmen stolen away fro calys thynkyng haue profyte philyppe dartuell thus euery thyng ordred cariage woman varlettes philyppe dartuell page hym good courser worthe great lorde fyue hundred florens hym nat hym entent flye away steale fro company gretter therby shewe estate mout hym nede folowe chase frenchman towne gaut nyne thousande men well armed kept euer owne person truste baners formast front aloyes grantmot next courtrey bruges danne scluse franke armed moost partie malles chapeause stele hocquetons gantlettes steele baleyne eche bearynge stake typped yron townes differece armes lyuereis knowe one company fro another cote yelowe blue blacke bandes reed cootes bordered whyte blewe cote pla ted grene blewe soelosenged whyte blacke quartred whyte reed blewe one quarter reed reed cutte vpon whyte baners accordyng craftes great holmes hagynge gyrdels thus taryed day light whiche nere aprochyng nowe shall shewe order frenchman p howe constable admyrall fraunce bastarde langres wente se flmynges howe fortifyed selfe cap cccc xx frenche kynge lord hym knewe right well howe flemynges aproched nere sawe well ther remedy batayle ther mocion made tretie peace wednisdaye crye made towne ipre yt maner peple men warre shulde drawe ye felde kynge oughte euery man obeyed kynges comaundement reason drue felde except suche bar lett comauded kepe maysters horse howbeit bowarde many horse ye adueturers dyscouer feldes thus wednisday frenche men kept feldes nere vnto rosebeque night kyng made supper four vncles costable frauce lorde coucy great lordes straugers brabant heynalte hollande zelande almayne lorayne sauoy come thyder serue kyng wherof thanken greatlye nyght erle flauders kept wache hym sixe hundred speares xii hudred men person warre supper whan lordes departed constable abode styll speke kyng vncles ordayned kynges counsayle co stable fraunce sir olyuer clysson shulde leaue office next day bycause thought yt shulde haue batayle lorde coucy shulde occupy offyce yme sir olyuer kynges person whan wolde haue taken leaue kyng kynge sayd hym ryght swetely amiably sir costable wolde ye rendre vp offyce handes night morowe day haue ordayned another occupy rome wyll ye abyde persone wordes constable great marueyle answered sayde right dere sir knowe well nat haue great honour ayde kepe youre persone sir shulde right displesaunt company theym vowarde haue nat company paraduenture maye lese therby wynne sir say nat bycause shulde thynke selfe valyant lacke shulde nat well sir sauyng correctyon cousayle say fyftene dayes past haue done none thynge pursewed myne offyce honoure people sir haue shewed euery man shulde sir fight morowe se nat amonge wyll abasshed wher shall receyue blame wyll saye haue deuysed many thynges flye way fro first stroke sir requyre grace breke nat hath ben first ordayned ensure ye shall haue profyt therby kynge suche hym wyst nat say last kyng right sagely said constable knowe well ye haue cause right well acquyted selfe shall kyng father deed loued trusted aboue great trust affyaunce therfore wolde haue aboute besynesse ryght dere sir quod constable ye well acompanyed valyant noble men ordred delyberacion wyse counsayle nothynge amended wherfore sir ye youre counsayle ought content therfore requyre goddes behalfe suffre alone myne offyce truste morowe ye shall haue good fortune iourney frendes shal gladde ennemyes displeased whiche wordes kynge gaue none aunswere great space last sayd constable name god saynt denyce exercyse offyce pleasure wyll speke therof ye se farther matter suche moued first matter morowe masse sir quod constable right good wyll toke leaue kyng retourned logyng thursdaye mornynge euery man apparelled theselfe redy armed saue heedes knewe well lykelyhodde shulde haue batayle day frenche kyng herde masse tymes mornyng great lordes great deuocyon prayeng god sende honoure daye mornynge arose great myst one coulde nat se acre brede hym wherof lordes ryght sore displeased coude nat amende masse kynge constable great lordes wente counsayle determyne shulde ther ordayned sir olyuer clysson costable fraunce sir mathue uyenne admyrall frauce sir wylliam poicters bastarde langres thre shulde go vysette demeanour flemyng nere ther might come agayne make report kynge vncles trouthe euery thynge meane tyme lorde de labreth sir hughe chatelone shulde order ba aylles thus thre departed fro kyng mouted good horse rode streyght thought fynde enemyes mornyng ye great myst flemynges rose drewe toguyder stronge place fortifyed stode toguyder one batayle tyll eyght clocke coude nothyng frenchman great pride capitaynes sayd eche thus standyng styll fete take colde nat go forthe great courage sythe haue great wyll fight oure enemyes tary nothynge frech men wyll neuer seke v lette v go leest mount dorrel take aduauntage hyll wordes multiplyed agreed auaunce forthe take ye hyll bytwene frechmen escape fro dyke went lytell wode behynde toke playne feldes came wode forsaid thre knyghtes aduysed great eysar rode costyng batayle within bowe shot whan passed lyft syde rode agayne ryght syde well aduysed hole batell flemynges sawe right well brake none aray dartuell sayd softely capitayns dresse v make v redy batayle enemyes nere v se right well thre knightes haue passed passed v haue well auiewed oure batayle h sie th drewe one batayle wente hyll philyppe sayd loude sir whan come batayle lette v thynke oure enemyes howe disconfyted batayle bruges reason helde oure selfe close toguyder let v beware opyn nat euery man beare weapen ryght hym enterlase staues ouer armes one within another wherby shall nat entre vpon v lette v go good pase leysar nother tourne lyfte hande right shote gonne atones shote oure cro bowes shall abasshe enemyes whan philyppe dartuell thus ordred men sette batayle arraye shewed theym shulde made wynge part men suche best trusted page courser whoe sayd go thy waye horse behynde yonder busshe whan thou seyst frenchman flye bring horse crye crye men wyll gyue roume entent may folowe chase formast page dyde commaunded set besyde hym wynge xl archer englysshmen whome wage p nowe beholde philyp ordred hym selfe well nat thynke dyde many suche expert bataylles dyde nat well wysely one thynge whane depatrted mornynge stronge place thought frenche men wolde neuer haue sought theym haue fought coulde nat haue done without great domage lyke foles thought shewe selfe valyaunt lytell fearyng enemyes serued therafter p maner batayle rosebeque howe flemyng yted cousayle thre knightes ewed b hauyng cap iiii c xx thre foresayd knyghtes retourned kyng bataylles ye redy good ey ought ther many noble wyse men well experte armes bothe vowa de reregarde kynges batayle knew right well ought done ther good ch alry worlde thus euery man gaue thre knyghtes way coe kyng lorde clysson spake first en lynynge body kynge doyng hatte sayde sir mery yonder people ure varlettes shall beate constable quod kynge god graunt let v go forwarde name god saynt denyce thane suche knyghtes apoynted attende kynges body sette good order kynge made many newe knightes dyde euery lorde owne batayle dyuers baners newe reysed vp ordayned wha e shulde oyne fyght kynges batayle riflambe frauce shulde fore fronte uo warde shulde passe syde wynge one syde kynge rerewarde passe lytell syde kynge thre batayls might atoues close mynges batayle came close toguyder one batayle arereward shewed apoyntmet erle ewe erle bloyse erle saynt poule erle arcourte lorde chatyllone lorde sere chiefe warde erle bloyse made barone yonge lorde haurell sir thomas dystre sir james ameth bastarde made ght made day reporte haraudes foure hundred thre score uyn knightes thre knight departed fro kyng went vowarde rome riflambe displayed si e e yllers dyde beare say haue founde written neuer sene displayed agaynst christemen tha voyage great questyon made whyder shulde displayed ornatte howe dyuers reason consydered finally determyned displayed cause flemynges helde opynion contrarie pope clement therfore frenchemen called theym urbanystes wherfore sayde hery kes oute true beleue chyefe cause borne displayed flaunders ori ambe precyous baner sent first fro heuyn great mysterie whiche euer great comfort sawe daye shewed vertue mornyng great thicke myst one coude scantese another soone displayed lyfte vp hyghe myst brake away skye clere tyme yere lordes fra ce greatlye reioysed whan sawe sonne shine clere might se greatly dyde reconfort great beautie regarde baners stremars waue wynde behelde well great batayle flemmynges euer styll aproched fast ioyned toguyder staues vpright semed lytle groue wode many p howe flemynges disco fyted batayle rosebeque cap iiii c xxii iwas enfourmed lorde destenort shewed howe sawe dyde dyuers whan oriflambe displayed myst gone away came doue made dyuers flyghtes ouer kynges batayle lytell fought sat downe one kynges baners whiche euery manne toke good token thus aproched flemynges began shote gones arowes fethered steele thus batayle began whiche right sharpe feirse first encoutryng ye flemyng set proudly thrustyng wt speares shulders lyke wylde re helde themselfe close toguyder coulde nat opyned ther shot gonne fyrst thrust slayne french parte lorde del rwyn baneret morlette harwyn james dorre therwith kynges batayle reculed vowarde ye arerewarde passed forth enclosed flemynges helde theym strayte shall shewe howe two wynges men armes fersly assawted stronge speares well heeded heed fyne stele wherwith persed flemynges cote mayle ye harde bone flemynges glad esche stroke thus men armes kept flemynges short coude nat well helpe selfe put downe armes gyue stroke many lost strength brethe fell one vpon dyed lacke breth strikyng stroke ther philyppe dartuell wounded beaten downe amonge men gaunt whan page horse sawe discofyture mayster departed lefte mayster coulde nat helpe hym rode courtray towardes gaunt thus batayls assembled gyder lemynges batayle inclosed bothe sydes coulde passe way ye kynges batayle came forth agayne whiche lytell drawen backe men armes beate downe flemynges euery syd good ax stele wher brake sonder bassenetes malles leade wherwith gaue suche stroke beat downe erthe fore flemynges beaten downe page redy cut throtes great knyues slewe pytie though bene dogges stroke bassenetes great yt man coulde speke noyse harde reported yt though armorer bareys brusels hadde bene workynge toguyder coulde nat haue made great noyse aduauced sore prease ayn ouercome lacke brethe sir loys gousalles getle knight berrey sir fleton renyell dyuers whiche great domage great batayle flemynges coulde nat ouercome without great losse yong knightes squiers wyll lightly auaunce selfe get honour prease great besynesse parylous whan thicke prease coude nat releue selfe troden vnder fote dethe meanes dyuers frechmen slayne great nombre lemyng slayne hepes one vpon nother whane behynde sawe discomfyture company abasshed cast downe pauesses armures tourned fled away towarde courtrey place mynde nothynge saue selfe ye breton frenchman chased dyke groues busshes euer foughte slewe downe ryght many fledde bytwene courtrey batayle go gaunt batayle mout dorre bytwene courtrey rosebeque yere lorde god thousande thre hundred sourscore two thursday next aduet nouember xxvii day french kyng charles beyng xiiii yere age p howe body philyp dartuell brought kynge ha ged vp howe towne curtray brent cap c c c c xxiii thus ye haue herde flemynges disconfyted mount dorre pride abated philyppe dartuell slayne gaunt parteners slayne hym felde nombre nyne thousande acordynge report herauldes chase xxv thousande slayne batayle endured nat past halfe hour disconfyted discofyture whiche right honourable christendome noblenesse sayd villaynes atchyued entente neuer great crueltie haue ben sene worlde comonties dyuers countreis rebelled haue distroyed noblenesse thynke parys wolde saye whan knewe disconfyture thynke nothynge ioyfull therof thus whan batayle atchyued laste left chase trupettes sowned retrait euery man drewe lodgynge vowarde lodged forwarde flemynges lyen nyght toke ease well refresshed newe purueyaunce came fro ipre night made great fyres suche pauesses staues flemynges broughte felde whan kyng lod gynge pyght vp pauilyon crymasyn sendall right noble riche kynges vncles ed hym dyuers lordes fraunce came thyder se hym reason requyred kynge sayde hym sir philyppe dartuell lyue dedde wolde fayne se hym answered howe wolde payne shulde se hym thanne made crye throughe hoost soeuer coude fynde philyppe dartuell shulde haue hundred frankes laboure many went among deed bodyes nyghe dispoyled clothes laste ther suche serche made founde knowen varlette serued hym longe tyme knewe hym well dyuers token drawen brought kynges pauylyon kyng behelde hym longe space dyde thother lordes turned retourned se hurtes woundes coude se wounde wherby shuld dye iudged fell lytell dyke great meny gauntoyse hym wherby pressed dethe wha well regarded hym last taken fro then haged vpon tre ende philyp dartuell sir danyell helwyn within andewarpe knyghtes squyers whiche kepte garyson right honourably wednisdaye batayle bycause knewe well kyng flau ders shulde haue batayle flemynges late nyght caused foure fagottes sette fyre caste highe towne tokenynge lay sege howe siege shulde reysed thursdaye tidynges came lorde harselles howe company discofyted philyp dartuell slayne soone thes tidynges knowen dislodged toke way gaunt left behynde moost parte prouysion warpe knewe nothynge therof tyll next mornynge whan knewe therof issued oute brought great pyllage founde hydden sae thursday nyght tidynges came bruges disconfyture batayle wherof greatly abasshed sayde lo may nowe se owne distructyon breton come hyder entre towne shall pylled slayn wyll haue v mercy burgess wyues toke best iowelles rich put shyppes saue sende water hollande zelande case four dayes left disshe cuppe syluer bruges put shyppes dout breton whan peter de boyse laye sore wounded hurtes toke passage comynes understode disconfyture company howe philyppe dartuell deed slayne howe people bruges abasshed suretie hym selfe determyned departe go gaunte thought gaunt wolde also sore abasshed made lytter dressed hym coude nat ryde ye may knowe well whan tidynges came gaunte losse men dethe philyp dartuell sore disconforted frenchman come thyder daye batayle next day ye saturday euer peter de boyse came thyder wolde haue suffred haue entred ye towne resystence haue done lyste frenche men toke hede therto thought right well lordes therof pleasure seynge philyppe dartuell deed thought surely people gaunte wolde haue yelded kynges mercy howbeit dyde nat alone made greatter warre euer dyd ye shall herafter hystorie friday kyng disloged fro rosbeque bycause eyre deed bodyes counsayled go courtray refresshe hym hase dyuers knightes squyers suche knewe countrey lepte horse galowped streyght courtray entred towne made defence agaynst burgess wyues men woman chyldren entred cellar church flye fro ye doth pytie se suche entred first courtray great profyte pyllage entred frenche men breton euery man toke vp lodgynge came kynge entred firste day decembre newe persecucyon made towne flemynges suche hydden founde slayne ther man taken mercy frenche men towne hated eche mortal lye bycause batayle one fought courtray sir robert arthors great parte oure frauce slayne shewed kynge howe courtray churche oure lady chapell wherin fyue hundred gylte spurres parteyninge olde tyme lordes knyghtes fraunce suche bene slayne sayde batayle courtray whiche yere oure lorde god thousande thre hundred two courtray one yere made therof great triumphe solempnyte wherfore kyng sayd shulde derely bought departynge sette towne fyre entent shulde knowen euer howe frenche kynge bene anone kynge thus come courtray came thyder fyftie speares fro garyson warpe sir danyell helwyn se kynge made ryght good chere dyde lordes whanne bene day retourned warpe company p howe bruges yelde selfe vnder obeysace french king howe gaunt reconforted peter de boyse cap cccc xxiiii breton voward shewed well demeanoure hadde great desyre go bruges pylle robbe towne erle flau ders loued ryght well towne bruges wolde nat wyll towne shulde clene distroyed also enformed howe bruges disconforted greatly abasshed pytie theym sayde sonne duke burgoyne sir bruges wolde come aske mercy goddessake lette nat refused towne ouer ronne breton shall neuer recouered agayne lost euer duke agreed well therto thus whyle kyng lay courtrey bruges lyued great feare wyst nat outher avoyde towne el abyde aduenture last determyned sende two freres kyng courtrey obtayne saueconduct twelfe best towne coe speke kynge counsayle two freres came curtrey spake kyng counsayle erle flaunders molefyed mater moche might kyng graunted twelfe burgess saueconduct go come speke hym thus freres retourned bruges twelfe burgess departed went courtrey kynge vncles kneled downe knee hym sayd sir requyre yor grace take accepte v owne men towne pleasure sir goddessake haue pytie v let nat towne distroyed loste sir yf distroyed many good men vtterly vn done euer sir haue ben contrarie oure naturall lorde puissaunce philyppe dartuell gau toyse hadde nat bene towne bruges hadde benefull trewe lorde kynge entended well wordes meanes erle flaunders present kneledde downe kynge desyredde haue mercy theym shewed theym apease breton menne warre lyenge feldes bytwene courounte bruges muste behoue theym paye certayne money comunyng mater demaunded pay two hudred thousande frankes last determyned yt shulde pay sixe score thousande frank thre score thousade hande resydue candelmas next therby lyue rest peace clerly become liegmen french kyng owe hym faythe homage obeysaunce thus good towne bruges abode peace nat robed pylled wherwith breton ryght sore displeased thought haue great profyte therby sayd whan sawe peace made lykely haue warre warre flaunders thyng profytable v haue lytle aduauntage therby let v returne coutrey let v go haynalt duke aubert hath gouernynge came nat ayde helpe cosyn therle flauders hath dissymuled hym wherfore good go vyset hym hathe good countrey fat shall ynd none wyll let v way let v recouer domag wage yuell payed one accorde nombre xii hundred speares breton burgonyons sauosyns countreis ieopardy good countre heynalt knowledge therof came gentyll erle b oyes one great lordes among one chiefe gouernours arere garde one kynges counsayle anone whan knewe ye breton burgonyons desyred nothyng pyllage howe asshed good countre heynalte fynde remedy therfore aduaunced forthe sayd howe nat thyng consented vnto good countre heynalt shulde ouer ronne called hym cosyns erle marche erle saynt poule lorde coucy lorde dangeen dyuers hauyng landes n coutie heynault heshewed howe wyse ought consent good countre heynalt shulde ouer ronne fro whens dyscended haue therin fayre herytage also sayd sir ye knowe well countre heynalt hath done maner trespasse warre bytwene erle flaunders countre alwayes heynalt bare faute hath serued kyng voyage well truely barones knyghtes therof also kyng came flauders knightes squyers heynalt serued truely erle flaunders closed beseged tere monde andwarpe aduentured bothe body goodes moche erle bloys dyde went fro one another gat suche frendes mater broken abode styll peace also erle dyd another thyng ther flauders knyght called lorde esquymyn loue kynsman called sir danyell buse throughe owne faute slayne towne ualencennes reuenge quarell sayde lorde sayde wolde make warr harry towne ualencennes goten suche frendes toguyder yuell drewe nombre yue hundred speares redy go heynalt harry towne ualecennes affirmyng howe good quarell whan erle bloyes enformed therof defended sayd knight shulde nat hardy entre heynalt countrey cosyn duke aubert dyde shulde derely bought moche dyde gentyll erle bloys stopped sayde knightes enterprise mater put clerely handes lorde coucy thus towne peace suche seruice dyde erle bloys army heynalt ualencennes wherby gatte greatloue specially towne ualencennes season lordes men warr lay styll courtray knewe nat kynge wolde whyder wolde go gaunte ornat frenchman beleued whan bruges yelded vp gaunte wolde lykewise seyng lost capitayne receyued great domage losse men batayle rosebeque trouth one gaunt mynde haue done thre dayes wyst nat outher departe leaue towne el sende kayes therof kynge yelde mercy abasshed wyst nat lorde harsels wyst nat howe reconforte theym whan peter de boyse entred towne founde gate wyde opyn without kepyng defence wherof great marueyle demaunded ment kept better towne suche come se hym answered sayd sir shulde ye knowe well haue lost oure good capitayne men towne besyde straugers nombre nyne thousande domage toucheth v nyghe haue recouery folysshe people quod peter de boyse ye abasshed wot nat well warr yet nat ende towne gaunt neuer renomed shalbe yet herafter philyp dartuell deed owne outrage close vp gate entende defence ye nede nat feare kynge wyll come hyder wynter tyme meane tyme newe season coe shall newe releued men holande zelande guerles brabant place shall haue men ynowe money fra coys atreman englande shall retourne shall capitayns warre neuer sore shall make better nowe alone tha whan helpe flauders nowe better expert therfore lette v entende nowe prouyde warre shall tha euer dyde thus suche wordes peter de boyse reconforted sore abasshed returnyng gaunt nat bene yelded themselfe symply frenche kynge lo thus ye may se counsayle confort ther one man tyme nede whan gaunt sawe fyue sixe dayes passed man cae towardes towne lykelyhod siege greatly reconforted prouder euer p howe treatie alyaunce bytwene englysshe men flemynges broken howe french kyng deted flauders cap cccc xxv ye haue herde howe sir willyam fermeton calys sent thyder kyng englande counsayle brought letter hym haue bene sealed good townes flaunders makynge men yon great alyaunces taken bytwene thenglysshmen flemynges calais hym styll fraunces atreman sixe burgess gaunt whan tidynges came discofyture rosebeque sore abasshed englisshe knight sawe well entre farther flaunders sawe well treatie broken toke letter vnsealed retourne englande agayne assoone might shewed mater howe fallen wherof gentylmen countre nat greatly displeased sayd also say yet comons flaunders wonne vyctorie noble men fraunce ben slayne pride comons euery countre
