wolde haue ben great noble men shulde haue repented whiche well sene lytell englande wherfore losse flemynges lytell thought taken whan flaunders suche ben englande frau ce atreman knewe tidyng right greuous departed water arryued mydelborowe zelande suche gaunt retourned gaut euery man home owne townes frau ce atreman company beyng cali departed went gaunt nat long frenche kyng flauders enfour ed retourned zelande season frenche kyng lay courtrey dyuers cousayls knowe howe shulde parceyuer warre whether shulde go ley siege gaunt nat kyng well wyllyng haue gone thy er lykewise breton burgonyos lordes cosydred howe moneth decembre ye deed tyme wynter dayly rayned wherfore thought good hostyng tyll somer season also sawe well howe horse feble reason ye colde season ryuers great large gaut wherfore thought lost tyme ley sege also lordes wery sore traueyled long lyeng feldes colde tyme tayny thynges consydred determyned kynge shulde go tourney refresshe kepe christmas farr countreis auuergne dolphyn sauoy burgoyne shulde returne home owne countreis fayre easely breton normayns frenchman shulde abyde styll constable attende kyng thought shulde haue busynesse parisyes newly forged great nobre malles wherfore thought set another rule order amonge whan kynge shulde departe fro courtrey counsayle forgate nat gylt spurres founde churche courtray whiche olde tyme parteyned noble men frauce somtyme slayne erle robert arthoyse batayle curtrey kyng ordayned departyng towne shulde set fyre distroyed whan knowledge therof came erle flaunders thought haue founde remedy therfore came ye kyng kneled downe requyred hym none yuell towne curtrey kyng answered howe surely wolde nat request therle durst speke mater departed went logyng fyre began duke burgoyne caused horaloge taken downe ye moost fayrest goodlyest coude founde syde see whiche horaloge taken downe peces layed chares bell also caryed diyon burgoyne sette vp sowneth xxiiii houres ye day night departyng kyng fro courtrey towne clene distroyed brent knyghtes squyers men warre toke men woman chyldren raunsome kyng rode came turney lodged abbey sait martyne towne dyde great reuerence kynge reason requyred ye towne arayed whyte thre barres grene one syde cytie deuyded lodge lord kyng lay saynt martyns company one quarter towne duke berry lodged bysshoppes lodginge duke burgoyne crowne duke burbone golden heed costable saynt james heed ther cry made king name payne dethe man hurt people cytie manne take thyng without pay truely therfore none entre countie heynaulte hurte domage thynges well kept holden lordes refresshed well ye farr countreis departed retourned homewarde lysle doway ualence ne erle bloyse toke leaue kynge vncles companyon therle ewe returned herytage heynalte lay day nyght ualencenes wher well refresshed achyued entierly loue good people towne seruyce yt dyde countre whan breton burgonyons sauoy syns wolde haue ouerron countre whiche let meanes also sir tyrrie disquemyne helde ualencennes great feate whiche mater putte erles handes lorde couces therby peace erle departed fro ualencennes went le decheries ther taryed season lady mary wyfe lewes sofie somer went bloyse cou tesse wife sonne taryed styll heynalt moost parte lay beaumont p howe frenche kyng cae parys howe caused putte downe cheyns harnes towne howe parisyes raunsomed pleasure cap cccc xxvi lykewise erle marche sir james burbone brother deted fro tourney went refresshe scluse heynault owne herytages sir guy de lauall breton went cheure heynault wher parte enherytauce sir robert namure lord therof lorde coucy went mortayn ryuer lescalt refresshed hym copany parte hym selfe kyng turney erle saynt poule comissyon chastyce urbanystes wherof ther many towne foude many euer founde churche lady el taken put prison sore rausomed meanes erle saynt poule gathered toguyder shorte season seuyn thousande frankes none scaped hym payed founde good suretie paye whyle kyng lay tourney gaunt saueconduct go coe entreate peace treaty harde proude thoughe vyctorie batayle rosebeque sayd wolde gladly put selfe vnder obeysaunce frenche kyng holde hym haue resort court parys sayd wolde neuer haue take lorde erle loyes sayde coude neuer loue hym bycause great domages receyued hym meanes euer ye kyng counsayle coude coude neuer tourne fro opinyon wolde neuer make answere butsayde thoughe lyued two thre yere payne trouble daunger yet trusted laste recouer bringe vp towne agayne great prosperyte welthe shewed might departe whan lyst deted fro tourney retourned gaunt mater hanged styll warre frenche kyng lord toke great payne cause countie flaunders good clementyns obey pope clement good townes church sore anexed bounde opinyon pope urbane coude nat turned therle flaunders hym selfe ye opinyon answered cousayle therle take aduyce answere detmynatly feest ester thus matter hanged kynge kept christmas turney whan kyng deted ordayned lorde guystell capitayn bruges lorde saynt pye ipre great lorde guystell regarde flaunders sir john jumont capitayne courtrey sent two c speres breton garyson andeburge andwarpe sent sir wyllm langhien c speares hym garyson thus garysons flauders purueyed kepe garyson warr wynter none otherwise tyll next somer thynges thus ordred kynge departed fro tourney went arras vncles hym erle flaunders company kyng taryed arras cytie great aduenture haue ben ouer ron robbed breton great wage owyng also endured great traueyle voyage nat well content kyng great payne refrayne fro doyng yuell costable marshal fraunce apesed promysyng howe shulde clerely payed wage whan came parys thus kynge deted went peron erle flaunders toke leaue kyng went lyle long kyng iurneyed passed peron noyon copayne came saynt lyse rested men warre lodged ye vyllages bytwene sait lyse meaulx bry ryuer marne saynt denyce ye countre full men warre kyng departed fro saynt lyse went towarde paris sent officer prepare hym lodgynge castell loure also thre vncles sent seruauntes prepare lodgynges lykewise dyd lord done cautell wyle kyng lordes nat determyned entre sodenly parys douted parys dyde proue countenance order paris wolde make kyng entre thought wold make assay fore seruautes went commaunded say man demauded kyng comyng wolde ther incotynent whiche parisyens aduysed among selfe armed shewe kyng entre puyssance men warr able make serue kyng whan pleased ben better haue sytten styll house shewe made couerted great seruytude ye shall ther sayd dyde good taken yuell wher kyng shulde haue lodged lour made lodgynge prepared bourgell voyce ran thorough parys kyng nere hade entre parys mo xx thousande parisyens armed yssued feldes ordred themselfe fayre batayle bytwene saynt lader parys towarde mount martyr crosbowes pauesses malles redy apparelled thoughe shulde haue fought incotynent batayle kyng borgell lordes thider broght tidynges demeanoure parys lordes sayde ye may se pride rybauldes wherfore nowe shewe estate yf wolde haue serued kynge poynt nowe whan kynge went flaunders thane done well hadde mynde rather prayed god yt shulde neuer retourne agayne whiche wordes dyuers ther helped well forwarde thentent greue parisyens sayeng kyng counsayled shall nat aduenture hym selfe come among suche people cometh agaynst hym army arrayed batayle shulde rather haue coe humbly processyon haue rong belle parys thankynge god vyctorie kyng flaunders thus lordes abasshed howe shulde tayne selfe finally apoynted constable fraunce lorde dalbret lorde coucy sir guy tremoyle sir johan uyen shulde go speke demaunde cause issued parys great nobre armed order batayle agaynst kyng whiche thynge neuer sene fraunce vpon aunswere lordes sayde kynge shulde take aduyse wyse ynoughe order great mater gretter said lordes departed fro kyng without harnesse suretie busynesse toke thre foure herauldes sende somwhat parisyens sayd sir go ye yonder people parys demaude saue conduct v go coe tyll haue spoken fro kyng heraudes departed rode great pace cae people whan parisiens sawe comyng thought full lytell hadde come haue spoken thought rydden parys dyde heraudes cote armures whan aproched nere parisyens sayd high maysters wher ruler whiche capitayns become sende fro lordes parys parceyued well word nat done well cast downe heedes sayde maysters one accorde kynges commaundement ye lordes therfore sir saye goddes name ye wyll v sir quod heraudes lordes sente v hyder named knowe nat ye thynke entende requyre may peasably without parell come speke retourne agayne kyng shewe hym answere ye make otherwyse dare nat come oure faythes sir quod ought say suche wordes v getylnesse thynke ye mocke v surely sir quod heraudes speke good certentie quod parisyens go way say may come pleasure v without daunger parell shall haue hurt none v redy fulfyll commaundementes herauldes retourned lordes shewed ye haue herde tha four lordes rode company came parisyens whome founde good array order batayle mo xx thousande malles lordes passed behelde theym well within selfe praysed moche maner also passed euer parisyes enclyned selfe whan lordes myddes amonge rested stode styll constable spake highe sayde ye people parys hath moued issue cytie order batayle semeth ye wyll fyght agaynst kynge souerayne lorde whose subgettes ye shulde sir quod saue youre grace neuer wyll thynge agaynst kynge sir yssued non cause shewe kyng puyssance parisyens kyng yonge neuer yet sawe without se nat knowe may serued nede sir quod costable ye speke well saye vnto fro kynge tyme wyll se maner ye haue done suffyseth therfore counsayle retourne agayne peaseably parys euery man owne lodgynge youre harnesse ye entende kynge shall come hyder sir quod shall right good wyll fulfyll youre commaundement therwith retourned parys euery man owne house vnarme hym sayde four lordes retourned kyng shewed vnto hym wordes ye haue herde determyned kyng vncles lordes certayne men armes shulde entre parys great bande yde without cyte roude gyue feare parisyens lorde coucy marshall sa xere ordayned assoone kynge entred parys shulde take downe leaues gate four princypals cytie towarde saynt denyce saynt gate myght stande open day night maner men warr entre pleasur thentent mayster parys nede also take downe chenesse euery strete ryde pleasure ordayned done kyng entred parys lodged loure vncles thother lordes dyuers logynges thus gate taken gouge layd downe ye grounde chenesse euery strete taken downe brought palayes parisyens great dout feared shulde ouer ron none durst loke strete open dore wyndowe thus thre dayes great parell feare receyue greatter domage dyd cost many great fynance rau called chambre counsayle one another suche lord wolde haue rausomed sixe thousande frankes thre one ther leuyed parys kynges profyte vncles mynisters foure hundred frankes ther nothyng demauded poore people great maysters suche might bear right happy might escape payeng rausome euery man self fayne bring harnesse sackes castell beautie wise called castell uycenes closed great towre mals also thus parisyes delt gyue ensa ple good townes frace ther reysed vp subsyd gabels ayd fouages douzimes trezimes suche thyng also playne coutre cleneryfled p howe dyuers notable men paris beheeded mayster johan marettes parys dyuers townes fraunce warr gautoise newe begon agayne cap cccc xxvii also diuers taken put prison many drowned apease remynant crye made cyte none payne dethe shuld hurt parisyen ro take thynge house without payeng therfore cry apeased greatly cyte howe day dyuers persones ledde castell iudged dye defaul styrring vp comons howbeit great marueyle made mayster johan marettes reputed renoumed sage notable man said wrong iudged dye alwayes bene man great wysedome good counsayle one moost autetyke men court parlyamet serued kyng philyppe kyng johan kynge charles neuer founde defaute howe iudged beheeded xii company caryed charet place execusion spake sayd hath iudged dye let come forthe shewe cause thus preached people went execusyon people great pyte durst speke worde brought markette place halle first beheeded suche brought thyder hym one called nicholas flamant draper ther offred saue lyfe threscore thousande frankes wolde nat taken dyed whan came mayster johan marettes sayde hym mayster johan crye mercy ye king forgyue mysdedes tourned hym sayde haue serued kyng phylyppe great graunt father kynge johan kynge charles father well truelye thre neuer layed thynge charge kyng nowe wolde haue done bene full age mane knowledge beleue iudgyng nothyng culpable haue nothyng crye hym mercy crye god mercy none requyre hym humbly forgyue misded toke leaue people many wept hym maner dyed mayster johan marettes lykewise towne rohan mayster towne ther dyuers putte dethe raunsomed also reynes chaalons troyes sence orlyaunce townes taxed great somme florens bycause begynninge disobeyed kyng ther gadered realme fraunce suche florens marueyle speke therof went profyte ye duke berrey duke burgoyne yong kynge gouernaunce saye trouthe constable fraunce marshalles great parte paye men armes serued kynge vyage flaunders erle bloys erle marche erle ewe therle saynt poule erle harcourt erle dolphyn auuergne lorde coucy gret baron fraunce assigned payed suche tare shulde payed countreis suche seruyce done kyng flaunders pay company assignacyons canne nat tell howe lordes payed incontynent newe taylles ceassed countreis kynge kynges taxe shulde payed executed lordes dueties putte abacke ye haue herde howe whane kyng deted fro courtrey towne gaunte abode styll warre capitayns gaunte tyme peter de boyse peter de myrt fraunces atreman renewed towne newe soudyers came fro dyuerscountreis nothynge abasshed make warre fresshe quycke euer capitaynes gaunt vnderstode ther certayne breton burgonyos towne dardenbourge determyned go thyder loke fraunces atreman deted fro gaunt thre thousande men came dardebourge ther made great scrimysshe finally gauntoyse wan towne ye cost many lyues two hundred men slayne towne robbed pylled moost parte therof brent retourned gaunt boty conquest receyued great ioye anon went cytie dabes teremonde iuste warpe pylled robbed countrey p alyaunce purchased bytwene thenglysshmen flemynges bulles pope urbayne sent englande dystroy clemetyns ca iiii c xxviii erle flaunders lay lile vnderstode howe gauntoyse auaunsed selfe ryde ouer ron countre distroy might ryght sore displeased thought nat wytte puyssaunce sythe philyppe dartuell deed howbeit counsayle sayd sir ye knowe well ye haue alwayes herd say howe gauntoyse right subtyll people whiche haue well shewed wyll shewe also agayne haue ben englande retourned agayne specially fraunces atreman companion philyppe dartuell faytes long lyueth ye shall haue warre also sir knowe well hath made great alyauce kynge englande towne gaunt hath certayne pensyon englande secretely johan saplemon pure englysshe dwelleth vnder towne bruges hathe done space xxiiii yere verify true rase ueyrte loyes de uos johan ser colacke gaunt clerke procureth bysshoppe gauut styll behynde englande performe alyauce sir ye shall trewer tidyng tell myddes may past erle flaunders beleued well sayenges trewe dede began ymagin agaynst john saplemon thenglysshmen dwellynge bruges caused somoned certayne day assigned erle lysle erles seruauntes came somoned johan saplemon dyuers riche englysshme ware ther commaundynge fyftene day erle castell lysle whan englysshmen herde therof sore abasshed toke counsayle toguyder hauyng great marueyle erle shulde sende thynges consydred douted gretlye knewe well erle fierse fell hast sayd amonge themselfe kepeth natte body kepeth nothyng dout lest erle enfourmed sore agaynst v fraunces atreman hath pensyon kyng englande whan englande hym two burgess towne bruges parauenture haue made enformacyon agaynst v therle nowe parte purpose rested englysshemen durst nat abyde erles iudgement go lyle day lymyted departed fro bruges wente scluse dyde moche founde shyppe redy aparelled bought money departed sayled tyll arryued london whan therle flaunders enfourmed mater sawe englysshmen apered nat theyr day sore displeased sende incontynet bruges caused ceased euer coude founde parteyninge englysshmen herytages gyuen solde johan saplemon clene banysshed flaunders hundred yere one day copanyons taken put prisone dyed recouered agayne euer lost comune prouerbe whiche true howe enuy neuer byeth say bycause englysshmen right en uyouse ye welthe alwayes hath ben kyng englande vncles noble englande right sore displeased welthe honour fallen frenche kynge noble fraunce bataile rosebeque knightes englandespake sayd eche ah saynt mary howe frenchman nowe mouted pride ouerthro wyng sort rude villayns wolde god philyp dartuell men ii speares sixe archer ther nat scaped one frenchman outher slayne taken god wyll glorie shall nat long endure nowe haue fayre aduautage entre flauders countre nowe coquered french kyng trust conquere agayne kynge englande sheweth well tyme erle flau ders greatly subget frenche kyng wyll please hym poynt whan marchantes dwellyng bruges haue dwelt ther beyonde xxx yere nowe banysshed chased flauders tyme hath sene durst nat haue done nowe dare none otherwyse feare frenchemen trust shall nat abyde longe poynt langage among thenglysshmen realme englade therfore supposed ye done enuy season wrote hym selfe pope urbane sixt came see fro rome gene well receyued reuerently genoways kept resydens ye knowe well howe england obeysat hym aswell churche ye people bycause ye french king clementyne fraunce urbane whome englysshemen dyuers countreis beleued beyng gennes aduysed howe might anoy french kyng thought sende englande socoure shall shewe maner sent bulles archebysshoppes bysshoppes englande makyng mencyon assoyled payne synne suche wolde ayde distroy clementyns knewe well howe clement aduersarye done lykewise realme fraunce dothe dayly called vrbanyst faythe beleue dogges urbane sawe well clementynes wolde condepne distroy hym might sawe well coude nat greue frenchman englysshmen first sawe well must fynde meanes gather toguyder great ryches knewe well noble englande absolucyons wolde nat ryde forthe warre without money menne warre lyue nat pardon set nat moche therby artycle dethe page duplicate page duplicate thane determyned besyde bulles sende englande prelate shulde ordayne full dysme church noble men men warre therof payed wage without greuynge parte kynges treasur comontie realme whiche thynge pope thought baron knightes england gladly wolde herken vnto caused writen engrossed bulles well kynge vncles prelate englande playne absolucyon payne synne besyde graunted ye kyng vncles playne dysme taken leuyed throughe englande sir henry spensar bysshoppe norwyche shulde chiefe capitayne ye men warr bycause goodes came fro churche therfore pope wolde yt one churche shulde chefe gouernoure entent church comons realme shulde better beleue mater besyde yt bycause knewe realme spaygne contrarie opinyon som alyed ye freche kyng aduysed parte golde syluer shulde gadered realme englande duke lancastre reputed hym selfe kyng castell right wyfe lykewise shulde make another army castell also yf duke lancastre take hym sayd viage pope said wolde graunt kynge portyngale made newe warre kyng johan castell kyng fraunces deed playne dysme throughe portingale thus pope urbane ordeyned busynesse sent xxx bulles englande whiche receyued great ioye prelate iurysdictions began preche voiage maner crosey wherby people englande light lye beleued gaue therto great faythe beleued verilye coulde nat go paradyse yf dyed yere without gaue pure almes towarde warre lodon dyoses gathered tonne full golde syluer accordynge pope bulles moost gaue moost pardon obteyned whosoeuer dyed season gaue goodes dones clene assoyled payne synne accordynge tenour bulles happy dyed seasone haue noble absolucyon thus gathered money wynter lent season pardon dysmes sayd drewe somme xxv hundred thousande frankes p howe bysshop norwiche englysshe men yssued englande ron make warre agaynst helde pope clement cap cccc xxix whan kynge englande vncles cou sayle vnderstode money gadered right ioyouse sayd howe money ynoughe make warre agaynst two realmes saye agaynst fraunce spayne go spayne name pope prelate englande duke lancastre ordayned bysshoppe london called thomas brother therle deuonshyre chefe capitayn two speares four thousande archer haue halfe money thus gadered ordayned shuld nat soone departe englande ye bysshop norwiche bycause army shulde aryue calys entre fraunce wyst nat shulde fall therby whider frenche kyng wolde reyse puyssace fyght nat also ther another poynt contrary duke lancastre yet great ioye vyage generally comontie englande enclyned bysshop norwiche go duke lacastre long season ye duke nat grace ye people also thought realme fraunce nerer iourney spayne also sayd yt duke lacastre couytousnes thesyluer golde gadered churche pardon wherof shulde haue parte dyde enclyne rather therto profyte deuocyon said howe bisshop norwiche represented pope hym instytuted wherby greattest part englande gaue hym great faythe kyng also ordayned wage churche go bysshoppe henry spensar dyuers good knightes squyers englande gascoyne lorde beaumont sir hugh caurell sir thomas tryuet sir wyllm helmon sir johan ferres sir hugh spensar cosyn bysshoppe sonne brother sir wyllyam fermeton sir mathewe reedman capytayne berwike englande gascoyns lorde newcastell sir john brother raymon marsen guyllonette de pauxe garyot uyghier johan de cachytan dyuers counted fyue hundred speares fyftene hundred men great bre preestes bycause mater touched churche moued pope men warr prouyded themselfe mater passage delyuered douer sandwyche ester passed ouer lytell lytell lyst voiage maner croysey thus passed see bysshoppe capitayns fully redy bysshop sir hugh caurell sir thomas tryuet sir wyllm helmon kynge counsayle sware solempnely kynges presens bringe truely ende voyage fight man countrey belde pope urbayne fight make warre agaynst opinyon clemet thus sware kyng aduyse counsayle sayd sir bysshoppe ye whan ye come calais wyll ye soiourne fronter space moneth terme shall refresshe newe men warr armes archer shall sende good marshall valyant man sir wyllyam beauchampe haue sende hym marche scotland wher kepeth fronter agaynst scottes trewse bytwene scottes v falleth nowe saint johans tyde retourne ye shall haue hym youre copany without fayle therfore wolde ye shulde tarye hym shall ryght necessarie bothe wysedome good counsayle bysshoppe company promysed kynge thus departed fro kynge toke see douer arryued calayes xxiii day aprill yere lorde god thousand thre hundred fourscore thre season capitayne calais sir johan deluarnes receyued bysshoppe company great ioye landed lytell lytell horse baggage lodged calays bastylles made dayly taryed tyll fourthe day may abidyng marshall sir wylliam beauchampe came nat tyme whan bysshoppe norwiche yonge couragious desyrous armes neuer bare armure lumbardy brother thus calays sawe capitayne many men armes sayde one day company sir soiourne hereso long tary sir wyllyam beauchape cometh nat kyng vncles trowe thynke lytell v let v dedes armes sythe ordayned lette v enploy money churche truely whyle lyue let v conquere somewhat enemyes well sayd sir quod herde speke let v warne oure company wyll ryde forthe within thre dayes let v take aduyse whiche way shall drawe nat issue gate entre landes oure enemyes frenche aboute euery parte good go towardes flaunders boloyne flaunders lande conquest conquered puyssaunce frenche kyng nat bestowe tyme honourably thynges consydred conquere agayne also erle flaunders hath done late great dispyte men countre without tytell reason hath banysshed chased bruges flauders passeth nat two yere sythe wolde haue ben lothe haue done nowe fayne obey pleasure freche kyng wherfore quod bysshop may beleued first iourney shall make shalbe flau ders sir quod sir thomas tryuet sir wylliam helmone ye shall well beleued lette v ryde partie within thre dayes lande enemy counsayle agreed gaue war nynge eche p howe englysshe men toke towne mynster grauelynge howe erle flaunders sent speke cap cccc xxx agremet nat sir hugh caurell gone se cosin capitayne guynes called sir johan droithton day retourned agayne nexte day bysshoppe sent hym castell knightes sayd bysshoppe howe wolde haue aduyse sir hughe caurell dyde thynge bycause moost sene vsed warre bysshop sayd hym ye haue herde commaunded hym say aduyse sir hughe answered hym sayde sir ye knowe well condycion departed englande enterprise toucheth thynge warre bytwene kynges onely agaynst clemetyns soudyers pope urbane hath clene assoyled v synne payne oure power distroy clementyns go flaunders thoughe countrey hath bene conquered frenche kyng duke burgoyne yet shulde amysse vnderstande erle flaunders flemynges good urbanystes also sir haue nat men ynowe entre flaunders redy vsed warre great nombre people haue done nothyng el lyned warre thre foure yere also stronge countrey entre also fle mynges haue done v trespasse sir yf shall ryde lette v ryde fraunce enemyes two maners kyng lordes warr nowe opyn also frenchman good clementyns cotrarie beleue agaynst pope also sir shulde abyde marshall sir wyllm beauchape shulde hastely come v good bre men last worde kynge sayd wolde sende hym v sir counsayle shall nedes ryde let v drawe towardes ayre moustrell ther none thynke yet wyll coe agaynst v alwayes men wyll come v oute flauders hath lost haue wyll gladde go v hope wynne agayne beare yuell wyll hertes frenchman hath slayne warres father bretherne kynsmen fredes sir hughe coude scant speke wordes bysshop toke mater hote hasty sayde sir hughe ye haue well lerned ryde fraunce ye nat ryde none place nat better ryde profyte thanne entre fronter flauders see cost towne bourbourge dunesshe mesport bergues cassell ipre proprigne sayd countreis enformed burgess gaunt neuer warre greued let v go thyder refresshe v abyde marshall wyll come howe wese nat yet lytell aparence comynge whan sir hughe caurell sawe bysshop dyde take hym vp shortely consydred well howe chyefe capitayne great man great lygnage helde peace sawe well also howe opynyon shulde nat susteyned nother ser thomas tryuet sir wylliam helmon departed sayd sir ye ryde forthe sir hughe caurell shall ryde ye shal nat go way dare well go beleue well quod bysshoppe ye haue good wyll ryde forthe therfore make redy wyll ryde morowe purpose agreed rydinge forthe publysshed throughe towne mornynge trumpettes sowned euery man departed feldes tooke way grauelyng nombre aboute thre thousand men armed came porte grauelynge thesee lowe passed forthe assayled mynster towne fortifyed towne closed pale whiche coude nat long endure also men towne see men ther ben gentylmen wolde haue helde le gar dyde also coutre nat ware therof feared nothyng theglysshmen thus theglysshmen coquered towne grauelyng entred drue mynster wherinto people towne drawen putte therin goodes trust stregth place wyues chyldren made rounde great dyke englysshmen coude nat haue ease ther two dayes wanne yet finally wan slewe kept defence resydue dyde lyste thus lordes maysters grauelynge lodged toguyder towne founde ther plentie prouisyon countrey beganne afrayed dyde put good fortress sende wyues chyldren bergues bourbourcke saynt omers erle flaunders lay lysle whane vnderstode tidynges howe englysshe men made hym warre taken grauelynge beganne dout franke bruges called counsayle hym sayde haue great marueyle englysshe men ronne lande demaunded neuer nothynge thus without defyaunce entre lande counsayle answered hym sayde sir thyng well marueyle supposed repute therle flauders frenche bycause frenche kyng hath rydden coutre yelded hym quod therle best done sir quod good ye sende sir johan uillayns sir john moulyn presente also haue pensyon kynge englande englande speke kyng fro shewe sagely busynesse demaude dothe make warr thynke whan hereth youre messangers speke wyll nat content theym thus warreth agaynst countre call backe great blame yea quod erle meane tyme whyle go englande nowe grauelynge wyll go farther great domage franke sir quod let first go grauelynge desyre saue conducte go calayes englande knowe demaunde thynke two knyghtes well aduysed wyll handell wysely shall sette countrey rest peace content thus erle two knightes enfourmed erle counsayle shulde say bysshop norwych shewe charge haue go englande shewe mater kyng vncles meane season knyghtes prepared go grauelynge speke bysshop norwyche countre arose burbourcke bergues cassell propringe furnes newport townes came dokyrke abode towne sayeng howe wolde shortely issue defende fronters fight englysshmen men flaunders capitayne called sir johan sporequyn gouernoure landes lady bare lande lyeth marchesse ipre sir johan sporequyn knewe nothynge erle flaunders wolde sende englande hase flaunders newly come hym xxx speares shewed hym howe erle lysle maryage bytwene suster lorde delbaryn two knightes dyde moche coulde styrre countrey ryse nobre twelfe thousande pykes pauesses cootes steele hoctons shapeause bassenettes maner lande lady barres bytwene grauelynge donkyrke enfourmed thre leages way stode towne mardyke great vyllage see syde vnclosed thyder came englysshmen scrimysshed thus came grauelynge sir johan uyllayne sir johan de moulyne erle flaunders saueconduct attayned fro bysshoppe came fro burbourcke came bysshoppe norwiche made theym semblaunt ryght good chere hym dyner day lordes host knewe well erles knightes shulde come hym tyme mynde wolde shulde fynde toguyder two knightes beganne speke sayd sir sende hyder fro erle flaunders lorde lorde quod bysshoppe answered agayne sayde fro erle none lorde flauders good lorde quod bysshoppe take lorde flaunders frenche kynge el duke burgoyne enemy puyssance late haue conquered countre sir quod knightes sauyng displeasure lande tourney clerelye rendred agayne put hand gouernyng erle flaunders hath sent v desyring two haue pensyon kynge englande may haue sauecoduct go englade speke kynge knowe cause without defyaunce maketh warre agaynst erle countre flauders sir bysshop shall take aduyce answere morowe thus went logynge left englysshmen counsayle day toke counsayle togyder concluded ye shall p aunswere bysshoppe norwyche made knight flaunders assemble cassell countrey made agaynst thenglysshmen cap cccc xxxi thynges consydred regarded sayde wolde graunt safecoduct go englande farre coude retourne agayne coutre wolde sore styrred greatly fortifyed also therle shulde tyme sende worde therof frenche kyng duke burgoyne wherby might come suche nobre people shulde nat able resyst fight determynacyon rested demaunded amonge answere shulde make knightes flaunders next day sir hugh caurell comauded speke gyue aduyce sayde thus bysshoppe sir ye chefe capitayne sir ye may saye howe ye lande duchesse bare clementyne howe urbane ye make warre body el offre lande church abbey wyll become good urbanystes ryde bring throughe countre ye wyll cause yor company passe countre pesably paye shall take touchyng gyue saueconduct go englande ye wyll nat graut therto wise ye may say youre warre toucheth thyng warre englande fraunce soudyers pope urbane sir thynke answere shulde suffyce euery man agreed well specially bysshoppe mynde nothynge sayd fight warre countrey thus mater abode night mornyng masse two sayd knightes erles desyringe haue answere cae bysshoppes lodgynge abode tyll came go masse stept forthe hym made good chere semblant deuysed lytell matter delay tyme tyll knight come hym whan assembled toguyder bysshop sayd sir ye tary aunswere ye shall haue request ye make erle flaunders say vnto ye may retourne agayne whan ye lyst erle mayster el go calais ieody englande sauecoduct ye get none nat kyng englade haue nat farr authorite company soudyers pope urbane wage hym take money serue truely nowe lande duchesse bare clementyne yf people opynion wyll make warre wyll go v take parte shall haue part pardon absolucyons urbayne oure pope voiage hath assoyled v clene frome payne frome synne wyll ayde distroy clemetyns whan knightes herde wordes sir johan uillayns sayd sir touchynge pope thynke ye haue nat herde cotrary lorde therle flaunders hath ben alwayes good urbanyst wherfore sir ye yuell make warr hym coutre thynke kyng englande yo lorde hath nat charged noble wolde haue made hym warre first wolde haue defyed wordes bysshoppe began angry said well sir go erle saye vnto hym getteth nothyng el v ye wyll sende englande knowe kynges pleasure ye lyst way calys shall nat sse whan knyghtes sawe coulde nat attaygne purpose none otherwise departed returned lodgynge dyned dyuer departed went night saynt omers day knyghtes deted came tidynges bysshoppe donkyrke theraboute xii thousande men harnesse bastarde flaunders company chefe capitayne dyuers knightes squiers somoche shewed thursdaye scrimysshed companye slayne hundred lo quod bysshoppe ye may se wheder erle medyll mater nat dothe entreateth peace swerde hande let v ryde forthe moro go donkyrke se people gadered euery man agreed therto day cae bysshoppe two knightes one fro calys othe fro guysnes xxx speares threscore archer knyghtes called sir nicholas clyncon sir john dracton capitayne guysnes nexte mornynge made redy ryde forthe drewe felde mo vi hundred speares sixtene hundred archer rode towarde mardyke kyrke bysshop made borne armes churche baner saynt peter felde goules two keyes syluer lyke soudyers pope urbane penon bare owne armes syluer azure quarterly fret golde azur bende goules syluer bycause yongest spe sars bare border goules difference also sir hugh spesar nephue penon baner penon lorde beaumont sir hughe caurell sir thoms tryuet sir wylliam helmon penon without baner sir wylliam dractone sir johan brother sir mathue reedman sir john ferres sir wyllyam fermeton sir johan new castell gascone thus men armes rode towardes mardyke refresshed dranke passed forthe toke waye donkyrke flemmynges assembled aduertysed englysshmen wolde come way redy aparelled fight determyned among selfe drawe felde redy good aray fight nede requyred thought abyde towne closed therin shulde nothyng profytable ordayned done euery man armed hym selfe towne issued felde sette selfe good array lytell hyll without towne nobre xii mo therwith came englysshmen aprochyng donkyrke behelde mountayne heir right hande warde burbourcke towarde see syde sawe flemyng great batayle well ordred taryed semed flemynges wolde gyue batayle lordes drewe toguyder cousayle dyuers opinyons specially bysshop norwyche wolde shulde incotynent go fight lorde beaumont sir hugh caurell sayde contrarie layeng dyuers reason sayeng sir ye knowe well flemyng yonder haue done v forfayte saye trouthe haue sente erle flaunders defyaunce yet countre courtesse warr make nothyng catche may without resonable warre also countre vrbanystes well holdeth opinyon beholde nowe therfore se iuste cause haue ron thus bysshoppe sayde howe knowe urbanystes nat name god sir hughe caurell thynke good sende theym heraude knowe thyng demaude thus raynged batayle agaynst v lette demaunded pope holde aunswere say howe good vrbanystes requyre vertue pope bull haue wyll go v saint omers ayre arras thyder wyll bri ge wha thus requyred therby shall knowe entensyon thervpon may take aduyse cousayle purpose holden heraude called mout forde parteyning duke bretayne comaunded lordes go fleminges shewe ye haue herde heraulde obeyed comaudement reason went speke p howe flemynges coutre lande cassell disconfyted englysshmen donkyrke taken dyuers castelles countrey cap cccc xxxii thus heraude deted fro lordes cote armes went warde flemyng thought non yuell toguyder gret batayle heraude wolde haue goone knyghtes might nat assoone aproched nere flemynges toke slewe hym without demaundynge fro whens cae wheder wolde thus slewe hym lyke people small knowledge gentylmen coude nat saue hym whan englysshmen sawe dealyng sore displeased burgess gaut suche right gladde moue mater might newe brewlynge flaunders englysshe men sayde yonder rybaudes haue slayne heraude shall dere solde el wyll dye place commauded archer steppe towarde flemynges burgesse gaunt made knight incontynent batayle began sore sharpe saye trouthe flemynges marueylously defeded selfe archer shotte thicke ouerthrue many greued sore men armes entred amonge sharpe speares first front ouerthrue many finally englysshmen wan place flemynges discofited fledde way thynkinge entre donkyrke englysshmen chased sore entred towne stretes sandes many flemmyng slayne howe ther many englysshmen flayne nombre foure hundred mo foude towne tenne atones twentie xxx ye fourtie dyde chase flem minge stretes fought withall howe finally flemynges nere slayne taken thus fell recountre donkyrke ther slayne flem mynges nyne thousande day batayle retourned lysle erle flaunders sir johan uyllayns sir johan de molayne shewed hym report sene herde thenglysshmen wher erle right pensyue thynke howe shulde deale mater also pensyue cause whan herde tidynges men slayne discofyted donkyrke bare paciently dyde reconfort hym selfe sayd well haue lost one tyme shall wyn agayne another tyme please god incotynent wrote therof duke burgoyne entent resystence might made ymagined well englysshmen hauynge one entre flau ders wolde hurt countrey departed agayne whane duke burgoyne vnderstode therof sende knightes squiers garysons fronters flaunders saynt omers ayre saynt uenaunt baylleule bergues cassell bayliwykes kepe thentre arthoyse p nowe let v speke thenglysshmen howe ceyuered disconfyture donkyrke towne taken englysshe men entred great pride semed flaunders ben say trouthe hadde gone bruges sayd knewe dealyng towne towne bene gyuen vp englysshmen wrought otherwyse tooke ad yse go bourburcke gette towne go ayre cassell conquere cou trey leaue nothyng behynde shulde contrarie theym go ipre thought verily towne ipre wolde soone yelde vp sawe countre yelden thus englysshemen departed fro donkyrke went burbourcke whan towne sawe aprochenere towne yelded vp towne sauyng lyues goodes receyued englysshmen entred great ioye sayeng howe wolde make ther good garyson kepe warre agaynst saynt omers fronters nere adioyning wanne castell driceham thre dayes wan conquered byforce therin slayne two hu dred men garyson englysshemen repayred agayne castell sayde howe wolde kepe best power sette therin newe men thanne wente forth came cassell tooke towne therin great pyllage departed sayde wolde go se towne ayre howe many knewe right well towne nat easy wonne without great losse men howe bysshoppe norwiche sayde wolde go nere loke theron p howe englisshmen conquered countre flaunders fro kyrke scluse howe seged towne ipre cap cccc xxxiii season capytayne ayre sir robert bethune vycount mealr hym ther sir johan roy lorde clary sir johan bethune brother lorde montigny sir perducas pount saynt sir johan chauny sir floreyns son dyuers sixscore speares good men armes knightes squyers whan bysshoppe norwiche sir hugh caurell sir henry beaumont sir thomas tryuet sir wyllyam helmon sir mathewe reedman englysshemen whan dyde aproche nere ayre place called newe dike putte selfe order batayle passed forthe baners penons wauyng withthe wynde knewe nat vycount meaulxe mynded vycont company beyng thanne garysone rainged good order causey barryers towne might se clerely englysshemen passe takynge way saynt uenaunt nat men ynowe stoppe theym way thus stode styll kepynge watche warde redy defence englysshmen passed wete night two myles fro sait uenaunt wherof knyght picardy capitayne called sir wyllyam de melle fortifyed mynster hym company drawe nede requyred dyde towne closed small palys dyke wherfore coulde nat longe endure agaynst englysshmen frenche men withdrewe selfe castell churche whiche right stronge castell nat assayled marueylous stronge coude manne aproche nere therto dyke rounde large depe mynster incontynent assayled englisshmen whan entred towne cause knowledge men armes withdrawen sir wyllyam melle good knyght valyant nobly defe ded churche saynt uenant englysshe archer rounde shotte vp arowes thycke rudely within durst scant apere defece howe aboue stone artyllarye great plentie dyde caste downe stone thynges hurt many beneth howe assaut sore contynued englysshmen mynster byforce sir wyllyam de melle within valyantly fought defence dyde company parceyued confort rescue wolde legar haue cotynued conforte coulde parceyue therfore easier wyn thus sir wyllyam melle prisoner englysshmen sette fynaunce went fraunce bonde oblygacion gentylmen englisshe frenche wont eche dyd nat almayns whan almayne hath taken prisonere putteth hym yrons harde prisone without pytie make hym pay greatter fynaunce raunsome thus whan bysshoppe norwyche thenglysshmen departed fro saynt uenant wente lodged wode mepce whiche nat farr then baylueufe flaunders entred ye bayliwyke proprigne messynes toke close townes therin foude great pyllage conueyed pillage votie bergues burborke whan countre pleasure lordes see syde grauelyng sluse donkyrke newport furnes blacque berque went layed siege ipre ther rested sende gaunte vnderstode sende frauces atreman ben batayle coquestes gyde fro towne towne p howe englysshmen sende gaunt came siege ipre lorde saynt leger company disconfyted thenglysshmen howe bysshop liege came siege ipre ca iiii c xxxiiii whane peter de boyse peter de mirt capitayns gaunt vnderstode howe englysshmen sende come sege ipre gretlye therof reioysed ordayned incotynent go thyder departed fro gaunt saturday mornynge next vias saynt peter poule nombre twentie thousande great caryage ordynaunce wente countre besyde courtrey ipre comynge englysshmen greatly ioyfull made good chere sayd sir surely shall nowe shortely conquere ipre wyll wynne bruges dan sluse thus made dout yt ende septembre shulde coquere flauders thus glorifyed tune season capitayne ipre right sage valyant knight called peter de la syeple ordered busynesse towne ther men armes hym sette duke burgoyne therle flaunders sir johan bougrayne chatelayne ipre sir baudwyn del beden sonne lorde dyssegien lorde stades sir johan blancharde sir johan meselede sir hamell sir nycholas belle lorde harleqbecke lorde rollechen sir john ahoutre john la sieple squier nephue capitayne frauces bell sir george bell dyuers expert menne armes dayly great payne wo defend towne also great feare leest comons towne shulde make treatie gaunt wherby shulde daunger betrayed ipre season towne courtrey valyant knyght heynalte called sir johan jumont set request duke burgoyne therle flaunders whan toke neuer knyght flaunders durst enterprise kepe perylous kepe whan frenche kynge went oute countrey vnrepayred fewe folkes abode therin brent beaten downe moche payne lodge therin horse sir john jumont toke hym kepe incontynent dyde repayre dyde thanked god attaygned nothyng therby honour prayse duke burgoyne busynesse flau ders touched right nere toke great study brige well thing passe sende thre score speares breton courtrey thentent refresshe towne first speares came duke lisle friday departed then toke way comynes lorde saynt leger yuonet ca temat capitayns sayd speares towne comynes morning breakynge day coe two hundred englysshe speares fetche forage abrode coutre bringe hoost ipre said breton ware fell handes dauger ther harde sore encountre foote bridge comynes valiantly bretos dyde beare selfe bene rescued many mo lykelyhode scaped withoute domage howe fayne flye fewe endure long moost parte slayne taken felde retournynge towardes lysle lorde saynt leger sore wouded lefte deed place happy yt scaped chase endured within halfe myle lyle whiche towne lorde saynt leger caryed wounded fyue dayes dyed dyde fyue squyers thus fortuned aduenture thus styll siege lay ipre englisshmen gautoys made many assaut towne trymvled feare erle flaunders beyng lysle feared greatlye takyng ipre knewe well englisshmen right subtell cofort might dayly come fro calys reason ye garysons way indede might haue great socoure englande lyst begynnyng set nothyng erle power frauce ther dyuers great lordes englande march douer sandwiche redy apparelled passe see calys haue ayded company ben requyred ther redy speares two thousande archer sir wyllyam beauchampe sir wyllm wyndsore marshal englande soueraygne capitayns set kyng cousell cause duke lacastre lost vyage season portyngale realme englade rather enclyned bysshop norwiches army tha duke lacastres therle flaunders knewe ryght well besynesse insydentes fell englade euery thyng done siege ipre thynkyng fynde remedy power thought well yt duke burgoyne wolde moue frenche kyng ye lordes realme reyse assemble driue englysshemen flaunders whiche wonne yere bycause knewe assemblynge lordes fraunce wolde belonge specially shulde serue kyng farre country many thinges might fall came toguyder therfore aduysed sende bysshoppe liege sir arnolde desorge good urbanyst entent shulde come ipre treate englysshmen depart fro then drawe parte bycause hadde great marueyle shulde make hym warre seynge good urbanyst countre flaunders worlde knewe moche dyde erle flaunders bysshoppe liege came heynaulte passed ualencennes came doway lysle spake erle ther determyned shulde say thenglyssheme thus bysshop liege cae siege ipre speke bysshoppe norwiche thenglysshmen gaunte receyued hym right well gladde hym speke p great comaundement assemble frenche kynge made entent reyse siege ipre dysconfyted englysshemen cap cccc xxxv enfourmed erle flaunders wordes ye bysshop liege offred bisshoppe norwiche englysshmen wolde leaue siege ipre go parte make warre agaynst clementyns howe wolde fynde fyue hundred speares serue thre monethes cost charge bysshop norwiche company answered howe wolde take aduyse went counsayle many opinyons gaut sayd howe trust promyse erle surely sayd howe wolde begyle might thynges consydred englysshmen answered bysshop liege howe yt myght departe whan pleased hym requestes wolde wyse agre therto sayeng howe wolde neuer departe fro ye siege tyll towne ipre comau dement whan bysshop liege sawe coulde mater toke leaue retourned lysle shewed erle answere whan erle sawe wolde none wyse pesyue parceyued clerely yt puyssaunce fraunce reysed siege lykely lese good towne ipre wrote matter answeres sonne lawe duke burgoyne lay compayne bysshoppe liege departed fro erle went doway ualencennes countre duke burgoyne sawe well er flaunders dyde ryght yuell lykely without kynge putte hande purueyed remedy dyde moche great counsayle somoned holden compayne great prince lordes realme fraunce thyder came euery man sende thyder came personally duke bretayne ther agreed kynges counsayle duke berrey duke burbone duke burgoyne howe kynge shulde go agayne flauders puissantly whan went rosebeque entent reyse siege fight thenglysshmen wolde abyde hym thyng agreed accorded frenche kynge sende comaundement throughe realme euery man shuld redy best apparell warre fyftene daye august arras kynge sende also farre countreis erle armynake sauoy duke frederyke bauyers duke hyghe almaygne sonne one duke bretherne greatly desyred one bere armes fraunce se estate frauce loued honour also enfourmed honoures worlde fraunce bycause duke farre therfore sende first prepared hym selfe redy sayde howe wolde passe throughe heynalt se vncle cosyn erle bloys meane season lordes aparelled themselfe sege endured styll pre dyuers saute scrimysshes made dyuers hurt bothe y capitayne ipre sir peter de la sieple toke good hede domage siege thus endurynge erle flaunders beynge lysle enformed howe mynster ye towne emenyn sore decay howe thenglysshmen came thyder shulde lightly wynne nat kept wherfore erle cou sayled sende repayre erle called sir johan de moulyne sayd sir johan take men towne cro bowes go emenyn repayre agayne mynster kepe defende fro englysshmen shulde haue wold yuell trouble countrey knight answered content prepared himselfe next day departed hym yonge knyght bastarde sonne erles called sir johan sansterre nombre threscore speares threscore archer thus departed fro towne lysle rode towarde towne emenyn came thyder founde body suche pleasur caused mynster newly repayred sette men warke theron daye rode forthe fro siege ipre two hu dred speares englysshe gascoyns knewe forangers mette ther men armes cro bowes towne emenyn repayringe fortifyeng churche englysshmen rode thyder soone came mynster lyghted fote beganne crye cryes whane sir johan moulyn bastarde flaunders sawe maner behoued fight putte theym selfe order caused crosbowes shote wherwith dyuers englysshme hurt howe incotynent englysshmen entred amonge fewe men sore scrimysshe many slayne hurt howe finally englysshmen many flemynges coulde nat endure theym disconfyted two knyghtes taken yet right valyantly defended selfe fewe retourned lysle nigh taken slayne thus fortuned aduenture emenyn wherwith erle flaunders right sore displeased coude nat amende englysshmen brought prisoner siege ipre within whyle put raunsome p howe thenglysshmen flemynges gaunt made dyuers assautes ipre howe freche kyng departed fro compayne wente towarde ipre reise siege cap cccc xxxvi thus often tymes falleth aduetures dedes armes somtyme wyn somtyme lese aduentures therof ryght marueylous knowe rightwell folowe styll cotynued siege ipre thentecyon bysshop norwiche englysshmen peter de boyse gautoyse wyn ipre assaut otherwyse accordyng ente te often tymes assauted scrimysshed towne amonge assautes one speciall great assaute whiche endured day tyll nere night done many proper dede armes well without within made day foure knightes within towne sir johan de la syeple cosyn capitayne sir fraunces bell sir george bell sir johan bell fourth good knyghtes dyde acquyte selfe right well day slayne gon proper squyer englade called lewes lynne sore assaute many hurt bothe tie suche aduentured selfe sore archer englande stoode one syde dyke shotte vp arowes thicke almoost none within towne durst loke ouer walles scant stande defece ipre gadered bp day two tonne full artyllary specially arowes fell thicke stretes none durst go without well armed pauessed assaut endured tyll night theglysshmen flemynges hadde assauted day two batayls retourned lodgynges right wery sore traueyled lykewyse towne ipre whan englysshmen flemynges lay siege ipre sawe howe coulde nat wynne towne howe lost moche artyllary aduysed make great nombre fagottes cast dyke strawe erthe fyll vp dyke entent might come walles fight hande hande towne vndermyne walles thinkynge therby co quere ther sette men warke fell downe wode make fagottes bring dyke nat soone done warke accomplysshed frenche kynge great desyre reyse siege fight englysshmen auaunsed forthe busynesse departed fro copaygne came arras passed forth constable fraunce great nombre lordes ordayned vowarde loged arthoise duke bretayne came two thousande speres great desyre confort erle flaunders cosyn greatly bounde founde hym euer redy aparelled tyme past busynesse thus lordes aproched bothe farre nere came erle sauoy therle genesue seuyn hundred speares pure sauosyns duke frederyke bauyere came forwarde heynalte qeusnoy refresshed vncle duke aubert aunt duches margarete cosyns duke lorayne duke bare fro then came arthoise sir wyllyam namur nat bene none foresayd warres erle excused hym came serue kyng duke burgoyne wt two hudred speares good men warr passed heynalte came lodged tornesys lordes came fro euery parte right strongly good wyll serue kyng marueyle consyder therle guy bloyse assembled men ladrechis men coude nat tell able coude endure payne ryde kyng army brought horselytter beaumont heynalte better ease ayre better hym ladreches howe sore sicke feble yet purueyed men serue kyng copany lorde motigny lorde useryn sir uyllaynes saynt martyne sir ualleraunce oustyen capitayne remorentyne knightes squiers auaunsed forwarde serue kynge tidynges came siege jpre bysshoppe norwyche sir hugh caurell englysshmen howe frenche kynge comynge mo twentie thousande men armes knightes squiers mo thre score thousande people wordes multyplyed hoost tyll last fou de trewe beginnyng wolde scant beleue said playnly howe king wolde come fight lay siege marueyle whan knewe howe duke bretayne coming agaynst toke counsayle togyder determyne shulde thynges consydered sawe well howe puyssauce abyde kyng sayd best peter de boyse peter de myrt gauntoyse shulde returne towne gaunt englysshmen bergues burborke abyde garysons without puyssaunce come englande kyng richarde selfe passe see el vncles thervpon take better aduyse cousayle vpholden euery man dyslodged gaunt drewe towne englisshemen went towarde bergues burbourke entred suche garysons conquered day englysshmen departed siege came sir thomas percy sonne erle northumberlande came spruce whan lytell fro then shewed hym certayne freche kyng kyng englande shulde fight togyder marchesse flaunders arthoyse puyssaunce agaynst puyssauce wherof knight great ioye hadde great desyre iourney thane xl dayes iourney then made suche hast rode fourtene dayes left people baggage behynde hym rode fast without chaungyng horse hym mo page came ye towne gaunt sayd space whiche tourned hym great valyantnesse p howe duke frederyke bauyer aryued freche kyng hoost howe therle guy bloyse men cae arras howe kynges vowarde toke cassell cap cccc xxxvii tidynges cae frenche kyng lay arras howe englysshmen departed fro siege ye gauntoyse lykewise euery man deted theyr holdes tha kyng counsailed make hast folowe thentent shulde nat scape departed fro arras went mount saynt eloy fayre abbey taryed foure dayes abyding tyll duke berry come styll people gadered thider fro party reported constable marshal sir guy harde erle dolphyn mayster cro bowes howe kyng ther mo hundred thousande men kyng departed fro mout saynt eloy toke way saynt omers cae ayre wherof vycount meaulx capitayne kyng taryed two dayes alwayes styll aproched men warre constable vowarde loged towne mount cassell kynge came saynt omers abode taryed people came tie whane duke frederyke bauyers came hoost great barownes frau ce went mette hym hym honour bycause came fro farre countrey serue kynge kyng made hym great chere gaue hym great thankes comynge lodged hym voiage nere person myght kynges hoost nobre thre thousand horse wherfore greatly marueyled howe prouisyon myght suffyce suche hoost howe somtyme lacked somtyme great habundaunce erle guy bloyse beynge beaumont heynault though nat good helthe longe malady ymagyned self shulde nat honorable lye styll many great lordes beynge felde also sent one chiefe apoynted reregarde therfore thought better hym go forthe putte hym selfe pleasure god abyde behynde men shulde suppose cowardnes getyll knight went forthe coude wyse endure ryde therfore caryed horselytter toke leaue lady wyfe loys sonne dyuers cousell agaynst voyage bycause season hote sicke man euery man herde spekyng therof reputed hym great valyantnesse hym departed heynault lorde sanzest lorde hauselles sir gerard warryers sir thomas dystre lorde doustrenent sir johan guysenell made knight vyage dyuers thus erle passed chambrey cae arras rode traueyled better helth owne men kyng wha herde howe lorde comynge cae mette hym nombre foure hundred speares prouisyon euer folowed hym heynaulte great plentie p nowe lette v speke kynge frenche kyng spedde iourney came saynt omers rested refresshed hym vowarde costable marshal went towarde mount cassell englyssmen kepte assayled towne wanne assaute within slayne suche scaped wente bergues sir hughe caurell hym thre thousande englysshmen bysshoppe norwiche gone grauelynge soner calays nede countrey cassell brent pylled theglysshmen frenche kyng deted fro saynt omers lay abbey called raynombergues ther rested friday saturday mornyng vowarde constable marshal lorde coucy great nombre good men armes went castell trughen ther thre hudred men armes kepte season frenchman made great sharpe assaut englysshmen within defended selfe marueylously pure dedes armes castell conquered within slayne costable wolde take none mercy base court ther foude fayrest white horse might sene whiche presented constable sende incotynent kyng horse pleased kyng suche wyse rode theron sonday day came therle bloys hoost reregarde yere batayle rosebeque therle ewe therle harcourt ye lorde chatellon lorde fere copany styll aproched men warr sydes season clere fayre el wolde haue ben moche ther suche nombre men horse p howe theglisshmen sege ipre withdrawen towne bergues howe departed then went burborke whan sawe kyng puissace cap cccc xxxviii towne bergues whiche closed wt nothing pale small dike theglisshmen gone thider saue ye bysshop norwich graueling sore abasshed repeted hym made vyage sawe well likely forsake co questes great blame also beforesayd vaunted howe kynge came reyse siege ipre wolde abyde fight hym puissace word spred abrode thrughout real frace saw well fayne sodenly dete fro sege puissance nat able resyst agaynst frenche kyng puyssace thought shulde turne great blame also theglysshmen beynge calys sayd howe right yuell enployed pope money say trouthe duke lacastre beyng englande bysshopes iourney lost vyage portyngale nothyng sorie mater went dyde whan sir wyllm wynsore sent lay ye sege offred newe ayde cofort bysshop sir thoms tryuet sir wyllm helmon answered said howe men ynowe wold haue mo fight freche kyng might frauce sir hugh caurell sene suche mater thother spake alwayes cotrarie sayd ye bysshop thother whan thoffre made englande ayde wyll ye sir ye wyll trust moche owne puyssaunce shulde refuce confort copany whan offred v realme englande wolde paraduenture day maye fall shall repent wordes coulde nat herde euer sayd men ynowe thus mater went length lost wan whan sir hughe caurell withdrawen bergues founde ther englysshe archer mo foure thousande sir hughe sayd let v kepe towne strog ynough people ynowe kepe thynke within fyue sixe dayes shall haue confort engla de englande knowe tyme case euery man sayde cotent ordred towne company sette euery man defence kepe walles gate caused woman chyldren drawe churche nat dparte then french kynge beyng raynombergues vnderstode howe englysshemen withdrawen towne bergues toke cousayle determyned go thyder constable marshall shulde go first lye wynge farthersyde towne kyng duke berrey duke burgoyne duke burbone companyes shulde folowe erle bloyes erle ewe reregarde shulde go another wynge towne close englysshmen rounde purpose holden kynge departed fro raynombergues people ordred felde great beautie beholde shynynge agaynst sonne ba penons clere bassnettes great nombre people eye man coude nat nombre speares semed great thicke wode thus rode four batayls towarde bergues hour thre heraude englande entred towne passed frenche army sufferaunce came sir hughe caurell sir hughe demaunded hym high euery herde hym heraude fro whens comyst thou sir quod heraude come fro frenche hoost wher haue sene moost fayrest syght men armes greattest nobre euer sawe trowe ther kynge assemble many guyder agayne goodly men armes quod sir hughe nombre doest thou call ser quod well xxvi thousande men armes goodlyest men best armed deuised ah quod sir hugh caurell sore displeased wordes art well made forge gretlye knowe well thou lyest falsely haue often sene asse blies fraunce neuer yet foude togider xxvi thousad yet scant sixe good men armes therwith watchman towne wned trumpet kyng vowarde comyng passe ye towne walles sir hughe sayd suche knightes squyers hym let v go se xxvi thousande armes comyng oure watchman went walles leaned behelde ye kynges vowarde passynge forby towne whiche warde xv c speares costable marshal maister ye crosbowes lorde coucy duke bretayne therle flauders therle poule xv c speares sir hugh caurell wenyng haue sene hole army frauce sayd beholde said true uat yonder ye may se xxvi men armes thre x let v go dyner yet haue nat sene bre shuld cause v leaue towne heraude wolde abasshe v well wolde beleue heraude shamed yet sayd sir ye haue sene yet ye vowarde kyng vncles yet behynde puyssaunce behynde reregarde wher mo two thousande speares sir shall yese wt four houres ye wyll tary se sir hugh caurell made force word went lodgynge sayd haue sene togyder sat downe dyner sat watche began blowe sore coude sir hugh rose fro table went walles se ther sawe comyng kyng vncles duke fre deryke duke lorayne therle sauoy dolphyn auuergne erle marche copanyes gret batayle ther well xvi speares sir hugh caurell thought himselfe desceyued sayd heralde sayd truely wrong blame let v go hen lepe vpon horse let v saue body goodes nat good abyde neuer sawe moche state fraunce neuer sawe many men togyder se yonder vowarde myddell warde yet sure ther reregarde behynde deted fro walles went logyng trussed baggage mouted horse wtout makyng noyse opyned gate towarde burbourke deted ledde pyllage frechmen taken good hede might haue ben knewe nat long tyme first nere burborke sir hugh caurell right sore dyspleased tourned horse taryed tyll copany coe togyder sayd sir thoms tryuet preset sir faythe haue made season shamefull iourney issued englande neuer vnhappye armye ye haue wrought pleasur haue beleued bysshoppe norwiche thought haue flyen wynges nowe may se ye honourable ende must abyde viage wordes might nat beleued soeuer sayd yonder nowe may se burbur wyll go thyder ye may wyll go grauelynge calais se well nat men suffycient fyght armye fraunce englysshe knightes knewe right well sayd trouthe answered sayde sir goddesse name wyll go bourbourke abyde suche aduenture god wyll sende v sir hughe caurell departed fro entred burbourcke frenche kynge anone certifyed thenglysshmen departed bergues gone bourborke lefte bergues clene voyde gate towne sette opyn kynge entred suche wolde first entred foude great pyllage whiche englysshmen coude nat cary away ladyes towne saued sent saynt omers men nere hande slayne towne bergues set fyre kyng departed bycause fyre went lodged vyllage therby friday lordes lodged abrode feldes well might happy season fayr drie bene colde shulde full yuell agone farther gette forage marueyle howe forage gette many horse mo thre hundred thousande great wonder howe hoost myght vitayled saturday whan came bourborke determyned close englisshmen assayle towne trust wyn specially breton great desyre assayle ye towne great pyllage trusted fynde therin p howe freche kyng withall hoost came burborke order englysshmen within towne howe fraunces atreman wan warpe cap iiii c xxxix saturday mornyng right faire clere host prepared selfe coe burbourcke vowarde duke bretayne erle flaunders therle sait poule constable fraunce thre thousande speares passed forby walles ye towne taryed othersyde ryght agaynst kynges host wher moost goodlyst men armes coude ymagined thentent lordes assayle ye towne baners penons wauyng wi h wynd euery lorde men vnder owne baner lordes frauce shewed ther gret honoure richesse lorde coucy great estate hadde courser trapped barded aucyent armes coucy suche bare thane hym selfe goodly courser ridynge settynge men array euery man sawe hym praysed goodly behauo ther eue shewed estate made day mo four hundred knight th heraldes nombred ye knightes nyne bre xxiiii men armes knightes squyers p thenglysshmen yt towne burboure sawe frenche kynges puissace hoped well haue assaut right well coforted sawe selfe enclosed towne closed pali nat therof well assured howebeit lyke men good cofort great corage ordred people ye towne lorde beaumont erle englande called hery c men armes thre c archer kept one warde sir wyllyam helmon many men kept another sir john newcastell gascos kept another lorde ferres englande kept another ward xl men armes many archer thus towne set rounde sir mathue reedman ser wyllm fermton sir nicholas tracton two c men armes many archer kept ye place mynster also ordayned certayne nombre men take hede fyre quenche nede without disordringe wardes thenglisshmen douted fyre bycause towne moost parte house couered strawe thus estate englysshmen pnowe shall shewe highe enterprese rauces atreman dyde proper friday night frenche kynge passed bergues howhe wanne towne warpe fraunces atreman peter de boyse peter de myrt capitayns gaunte whan retourned fro siege fro ipre came gaunte studyed night daye howe might domage enemyes fraunces atreman vnderstode howe capitayne ande warpe sir gylbert lienghien nat wt towne menne warre howe kyng army theerle flauders sende wherfore fraunces thought well towne andewarpe easly kept howe dike warde medowes agayust theym drie water bene let fysshe therin one might easely go drie fote walles towne ladder entre towne spyes gaunt brought worde frauces atreman warpe feare gaunt maner forgoten whan fraunces atreman iustely enformed howe came peter de boyse sayd peter thus case towne warpe tyme wyll aduenture gette scale night ther neuer tyme good nowe capitayne ther men warre nowe frenche kynge fronters saynt omers feare body peter one agreed purpose said ye may come entent neuer man dyde suche dede haue prayse nat tell quod fraunces wyll happe courage good herte gyueth shall haue night warpe frau ce chase foure hundred men best truste departed fro gaunte euenyng toke way warde andewarpe moneth septebre whan nightes resonable length wether fayre clere mydnight came medowes ande warpe scalynge ladder redy passed maresse woman towne gaderynge grasse kene bydde selfe whan herde noyse men comyng way herde well speke knewe well howe gautoyse comyng towarde towne scale sawe well ladder woman sore abasshed last sayd selfe wyll go warpe shewe haue herde sene wache menne towne leyd downe baggage toke preuy way knewe stale towne gauntoyse cae ther called last one went walles fro gate gate herde sayd art thou quod poore woman say herby certayne nobre gau toyse haue sene bringe ladder steale towne nowe haue gyuen warnyng wyll retourne agayne mete deed thus poore woman departed man abasshed thought abyde styll se woman sayd trouthe nat gautoyse right priuely dyde enterprise made noyse trumpette noyse langage fraunces atreman sent foure company sayde go way secretely wtout wordes cough hynge towne walles harken aboue beneth ye parceyue thynge dyde fraunces companye abode styll marisshe stode styll nere woman sawe well herde sayde sawe nat forsayd four men went dyke behelde walles sawe herde nothyng lo ye mayse yuell aduenture fell within fortuned haue cadell lyght gautoyse might haue sene durst nat haue come ther wolde haue thought hadde ben good watche made four men returned agayne fra ce atreman sayde sir canse maner thynge thynke well frauces trowe watche hath made theyr tourne nowe gone rest let v go hyghe way towarde gate entre lowe downe dyke poore woman lay priuely herde word went agayne wall came watched shewed hym dyde declared sene herde counsayled hym go gate sehowe kept surely shortly ye shall gautoyse wyll go way dare legarabyde haue shewed haue sene herde nowe ye lyst wyll come nyght good poore womandeted man remembred wordes wente gate founde watchman playenge dyse sayd sir haue ye surelye closed gate barryers woman cae right nowe shewed thus thus ye haue herde answered sayd safe ynoughe yuell tyme night woman come hyder trouble v kene calues broken lose weneth noyse gautoyse warrant haue lyste coe hyder meane season whyle thus talkynge fraunces atreman company come entred dyke wherin water brake downe certayne pale wall rered vp ladder entred towne went streight market place without wnynge noyse tyll came thyder founde knight called sir john florence hulle lyeutenant vnder capitayne towne kepte standynge watche xxx men harnesse hym soone gauntoise entred place cryed gaunt gaunt strake watche sayde knyght slayne copany thus towne warpe taken howe warpe put towne none abode gauntoyse howe amergot marsell toke castell marquell auuerne howe gyuen vp coposycion fyue thousande frankes erle dolphyn auuergne cap c c c c xl suche slepe theyr beddes ande warpe sore abasshed whan herd cry saw towne taken coude nat remedy gautoyse brake vp house byforce slewe without defence makyng taken sodenly wherfore recouery therfore euery man saued selfe might best men fledde house naked lept ouer walles left behynde waded throughe dyke water towne ryche men bare nothyng away happy might saue selfe lyue ther night great nombre slayne towne drowned dyke water thus tuned aduenture moruynge whan gauntoyse sawe howe lordes towne put woman chyldren towne naked shert smockes worst tayment went tourney suche escaped went mount achacondent ualencennes tourney tidynges came many place howe warpe taken wherof gaunt greatly reioysed sayd howe fraunces atreman achyued great highe enterprise whiche ought tourne great valur prayse thus fraunces atreman abode capitayne warpe wanne great rich great prouisyon came well poynt towne gaunt whete otes wyne whiche towne gadered togyder fraunce flaunders turney heynalte saued toke nothyng therof payed season ther fell nere suche lyke adueture auuergne englysshmen helde dyuers castels marchyng lande erle dolphyn bysshop saynt fleure cleremont bycause garyson knewe well howe countre voyde men warre howe lordes knightes therof leest moost parte kyng voyage flaunders therfore thought wolde assay steale scale towne fortresse happed amargot marsell capitayne aloyse right strong castell within myle saynt fleure toke xxx company rode couertly towarde lande therle dolphyn entent assay take stelthe castell marquell wherby erle dolphyn beareth armes came thyder throughe wodes taryed lytell woode nere castell tyll sonne went downe beestes men castell entred meane season capitayne called grandon buyssell satte supper englysshmen redy apparelled en prise dressed vp ladder entred castell ease castell walkyng beneth courte whan sawe enemyes walles cryed treason treason whan capitayne herde thought remedy saue selfe preuy way knewe whiche went chambre great towre whiche cheife defece castell drewe thyder toke keyes hym closed selfe ye towre whyle amergotte entended thynges whan sawe yt capitayne scaped towre whiche strong wonne sayd hadde done nothyng repented entred enclosed within castell coude nat get agayne gate amergotte went towre speke capitayne sayd hym grandon delyuer keyes gate castell promyse shall departe hen without doyng hurt grandon ye wyll lede away catell wherin haue great trust gyue thy hade quod amergot shall swere faythe thou shalt haue domage folysshe capitayne putte hande lytell wyndowe thentent shulde swere hym soone amergotte hande drewe hym streyned hym sore drewe dagger sware without wolde delyuer keyes wolde nayle fast hande gate whan grandon sawe hymselfe case sore abasshed nat withoute cause sawe well amergot wolde nayle fast hade gate without delyuered keyes delyuered hande nere hym nowe quod amergotte company haue natte well disceyued foole shall lerne well suche dedes thane opyned towre maysters therof put capitayne within clene dyde hurt bodyes tidynges came erle dolphyns wyfe laye castell good towne called zaydes lytell myle then howe castell marquell taken englysshmen lady sore abasshed bycause lorde nat countre sende knightes squyers countre come ayde coquere agayne castell knightes squyers came anone lady layde siege castell englysshmen made force therof helde fyftene dayes thane lady fell treatie composycion taken amergot departed fyue thousande frankes retourned owne gary sone agayne lykewise caluylcell wherof peter de brenoise capitayne dyde moche hurt auuergne lymosyn englysshmen tyme helde fronters lymyties auuergne quercy lymosyn mo threscore stronge castels might go come fro forteresse fortresse tyll came burdeux fortres dyde moost hurt ua tatoure one strogest castels worlde chiefe capitayne therof bretone called geffray testenoyre cruell pytie man soone wolde put dethe knight squyer vyllayne sette body feared men none durst displease hym hadde hym foure hundred companyons wage well truely payed fro moneth moneth helde countre hym peace subiectyon none durst ryde countre feared douted maner purueyaunce hym man worlde coude haue better clothe brusels normandy peltre ware mercery thynges necessarie solde people abated wage also sell prouisyon yron steele leddar spyce thynges plentyfull thoughe hadde bene parys somtyme moued warre well englysshmen frenchman entent redouted castell uantatour euer purueyed thynges abyde siege shulde endure seuyn yere p nowe lette v retourne busynesse flaunders p howe french kynge assayled burbourke howe ordayned soeuer brought thyder fagotte shulde haue blanke cap cccc xli saturday said frenche kyng cae burbourke neuer sene goodlyer army euery man redy apparelled assaut towne great courage wyll sayd towne shulde nat long endure agaynst howe first cost many men great marueile went nat incotynent saut said agayne duke bretayne erle flauders farther syde towne trea e englysshmen yelde vp towne without assaut breton burgonyos normayns almayns peple thought surely within towne great pyllage protyte yf might wynne towne byforce wherfore sore displeased went nat streyght wayes assaute scrymysshed barryers without commau dement ordynaunce constable marshalles mater multiplyed suche wyse frenchemen shotte fyre towne fyre mo xl place myght se flame smoke euery parte hoost begane crye assaut formast front sir wyllyam namure copany valyantly dyde assayle done many feate armes assaylates great courage wyll entred dyke knee water myre came shotte fought pale thenglysshmen defended theym selfe well men myght nede within moche wyste nat well assayled euery syde styll brent house towne whiche abasshed englyssmen moost thyng went nat fro wardes abode styll defence sir mathue reedman sir nycholas traicton suche stablysshed towne dyde moche myght quenche fyre wether fayre season drie house flamed certayne assaute begonsoner saturday night hadde nat soone coe wonne towne assaut behoued cease assaut bycause nyght sir wyllyam namures company xxxvi sore hurt slayne hoost heraldes reported slayne hurte mo fyue hundred ceased assaut bicause night frechmen drewe lodgynges entended hurte people bury deed sayd ye hoost next day mornyng wolde newe agayne assaut towne sayeng surely wolde wynne shulde nat endure agaynst englysshmen nyght entended repayre pale whiche broken quenche fyre towne sawe selfe thynges consydered harde case sawe well closed rounde coude wyse flye sonday mornyng kynge herde masse crye made host soeuer brought fagot kynges tent shulde haue blanke frauce many fagottes many blankes thentent caste dyke men passe pale monday gyue assaute good makyng fagottes bringynge theym kynges tent within whyle great stacke thus draue sonday without assaut said sonday duke bretayne farther syde towne fell treatie theglysshemen sawe well case counsayled yelde vp towne sauynge bodyes goodes whiche counsayle gladde folowe desyred duke goddes sake gentylnesse wolde helpe make treatie cause sonday duke sende kyng vncles counsayle constable therle saynt poule shulde helpe make treatie counsayle kyng take fortresse offred assayle theym shulde cost kynge moche people bourbourke wolde harde wynne therin fewe poore menne warre wolde defede themselfe dethe kyng vncles bycause duke bretayne spake sayd wolde treaty good wyll thus sonday passed peace said euenyng assuraunce johan newcastell gascone raymonette saynt marke came lodgynge sir guy dela tremoyle sporte taryed night mo day mornynge retourned bourburke departure sir guy sayde sir night ye shall prisoner sir quod rather poorer knyghtes euenyng tidynges came hoost howe warp taken stelthe wherwith capitayne therof sore displeased bycause ther whiche losse towne excused bycause erle flaunders sende hym sonday night erle blois kept watche wenynge assayle towne mornynge monday mornyng crye made man shulde hardy make assaute towne tyll commauded whan crye publysshed throughe hoost euery man ceased ymagined englisshmen shulde departe treatie sithe comaunded nat assayle towne noone yssued towne suche shulde comune treatie sir wyllyam helman sir thomas tryuette sir nicholas traicton sir mathue reedman nombre xiiii knyghtes squyers duke bretayne costable fra ce erle saynt poule brought kynges tent kyng gladde se hadde sene fewe englisshmen except sir peter courtney ben paris dedes armes sir guy de la tr moyle tyme kynge counsayle agreed fought nat toguyder bycause tyme passed great renome brute ran howe englysshmen valyant armes therfore yonge kyng gladde se treatie aueyled moche better thus monday kynges tent kyng ther duke berry duke burgoyne duke burbone duke bretaygne erle flaunders constable fraunce mo duke bretayne toke great payne treatie last concluded shulde departe fro burbourke leaue towne grauelynge take moche coude cary owne treatie dyuers breton frenchman normayns burgonyous sore displeased hoped haue parte goodes fayled entet kyng wolde haue thus sayd treatie knightes toke leaue kyng vncles duke bretayne erle flaunders costable therle saint poule toke theym supper lodgynge made right good supper conueyed gate towne wherof thanked hym greatly p miracle done towne burbourke howe sir thomas triuet sir wylliam helman englysshmen putte prisone domage fraunce cap cccc xlii tuisday day ordered busynesse shodde horse stuffed male wherof great plentie wednisday mornynge trussed toke way passed saueconduct thorough kynges hoost bretos sore displeased whan sawe departe suche baggage suche abode behynde dyde hurt ynoughe thus englysshmen departed went grauelyng rested thursday mornyng departed set fyre towne brent clene vp came calais pyllage taryed wynde haue passed retourne englade thursday mornyng frenche kyng entred burburke lordes ther companyes breton began pyll robbe towne left nothynge towne churche saynt johans whiche churche vyllayne among lept vpon auter wold haue taken away stone acrowne heed ymage lady ymage tourned away fro true thynge vyllayne fell fro auter dyed shamefull dethe many men sawe myracle ther came another wolde haue done belle church rang without helpe ne hades also coude nat ronge rope tyed vp lofte myracles churche moche visyted ye people kynge gaue ymage lady great gyfte dyde lord day ther offred gyuen well valure thre thousande frakes next day dislodged kyng gaue leaue euery man departe kyng thanked farre countreis specially duke bauyer bycause come serue hym farre also erle sauoy thus euery lorde drewe owne kyng retourned duke burgoyne taryed lytell behynde erle flaunders set busynesse good order taryed saynt omers lorde coucy mayns diuers knightes squiers poictou uymewe picardy entred grauelynge whan englysshmen lefte newe repayred made countre garyson agaynst calays lytell lytell peopled agayne countre furneys dokyrke disqueme newporte whiche lost conquered newe agayne ye may knowe well ye duke la castre nothynge dyspleased bysshoppe norwyches armye spedde better dyde reason army lost viage spayne portyngale whan englysshe knightes retourned englande sore taken vp comens sayde howe right yuell quyted theselfe vyage whan fayre begynnynge flauders conquered nat hole coutre specially sir thomas tryuet sir wyllm helman moost blamed sir hughe caurell faute layde charge nother kyng cousayle comons well knowen counsayle might haue bene beleued spedde better dyde honores layde two knightes howe solde burborke grauelynge frenche kyng realme sore moued agaynst parell lyues comaunded kyng prison towre lo prison comons apeased whan delyuered prison boude kyng wyll pleasure ther put forthe treatie bytwene englysshmen frenchman gaut coprised treatie wherwith therle flaunders sore displeased coude nat amede detynge burborke duke bretayne abode styll saynt omers erle flauders cosyn wolde gladlye haue sene good peace longe truse might haue ben bytwene frenche kyng naturall lorde kyng englande set forwarde mater moday wha englisshmen kyng tent moued mater promysed hym assoone cae englande kyng wolde speke hym vncles counsayle mater shewe wyllyng bring mater good ende sent englad two knightes owne good assuraunce lorde housey lorde maylly dyde moche duke lacastre erle buckyngham brother bysshoppe suffolke sir johan hollande brother kyng sir thomas percy kynges counsayle
