shulde come calays hauyng full puyssaunce authoryte kyng ye realme make peace ordayne treuse pleasure parte shulde come boloyne duke berry duke burgoyne bysshoppe laon chauceler frace hauyng also full authorite fro frenche king cousayle realme take peace englysshmen take truse suche coude agre vpon whan tie coe calys boloyne taryed lytell met counsayle spaygne shulde come thyder frenchemen wolde make treatie without spanyerdes enclosed therin finally cae fro kynge spayne bysshop dyacre two knightes aduysed party bycause thought suretie frenchemen come calais englysshmen come boloyne therfore ordayned ther comunyng shulde mydway bytwene sayde townes lytell vyllage ther churche called abolyng thyder came party dyuers dayes ther met duke bretayne theerle flaunders felde pyght vp great tent bruges erle flaudes made dyner tent duke lancastre therle buckyng ham lordes englande ther great estate holden bothe party thynges cosydred coude fynde meanes haue peace frechmen wolde haue agayne guynes calays fortress thenglysshmen helde syde see ryuer garon aswell norma dy bretayne poictou xaynton rochell whiche thenglysshmen wolde wyse agre specially guynes calys chierburge brest bretayne comunyng treaty thre wekes euery day lordes el counsayle season dyed duchy lusenburgh towne lusenburgh gentyll ioly duke uincelyns boem duke lusenburgh brabat ben tyme fresshe sage amorous hardy whan dyed sayd yt highe prince grettest lynage moost noble blode deed god haue soule buryed abbey uauclere besyde luzeburgh lady jane duches brabant wydowe neuer maryed dethe noble duke suche knewe hym right sorie p howe lordes englande fraunce assembled togyder make peace whiche coude nat done howe loyes erle flaunders dyed obsequy cap cccc xliii let v retourne assemble bytwene thenglisshe lordes freche bytwene calays boloyne whiche treaty coude neuer come none effect peace profyte one partie sayd ye erle flauders great defaut therof wolde wyse haue gaunt comprised treatie wherwith thenglysshmen displeased wherfor treatie spedde worse ther great promyse made peace shulde made without gautoyse coprised therin sworne calays therfore brake treatie finally ther coude made peace shulde seme good tie fell treat truse thervpon treatie ceded therle flauders wolde gladly gaunt shulde haue ben truse englysshmen wolde wyse consent therto gaunt shulde coprised truse euery partie shulde syt styll hath partie redre vp fortresse treatie thus bytwene calays boloyne gauntoyse garyson warpe came brent subbarbes tourney retourned sauely agayne warpe feest christmas gauntoyse gadered vp rente parteyning lorde tourney wherwith right sore displeased sware great othe whatsoeuer treatie made bytwene fla ders end gauntoyse wolde neuer entede peace alwayes make grettest warre coude sayd toke fro hym herytage wherfore wyste natte howe lyue without frendes brabant heynalt ayded gautoyse distroyed herytage treaty thus bytwene boloyne calys bytwene lordes englade fraunce cocluded moche truse shulde bytwene frenche kyng kyng englande adherentes alyes say frenche kynges parte spayne galyce castell enclosed well water lande also realme scotlande frenche kyng assoone may signifie truse kyng scottes baron scotlande shulde go message haue saue coduct go coe realme englande also thenglysshe parte ther coprised adhere te alyes whatsoeuer tie gaunt expresly named enclosed truse wherof therle flaunders sore displeased truse endur feest saynt michell yere lorde god ccc lxxxiiii party retourne agayne place el hauyng full puyssaunce apease sayd realmes thynges letter autentyke instrum te publykes writen sealed holde accoplysshe truse poyntment lordes sware nat breke poynt thus counsayle brake vp frenchman retourned fraunce thenglysshmen calys duke bretayne retourned owne countre therle flauders saynt omers ther sickenesse toke hym wherof dyed ordayned shulde entred churche oure lady lysle erle flaunders dyed ye yere lorde ccc lxxxiii xx day january brought abbey besyde lysle lyke wise countesse wyfe dyed fyue yere countie reches brought thyder also bothe toguyder buryed churche saynt peter lysle p nowe shall shewe thordynauce buryeng conueyeng lysle foloweth ordynauce buryeng therle flaunders countesse wyfe whose bodyes brought abbey besyde lysle whan entred lysle great nombre lordes fraunce flauders heynalt brabant redy euenynge obsequy gate sicke people brought bodyes towne churche saynt peter armed warre squiers ledde first ther sir john helwyn moost next body ledde angurant uelomy roger lespyre lord markdeuant led marquemene johan espyre lorde sausse ledde fretynand sir john molyn lorde mauuesledde geffray denoyle henry uaquery p item ther folowed suche ordayned conioy sir peter baylleule next body sir john molyn ledde ser johan quynhen haubeken marshall sir sohyre gaunt sir peter baylleule ledde guyot lopre johan loys lorde bretecourt ledde hyart quynhen mychell de la quare p folowed baners bere first sir frauces hasurquene sir goussayn le sauage sir lacelot son sir gousayne sir john de la hell sir lancelot p folowed barethe baners bere conuoy sir mathe hunyers sir johan de helles lorde aueaux also sir mathue sir cyrchelart de la bare said lorde aueaux sir johan parys cyrchelart p item herafter foloweth name ayded beare body fro gate sicke folkes throughe towne lysle church saynt peter first sir john de uyen admyrall fraunce ryght hande lorde guystell lyft hande sir ualerat raneuall also right syde chatellayne disqnyue left syde lorde distenoy right syde sir aunsell salyns lyfte syde p herafter foloweth baron ayded beare body countesse flauders fro gate saynt leder churche saynt peter first lorde sully ye right syde lorde chatellone lyfte syde sir guy potayle marshall burgoyne right syde sir guy guystels lyft sir henry right corner chatellayne furnes lyft corner p foloweth ordynauces day obsequy done churche saynt peter lisle name ther suche squiers helde sheldes masse offrynge duke burgoyne first alone first shelde borne hym shelde sustayned lorde raneuall lorde de la gonese labequen de la coutre johan de pout alters brother marshall burgoyne seconde shelde lorde johan arthoyse erle ewe sir philyppe de bare shelde holden ualerat de la sale lesquans denekyn erle marche sir phylyppe darthoise shelde holden gyllon delabret robyn florigny sir robert de namure sir wyllm de namur nephue ye shelde borne chaux bernarde gerarde destrenayle p item sheldes conuoy lorde dangyen hym sir johan namure shelde holden ayllert pouthees henry moucy next sir ewe chastellon lorde fere shelde holden john helwyn edwarde castren lorde dautoyne lorde guystels shelde sustayned trystram landres johan du beart lorde mori ne lord sully shelde holden fresinguy dame bucy p item name offred courser warre first lorde chatellon sir symon de la layne bayly heynalt lordes fote horse armed couered secode sir ualerant raneuall ye cathelayne disqmade thyrde sir hewe meuleun lorde daucy fourth lorde brunell lorde brumen p foloweth offred courser conuoy first sir henry datoygne sir gerarde guystels seconde lorde montigny lorde rasenghien thyrde lorde de la haurade chatelayne furnes fourthe lorde fagumelles sir roulande de la clycque p foloweth name offred glayues warre first lorde admyrall frauce lorde rary seconde marshall burgoyne thyrde ye lorde saynt pye fourthe lorde p foloweth suche offred ye swerdes conuoy first sir wyllm ponthue ii sir wyllm de tremoile thirde chatelayne ipre iiii sir guy de hancourt p item name offred helmes warre first lorde maylly seconde sir wyllyam de horne sir ansell de salyns thyrde sir johan doppeyn chatelayn saynt omers iiii sir guy de guystels galoys daunoy p ite helmes couoy first sir joise de hallayn sir olyuer de guffey ii lorde dysobeque thyrde lorde de lalayne fourthe sir trystram de boy sir johan jumont p name offred baners warre first lorde lystrenayle ii sir leoncell dareynes thyrde sir gyles de la goneufe iiii sir john de lysolom p item baners conuoy firste sir orenges rely seconde sir rafe alayne thyrde sir johan disquenyue iiii sir uyllayns de la clycque p name obsequy done layde body erle erthe sir john de uyen admyrall fraunce lorde guystell sir ualerant raneuall chatelayne disquenyue lorde ray sir ansell salyns p name layd countesse body erthe sir guy de la tremoyle lorde chatellon ye seneshall burgoyn lorde gerarde guystles sir henry datoygne chatellon furnes suche entred churche saynt peter euenyng offyce day masse aswell knight armed yt bare baners also squyers led horse p item went bodyes erle countesse towne lysle churche saynt peter nobre four hundred men blacke euery man bearyng torche helde torch nexte day masse tyme marchates good townes officer house tharchbysshop rayns sang masse acopanyed wt bysshop parys bysshop turney bysshop cabrey bysshop arras v abbottes p ite also churche duryng obsequy vii c candels therabout euery taper coteyning weyght waxe trayle herse ther fyue baners myddes baner flaunders ye right syde baner arthoys lyfte syde baner burgoyne iiii baner newers v rethell trayle one syde poudred scochyns armes flauders lyft syde lady scochyns flaunders brabant downe long mynster ther ii hudred xxvi candels lyke vnto herse ther nother lady damosell ye gouernors wyfe lysle ther great dyner costes knightes squiers borne quyte nyght day obsequy blacke gownes whan done euery man returned owne duke burgoyne left garysons flaunders knightes squyers truse yt taken bytwene englade faunce euery man toke hede charge lady wyfe taryed styll season arthoyse p howe erle northuberlande erle notyngham englysshmen made iorney scotlande ambassadours fraunce sende scotlande notify truse taken bytwene englande frauce cap cccc xliiii le haue well herde lordes frace wha made truse englysshmen charged deting signify ye truse scotlande entent hurt shulde done bytwene englade scotlande howe saye trouthe thy fraunce dyde nat dilygence mater ought haue done shulde haue sende incontynent dyde nat thynke let therof bycause great busynesse duke burgoyne ye obsequy father lawe therle flaunders ye haue herde also thought full lytell englysshmen wolde haue done dyde anone ester erle northu berlande erle notyngham baron northe coutre made army two thousande speares sixe thousande archer passed rosebourge entred scotlande began brinne countre lande therle duglas lorde lynsey left nothyng vnbrent edenborowe lordes knyghtes scotlande nothyng ware iourney toke mater great dispyte sayeng howe wolde amede power said herde reported shulde haue truse englysshmen howe nat warned therof wherfore knewe well warr opyn ye wotte well tidynges wyll sprede anone abrode wherby shortely knowen flaunders specially scluse marchantes cae realme scotlade howe thenglysshmen entred scotlande howe kynge robert scotlande lordes realme dyde somon people asseble fight thenglysshmen also knowen frauce englysshmen felde scottes also short tyme likely mete duke berrey burgoyne cousayle frace whan vnderstode tidynges sayd folysshly done nat sende worde treuse scotlande tymes promysed ordayned sir hamart de marse shulde go scotlande sage discrete knight sir peter framell sergiant armes nacyon scottes called janequyn chapenoyse went bicause knewe lagage coutre meane season ambassadours ordayned selfe go scotlande englysshmen ouer ran coutre scotlade ther tyme scluse men war frauce lay styll slept wyst nat truse bytwene englade fladers styll endured herde howe glysshemen scottes made warre eche sayd scluse certayne hastely ther shulde batayle bytwene sir geffray charney sir john plasy sir hughe boloyne sir sayng uyllers sir garnere leborne sir garnere gussaguyn sir oden metyn sir robert capyhen jakes moutfort john heluyn john melles michell dela bare gyllam gobert xxx men armes knightes squyers made promyse togyder go adueture bodyes wyst nat wher better enploy season ye realme scotlade deted fro scluse toke shyp left horse behynde danger see long iorney maryners knewe well coude nat arryue haue edeborowe dobare non hauyns nere thenglisshe army aswell see lande englysshmen lordes maisters first port scotlande bycause uisyon might folowe see season freche ambassadours cae englande go scotland kyng vncles made great chere first day somwhat dissimuled delay tyme bicause men makyng war scotlande whan vnderstode men hadde done enterprise retourned agayne englande let frenche ambassadours departe gaue saueconduct passe realme scotlande made townes castels opyned agaynst comynge departed went towarde scotlande long men warre went fro scluse sayled see costyng holade en glande eschewyng el thes e encou tryng theglysshmen last aryued scotlade lytell porte called mostres whan scottes dwelt towne knew howe frenchemen come exercise dedes armes made good chere dyde helpe get neded whan knightes squyers refresshed two dayes lerned tidynges ted rode hakeneis cae dondem fro then saint johans good towne scotlande ryuer tare good hauen sayle whyder man wyll whan coe thyder vnderstode howe englysshmen withdrawen howe kynge scottes lordes edeborowe cou sayle ordayned sir garnyer cuissangyn mychaell de la bare shulde go edenborowe speke kyng counsayle knowe shulde leest shewe theym good wyll come flauders scotlande sir geffray de charney wolde abyde tyll worde agayne ordayned done departed went edeborowe wher kyng therle duglas called james father wyllyam newly disceased also erle moret therle orkeney lorde uersey lorde lynde lorde surlant sixe bretherne therle orkenes knightes lordes scotlade made good cher knightes frace sir garnyer shewed kyng baron scotlande thentencyon copanions cause comynge realme ambassadours fraunce cae thyder sir hemart de percy ser peter framell janequyn chapenoise brought truse deuysed bytwene frace englande scotteshelde agaynst sayd howe came late wolde haue truse bycause theglysshmen season done moche hurt thus king knightes differece erle duglas therle moret chyldren lindsey dyuers knight squiers scotlande desyringe armed helde secrete counsayle togyder churche ede borowe knightes fraunce sent sir michaell de la bare sir garnyer desyring go copanyons shewe entent kepe purpose secrete two knightes returned saynt johans towne shewed company herde sene p howe baron knightes scotlande frauce made apoyntment entre realme englade without knowlege kyng scottes edenborowe cap cccc xlv tidinges sir geffray de charney knyghtes squiers greatly reioysed deted then came edenborowe made knowlege shulde nat bene ther two dayes erle duglas sende come castell alquest sent horse came next day incontynent brought certayne place wher scottes assembled thre dayes mo xv thousande hors backe armed vsage coutre sayd wolde make iourney englande reueng hurtes domages ben done went forthe passed forestes woodes countre entred northuberlande lande lorde percy began brinne robbe steale retourned lande therle notynghm lorde moubray dyde moche hurt passed rosebourg taryed nat bycause great pyllage wt well prisoner catell retourned without daunger coutre agayne englysshmen withdrawen coude nat soone agayne assemble toguyder fyght scottes therfore behoued beare brunt gyuen fore suche another scottes iourney kynge scottes myght ryght well excuse hym selfe assemble departyng knewe nothyng thoughe knowen therof coulde natte haue let whan one onwarde iorneys thus made bothe scotlande englande abode styll kyng robert sir hamarde de marse sir pe framell bycause wolde layde faut breke truse taken bytwene englande fraunce castell kynge scottes ambassadours fraunce sende heraude armes englade whan coe kyng englande vncles founde countre sore moued ryde agayne scotlande duke lancastre erle cabridge desyred greatly yere go portyngale castell el one great puyssaunce menne armes helde selfe heryters therof ryght wyues child castell renewe war bytwene kynge portyngale kyng castell kyng ferado deed portyngales crowned dan johan bastarde brother valyaunt man desyred nothynge warre spanyerdes myght haue alyaunce englysshemen confort ayde therfore duke lancastre dyde fredes moche might shulde none asse bly go scotlande also sayde playnly howe kynge scottes denyed knightes scotlande fraunce make rode englande dyd cotrary wyll knowlege whan scottysshe heraude come kynge englande vncles well instructed shuld say kneled downe kynge requyred might herde heraude kyng scottes message kyng content ther shewed wherfore sende singulerly fro kynge fro ambassadours fraunce excusyng sayeng howe kynge scottes mekely receyued messangers freche kynkes alwayes entended kepe trewse bothe howbeit march realme elre duglas erle de la mare vncle sir archebale sir rame sir peter sir wyllm sir thoms duglas bretherne lyndsey ra sey sir wyllim asweton wolde neuer agre truse sayeng howe englysshmen done lande great hurt domage whiche ryght sore displesant fredes sayd howe wolde reuenged whan might whan lordes assembled togyder go englande dyde neuer made king counsayle preuy therof knewe well wolde neuer haue consented therto howbeit say playnly scotlande firste incydent occasyon warre moued firste saye howe grace counsayle knewe right well truse taken bothe lande water also say howe frenche ambassadours whane passed way let comyng scotlande ye draue forthe pleasure solace taryed ouer longe wherby myschiefe fallen bytwene englande scotlande vnder shadowe dissymulacyon thynges done redouted souerayne lorde kynge scottes counsayle ambassadours fraunce hym excuseth selfe wyll tymes last iourney lordes knightes scotlande made englande vnknowen ignorant therof addresse reforme thynges bring good estate charged say desyre grace entede kepe obserue truse taken beyonde see high noble discrecyon counsayle bothe frenche kynges cofyrme truse endure sayd terme soueraygne lorde kyng scottes noble counsayle cofyrme parte vpholden kept please grace gyue answere kyng englande vncles well vnderstode heraude duke lacastre sayd howe shulde answered made hym tary london answere p howe truse taken bitwene englande fraunce publisshed englande scotlande cap cccc xlvi thende two dayes heraulde answered sir symon bulle chamberlayne king mater set good poynt say trouth thynges consydered lordes englande bene beyonde see toke truse dyde nat honorably co sent sende men ouer ron scotlande seyng knewe truse taken best excuse coulde make howe nat boude sende worde therof ye scottes frenchemen bounde therto sayd heraude name god welcome howe yt thentency kynge englande vncles counsayle yt sworne mysed wolde wyse breke wolde cofyrme best power hath ben done contrarie moost done moost lost haraulde desyred haue writyng thentent might beleued gyuen hym great gyftes well cotent thanked kyng lordes departed fro london returned scotlande messangers fraunce styll taryeng answere desyring knowe howe englysshmen wolde whan knowen answere ye king englande vncles made letter sealed greatly contented reioysed thus endured trewse yere bytwene englande scotlande publysshed throughe bothe realmes suretie ambassadours fraunce retourned countre passed throughe englande safely without parell shewed frenche king vncles returnyng howe spedde lettes founde iourney shewed case ye haue herde whan sir geffray de charney knightes squiers realme fraunce suche bene scotlande sawe peace bytwene enlande scotlande tooke leaue lordes scotlande specially erle duglas erle moret kepte ryght good company scotlande sayd vnto detynge sir ye haue sene maner condycion cositre ye haue nat sene puyssaunce knowe certayne scotlande lande worlde englysshmen moost may ye haue sene entre englande oure ease ryde farre countre without daunger see yf men ynowe might moche hurt wherfore sir ye wold shewe suche knightes squyers wolde auauce selfe get honoure come countre seke dedes armes thike shulde gret feate thousande speares knightes squyers frauce people haue countre shulde suche dede englande shulde spoken xl yere sir desyre reme bre whan ye come fraunce answered sayd wolde nat fayle mater nat forgoten thus departed toke see thought haue sayled scluse howe wynde contrarie whane see fayne take lande zelande towne called uorell tha thoght sauegarde nat normayns lytell ouer ron countre therabout done zelanders great domage wherfore knightes squiers fraunce great dauger brute thus towne shyppe entred cofers broken armure taken great parell slayne daye towne squyer erle bloyes called jacob grasyns dyde helpe ayde frenche men moche might spake maysters towne dyde moche la gage parte goodes restored agayne bring parell daunger sawe knewe well people towne sore moued agaynst mynde ly waite see execute purpose warned townes sayed squyer shewed daunger countre sore moued agaynst sayd loue kyng thonour realme fraunce wolde ordayne remedy went maryner hyred shippe go wher pleased hym company sayeng howe wolde sayle dondrest maryner made couynaunt entred shyppe sayde frenchman hym first maryner set course donderst whane jacob sawe tyme sayd mariner sir take hede say haue hyred shyppe viage sayle whyder lyst therfore tourne yo sayle towarde streneghen wyll sayle thyder maryners wolde nat agre therto sayd sir ye sayd ye wolde sayle dondrest thyder wyll bringe none place jacob sayd marke well say commaunde el ye shal dye therfore maryners durst stryue lay nat power tourned helme sayle sayled toward towne streneghen came thyder without parell towne belonged erle bloyes refresshed departed pleasure retourned countre brabant heynault jacob dyde seruyce squyer guyes erle bloyes whane sir geffray charney sir johan blassey knightes squyers bene scotlande retourned frauce enquyred tidynges scotlande shewed herde sene shewed myndes baron knightes scotlande sir johan uyen admyrall fraunce spake sir geffray charney shewed ye haue herde admyrall aduysed well dyde baros frauce howe might haue fayre entre englande scotlande also knewe well naturally scottes loued nat englysshmen sir amery marse confyrmed sayeng howe desyred kynge scottes counsayle shewe frenche kynge counsayle thus frechmen ymaginacyon yt truse one expyred wolde sende great puyssaunce scotlande wast parte englande purpose co cluded duke berry duke burgoyne gouernynge realme kept secrete p lorde destornay made assemble wynne agayne andwarpe howe policye wanne cap cccc xlvii haue herde howe fraunces atremanne meane tyme whyle freche king iourney flaunders toke stelthe towne andewarpe wherof tourney townes therabout sore dismayde garyson truse taken dyde moche domage coutre turnesyn specially lades lorde destornay obeysauce feest christemas gadered vp rente capon thynges townes wherwith sore displeased seruautes fre de sayd whatsoeuer truse respyte warre taken bytwene englande frau ce flaunders wolde wyse kepe truse gautoise done moche hurt nat able beare maner vndone therby thus lorde destornay dyde cast aduyce get agayne andwarpe atchiued entent ayde knightes squyers fra ce flaunders heynalte helped hym purpose yet whan sende many knewe nothyng wolde chaunce happed xvii day may lorde destornay knewe spyes fraunces atreman gaunt nat andwarpe trusted truse bitwene fraunce feared nothyng whiche great folly tooke nat good hede andewarpe shulde haue done ye shall herafter lorde destornay made assemble foure hundred knyghtes squyers good men armes came wode lart agaynst gate towarde grauntmount right nere gate andwarpe hym sir johan molyn sir jakes de la tremoyle sir gylbert sir johan cacq lon sir roulande despyre sir blaynchard de calonne lorde destripouylle ther made knight shall shewe maner howe andwarpe disceyued toke two carte laded vitayle four carter gray cote harnessed vnder neth right hardy aduenturous felowes came draue carte andwarpe shewed watchman howe brought prouisyon heynault vitayle towne watchemen thought nothyng good lette downe portcolyse carter priuely losed horse fro cart watchman sayd sir driue nat forthe carte watchemen toke forehorses heed drewe forthe passed carte abode styll gate bridge thane watchman sawe well betrayed began fight carter defended selfe right well well armed vnder cote slewe two watchman incontynent rescued lorde destornay copany pursewed fast entred towne tha watchman fledde towne cryed treason treason towne reysed armes entred slewe encountred made defence cryed towne wonne thus andwarpe taken agayne gauntoyse slayne drowned thre hundred founde great richesse parteyning fraunces atreman sayd amouted fyftene thousande frankes ynges sone knowen dyuers place howe andwarpe take truse duryng frenchman specially gaut sore displeased therwith reason touched right nere toke counsayle togyder determyned sende duke burgoyne shewyng hym howe assurauce peace andwarpe ben taken fro hym desyring might restored agayne el truse broken sende hym duke excused hym sayd medled nothynge mater prayed god helpe sayd knewe nothyng lorde destornayes en prise sayd wolde write hym good wyll dyde commaundynge hym rendre agayne andwarpe gautoyse sayeng howe nat honourable take towne castell fortresse duryng peace lorde destornay answered duke letter sayd messangers sir alwayes garysone andwarpe hath made warre bothe warr season peace tyme hath take fro myne herytage neuer agreed peace thus haue taken andwarpe good feate warre purpose kepe proper herytage tyll fla ders gaunt one haue nothyng el lost warre thus mater abode gautoyse coude get nothyng el yuell kepynge andwarpe fraunces atreman sore blamed specially lorde harsels great heynous wordes bytwene fraunces sayde howe done better seruice gaunt euer dyde lagage multiplyed farr eche belyed foule wordes anone lorde harsels slayne sayd meanes fra ce atreman peter de boyse enuy season gautoyse made request kyng englande haue noble man blode gouernoure gaunt kyng counsayle sende gaunt valyant knyght ryght sage haue gouernyng gaunt called sir johan bourchyer gouernynge gaunte yere halfe p howe duke aniou dyed castell besyde naples howe quene cicyle counsayled go pope cap cccc xlviii haue herde howe duke aniowe wrote hymselfe kyng cicyle hierusalem went puyle calabre conquered countre naples neapolytas wolde neuer tourne parte euer sustayned helde sir charles de la payx duke aniou abode vyage thre yeres whiche great cost charge though man neuer riche men armes warre wasteth wyll haue seruyce warre must payed truely wage el wyll thynge aueylable certaynly sayde iourney cost duke aniou moche canne nat well estemed wasted confouded moost richesse erle sauoy sauosyns howe erle sauoy great parte company dyed viage whiche great pytie duke aniowe began waxe feble bothe men money two cause sende coure fraunce two bretherne duke berry duke burgoyne desyring nat fayle nede socour hym men money sayd wolde tha aduysed men mete sende voyage thynges consydred ymagined coude sende better one knewe better men warre thane gentyll lorde coucy hym lorde daghien erle conuersant whiche erldome puylle two lordes desyred kyng vncles take iourney whiche wyllingly agreed thought right honorable made redy went forthe sone myght men warre whan come auignon inteded besynes made men passe forthe tydinges came howe duke aniou deed castell besyde napoles whan lorde coucy harde tydinges wente farther forth sawe well voyage broken lorde conuersant passed forthe farther moche cou trey puylle conuersant tydinges knowen anon frauce dethe duke aniou thus dethe kyng cicyle passed ouer well might whan duches aniowe beynge anger harde dethe lorde husbande ye may well beleue sore discomforted sone erle bloys cosyn germayne knewe duke deed deparred fro blois trayne came cosyn anger helde hym comfortynge counsayling best power came frauce writyng selfe quene napoles cicyle puylle calabre hierusalem speke kyng duke berrey duke burgoyne haue cousayle comforte brought two sonnes loys charles lady counsayled noble frau ce blode shulde go auignon pope promyse possessyon erledome prouence whiche lande parteyned kyng cicyle lady beleued counsayle ordeyned selfe go auignon leade eldest sonne loyes thane called kynge succession father mater nat ouersone accomplysshed shall deuyse wynter frenchman ordeyned sende scotlande armye rowble realme englande truce bytwene fraunce englande relonged adherentes fro mighelmas st day may great prouysion e lande see entent counsayle fraunce next somer wold make englade great warre sydes admyrall fraunce go scotlande two thousande speares knyghtes squiers duke burbone erle de la marche two thousand go conquere certayne castels holden englisshmen whiche ryght sore traueyled countrey frenche kyng caused great nombre ax made picardy haynalt serue voyage scotlade arthoyse lysle doway turney moche bysquet made prouysion longe see syde harflewe sluse whiche princypall hauen thought take shippynge p howe lady brabant caused called counsayle wherat duke burgoyn duke aubert cytie cambray treat mariage chyldren cap cccc xlix duches brabat beyng wydow duke wyncelent boesme deed whose deth greate sorowe harte lay brusels greatly displeased trowble sawe flaunders gladly wolde haue made peace might vnderstode gauntoyse dayly fortifyed selfe reason englisshmen promysed great comforte also sawe well nefewe duke burgoyne shulde right enherytoure flaunders one greattest enherytours worlde thane likely sore troubled gautoyse also sawe well duke aubert chefe haynault duches wyfe fayre chyldren gyder two sonnes doughters tha vnmaryed also knewe duke lacastre treaty maryage philyppe doughter lady blaunche first wyfe eldest sonne duke aubert shuld right enherytour erledome haynault holande zelande sayd lady douted alyaunce made bytwene englande haynaulte frenche men wolde haue indygnacion therat ther ioly countre haynalt outher couertly openly suche shulde passe fraunce flaunders comynge goyng shulde sore troubled greued rather bycause duke aubert meanes holaders zelanders suche marchyng see syde dyd comforte dayly gauntoyse dyuers maners wherof duke burgoyne counsayle well infourmed therof wherfore loued duke auberte neuer better yet therof nothyng gylty holanders zelanders warre flauders touched thynge wolde nat therfore defende marchaundyses rynne sayd good lady consideryng thynges parels myght ense aduysed bringe two duke togyder duke burgoyne duke aubert wolde meane treate bytwene also though entreat duke burgoyne gauntoyse myght coe mercy lady aduyse ymaginacyon wolde nat let slepe set clerkes messagers warke dyd somoche bytwene two duke day assygned mete cambray cousayls howbeit bothe duk knewe nat full entent lady caused counsayle counsayle acordyng promysed moneth january xii day came cytie cambray duke burgoyne duke aubert counsayls duches brabant opened mater assembled first shewed duke burgoyne howe great lorde lykely howe fayre chyldren howe shuld happy bestowe well nobly moost auauntage countrey saynge howe opynion knewe place metely coutrey haynalt holande zelande bringe coutreys perfyte peace gyue feare doute enemyes fayre nephewe knowe trouthe duke lancastre right puyssant england dothe doughter maryed wyllim heynalt sone heyre sir rather se profyt chyldren englysshe men fayre aunt quod duke thanke beleue well content ye canne bringe boute let doughter margarete maryed heyre haynalt lady went fro one parte treat maryage duke aubert whome tydinges newe answered right curtesly sayd howe hadde counsayle suche wolde haue counsayle wolde ye haue quod duches want well bringe countrey peace lacke wyfe duke without wyll nothyng mater hathe moche parte chyldren also fayre aunt metely noble countrey enfourmed therof well duches pray god best thought departinge desyre mete agayne place lent tyme bringe wyues counsayls lady dyde secretly fewe folkes knewe wherfore cousayle thus two duke departed fro cambray duke burgoyne went cytie arras lady wyfe duke aubert returned holade lady wyfe duches brabant retourned countrey euer secretly wrote sent eyther party tooke great payne bringe agayne lordes wyues cytie cambray greatly desyred mariage confyrmed bringe vnite concorde flaunders brabant haynalt gyder moche dyd good lady sayd duke wyues counsayls came agayne cambray ther done great honoure eche enforsed selfe honoure eche duches margarete burgoyn duches margaret heynault helde sore treaty saynge sonne shulde mary margarete burgoyne wolde also doughter shuld mary john burgoyne make crosse maryag wherby shulde coniunction loue two chyldren burgoyne shulde maryed one howse duke burgoyne thought ynough mary doughter excused johan sonne saynge howe h yonge age maryed duk burgoyne ymaginacion mary jo sonne katheryne fraunce suster nephewe french kyng thus poynt treaty lyke haue fayled duches bauiers sayd howe shulde made maryage chyldren maryed alwayes helde purpose ther coude man breke therof duches brabant hadde great payne go fro one bringe treaty toguyder moche dyd alegynge wynge good reason specially duke duches burgoyn finally went concluded sonne doughter duke burgoyne shulde maryed sonne doughter duke aubert bauiers let mater fyue dayes mater duke burgoyns cousayle feared vnderstod duke aubert nat bene trewe possession heynalt possibylite therof lyued erle willyam haynault brother lay sore sycke ouesnoy whiche erle myght recouer ouerlyue duke aubert brother dyd thought clerely feared greatly bretherne shulde haue gouernynge haynault chyldren duke aubert put clene dought made delay maryage space fyue dayes tyll last clerely knowen duke aubert hadde mo bretherne erle haynault coulde nat put herytage fro duke aubertes chyldren whane thynges knowen thane lenger delay maryages sworne couenaunted willym haynalt shulde haue maryage margaret burgoyne johan burgoyne haue wyfe margarete haynault shulde retourne cambray parforme solempnisacion maryages vtas ester next ere lorde thousande thre hundred four ore fyue p h frenche kynge lordes frauce heynalt made rouisyon cabray nessage duke lancastre erle haynalt yages chyldren haynalt burgoyne p cccc l thus euery man departed fro cambray duke burgoyne returned fraunce king duches wyfe returned arras duke aubert duches wyfe retourned towne ouesnoy haynalt lady brabant countrey warkmen sette awarke make redy lodgynges cytie cambray men sent thyder make prouisyon great costly marueyle consydre feast cryed publysshed abrode holden cambray weke vtas easter whan frenche kyng enfourmed besynes sayd wolde maryages cosyns set cabray stewardes howse make prouisyon acordyng bysshopes palays taken vp duke burgoyne prouysion made howbeit fayne delyuer vp kyng carpenter mason set warke palays make astate royall whiche warke yet apereth feast nat remembrauce man harde two hundred yere great feast solempnyte aelled lordes make fresshe gorgious exalte estate spared money fallen fro clowdes euery man helped tidynges mariages came englande duke lancastre alwayes hoped willyam haynalt shulde haue wyfe doughter leest borne hande right pensyue sore troubled newes whane well ymagined knowe trouthe therof sent certayne person howse gaut speke wi h duke auberte whane messangers came gaunt foude sir john bourchier alderman gaunt peter du boyse fraunses atreman made right good chere ther taryed two dayes fro thence went mon heynalt quesnoy came duke duches child receyued goodly honour duke lancastre made good chere lykewise dyd lorde gouuighen mayster byenge wolles englande spake first hadde de lyuered letter credence recomaunded duke lancastre duke auberte cosyn spake thynges charged amonge thynges demaunded duke auberte enfourmed entent perceyuer maryage chyldren duke burgoyne wordes duke lytell chaunged colour sayd ye sir truely faythe wherfore demaunde sir demaunde bycause duke lancastre hathe alwayes hoped vntyll tyme lady philyp doughter shuld haue lorde willyam sonne thane duke sayd copanyon say cosyn whan soeuer mary chyldren shall nat marueyle dismayed therat hath take care maryenge child whether wyll mary nat whan whome answere thenglisshmen duke aubert thus toke theie leaue departed went nyght ualencennes next day gaunt tell thynke retourned englande whan easter came acounted thousande thre hundred fourscore fyue yeres lorde freche king duke burgoyne duke burbon duke aubert duches wyfe duches brabant duches burgoyne sir willyam sir john namure came cambray kynge went palys lodgynge euery man drewe lodgynges ye may well beleue knowe frenche kyng many noble prince great ladyes great noble chiualry king entred monday none lord ladyes met without towne conueyed trompettes great plenty mynstrels brought palys monday presence great lordes renewed couenauntes maryages willm dorset shulde haue countye ostrenant lady margaret wyfe endowed lande acque brabant duke burgoyn gaue doughter hundred thousande frankes thus made porcyons tuysday hour masse wedded cathedrale churche lady cambray great solempnyte bysshoppe cambray dyd obseruaunce called johan borne brucels dyner ther shewed moche noblenes kyng caused two lordes two ladyes newly maryed syt table lord serued sate dyner constable fraunce marshall frauce sir guy de la tremoyle sir willyma de namure serued dyd dyuers great lordes frauce fyue hudred yere nat sene suche solempnite cambray dyner knyghtes squiers armed iust iusted markette place xl knightes one syde yonge kyng charles iusted knight heynalt called sir nycholas espinot iustes nobly contynued yonge knyght haynalt price called sir johan desternne besyde beawmont haynalt knyght iusted greatly pleasure lordes ladyes prise gyrdell set precyous stone gyuen hym duches burgoyne owne wast admyrall fraunce sir guy de la tremoyle dyd preset thus great reuell contynued weke friday dyner kyng toke leaue lordes ladyes departed fro cambray also duke duchess deted duches burgoyn brought margaret haynalt doughter arras lady haynalt brought lady margarete burgoyne quesnoy thus passed forthe besynes p howe duke berrey ensured doughter sone therle bloyse howe therle matche duke burbon made somons entre lymosin cap cccc li sae season trety maryage bytwene loys bloys son therle guy oy lady mary dought johan berry th rle bloys well acopanyed lordes ad brought doughter bergues duke duches redy de tyght nobly receyued company rmed assurance maryage chebysshop bergues ensured der presece many lordes lad howbeit natte wedded ey bothe yonge ther great feest reuelyng daunsyng last therle countesse retourned countre sonne lady abode styll duches mother barrey fayre castell besyde bergues called mehune ryuer yure season duke berry went auuergne laguedocke auignon se pope clement ordayned duke burbone therle marche two thousande men armes shulde go lymosyn delyuer countre fro englysshmen theues robbed pylled coutre poictou xaynton certayne fortress whiche dyde moche domage coutre wherof complayntes came heryng duke berrey mynde remedy desyred duke burbone cosyn wyse whan come limosyn xaynton shulde coquere garyson bertuell forteresse dyde moost hurt countre duke burbone promysed hym hadde made somons molins burbonoyse first daye june thyder drewe tyme maner men warre duke burbone hym gentyll squyer called johan bone lauce mayster capitayne men warre certaynly squyer well worthy haue suche charge erle marche shulde copany duke burbone made somons cytie toures season came scluse flaunders suche men warre apoynted passe see scotlande sir johan uyen admyrall fraunce shulde haue hym thousande speares knightes squiers beleue well great desyre go moche nat desyred aduaunsed selfe go voyage admyrall shyppyng redy apparelled scluse caryed harnesse xii hundred men armes taken harnesse castell beauty besyde parys harnesse parteyning parisyens whiche caused bring sayd castell tyme rebellion admyrals company great nombre good men warr entensyon delyuer sayd harnesse knyghtes men scotlande bycause sir geffray de charney enformed kynges counsayle howe men scotlande easely harnessed shall name vnto parte fraunce wente scotlande season first sir johan uyen admyrall fraunce erle graunt pre lordes uerdnay saynt crouse mountbury sir geffray charney sir wyllyam uyen sir jaques uyen lorde despaigny sir gerard burbone lorde hetz sir floromonde quissy lorde marny sir ualerant rayneuall lorde beausaige lorde uaynbrayne lorde rynoll baron dury lorde coucy sir percyuall daneuall lorde ferrers lorde fountaygnes sir braquet braquemont lorde graunt court lorde landon breton sir guy la son sir wyllm de couroux sir johan de hangyers sir henry de uyncelyn cosyn great maister pruce diuers good knight whiche nat name nobre thousande speares knightes squyers besyde cro bowes varlett gode wynde fayre season see wether fayre moneth may tyme truse bytwene englade frauce expyred bitwene gau toyse flemynges lykewise semed euery parte desyred warre knyghtes squiers desyred greatly go voyage scotlande thought ayde scott haue fayre iourney agaynst enemyes englade thenglysshmen enfourmed comynge loked theym euery day thus endeth first volume sir johan froissart cronycles englade fraunce spayne portyngale scotlande bretayne flauders place adioynyng translated frenche maternall englysshe tonge johan bourchier knight lorde berners comaundement moost highe redouted soueraygne lorde kyng henry viii kynge englande fraunce hygh defender christen faithe c imprinted london fletestrete richarde pynson printer kynges noble grace ended xxviii day january yere lorde xxiii cum priuilegio rege indulto blazon coat arm
